reviews.review: Fab!. kids loved it!I was too scared to try the aquaventure attractions..some of them was easy some are super scary!my daughter was so brave enough to go and play the way she want it!amazing!

So much fun . Can't believe we spent 5 hours here. It was so much. Top tip in hot weather - make sure you wear flip flops, the ground is so hot. Waterproof camera is a must! Take the monorail as you get a great view of The Palm.

Good - but some downsides. This is the 2nd time of visiting the Aquaventure waterpark in Dubai. The waterpark itself is great, loads of rides and a great beach. Only downside is that when we visited there was a number of rides out of action. I understand that maintenance needs to be undertaken, its just a bit dissappointing when you arrive to find 3 of the attractions closed for maintenance.
Superb. It's amazing. I haven't braved the drop yet but I will before I leave. It's a definite must to come here even if you don't stay at Atlantis the palm.
Loads of Fun. The design of this is amazing, so many different activities that can be done here from the big slides to lazily floating along. Just wished we'd had the time to fully enjoy it.

Great weekend experience!. Very relaxing and fun to visit especially if you got nothing to do on the weekend. You must try Zoomerang and Aquaconda!!!!!! So much of fun! :) Also, you must try their Hotdog Sandwich! :) Awesome!!

Great day out for the family!. Amazing views of Dubai at the top ride. Great day for families with kids who are little bit older (7+). Your child's height may limit your day if you have are not tall and for the price you don't have a lot of options. However if yours kids are little more grown up it is a great day out and there are loads of rides. Food is expensive though!!

Definitely worth a visit. We spent a day at the water park while staying at the Atlantis hotel. The flumes and lazier rivers etc. were all very good and the park was relay quiet before 13:00. It seemed to get a bit busier after that.

Too much expectations. Nice but we had too much expectations. It didnt have much to offer...still it was enjoyable. We missed more rides and seats, the beach was okey but not for swimming. Nice to walk and have a look at the dolphins.

Great day out for anyone of any age. Great waterpark in a fantastic location on the Palm in Dubai. Plenty of sun loungers were available for us which we thought might have been a problem given how busy it can get. Changing facilities and locker rooms were great. Plenty of food/drinks outlets throughout the waterpark. Rides were amazing, in particular the big kamikaze slide, not for the feign hearted! Price is high but you are in Dubai so it is expected.

A must visit !!!. Super place . Loved it . Spent 5 hours on the rides of which all had hardly and queues .
The park is next door to the fantastic Atlantis hotel

Very busy but fun.. Very busy and fun, I couldn't spend more than 3/4hours here as it gets too much - and we wanted a relaxed holiday but no issues just wanted more relaxation area - this place probably not right for that!

Very disappointed- lots of rides shut- very expensive. We arrived at the waterpark around 10am after catching the tram/metro and metro link to the park. When we arrived the place looked lovely. We had to queue for a short time which was no problem, we were not informed any rides were shut when paying for the waterpark. The food deal is good as the food was fantastic in the restaurant. 4 rides were shut which was very disappointing. The beach is beautiful and the rides and lazy river which were open were very good.

Great day out. This place is really good fun. The price of the food and drink is quite expensive though so I would advise you to bring your own bottled water etc to save some money. Although they do have an option to load credit to an electronic wrist band before entering the park so you don't need to carry cash.I would recommend leap of faith and especially Poseidon's revenge for anyone looking for a bit of a rush!!!It's a nice touch that they give you one free entry to the park during your birthday week.

Great but shark tank was empty at one of the rides. Great water park.Loved the rides only unfortunate thing was that the main reason we went was to do the ride which takes you through the shark tank but the shark tank was empty so we were disappointed with that.We enjoyed the rapids and other rides and had ab enjoyable day.

Best waterpark i've been to!. For all ages, big waterpark, beautiful too. There was one ride i remember where you go through this glass tunnel which is inside an aquarium, you see all the fishes around this glass tunnel (slide). Absolutely amazing. Theres a beach where u can sun tan (for all the lazy mums or relaxing types out there). Would definitely come back here.

Good fun but been to better waterparks. If your comparing this water park to others (i.e. Disney) its not anywhere close to that standard. Less rides and shorter in duration when on them. Slightly chaotic with the planning of the rides as the tubes used for some of them are no where near the actual ride itself. When visiting Disney waterparks the tubes are always at the end of the ride so people know where to collect them from.Some of the rides were fun as they went upwards which was different and you could access them from the lazy river around the park which was a great idea. The family tube rides were really good and went on them several times. The lazy river with rapids option probably best bit of the park.We went in early October so thankfully quieter compared to what I imagine it could be like during the busier periods. The floor was boiling hot so needed flip flops or similar to walk around, (would be useful if they sprayed water on the paths to help with this as they do in Disney!!) Worth a visit at least once and probably ideal for people who are staying at the Atantlis who have kids but I wouldn't rush back.

Great Fun. As we were staying at the Atlantis we had free entry into the waterpark with towels included, however lockers you have to pay for if you want to store your items. The rides were super fun. Poseidon’s Revenge, The Leap Of Faith, Aquaconda, Zoomerango and the Water Coasters in particular were awesome! Though the park was busy, there was hardly any wait for the rides. Food & drink was reasonably priced. Be sure to wear flip flops or water shoes as the ground does get hot! Overall this is one of the best waterparks I've been too and just as good as Wild Wadi if not better.

An absolute must for families to escape the heat!. We stayed in the Imperial Club at the Atlantis so had complementary access to Aquaventure. This turned out to be the best inclusion, as we spent most of our time there. The kids area was fab for our toddlers but also had shaded areas for adults to sit too. We really enjoyed the rides, and the lazy river and Rapids were great too! Towels were also included complementary too, which doesn't happen at every Waterpark. There was plenty of shaded areas and sun loungers, but it was relatively quiet in late September mid-week.Only downside was work being completed on the wave pool meaning this was out of action, but didn't spoil a great few days.Great fun and should be on the must-visit list!

Good waterpark...a bit expensive. We prepaid for our tickets online, but the queue to collect them was still quite long. Would highly recommend if going as a couple to upgrade to a cabana in Neptune's retreat. There are long queues for the more popular rides but it is a good waterpark.
Great day out. Good fun, great day out but you must arrive early to avoid lines. We went in early October and had no hassle with lines from opening till 1pm.

So amazing. We had an amazing time here, this was included in out stay. And we checked the prices very expensive if not. But We think worth it. We had an amazing time lots to see and do lots of different eateries to try. Only gripe!!!! No shade it was mega hot hot hot. Though we did visit in August 50 degrees.

Best Aquapark in Dubai. This is the best aquapark in Dubai and maybe one of the best in the world. We visited this place with my wife and enjoyed alot. There are few aquaparks in Dubai but this is the one, highly recommended. You can spend your whole day with different difficulty level of water skis. There are place to eat, rest and drink. The price is cheaper than the ones in Europa and the US. Its safe and staff are friendly. I would strongly recommend you to take "leap of faith" drive. It was wowwwww :)

Expensive but lots to do. We went to Aquaventure on a weekday, which meant that the park was not busy and we didn't queue at all for anything. At 320dhs, this is more expensive than the competition, but the advantage is that the park stretches onto the beach. There are plenty of rides to get stuck into as well, more than Wild Wadi, and in our opinion slightly better.One disappointing thing was that, out of 11 rides, 4 were not fully functional. Shamal, Surge and Plunge were not operational at all. Also the shark viewing tank was being refurbished, so no sharks on view, and also when riding on Shark Attack it meant riders were plunged into a tank full of construction and building work. Not quite the same effect! Seeing as this is a major selling point of the park, it's a shame that no discounts were offered off the entrance fee, especially as this information did not seem readily available on the website. In hindsight we'd recommend ringing ahead to find out if any rides are closed.One other point to note if you're thinking of driving there. It's valet parking only, which costs 150dhs. If you spend this amount on food you get this money back, BUT you have to go back out of the park and into the forecourt, you can't use it at Barracuda or Shark Bites. Despite this, we still enjoyed our day, and happy to give 4 stars.

Great day 2 adults. Bit pricey, but I celebrated my birthday week of visit and found a voucher online for free entry if celebrating birthday.Great slides, really big water park can get round water park on rapids. Have to purchase a locker for day but can regain access to it during day, also changing rooms immaculate.Wrist band allows you to add credit so if refreshments needed saves carrying cash just swipe wrist band.Hardly any wait for a slide and it was really busy as well.Great beach also located in here with plenty of loungers. Great day not just for kids,

Best part of my visit to Dubai!. Simply put, this was my favourite part of our holiday in Dubai. The location is spectacular, located in the Palm Jumeirah (we had to get there by taxi for 35AED as metro does not go there). Cost wise it was expensive but worth it. Not sure it was worth us getting our lunch with admission though. You only get a very small choice from the menu if you pay beforehand so definitely recommend buying lunch separately. Definitely also take sandals (which may sound obvious to some but i made the mistake of not taking any and the floor was way too hot to walk in). All the rides were so much fun. It's very child friendly. The atmosphere was great, welcoming and very friendly people/staff. There was a bit of a queue for the showers though and you have to pay about 40 AED for a small locker...so like i said it's expensive! But worth it! And it's all in a shopping mall at the bottom of one of the most eye catching hotels in Dubai so plenty of other things to do.
Love it . Amazing water park with different rides to choose from, you have the single and family rides to go on.

Poor water park. This is not one of the best water parks that I've been to. There are approximately only 13 rides. My husband and I did the majority of the rides and had lunch and we were only in the park for 3 hours and it cost us £70 per person! Total rip off. Be prepared to take your flip flops with you around the water park as the floor gets too hot to walk on. Take a cheap pair of flip flops incase they get picked up by someone else by accident.

Excellent . Very nice waterpark, the attractions are out of this world, we enjoyed shark attack especially and also the Rapids and wave machines were amazing, we went on all the rides and thought they were all excellent

Comparison.... We just visited wild Wadi water park (wWwp), so this review will be influenced by that. The staff was polite, friendly and helpful. Food (fast food inside the park) was OK, and easy to come byThe rides was ok, but the height limit was 120cm on most of them. (Compared to 110cm at wWwp) My 6year old son couldn't do much there, witch was a bit boring. Also, most of the rides are not as thrilling as in wWwp IMO (there was one 4-person ride I didn't get to try)Outside we had to wait 30-45 minutes in a taxi-line to get home. The palm is situated a bit remote, and taxis were not abundant in the evening apparently. Close by the park, there are many restaurants, the aquarium and a few shopsIMO the wWwp was the better choice of the two, and we will pay it another visit tomorrow

Get wet and wild!. Had a great day just in trunks wandering around the waterpark! Take flip flops - ground very very hot! Great variety of rides for the more adventurous - Poseidon's Revenge is a vertical drop waterslide! The rides on the big rafts were great fun in groups. The lanes for the rides were confusing leading to people trying to swap or lane jump which caused friction with some guests but staff monitored the queues well. Loved floating around the lazy river in a single or double rubber ring. Great rapids and an amazing wave machine!

What it says... It's just a great day out!There's lots for everyone to do and rides for all ages.The staff are simply superb with all the lifeguards playing with the kids at the various rides - especially the lazy river Rapids..Always enjoyable!

Aqua Fun. The rides are awesome even our moms had a blast in the river rides. Though it was again short for us. Next time we come here, we'll make sure it's longer so we can do the zip line and shark safari.

Good fun day out. Went to Atlantis the Palm Aquaventure yesterday and had a brilliant day out. Park was spotless, staff were friendly, no queues at all. Only issue was the shark tank was closed which we were really looking forward to seeing also the Plunge and the Surge were closed and no money was deducted!Went on everything including Leap of Faith and Poseidon's revenge (not for the faint hearted) but you have to do it while you're there.Would recommend this place for adults and children alike. Just remember you're water shoes as the floor gets so hot and easier to keep shoes on rather than flip flops.

Great day out. This gave me and my family a great day out, a few long lines for things but thats expected. Lots of fun to be had here make sure you give your self a decent amount of time. Always pack spare clothes we were stung in the atlantis shop for shorts for my son £75??? Crazy price

The best rides. I enjoyed my day here. We got one free ticket as it was my boyfriends birthday week, so don't buy a ticket if you are visiting the week of your birthday. Print the voucher from the website and bring ID. The rides are good fun and if you have heart try the leap of faith!!

Great way to spend the day!. The waterpark is actually attached to the Atlantis Palm and you have free entry if you are staying at the hotel. It is a great way to spend the day, either sunbathing, relaxing on the lazy river, or zipping down the rapids on a rubber ring. Food and drink are very expensive but the park is vast and well worth a trip.
Great place to enjoy your day. I'm always here to hangout with my friends if we have our free time. The leap of faith is a one a hell of ride.!

Mind your bum!!!. This is the first ever water park I have ever been to and it was so good!From the family dinghy rides to the tallest single rider slide in Dubai, I loved it all.I felt at ease with the hundreds of life guards all through the park, down the lazy river, in shallow pool areas and at the ends of each and every slide. They're there to look after you, make sure your safe and have little bit of a laugh with you as you go around.Make sure you keep your flip flops/water shoes nearby as the ground gets extremely hot throughout the day and to avoid burning your feet you need to try and get out of the water where you left them!Hats and suncream are needed especially as the temperatures reach mid 30s and higher very easily even though there is plenty of shade and sunbeds to retreat under.Photos for slides are available and staff give you wristbands with codes on so you can see them on photo machines at the end of the day but they do work out to be around £10 each per photograph, so this is something to keep in mind and maybe only choose the best photo out of them all at the end of the day.Entry is free to hotel guests and towels are included in the price too, however lockers you still have to pay for if you want to store your clothes, snack, suncream etc.My only regret is that we didn't go to the waterpark early enough in the holiday to truly be exhausted by it. It was a fun day, I just wish we could've done it again!

Great park. I've done the research and I learned from friends' information This water park was really the best water park in Dubai. A large variety of roller coasters and high adrenaline I enjoyed it so much.

Lazy river exposed. Staying at Atlantis we benefitted from free access to Aquaventure next door. What a great water park. Enough for every age and adventure. Pity the day we attended was spoilt by an afternoon closure of the lazy river whilst this was cleaned. This could have happened any day any where so no fault of the venue. Some guests were agitated as they had clearly paid for a days activity which had to be curtailed. In such circumstances outside park control maybe a second day free pass would earn the park the kudos it deserves. Do visit, it's as good if not better than Orlando.

This modern waterpark is amazing. My favourite waterpark in Dubai hands down beats Wild Wadi for me. Their is more space to relax and chill and the rides and the waterpark seem newer and more modern feel. The rides are sure to give you an adrenaline rush.

Rides closed . My partner and I went here on Sunday and there were quite a few different rides / attractions closed due to maintenance. This included the shark tank which is one of the main reasons we booked tickets to the park to it was extremely disappointing to find out this was closed. I advised the park staff that this should be communicated more clearly on their website before guests purchase tickets. They had a small sign up on arrival communicating this but by then you were already there so it's too late. Even some sort of discount should have been offered or perhaps only closing down one or two rides / attractions at a time could work better. Other than this, the rides that were open were so much fun!

Fantastic day out. The water park is excellent for all ages and swimming ability. It is very well supervised, and the life-guarding team are friendly and helpful. The "scary" rides are excellent - the Leap of Faith and Poseidon's Revenge in particular. A couple of the rides were closed (eg Shark Attack) for maintenance, which was disappointing. Be warned, the food options are expensive (and you cannot bring your own). Finally, the height restrictions are a little odd - one of our kids was too short for some of the rides, but too tall for the free monorail ride!

Fun day at Aquaventure. Had a really fun day! We went when it was quite hot still as it was the month of July. The advantage was we didn't have to queue and the entre ticket was part of a promotion, so we had access to the lost chambers as well. Fun day to spend at the waterpark if you like.

Something special for the kids. Wow, this is a real water park, had a whole day out here, well the kids loved it and turned into fish lol. Good family fun, go on all the rides, but be aware the food is terrible. Do not get package with food your restricted, better off buying food from were u want I would advise. My wife who can't swim even took part lol great family fun that will stay in memory banks of kids and highlight of holiday.
Great resort. I spent half a day in the water park, all thought it was really warm outside I really enjoyed the water and the view. Take the monorail if you want to see the palm island.

Great Fun. The rapids and torrent river rides are brilliant - quite exciting so not for anybody afraid of water.Unfortunately could only use some of the other rides due to ingoing repairs but they were also great fun. The whole park is very clean and well run
Splash Dash. Good place. Has great food options within the park. I love it we go every year once or three times. :)
A must-visit whilst in Dubai. So much selection to choose from including slides, Rapids, lazy river, inflatables etc. Camera men are round every bend taking photos that you can purchase afterwards!!

Real Deal. Don't miss while in Dubai. It's one of the main attractions and things to have in your bucket list. The leap of faith (Oh yeah) & the rest of water activities are excellent. Don't miss the Poseidon and the capsule if you dare.
Get your adrenaline rush

Loved the rapids. The Rapids and tube rides were amazing!
Drop rides aren't really my thing. Lots of building work going on which affected getting around the park.
Drinks etc were quite reasonable and lots on offer.
Not sure we would go again.

2 x Code Brown in the kids pool. Been here before, generally always enjoyed ourselves but this time w had two closures of the kids area, and the second time closed it for the rest of the day. Also, many other rides closed as well. Overall, a very weak episode of customer service and experience. Disappointed.

strange experience!. Is interesting, but often some of the slides are closed or broken! Its open between the hottest moments of the day! I would personally keep it open from 9am to 7pm as between 10 and 6pm is the hottest time. You walk a lot to get from 1 slide to the other and the heat is killing you! Is poorly mapped and the lifeguards all give you contradictory information! By no means that amazing experience they advertise! 'Leap of faith' is a cool slide! The 'shark' slide was closed as they had a leak! The lockers are somewhat inconveniently located very far away. I would create some sort of small lockers from place to place where people could put a mobile or a camera or their sunnies while they go for a slide.

Tons of family fun!. We recently stayed at Atlantis with our two small children and had daily access to the water park. The park is very kid friendly, ours could have spent the entire day at the kids zone. We also rented a cabana one day and thought it very much added to the experience - the best bit was having a safe to lock up your valuables so one of us didn't always have to stay back with the bag. Would highly recommend this for adults and kids alike. Lots of fun to be had!

Great water park!. Great water park, there were absolutely no queues which was a bonus! Some great water slides, the area for younger children looked good also. The lazy river ride led to some water slides which was different & good fun!

Pretty good unless you have been to Wild Wadi. Aquaventure is within Atlantis on the palm. It can be reached by either monorail or road. It is home of dolphin bay where you can swim with dolphins and this gets you free entry to the waterpark. It is very spread out so there are little buggies that can drive you to different areas but this is a bit tedious. It is very clean. Lockers are expensive. It's not as good as Wild Wadi. Dolphins were incredible however. A major highlight but is an expensive activity and the professional photographs were ridiculously expensive. Over £20 for a single 6x4. You can buy an observer ticket and the observer can stand on the beach near the dolphin pool and take photographs (no videos) and this is close enough to take great photos although the angles not quite as good as the professional who is in the water. The observer pass was about £60 but also includes free access to waterpark as well.

Great!. My husband and baby loved the water park. It's a great place to cool down in during the humid days of September. We couldn't use the adult rides as much as we have a little baby. My husband did go on the Neptune ride twice and loved it, but we spent majority of our time in the children's splash area. The lifeguards at the children's splash area are very polite and friendly with the kids. The ice cone place at the front of the waterpark is a must! We stayed at the Atlantis so we had free entrance.

Fun in VIP. Came to the park today with little expectation other than the same old water park, boy was I wrong. My friend and I decided to upgrade to the VIP area for 300dr well worth the price as water costs a lot. The service was excellent even tookUs to our beds on a gold buggy.The views of Dubai from here are amazing, swimming with the sky rises in the distance .The lazy river is long, great fun and takes you to all the extreme slides. They were all great, especially Aquaconda and Zoomerango big rapids type type for 6 and you need to hold on tight!Great day and well worth a visit

Amazing! had so much fun!. My brother is 12 years old, and we spent 3 entire days in a row in this waterpark without getting bored! It was the craziest slides i have ever tried in my life, but it was a lot of fun! My mother stayed in quiet sunbathing areas and enjoyed it there. Occasionally she came on some of the lighter water rides with us. Some are literally for all age groups, where you just lay in a round air mattress and float through the water, being pushed by some light flow. The security and lifeguards are extremely careful and friendly. Security is their main priority, and it is taken care of accordingly. Furthermore it is clean and above european standards! All in all, it is an amazing place to go for anyone who like waterrides or has kids that enjoy them, since for adults there is plenty of space to relax. Besides, it has its own beach, where you can also play volleyball, bath in the sea or kajak... there is also an amazing zip line in the park!
Loved it. Fantastic Waterpark, very safe and rides are fab, it is slightly expensive but worth it. The food and drinks inside the waterpark were reasonably priced.

Great fun and variety of rides. Spent a day at Aquaventure and had a great time.
Best lazy river I've ever been on - lots of gentle bits and then brilliant rapids!

just perfect. Great waterpark with many activities for every ageI could live in Dolphin Bay for a life(even if i don't like the idea of dolphins in a pool i really notice the excellent and kind behavior of the staff).Book online to get info about the park, skip the line and have an discount.You could take a walk in Atlantis hotel before you visit the park.

Fab fun family day out. Aquaventue is a great day out for all the family. The lazy rivers aren't so lazy so small people and unconfident swimmers must be watched closely. The water slides are great fun.Queues can be long and the paving gets very hot under foot so wear flip flops or water shoes to stop nasty burns, especially on young feetIf you hold UAE residency you get a discount on entry when you shoe you Emirates ID card.

Great slides, lots of steps, fun for a morning. Spent the last day of our hols here and enjoyed a great half day of fun. The park is large with two main towers of slides, each one having about 6/7 slides each. There's loads and loads of steps to climb up to the slides, so after 4 hours of fun, we were wrecked from all the stairs (and we're fit runners!). Poseidon's revenge is not as long as similar slides in Florida but worth trying. Favourite slide was zoomerango, really fast, adrenaline filled and worth doing with a large group of friends- the dingy can take 6 adults.Everything in the park is very pricy, as you'd expect and beds tend to be reserved from mid morning. They don't allow you bring your own food or drinks in (except for water) so be warned- it'll just be confiscated and dumped in the bin!There's deals with your entrance fees where you can get a discounted lunch included, which is worth doing as we worked up quite an appetite sliding down all the slides.
Aquaventure . Had an amazing day with my husband and girls. Absolutely loved a Lazy Pool my favourite!Vandana Parmar

Great day. Spent a full day at the water park which was great.It was my husbands first time at a water park and what a great first impression he got!They have everything well thought out and sortedLoved being able to buy items with just out wrist band (saved lugging bags around)Bit of a shame as the shark tank was closed for cleaning but it didn't distract from the funGreat day!

horrible experience. Horrible experience, never expect this.Not many rides plus half of the things are closed, no good directions, extremely rude staffTook them 45 mins for food after we ordered and it was empty I wonder if it was many people in the resturant what will happen (keep in mind I got the food with hair in it)You need the towel after you finish, and they ask you for the receipt which obviously it's in the locker cause can't we carry it during the day.I wouldn't say go to the other water parks around UAE because it's not fair to compare this horrible experience with the rest of the amazing water parks we have in UAE.Just save your money and sit home it's better than this bad experience.

Aussies will love it! . So you are planning a holiday and not sure whether to go East or West? Do stay on the Palm close to Aquaventure, it's a great day out and your children will love it.120cm is the height restriction for the more adult style rides although for some rides it may be a little frightening. Life jackets are provided .If you are staying at Atlantis it is very convenient and entry is included; they will take you via buggy to the door. The ground is very hot and you will appreciate the ride. There are plenty of chairs and towels and places to sit. See my review of Disney Aulani Hawaii. In my opinion Dubai makes for a better holiday overall, the restaurants are better. The staff are very professional and at all times, there to assist you and help plan your time so you can relax.
Fun water park. Very complete the water park, has many attractions for all ages, has what I do not like is that it is too expensive, and there to queue for almost everything, because many people.

overpriced!!. The shark tank was empty, so I was very disappointed, That was the reason we choose this park.Three good rides, the rest nothing special. The view from the top pf the tower are stunning!

Great Fun at Landmark Atlantis. We were staying on the palm so the waterpark is within close distance by taxi. Big waterpark with some great rides, the rapids take you around the whole park meaning you can take the Rapids Inbetween each different section of rides.Staff were friendly and helpful and the park was very clean.Busy but fairly Short queuing times, we didn't queue over 20 minutes. Good taxi rank pick up point to leave the park as well.One down side of Atlantis is that you have to pay in cash for drinks/ food! A waterproof credit band would be so much easier, as the walk to the locker rooms is quite far when you are in the middle of the park and want a water! You are given a paper map when you get to the park however more signage is needed, paper map when you are wet and limited to what you can carry around isn't a great idea! Other water parks we have been to have big map signs which I think would be useful. In addition when you are the queuing signage for rides should be clearer as sometimes their are separate queues for different rides very close together.

Hugely disappointed!!. This experience was a massive disappointment, we were looking forward to visiting Aquaventure as we read loads of amazing reviews.It was far too busy and we spend half our time queuing. 'As one of the biggest water parks in the world' I can't believe we only went on 6 slides in 7 hours! When you are paying £50 per person I excepted to get more use of the facilities. Also the Shark Attack slide was under maintenance and the Poseidon Revenge only had one slide open. Huge disappointment Won't be going again

Greta water park. It was a small water park in the hotel but it was great. It has 2 of the scariest rides I have ever been on. Also, had a big play area for young children where my 3 year old daughter had an amazing time.
Short Trip to UAE. This is a Very nice and Big Waterpark in Atlantis with So many slides and a Big Lazy River, The Crowd comes is very posh and very good people so No problem for ladies and families

Nice day out. Although costing anywhere between 35-50 pounds English depending where you buy. This is a nice day and environment if you spend all day there. Little bit pricey in the food places but you keep cool in and out the water alot so no need for lots and lots of buying drinks. Its great for kids as towels and mini life jackets are supplied at no cost and are everywhere.there is a childrens play area in shallow water which is huge..plenty of huge slides and rides without to much queing even on hot days and the surroundings are lovely. You can even get access to the beach which being at the edge of the palm is nice

Fun day out for all ages and a full day activity. I visit this park more than 3 times a year and i have to say it is always amusing and fun. Wether be it with a group of friends or young cousins it is always fun. Always surprising and you will never get bored with great food and beverage options. Highly recommended .

not a clear communicaton. so basically its not our first time to go to the water park, in uae as a trip for my friends and cousins, in dubai we went to wild wadi and atlantis, so my friends were not allowed to take a ride in the atlantis coz they were not wearing 2 piece, whereas there was no problem at all at the wild wide as she was wearing the same clothing.. make no sense to us. afterall its just a waterpark. and if we are standing in the queue for sure we are there to take a ride, we jst have to come there 2 times because of one of my not allowed to take a ride. so the second time when we reached the area for the rides, she pointed another person from our group saying not appropriate swim wear, its the same person who is rejecting again and again.So when we questioned her why she cannot tell the same thing on first place and giving trouble to go and come back again and again from our cabanas. SHe was like oh i didnt know that you are here for a ride too.. HAHA what a person. NO Common Sense... The staff needs more practice or training in making clear communication and not troubling in the hot weather..

WOW. Me and my husband booked a hotel here at the palm Atlantis to play with the Dolphins so didn't think there would be much for us at the water park. Was I wrong even though we are in our mid 50's we had a blast on the lazy river. Which wasn't that lazy lol.

Hot feet. If you intend going here, suggest you take some slippers from your hotel. The ground is extremely hot. Someone took a liking to my flip flops whilst I was on one of the slides and I ended up with burnt feet.

Wow!! Take flip flops with you!. Wow this place is unbelievable!You would think that this place would be busy (we went on a friday) but it wasnt that bad!!You can get a floating tube and take on the rapids... you can stay on this all day if you want... the kids area was pretty busy but my kids loved it!Wear some things or swimming shoes as the floor gets really hot during the day!

Shark Tank Closure - Extremely disappointing! . We were extremely disappointed that the shark tank was closed for maintenance and this did ruin our experience of Aquaadventure considering that a large proportion of the rides went through the tank. We had saved a lot of money to go to the Atlantis (we stayed there for 2 nights) and do feel that this massively impacted our trip. It was also not advised prior to us arriving.
Splashy fun. Has a fantastic time at water park and I hate things like this! Promised hubby and kids - it was excellent.

Great day out. Went mid September and arrived at 11am and was surprised with how empty it was! I've been to other water parks where its packed and you're queing for up to an hour, but with this I qued no longer than 10 mins even for the big rides. (Although that could be due to the time of year). Definitely recommend getting some sort of slip on wet shoes as the floor gets really hot, but most rides still ask you to take them off (but they let you hold them while riding).

Don't leave flip - flops in locker. Feet will burn on paths without !. As you would expect in Dubai this place is outstanding. Good customer service, crowd control and even the price isn't bad if your there all day. WARNING ! The paths get VERY hot! Walking between pools or going to slides, your walking on brick paths that arnt always in shade or have a carpet covering to protect your feet. Keep your flip-flop or jelly shoes on! I was there only for a morning and got my feet so badly burnt from walking from pool to pool or to the lockers, I got blisters on both my feet just from the hot paths. Some are even made of black bricks.

One of best waterparks in the world. Excellent waterpark for adultsNo big ques anywherePlenty of stomach churning slides .A mixture of ring slides ,solo slides and nice poolsa must if in dubaiIf you are staying in atlantis go the backway in along the beach and get off the buggy at the second stop that way you can get all the better slides done before the general public have chance too get too them....
Amazing Water Park. Excellent day out. Something for everyone! Some amazing and hair raising rides and some gentle ones! Spotless amenities and good food if a little pricey.

Lazy river with rafting, roller tube and wave sensations!! Feel heat no more .... Enjoying great waterparks with small kid especially below 110cm is really not easy!! Moreover to go out from the kids zone area...But of course its not the case in Aquaventure!!Yes indeed we missed some of the attraction but just went to the lazy river was sooo amazing, we can take turn to the "fast river" which really quite feels like rafting for the kids, we may turn to the wave river which gave wave sensations up to 2m hight.There is also options to the roller tubes!!! Fascinating.The most unbelievable part is they have double tube especially made for kids (child save) so no hole in it. Will update with some pics after if possible, sorry didn't save it in my phone Spent 2 afternoon... Still feels like going back .Didn't evel the heat of summer ...

Disappointment . We had really high expectations for this one, but were sadly disappointed. The whole experience was just not practical with little children. You have to take a shuttle from the parking lot to the Waterpark. It's an old and rusty bus, that was driving too fast and honking it's horn to the very guests it picked up the next moment (us included). Waiting in the shuttle to fill every seat was not convenient with our young kids that were eager to get going. Once we made it to the water park, we had to wait in line in the exhausting heat to collect our tickets, even though we had paid beforehand. Towels, lockers and everything cost extra, and tickets are pricy to begin with. The lockers were the worst. They are tiny little rooms where you can't even imagine fitting yourself and your children, which leaves you with the option to get changed in the common area or women/men's locker room. However if you get undressed there, a staff member will notify you it's inappropriate. This makes things very difficult for someone with young children that can't be left unsupervised. The rides and pools themselves are nice, but the whole experience was too draining for us. For older kids and adults it's probably a lot of fun. With young ones, wouldn't recommend.
OK OK water park. As I had been to Sunway Lagoon in Kuala Lumpur, this seemed to be a shade lower than that. But nevertheless, great water park in the Atlantis Hotel. Must visit place.

Water park good, taxi not so good! . Was a fun day out although the day we visited there was a couple of the rides shut which was a shame. It is also quite expensive to get entry, I think around £80 and there was no discount given to say certain rides were shut. I was also really disappointed as we had to travel to Atlantis from Dubai town by taxi and paid 40AED which was reasonable, however when we left we were told by staff who were showing people to taxi's outside the entrance that it was a fixed price of 120AED to get back to town. We did argue this however we were told that this is what we had to pay. The taxi driver had no meter in his car and we did the exact same journey that we had made to get to the water park although it was three times the price!! Since then I have spoken to my friend who lives in Dubai and she said that I should have reported it to the hotel as the staff should not be charging fixed rates.So watch out for that if you are getting taxi's too and from the water park!!
Overrated . Very disappointed when we visited here it it quite expensive but we only stayed about 30 minutes.....very busy lots of things to do but not our scene at all. Would not return here.

Very very poor service and attitude from staff. The water park itself is good but the service from staff at the main ticket counter was horrible and well below standards. Luckily we pre booked tickets as the card payment system was down so we struggled to rent towels and a locker. The manager S Gomez was very incompetent with dealing with a system issue they had with card payments as they could not take any rather than being apologetic and trying to rectify the issue or come to some sort of agreement he was just being rude and saying he could not do anything and said was not his fault but the banks. That is not a way of good customer service to lay the blame on other people. He basically told us to go to the arm and get cash out regardless of me pouting out that taking cash out using the credit card would incite forex charges and additional interest charges to take cash out (which at the end I had to do due to mr Gomez not playing ball) I even offered to pay offered to leave my card and come back and pay later when the system issue was sorted but he was not having any of it. Was so disappointed in the end that we ended up leaving the water park after an hour. Please train your staff in how to deal with problems and have contingencies in place when things go wrong.

Much welcomed water in the searing heat. As we were staying at the Atlantis we had complimentary access, the park never seemed crowded at any time, the q's were all short, only negative the shark park was closed, still more than enough to do and keep everyone occupied, fast food restaurants were typical but I would suggest you try the dosa's they were very good. Back to the water park, sufficient sun beds and good quality towels available. It seemed safe to leave valuables whilst you enjoyed yourself on one of the many the lazy river trails. Not 100% sure of the cost if you visiting and having to pay, but its certainly worth a visit.

Fun Fun Fun !. Have been here a total of 4 times now with my family and it never gets boring. Lots of fun to be had on all the slides and the lazy river has to be one of the longest ever! The rapids are great. There are also animal feeding experiences and the ability to get in the water with other animals. You won't be disappointed. Whether as adults or with children you'll have bags of fun.
Exciting. Great rides, suitable for all ages, well worth a visit. A free buggy ride from the hotel is great and payable lockers available

Best in the planet. Wanderful place, a real water park paradise!Take a round tour on inflatable rings, face river flows and rapids to get to know the park better.Then try more thrilling attractions on two towers - one with numerous glides including one of the fastest and straight one -Leop of Faith and second one with exciting rides on a team pontoons via Aquaconda and other tunnels. Enjoy zip line additionaly and a beach with a view at the palm. Try nice food in two food courts and ice cream and coffee vans.It was our 4th visit to the park, the first one with limted queues , it seems September is a good time to visit this attraction.No food allowed on entrance. Mini cameras accepted. Online tickets are an interesting option.

Visited 2x. 2nd was not entertaining anymore.. Its good but Yas is better. Its still good for the day activity in Dubai. I suggest to do all the water ride available. All fun! And there's a beach too. =D

Overpriced overrated . I wish there was something new and different as I was expecting but it was almost similar to any other water park. Ya you can invest on the floor mats all over rather than small patches it will make it easy to walk in the heat I almost burnt my skin walking barefoot. However I felt it was to overrated.

Short trip to dubai. This is a very nice Waterpark in Atlantis The Palm. The rides are full value for money. The location itself is amazing. Do take the combo which includes visit to lost chambers and a meal
Day visit. My Family and friends spent the day here and combined it with a visit to the aquarium, the rides where good and the place was very clean, all in all a very good day

Only average for what they charge you. I'm sure better will open soon. Grand for a couple of hours but for this price you expect an adventure park style rather than a couple of rides as part of the Atlantis resort. There are only two I would put down as very good and even Poseidon it’s flagship is only OK compared to some I have been on in the states. It is well maintained, looks well and the facilities are good from lockers to restaurants etc along with the staff and places to relax by the pools and beach. Overall grand for a few hours but not worth the money they change for entry or concessions inside.

A lot of fun, crowded at times but a whole day of activities here to do. At a rather pricey £70 for a student like me, I was hoping that this would redeem itself throughout the day - and it did. There are enough waterslides and activities here to fill an entire day (we did 11-6pm) - however because we visited during Eid there were some very long queues for the slides. Also some of the slides were under repair such as the shark slide.

Family fun in the sun. Wow what a great time we had here. We rented a cabana and enjoyed all the benefits that came with it....lots of ice cold water a fruit bowl and butler on request and a hammock to rest in the sun with the grandchildren off exploring the rides..We did try the lazy river and had so much fun...The kids all agreed it was a great day out and was enjoyed by everyone young and old...

Simply the best. Every visit to Dubai I make sure and spend at least one day here. The size of the park is great and the shuttle runs between the two towers if its a little to warm to walk. The leap of faith is scary but also addictive, once you have been down its a race back to the top to do it all over again. My favourite ride is the slitherine where you race against a friend in the tube next to you. There are also a number of slides where you ride in either a 1 or 2 person tube and 2 where you are in larger dinghy which hold up to 5. The lazy river is great as it includes rapids and is an easy way to get round the park. The only ride which is just ok is "The Torrent", which is a tube ride on a wave machine, it is too long and you are bored after one go. The food outlets are mixed, best recommendation is to buy a refillable cup especially if planning to go more than once. By far the best water park in Dubai
Disappointing. Extra for a locker, extra for a towel, etc. Not great, not the best but staff are really good and make it fun. Would go to an alternative next time
Best waterpark. This was our second visit as good as last time. Once you've experienced the Atlantis nothing compares to it.

Great time at Atlantis Aquaventure!. Had a great time the entire day. Lot of water slides, some are bit scary, but super fun. It is crowded on weekends so you might have ot wait to go for the slides. There is one slide where you go through a glass tunnel of the aquarium and see sea creatures, which was amazing, They have lockers and load money into water proof wristwatch. And remember to apply sunscreen, as the place is hot and bright.

Great to go to after Eid. We went just after Eid finished so it was really quiet which meant no queues! Some rides weren't open and there were no sharks in the shark tank. The kids loved the Leap of Faith and we did the scary rides in the big tubes as a family. We wanted to swim with the dolphins but thought it was ridiculously expensive. The lazy river was good with the options to ride the rapids which were fun. The water could have been a few degrees cooler. We are spoilt for choice with water parks in Australia but we still really enjoyed this one.

Waterpark day . Today it's 36 d and we're going to aquaventure water park at atlantis, the palm . Dubai. Take your own towels and a liter of water . You don't need to hire there's . You can also take in a litre of water .but other food and drinks have to be purchased inside. A day at this place will cost you about £75 . We opted to add a meal deal with our tickets which saved us a nice amount on our lunch . A great day out and don't forget to keep applying plenty of sun tan lotion . Enjoy

Leisure Trip. Very few rides and most of the rides not suitable for younger children
Sign boards should be displayed about each rides and also information about the length and duration of the rides.

Not up to scratch. Visited the water park and aquarium on a pre booked package, took tram to location from hotel which was reliable and cheap, metro to water park is expensive at 25 Durams each, the ride is slow and only lasts around 10 mins. On our arrival at the park we were told two of the main water slides were closed which only gave us access to one other, each ride starts near the same location and only lasts a matter of minutes before delivering you into the lazy river, this boasts Rapids which are anything but and I found that on several occasions I had to get out the inflatable and push us around as the water doesn't travel through very fast, disappointing visit that I thought would last all day but I left after three hours having gone on all available rides three times. Aquariam was good but nothing special if you have seen similar before, save your money and go to wet n wild on Orlando Florida.
Best Waterpark. Totally the best waterpark I've been too. The life guards around the lazy river were so happy and helpful. I'm not a good swimmer, but they made me feel safe, thank you so much
Aquaventure Water Park at Atlantis . Family loved it especially my husband on his 60th Birthday done the leap of Faith... so much to do its an amazing water park.
GREAG FOR KIDS. We live this place where the kids can enjoy a lot. A lot of rides and its fun thebwater temperature is just right and very nicenambience

Year end trip . This is a nice but again one more expensive place to visit if you come early around opening time then you can complete all the rides by early evening and then visit the aquarium some of rides are really exciting even with family

Very good!. This is the best water park i have ever been! We were there from 10 am to 17 pm , that is like 7 hours, and we did not see it all. You realy have to go there for 3-4 days to see and do everything. The slides are awsome, the staff also very nice. My only complaint is that a 5$ is too much for a bottle of water. Food and drinks very expensive.
Nice. A huge water park with a lot of water slides and some of them is really special!For example ,the one sliding down and you can see the shark...
Amazing place. The place is amazing for children , the family have a lot of options to have a fun, but isn't cheap, it's a good option for couples

Good stuff . A great way to spend a stop over, not many people in the summer months makes it better. Remember to drink some water when it gets hot -47- but plenty of shade and everyone is there to have fun! Highly recommend if you have kids, loads to keep them busy and tire them out!

Aquaventure . Good property but extremely rude and untrained staff, especially on the rides.
Dolphin bay is much better with very cordial, friendly and trained staff.

Honeymoon. We went here whilst staying at Atlantis for our honeymoon. It's good fun for a day out. Make sure to get a locker for your things but wear your flip flops as the ground gets VERY hot so u cannot walk around bare foot. You can take ur flip flops on most of the rides so u don't have to worry about leaving them anywhere.
Great time!. Not the cheapest attraction, but you can spend all day there. Great system with loading credit onto your bracelet, so you don't need a wallet. Loved, loved, loved all the slides!
Fun!. Make sure you wear water shoes floor its really hot! Place its awesome! They have one of the best lazy rivers ive seen!

Fun fun fun. This park is well run and feels very safe with a lot of trained staff in attendance. It felt like that meter of water wherever it was, was supervised by a trained lifeguard. I also liked the availability of the rubber rings. No need to wait for them. The rides are amazing and queues are mainly in the shade. Some parts can get over crowded so explore before settling down. Make sure you come with a waterproof phone case and old flip flops which you can then carry on the rides
Great Place for the Kids. 3 days non stop of water games very nice and for all ages.Food expensive and not a lot of choice, bring with you some biscuits or fruits with you

A must GOOOOOO. It is an excellent waterpark if not at all the best. I am super happy with the good house keeping, discipline, and the variety of the rides. You should avoid weekends as it is packed. Definitely a must go place

Fun day out with lots to do, although be prepared for long queues. Really fun waterpark which also gives you access to the private hotel beaches. My group didn't get here until about 1pm which was a bit too late as we had to rush towards the end - would recommend you come in the morning and spend a full day here. The only downside is that sometimes the queues for the rides can be quite long.
:(. You pay as much money as you pay in Disneyland but it doesn't worth it. You dont have many options and the beach isn't nice.
Fun for all the family. The children will love it a great day out for all the family so much to do and rides were fun for all ages

Best Water Park in UAE. By far the best water park in all of the UAE. You can literally float around the entirety of the park and up escalators right onto the slides without ever leaving your tube. A bit pricey compared to other UAE water parks but the quality is so much better. We make it a point to get there at least twice a year.
Loved it. Loved going here, great place to see. Would recommend getting a plastic pouch for your phone so you can take pictures of the amazing views. Slides were ace!!!
Mashkoor. Over all the visit to the water park was very amazing and delightful. The children were very happy and excited.

A few tips. A few extra charges that you can beat, take your own beach towels, water and sun cream. Locker is essential but small and 40 uae to get, so don't take loads. Oh pre-book your tickets - cheaper and a shorter queue. Once you're in, it's brilliant!! Maybe it was a quite day, Wednesday, but we didn't have to queue for any ride and there was loads to do. We burnt though 5hrs going around all the rides. Take your flip flops as the ground is very hot!! Clean, helpful staff, loads of lifeguards and beautiful views on the beach. Last piece of advise.....when getting a taxi home we were advised by staff outside to get a taxi at a fixed price of 70 uae, because of the rush hour traffic, con!! The metre in the taxi stops if you're not moving. They'll just charge a fixed fee more at rush hour. Go on the metre. Overall, brilliant day.

Fun with family. It was during our stay at the Atlantis that we visited the aqua venture water park. The tickets to the water park were complementary for the hotel guests. For those staying in the hotel i would recommend visiting the water park on the day after you checked-in . The check-in time at the hotel is 3.00 pm and the park closes at 6.00 pm. The next day you can start at 10.00 am when the water park opens and use it till the park closes at 6.00 pm, even if you have to checkout at 12.00 pm the luggage can be kept in the safe custody of the hotel. There is an entrance for the hotel guests to the park via buggy transport at different locations. Bring your own swimming costumes and drinking water as these are very expensive inside the water park.All of us had a fun filled day, especially the kids.

Great fun day out. Even without the children we had a great day out. Lots of wet rides. Take sandals, as the ground can be very hot and if you don't take them on the ride with you, you can find yourself having to walk quite a distance back to get them back. Suncream essential and I would suggest a rash vest / sun top.

Great fun beautiful views to spend a full day. My 81 year old mother insists on us taking her to the UAE water parks every time she visits. Aquaventure is a favourite with a great lazy river, and good selection of slides for the kids. The weekends get very busy as you would expect. Most weekdays it is much more relaxed. Take the monorail from Jumeirah Beach Road for an added bit of fun and enjoy the slidefest.
Busy busy busy. Long queues for the best slides, hard to find the rubber rings, food poor quality. Floor to hot to walk on. Spent a few hours here... It was fun but not looking to go back.

Brilliant day out!!. This was a fantastic day out, the rides were great fun however, the food inside the park is expensive so make sure you put plenty of money onto your wristband.Would definitely visit again.

Those who love water sport have to visit this place at least once !. A lot of fun to to the water sport in this huge water park . Lovely water park which people can enjoy great water rides and it is very suitable for family , family with children , friends . I love the day out in this water park.

Awesome rides. This waterpark was cool! Quite a few thrilling rides with the Leap of Faith being my scariest!! The ground is HOT - wear jandals! Quite a bit of walking to see the whole park but they do have the buggies going that pick you up. The beach area is nice, spacious, lots of seating and great views. Food, drinks etc are expensive. water is $13UAE. You can take water into the park which id advise - but you can't take food. We enjoyed our day, from opening to closing! HUGE DAY

Unlimited access. As we were staying at the hotel we could go into the water park how often we wanted too. Plenty of sunbeds, great water rides lots of well trained staff keeping everyone safe!! and immaculately clean.
So much fun. the best water park ever!!!!!!! We had so much fun with my friend. The only bad point is the food is expensive there.

Alton Towers watepark Copycat. Very good place to go if you have children but the walk to do the rides is not very pleasant. Climbing the steeps steps to get to the tides were a killer. Didn't enjoy it at all.

So much fun for a day out in Dubai. This place does exactly what you expect from a waterpark and more. The lazy river here is incredible. I could have happily gone around it all day long! The rides were great fun, and I loved that there were a lot of rides that my wife and I could go on together in a double ring. Would recommend to anyone that wants an adventurous day out.

Disappointing. I found this waterpark chaotic a little bit scruffy the floor around the pool was peeling and bubbled which made people trip up too crowded and busy ques for rides quite long and we were in early, showers not many having been to Wild Wadi next to Jumeirah beach hotel and free while we stayed there how clean and well run I found Atlantis too big busy and scruffy the beach area felt slimy underfoot and the sea felt more like a stagnant pond.

Visited twice whilst staying at the Atlantis . Fabulous water park rides especially the rapids are fun lots of places to relax with plenty of sun loungers and the beach and sea were a good place to relax and have a swim

Someone stole my shoes, still enjoyed it. Quite a queue to get in and they will try and get as much money as possible from you, a bit like florida ,but still a great day out ,great slides lazy river was refreshing in the crazy heat and nice beach, whilst on the lazy river someone stole my shoes leaving me bare footed in 40 degrees 10 miles from my hotel LOL , lost and found were not too helpful but my wife thought it was hilarious and it made her day ,
Time to play. A great park with lots of thrills. It needs more variety of water experiences to advance its status. Great life guard protection

Great Fun. First time at the Aquaventre Waterpark as during my previous stay I went to Wild Wadi Waterpark. Having been to both my personal opinion would be Wild Wadi was better, however this is purely based on the fact that when we went to Aquaventure around 2/3 of the rides were closed for maintenance, including the Aquaconda which I was looking forward to before going. However with that being said it was great fun with friends! Would recommend a visit.

Wild and Wet!!!. Don't miss Poseidon's Revenge (my butt is still hurting...), and Leap of Faith (unfortunately, the sharks were on vacation while we were there :-(
Other than that - bring your sandals, it's HOT!
Oh, and don't forget to bring loads of $$ - you'll need it for every cone of ice cream, towels, aquarium, lockers, basically everything...
water world. tower slide is most attractive one we found there. friendly staffs and crews are supportive.totally a great atmosphere.
Fantastic fun. We had a truly fantastic trip to the adventure water park. Excellent for families and for a romantic day away.
amazing park. beside various water rides all funny, i enjoyed nice cool fresh fruit stands, also the new zip-line ride was really enjoyable...

Awesome!! . It was a bonus coming here as it is located within The Palm Atlantis, so to view that hotel was crazy! The water park is AMAZING! The rides don't disappoint and there is something for everyone. Entry price is reasonable and with views of Palm Beach on the doorstep, it's hard to not feel like you're in paradise
Fun. My family enjoys water parks and this one doesn't disappoint. The lazy river is quite long and branches off into rapids and big waves.
fabulous and fun day out (2 adults!). Lots of fun, great slides and a good day out. Well organised. Beware of the hot floor. Worth a visit.
Well worth a visit. A great attraction with slides to suit every age group. Great value for money. Stunning location. We had a fantastic time.

Very expensive day out. We visited the watermark via courtesy shuttle, from our resort with 2 families. We found the park very expensive, even on the basic package, and soon realised that compared to Wild Wadi and Yas Water Park in Abu Dhabi, Aquaventure did not have the variety of rides or activities we had experienced at the other parks. Disappointing, expensive day out.

'So much fun at Aquaventure Park'. As guests of Atlantis the Palm we had unlimited entry to the water park, our stay was from 28th August-4th September 2016. Upon approaching the gates at the entrance of the water park we showed the attendants our room key and joined a queue where we were given a band to wear around our wrists to allow us entry into the park. We paid for a locker at this point as well. However, once we had entered the park we bought a waterproof plastic see through case that you wear around your neck that holds your iPhone, and you are able to take photos through it. We also kept some money in the case for snacks and food which is sold around the park. We found that if you don't have a lot of items to lock away it is not really necessary to pay for a locker and the waterproof case. We had paid for both unnecessarily. We found Aquaventure a thrilling experience and there was an abundance of lifeguards all along the routes of the water slides, and all around the park, so you felt completely safe. Aquaventure is so much fun for all ages !!!!!

Family visit to water park. Very big with lots of walking. Very good children splash area with many small slides. The lazy river is unique as there is a wave feature inthere. Long rapids good for family's. Tried aquaconda and zoomarango both are good for youngg children. The towers need better cleaning as there wass a definitive stink like old shoes

Expensive but worth it. Ive been to several waterparks and this is so far my favorite. The entrance is quite expensive, basic entrance ticket is 80 euro for tourists and 50 euro for locals. But when you love waterslides, it is totally worth it. When you dont, stay away.Tip: buy some water sandals/shoes because tiles tend to get real hot or use the watercirculating system to float from attraction to attraction.

Loads of Fun and Excitement at Aquaventure!!!. One of the best water parks I have ever visited. Although it was a sunny day when we visited it was still enjoyable as we were in the water most of the time. The lazy river with intermittent Rapids and Torrents was really relaxing... you could just stay floating on it all day long. Poseidon's and Neptune's towers have a good number of adrenaline pumping activities. However, if you are the scary kind... avoid the Leap of Faith and Poseidon's revenge. It would be best to stay in house at Atlantis the Palm to enjoy the park unlimited number of times in a day.
Best in the World. It is a must visit place in UAE. Staff and the environment and its visiting customer all are unique.
Amazing. Amazing and magnificent water park , a lot of activity's and smoothly running park , No long waiting time or queues

Average. Had high expectations of this water park. Had a good day, but apart from leap of faith thought rides were very tame. More a young family water park. Having been to the Australian Theme Parks (which are amazing) felt this park had a long way to go to get to their standard.

Recommend 👍. We had a right laugh,even though we only had an hour ,are fault,we went along lazy river and the Rapids ,don't know who had the biggest laugh me or the life guards.No matter what age something at Aquaventure for everyone

Exceptional Recreation Activity. Just follow these tips and you will not make the mistakes we made:- Book to stay at the hotel and get this for free. This way its will be a great value. People normally calculate for one day, by staying at the hotel, you get it for both the days - the day you check in and the day you check out and if you get a ate checkout like we checked in right at 12 pm and checked out at 4 pm, you will have a ball of a time.- Buy the Go-Pro with a head band to record the real adventure.- Buy the waterproof mobile pouches at the Atlantis shop, worth it than buying a locker for 40 AEDs.- Start from the river area in front of Kids Splasher Pool. This is the best point as it leads to Torrents and Rides and you manage to come back to the same spot you have started from- Buy zip-lining right in the morning the next day, that way you can do it as many times as you want to.- take a light breakfast as some of the rides, you will have a problem with a full stomach- take your own beach sandals, the hotel ones are very flat.- opens up at 10 so be there at 9:45 am to start it early- plan, read it in on their website and get the max bang for your buck- Keep a pack of panadol - you will need it for both the days.- keep some band-aids handy as you may need them

Great Day Out at Waterpark. Many slides, tubes, rafts, and rapids to be entertained for a whole day easily - or even just relaxing on one of the many sun chairs available with umbrellas.Not sure how much it is to get in if not a guest at Atlantis, but understand that if you want to come for the day I believe it is available.Food is at premium prices but maybe not for Dubai.Great day out but it is connected to a resort, so be prepared for resort prices - $$$$$

Lazy river brilliant. I have visited the Aquaventure a few times now and thoroughly enjoyed it each time. We went in June 16 after doing the dolphin experience. You can go in for free if you book swimming with the Dolphins so try to book dolphin experience early morn so you can spend the rest of the day in the waterpark. Love the lazy river just floating along on your inflatable ring not a care in the world. The leap of faith is a must, queues can be a bit long but worth waiting for. Food and drink is quite expensive and don't try to sneak your own in as they check your bag and confiscate them off you. Can get a bit crowded at times but well worth it, if you have kids they will love it. Would have given 5 stars if it wasn't so crowded and the food was a bit cheaper.

Fun for young and old. During my stay in Dubai I was 2 times in the waterpark. I enjoyed it very much.
Very refreshing by hot weather. Would go back that is sure!

Summer attraction . Definitely an amazing summer attraction, we had a complimentary entry because we were staying in Atlantis. The park was big and had great games and friendly staff. Most of the services were good and will definitely visit it next summer.

Good day out enjoying the sun and the water rides. We visited on a Friday which we thought was going to be very busy as it is the weekend for people in the UAE. we arrived at about 10.30 time and it wasn't too busy so we went up and done the leak of faith flat to get that out of the way which was a great way to begin with a big adrenaline rush dropping down 9 stories. We hired a locker and a towel for 50d. Which is not to bad the towels are huge which is good. We went on all the different rides and only really had to que up for two rides which was only for about 15-20 minutes. The disappointment was that the ride going through the shark tank was open but there was nothing in the shark tank, so you just bobbed along looking into an empty tank. The dissapointing thing was that there was no signs saying about it or no monies off the price of the tickets as not all working. There was one other ride not working as well which was a shame to again no signs beforehand saying it was closed. The other rides were great thou and we throughly enjoyed our day out on the lazy river going around enjoying the sun. I would say if you want to go to sunbathe then get yourself a lounger early as they more than likely will go. We didn't have a lounger and you don't really need one as you dry off instantly and there are seats to sit on when buying food drink etc. All in all this is a great day out where you can enjoy the sun and the water rides..

Really great day. We arrived at 10am and paid 40 dirham for a locker. There was no queue for the slides at this time of morning so we hoped straight on all the slides. We even managed to get a sunbed which we had all day. The food in the restaurant is reasonably priced. The rides are really fun and so is the lazy pool... I loved the fact that there were different routes for the lazy pool which led onto the rapids and wave pool and also a slide which we didn't have to get off our float as we were taken up on a mechanical ramp. You can also access the beach which was nice for some quiet time. The park definetly filled up in the afternoon which we had to queue up for rides.

Friendliest staff around. This is a great family park with great staff. The lazy river is my favorite to relax and soak up some sun. Easy to get around the park but bring some water shoes because the ground is HOT!!

Lazy River fun. This is the 2nd time I have visited Aquaventure. There were some areas closed, I assume for maintenance. I did comment at the time the park could do with a lick of paint as starting to look abit faded and worn out! However maintenance aside, I still had a blast spending most of the day on the lazy river. This time around we found we were getting numerous wrist bands stuck on us after getting unwanted photos taken by the photomen. It got very busy in the afternoon so we did a stint on the slides and on the beach. The beach was a lovely escape from the masses in the pool areas and had a nice peaceful area partitioned off for swimming / bathing. Wish we moved to the beach earlier than we did.

wet. we stayed at the atlantis hotel so had free access daily towels are freely available if you are a hotel guest not sure if paying guests get same free towels large crazy childrens area where water pours everywhere and keeps them cool shark pool was undergoing a make over and was drained but everything else was open the lazy river is fantastic and so long if staying off hotel its very well worth a visit

Great day out! . Visited with my husband. Despite being super busy the park didn't feel full, no huge queues for anything and plenty of free sunbeds. You can take go pros and cameras, and would probably get some good action videos on the rapids which are great. Lockers are an additional cost and it's cheaper to book tickets for the park on the website, which you can even do on the same day. Easy to spend all day there, as there is lots to do, and you can chill out on the sunbeds/beach once you are exhausted from the slides! Although there are a lot of rides the park is pretty compact which makes your day easier.
Run Down. It is shame to the Atlantis brand that this hotel and park have got so run down and in need of a refresh

Relaxing and joyful . We went as a family for the second time and we enjoyed it a lot.You can find for all ages from 2 years in going,no big queue, the river is wonderful for all ages and safe.The only comment is that their is no food diversity or fresh juice all the food and juice are unhealthy.

Fun & Expensive. As most things in Dubai Aquaventure is rather pricey. Went there with an Emirate Platinum Card holder which makes it 50% less expensive so that was positive. The water park is very well done, cleaner than most water parks as well. The rides are fun and some, really fast. You need a whole day, not only because of the fact that you want to try the rides several times, but you queue like never before, and remember in the Dubai heat, you spend at least half of your day waiting in a queue under the baking sun. All in all a fun experience. I have been there several times and I like the rides and the different things to look at. Avoid all public holidays and days where most people are off work. It will make it the trip from hell. Enjoy

Great way to cool off, fantastic for young children. We came here as a family of 2 adults and 3 young children. We arrived very late at 4.30pm and we were told the adventure park closes at sunset therefore we only stayed at the children's pool area and a little bit of the adult pool. It was a bit pricey but I was not surprised I mean this is at ATLANTIS. It was however worth every penny, the children's pool with the slides was amazing. The water was nice and low even my 1 year old was comfortable to be left alone. It was a perfect place to cool off as you can imagine Dubai weather. This place is one of the top things to do while in Dubai if you're a family with young children. Overall it was a perfect family day out. The kids really enjoyed it. The staff were excellent and very helpful.

Good Fun and worth a visit. Good fun and worth a visit. Site is well planned with plenty of room considering how busy it was. Rides were great and the rapids a favorite. Barracuda was great to cool down and get some food. Long day and exhausted by having so much fun.
Wicked. Totally fantastic - not for the faint hearted. will keep you occupied all day and a great choice of restaurants.

Lovely way to spend a day. We spent a hot day floating around in the pools, and jumping on the rides. The Leap of Faith was pretty intense, it took all my courage not to walk back down the steps! it was definitely quicker this way!
For the Whole Family. bring your whole family they will enjoy so much the slides and the view. good staff and friendly. we love it

Fun day. It was really good for the children to have their day at the park. The leap of faith was an experience in itself but not for the faint hearted but still worth trying to get the adrenaline pumping. Its a great place for the children.

Good Afternoon with friends. Very busy park. Lines were long but tolerable. I enjoyed my afternoon there. Had lockers and towel hire and plenty of loungers to relax on. Though we just sat in tubes through the Rapids and lazy river as it was less crowded that way.

Fun day in the sun. You don't need kids as an excuse to go and it's a lot of fun. Spending the whole day in there is worthwhile and there are thrill rides to suit most tastes. Service is good and plenty of places to get food and drink
Significants. It's a good place in a very luxury hotel, but it's very expensive, and it wouldn't be good in summer.
The best aqua park I have been to. No regrets. Just go for it. This is a really great place to spend a day in, Food is bad - typical fast-food. Bad food is compensated by great rides.

This place just gets better with every visit ❤️. We visited at the end of August and it was quite quiet which was great. The water slides were such fun I was worse than the kids would definitely recommend it to people who want a bit of fun and also a relax because the beach side areas are so relaxing just a short distance away from the action. My kids loved this place so much we will be returning ... The zoomranga ride was an experience ..
Fabulous. Everything you expect and more. We have been 3 times and it gets better each time. It is the perfect place whether you have young children or teenagers.

Must-Do when in Dubai!. We visited the aqua venture waterpark in May 2016 and it was a great day out. We didn't stay in the hotel but a quick taxi ride took us out to the edge of the palm and the waterpark. Loads of slides to suit everyone (thrill seekers and chill-seekers alike)!My personal favourite was the shark attack that takes you through the fish tank, absolutely breath-taking. We also did the zip line for a small additional fee, and while it was fun, I probably wouldn't bother with it again, I found it quite sedate!Using the lockers in the changing room can be slightly tricky but when you get it sussed its relatively straightforward. Food onsite is basic but nice. There are also plenty of toilets around for use.We stayed on the lazy river and went round and round for hours until it was time to leave. I will be back!

Offers fun and joy. It's the largest water park in the Middle East. You can enjoy the water slides on a boat or move around in the wavy river connecting the pools. You can rent a safe box and lock your staff in the box, for around 40 AED.
Waterpark in the alantis the palm is amazing 10/10. Best waterpark ever ! Our children wanted to go every day for 2xweeks and they never got bored ! The staff are very friendly X
Fun for the family!. We loved the water park and tried almost everything they offered! Plan to spend the day as the lines can be long, but you'll also not want to leave!
