Fantastic. The best water park in Dubai! something for every age group, we stayed all day was pricey but money well spent

Best waterpark. The best thing is that you need to book a room in Atlantis and the water park enterance is complimentary, in a way it is good as it gives you enough time to plan and also enjoy the masterpiece of the hotel. Most importantly there are lot of staff and lifeguards every 5 Mts to take care in the water. Hats off.
the best. The best waterpark with a numerous of slides that you will enjoy with your friends or family! Quite expensive for no-UAE residents.

not a good idea during the summer season. A huge waterpark, many activities and water slides, too expensive though for providing nothing different than any other similar park. We have been there in September and the weather was too hot (more than 40 C) to be pleasant to stay the whole day outside as there are almost no shades to hide (very limited number of umbrellas; dappled tree shades); water too warm to be pleasant. Only junk food inside, again - very overpriced. They offer pictures taken on you (you can see them when exiting the park) which are approx. 30 USD each, only on paper (no digital copy)! In general - if you have plenty of time to spend in Dubai and you are visiting the park during the season, which is not so hot it may be worth it as it is an interesting attraction, otherwise I wouldn't recommend it.

Eid Holiday getaway!. We've decided to spend our Eid holiday at Atlantis Aquaventure in Dubai. Everything was ok except that there are no sharks in the shark attack ride (i think they're on maintenance or something). Overall it was a one of a kind experience. Definitely will come back here.

Best Water Park Ever. I went to Aquaventure last week and after being to the disney water parks earlier in the year found this to be by far the best water park i have ever been to. The slides were exciting and the lazy river is anything but. The biggest slide where you are stood in a tube before the floor falling away was a highlight for me although it was terrifying i found it exhilarating and great fun. The only disappointment was that the sharks tank was closed but this didn't spoil what was an amazing day out.

Adrenaline Pumping Experience. This is a great place to enjoy with your family. But can't recommend it to a family with very small children as you won't be able to enjoy the adult areas. Quite expensive place but if you enter early in the morning you can enjoy the whole day and it is worth the price you pay.

Average . Visit this water park with kids is really expensive, the ticket is very expensive and you have to pay for the safety box , towels.There is no showers enough for people i have to wait approximately 30 minutes to take shower and the same that happened to my wife The changing room is very small so the doors open half way.
Cool attraction for family and kids who love water. At atlantis, there are so cool rides, dolphinarium and suer exciting fun all day long, a full day is needed

Excellent family fun adventure.. Must stay in the Atlantis, just for a Aquaventure access. Fantastic family fun, even teenagers have lots of thrill rides. World class facility which will ensure you memorable time.
Aqua fun at Atlantis. Great family trip - well worth the day out for old and young alike. Plenty of options for families and singles
Brilliant. It is quite prices to go into this attraction but I stayed from 10-6pm and the lazy river is amazing. Lots of staff around and very helpful. The food is good value along with the drinks

Ideal for all age groups; renting a locker recommended. It has something that appeals to every age group. Avoid visiting on Friday/Saturday due to maddening rush and renting a locker is highly recommended.

Great Waterpark but Expensive. The waterpark is one of the best in Dubai.. A must if you visit Dubai in the hot summer. You can spend a good whole day here and not get bored at all but the prices are quite expensive as on top of the high entry price per person, the lockers are charged for to store your things in, which you will need unless you go completely empty handed as you will be submerged in water for most of the time there while going round in the float rings.The park is also quite busy so do expect it to be packed out and queues on the slides but never the less its a very nice place to be and to enjoy with your little ones.

A fun day out. We went to Aquaventure for the first time yesterday, despite living in Dubai for 3 years. I had heard many mixed reviews about the place and I'm glad we went and experienced it for ourselves. Being UAE residents, we only paid AED 195 per adult for entrance when we showed our Emirates IDs. The rides were in good condition, and there were lifeguards stationed everywhere - lovely for parents worried about taking their children. My favourite rides were the rides at the Tower of Poseidon (Aquaconda, Zoomerango, Slitherine and Poseidon's Revenge). I did feel that the water flow was a little too weak in the rapids, which resulted in many people just bobbing in one place and causing a backlog. Tip: Get there early! We were able to do all the rides between 10:00am -12:00 as there weren't too many queues.

Fun filled adventure to fill your whole day. Like any other water park, Aquaventure water park at Atlantis is wonderful place to spend a fun filled day of adventure with kids n family. Rides like Poseidon's revenge, leap of faith and neptune's tower needs strong heart. For the faint hearted there is beautiful water ride by the beach. Good restaurants are available to feed tummy grumblings. Must must visit.

Great day out!. We arrived at around midday and did the Dolphin Bay experience where we swam and played with the dolphins - great for all ages and would recommend.The lazy river was fun and it was great to chill out before hitting some of the extreme rides. Lots of people turned back at the top of 'The Leap of Faith' (I nearly did) but my advice is to go for it!Food in the Baracuda restaurant was as good as food is at these parks and was included in our dolphin bay ticket but like everything in Dubai, it's a little expensive if a big family. Aquarium was good but only went as it was included in the dolphin bay ticket and I don't think I'd bother otherwise as Dubai Mall has a better one!
A family day. on the birthday of my daughter ( free entrance ) we have spent a great day at tha Aquaventure Waterpark.

You can spend the whole day there. We arrived at the park at 10am in order to miss queues etc, and we left after 6pm and we didn't want to leave. We went in September and the park wasn't that busy, didn't have to wait long in lines for the different rides. I went on every single ride and the thrill you get out of Leap of Faith and Poseidon's Revenge is hard to describe, you will not be disappointed. The beach is nice and clean, and the overall park is pleasing to look at. The lifeguards are funny and always watching out for you. It is an expensive adventure, the food, drinks and other stuff you'll want to buy there is pricey, but you will spend the whole day there and you will have an awesome time.
Love it. My favorite waterpark and one of my most fav things to do in Dubai. Amazing lazy river/ Rapids - could spend all day going round and around and around and around...
A great way to cool down in Dubai. We spent an afternoon here and it was great. Did not go on many of the "extreme" slides but enjoyed the peaceful ride on the long (45 minutes) river ride

Most amazing experience. Caters for all. So my husband likes big water slides and this without a doubt caters for this. As i am terrorfied of hieghts there is one which is like a lake with soft twists and turns with a few cheeky guys who push you along and put ice on you or even cold water. You have to be up for fun. I really enjoyed the lake ride. Super sweet. Spend 45 minutes on my own and did not realise it. Great. I also managed to do a step on with the dolphins. This 10 minutes was the best experience i have ever felt.

Lazy days on the lazy river!. Excellent park all be it, it's a bit expensive to eat or drink but great rides and wasn't too busy. Take your flip flops as the ground is too hot to walk between rides. Plenty of loungers and massive thick towels. All part of our hotel package so even better.

Brilliant . Simply brilliant loads to do for children and we loved it.Be carefully on the lazy river and part of it comes out my the Rapids and overturned our rings and my 1 year was with us so I would suggest getting out at the main part then go back round.The only thing that would be better is have a single que and then they can join groups they do at Disney and it's brilliantBrilliant park brilliant day will come back again

day out. This visit was not a good as previous visit, had packet of pringles and packet of crisps taken off at entrance and then only to see other people having there own food in there. Not impressed. Felt happy to take money not even given a map of the park!
Verry good park. I have been to a lot of waterparks and this is a good one for adrenalin and chilling. Mostly for young people (like 20-30 year old)

just average. We were disapointed with this park. As we arrived, we were informed they had 2 experiences closed for maintenance and one only half working, the "shark attack" ( a water slide that enters inside the aquarium with sting rays, sharks and all kind of fishes), which was what we wanted to see the most, so it was very disapointing because the price is expensive for what you get. I recomend paying for a locker with towel if you don´t have yours and also buy the meal deal as it is less expensive than the normal food inside the fast food restaurants. You are not allowed to take food inside, just water and I advise it. Inside each small botle is 12 AED ( normal price is just 3 AED). To get there you can take the metro to the station where it links to the tram and then from the tram go and catch the monorail. The slides inside are ok, but not what I would expect for 65 euros each person...

Birthday bash with a splash! . Great escape from the real world. The waterpark made my birthday a blast! Plus it's free access when you register to them. Really an awesome treat for a celebrant. Anyways grateful for this experience.

second visit but could do better. I wish I could like this place but I do find its so manic as well as very very expensive. We visited in August 2015 and then in August 2016 and I feel the park could make the experience better. Its not cheap as it cost us over £200.00 for 3- 4 hours of rides, which for me with the queueing worked out to 4 rides..... My tip is take water shoes, although they ask you to take them off and hold them on certain rides "Leap of Faith" etc as to walk around the park is an impossibility with the extreme temperatures of the floors. We had 4 Slush drinks in the park and it cost £25.00 !!! You come out feeling shattered. If we return to Dubai next year we will give it a miss.

Wonderfull rides and great lay out!!. If you are a game for water rides, there are a few better than this. Amazing!! Just too much fun for kids and adults alike. There is sufficient security and back up available so not to worry. The only negative point that I can mention is that I went thinking it is open for Hotel Guests only and hence was a bit let down due to crowd.It can get a bit crowded!!

Fun fun fun. Perfect for a day with your family or friends. Plenty to do and many outlets to use. The rides are fun and you will laugh plenty for sure. Good for small children as well as young adults !

I don't usually like waterparks but I enjoyed this. My partner and I went to the Aquaventrure Waterpark because he really wanted to, I was not overly fussed but was happy to go along. I really enjoyed it! The Palm and the Atlantis hotel itself is incredible. The waterpark had great slides, lots to do, and something to suit all ages. It was clean and well run. We had a wonderful time.

Disappointed. Probably not a true reflection of the park itself, but we wanted to take our 1 year old for a splash in the kids pool but it was closed on the day we went. Disappointing for us, but it did look like a great place. Would have liked to have gone without kids!

A day filled with aqua joy. Situated at farthest crescent of Dubai Palm, aquaventure water park also known as Atlantis water park is dream destination for family tourists visiting Dubai. Getting there from centre of the city is costly as it would charge AED120+. Entry to the Park is also expensive but definitely gives value for money. One should bring sun lotion

the best waterpark.. as guests of the atlantis hotel you get to go to the water park free of charge, and the queing times are really short so its a must for a fantastic family fun day in the lazy river.

Very disappointing . It was our second return to The Atlantis Aquaventure water park as we did it last year on our trip to Dubai and it was the highlight of our trip we loved it and couldn't talk about it enough. But this year was an entirely different story. As we were walking through park on our way to lazy we noticed some construction going on and some places blocked off to the public but didn't take much notice then we proceeded to the lazy river which 90% of it was fine until you came to section where there were doing construction and there was loads of rubble and dirt coming into the lazy river and they had one lifeguard in the water trying his best to push people out of the way. We then proceeded to go on the slides and as shark attack was my favourite ride last year I was greatly looking forward to it because as a lot of you know you come down the tube tunnel and in to a see through long glass tunnel where you can see the Sharks and thousands of other fish which is amazing . But to my shock came out of the tunnel into the glass box to find no water and no fish terrible we were like what is going on here and made our way around what would be great attractions watching all the fish in tanks around the park there was nothing just bare dirt. We were so dissapointed at this it just ruined our day there and the fact that they do not tell you this on entrance when paying is a disgrace they should have at least a discount running and give people proper notice (shame on you Atlantis) I spoke to one of the people whom worked there and he said that some pipe had burst there about a month ago and they had to empty all the fish tanks to repair it and it's unknown when it will be finished maybe a month or two. It's totally understandable and these things do happen but let the public know before people go wasting there money to see something that's not there. TERRIBLE
fantastic. one of my favorite place in dubai. i left my children and wifes and was playing screaming like a small boy.
Adventure . So amazing....Really we have fun.My friends and i really grateful to be inside. Stress free.Fanstasy island...We will come again...

Excellent Water park. Can't really express how much we enjoy this water park. The rides can be breathtaking and there is not horrendous queues.Plenty of sun beds and umbrellas for when you need a rest or time in the shade.Plenty of places to eat or just buy a drink and a range of shops if you want a souvenir or have forgotten suncream, pool shoes etc.There are life guards in abundance making sure everyone is safe

Great waterpark where the time flies!. Buy the ticket in advance from your hotel or online, it's cheaper. Buy a locker so you can leave your stuff there and take some snacks with you. This way we didn't have to buy any food or drinks from the waterpark area. These lockers are situated in changing rooms so if you have boys and girls in same group, either take two lockers or be ready to deliver other group member's stuff to the locker and back. Some diving "shoes" or similar can be good, but we where barefoot and it worked fine. Slides are soooo much fun! This waterparks has activities for adventurous and more laid back people, anything you want really!
chilling expereince. though its crowded but its better than iceland and rak island water park, enough spots for little kids and thrilling slides for adults
Family day. I stayed at the Atlantis and had free access to the waterparkit was a good fun day, floating around in the double rings in the lazy river. I was not brave enough to try the slides.
Kids and Adults love it. We went as a family and my boys really enjoyed it. there is so much to do and enjoy the water park . Weather was lovely and warm.

Enjoyable aquapark. Wow. How amazing this place.
The rides.
The view inside its perfect.
As if you are in fantasy land.
Me n my hubby really enjoyed our stay here in Dubai.
I will surely recommend to every one this wonderful land.

An average experience compared to others. Somewhat disappointing considering the price of £60 ish per entry. 2 rides were cancelled, providing customers with about 4 rides.
Other waterparks are better and cheaper however if in Dubai you may as well experience this.

Me and my wife with 13 and 4 year old. Staying at the Atlantis so had a pass to enter daily, I had visited the year before for a day pass whilst staying elsewhere. The park is huge !! You need to use a golf buggy to get around haha, shark tank was not open due to a leak which I no is out of any ones control but was a bit upset as my children could not see the fish.Loads and loads of lifeguards all on the ball in the kids area which again is huge All in all great day out if your not staying at Atlantis and even better if you are staying on site as its free and you can go as much as you want.

Expensive but worth it. Visited in early September and although expensive it provided entertainment for the day. The one ride i wantef to experience through shark enclosure closed but still charged full price being one of only 3 negative issues. The 2nd is that the ground and cement is extremely hot and you need to ensure your shoes with you the whole time or you will run from shady spot to shady spot to get to next ride. Carpet tiles on the side of cement walkway would solve this. Finally signage very poor to non existantOther than that it was money generally wrll spent with the park catering to all ages and types of thrill seakers.

Take a lot of money !!. My wife and 2 daughters went on the Dolphin adventure and I sat in the shore watching . Afterwards we went into the water park . Food prices and entrance fees are absolutely insane . 9 $ for an ice cream or soda . Photos of dolphin interaction were almost 30$ each . The rides were not bad , but they didn't justify the price .

nerve wrecking experience. Pros-****water is clean and well maintainedmany sports and adventure activityspread in large areacan be enjoyed with friends and familybest in towngreat addition to Palm Atlantis HotelCons-******Very expensiveyou need lots of spirit and sportiness to enjoy

Not the best Waterpark, but still enjoyed it.. It was a fun day out and we enjoyed ourselves. I do feel however that there is a lack of thrill seeking rides. There are about 2 that really gets the blood pumping.Also on one ride 5 friends consecutively went down the ride and had terribly red scratched backs from the tube fittings, This put me kinda off. If you are staying at Atlantis this is free of course, which would make it worth it, but I would rather spend my money on Yas Island or Wild Wadi to seek the thrill.

Brilliant day out for kids and adults!. It's pricey but get there when it opens and make a full day of it. The big rides get very busy as the day goes on so do those first and then spend some time on the lazy river as the park gets busier. Eating and drinking there is quite expensive but that's standard for most waterparks - take your own towels and we often go for dinner afterwards so it feels like a real treat.

A place for all age. Love this big waterpark. They have a kids water play area which is where my 3 years old played. Love it. The weather is very hot but it's ok when in water to keep you a bit cool. Drink plenty of water. Didn't try the water slides this time. Will go back one day.

Thrilling . This water park is located inside the Palm Atlantis Hotel. It has variety of rides from small to big so anyone of any age can enjoy this park. It's connected to a white sand private beach which only accessible to hotel guests and it's very beautiful and peaceful .

Not great - overhyped and unhelpful staff. Our visit to Dubai exceeded all our expectations... except this place. We found staff were not helpful, the layout was not thought through (you can hire towels, but cannot collect them near the changing rooms, for example - only a 5 minute walk away - yet you only need them at the end of your visit when you get changed). Loads of rides, and you cannot do them all in a day, but very few suitable for younger children. Probably great for a group of adults or families with teens, but we were held back because there was so little for our youngest to do. The area for little children closed during the day as someone had 'made it dirty' - great that it is kept clean, but it meant there was nothing at all left for ours to do. Lifeguards were amazing and very thorough. The day was spoilt by the other staff, though, and we were hugely disappointed that an attraction aimed at children was full of cigarette smoke, particularly outside the changing rooms and near the rides (totally unlike the rest of Dubai where smoke was almost non-existent).
Brill day out. It's expensive but well worth it.We spent 5 hours there and found it very clean with liads of space to sit. The staff are also very helpful.I found the drinks reasonable priced.

SO DISAPPOINTED. Can't believe I am writing this review.Ever since seeing the Atlantis on tele, I've always wanted to go.I went with my wife and son, My wife hates water parks. She sat on the beach. The whole day cost me £258 WOW That is a lot. That price included 3 adults in water park, entry to aquarium + lunchFood,, well Soggy burger Disgusting.Water park, its massive and proper spread out. which is not nice in 45 degree heat.I know they cant help the heat,(+ i love the heat) but lockers were miles away, so you couldn't carry money around with you, so that meant you dehydrated. One water slide we queued for over half an hour in that heat. They need a water machine up the stairs or something. I went to a water park in Paphos in May, it was fantastic you had barcoded wrist bands where you could buy a drink without carrying cash around and pay at the end.. Solves all the problems of people dehydrating and killing over in the heat.Back to the slides, so spread out and busy I got to go on 4,, I had enough just to busy..I cant believe this water park doesn't even have any nice big pools or a wave machine pool..At least my wife could have enjoyed it a bit more. The sun loungers are near enough on top of each other, its like looking at a tin of sardines.The main reason why I wanted to go to this water park over the others was because of the shark tank, where you go into on a ring or in a slide...Guess what it was empty being worked on AAAGGHH.. That explains the day I had their.The Aquarium was nice. It had some lovely colourful fish in the tanks.. Please do not ask me to name any of them except the ones from finding Nemo ( i only know their personal names)The reason being not one tank had a chart on saying what is what... How is anyone suppose to learn...Overall review.. You are paying for the name and location. That is it..Mr & Mrs P

Best park in the world. Woow what a place. Great rides for all age. I have been there with family with my parents we all enjoyed a lot . Leap of faith is awesome. Awesome experience and relaxing in water. Water is damn clean. Good facility of showers,soap.conditioner in washroom

Go on a Friday morning. Arrived at Atlantis at 10am and within an hour my son and I had been on all the top rides, some of them twice.. it was like having exclusive use of the park for a time.. By 11:30 it got busier but it was still very comfortable considering that Friday is a day of rest for most in Dubai.The exchange rate meant it was £116 for the 2 of us for the day which isn't cheap but we did get our monies worth so value wise I can't knock it.

Great Water Park. We stayed at Atlantis so we had free admission to Aquaventure for the duration of our stay. We visited from 23rd August to 28th August and found the park reasonably quiet in the mornings if we got to the park for 1000am. Tuesday was the quietest day and Friday & Saturday were the busiest days.We took the golf buggy ride from Atlantis and got dropped at the Barracuda restaurant stop at there are locker facilities there that are less busier than at the front of the park.Obviously during August it is very hot but we actually managed to stay fairly cool as we were in the water for most of the time. Because of the heat the floor surface gets very warm so I would recommend you were pool shoes or sandals throughout the park. You are allowed to carry them in your hands on the water rides so we found it much better wearing them than leaving them in the locker. Queue time during our visit was generally less than 5 mins. There were two attractions closed for maintenance during our visit but this had no impact on our enjoyment.We normally holiday in Florida every year and we have visited most of the waterpark there. What we particular liked about Aquaventure was that some of the attractions you could go on without having to get out of the inflatable ring as you were transported uphill sitting in it.The views from the waterpark of the Palm Island are incredible. The kids have already told me we are going back next year!

A enjoyable day out.. Generally, a well thought out park with a variety of things to do. We visited in August and two of the main attractions, the world's longest water slide and the slide through the shark tank were either not working or undergoing maintenance, which were the only disappointments.

Overrated . We had pre booked our tickets, on arrival we was told 3 of the main rides were closed, we had already travelled 45 mins and was unable to go a different day, the children's area was closed most of the morning (we was not told this). The food is expensive, the slush drinks were like water and the park closed 30 mins before advertised time. Staff unfriendly. Wild wadi is much better. The only good thing was the lazy river with Rapids

good day but a few disappointments . This park is expensive for tickets and they charged us full price even though some of the main attractions were out of order. 3 rides were closed for maintenance and the shark aquarium was not in use either. The park is overpriced but the slides are good. The views are exceptional and I loved that you could go on the beach too. The zip wire was fun and wasn't too expensive. There was a female life guard at the lazy river who sang to swimmers as they went passed, she was lovely and a great singer. We went round a few times to hear her as we found her to be adorable. The life guards are really nice. The admissions staff not so much.

Love it. Such a fun place. I spend almost all my time in the lazy river and Rapids which is as much fun as anything. The slides are also great and there's a good variety. Brilliant kids area also. Well worth going for a day.

Best ever. Great water park. Never been anywhere like this. We stayed in the hotel and came in 4 days on the trot.
Loved it.
Massive rides.
Great lazy river.
Fantastic !!!

Great family day.. We have used the park on a number of occasions as we stopped at the Atlantis. Kids aged 11 and 8 and both had plenty to do. The rapids are great. You can just keep going round in circles up the escalator then back through the rapids, great fun. The leap of Faith is worth a try if you dare. Various places for food and drink and free towels. Really good fun for a family day.

Lots of fun. It was amazing!! overall, I am scared of water since I cannot swim so I thought I might be in trouble... but i still did try to do it.I do not regret it. It was hella fun of a ride. First few rides were scary since you do not know what to expect, but after that it becomes fun and you go again and again. There's a lots of people! sadly there is one ride which does not let you go alone, so I did not try that, even though I wanted to. Other than that, it's lost of fun, the possibility of drowning is almost close to none. So many guards and everyone is friendly. It is good on a hot day to relax and just go around the waterpark. There is also access to the ocean on the side.. So you can spend all day there just to relax and have fun.

Expensive and not the best water park we have visited. We had a good day trip to Aquaventure. It is expensive and there is not much to do for children under 1.2 m. My 6 year old daughter was frustrated at the lack of slides she could go on. My older son enjoyed it but the ride we wanted to go on Aquaconda was closed which was disappointing. The staff were not overly helpful which is unusual for a Dubai resort. We have been to better water parks but it was ok.

Very good, but a few oversights are disappointing. Overall, the water park is great. The price is about what you would expect (AED195 for UAE residents, AED320 for tourists) and the price of food etc. once inside is reasonable. The rides are all great fun and there's a good variety of them. The lazy river that winds its way through the park is especially well thought out. What isn't well thought out is the fact that you would normally expect to be able to walk around a water park in bare feet, but this is barely possible at Aquaventure as the ground (at least today when I was there) was scorching hot, making you run from one scarcely shaded area to the next. It's completely ridiculous. If you do decide to wear flip flops from ride to ride then you're forced to either leave them at the bottom of the ride or carry them in your hands while you slide. I would recommend wearing your flip flops to one of the entrances to the lazy river, then leaving them there and using the lazy river to get near to the slides to minimise your walking distances. The other area that they fall down on is signage. Knowing where all of the slides are and how to get to them is not very obvious, and when you arrive at the base of a set of slides there are no signs telling you which way to go, no signs telling you which rides require a tube or not, and no signs telling you which line to choose for a particular ride. Quite how they can miss something so obvious baffles me. My advice - just copy what most people around you are doing and explore each line/set of stairs yourself. Overall, the park is great, I think I prefer Aquaventure to Wild Wadi, but I'd still say Yas Waterworld is better as far as rides are concerned, if you're happy to make the drive to Abu Dhabi.

Feels safe. Big park but so many lifeguards that i feel that my 2 children were safe going on the rides by themselves. They thoroughly enjoyed it. It was busy but didnt struggle to find sun loungers. Nice place to relax and cool down from the heat. Slippers are a must as couldnt walk otherwise, the ground was hot. Expensive to buy flip flops inside the park.Bought the photo of the children on our way out for 50 dirhams.

Much better than the wild wadi. Great family day out, little children can enjoy the kids section plus the torrents. Go early as dinghy are hard to get for small children.If you have booked in with the Atlantis its free to enter
Decent. Had fun there BUT dress code should be addressed at entry of the park not at top of the queue when you've waited to embark on a ride!

Good fun. We stayed at atlantis and went to the water park with kids. Found the walk soo far in heat especially when we couldn't find a bed. But after that it was good fun. But definitely prefer wild wadi. Queues was very long and as u had to put ur shoes in one place due to heat your feet would burn!!
We had a great time!!. Beatiful water park, nice, clean & friendly staffs!The best part is the the park is right next to the beach.Would love to come back again

Best waterpark in dubai. Aquaventure is the best waterpark in dubai but its expansive , compare to wild wadi its much better in term of visitor quality , rides , attractions , cleanness
The only thing is the higher price that is worth it compareto wild wadi

Great fun! One of the best days spent in Dubai. If you like the water like I do, and some thrills to go with it, I'd definitely put some time aside for this park. From a wave pool to the lazy river to the massive slide dropping into the pool below this park has something for everyone - whatever level of adventure seeker you are. Super for families with kids, and the temperature controlled water makes a welcome break from the scorching heat.

Great fun but busy !. Great to see new family rides. Gets Very busy and it seems with a lot of day visitors. Excellent pool/ride photographers so do give them a chance and you can view them free and buy only if you want. Children's area can get overly busy so keep an eye on them. Plenty of rings for lazy river. Nicely maintained although 2 new rides were closed for maintenance during our stay which was a shame. Hard working lifeguards despite the heat. Well done guys !

Excellent waterpark. Some of the slides are super fun. The beach is very clean as compared to the regular jumeira beach with much more facilities eg. sun shade, shower areas etc without any extra charges. kids play area is very nice.

The best Aquapark in Dubai . It is really the best Aquapark I have ever visited hear in Dubai! Access for the beach, good place to take a photo. Very good slides and very fun for babies, children and adults! The food in the aquapark is very delicious! There are two restaurants (exception onother smaller ones) that have a big areas with free water, ear conditions and really good food and service! I really love their Shavarma and reali big Hod dog menu! We see you again very soon guys

Great way to enjoy the heat of the sun!. This resort is a must place to see in Dubai, they have different water attractions that you would really enjoy, the water park is big and you will never get bored, the food inside is not that expensive as well, the staff are very helpful, most of them are expatriates and could speak perfect English so you don't have to worry about miscommunication. I would definitely visit this place again.
Good if you are staying in Atlantis Hotel. Good if you are staying in Atlantis Hotel, but its expensive for outside visitors, I Think the number of slide is limited and its very crowded in Aug.

Great fun!. We spent many days here as we stayed at the Atlantis. The slides and pools are great and there is so much to do! The queues could be long, I recommend going first thing in the morning or an hour before closing if there is something specific you want to do, without wasting your day queuing. My reason for 4 stars is because the ground was so hot it burnt your feet! You couldn't leave your flipflops if you were going down a waterslide and only certain rides you could take them with you. Therefore they need more areas whereby bear footed people can stand without burning, whilst queuing up for the rides. My adice is get as close as you can to a pool and get on the rides from there, instead of standing and queuing.

Chilled visit. The longest lazy river I have ever been on. Seemed like an hour. between the rapids and the torrent it was enough for me. Teens loved it but be warned of very sunny spots!! We paid the the retreat area which was well worth the money. Towels and as much water as we could drink and a very friendly guest relations who took food and drinks orders. Never spent more than 2 hours at any water park but was here all day. Loved it.

One of the Essential places in dubai to visit. The water park is free to those stating at the atlantis hotel and is a must to go. We spent a very happy week bobbing around the lazy river going into the rapids, torrent and water roller coaster rides. Then there are the jaw dropping water extravaganzas like the Leap of faith, Posidens revenge and the Shark bite rides for the non fate hearted

love it love it. second time visit this time with the kids 9 11 13 they and we absolutely loved it we had a fantastic day go on the zoomerang don't google it before and sit facing backwards and hold on.

Such fun.. Loved this place. Best tip I can offer is absolutely take a pair of water shoes with you in July as you will NOT be able to walk on the ground.
Have fun, it's ace.

Absolutely loved it. It's been 9 months since i went and i still can't get this waterpark off my mind. It was expensive but it was worth it. I would go back to Dubai soley for this waterpark. My favorite part is the conveyor belts that carry you to the next slides. The slides are so nice looking - they go through an aquarium type of thing and it's just beautiful, not much in the world like this to be honest!

Aqua splash fun!. Amazing day out. Queues are very long to get in. Even if you get a pre paid voucher you have to queue for wristband for entry.Positive: Very hot in AugustGet there earlyDont charge for sunbedsExcellent water ridesNegative:Not great food @ the park go into Atlantis to get better variety and feel the AC then go back out
Well organised and clean waterpark.. I like the Atlantis as opposed to the Wild Wadi as it spread over a larger area and doesn't feel too cramped or busy. The grounds are clean and well run.
So much fun!. My family and I loved the Aquaventure Waterpark! Full of fun! It's a great way to cool down especially in the summer, and also get the adrenaline pumping!
Great Fun. Definitely worth a visit! Less busy on a Sunday. Towels are provided....just brilliant! The torrent pool and rapids were great fun and the kid's splashpool is out of this world!

Holland. Just a great day out with the kids lots of fun down the rapids and leap of faith wow the lifeguard are so good nice people and friendless is just great thank you for a great time and memory's room 13450
Some attractions being refurbed. Went with my two children aged 10 and 12. They loved it but it was very expensive for what it is as parts were closed including the dolphin area.

Great waterpark but slightly spoilt by other guests. We love Aquaventure and have visited many times both as guests when staying at Atlantis and as day visitors when staying at another hotel.We have had some great times here but this most recent trip took the shine off it for us.For a start the park was so busy. I spoke with a member of staff who said that there was around 4000 visitors that day. Capacity was 12,000 and the most they had ever had on one day was 10,000. I can only imagine it would be hellish with those numbers!The lazy river was packed and huge bottlenecks were forming around the travelators which I didn't feel comfortable with.A couple of the rides (Aquaconda and Shamal) were closed for maintenance (didn't see any maintenance going on) but what really spoiled it for us this time was the behaviour of some other park guests.We left our belongings by Splashers and when we returned a lady and her family had completely taken over our loungers, moved our things onto the floor and pretended not to understand a word of what we were saying. Our clothes were still hanging from the back of the sun loungers and only when we threatened to call security did she move - to someone else's lounger! Another day we returned to wet towels and empty drinks cans on our table and on our final day, someone stole our towel. I don't know what's happened to the clientele visiting Aquaventure but I wasn't impressed.Food and drinks very expensive but 15% discount with Emirates Skywards card helps.Our daughter wanted to do the zipwire ride but every day we went it was closed for maintenance. Again didn't see any work going on.We have so many happy memories of visiting Aquaventure previously and because of this I am giving it 4 stars.ps. the staff ( lifeguards/team leaders etc) are always excellent.

Aquaventure Waterpark. Well this was my the second time visiting the Waterpark as i was there last year. It's a great place for families (teens and young children) you have single and double shaped donuts....well thats what i call them.. that take you around the lazy river with loads of sedate water slides.And is very safe as there are loads of lifeguards Strategically placed along the routes and in the water. Cost AED 260 which equates to about £55.00 for adults and AED 215 = £45.00 children the above fees are only available online so maybe a bit more in person. But if you are a resident of the hotel then all is free all day every day for the duration of your stay. May i also add they do have rides that are not for the faint hearted....Just saying.

Not great for Young Children. We went here with my 7 year old daughter, a lot of the rides were too big for her to go on. We were unable to get a sunbed or anywhere to sit. We stayed at the Atlantis hotel so got a free pass but would prove expensive for the attractions if not

Great Waterpark. Have visited this whilst staying at the Atlantis hotel so it is great value for money because you can come and go as you please. Loads to do. Kids know where our base (sunbed) is and they go off and have a blast. Recommend having water shoes as the ground gets very hot and if you have flip flops you need to go back and get them each time.Have been once when we went to dolphins - got tickets to aquaventure as part of the cost. Makes it a very long day when you have to stay there all day to make it worthwhile.

Great rides. you must do it ... great rides. Loved the rapids, this place has activities for all ages and you can gave a a lot of fun Plus you get to know the lobby of the hotel and watch the amazing aquarium that they have The private...Couldn't believe the amount of lifeguards,one around every corner. so safe.

a great day out!. We love aquaventure and have been here a few times, it's a great day out with lots of water slides and features for kids of all ages ;) Previously we have had free entry as guests of the atlatis, this year was the first year we paid for entry and I was very shocked that we were made to pay for my ten year old so as an adult! He didn't even want to go on any of the rides.... this is why I have only given 4 stars. a visit for 2 adults, 10 year old and 7 year old will set you back about £300
Land of dreams . Land of dreams. Top water attractions. The lazy river is fantastic where you can spend hours without any bit of boring. Safe & secure: lifeguards are everywhere.

Great Day. 4 adults and 2 children not cheap entrance money towel money locker money then food and drink as you cant take your own food in. not many rides for the little ones lazy river / rapids 5 out of 10 keep an eye on your flip flops as they seem to disappear and it was to hot on the floor to walk round without them. swimming with dolphins is cheaper to booked in the uk we found the wild wadi was better.

Too much to do for a day. Yes you get meals too with the entry pass.. Make sure you don't combine your trip with visit to another place with aquaventure. Its huge, you have to use golf carts to visit from one place to another inside the park. Most importantly carry your slippers please. The floor gets really hot.
A nice place to visit. Great place for children An experience they will never forget.The hotel and the water park are a one placeYou do not need to Go too far .
Waterpark for familty. Waterpark within Atlantis great place for family. Children enjoy the park. Very safe and secured. Many themes including great vertical slide to floating bubbles.

Amazing . Fantastic so much fun yes it's costly maybe but the fun you have while there for as long as you want makes it value for money in the end . The Pizza in the food court was lovely and more than enough for three to share ( average appetite ) . Not great for small children I would say 4 yr plus and they then get the most out of the children's area.

Worth a visit . It was my birthday when we were on holiday so my husband treated me to a swim with the Dolphins. It was the most amazing experience, they are so intelligent I loved every minute, I danced, got spun round and lay on the Dolphins stomach while it swam to the shore. We also spent the day at the waterpark, the lazy river is so much fun you lose all track of time the day passed so quickly. My husband was brave and went on the water slides. Good way to spend the day.
Fun times. A must for water fun activities in Dubai. The staff were very helpful and smiling. There is a good variety for food&beverage with good quality choices at acceptable prices.

Water park fun however.... Not sure this is value for money for what it is. I suggest you book online rather than at the door as it cost us a lot more and we were a group of 6!It was about 36 degrees and there is not a lot of shade. The floor is burning hot and I remember seeing this in the reviews but my father-in-law thought he could manage and didn't pack any flip flops. Needless to say, he had to buy a pair for about £30 which was painful.We didn't use the lockers as we always had to rotate with someone watching stuff and keeping our sun beds. My husband ended up hurting his coccyx while going on the green kids slides with our daughter. This messed up the rest of our holidays as it meant he could do nothing else while we were in Dubai. On the rapids as well, while going up the ramp, there is potential to do some damage to the coccyx so we always had to lift our bums up whilst going up the ramp! This was something else I read on here before we went on holiday but didn't pay any attention till my husband hurt himself!Everything was expensive there in terms of food and drinks. We went for the drink package which cost about £15 for the bottle and then we always had to pay about £4 or so for a refill. Because of the really hot weather, we were always extremely thirsty. On the rides as well, there was not a lot of shaded areas so you would love it if you like the intense sun. Overall, nice water park with enough activities for kids of various ages . I'd rather go without the intense heat and will plan better.
Become a child again!. Very expensive but it is worth to visit it especially if you travel with kids. Clean but crowdy!! also, the fotos they take are expensive, take a camera with you!

Huge water park. To make full use of our transit in Dubai we treated the kids to this park. They loved it! But some slides are really meant for adults though. My son who was 6 then could do most of them, or at least accompanied with an adult. But beware of the burning floor! We literally burnt our feet and we were running from one slide to the other. So get organized (unlike us) and bring a pair or water shoes which you can wear while on the slides (no flip flops though). You can always buy them in the park as we were obviously not the only one in this case... They have people controlling the slides at the departure and the arrival which make you feel more secure. Food is not cheap though. I personally loved the rapids which was quite fun. My daughter who was 3 then had limited access but I must say, the kids zone was big enough (and scary enough!) for her, knowing that she can swim already and is not afraid of water. Some slides were really scary for my own self ... And some I would never try (like the big pyramid and the one that shoots from from a tube). For people who like being in the dark they have quite a few slides in the total dark... The fun one is when you arrive in the middle of an aquarium filled with fish (not for the claustrophobic like me though... Did it once, not twice!). We stayed at the Palm finding it more convenient and they were offering a good package with the park. My son is still talking about it and it has been a year now!

Over crowded !!. This is not my first time, but this year it was over crowded with people that some activities had to be closed for cleaning or maintanance, I wasn't sure it was safe to let my kids play in the play area with the number of people who were there which defninitely exceeded the safety limits by several folds, we ended up leaving for safety reasons.Many activities were already closed for maintenance, although this was not shared or announced.The food, extra activities, drinks and everything is over priced in a silly way.I believe there should be a maximum safety limit on certain activities or the park as a whole to avoid accidents.

Water Park. A fantastic water park. Our kids enjoyed all aspects of it. Ride height is 1.2m for some of the rides. We did find a few areas and rides shut off but in all honesty it did not affect us. Very well staffed by life guards and very clean.

average. the quality and quantity of various rides is limited. One can find better parks within asia. the area is large and well spreadout. accessability by taxi is good, not by the monorail as waiting times are high. some directions in rivers are confusing.

Great days fun. We went here as family and had great day.Loads of stuff to do for all ages and we all really enjoy it.The heat was only issue as it was really hot that day but we really enjoyed our day.Maybe they could create a new ice room theme slide or something like it. LolDrinks and food very expensive but had great days fun with no big crowds.
Great. Nicely built Waterpark. Very friendly staff and filled with beautiful themes. Spacious park and wonderful selection of shops and venues. I had a pleasant time.

Queues are overwhelming. TWe arrived there around 11am and there were around 50 people in front of us, took around 40 mins to reach the counter.You have to pay 40aed for the locker and 45 aed extra for the meal deal, which you can get cheaper meal in the restaurants. We have two kids, 5 and 2 year old. So we got the floats with the child seat to put them in. We went thru the rapids and torrent, which was pretty safe for the kids and they enjoyed it very much as well. We couldn't get the rides as they weren't child friendly. The wave pool was under maintenance, which was actually one of my favorites. After spending 4 hours in the crazy river, we decided to leave as they have also closed the kids pool for cleaning.In general it was a nice experience.
Just out of this world!. I only can say.... AMAZING.It is all I had dreamed all my life and I finally found it!If you come to Dubai, do not miss this place. It is just incredible!

Must visit place in dubai. My kids are obsessed with water, we had a great time in the water park! All the kids slides are safe . The best part is they have life guards at every slide n attraction in the park!

Best Water Park. this park has one slide ride, which looks very exciting apart from that just pickup your tube and let lazy river float you wherever and whatever ride you like to do. Family ride is fun too, food inside park is but expensive so the merchandise, but yes good place to spend weekend with family or friends.

One of the best places in the world. We went here for 4 days as we were staying in Atlantis. We were initially worried how our 3.5 yr old would go at the water park as he is afraid of water. I need not have worried as he absolutely had a blast in the children's water park and on the rapid rides. I am a water slide lover and absolutely loved the water park. I endeavoured to try out all the rides. My favourite was the leap of faith. If the park could be improved it would be to somehow change the flooring so it didn't heat up as the few occasions I walked around with out thongs the ground really burnt my feet. So only a minor fault but there may be a practical way of fixing the issue.
Great fun. We all loved it....It's a water park with lots of slides and rapids..Spent 4 days here and still wasn't board ..great for kids off all ages even adults...

Fabulous Water Park. Water parks are one of my favourite things and this one certainly did not disappoint. I travelled with a friend that had never been down a water slide before and we started with the Leap of Faith. It was amazing and my friend loved it. There are so many different slides here to enjoy and the adrenaline junkie side of me was not disappointed. Highly recommended for some good thrills.

Lost Chambers of Atlantis. What an amazing set up....the way in which the Lost Chambers of Atlantis was set up was a worthwhile visit and the displays of the fish was brilliant...the only down side to this attraction was that a lot of the biggest tank set up could be viewed from the outside when walking around the Aquarium complex...but the amazing part for me was how the Lost Chambers was structured on the inside....this was the main attraction for me...

So much fun. This place is amazing great for kids, couples and familes, thers so much Great big smiles on faces throughout the whole day, the best watervpark ive ever been too amd so many slides and not waiting for long Walking distance between eatch ride. A great day is what you will have

Fun but a little on the small side. Fun park with one giant slide , two medium slides , a water rapid ride and a lazy river. There's also a good kids area if your bringing little ones.They have a section of the beach for guests to use which is gorgeous . A bit on the expensive side for what's in the park , around €70 each . Lockers and towels available to rent on the way in.If you want to go zip lining buy your ticket at the entrance as its a bit cheaper than buying it at the attraction . All in all its a fun day out and a good way to keep cool!
Lovely water park. Lovely. Good quality food. better for older children.Beautiful beach with wonderful view. Crowded on Fridays.

Fun Day . Come early and take the package with the lost chambers. You need the whole day! We (all adults age 25-33) loved it! Slides and tubes are better than at Wild waldi water park. Have never seen so many lifeguards which make you feel save and welcome. We would visit the park again!

Great water park. It was really hot (near 45C at times) during our stay and so the water park was great to cool off in. We visited as part of our stay at the Atlantis and so it was free. Our little daughter really loved the dinghy rapids ride and I tried the 'leap of faith'. Unfortunate that shark tank was under maintenance so the ride where you go through the shark tank was closed. We spent the whole the day there but it was extremely difficult to find any loungers (even the private cabanas were all occupied). Towels were free for hotel guests. There was a golf buggy service taking hotel guests from the park to the pool (and other areas) which was quite useful.
AMAZING!. Can not recommend this place enough, friendly staff and amazing waterpark. If you don't go anywhere else, just go the Aquaventure

A little underwhelming :-(. We spent a full day here recently, knowing Dubai we anticipated the high prices so after a bit of research were not too surprised by entrance fee. However, lockers & towels soon rack up the cost.There were sunbeds available unlike other parks we've been to which was a bonus & prior knowledge would have perhaps negated the need for lockers!There is a lot of walking from lockers to main attractions & the need for cash at food outlets is a real bore as that requires a return visit to lockers! Otherwise you are carrying valuables with you on the rides which seems to ask for trouble!The food & drinks were eyewateringly expensive, we racked up a phenomenal bill on 4 sandwich deals & drinks. Souvenir cups are extortionate & refills cost even more - seriously never experienced that before ! I will ignore kids demands next time !! There is a bottled water deal 6 bottles = 55AED - the first sign of reasonable!Due to a family hiccup, we only played on the lazy river and tube rides off it, we didn't think it was as thrilling as some parks we've been to but we all had fun & went home exhausted (& bruised - keep your bum up !). You will need shoes of some sort at all times as the surfaces are not cooled.We would not return, expensive and too much hassle/worry carting cash around.

Best Water Park in Dubai. Excellent water park- very few queues. We did not feel the heat of the day because of the breeze and all the water around the park. Very easy to do in hot hot weather. Best place to get a sun lounger is on the Beach under the tress- lovely and cool and away from the rest of the crowd.
Water park. Fantastic day out with the kids when needing to cool down. There's so much to do which involves water.We had huge smiles on our faces all day.You must check this out when in Dubai.

Lovely place to spend time with your family. One of the best water park in town. They have lots of water slides which is pretty good and no need to walk long distances for each ride. Specially the Leap of Faith water slide is simply awesome.

A Pretty Good Waterpark. It's really hard to review this waterpark apart from broader experiences in and around the hotel – but as a park, it's fine. Not amazing, but the kids loved it, and it has a good layout and is reasonably clean and entertaining. For what it's worth, I've heard it has the best lazy river of the other options in and around Dubai.

Fun water park in the heat of the desert. This is herald as a main attraction in Dubai. I guess you can find similar in any large city in the world, but a great refreshing break from the desert heat. Expensive.

Aqua venture Waterpark. We stay at the Atlantis Hotel so our entrance was free, had to purchase a locker for roughly £8. Really good day out we were allowed to go in as many times as we liked, so we'll worth it for us. Some of the rides did not have enough momentum to get you to the end of the ride. Rapids were brilliant we from top to bottom many times and a couple of rides finish in the Rapids. Plenty of sun cream should be used.

Great day out. We had a super day at this park loads of different rides, suggest you get there early to avoid queues for the rides. Also definitely slops,slippers or sea shoes the floor gets really hot.. The package including food is handy.

A must for families, friends and fun people. Simply fun all day long, whether you are with your family or with your friends. Good for all ages. The staff are so cool and always in a fun fun mood. Not to be missed when you visit dubai.

Beautiful moments in water: Aquaventure Waterpark. The water park is located on Palm Beach - we get there by train. The ticket we bought included Dolphin Bay, Aquaventure Waterpark, lunch and Lost Chambers Auqarium. The waterpark has got a very friendly helpful staff. The little cars offered us the lift from one slide/attraction to another by to save you time for rides. There are the slide and rides for everybody: with the thrill and just relaxing one. If you get hungry you don't need to leave a park - there is food court inside when you can get some drinks and food. I could even get the locker to hire, which is very convenient when you having fun. No need to take your own towel. We both my husband and me enjoyed the place - we plan to come back there again whenever we in Dubai!

Expensive family day. Really quite crowed. Visited with 3 adults and 5 year old grandson. We expected it to be expensive....and it was! You are charged for everything lockers, towels. The changing rooms were clean and well maintained. Best to lock everything in the locker but it is quite a walk back to go for bits and pieces throughout the day. The children's play area was great. It was huge but extremely crowed. Life guards were very attentive and loads of them. The lazy river was good too. We visited Dolphin cove and would suggest you jumped into the little golf carts as its a long way to walk in boiling heat. As part of the ticket we payed for included lunch we opted for the Baracuda restaurant. Big hamburger restaurant. Food was decent.We also visited the aquarium which is really good and helps you get out of the heat. We spent more time in there than we spent in the water park. Would I return...probably not.
The Lazy River. This is a great water park with different rides and experiences for everyone to enjoy. I highly recommend this if you have a day to kill

Amazing place! . It has always been a dream of mine to visit The Atlantis hotel as the pictures make it look so prestigious and incredible. We visited on a day trip to the Aquaventure waterpark and it did not disappoint. The hotel & waterpark far exceeded any of my expectations, I was almost lost for words. There is so much to do at the waterpark that caters for everyone in the family. Water rides for the thrill seekers, a separate kids area and family friendly rides, amongst a private beach area and cabanas/sun loungers for when you fancy a break. We had a fantastic time at Aquaventure, with memories created that will stay with us forever. Thank you to the incredible staff for making our visit so memorable and enjoyable - we cannot wait to return to Dubai!

Great water park, hot floor. Went here as part of our honey moon linked with Atlantis the palm. It's a good water park but there are definitely better. The lazy river is brilliant with one half rapids and the other half waves pushing the rings around.The main two slides are the slide with the opening floor and the slide with the shark tunnel. Both of these had a very small que time.Most of the other rides required the ring and all felt very similar leaving us bored after an hourCan't help feeling the park misses a big wave pool that's just my personal opinion.We had free entry due to the hotel but can't help but feel would have been disappointed if we had to pay the full rate to come in.
Wow. Diversity of species of marine creatures which will definitely take you breath away. children enjoyed it.

Better than water parks in USA. Went here as part of our stay at the Atlantis hotel. Had free entry the entire length of our stay. Fast track entry from the hotel and complimentary towels. Arrived early enough to get a subbed . Downside was the heat making the ground to hot to walk on without something on your feet. Loads of lifeguards and photo oppurtunities. Buggies to take you around the park and back and forward to the hotel. Plenty of tubes for the rides. If there was a downside it would be the signage wasn't always clear where things were.
Wet and wild. We went today with our 6 year old daughter and she is now tall enough for all the rides. Tip is go at 9.45 as it gets too busy in the afternoon.

Nice waterpark but poor value. This park is great fun but has only a few water slides you can do all the slides several times within half a day . The lazy river is wonderful and for me was the best attraction it can take a a good 30 mins to do one circuit with the occasion rapids which were really fun. Sunbeds are plentiful but most people don't realise they are several sun bed locations so some areas got jammed packed and other empty There are very helpful hop on and off golf buggy taxi's which take you from one part of the park to another. A wide variety of food but a little pricey and they don't allow you to bring any food into the park so you have to buy here. Three scoops of ice cream for £10! We booked direct with the website and got much better prices than were being offered elsewhere so worth comparing before you book. Overall great fun but poor value for money!

Pretty cool!. Visited the waterpark on during our stay at the Fairmont. Great views from the top of some of the rides, staff very helpful and food was good in the eateries. Good rides and an enjoyable day had by all.

disappointed. After we paid our entry fee of over £500 we discovered that three of the main water attractions were closed which was a great disappointment. It would be advisable to ring before making the trip.
mini moon holiday. The water theme ark was great and you are given free access if you stay at the hotel. Fun experience for all ages!!

Huge venue but far too crowded. The rides and facilities are good but the place is far too over crowded and this spoils the experience quite a lot. We got separated from half our family which is a nightmare on holiday and the security response was terrible. No tannoy announcement just a call over the radio with the missing members description luckily they found us two hours later.Cost wise very expensive lockers and towels aren't cheap either but then it is dubai and not much is reasonably priced.

Fun day out. My 14 year old decided this looked better than wild wadi waterpark so we booked for 3 of us to go. It's not a cheap day out, but then Dubai isn't a cheap destination! The ability to rent a locker was useful as was putting money on your wristband. We were allowed to take our GoPro on all rides. We had a very enjoyable day and loved the huge lazy river

Great water park, free for Atlantis the Palm customers. Aquaventure water park is one of the best and most famous stops in Dubai. It's located just by Atlantis the Palm and free to all customers of the resort. Great facilities with electronic and automated lockers, showers, towels. Be aware that in August the temperatures are extremely high.

Needs updating. It is a shame because it would be lovely if they updated this waterpark. It is long walks between each ride and it has few rides. Not what I expected. Luckily we did not have to pay as we were in a club room but it could work out expensive otherwise

Too busy . I've been here a few times over the years but on my last visit I could see a marked difference in the amount of people. At mo point throughout my 5 night stay did I manage to get a sunbed at the water park. I had to leave my bag with the towels on top. The lazy river/Rapids were too full. Loved the new slides they've added but hated walking up all the stairs in 44degree heat.

Amazing place. One of the best parks I have been to. I totally loved it, although even in the summer is a bit busy for certain rides, so in the season I guess it's reallly busy. But overall, we had a blast.

Best day in Dubai in Aquaventure. I was overwhelmed to visit this park. So very well organized and built, it has many rides and is great fun. Just take the tube and follow the water link. It will take you to the rides. For couple of rides, you need to take steps and go at the top. 'Leap of Faith' was the best one, you experience almost fee fall. Advise: take towel with you if you can or else you can get a towel and locker at AED 50. I also purchased a waterproof pouch and was able to take my mobile along in the water rides and got some great pictures. Have fun. Enjoy full day here.
Very fun. Very fun. We loved it all day. Rides were fun like in Bahamas but the staff was more relaxed and interacted.

Worth the trip for all ages. Most amazing waterpark ever. I am not a big fan but this is amazing for all ages and also there is a beach. Yes its costly, but worth it. Annoying you cant brign your own food cause the food is pricey too and rubbish. Great day out. Sun, water and its safe. Love it.

Review. Impressed that this time you will find many tubes with kids seats. This helps for families with young kids.The water park is safe and there are many supervisors and lifeguards around the park to make your adventure good.

By far the best of the aquaparks of Dubai. It might seem small compared to the rest, but this is one memorable, fun waterpark. For me, I prefer it over the other one's because it's more compact and the attractions are well thought.

Escape the summer heat. Visited water park on very hot day, good place to stay cool, very expensive , 2 adults and 1 child including basic lunch and entry to aquarium was over $500 , like all attractions in Dubai shop around for tickets as prices vary greatly, no really outstanding rides doesn't compare to waterparks in California and Gold Coast Australia
Great water faciliteis. Must say that it is one of the best Aqua park that we have visited with family. My kids just love it and they could not finish all the slides in one day.

A must do if in Dubai with kids. We stayed at the Atlantis so visited the waterpark every day of our 5 day stay. Simply superb and even better than the Disney water parks we have been to in USA.The lazy river is not so lazy - be prepared for some thrills!Kids loved the zip line too. On my daughter's birthday we splashed out for private cabana and hammock - worth it!Tons of fun, and very friendly staff and lifeguards. Quite simply the best water park we have ever been to.

Fabulous family fun. We stayed in Atlantis so entry into the water park was free for us. What can I say? Aquaventure was awesome! There were hardly any queues. Only on the major rides and never more than 10 minutes tops. There were plenty of floats available. Plenty of vigilant lifeguards keeping an eye on things. Loads of food stands etc. My favourite ride was the lazy river Rapids. Went on the Leap of Faith once and will never do it again. You only need to try it once. It was indeed an experience to last a lifetime.

A brilliant place for water rides. My family had a blast at the aqua water park in Atlantis. It was one of the best we experience. I believe it as good as the ones you find in Europe and Asia. It is a bit expensive though and all the drinks and food inside is also on the high side. Anyways, it was worth the try.

Ride of a Lifetime. This place is amazing! We paid 50 AED for a towel+locker combo, but my travel partner lost my towel and I realized I didn't even need it that much. You would do well to carry your own towel. The weather was very very hot (summer). Carry flip flops or swimming shoes; you will need them to walk between rides. The soles of my feet are nodding in agreement! :DThe rides were absolutely exciting. There are signs all around that let you know which ride is ahead, but the queues can get long enough that you cannot see the signs yet at the end of the queue. I did each ride at least twice.There are shops that sell swimsuits, flip flops, phone-protectors, swimming shoes and caps, etc... It is best for you to go prepared with your own stuff to avoid spending a lot of money and time browsing for your favourite colour swimsuit. Carry your own camera.

Insane experience!. Aquaventure is one of the most famous stops in Dubai. Other than the fact that it is the famous Atlantis resort, it also contains a remarkable structure and design that brings out the culture of Atlantis itself. You can't do everything in Aquaventure in a single and will require at least two visits. It's definitely a must see. I would recommend bringing your flip flops with you wherever you go during summer as the floor gets too hot for the feet.

One of the best days with family . We always enjoy Aquaventure waterpark every time we visit it. It is a very good place to spend a day with the family. The variety of rides makes everyone in the family very happy.Just try to avoid weekends if possible, and try to avoid summer months because you might spend some time in the heated sun while waiting in some lines. Food is a bit expensive and they don't allow food from outside

We wanted to ... But .... This was my first ever to be in a water park.Keeping that in mind i am so happy i went here first. It was a full day of fun and excitements. We wanted to stay for couple of hours but we ended up staying for 7 hours and we wanted to stay more.You can just lay down on tubes and go around the water park and play a lot of games.Its a bit pricy but the level of service is very high.You have to come here

Great waterpark!. I loved this waterpark! So well set out and so great to escape the heat! There is something for everyone, you can relax in the pools or enjoy the water slides for the more extreme people! Great place to visit!

A super day out. We visited with our two sons and had a super day. There is so much to do and it wasn't crazy busy when we went so there weren't the long queues I have heard about from others.I would say get there early and get on the big rides/roller coaster. If you can pay for a few fast track passes so you can go later too or just get lucky like us!A really great way for the family to spend time together with a great mix of rides to suit all tastes.

Fun - kids loved it. This had the best lazy river I have ever been on - lots of fun, my kids aged 6 & 11 had a great time. There are plenty of chairs and places to sit and if you are staying at the Atlantis they provide free beach towels. Get there early to avoid the queues!

Great water park but wouldn't want to stay at the Atlantis, too big and crowded.. Great water park, lazy river looks like it needs the floor replacing, life guards need to be more aware of what's going on as two men were being idiots and I got badly kicked in the head due to there stupid behaviour causing me to be concussed.

'Love the experience". The park is well maintained and rides and full of fun and joy. This is an experience that you will cherish for a long time.. must visit if you are in Dubai and love the water activities.

Great day out . Really good day out, lots of choices of things to do, from rides for all ages and interests, a quiet beach to relax on, food and drink outlets. Sun beds get taken quickly and food is of a fast food nature. Gets very busy in the afternoon so I would recommend getting there at opening time. Take shoes that can go in the water as the ground burns feet between rides!

Busy even in low season. Don't just turn up and pay the price on the door. This is an expensive day out even with a discount. We got sun loungers on the beach at the edge of the park which was peaceful, right next to the rides and the sea was absolutely lovely. The lazy river, which is usually a family favourite was not the relaxing experience we expected it to be. My teenage daughter got split from the rest of the family and felt hassled by the 'lifeguards' who had fun splashing her and pushing her ring around. My son enjoyed the rides although it is very difficult to know what you are queuing for so you have to be prepared to do anything. We have been to better water parks.

Love this place........... We were staying at Atlantis so the water park is included. The staff are very friendly and the rides are awesome. Some parts of the park are closed until further notice and it would have been nice to know before we started our holiday but what can you do?? The part of the park that you go through the shark tunnel was the part all closed. The ride was open but through an empty tank and no shark safari available. We were disappointed that we couldnt do the safari but again what can you do! My daughter who is 8 struggled to sit in the large inflatables but I saw some one with a child inflatable seat which we managed to get after an hour or so. There are not many around and basically have a sealed base so the little people can sit in a ring with or without you but the bottom is sealed a must for anyone under 8 as the waves can carry kids and grown ups away. For everything except the rapids and the lazy river you have to be taller than 1.2 meters so my son didn't get to do the slides. The kids loved the childrens play area which has some great slides and a constant stream of water in your face! Be prepared for some one to shoot water right in your face! Definately worth packing some water shoes or some flip flops that you dont mind leaving somewhere and reclaiming whenever you can back to them. You can buy them there but they were around £20 a pair and I got the kids from Aldi for £3.99 a pair.Its a big place to walk around with young kids and because we went in August it sometimes got too hot. If we went without young kids it would have been easier to cope but seemed mean to leave the kids! haha. We bought some nice ice cones and they cooled us down nicely but at £6 each the prices are that of a captive audience. The lockers are £8 each 40AED, so its not cheap. BUT is lots of fun.

Great place to spend a day. We really enjoyed our time here. Although good for families, my wife and I, in our late 20s really enjoyed it. They have something for everyone and the queues were not that great. Leap of faith and Possidons Adventure are the best rides!! Go to them first, nice and early as avoid the queues.

Good, but this visit had issues. I visited the park with some family members and whilst we all enjoyed the experience, we did leave with a certain degree of disappointment and frustration. Neptune’s Tower was not open, as far as we were aware, due (so we were told) to a private party. I have no verification of this. However, it was clear that the remaining open side of the park was seriously crowded as a result of this and some other maintenance work. We paid full price for half the park. Not really good value. On leaving we joined the taxi queue. There were a number of the hotel taxis blocking access to customers from the normal taxis (of which there were several waiting). This seemed to be a deliberate ploy to try and force customers to use hotel taxis which were double the price. I did complain to the staff with little reaction. So we had a good time but it was somewhat of a let down that half the park was blocked from use and then the money grabbing action of the hotel taxi staff really made for a very bad end to the day. I have e-mailed Aquaventure slightly less that a week ago, without any response so far. I would advise potential customers to call and make sure the full park is open before paying out quite a hefty fee.
Fantastic. We spent 1 day in aquaventure. It was terrific experience. The service is perfect. The staff is very friendly.

Bliss. If I had to describe this place in one word, "paradise" would be it. Great waterslides, amazing staff and the whole place looks very exotic. The lifeguards are very funny and friendly and would do anything to keep you entertained. If you go to Dubai, this place is a must :D

Rip off heaven. went with my ife and 2 daughters. got free entry via staying in the Atlantis saving us £20 entry. However, the children's play area is next to the toilets so you have a horrible baked in urine/faeces smell. you cant keep items safe on the sunbeds which lie elbow to elbow. The price of swimming with dolphins was £517- they charge for everyone even children (one of 7 months the second of 2.5 yrs were same as adults). Thats with no pictures included which are £20/p picture.with this package you get a free very select lunch at Baracuda fast food shack or the Shark bits food shop (essentially KFC and burger king but not as nice and normal prices are about 12-15 quid for a standard poor meal).I have been to swim with Dolphins in Mexico, Egypt too and never had such and expensive rip off.cant recommend it unless you have money to burn

Aqua venture water park. Great day we had on the all the water slides recommended day out , plenty to do ,lazy river is massive on its own too many rides to remember all the names but you will enjoy it .

Supercool for active families. Highly recommended to rent a GoPro if you do not own one yourself to catch all those nice moments! Also recommended to swimm with dolphines - the most adorable thing we ever did.

Fun water park. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to Aquaventure. Before going I was a little concerned about having to queue in the hot weather however after reading another review which suggested going early we arrived as the park opened at 10am and didn't have to wait more than a few seconds for any of the rides all day. The rides were fantastic, scary but good.
