As other readers have suggested you need to wear something on your feet, we took some watershoes with us which you can wear on most of the rides and carry down with you on the others. We bought our tickets in advance through Trip Advisor and chose to also go into the Aquarium which was well worth it, this also meant we got a free lunch in the park- so well worth doing. One other thing to note if you go by taxi is not to get in to the slightly posher looking taxi/private car (as opposed to the Dubai Taxis) that was sat at the front of the rank as we left the park, although it was on a meter it was obviously running on a different tariff as it was much more expensive than our fare on the way!

Tame rides no Information. This park is just OK. I found it so chaotic, no information, maps etc. We entered, then found out we had to load our wristbands. Then had to go back to entrance again to hire a locker. We bought our room towels, and were harassed constantly when taking them out of the park. A little info could avoid all this. I mean Waterbom in Bali does it better. No info rating each ride- so just a lucky dip, if its super tame, or hair raising.

Fab fun. We were staying at the hotel so entry for us was free, so I can't state if this is good value for money for the paying customer. But fun wise, it was brilliant, and the lazy river is a lovely way to chill, even if there is a few mini slides. They are so safety conscious, which is very reassuring, there was so many lifeguards. We also did the shark safari, which was different, just wish it had lasted longer, but a fab experience.

I prefer Wild Wadi. Location means a long drive to and from the park. It's vast which means lots of waking between rides so you'll need footwear of some sort as the floor is scorching, it's more expensive than Wild Wadi, the queues were really long too and once you've parked you've got to get a shuttle bus or walk a fair way to the entrance. Still a good day overall.
Best water park I have been to. The park is very clean and the staff very helpful.The rids were great, make sure you do the one through the shark pool, it is an experience not to be missed.

Not to many things to do.... I went because when you buy the Dophin Experience they give it to you for free. But there are not to much attractions for young/adults... And EVERYTHING INSIDE IS SUPER MEGA DUPER EXPENSIVE. (1 picture= 100AED)
Must visit . Everything was good abt the waterpark except the shops inside were very expensive so it's advisable to come prepared with all stuff rather than buying from atlantis

Fun In The Pool. My family recently stayed at Atlantis and enjoyed having access to Aquaventure Waterpark. The park is FUN! There are many waterslide of varying degree and there is something for everyone. We loved floating around the lazy river all day. My wife was brave enough to tackle the two waterslides that were featured on The Amazing Race! They also have 2 family rafts rides that can seat about 5 or 6 people so the whole family can have fun together. Safety is no issue since life guards seem to be stationed about every 25 feet, i have never seen safety taken so seriously. This is a great way to cool down and spend the day having fun.
What a place!. The heat, the long lazy rivers and friendly staff. A family waterpark that you can easily lose yourself in the fun.

Splish splash. For 375dh which includes a burger meal and entry to lost chambers aquarium I personally still don't think it's worth it. It's very overrated, I've bn to kussadassi waterpark in Turkey, so far is one of the best. Obviously going to dubai ppl want to try out a waterpark but this one is good for under 10's as they have their own slides.For adults the rapide ride, lazy river and abt 5 other slides. Which isn't much compared to wat u pay for. Meet or swim with dolphins area was an extra charge.

It's ok. Our day of 4 hours was ok. The park is very big and have a lot of rides. The showers next to the pools/rides aren't cold, so that was sad. The beach part is not cool, to stoney and not even like on the pictures. The rides are amazing, but the waiting period horrible. I suggest to visit the park only from Sunday-Thursday.

Great for all the family (1.1m height restrictions apply like most other places). Great variety of water park rides for all types of thrill seekers and those looking for an adrenalin rush. Cabanas also available at 900 aed'so for half day. Costly but we'll worth it if you have kids and want additional privacy and extra pampering

The aquapark has long queues. The aquapark gets very busy with non residents and you need to be aware not suitable for guests with mobility issues as many rides have large quantities of stairs to climb and standing in queues. For able bodied guests be prepared for long waits in the heat, plenty to do but food and drink expensive.

Fab waterpark. We all loved this waterpark, especially the Zoomerango slide- took our breath away!Floating about in the rings along the lazy river, torrent, rapids and slides was fantastic. The only things that let us down were:  a couple of parts of the river were closed and we didn't know why but it meant you couldn't get to Poseidons tower where Zoomerango was without getting out and walking. And the anaconda was not open for the 3 days we were thereAlso the shark tank was empty due to a burst pipe so spoilt the end of the shark attack slide we had looked forward to as it's on every piece of advertising for the Atlantis and the waterpark.If you are holidaying in Dubai, do go. And if you're staying at the Atlantis, you would be a fool to stay at hotel pools, get to the sun beds round the many " beaches" here instead!! Drinks cheaper too!!

amazing day out. An amazing day out with fantastic slides and lazy rivers. The staff are all super friendly and the life guards good fun. Access to the beach and walking around the Atlantis is an extra treat!

Good park with interesting up hill slides but not as varied as ones in the USA. Overall this is a great park but it just isn't as good as some parks in USA.There is only one locker room, and 2 main restaurants - though none of them felt busy when visiting. The lazy river was something that was very new to us as it had log flume type conveyor belts to get you to a summit and then you could choose to either continue floating or go on rapids.The main slides in the middle had some many options, and they had up hill sections in them which is a new one on us. It was also welcomed that you could get onto these slides with the help of a conveyor belt, minimising the time you spent out of the water in the heat.Shade was plentiful and the staff were helpful. It was a shame that two large slides were out of action when we were there, however the staff managed the queues for the other large attractions well - but some guests knowledge of queuing and fairness leaves something to be desired.A great park in Dubai that is convenient to get to if you are staying on the Palm, however not as good as those in the USA.

To busy. We didn't enjoy this waterpark, quite a bit of it was closed and being repaired, it was really busy & the queues for the rides were really long, not much fun in 45 degree heat,we found the Wild Wadi much better.

Amazing!. We spent a whole day in a park, and it is absolutely amazing. It is a bit expensive, but if you like that kind of entertainment it worth. We didn't go to any special show, we just enjoyed rides on many attractions.

Best water park . So many rides and so many life guards all of which are very friendly and helpful. 5 star service even from a water park! This water park is reflect for families and those that are thrill seekers! Such a fab day!

Day out enjoying the slides. We went on a Friday with a whole bunch of people. With Emirates ID it is cheaper for the entrance tickets. There are plenty of different kinds of slides. You have to go to this Aquapark, I have had nothing compared to this one in Europe. So go and enjoy! The pavement are burning your feet so try to take some tongs, flip flaps. There are some fast foot places nothing like a healthy meal... That's the only downset. You can also chill if you are not into slides, there is a nice beach.

Fun in the Sun :-). It is definitely a good outlet in the hot weather of Dubai... But grossly overpriced !!!!! The entry is worth AED 320 for the water park... There is another waterpark, Wild Wadi, in town too but the real difference is the Dolphin Bay, but that is AED 795 for a 45 minutes experience. No doubt this an experience not to be missed, no denying that.

Warm waters.... We loved the slides, especially the large blue ring where all of us went on. Go pro hired for 200 dhirams. Food is usual water park stuff. The beach front is really relaxing and therapeutic. Great at sunset with lovely warm water. All the family enjoyed a fab day. Downside: shark ride and three others closed, but we were given a free meal voucher when we expressed our disappointment. 2 lockers costed 80 dhirams which also felt like a bit of a rip off. All in all though, a memorable visit. Staff extremely helpful and polite.

Wanted to do something we hadn't done since children were young. Nice place to cool down, not that much different then USA parks. Nice to take photos of Burj Al Arab, which is very close by. Probably wouldn't do it again, unless grandchildren with us.

Splashing time. Spent the day here. Very well organised. Very clean. But expensive for food and drink ie bottled water 13 dirhams compared to 1 dirham in the airport. Plenty of shade. Need to take your own/hotel towels unless you rent one for 8 dirhams. Lockers also available to rent.

Excellent lazy river. We came for the day with friends. It is quite expensive to get in and we got sucked into buying food etc, however you don't really need to do it as we ended up eating for the sake of it, however if you have a big appetite it is probably worth getting the food package. You can't take your own water in and it was about 50 AED for 6 bottles, which wasn't bad. The park it self is great. The lazy river was the best i've seen. You can go through the river and then it takes you on rides, so no need to queue. To be honest the queues were great anyway and we waited no longer than 5-10 minutes for each ride. There is plenty to do and worth it all. We purchased tickets to go to the Aquarium but we didn't' really have much time so didn't spend that much time in there . But worth going, as it was fantastic. We also paid 40 AED to buy a plastic drinks bottle and then you pay just 8 AED to top it up. This is fine but not all the food and drink outlets do it so you can only go to 2 in particular which is quite annoying to walk there every time (the floor is very hot!)You need to take your flip flops with you everywhere as the floor is so hot, so you have to end up attaching them to your arms in all the rides. All in all a great day out.

Great day . We came here and did the water park and the dolphin experience It was a great day out and fun for all ages Dolphin experience was amazing and we got to touch them and play Slides are very modern and food or fruit stall are located all over the park to keep you hydrated The lazy river spans the whole water park and you can stop off at each restaurant from the river and top up your drinks or food intake Great fun
excellent fun. very clean, brilliant rides, well organised, good fun, definitely worth a visit and set within a beautiful resort

Great fun day out. Aquaventure is a great fun day out for kids and adults alike. The rides are fun, and a great way to get around is just jump in a tube and float around the park then get off wherever you like. Fun day for all!
Much Fun. Very nice place to be with your family and Kids. Lots of activities and water games. Beverages and Water are very expensive though

A great day out but expensive. This was our first visit having always gone to Wild Wadi. As we were visiting and not residents we needed towels and lockers which were costly as was the food and drink in the park. The water park itself was great fun especially the rapids on the lazy river- this created some fun without having to go on the other rides which we did though.

Brilliant, and even better when free!!. My son and I stayed at the Atlantis resort for 8 nights and used the Aquaventure Waterpark every day, some days we were there for 8 hours. All the staff/life guards are very friendly and great towards the kids. They did a good job of stopping people line jumping as well. Buy a refill cup if you are going as that is real value for money. It seemed to get busy around mid day but quietens down around 4pm.

Exhilarating. We visited the waterpark at Atlantis. We were Staying at Atlantis and hopped on free golf buggy between resort and water park. The rubber rings in the lazy pool were fantastic. Lots of life guards were stationed around the pools and extremely vigilant. Lots of deck chairs were at the pools and fresh towels.

Great fun day out!. This waterpark has a good mix of water slides and is a very fun day out. Despite it getting very busy you are able to enjoy the amusements and slides and find spaces to settle and relax. It does get tiring if visiting for a day but thats expected. Access is given to a 'public access' beach on the Atlantis palm which is good.I would recommend this.
Water way to spend a day. As you would expect. Clean, well run, safe and exciting water park experience. Make sure you apply sun cream.
The leap of faith. This is awesome, thrilling and fun. Although verry bussy I had a great time here. Easy to get to by monorail.

Adventurous. This water park has the best water rides I have been so far. The best one was "Poseidon's revenge" (not recommended for everyone). If you are the guest of Atlantis, The Palm then you have free access to the aquaventure park.

One of the best water parks. This is one of the best waterparks I have visited. We stayed in Atlantis for one night so it was complimentary for us. The rides are superb. We took all tube rides and the leap of faith is a must.

Great day out. Enjoyable day out with the kids. Booked online in advance and got a meal deal included in the price which was a bonus. This isn't the best waterpark I have ever visited but we still enjoyed it. Loved this fact that the lazy river, Rapids and slides were connected and we could float between them for hours without ever getting out. Only downside.... I've never been to a water/theme park before where you can buy a refillable cup but have to pay for refills!!!! Would still recommend a day here.

Very disappointing. I visited this place a few years ago and it was much better then. Except for a South African called Danielle, the staff were either rude, unhelpful or both. On arrival I tried to get a special combination which included sitting in a private area including lunch, towels and a locker - as advertised. The cashier could or would not understand this and eventually I gave up and just bought the towel and the locker. Luckily we bumped into Danielle who did manage to get us into the private area ('Poseidons Retreat' i think it was called) with the locker, towel & lunch combo. Seating area was very nice, however, other than Danielle and a couple of others, NO-ONE knew where it was! We were on the Lazy River Rapids ride which is almost 2km long and after a while we wanted to know how far our seating area was. We asked nearly 40 different lifeguards who either shrugged or did not know or worse, just ignored us. Very surprising for Dubai. Lunch was AWFUL. In fact it was downright nasty and I would not recommend it to anyone. If Gordon Ramsey had tasted or had seen anything we were given inside the waterpark I suspect he might have shut down his restaurant that is part of the complex. Changing area did not feel clean as there was water and tissue every where in the shower and loo areas and there were no staff taking care of it. I tried to let someone know only to be met with the same dumbfounded expression or just a shrug of the shoulders - 'not my problem....'This could be a great place again but I have heard the waterparks in Abu Dhabi are much better run and the staff are generally politer.Whoever the GM is of this place, I strongly recommend they have a serious look at staff attitudes and helpfulness and for goodness sake do something about the kitchens offering food in the waterpark! The food standards would be unacceptable in most places in the world, but for Dubai, it is shockingly bad.

A great day out for children of most ages. May not be the cheapest , but certainly a most fun-filled day out for children of all ages. Whther floating leisurely around on a gigantic swim-ring , or throw oneself into twists and turns in water tunnels, theres something for all ages! Two tips:get allpairs of feet flipflops or batheshoes, and make sure to protect from sun to have an enjoyable day. And finish off with avist to the calm and beautiful Lost World aquarium before heading out again. Warmly recommend (albeit a bit pricey) for families which enjoy outdoor activities and amusement parks.
Water park. My kids really loved the water park and we spent two/three lovely days there. The lifeguards and safety features were top notch and it was an amazing experience.

Great Wet Fun!. This was included in our hotel package. Hence we were there almost everyday. The Leap of Faith was awesome and the 2.1km of just drifting around the water park grounds in inflatable rings was just bliss.
very nice inside the palm. the park is very nice, big and well organized. you can also swim at the beach which is inside the palm. many games to do. and activities. nice food iinside. very safe .

Fun in the Sun. Huge Water Park with alot of attractions, Lazy River is such a chilling ride. Other extreme rides keeps your breath away. Food and drinks are affordable and available everywhere.Shisha on the beach, what a delight.

Brilliant day out. 2nd visit to Atlantis Aquaventure &Still a great favourite! We got a deal which included the lost chamber aquarium & lunch in with the Aquaventure so was great value. At the ticket desk we pre paid 100 Aed into our wrist band which was great as meant we could go to kiosks and purchase drinks without needing cash. Lockers available to hire. We loved the lazy river with the water Rapids & torrents but there is a whole host of rides. Suitable for all ages. Loads of life guards. Every time we visit we will include day here as such good fun well laid out & great fun
Loved it !! . Fab water park spent days going around the lazy river !! Missed dinner thou !!! Heading for the leap of faith in the morning

Most Fun I've Had In My Adult Years. No, joke this is one of the greatest water parks of all time! I've been to a few throughout my life time but Aquaventure was a real treat even for me as an adult. My boyfriend and I decided to skip on a beach day at Nikki Beach to go here and it was absolutely worth every minute we spent there. The leap of faith was one of the most thrilling slides I've been on, the lazy river rides were so much fun and the aquarium was soooo nice and soothing to look at. One of the best days I've had in years, it cost us like 300$ for 2 people to get in and get the full experience but it was worth every cent
Best Waterpark in UAE!. I've been to all the water parks in UAE and this is definitely the best! the variety of rides and the Adrenalin.

Great day. We had a really fun day at this waterpark. It was hot so being in water was very nice but there was also lots of shade to stay out of the sun. Queues weren't overly long but I imagine in slightly cooler weather it would be busier (it seems strange saying it was too hot for a waterpark - 45 degrees explains it though).Our ticket included lunch but drinks were very expensive - AED75 for 6 200ml cans of softdrink.One thing we noticed was how clean the park was - it was spotless with not a piece of rubbish to be seen.

Amazingggg. Wonderful place, this Atlantis hotel is way better than the one in the Bahamas!!! A lot cleaner and better food for sure this hotel is located on the cresent of the Palm man made island in Dubai very nice!!!

Best waterpark in the UAE!. Been twice to this amazing waterpark at Atlantis and it does not fail! Loads of sunloungers scattered around the park and with lockers you can leave you're towels and lock away you're belongings and have no worries. Loads of decent places to eat but they are mostly fast food outlets but the food is decent and I've hardly ever had to wait in a queue for rides. The beach at the waterpark is also very nice.
Great water park . The Aquaventure Waterpark is a part of the Atlantis Hotel the Palm. Great water slide with options to book some dolphin experience. Also you can have access to beach
A great day out for all ages. The water park is a great day out for all ages and if you have not stayed at Atlantis before you also get to see what a beautiful hotel this is.

Good waterpark but not sure if I'd pay to go in. As part of our Atlantis resort, we were provided with free access to this waterpark. Not being a waterpark person, I appreciate this park for what it was and my girlfriend loved it. I think the positive aspects were the amount of rides and how they were all located in 2 areas so quite easy to do all the rides once you figure out the park. The rides were also fun even though 2 of the main ones were shut down on both days we went.My issues were was there wasn't a clear guide how to get around the park and where all the rides were. They need to provide a park map at the beginning to explain where everything is as we did not even figure out there was a whole different area until the second day we went. The guideposts were not clear at all. You will also need to wear your jandals/thongs/flip flops when walking to rides and then hold them on the ride. This is because the floor is just too hot and even though the park provides mats to walk on, it is still too hot and you will burn your feet. Being a gues of the hotel, they provide free towels for guests but for people visiting on their own they will have to rent towels. As others have said, it is expensive to visit which is why if you want to go to this park you should just stay at the hotel to get the free access.

Lights and Shadows . The lazy river is the longest and best I have ever seen and experienced anywhere, awsome and food options are surprisingly good quality as far as theme/watermarks go. Lost Chambers of Atlantis are no e too and we'll worth to include. Lockers are fine and towels really deserve the XL moniker.The only downside is that rides are only so so. Nicely instructed and presented in theme but compared pound for pound Bali Waterbom or even Vana Nava in Thailand deliver more, higher and more thrilling rides with more stringent security.
This was so much fun!!. If you like water parks, this you don't want to miss! Awesome super tubes, free transport inside the park taking you from one point to the next. Trilling rides!

Great fun for all the family. The park is free to all hotel guest. There are adequate safety precaution and a lot of life guards. There are quite a number of interesting rides, and depending on the day, queues are not so bad. There are activities for all age range. "The leap of faith" is a vertical slide for the strong hearted. A must try! Souvenirs and swim items are rather expensive.

Pricey but worth it. This is pricey, more than 300 dirhams per adult for the base package and more than 250 dirhams per child and that doesn't even take into account the price of getting towels and locker. However, once you get past that, there are enough pool and and slides to shake a stick at. We had our 3.5 yr old daughter and 5 month old son and we absolutely loved it. Great day out!

Excellent for who likes water rides. This is very nice place in the Palm of Dubai. This is part of Atlantis five star hotel but you can visit it by buying seperate ticket for Aquaventure water park. There are many rides which are unique. If you have time you should not miss it

Best of the UAE bunch. Top day. Expensive if you don't have a deal of some sort, so best make sure you do first. Best selection of rides in the UAE; even their lazy river is 10 x better than Wild Wadi. We went on a quiet day and the far 'ziggurat' was virtually deserted - we could run to the top & rise again after each trip.  2 grumbles:1. Like everyone else has said, the F&B is ferociously expensive. 2. We have a 121cm child for whom the visit was something of a 'coming of age', 120cm being the height to qualify for the good stuff. However, there's no uniform nor objective height measure with each ride having their own inconsistent gauge. On one, we were cleared at the bottom only to be refused at the top. Ridiculous. Take a leaf from Wild Wadi's book and have a single measure at the start of the park with all marginal but OK kids getting a definitive 'in' tag or bracelet that clears it once and for all.
three days in Atlantis. this only three days of luxurious life you can spent every day kids enjoy aquaventure unlimited entry most exciting and enjoyable water park you can ride in the town

Amazing and a bit scary.... Nice place on a hot day, especially for kids and teenagers. Water slides for everyone, one with a thrilling vertical 20 meter drop...Buy tickets at least 24 h before visit to get a nice discount!

Water park adventure at Atlantis. . We had girls weekend in Dubai at the Atlantis. EHATS great about Atlantis properties is the water park attached. There is only so much sitting at pool one can do. And riding the river in the tubes can be just as relaxing and necessary with such heat. Definitely spend time in the river and the rapids as the best part. The Torrent ( aka tsunami) was not as good as the Atlantis in Bahamas much tamer (smaller). Same as Bahamas there was the water slides in neptunes tower. Side by side racing water slides always fun. Poseidon's tower was fun. This was new to us. Slides in boats fitting six people. SO much fun. And th best (or worst??) was getting the courage to ride Poseidon's Revenge. A single person water slide. You stand in a tube like a cockpit on a tap door and the door opens and down you go. Only lasts 15 seconds or so so while Terrifying also fun and done before you know it. Staying at Atlantis in the imperial club we got complimentary access to the water park. I don't know if that is same for all rooms at atlantis or only in the imperial club class rooms. Was worth it for us
too far and dirty. too far and it was so dirty even with lot of fun it was not so good don't know but it was dirty place

Amazing fun. Enjoyable with children and without there is plenty of things to do and the entire park is linked with a lazy river therefore there is literally no need to walk unless it is to some of the larger attractions. I would recommend booking the dolphin bay first as you get free access to the waterpark included which is roughly 150 pound for the dolphins and the waterpark itself is 70 pound.
Amazing water park. What i like the most about this park is after enjoying the amazing adventure in the water park you can also enjoy the atlantis private beach and relax.

Lots of fun but quite dirty. Lots of fun and wide variety of rides, however lots of kids running around and also the sun bed areas have got quite dirty and there is no one picking up litter/tidying the grounds.It's a fun day out but wouldn't rush back! I came in 2010 when it was fairly new and it was a lot cleaner and more fresh!

Overrated, expensive and a lovely touch of rip off at the end of your day!. Went to aquaventure today, even booking weeks earlier the cost was massive. The lazy river, Rapids and slides are great fun but as the day goes on the park becomes so busy it becomes a frustration. Water park aside we ate in the burger area outside in the Avenue Mall section which again the prices were insane (£46 for 2 burgers, 2 large fries and 4 drinks)! As you leave the Avenue Mall be careful as the guys at the main door to try to rip you off and herd you into a taxi with a 40 Dirham fixed cost for a 12 Dirham journey. I actually got out of the taxi and when I challenged the guy he played stupid and said "oh you want normal taxi"? Dubai is a wonderful city and we are having an incredible family beach holiday but aquaventure is just a stack em high charge through the eyeballs kind of place offering none of the quality the other highlights of Dubai offer......my advice stear clear you can spend £300 on something much better in Dubai!

Worth every penny!. So worth every penny! The day just flew by and we felt like children again. I would definitely recommend swimming with dolphins there too. We did Dolphin bay in the morning then spent the afternoon at the water park. It was just the best day!

Great day out . Nice way to spend a day on the many slides, the flowing river is really fun and relaxing, the staff are really friendly. It's quite expensive for food or renting locker and towels so bring your own towels .
Well worth a visit

Amazing. This water park was easily the best in Dubai. It was very clean and there were plenty of sun beds unlike wild wadi. The beach is accessible which is a great touch if you are staying away from the beach. The staff let us take flip flops on the rides over our wrists which was great as the floor was really hot. Food package and unlimited refills was good value. The aquarium as part of the ticket was a nice end to the day.
Brilliant . This place was free to us through the hotel and it is worth every penny as the kids spent all day playing at the splashes kids park or floating around the lazy river

That Much Fun You Must Go!! . Aquaventure Waterpark is just awesome!!If you visit Dubai this has to be one of your days out. It was so good I went twice. It doesn't matter if you are family or a couple, young or old you will have a ball. You need to let your hair down and have fun. The rides are state of the art and you can be in the river Rapids all day just going on different routes. There is locker and showering facilities available. The lockers are very secure as you use your wrist banned to open it. Staff are very friendly and always around to help you with anything. There is a lovely beach which you can lie and relax or play some games. Aquaventure Waterpark at Atlantis the palm Dubai is the best Waterpark for sure, visit it, it's great fun!!! Enjoy!!!

A well designed waterpark that ensures fun for all ages. We had great fun at Aquaventure. Coming from Singapore, we are relatively familiar with water parks, having visited at least three in Southeast Asia. But they are pale in comparison to Aquaventure. The design is well conceived and people of different risk tolerance can enjoy the variety of rides. They offer unique experience that makes you want to have another go at them. The water is a bit cold for December. I think a visit in October or November would be perfect.

A very fun way to spend a hot day. It's expensive. But it is a hoot of a time. Make sure you find some shade--which is at a premium-to lounge when you are not running up to the top and sliding, falling, tubing back down.

Disappointing. We arrived at 11.30 am with the park opening at 10 am. With us visiting in August (hottest time of the year in Dubai) we thought it would be much quieter than it was due to the intense 45 plus degree heat. Our initial impression was not good, we got to the sales desks where you purchase tickets and the queue was huge. There was no air conditioning whilst queuing, although due to it being open air they cant help this (although i would suggest an indoor queuing system as queuing in intense heat make people even more agitated).After around 35 mins of queuing in horrendous conditions we finally got to the sales desk and purchased 2 adult tickets plus the towel and locker combo at a total cost of around 650 AED (roughly £125.00) which we thought was extremely expensive. Not a great start i thought, but if we have a good day it would be worth the initial hassle and expense. I was wrong.The whole place was manic with children running wild and adults fighting for inflatable rings. Each ride was a queue for around one hour so we decided we would lie on a sun lounger instead and take a cool shower when we got too warm. Turns out we couldn't even do that ! EVERY shower point in the waterpark is unable to run cold water and instead runs extremely hot water meaning you cant even cool off in temperatures of 40 degrees plus nor remove the dirty water that you have shared with hundreds of other people.Water is very expensive (13 AED per bottle, around £3.00) for a small bottle, and the food option where ghastly with only burgers, hot dogs and chips on offer. Quite different to the smoked salmon and caviar i had been accustomed to at my hotel i must say. Sign posts to point customers in the right direction for rides are also poor and not made clear at all so lots of people tend to get lost trying to find basic things like the towel collection point. The rides we actually bothered queuing for were OK although not amazing. After 3 hours of frustration we called it a day and returned back to our hotel. All in all, an expensive but disappointing day. Vast improvements need to be made to this water park, not least with bringing in accessible COLD shower points, cheaper drinking water, clear sign posts and cheaper entry tickets as the price is not worth the 3 good rides the park offers.

Cooling down at the aquaventure waterpark!. there is no way you an last for more than 5 minutes in the August Dubai heat. it is a heatwave guys!!! BUT in the cooled water of the waterpark it's another story. there you can take the lazy river or try the Poseidon and Neptune towers. i prefered the Poseidon because the Neptune is mostly closed dark tubes...

Brilliant but busy , needs more sunbeds !. Firstly in terms of scale this thing is huge ! there are endless slides , all of which are very very good and on par with an american waterpark. The staff are all friendly and super helpful. There is only a few things stopping it been excellent , The queues to enter are huge both in high and low season. They seem super slow at getting people in. My advice is to get there as soon as it opens so you can get a good sunbed or you could be left without. Furthermore, I would not recommend in the colder months as the water is not heated at all and even for somebody from the UK it was freezing. There is also no free wifi available for the park only if you are staying at the hotel Lastly , leaving the park, so it early if you intend to get a taxi, most people at the park are not staying at the hotel so the taxi rank queue can take an hour. If they park was a little more organised it would be 5 stars, it seems very critical but this isn’t a cheap day out so I am been picky, but don’t be put off its an amazing day.

Fun in the sun. We visited aquaventure on our final day in Dubai and with a temperature of 52 degrees we couldn't have picked a warmer day! The attractions are fun for even big kids like me and my partner and the water park is huge with lots of sun loungers free! Take your own towel as it costs to hire one and try and take your own water as it isn't cheap once in there as we paid 13AED for a 500ml bottle. Book this attraction in advance if only for the fact that you will save 60AED

Good day out. It was very busy. The rides were good, lots to go on with the kids. It's quite easy to get lost on the lazy river as you keep going round and then up the rides with your donut. You're not really sure what ride you're getting on.We had a great day and it's good to say you've been to the Atlantis.

Fantastic day out. We spent a whole day here and combined it with a visit to the aquarium - which I would recommend. I booked the combined ticket in advance from the UK - which works out a bit cheaper. The staff are all friendly and the system works well (with lockers to leave your valuables in for the day). We took our own towels (otherwise you have to pay to hire them).The rides are amazing and the lazy river goes on for ever. Even though it was VERY hot when we visited, we did not get burnt. We just had a large breakfast before we went and ate a wonderful flavoured ice drink at lunchtime! There are lots of official photo points and we did buy one at the end...but there was no hard sell. Don't miss this park on a trip to Dubai - whatever your age!
The Atlantis acquaventure. Take a plunge in acquaventure for water rides promise a great adventure with 80 ft plunge in the pool

Amazing. Brilliant free if your staying at the hotel 3of us so well worth it I think it's about £50 each if your not staying there the rides are just fantastic some really scary ones" Poseidon "The lazy river is great and you can get on and off at different places around the park staff where lovely and very helpful no queues little bus take you too and from hotel great day out definitely recommend

OK.. better waterparks out there. when staying in RAK last year we travelled to Dubai to meet up with friends and go to atlantis waterpark and aquarium. The water park was ok. It was a struggle to get sunbeds however (I think the waterpark opens up earlier for those staying in the hotel). On the day we went there a few of the rides were closed and ended up remaining closed throughout the day. When purchasing tickets we weren't told this so I can only assume they closed a short while after we entered the park. The zip line was also closed. The water park looked nice but if you have been to florida this is no where near the same as the quality of the water parks there. I loved the aquarium! Me and my partner seem to go to an aquarium every time we are on holiday as I love going. The albino aligators were something I had never seen before so made this aquarium stand out!

Wasnt as good as we expected. We visited for my sons birthday. The good thing was if its your birthday you get in free,all you have to do is follow the links on the website and take ID. We also all got in for a discounted price as we are residents which made the visit all in all half price. I thought this was OK value...i would have been disappointed if we had paid the full price. We have been to other waterparks here in the UAE and out of all of rhem Atlantis isnt the best one. The park isnt very big..we were expecting it to be huge with far more rides. However, it was still a good day. Not too busy either but i think thats because its sooo hot! Worth a visit with discounted prices.

Good fun in the sun !. Visited on June 18th - the weather was very hot ! The water was a welcome option, but despite that the heat gets to you.. Be adequately hydrated - cover yourself well and you will have fun.Our son was not too happy with the heat and so we had to beat a hasty retreat soon.
SUPER WONDERFUL. Try to go as early as possible to enjoy a full day with all levels of difficulty with family or friends. You do not need to be a good swimmer to enjoy every moment.

Excellent time after time. Such a good experience. Great family day out, lots to even for the little ones as they have a big toddler complex with lots of slides, it is quite manic in this area but it is great for the smaller ones in your group. Food expensive as always. Areas nice and tidy. Best parts are the lazy - rapid rivers. Make sure you go !
Bets of the Bset. Best water park in Dubai .....A must for all Dubai travelers! If you stay in Hotel it is free entry also..BONUS

Fun!. This was lots of fun and enjoyed the lazy river it is quite bumpy so hold on and enjoy also the slides are fun too but if you have a back problem I would not recommend the slides or Rapids at this park.

wonderful , funny, entertaining.. yippee, if you don't like this water park , you must be dead, from kids to tough guys, everyone loved it. Never heard a kid crying!, great drinks and ice creams etc, go again next time in Dubby. Ginger

Amazing water. Clean water spacious entertaining good ice cream amazing water slides incredible kid place with in scary slides falling bucket of water nice breakfast lunch brunch diner desert oh wow expel any trip

NEEDS DESIGN IMPROVEMENT . Having visited many water parks around Europe and Florida i was very suprised at the lack of design details which seperate a good water park from a bad one. There were no pools to relax in at all. Every pool in connected via rides and shoots so you either went on a ride or sat on a bed. In 50 degrees this can be hard if you have small children. If you are staying in Atlantis and you have free access then it's worth going a few times but I wouldn't recommend paying big money especially in july/August. In Cyprus i visited a waterpark where special material is used on the floor to stop your feet burning. Here you have to use your footwear everywhere which can be tricky if a ride finishes a 10 minute walk from where you left them!! There were many people running around all day looking for a bit of shade to cool there feet. Quite funny! If you are coming during July or August then i strongly advise bringing some plastic "pool shoes" no other footwear is allowed in pools and although they are sold at the park they are very expensive.

So many slides!. There are so many slides to choose from. There is definitely something for everyone in the family. We had great fun and found that the Neptune and Poseidon towers where many of the slides are housed was cooler and shaded. However in the August heat it was just too hot! You have to walk a fair bit because the park is huge and when you are on some of the longer ride on rubber rings such as the rapids, you are exposed to the sun for quite a while. We would suggest going in slightly cooler temperatures. There was an abundance of life guards throughout the park and rides who were friendly but also very focused on their jobs.

Wet Wild and Cool Comfort. I choose this adventure on a day that was over 35 deg celcius and it sure was one way to get cool on a very hot day it features just about everything a waterpark could offer a special feature is pool surfing on 6 ft high wave and waterslides galore. Well worth the admission price.

Entertaining worth the visit. I stayed in Atlantis with my family. My two daughters enjoyed every minute in this park. I thought it would be a small park with little games, but I was serprised how entertaining the park is. You need half day to enjoy the park. They give discounts for UAE locals. Also, they give discouts to hotel residents. I can assure u will enjoy it there with the kids.

Great day out, fun for all. We paid for the seal lion experience for the teenagers (photos and to be able to touch the sea lions) rather than the in the pool experience. It was excellent, well worth the costs and the staff were superb, friendly, informative, helpful.The rest of the watermark is great, lots of rides, a great lazy river (we went around and around on this). The best ride for us was the shark tank ride where you descend in darkness on a water slide and then emerge inside a glass tunnel in the middle of the shark tank - brilliant.It's an expensive day but worth it.

Great fun. We've been to this water park many times before and it never fails to give thrills. It is by far the best water park in Dubai! The only let down was that I wasn't allowed to have my GoPro on its foam, floating handle which was a let down. It is foam and in my opinion would be much safer on that, than loose in my hand where there's the potential it could become a projectile. I understand if it was metal and thin, which could cause an injury to myself, but the fat, foam, floating handle should be allowed for safety in my opinion.

Very expensive and busy.. We arrived on a free shuttle transfer from our hotel The Waldorf Astoria which took 3 hours with small children. It was so so expensive. In reality it was too busy and extremely hot. There was very little space for young children in the water, no loungers, no parasols for us to base ourselves and the rides were only ok for our oldest boy of 5 yrs. If you have a young family I would give this a wide birth. The park is geared towards the residents of the hotel where most things are included. If you are not a resident then please be cautious.

MUST SEE. This is a must see attraction. The best waterpark in the whole world. All the slides, rivers and pools are an undiscribable experience. Nice sandy beach is a part of the waterpark.
Price relatively high, but worth that experience.

Amazingly fun. What to expect? Lots of amazing fun! Water, splashing, swimming, the lot! It's located on the top of the palm island next to the Atlantis hotel, queues in the morning were not very big on the Sunday (as its a work day,) but expect it to be very busy on the holiday days (fri/sat).First off will go through how the day went before mentioning the issues/tips for future adventurers towards the end, sorry this is gona be quite a read but well worth it.The park overall was well space, tickets cost aroubd 267 AED at the time, the park had 2 towers a number of slides and rides all located in the same tower or location, early on you so get most of the fun rides as there are lower queues. Recommend first find a bench and place your towels,etc there, and come back to it throughout the day, and to do the most popular rides first before queues get big. Each tower has 1 of the 2 drop slides which I recommend to do atleast 1 time as early as possible before you hit the 1-1.5 hour queue later on in the day.First of i went through the rapids and managed to grab a single float (there are double ones too and some slides require these only.) And floated around the park on the raft at the start of the day. Halfway through I started to hit the bigger slides where I had to climb towers and go down, I a manged to clear all 6-7 slides on the tower of Neptune and it was amazing.Shortly towards the end of the day, due to the temperature (it was 52'C) we had to stay in shaded areas and water areas to cool off as some of use suffered a minor heat stroke, but we managed to cool off and just float around the rest of the day to end it.Well coming to the problems/issues faced:1 - It's located at the back of palm island. There's no way to walk to it. Only way is a monorail (which costs around 25-35 AED return I heard), or taxi, I took a tram to the Mall of Emirates and then a taxi, and it cost around 45 AED from there to the Park, on the way back it was 35 AED, probably due to the route.2. It's super hot! The weather does not get to you but the tiles/stones in the park are scorching hot!! Bring Sandles for everybody or you will be hopping around shaded areas or water, the water park has put some mats on bridges only to protect your feet, but they havnt everywhere, and it's to promote and sell their overpriced branded footwear.Alot of reviews say you have to leave Sandles etc! It's what's put me off taking them, but when I was at the park, I discovered that you can wear your Sandles on your hands like gloves before getting on any ride to take them with you, any other object/footwear will have to be left behind, and collected later on. The park charges about 120-180 AED per pair of Sandles, which is crazy considering you can get them from any local market for <10 AED.3. Take a water bottle with you, drink as much as you can, and stay hydrated, long queues halfway through the day can cause health problems, as I mentioned we suffered a minor heat stroke and managed to control it, however food is not permitted into the park itself and will be confiscated with a through bag search per person. The park has restaurants on the inside and outside, I did not manage to go to them so I cannot give an opinion of them.However there is options to get fluids/drinks around, there is 1 stall I recommend near the Neptune tower, or well any that had a 50 AED refill container, they provide you with a bottle which you can pay between 5-12 AED for a refill, which is the cheapest option available! Do not go for the snow cones, they are amazing but aslong as your happy to pay for it 50-70 AED per cup... the refill options saves alot and you can get a not so nice looking snow cone, but hey... its to cool you.. not to be pretty.. and it melts almost instant so eat it fast! And do not leave any water on the benches, even in the shade! By the time you are back they are boiling, and worse case If you need to cool off go to nearby bathrooms, as they have air conditioning and the tapwater is filtered for dubai and clean.4. You normally have a paper band on the arm with a barcode similar to another park, it allows you to make purchases or products and you have to top it off at the entrance, apparantly any money left on at the end of the day gets refunded (be careful you may have to queue up for it,) on the day I went, their systems were down.. which was very problematic as i had to walk 10-15 minutes to go from where I am, to locker rooms near the entrance and collect coins/notes and take it to the stall, any change i'd have to take back and go back to where I was with family. So do make sure their systems are not down when you go.5. The big thing I have not seen anywhere on any review so far.. The > LOCKERS <. There are 2 sizes, small and large, I managed to take pictures of them below. Small costs about 50 AED large was i believe 75 AED, and there's a special offer with a towel for an extra 10 AED If i remember right. These prices are crazy and non refundable. You'll manage to fit 1, backpack, 1 pair of shoes and maybe a wallet or 2, and that's it. Also the locker unlock is only given to 1 person, so going in a family, you'll have to either go together or buy seperate lockers.6. Photographs at the end, this isn't a problem, just stating the costs, 100 AED for 1 photo and 350 AED for 15. Which I'm not sure.. but when I visited the burj khalifa they were only going to give you 1 printed and the rest either on usb/online In the higher price.7. I recommend everybody to buy the waterproof plastic cases for their phones, I never noticed this till halfway through the day, but it protects your phone and allows you to take pictures on the go! :D just make sure you don't drop it on the slide down lol! I'm not sure how much these cost.. but I bet they will be extortionately priced, but worth it for your own pictures as its one of my regrets I did not manage to get many.8. They I believe rent out go pro cameras near the inside of the park entrance after enter past the checkers, on your right side, I missed this, not sure on the cost of this but it's there.Besides the downsides and problems on the day... it was a lovely and amazing time and I'm glad I went, oh and it's free to enter the park of you have a room at the Atlantis hotel. There are many other activities such as zip lining, scuba diving, aquarium, these however are at an additional cost, ranging from 100-400 AED (guessing.)Hope you all have an amazing day here, it's well worth it, and it will take the whole day, and you will be drained in the evening. Don't forget the slippers! You have been warned.

Best water park for our age kids I've been to. . We were a party of 5, the wife and I and 3 boys, 14 and two 9's. Despite the heat and it is very hot in summer, there are plenty of places to hide from the sun and lots of facilities to get drinks. You will need sun cream and a pair of flip flops; your feet will roast on the ground otherwise. The rides were very safe and great fun. A split vote on which was the best but it's a shoot out between Leap of Faith and Zoomaranga. Wait times were short although again maybe the time of year and heat. We lasted 3 hours which was plenty and allowed us to get on everything, two or three times for some rides.Best water park we've been to for our taste and age range of 9 upwards and we've been to a lot.
Fun every time we visit. Been many times and always had lots of fun. Staff is very friendly and engaging. Rides are fantastic!

Great fun at a high price. We had a great day at the waterpark , really nice slides some of them you are not going to find them in any other waterpark. Great variety of slides even though I was expecting the park to be bigger. I found it too expensive for what it offers.

a good place to visit if you want to explore. the major attraction of this park is that it is situated in the Hotel Atlantis, an attraction in itself and in the Palm Jumeirah area... it does not have a very vast variety of water rides but yes whichsoever it has are enthralling.. the ticket can be called a bit on the higher side.. and yes, the floor gets really really hot to walk on with naked feet, so do carry your sleepers or you would need to shell out more than 150 AED to buy from the park.. and yes, to enjoy all the rides you need to be in a proper swim attire,especially if you are a girl.. otherwise they wont let you in.... all in all its a visit that will cost you around 1200-1400 AED for 2 people..

No water...no joke.. My wife and I traveled from the UK with kids. This was one of the main attractions. You need to be prepared for the heat, the size and the price. July 2016The goodNo queues to speak of.Good rides for the thrill seeker and more tame also.Food onsite was adequate but we didn't shop around because we weren't there for the food.The badThe price was the going rate for the region; which is a little high.We found the site navigation a little confused, there's not much I can do with a paper map is there?Although it is bigger than wild wadi I understand, the kids splashers area was over crowded and too small to be honestThe UglyThere is a limit on the water you can bring in, no fountains to drink from and utterly ridiculous price of water inside aquaventure. We were charged 12Dh for 1 small bottle.TIP bring loads of water and drink it on arrival if they stop you.

A thrilling unforgettable experience . Do remember to wear swim suits coz otherwise u won't be allowed on many rides . the elderly can enjoy in the lazy river , in fact the entire family can spend a wonderful time on it . There are long queues in a few rides so be sure to do them first . Many couple rides are there which are indeed thrilling . A few family rides too which makes it more fun . Do remember to take a map and chalk out your day plan . Also tick rides u have done so that u don't end up missing on any thing. We payed extra for " swim with the Dolphins" for our 2 kids and it was really worth the experience. The photos however are quite expensive and so I paid to accompany them. This way I could click many pics rather than buying one from them . However they don't let u in the water so be sure to take a high definition camera with u . Eatables are not allowed inside. Locker facility is available. Simply amazing rides . Even if u are not staying at the Atlantis be sure to go there for a day long visit .

Fun, fun, fun. Absolutely love this watermark and it has so much to keep you busy and entertained throughout the day. The lazy river is superb and it comprises of many rapid water sections to give you that wee thrill. Recently we found the more scary water slides which have a height restriction but were amazing. Small child area, many, many sun loungers and private cabanas if you want that little extra touch. Food and beverage all around the park with some nice shops for those little souvenirs. There is a zip line and you can take a little wander down tot the beach area. The food court is ample and tasty. You can buy a ticket with a meal deal but this limits you to the choice of food so I recommend just purchasing your ticket for the waterpark to allow you a choice of all the foods on offer.Superb day for the family and the children and adults will not ever be bored.

Always on the itinerary when friends come to visit!. When friends come to visit and you need some downtime for a few hours Aquaventure is right up there on my list of things to do. Not only does it offer great slides (The Tower of Poseidon has a bunch of excellent rides) but the views from the top offer a unique view of the Palm, one of Dubai's most iconic landmarks.It's expensive but if you've made the conscious choice to visit Dubai you'll find it in keeping with pretty much everything else and it's a great way to spend a few hours and it's not just for kids.

Super fun. We all loved Aquaventure: its great for grown ups and kids. Very friendly staff, lots of rides but do get there early to avoid the heat (which is furnace-like and exhausting in the summer) and the crowds (which can get annoying). Food/drinks in the park are expensive, and there are very few water fountains, so bring your own water bottles.

This place is awesome. I love waterpark and was happy to hear the waterpark was right nextdoor to our hotel. I couldn't believe it was joined to a hotel seeing as it's huge and so much to do. I did chicken out on two water rides which was the leap of faith and the 321 go lol but apart from that it was enjoyable and a wide range of snacks,meals and beverages around.

Aquamazing. Aquaventure water park is a great day out. You can just get in a rubber ring and float in the queues for the rides. This was such a relaxed and chilled out day for us which all the family enjoyed.I would definitely recommend a day hereThe food and drink was rather pricey but that is the only downfall.

Unbelievable . The water park at the Atlantis blew my mind. The slides were amazing for all ages and gave me a thrill of a lifetime. The lazy river went around the whole park and kept going with Rapids. The worlds largest water slide let me live on the edge. It is not cheap and I recommend getting a locker, but it was worth every penny. There is even a beach to relax on.
aha wonderful. at the time of stay at Atlantis we have a complementary entry at the aqua venture water park it is the long 1.6 kilometers long and the very good rides and clean water...

Amazing. Amazing water park in the Atlantis. As we were staying in the hotel the entry was free. We took buggy ride from our tower to the park. All the rides including lazy river,slides & leap of faith were amazing. We felt safe on all rides as there were many attendents to assist . We went there during Ramadan but all the eating joints were open in the park.If you are staying in the hotel please take water bottles from room when going to water park as the water & drinks are very expansive inside the park.
Gerguos adventure . 5stars Aqua park, has all aqua facilities, well organized and classy... I can say good restaurants available.free entry for Atlantis the palm residents .. Must try

A waterpark full of Fun. Atlantis waterpark, is a most visit place, whether young or old, the kid inside you will pop out, you can chill out on the lazy river which goes around the park, so you can hop on and of were ever you lay your towel, I have 5 times in past year it great, one bit of advise take flip flops with you because the floor get roasting(you can carry them on the rides), sun burnt feet is not funny ask my friend lol
Visit it again. We are planning at visit it again as this was the best feature of our visit. Take all rides but do not travel with minors as they can spoil all fun.

Great Experience - but expensive. We had a three day stop over in Dubai en-route to Sri Lanka, and this was on the to do list.Great place to spend the day, has just enough rides to keep you and you're kids entertained. We combined this with a visit to The Lost Chambers Aquarium.The lazy river was really good fun, had lots of side routes, escalators, rapids as well as the obligatory water fountains. The rides were really good too, especially the family ones. Have been to a fair few water parks, being a big kid at heart, and loved every minute of this.Went end of July and was not busy, hardly any queues to speak of but the queuing layout suggested this could get take a LOT more people!!The food was OK, felt they could have done more than they had on offer, but they have to appeal to the masses and get the food out fast, so take it for what it is.The drinks though are extortionate, at 15 AED each, nearly £3 a bottle, was a bit steep. Would suggest taking a locker, to keep your stuff secure, does cost 70 AED, but for the day, worth the piece of mind.My two daughters absolutely loved it, and if visiting Dubai, you have to do this.

Amazing day out 😄. It was my boyfriends birthday while we were away and decided to go to the water park. This I such a good day out. We absolutely loved it. I'm not a fan of water park but this one I would go again. The creek you travel round has so many different rides going off it you need to know where to go. Just explore and you will be surprised. Definitely recommend this place to anyone.

Wet, wet and wet - one week in the Aquaventure park. One of the best waterparks I've visitied so far. We spend a week in the hotel Atlantis and took benefit of the Aquaventure park every day. Even for a littel 4 years old boy its a perfect adventure and learning experience. Taking the water slides on his own or try all the activities at the Splasher or the rafting rides. I can truly recommend this venue to parents with kids.Only one advice, take care of your belongings. Twice in a week we "lost" our shoes...
LOVE LOVE LOVEEEEE. Such a good water park. worth ever penny! food is good in the restaurants and the lazy river is out of this world!

Fun day out!. Probably the best waterpark is ever been too. It's not cheap, make sure you book tickets online before you go as that's the cheapest option. If you can, take your own towels with you or from your hotel as that keeps down the cost. You can rent lockers and also put money on the wrist bands hey give you so you don't need to keep going back to your locker when you want to buy food, drinks or souvenirs etc. Changing rooms were very clean and lots of lockers, toilets and changing facilities. There are lifeguards everywhere so felt very safe and looked after at all times. The rides are so much fun, we only did Neptune's tower which has about 5 rides which you can go on all as a pair or individually. When I next go to Dubai, I'm defo going back as need to do Poseidon's tower too!

Atlantis on the palm. The Atlantis on the palm was truly the mother of all adventure water parks! It is also a hotel,it was not the hotel we stayed at though! We stayed at the fairmount on the palm beautiful well manicure hotel, and is more of a adult atmosphere and its surroundings! but the Atlantis on the plan is more of a family environment and its grounds have activities that have different creativities and lots of exciting things to do, for the kids .& incase you get hungry! no need to go outside to find KFC or MCDonalds!everything you need is right at your finger tips! lots of burger bars & drinks within the grounds. I'm not sure how large the grounds stretch out too! But the parks are huge! And of course the beach is always nearby if you want to sunbathe! but why would you won't too, if you can cool yourself off on the six level rides within the grounds! Calling all families with adventure!can you take the heat!

Good but expensive ! . Perfect place to spend full day. Great fun even for adults. Decent choice of attractions. Expensive admission, small locker (paid extra!) very expensive bevarages!!! ( small bottle of coke 18 aed! )

Barrel of monkeys. This place is an absolute hoot. This waterpark really does need a whole day to go on all the rides. The big water slide there is terrifyingly awesome, the multi-passenger rides are guaranteed to induce a few giggles amongst friends, and the lazy rivers are endless. It is one of the best waterparks in the region and there is a lot of competition for that title. Now a few negative comments which are not the end of the world. 1.) you cannot park at the hotel if you are just going to the waterpark. You have to park at a nearby car park and take the hotel shuttle. They leave regularly enough,(15 to 20 minutes - but that seems like a lifetime when you're hot and all you want to do is go have some fun. 2.) The concessions are ridiculously priced, and you can expect to overpay for a burger or a hot dog, but who cares? You're too busy having a great time... Now despite having a small children's' area, this is NOT a place for young kids. If you're children are not capable swimmers, do not take them... This is one of the must-visit attractions in Dubai and I would highly recommend it. p.s change rooms, and rentable lockers are available

Brilliant !! . Brilliant water park slides are very good and there is plenty to do/ see. Lots of places to eat around and get refreshments which is fab throughout a hot day. What was very good too was that there was ridiculous amounts of life guards and staff around the site and also along every slide, this was very safety conscious and the main thing I loved about this water park. Would definitely return visiting Dubai again, very good price too
Well worth a visit. Great day out for everyone. Terrifying options that I steered clear of but there really is something for everyone to enjoy,
Great fun. Great fun at the water park, get there early or it's a struggle to find somewhere to sit and relax. The queue's were not to busy on the slides and the lazy river is worth a go to chill in.

I had so much fun!. Me and my wife went to the Aquaventure waterpark when on honeymoon and we had so much fun. All the rides are so good and the lazy river is excellent. The water isn't too deep as well so people who have difficulty swimming don't have to worry. Overall I would definitely visit again.

Only place to be without a/c. Had a brilliant full day here enjoying all the flumes and the lazy river and rapids.It is so hot in July that apart from the malls with aircon this is the only place to be during the day.There are 2 areas with about 5 different slides in each and we very nearly missed the second area "posidons tower" which had the more extreme slides.It does get very busy but plenty of sunbeds and shade if get there before 11am.

One of the best Water Parks.. The Aquaventure provides a fabulous and thrill seeking experience. Book your whole day, arrive early and enjoy all of the rides. The staff is very friendly and are very helpful. Lockers are available.There is something for everyone. There are fun rides for the kids, thrill rides for adults and teens......... the place is totally fun. The tower of Neptune(if i remember correctly) allows you to take different rides. The best one was the top one where you actually slide below the fish and sharks. The rates have certainly increased since my last visit.Cant wait to visit again.

Fantastic day!!! . We absolutely fell in love with this water park and ended up staying here from the minute it opened to the minute it shut. There are virtually no queues for any of the rides and if there are they go super quick. The rapids and the torrent were very fun. I braved the leap of faith and it is not for the faint hearted, it's an adrenaline rush for sure but you will not be disappointed!! The shark ride where you're in an inflatable raft through the aquarium means you get to see the fish up close. Cannot recommend this park enough!

Great. Love this water park; it never feels crowded and managed to entertain two teenagers for the whole day.Staying at the hotel allows you to visit free of charge and avoid the hottest time of day.The lazy river is fab with extras such as the Rapids if you're feeling more adventurous.Food and drink is responsibly priced and if you are staying half board the restaurants are included in your meal package.

Superb, best water park ever!!!!. It was amazing great for thrill seekers the life guards were really friendly and there was loads to do. the queues weren't that bad either. I recommend you go with the hotel for easy access.

Awesome . We were there today despite the heat , the place is massive and we got round most of it children's play area was best we've ever been too ..clean ,and not a bit of rust to be seen in site .. the place is well cared for ,staff are plenty so are the towels and sunbeds , we could learn a lot in England from this place ,the only down side is price of drinks but then again this is Dubai

Absolutely fabulous. We went to Aqua Adventure when it opened at 10am and enjoyed the rapids & torrents of the lazy river before the masses arrived. We had an excellent day and particularly liked the family rides at Poseidon's Tower. Entry is free for guests staying at Atlantis the Palm as are towels. A locker is 40 dirhams so all in all a bargain. We will be back soon!
Awesome day out!. Expensive entry fee plus extras, such as, locker and towel rental.Book before you go on the Internet as it is cheaper.The park is great fun with lots of activities and rides.

Great waterpark !. I visit this waterpark upon my visit to Dubai, I'm glad that I did because the waterpark was great! Although there isn't loads and loads of slides to chose from the ones they have are spectacular especially being able to slide under water in a glass tube in an aquarium an experience I will remember for life, there is different levels of thrills depending if you prefer to play it safe which I usually would on small slides but these where so good I ended up doing bigger thrills on the biggest slides which was a lot of fun! The staff were very friendly and made you feel very welcome couldn't have asked for a better experience great day out

I kissed a dolphin and I liked it . So I'm a 33 year old mom of 2 boys which I'd like to note is already quite adventurous and although I spent a lot of time promoting Aqua venture and the looking at other people hanging out with the Dolphins, I finally took a staycation at the Atlantis hotel and got to hang out with the Dolphins. Slightly pricey but as a once in a lifetime experience with amazing pictures for memories, I'd say it was worth it. We got the summer and resident discount so that added to pleasing us as well
Money well spent. Definitely worth splashing out - rapids was our favourite.Will be back to Dubai and will definitely come back to water park.

The Fun is Never Ending Here. We celebrated our nephews birthday here at the aqua park and we enjoyed every bits of it. The place looks really amazing, I recommend you to invest on a very comfy wet and dry shoes, since you will be doing a lot of walking and ive seen some of the people here walking barefoot and the thought of walking under the scorching sun, it must have been torture to your feet. And also bring a good sun screen lotion, since the water tubing goes for ages to finish you will be baking under the sun a lot :D

My favorite water park in Dubai. The park is extremely expansive. There are all kinds of rides - something for everyone. Most rides involve tubes. There is an extreme downward vertical ride for adrenaline junkies. Some rides even take you through glass tunnels with sharks viewable on the other side of the glass. Swimming with dolphins is one of the main attractions and something to truly remember. Highly recommended attraction for anyone visiting or residing in Dubai. Also easy access to Atlatis hotels, restaurants and bars and events.

It is more than excellent, Must to Do. I had been to Orlando and visited different water parks, and for me Aqua venture Dubai is the best. The rides are amazing, very clean. water temperature is adjusted where you dont feel the heat of Dubai (also not freezing)Different age groups enjoy the park, also the new extension has added more variety if you are willing to pay more then Dolphin bay is a must along with the Zipline

Great Asset for the Hotel. Whilst staying at Atlantis guests can come and go to the waterpark. The park has a number of adrenaline pumped slides based around two towers. The Tower of Neptune is the closer one to the hotel and features the leap of faith which is a steep drop which takes you through the aquarium in a glass tube at the bottom. The second tower, the tower of Poseidon, features the other top ride Poseidon's revenge. You enter a glass tube and the floor falls away, dropping you for what seemed like ages before you turn in the water. Staff are superb, but be warned the ground is hot so have some form of water shoes. Some rides do not allow selfie sticks or Go Pro buoyancy handles. The lazy river features rapids and a couple of rides and is a great way to see out an hour. Only negative was that the Slitherine ride made your back feel as if you had friction burns as you went down it, very unpleasant and not worth it. You can use the lazy river to get from one tower to the other , or use the hotel golf carts which run along the beachside. Have a great time

Best water park in the world. Aquaventure is one of the best water parks we have every been to. The life guards are all really friendly and helpful. The slides are really good fun in both towers and the lazy river is nice to relax on.Even though we were staying in the imperial club, which has its own private beach, the beach at the water park was full of shells and wildlife so we enjoyed visiting there each day as nobody else was on it.

Best waterpark ever!!!. Loved this place!! Leap of faith was so awesome that I did it twice!!! Lots of adult rides compared to other waterparks worldwide. Tip- go early so you can spend the whole day on the rides and attractions!!
Best water parks. Aquaventure is included in Top 5 waterparks in the world and it really deserves this, Very well maintained and lovely water park.

Random weekend. We got there right at opening time! This allowed us to get onto the lazy river and the big slides with not a single line. I'd advise anyone who wants to feel a rush to ride on Poseidon's Revenge and the Leap of Faith!

Brilliant. Brilliant water park for the whole family.
Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and definitely recommended for the family
Average. Having seen lots of advertising for this park, we looked forward to a visit. It is in a fantastic location but the park itself is overpriced and not value for money.
Huge. The waterpark is huge and you need lot of time if love water parks . There is something for everyone and will definitely love to visit again
Very good. We had a lot of fun and really enjoyed . The visit worth it, but my daughter said that Siam park at Tenerife is the best ever.

Me and my hubs. I really enjoyed this!! We didn't too much else except laze on the lazy river but beware!! Very busy which kind of spoils the tranquility if you fancied a relaxing moment but it was really good fun. Invest in a pair of waterproof shoes though as the ground is soooooo hot when you walk around the park and trust me when I say it's hot!- u can leave the shoes where u get into the river but a couple had their shoes nicked(probably by people who hadn't got shoes and will have dumped them once they had got to their sun beds)There are a lot of lifeguards about and they are all very friendly and very helpful/ the river can be a bit boisterously at times so safety is huge.I had a good time here but be prepared for lots of people.

Awesome place. Fun for the whole family. Definitely worth a day. Must recommend the dolphin encounter. So amazing. You can literally spend hours in the lacy river and watersides to keep you going forever.
water park in atlantis. Nice experience lot's of ride i really enjoy our 1 day stay in atlantis waterpark..i hope i can comeback with my brother and sister im sure they will like it also

Great if at Atlantis . We had entry included within our package and made the most of it, queues are not a problem all very well run. Life guards galore and all of them smile and add to the visit, spotlessly clean with no pushy sales people trying to upgrade you etc (although the photographers are always on hand). I am not sure that we would pay the admission price as it is too hot to spend a full day in the park, be prepared with plenty of drinks etc if you do as with all of these places they are not cheap to buy on the day.
Atlantis Adventure. Great experience at Aquaventure waterpark at Atlantis. Huge water park with fun rides and some tough ones as well . Worth a visit !

Take your flip flops !!. A great water park with a good selection of rides whether you want something chilled or extreme Just remember to take your flip flops - the walk between attractions is not far but the ground gets scorching in the hotter parts of the day A great day out for all
Fun in hot summer. Went there many times during our stay at Atlantis. Loved the children's pool as it was too much fun for my kid. The slides are great and lot of fun.

Lots of fun but EXPENSIVE. good thingsNumber of water rides. The kids will love it.The park is Very clean especially considering the number of people who travel through...Army of staff including lifeguards which is reassuring for families with childrenStaying at Atlantis you can enter early and walk to the park. bad thingsFood is so expensive. Cost for average theme park lunch is staggering. I could not believe it, easily 3 or 4 times what you would expect. There is hardly any free drinking water and the one we found was very discretely placed. I wonder if vendors are more interesting in you paying for OVER PRICED waterSmoking - seriously in 2016 it is not acceptable to have smoking allowed throughout the park. In queues, on sun loungers, in the pool??? Designated smoking areas please..There are queue jumpers which is not nice. More help is required to ensure people do not bully themselves into queues...
Super fun for family . Nice very organized good staff very helpful and nice you don't have to wait too much to get in rides plus you don't have to be a hotel guests ( Atlantis) to get in

Good one time visit. Aquaventure is good for a one time visit. it has very minimal rides and gives you a relaxing feeling if you are not the kind who wants to get value for money.Overall good experience, very expensive food inside, DONOT GO in summers else your feet will definitely get burnt. Drawback is you need to keep dragging your big massive tubes for any ride you want to go for, its like a workout.Lazy river and poseidons slide( scary) are the best.
Relax. the best water park ever...perfect.for.lovers...perfect for hot weather in Dubai so excitingi really recommend.to all my.friends..coming to relax in this city...
Good experience. This is good place especially if you are in a big group where you can collectively enjoy. Can go many times

Great fun! . We had lots of fun and visited the park for 3 times, absolutely a must with kids. Lots of great slides and it was Ramadan it was empty.Don't forget to bring shoes for water as walking around requires some and the options onsite are way too expensive!
Nice for the kids. Nice place for the kids but just too sunny. there was not enough chead available, vut it was a fun event

Wow. First time I go to this place, didn't know what to expect but at the end was an incredible experience!! very safe and good for people of every age!! I totally recommend it to have a different and great time in groups!!
Excellent . Fabulous place, lots of places to relax as well as going on rides etc. Friendly staff and can be quite pricey if a few of you go it is well worth it once inside.

Water all over in desert.. After reaching the waterpark you don't feel getting out of the park. So many good rides and adventurous experience. Leap of faith fall is stunning. One can spend the whole day riding the managed water canal encircling the park. Trip to be combined with lost chambers.
