Being a non-swimmer, I just loved it!. Nice and clean place, my daughter had a gala time.
We didn't go on the too adventurous rides, but did try their family ride which was fun. The kids area is also nice!
The best waterpark. A highly recommended site with amazing slides, attractions. Food and drink expensive whilst there but it is like that everywhere...
A must. This is one of the best aqua parks in the world. Located in the palm island as a part of the Atlantis 5 star hotel. A bit expensive but worths it

Lovely aqua water park. We arrived at the aqua park at 2pm. It was approx 48 degrees outside!This ensured we made the most of the slides and lazy rivers etc. Wonderful helpful staff there too. We were always well spoken to.One person who worked in the Barracudas restaurant - Karan was extremely hospitable. I kept forgetting things such as cutlery. He didn't let me stand up once. So kind, helpful and friendly. Karan, thank you for making our visit to the aquaventure park extra special.

Great Rides, Take Flip Flops!. This is a decent water park with some fab rides. The layout is smart with many of the tube rides finishing into the main river part of the park. You can access many of the rides from your tube which is a bonus as the floor is so hot (in the summer) - this is where the flip flops come in!! Take these with you around the park and just hold onto them on the rides. Unlike the USA water parks they are quite relaxed about this which is helpful. You need most of a day to do all the rides, and enough time to do your favourite ones a few times. Towels and lockers are available and the restaurants are as you would expect for a water park - but let's face it you do go for fine cuisine you go to get soaked, thrilled and a few giggles.

Fun for all Ages. Great water park for all ages with a beach next to the lunch venues. Perfect to have a lazy afternoon after all the adventures you had during the morning hours. I do recommend to bring your own food and drinks when this is not really value for money.

Worth the money!. Visited for a day with my boyfriend last week. Paid at the door and it cost about €90 each which covered entrance, small locker and lunch which was burgers and chips. Well worth the money. We brought our own towels, towel rental costs about €10. Spent the whole day here, the water was lovely and cool. Great slides for thrill seekers. If you are visiting plan to spend the whole day as there are a lot of slides etc.

Water Wonderland. A highly recommended site with amazing slides, attractions and a private beach area. It has excellent changing room and locker options and the entire experience that we had was simply memorable. one is required to be in the proper swimming attire and taking your own towels is advised but there is an option for renting out there as well.

Great day out but expensive if you're not a guest. Lots to do and plenty room to have your own space when sunbathing. Food and drink expensive whilst there but it is like that everywhere, the tickets in can be expensive if you don't stay at the hotel however, its free if its your birthday!!

Short day visit to break long haul flight. It takes a bit of careful advanced planning, but to break a long haul flight that had a long wait in Dubai we opted to get out of the airport and have a few hours of fun at this great water park. Before doing this, there are important things to remember: pack a towel, good sunscreen, shorts and swimwear into your carry on luggage. Work out approx travel times to and from airport. Don't forget queuing times to get into park and allow yourself time to eat (at airport, as park is way overpriced for food), you are not allowed bring food into the park. Also DO NOT pre purchase your tickets at the airport as it took almost 45mins for them to recognise and validate them at the park and it's far far quicker to just pay at the entrance. Ok so that sounds like a lot to sort out and plan, however it actually just needs a careful bit of time management and it all went brilliantly. The water park is incredible fun, with a great mix of adrenaline rides like leap of faith and one in a capsule drop, to equally fun and relaxed meandering river rides. Over all the queues weren't too bad however it was mid week when we were there. I would highly recommend a visit and after a fun filled day and shower you arrive back in time refreshed for your on bound flight. Would definitely do it again.
KIDS HEAVEN. July in Dubai is exceptionally hot... the waterpark was a perfect solution for 9 and 12 year olds... lifeguards every where..very diligent and safe.

A week isn't long enough. I love waterparks and I've visited many across the world. Dubai is hands down the BEST!!! We spent one week and it simply wasn't long enough. You won't be bored. And there's a dedicated Kids Waterpark attached to the main waterpark. And try the "Terror of Terror"!!!!
Aquaventure. Funfilled half a day long cooling escape at an international level water theme park... we totally loved it..

Amazingly wonderful. the place is awesome everyone has a smile on their faces. and a big thanks to Mr. Christian from kids club as he was very helpful in many ways. and to jonhassa from one of the restaurant outlet as she is very welcoming. looking forward to come back and see them again.

Goos but too expensive. There werent so many extreme things to do but still enough to enjoy all day over there. I didn't like the beach , but i loved the lazy river. I am sorry that i couldn't swim with the dolphins but it was too expensive for me.
Fantastic . Such a amazing place, plenty off slides/rides. Great for both adults and kids. Visiting Dubai was a amazing experience. I have been to other water parks but nothing comes close as this

Not what I was expecting . Honestly I was disappointed. After hearing and reading so much about it, I thought I would be blown away. Unfortunately I wasn't A lot of rides were closed and for some reason it seemed like only few rides were working. Didn't like how extremely expensive things were at the park. If you want to go once just for the sake of going then it's fine. I've been to other water parks that were more fun

Go early!. Had a great time. We were there with our 12 year old and went in low, but the hottest season. We got there at 10am when it opened each day and pitched up near 'Barracuda's' restaurant. We then could do all the tube rides before it got busy mostly without queueing! There are lockers to rent for the day about £8, but as we were only staying next door at the Atlantis didn't really need them. We also got in free as residents of the Atlantis the Palm.Towels are available to use free of charge. Take lots of sunscreen and flip flops or the like are essential as the floor is too hot to walk on between rides!!

Good but half of it closed but still charged full price. There are a number of rides but with half of it closed we found ourselves repeating rides. The staff were friendly but one of my daughters couldn't find a single ride float and was turned back after entering a slide which separated us and led to a twenty minute waste of time trying to find her by which point she was very upset, there were no notices to warn people that they were not able to use double floats on there own and I felt it was irresponsible of the park to split families in that way.

Good Experience. The place is awesome and we enjoyed a lot. In all other slide I liked Leap of Faith very much. If you like adventure, surely you have to try it. Make sure while going to this water park, if you want to enjoy all the slides, you have to take with you a suitable attire particularly ladies dresses, which has to be suited for water, otherwise you have to purchase from the shops there, which are expensive. So be well prepared with your attire and enjoy.
Far better than Wild Wadi. For the same money, Aquavenutre themepark is far better value for money and experience that Wild Wadi which is tired and run down.

Not great value for money. We spent a few hours at the Aquaventure waterpark. We got there a little later than planned because we slept in, so didn't get the full day. However the park was a little understaffed, with quite long waiting times for some rides, and some rides closed. For this reason we didn't feel we got value for what we paid.If you do go in the hot months make sure you wear some footwear as the floor is really too hot to walk on. Ouch !

Don't be put off by the price!. An excellent day today at Aquaventure on the Palm... The entrance package that we bought through Emirates holidays was great and included a meal for the family. Drinks are a little expensive but we bought a souvenir refill flask for 50 AED (approx£10) including a slush fill and it then only cost 8 AED (approx £1.70) to refill.Well worth a visit if you have children but don't be surprised as you are visiting one of the most luxurious holiday areas in the world!

DREAMLAND. It was really one of the best experience of my life. as we stayed at atlantis we got a free entry and those 6 hours spend there was really out of the world experience. a must visit for everyone specially for people loving aquaspark
Wooaw. Me and my son we have the time of our life, joy all the rides and have best time over there. Friendly and care staff as well the food inside. Highly recommend !!!

Great fun for any age. This waterpark is one of the best I have ever been. you can find adventure for any age and any level. My nieces loved the kids area with many slides in different colour and size. While the grown ups can enjoy the slow rivers with little adventures or the leap of faith and this or that that get your adrenalin high :)
Its fun to be under the sun. The rides are amazing, you can just keep on repeating the rides though I dont have the guts to try the leap slides, its too tall for me but my children did.

FUN FUN and more FUN. Aquaventure waterpark is not only for children and kids,we had so much fun and a lovely time with our little boy. no worries with little children ore babies,because there are enough ore to much lifeguards and they really do a great job. once my husband wanted to take our 2 year son to a to big slay and they did not allowed it, that means the lifeguard care about the children. the water is clean and the aquaventure looks very nice. we went ther 6 times.

Super funnnnnn.. Definitely the best water park I've been to. It has attractions for all ages; toddlers,kids,teens,adults and even the old. You can spend your day just lazing and watching families having fun or experience adrenaline on the craziest rides!!!

First class service and care. I visited with my 10 year old daughter yesterday. On holiday I often turn into total klutz mode and managed to fall down some stairs whilst grabbing a rubber ring to do lazy river. I sprained both my wrist and ankle, The medic who attended (Shalini) was kind and caring. I tried to continue our visit but was unable to do so. Riyaz? at the ticket desk was extremely kind and gave us 2 tickets to be sued within the next 3 months as we had to cut our visit short. First class service :-)
Great place for families!. I have been to Aquaventure on two occassions with my teenage son! If you prefer a smaller waterpark, this would be great!

Perfect team ohting. Planned a team outing at aquaventure. It truly is one of the best attractions of Dubai. Located in the beautiful Atlantis Hotel, Aquaventure is a beautiful water park, family oriented and a lot of fun water slides. They also have a variety of restaurants to choose from. Good for an all day outing.

Amazing . What an experience. It was truly amazing. I have never done anything like this before. We opted for the deep water dolphin experience and it was great. Lots of training before you get in the water to meet the dolphin. You spend about 30 minutes with themThe staff are excellent and explain everything as you go. There is a photographer their to take pictures the whole time. Book early as it fills up quickly !

Worth it just for the Leap of Faith Slide. The waterpark itself isnt the biggest, and the slides are just ok. But if you're going to do any, make sure you go on the Leap of Faith. it is scary, my heart was pounding when i got to the front of the line, but just close your eyes and take that leap. You'll be glad you did it afterwards. Also, beware of the super hot floor. You can wear your thongs and they let you take them on the slide. They also let you take your GoPro - if you have one, make sure you take it with you.

Great in the water and on the flumes but watch your towels/belongings!. Went to Aquaventure for the second time in March 2016 having previously been in 2012 and had a great day.We arrived early so we could avoid the queues and got our wrist bands along with a wrist band for a locker. When I tried to use this wrist band on a locker it did not work and took around 20 minutes to fix and involved me standing in 2 queues, so this wasn't the best start to the day.Once this was cleared up we got into the park and went on to enjoy our day on the flumes and in the river Rapids. Since our last visit a new tower had been built with new flumes, which was a pleasant surprise to us and made our day in the water even more enjoyable.On a side note, our towels were removed/ stolen from our sun beds twice. This was frustrating as we had to convince the guy at the stall twice to provide us with replacements, which took time to begin with. Not sure what can be done to stop this but be wary leaving expensive sun glasses or items lying around. We were always told Dubai was safe but this gave us a few doubts and concerns.This was a slight dampener on what is without a doubt a fantastic water park.

very fun!. We had a very good time at the waterpark. The rides are very fun, the pools are very clean, nice towels offered to hotel guests for free, the park is very large, organized and clean. The only downside is the food price, which was somewhat over priced.

So cool . So cool, an outdoor park with water activities, suitable for everyone. Make sure to wear swimwear though otherwise you won't be allowed on the rides (we had to go back and change, luckily we were just further up on the palm)

Fun! But limited. If you went to a flagstaff in US before, this will not be so awesome. If you are comparing Wild Wady to this one, Aquadventure is the best option! Is a very big place, kind of expensive, and be mentally prepared to walk a lot! The las week of the season, you might found many attractions closed. So plan ahead. They also have family packages were you can find yourself with a private tent, a welcome fruit basket, juices and private pool chairs for 4 members. If you want your space and privacy, you will pay for these. Also, dont forget your go-pro like camera, and sunscreen!

Fun times.... We've been to many water parks. This one is great, but the rides are much like other parks, so my boys (10 and 12) weren't particularly impressed with the rides but they were happy to be at a water park. We visited during a low season, so to speak. It was super hot so staying in the water was perfect to help stay cool. Carrying our flip flops on every ride was a little annoying but necessary because the ground was too hot to walk on between rides. Bring water shoes. We bought some for the kids because it was too much to ask them to hold on to their shoes. We liked most of the lazy river but there were parts closed for various reasons. We stayed at Atlantis so going back and forth to the hotel was a perk. Because it was so hot, it would've been nice if free water to drink was available. There are two water fountains, each in front of the two eating places, but there really out of the way. The cost to get in, plus the cost of a bottle of water is really asking a lot in stroke heated weather. Sunscreen is a must! After water and sunscreen is taken care of...the rest is great! Have fun.
A great day out for the whole family or friends!. The Aquaventure Waterpark is a Dubai landmark - and definitely worth a visit for any family with young children or teenagers!

The Best I've Every Been To!. Part of our pacakge as we stayed at the Atlantis. The best rides I've been to at a waterpark. I highly recommend trying all the rides even onece no matter how scared you may be - as I am! Will not regret :)

Best waterpark in UAE. Although busy this is a fantastic waterpark. I would advise to get there as soon as the park opens so you miss the later queues. There is so much to do, with many fantastic waterslides as well as the lazy river and beach also if you fancy it. Food and drinks areas are there too pplus sun lounge area. Really great waterpark!

World Class Waterpark!. Had an amazing time at Aquaventure with my 11 year old brother and father. We thoroughly enjoyed the waterpark, which features lots of thrilling rides for all ages! It was easy to walk around the park, and the even offer a shuttle between rides! We really loved that the river in the middle led to several rides without even getting out of the water. Overall amazing service & lots of fun! Well worth the price.

Fun, Cool and you will never know how the time will pass by..... Its not cheap to get an entrance ticket but its worth. You need to have a full day off in order to enjoy the most out of it...... you will get a ticket once and u will enjoy all the rides there are some extra pays once you enter but that's based on your choice that you wana pay for it or not.

Dubai's best spot!. Situated at Atlantis the Palm, exactly center of the Crescent of this wonderful man-made-island of Palm Jumeirah, a hidden paradise was known as one of the best tourist attraction in Dubai and that is Aquaventure!Good for the kids as there was this section called Splashers where they can definitely have a great time. If you are brave enough, don't ever leave the place without trying the tallest water slides in UAE called Leap-of-Faith. Not so sure with the measurement but one thing is for sure - you will be getting the experience just in 3 seconds! They have got pool and beach were you can both do sun-bathing. Sun loungers are every where. Towel service was also free. They have got food gazebos where you can buy your snacks and value for money was fairly reasonable. And most of all, life guards and staffs are all friendly and warm.If you are planning to get a summer escapade, you better visit this place same as we did! We enjoyed the water slides and we indeed had a wonderful time!

Vacation. Awesome,,,,,, with the kind of weather in Dubai during summer time ,,,,ohhh the perfect place to stay,,,, the aquaventure it's so nice to dip your body in their pool ,,,,amazing it's relaxing,,, we joined the Big Bus tour to reach Atlantis for the Aquaventure,,, thanks to them for suggesting and selling us the aquaventure,,, it's really amazing,,, we love to come in Dubai and do it again,,,,

Such fun! . We visited the water park on a super hot day so being in the water was lovely & refreshing! My son (19) went on every rude and said they were all brilliant (and a couple a little bit scarey!) I was happy on the lazy river & the rapids though did attempt a few of the rides....brilliant fun was had by us both. Tips...Book online as the queues were shorterWe managed with one locker rather than the cost of twoThe showers & changing rooms are very clean & never seemed too busyWe didn't visit the restaurants in the park as there are plenty to choose from in the AtlantisHave fun!
SUMMER ESCAPADE. Been there's so many times during summer. We really have a fun and wonderful time with family and friends

Extreme fun!. Won 2 tickets on the radio. Always wanted to come to Aquaventure!The slides are a lot of fun. There's quite a few rides to do unlike many other waterparks where you get bored easily. You really feel the thrill when passing through the shark tank or going down the Leap of Faith!There's quite a queue to go on the rides but I guess that's something you face in every waterpark. The enjoyment of the rides at the end make it worth the wait! (Went on Leap of Faith 3 times! It's a 5 second slide and I waited 30 minutes every time!)A lot of lifeguards around, smiling and greeting you and ready to help and answer questions. Alcohol is not served there.Food is a little bit overpriced. ex; 100$ for a bucket of 24 piece chicken. Even a bottle of water or soda is expensive and it is strictly forbidden to bring your own food or drinks.In the end, I would really recommend this waterpark, you won't regret it. Suitable for family, friends, couples, you are sure to have a good time.

Best waterpark for very young kids. If you live in Dubai or are just visiting and have kids above 1.2m then Wild Wadi still hold the title for best water park. Kids shorter than that? Then aquaventure is e best bet. The difference is the raft ride around the park. Wild wadi has great slides, is compact but the raft ride isn't as good as the one at aquaventure. Kids of all ages and sizes can go around this ride with an adult.If you aren't already at the hotel, park at the monorail car park at the start of the palm and use that to get to the park. Shorter walk and better views than driving to the hot car park and getting the shuttle bus. Or get a cab if your nerves can take it.Expect a very expensive day. If you plan on using the park more than once, seriously consider staying at the hotel. It may be cheaper in the long run.

Great!!!!. We visited here whilst guests at the Atlantis (entry was included). It is not as big as we thought, but big enough. There are two main waterslide towers with a few slides off each (very good), a children's area (very good), and a 'lazy river' (excellent- but not lazy- there was a 'torrent', access to a really fast ride, and a rapids section), a beach and lovely pools. There were plenty of sun loungers, towels were free to guests but could be hired. The food halls are great and fairly reasonable. Toilets clean and well placed. Definitely take flip flops as the floor is burning hot- you can hold them on all the rides. If you take a 'Go-Pro' camera you need a hand strap- they do not allow the long handle on the rides. All staff excellent and friendly. Worth a trip.

Big waterpark. Aquaventure is nicely done, with good rides and a lovely lazy river. We had a free voucher for shark bites which made the day a bit less expensive but it's not for penny pinchers as everything is chargeable. Take towels!
Great experience!. We participate the Sea Lion adventure first which was amazing! Then we went to the adventure park, excellent slides, heart beating surprises!Great option for all ages.

Atlantis park was awesome!!. The slides were awesome! The whole family loved it!The Aquaconda ride was amazing with my daughter!The queue can be a bit long,so best to get ticket in advance. Use normal taxi, far cheaper than the expensive Lexus cars!We were quoted 80aed for a short journey back to Marina, but we got it with normal taxi for about 30aed!

Fun Filled day. We visited the waterpark during our 3 week stay in Dubai. We haven't been here for around 3 years and it did not disappoint. The summer discovery deal offered general admission, meal deal and admission to lost chambers for 335aed each. Our party was keen to undertake couple of activities - zip line (which we found out in arrival was not operating!), shark safari and stingray feeding. We could not however book these at the general admissions desk but had to book at TIKI hut in the park. Unfortunately staff could not be precise about the opening time (12:45) and thus meant we kept going to check and wasted a bit of time. If you want to do any of the activities be at the hut early, as very limited places. We were fortunate that those who wanted to feed the stingrays all got a place but only one of our party got the shark safari. Both activities were very enjoyable and a unique experience the divers / instructors for both were excellent and provided a short presentation and safety brief prior to the experience.The meal deal is a good option. There is not an extensive menu but includes chicken or hamburgers, chicken pieces and vegetarian option. Chips and choice of drink. It is cooked to ordered so fresh and very hot. The deal itself saved us 270 AED. We chose to locate ourselves towards the back of the park, this meant we right beside the lazy river, barracuda restaurant and 5 slides. There are also changing facilities and lockers rooms there too so you do not need to use the ones at the park entrance. The rides are great (probably better than wild wadi, particularly those travelling with teenagers etc). The guest transfer buggies are great especially if you are not wearing flip flops in temperatures >40 degrees! The park should consider adopting the path sprays which cool down the concern ate and make it bearable to walk. Many rides are off shoots from the lazy river and Rapids so little waking. However the rides at the back of the park (4-5) do require you to walk up a number of flights of stairs albeit it is shaded. Some amazing views from the tip of leap of faith and the capsule drop ride (can’t remember it's name) a must do ride!

Amazing. Aquaventure came as part of the package with staying in our hotel. Even if it hadn't it is worth every penny visiting. The slides are amazing and the rapids. Drinks prices aren't expensive either in comparison to other water parks I have visited.

Aquaventure Waterpark Atlantis The Palm Dubai. I love waterparks, but this one is the best one that I have been to. Many fun activities, but many people as well. I recommend you to go to the lazy river - it's very relaxing.
good adult fun. really good adult rides, lots of sunscreen required in the full hot sun. but had a lot of fun with 5 adults and a child. somthing for everyone

Kids Paradise!!. This was part of the package which we got when we checked in Atlantis Hotel, we had 5 kids who went crazy once they entered this water park and so was the case with 7 of us the adults!!! If you have time and want to spend some in water then this is the place to visit and enjoy!! They did not had many rides but whatever they had was really amazing, specially the leap of faith where u have a slide which must be almost 200 feet fall and once you hit water you are surrounded by sharks and rays which are enclose inside fiber enclosure, everything is good about this park apart from that basic bottle water is pretty expensive you can buy 6 bottles of 200ml each for 100 Dirhams which is pretty steep.

Great Time . We had a great time at this water park,
There was enough to do, we went in the afternoon to early evening! we loved all the rides! The two big water slides give myself and partner a fright but was so much fun!

Something for everyone. There are rides of all types for all ages. There are entertainment spots for kids, adventures for the young at heart and lazy time for those seeking pure relaxation. I cannot get enough of the things to do at Aquaventure Waterpark. This was my third time there. I will definitely be back soon.

Great fun...but pricey. Excellent location on the palm. We have just returned so went off season and it was busy. No problem getting sun beds but the rides had big lines and the lazy river was at times a sea of rubber rings. Wouldn't be for us peak season. Having said that it was modern, clean and inviting, great rides for all ages. We teamed it with the aquarium ticket which was a great escape from the midday sun. It got all the hallmarks of a good disney waterpark. Tip: find the snow cone stall...its not cheap but perfect

Fun in the sun. Amazing place to go to! The park accommodates all ages and whether you are with a family or single you will love this place. I'll definitely go there again! It was the highlight of the trip.

Best water park. Stayed at the Atlantis several times we stay here just for the water park plenty to do you can spend the whole day in there and return the next day and do the same again. It has loads of rides the lazy river is amazing and has lots of offshoot rides that lead you other places. Buy the refillable drink and it is only 8dhs to refill. Don't forget the sun cream and waterproof mobile phone holder so you can take your own pictures

Highlight of our trip. Staying at the Atlantis we had free access to the waterpark and it was by far the highlight of our trip. Our kids (9 and 11) loved it and could have spent the whole trip just here. Due to the time of year we visited (July 2016) we were limited to go after 4pm (as it was just too hot to go before) until 7pm. If we could have handled the midday heat I am sure we could have spent the whole day but instead split our trips to the waterpark over a few days.If you come to Dubai you must go here!

Uninspiring . I'm certainly not a water park regular but I have been to almost all of the ones in the UAE. Aquaventure has been on our bucket list for a long time so we were quite excited about going. Unfortunately it did not live up to expectations.We ended up going around the Rapids a lot during the day, simply because everything else was a bit difficult to find. Obviously you could see where the big rides were but it was too hot to walk around with not enough shade.The slides weren't really as good as I have experienced elsewhere...a bit short and not frightening.I thought the queues to collect tickets were too long - even though we pre-purchased.I was quite surprised by how big the food portions were in the restaurant! I thought we were going to be ripped off the way we generally are everywhere else (AED18 for a soft drink is rather high), but we were pleasantly surprised (actually we couldn't finish the food...).I think the whole "sliding through the shark tank" marketing pitch is somewhat over played. You can barely see anything out of the tube when you actually slide through.Not as much fun as Wild Wadi, not as kid friendly as Dreamland, not as big as Iceland, not as full on as Yas.And not cheap to get in at all.

Go with a GoPro. Book the tickets online, also the park will allow you free entry if you visit on your birthday (check website for offers). It was crowded though, even after buying the tickets online there was a queue. Rent a locker also, we rented a small locker which was enough for our stuff, however if you have bigger bags take the bigger locker. Please bring your own towels, otherwise you would have to rent them too and its expensive. Do not bring food or drinks with you, the security will throw them in the garbage. There are free shuttles to and fro from the park, do check with concierge for more info. We got the free shuttle which dropped us till 'Mall of Emirates' from where we took the metro to the hotel (cheaper option).Complete all the rides and make sure you take a GoPro or similar camera with you, it would be fun.The food inside is insanely expensive!

Unforgettable. I would advise you arrive early and pre-book your tickets. At the kiosk you get offered a locker and towels.... we got 2 towels and 1 locker. I advise you only get 1 towel and 1 locker because we hardly used the towel because it was so hot during our vist. Take your flip-flops everywhere with you drung the summer months as the floor is so so hot. The park opens around 10am and we got in at 10.30. The park was failry quite for the 1st hour and we found getting onto most rides easy and fast.As the day went on the rides become busier. But the park didn't feel over crowded. We spent around 4-5 hours here going on rides 2 or 3 times during this time. Some of the rides are quite scary too - not for the faint hearted down at the dolphin bay area. Loved it!!

Great water park . Really great day out, we went at 11am and definitely go early because by 2pm the queues were getting longer but the max we waited was 30mins (could be because it was a Monday?). Prices are steep but there was good packages, we got a meal and the aquarium included and that was worth the few extra pounds and much more economic. Great rides for teenagers and thrill seekers but also enough for those less keen or those wanting a relaxing ride in between. Bring flip flops because the floor is absolutely boiling and you can take them on all the rides easily! Overall, a great water park if you can get over the initial price.

Absolute favourite in the winter months!!. Absolutely love this water park and have been going there with my family every year since it first opened doors. Great for a day out with the entire family and love the meal at Kaleidoscope afterwards.
Great Day . We got our waterpark tickets included in the price of the Dolphin encounter which is great. We had a fun day at the waterpark and I would recommend it. You can bring water in with you.

Pretty nice place to spend a day. We went to this park, it's basically next to the Atlantis hotel on the Palm. You park for free and you take a shuttle that takes you to the entrance. In my opinion is over priced, about 80 euro per person, and they wanted 25 euro for each printed picture they took of us on the slides, seriously? It's not a huge park and they have a few rivers around the main tower. From the main tower they have probably around 6 slides, so not many. But I would say it's pretty fun place to spend a day if you don't have too many expectations from a park with many slides. If anything I would do the diving with sharks, but it's probably very overpriced like everything else there.

Huge Aquaventure Waterpark in Dubai. So amazing Waterpark, lots of activity to do. Access also to the public beach, we really enjoy swimming with my friends. Recommended to the others not only for tourist...worthed and value for money..

Amazing!. We stayed at Atlantis, the palm for 3 nights and we couldn't have enough of this waterpark. As it was a part of our package, we visited it everyday of our stay and had a gala time. Rides are unique and very safe. Plenty of snack bars and a food court helped us keep our glucose levels high. 'The leap of faith' will surely get your adrenaline rushing. It is also a great place for photography as this park offers some amazing backgrounds.

FUN and thrilling! . We had a fantastic time coming here with our 6 year old son. There was a great variety of slides for families which meant we could all go together. We especially enjoy the lazy river with Rapids and the surrounding slides that require tubes! Lots of fun for all ages!

Super!!!. What a wonderful place on the Palm! If you are staying at Atlantis the a palm hotel, you can enter for free. One of the best water parks in the whole world! Many different zones, some exciting attractions, long beach line.
Blast . It was one of the best waterparks I have been to anywhere in the World. It had plenty of life savers and staff to ensure everyone was safe and well.
Best Ever!!!. We stayed at AtlantisPalm and as part of the imperial club package, unlimited access to the park is one of the perks. WOW... Such an amazing place. A most do for kids big and small❤️
Huge waterpark. Very enjoyable with the family. Nice installations, very long and fun lazy river. Lawn chair are very comfortable and in good condition.

Great rides for all. Great waterpark and we have been to many. The rides cater for all ages and the extra dimension of rides going through the large aquarium with sharks and rays make it all the more exciting.
Breaking the heat. When the temperature are soaring in the Arabian desert what bette way to break away from the heat then going to a water park and Aquanventure is the place to be during summers
We had a great day!. The rides are all very fun and well looked after with attentive and professional staff. The fast food is not 5*, but what do you expect - it is a water park.
nice day. ticket are very expensive, water or food very expensive, nice to spend the day, but was expecting more attractions...,

Fun day out. Loved the water park. From the gentle cruising along to the fast and furious rides it was a hit with us. My only observation, and if you're reading this review apparently others have written this, you must wear water shoes. If you take your thongs (jandles/flip flops) you will need to leave them at the waters edge, once you have glided along in the inner tube you come out somewhere quite different and need to walk across the burning lava of pavement to find them again! Oh my goodness blisters, burning ...running and ahhhh water.Lockers are available to store expensive items, towels can also be provided although I'm not sure if you pay for this as we just grabbed a couple from the hotel.

Summer cooldown. The rides at the water park are great, nicely laid out and fun to go on, if you like a bit of trills and excitement then the near vertical drop waterslide is a must. Its a great place for family as the pools are not to deep for kids and there are many life guards around, grate place to visit.

Had A Great Time. I was here with my family because of the complimentary access thanks to the stay at the Atlantis The Palm.It was a great day for a visit to a water park as the climate was not too hot nor too cold.I had a great time here, and i made sure i tried out everything they had to offer.Being Lazy on the lazy river, to the heart pumping Poseidon's RevengeI truly enjoyed every part of this park, and then headed towards the beach which was also funDefinitely would visit againUntil Next TimeCheers

Hot and bumpy. Travelled here by taxi as a family of 4 a few days ago. I hurt my coccyx on one of the rides early in the day (still bruised and terribly sore) which put me off going on any more. My wife isn't one for such parks but the kids enjoyed themselves. Some foreign person also tried to take my sons size 11 flip flops right under my nose with his size 5 feet. I obviously challenged him and he took them off quickly and scampered off mumbling under his breath. Did we get value for money? No, probably not but I'm glad we went because we can say we've been now. Would we go back? No, I don't think so.

Family fun for everyone. Nice day at the park Even though it was 45 degrees. I was 5 months pregnant I didn't expect to go on many rides. Most of the rides you go on single and double doughnut floaties and I got to ride many more things then expected. The rides were friendly and "mild" but for those enjoying more action there are slides for you as well. Everything inside the park food/beverages is expensive so be prepared. One downside being that Dubai is very hot were the showers near the pools containing hot water and only the only way to cool down was inside restaurants. (Pools are generally warm due to the heat) During our visit I saw to grown woman needing medical care because of the heat so aerea's with outside fans maybe would help or more golfcarts transporting guest around. Walking to different rides were a challenge in this heat!

Amazing. We had a great full day at the waterpark. There is so much to do and plenty of food available. Loved that we could keep going back to the lockers when needed and didn't have to worry about leaving our stuff. Queues for the rides but that is to be expected and we still managed at least one go on everything.

Family Friendly. Very nice and well maintained
The Security and life guards everywhere
The rides are fine (not extreme) and suitable for families
Best water park for Old and Young. Well managed water park, all the rides were supervised and we felt safe all the time, considering I am a non swimmer.

Fun Day Out for Family. Good fun, rides are similar for a waterpark. We went on a weekday doing Ramadan. Queues were short but park was busy. Not as good as Yas water world in Abu Dhabi but better than the Wild Wadi and definitely worth a visit. Towel hire is expensive so advisable to take your own. Website says you cannot take food or drink but when we got there, they had signs to say you are allowed to take 1 bottle of water per person. Take flipflops as it does get very hot for bare feet when getting around the park to go on rides. Food & drink are expensive but not unreasonable. Well supervised with many lifeguards.

Family fun vacation. Great fun but it definitely needs some new rides it's nicely laid out but seems to have a lot of over priced concessions. Service and safety is top notch and lots of park assistants around to help. The zipline was fun and inexpensive. There needs to be proper smoking areas since it's quite awful that people are smoking right outside the locker area and you end up breathing all that nasty smoke each time you go to the locker entrance. They should ban smoking altogether we are in 2016 not the 70s

MUST VISIT. If you visit Dubai and don't visit Atlantis then you wasted an entire trip that's how good it is. Even though the day we visited we only got to go on half the rides. Easily in the top three things to do in Dubai.

Great water park. Great park, plenty of slides and places to base yourself. I would say that Siam Park in Tenerife is betterSea water temperature is hotter than a bath, probably as its shallow water between the fronds of the Palm

Good Fun. The Aquaventure Water Park is a fun place to be. The rides it offers are thrilling and exciting. From activities for children to the more tough people, it has everything. The lagoon ride with torrent and waves to the Leap of Faith and the Chute at Poseidon's Revenge. However, pre-book on the internet for some discount and be early as then it gets too crowded. The waiting period for each ride is almost 30 mins which spoils the fun. The management needs to distribute the crowd somehow, especially a time bound allotment for the popular rides. Do remember to carry ur footwear at all times as when you move from one ride to the other, the hot ground blisters your feet. Happy Fun Time

BRING THE RIGHT TYPE OF COSTUME!!!. Well well well.... I had already booked our tickets online. After taking the metro, tram and then the monorail, we finally reached, checked in, got into our swimming costumes, purchased locker and went inside the park. Guess what? We were rejected from doing any of the rides bcz we werent wearing the right type of costume. Me and my wife were both in random cotton tshirts and shorts so we were rejected as the park only accepted proper swimming costumes or any other clothe made of SILK and POLYESTER only. This was fine, it should be rather like this for the safety. But the best part is here, the guy told us there is a shop inside the park where you can go and purchase the right type of costume. I went there and guess what, a swimming costume for female (the one that covers the entire body) costed TWICE more than the park entrance ticket. It costed AED 520, I was shocked and liked, are you serious???? I had my slippers broken so I had to buy a basic flip flop which costed me AED 80 (again, are you serious). Anyway, I did not have enough cash or credit cards to pay that crazy hefty amount (and who would) so I went to the main entrance and asked for refund whcih was refused but they allowed me entry on the next day with the right costume. I went to one of the malls and bought the same type of swimming costime for under AED 100.This is seriously not acceptable, LOOTING money from your customers for items like costumes. The next day, we enjoyed a lot, the park is great with services and all.
The highlight of my Dubai Trip!. ugh a beautiful place for day time activities. The hotel is on this man made island in Dubai. The water park is a MUST :)

Highlight to our stay in Dubai. Dubai was the 2nd leg of a 2 center vacation with our family, 2 adults and 2 children. As a surprise for the children we booked the Dolphin experience for our eldest and the Dolphin Photo experience for our youngest, expensive, but well worth the money, especially when it includes complementary access to the park and towels. The park was fantastic, We arrived at 10 am and stayed until the end, leaving at 7 pm. What a day, excellent memories for all of us, from several trips on the lazy rivers/rapids/etc. to the slides and topped off with the Dolphins, exception day had by all. It has to be a must for a family day. Comment - takes more than one day to see everything, people have recommended staying in the Atlantis for one night and doing the park over 2 days. We will consider this next time.

The more the merrier. You have to go in groups to really enjoy the waterpark. It is better for the staff to give maps upon entrance because you really can get lost in there as it is vast. After seeing the miniature model of Atlantis we discovered we only covered 1/4 part of the Aquaventure park. The staff were very approachable,friendly and accommodating. Any lingering stare will attract their attention to ask you if you need anything. Gopros are allowed but not the sticks. You have to leave it at the locker or with the staff.the place itself is very beautiful so you will enjoy if you are there for pictures. Some rides have to be more exciting though.

Energetic and exciting!. This was a fabulous day out!!! The slides and rides were all lovely! My mother and I spent most of our time on the Lazy river/rapids.However, we would advise that you eat only at the end, as the meals can be quite greasy and may make you feel a little sick on the rides!

Love this place. . Just stayed in Atlantis for the second year running. The water park is an amazing addition to this spectacular hotel. There is something for everyone, and I couldn't imagine someone not having a great day in this place. Very well staffed, extremely clean, and great experiences.

WICKEDDDD !!!!. This water park is crazy, if you seek thrill this is the place to be, rides with dark tunnels, shark aquarium and steep slides etc. Dare to take the chance... Lifeguards are located at every corner to help and guide you, beverages also are available and towels
Good For Kids. This is at Hotel Atlantis and very nice water park for kids. Got one of the bigest Aquarium of the world surrounding the hotel.

Huge fun at Atlantis waterpark!. If you love water-parks, you'll love this. We stayed at the hotel so had access as part of the package. You could easily spend a day here, the slides and layout are great, you can just bob around on a rubber ring around the park if you like (like me). Lockers are provided at a small charge, towels are provided at points around the park so you don't need to bring one. And everyone just walks about in their swim-wear so don't be shy no-one bothers, you'll need flip flops though the ground is hot! Brilliant fun and great way to stay cool in the heat.
Kids had fun. It was so huge and a lot of rides and fun things to do. Even though there were queues but we moved quickly. Both adults and kids have had a great time!

Super fun day out!. We visited this water park for the day - and it was excellent! Lots of different slides, both for sliding down alone or with a doughnut. Loved the rapids/lazy river that ran through the whole water park - very fun and relaxing. Would recommend getting there for when it opens (10am), as gets a lot busier in the afternoon. Overall, very clean and lots of of staff on helping hand. Tonnes of lifeguards too - which is reassuring! Would highly recommend!

Fun all around!. Spent multiple days at the water park during our two week stay and it was fun all around for the entire family. We could see the water park from our room and it made us more excited every day we went!

Keith732. Not many rides.Very long queues. Good for average fun seekers overall it's a place to spend couple of hours.Rides suits for kids 10 and over.Take plenty of water with you and pair of slippers.

Enjoyable and funny. We enjoyed too much with our kids visiting the water park it is organized very well and all activities are supervised
All you need is available there just visit the place and all shops are available and restaurants
No need to drive take Dubai metro
Go early and enjoy your time
Regards

Wahoo what a day. This park offers a good mixture of thrills, for both children and adults.
Leap of faith was great. And Posieden's Revenge was really really intense!!
Great day out!

Great day, pretty expensive though.... Ground was incredibly hot, we ended up taking our thongs on the ride and holding them in our hands on each ride as it was too hot for the kids to get around without shoes. Get the deal with the meal, so you don't have to the ink about how expensive the food is there!! Had water fountains to refill water containers. Rides were great fun. Our kids 9 & 10 loved them. Great day out.
A must. Lots of rides, more adrenaline in some than in others. The new rides Aquaconda and Zoomerango are great, but unconfortable when you have to ride together with five other people.

Scary slides and long lazy river. Wish there was more for younger children to do - height restriction is at 120CM, so that's about 7 or 8. Great fun, remember to take your flipflops on the lazy river as the ground temp will kill your feet.

Awesome waterpark with exciting water rides. Been there last week. Time does fly as the previous trip was few years ago. Living in Dubai & so much to do, we dont appreciate some of the awesome places to see here. Aquaventure being one.Few tips - 1. Dubai is a Sunny, city and in summer you get best deals to hotels & parks. So plan ahead and enjoy these outings.2. Be there early in the day, as you have so much to and if you wish to enjoy most rides, one full day is not enough3. Bundle your Aquaventure with Dolphin Encounters, Shark tank dive etc. Of course these blow your wallet, but these are once in a lifetime encounters.4. Take suncream, a small towel (if you use Dolphin Encounters, you get free Towel - which you can keep with you for entire day. Also at the Dolphin Encounter, you get free water - so pick up as many bottles as can, you will need plenty of water5. Avoid taking any Jewellery or precious stuff, as lockers are available, but depending on where you are - got to walk towards them. You have lockers at Entrance and at Barracuda restaurant6. Plenty of food available at restaurants in Barracudas. They are marginally expensive - but as you are not allowed outside food, not much of choice. You have options from Pizza, Arabic, Indian, Burgers etc and Ice Cream too7. Leap of Faith is a must do, though the queue can be long. Took 75 minutes for me. Its more frightening to see people plunging down, but the actual experience is not8. Aquacondo and Zoomerango are awesome experience for families. But if you have kids make sure they are above 1.2 Metres which is minimum height for most rides9. The kids lagoon is exceptional and MUST DO if you have kids. Here there are no height or age limitations10. Get Flip Flops as floor is hot and cannot walk barefoot. For kids Aquashoes - so they can swim and walk, when required11. Slitherine is awesome waterslides. I did not try it, as there was a long queue. You need to take your own water tube - plenty of them available. Saw people were very excited and some were repeating it12. Poseidon’s Revenge - Did not have the courage to try and heard is the most exciting. Probably next time13. I noticed many guests wearing a plastic pouch on their neck and dangling their mobile phones inside. Think its sold in Aquanventure - handly for those who cannot live without clicking pics from their mobiles & not bothered with them getting wet

Consistently Excellent. I have been here thrice in the past 2 years and the water park is as exciting as ever. I recommend the lazy river if you just want to relax and then the slides if it gets too boring!! Also a great kids play area with all sorts of water fun!!F&B can be a bit expensive within the park, so I recommend you carry your own snacks if you wish.

Thrilling rides, lots of things to do. There are rides that are very easy going and then there are rides that are definitely not for the faint of heart. Poseidon's revenge is probably the scariest thing there. You stand in a capsule, waiting for the floor beneath you to fall out, at which point you feel the full force of gravity and accelerate incredibly fast in a near vertical drop. Watching others disappear and start screaming while waiting your turn doesn't help either.For the less adventurous there are also chilled out rides like river rapids and you can book a dolphin adventure. If doing the dolphin adventure then it's best to have someone in your group who is not participating so they can take photos for you. There is an official photographer but the prices for the photos are sky high.

Fun day out . Stayed at the Atlantis and they really look after guests! Separate desk to enter for guests and free towel hire and entry. Get there when it opens ( why wouldn't you!! ) as it was quiet when we went in and packed when we left. It took us 4 hours to do everything including lunch ( used our half board at shark bites- huge portion and included a drink - brilliant ) as it was empty in the morning. People were arriving when we left ( at 2) and there were massive queues! We couldnt work out why people arrived so late and when it was so hot!Tips - lots of sunscreen, take your own water ( can take a litre each sealed ) and wear water shoes!!!! Could not believe the amount of idiots not wearing anything or parents in shoes and not their kids!! Kids screaming in pain and we saw a full family stranded because the floor was so hot!! Leap of faith scary but fab. Great day and lots of lifeguards

Fun!. Very entertaining water park! Get some slippers with you as the you will need to walk around the park and the ground gets extremely not. Be prepared to buy a small bottle for water for 10+ dhs (10 times the retail price) if you need to. Best not to go on weekends as it gets really busy. You can also buy the tickets online 2 days before the visit at a discount. If you have a residency, with your EID, you can get a discount for each EID presented.Enjoy!

Great park . This water park is a great day out for families, friends and couples of all ages. The overall park is clean and well maintained, staff are plentiful and friendly & the rides are good for kiddies and thrill seekers. A must for anybody visiting or looking for a fun day away from the stress of life... Value for money for residents as well.
We loved it. We had this as part of our stay at The Palm.We really enjoyed it although as previously stated its not well signposted.

Great day out in Ramadan!. For future reference, going to Aquaventure within the month of Ramadan is the best time as there aren't any queues or they are very short.Far fewer visitors frequent this attraction plus there are amazing discounts for GCC residents and those staying at the hotel. We normally stay as a family in a regular room, go early on the first day and leave our luggage with the concierge inside the hotel. This maximises your time at the park! Take your time to look at a map of the park as you go in to decide where to put your towels etc. There are lots of umbrellas and trees to provide shade and there are sun loungers pretty much everywhere. Obviously if you have very young children, you are going to need to grab a lounger near the enormous kids area. Watch out for the tipping bucket of water, it's quite a force and may frighten young kids. Not surprisingly, the summer months make the paving round the water slides etc very hot. Either take your flip flops with you on every ride and tie them onto your rubber donut as you go round or invest in rubber sole water socks. If you need to take a bag into the park, make sure it's a small rucksack and it will fit into the small size lockers. There is a big size, but it isn't worth the extra cost. Beware the fact that you can either pay to get into your locker once or as many times as you wish - different cost! There is also a deal that includes a locker with towels, or you can be cheap and bring your own like we did!Note that there is a rule saying no food allowed into the park and the security will check each bag as you enter. However, it does say that you are allowed to bring a 1litre bottle of water per person. The food options once inside are ok, nothing to write home about though. There are lots of kiosks selling a variety of drinks, ice creams and typical fast food such as burgers and pizza.It really is a great day out for all, big and small!

Great day !. I went there on Eid day and booked my ticket online. The resident fare was more expensive than usual for that special day but still cheaper than regular price. The parking and shuttle service worked well. We ended up waiting in the ticket line as long the people who didn't book online, that was a bit frustrating. I took a locker and a towel, the locker with the bracelet is very convenient. The park was not busy at all and there was no long lines for the rides. I had so much fun floating around in the lazy river for half of the day! We had lunch at barracuda and people there were super friendly.Overall an awesome day and I will go back again!

Fun Filled. Had a great time going o n the slides. One of the slides was disappointing as it kept getting stuck - but that was due to people not sitting properly in the rubber dingy's.We went early to try and get a head start on the rides as time went on there was abit more of a queue. Had a great time as expected with a water park.Had a great time and would definitely recommend it if you have a day spare - you can make it as busy as relaxing as you like.

If you are in Dubai & love water parks - Then dont miss the place. Whatever you see here is beautiful, curvy, twist & turns ;-) and you will enjoy for sure...!! Little expensive but worth once in a while...!! All the rides are thrilling and lot of fun...!! Lockers are also very costly...!! dont take too much of things - just have one or two towels and a credit card with you...!! thats it...!! Plunge into the water, feel the fun in the rides and let your eyes enjoy all the natural scenaries that are around you ;-) ;-) ;-)

Excellent as always. We go here almost daily during our 2 week stay at the Atlantis. Always clean, staff helpful and a great way to cool down during the July heat. Seemed to get busier at about 12:00 which I didn't really notice much in the past but possibly due to the end of Ramadan. Queues slightly bigger than previous years for some rides but most have no queue at all. Only slight improvement would be to open the full lazy river more often.
Wow park. Very well run, clean park.Lots of Lifeguards throughout the park.Rides and activities to suit everyone.Easily accessible from Atlantis, via frequent shuttles.

Amazing location. Expensive but worth it. It was an awesome experience. Me and my father went there. We did an aquarium ride too. I seriously loved it. I advise you that you should go there once in life

Great fun. What a water park... visited with friends we were a group of 20.. and boy was it fun.... the food ... the rides.... and the setting was spectacular....And the rides.. where do u guys come up with insanely fun rides like this.. over all if in dubai its a must visit but be sure to carry sun block

Good fun,tough to find your way around. Some fun rides,the lazy river is great, but as they don't provide maps it is quite hard finding the start of each one. Wear water shoes, the floor is soooo hot!!

Wonderful and fun for the family . We had a chance to take advantage of the Aquaventure, since we were staying at the Atlantis, truly enjoyed it. Best kiddy waterpark by far, especially when you have a four year old.

Smaller than expected. My girlfriend and I visited the Atlantis waterpark in July 16. Overall we were very underwhelmed by the size of the park. Having visited many waterparks in the USA and Siam Park Tenerife, this waterpark simply does not compare. Yes it was all the rides you would expect, the vertical drop 'leap of faith' and the lazy river but every ride felt short and not really of the high standard you expect from Dubai. Positives were the food, very affordable, tasty and you get plenty of it. Lockers and towels are available to hire and there is plenty of room to chill and soak up the sun. Because of the heat in July the park was quiet so we didn't really have to queue but if you did there is plenty of shade to avoid the sun.
Good day out ! . Great staff , very helpful. I couldn't really say if it's value for money as we had free entry with our hotel.Kids had a very nice time here and it made the July heat bearable.

Great Fun for all ages. This is a fabulous Water Park, the Lazy River is fun & the kids Water Park was brilliant. Lifeguards everywhere you looked. Not bad prices for refreshments. Free Towels. A fabulous day out.
A day full of fun and exciting adventure rides. Amazing rides for all ages, in order to enjoy and experience all their exciting rides you have to be there before opening time.

Great day out. I was very impressed with the water park, to which we had free entry as we were staying at the hotel. Because it was free and we were rushed for time, we only spent around four hours here, but you could very easily spend at least a day, especially with kids. The waterslides were of varying excitement levels, from small kids to super brave adults. Whilst there was no way in the world you would get me on some of them, that wasn't because I didn't think they were safe...the park is well designed and well maintained, and I don't imagine there's many injuries.The extra facilities are also superb, with more than adequate sitting/lying areas, and high quality beach towels readily available.We didn't eat at the park, but I snuck a look at some prices and they are astronomical. Not sure if you can sneak your own food in, but if you can it would definitely be advised.

expensive but fun. we loved our morning here, although in the 40 degree heat the floor was baking. the sea is so hot at the moment to cool you down. it is pretty expensive, but slightly cheaper to buy online and they also offer military discount, if you are in the military
Awesome. Had the best time here, cannot recommend it enough! Went with my partner and friends and laughed every minute.The rides were amazing, I would love to go back!
Dolphin Experience and Water Slide Wonderland. The dolphin experience was sensational. It isnt that often that you get to swim and play with dolphins. The water slides were awesome
so much fun - even for an adult!. So much to do and the rides are incredible! You will not regret the visit! Leap of faith was terrifying but so glad I went for it!

Just one thing... We spent most of our holiday in the water park with our daughter and she loved the splashes zone! We thought the water park was fantastic, with life guards everywhere which gave reassurance.But, when we were on the water rapids and the lazy river with our daughter, who was in the child seat ring with her dad. We noticed there was alot of loose floating rings, which became a problem. On the lazy river they started to back up which restored in other trying to throw them out the way, which then came over our heads. On the water rapids a empty double ring crashed into my partners ring, which also had my daughter in, causing them to tip over into the fast rapid water. This was a horrendous experience. As I watched this happen I jumped out of my ring and luckily enough my partner had hold of our daughter but they where both shaken up, my daughter was hysterical and all in all a terrifying experience for us all. My partner had fell Into to the floor with such force his elbow ended up in a huge bruise. Thank God our daughter is good at controlling her breath under water, had a swim float on and is able to swim. We noticed very small children in the child seats with their parents, who didn't have any floats/life jackets on. We couldn't help but imagine what would have happend if it was a smaller child who couldn't swim.We really think that the water park should look at providing stations where u can obtain and return the rings because in our opinion having empty floats in the water is dangerous. Other than that everything about the water park was great.Just expressing our concern from our experience .

"Stupendous Acquaventure". Simply amazing experience going into water park. Great rides for children's as well as adults. Maintained very well. The only thing is for every slide you've to use stairs, which is very tiring.

Loved this waterpark! . Great waterpark! We pre booked our tickets online so we avoided the queues when we arrived. I would recommend you arrive early, we arrived at 10am when the park opened and it allowed us to use the slides/pools freely before the crowds arrived. Bring flip flops for your feet as the ground is hot. Bring a bottle of water as its expensive to buy in the park. Park is very clean and staff are helpful. Leap of faith was brilliant! Really enjoyed this waterpark!
very exciting. Good for family and couples.very exciting silder and clean water.very big places and can enjoy water parks

Water park. Great way to enjoy the heat. Atlantis water theme park. Just sit on a tube and enjoy the many rides around the water ways of the theme park. The whole family will enjoy,including one ride which travels through a fish aquarium.
Fun filled, high adrenaline filled days. Stayed at the Atlantis so spent most of our time here, something for everyone, good clean wholesome fun!

So much fun. We stayed at Atlantis so had unlimited access to the waterpark. My little boy loved the children's play area along with a lot of the bigger slides too. We both had lots of fun on the Rapids and because he is younger we made sure to have a double ring with a child's seat in so that he could not fall through the bottom. Shark attack is my favourite ride and travelling through the Sharks and Ray's never gets dull. The park does get busy and finding a lounger at peak times is hard but we found we didn't really need a sun lounger as we were on the slides all day. Towels are available to hire (free if you are a hotel guest) as well as lockers which you can pay to use. We took water shoes with us as the ground gets incredibly hot and so wearing water shoes means you don't burn your feet between rides. It's such a fun day out and during our weeks stay we visited the water park 4 out of 7 days and had just as much fun each day.
Great but not for the youngsters. Great water park but are 28 month old couldn't go on much could do with a bit more for the youngsters

A great adventure. One of the best water parks ever attended, space for children, for adults and also slides for the braver!Offer good quality towels and has sun loungers to rest, unique sensations of adrenaline and freedom. Waterslides that pass through aquariums with sharks, wave pools to enjoy, simply amazing.

Fantastic for kids and adults of all ages. Fun for everyone but be attentive: after noon it's full of people and you almost can move on the water. Lots of chairs and shadows but the floating seats are taken fastly.

A fun day out in Dubai!. We arrived at the waterpark around 10am after purchasing our tickets online a few weeks prior. You get a wristband from the check-in area and can purchase a locker and towels if required (advisable to bring your own towels). You then choose your own sun-loungers from anywhere in the park and then you're free to explore. The "lazy river" is very relaxing but for more excitement, grab a single or double inflatable dinghy and head down the Torrents or the Rapids. They're fun! There are two main areas where the water slides are located meaning there is not a great amount of walking to do between the slides in each area. We went during Ramadan so the park wasn't very busy which was great news for queuing! We didn't queue for any longer than around 5 minutes! The floor is scorching hot so please remember to take some flip-flops with you. They are much easier than sandals and you can hold them too as you go down the slides. It's Dubai... so suncream needs to be constantly applied and you need to keep hydrated! Have a wonderful time!

Loved it!!. What is not to love. I am grandmother material and I loved all the water themes. Although some things are scary I still had a go. I am adventurous and it was lots of fun. A children's section is amazing I only wish I could have borrowed a child to have a go through the children's section it looks like so much fun. When tired of this the pool and beach is available.

Got lost on the lazy river. An amazing water park,rides for all ages.I got lost on the Lazy river, spent over an hour,taking different turns,what a great relaxing day.flumes for all agesI recommend this

Aqua Adventure!!!. There are two famous water parks in Dubai...One is Yas Water park and other The Aquaventure...The slides and other rides are pretty good...Leap of faith the most scary slide here....Also has a beach...Dont forget to carry your swim wear or else you will either wont be allowed to enjoy the rides or would have to shell a bomb to buy new here...

Great day out. Great day out. loads of slides and the lazy river is amazing as this connects to some of the slides. be careful floors gers really hot when walking round so take flip flops everywhere with you

Aquaventure is one of the biggest water park with most thrilling water slides. Aquaventure is one of the biggest water park with most thrilling water slides in Tower of Poseidon Pyramid, Poseidon’s Revenge sends you plummeting at speeds of 60 kmph, Slide named Leap of Faith, a 27.5-metre a near vertical plunge that carries you through aquarium (clear tube) surrounded by sharks and rays. Crazy river which takes you upward & then a rush down fall, it has a private beach of 700 meters, it really has incredible water rides and adventures for complete family.

Great fun! . My daughter and I spent about four hours each day of our stay at the Atlantis hotel at the waterpark. It gets very hot out of the water and I found going for shorter periods over a couple of days more manageable. We did nearly all the activities and there were rarely queues. We were surprised at some of the minimal attire worn by some of the women especially given the burning sun. We found board shorts and a rashi vest worked well on the water slides.

Family adventure for all levels. We came recently every day for 5 days as guests of Atlantis Hotel. This place is truly amazing. Catering for children and adults alike there is so much to do there the holiday just flew. In July the paving stones were too hot to walk on without sandals so bring them with you (however there are many stalls selling clothing items so no problem if you forget). The Tower of Neptune area was wonderful and 'Leap of Faith' was scary, as was the vertical drop ride at Tower of Poseidon (terrifying actually!), but these two rides were just the tip of the iceberg in terms of quality and quantity of entertainment you will receive here. Non-stop action and excitement, and all for free if you are staying at Atlantis.

Fabulous waterpark. We had complimentary access to this park as we were guests at the Atlantis. It's a great park with lots of different rides to try, as well as a relaxing lazy river with deviations of rapids or torrents for a bit more fun. A great day out. Just beware - the paving gets very hot in the heat of summer and you will need to wear footwear.

Full day action pack for the whole family. You've got to love the heat and the never lasting sunshine to enjoy this park! It was over 40.c but that didn't stop my friend and I having a wonderful day outing with our young kids 7 years of age and under in the water park for 5 hours stretch!!Kids absolutely love the Splash kids area.... they enjoyed getting on the lazy river and the older kids have a blast getting on the big grown up slides with parents.Great fun...every time! Must try!

Amazing. We had free entry to the waterpark as we were staying at the Atlantis so we visited three days out of our six day stay. The park is huge, lots to do. The lazy river is brilliant and its nice to just chill out by the pool and sunbathe while my husband acted like a big child on all of the other slides. Highly recommended day out.

Place to spend a day. This park had more games and a lot of varieties. I recommend to book the tickets online or by the hotel before arrival or you will waste a good 45 minutes in the queue. Food is not that good and without value for the amount you pay but I guess that's the way with all water parks. Even though it is crowded but you get to play the game you want and the maximum I had to wait was 10 Minutes.

Great Day Out!. At first I thought it was a bit expensive for the entry fee but it was totally worth it. A great day out and time just flew by. Food is very expensive however but I guess you have to survive so I'd recommend buying a large pot of fries as it really is a lot to keep you going for the day.

Brilliant Place to Spend the Day. We went here for 2 days and we were not disappointed. Some brilliant rides for all the family and a load of places to eat and drink as well. Excellent rides and brilliant staff throughout. Was boiling hot and this was a pleasant treat especially when going down the lazy river.
A palace for Fun. We had a fabulous time here in the park specially our 5 years old daughter enjoyed the kids water slides and the lazy river
Fun in the Sun. Lots of activities for all ages, lazy river, and several water rides all of which we enjoyed. I was truly impressed with the number of live guards on duty. Clean, safe fun in the sun!
Simply amazing 😍💦. Its THE BEST WATER PARK IN THE WORLD ........... it has alot of amazing water slides and also has water slides for kids , it's suitable for all the ages
Here is where I met Alice :-). Always wanted to swim with dolphins and I did it! I cried afterwards :-) Awesome experience!!! Goes by very quickly though, but sooo worth it!

If you love water... This is the place to be. super water park... but be careful with the swimwear.. because unless you are attired in proper swim wear they will not allow you on certain rides.The Park contains a variety of rides ranging from the very basic to the extreme thrill seeking ones.

Great waterpark for group fun. Arrive early and take the most exciting rides first. Leap of Faith and Poseidon's Revenge are a must. Large waterpark but golf carts available to ferry people around.
The only let down here is the zip-line. Too slow and not impressive but maybe this is geared towards children? All in all, enjoy the park.

WATER RIDES WITH FLAT WAVES. Expensive family experience, around $100/person, not including food, additional rides eg zip line , dolphin bay or professional photos. River rapids with mostly flat waves that go for around 2km long, with exits to rides.So you need strong arms and back to carry on to the end.More water pressure is needed to carry you around the circular river course.Both towers have thrilling and quite exhilarating rides, that will surely get your heart racing.Free leisure pool and beach, with views of Dubai marina and the Atlantis. Zip line is a great additional activity with extra fees. A chance to view Dubai and Atlantis from the top.But shame it was closed for our second time of attendance. I think zip line open on the weekends.Dolphin bay is a fun experience again with additional charge. Is expensive but it's quite memorable for the children. Good professional photo opportunity. In peak season leave before closing time to avoid 2 hour taxi wait! Overall an exciting day activity that keeps you cool in the Dubai weather

PLAN TO VISIT DURING RAMADAN!. Unbeknownst to us, it turned out that experiencing Aquaventure Waterpark is best enjoyed during the holy month of Ramadan! Why? We got there early morning and there was hardly anyone there! No queueing at all! It did get busier as the day progressed but man did we time our visit well! All the bad reviews about it being too busy and not getting to enjoy the park due to the loooong wait time were non-existent for us when we visited in mid-June. I can imagine the enjoyment of the park would be compromised having to wait ages for the awesome slides! The one where you hop in the enclosure (plastic coffin) and then you get dropped 35m was a standout for me....might not be everyones cuppa, though!Bad points?.....The food / drink is a bit of a rip off tbh and if I understand right, you can't bring in your own snacks. Well played...they know you'll be staving after running around all day! The entry cost was also a tad steep, but once you find out just how many lifeguards they have in there (one every 10m it seemed!,) you understand they have to cover all their staff costs!So if you're travelling through Dubai during Ramadan, make sure this is on your list!

Simply Amazing. I have been to Aquaventure more than 4 times, and I have to say it is wonderfully safe and clean. My experience has been mostly at the kids' area. At first, I thought I would not be able to handle my son there by myself while enjoying my time, but I was proven wrong as the life guards have been extremely helpful and the setting itself is very kids' friendly and is constantly checked and cleaned up at different time intervals. Thank you so much!Keep it up!

Dolphin experience comes with free access to water park and the most scary rides going ! . This was our second visit to swim with dolphins and again it was just magical we swam with s2 who is a rescue dolphin. We were able to pet and play and ask lots of questions and his trainers were really knowledgeable and friendly. The experience was about a hour and was just brilliant. You get wetsuit hire and towels included there is hot and cold showers to get changed and unlimited drinks which you are welcome to take into the water park. You are able to get printed and digital photos of your experience. Afterwards we spent the entire day in the water park we visited during Ramadan so it was really quiet loads of beds and no queues !!! We went on the leap of faith 3 times, and slitherine twice which is actually the more scary out of the two!!

Superb day out.. This water park puts all others to shame. When you have as many lifeguards as guests you know someone has really though about your safety and enjoyment. My kids loved every minute of the Rapids. Food was ok but that's not what you should come for. The staff are excellent and extremely helpful and cheerful. We will be back.

Loved it! Fun waterpark and great activity to do in Dubai.... Best thing to do on a hot day in Dubai. Great rides, good variance and lots of staff that are friendly (often making jokes) and attentive. Poisedon's revenge was by far the best waterslide, almost more like a rollercoaster than a slide. So much fun! Was a touch on the expensive side for entry, but worth it. If it helps, you can catch the Metro to Dubai Marina and catch a tram to the Palm monorail to get to the entrance. Cost was approx 30AED for monorail. Suggest, if you have more than 2 people or a family - best to get catch a metro to a close station (Dubai Marina, Internet City etc) and just taxi it from there.

Safety comes first. We have just returned from having 3 days at atlantis. So impressed with the service and facilities. We loved aqua venture. The lifeguards are amazing. There are so many and they watch out for everything. Very friendly and helpful too. Initially we were disappointed our kids were slightly short of the 1.2m height requirement for the bigger rides but I am glad as they were too extreme for younger kids. Good advice! The lazy river with waves and rapids were a big success though. Overall a great family experience.
