All day fun. Excellent day out at the water park. Lots of rides and activities for different ages. That helped a lot since we went as a family. Very well organised too.

Dolphins, diving with sharks, aquapark. This place is perfect for the children and adults. I enjoyed playing with dolphins with my son and after dolphins my son enjoyed with his father diving with sharks... This is great place for whole family and should not be missed to visit ❤️

Best water park ever. So many things to do at this brilliant water park. The lazy river goes on forever with different ways with different levels of slides, Rapids and torrents. The slides are brilliant for teens with leap of faith fantastic and scary at the same time which goes through the shark tank. Loads of drink and eat stations dotted around and free towels if you stay in the hotel. There are lockers available but your belongings are just as safe on your bed as long as they are not jewellery etc. There is a adventure water playground for little ones and plenty of shallow pools. Sun beds and shades are abundant so you won't be without one. A brilliant load of fun when your staying in the hotel. You get priority bands to get in as well.

So Fun!. Great fun! There's water slides for all ages. Great way to spend your day especially in the summer when it's 40 degrees heat. But do make time for this whilst in Dubai. Note: there's a load of lockers available for anyone worrying about their valuables. The snacks and food are also reasonably priced, we paid around 55-60 Dirham for a burger chips and cola. The sun really heats the floor so remember your flip flops!

Water Fun 😃. Excellent water park next to The Atlantis hotel.Super thrill rides to slide down at speed or just sit in your rubber ring and float round. Something for everyone and things i done but never thought i would do.To be honest by the time you are crapping yourself the thrill is all over and done lol

Brilliant!. We were there during a very quiet time which I'm sure helped, but loved LOVED this waterpark, the high point of Dubai & The Atlantis for us!We've been to the Disney waterparks in Florida and also one in Thailand but this is far bigger, better, has more going on, is so well organised and spotlessly clean.
Super Wow. I didn't expect that it will be very funny like that but I never be happy ion my life like this day Greeeeeeat

First time ever experience of a water park. Great place to start!!. So I'd never actually set foot in a water park before. Until I spent the weekend at The Palm Atlantis. I kinda thought it would be fun to try and experience a water park, before my mind thought it too late, at the age of 47 with my 48 year old boyfriend, I donned a newly purchased one-piece swimsuit and braved the heat, water and general public. I did not regret this for one single second! I was pretty rubbish at first, not knowing how to get into a rubber ring to enjoy the slow flowing river ride, which was actually a great introduction into what a water park actually looked like! Once we'd done a full lap of the place we jumped out of the ring, yes - jumped! Then we wandered off to adventures new. When I say adventure I had no idea what I was actually about to experience. Walking to the top of an old looking inca style tower, I unknowingly decided to experience a vertical style drop which I kinda dropped vertically for a little while, then shot me through a tube then fired me into a splash pool where my journey ended and I was then able to open my eyes. I've since found out this was the Leap of Faith from the Tower of Neptune. Still giggling, we climbed back up the Tower of Neptune and wanted to try another ride but unfortunately we didn't have one of the inflatables with us to partake so decided to leave the tower. My boyfriend, sensibly, realised it would be quicker to exit via the leap of faith, once more, instead of walking down all of those stairs. Of course it's quicker! Why didn't I think of that? Because I'm a 47 year old woman that's why! Anyway, yes, I did it again but this time I managed to keep my eyes open for about 3 seconds longer than previous and still didn't take in much of the views as I zoomed passed, laughing so much cos I couldn't believe that I'd done that flipping thing again in the space of 10 minutes!We then decided to walk to another tall structure because, obviously, that will probably be where another crazy ride would be. You know, the higher you go, the longer you'll drop. With a ride that sealed you into a capsule, counted down, then the floor gave way from beneath your feet. Yeah, that one. It's called Poseiden's Adventure and I'm sure that this ride was meant for middle aged ladies who were water park virgins to actually let them know exactly how water parks should be. Well it started and I tried to keep my eyes open but I was laughing so flipping much that by the time I finished, ending up flinging down a long straight chute, I'd missed it. I'm sure I did a loop-the-loop at some point though. Our last ride, cos we were heading to meet friends for Brunch in the hotel, was going to be a bit of an easier experience, because we were in a queue alongside a group of kids, on the Zoomarango. It wasn't easier but it was equally as thrilling and fun as both of the individual rides I'd experienced. The kids were all great but I think us two oldies giggled and screamed a tiny bit more than they did.I'm dying to return. It's a great day out and thrilling experience for all ages. Try it!

All Change. This is our second visit to Aquaventure and although it was a good day out things had changed and not for the better. Last year we had food, drink, lockers and towels included in our ticket price. This year we had to pay for these things separately which obviously we didn't know as we were going from what happened last year. Park busy and one ride closed due to staff training but we all had a good time. I think guests should be aware they need to pay extra for towels and lockers on top of the ticket price or at least let them know to bring their own towels as if a family all need lockers this all adds up.

A must in Dubai for the entire family!. My family spent one night at the Atlantis Palms hotel on a special rate during the month of Ramadan. Part of this great package was as much time as you could spend in the Adventure Water Park! What a BLAST!!! I am not really a water baby by any stretch of the imagination but by the end of day 2, my family had to bodily remove me from the water! I made friends with one of the floatations tubes provided by the park for free, which you use to ride on the various types of adventures. There were Rapids and waves and waterfalls and a hectic tube ride. My brave boys did a very long free fall 'drop'. There are so many helpful and friendly staff and the lifesaving team are superb!!! Note to self: pay for a locker before you go through the turnstiles. I am definitely going back as the snorkeling activity to swim with the sharks is calling my name! Will keep you posted!

Enjoy the child in you!. This is my 2nd time in Atlantis Aquaventure but I've never been disappointed. A great place to distress and have fun! Rides are extremely ejoyable that you almost feel like your back to being a kid. Will definitely recommend specially for families with children.

Classic Waterpark Fun. We visited this park 3 days in a row as part of our short stay in Atlantis during Ramadan 2016. This park has all the classic water-park rides including an excellent lazy river that branches off to several different rides giving a smooth flow from one ride to the next, as well as the lazy river the main rides all stem from two main towers. When we visited there were plenty of sunbeds and no lining up for any rides at all. Towels were free and I recommend taking the little shuttle car directly to the park.
water-park facilities was great. I and my family had a great time and I look forward to visit there in future, My kids have enjoyed their time, Water park for kids was best

Absolutely brilliant . A great waterpark and rides for all. Really enjoyed the lazy river. Take shoes with you on all rides as the ground will burn your feet. We quickly found this out.Plenty of space with loungers and seemed very clean. Food was nice tooWe also got to experience time with the dolphins. This was amazing!! Family and friends can stay on the side and take photos. Got some amazing shots..some better than the photographer. It's nice to see them being well looked after by the staff. We swam with Jasmine..who is the first born at the parkI'd really recommend this..I hope to stay in the hotel next time.

It's brilliant!. We were hotel guests so got in for free every day however we wouldn't have complained at the cost if we'd had to pay. Enough for everyone to be kept occupied and the staff are great. Rides are well maintained and the towels are big so cover your Sun bed with ease. We didn't use a locker but I'm told they're much improved in years ago when I last used one and are fairly reasonable. However if there is more than one if you then keep your items with you on your Sun bed.
Feel you like a child.... Relax and just have fun. You must try all attractions...Just don`t miss your hat, the sun is very, very strong

The best!. I've travelled alot and have been to alot of waterparks but THIS ONE is on another level. a must see attraction in dubai. has alot of cool rides, good food and very nice ppl. free flowing throught out the whole park.

Great Waterpark!!. If you love waterparks, you need to check out this place. It's so much fun. If you live in Dubai and have a valid UAE ID card, you can get in for free a week before/ after your birthday. It's a bit pricey in my opinion, but everything is expensive in Dubai anyway!!

Bit Disappointed. My hubby and i booked a day ticket to visit the water park and lost chambers the chambers was absolutely awesome, but i have to say who ever designed the water park could have thought about an enclosed air conditioned pool area as apart from all the water shoots and lazy pool area there was know pool just to swim in a heat below 111 degrees!!!! . The architect who build the amazing buildings in Dubai are very gifted but maybe next time they are making there plans please bear in mind us pale skin delicate creatures from the other side of the world !.

So mich fun, even for the adults. We can't wait to go back. Very well organised and lots of fun. We went during Ramadan so was really quite and no queues for the rides which was an added bonus. I would definitely Receommened visiting.

So much fun! . We love the water park and go every few months. The rides are really great, especially the group ones where you can all sit in the ring together. There are hardly ever any queues so you can go on rides over & over again. My only criticism is the cost of suncream which was absolutely extortionate- 250 dirhams!!! We found some for 140 in the end but bearing in mind it is necessary for skin protection against cancer there is just no way it should be so dear. An absolute rip off, which they know they can get away with as people won't want to leave the water park to go & buy suncream. There is also always a long queue for taxis at the end of the day & I think the hotel should call taxi firms and get more to come. We will visit again but will make sure we bring our own suncream!
Fantastic. Amazing !!! Do not leave your shoes at loungers or you will be Stuck after the rides - the ground is boiling hot !! Take them on with you
best waterpark I've been for now. so many attractions - all are thrilling and exciting. some might have lines or long to walk to - like any water park i know

A pleasant relief oasis. Well thought out activity day, plenty to do or just lay back and relax
We went in Ramadan when it was quiet, found it slightly expensive compared with other waterparks we've experienced
Great fun! Great Park. I went with my children and we had great fun! Kamikaze is fantastic. The park is well organized and there is the chance to have some good good food as well.

Nice WaterPark. The FreeFall was the best thrilling experience! A Must Try!
Otherwise the facilites are huge and you have many rides all around the Park.

Meeting Flipper!. I can only review review the dolphin swim located in the park. Being older I did not think the rest of the attraction's suited me. However we did walk through the waterpark, it looked exciting and very clean.The 'Royal Swim' was great fun and something I really enjoyed. I found the staff and swim instructor's very helpful, making the experience memorable. I am a large, well padded lady and a good quality, well fitting wet suit was easily found for me. The changing \shower rooms, lockers were excellent. Totally privacy and no rushing. My partner paid a small amount to enter the area we were in and take photos. I would advise non swim family\friends paying this as they will have a great view of the action and can take photos of you with dolphins. The free public viewing is not close to the Royal Swim and photos will not be good. In the water for about 45 minutes, you don't need to be a great swimmer just be confidant in the water.

Amazing!!!!!!!!!!!. We went into the park from our hotel which was included in the package we paid for. I actually did the slides and my younger daughter and my grandson did the shark dive. They had zip lines there and I for the first time tried it out and Loved it so much zipped four more times. Had a blast! My granddaughter and I did the dolphin bay experience which we loved.

So much fun. There is something here for everyone.Firstly it's at the beautiful atlantis resort which makes a visit here worth while anyway. Theres a real mix of rides that will suit everyone from sheer drops to the lazy river you'll find something for everyone to enjoy.
Activity to do while in Dubai. Its nice for a very hot day in Dubai with a ride on the monorail to the palm. Glad that we tried it :)
Super Duper. Aquaventure Waterpark is a must do when you are in Dubai, the best thing I loved about this park is Lazy River....

Epic Waterslides. This is the aqua park to beat. There is something for kids and adults, and it gives me a sense of peace seeing and knowing that the water park is well maintained and sanitized. There is a long queue for the slide where you end up in an aquarium with sharks. The kids' pool and water slides are also quite fun and the presence of life guards is strong so it gives some sort of security. Lockers are also clean.
Very nice and recommend . Its a very nice experience and. You have to try it once at least in your life. For me my self I've been there two times. You need a full day to spend there. Good luck

Aquaventure . It's a water park, it does what water parks do. Yes it's expensive but it's Atlantis. Went during Ramadan and as expected it was quite quiet. No issue taking on water in the blazing sun as mainly tourists. My only piece of advice is if it's hot take flip-flops the concrete gets hotter than the sun. Other than lots of screaming and lots of fun.
Worth a visit. Perfect place for a family weekend if you come to Dubai during summers to beat the heat. Its a proper family retreat

Amazing Adventures in the Water. We are staying at The Atlantis and have complimentary use of the waterpark every day we are here. We have used it most days... The rides are superb and the staff are excellent, so helpful and friendly. A special thank you to each and every lifeguard who works at the waterpark, they do an exceptional job, especially when you consider just how many people they look after every day and they always have a smile and a sunny disposition .... A real must to visit whether you are staying at The Atlantis or just to come for the day.
You can't miss it. We have a great time in the Water park and went to most of the attractions there. Not to be missed especially if you stay in the Atlantis Hotel

Loads of fun. This is a great place to enjoy for all ages.. There are easy going options to enjoy and dare devil fearless rides as well. During the warmer months it can get very very hot so bed sure to drink lots of water. Lockers and towels are provided at extra cost. Photos also available at extra cost Great day out FYI - the Palm monorail is not part of the metro system and will cost you 25 Durham per head return.

Fun day out even in the rain. We got 2 free passes with our holiday with Virgin and we thought as the weather wasn't great (it was raining) we should go. Our hotel reception just issued us with tickets on the day. There is a shuttle bus which can take you to Aquaventure on the Palm however we got a taxi, it didn't cost a lot. There are some great rides here, although being a wimp I let my boyfriend go on most of them. He loved the Tower of Neptune and Poseidon’s Revenge the most. Poseidon’s Revenge is a water slide where you are basically dropped into darkness. Not for me at all, but there is a mixture of slides in The tower of Poseidon and I went on most of them so even if you are a wimp you get to enjoy the day too. I also did the Zip slide but it wasn't worth the money to be honest, the views were the top of peoples head and the beach - it was a little boring. Lazy river was fun but once you have done it there is no need to go on it again. All in all a great day out, broke up the day especially as it was raining.
Water park. A great water park. Very clean and well run. Lots of slides flumes etc. As with all these places food and drinks are expensive. But all in all a great day out.

Excellent water park. Excellent water park conveniently next to Atlantis Hotel. Golf Buggies to take you to the entrances. All felt very safe. Huge towels provided. Great rides, clean park. Just a few bruises!!

Best shark safari ever. I booked the shark safari and it's still today's the best experience of my life, the fish & baby shark swim so close to you and it's a once of lifetime experience, it's great if your a non swimmer as you walk along the bottom and there is no need to swim, the staff are really good with calming your nerves to as I was a little nervous that soon turns to excitement as I watched marine life right before my eyes, it's good value for money at £50 for 30 mins! I'll do it again once my son is 8 as that's the age requirement.

Best water park ever. On holiday with my wife and nineteen year old daughter, staying at The Waldorf Astoria, a little further down the road on the palm.The welcome, information and organisation were exceptional.The park is immaculate and there is lots of shade...it was 44 degrees the day we visited last week.Lots of amazing rides, all feeding into a river which ran around the park.Take flip flops, as the floor is the temperature of molten lava.The food outlets sold the best fast food burgers I've eaten and I'm 54 years old.You can sit on the beach if you like...no shade though.I booked through British Airways from the UK and it cost £150 for the tickets. Good value for a superb day out, loved it.

Sensational . There's no better way to spend a fun day in Dubai. I have visited all the local water parks and this one is by far the best. Make sure you visit the beach too, the sea is hot but is full of fish. If you lay on the edge of the water they swim up to you. Very cool. Highly recommend going, pre book online and if you have a birthday in the group, that person goes free. Nice touch Atlantis.
Free Birthday entry :). I love that you can register your bday and get a voucher for them for 7 days from your bday... We went there with a group of girls and it was such a fun day! :)
Very nice experience. Very good place to for day out with your friends. It is too hot but still worthy to visit here . Service is good , but price is very high

Great on a hot day. Well set out, all rides are free in park , very well supervised, safety is excellent, great for kids of all ages, plenty of loung chairs around pools, loved it , would go again in an instant

Awesome fun but very overpriced. Magnificent place to have a great time in some of the most amazing water rides I have seen. Revenge of poseidon is the best along with too many other rides. The lazy river is the longest I have seen and has got some not so lazy turns to make it exciting. Please pre-book or you will end up paying 50-100 AED more at the venue. The lockers are a decent size to stuff in a lot of things. One couple can manage eith just 1 locker and you are allowed to open the locker many times. Buy a waterproof phone cover to capture great snaps.

Sooo much fun. Aquaventure is great for all ages and has been really well designed the lazy river Is so much fun and scales the perimeter of the park with lots of twists and turns as you go. There are plenty of slides and I like that there are a lot of slides that you can go on in twos in rubber rings and that a few of the slides drop into the lazy river...a great day and would certainly recommend.

Fun, fun, fun! . A must do activity in Dubai. Our whole family had an absolute ball at the waterpark. So handy staying at the Atlantis resort and being able to visit this facility everyday. Nice to be able to break the visits up, to survive the heat, as the heat can be very overwhelming at times. The waterpark is huge! Very handy being able to hire go pros to take photos and videos while at the park.

Holiday . Average, was disappointed that one of the main attractions was not working. Found the drinks and food to be expensive. Overall it was Okay, I would suggest taking flip flops because the floor was extremely hot.
great if you`ve no budget. £200 for 4 for the day, plus food which isn`t cheap.having said that if that sounds good then you`ll have a great day, loads to do and you won`t see the kids!

Best waterpark?. Following a week at the Waldorf we stayed one night at the Atlantis for a day at the water park. We are glad we did it especially my daughters and also we are glad we did it only for a day and not longer. It is a very crowded waterpark mostly by day visitors however it has the space and various options. Still you have to wait 10-20 mins for the best rides. I would recommend the lazy river and its currents as a starter and in between rides as many other reviewers suggest and it gets better after 3-4 pm. So if you are staying at the hotel might make sense to do other things and then visit for a few hours each day. In terms of how they organised the general area and food offering and also safety I was positively surprised. Would recommend for a day or two if you have young children or teens.
Great!. Great park and even better when included with the Atlantis package. Would 100% visit again, even if not staying on the resort.

Amazing!. Best waterpark on this planet!! Lazy river is brilliant as lots of rides are attached to it and you can spilt off from the lazy river if you fancy a ride. Loads of rides for families, couples and thrill seekers. Can't wait to go back.

Not the best bang for your buck. It is marketed as a high end aqua-park. We made pre-paid reservations and we arrived super-excited only to learn that there is nothing exceptional about this place. I went to many waterparks this will get a below Average Rating from me, it is extremely overcrowded (they should do a better job and put a stop on coming in when at capacity). Went in , spent 40 minutes looking for a place to settle, could not find any and we left. For the same amount of money go and check yourself at a 5 star Pool Club downtown Dubai. That's what we did and we had a blast plus VIP service and beyond.
Great place. I had been to this place during March with my wife, It is a perfect place to go . It was a refreshing trip to spend time leave all tension and be a kid
Great way to beat the heat. Fantastic fun and excellent way to beat the heat and breaks up flights to Europe from Australia Good value with large variety of rides and not too long to wait.
great day out. loads to do,we got tickets to the aquariam as well as the water park,5 different rides using inflatable rings,and a few other big rides,great day out
lots of fun and lots to do!. Definitely worth a visit. Different rides, can spend time on their beach and usually not too crowded. Been there a number of times and will go many more

Adrenaline rush. Aquaventure is a fun place for all age groups.For the lazy ones , there's a lazy river which has some rapids for some thrill and for the enthusiasts there are some wild rides which challenge sheer gravity like the Tower of Neptune , Poseidon s revenge or the Leap of faith

Fun!!. This waterpark is a must!! The park is huge much bigger than wild wadi, there is slides that you can't even imagine,they are out of this world. The rubber ring rides are the best going from small dips to huge tummy turning dips. There's a rubber ring ride that you go through the aquarium, sharks, sting rays and fish all swimming around you, you are in a square tunnel so you can slow down to get a look. I bought the waterproof pouch for my iPhone and I highly recommend getting one, the videos and pictures you can get are hilarious
Awesome!. The place to go for a perfect day! Both for children and adult, everyone will have a good time with funny games and other awesome things!
loved it. 100% go its fab,and swim with dolphins if you can and take loads sun cream happy staff n loads of rides
Fun. a fun place to go, thrilling rides. Beautiful fish. Kids will LOVE it. Lovely to go along the Jamureih and enjoyed the star bucks to warm us up after all the water adventures.

Fantastic waterpark. Awesome rides, bit expensive but good to have fun with friends. Overall I loved it!
For thrill seekers and adrenaline rush lovers I recommend this attractions.

Amazing day out! . My husband and I went to this park and really loved it! The place is huge and has a lot of good rides. The lazy river is great you can spend hours there without having to go out of the water. The Poseidon ride is... I'll let you experience yourself! The restaurant is also ok and the prices are not too bad. Bring a towel from your hotel so don't have to pay for one in the park. I would recommend this park. P.s the aquarium it's also worth the money!

Family fun!. We visited Aqua Adventure during the Ramadan so it was less crowded which turned out to be nice. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. I was impressed by the number of lifeguards on the premies which helped me feel safe with my kids. The food was tasty, a bit pricy but good! The only warning is to take flip flops of swim shoes! The concrete will burn your feet!

Fun for everyone!. We were not staying at the Atlantis hotel, so we arrived at the parking lot at 10 am and a bus took us to a bus stop but we didn't know where to go from there. Since it was our first time there and there wasn't anyone leading the group, we followed the crowd from the same bus and they walked to the entrance of the shopping area which leads to the water park. The queues had already begun but the waiting times was reasonable because they had many booths to keep up with the crowd. And all the screens and signs are good to read while you're waiting at the queue because it gives you ideas about the packages and which type of ticket you need to purchase. The bathrooms and locker rooms and changing rooms were clean. Some people needed help with using the electronic lockers and when they asked the lady who works there to help she just pointed at the machine and left without explaining. So another girl helped. It really makes a big difference when people working in a foreign country have a good attitude with a guest. It leaves a very good impression of the place and experience. They needed more ladies to keep the bathrooms and showers cleaner because its a large area and usually very busy. More needs to be explained about the money saved in the bands and how they could be used and some tickets which include meals are on paper receipts instead of saved on the band. We had the issue of going on rides then to eat but they asked for the slips and no one would walk around with paper slips at a waterpark while on rides etc. although our bands had mentioned meals included. And which type of package we had.Other than that, everything was nice. It got very crowded fast but we left early enough to avoid the afternoon crowd as more people were arriving. They had small shops all around and they had spray tattoo booths at a few places. And a go pro renting booth. Good experience would go again and always try to be there when they first open and leave before it gets too crowded. But for those who don't mind, going anytime is good. Weekdays and weekends are always packed because it is Dubai and people visit it all year round. They have managed to get tourists from all over the world. And they are trying their best to provide everything to keep everyone entertained.

Fantastic waterpark. The UAE is no stranger to waterparks! Aquaventure is great fun and has some awesome rides, all very similar to Wild Wadi and Yas Waterworld. However it can be slightly confusing when navigating the park; perhaps more signs would be helpful!! And more indication of the thrill level of the ride! But overall I loved it!

Good rides but quite small for the price paid . Generally we can't fault the park it was good but for the price you pay circa £ 55 it feels slightly overpriced.We also paid to goto dolphin bay for that experience but that was amazing all in all an expensive day....the park lacked another tower of rides and maybe some sort of wave pool etc the lazy river is okay but gets old quickly.The photos are overpriced and it's almost like once you are in the park it's like how can they get more money from you i.e paying for a towel and locker not being included given the entry price you should expect something in your deal.

Atlantis Water Park. Bit of a palaver to get there. Drinks very expensive, we wanted 2 cans of lemonade...chap said he could only sell 4. Massive queues for the rides, apart from the lazy river...which you can get on all around the park. Wouldn't go back.

Lots of Funs and Walking. If you want to enjoy any park in Dubai, visit it during school days. Avoid GCC school holidays as well as the weekends. Be there by 9:30 so when it opens at 10AM you will be ready. In May the weather started to get hot so if you can visit it 2 months earlier it would be better. The rides are exciting but prepare for too much walking between rides. Despite preparations and planning, the park started to get a bit crowded by 2 PM, which meant longer queues.
The BEST!. So very clean, so many slides so much fun! This is included with the Atlantis and was the best time. It's so nice to go to a very clean waterpark with so many cool things to do!

Funnest thing ever. The rides are all great. Poseidon's Revenge is the scariest. You get into a big plastic tube, the door closes then a 3 2 1 countdown and the floor drops away and it feel like a vertical fall for just longer than feels OK before a high speed tube ride to the bottom. Once was enough for me but a real adrenaline buzz. Next best is Leap of Faith which is pretty scary but I managed three times so obviously not too bad! The raft rides a fantastic. Points to note 1 We went during Ramadan so no queues at all for anything 2 wear pool shoes, the ground is boiling hot (you will have to put them on your hands for some rides to stop you getting caught) 3 Rash vest is good but T shirts need to be removed for some rides due to friction 4 Kids under 1.2M will not be able to do many rides. However our 5 year old said the splash park was "AWESOME" and the rapids ride "THE FUNNEST THING EVER" It was his favourite bit of the holiday - and mine too made a 53 year old feel about 9 again.

Adventure.... For thrill seekers and adrenaline rush lovers I recommend this attractions...there are many rides...it's a huge waterpark...there are swimming pools...there's a slow long ride also...you will enjoy it...for adventure lovers they can try the leap of faith water fall...
Dubai break. Loved this park - spent around 3 to 4 hours enjoying the selection of slidesWatch out for the death slide though - it's scary !
FAB FAB and FAB. if you love water parks you would love this! the rides are amazing and the parks are kept very clean and tidy - highly recommend
Great day out. Brilliant water park and no queuing. Went on a Sunday. They could do with water sprays on the pavements to cool floor down but you are allowed to take flip flops on all the rides
Fun filled getaway. It was indeed a fun filled experience. Loved the rides and dolphins. It was amazing watching them. But I did not enjoy the food much out there. Options were not that great.

Good water Park.. We were there on a Saturday during Ramadan which was great as there was not many people there so no huge ques for rides, at most we would have waited 5-10 mins. Compared to a friend who had gone a week before Ramadan and said that they were waiting up to 45 mins for rides. Staff were all very friendly. A few sections of the Lazy river were closed as there was not enough guests but this didn't really effect our experience.

Good fun for kids. If you are staying at the Hotel you don't have to pay extra to use this waterpark As you would expect there are the waterslides and tubes. Lots of screaming girls in the slides and tubes. Good fun for the families I think.

crazy thing. One of funniest places on the world, i swear... we tried allmost everything, but it was not enough. Everything is organized perfectly and the whole time you feel special. The atractions are top class and the atmosphere is amazing. Like you are in heaven. Everyone should try this. I recomend the Leap of fate and Poseidon's revange.

The best waterpark. Having visited many water parks across the world including Blizzard Beach, Orlando, this is probably the best one. It can be expensive to get in, although we went during Ramadan, so they offered discounted tickets and it wasn't busy.You can rent a locker for the day which costs £8 (non refundable)The slides were all brilliant, whether riding the single riders, doubles or group rides. All great if over 1.2 metres. The lazy river is nice, particularly in 45 degree hit, but be warned there are different turns in it, and some take you on to Rapids and also back up to some of the slides. We had 6 hours in the park and I think we did everything. The food is good, but you will pay around £11 for a kids meal and between £11-£14 for a adult (drink included). You can load this into your wrist band at the entrance kiosk to save carrying cash.There are lots of loungers and a towel can be rented for £2.There are golf buggies which drive around the path way for guests to jump on and off to get between the rides.In the heat you will definitely need footwear to get around, which you can take on the ride with you, you just need to hold on to them! All in all a brilliant day out for a family in a great location.We wanted to go and have a look at the Atlantis Palm with a view to bringing our children, but security prevent none guests from entering.

First and last visit. What a waste of time this place is. Staying at the Atlantic (Butlins in the sun) you get complimentary admission into the park. You enter at one end and the lockers which often don't work are at the other. Then it's a half mile walk to get it sorted out. No one is interested if you have a problem its basically pay up and shut up. Never again Dubai is great my third time normally stay around Jumeriah beach area this is too far out and far too big.
Amazing. Lots of great facilities, very clean, lot of food and soft water facilities and very Nice staff. Love it.

Fun day especially in the heat. Costly day out but you just got to do it. Plenty of water rides and restaurants to eat but my favourite part was access to the beach with views of the Dubai Downtown. It has some scary rides - leap of faith a must.

A great water park for all the family. There aren't too many rides her and there is no big wave pool. But the lazy river is very long and you can divert off it straight on to some exciting rides that put you back on the lazy river. The lazy river rapids are fun too. Water proof shoes or flip flops are essential because the foot paths get too hot to walk on - you can carry these with you on many rides.

Disneyland but in water. There is a great selection of slides that are bound to make your heart race and it doesn't matter whether you can swim or not! Everything is open to everyone and you'll have a few giggles on the way! We also paid to do the shark safari which I recommend booking in advance and it was a fantastic experience!
aquapark. nice place for hang out for whole day especially if it hot weather.and near aquarium in atlantis which you can visit at evening
So much fun . My fav waterpark so much to do and see queues are quick moving very clean and a good choice of food and snacks available. The dolphin encounter is well worth a go amazing

Thrills and spills . Great waterpark! The slides are awesome and the staff super friendly. There's great places to grab a snack as well, including some great snowcones I recommend the super steep slide that takes you through the shark tank.

Great fun for lazy river laying out OR exciting adventure slides!. Aquaventure has great combination of "extreme" waterslides, a lazy river, areas for laying out, and beaches. It is a great "get-away" for a day here in Dubai. I enjoy adventure rides, so I found the slides to be great fun. My wife prefers less adventurous activities, so we enjoyed floating along the lazy river and relaxing by the pool (and beach as well!). It can get crowded at times making it difficult to find chairs near the pool/lazy river. The price is also a little high (and food inside the park is also expensive).

Defiantly an adventure!!. Amazing water park, very beautiful and big. The park had two parts to it, we found the second part of the park half way through the day but was still able to slide on the slides. This water park has the most amazing views if you are able to reach the highest point of the largest scariest ride.
Don't miss out! . Scary, high adrenaline and most amazing peaceful toboggan at the same time.. You don't have to go very hard if you're not a fan but must do and enjoy the toboggan in the aquarium..

Don't miss it!! It is the best!!. We stayed in the same hotel (Atlantis The Palm) and the entrance was included in our room price and we went many time during our stay.It is simply insane fun!!! And for young kids and adults. If you have babies or small kids they can use a space dedicated to them, just be sure to bring floaters and if possible a neoprene suit if you go on european winter as the water is not heated.

Beat the Dubai Heat. Aquaventure Waterpark, Atlantis. Huge Park. Gives you access to its private beach on Palm Islands. Awesome rides. People of all ages can enjoy their. you can definitely beat the dubai heat here. There are few rides that can give you adrenaline rush.

Spectacular Water Park for all Ages. Visited the park with my teenage Son in June and on the first day of Ramadan. A spectacularly good water park with great rides varying from adrenalin pumping "leap of Faith" to a more sedate "Lazy River." Despite it being Ramadan, plenty of water on sale and given the 37c heat, very much what was needed! We didn't have to wait long in any of the queues, all staff helpful and knowledgeable in answering any questions. Highly recommend a visit!

Has to be the best I've visited. This water park has something for everyone.The thrill seekers amongst us will enjoy the leap of faith ride whilst everyone else will enjoy the 2kms of lazy river with added Rapids and wave machine.The park is inclusive if you stay at the hotel which is fab and if you wanted to do, could make a day of it - many food and drink outlets and also sun loungers if you've had enough of the water!

Scream of Joy. We had a Cabana near Zoomrango ride. The service was excellent. The food was delicious and we had an amazing time.Tips for first timers:- Leave everything in the locker, bring towel and nobody touch your stuff so you can leave them on a chair near lazy river and get back to it whenever you're back.-You can wear your flip flops to most rides, and it's better that you do. My brother left his by the lazy river and kept hopping in between the rides (The ground gets pretty hot). Needles to say when we get back he fond his same place he left them.- There are very few rides that GoPro are not allowed -for your own safety of course- and lazy river will get you to all rides across the park which is fun of it's own. - Between AquaConda and Zoomerango - Zoomerango will pump more Adrenalin to your vain. - Leap of Faith is free fall experience for those of you who dare to try it.- Poseidon's Revenge is not as scary as it looks. (Still pretty thrilling) - For beach still prefer Jumeirah Beach.Not a fan of heights or darkness I tried all the rides and It is the scariest most crazy thing I've done in my life.Will I do it again? NoWay!!!

Worth to visit, amazing experience!. It's just an amazing experience! Must go with friends or family. It offers lots of attractions. I was impressed with it. I will definitely recommend it to everyone!
AMAZING. A must when you are in Dubai!!!!! It's worth spending the money to go, it's a water park like no other. Also good and drink is reasonable inside the park!

Ok, but a little disappointed. I have to be honest I was a little disappointed with the park. There was a lot of space but in all honesty not that many rides. The lazy river was large but you seemed to be travelling around for ages with not much going on. The rapids were quite poor (took ages to get there but very slow and had to get out of rubber ring quite lot as you were just floating about). Shark attack was good, dark tunnel which lead into the aquarium. Childrens area, be cautions aw quite a few children and adults with. It's. Didn't allow my little one to go onto it after that

Not the best. We got there early so managed to get prime spot for a Sunbed. My son was just under 120m so unable to ride all the slides except the toddler splash zone. Very disappointed as we travel to Florida and he's done all these rides except the drop. By lunch time the place was rammed. With rude people just sitting on your Sunbed. That was our cue to leave! The prices of food are a disgrace. It's clean and the 3 stars are for the lazy river and the feeding the stingrays.

Not worth its money. Nice place, nice staff. But when we been half of park was closed so why prices was not cutted?!Presented slides not worth $80 per person. And 100 AED ($27) for photo? Are you crazy? Set price 10 AED and everyone will take more than 10 photo. It's nothing worth for you. For $80 they could give free locker and towel. Greedy owners.

Exciting and somewhat scary rides. Visited Aquaventure with friends and I can tell you they have 4 rides that really really exciting for adults! I did skydiving before and I couldn't help but close my eyes on the "Tower of Neptune" ride. and of course remember to check your pictures in the end!Little kids will have an amazing time at the "Splasher's Chilren Play area" and older kids can enjoy river rides or try the zip line.Awesome experience! gotta try it!
Best park in the Emirates. Amazing park connected together by the lazy river and you can literally come out the river in your ring straight onto a ride then plonked straight back in the river

Best waterpark in UAE. This was my second visit to Aquaventure in last 2 years and coincidentally third water park in last 1 month. I had come across their promotion of free ticket on birthday and did not leave chance to capitalize it. Me and my fiancé been there on my birthday and feel that was the best way to celebrate the day. Coming to the park nowLocation-Speechless as situated inside the sea, palm itself is a wonderDesign-This is the most user friendly water park I have ever visited with proper signages all acrossBest-obviously leaf of the fath (I did not try) but yes everything. River is for lazy people (like me), small to large rides for beginners to experts, family to groups, kids to grandparents. I loved the part that u dont need to walk or climb much as travelators are installed all across and u can be seated on ur tubes and feel lazy to even go to rideCrowd-as name itself, u can expect some good amount of decent crowd generally families and couples. Price-We got it for deal but even if u buy it at full price, it worthFood-Most of the cuisine options (I loved pizza and south Indian)Tips-Get ur wrist bend loaded with money for food to avoid carrying cash insideOverall a must watch attraction of Dubai

Fun place for whole family. The Aquaventure waterpark is a fund place for whole family with great beaches, easy flowing tube rides with the occasional rapid. The slides are great especially the leap of faith. Fun for all.

Great day out. We had a great family day here - it was June and Ramadan, so perhaps quieter than usual. We were really taken with how easy it was to get on rides, which are great fun. Really well run place, kind staff and great well run facilities. I go back to my point about Dubai - it's far too money-grabbing. 20 UK pounds sterling for 3 ice cups with some flavour on top. 70 UK pounds sterling for 5 (including 2 kids) meals. Really? That's just disgusting. And you can't take food OR DRINK in. If you can live with that, the day out is brilliant.
The Destination for Thrill Seekers. Wow, I can't get enough of this attraction! Full of fun and slides, ranging from cheillaxing to serious twisted action packed rides.

Good Fun. A nice water park with good rides, there are few draw backs which can be ignored.very very small shower and toilet facilities specially for disable people they need a big improvment there.If you are going their do not forget to take few thing otherwise you will be sufferred.flipflops as the floor of park is too hot and nice sun glasses and sun scream lotion.try to be there early and leave early as well as becuase changing rooms are packed specially mens toilets and then there will be a very big que to get a cab.we waited around 1 30 mins to get a cab.over all the trip was fine.

Excellent. Its pricey, but worth the money. Its one of the best themed water parks I've ever been too. The rides were brilliant but the larger ones are really short, all that queuing for seconds worth of ride. The only issue we had was finding the rides, they are not very well marked out and there were other people wondering around looking for the entrances to rides.

Fun rides. It is one it the best waterparks , it's fun for all family. The main river is for all ages except for one ride in it that has a minimum of 120 cm height to go in. There is a fun kids splashy area and other adults exciting rides.

Spent a good time there. I went with my little brother to spend a day over there. The rides are really nice, we enjoyed the time very much. The only thing is that you have to wait in queue in some games. Otherwise, it's highly recommended.

Lots of fun, even for adults!. The waterpark was alot of fun. However, one of the major slides was not in service. (they did advise us of this before purchasing tickets). It's nice and clean and alot of places to eat. We chose the combo ticket for the Lost Chambers & meal aswell. We paid £7 each for a towel that we didn't end up using as somebody took them and the lockers are highly recommended.Also, the burger meal option said any burger with your meal but they didn't give us the double burger I ordered and gave a single patty cheeseburger which I thought was very cheeky.
One of the best . One of the best watermarks in the middle eastLocated at Atlantis on the Palm.Loads to do for kids and adults.Lost chambers worth a visit too

Amazeballs!. Don't forget your brave pills when you visit. The slides are truly incredible. Each pyramid has a super-extreme slide - don't bottle it! Plenty of sun loungers and more gentle slides too, plus a great kids water play area.
Excellent waterpark I've visited in my life. Excellent water park, nice place to visit in Summer. Had very thrilling rides. Was not that much crowdy.

" Fun Water Park !!!". This water park is a part of world famous Atlantis at Palm ... Buy tickets online to save some extra money.. There are lots of fun & thrilling rides like Poseidon ... Don't forget to spend some evening time at their private beach at Atlantis.. There is also An Aquarium but you have to buy tickets separatey for that..Worth visit.. enjoy...

Best waterpark. Used most of the rides in the waterpark. The lazy river is the best I have seen, IT has to routes, either one in which a tone of water floods you and one in which you feel like your white water rafting. Nearly all of the slides from enter the lazy river.
Fun with a capital F !!. Great park for all , lots of fun with adult and children slides and activities , very well run and very clean , great place to cool off in from the Dubai heat !

Aquaventure. The aqua venture was simply amazing! The thrills are endless and to my adrenalin junkies whatever you do, you must not forget to try out the Poseidon! Trust me you are not ready for this one! Lol!

Memorable Experience. It was a day well spent at the Waterpark. Tickets can be bought online through vendors on trip advisor or you can book them through your hotel reception. You can also buy them onsite but i would advice you buy it online and print your vouchers to take with you to the venue, failure to present printed vouchers means you wont be given access to the water park. all in all great place to visit. You can rent Go pro cameras onsite for about $20 and they give you the memory cards to take home when you are done.
Fantastic for all the family.. Excellent water park, water is lovely and warm.Loads of life guards.Make sure you wear flip flops or swim shoes as concrete gets very hot.
Great water park . Incredible place with loads of slides and pools. Really impressive overall and hardly any queueing required for any of the rides.
Fun!. We were there in January, which was perfect. Really enjoyed our day at the waterpark. It was not busy and the people who worked there were really lovely.
better than wild Wadi!. better than wild Wadi! - a must for waterpark enthusiasts. I recommend the leap of faith down through the shark pool (not that you will see much at that speed!)
great place. Nice water park, good choice of rides, nice kids area. good food, plenty of choice of places to eat and drink, nice to see the fish too
Memorable visit. The Park has varieties of play. Heaven for the kids but it is equally entertaining for the grown ups as well.

A day well spent. This water park is part of the Atlantis. You can buy tickets online. We booked it through our hotel reception and hired a cab to reach the place.The water park has many amazing rides and off course there is world famous Neptune slide which drops us into a see through tunnel covered with mantra rays and fish with in blink of eye. Not many know this but, there is a private beach that is accessible from the water park. Enjoy the evening there after a tiring day at the park. Visit the lost chambers if you find time. It is adjacent to aquaventure and is a huge aquarium.Have a great holiday! :)

Atlantis Palm Stay. This hotel is outstanding. Very clean. Food is the best, so many different types from so many countries. Deserts bread fruit etc are superb. Customer Service excellent. Very well maintained.

Water Park of Wonder. This is a must when in Dubai it opens at 10am and closes at 19:00pm so you can spend all day here and believe me you will want more time there as its so good. The lazy river is brilliant we spent 2hrs on it they have great Rapids and elevators hours of fun on the rubber ring. The slides are worth the queue which go down really quick and they are great for the kids. It's worth every penny and there are restaurants inside for times you don't want to be in the water and need a bite to eat.

The best. Another fantastic experience at Aquaventure - anyone that try's to tell you Wild Wadi is better or even on par with Aquaventure is quite frankly losing their mind.There's such a variety here, queues aren't bad & the thrill seeking water rides are amazing. For anyone with a GoPro they'll let you on all the water rides with it, even the one where the floor goes from underneath you. Great experience & can't wait to return.

So much fun!!!. Had the best time here, got to go free with staying in a suite in the Atlantis and I had the most fun and amazing time, lots of facilities, slides and things to do for all ages and lots of sun beds to use too. I loved it so much here!

Fun, but expensive. We had a resident discount so the price was good. But for a normal everyday ticket the price is way too high for this. For sure the facilities are modern and the aqua-park is great, we had a great time and a lot of fun. We were there in the colder winter days, so the crowd was not so big. The price is a big turn off though: the place is sure great, but the difference in entry ticket is WAY too high.

Family Fun. Whether you like the thrills of the 'leap of faith' or the sedate-ish enjoyment of the lazy river you'll love it here. We arrived at midday and left about 6pm. Thursday (i think). Queues were OK. Went on most things twice. Plenty of cover for little ones too. Plenty of cafes too. Thoroughly recommend.

Aqua park . We took out 6 year old daughter here and had a great day, really glad we didn't have a later night the night before as its a big place and plenty to do it's worth the money and food is good, the only real rip off is the meet the Dolphins as they expect under 12year olds to be with a parent in the pool but make the parent pay as well so it's circa £300 then which we just laughed at them and I said they are being bad to younger children as some families would not be able to do it on that account but for us it was the principle of the matter. But for the sake of the review I would say j would return there as its a good day out.
Water all over the place. Really nicely built place for kids and every age group to have some fun and rocking time. Cool slides, big area and shark theme are biggest attraction.

On of the best waterparks in the world !. This waterpark has nothing to do with waterparks you get in Europe and is even better than the ones in the US.... Once you get on the tube you can literally stay on it for the entire day without hassles of waiting in lines and queuing on the stairs... There are 2,5kms of rivers and tons of waterslides with belts taking you up, so you don't have to walk and climb the stairs.... There are also some extreme waterslides you cannot find anywhere in Europe... Highly recommend it !

Must see in Dubai. Seriously it is so hot in Dubai you would be crazy to not spend a day at the waterpark. It is unbelievably massive with so many rides and pools for kids and adults alike. We spent the entire day here. It's free to hotel guests. The water is much much cooler than the resort pools. It has so much to offer. You rent towels and lockers if you need them, plenty of sunbeds to lie on but you spend most of your time in the pool. Take sunscreen Everything is expensive to buy there!!! And wear your thongs or reef shoes, the concrete paths are seriously hot!

Fantastic Day Out. Regardless of age this is a great day out. The park is spotlessly clean, equipment to a high standard, towels are included and there is plenty of space to relax which includes access to the beach. There is the option to shark dive which although a little expensive is well worth it. Really worth having a pair of swim shoes as the ground is so hot in the heat of summer you risk burning your feet running between rides. The waterproof i phone cases available in the shop for £25 are well worth the price, you can take photos and film whilst on the rides. Great advantage to stay at The Palm hotel with free unlimited access to the park

Brilliant and quiet during Ramadan . Visited on 8th June so during Ramadan, it was so quiet! No queues for anything. This was our third visit to aquaventure, still very good. The water coasters here are very good, we spent the whole day here and it was worth every penny. Only complaint is the floor is ridiculously hot, take your flip flops everywhere with you (even on the slides as none of the slide exits are near the entrance)

great water park. great park although a bit small. finished all slides in 4 hours. can be done during the summer hot season as a lot of shade on the slides, and while waiting. long trip by metro, tram and another tram
Good times. A great place to go, very busy and very clean. Full of locals, who don't queue and will short cut. Foods alright and they serve alcohol. But I do prefer Wild Wadi

You will not be bored at this waterpark that's for sure!! Awesome day out :). It's about £70 for a day pass at the park and it is definitely worth it!! Would of loved to of swam with the dolphins here but a little too pricey for my budget at the time but will definitely be coming back here and with more money to be able to swim with the dolphins for a once in a lifetime experience !! The waterpark itself is huge!! There are so many slides we didn't actually get a chance to go on all of them because we didn't get to the waterpark until about 3pm. It closes at 7pm so I would definitely say to make the most of your day here to arrive around 12pm. The lazy river was great, staff take pictures of you whilst you are going around so is funny to check them out at the end of the day on your way out to see how silly you look :D There is access to the beach at the waterpark as well so if wanting to chill out from all the fun of the waterslides there is a nice relaxing beach too. Great day out :)

You need to know these things. We loved it. 1. You must wear swim shoes. The paths are too hot to walk on. If you wear flip flops some rides don't allow them and it's hard to get back to your footwear after the ride. You can buy swim shoes there, they cost around £25. We wore sports socks which made do but I've now bought swim shoes from eBay for our next trip.2. Most rides put you back in the lazy river.3. There is no special place to collect rings. Just look for the sun lounger area and random rings will float pass. By 2pm there are lots of spare rings accompanying you on the lazy river. This could be improved by collecting of the rings by the staff. 4. You cannot ride in a double ring on your own. 5. When you arrive just join the lazy river. Which is FANTASTIC we spent about 4 hours going round.6. The signs are poor. Just look for the tower as most rides start there.7. Be prepared to queue to get in. Once through though queuing is minimal.

An amazing day!! . My husband and myself spent a wonderful day at the Atlantis Aquaventure Park! We enjoyed the all the slides and all the rapids! It is the best aquatic park we have ever experienced! Only thing which is disappointed is the dress code to go to some restaurants close to the park.. It did not make sense for us to have this kind of dress code close to an aquatic park as we do not usually go there wearing a tuxedo.. Yeah.. You guessed it.. We were wearing shorts and flip flops.. Which is normal when you go to an aquatic park.. Anyway, we definitely recommend this Aquaventure Park!!
Fabulous water park. Great experience, I especially enjoyed my swim with the dolphins, never thought I would ever do this. A highly recommended experience
Atlantis Aquaventure water park. Its marvelous......a perfect way to spend holidays with your family.......Everything is beyond imagination............. a wonderful experience.....

Amazing rides, Amazing fun.. When driving you walk though the atlantis hotel, this gives a great impression for the area. th service for tickets was good and the changing rooms were excellent. i feel there was enough rides, but i recommend wearing a tight water t shirt as some of the rides mark you back due to high speeds. the food services were ideal, we went during ramadan and there was not change which was great.

Fun and Exciting. Good waterpark although a bit expensive for what it is. The rides are enjoyable, the vast majority are dingy based so you can do them in pairs if you wish. We didn't find the wait time for rides too bad. A couple of the slides will get your pulses racing for sure! Worth a visit if you are near Atlantis, but if you have already been to Wild Wadi, don't bother given the cost.

Lack of uphill water a shame! . Can only compare this to wild wadi which is its most direct competition and they are both excellent and both do some things better than the other. Aquaventure is bigger so there is more walking and potentially more queuing and be warned that in the summer you will need something to wear on your feet as you go around the park as the concrete gets very hot! The river parts here are longer and more interesting/varied than wild wadi but the escalators are dull and add nothing to the experience. This has more rides and has more rides with bigger drops but overall the ride experiences are shorter so you will spend more time queuing than riding. Great day out but better if done while staying at Atlantis so you can visit several times.
A great place . It was the best wonderful place ever I visited in Dubai it was a good time we spend it there. But the food was too much high price.

Amazing. Even as an older adult - One of my pleasures in a vacation is a good waterpark to relax in on the lazy river type rides - Much more enjoyable than just sunbathing. The lazy rivers here are probably the best Ive experienced including Disney.Add to that slides etc for any type of age and you have an ideal family day out. Its a free bonus for those staying at Atlantis.
Great Day Out. We had a fab time here, remember some cheap flip flops as the walkways get way too hot to go barefoot.
Ok.. Very expensive and not enough for young toddlers to do. There are not enough rides as everything has a height restriction.
Very poor for the cost. For the price you pay, not a good investment to see such a small number of different fishes. Quantity but not quality.

Amazing place. When my local Dubai-based friends highly recommended that we go to Aquaventure, I wasn't sure what to expect - I didn't do my online research - but their excitement was enough for me to agree to go without thinking about it too much. To say that I was impressed is an understatement, I simply had the time of my life! The slides, the thrills, the atmosphere, the beaches were just sublime to say the least! We even made few new friends while we were at it!We spent about 4-5 hours there and I wished that we had spent longer! It was a bit pricey but well worth it at the end! GoPro (or equivalent) is highly recommended there - we've managed to capture so many videos of us going down the slides and rafts, and these videos were the highlight of my time in Dubai! I will definitely be back again to Aquaventure next time I'm in town! Thanks again for the great time, memories & laughs!

The best park in Dubai so far.. we come here quite a lot but in the summer June to Early September we love coming down. You dry quick and the wind is not so strong leaving you chilly. The slides are just insane and fun. No walking or high steps to climb. This park is built in a state of art way. Dolphins experience is just a must do here. The food in the park honestly is not so great. Starbucks has a better option. Quick light sandwich and coffee to keep you going. We love it.

Brilliant. Loved it!! Brilliant park! It's a shame it doesn't interconnect with the lazy river however I had a fab day and would love to go back! Lots of staff able to assist you with anything you need and to take pictures!
The best water park. Certainly the best water park, the no of rides for children and adults are truely awesome, some of the best rides
swimming with the dolphins. great experience swimming with the dolphins then having a day at the waterpark, it was very warm only advice make sure you keep your flip flops with you

Great fun. Apart from having to carry your own ring up a lot of stairs, numerous times, to go on all the first section of rides it is well worthwhile. The staff are very pleasant and ensure that the children are safe. The second section of rides include a bomb pod, trap door which is insane. The family rides on this side are excellent

Love this place. Been numerous times with the children (both under 10). Plenty for them to do. The lifeguards are great, making the kids smile whilst ensuring they stay safe. Good selection of fast food at Baracuza food court at a reasonable price.
Visit. this was great the entry fee was included in our Big Bus two day ticket we had a great couple of hours there a must see

Simply superb . It's one of the finest water part on the edge of Palm Jumeirah in Hotel Atlantis. Has lot of rides and slides. Leap of faith is great. But crowded so make sure you get your places early.
Great fun for all the family. We had lot's of fun and if you go before 12pm the queues are not too long.We left our stuff on the sun beds so we didn't use the lockers.

Enjoyed my visit. I brought a group of students here for a field trip and we had an excellent time. The staff was extremely accommodating and helpful, from booking to arrival. Luckily the lines were pretty short or moved quite quickly and the rides were a lot of fun. Even though it was 38C, the water was a nice cool temperature and quite refreshing. We wore our flip flops right up to the rides and then put them on our wrists to protect our feet from the hot pavement. They also check your bags at the door for food (and I'm sure other things) so don't try to carry in or it will go to waste. They did let us bring in our own water bottles though which was good because water was 13 dirhams. There are also lots of nice shady spots and foliage, making it a very pleasant environment. Overall, would definitely recommend it for a day trip.

So good. Why moan about this place....no queing.free towels.ample double and single rings.fantasticly clean and safe.buggy dropped us within metres of each tower rides straight from hotel pool i simply cant see how it could be better! Even got wristbands at our breakfast table in club lounge on 12th floor.Lots of sunloungers and direct access to beach.....tip sit by barracudas and get on lazy river to access everything.such a quiet area with access to food, lockers, towels and shops which of course have great AC to cool you down.

Huge. This place is so big we didn't get round to it all, with its own beach!! You can hire towels and a locker as well as putting money on your wrist band so you don't have to carry anything around with you all day!!!

Great day out-Food a little dissapointing. We had a lovely day here at Aquaventure, we booked a cabana and it was so worth it, you get 2 sunbeds, a shade, 6 bottles of water and 2 fruit cups and although it may seem expensive for just this i think it was really worth it. Firstly thank you to Prakash for looking after us during our day, he and the staff were amazing and kept checking on us to make sure we had ice and everything we wanted. We had a nice area by the water and the shade kept us cool all day. The only thing i felt edissapointed with was the food, we ate at the Barracuda and although clean i did feel that the quality of the food was poor for the price paid. We had Wagyu beef burgers and it wasn't the quality i would have expected at this hotel and for this price. Nice day out but avoid the food

Excellent way to keep cool - and have fun!. My friend and I were staying at Atlantis in early May and we made use of the waterpark every morning to keep cool. I noticed a massive difference in numbers from having stayed over a school holiday previously, as queues this time were minimal and free sun loungers were in abundance all through the day. As hotel guests we could access the waterpark via the resort buggies and never had to queue to enter. Towel stations were in handy locations and we were able to set up base before spending hours enjoying the park.Safety of the visitors comes across as paramount and there are numerous life guards stationed at every point who have no hesitation in either enforcing the park’s safety rules or jumping into the water if they see something untoward. Virtually all were smiley and friendly and gave us the impression that your safety was their first concern.Not sure if the water is salty or heavily chlorinated but our eyes did suffer, or maybe we just spent way too long lazing around the lazy river!
Brilliant day out!. Lovely, clean water park with the most amazing rides!! The only downer was that we did get our flip flops stolen but not that much of a big deal. Great day out!

A good day out. I went with my 13 year old daughter who had be underwhelmed by her trip to Dubai until visiting the waterpark. We arrived early but there were still big queues and the staff were not very helpful. We really enjoyed the day and the rides, but some of the queues were quite long. The food was quite expensive and poor quality fast food, I had expected something better. The changing facilities left a lot to be desired. When we left at the end of the day there was a massive queue for taxis. We took the monorail off the palm and then got a taxi, probably worth doing. We felt a bit ripped off but did have a lot of fun and stayed there the whole day. I think I enjoyed the wild wadi just as much and it is probably better value for money.

Fun for all. I'm not a water park person but this was rather fab and had something for everyone. One fault would be that the floors get so hot and if you go on the lazy river and come off somewhere else and you haven't taken your water shoes on, you will scald your feet. Me and my children were in tears running for each small area of shade to try and locate our original seat and shoes. Get some water shoes or take your flip flopsOn with you. Perhaps the park should make this suggestion or put some parasols in areas to make it more bearable to walk without foot protection from the lazy river/Rapids even with white slabs, 43 degrees are going to severely burn feet.

Fun in the dessert. Great place for fun and watersports and games. You can also learn a lot from doplphins and sea lion.You feel like any disney water park and better . Everything is perfect and very suitable for kids of any ages.

Great waterpark. This is a great water park, however only a few rides for the little one to her disappointment. Could probably do with a few more attractions for children.The floor gets very hot so would advise flip flops of some sorts.

Good level of thrills for all ages and fear factors. Poseidons Revenge is scary just looking at the people drop themselves through the floor into a loop and and eventual finish at the back of 7 seconds of fright. loved all except the over busy river rides

Good for your soul. You have to be there for understand how cool this park is.Great rides, clean and helpful staff.Everything was awesome but food and beverage was worse of all things that I've tried in Dubai.

A fun day out with the family (with some caveats). Visited Aquaventure with my wife and 3 young children on a Thursday. We had booked on line but it still came to 1700 Dirham which was steep, especially when you add in the cost of renting towels and lockers. I am not a big fan of water parks and would have rated it a "3" but I have to be fair and say my wife and kids loved it and said it was a "5". So, it is a "4" on balance!We arrived at 1030 and it took around 20 minutes to queue on arrival to get our wristbands and hire towels and a locker. By the time we had entered the park we couldn't find any sun loungers in the shade at any locations ( and ended up finding some near the Barracuda restaurants at the far end of the park which had a touch of shade under a palm tree (TIP arrive early to enter by opening time to secure a good spot and minimise queues). The park was well designed but would have benefited from more maps and signposting (as done well by the Disney and Sea World Parks in the USA) as it was very disorientating getting around. You could, on request, ask for a map at the shops but it was small and not really that helpful. The family really enjoyed the lazy river (despite my youngest son falling out of his tube on one of the conveyer belts and cutting his leg in two places - the staff beyond kindly got us out of the river and checked him over). We would have liked to have done more rides but there was no way of knowing which ones would be suitable for our children (perhaps the Park could consider providing a "rating" system with a brief description of each ride on their website). After some trial and error we discovered the Shark Attack ride which the kids loved and did 6 times over towards the end of the day. This park would also benefit from an independent "Top Tips" fact sheet to help guests get the most out of their day (although I guess that is partly what TripAdvisor does). Food was pricy but better quality than a typical US water park and much was freshly cooked to order. The taxi queue at the end of the day was lengthy, around 45 minutes waiting time, which was frustrating at the end of a very long and hot day. All in all a good day out and, with a few improvements in my view could be fantastic.

OH MY GOD. Yes this was the highlight of our trip. The Aquaventure Waterpark was excellent for kids and adult who still think they are kids as well. The water rides are super The Leap of Faith was the highlight of my visit. A must do if you ever visit .

Awesome but insanely expensive.. The waterpark itself is awesome, but the cost for a ticket for this, the aquarium, a meal deal (fast food) and use of a locker worked out at £80 a head. It was a really fun day out but not cheap!
atlantis waterpark. Very good site to vist and spend an entire day from 10 am through to 7pm.Good lazy pools and rapids .

Fab fab fab!!!!. Had a day at the waterpark last week and loved every minute. Slides were fab especially the lazy river/river rapids. Easy to get a sunbed, queues not too bad, views from the top of the slides were amazing and the beach was gorgeous. We had lunch in shark bite and we're pleasantly surprised that it wasn't too expensive as you usually find in waterparks (£16 for 12 inch pizza, large chips, cake and 2 drinks). Well worth a visit

Excellent entertainment. Since we went in the end of may it was very crowded and hence had a long wait for the water rides. However the rides were exciting and challenging. There were life guards all the way so you felt safe. The leap of faith was a great thriller. The changing rooms had hot and cold showers with hair dryer also. The only draw back was that there was no time to do all the water rides

Must visit if you travel to Dubai. so much fun, but they need to train the staff to smile and by more cheerful. Toilets and changing rooms need to more attention - specially when it comes to refilling shower gels and shampoos.price is expensive (compare to other water parks), but it's enjoyable.

Wet and Wild!. Stayed at the Atlantis for a week. Water park great fun and kids loved it. Daughter was thrilled with the dolphin acquaintance but i was less than impressed with the price of Scuba with the critters. Leap of faith is a must even though queued up for 90 minutes.

Lovely offer of free birthday ticket . A very nice waterpark but that meet Atlantis expectations.. Good thing you have a beach access as well yet not the best beach also... Still worth visiting and I would say it 2nd best after wild wadi

Surprising . I have been to aquaventure and wild wadi many times, and wild wadi has always been a favourite of both mine and my family. However, on my most recent trip Aquaventure was miles better than wild wadi, where I found myself and others to be bored. It was well facilitated with some very thrilling rides.
Brilliant. It is fantastic if you are staying at the Atlantis. A buggy brings you there and back. We had a great time at the water park. Suitablefor the old and young. Lockers are available,

Excellent water slides, but everything has a price.... Our family had a rocky introduction after learning that a locker was 70 dirhams (£14) and that towels were 30 dirhams each (£6). Fortunately we had called ahead and brought our own towels. Once in, the rides were amazing! Long queues at times, but that's to be expected at a waterpark or any amusement park. We found plenty to keep 2 adults and a 6 and 9 year old entertained throughout the day. Lifeguards were stationed at frequent points for the lines as well as the beginning and end of each ride and along the lazy river. They were all friendly and very helpful. You cannot take in outside food and food in the park is very expensive which adds to the cost of your day.At various points on rides there is a photographer who gets a shot of you enjoying your day. You are given a wristband with a barcode which allows you to view the photos at the end of your day. We had some great shots, but the 100 dirham (£20) charge seemed on the high side!Worth a visit and you will certainly have a great day, just be prepared to pay a premium for it! Not for those on a budget!

Amazing. If you thought Alton Towers and Disney Land was good, then wait till you see this! So much to do, an amazing park for the whole family. Best part is you get unlimited access if you stay at Palm Atlantis

Awesome place. Brilliant park. Only really five or six high slides. You can rent towels and lockers. 45 dirham for lunch deal at the ticketing counter. Good value for money. Go to lost chambers In the Atlantis building.

Great day out. My wife and I had a great day out here and made full use of all the attractions. My only observations would be that Aquaventure lacks any real thrill rides that make the adrenaline pump. Both my wife and I felt that Wild Wadi was better for these. That said, I preferred the lazy river setup at Aquaventure so I guess it depends what you want from a water park!We also preferred1the food options at Wild Wadi.

Water park experience . Well, the other half insisted we went to a water park on our trip.... On arrival we booked the VIP experience , best idea we've had, our own sun loungers and bottled water , plus link brought straight to us! Next and the rides , they're fantastic but after queueing for 30 mins for one ride , I chicken out! You need nerves I steal for some of the rides. Best fun day out we've had though! Highly recommend. If you get scared easily, is suggest brining ear muffs for the kids , slit I swearing will be done !

A must when in Dubai!. Visited here recently and we had a great day! Make sure to book in advance to save a bit of money. Also, bring towels unless you want to rent them or are a guest at the Atlantis Hotel. The water park is big with a variety of rides. They are all spaced out well, so there was never any major queues to get onto the rides. It also has access to the beach when you want to chill out in between rides. Make sure to bring water shoes in order to protect your feet from the hot floor! A great day for all of the family.

A highly recommended family getaway !. The water park is huge and awesome with some 8-10 extreme rides and the most popular lazy river which where you can witness some exciting rapids also!!any one who needs some adrenaline push should try " leap of faith" .
