Try getting a good bargain by booking a room for one night atleast and you get free access to the waterpark along with the lost chambers ( aquarium) but please try to visit on a weekday to avoid mad rush and long queues. Would also suggest to try the dolphin park where you can have some interesting close encounters with these sea friends.

Fun and wow aquariums. Good slides and water rides for whole family with beach access, then after all day in park you can go through lost chambers, they have varying ticket prices for what you want to do.
Experience . Fab day at the Atlantis. Daughter did the Dolphin experience which I would recommend.. Great choice of slides suitable for all ages. Would go back

let's go swimming. the atlantis aquaventure water park is amazing.we've tried lot of rides and super enjoyed.they have also fun rides for kids so it is for everybody to enjoy and wants some fun in the summer.never been in the hotel but as i seen outside, its really really nice.how much more inside!

Thrilling !!!. The Aquaventure waterpark was extremely thrilling, we went there 2 days as we stayed in Atlantis. The waterpark has got all kinds of slides and pools you could imagine. Me, personally is quite scared of doing this things but you cannot resist sitting in these slides.

One day ain't enough!!. The Waterpark was Mind Bobbling!! We had thought that it would be like one of those waterparks which we have in India. But this was totally different...! This was the best waterpark I had ever visited. I wish to visit it again in the coming future!!
FAB. Great for kids and adults on a toasty hot day . Enjoyed floating around the lazy river to keep cool ..

Very overated. Still a good day out but only a handful of rides. Food is expensive inside. Lazy water is good fun as it just takes you around the park at fast and slow speeds while you sit in the doughnut

Great day for whole family. The waterpark is complimentary for guests staying at Atlantis which is excellent. We stayed for 3 nights & visited the waterpark 3 times. It has something for everyone. My husband & son enjoyed the thrilling rides while I was happy using the lazy river. There's a fun kids area for younger visitors. The seating areas are filled very quickly so go early to avoid disappointment. Good variety of eating options.

Fab day out. This water park is brilliant - so many rides and it's probably got the best lazy river I've ever seen with options of Rapids, rides and a wave torrent. I particularly like the fact that you are mainly inside when queueing for rides rather than standing under the blaring sun. All that said we didn't wait that long for any of the rides. They do tend to get busier after 2pm. Anyway would highly recommend. One of the best water parks I've been to and certainly better than the big branded Florida ones.
Full day fun!. Great water park! Loved the rides and the park. Do not forget to swim in the sea as well, water is very salty but the floating experience is great.

Awesome day out!. Checked this out with my partner. Amazing day out soaking up the sun and cooling down on the water. Crazy slides, awesome beaches, huge park.Try visit in the weekdays as there are far less people.

Day out. A tad expensive though we spent the whole day enjoying the delights of the park! My favourite was the lazy river it just suited me and my mood though there were a few more enthusiastic rides to be had and we did them all over several hours!

mixed feelings. Entrance cost a lot per person and actually there is just 7-8 extreme rides plus lazy river. So if someone doesn't like to get too much adrenaline than you will be bored and have a feeling of waste a money. You can spend time with dolphins instead or feed rays but everything cost extra.

Wouldn't go again . We lasted three hours at Aquaventure. For the price they charge to get in, I really thought it would be better than it was. We arrived at opening and it was a mad scrum to get any sun loungers and there was minimal shade in the whole resort. We went during the week when it was supposed to be quieter but if that was quiet then I would hate to see what busy was like.I really wouldn't bother going again. The rides were okay but there are more negatives than there are positives.

Great for all ages. My boyfriend and I are 20 and 23 years old and were skeptical that the water park would be a little childish for us. We were wrong! We spend the day there and enjoyed every ride. Great for those staying at Atlantis who have free access. Also the facilities are spotless!

Fun day out. . Water park is kept very clean and easy to get around. However the floor is unbearable to walk on without shoes because it gets stupidly hot. Queues for the slides weren't too long at all, waited maximum ten minutes for a slide after getting there when the park opened, best time of day to go. Staff at the aquarium however weren't helpful or polite and kept sending us to the wrong desk for no reason until someone scanned our wristband and let us through, very confusing.
Amazing. Best day out in Dubai!!! Amazing for all ages, park is clean and well kept. Would recommend to anyone!

Fun but not the best water park in the UAE. If you're staying at the Atlantis in Dubai then going to the Aquaventure Waterpark right next door is a must. If you live in Dubai and want a more adventurous experience then visiting Wild Wadi or Yas Water Park makes more sense.

Fun day out for all ages. Visited Aquaventure with my boyfriend (both in our mid twenties) and had such a fun day out. If you're on holiday and wanting a break from sunbathing then I would highly recommend this place, regardless of your age!We had a great time and took lots of great videos on our Go Pro.
Fun. One of the more expensive water parks, However no complaints , the view is beautiul. The rides are not bad. Can enjoy with the kids.

Epic. Swam with and fed wrays, incredible. The park is fantastic. Heat was unbearable the day we went but plenty of shade for families. Loved every sec especially the lazy river with couples water rings
Beautiful. Aquaventure park is definitely worth a visit.a lovely relaxing day the beach access is great and clean with beautiful views. better than the free beach at jumeirah by far.

one of our best days in Dubai. When you're travelling with a child like we allways do, at least one aquapark during your hollidays in warm destination is a must to keep them motivated. My son loved the park, it wasn't even that crowdy and we easily found free sunbeds in the shade. Food was nice, and they offer some healthy snacks, too like fruit salad and yogurt, which is not very often in theme parks. I was in my 3rd pregnancy month when we were there and there were plenty of things for me to do, too, like lazy river, big pool with waves or walk along the beach which can be reached just few steps away from the park. It was really fun for all ages.
Yes just great. Would really recommend this place. Spent the first 3 hours doing the rides and lazy river. Great place and loved it

nothing great. aquaventure water park is part of an atlantis hotel.. its too much of hype about aquaventure but it was usual waterpark.. not much of a thrilling rides...you have to pay lots of money to view or play with dolphin

Amazing waterpark with great views. This Water park was amazing, we went on a Friday which in Dubai is a public holiday and were told that it would be extremely busy and we would be waiting in line for 2 hours but it was actually the opposite, it was very quiet and we spent basically no time waiting in line apart from getting the tickets.The one downside that stopped this being an excellent review was that I had a dolphin encounter voucher that was valid for the week of my birthday and we got our tickets and went to the dolphin bay and found out that we had to make a booking and that I had only general admission not the dolphin encounter.Overall though it was an amazing time and I would definitely go there again.

Amazing day out. Spent a whole day here on all the rides and slides, leap of faith is breathtaking! Take a dip in the shark tank; well worth it! Swam with the dolphins here which was amazing and spoke in depth with the handlers/carers about them, they are very knowledgable and know their professionalism very well. Very helpful, friendly and polite staff. Lovely beach if you want to relax for a short while, fresh melon on the front to quench your thirst. Visit and enjoy.

Phenomenal Experience - Memorable Moments. My children, aged 9 and 6, were on a one week visit in Dubai and Aquaventure was our highlight for the week. Whilst we have experienced various waterparks together in the past, Singapore, Manila and others - Aquaventure tops it all! The variety of rides, the absolute seamlessness and smoothness of logistics, high quality of hygiene (water, changing rooms, overall cleanliness) and friendliness of the staff was out of this world. We have had a phenomenal time, spending >4 hours in the park and will certainly come back and most definitely recommend! Last but not least - great variety of attractions serving each age group, i.e. even for children below 120cm of height, so much to do and experience! Congratulations to the team at Atlantis and Aquaventure!

A fantastic day out! . My 5 year old daughter and I arrived at Aquaventure at around 9:45am, mid week. Even at this time, there were quite a few people here. I paid £130 ish for our entry, a small locker and 2 meal deals. The meal deals were printed on a ticket which we took along to the food hall for lunch. We started off straight away in the lazy river and used the river to find our way around most of the time, rather than walking. The rapids were lots of fun and the torrent section provided waves to add to the ride. The tubes are single or double and can include a child seat where the bottom is sealed to stop the little ones falling through. At the towel kiosks, you can pick up complimentary kids life jackets for use during the day. We took wet-shoes which we wore all day, eliminating the worry of extremely hot ground. The 'splashers' area was a huge hit with my little one; a big structure stood in shallow water with several different sized slides, water guns, tipping buckets and other such fun things. At lunch, we ordered a burger, hot dog and chips with drinks from our meal deals. The portions were a good size and really tasty. There are water fountains around the park near the restaurants and plenty of smaller stalls or kiosks for drinks and snacks. A huge souvenir cup cost 40dirhams and then 8d per refill after the first time, a regular soft drink is 15d. At the end of our day, we went to view the photos that had been taken by the photographers dotted around the different rides. These were priced at 100d per photo or 125 including a souvenir frame and the chance to email one copy of the purchased photo from a separate booth. The only thing I wish I'd done was bought a waterproof pouch and lanyard for my phone at 120d from all of the shops around the park so that I could have had more pictures from the day. Even though it was an expensive day out, we loved every minute and would definitely go again.
fun but crowded - don't miss the dolphins. a few great rides but really very busy and a very mixed crowd. the dolphins are the high light and well worth the cost

Ok day out...perhaps Wild Wadi is better?. Visited today, was an okay day (weather fab) and the surroundings are totally breath- taking but the park doesn't deserve the hype....prepare to be disappointed if you've been lucky enough to have visited any of the Florida water parks as this is nowhere near as good. Make sure you take watershoes or flip-flops or you'll be doing the 'hot...hot...hot' fast walk wherever you go!

Great day out for all the family. We visited the waterpark when it was first opened and have to say it has improved considerably since then. Although an expensive day out if you have a large family it is well worth getting there early to take full advantage of the cost. We went by car & were guided into a well organised clean car park where a shuttle bus took us straight to the main entrance of the Atlantis hotel, enabling us to walk through the shops etc before queuing to pay for access to the waterpark. there are many packages available so read carefully before you purchase. The best one was including the meal deal in the admission price, as the food in the 2 selected restaurants was really good and huge portions. Also pick up a waterproof phone cover in the shop before you enter so you can capture all the wet hilarious moments on camera ( we didn't so have none to share as had to lock up all our belongings in the locker beforehand)Now has access to a private beach which is identical to the one shared by hotel guests so you get to enjoy the use of sunbeds for free, view of the Burj al arab & can say you stayed on the Palm!

Good Adventure. Well it was really amazing visiting this water park. Great lifetime experience, some really amazing and thrilling rides, a must go for all the tourist coming to Dubai.The only issue I had was taking my slippers and tubes along to almost every ride.

Atlantis water park day. Currently in Dubai and spent a day at Atlantic as a day guest at the waterpark. Its not a cheap day for sure, firstly you need to get there. We took a taxi, it cost us 70 aed from the Downtown area. Once inside the food and drink price are very high, like any theme park really. 12 aed for a bottle of water. ( you will need to bring a lot in the heat) be warned you cant bring any food or drinks in with you, they check your bags. Towels are not free, so bring your own. You can rent a locker, but as we found out once there you dont really need to, just leave your stuff on the sun beds , that are all over the place, everyone does it. Put your stuff in a small bag and hide under your towel ( use lockers for valuable though) be sure to bring flipflops or plastic jelly shoes, the ground is too hot to walk on barefoot. You can keep your shoes on for some rides, not all, you will leave them at the entrance or hold them during the ride. The beach is also free with the waterpark ticket. Found the place rather dirty overall,, and overpriced. Avoid going Friday and Saturdays, as these are the days off in Dubai.

Must see!!!!!!!!! . This was literally the best thing we did in Dubai!!! Best day ever - have to visit if you enjoy water parks & like water rides etc.Only criticism would be that the floor gets wayyyy too hot so need some sprinkler's etc. so you can be cooled off.tips:1) book your tickets in advance, get them direct from the aquaventure website, this is the cheapest you will get.2) get your locker at the counter - small locker is 40AED & was enough for 2 bags & towels etc.3) bring your own towels4) bring water shoes - I read this on trip advisor & wish I listened to the reviewer!!!5) get money for food/refreshments etc. added to a wristband at the counter this saves you carrying any money inside the park. Any money leftover on your wristband is returned back to you at the end of the day. Food inside costs around 50AED per person. Bring your own water & stay hydrated.6) bring clothes to change into at the end of the day, they have shower facilities on site7) inside you only want your water, towel & flip flops - we left all 3 of these on sun loungers near the ride we went on & came back to collect when we wanted to move on. No one touches your stuff really so it's pretty safe, but we didn't carry into the park any valuables.8) getting to the aquaventure on the Metro or Tram is easy. We got there on the tram as the tram stop was right outside our hotel & we got off at Palm Dubai station & walked outside to get a taxi straight in. On the way back we got the mono-rail to the tram station.
Ms. It waz an amazing experience. There were a lot of fishes and sharks and they were swimming together in a beautiful harmony !
Fantastic adventure. I and my daughter enjoyed the water park and the crazy atmosphere the slides and the rotating floats

So much fun!. We had such a fun time here! There are just enough slides to keep you busy and not create huge queues. That was a plus...we barely waited in any queues. We got lost in the lazy river a few times but it was worth it. The leap of faith and poseidon's revenge gave quite the thrill. Don't worry the anticipation is worse than the ride...just try it! Pro tip - Rent a spot in Neptune's Retreat. You can two lounge chairs, a few bottles of water, a locker, towels and you can order food to be brought to you...also it's 18+. So worth it!
Best waterpark ever. Towels provided to hotel guests. So easy to enter and exit as many times as you like. Lazy river is so different, tidal, slide etc..

Amazing Park. Had a free pass as it was my Birthday which i got from the Atlantis Hotel by registering with them. This saved a good chunk but i then paid extra for Neptunes retreat which was fantastic for a water park. Private area with dedicated beds for you and towels and ice box with water and fresh fruit in the afternoon. Even had a button to press for our own Butler for food and drink and umbrella use.Water park is massive the lazy river takes at least 45 mins for one full cycle but you could stay on longer if you took a turn off on the side alleys which take you up a travellator on your ring to the 3rd floor of one of the towers.You can hire everything on site if you need it if not doing neptune. Such as towels and even go pros Food is good and reasonable priced. Far better quality than parks like Alton Towers etc in UK and better priced. You won't get a beer in the park which is a good thing and you cannot take food or drink in except a SEALED 1 litre bottle of water as there are strict bag checks on arrival.All of the rides easy to get as queues were non which i think we hit well. Got told to avoid time after RAMADAM as it gets mad.You can get to the beach also here. Top tip get to park as early as possible as ticket entrance is worst part long queues

Fun, but really bad signposting. The rides are fun. Signposting is the park is awful. When you appear at the end of a ride it is very hard to know how to get to anything. The big lazy river ride takes you around the whole park but it is hard to know where to get off if you want to get to a specific place. Bring waterproof sandals/flip flops, as the floor is Very hot.

Endless fun. I had a great time in Aquaventure Waterpark with my family. We went there, as a birthday gift to my son, who just turned 7, so he can have a very special day to remember, rather then the usual gifts. One of the best thing was that we managed to get a special day pass offer for residents, which made the whole experience less financially painful. After meeting the dolphins you have a Starbucks coffee to start your day with, and then a few hours later we ended up at a place called Barracudas.The staff was smiling and polite and you have an amazing variety of burgers ,pizzas, Asian food...you name it.They even have a home made ice cream!!!I bought a big and colorful Atlantis Cup, that you can re-fill anytime with your favorite soda for just 8 dhs. The prices were reasonable and the quality of the food was good.The Gift Shop and locker rooms are just around the corner, simplifying you life , if you forgot any essentials or want to keep your valuables safe.We ended up in Shark Bites, which is another great place to eat and great Meal-Deal offers.I highly recommend this place, as everyone was very professional and nice.

Amazing - a must do for any visit to Dubai. I went on a warm 42 degrees day in May - would definitely recommend going on a weekday. We choose midday as the sun isn't as harsh in Dubai until around 2 pm. The Lazy river is great and good to start out with as it breaks you in. Try both the rapids and Torrents and recommend you use one of the provided inflatables - we used a double. Then head off to the main tower called the Ziggurat where you can carry your inflatable up for a fairly adrenaline filled ride. You can meander back to the other rides as you are guided through. When this done, I'd recommend the Leap of faith - which is all of 3 seconds through the shark tanks. Make sure you cross your legs and arms and hold your nose. Make a valiant effort to open your eyes and you will see shadows of the Sharks as you go by. If you are still up more thrills, head over to the second tower where you share the slide in round rafts with around 5 others. There are handles to hold onto but not much else. There are 2 slides here which are both thrilling but there is also a verical drop down a chute called Posiedon's revenge. You stand in a see through pod which has a trap door and rhe pod is closed. Then the operator presses the button and the trap door drops. I stepped on but couldn't continue with this one (after spurring and convincing a stranger to try it!).You can head to the beach after for a dip in the sea or back to the lazy river. Would recommend purchasing a locker when you buy your ticket and removing your sunglasses but keep your flip flops. Also you can register for a free ticket for your birthday - you need to print the email out and take with you. Overall a fun day out but don't buy any of the snacks or drinks here as they are overpriced.

Great for everyone!. We went there today which was a Sunday (29th May '16) and it was great! The waterpark wasnt overly crowded, and the queues for the rides took no longer than 5 minutes! It did get a little busier after the 2-3pm mark.. so the lines did get a little longer.We got there at about 10:15am and the place was just so alive! There are locker and towel hire available. The small lockers are able to fit a full average sized backpack. So there wasnt a need to spend the extra money on a larger locker.We spent just over 6 hours there - which is probably a lot more than some people would stay.. but we were able to go on every ride and the lazy pool was amazing! We ended up going back and just spending the last hour and a half there.There were rides for all ages. A section for the children and of course, the more thrilling rides. You could also pay an extra fee to do some of the other things provided such as swimming with the dolphins or taking the zip line from one ride to another.I've heard about people jumping queues there where the lifeguards just let them in, but had only experienced it once on one of the rides.We ate at the 'Shark Bite' restaurant and the food was okay. Food is quite expensive. We both got a small cheeseburger meal... and couldve really opted for a large meal and halved the burger!Remember to wear thongs/flip flops as the ground gets extremely hot.The ticket prices were quite expensive in my opinion, but we really made a day out of it and had so much fun! Hope this helps! Safe travels!

Ok.... It is good fun with some good slides however I don't think it's worth the money. It doesn't have a deep pool for adults which is a downfall. On the other hand, it does have a beautiful beach in the within in. The slides are good fun but there's not much variety.

Brilliant day out! . I thought the Aquaventure water park was amazing! My boyfriend and I spent a full day here and never got bored. The lazy river is a brilliant feature as it takes you to several attractions such as water slides, the Rapids and torrent, so it is a brillaint way to see the park and chill out. The slides at the park are fun and thrilling. I especially loved the slide that went through the aquarium as it was amazing to float through the middle of the tank and see the fish whilst on a slide. Definitely works visit!!

Fun fun fun. One great thing to do in a sunny hot day.. You can get there by car, monorail or you may choose to stay at the Atlantis next door. My whole family had a great time. We enjoyed the water slides, the pools and tubing down the river like experience, and the food was also good. During the middle of the summer is a bit crowded and hot. So use some foot protection as well as sunblock lotion. We were having so much fun that by the end of the day we were exhausted and felt like we have been in a boxing match. We made to our beds at the hotel that was just near and just waiting for us, as well as a good massage. I recommend it to everyone. The second visit I made it to both the water park and the aquarium. I recommend you to buy a combo ticket. One can see many marine species. And enjoy the charming exhibits of the lost city of Atlantis and interactive shows. Just a lots of fun.

It was nice but not worth the price. The rides are not too busy but people do get stuck in the rides which put me off. I liked that there was access to the beach but there is so much construction around that the sand feels more like a construction sand rather than beach sand. You have to pay for towels and lockers on top of £50 entrance to the park so it sure if it's worth it. It was a fun day and the rides were ok but I've been to better parks. Also there are normal water slideshow the fancy scary ones so if you want a couple of thrilling rides and an OK beach go here.

Wow . Stayed at Atlantis for 8 days has the wow factor amazing water park spotless clean so much variety didn't manage too see all the park being that big' queues weren't that bad & plenty off helpful staff around

Everthing . What a water park it was included with our stay at the Atlantis.The day whizzed by .Safe ,clean well maintained .I did hear people moaning about the price of food and drink and it makes us smile you must remember where you are ? In Dubai in a desert on the end of a 5km man made island in a five star hotel!!!!! Come on people.Will go back.

fun, fun and more fun :). I am not a big fan of water fun but my friends convinced me to go with them. I am soooo glad that I went! They had to drag me out of there even after the part closed :) you have to try it

Great day. Waterpark was a great way to keep cool in the heat. Lazy river had rapids also so not just a boring tide. We all had a fun time on all the rides and enjoyed having the beach there also . The beach was fairly empty and quiet with plenty of loungers. Only gripe was you had to carry your own tubes to the rides unlike others we've been to. It was well worth the money to get in and a great laugh.

Splashing time. There is a wide variety of rides and things to do here. The best for me was the rubber ring ride that went through a tunnel fish tank meaning you can get up close. There is lots of additions you can do here as well, including swimming with the dolphins which is a great experience. I would recommend wearing waterproof footwear as the floor was extremely hot.
Amazing. Went with 2 friends.Great experience, make sure u bring a waterproof phone case. . . Or u can buy one there.Lockers are provided with good security (small fee)

Second time for mom & dad . First for our preschooler .. Best place in Dubai for family fun and to cool of the hot Middle East sun . We totally loved the kids swimming pool / playground. You only need to take your bathing suit, everything else is available there (some for an added price) : towels , lockers , showers , shampoo , hair dryers , food , even a mini store that sells swimming gear .. Loved it

Real Adventure. This is one of best place to experience the adventure and enjoy the Dolphin activities, Dolphin Encounter & Sea Lion Discovery are bit expensive, but its a nice experience. Aquaventure River Rides are really good for all the ages.
What fun. Six of us spent the day here aged between 25-63 what fun, well worth the trip and made you feel so cool, beach was lovely and sea like having a bath. Loved it

Fun day out for all.... We squeezed every minute out of our day here. Prices suggest its a good strategy!It was busy on entrance ( (20 mins to pick up our pre booked Ickes ) and changing rooms a bit crowded on arrival and departure. But that was all worth it, activities were great fun. Left tired.

Fantastic!. Large water park with a lot of attractions - my favorite: The Tower of Neptune (really wow!), The Tower of Poseidon and lazy river. I spent a lovely time there - I hope I will come back soon!
Explore a unique experience. What a place this is near the Atlantis hotel. it was worth upgrading our stay at the hotel to have all attractions included! beautiful.

One of a kind . Visited this place when I stayed at the hotel for a few days, fully worth it for the whole family with is personally the most safest water park in the world in my opinion because of the life guards at every corner of the way so nothing at all to be afraid of. Even if you aren't staying at the hotel, please I recommend to go to this watermark at all costs

Best Aqua park in Asia and Europe. I have been here 6 times and Atlantis is my favorite location in Dubai. Posidesion 's revenge is the world most scariest ride and beach is also beautiful along with other rides such as leap of faith. Highly recommended.

Good fun. Wild Wadi a better day out though.... I'll start with the Cons. Very busy. Very hot (I know we're in Dubai) - not many covered areas and long walks between attractions. Also no water sprays on pathways which I know work extremely well from parks in the USA. To avoid this everyone is using flip flops all day and then having to carry them whilst on rides. Distinct lack of inflatables on the day we went. I thought the signage was poor also after the first section of the park and everyone seemed to be asking where to go for slides. Large sections of the connecting parts of the lazy river seemed to have no current whatsoever - I don't mind a bit of paddling but after the Rapids it was a bit ridiculous.Pro'sAwesome fun. The slides were very good and a great selection for all ages. The Rapids were good fun and connected nicely back with the lazy river (even if you did have to pull yourself along). Air Con food hall at the back of the park was nice to get away from the heat. Location - being on the Palm and next to the Atlantis is obviously a massive pull.Overall a good day out but I'd pick Wild Wadi if you go to just one of the Parks whilst in Dubai.

Good food, great service. When visited, I was amazed of interior decoration of the restorant and outside terrace with fantastic view toward the palm. The line toward the counter was running fast and my order had been taken by polite staff. Then I did not wait long until my meal was ready to take away. It is clean and peaceful place when you can relax and your dependents could fully enjoy the food and water slides.

Atlantis water park. Great day out a must if your visiting Dubai , kids will love it , a few sharp stones on the private beach though ! .............................,.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,, quite expensive for food and drink

LUSH WATERPARK. it is fantaboulus waterpark. we enjoyed the rides and had lovely time.
its a good thing to do in dubai. would suggest people if they want to enjoy in summer just go aquaventure park.

Nice sports in The Palm. Lovely creation in a desert and unbelievable. It required one full day and don't plan to go there in the afternoon or evenings. All the things are quite enjoyable and you need lot of time. Metro connection is available from the city centre.

Adventures. It is an amazing water park with many activities differs on ages . There is the Teenage's and adults water park and young children there is also a beach wh you you can just relax . Don't forget to take a swim with the dolphin

Best waterpark experience ever. Simply perfect is the best description for this park. Nicely built with many details, thrilling slides for all ages, beach areas, restaurants, a nice river to cruise around and an epic child adventure land within the area. This is a must see in Dubai if you have kids and also recommended to adults who love the thrill.

Fulfilled water theme park.. Exciting place for adventure water sports lovers. Quiet a lot fun for children as well. Disappointing factors is they are trying to make money in every possible way. Guest not allowed to take even their water bottle inside and ur forced to buy only from the shops inside. Rates of water and resdreshments are very expensive and if 1 person buys 2 bottle of water and some refreshments the price could be higher than the main entrance ticket

Fabulous rides at Aquaventure Waterpark!!!. I had visited Aquaventure Waterpark along with my family and trust me the waterpark is full of so many activities that you always want to come back. I along with my children repeated various water slides. The best thing of the Aquaventure Waterpark is that at every corner you will find the helpful guards to extend help. you feel confident that you are at safe place and there is no room for any incident. Secondly, the water was so crystal clear that you can enjoy the water rides without any hygiene issue in your mind. So for me the safety and hygiene at the waterpark is always very important which is very well taken care by the management of Aquaventure. I was the guest at Atlantis The Palm so with the special wrist band had the privilege to enjoy more..
Fun Adventure. It is a fun waterpark, very similar or even identical to the one in the Bahamas. we had a fun time, if you have the time and want some fun to your trip, it is a good option.

Loved it. Just loved this place, we went for the day and chose a relatively quiet Monday, it would be awful on a busy day but we really had fun, although I really bruised my coccyx on the torrent part of the lazy river, the bruise is black!, I shouldn't have done it twice!, pier pressure from my hubby!.The swim in the sea was fabulous also as the water was so warm.

3.......2........1....... Loved it, didn't have all that long in the park but made sure I did the 'biggies'. Poseidon's revenge and leap of faith, wondered why there were no queues at top top, then soon found out, especially when the wife missed taking a picture and I had to do it again.....you must do these two if you can!Also did the aquaconda which was also good fun and even the lazy river is excellent.
Aquaventure . They said you are different in water . boy! They were right.what a fun filled day in the aquaventure. Suits all ages and sizes .never a dull moment.just slather sunblock.

Fun. Must visit the aquventure... fun .. adventures... and good for kids .... thanks and good
Ahhh the ground to hot
Administrator. It is an amazing place for adult and children .. but its is really very expensive .. comparing with other countries

Enjoyable. Spent 7 hours here, enjoyed our time got a wonderful tan!!
Queues didnt take long at all we got on all the attractions besides one which was closed.
Plenty of things around.

Awesome. I have been to many many water parks over the years but this one wins big time. This is my second time to the park. It's fabulous. There are plenty of water rides for all ages and thrill seekers galore. If you just want to relax on a lounge chair you can do that as well. It's easier if you buy your tickets online prior to arriving to avoid the queues. Mind you both times I have been was in the month of May and we only waited for about 15 minutes. The rides were no longer than a 5 minute wait but I am sure in the busier months this will be a different story. Can't wait to come back.

Fun day out in Dubai. This is a brilliant waterpark! We were in a group of 4 and we had tremendous fun! The slides are amazing! Just excellent from start to finish.To give a negative the ladies changing room is not adequate in size/ services for a water park of this size. It was sickeningly warm when we were trying to get ready to leave. There was a queue for the showers and changing rooms. Kids everywhere! I couldn't wait to get out! It was a shame because we had such a great day.

Largest water slide in the world on a beach! Really?. This was a very fun and memorable day. Lots of water slides that seemed to be pretty standard. They claim they have the largest water slide in the world. I am not sure what that means as it didn't seem so. Also the shark attack water slide was not what I expected. It was actually quite boring. Overall, very fun day and we has access to the beach with a view of the Burj hotel! The views of Dubai were outstanding at the top of the water slides. Wish I had my camera.
Great day out for all. Fantastic day out. Very hot in the summer but the rides are all oprated efficiently. Had an enjoyable time with a group of friends. The "scary" rides aren't that scary....

Best day of our holiday!!. This is a day not to be missed!! The lazy river had us hooked as soon as we arrived, location was amazing, as were the views. We also went to the aquarium afterwards which I wouldn't recommend, it was small and not worth the extra bit of money, plus we had to leave the amazing water park early to go to it, which we wished we hadn't bothered

Expensive, but a good day out. We pre-booked our tickets to aquaventure which saved a bit off the entry price as we weren't staying at the Atlantis hotel.When we arrived at the ticket office area we were surprised to see the queue was bigger for pre-booked tickets compared to people paying on the day. We probably queued for about 30 mins which was a bit annoying, There is very little effort made to educate you on all the various options around buying lockers, towels, prepaid wristbands which would help reduce queue time and at least offer some form of entertainment. Once we were through the pain of the queue we dropped our things in a locker, unfortunately the first locker we'd been allocated was broken which wasted about 10 mins of our time. After this things got a lot better. The water park itself is great for adults and kids, my only other recommendation to the management would be to put up more maps to help find your way around the water park better.We visited on a Sunday to void the weekend crowds.
Fun Fun Fun. Fun for the kids, fun for adults. I love just floating around in the river and rapids. Come early to avoid long lines in the more popular attractions.

Amazing experience . My family enjoyed one day in aquaventure although it was sunny hot weather but water games were fantastic.
Additionally sand beaches we excellent for children.
We also enjoyed aquarium visit. Variety of entertainment channels satisfy all family ages.

Aqua and Adrenalin seekers dream come true !. We visited as a family of 4 with 2 kids
This is clearly. Must do and am thankful to well wishes and friends who gave us feedback on this to be on the list
What a delight ... The rides are amazing!
Kids had loads of fun
I wish I was a d again !

Great day. Started with the dolphin experience which was great and then a day in the water park.It's a huge site so never feels crowded. Lots of rides of different levels of terror so covers everybody.It's not cheap but worth it.Has access to two beachs which is also nice.Food and lockers inside expensive but always are at these things.

Great water park - minor changes would make it five star.. We visited on a Monday and arrived on the monorail just before opening.As per the other reviews we had to pay for a small locker (40 dhms) which was big enough for both our belongings and two towels.We also paid 45 dhms for one meal deal which was plenty big enough for the two of us to share.We had bought swim shoes which were very useful for when walking in the paths around the park.The rides were great, it was a bit of a bind having to cart the ring around with you rather than them being available in different areas.All in all it was a great day but not a cheap one!
Great Day Out. As staying at Atlantis entrance to the park is free and access is just along the beach front. Rides are great for both kids and adults

Amazing. Entry was around £40 but totally worth it, we get there at 10am and didn't leave until 5pm. Everything is clean, staff are helpful and we had a great time. We didn't bother with buying sunbeds/cabanas as they are beds everywhere. You can buy a locker on entry and we just put our valuables in there and left our towels and sun cream on the beds - nothing went missing.So many rides from the huge lazy river to the 'Leap of Faith'. There are also a few hidden extra rides that find along the way. The beach is a literally on the edge of the park and you can then go and swim in the Palm.

Great waterpark but with faults! . The waterpark was good in general. The rides are fun and there are some great thrills to be had. This is our third visit to Aquaventure and I feel that the overall cleanliness has slipped. Also, there were many areas closed off during week days like the river entrances at the top and even the pools. Having stayed here for two weeks and entering the waterpark on most days, this is a regular occurrence. This is quite frankly ridiculous considering the amount of money you spend to visit. There were no lifeguards at the two highest sections of the waterpark so the children weren't allowed to even paddle and yes I realise safety first but when you see the gentlemen with blue tops and clipboards (team leaders as they are known and too important to even smile or greet you) sitting down in the shade having a joke and laugh instead of sorting out the situation, it can really rile you!!!!! Maybe they could step in?! I do feel for the lifeguards that have to tell you it's closed, it must really get them down!!!! Here's an idea - sort out the schedule before hand! Employ more people. Team leaders step in when there is a shortage? If it is a money saving ploy then shame on Atlantis!

Enjoyed it thouroughly. Must visit!!. All the rides are super exciting .. some of the rides are so scary, you should experience each and every one at least once ( and surely once wont be enough for you ) this was the best part of my Dubai visit
Water and people mix up. Just relex and start Dont forget, it takes approx 5 hrs to cover each and every ride ....Well managed and maintained.Thrill with joy Give yourself a free fall .Happy holidays

If i could be in one place for the rest of my days..... If you've been here, give up now folks cause it doesn't get much better than this.I've only been to Dubai three times and i can't even remember how many times i've been here. I'm not even kidding, i'd return to Dubai simply for this place. Everything about it is perfection.Oh, and go on the coffin ride you scaredy cats.

Great Day at Atlantis Aquaventure. This was a great day at Atlantis Aquaventure. We spent the day last Thursday and were welcomed by staff at the Aquaventure ticket office. In particular, I would like to thank Deepak and his team. Furthemore, I must mention the excellent care and professionalism shown by William our personal concierge. We booked a Combo ticket which allowed us all day access to the main water park, as well as entrance to The Lost Chambers. We also booked a Family cabana which was lovely. Plenty of room, with 4 lovely sun loungers, dining table and 4 chairs, under the cabana. Furthermore, 2 large lazy boys and a good sized hammock. 12 bottles of water in a large cooling box with fruit was provided. A large wardrobe space with safety deposit unit is also provided with the cabanas. Towles are provided. We were glad to have taken the cabana as the park got extremely busy with little umbrellas and deck chairs available. The cabana area is large and marked out. Staff are attentive at not allowing others into your cabana area. During the day, we did not get the chance to try all the rides as the park caters more for teens and adults, rather than young kids. As we had our 2 year old daughter, we enjoyed the lazy river and kids water section which was huge and great fun. I got the chance, when my wife and daughgter were sleeping, to try the Leap of Faith ride within The Tower Of Neptune. Outstanding. Overall, a very good day out. We then finished our day around 4pm by a lovely and refreshingly cool experience at The Lost Chambers.

expensive and awesome. been there on my birthday so i got free entrance in water park. we had a great day and leap of faith one of most thrilling experience i had but from tickets to water bottle everything is so expensive. dnt forgt your swim suit,water bottles and sun screen.
Best thing to do i Dubai. Best thing to do in Dubai. We spend their entire day and it still wasn't enough. Pricey food, so bring your own snacks

Great park. This waterpark is nicely situated as it is also on the beach so you can relax and swim in the sea too. There was a good selection of slides including two trapdoor ones! There was a very good slide with conveyor belts to bring you up at speed too. I'd recommend wearing sandals as the ground is very hot. You won't be able to wear them on some of the slides but you can leave them at the bottom and collect them afterwards.

Hoo wow. Can't visit Dubai and not visit here. Very lovely waterpark with everyone enjoying. No matter how you want to get, from leisurely drifting down to absolutely mind blowing, vertigo inducing but absolutely safe attractions, this park has it all. Be sure to rent a locker for your stuff. Works best with groups. Moderately easy to access by Metro then monorail or taxi for a group.

A place with bad security. we went to Aqua venture Friday 19th of may. If you are going to have a memorable memories so you don't have to go their at all. very crowded everyone their is in a hare and do not want to wait for queuing due to the week management.in this day they closed at 4.30 because they have a special event! but i have been shocked when i sow a family of 4 persons payed the amount and enter at 4.15 !! and they asked them to leave the park because they are closing after 15 minutes !!someone stole my wife sleeper !! and when i asked the security he told me its normal we are facing this problem daily !! waw what a great answer from him.i payed 1790 DHR for me and my wife for the entrance and dolphin bay but the surprised thing is that i have to pay 60 DHR to have a locker for us !bad experience the park but good one in the dolphin bay only.

A definite must while on holiday. Great waterpark. Lots of good slides and rides and the food is wonderful too. A tip, make sure you take and wear flip flops as the ground is boiling even at 11 in the morning! The lazy river is anything but lazy with rapids and waves and slides too. A really good day was had by all

Good fun for the kids. This is a mid-sized water park that is very do-able for half a day. The rides are fun but certainly not spectacular. The Lazy River is a good way to get from point to point. The kids enjoyed themselves and there were lots of fun food options onsite. Bit crazy on the weekends so go early and leave by 2pm.

Life time experience for the whole family or friends. Aquaventure water park is amazing it's something you have to see if your going to Dubai and the slides are awesome if you like to have a trill for kids and adults,so much different thing you can do in one park example dolphin swimming , aquarium where you see every fish ,sharks in the world.Shopping mall and many other thing you will never be disappointed.

Enjoyable as always . We had a fantastic day out at aquaventure, only for it to have to end early. The opening hours are from 10-18:30, however, when we went there it was closing at 16:30. When we were buying our tickets the staff member informed us that the park was closing early and if we were okay with that. Of course it had it be since we had made a costly taxi journey to the water park. I had been on their website the previous night and it didn't mention anywhere that they were closing early. Of course they didn't want to lose out in potential customers coming: not cool! Besides that hiccup, the day was enjoyable and I would recommend large families to buy the souvenir cup to get refills for 8 AED a refill.
super-the best aquapark. very big areas with good availability, the price of the locker is too hight, I recomend be here all day-only to the sunset, a lot of atractions-sharkslide etc.
Dubai trip. A fun filled experience. A good water park with a lot of fun water rides. A full day of fun time to be spent with the family. Enjoyed fully.

Fabulous fun filled and awesome Water Park with integrate marine life.. This water park is a child's dream come true with pools, waterslides and a miles of lazy river which circled the resort. It was calm in some parts but had rapid and a tidal wave at one section. There are many daring rides include the Leap of Faith, the Challenger Slides and the Serpent slide. For younger children there is Splasher's Kids Pool and several other kid's pools. Their slides which are second to none along with the marine life that's integrated into some of the rides –This place offers great time. Atlantis is a Paradise, which offers amenities for all ages!

Amazing Aquaventure. Free entrance as we have booked in the Atlantis Hotel, love all their rides, clean and organized plus there are fastfoods just before the entrance just in case your teenagers and little ones needed to refill their energy.

Excellent. Free to guests at the Atlantis. Great rides, free towels, plenty of sunbeds, food and drink reasonably priced. I accidentally left my wallet on display on my sunbed by the pool with a large amount of cash in. On my return a couple of hours later it was still there! Take flip flops to wear between the rides as the floor gets red hot.

#YourBetterInWater. I have lived in Dubai now for only 7 months but have been to Aquaventure 4 times already. I have been alone once, twice with friends who were visiting and once with my team from work. Such a great day out full of fun and entertainment. Just Love it!!! The food is also very good and far better than what you would expect from a waterpark. Visiting Nassimi beach at the end of the day for a sunset cocktail is a must too!

Expensive!. This is an expensive affair. To reach here requires a taxi or a monorail ride (priced at a steep 25AED return per person). We went for the Lost World aquarium (200AED/peson) and it was awesome. The collection of marine life that's available in this lost world aquarium is unparalleled and mesmerizing. I would definitely recommend this if you dont worry about value for money.
Too good!. The water slides : Poseidon's revenge, Leap of faith are just too good and a little scary at the same time. It's expensive but worth a one time visit and experience!

The best, immaculate at all. even though this attraction is bit expensive but must visit attraction in Dubai. Safety and service is paramount, friendly staff, immaculate place. Kids to adult have plenty option. Will agree if this is the best in the Middle East. So fantastic attraction

A Splendid Splashing Time!. Great rides to entertain adults and children alike for a whole day! The Leap of Faith - a 60-foot almost-vertical drop - is a must for adventurous adrenaline junkies. Aquaventure Waterpark promises a great time for people who are enthusiastic about water rides and want to have a great time out!

Great in the hot tempreture. We took advantage most days of our free entry to the water park. One of the bonuses of staying at Atlantis. The quickest way to get entry is to take one of the beach golf carts from one of the stops near the pools. The cart then stops at a kiosk for you to get your entry bands for the day. The floor gets very hot in Aquaventure so be sure to take some footwear you could take with you on a ride. We always try and get sun beds near the beach. There's a grass bank, under the trees which is a popular location to have as a base.
Amazing rides. Excellent water park for children and adults.The rides are great fun even though overall its a little expensive but then its the Atlantis

Thrilling!!!. An absolutely amazing place! Take on the bucket list for sure!!! Take proper attire with yourselves and don't miss any ride! You've food courts, lockers, souvenir shops and apparel shops!
excellent place for fun. we booked this for our group and i can say it was worth while.many rides and pool area. the beach was not so good and although play full.

AWESOME. we stayed at the Atlantis and the waterpark and everything around it was include, this is the best waterpark i've ever been, my favorite part was the slid you can see the fishes, i love it :) my kid love the kid area, we loved it!
Clean and adventurous water park. It is a very clean and attracts only decent crowd at the water park , hence no nuisance is there. Its a must go
Fun Water day. Great water park with plenty of amenities and water slides fro all ages. Great day and free to enter if staying at Atlantis.

Great day. A huge water park with something for everyone. We were cagey about visiting given that my wife had only just recovered from a neck injury, but on the advice of an acquaintance and using a little bit of common sense we found plenty here to enjoy. Those rides that we were comfortable enough to try were great fun and great way to cool off from the 40c sun. We made two visits during our visit to Dubai the first we choose to add on the tour of the aquarium (which is small but impressive) and on the second visit we also did the Sea Lion discovery which was an amazing experience.
Good Experience and Fun. Second time to experience aquaventure, awesome attraction and fun, especially the the both leap of faith, must try once.

Good day out. We really wanted to visit Atlantis, so we combined the Aquaventure waterpark with the aquarium. Was not so impressed by the waterpark, but the shark tank slide was a unique experience, it was worth visiting just for that. There is a stand where you can rent go pro cameras to capture all the nice memories of the day, came very handy since we forgot our water camera at the hotel! Overall it was a good visit
Wow!. Amazing rides, plenty of sunbeds/umbrellas/towels/clean toilets. Make sure you get there for 10am to make the most of no or little que.

Thrills and spills. This is a water park for all the family. Here you have three sets of water slides, one for toddlers and children, one for the family, and one for the more adventurous. When I say one, I mean one area as there are multiple slides in each area. Then there are refreshments toilets, lounges, umbrellas and a fabulous ride in tubes on the flat. A great day for all!

Its another man made adventure. You will get sea zoo visit while in you're shopping complex,multi varied sea animal even shark are in aquarium also you got chance to touch them by touching glasses.Also by paying extra dirham you can have boat rude on top floor.

A waterpark full of disappointments!. First of all I want to say that the slides were pretty good but that was the only good thingDisadvantages:Very expensive food (60DHS for a burger without fries or drinks)Many queue jumpersThey don't allow aqua slippers on rides only in poolNo good signs (signs only say:food court,rides)THE NAMES OF THE RIDES ARE NOT MENTIONED The bus to the car park takes so long and there is only one bus

Great for families!. I have been to Atlantis Waterpark a few times now and it gets better every time! I took my 4 year old this time and he loved it! The kids bit isn't massive so I would recommend going early to get a lounger near this area if you have small children but my son loved the lazy river that much we ended up spending the majority of the day here!Worth the day pass!
G. Excellent restourant, enourmous dishes, wonderful view. Nice beach in front of the restourant. Fjrjwkw

Amazing water themepark. Great water themepark at Atlantis with a lot of different rides.It is fun for everybody: old or young. Just get in a tube and enjoy your day. It is expensive, but worth a visit.Negative: it allowed that people smoke inside. In front at changing rooms etc there are a lot of smokers.

Good place to chill. Big water park with a river kind of attraction, which has a long encircling route to all attractions, get into it with a water tube, which is big enough to accommodate you and there is a double sitting tube too. There could have been a open water slide to enjoy more, you will find one big and very vertical open slide from top only. Kids splash pool is a big fun for elders too.If you are Atlantis room guest then its free for you. You can enjoy it on the day of arrival as well as on the day of checkout, keep your luggage with hotel and can enjoy Aquaventure again after surrendering your room.

Guaranteed family fun!. This is my second time to experience Aquaventure, but this time around we brought our 4 yr old son for the first time in Dubai and this place was on top of our list. As expected he had an amazing time inside the waterpark! The place is perfect for a family day out, lots of slides and adventures! The place was clean and kept pretty well. We came at a very busy day but inspite that we felt safe with all the lifeguards at every corner and looking very alert in the stations that we have passed. The staff was also very polite and welcoming, We didnt get the chance to sit in the sun lounges as it was always full so perhaps some additional seats would be great...but then again who needs to sit when you have a toddler who runs everywhere! Will definitely be be back again!

Good attractions but expensive extras. Free entry for guests of Atlantis so no idea what cost would be for day visitors .Lots to do but if you want to eat /drink be prepared to spend money .There are queues for most attractions .

Adventure!!!!!!!. We went with our friends and we had so much fun!!! Must go place in dubai... Search all the places around, walk to the beach, go see the dolphins, off course all these after the water slides...

Very very expensive. Not only is entry expensive but so is food and drinks, even water! The rides are good the beach area fun but I am not sure it is value for money. Disney is just as good and far less expensive. Rather spoilt by the noise From construction work going on near by. Also it took ages to get off the island because of traffic. I don't think the cost for a family would be worth it.
Fun place for any age. Perfect place to spend full day, so much offered for any age and interest (Aqua-park, sunbathing, dinning, shopping, educational) Simply perfect .
Amazing , Amazing, for all family members. you will need a full day , go at 9 and leave at 6 , don't go in summer "June to Sept" it will be very hot and humid
wow full masti. perfect waterpark and very discipline and co operate all staff members and very natural waterpark ,must go this place
Aquaventure Waterpark. Here you can get a great adventure ever using your own swimming tube I had a great time with my friends during our business day ;)

Summer Fun. Recently revisited Aquaventure after a few years' break and thoroughly enjoyed the day there, now that all of the "newer" rides are open. Great fun had by my 3 kids - who we rarely saw for the whole day - and a bit of a more relaxed time by the beach away from the hectic of the park. Despite the heat, you can manage to stay cool in the many water options and of course the loads of covers available to beat the sun!

A must do. Fabulous!!!. One of the best water parks we have visited, and we have been to many over the years with my 10 year old son. The water slides, Rapids & wave tunnel are exciting and fun. The children's water pool is amazing with this huge contraption with many slides, stairs and water buckets & hoses. It's a treat for kids. We even had a dolphin adventure where we interacted with a dolphin and swam with it. An unbelievable experience.

Great place lots of fun. We came on a Thursday in May and as we were staying at the hotel it was free. Get there early as easy to ride things without others. The first time round on rapids was great early as wasn't to many people later in day was much slower and easy to split up with group due to so many people. Rides are great for all ages caters for all types of rides. Had lots of fun and really enjoyed it. Towels are free for guests of hotels I'd read somewhere you had to pay but not when staying at hotel. We only stayed half the day didn't think it was worth staying all day as a couple - if you have kids I'm sure a whole day would be worth it - but would recommend if staying at hotel as free

2nd best water park after Wild Wadi Park. We had aquaventure watepark package in our hotel package of Atlanstis so we could use the park twice. I will say Wild Wadi is better than Aquaventure Waterpark for kids and families as most of the area in Wild Wadi was useable for kids where as Aquaventure rides were not ALL suitable for small kids PLUS Kids are not allowed to go to some rides so 1 of us had to stay with kids down and other will for up for rides and stand in queue. It was alot of time waste as we went to the park quite late in the evening. Pictures were very expensive to buy. Didnt know that you need to tell the camera guys to take your family picture. You dont get nice pictures done if you dont grab a camera man who will be everywhere in the parks. Dont forget to buy your waterproof phone cover (worth the money, you can buy from park shops or cheaper to buy from your own countries)

Good and fun however . . . .busy and expensive. OK it is a must do certainly if you have (teenage) kids and they do have some great rides. However the value for money part is a bit out of balance and it was very very busy when we were there. Be on time there are enough floats however only limited amouts of beds certainly if you want them in the shadow.

A must experience !. We went to this aqua venture as a family. The place is very organized and well kept. The bathrooms and changing rooms are convinient. The life guards stationed at each point are well trained and very polite. People of all age groups can enjoy this aqua venture. T shirts with shorts are also permitted. Lockers r available as well to keep your things. Rental towels are available at the site. You can walk around the place without sandals too.

Expensive average water park. I was expecting it to be an amazing water park but in the end it was as a nice waterpark. First of all bear in mind that it is expensive (around 65€) and food/activities inside are also very expensive. Some of the slides are huge and they are very tall. However, nothing exceptional that I hadn't seen in other waterparks. According to what people told me this waterpark is better than the other one, Wild Wadi which is older and smaller.The only reason why I gave 4/5 instead of 3/5 is because of the queue management. At least on the way when I went there I didn't have to wait much for the slides

Water Park 16. This is the best place where you can have fun for the complete day and it is so fun that you will never like to come back. The place is full of surprises and it brings out the small boy in you.

Good water park... but expensive. Went there for a day, its quite expensive but it worth it, we had fun, there are good slides for adult, great beach too, but food and drinks are unbelievably over priced, i paid 17 dhms for a small bottle of water!!

Not what I expected. It was not what I expected... its not an adrenaline-full adventure, rides are pretty avarage... BUT it's not a bad thing, I really enjoyed it, it was sooo relaxing, took a nap on the beach, swimmed on a private sea, you can just hop into your inflate and go through the river 1000 times worrying about nothing, it has rapids, waves, some small rides (non adrenaline feeders) but it is entretaining and relaxing. Worth

Funkadelic Waterpark, A must for Adrenaline Junkies. Aquaventure Waterpark, at the palms dubai is an incredible outing for all those who are above 1.2 meters tall. The best ride has to be the leap of faith!...there are a lot of steps to climb but, for the ride down....its completely worth it. I went on it 8 times in total. Poseidens revenge and leap of faith are pretty similar, with the near freefall experience. You only feel scared for the first two times...the third time onwards, you feel like going again and again...trust me, you have to go on it twice atleast!...the first time will be a shock as you wouldnt be expecting it. There are two lockers...one next to barracudas, the other one next to the entrance. Leave EVERYTHING in the lockers except water bottles, slippers, which are required as the floor gets very hot, spectacles (if you own a pair) and a towel...If you like to keep your eyes open, do bring swimming goggles.I brought along two bags a big one and a small sling one...no one touches your bag or things...i was away from my belongings for 2 hours and nothing happened. So lets your bag bake in the sun and go enjoy the rides.

Fun fun fun. You want fun under a hot weather? That's the place to be! Fantastic toboggan for small children youngs and adults! Very clean and very well controlled. Nice variety of food cafés. That's really a very nice attractions to do with family or friends

Biggest water park of the world. We visited aquaventure water park which is adjacent to atlantis hotel. The water park is very large in terms of area and the quality of water rides. There is a different class altogether which is nothing comparable or even close. Really loved it

Brilliant Afternoon. We spent from 1230 until 1800 at the waterpark and had a fantastic time!Tickets were previously booked, however we did pay extra for use of one locker. We took our own towels as didn't want to pay to rent any. The park appeared busy but at no point did we queue for longer than 5 times to go on each of the slides. The only issue I would think of is that the food actually in the park is all very much fast food. Great afternoon!!

This is a Must Place in DUBAI. This place is an amazing for Families, even just for couples that want all the Water entertainment that this place offers. Although it is expensive still worth the money for it. This is a must place to be, so who ever is going to visit Dubai it is worth a day stay in this place.

Great Waterpark!!!!. We stayed at Atlantis & had free unlimited access to the waterpark. Even if I was not staying there I would pay to go to this park. Great selection of water rides, rapids, tudes etc etc. Huge park with plenty of room for couples or families.

Could spend a whole week just here. Such good fun - from gliding round on the donuts to chilling in the warm weather. All of the rides were brilliant and there never felt like huge queues which was great. Only shame was that none of the photographs we'd gone to the trouble of scanning at each ride didn't work. So we don't have any photographic evidence that we hit the big rides!
Splash. Love it one of the best water parks in the world the last river goes for ever so much to keep you entertained
Holiday tour. Aquaventure in Dubai tour is excellent experience .it's very very enjoyable n happy movement fr youngsters n children .
Fun. Great day, not as busy like most water parks. Lots of good rides. Only negative was the traffic and road works. Took 45 minutes to get off the island.
Crazy Rides!. This water park has some amazingly freaky and fun water rides.A place where you get can spend entire day where you forget every

Fun under the Arabian Sun!. Really great waterpark, with plenty of space to relax with the many 'beaches'. The Lazy River is real fun and not that lazy every now and then. Would advise to accompagny small kids, as some parts are bit more challenging. Also plenty of spots for getting some drinks and food. If you're willing to spend the money, swimming with the dolphins is a really great of course. As the 'shuttle' service is constantly on its way, it's easy to use it as hop on/hop off service. Bottom line, great place to visit for at least a day, whether or not your a guest of the Atlantis The Palm hotel.

Clean, scary . Probably the best waterpark in Dubai . The best part about it is the cleanliness and the crystal clear water all around . Very scary slides . Lots of them . Water temperature is nice all around . The best part is their flowing river . Good place to relax if you want a city break for a day
Average experience . Had high hopes but no of rides arent much. I would rather visit the adlabs imagic or essel world waterpark. Had fun but more of tube rides that u guys get to go for.

Best Waterpark in the UAE. I've been to Aquaventure a dozen times, because it is one of the nicest waterparks in the UAE. Great rides, a special dolphinarium where you can swim with dolphins, a beach, etc. etc. Highly recommend this place, and also the Wild Wadi Waterpark. Wild Wadi has better and longer rides, but is an older waterpark with not as many amenities. But good nonetheless.

Marvellous experience !!. We visited dolphin bay at atlantis and booked for the shallow water encounter with dolphins. It was a bit expensive but perhaps a once in a lifetime experience. A full half hour interaction with our dolphin. We were in a group of 10 and each one of us got the chance to dance hug and kiss with our lovely dolphin. The package gave us access to all the rides of the waterpark and we tried a few which was great fun. Lunch at the park was really good with a lot of things to chooce from. The place IS CROWDED which is expected but if you go earlier in the day things seem a lot better !! I am an animal lover so i dont regret i did this and i will always treasure the memory !!

Great water park. Another good water park. Lots of fun for kids and adults. Personally I think Yas Waterpark in Abu Dhabi has much more to offer children. Still this one is great fun especially hot months.

Fun day.. We had such a great time here. Lots of different activites/pools to experience and a beach to chill on. Negative is the extremely long line to get your tickets even when pre bought and the lack of sunchairs/areas to sit at. Would absolutely recommend a visit.
Best Water Park. Love this water park, strong competition with wild wadi so always making improvements. Can even go and sit on the lovely beach if water parks aren't your thing

Very nice but extortionate . Had a lovely time but had to pay 680AED for 2 entry tickets and a locker. I will definitely recommend buying your ticket online In advance, getting a local to buy it for you( they get a huge discount) or buying it in person a day or 2 before your visit. Once inside try the leap of faith and Poseidon drop but please note that both of these are not for the faint hearted or young children but a lot of fun though. Definitely worth a visit if you got nothing else to do

Wow! What a great water park!. Having looked around on-line for waterparks in Dubai, my wife and I opted to go for the Aquaventure Waterpark. What a great place! We went on a Monday so the waterpark wasn't too busy and there were hardly any queues which was great. The most we waited for any ride was about 10 minutes and that was only for the large water raft rides.The waterpark is really clean and very well presented.They have a great selection of water rides for ages. I particularly loved the 'water coasters', the rapids and the large water raft rides.This is one of the best waterparks I have been too and is definitely up there in comparison to the Disney waterparks in Florida.Entry isn't cheap however it is well worth the money if you spend the day on site. If it is your birthday (or the week after), make sure you sign up on-line for free entry for your birthday week. A great promotion that they run!When arriving on site you get the option to 'charge' your wristband (entry pass) with money in order to purchase food/drinks etc. on site. This is a great idea as it means you don't need to carry cash/cards etc. with you for purchases and saves you having to return to your locker. Any money you don't spend is refunded when you leave.On the note of lockers, these are really big and one locker will easily have enough space for two adults.An excellent park which we look forward to visiting again soon.
The adventure does not end. Excellent rides , thought a bit expensive when I convert in INR . Its really very clean and safe too

Aquaventure FUN!!!. We did this our last day in Dubai and what a blast we had. All the rides were totally thrilling especially leap of faith and zoomerangoride.ive been to wild wadi as well and can say without a doubt this is way better water park.you can also enjoy sitting down by the beach as well.bit pricier when purchasing at the park itself as online tickets are much cheaper.
Excellent for the whole family. We visited the aqua park end of April.The weather was brilliant.It was not crowded and we had a lot of fun.

Too few rides, too many queues . For a city that does everything in extremes, this water park is far too small, far too overpriced and very very busy.Queuing takes about 15-20mins per ride and the majority of them are pretty average. For a little adventure in the South of France, this is acceptable. But for a £70 day out in Dubai? Not good enough. Everything costs money. You want a towel? Money. A locker? Money. I really sing understand why it's so busy. Or why this does so well on TripAdvisor.The aquarium next door is similarly disappointing. There's nothing really 'wrong' with it, but for such a high profile resort in Dubai it's a let down.We didn't stay at the hotel that accompanies this resort, but would be wary to. I can't comment on the accommodation but it is quite some distance from the city and transport isn't particularly reliable.Avoid.

Amazing!!!. We went to Aquaventure for my Mum's 40th and it was just... Brilliant. There were loads of sunbeams available and even some alongside the beautiful, clear, white sandy beach. They filter the water going into this part of the Palm so there are only fish and some clean water. My only minor complaint would be that walking on the footpath connecting Aquaventure to the beach and Dolphin Cove is like walking on hot coals... Regular water spray there would be great :)

Simply wicked !. I visited the leap of faith at Wild wadi years ago did the same here at the Atlantis and let's just say it was worth it ! If you love adrenalin then this is a must. The water park itself is fab for family fun and just adults you simply cannot go wrong here ! Simply the best !

Good but not great. Me and my partner had really been looking forward to this but we actually left a little dissapointed.On arrival we found the staff at the booking desk to be a little unhelpful and disinterested in any questions that we had.Once we entered the park we did really enjoy the rides even if there are lots of steps up to them(if you are disabled or have walking difficulties i wouldnt even consider going hear)The lifeguards on duty are lovely always smiling and laughing with the customers these guys are great and probably dont get the recognition they deserve.We found most of the customers in hear to be pretty rude and arrogant, most other people we have met in Dubai seem lovely genuine people but hear people seem to forget normal rules of decient human behaviour The whole experience hear just left us a little underwhelmed it all just felt a little manufactured and naff i would not return when next visiting Dubai

Too many queues.. . Great day out but just too big for my liking and the queues for entry can be horrendous. Take the monorail as the carpark is a pain. Inside the park has far more attractions than WW including a dolphin adventure but you will pay extra for it. Not my cup of tea. Too false. Great slides though, but not the best or scariest. Give it a try.. you'll love it.

SHARK SAFARI is a waste. I don't recommend the shark safari for anyone. There are only a handful of sharks and they are very small. Most of them laid in the corner and were hard to see. We didn't get any cool pictures with the sharks. I was more impressed with the stingrays. you'll pay roughly $100/ person. ITS NOT WORTH IT. You'll get no more than 20 minutes in the tank which consists of mostly fish. They do not refund for any reason whatsoever.The waterpark is ok but YAS is way better!!

Shark safari is a must!. Fantastic park with plenty of rides and activities to keep you entertained for the entire day! There were virtually no queues on any of the rides which was perfect! Plenty of inflatable rings and sunbeds available all day long.Definitely try the shark safari activity! Booked this as a surprise for my boyfriend's birthday who has an ear condition which prevents him from most water activities. The special helmets prevent your ears and face from getting wet and also help to keep the pressure the same!Fantastic experience getting so close to the sharks and sting rays! The whole experience was 30 mins long.

Good, not great.... Just home from a day at Atlantis Aquaventure. We had a really nice day, but it wasn't amazing - and for all the hype, and the price, that's what I expected! Food was good, ice cream was good, staff were good, rides and slides were good, aquarium is good, queues were good (esp before lunch), cleanliness good, safety good. Lots of things were good...And there were no big negatives either - but lots of small ones... - remote parking with shuttle bus; - bus drop off point not really convenient for entry; - slow ticket desk queue as only 4/12 counters open...- no map provided at check in - though they found one when I asked- an initial error in the price charged (quickly resolved when challenged); - a kids pool area that is brilliant for 5 year olds but has little to offer 2 year olds; - and way too small for core customer numbers (parents with little kids)which means too many people (and sunbeds) crammed in; - general signage is good but signage to each ride/at ride entry points is poor; - there's an illogical ziggurat ride system that forces everyone to fetch inflatable rings from a pool 100m away (why don't they have rings stocked at the ziggurat?); - one ride closed for maintenance (advised by a very small sign at the ticket desk);- one ride where you have to be 45kg to go on - which would have been ok except my sub 45kg 8&5 yr olds had already been charged full fare based on their height- you can pay for food using a wristband but the cash desk staff have no way of telling you how much stored value remains; - all in a huge site which seemed generally quite quiet and spacious except around the overcrowded kids pool.I'm not saying it's a bad place, but there is certainly room for improvement and, tbh, the wow factor just wasn't there. In my view, for families with kids (mine are 8, 5 and 2) it's not as good as Yas Waterworld or Wild Wadi (at similar prices), and even 'old skool' Dreamland offers more for a lot less.
Great day out. What a day ... we had a great time. I would suggest taking pool shoes with you as the ground does get hot. We bought the refillable water bottles which we found saved money.

Nice enough but SOOOOO expensive. Included in the dolphin tickets is access to this park for a day. High light was shark attack where the last bit of the ride on the tube is through a tunnel in the shark and predators tank so it's like you are in the aquarium under water. My 7 year old loved it. She just made the height restriction (phew !)Some of the rides are actually pretty hair raising so do be careful with younger kids. The rotary tube ride around the park is pretty nice but we managed to get quite disorientated and didn't know where to get off. Couple bare feet on boiling hot walkways it made our getting back to the rest of our party interesting but we managed to hitch a ride on the complimentary carts so alls well.Kiddies pool was nice but very overcrowded so i cant imagine what it must be like in peak holiday season.
