The prices are criminal though. Lunch for 2 cost over USD80. A large coke is USD 6-9. A potato chip stick thingy is USD 10. Although locals get a half off price, I struggle struggle with the prices and doubt we would go back. The whole of Dubai is overpriced but this makes Disneyland look modest by comparison. A real shame.

Loved it. Big park with loads of rides. We went over weekend. No doubt it was very crowded. It took an hour to enter and then each ride took it's own sweet time. Plan was to do high adrenalin rides and if time permits, try rest. But there was no classification of rides into difficulty/adrenalin level so we had to explore on our own. It also has a private beach. Best part was free entry for my wife as it was her birthday. Leap of faith and Poseidon's revenge are a must. Try shark attack too. You may find decent veg food too. We tried the burger and it was nice.

FUN FUN FUN. We went to Aquaventure on a rainy day and it was still awesome. The queue times on rides were not so bad and you could easily get a sun lounger with brolly. If you have a family make sure you take the the large locker!

Fun time! Needs some improvements!!. Buy a ticket online to save time and skip massive line at the cashier. Lockers are not necessary but you can take combo (Locker + towel) for AED 50. The food inside is pretty expensive. Average costs about AED 80/person.Finding tubes for some rides is HARD. They must store it in one place. All the rides are fun though the lazy river will get you stuck at a lot of points.
team building. we did our work team building and it was cool, good way to spend your afternoon and then hit it up let at other places.

Excellent Waterpark. Great fun. . This Waterpark is awesome. My teenage boys loved all of the water rides & insisted we return each day of our stay in Dubai. Quiet areas for those (me) who wanted to chill & read their book !! Excellent lifeguards. Highly recommend.

Atlantis water tour. Great place to be with family or couples located in a very big and beautiful hotel i been there more than 20 times. 2 times before the official opening of the resort and i will keep going there.I highly recommend it for all family

Very Good . We went here early in the morning and it was definitely the best time to go to beat the crowds. We arrived just before 10am and it was perfect. The park was empty and we had no queues. The park was very good. Not as many rides and I would have liked but none the less very good. The leap of faith is a much, and the lazy river is amazing. It has fast bits and tunnels to lead you to other rides. Would definitely recommend taking the time to go round all of it. It was very expensive too for the two of us and a locker but it is Dubai. It cost us well over £100.
Great day outing. The Aquaventure park was a fabulous day out for the whole family. There is something to entertain everyone from babies to adults.
Favourite place in the world. 3rd time at the Atlantis, I really should holiday in cheaper places but 'It's just so good' and will probably end up going back.

Simply Wooooow. Unbelievable and unimaginable experience for kids and adults.Kids enjoyed the special pool designated for them as well as the splash area. They enjoyed the lazy river and the wave river.On the other hand, we adults enjoyed the place and the rides....unbelievable adrenaline rush on the Neptune tower / shark attack...For those who cannot handle the rush, simple go to the beach and relax under the sun.Place is filled with restaurants and small food kiosks as well as a souvenir shop and several small retail shops. What is most astonishing is not the fact that cameramen are planted everywhere taking pix of u but the fact that there is a Go Pro rental booth to make ur visit unforgettable.If ur driving there, for ur convenience there is a huge parking lot where there are buses that pick u up and drop u off the location.If ur taking a taxi, make sure to leave early to u wont get stuck in the huuuuuuuge line up at the exit around 6pm. (closing time)MUST DO & EXPERIENCE
Fun!. Quite expensive to eat or buy drinks here. But this place is so much fun, got to act like a child again! also great for kids/

Excellent Park, Mechanical Failures. The children's zone was shutdown the bulk of our visit along with a few slides over our two day visit. The theme is great and decorations are great. Clean park. Friendly staff. Seemed to be a shortage of tubes available as people continuously asked me where to find tubes and we had trouble ourselves.
Too Crowded. amazing water rides but crowded. The lockers were chargeable even for hotel residents who are already spending on the room

Best experience with a water fun park. Never been to a water fun park so big and so many variety of facilities can play with joy! Suitable for kids and adult especially whole family to spend a enjoyable day at.

very nice. stayed at Atlantis for a week...the beauty of it is that hotel guests get unlimited access to Aquaventure..and you have a different ticket counter and different entrance....you also get free beach towels...there is a Golf buggy that is available for hotel guests to transport them back and forth to the Aquaventure. ..the park is lots of fun for everyone.....tried almost all the attractions since it was not a high season (April 22-29th)there are so many life guards which gives you a great sense of safety...the place is very clean. ..better to get there early to do the slides that are more popular to avoid the long lines. ..

Fun day out. We came first time to the park with our two young kids ages 4 and 21 months. They loved the kids section and spent hours there. Food is quite expensive by the pool. We enjoyed the adult slides as well when we got the chance to try them. I had a nice day with my Family

Fantastic!. Brilliant day out! Fun for all. Just remember to take your flip flops! The only downside. I forgot mine and had to fork out 275 AED or £51.64 for a pair which is just shocking - pic attached, I can confirm, they do not sing or dance or do anything else that a normal pair of flip flops can't do.

Great day out. We had an amazing day out at the waterpark. We had previously been to Wild Wadi, the greatest difference between the parks is Aquaventure is so much bigger! We bought our tickets online the day before so they were 60 dirham cheaper. We also took our own towels which saved us money. The park is very clean and the staff all helpful and friendly. We will definitely go back!

Service is superb !. We decided to do the water park on our last day and booked the tickets online as it was cheaper. The price including aquarium entry was about £62. Also at this time we noticed you could pre-book sunbeds at Neptune's retreat for £60 per couple this got you 2 beds , 4 towels and 6 bottles of water and was located in a fenced off area within the park. On arrival we were shown the red carpet treatment due to reserving beds everyone was very nice and helpful. At the retreat there is also a kind of consierge service where they will go and get your order for food and drink allowing you to enjoy other benefits of the park. The park itself has everything you could want except I think there could possibly be more individual flume rides. Overall we had a great day and I would highly recommend you reserving sunbeds at the additional cost.

What the website doesn't tell you...... So just been to Atlantis waterpark and had a cracking day, so much we got back to hotel and just zonked out. But there were issues which we didn't expect hence the review.....1) it seems to be the only place left back in the 20th century with regards to bookings In sense that you have to actually print the voucher and cannot show them on your mobile device, which is silly in this day and age so print the voucher if you have booked through viator or such. If you don't, you can go to the hotel business centre which is a good 10 walk through to the other side and pay to have it printed.2) hidden costs..... Atlantis do look after their own guests (which is fair enough). If you are visiting for a day trip, expect to pay 50AED (£10ish) for a towel and locker set (non refundable). They do search your bags on entry and you are allowed to take up to 1Litre of water per person so do it as they do charge Disney type prices for refreshments and such when in there.3) flip flops, take them!! The floor is hot hot hot so what you can do is wear waterproof flippys around the park and up to the slides, we found the lifeguards just threw them down the slide to the bottom to be there when you did, or you can leave them at the bottom as all slides were in same facinity.We had a great day and it was brilliant, but felt these points did need to be raised so not unexpected. Top tip, get there for half 9ish when hotel guests going into breakfast, found walked onto all rides until about 11ish

Excellent family fun. We got free entry to the waterpark included as we stayed at the Atlantis, the water park is a good size and there are plenty of rides to suit all ages, my 7 year old son loved the faster rider and the one off the top of the tower through the shark tank, my youngest who is 4 loved the kids area and spent most of the day there. The park is secure and had no fear of leaving our bags on loungers whilst we where on the rides and slides. Food in the park is expensive especially the drinks, luckily for us as we where staying at the Atlantis we would chill bottles of water in the room and then take these with us in a cooler bag also chilled bottled drinks are available in the monorail station for 3 to 4 dirhams. This is located just outside the entrance.Overall a great experience and would visit again, although the wild wadi is pretty much the same and more hotels allow free access to it.
Kids will love it. Friendly staff and great facilities. The adventure park is one of its kind. In addition there is the Lost Chambers where you can spend hours at end. Great for family and kids.
You can Spend Days Here. Fun for everyone no matter what your age. We were going to spend one day here but the child in my wife and I made us come back for a second day

Loved it, only fault is the hot floor!! . Me and my partner spent the day here as visitors and we had such a good day. They offer a locker service for 40 AED which is accessed by a wristband with a bar code on so you can't lose the key which is handy. We also got the meal deal for 40 AED each which includes a meal and a drink at one of the fast food counters in the park. Plenty of beds and stalls to get refreshments. There is a handy golf caddy that takes you from one end of the park to the other which helps a lot as the floor is so hot we both burnt our feet as you can't wear flip flops etc on the slides so could do with fountains wetting the ground like the water parks in Orlando have which I found really useful! Apart from that we had a really good day and the staff operating the slides and Rapids etc were all friendly. Would definitely go again but maybe wear some wet shoes!

Always The-something. Glass slides to sharks, great long rivers, panoramic view to Dubai, wonderful arranged park. Compared to Wild Wadi, Aquaventure is newer, has more slides and the slides are more interesting-speed slides or those where you sit on something and slide in a glass sleeve to the swimming pool with sharks-that's an experience to try

Simply amazing. I went with a friend on a Sunday and we had a lot of water fun. I wish i got there earlier. It is better to book online cos it's cheaper and arrange for a cab to come pick you up cos the queue for taxis gets really long after 6pm

Best water park I've ever been to!. We visited for my sister's birthday and were not dissapointed! The best water park I've been to in my life! The death drop slide was terrifying the glass floor literally disappears from underneath you and you hurtle vertically a few hundred foot! One of the slides goes through a shark aquarium! Top tip take a photo editing pouch with you to take photos because the ones in the park are expensive £25! The zip wire across the beach is fun too!
very nice experience. A great place with nice system for all family. specially if you try the ride on the river with underwater section

Very pricey and short opening hours. It's a great waterpark with a range of water attractions that you won't find anywhere else. The park itself is not that big and it's very crowded. We spent lots of times waiting on the queues for attractions that only last a couple of minutes. Also, the park opens at 10am and closes at 17.30, though at 16.30 they started closing some of the attractions. For the price of the ticket (around 75 euros), they could at least close at 19.00 like other bigger waterparks in Mexico, Spain and Portugal. Also, the general admission doesn't include anything else than the entrance... You'll need to rent a locker for 10 euros to leave your belongings (you can't carry your things with you and get on the water attractions with them). If you want pictures or food you'll need to pay 10 euros or more as well. Food is not allowed into the park and your bag will be checked before you're let in, they'll check it after you've paid for your ticket. They'll give you the choice to eat your food or dispose of it before going in. This does not appear on their website either.I recommend you go with a towel as otherwise you'll need to rent one as well, which you'll need to return anyway.Also, the only way to reach the park as a tourist is via the monorrail, which costs around 7 euros for the return ticket. We were shocked to know that we couldn't even keep the ticket for this tram. They won't let you outside the monorrail unless you return your ticket upon your arrival to the station.Though the waterpark and views to the Atlantis hotel are amazing, their greediness have made this park into a place I don't really recommend unless you have plenty of time in Dubai and don't mind spending lots of money for a couple of hours of fun and lots of time waiting in queues.

Nightmare to check in. We had pre purchased tickets so only needed wrist bands& to hire locker.we went on a Wednesday & not in the school hols,we queued for 60mins there was only 3 booths open there was 1 for Atlantis guests but only 1 person went in all the time we were waiting why oh why don't management say go there if nobody's waiting all it would take is taking a rope down& it would not stop preference to hotel guests,also the other side where you just purchased tickets the queue was only small but more booths opened.the experience was terrible before we got in.really enjoyed our time with rides etc ,went to the beach but no parasols or shade.we found food&drinks pricey & it was just the two of us.i did look in to cabana but with it only been 2of us no good but if there is a big group of you would be great.

Excellent and well laid out.. My family of four, 2 adults and 2 teenagers thoroughly enjoyed the waterpark. The queue at the beginning is a bit tedious but once inside there is a huge amount of space to find a quiet spot. Rides excellent and different range of thrills. Never did the absolute extreme ones but my kids rated them. Great day out but pretty expensive. Catch regular taxi to and from as works out cheaper than train and dont be caught by the more expensive taxis just outside entrance who have a lower starting rate but increase rapidly!

Great fun day out. My 5th time at aquaventure and I would always return - I think it is the best water park in Dubai. - great selection of rides from tame to terrifying!- new rides in Poseidon tower add good variety- friendly and helpful staff, always smiling and aiming to enhance your experience - tickets available in advance online - it's cheaper and you beat the queues- shuttle bus if you drive and park, very convenient - some long queues for rides - markers in the queue estimating wait time would be helpful

A faboulous day out for all the family.. Whilst this is an expensive day out it is worth every penny. Theme park companies in the UK should visit this attraction to see how to deliver the best. Customer service and safety is paramount and the whole place is immaculate. Even the drinks and food offerings are plentiful and reasonable priced. There are rides for all ages and levels of adrenaline junkies. It is worth paying the extra to get a private cabana where you get great service (loungers, towels water and fruit as well as being able to leave your stuff safely attended whilst you take on the numerous rides. Would definitely support the claim that this is the best in the Middle East and Europe. Awesome!

Great day out for all. Had a great day here, it's set in the grounds of the Atlantis Palm but doesn't intrude on the hotel. You can change and leave your valuables in a locker at an extra cost. You can also leave other items (e.g. sunglasses, t-shirts, etc.) by the rides and they were safe. It was clear they were safety conscious and occasionally you had to wait a short while to get onto the rides as they wanted to ensure the person before you had exited the ride fully. There are lots of hosts walking around offering help and support, the park was also extremely clean. There were lots of snack bars and restaurants around allowing you lots of choice. A fun day out which is highly recommended.

Had a Lovely day here. Went to this Waterpark as part of the celebrations of my Daughters 21st birthday, had a great time here, we took our own towels but you can hire them, its all part of The Atlantis Hotel although you cant gain access to the Hotel, guest only, plenty of sun beds, drinks and food pricey( but seems to be the norm in any waterpark)Tip- depending on when you go, ie school holidays etc, you might have trouble getting Taxis, we were lucky the queue for Taxis was small(we went in April 16)so we did not wait that long, friends of our was here over xmas period the queues were so long they ended up using the mono rail.

Great day out. Fantastic fun crazy day out, even if you aren't into the big water slides it's so nice to chill out in the lazy river!.As with all watermarks you will queue & the food & drinks are overpriced but I do think it is well organised.The transportation system to get to the palm is better now with the monorail, taxi queue at the close of day can be horrendous!

Thrilling Aquaventure! Adventure Adrenaline rush at its peak. Breath taking views from top of the water slides my experience was superb. It is important to be in a swimwear parachute material boxers for men or else you'll have to buy swimwear worth 300AED to 500AED go prepared for the adventure of a life time. The leap of faith slide is a must go scream on top of your lungs and take the leap.

A Perfect Family Place. When you come for Atlantis Aquaventure, you must visit The Lost Chamber Aquarium too (additional charge). But our tickets are included. We're lucky as the park was not so busy and we can play all rides.

A Fun Packed day out. We had a great day at Aquaventure.Having done the Water parks in Florida in November this was just as much fun and in April the ques were much smaller with the maximum que being a maximum of 10 minutes.The Lazy river and rapids were excellent and really enjoyed by both my kids who are 7 and 12 as well as my wife and I.The water Slides were lots of fun especially the Zoomerango!! although we did give the leap of faith and the Posiedons Revenge a miss.Food as you would expect was expensive with a Burger, drink and fries coming in at circa £10.Overall though a great day out

If you like queuing then this is for you. This excursion was such a waste of money compared to other waterparks we have been to in the world. We prepaid our tickets online but till had to join a very long, slow, busy, hot queue. This is where you also need to pay for your locker/towel/meal deal etc. The changing rooms are just beside the entrance to the park and boy was the ground hot - felt like those lizards that hot from foot to foot. Locating a lounger and the towel booth was a chore. Ended up taking loungers on the beach which then made quite a walk for the rides. I couldn't do any of the rides due to a bad back but my family only managed 4 (yes only 4!) rides in all the time we were there. What a flippin waste of money! Our ticket also included a trip to the Aquarium - husband really enjoyed this bit and it was air conditioned and not too busy. But the worst bit was still to come...we weren't staying at the Atlantis Hotel so had to join the queue for a taxi...it was daylight when we joined the queue and dark by the time we got one. 75minutes yes, 75minutes. Would never recommend this park nor would I go back.

the most beautiful moments in life. in every Dubai trip, you must visit the palm islands, but this time we booked the Atlantis for 2 nights, ans the Waterpark was the most beautiful moments we had in our life ever, i need to mention that my wife wears Hijab, and the park had no problem with that, we bought our muslim swimsuit and started our adventure, recommended for everyone with strong hearts
Fun & beautiful place!!. This was a really fun place, the rides were fantastic, I just wish there were more rides & slides! The food there was reasonable but pricey! I would definitely visit again!

"Adventure++". What an adventure!!!The park opens at 10:00 AM, so if you arrive around that time you avoid any lines at all and can ride all the scary rides that last 6 seconds several times in a row without waiting. If you are not residing at the Atlantis resort, getting to the waterpark from the Dubai downtown area will cost you, about, 90 AED one way ($24.50 USD) But, to save money, you can take the metro all the way to the park for about 42 AED ($11.00 USD), one-way. I preferred the Big Bus because at 285 AED you get to see the whole of Dubai in 48hrs, and it was a great way to see the city. The lazy river had a wave pool connected to it and fun rapids to ride down over and over again if you were not into water slides. The waterslides ranged from mild to extremely wild! They have waterslides that are completely blacked out and ones that push you up like an actual roller coaster. Avoid eating the food from the kiosks stationed around the park. It is a waste of money and gross. It is best to eat at one of the restaurants located in the hotel. I spent about 6 hours at the park and felt I got my money's worth. This is, by far, probably one of the best waterparks that I have been to the $71 admission fee, is absolutely worth it. Highly recommend!!!

You HAVE to come here if you are in Dubai!. Taking the trip to the Palm Island was amazing. It is picturesque. This park was great! It wasn't too busy; we went on a Friday at the start of April. I pre-booked my tickets online so we waited in a shorter line. I also booked a locker. I didnt think there was a need to book one of their towels as you actually dry out while you walk around. They have hair dryers and showers in the bathrooms, so you can literally leave looking your best. Make sure you do all the 'scary' rides! There is one that is a free fall drop, it is a MUST! There is also one that literally takes you inside a shark tank.
the water park is amazing. This park is incredible - it even has escalators on the slides so you don't have to climb up stairs all the time!

A fun day out. If the weather is great, then this is a place to be. Try to avoid the weekend or else you would spend approx. 30 mins waiting in Q for each ride. Even the simple tube ride like Torrent in the lazy river is a great fun. F&B are expensive, but you can expect that. AED 13 for a small bottle of water, or AED 40 for a pack of 4. One down side – the changing room / shower rooms are super small considering the amount of people in the park.

Excellent Waterpark. It's a splashers ultimate playground. The slides are wonderful, I personally liked the leap of faith. What a rush! For those who want a relaxing swim or ride on the inflatable ring/donut just move with the slow and steady current of the lazy river. The beach is a few steps away as well and with the Burj Al Arab serving as a backdrop you can also play beach volley in style. One day here is not enough. We would definitely go back.

Awesome Waterpark, Extremely Well Run. One of the best, if not the best, waterpark I've been to. Very well managed and staff very well trained.We arrived early in the morning, so there were no lines to all of the rides. Been on all the rides within an hour or so. 'Leap of Faith' was my personal favourite. By the time we left around midday, the park was extremely busy.Hotel guests from Atlantis have unlimited free entry to the park and free shuttle buses between the beach area of the park and the hotel, if you don't want to walk that little distance. However, when you see the views from the beach area or the top of some of the rides, you will be tempted to walk anyway to be able to enjoy the magnificent views. Hotel guests also enjoy unlimited free towels (30 AED for visitors), which you can pick up anywhere within the park and when done, just drop off into the used towels bins, so you don't have to carry it around.You do have to carry the tubes around if you want to use majority of the rides though, as they are not provided at the top. Only 2 rides use their own large tubes, which you just jump into.They also have GoPro hire at the front of the park to let you capture all the fun if you want to relive it after you leave.The only criticism (and the only reason why this isn't 5 stars) was how hot the ground got towards midday. It was so hot you could hardly walk on it without burning your feet. Considering it's a waterpark, most people would be walking bare feet, so that's probably the only area they need to improve/find a solution for, in an otherwise very well run waterpark.Highly recommended, especially for Atlantis hotel guests.

Could do with some more rides . Having been to both wild wadi and aquaventure I feel comfortable to day that this is a great Park but could do with some more good slides. When we went the park was not overly busy but queues formed as there were not enough rides to cope with demand. The park does offer great things like the ability to put money on your wristband to spend in Park which they refund at the end of the day. The shark attack ride though the aquarium is exceptionally good! I think however next time I would go back to wild wadi.

Best Waterpark ever. Absolutely the best waterpark I have ever been to, all the rides were excellent and different experiences in themselves, can thoroughly recommend the lazy river ride it took 40 minutes to go round and get back to the start point.

We loved it . Loved the waterpark...my son enjoyed the kids area alot and didn't want to leave...definitely recommend for families as theres something for everyone. The park itself is nice n clean and alot of staff around. Definitely worth to spend a full day.
Amazing. This is an amazing water park worth visiting with children. You can spend the whole day there as there are many water rides to work your way round. Definatly recommend a visit.

Best Waterpark in the World!. Out of all the waterparks I have been to, this is by far the best! I got in free as I signed up on their website with a birthday deal which entitles you for a day pass into the waterpark expiring after a week. The rides were fit for thrill seekers who love the adrenaline rush like me! They also have an area for children who aren't able to go on the bigger rides unfortunately it wasn't open when we visited. They have their own private beach area for guests using the Aquaventure Waterpark which is ideal if the big rides aren't your cup of tea and the views from the palm are incredible especially up at the top of the big rides. They also have a GoPro section where you can rent GoPros for the day which I definitely recommend, I had already brought my GoPro with me and it was such a good idea and I am so happy I did and if not I would have rented one.

So much fun. The Aquaventure Water Park is honestly a must. I am 29 and traveled with my 28 year old partner and we just loved it! The views are amazing, the slides are fun, the exhibits are fantastic and it even has it's own beach! I would say it's a Dubai must do.

A great family day out. An excellent waterpark for all ages with a variety of rides. Plenty of sun beds with umbrellas but it is a good idea to arrive early as people do reserve beds and then leave them. You can now take drinking water into the park too which is a bonus. Great day out!
Very nice. Very nice water park. Great for kids and adults. My kids absolutely loved it. We were there as soon as opened and stayed for 5 hours very nice place
Water!. Excellent water slides from daring to faint of heart.Many involving 4 members or more of a family together!!
Dubai Tour. Aquaventure Waterpark which is situated in Atlantis The Palm, Dubai is the whole new thing to explore with the family.

Great fun . We have been to the watermark on every visit to Dubai. It a great day out for the family and has something for everyone. Lockers, restaurants, towels are all there - so you don't have to worry about a thing.Great fun!!

Slidetastic. £52 each and then more for towels and locker. If you aren't interested in crowds and slides head for the nice beach and get under a palm tree away from the excitement!All the slides are good and we were surprised at even the less popular ones as they were easily worth a go. The tower further from the entrance has fewer slides but they were better.

Pricey but brilliant. It is very expensive but the best water park I have ever been to. Go for the whole day to maximize your fun but leave 30 minutes to an hour before the end to save yourself the very busy changing rooms!

Leap of faith, indeed!. This waterpark is best visited on quieter days as the queues can be a bit tedious. Nonetheless, the rides are a must -the best has to be the leap of faith. Be sure to enjoy some beach time as well. The staff are very friendly too. The restaurant, shark bites, is overpriced but it's what you would expect at a theme park.Tip for Shark Bites: No need to book 2 meals, one portion of fries is more than enough including on drink for free refills. Do not get sucked into the promotions. Tip for Aquaventure: Go early and avoid the weekends (Fri & Sat) for maximum enjoyment. The park, without rush hour, only takes 4-5 hours to enjoy.

Great day out. Fantastic family day out with lots to do. A bit busy round about the pools so you need to get there early. For the pools are busy then head for the beach as plenty of space. It has one of the best lazy rivers I have ever been on and some of the water attractions are first class. I would highly recommend it.

Great Fun. Really quiet when we were there so barely any queues. All the rides were great fun and ideal for my eldest (6). However it was limited for my daughter who is under 120cm (4) as the childrens play area was closed. Food is overpriced.

Great waterpark with overpriced food. This was, by far, probably one of the best waterparks that I have been to. Not to mention, if you visit the park on your birthday, your admission is FREE! And that's what I exactly did. But, had I paid the $71 admission fee, it would have been worth it. The lazy river had a wave pool connected to it and fun rapids to ride down over and over again if you were not into water slides. The waterslides ranger from mild to extremely wild! They have waterslides that are completely blacked out and ones that push you up like an actual roller coaster. If you are not staying at the Atlantis resort, getting to the waterpark from the Dubai airport area will cost you, roughly, 90 AED one way ($24.50 USD) But, to save money, you can take the metro all the way to the park for about 42 AED ($11.00 USD), one-way. I preferred the metro because it was 90% above ground, and it was a great way to see the city. The park opens at 10:00 AM, so if you arrive around that time you avoid any lines at all and can ride all the scary rides that last 6 seconds several times in a row without waiting. DO NOT eat the food from the kiosks stationed around the park. It is a waste of money and gross. It is best to eat at one of the restaurants located in the hotel. We spent about 4 hours at the park and felt we got our money's worth. I would go back for sure!!!

Great fun, very relaxing. Great park, lots to do, or head to the beach for a break. Water slides are loads of fun and exhilarating. Go early enough to get a good spot, or book a cabana to be sure of one.
Great slides but the queues!. Had a great time but the place was packed which meant that you spent the majority of your time in queues....

Nice time. Visited for the Dolphin Encounter. The prices are quite high for non hotel guests, even just to observe others in your group. However, given the amount of time you get to spend interacting, it's worth it. The trainers were very knowledgeable & informative, staff in the lockers/wet suit area were super nice, complimentary beverages were a nice touch. Overall, everyone had a good time.

Great Day Out. We arrived early at 10.30 and had already booked our ticket on line to reduce the queing, still had to que a little, but be aware of all the extra costs of lockers, towels and food! But once inside the rides are fantastic!! we went on all the ones in the temple are and were a little dissapointed with the park as we hadn't realised there are a lot more rides in the furthest corner of the park and they are FANTASTIC!! Really enjoyed it. The beach wasn't worth bothering with as the sand is so sharp, it's painful to walk on, and the sea is covered in a layer of scum as it doesn't appear to move (on the inner branch of the palm island). We went on Sunday so the ques were not too bad and left at around 4 utterly exhausted and happy. It's only downfall is the cost, which is (like everything in Dubai) totally over the top! take a pair of cheap flipflops you don't mind loosing as the floor gets very hot!!

Amazing Aquaventure Waterpark. I went there with my sisters this month and the Aquaventure Waterpark is amazing. I used a complimentary ticket but regular rate of ticket is almost 80 USD.Their waterpark has a big area, its good for families and they offer many rides. Their slides is very good.. You can't bring food inside but they allow water, rate for food is between 15 USD to 60 USD. Waterpark opens from 10am until sunset. For more details you can check their website https://www.atlantisthepalm.com/This place is very good for families, the kids will surely enjoy it. :)Have fun!
Exciting. Exciting day off, is full of fun and exciting all day, good music and relax on the beach lot of fun machine. will be back again.

Amazing!. We got complimentary access to the water park with our stay at the Atlantis. And trust me it is worth it. The rides are amazing and the wave pool and tide pool are really worth trying. The currents are thrilling. I would suggest you to go there and experience it. Don't miss out on it looking at the price.

Pricy but worth every Dirham. We spent a whole day at the park and had a great time. Want to know, how that goldfish felt that you flushed down the loo? Try "Neptunes Revenge". A very well made park with great rides (slides). The admission is quite expensive, but you can save a few AED when booking on the web in advance. Grab a tube and start floating......
Great family fun for all ages. Everything you would expect from a water park and then you have all the experiences Dolphins, Rapids, shoots you name it the park has it.

Average. Been here 2nd time and will not visit again. Very expensive and not impressive at all. This time went with our new child and play area for kids was shut!! What a disappointment! Was not happy at all. Avoid going there during a weekend as u would spend more time queuing than actually enjoying yourself.

A lot of fun. We booked a day pass (and you really need a day), so we were able to leave the place and come back at any time on that day. We went during a weekday, so it not too busy. Some slides - prepare to wait in a queue and try to avoid weekends as it is very busy then. There are few fast food restaurants and prices are ok. We had loads of fun and really enjoyed the day.

Wow factor of Atlantis stay. We stayed at Atlantis and the Aquaveture entry came as complementary. The number of rides are comparitively less, but are clean neat. The crowd is mostly decent. Don't get offended by the scantly clad- this is a waterpark. Don't forget to try the leap of faith.
Amazing . We stayed at atlantis hotel that's why it was complementary for our family. We continue visited for two days. I have no words how we all have enjoyed. DON'T MISSED

Fun all day. Been here already three times and can say only good things. Here everyone can find something that they like: beach with sun beds, thrillslides or relaxing in the river. Good fun for whole day. Definitely recommend this place!

SUPER FUN!. This place is super fun. There are so many rides here to get you going throughout the day, some will get you praying for you life, and some will make you day dream. The moment you enter, there is that exciting feeling, and as the park closes, you will leave fully satisfied, filling up your adrenaline meter. A day in aqua venture is a mandatory procedure for all tourist in Dubai!

Awesome water park. Had great fun for hours here and even better if you're staying at Atlantis, even if you split your trip and only stay at the hotel for a night to use the hotel.Watch your feet in the sun, the ground gets VERY hot. lol
Fantastic!. If you are planning to visit Dubai, you must visit this place. It is huge very clean area of fun and water attractions.

Pricey but you see and get what you pay for. Me & my young kids came early right at opening time so we got to avoid lines at admission and attractions. We got the seats we wanted at the various pools, beach, food court and used the lockers at around 2pm. Following these times we were able to avoid the crowds and lines hence our experience was great. The place does pack in quite fast so if you're one of the visitors coming in at the peak days and hours I'm pretty sure the review is not gonna be good. As big as the place is, it is very popular so crowding is unavoidable even at these prices. We liked all the attractions advertised and one can appreciate all the money they spent building this place. Incredible!

Definitely better than Wild Wadi. If you're only going to one waterpark this is the place to go! Had so much fun here with a family of all ages, the beach is lovely too (just be careful during jellyfish season)

Great park, terrible admission . You are greated at the entrance by two queues either side of an open room. Having prebooked tickets you would hope for, nay, expect a faster entrance to the park. This is not the case, the larger of the queus is to buy tickets on admission, however it moves at 3 times the rate of prebooked. The park itself has many decent rides that offer a range of different adrenaline packed action, from the lazy river (with rapids) to the zoomarango, a 5 person doughnut with the most terrifying of drops and the larges slide in the world. Shark Bite has good food, but takes forever to be prepared.

Superb. Aqua venture is a great day out for the entire family. There are plenty of attractions to keep even the most adventurous family occupied all day, especially with the addition of the 2nd ride tower.

Busy and expensive. Took the kids for a dolphin adventure, which was great, but still not sure if it was value for money. For the 4 of us, it cost around £650, which I can't complain about as I knew in advance. However, the photos cost an additional £100 and that was for them to be put in a USB stick. With lunch, drinks and cabs etc., that was the best part of £850 gone.Spent time in the watermark, but found it too busy. Too many people around.Not exactly my cup of tea

Fun Day - Great Waterpark. Visited for the day with my wife and had loads of fun. Great rides for everyone and a really lovely lazy river connecting to a lot of the action.Only complaint was that the pathways got too hot to walk on bare foot, they are in need of mist machines to keep them cool.We did the lost chambers after too which were breathtaking
Great for kids. Had a great visit, water adventures a bit far apart, lazy river very boring, very much modeled on Lost City in South Africa. Staff could be more helpful when lost.

Great Review of the Atlantis Aquaventure Waterpark, Dubai, UAE. This waterpark is one of the best in the world, that I've ever visited! They are a lot of great attractions, and the staff is wonderful! They are Lifeguards every 20 meters and the safety in the parc has a big level! The amazing rides and waterslides are safe and really funny! A negative point is: In some attractions and waterslides they is an photo shooter which you can use with your entrance ticket, but then at the end of the day, if you want to buy the pictures you can't because there aren't organised with this system, and they just sell the pictues made by a photograph! This wasn't great because I've done a waterslide just because I wanted a picture, and at the end I had nothing!Otherweise the parc is safe, clear, amazing, funny and the entry price is OK for the given service (Naturally there are a lot of exstentions for giving out more money :-)It's a great parc, I really recommend it!

Fun day out . Spent the day at the Waterpark lots of fun had by all. Park is for all ages, very clean. Lots of additional things to do for example swimming with the Dolphins or the zip line. Changing rooms were clean and plenty of toilets. The park was easy to navigate around with a nice beach to the side for when you have had enough or would like some quiet time.
What a park . Wow what an awesome time we had. Very well organised and great service lockers are available. Also the staff take your photo out you come down the the ride. I'm so going back.

Great day off . Fun for all ages, with different pools and activities available. I would say some paid options could be less pricy and so people would probably engage even more.The quality of the installations, all water rides, beach access are great and it is definitively a very fun way of spending a day in Dubai. You may say there are thousands of water parks but, how many can call them installed in an artificial island, next to so many remarkable land scape / sights?

Fantastic waterpark.. Wonderful day (or days!) out and kids (aged 5&7) had an absolute blast. I have never seen so many lifeguards in my life, they're literally standing 20ft apart in the whole park so felt very very safe and was comfortable in letting the kids go and explore on their own a wee bit. Didn't really eat at the park so can't comment on the food but the slushies were nice and the toilets were very clean.The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because my 5 year old couldn't go on most of the rides as you have to be at least 1.2m tall. Otherwise, a perfect attraction.
Swimming with dolphins. A real nice meeting with dolphins, also good informations about them. You book best in good time, not always easy to get in touch.
Just a lot of Fun. Brilliant and patient staff, Well thought out and safe rides absolutely loads to do. Only two drawbacks are the horrendous entrance queues and the cost of the resturants

Fantastic park with the most amazing slides and water rides. Spent the day here and had a wonderful time. We took a taxi there which was about £20 from our hotel downtown at Jumeirah Emirates Towers. Its a fabulous park set in the grounds of the Atlantis Palm but without actually seeing much of the hotel. Its well worth purchasing a cabana , its a closed off area where you get your own sunbeds along with an icebox full of bottles of water. There are hosts wandering around and it is safe to leave your belongings if you want to go to the rides. Alternatively there are lockers which are dirt cheap. They are very very big here on safety so expect to wait a while to get onto the rides. That said, its a spotless park and great great fun.

Full day! Never stopped!. Great day for us and our 12- and 10-year old boys. Only sticky point was when we were trying to get in - the car park is not clearly marked and complicated by the fact that you have to park in the first car park you come across and then get into a shuttle bus (also not clearly marked!). However, everyone we stopped and asked pointed us along the right way. Lockers - we managed to cram clothes for me and the two boys into one small locker, but it was close! The digital scanner/wristband system works great. We also put money on the wristband and used this for drinks etc through the day. the money we didn't use was refunded easily at the end.We went during the week and I think that made all the difference as we didn't really have to queue for any of the rides - or if there was a queue we just popped across to the empty queue for a similar ride. We all had flip-flops/crocs as the ground did get quite hot - we also had sunglasses and I had a cap too. You can either leave these at the bottom of the stairs to the rides (there are plenty of lifeguards there) or hold them on with you. We also left a bag and towels on one of the beach loungers - nothing went missing, even though we only came back to it twice during the whole day. If you don't want to take your camera/phone in with you, you can hire GoPro cameras at the entrance or there are photographers at all the key points to take pictures and give you a wristband so you can view and buy your pictures at the end of the day (they are good).All the staff here are fantastic - without exception. Lifeguards are VERY patient if there are queue-jumpers and very helpful about making sure everything is secure/safe before you set off on the rides. Our boys went off down the river as soon as we got in and it took us a while to get a double ring to follow them - so we couldn't find them for the first 30-40mins - if this happens (we asked one of the lifeguards), you can tell one of them and they will put out a general alert so that if anyone sees your kids, they will bring them out and get them to come to a pre-arranged place.We had a fantastic day - fully on the go from when we arrived (around 11) to when it closed. There was a bit of a queue for showers at the end of the day, but it soon cleared and there is no rush to leave.Fantastic day and we would definitely go back again! Well worth the money!
Fun. We basically spent the whole day in this fun park and we still wanted more, the brave ones among us (myself excluded) went down the leap of faith and came out different people, lol!

Amazing Experience !!!. Amazing water park with slides, straight & zigzag tunnels, river & lot of other activities. Has got something for everyone be a kid or an adult. Enjoyed the thrilling rides & was a life time experience for me. This was the best thing about Atlantis The Palm. A must go for everyone who like water sports/ activities..
great attractions. Very expensive but great fun.. Rides for all ages and the kids can have a day out there. Its a bit far from Deira City centre but worth the ride

Amazing park, horrible service. I was staying in the hotel and i took the advantage to access the aquapark. The attractions were even better of what i imagine, no queus and some of the attractions are connected to each pther what make more attractive the experience. But the attitude of the staff is a minus in the place, not friendly at all, lack of information, no maps and not helpful staff, they looked to be tired to be there. Amazing place but not a good experience provided by the staff.

great dolphin encounter experience, great splash. we booked a dolphin encounter at the atlantis dolphin bay. The experience was great; the groups with about 6-8 people rather small and ok sized for still providing a personal experience when meeting the dolphins. The guides were very polite. The dolphin encounter also included a day visit to the aquaventure park; a nice experience too, and great to spend the rest of the day there. We enjoyed the slides and swimming in the many pools.

Thrilling and with full of Actions. Marvelous times, altogether 10 water activities apart from normal pool with rapids and for relaxing. Just follow the safety instructions and watch some youtube videos and you are just safe. Lifeguards all over with good attention. Your heart will stop at some point but will be back in soon. Not recommended for people not taller than 1.2m and pregnant ladies. Wear proper swimming attire - they will not allow clothes in cotton or any such materials. Even though you have paid for the ticket no chance of doing activities (still you can be on the pool). Minimum price to buy a men's short is 118 AED. So be with your proper swimming attire. There are additional activities you can pay separately and attend. Check on the fly while you do the activities in park. There are few hell of a kind activities just do them - will be excellent memories, recommended to use go pro to capture your memories. Don't forget to pay a visit to beach after your action filled day in water park which is maintained by Atlantis hotel. You can have a sea bath. Beach is not the best one but still in range. You need a full day of your schedule for Aquaventure Waterpark. Use cabs to reach as Metro/Tram will cost you same amount of money if you travel as group. Couple metro will be cheap.

A fantastic water park. This is a fantastic example of what a water park should be like. It is totally fake like the rest of Dubai but hey ho. The park is amazing with really cool rides we spent the whole day there. The best ones however require a long, long wait which is irritating. The food options are expensive. Don't take anytoing with you as the lockers are ridiculously expensive. There are peopl e taking photographs all the time but they are totally overpriced and it was so disappointing at the end of the day to be faced with that as it was expensive enough. Transport options are limited back and forth so be prepared to pay for an expensive taxi!

Fantastic day out. If you enjoy waterpark slides this is the place for you.Not only are the slides great but the water "canals" and pool areas are good fun. I (gramps) had the good luck to be dragged around the water "canals" from slide to slide by the teenagers while I relaxed in a large tube.Most slides had reasonably short waits, especially Poseidon's revenge where the few people who had the courage to tackle it tended to dither about gathering their courage to go. It's terrific especially when the trap door beneath with your feet suddenly opens and you plunge down from a great height. Worth the money for this slide alone.Get there early to make sure you have a choice of sunbed to choose from particularly if you are with family.We found best eating places were towards Poseidon Tower.To relax towards the end of a busy day it's well worth going to the beach area. Indeed a family looking for a quiet time can go to the beach while more adventurous members can go to Poseidon Tower nearby for more exciting fun.

Hilarious!. We went expecting to spend a few hours here, we ended up staying until it closed! An absolutely fabulous place. Pools, water slides, rapids, slides, aquariums, high wire slides and vertical drops. Fun for all the family no matter what the age. Get there early to avoid queues, take your own towels to avoid expensive towel hire, lockers are available for a fee but worth it. This place is a must visit when visiting Dubai.
best time ever. turned into a child again, went down the leap of faith and spent the next hour shaking (would not do that again) loved every bit of this park
thrilling, enchanting. Great experience, good rides, refreshing, enjoyed a lot with family but experience poor management. Overall good experience.

Retreat and get refreshed!!!. Great time out and great fun with Friends and Family..
Some rides are truly mind boggling and can take your breath away..
Specially the Leap of Faith..
Great place to visit if you enjoy water activities..

Large, clean, very nice. Excellent Water Park in the Palm. One of the best water parks I have ever been to. Nice way to spend a day in Dubai. Even just going to the Lazy River and its different streams would be worth it but there is much more. We had a late lunch in the Gordon Ramsay Restaurant at Atlantis, very nice.

Awesome awesome awesome. I have never been to a water park before and I was super impressed. I saw negative remarks on trip advisor relating to the life guards. I totally disagree. They were the most friendly and most efficient life guards I have seen. They were ready to assist at all moments and where really helpful. This place is so well organized and the people that work here are really nice and friendly. We had a fabulous time and I felt safe - even on the scary rides! My only negative remark is on the price of the photos. It would have been nice to be given a certain amount of the digital photos if you purchased a hard copy. They are in effect worthless to the hotel after you leave.

Simply THE BEST. No trip to Dubai would be complete without a visit to the best water park in the world!Have you ever got lost on a lazy river !I have,A lazy river with rapids ! Tunnels and falls.a brilliant day out the kids will never forget it !Just remember the sun cream, it gets very hot and there isn't much shadePlenty of places to eat and lots of great water slides.

Great for the kids. Obviously a great place to take the kids for the day. Lots of choice of where to sunbathe and lots of different rides and entertainment for them. Rapids are fun and it's a nice way to spend a day in Dubai. Worth the price tag? I think for what it is, it is overpriced but if you're staying in the Atlantis it is free entry. Food and drink prices are as you would expect but I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the food and drink we did purchase so I would say this element is okay. Just don't go expecting a cheap day out.

Quite old but still very funny ! . We went to this aqua park with two friends and we really enjoyed the experience : there are a lot of slides with good speed and for all levels.I really recommend the slide that goes into an aquarium ! The park needs a renovation soon but its still a lot of fun.Tip: you will have a good discount at the entrance if you have the emirates ID, so make sure to bring it with you.
Excellent Day Out. This is an excellent day out for all the family!! Great slides and lots of things to do!! Food available and of a very good quality.

BIRTHDAY TREAT!!!!!. Thank you for the birthday treat!!!! amazing rides!!! the nice one also was the free access to the beach which is nice option to relaxed after all the rides.LEAF OF FAITH!!! that was the most amazing ride...
Top of the world. I was not sure when I booked that how it would be. But no do not want to leave this place. All age, gender enjoy to the fullest. It was so good, safe and amazingly wonderful

Great day out!. I love visiting the water parks in Dubai. Aquaventure is pretty spectacular, with the venue (the Atlantis hotel perched on the crescent of the Palm Jumeirah), the beach, the slides, the aquarium that a slide is actually built into! Great way to escape the heat in Dubai.

Fun for all ages. We arrived at 10 am found sun loungers set up a base and off we went lazy river Rapids slides it has it all there are plenty of food and drink places start earlier because as the day goes on it gets busy
Not cheap but a great day. Entry for two on the day was north of £150. Was a good day and made the most of the park. Well worth getting food as part of the price and bring your own towels!

It's not cheap, but you will probably only visit here once. My daughter and I started our morning with a swim with the Dolphins. Wow! What an experience that we will both never forget. Accompanying family can't take photos, thus allowing the site photographer to reap the benefits of the extortionate prices for photos afterwards.All that said, you do get entrance into the aqua part afterwards, although you even then have to pay more money again for a locker! Get there early to avoid long ques on the slides etc. Food is also expensive,mane your bags will be searched before you get in. In closing,mite a great day, but certainly not cheap.

Highlight of the holiday. Yes it's expensive but an amazing day out- really clean. Great range of rides, plenty for our 8 yr old and sure teenagers would be just as pleased. The slides through the aquarium with sharks are great. We also did the dolphin experience which was incredible. Just don't think about the cost.

Great place if you have the proper swimming attire. The water is a constant temperature. But make sure your swimwear is not made out of cotton. The pool attendants will not let you in the water, and they are everywhere. Have proper swimwear. Call ahead for information on swimwear. Otherwise, enjoy. The water was nice in March.

Still about the best layout and rides in the world. We've been a few times now and the park is as fresh as ever, however the 8 days we were there the three rapids sections at the Barracudas end of the park were out of order for 6 days. Get there around 10am to guarantee a lounger anywhere, avoid Fridays at all costs as it's full of local workers on their day off, don't sit at the beach pool food hut to have lunch as there's a bird problem. Also, join Emirates Skywards before buying tickets for 15% off entry (and all food/drink), unless you are staying at Atlantis, whereby entry is free.

A beautiful waterpark. Beautifully built, nested in one of Dubai's many landmark hotels. Aquaventure is definitely recommended for adults looking for a fun day in the water. Anybody who likes scenic surroundings and is pretty easy going with water activities will love it here. You can even swim with Dolphins or zipline for a set price. However, Wild Wadi has better ride options although it is much much more crowded.
Great park to visit just not during peak season.. Great park, nice rides though in peak season expect a crowd which makes it unpleasant. Food overpriced but expected in any waterpark.

Expensive but worth a visit . We spent a whole day here and still wasn't enough time. 10 of us went 6 children aged 2-13 and there was something for all of them to enjoy. It was very expensive to go and thought the idea of having to pay additional to hire a towel & locker was a little cheeky however food & drink on site wasn't that expensive compared to the hotel we were staying in.Great fun...lazy river was fab for the kids!!
Aquaventure Waterpark. We did not have to pay for this as we were staying at the Atlantis Hotel, but we would have paid as it was so much fun and catered for everyone.

Top tips for Atlantis Aquaventure waterpark. A fantastic day out with kids which can be quite expensive. Here's how to get the most out of it without breaking the bank. Dubai residents get a discounted rate. Buy tickets on the door with a drivers licence for residents to get these tickets. Book your tickets online 24 hours before you go to get discounted rates. Different browsers and peripherals throw up different results. Easiest was using Safari on an iPad. Take your own towels. Ticket price does not include a towel which works out to AED30 a towel. One towel is good for an adult and small child cos they're huge. Showers have soap and shampoo so leave yours at home. Girls' showers have hairdryers too. Wear slippers with straps so you don't lose them on rides. From 10am to 3pm the stone floors are super hot and a little rough so can become very uncomfortable if you go around barefoot like most people do. Try and get hats or baseball caps you can attach to kids' heads. The sun and glare is strong. Take your own water. Small bottles of water can cost about USD4 and ice cream ranges from USD4-10. Get a waterproof case for your smartphone to get those holiday snaps in the park. Photos from the good people at The Atlantis cost USD33 per snap. Eat before you go. We went after lunch for 230pm when it wasn't blisteringly hot and had a great time till 6pm when it hit rush hour traffic times. It makes sense to go with kids who are over 1 metre 20 centimeters so they can enjoy all the rides. Study the waterpark map before going in. Some rides seem to have more than one name so hunting them down in the park can be confusing. Eg the ziggurat rides are also called the boomerango/poseidon's revenge and the rapids was also part of the lazy river. Some rides require that you grab a float ring for yourself or kids before getting on. Also some double floats have a child seat with a plastic bottom in them and others don't. Depending on your kids' ages grab the right one. There are separate cabanas overlooking swimming pools that can be booked out for larger groups. Have a good one.

Best Aqua place ever. The best and the biggest Aqua park ever. Pools are very big and various options in it. In the hottest months of Dubai, you have to go there and have rest. Lots of workers in it. They are all kind and make the place secure and safety.

Great. What a great day.We didn't have to queue long throughout the day for any of the rides, no more than 10mins max.It was a Saturday so one of the busiest days of the week aswell.All rides were open and were decent.Highly recommend for a day out to anyone.

Think of Disney on water... Amazing!. It's hard to describe this place. I think to say it's the Disney on water is probably the closest I could come up with. We came to Dubai from Estonia. So the 30+ weather was perfect getaway for sun and fun. One of the best things to do in Dubai for sure. We all loved it. Family ranging from 9, 15, 17 and mom and dad.
Fun day. My husband and two daughters attended the waterpark for a bit over 4 hours while I attended a conference. They had a blast - rode all the rides and were exhausted at the end! Bonus for mom!
Very good day out. I have been many times over the years and have done the dolphin swim . My kids love splashers most of all and it's well worth going but go early to be able to enjoy as it is big.
One of the best water park in the region. Aquaventure water park is one of the best water park in the region. A fun place on the Palm Island to be with family and friends.

Great for those that love both adrenaline and relaxation!. My other half and I are complete opposites when it comes to waterparks... he loves the fast heart racing rides and I love bobbling along on a lazy river... we were both happy at Aquaventure! Best lazy river I have ever been on and the faster rides also enticed me! Would highly recommend. TIP: get there early to secure a bed, or you can guarantee a bed on the beach which is where we located ourselves... just be careful of the burning hot tarmac on your feet!

A WONDERFUL, WONDERFUL DAY. Despite the fact that we visited aquaventure park on January , the weather and the temprature of the water were ok ( from 11 am until 4 pm) so we enjoyed the park a lot. The slides were great and the water and the environment very clean. A bit expensive, but unique experience.

Wow! Brillaint fun. Well I have been to many water parks in my time. And this is one of the best I have had the pleasure of visiting. Mainly due to its rubber ring conveyor system which pulls you around the park to different rides and sections. Good clean park with good rides. Amazing hotel too joined onto it.

Fun way to keep cool. Visited with our 15 year old son and spent a fantastic day whizzing down water slides and Rapids. This was our second visit and this time both pyramids were open (one was closed for maintenance last time). My favourite is always the lazy river which becomes not so lazy as you can nip off to ride some flames and Rapids on the way round. My husband and son were fans of the bigger rides. The Leap of Faith was skipped this year and both experienced this last time and neither were keen for another go! Poseidon's pyramid rides were new to us and I have to admit I found them too much! The boys enjoyed them far more! We found that the costs for the day were high 400 dirhams (£80) but it was a full day. We only had snacks at lunchtime as we had a good breakfast but food was very expensive throughout. The changing rooms were clean as were the areas around the pools. Altogether a lovely day!

Great slides. Great park for all the family. Fantastic slides, in particular the more daring ones such as Leap of Faith and Poseidon's Revenge. You have to try them while there! Lazy river not so lazy as you go through rapids which are a lot of fun. Highly enjoyable park.

One of my favourite thinsg to do!. Atlantis is my first recommendation when people visit us in Dubai. I have been here so many times and still enjoy each new visit. The lazy river is amazing and hours can be lost floating around the rapids and the huge wave machine. The slides are awesome and provide a range of experiences. My 6 year old son loves the shark attack (where you ride through a tunnel surrounded by sharks, rays etc). Whereas the leap of faith and the Poseidon's revenge provide ample adrenaline for the thrill seekers! The park is well laid out, very well maintained and has a vast amount of extremely friendly staff. My 4 year old daughter loves the children's area and spends hours on the smaller slides within this area. It may seem expensive but it's a great day out! Quick tip: The double rings with a child's seat in from can be difficult to find, if you see one; get it!
Amazibg. The reviews do not do this place justice!! It's a fantastic location and the attraction will not fail to disappoint must visit location if in Dubai xx

Great fun and excitement. So much like Florida theme park with the rides,the water shoots, the man made beaches. It takes time with the queuing allowing one person at a time to slide down the shoots. Also all the sun beds are fully utilised and it is not easy to get a seat. Best being in the water on the huge rubber ring and just go with the flow drifting with water current. When we eventually got a seat, it was great and we were able to relax and enjoy the ambiance. On that day only three toilets were available for the women and it did cause a fair amount of delay for all the people in the park using the changing room. Minor issues, otherwise great fun.

Good way to cool down. As two adults, we weren't 100% sure this would be worth it. However, we took the plunge and didn't regret it. We went on pretty much all the rides and we had fun on each one. We ended up going on three times on one particular ride due to the fun we had. I recommend you go as close to the opening time as possible to beat the heavy queues which develop by lunch time. We went as soon as it opened at 10am and we managed to make a full day of it. There is also a beach which is nice to wind down later on in the day. However, be warned that the water has some sharp shells on the sandbed which can make it a bit painful if you are not careful.The waterpark itself is very clean and most of the staff are helpful (we did come across some grumpy staff members when asking for help, but this may be due to the weather as it was extremely hot). Overall worth a visit, albeit slightly pricey if you have kids to pay for too.
Good fun and you could spend a whole day here. We had free access to the Waterpark as we were staying at the hotel. I was happy with the facilities offered and the waterpark matched my expectations.

Aquaventure a day of unlimited fun. If you are looking for a place to unwind then Aquaventure is the place! Perfect adventure for both parents and kids! One stop shop for a whole day of fun. U are in the lap of one of the most beautiful hotels in the world and a family day out here brings a smile to everyone's face!

Wonderful Lazy River. It's a great place to relax and also have fun on the many slides available. It's better to get there earlier in the day to beat the crowds. If you are staying at the Atlantis Hotel you can go into the park earlier than the public. During Ramadan the park is open at night and it's a lot of fun to go play in the water at night and no sunblock required. Make sure to go on the slide that takes you between the shark tank. Enjoy
Great. The rides are fun, no line for most rides(we were there on a sunday), the ride with the rafts is amazing !

Now this was awesome!. Expensive, very expensive. I booked a couple of months back with a 50 pc discount including lost chambers. This is exhilarating!!!Rides are awesome. This was my first trip to a 'good' water park and couldn't have been better. There is a child's play area, lazy river, rapids, couple of towers where each has a few rides. I was a little freaked out with Poseidon's revenge and did everything else. The sight of people falling down in transparent tubes, almost vertically, from a floor below is a little scary. Leap of faith is very good. For a moment, you feel you have lost contact with the slide. Tips:1. People wrote food isn't allowed. Dietary and kid food is allowed. Checking isn't as intense you can slip in energy bars - we didn't carry any reading all other reviews. 2. Food is very expensive even by a very good hotel/ restaurants standards. Buy meal coupons for each one prior. 3. Some people advised to carry chutes. We did initially. And there are too many of them. So, please don't be stuck up. 4. You do need to carry your chutes to the Leap of faith tower rides. There are plenty in the lazy river. 5. Start from the last tower (Poseidon) and reach early 9 30 AM. 6. Strictly beach wear - Strictly! Be prepared to spend AED 300-400 otherwise. 7. Boom before and online. 8. Try and close early by 5 pm so you avoid the rush for the cab. You'll be yearning to leave anyway by then.9. It's hot so sunscreens are must, hats are optional. 10. Men, carry a swimming vest - copious amounts of sunscreens won't help. 11. Go on weekdays. ... Have fun!!

Great visit.. Overall our visit here was great. Plenty of positives and the only main negative was that children have to be 1.2M to ride 90% of the rides here as opposed to 1.1M at Wild Wadi. Lazy river however was great for families and we watched the dolphins and sea lions as spectators and this was fun too. We would return to the park and hopefully the kids will be 1.2M in height where the kids can ride all the attractions and not just the lazy river and kids water park. Staff are curtious and the park is clean and safe. Nice water park to visit if you have chance.
Superb day out... But expensive . It was fantastic day out with full family... Nice rides and plenty of river slides....Very clean and neat and good staff
Like no other!. Fantastic waterpark for all ages - we had a blast! Floating through a glass tunnel surrounded by sharks is unique! Huge variety of hidden experiences to explore.

always good fun. Sunday was a quiet day and a good choice to visit. very short queues and a lot of fun as normal. Lots of staff and very easy to get round and enjoy it. Tip: get a ring and don't let it go

Amazing experience!!!. We are group of 4 girls visiting our first day in Dubai this amazing park - we booked even an Dolphinarium (shallow waters swimming with dolphins) - was perfect!! After dolphins we had whole day exploring the aquapark, and having so much fun!! We recommend to rent an go-pro camera near the entrance to have as much photos and a life time memory of all!!

Fun in the sun. we spend a day in the aquaventure waterpark in a cabana we had reserved for the day.we had a wonderful time and we went all the way on the different waterattractions and myself i went on the leap of faith waterslide...waaaw amazing speed !! our butler Prakash was very friendly and served food and drinks on demand.definitely a day to spend with family and kids regardless of age. some of us went swimming with the dolphins at dolphin bay which is just a few steps away. what a day to remember

A great day out. I had a great day out at the Aquaventure Water Park with my partner in January, although we were disappointed the half the rides on one side of the park had been closed for some reason. This had been poorly advertised as we didn't know when paying for the tickets!
Crowded, expensive controlled.. The aquaventure is expensive for having to stand in lines. The chairs go quickly and there is no access to other parts of the property.

A fun day out. Both my husband and I had a great time at Aquaventure Waterpark & would highly recommend it for anyone visiting Dubai.We got there for 10am when doors opened, which was a good idea as after lunch time and early afternoon the lines started to get very busy. We collected our tickets nice & quickly with minimal wait time.Booked ticked online (I believe if you do this 24hr in advance there is some sort of discount offered?) You have to pay extra for towel & locker hire, and you can also rent a go pro.I did not purchase any food or drink so cannot comment on how good or bad that was.The lazy rapids were good fun and there was plenty of double tubes available.A lot of the waterslides are also tandem which is good if you are a bit on the scared side like myself!Majority of the rides that I went on did have some sort of element of darkness to them, but coming from someone who hates the dark & closed in slides, they were not very bad and I ended up laughing and screaming on all of them.The ground does get very hot so bring a pair of thongs (flip flops), we took ours off and left them near the rides we were going on and they were always there when we got back.One thing to note if you are travelling with children there is a height restriction of 1.2m on a lot of rides so be aware of this before purchasing tickets.Highly recommended while in Dubai - have fun while staying cool in the hot weather!!

One of the best. We visited Aquaventure Waterpark several times in April 2016 as we were staying in the Atlantis hotel which meant we got free access to the park. We have been to all the Orlando water parks and I would say Aquaventure beats them hands down because of the lack of queues. Although the park was busy the longest time we had to wait was for Leap of Faith (the big one!) and that was around 20 minutes. All the other rides were around 5 minutes or less. Disney needs to take lessons on queuing from this park! Good fun days although I wouldn't go if I was just laying on a bed - they're not that comfy! TIP If you are going with children most of the rides are 1.2 meters minimum height although if you have little ones the children's play area is amazing.

Fantastic and worth every penny. Oh meah, I did everything, every slide. Forgotten most of their names but tower of Neptune and Poseidon was amazing, I was exhausted from doing everything. Only draw back was everything was overly priced but the fun I had compensated that.

the best water. Park ever. Atlanta is a good place to beat the heat.there are lots of slides,including the leap of faith.Alazy river with rapids and a variety of wavpools.There is also a kids play area but on the other hand it's expensive to swim with dolphins.It cost more than it should be and when people want a McDonalds you have to wait half an hour. However photos of you taken whilst you ride the attractions are expensive, but worth it.
Great. We stayed at the Atlantis, so it was great to take the buggy cars to go everyday to Aquaventure Park.Great rides, good security and good service

GREAT. Really enjoyed our day spent at Aquaventure water park. Unlike other waterparks we have visited this one was quite quiet.There were plenty of rubber rings even the double ones which normally you have to wait for at other waterparks. The sunbeds are really comfy and you don't have to pay for them which is great.
Best acqua park in Dubai!. I love the place and tried other acqua park, but this is by far the best and it's the best for parking and organization! also plenty of food options! love it!

Amazing place. This is an absolutely amazing water park and i definitely agree when they say the best in Europe and the middle east as it was far better than another water park i have seen in my life before. There are loads of rides all amazing. However if you are claustrophobic or don't like the dark this isn't the place for you as nearly all the rides have big sections in complete darkness which makes them much more fun, but worse if you don't like the dark. However overall i would definitely recommend this to anyone coming to Dubai of any age.

Clean and amazing staff but to expensive if you travel with kids under 1m20. We bought tickets in the airport and we were told our 4-year old boy could do almost every attraction if he could swim (he can). When we arrived at the slides, he could not go in because he was to small. We understand this safety procedure but then the price should be half for kids as they only have the kidspark. As a parent you then also pay a lot because you can not and be with your kid in the park and on the slides. Better idea would be to have 2 kind of tickets. One for the kidspark and rapid rivers and one that includes everything. Entrance is very bad organized as even with our pre-bought tickets we had to wait for 1 hour to get in and to receive our bracelet-tickets that then did not work, another 20 min waiting before to have my belongings in the locker and at the restaurant or every time you order something with a bracelet that is not working. Lockers are to pay and you only have them in the beginning of the park which is bad organized as you can not take your personal belongings in the water attractions, they should be next to very toilet or something like that. BUT a special thank to the staff, these peolpe are amazing, they did everything to help, watch the kids coming out of the slides and the manager gave our son a free ride on the slopes as he saw that we were all very dissappointed about him not being able to go in the aquarium-slide. The staff is amazingly friendly and caring about 'safety-first' which is very important here, so thumbs up for the working people on the field.

Nice place for adrenaline fans. One of the biggest water park I've ever seen. Dozens of water slides and places to relax or just get tan. Big but bit stinky beach zone, i don't know why but you can feel strange smell coming from water. Plus water was bit too cold, but despite that it was on of the best day in Dubai. Thank you for that !

wonderful park. The park is huge,moderate busy,all slides are perfect.Some tips:Get tickets online 24h advanceWear water shoes or socks,the walks are hotBring towel with youBring only allowed 1 bottle waterThere are water fountainsGet Refill cup from the ticket bootCooming soon again

pure luxury. super day out with beautiful scenery and great thrill seeking rides or relaxing rivers. the food court has plenty to offer and at very reasonable prices. free entrance to the water park if you book to go to Dolphin Bay

Big, bigger, biggest. High higher highs, fast, faster fastest. Forget about every waterpark you ever did. This is better, bigger, with crazy slides. Most of the slides are for children from 1.20 m but there is also a kids play zone really crazy even if they are smaller they can play hours in it.

Massive waterpark. What can I say. This waterpark has something for everyone. We stayed at Atlantis and therefore decided to go to the waterpark. It is huge and a lot of fun. I noticed that they have huge numbers of staff/lifeguards which is obviously good.
