recommend the experience . We had a stop over on our way to Europe and since my husband loves rides we decided to go to the water park for so fun and recover from the flight. We hired a cabana which I loved cause we could leave our belongings knowing that someone was there keeping an eye on it. The actual park wasn't busy as well so that made it all the more fun didn't have to line up at all, so we did the whole park. Highly recommend going for the experience

Lots of fun!. We spent the day at Aquaventure and had a great time. We began the day by swimming with dolphins at Dolphin Bay and then spent the rest of the day in the water park. It was so much fun - one of the best water parks we have been to. I would recommend getting there early - we arrived for opening time which was perfect, as we managed to get on lots of the water rides before it became too busy. The staff at the water park were also very friendly and there is a beach for visitors with a good view of the Burj Al Arab.
Good fun and the shark tank is cool. Not as logical and easy to navigate at Wild Wadi but worth a visit, particularly if visiting Dolphin Bay which is amazing!

not for the english. can not wear throw overs for the woman or even tee shirts while queuing in the sun but others can be fully dressed!!! so a woman with sensitive skin has to queue up in the hot sun just in a swim suit place packed out can not get a sun bed close to anything but the red hot beach and along walk to the rides then you have to find a ring 200yds away to get on the rides and take it with you carrying it all the way up the stairs can not wear jelly shoes to protect feet , very dear to eat and drink what A WASTE OF SPACE THIS PLACE IS taxis go the long way back long que doing road works 500 road workers only one working like england the rest texting or sleeping. ( with dress code there are rules saying this one for us and one for them ) go to USA instead

Great family attraction. Stayed at Atlantis hotel which allowed us unlimited access to the park. Was a little unsure of parks such as these as past experiences not the best but was blown away with amount of different rides and above all the cleaniness of the park.Only downside was of the measurement guides for young children. Our daughters day was patially ruined by not being allowed on majority of rides due to not being being 120cms. We had measured her at home and she was 121 cm. Parks seem to use a 120 cm pole stuck on a 3cm high metal base! A really big positive was the amount of life guards on duty, no blind spots on lazy river and also cheerful!

Give it a miss unless you're an adrenaline junkie!. Visited Aquaventure water park a couple of days ago, and was not that impressed. Most of the rides were fairly steep with lots of fast twists and turns - I'd say unless you're an adrenaline junkie stick with the parks in Europe as they are more suitable! The beach is also not that impressive. If you do decide to give it a visit my tips would be buy your tickets online in advance as that queue is shorter; Take the tram/metro and the monorail instead of queuing for a taxi - the monorail is 25AED per person for a return (15AED one way); A small locker is big enough for a standard size rucksack; and get the meal deal if you want to eat there. We arrived at about midday and did not have to queue for more than 20 minutes per slide, and went for lunch at about 3pm when it was quieter.

The best waterpark ever. This is truly the best waterpark I have ever been to. It's scale is amazing, the rides and slides really are first class. I took my two teenage children who were completely in their element. We had so much fun we really didn't want to leave and we were literally the first non hotel guests on the park at opening time. I cannot recommend this place enough, truly unforgettable.

Busy but a great option for a summer day out with kids. The place can be really busy on summer. Line to some of the rides were very long.The kiddies play area was very crowded that one can not get a seat or table anymore by 11AM. When taking the lazy river it will be good to be familiar with the alternative routes as the routes diverge and may take a while before you reach the same point. sections as the route is long and options are available along the way. Can also be confusing sometimes and forget where you left your stuff.There are limited food options inside but the kids loved the chicken nuggets and footlong hotdogs.The park closes by sunset so be sure to come early to maximise your stay.
Amazing. This is one of the amazing place for those who like some adventure type of water activities with many option.

Great park but long wait to get in. The best lazy river in any waterpark I have ever visited, we visited a few years ago and there were not enough inflatable tubes but they seemed to have sorted this issue now. The worst thing about this was waiting more than one hour in the queue to pick up our pre paid tickets (it said on the website to buy online and jump the queue!). We actually would have been better off just buying tickets on the day as the queue was shorter. We went on an weekday, I suspect the queue would be much longer on a weekend. Some super rides here, Posiedon's revenge was a standout. Lots of people in the park but it's big enough to accommodate them. Highly recommended, especially if you can jump the queue.

AMAZING. booked our tickets with the hotel which is at least 20% much cheaper than paying there. Pice ranges from £50-£60Restaurants are really good with a lot of selection of different foods, the slides are amazing!Underwater slide with views of sharks, stingrays etc.. Private beach is included with the package.We had an amazing day all together!

Ok but not great . Very confusing entrance - no directions to lockers or as to the fact that you need to go to another area to buy the locker keys before you enter the changing room . Rides ok but not that good.
Best in the league!. watery, systematic, great services like towels and shower gel. Amazing and thrilling rides with great experinace

Great waterpark!. We booked in advance for the waterpark (paid 260 AED per person) which saved 60 AED per person that buying on the day so definitely worth doing this! Although the only thing you can't always predict the weather, however it was very sunny the day we went. We also got one of our party free as if it is your birthday within the week you are going, you can go in for free as a birthday treat (go on website for details) - you just have to register for this online and take passport for proof of birthday on the day. The park was great for a day out - we arrived early (around 9.30am) which was a good time to arrive - very little queues and they let you in to get changed before 10am, but arriving earlier means you get selection of beds which were full by around lunchtime completely! There was a good selection of rides and a fun 'lazy river' with rapids and torrent as part of it! Best ride is shark attack where you finish in the aquarium, but a lot of the rides aren't too scary! We loved our day here - only downside was trying to get a taxi afterwards and traffic off the Palm!

Always Great Fun . We travel with a 14 year old and a 5 year old so theres a big gap. This place is a big hit with both. They love it, we love it. Its just Fun and Spacious. Only prob is with small kids they need more double rings with seats in. If you find one KEEP IT as they cant sit on your knee in a single.

Over rated - Disappointing. We have visited the place found the place firstly not value worth the money you pay and secondly boring. There are not many rides and due to which each rides becomes so crowded that you don't feel like going. The only ride i liked is leap of faith and the rest were just ok. You would get better rides here in Water Kingdom and surely much better at Aqua Imagine.It is marketed like there is nothing like it, a place in Atlantis palm that's it. Being at a costly place does not makes it exciting. Further the facilities are not good enough to accommodate big crowd. Not at all recommended
Fantastic day for all the family. Expensive but worth it especially the Dolphin encounter enjoyed by 3 of our party. Everything is well organised to make the most of your trip.
really nice. either good for relaxation and getting excited. I think I had never had such an exciting experience. Full of adernalin

Amazing!. Went out for the whole day with family and there is everything for everyone kids and adults alike there are coves and lagoons to vary the ages the rapids are amazing, the food they sell in the shacks is still great as well I had the hotdog and you may think because it's shack food it's bad no no no it is great! 10/10 would go again.

Awesome, Big and. Awesome water park located on the Palm islands.A must do/visit activity while visiting UAE.Be there at 10am if you want to enjoy all of it...Carry waterproof bags for dry clothes and towels.Carry Waterproof Sunscreen.

Not really suitable for very young children. Visited with a three year old. Not really much to do as she was scared of the big water buckets in the children's splash zone. It was busy and families were hogging the child friendly tubes so we could not go on some of the other rides.The toilets in the park were very wet and dirty. The changing rooms were clean but lockers are 40D each and small and as there are only separate changing rooms if you are travelling as a family the logistics are complicated if you don't want to pay for more than 1 locker. We only stayed an hour so it was a bit of a waste of money.

Dixon. A really good water park plenty to do for all ages , food etc was of a good standard . There is plenty of lifeguards on at all times too which impressed me . The rides where really good and staff was there to help out if needed We are definatly going again

Watch out for sunbed squatters . Great day at the watermark lots of fun and amazing slides and rides. Came back at lunchtime to find squatters on my bed using my towels and stuff. Could not give a monkeys and they moved on to the next bed and used another families towels until they returned. Then they moved on to their next prey. Told this is the norm by another family who read this online so lock up your stuff and don't leave anything you don't want other people to wear of use.

Enjoy whilst you get RIPPED OFF. Here are some highlights;- Higher entry prices as compared to other water theme parks in Europe / World - Busy rides and not so clean waters- Filthy changing rooms - Expensive lockers hire- You can't bring in any food or drinks from outside- Overpriced and poor quality food - No concept of single riders, long queues on major rides- 2+ hours of wait in the taxi queue on the way back OR pay for a premium taxi [aka bribe] and bypass the queueWe visited with a young family in March, our day was first spoilt by the rude security guards from the point we entered the park. Their treatment was insulting and condescending towards all guests as I observed.We were forced to discard the soya milk and special food for my son who allergic to dairy, nuts and eggs despite showing the hospital letter which most airlines, hotels, parks and restaurants have accepted and given us an exemption. The very rude security guard made it clear either throw the food or no entry !Since returning I've written a complaint 3 days ago, however no response as of yet.Additionally when we exited the park, around ~6pm the queue for the taxi was miles long and there were no taxis available. My wife and young child were not comfortable standing in the queue for 2 hours waiting for a taxi after a horrible day so we had no choice but to pay for a premium taxi [basically a bribed system where a private hire will whisk you off the queue]. They charged 200 dirham where the usual taxi will charge 25 Dirham.

First class. Family visit with children spread from 7-13yrs. Suitable for All. Generally based around inlet bays all joining a lazy river connecting the whole park. Just ensure when buying tickets children's heights. Less than 1.2m is classed as child and as such cannot go on many rides. ( even family raft) Plenty to do and eat for a full days entertainment. If willing to travel dreamland aqua park a better option for younger children.

Good exhilarating rides. This water park has a lot to offer with rides for the whole family. The water park is well kept and the lifeguards are always helpful. My family have good fun when at this water park.

Atlantis. Second time been there, managed to do all rides. Need to be there at 10am sharp, and start by doing one tower at a time. Leap of faith is hardest for me! Also did poseidon revenge which is a free fall! Very nice place not to be missed!

Fun in the Sun, Nearly Identical to the one in the Carribean. My wife and I vistied the Atlantis Water Park while in Dubai, it was a great day and is a very interesting experience, but we have previously visited the Carribean version of this attraction and were disappointed to find many of the same rides and attractions. It was still a great day though.

Breathtaking. The waterpark is simply brethtaking. Went there with the family and the place is enjoyable, adventourous and fun. Recommend this place for a nice family outing and funfilled. Will definitely be back time and again.

Definately worth a visit. If you visiting Dubai, this is one attraction that is unmissable. The park is part of the Atlantis hotel and it is fantastic. The design of the park is breathtaking and the hotel is a must see. It is not cheap, but it is well priced. Make sure to take to take sageway ride on the beach and don't forget camera !!!

Love this place . This is well worth the money, wasn't happy that the kids had a Pringles crisp box and was not allowed to take in, apart from that this is well worth the money and friendly staff, helpful it self. Will deffo come back again
holiday. burge kalifa a must . The metro is so clean and fast and is the only way to travel .i found palm tree court a really great all inclusive hotel

Cool day out on a very hot day!. What a great place to visit for the day in Dubai, its pricey but worth it. the whole family enjoyed it and you must try the leap of faith...it lasts a few seconds (barring the queue), but its such a rush!
Amazing day out!!!. This was an amazing day out for the kids and me it makes you feel like a child again! I went on every ride

Aquaventure - Atlantis . The aquaventure which is present in the atlantis hotel is worth the visit. Suited for all age groups of people. Be sure you are in the right attire to visit it. It's crowded throughout. Pre registration helps in moving to the start fast and getting a deal. Lot of rides in the water. Amazing place to be. Spend the whole day or you will not have sufficient time. Make sure you make every minute count. You get a cashless band which helps you to eat and shop anything and pay at the exit. Must visit. If you miss atlantis then the visit to dubai is not done justice.
Great waterpark. I enjoyed this place more than I thought I would. Fun for the whole family, including adults, older kids and younger kids.
Great waterpark. Having visited Atlantis in the Bahamas often, this place was even bigger and better. A great waterpark!

for the young and the water lover!. went there for half a day as it was recommended as the best water park in dubai. was not dissappointed, thought the ticket prices were a little steep for our liking, taking the combo for meal deal helped in saving money. its a perfect sunny day activity for those who ove the water. we didnt try the death defying rides but did the shark attack n few more. also liked relaxing in the beach chairs n going around in the wter through gentle waves n stimulated rapids and ocean waves. food prices were steep but buying the combo meal helpedone unpleasent experience was that the female toilets smelled very badly though they were cleaned. couldnt stand it. probably improper air ventilation. i gave a rating of 4 stars only for this reasoneverything else was nice n clean n helpful staff. didnt want to pay for the umpteen photo ops too.if you have aready seen big aquariums like melbourne, sentosa singapore etc, you can give the lost chambers aquarium a miss. its more of a set up with atlantis theme .i was not impressed in any way.overall a good experience ,a break from the ubiquitious malls of dubai.
great rides. i loved the water park some quite scary rides but lot of fun need to very fit to climb the stairs and there is lot of themdo not go to lost chambers not worth it

Great place but experience spoiked by locker problem!!!. Had a great Dolphin experience and then full use of the Aquapark afterwards. The crazy river is the best I've ever experienced and there were no major queues for the slides. Major downside which spoiled the start of our Aquapark day was the faulty lockers. From other reviews I see there is a common problem which management at Atlantis need to resolve. Waited for 40 mins to get a faulty locker to be re-opened. Rude staff at the locker/towel counter. Very poor customer service. I get the fact technical problems happen from time to time but it all comes down to how the staff and management handle the situation. Unfortunately, Atlantis is not quite there yet on their customer service!!That said, when we eventually got our day started, the park proved to be good fun,slides for all ages and levels of courage!Tip, if you get a locker, please test it first before putting anything inside. Make sure it locks and re-opens on first attempt. Otherwise you are in for a long and very frustrating wait. Management, take note and get it sorted!!!!

Amazing Day!. Had a great time at atlantis. Loads of rides and fun! defiantly advise those going to arrive early in the morning due to queuing and do not go on a Friday or Saturday as that is the locals weekends and it is very busy!

Spring/Easter Break Trip!. Great place to go to with your kids! Even as an adult, I enjoyed it. Quite a lot :) Though it's during the school holidays when we visited but the queues are not as horrible as the ones we experienced in other theme parks that we've been to around the world. Didn't have time to venture all the rides as they are only open from 10am till 5:30pm. So it's best to start your day early there as soon as they open up. It is best that you book online first for the entry tickets. Also, book a locker that will be very helpful too.

Book in advance or expect to pay a lot more on the gate. Second visit last time we booked in advance and also did the dolphins. This time we thought we would not book as weather had been a bit unpredictable . We checked the price the day before we went online and when we arrived at atlantis the price was so much more. It worked out about £60 more on the gate for 3 people. We booked a combo ticket that was also for the aquariums. If you need a locker this is another £8 or 40 aeds on top for a small. if your child us over 1.2 metres then you have to pay an adult price and they do check. Once inside it's great clean and we'll maintained. You have the lazy river and the shark drop ride which you have to find and take a ring with you on most rides along with a couple that you go on a big ring that takes about 7. But be prepared to quew even on less busy days. If you get there early go for the most popular rides then as not such big lines. There are lots of areas with sunbeds but be sure to leave your towels on them and not just leave shoes or a bag under as people will just put their towels on them and disregard your stuff. There are many places serving food and has different choices at each place so look around. You can get burger meals chicken pizza sandwiches ect. For an adult meal combo it's around 65 aed £12 I had a chicken club sandwich with fries and a drink. My daughter had a kids meal chicken nuggets fries and a milk for 39 aed about £8 I think I also got a fruit salad at 14 aed for small. Food and snacks are quite pricey ice lollies are around £5 each. We brought a refillable cup for £8 including the first drink then it was just under £2 each time you had it refilled. They take you pictures all the time so you end up with arm full of bands each time they take one. The only thing I would say is the signs for the rides and the directions could be better as you do tend to get lost or confused with them. If you want a taxi back to your hotel then expect a long wait of over an hour or more if you leave as the park closes or even after an hour after. We went to the aquarium after thinking that the line would be gone but we still had to wait for over an hour. The monorail from atlantis to the tram is 15 aed each one way which isn't a lot but when you consider a taxi is about a third of this total. Then once you get off the monorail you have to get a tram then the metro depending where your hotel is it does work out expensive. Also you get approached by private taxi drivers whilst waiting in line but they inflate the cost of the taxi by about 5 times the cost. Or my advice would be book a taxi in advance as you can get some taxis that only get booked by a call. All in all its a good family fun day out but costly. But it's a definite must do when in dubai . Oh the floor gets hot when walking to rides so take flipflops with you on the rides.
worthy but so expensive. it was a grateful and worthy water park you could ever seen . nice to being here whole day . but it's expensive to

Who could ever criticize this place?. This was a return visit it for us and again we found the service to be unquestionable. The multicultural nature of the guests and staff makes for a great atmosphere and nothing is ever too much trouble. New additions to the rides and slides since we were last here were great and our kids had such a great day. Surprisingly the food for a theme park is great quality and well priced - something we are not used to. One recommend is go the cabana - the extra benefits are definitely worth it. The day was finished off with the mandatory visit to The Lost Chambers, and again - WOW!

Best water park I have been to.. I have been to a few water parks around the world and this one is my favourite.The park is huge and there is obviously plenty to do for the children, however, there is also plenty to do for adults and some of the rides are great and you even feel quite nervous before going on them.I was actually there during Ramadan so there was hardly any waiting about for any of the rides.

Unique experience. Aquaventure is a great place to spend your day and should be included in your itinerary if you are visiting Dubai! Poseidon's Revenge is an absolute must try! Be prepared to spend more for food as it isn't allowed to carry home food inside the park.

Fun day out. we got free access to Aquaventure for free after booking the dolphins bay adventure. At first we weren't going to go to the water park but after talking to a guide he persuaded we should stay behind and enjoy the slides. After consulting him we got tickets to do zip lining. Im glad we did cos we had the best time ever. zip lining was fun must try slides are leap of faith and poseidon's revenge. It was an amazing day out. Lines weren't that long so we were able to try every water slide. must do.

We almost lost all our stuff there. To start with the park is better than average and we've been to many others around the world - it is well maintained and clean. Being a mom of three kids I got used to such places and I've never seen a perfect one. Lazy river is really great here. BUT at the end of the day when we returned to the lockers we couldn't find all our stuff!!! (I booked a large locker). The stress was huge! I thought we lost everything, incl. my wallet, iphone, cloth, etc. After searching everywhere we found the stuff on the floor in the locker area. According to the park staff, I didn't lock the locker properly. Apparently, their normal procedure is to automatically allocate such a locker to somebody else regardless if it is full. I was unlucky that this somebody else just threw my stuff out and put their stuff in my locker without any staff warning. Their manager admitted that this happens quite often, but only blamed myself in what has happened without even saying 'sorry' as if it is a normal situation. The process definitely doesn't work and their manager is not professional enough to treat this issue properly, I could even use a word 'rude' when he talked to us.
So much to do. Stayed at the Atlantis so we visited the park everyday. My children are aged 3-16 and they all had something to do. The shark safari and Ray feed was great fun too!
Superb. Must visit for all age groups. amazing location, ambience & rides are awesome for adventurous & normal for both

Great family day out.. Best to get there before 10.00 to avoid ques. We got there at 11.00 and the que was quite long took about 40mins to buy a ticket, but the service was very good, the attendents were very good in making sure no one pushed in, those that tried got sent to the back. When we bought the tickets we thought it was quite expensive but it is well worth it. (Tip: You can you the locker rooms without buying a locker pass, you really do not need to pay for a locker just pack your change of clothes in a beach bag and set up camp somewhere, very safe place). We had an excellent time. The water rides are some of the best I have been on. The whole place is kept spotlessly clean and well run. The staff are all very helpful and friendly.

Worth a visit. Quite an expensive day out. The park is fantastic and the rides are so good. The organisation is very poor. The queue was longer for the prepaid tickets (which we had) that if you just arrive without. It would be so easy to speed this up. We had to queue for 45 mins to get our prepaid wristbands. Make sure to get a locker/towels at the time. You have to re-queue if you don't. Huge queues for all rides. Get there early. Food expensive too. Worth a visit.

Good fun but... We had a great time here, my only issue is the fact they do not allow food in the water park and this is not made clear at the time of booking. We do not want to eat burgers and chips and pay 75 AED for a portion of chips so please do not take our picnic food off of us!! The food within the theme park was a rip off and with families paying a lot for the entrance i did not think this was fair. the rides were a lot of fun however and we did have a great time!

Great waterpark even for adults!. Loot of fun fore the whole family. The water in the pool was a little bit to cold. The park was clean and safe. Loot of slides to choose between. A minus for that you must be over 120cm to go on the slides. Our youngest soon was 115 and got really disappointed. At wild wadi you only need to be 110cm.

Best waterpark in the UAE! . Go during the week! Not on a Friday or Saturday. Best slides, so much fun! Get into the lazy river and just relax. Or chill out at the beach with a great view of the Dubai skyline. It's my favorite waterpark in the UAE. Go and dine later at one of the restaurants in the Atlantis. They have a good evening brunch!
Waterpark. Brilliant waterpark, nothing like it in England! You have to Poseidon Revenge... and try not to scream lol

Fun for all of the family .. Simply a place to have fun for all members of the family .
bit crowded on the weekends. they have a resturant too.

Family fun. Not normally a fan of waterparks but loved this one. We visited three times as guests of the Atlantis hotel. Rapids and lazy river are enormous and take an hour plus to navigate the whole course. Shark Attack and other rides all great fun. Super facilities, never felt overcrowded. Lots of lifeguards and the whole park felt clean and well-maintained.

Great Animal interactions!. My wife and I did the diving with dolphins and the sea lion encounter. The trainers are great and the service and facilities are all first class. we asked for some extra poses with the sea lion and they were very willing to accommodate us. I would highly recommend this experience to everyone.

Wow !. What a place ! So much to do for adults and children alike . Even when it's busy there's no queues as there's so much to do for everyone . You'll need to visit at least twice to try all the rides etc .

I hated Aquaadventure. There were just too many people. With hindsight I should have just stayed in my five star hotel and resort and waterslides and the like just aren't for me. Plus my kids were too small to go on many of the slides. If your kid is shorted than 1 metre and 20cm them don't go.

Exciting & Enjoyable Rides!!!. Wow....we loved the water park even though the temperature was chilly. Had excellent quality time with my 8 year daughter. The staff were excellent in their service. We regret we did not start in the morning, but maybe next time, so that we can explore the entire waterpark. Only drawback is when we wanted to go back to the parking the driver informed us that there is traffic jam and recommended us to walk . First of all the temperature was chilly and secondly there is no pavement for the pedestrian to walk and it was too dangerous to walk on the road. And by the way when we were walking there was no traffic jam!.
fun world with kids. your and your kids will enjoy a lot...and will need a lot of will power to come out of pools and rides ..

Great day out!. We had a great time at aquaventure during the half term holidays. It wasn't as busy as we'd thought it might be either so bonus!Get there early to have any hope at getting any sun loungers as there just are not enough for the number of people in the park. We struggled in this regard. The facilities are very well maintained with the onsite F&B good if a little expensive in our opinion. There is also a great kids area which ours absolutely loved.

Great water park, fearsomely expensive. Best water park I've ever been to, but the cost reflects this. Around £250 for a family of four. Apart from the lazy river and the kids' pool our kids aged 4 & 6 were too young to make the most of it, but they still had a great time. Beach is also available to use although this faces towards Dubai and therefore looks out onto building work on the Palm.

It was good but I've been to better. We had free admission into here with our hotel. We had a good few hours here.. we enjoyed the rides and wave pool. All in all pretty good but we enjoyed the atlantis water park more.

One day is not enough.. I visit 2. Time with my 7 years son. New attractions is very good. Here problem is this aquaventure is really big. If you will try all attraction you need to have 3 full day minimum.Anyway was good day for us . Thanks for all staff. For food they need to develop their menue and food quality. Food quality is poor.

Don't pre book! Weather so cold!. We made the mistake of pre booking thinking it is always warm in Dubai. It was cold and raining. We thought we may as well give it a go, ate lunch there and ventured out. Water was cold and now I am full of cold. We left after a couple of hours. Asked if we could come back another day when weather is better to be told tough as park is open. You would think they would be more customer service focussed, as we would be spending more money in there on food, lockers, towels etc. Very shortsighted. Complete waste of money on expensive tickets.

Great Fun. Spent the day shooting down huge slides with my 15 year old daughter; sometimes in a hoop, sometimes in a big paddling pool type arrangement and other times by the seat of my red swimming trunks. It was brilliant. We did all the slides. Some were gentle, smiley time, others proper white knuckle jobs e.g. standing straight in a capsule until the floor is removed from where you stand leaving gravity to do its best in a vertical drop ...fantastic! There is a whole day and more of action packed activity. Or you can as my wife did and sun yourself by the pool all day. Food was not cheap but I decided it was good value, one chicken breast sandwich could have fed two adults, the burger was good meat and fries were plentiful. I couldn't give it all 5 stars partly because it is so busy but you would expect that when there is so much fun to be had. The key problem we had was after leaving the park roadworks jammed the roads in and out, there was not a cab to be had, it took an age to get away. We were unlucky. If this happens to you, hop on the mono rail back to the mainland and get a cab from there (as I learned the next day). It really is a fantastic adventure park for kids, teenagers and adults that have not quite grown up yet.

perfect waterpark for everyone. We had an unforgattable day altough there were too many people that by the time we arrived at 12.00 we didn't find any deckchairs available. Its better to be there by 9 am to avoid queues. The park and the water were clean .The rides are fantasvtic especially the shark tank .we had a unique experience at the dolphin bay ,this park offers many activities and experience such as zipline,stingray feeding and much more. It was an unforgettable day during our stay in dubai. I highly recommend this waterpark

Overcrowded, overpriced and overrated!. We visited thie waterpark for the first and last time. It was very overcrowded, you couldn't move. There were no sun beds and it was very expensive.Very disappointing and we didn't stay there long. Never again.

Best experience so far!. This has been the most amazing experience ever! Amazing water rides...from the rapids thats sure to tickle your stomach.....to the torrents and my very best, the Leap of faith that totally gave me an adrenaline rush! Awesome place and ambience! Besides it also has kiddies water experiences too! Definitely going to aquaventure again .....this time with my two princesses!

Good day of fun. My family (2 adults and 2 kids ages 6&9) enjoyed our day at Atlantis. Plan for a full day to maximize the experience... And better to stay at hotel so You avoid the painful taxi line as mentioned by a lot of people.We got there at 10, opening. There was a long line even for those who bought ahead and saved some money. We did the large locker which worked out for valuables and put money on the wristband (hold on to your receipt in a special spot, guy gave us a hard time at end).We found some chairs near the kid zone play area and parked our towels and a non valuable bag. If you don't care about the kid zone, find a nice place on the other side. Not as crazy busy and better sun access. Then we were off to the rides. All the rides were hard to know where they were at, how scary it was, do you need an inner tube. So you just watch where people are going and look at the safety sign or weight or other signals. Also the queues aren't very organized. Especially the shark attack ride where it empties into an aquarium. Cool but I would suggest to do first thing in the morning or last. It was an hour wait for us and there was some pushing and line cutting. The photo queue at the exit was also really annoying. Only 5 computers with all these people leaving. You would think some people say "screw it" when they see the craziness and Atlantis lets money walk out the door.Food was quite good for park food. We ate at a place with several types of food near the Neptune pyramid. Asian and hamburgers were really good.There were a ton of lifeguards and the place was quite clean for the people and food everywhere.We tried the monorail exit option. It was 60 AED and there were no taxis at the gateway station. Then we paid 24 AED on the tram back to our Dubai marina hotel. Compared to taxi from Atlantis, we paid over 3X. My husband started wondering if we should have just waited in the hour plus taxi line. Overall the park is really nice but the organization needs a lot of help - taxi, queues, photos, wristband money.... Consider doing the hotel for 1-2 nights and have the free entrance plus no exit issues.

Worth It!. A great way to spend a day with family in Dxb. The water park is very clean and has good rides for all ages. There is a kiosk at the airport arrival terminal where you get the cheapest tickets - even cheaper than online!!!Get to the park by 09:15am as it will be easy to get the free sun loungers and less rush at all the rides. You are allowed to carry 1 litre of water per person. Keep it in mind to leave by 4pm or else be prepared to get stuck in traffic for hours after 5pm.

Fantastic place. Hardly any queues even when adjoining hotel was at 100% occupancy . Favourite fur my 7 year old was the family boat ride (zoomerang?!) . If staying in Atlantis Paln very handy next door and free entry made it even better .

Right place for the wrong season. It is quite an incredible place. One needs to take a short boat ride to get to this man made fun centre. It is worth the trouble. There is a lovely beach and clean pool for swimmers. Unfortubately, it was February and the water was still too cold for most. There are eateries on the artificial island. There are places for one to kick a ball and for young children to run around.

best day in dubai. i think it was one of the best places in dubai (must visit)
it was very expensive but it worth all the money i paid
i loved it all games are amazing

Waterpark for all ages. This waterpark is amazing! Set aside a whole day to get the most out of the experience. We spent most of our time on the river rides going from one experience to the next. The food facilities are good as is the beach if you want a little relax during the day. Towels and lockers are provided for a small fee as are GoPro waterproof cameras. We thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience.

fun day for family with young kids. There are no signs when you enter the waterpark so if it's your first time you might feel a little lost but just keep walking together with the others. It would have been nice if they didn't run out of maps!We went here on March 29, a Tuesday, expecting there would be less people but unfortunately there were plenty of people. There was a long queue in the ticket booth. It's really a good idea to book tickets online at least a day in advance to save money (at least 60AED, I think) and the queue is shorter than those with no bookings or better yet stay in the Atlantis hotel for a complimentary entrance to Aquaventure. If you're planning to go to Aquaventure, staying in the Atlantis hotel may actually be less expensive than paying for another hotel plus Aquaventure entrance fee. We couldn't find an empty beach/pool chair in the park. Maybe it's always full throughout the spring break which is the best time to come here when the weather is just right.My daughter who is 145 cm tall and weighs 39 kg was not allowed in Poseidon's Revenge and Leap of Faith because they say she's too light but I didn't see any weight restriction on the website. Because of this she's not raving about aquaventure and thinking maybe we should have gone to Wild Wadi instead.But to be fair, my 7 and 10 year old daughters had an amazing time at the Splashers Area and the river rides. Make sure to walk around and visit the beach area as well. There maybe more vacant spots on the beach and grassy area overlooking the beach. Just bring extra towels or picnic mat if you can.
Good day out!. A really good day out, not as many slides etc as we thought there would be but still a really fun day!
WOW. This is another must see while visiting Dubai. It was really really amazing.But for people who dont like getting wet - dont go.

I was expecting more for the price we paid!. Although my son had a fun time at the Aquaventure Waterpark, it is too pricey for the few activities they are offering. I understand that they have loads of lifeguards which is great which means their wage bill is high. I was impressed by the fact that all the slides we wanted to do were in the same building and did not have to walk to different parts of the park

Never fail to disappoint . Other than the confusion of where we were going the aquaventure Park was a one and only for me. Most holidays I would go to a waterpark and it would be pretty straight forward, there would be about 6 slides and one place to eat but as usual Dubai have topped everyone and better! With a huge range of different slides and others activities to do, familjes would love this park as much as thrill seekers. HIGHLY RECOMMEND

Disappointed. We were expecting this to be an amazing day and we were quite disappointed.We went on an overcast day and it rained slightly so the park was very quiet. This was good as we did not have to queue for a single ride. However, because we didn't have to queue we had gone down every slide or on every ride within about an hour. I didn't think there was anything particularly special about this water park, and I would not go again. If we returned to Dubai we would try Wadi Waterpark as I think this would be better value for money!
Great fun. Great fun for the whole family, water slides not for the faint hearted, lazy river and sunbathing. A little expensive

Water park like never before. This park has amazing rides as well as a system of water flow in which the person don't need to go anywhere and goes everywhere with the flow of water an amazing experience must go for a life experience
Lots of fun. Great if you have kids or just want to be a kid for a day. Dont miss out if in Dubai or the Bahamas. Definitely the highlight of the Atlantis

A bit pricey but a wonderful waterpark. The negatives first, it's a bit on the pricey side and the sun loungers very quickly get filled up with a single towel and a tube of sun cream - but actually no people!! However, on the positive side the water park is fabulous! There's something for everyone. There's a family section, that people without families don't have to mingle with! There's a lazy river with various sections including the rapids. There are group slides, individual slides and daredevil slides. One slide that ends up under the shark pool. Obviously, being Dubai the weather is pretty much guaranteed so for a break from the slides simply lie back and enjoy the sun. Watch out at the end of the day too, if you're not staying on The Palm then put some thought into your transport back as taxis don't come out this way by chance! The public transport is excellent but you will need to take the journey into account if at the end of the day you have tired children!

Not a bad Water Park. The feeling was your regular water park from the US, we enjoyed especially the beach area where we lounged for most of the day. The Lazy river was great but it got crowded fast. The only thing we did not like was the food. The Shark Bites restaurant had american style food but it seemed that everything had curry which made the flavor very different than what we are used to. From the fried chicken to the burger to the chicken avocado sandwich they all had a curry kick. If you are a fan of curry then you might like it.

Great waterpark . Had a fantastic day at this waterpark. Staff are brilliant as we have found in Dubai generally. Recommend you arrive early especially in school holidays as it gets very busy. We arrived as it opened and took sunbeds by the children's play pool. Lockers are provided but it felt safe enough to leave most things on your beds. Visited aquarium after which is nice. One big tip when leaving the taxi queue was huge we had read on trip advisor it can take ages to get off the palm in the traffic. We took the monorail which was a nice experience we then easily picked up a cab to our hotel from the station much easier than waiting for the cabs at the waterpark.

Superb waterpark for kids. The dolphin experience and waterpark for kids is all you need to keep the little ones entertained. Easy 3 quarters of a day can be spent without a flutter. Better to avoid Fridays and Saturdays as traffic outside the hotel after 4pm is manic and barely any taxis due to construction of widening the road going on

Great aquapark .. Just one tip try to visit this waterpark once your kids are taller than 1.20meters as the best rides do not allowed kids under 1.20! That was a but dissapointing! If you can, do the swimming with the dolphins- a very unique lovely experience !!!
Amaizing. Endless fun and joyful under the hot sun of Dubai !!All kinds of water games and venues,, a place that you need to visit

Great side trip!. We were staying at the Burj Khalifa but had been recommended to go visit the Aquaventure. It is excellent and we want to go back. About the only point I'd make it don't go on a weekend (Friday/Saturday). The queues were over half an hour on all of the slides, which is a real shame when the experience is about one minute of excellence.

Be prepared to queue!. I've been in Dubai for 5 years and only visited as I had a friend stay from out of town who wanted to check it out. We went at lunch time & spent the majority of our 4 hours there queuing! Firstly for tickets to enter and then for the slides. The queue for the 'Leap of Faith' must have taken an hour for an experience that lasted less than 30 seconds!! LOL.So I guess it depends how desperately you want to go on it as to whether the payoff is worth it. I am a boring old git now though so perhaps those younger than me would be happy to queue multiple times for the experience. It's certainly not cheap, so I'd recommend booking in advance to save money and to avoid the queues for tickets. Plus arriving early is probably a good idea too.

Excellent water park for children. Aquaventure water park is open to all for a fee and free of charge for hotel guests. Towels are provided free of charge to all hotel guests, but paid for general public.the water park has some amazing rides. it is spread across a sizeable area and is easy to loose your bearings. so be prepared to walk till you find your destination.The rides themselves are amazing and loads of fun for the entire family. Lifeguards are stationed at every strategic point and keep a keen eye on the guests and look after children well.A must visit if you can squeeze in the time.

Fun day out, great staff. It's hard to say if this watermark is better than Yas in Abu Dhabi, but it certainly is a brilliant fun packed day out.The Leap of Faith is terrifying and brilliant at the same time.The staff here were brilliant too, my cousin had a mishap and the first aid team took great care of her.Only downside is the food - with healthy eating options being few and far between.

Good fun. A lot of fun slides. I would recommend heading over to the second tower on arrival as everyone tends to stop at the first one which gets quite busy, we did 2 slides at the tower of Neptune on arrival and then headed over to the tower of poseidon which was considerably quieter. We had an enjoyable day and finished it off in the Lost Chambers Aquarium.

Fun Filled Day at Aquaventure Waterpark. Visited Aquaventure with the idea that it would be another typical waterpark, however was pleasantly surprised to see that it catered for all the members of the family, which made it more special and enjoyable as well.The rides had just the right balance of fun and thrill. The water and the whole area was squeaky clean.Had paid for a combo of Towel+Locker for my full family of four & we all used the locker near the entrance itself to change into our swimming costumes, to make the most of the park, We did not carry our towel tickets and therefore could not get one issued inside the waterpark as they insisted on the Towel ticket for the same. Here would like to mention that firstly, no one briefed us to carry the towel ticket. We were under the impression that the band put around our wrist for the locker would be enough to get the towels issued. Secondly it is suggested that all your combos should be embedded in the bar code to enable a hassle free enjoyment without having to worry about the administrative aspects.The rides were very good but the sign posting or briefing of any kind on the type of rides along with the degree of thrill etc was found to be very inadequate.Most of the guests were asking each other and were generally not clear about the type of ride.

great waterpark. we visited the place during our stay at palm atlantis. its a brialliant waterpark and kids friendly rides as well. While many rides are for kids more than 7-8 years (height restriction) but its a good place.

Fun day. We had a excellent day here...we have two children 19 and 13 didn't see them for the first four hours...came back full of laughter ...managed to get us on a couple of slides. ..great lay out...food bar with good selection was great for a water park..downside waiting for a taxi...no organisation at all...waiting well over a hour and in the end we took the shuttle bus to Dubai Mall and got the taxi from there..

Fun destination... Once you get there/in.. Tough to get to and pricey, but fun once you get going. Best if you're staying locally, as getting in and out of area was difficult. Palm Jumeira is deceivingly large, densely populated and traffic-prone.

Excellent for children. Was with friends and thought what all the hype was all about.It was one of the biggest water activities I've ever been to, this is more for families with children but overall it was exciting will defo recommend.

Great Fun!. We spent a full day at the water-park. We paid for the dolphin encounter, which was a separate charge and quite expensive. That said, my kids really enjoyed it! My 5 year old daughter also went zip-lining through the park. I didn't expect them to allow her to go given her age, but it wasn't a problem at all. If there's one thing to complain about it's getting off of the palm at the end of the day. The line for taxis extended forever. We were able to get on a shuttle bus to the mall, but it literally took over 2 hours of sitting in traffic to get off of the palm. We had fun, but I definitely wouldn't go back until that traffic/construction situation is resolved.

Lovely experience. I had visited the Atlantis in Bahamas several yeras ago on a business trip and then decided that I really want to bring my daughter one day to experience the amazing Atlantis waterpark. So we visited Altantis waterpark on our Dubai trip. Luckily it was very similar to the one in Bahamas. We had a really amazing day (even though it was the only day during our trip that was not sunny at all..)

Something for Everyone. There are lots and lots of different rides for everyone here. I am not a big water park fan but ventured onto the the Lazy river which was a very long ride and very enjoyable - although my daughter omitted to mention there were some faster areas on the ride ! She also talked me into going on the Shark Attack ride !! OMG its in the dark the first bit and very fast (for me )but then you come out into the middle of the Aquarium which was pretty amazing !! My 16 yr old son went on the Leap of Faith (alone!) and queued 40 minutes for 10 seconds of ride but said it was brilliant! My husband went on fair few rides with the kids and I sat with the bags but there are lockers there if you are all braver than me ! There's also a zip wire and beach and lots of burger type food places. Good fun for all and great way to keep cool on those hotter days.

Everything a waterpark should be.. Greta for familys, well run, could be more signs to help figure out how to get around. Alos rides could marked on level of Exictement (i.e.e for those who only want a peacful tube ride down the lazy river).

family fun. wonderful place,even is crowded day,many rides,a lot of fun.Good meal deal and refill options,must try
Get your towel from the hotel as well get water socks as the walks are getting hot

Fun day for any age. Reserve a whole day for this water park! Lines are considerably shorter in the morning (10 am) so try the most popular rides early on. Great variety of slides and friendly staff. Consider wearing a less revealing swim suit if you are a fan of the crazier slides, I wore a bikini and my back was left quite sore from all of the friction!A small locker holds one backpack (2 people's worth of belongings) and a large one about twice that. You can load some credit on your entrance bracelet to use in the park (for food, drinks) and if you don't spend all of it, the park will reimburse the credit in cash at the end of the day.Getting a taxi at the end of the day is a nightmare, so take the monorail instead and then transfer to the tram or get a taxi on the other side of the palm.

Families should not hesitate . This is a large water park with a lot of different attractions, a lot of people...for some people that is a dream come true - for me, who would rather be camping in a rain forest, not so much. That having been said - I would do it again. The lazy river suits me, and lifeguards at every juncture - impressive. Lines were reasonable when we were there - they moved along.The animal education was solid - you could see that the animal trainers care about the animals and want people to learn conservation. Young children loved it. Parents loved it. Tweens, teens, etc. etc. I don't think you can go wrong. Our family spent three days at this park, and I returned to work rested. Close to miracle level entertainment ;)

Some things I wish I'd known but great! . Went on Friday 12th March and it wasn't as busy as we'd anticipated/dreaded. Weather was great so really expected long Q's and packed pools but wasn't the case. Went with my friend, we're both 26yo and had a blast. The kids have a great water jungle gym type area and it's mostly adults in the pools! It's not well sign posted though - we came via Metro (from Burjeman area) & tram (22AED for a day ticket which includes the tram) then finally monorail. The monorail runs up the palm and is 25AED return. You can get a taxi up there but we wanted to save a bit of cash and see the views up the palm. The monorail is great for this. When heading towards the water park, sit on the left side of the monorail for the best photo opportunities. When you get off the monorail go down to the (only) exit and take a right then head toward what looks like the main hotel reception. It's through there on the left. We didn't buy tickets in advance - I WOULD STRONGLY RECOMMEND. it's way cheaper and the line is smaller. Still, we waited max 10 min.They charge you extra for towels and lockers and they don't let you take your own drink in. Bags are searched. We took our own towels and just got one locker - they're plenty big enough. Remember sun screen, sun glasses and to wear a one piece if you're a woman. Bikini's seemed to be a bad idea if you like the extreme rides as the water pressure is high and lots of people had sore marks on their backs from the speed! Luckily I wore a one piece and was fine. There's a private beach too - great to swim in and is warm. We waited a maximum of 10 mins in any Q. Even when one of the rides stopped working (the one where the floor dropped out). Unfortunately two of the rides weren't working that day with apparent 'scheduled' maintenance. Very annoying as there was no mention on the website. As others have said - it's pricey, and not just the admission, a paratha snack was 35 AED. Another tip - if you have goggles - take them! Or buy some cheap ones in Dubai (too expensive at Atlantis!). You can also hire a Go Pro on the day - something we didn't realise until we left. The price was about £40 if I remember. Or take your own. Saw lots of people with those under water cameras and the pouches you can put your phone in. Depending how hot it is - take sandals / jelly shoes that won't slip off in the pool because the tiles are HOT. A fantastic day and would go again!
Perfect. The day just passes, lots of fun and slides, suitable for all ages. Massive waterpark and beach. Recommended for everyone visiting dubai.

What a day. . Everything about this place ticks the boxes. With it being so popular you're expecting queues everywhere and and an inability to move, screaming kids. Moaning people. But it's nothing like that. Organised rides, pools, food kiosks mean that even for the popular plunge ride or the tomb ride that scare even your most brave, waiting time was at best 5-10 minutes at the absolute max. It's tough going getting through everything this place has to offer and rewards of food and drink always comforting when rented an array choice only a few minutes away from everything. Free towels. Free sunbeds. Free shuttle to and from hotel. Was such a great day and made the trip to Dubai such a great experience.
Fanstastic. Fantastic, However the Wild Wadi is fine and there are similar, but you can enjoy Dubai Aquarium and a nice view around.
Perfect place. I`ve been there with my girlfriend. The place is huge. Awesome. You just go there and enjoy the place.

Make a Day of it!. The shark slide is a must visit and is the unique part of the park. The swimming with Dolphins must be booked and paid for separately and should really be done in advance. If you download "The Entertainer" app on your phone you can get discounts on entry and restaurants at the water park. Its worth also planning to visit the Atlantis, aquarium and stay for sunset drinks at Nassimi beach club is your only visiting Atlantis and the water park. Make a day of it!
Sun & Fun. Had an unforgettable day on The Palm at the Aquaventure Waterpark. Awesome slides and rides with enough thrills to keep everyone happy. Great way to spend the day with friends.
A good outing. It has only a few sets of rides but we had a lot of fun carrying our tubes and going around the various water slides.

Overpriced lockers. The price of the lockers at this place is like London property prices, flippin crazy that for 4 adults and three kids the lockers were almost £60!! We got tickets online and were cheaper than turning up. The rides were pretty fun but can be done in half a day but good fun anyway. Haven't been wild wadee so cannot compare! Well maintained though but needs clear signage getting to the main entrance!

Great rides, but a frustrating experience. The rides at Aquaventure are great.... they have some high level thrill rides and a fantastic lazy river which is superb for chilling out on. Overall I rate the rides very highly.However a trip to Aquaventure is not without frustration. In addition to my (fairly expensive) entry ticket, I also paid to borrow a locker and towel. The ticket for the towel was on a paper receipt (in a waterpark!!!), so I had to store this in the locker until I required to use it as the end of the day. However (and there is the frustrating part) - the booth for collecting the towels is another part of the park. So at the end of the day I had go all the way to the changing rooms, get out my paper receipt, turn around and walk all the way back to the pick up my towel. By the time I made it back my friends (who had their own towel) were ready and waiting for me. Annoying!!! The second (and most) frustrating aspect of Aquaventure is getting a taxi outside. The traffic on Palm Island is horrendous. We left fairly early (about 4.30pm) as we were heading straight for our flight at the airport. We waited about 45 minutes to get a taxi and then about another 40 - 50 minutes for our taxi to actually get off the island. We only just made the flight. My recommendation would be to take the monorail off the island and then get a taxi at the monorail station instead.

Atlantis Dubai. A must fun frolic place if you happen to be in Dubai and looking for a quality family time.Lazy river and deep dives are the main attractions and there are plenty of things to do for both kids and adults

Disappointed. The pool was good for kids didn't really get to see the rest of the park but my whole experience was ruined as I suffered good poisoning after having one of the Atlantis burgers.last 2 days in dubai were ruined after being taken to hospital for food poisoning. This experience alone has put me off from visiting the park again

One of the best Waterparks!. We spend almost one day with kid, and enjoyed like anything. A lots of adventurous rides for kids as well as adults, very neat and clean water. Better if you carry some polyester/nylon swim costumes as they don't allow cotton cloth in water park. Not to carry any food item as they don't allow inside. Metter to purchase waterproof mobile pouch for safety of mobile as well as currency notes. Try to use boat having twin seats as single seat boat is not very suitable for high speed rides.

Holiday Water Park Visit. We spent the day here whilst on our holiday. The weather was a bit dull with some rain showers ( unusual for Dubai in March apparently) but that didn't stop us or reduce our experience. The park is fairly large with different slide towers and pool areas which makes it less crowded. The slide are all great with a lot for the kids and adults alike. We particularly liked the 4 to 6 man rafts and slides which were a lot of fun. The park was very clean and tidy and felt safe. The only pain was having to return to your locker to get money to pay for food and drink (not too expensive for Dubai). Although I believe you can load money into your wristband - best do this when you first arrive.
good place to spend a day. really good water coaster, quality of the Park is nice, only bad thing they only offer greasy and junk food, nothing to keep healthy,Will return

visit to water park a must. Excellent day at the water park - not busy at all.... hire a cabana...makes a massive difference, real vip experience and great secure base to have all your items.... people fetch you stuff all day ... no need to queue etc.

Overcast day but doesnt spoil a trip to Atlantis. Great day exploring the many different rapids, slides, flumes and rides as Aquaventure. A great day out with kids or for adults who want to behave like kids!
Great time for the entire family!. The water park is great fun for the entire family. Make sure you have water socks as the pavement gets very hot. If yo

Awesome waterpark! . My husband and I visited in March and it was awesome. Hardly any waits for the waterslide, max 15mins, and enough to keep you entertained for a half day. We went on almost all of the rides, the scariest being Poseidons revenge!It's a good waterpark, v. Safe and clean with friendly staff.You'll need to pay 40dhs for a small locker for the day which is worth it. They don't allow food inside. And dresscode is like any waterpark. Highly recommend!
Overcrowded . If you would like to enjoy the water park at least a little bit without the queues you got to be there at 9am. Try and book online as tickets were 50 uad more expensive by the counter

Great place, not only for kids. Nice experience, especially 30-minutes we spent in "deep water" with dolphins (a bit pricey -there is a separate ticket for Dolphins Bay, but very unique experience with dolphins).

Relaxing day. We are in our 50's and really enjoing this place.I try all rides,same as am young teen;)The beach is my favorite,like the palm trees and the shade.Come early and aboid queue,as well there are very good deals for meals,as well refills for drinks

one hell of a place. we went to the park for 2 days from the adjacent atlantis hotel 7 it is a great place .for the kids they have a wonderful play area in a pool which is great.Now for the rides they have neptune & pseidon play area. > you can go around the area in the battery operated buggy cars which are complimentary.Do rent a locker where you can keep all your belongings bcause taking care of them on the rides is quite an issue.wear a pair of swimming trunks & towels are availabe free at most of the locations.the rides of the neptune are amazing & most of them are open for kids above say 10 years ( 4 feet tall ). they are all great and really take your breadth away.The rides on he posiedon are hair raising & the leap of faith is actually what it says.( it is supposed to be the fastest on this part of the globe).Most of the rides are unlimited but you do have to wals a lot & carry your own tubes which restricts your no of revisits to a particular ride.For the kids they do have the dolphin & sea lion activities which are exhorbidantly expensive & they ont have any shows which is a big let down.Overall i would recomed this place for a 1 ?2 day visit depending on your group composition/time budget.

Nice place to relax. It's a really nice place, but is not as amazing as some other water parks in Orlando. Don't get me wrong is still very beautiful but I had bigger expectations. The lost chambers aquarium was very beautiful but you need to pay extra if you want to see it. I enjoyed a lot the lazy river, which was not so lazy as it has a continuous wave.

Fun in the sun!. Really had a great time both times I've been to Aquaventure. Many fun rides to go on and queues are not too long if you go at the right time. Leap of faith and shark attack are my favorites. Poisidons drop is intense. The tubes are super fun too when going with your friends. Staff ate all very helpful and friendly. Food and beverage is a bit expensive.

Good....but not great.. TIP: Get there early, it opens at 10am and we were the first to arrive, we managed to get all the rides done in 3 hours with very little queues. The good - The rides were all enjoyable, and the venue was very clean. The Aquaconda was the best ride, basically a big ring that finds you up a vertical wall!!! The average - Apart from maybe three rides, we found them a little tame. Having previously been to a water park in Abu Dhabi we felt that offered far better and more rides than Atlantis. The bad - Finding your way around is not easy, sign posts are hard to follow and there is no indication as to what each ride is, how intense the ride is or where to go for the ride!!! The most frustrating part of it all, when you finish some of the rides it leads you on to a lazy river which you think is the exit.... it is not, you then spend 20 minutes floating around trying to figure out how to get out!! All in all, it is a good day and i am sure if we had children it would receive more stars as very geared towards families. Also is expensive at £125 for us which was entry, locker, one towel and a bottle water....
Great place for relax. We love the beach,specially relaxing under the palm trees.Nice sport activities as well.All rides are good,we enjoyed

Best Waterpark in DXB, Must See!. This waterpark is the best in Dubai.
It is a very large park and offers many different kinds of slides! They also have a beach access where you can swim in the ocean, and they also offer many other activities such as Zipline-Flying, Stingray feeding (everything is well explained on the website)!
Overall, very satisfied and re-visited many times!

Had the best day ever here. I went with 3 friends that I met on holidays. They were already booked in and I tegged along. Possibly because I had no expectations I found this to be the best day of the holidays. We arrived around 11/11.30. In hindsight we should've come earlier as they were open from 10. We had booked online so getting through the entrance was fast and efficient. We chose to base ourselves at the beach on loungers and walk up and down to the park. There were places to sit, with alot of families so we found the beach quieter. We could sunbathe in peace and take trips in and out to the slides. We started of on the bigger slides with the inflatables. These were good fun and an easy start to the day. I dont think it was by design but as the day went on we were progressing to more terrifying slides each time. We went on every slide. The slide which brings you into the aquarium was good to do however compared to the more scary slides it was quite tame. The best 2 slides, and forgive me I cant remember the names, was one where you had to cross your arms across your chest and push yourself off a steep incline. Nothing can prepare you for the terror you feel going in and the high you feel coming out the other end. Another one was where you stand upright in a coffin like box, with a perspex floor beneath you. You have to cross your arms and legs.The glass door closes and counts down from 3 and the perspex floor gives way to a straight drop. It was the most frightening thing, yet the best thing we did all day. It was an excellent day out and highly recommended.

A way to spend a memorable day in Dubai!. There's so much to see and do that this one takes a whole day! There are plenty of waterslides and creeks. There's something for everyone weather you like a peaceful ride floating slowly in the water or an adrenaline full, fast-paced slides! There's also a beach with sun beds, volley ball fields and soccer goals. For a 100 dirhams fee you get to use the zipper lines the whole day. There's also sharks, rays, fish and dolphins to see! Some of the slides go through the shark-filled tanks, and with an extra payment you get to swim with the dolphins or fee the rays. It's definitely worth the money!!

Amazing Waterpark, Dolphin Encounter Experience made the day extra special. My husband had booked the swimming with dolphins experience at this Waterpark as a surprise treat for me as we were in Dubai on honeymoon. The experience was amazing and something I will never forget, it was so special to be up close to such a beautiful animal. You have the opportunity to stroke and have a cuddle with a dolphin, you also get to swim with the dolphin pushing you along. There is a photographer there to take photos to capture your experience, as you are not allowed to take your own cameras into the water with the dolphins. Unfortunately, we didn't like any of our photos but I don't need a photo to remember this once in a lifetime experience.The rest of the water park is excellent, there is something for everyone from the super fast 'drop' water slides, the lazy river which goes on forever and the wave pool. I think we pretty much went on every water slide in this park and they were all really good.A great day out to cool off from the boiling sun in Dubai
Awesome!. Aquaventure Waterpark is really awesome place! Even the adults can go without kids, it is so entertaining.
Get there early. Great park - a tad expensive.Would recommend getting there early (opens at 10 am) as it was considerably quieter in the morning then after lunch.

Cool down. We had a day here as part of our stay in the area and we had a great fun filled day. Its within the grounds of the Atlantis Hotel on the Palm itself, great for cooling down and enjoying the waterpark rides and the lazy river or for just staying put and chilling in the sun.

Excellent. A must visit attracation every time I visit Dubai, every age has a choice in this park.. My kids enjoyed and never had enough.The only problem is the time is shorter during this time of the year as the sunset is earlier.. But weather much better than summer. So, come early (10 AM) to avoid queues and if u have a car, park it in the lot then ride the free shuttle ( I could find the parking lot as it was right after Atlantis hotel, now it is before the hotel). Also,book 24 hours before your day of visit through their website to save around 60 Dirham(17$)/ ticket.Everything inside is overpriced, bring everything u need with u.. Water, snacks, swimwear, towels, slippers.Enjoy :)
Half day trip. Great views of the beach . Decent size of water park . Lack of slides was a bit of a let down . Nice relaxing evening

Good fun. Have visited the park some time back. The park and rides are really fun. Make sure you go there on a weekday where its less crowded, and earlier on the day. The parks signature ride is the high and steep slide which passes under a sharks aquarium. Its a real rush!

Fun time @ Aquaventure. First of all be ready to spend some money as you decide on your trip to Aquaventure. if you are resident of UAE,show your Emirates ID and get the discount.You need to leave your car in a separate parking area next to Atlantis and the shuttle bus will take you right into the park. I think its done to avoid rush at the park entrance which is fair and easy for a lot of people. Buses are parked right outside and they shuttle quickly.You need just one day to enjoy this place and if you have been to other water theme parks across the world you will know this one can be finished in just 5 hrs. Drops are there for dare devils,Slides are available for the fun seekers and lazy river with waves are there for people who don't prefer the adrenaline rush just like my friend who wanted to stay in that forever. I found that the slides are covered 30-40% on most of them which was not very great as you cannot 'see' anything to feel the fear factor.When you see the rides go till the edge it creates an excitement, hence a little disappointing on that aspect.I recommend the Zoomerango for all. if you are a couple you may have to sit with others as this ride needs a min. of 5 people (i think) to balance weight. Please hold tight while you are on this ride, it was not advised to us and we felt that if we had not done that we would have fallen out when it goes vertical before the final fall. And please move around the park quickly there is more than one tower and the tower behind is less crowded always. One single major disappointment was that the guards did not allow me to sit behind in all double rides, for some odd reason they prefer the men to sit behind. We asked them why they insist on this and it was advised that its to balance the weight. But we told them that we are both of the same weight 68kgs still they were adamant that men should sit behind. I found that weird.Tip: Carry your own towels, so u can save money.No need to carry shower gels & shampoos, it is provided. Ladies, hair dryer is provided in the wash area so no need of them as well. Carry small & flexible bags which can fit in a locker. Buy one locker first ,see if all your items fit in it ,if not you can still exit and buy the second locker.

Try Every Ride!. The Leap of Faith was the best. Started and ended our day at Aquaventure with this.They offered a free ticket to my sister since it was her birthday, it was a really sweet gesture.If you're in Dubai, it is definitely a must-do. The views from the top of the rides are amazing. Totally worth it.

Great fun!. Rides are great.Staff are friendly and helpful.You are not allowed any food and you need to pay for lockers before you enter the water park.The beach area is very nice any member who is not a great lover of water park can relax and watch out your bulky stuf there and others can enjoy rides.They allow water or else can buy at 13 AED.(Small)They have food served various locations but if you are not happy paying the rates have your meals before you arrive.

Overpriced. As noted in one of the recent reviews, the cost for a day here is pricey bearing in mind the limited number of rides and the additional charges. It smacks of being a money generating operation. However, we unfortunately encountered more than the usual in terms of staff due to an injury and can't fault the way this was handled. The paramedics in First Aid were first class - thank you.

Full of fun. This place was a highlight of my Dubai trip. Slides were fantastic, some really fun for both kids and adults. Has a beach where one can just relax. Lazy river and other rides for people who just want to kill time. Other slides on two towers for the more adventure seeking. I personally loved the zoomergo and anaconda slides. Cons:Expensive place, high entrance fees. It doesn't end there but the locker fee, towel fee and the highly priced food in the park follows. Rental go pro at AED 200/-.But it is worth going and trying once in a lifetime! Almost all of Dubai is overpriced.
Superbbbbb. Aqua venture is by far the awesomest water park I have been to. Rides are amazing, advised not to miss any of them.

At least 1 visit required.. Note the essentials that most dont know about!. If you're heading to Dubai for the first time then the Aquaventure Waterpark is a must. Located at the Atlantis Hotel, it is worth seeing what they can do on a man made island. Its just like any other waterpark, water slides, tube rides, lazy rivers with a couple of adrenaline pumping slides thrown in.Points to note:I have to mention these since about 50% people going here dont know this (You'll be surprised!)1. DONT carry any food! I cannot stress this enough. I have seen many people carry bag load of food and the security just doesnt give a damn whether its worth 2 DHS or 200 DHS, they'll simply chuck it in the bin. Water you can carry but food is a strict no. For those of you who can sneak em past the security, good luck.2. Clothing. Most of you know this and have seen numerous articles as well, but i'll repeat. Ladies: You need tight fitting clothing. Swimwear is obviously one of them. But in case you dont own one or are uncomfortable flaunting a bikini, you can wear some tights and a slim T on top and the guards will let you go. They are not much fussy about all that. Its just that you cannot wear lose clothing since it might get you stuck on one of the slides or worse.Guys: Board shorts are completely ok or any other swimwear you desire. You can even wear a singlet on top if you dont want to flaunt that beer belly of yours! Or that hairy chest (I would recommend wear something in the latter case)3. The Park. The Park itself is big and divided into two towers. You'll be surprised to see how many people dont even know the second tower exists. There was a line of about 20 people to get into one of the slides on the first tower and a line of 0 people to get me into a slide on the second tower. So do the math. Its a little walk along the coastline from the hotel Shark Bites (I think thats what the name is) and you'll reach the other one. The famous trap door slide is located there and doesnt matter how scared you are. Do it!Apart from that the waterpark itself is very clean and the staff there quite helpful. Nothing left to say except take all the rides! And I mean all of them. Yes the Leap of Faith too..

Nice but pricy, reconsider . .... Let’s start with the good things.This is really fun, you don’t need to have kids to go there or enjoy. We were 3 persons there and had a lot of fun. There is many guards at the park so don’t worry if you can’t swim, it is not needed.There is a minimum weight requirement for many attractions, one in our company got stuck due to her weight being lighter than 50kg. They got her out of the attraction tunnel and it was harmless, but she didn’t understand why she suddenly stopped gliding.Make sure to come early to the park, before 10, to avoid ques and to get most out of the expensive entrance to this park.Because Aquaventure Atlantis is not cheap.265 Dirham for a waterpark of 2 buildings with 4 rides each where food, towels and lockers require additional charges. Totally 8 attractions, if you want to ride the zipline there is additional charges. Then there is a beach to access and a riverride, both included but are not much to conside. Except the entrancefee you gonna need a locker, that would be 70 dirham for the bigger locker that fits 2 bags. 45 per meal food if bought in advance, mediumsize meals unlike what others said on tripadvisor the meals are not that big. So this means at least 400 dirham, then add 300 dirham for each additional person. But if bought at spot the entrance is much higher and 3 persons would probably cost 1000 dirham. Too much money for 8 rides if you ask me, especially compared to other waterparks in other places.
