But you probably noticed that Dubai is an expensive place and either you are ok with that then just visit the park, or you just may reconsider other places options with better prices around the world.After entering the park it is possible to rent a gopro action cam for 200 dirhams, it is worth using one of those inside there. But it is probably not worth renting it, a better option is to just buy a new one for maybe 400 than renting it. Reconsider that before going to the park, otherwise it will be late to do that after entering.

exciting times. This is a water park for everyone we were holidaying with my brother and sister-in-law the youngest being 59 !!! and thoroughly enjoying some really dare devil rides just go for it !!!

Lots of fun!. After having this waterpark recommended by different people I had to try it for myself, and I wasn't disappointed. There are a good mixture of slides of varying inclines, including one where the ground drops out from underneath you!There are a lot of slides where you sit in an inflatable ring, but unlike a lot of waterparks where you have to get out and carry your ring up 5 flights of stairs, at Aquaventure you sit on a conveyor belt in your ring and it takes you back to the top, much more fun!!The lazy river also incorporates some more interesting rapids and other sections that you don't get at many parks.If I had one complaint it would be that there aren't enough slides that you go on without a ring, but you can still happily spend a day here without getting bored.

Worth it. So, probably like many, I baulked at the price when pre-booking. But our trip to Aquaventure during the UK February half term holidays was worth it.Our family of 4 (2 adults, 2 kids of 13 and 11) arrived at opening time and were able to use the pre-booked ticket window to check in. We additionally paid for a large locker and loaded some money onto a wrist band for using during our visit to save us trips back to the locker room.Changing rooms were clean. We were glad we'd gone for the large locker as the small ones were really small, but the large locker was just sufficient for 4 people's belongings. Lockers are in the changing rooms so if visiting as a family, bear in mind that if you use one in the ladies changing area, men won't be able to access it and vice versa.The slides are centred around two large towers - the Tower of Neptune and the Tower of Poseidon. We started with the Tower of Neptune as it was closer to the entrance. These slides nearly all require you to carry a rubber 'donut' up the steps. Both single and double rings were available - plenty of both. We enjoyed all of the slides in this area - some have motorised sections which take you up again before bringing you down - one of which can be accessed from the lazy river. The Leap of Faith which takes you through the shark tank takes around 8 seconds. A better view of the sharks and rays is possible from one of the other slides whre you coast gently through the tube on your donut.The lazy river is a great way to get around the park with a good selection of rapids en route. No donuts were necessary at the Temple of Poseidon. Better signposting at the bottom of the steps would be helpful as each of the 4 lines of steps leads into queues for different rides. The family raft rides were lots of fun.We ended up lunching from a food court area near Poseidon. A burger meal cost about £9 - but it was wagyu beef - if you can tell the difference. The fries were good. The eating area was clean but the floor was slippy inside.The crowds were very low in the morning with minimal queues and waits of not much more than 5-10 minutes in the afternoon. So it was a good time to visit. As the sun went lower in the late afternoon, a lot of park was in the shade and it was noticeably cooler.The only downer on our day was the horrendous wait for a taxi at the end. We hit the queue at around 5.15pm (the park closed at around 6.15 that day) and had to wait around 50 minutes for a taxi. There were unpleasant scenes when people at the back of the queue tried to grab taxis dropping people off before the taxis had a chance to pick up the people waiting at the front of the queue. This aspect really needs managing better.

Dreamland of water sport. The best place to enjoy. An amazing adventures. It has all thrills,a mind blowing experience. The staffs were very attentive and responsive. The food available here is good but little expensive. We loved lazy river with waves and torrents. Make sure you apply good amount of sun screen before you enter here.

Great day of fun. Great for the family, all round fun with the water rides and even if you just use the lazy river like me, kids love it and it's a must do, advise getting tickets in advance and avoid the queues on the day you want to go

Amazing views and super fun. Amazing day.The favorite attraction was the capsule where the floors just disappears and you drop down - seemed super scary but was absolutely fun and not dangerous at all. Make sure you get a locker, an absolute must, and worth the extra price.The best views of the whole Dubai skyline from the top of tower furthest from the entrance.

The Kids went totally crazy in this place!!!!. We had such a great time!!!!This is really a family or couple place. We visited the aquarium which was great and then went to the water world for the day. The great thing is that you have family activities with huge tubes able to take up to 6 persons. Really outstanding! !!!!!!Go for it.
I had so much fun. If you are going you should spend a day there..i had a lot of fun, laugh and action it doesn't matter how old are you..just go and it is really safe.

Great watery fun for all!. There is no shortage of rides for timid people or adrenalin junkies and we loved the Shark Attack. We didn't try the Leap of Faith, but maybe next time we'll muster the courage to do so. Don't forget the sunscreen, enjoy yourself and remember all attractions close at sundown (usually at 6:15 - 6:20pm) or just ask any of the friendly staff.

Good for all levels of thrill seekers. Was a great water park to go to, something for my adrenaline junkie husband and fun things for me to do. I loved going through the aquarium on one of the slides and the tandem slides that seem to go forever, they were so fun, you could ride around on these all day! Not much food to choose from, I would definitely bring your own lunch.

Best time to have on Sunny day (summer). If you are water person, A visit is must as the rides are just doesn't fill you up, you wanna have the same ride again and again, specially the one in the tunnel.Mind Blowing experience - amazing staff really very attentive. See you soon Aqua :)
YOU WILL NEVER FORGET THIS PLACE!!!!. Bring your children or/and your friends to this place and believe me, they will never forget.The rapids and the lazy river were really exciting!!

Great choice of rides. Good fun place for the whole family, young and old. So many rides to go on and the park is very clean and tidy too. You do need to pay for your lockers though which is my only negative. So if staying in the hotel do not bring any valuables , towles are provided at a cost too so maybe bring towel from hotel too. Plenty of sunloungers to relax on and lots of places to eat.
Waterpark. I used to travel with my family every year to Atlantis hotel especially because of Aquaventure Waterpark. It´s amazing adventure!!!

Chilling in the sun. We were staying at the Atlantis on the Palm so got free entry, however you do have to pay for the lockers. First day we went no one explained where and how to get the towels and lockers so we went back to the hotel. The next time we went we had to walk to the opposite side of the park which was a but of a pain. The Lazy river and rapids were a lovely chilled way to catch the sun, didn't venture the slides but seemed to cater to every one, some the death drop to the slides in the rings

Instant fun right beside you. Yes it is another waterpark. But it is cool, good designed. The rapids were really distinguished.You ride along a loong path. And the leap of faith was so great. All the family would like it. And the sprinkles around are spraying cold water in the summer to keep everyone chill.

so niceee. Must vist!. all the games are great you fell like a kid again and they are challenging. day passes so fast as its a big aquapark. and you can also walk to the dolphin area and relax on the sandy beach . recommended big time

Simply amazing waterpark. As a waterpark attraction, it is one of the best you can go to in the world though it would've been great if it were that bit bigger with more rides.Saying that, the rides are fantastic especially the two solo drops. A heart pumping experience!
Must visit! . I loved it! Lots of great water games and loads of fun. However, it's almost like a theme park, so if you don't like heights or speed, you won't enjoy it.
Nice entertainment . No matter how old are you, you will enjoy your unforgettable day in Aquaventure. Better to go during the week, less crouded.

Nothing on Orlando Waterparks and overpriced. Having heard rave reviews about this place, I decided to check it out. Due to the great reviews and the price of the ticket (just under 70 pounds per person, I was expecting it to be on a level with or better than the waterparks in Orlando.However, there were limited slides, most of which were basically the same and had little thrill factor. Poisidens revenge was good and a highlight, as was the lazy river/water rapids.It was on the same level as a generic park in Europe but ridiculously overpriced. Overall, was very disappointed.

Great day out with the kids. Great slides and water fun for the whole family. Book your tickets online to safe some money. We had the advantage that 2 of us had their Birthday in the week that we visited the park, which saved us 2 tickets.

For the heat. Duabi have everything from ice ring to water them park .
When they don't have water.
But it's true they use very well they don't waste water .

As much fun as you can have at a waterpark. I love this place - we go everytime we visit Dubai and it just gets better and better.
Head down early morning to miss the queues, but from the adrenlin rush rides to the lazy river, its all amazing! Food on site is really good too. Basically this is how everyone should do water parks!

Good but not perfect. Very good facilities, poor transportation to and from the park. Long line for taxis. Mostly expensive lexus taxis instead of TAXI DUBAI. I liked the water park fairly. But frankly, WILD WADI was something else. Won't go back to Aquaventure for sure.

Fun day out. Fun way to spend the day. Advice going early and do the rides first so that you do not have to queue later. Later in the day can just do the lazy river or lay by the beach. Can play volleyball or football. Food is the basics. Advice taking your own towels to save the pennies but you can rent the towels there too. Fun rides but nothing to scary apart from 1 which is worth the experience if you are daring enough. Go there to have fun without expecting a whole lot and it will be a fun day. We pre booked our tickets online and getting in was a breeze.

All you need for a family all day out. Beach, pools, extraordinary water rides, great aquarium, fantastic dolphins interactions, good food outlets and some shops will bring joy, fun and good memories for everyone.

Oh the gleeful joy!. From a country that doesn't boast weather consistently good enough to justify such an ambitious outdoor water creation, I was like a kid in a candy store visiting this place in February heat! An extension of the plastic fantastic monstrosity that is The Atlantis, this place is a buzzing metropolis of shops and eateries on arrival, I'm thankful that we visited on a Sunday, immediately after the weekend (yes, weekends are Friday-Saturday for those of you who might not know) because there were no queues to endure, though the entrance hall looked more than prepared for the regular onslaughts that I'm sure happen frequently. This trickled to eateries and ride access when inside too, with nothing troublesome to enjoy or time consuming to wait for. Yippee! After a pizza and such equally unhealthy snacks (there's aren't too many healthy alternatives I'm afraid), we navigated our was past a trailing looking children's water playground (wish I was a kid again!). Before I launch into the adventure, can I just express my sheer delight I. Double rubber rings?! So much more fun than riding alone and definitely worth holding onto because all the best rides were ring friendly. More yippee's! Every ride ends up in the same river rapids and pool, so go crazy and enjoy the thrill...For the daredevils of you, there are som exceptionally crazy death drops that I didn't try, but if you crave the adrenaline, they looked every bit as terrifying as one would hope them to be! On the other side of the park, yet more ring rides exist and of course, more drops, but nothing quite as dramatic as the death drop (or whatever they call it!). Zip lining can also be found on this, the other side of the park, but I'm afraid that this is at additional cost. Boo! There are plenty of places to bask in the sun by one of many pools or indeed, in their private beach. There are water stands everywhere and plenty of fandom stalls positioned strategically to catch the active snacker - ice cream, popcorn and the suchlike (again, nothing much healthy). A wonderful day out that easily takes up the whole day, worth every penny of floating fun!

So much fun. . Had an amazing time at the adventure park my favorite slide was definitely the one that went through the aquarium part and you could see the fish and sharks. I plan on returning from Australia at the end of the year.

AQUAVENTURE Waterpark - Lovely water rides. Aquaventure Waterpark is wonderful place to spend a quality time in Dubai. We found lovely rides and it was a memorable day. I like water rides. Good value for UAE resident. However expensive for Tourist.
A Good Day. There are total 10 rides in all.Some of the rides are very adventurous.Overall it is good and will take around 3 hours to complete all rides.

fun for kiddos. Enjoyed by my children. esp. the slide. Though the pools were really a bit crowded during summer (peak season) benches or umbrellas are a scarcity. Not much enjoyed by adults like me, waiting for my kids to get done. The beach was good though.

Not to be missed. Amazing, fun filled day in Dubai - swimming with the dolphins was one of the best experiences in our lives! Unforgettable memories. A must for water babies! Lovely and helpful staff!

Great day for kids and adults. One of the best water parks in the world, plan to spend your entire day here though. There is plenty to see and do and it is a bit of a trip out from central Dubai unless you are staying along the beach area. swimming with the dolphins is a highlight of the day.

Nothing special. We took 1 and half hour to get a taxi in front of the hotel in the end of the day. The line was huge, so I asked some hotel employees if that line was normal. They told me "yes, everyday". I told them this was a lack of respect with people who visit them, and all I had in return was a "yes". Bad service and not even a "I'm sorry".The water park is ok. There was no great atraction that made me say "Atlantis Aquaventure is awesome". No, it isn't. It's really just okay.I was happy with the day I spent there, until the moment I tried to come back to my hotel. The prices are too high and I noticed that you can purchase a ticket at the hotel for 310 dirham or by internet for 260 or in a tend in front of the hotel for 250. I think this isn't honest.I wouldn't come back or even reccomend. There are plenty of better stuff to do in Dubai.

Good fun day out. We went Feb half term, got there around 10.45. Very quiet, got two sunbeds we used for a base, hired towels and a locker. The lockers are near the main entrance so although good for valuables, don't leave stuff you need in them like sun cream and t-shirts otherwise you will spend lots of time walking to and fro!Spent a few hours floating around the rapids and the lazy river. Some amazing rides; the Zoomerango is brilliant. Didn't try the leap of faith looked a bit too scary! We only queued once which was for the ride which goes through the shark tank which was the most disappointing ride of the day (I have always wanted to go to the Aquaventure Waterpark because of this ride so quite probably it is a bit overhyped).Food was the usual stuff; chips, burgers, etc. Overall, a good day out. I thought it was quite expensive; we got a discount because we booked through our hotel and they gave us a voucher to present when we got there. It knocked a third off so if you are not staying at the Atlantis, ask your hotel if they do anything like it. Even with the voucher, for three (kids over 1.2m count as adults) cost £148!

Turning 50 Trip. Turned up for a pre booked Dolphin Experience on a day when it rained and the thunder and lightening resulted in the park being closed Fortunately we had a day spare before our next flight The receptionist Carla when above and beyond are expectations arranging the experience to be rebooked for the following day and when we turned up for the booking we were met by her and greeted by nameThe Dolphins and trainers were an experience we will never forgetAll the staff were very helpful after in the park we had a great time on the slides it got a little busy after lunch but was still good fun

Splash the Day!!. We really enjoyed our adventure in this Aquaventure water park.. More than Wild Wadi.. It gives u lots of options to do and Rides to choose.. And if u feel tired of the rides.. U can relax to the beach area of the waterpark.. And enjoy the view from the beach area..

Good family fun time. It's a great place for family fun. My only complaint is that the rides weren't too scary. But rides were versatile and nice. I suggest buying tickets online because the lines are huge to get a ticket.
Unforgettable experience. Rides was so challenging. .It was really an adventure. .amazing! !! Wanna come back and bring friends with us..

Used to be the best Waterpark in UAE. Used to be the best waterpark in UAE, until Yas Waterworld stole its thunder. Still good fun if you are planning to spend a day in Atlantis anyway. My only gripe about it is that the kids area is quite boring compared to Yas, so my daughter doesn't enjoy it as much.

Such a great day out. I had never been to a water park before, thinking it would not be me. This place was a hoot and such a great time from the moment we arrived to when we left. It offers adventures and laughter and you can really feel like you have become a kid again. And do the Leap of Faith drop - it was exhilarating, and rushing past the tanks of sharks was such a thrill.

Fun for all. Great fun for the family, many rides and lots of attractions. The leap of faith deserved its name :) I've done only once. kids would love a twin tube ride with mom or dad over many attractions

Brilliant fun. Loved the park. Lots of water slides and tubes to go on. We went on a Sunday and the queues were minimal, even the famous Leap Faith was virtually no wait. Found myself laughing hysterically at the end of some of the rides. The changing rooms were clean and well maintained with lovely hot showers for you to clean up after a busy day.Top tip. Rent a small locker for the men and the ladies to make it easier.

Amazing day out. I visited this place in Jan 2016. The day was full of fun, excitement and in the end was tired. It was my first ever visit to a water park. I enjoyed it to fullest like a kid. Took all rides, apart from one on Poseidon (the scariest one).It has basically 3 sections, one for kids with lot of kids slides, tower of Neptune and the the tower of Poseidon. It is a full day excursion. Each of these sections have different slides. Tower of Poseidon has done great rides. Do not miss the scariest slides, they are fun. We did this on weekday so it was peaceful no queues. Staff was friendly and nice Some tips:1) they have small and large lockers to keep stuff, which is chargeable. A large locker for about 75 AED. But you can carry bags inside the park and keep it on slide while you enjoy rides.2) The food inside is expensive, you cannot carry own food3) Only kids of a particular height, i think above 3 feet are allowed in Neptune and Poseidon4) Do not recommend this park for old people as to take rides on Neptune and Poseidon, one has to climb stairs for each ride with the tube5) there is also a beach there which can be enjoyed.6) the changing rooms are equipped with soap, shampoo and hairdryerIf you are also doing Lost chamber, do it after the rides, as the park is closed at 6, but Lost chamber is open till 6pm

We had a great time!. After walking through the mall we discovered the aqua park which we came to visit. We had a brilliant day! It was warm and queues were minimum, we only had to queue for one ride which was about 15 minutes. All the rides we enjoyed and we even went on the scary one which counts down and vertically drops you, this however did feel like it scratched all our backs. Food we though was average prices, came to £8 for dribk, hotdog and chips and the hotdog was huge! All the workers were lovely with us. So glad I had my waterproof camera to record the snaps and videos so definately recommend taking one! It is worth walking to the top of the temple tower where leap of faith is even if you don't want to go on just for pictures of Dubai as it is beautiful. We all thoroughly enjoyed ourselves, and don't forget to pack sun cream!

Fun for all ages. One of the experiences you just have to give time to in your trip to Dubai. It can be easy to get lost in all the luxury malls in the city and all the shopping, but going to the palm and to Aquaventure Waterpark is a good idea for an activity.However, it's a bad idea if you're here in the summer though :D stay indoors and stay hydrated :D
Quite a fun day out.. Some good rides and a nice place to spend a sunny day in Dubai...but in a city that's always trying to outdo itself, it doesn't blow your mind.
Relaxing at its finest. Very nice Waterpark and quite laid back. If you want to spend a relaxed day with a lot of thrills you are 100% in the right spot with Aquaventure!

A great water park, and no wait for the rides. We spent most of the day there, and experienced very short queues. I went to wild Wadi a few years earlier, so not recent enough to compare the 2, but Aquadventure was certain good fun with a good variety of rides to suit most appetites

Watery adventure on the rapids. This was our first visit to Aquaventure as a group of three adults, although two of us had previously enjoyed Wild Wadi water park.The rapids were our favourite, the longest ride with some uphill 'travellator' sections, the ride also has options at various locations, so you can chose a different direction and try a different experience. We rented Baracuda 2 cabana for the day. The cabana was provided with four loungers, table and four chairs, a hammock, 2 fat boys, towels, coolbox with complimentary water, complimentary fruit bowl, and waiter service for food.The downside of our day was when we tried to leave at 5pm via taxi. Due to roadworks and heavy traffic, it took an hour to travel down the Palm frond away from the main trunk and back past Aquaventure to take the tunnel back to the mainland. In total, 1.5hours to travel from Aquaventure back to our hotel in Dubai Marina. Ridiculous!
Bit disappointed. Been a few times, different times of the year, and certain rides are always closed, and the ques are horrendous because of the connection of the Atlantis.
Great Fun!. In a group of 10, we went to Wild Wadi and Atlantis, both were equally as fun, Leap of Faith is a must try when in Atlantis...however, I warn, this is NOT for the faint hearted!
Refreshing Atlantis. Atlantis is something that attracted us to go to Dubai and we didn't regret our decision at all. Don't miss any of the rides and games. They are very safe and lot of fun.

Great place. This place is the epitome of Dubai, the worst thing about waterparks for me is getting out and climbing the steps, many of the rides here have elevators which pull you up on your tube!!
We came in a very quiet time but you can see that the queues in the summer would be massive!

Great adventure with young kids !. The water park is beautiful and very nicely designed. The kids water park is fun, safe and practical. Different type of restaurant to choose from and kids will enjoy this place... Highly recommended !
Day trip. It is right getaway from work for a day. It gives the right adrenaline for you. You will feel again the energy pumped to your brains.

Not that great. Hectic, not very well signposted, very expensive, I was expecting much more, A big letdown, wadi wadi was far better, we stayed in the Arabian courtyard hotel and the taxi was £40 each way, the shark safari was also a let down.

Aquaventure waterpark. Really nice experience for the whole day. Don't plan it for half a day, because it's not paying the money you'll spend. If you have water parks in your country it won't be wow effect, but it's interesting. there is a private beach you can use with a really beautiful view.

So much fun!!!. I had an amazing time here!!The leap of faith scared the hell out of me. .I literally think I stopped breathing for a few seconds..if you are looking for an adrenaline rush...and also a bit of fun in the sun and water..this is the place to be!I would definitely go again!

Simply the best. You can not find a more perfect water park or attraction than Aquaventure Water Park . The staff are simply amazing and helpful and the rides a delight. It is so clean and well thought out even the music is chilled and a delight. The food is perfect and everything for the health conscious to your bugger and chips fans. I did not want to leave.
Great day!. Fantastic day! Not much to say other than a fantastic day with great attractions and fairly priced! Very clean and well kept and well staffed! Brilliant!

Fantastic water park but a bit pricey. GOOD: This is one of the best water parks I've been to. Very nicely laid out and designed and there are a few amazing slides. Anaconda and Leap of Faith are great. Staff everywhere and are very helpful.BAD: Difficult to find sign posts and they aren't great even when you do find them. Very expensive - around £50 per person plus towel and locker rentals. Locker door wouldn't lock and had to change. Food and drink are always pricey in these places but it was a tad overboard. Staff told us if we didn't pay to swim with the Dolphins we could still see them (we assumed relatively close up at ground level). What that actually meant was you can look down from the top of the slides a few hundred feet away.OVERALL: The positives outweigh the bad and we had a great day but I still reiterate it's overpriced by about £20.

Amaaazing aqua park. Very nice place to spend the time with the children. We have used the entertainer coupons and got 2 free tickets when we've bought 2 tickets. It was a very big saving for us and we have enjoyed the time to max.

Fabulous Waterpark!. We visited the Waterpark during our recent stay in Dubai and it was amazing! It is clean, tidy and with lovely gardens. The rides are fab and we loved the 'lazy' river, which also had waves, torrents and rapids - brilliant!There are plenty of sunbeds and lifeguards everywhere, so its very safe and great fun!

Great day out! . This water park is a great day out. We visited with a 13 and 10 year old in March. The only down side is the water is quite cold. The kids didn't mind at all but it was far too cold for me to enjoy! Also the drop slide where the floor gives way underneath you has a min weight limit of 45 kg, we had a disappointed 13 year old on our hands when he was as told he was too light to ride it!!

A day at the aquaventure with the family. we went to the park from 11:00 AM to 16:30 PM. The kids really liked it but we were happy that the weather was cloudy, otherwise beware of the sun. The attractions are fun but very few are good for smaller children. If you dare try the waterslide, otherwise try the attractions with the small tires.The prices of food and beverages are really expensive - I mean a burger costs 25 USD -.Because we stayed at the Palm Atlantis hotel, we had free access to the park.Avoid the beach, it is not worth the effort.

The Best Water Park in Asia.. The best experience of a water park ever. Don't miss these rides:1. Leap of Faith - Not for the faint hearted; try at your own risk! Ride of a Life!2. Shamal - It's all in one and you're gonna enjoy it.3. Shark Attack - The most beautiful ride ever - you get to experience underwater aquarium during the ride which is simply captivating.

Great fun for kids and adults. We got the ticket for the adventure waterpark included in the Dolphin encounter visit. We were sceptical at first but in the end we wished we had come earlier to enjoy more of it. A fun on the rubber floaters in the rapids and water slides! Recommend!

Poor staff, no management. We went to aquaventure on 22nd february as we had stayed in Atlantis for 1 night. The problem is that the staff doesnt understand English. Very less people working in a particular attraction. The hopelessness was that my wife got stuck in the ride that had a drop followed by the tube (poseidon's revenge) as they call it. First we were waiting at the top to hear something. but the staff didnt mention to us what had happened. Second the ride has a 360 degrees turn which makes it more dangerous and third there was no apology or any sort of regret for getting stuck. A person getting stuck in the tube can be very dangerous. But the staff just laughed off (" you got stuck") what the hell does that mean. DIDNT expect such sort of service in atlantis. Would recommend to stay away from poseidon's revenge ride.

Amazing waterpark . I have been to a lot of waterparks in my life and this is definitely one of the best. The have a lot of tube rides which I really enjoy. And they have the best tube river of all I would say. Great day overall!
Rubber rings. This was a great day out. Lots of good shoots and rides. The double ring rides especially good fun. Something for everyone. Wasn't busy so short queues for rides (Monday).

Half of the park lagoon closed. Been here before and enjoyed sailing around the lazy river but this time half of it closed and it informed. Would not have stayed at the Atlantis (free access) if we had known very disappointed.

Fun for all . Excellent! A great water park with something for everyone.The lazy river is fun, there are rapids , torrents and water slides. It is extremely well patrolled by a vast team of lifeguards and it is very clean.The waterslides cater for all ages but there are height restrictions for youngsters on some. In saying that there is a great fun park for children.The park is very clean with lots of areas for sunbathing and there is no shortage of single and double tubes for the lazy river & rides. There is a good range of snack bars, cafes and restaurants as well as a number of shops selling associated accessories & sun protection.

Average waterpark and taxi scam. No where near as good as Typhoon Lagoon or Blizzard Beach in Florida. Nearly £50 entry pp online so on the door must be more. Also extra for lockers and towels and locker barcode wristbands are a nightmare. Terrible sign posts, couldn't find anything!Food is very snack-y and expensive. Not many toilets in the park. Queues were virtually non-existent on a Saturday which was amazing! Some rides are scarier than others - I bottled Leap of Faith and Poseidens Revenge after hearing my boyfriend's screams! Lastly, there is a taxi scam in operation outside The Atlantis entrance which frankly is despicable. The hotel stops meter taxis coming in so that guests are forced to use the over priced VIP cabs. They know that eventually guests will cave in and pay 5 times as much just to get home. Not on!

Nice water slides. We came soon after opening time 10 am. There was lot of available sunbeds and inflatable rings for slides. None or minimal queues for rides. Slides are good - especially Shark Attack with underwater tunel and sharks, rays and other fish all around you. Drinks and food quite pricey - as usual in most amusement parks.

Good fun . A good day out for the family. Fantastic rides and beaches. Very crowded at times. The over zealous lifesavers that told my 9 year old son that he could swim in cotton shorts were an unnecessary irritation

Worst waterpark in middle east. Don't go there for the sake of your time and money. It is overpriced and you should pay for almost anything. I bought a swimming suit for $120 and I saw the same suit in a shop priced $15. The foods were aweful and overpriced. I cannot mention one good point about this waterpark and I suggest everyone not to waste their time and money going to this waterpark.
fantastio . The best waterpark I have ever seen honestly had the best pleasure of my life and is 1000 times better than blackpool. The rides were thrilling and my colleagues enjoyed every moment !

Please Avoid! The Worst Waterpark I have been too! Overpriced and terrible waiting ques!!!. We wasted our time and money at this place. There are much better waterparks in the world I have been too such as in Algarve and Sharm El Sheikh.Long waiting time and not so great rides.Only thing good was the Rasberry Slush Drink and Potato Chips on a stick!

Great Magical Aqua Park. Authentic .. Multi actions and water thrilled games and rides .. Really magical & legendary aqua park with the flavor of Atlantis and Alaadin era of Aqua sultanate at the amazing Atlantis the Palm - Dubai
Nice vist. It was very nice really beautiful look at the right in the hotel where we stayed , good still like it very safe very clean nice updates lights everything was excellent

A FUN Day. As we were staying at the Atlantis we decided to visit the water park and spend the day both relaxing and also being adventurous on the rides and slides. This is a fantastic place, we both had so much fun (we are both in our 50's and had a ball). You need to get there early as it fills up really quickly so finding a lounger in the shade can be challenging. An awesome place for EVERYONE
Bæsh. Very good. i like it. beacause its col and rare plase.you have to vissit thiss plase. The slides is good and i like it. :#<
One of the most enjoyable place in Dubai. If you are adventure ride lover, you must visit this place. The name of the most adventures ride is "The Leap of Faith".
Fun day but expensice. Had a great day at Atlantis and the waterpark. Slides were all very different and scary!!It was expensive but definitely worth it.

Fun day out . Aquaventure is a great water park. Lots for thrill seekers and a palm beach for the sun lovers. The sea is very salty and so very easy to float in. The slides were varied, the large green dingy rides are very fun and there is a poo-your-pants almost vertical drop slide which had my heart pounding. Expensive food and entry but decent portions for your buck at the fast food restaurant. There was a bit of a wait for taxis though and the park isn't very well accessible. Very nice shower and changing room. All in all great day out.

Awesome . As a kid I remember Atlantis to be that huge water park with endless slides and entertainments. As in all parks lines can be huge at tourist peaks unless you have got a quickpass. Food was nice but pricey I believe. I enjoyed my time there but can not compare it to Wild Wady as they are both exceptionally good.
Good for kids. There are two parks and its better to get into water park. Couple of nice rides and few insane ones. Go for it with kids and you will have fun !!

Exhilarating rides!!! Not for faint hearts. Craziest rides that one can experience on Earth if not competing in final round of "Wipeouts".To get the best bang for your buck do the pool rides later and head for the water slides. If you are looking for THE CRAZIEST EXPERIENCE head straight to "Leap of Faith" and "Poseidon's revenge". Rest of the rides are so so and for me its mediocre. I have a voracious appetite for thrill. Rest of rides according to me are for faint hearted :)Tips :1) Go for food combo's available to buy when you collect your passes.2) If someone is not accompanying for rides then no need to take locker.3) Carry your water bottle its expensive at resort.4) Make use of shuttles it will help save you energy if you are planning for all the rides.

Public transport . Take the DAMAC station on train then take the tram to jumeirah palm and then take the monorail,surely dont miss the monorail because you can see towers and palm and luxry villas from the monorailBuy your tickets from out of the complex because its cheaper than you buy ticket from inside.Each towel and lockers is charge 50AED and the tickets is 250AED for each personRemember:Dont miss the zigorat slipper

awesome, awesome, awesome. This has everything to keep kids and adults entertained. It's a great place to be and is most needed with the heat that there is in DubaiGet there as soon as you can because in typical fashion - the sunbeds get taken up quicklyI liked the free refill drinks - made it worthwhile The lazy river is great to dip in and out of The rides are impressive Well worth the visit - and if staying at the Atlantis you get free entry

Adventure and thrill lovers paradise. Its a place for water lovers, I also tried scuba diving and the staff of Aquaventure are so professional that they help you through out the dive. They are well trained and very organised, they abide by the safety regulations and ensure that the customer is at ease first. They have various options ranging from scuba, snorkelling and adventure sports.Its highly recommended for water lovers who want to explore the sea creatures with dive in the waters.

aquapark is always fun!. overall it is nice, but getting there is complicated. you leave the car at the parking, then you take free shuttle bus, then you have to wait in line for tickets for at least 20 min...i guess for hotel guests it may be different...don't know.
Brilliant day. I have never been to a water park before, so I cant compare it. My friends had, they said it was on par with the best ones in america. Lots to do for all ages
Great family place with great service . Me and my family had a wonderful time. Staff where very helpful and had a can do attitude.Lovely place to relax and will not hesitate to re visit
A nice place to go. I was there last week! I was a guest at the Atlantis the Palm! Really nice place to go to enjoy, not so big but really very nice! Go there if you have time!
awesome. Vast water park with zip lines, slides through shark-filled lagoons & a splash area for kids.Address: Atlantis, Crescent Road,The Palm Jumeira - Dubai - United Arab Emirates

BEST WATER PARK IN UAE - EXCELLENT!!. General - This water park is by far the best water park in Dubai, and the UAE - BETTER THAN YAS WATER WORLD (See Yas review)The park is set on the palm and attached to The Atlantis Hotel and everything seems to have been thought of and planned for excellently so that the park and your visit runs smoothly.I have visited in the heat of summer (August 15) and also during the busier period of December and January and on both occasions had a great time. The August visit provided a quieter and less busy experience, but you then also have to deal with the extreme heat that the Dubai sun provides. This is not a problem as you are constantly in and out of the water and the ques for rides are not at all bad and you get to go on rides multiple times throughout the day.Suggestion - One thing the park could do to help improve customer experience is use a small sprinkler system around the park for the paths that customers walk on. During the summer months the floors are sooooo hot that you have to walk around with your flip flops on and hook them on during the rides. In parks I have visited in the USA they have sprinklers on the paths so that some / all of the path your walking on from ride to ride does not burn your feet.Rides - The rides here are excellent and cater for a wide range of thrill seekers. There are some really good group rides (that could be slightly longer) and also some very good individual slides that in general you dont have to que up for too long - maximum queuing time I have experienced on both visits was about 15 minutes. The space in which the rides are spread out across is also very good - even if on first visit you dont realise there is whole other area to visit.Beach - The attached beach area is an excellent area to chill out on when not on slides and also provides a good area to base your towels and bags. The sun beds around the lazy river are very busy and also there are alot of children based here. Food - The food establishments at Aquaventure are excellent. If you visit the food court then you are able to order a range of cuisines and the food here is cooked fresh - for example we had some Thai food and was lovely. Reasonably priced for theme park food also.Overall - Excellent water park with great rides, set up and provides for a range of customers. Only shame is that they dont have a flow rider / body board machine as does Wild Wadi.

The best water park in the world!!!! . What a truly amazing place. We were staying in the Atlantis so access to the water park was free. We have visited Disney water parks but they had nothing on this place. Every fine detail of the experience was top quality. The lazy river was coupled with great little diversions which took you into fantastic offshoot rides - these were breath taking. The Shark Tank ride was popular and dropped you straight into the aquarium - this was really novel. We loved this day and went back a couple of times to enjoy the experience. Well done all at Aquaventure.

A must visit for kids.... and adults. Amanzingly well organized. Top safety. Very clean. So everything given to enjoy the multiple attractions. Our young kids enjoyed the rides starting from the pyramide and going through torrents and waves taking them easily up to 20'. Correct price for min. 5 hours of fun, certainly when there is no waiting time.

Massive, clean, well organized but lacked excitement . Me and husband visited Acquaventure during our dubai & Abu Dhabi tour in Feb. We had to choose between Wild wadi, yas island and this. We chose Acquaventure mainly because it was in the Palm, Atlantis hotel. There were two towers with some great rides such as leap of faith, Shark attack and many more. May be about 15 rides in these two towers. We did many rides but skipped a few which we thought were too risky. There were several lazy rivers for you to settle and some nice areas for you to relax. There is a nice beach which is clean and no crowd. Restaurants were good but everything was exorbitantly priced. You couldn't really find a place for cheaper or less priced food or merchandise. Overall this is certainly a good water park you must visit. However it could have been made a little more active and happening with some more activities apart from two towers.

Dolphin . I loved the Dolphin encounter, it was on my bucket list, although it was very expensive. We paid 1700 Dirhams for two people . It was funny, if you wanted your pictures you had to pay 100 dirhams per picture and we ended up paying 500/ for five pictures. We didn't us the water rides as it was crowded. If you love Dolphins then go ahead.

Huge. The water park was free to us as we stayed at the Atlantis hotel.It has lots of slides to suit all types of thrill seekers from a huge drop slide that takes you through a shark pool to a gentle river ride that bobs through the park.Life jackets are provided for youngsters and there are lots of lifeguards on duty.

Dubai Holiday. As Aqua parks go I am not a fan of them, although I would consider myself a good swimmer. However, I really enjoyed the fun of this water park, none of the slides are too far to walk from one to the next, there is a slide for everyone either it be a fast one, a slow one or a thrill seeker. Fantastic beach to chill out on and plenty of food choices.I do think it is rather pricey for what you get considering all the extras you pay for inside. Lockers, towel hire etc, I really think all of this should be included in the price. I would recommend taking up the money card on offer for when you want to eat and drink as we carried cash with us. A bit fiddly carrying purses and wallets about.

Great range of rides, beach access real bonus but pricey. Not a cheap day out but teenagers will be entertained all day long and empty beaches to relax in between or after rides. Food in the park surprisingly good especially the freshly cooked Thai options. Head for the posiden's revenge tower for the latest rides which we all great fun. Not as compact as wild wadi - a lot of walking and if you prefer the rides on the rubber rings, wadi wins. We had a split decision on whether if we could do one more day in a water park which one we'd choose, wild wadi, the lads aquaventure - but a close call.
Best part of trip. This water park was so Awesome!!! Well designedEnjoyed a lotNice rides,loved the River ride and rapids

Beautifully Made. Amazing Water Park, its a must visit if you are on a holiday in dubai. The rides are nice, water is clean so is the service. One should carry there costumes else you have to buy from there which is expensive and the guards wont allow to take rides without proper costumes. One should also carry towels as Towels and Locker can be availed at extra cost.

Must see!. One of my best experiences when visiting Dubai. The park is a part of the Atlantis at the end of the Palm. For approx $100 you get to sit on 14 different rides. I would recommend starting with the 'leap of faith' which is in the first tower. It is a steep slide (prob 80 degrees), the rides get progressively more exciting as you go through the park. You can pet dolphins and Rays but they come at an extra cost of approx $100 each. Being in a 7 star hotel the cost of the food, drinks, etc. is quite high so I would suggest you eat well and go there. 4-5 hours are needed to complete the full park. They have locker facilities as well so don't worry about having to leave you phone etc behind. For those who want to relax a bit, the park has its private beach as well. For those visiting Dubai for the first time, I would strongly recommend visiting this park. Fully worth the money. Thanks.

Not so good,but very expensive. We spend my son's Birthday 24.2.2016 in Aquaventure.He have a voucher for atlantis adventure park,because of Birthday/no paid/ and my ticket cost about 360 dirhams!!!If you don,t know 100 euro is 395 dirhams.Staff was very friendly.There was a lot of people ,everybody run somewhere,chaotic everything,it was crazyI don't come back.

A fun day out for all the family. Myself and my husband enjoyed a fun day at Aquaventure. It is spacious and clean with plenty of sun loungers. There are plenty if inflatable rings for the rides. There is also a nice beach to relax on. It is suitable for all ages. We went there on the monorail which runs frequently and takes you right there.

Please book in advance. Tried to book online its was 215 DHS..didnt work. Got to kiosk and paid 320DHS - thats like £30 more per person.
£150 for 2 people.
Rides are good - pretty amazing - nice day out with me and my daughter. Cant fault it.. swim eat and relax in the sun.. what more do you want?

Stunning design but marred by technicalities. The Aquaventure Waterpark is almost the same as the one in the Bahamas give or take 1 or 2 attractions. The biggest killer was that NO BATHROOMS were working the entire morning and we weren't allowed to use the ones in the hotel lobby either. They told us this AFTER we paid and made our way in. What made it worse was that the staff kept telling us to go different places to find a working bathroom but all of those weren't working either. Thank god they were fixed just after 1 PM as it is a water park and people will find a place to use the bathroom one place or another. The Lazy river pretty much connects everything. You can spend a good 2 hours in there after one of the rides, get off and do the other rides, followed by more relaxing in the river. Water park tube rides are always super fun. Showers and changing rooms with lockers are easy and convenient
Fantastic Adventure. Wonderful to be able to see dolphins and to be able to swim with small sharks and stingrays the slides were great fun
Have fun!. good spot to have fun with family or friends in sunny hot Dubai. Its better to go during weekdays as its not so crowded

Second Visit and Still A Great Day Out. What's not to like here.So much fun to be had, the day is too short to make the most of this wonderful place.Have fun with the rides, river rides, dolphins, etc .... enjoy the good food ... and take relaxing break and admire the views on the white sand beach.If only we were back there!

just loved this place, great water rides. Leap of Faith and Poseidens Revenge, must dos in Dubaiother rides are also very good and very well run, total confusions rains when you get in the park as no assistants to help or tell you where to go. first hour wasted working it outRides are to die for though

Dolphin experience not to be missed. Visited here with my wife to have the dolphin experience and loved every minute. When it was booked it was done so for my wife as she rally wanted to do it, and I had already seen dolphins in the wild and as such was apprehensive about going. The dolphins are clearly loved, very happy and extremely well looked after. It's not cheap, but it's worth every single penny!!!! If we are back in Dubai we would certainly go back and do it again. Thank you to lexi and her handlers!!!

Waterslides!!. Loved it!!! Park wasnt swamped with a billion people, lines dissapated quickly, actually managed to hit up every water slide/tube ride in the park!! Lazy river is basically a taxi station with access points to diffrent areas!! Wild time!
Thrilling!. the rides are awesome..try the "leap of faith" to know the feeling of falling and dying..one of the greatest experience i ever had..

Fantastic Water Park. Superbly planned Water park with amazing rides. A Must experiencing event for anyone visiting Dubai. Very safe with highly trained life guards and high quality of equipments and each and every water ride is mind boggling..

Wonderrful Place !!!. Great Water Park in Dubai!!!The Leap of Faith Slide is the biggest attraction at the Aquaventure Waterpark. The ride is located at the top of the Zigurrat at the middle and is an almost vertical slide that is about 9 floors in height that goes speeding through a clear acrylic tube surrounded by sharks and rays. This waiting time here is about 1 hour as this is the most popular attraction in the waterpark.

Great day out. It is expensive but it is a Dubai holiday so you have to accept that sometimes. There is a good variety of slides for thrill seekers looking for an adrenalin rush and other more sedate rides, for those that want some peace there is a lovely beach as well.We added the shark safari to our day which is great underwater experience and would thoroughly recommend.

All sorts of fun. This destination has something for everyone. If it's big high water rides or a leisurely float around the moving pool it's all here for you. I would advise you keep a pair of flip flops close by as the ground gets very hot. The one downside was they don't have a chargeable wrist band system so you have to carry money/card on you. Not ideal in swimwear on rides.
a fun day out. Great water park, in an iconic building and location in dubai.Very touristy and busy but to be expected.The underwater shark experience is fab!

DISGUSTING LEGAL ACTION PENDING. Cannot say to much as I have instructed my legal team to take action against this organisation.All I will say is do not go if you have medical conditions or any serious illness ! You will not be allowed to take drinks,or the things you need in the park.I took a video of the disgusting treatment by the security team ! They even made me delete the videos and threatened me if I didn't they would fetch the police to delete them and confiscate my phone!!! Thank god for whatsapp as I had already sent to my legal department.So thank you for you gesture of a 750 ml bottle of cola but now I will take legal action to recover the loss of money,the upset and distress caused to me and my family.GO TO WILD WADI THEY KNOW HOW TO CARE FOR THEIR GUESTS

Not as good as Atlantis Bahamas. This is a great day out but it's no where near as big as The Atlantis in The Bahamas which is soooo much better.The new rides are awesome - the ones in the super big tyres - but the resort itself is a tourist attraction so there are just too many people here taking photos etc - really spoils the overall atmosphere.Great cars to look at in the car park waiting for a taxi though!A must do if your hotel doesn't have a great pool area - book online in advance for cheaper tickets. Great shower facilities near the exit - hairdryers etc - bonus!

Not for Seniors -. Since we also had The Lost Chambers Aquarium booked - it turned out jus OK experience. Water Park was nothing to write home about - since and experienced better. The tour operator did not indicated that this was a water park and if one wanted to enough it was to have your wet clothes available. Though we would not have experienced it anyway - we are seniors.
Nice day on the beach!. It is a really amazing park that has everything you can expect. You can stay later in the hotel for drinks or dinner and see the great aquarium
Brilliant. A must do even if you haven't any children with you on holiday if you are staying at the Atlantis there are buggies to take you along the sea front
Good. Good water park, the water temperature was nice. Good rides, wasn't that busy so was able to go on all the rides. Would visit again.

A great way to spend a few hours. The rides are good, the lazy river does the job, there were more than enough rings and, best of all, I recommend booking up the feeding of the rays - a fabulous experience for both the big and small kids.

Good Waterpark. As a family we had a good day at the waterpark. We did the dolphjon experience which was fabulous.
As a water park it's good, but a bit overhyped. We had fun though.

Day Out 15th Feb 2016. Spent our last day in Dubai here but needed two! This is a must if you visit Dubai, well organised and although it is expensive, you will not disappointed. There is something here for any age to enjoy. this place is so much fun!! Couldn't believe how quickly the day disappeared though, great place! :)

Fantastic. Visited every day with children aged 3 and 7 years.We've planned to visit for a couple of years and finally made the effort to book and go ,and have to say really impressed with the surroundings.alittle building work going on in the palm and across the water but nothing to put you off.The park itself was very clean the choice of rides was excellent and ticked all the boxes for all ages.The facilities for towels ,toilets .and food places was certainly not in short supplyThe dolphin experience was a dream for us and our children come true.we never experienced the sea lions,but the staff managed to slip us in to do some pictures inside the enclosure on our last night ,and our children was delighted.so again well done to the staff for making this happen.Can't wait to take all our 4 children back to the park and the Atlantis on our next family holiday.

Not the best but fun. . The waterpark is nice and clean. The slides were fun but i expected more for this price. Also additional activities are too expensive. Anyway nice to see but one time is enough. For families with small children it's for sure amazing.

Fun Day Out. Considering you have to buy everything there once you're inside I would say entry is a bit on the expensive side especially as you could just spend your day by your own hotel pool but I guess its about average for a theme/attraction. Its pretty easy to navigate your way around. There is an area for small children which is away from the main slides so if you're older looking for fun you don't get slowed down by families, equally if you're there with little ones, you can enjoy the children's area without getting pushed about my teenagers heading towards the more hair-raising slides!A few dos and don'ts that we didn't realise before we went- definately if you can go on a week day (Sun - Thurs) it was just so relaxed, hardly had to wait for any slides and had the pick of sun loungers even though we didn't get there until almost lunch time- get hold of an Entertainer voucher from a friend/local if possible - someone will get in for free!- head out to the beach area as well as the sun lounger areas - lovely views back towards the city (Burj al Arab, Marina etc)- don't take any food or drink with you - there was no moving on this so literally had to put all we took in the bin

Awesome fun.. It's fun and water slides just sit on the tube and enjoy the slides there are rides which u can continue n relax and enjoy wld mst visit place to enjy u can also see the aquarium with it the most chambers 1 .

Awesome fun. Brilliant water park - what makes this better than the Orlando water parks is that the lifeguards are friendly eager to interact they are happy for you to go-pro your holiday fun.The lazy river is amazing you can go round and round but from the lazy river you can actually navigate yourself do you get shot up a ride to the top of the tower where you can do other rides so you don't even have to walk up the steps My unbrave 7 yeAr old enjoyed shark attack where you go down a dark slide and end up in a see through tube where you can see sharks floating pass as you still in your boat float through the tube - awesomeLot of rides are good for families as you go on twin rings there are challenging tides too my 10 year old daughter did leap of faith but even though she was tall enough she wasn't heavy enough to do Poseidon revengeEnjoy - real quiet first thing

Overrated!. If this waterpark is the best that Dubai has to offer then Disney and Universal can sleep tight.It looks amazing from the pictures but there actually very few rides and as such the park can be done in a couple of hours. I would recommend that you only purchas tickets for 1 day - as it was my first time in Dubai I sadly allowed my rep to convince he. To purchase tickets for 2 days and as a result I wasted my money.
family day out great day for the family. We found a day is not enough to to see and do every thing there u have to pay for towels and lockers

Worth a visit . Visited with 4 adults and 2 children. You need at least 5 hours+. Arrive at the water park between 10 - 10:30am or the queues build up.To take full advantage you need to go with just adults as someone needs to stay back with kids who are unable to go on the 6 major rides.My 5 year old loved lying in the inflatable rings and drifting in the water, she even enjoyed the rapids which we thought she may be slightly wary of. There is a children's area but not appropriate for toddlers or over 10's.We all thought the water park was expensive. Take your own towels and you will need to pay for lockers.Once you get there search for inflatable rings.Overall a great place to visit with the usual issues mentioned above.

Aquapark . Maising place. Fun for everyone. I'm over 40 but felt like 14 again. Recommend to enter park early as it gets very busy to get sun beds. Lockers available to keep valuables save and towels available too.

Excellent park - if you can, get a cabana. We arrived 15 minutes before the opening time because we were let in early, having booked a cabana (at AED900 - which is very expensive). Ours was in a quiet corner of lagoon 2 which was a 5 minute walk away from the main tower with the leap of faith and five other rides. Since we arrived early we practically had the first 3-4 slides to ourselves, despite it being a weekend in Dubai. Even for the other tower and slides we only queued for about 15 minutes or so. The cabana for four is great, you have your own secluded area, a cabana with four chairs (and towels), a table, then outside the cabana a Fatboy hammack, two Fatboy bean bags with a small table, four lounge sun recliners with mattrasses and towels on then, private access to the paddling pool which feeds into the lagoon trail which surrounds the water park. When you factor in the 12 free cooled water bottles and complimentary large cooled fruit bowl you understand why people are prepared to pay such a huge amount for a cabana (in the west coast of the USA we paid USD100 for a cabana for 20!). We had no regrets, though, since our butler Prakash looked after us very well and it was nice to have space and be in a quieter part of the park, compared to all the other people which were stacked sunbed next to sunbed.

Very expensive day out with a lot of water fun.. Here and there in the rapids along the easy-flow ride it is a bit dangerous for non-swimmer youngsters; tubes might flip over. This might sound like fun, but when happening at the wrong spot, there lays a source of trauma. Aquaventure is a great day out; the park has some super rides with surprising moments. Asking the kids: they enjoyed very much, but a comparison with Wild Wadi made them choose the latter (after reconsidering a lenthy time).
Great fun. Had a great time and we're both nearly fifty.Haven't laughed so much in a long time.Let yourself go and have a great time.If you enjoy it anythings worth the money

Great day of exciting slides and rides for the family. Aquaventure Waterpark is a large waterpark with numerous water slides in a large leisure park. It is not cheap so ensure you arrive at the time of opening and stay until you are thrown out! Rides are varied and that is in type and level of adrenalin producing! Anyone over 1.2 meters tall pay an adult price so it is expensive for families. The park has different attractions and having three children 10, 12 and 14 their demand was for water slide action so the day was spent on amazing water slides and rides. This was mid February and although temperatures are a good Summer's day in Britain the water and shade could feel chilly. However sunny it is so some skin protection is needed. As I have said there are many attractions with meet the dolphins,ray fish and sea lions. One day is not enough so this other exciting side to this water park has been promised for another day. Park is impeccably clean, food is available and the staff are polite cheerful and plentiful making you feel confident about safety of the children and yourself if you are not too sure in water.

Just Awesome. I think it was my dream bath. Definitely a fantastic day spent in the park, the long tube rides are definitely enough to entertain you for an entire day. one round trip takes over 1 hour. It is well enough and safe for the kids. The prices are out of this world though, but perhaps that is just a Dubai thing. Highly recommended.

Relaxing Pleasure. A fabulous and entertaining Waterpark to be enjoyed by all the family. This park has everything to cater for all ages. From slow rides for younger children, through to drop slides for adults and the more active in your family. Clean and safety conscious and that makes you feel that you do not have to worry.I recommend this park to families and I enjoyed my time there.
Everything about the waterpark is exquisite!. I love the thrills that the rides at the Aquaventure Waterpark offers! This is the best waterpark I have been to. The layout is simply fantastic.

Nice Waterpark. It's a nice Waterpark, it has one good day's fun in it.We stayed in the Atlantis hotel where you don't have to pay to enter, otherwise we most likely would not have gone.Kids should enjoy it
Awesome place.... The best place that you should visit with family...Every ride is good, value for money, neatly maintained rides.

Amazing water park !!!. Omg amazing !!I don't normally write these review however this place I had too.Got there just after it opened at 10:30am and I must say I've never been to a place like this before it really was unbelievable. The staff were really friendly and lots of life guards on duty on every corner. The water slides are the best I've ever been on and we was able to just keep going on the slides straight after each other. It was busy around 2ish hotel guest from Atlantis coming in before the park closed at 6pm I'm guessing but well worth a trip here and you really would be missing a great day if you don't go there adult or kids will truly enjoy.

Great day out tainted by expensive, poor food and beverage outlets. On the whole a really good experience and I'm only writing this review as i was so appalled with the food available and the extortionate prices. Hairs went up on my neck as we entered and were told to dispose of any food / drink we had brought with us. This is perhaps understandable if they don't want litter and picnicking everywhere but only if the options available are reasonably priced and of an acceptable quality. Sadly this just isn't the case here which is disappointing when the whole complex is touted as 6 or 7 stars. It just seemed cheap and smacked of greed and control. Disappointing. The hot dogs my 2 kids had were about £10 each and bore no resemblance to the delicious looking images of the food at the food outlet. When we asked for fresh fried onions on the hot-dogs as per the picture they said no and just gave us some awful crispy dried onion flakes out of a tin.

Good day out - overhyped . Had a good day here. However if you do not like big crowds and business it is one to avoid! I went with my partner in February on a Monday, having chosen to avoid the weekend rush. Goodness knows what it must be like over the weekend as Monday was busy enough and we arrived at 10am. Big queues to get tickets, locker rooms heaving, usual theme park queues for the actual rides. Food is expensive, best to buy a meal deal if you can when you purchase tickets.The rides are good fun, there are a good variety of tube rides and a few good flumes. As a nervous flume rider it would have been nice to have a couple of "tamer" flumes to warm up on! But for a thrill seeker they are fab.Overall had a good day out for a young couple but probably wouldn't go again. Imagine it would be a fabulous day out for a big family.
LIKE THAT. i like this park, nice , huge , clean,a lot of nice slides ,its good for differnet ages from children to older people who like adrenalin.

Great day . Had a great day at the waterpark. Was clean and lots of lifeguards on duty. Lockers and changing facilities could do with being bigger and more places to leave towels near rides. Food was ok mainly fast food. We got a bit bruised from all the rides but enjoyed our day

Pricy. It was a cold day we went anyway the water park is amaizing but the rides r fewu have to pay for a towel a locker food which is overpriced n not that good The lockers r far from the ridesIt was a very nice day but i think its a one time experience

Fantastic waterpark. Went here as the Wild Wadi park was closed at our hotel. Managed to get a discount by booking online. The waterpark was much better than expected and loved the rides and in particular the lazy river.

A lot of fun!. Excellent place to visit! You will have a lot of fun in this place! Its worth the visit and will definitely will go back if have the opportunity again! Recommend for families and couples! And also you will get wet!! :)
Had the best time!. Great for families and friends. Great rides for everyone. However, the Leap of Faith is not for the faint-hearted!

Fun day!. For Aquaventure Waterpark you must save the whole day - the slides where scary, but super fun. We took also the Dolphin Encounter tickets - dolphins where cute and we were really able to touch them and kiss them, because the group was small - 8 people. In february you must go there early, because when the sun starts to set, it gets cold at the top of the slide towers.

Aquaventure. Took monorail ride to reach. Well maintained water park. Enjoyed all rides. It is all together different experience to slide through tubes with surrounding of fish world ! Make sure u go with necessary clothes and slippers else it is costly there. Food options are also comfortable. Need one full day !

Good Day Outing. It is a pretty decent size waterpark with many rides and games. It is part of the Atlantis Hotel, so you get to see other attractions to alongwith it.Here Tower of Poseidon is possibly the best of the lot. this tower has many slides in it. There are slides and activities for small kids also. There are other non-water rides as well like zip line.Make sure you carry swimming costumes otherwise you will not be able to enjoy any of the rides and the swimming costumes in the stores around it are extremely extremely expensive, if you forget the costume then it is worth taking a taxi back to your Hotel or the nearest sports shop.Also food items are not allowed inside except few fruits for kids. So make sure to not carry any kind of food with you otherwise you will have to throw out everything, There are foodcourts inside and are slightly pricy but you have no choice if you are hungry.
Fun in the Sun. Loved the rides - made me feel like a kid again - even in the heat we ended up enjoying every second of our waterpark adventure

Amazing Fun. We were staying at the Atlantis Palm this was free of charge to us. It was fantastic lots of great sides water activties surroundings are so nice dun lounges beach area food venues towels even beach buggy which drives you back to the hotel area if you get tired from all the things to do. Staff are great nothing to much trouble for them. Well worth a vist but you need full day there and more

Adventure with friends so funny . This is the hugest water park in my experience. Me and friends are very happy and challenging. wonderful! All staffs are friendly. Moreover, here is provided good safety for any customers.

Amazing day . Even though it is quite expensive: it is always a good day filled with fun!! Plenty of rides and slides to keep you busy all day, a kids pool for the little ones, some sun loungers for those wanting to tan; and a little beach or you could float around on one of the tubes to relax. try to go during Ramadan or summer maybe as they do special offers during that time of year.

Pricy food. The park was great, you could spend hours there. My complaint is we had 11 members and we spent £200 on food, what a rip off after spending so much on the entry tickets. We did not over order our food but felt helpless as the kids where hungry.

Great day out for the Family. We have visited the park on a number of occasions and have always had a great day out. Staff are very helpful and the place is very clean. The only reason i did not give it 5 stars is because i believe the food outlets are probably too expensive if measured against the quality, This could be improved.Will we visit again? absolutely.

Funny day !. First of all it is a well organized , safe and clean place. one can find the right attraction for itself , waterslides, pools , Dolphins / stingray / sharks or sea lions encounters. Every time I came in Dubai, one day I like to spend it here. My young daughter (5yrs) enjoy so much to play in this place.

Cold. January isn't a hot month, I'm a Geordie how can I even say that! Believe me I'm used to near zero, but scantily clad in a gentle breeze, proved too much for me!
Plus side, no queue's round the whole thing in a few hours.
Try the kaleidescope restaurant after, good value and a huge selection.

Third best in the country. I have been to Aquaventure twice and it doesn't look like I'll be going back.
The place is a bit pricey for the amount of slides you get and the food tastes bleak.
Would pick Wild Wadi (Dubai) or Yas Waterworld (Abu Dhabi) in a heartbeat, over Aquaventure Waterpark.

Wow. Spend a whole day at the park. Was not busy at all. So could do all the slides with ease. Very nice surroundings.
Quite expensive (as everything in Dubai ;-)).

Great Water Park!!! Good fun for couples!. We went to check out the palm. Decided to go into Aquaventure water park. We paid 380AED each which was slightly more that Wild Wadi which we visited earlier in our holiday. This included lunch and access to the aquarium as well.I feel this price was quite steep but then this is Dubai so not unexpected. In return we got a really nice day out! There are many facilities and we felt that as a couple we preferred this to wild wadi. There were plenty of sun beds available we were able to leave out towels and then go and explore.The water slides are great for couple because almost all can be done in a double tube. The rapids allow you to float about leisurely and decide which rides you want to take without getting out. You can access almost all rides from here. My and my fiancée highly recommend the aquarium slide that goes through the shark tank. I would also say this is good for families as there are many rides but also access to beach, volleyball, peddle boats and zip line.Overall a great day out. Expensive outlay means no 5 stars from us but truly an unforgettable time.

Overpriced, only a few thrilling rides. 300AED for a pair of simple flip flops, 80AED for a simple burger meal, and 400+ for an entry ticket and a locker!! There were only 3 rides which were meant to be thrilling, one of which (Leap of Faith) was closed due to maintenance.  Really not worth it.

Beat the summer blues. This marvel is another not to miss place in dubai. The rides are wonderful..the rapids are great. you must go at 10 in the morning and spend the whole day. if you are staying there and check in at 3 pm, then just remember the park closes at 6 pm

Great Fun!!. I have been to Aquaventure at the Atlantis Hotel on numerous occasions, the park is huge with loads of different rides. I'm an adrenaline junkie but some of these rides even terrify me, slides that plunge into darkness, go through shark tanks and the epic vertical drop which I had to be pushed down by a 10 year old as I was far too scared to go myself. Aside from the rides there is an amazing lazy river, stunning views and a large very quiet beach. Excellent place for all the family an absolute must for anyone traveling to Dubai.

So much fun!!!. I spent one day in this park with my husband and we had a lot of fun. Since it was the low season, we never waited for any slide. The site is beautiful. The slides are fun. There's a beautiful aquarium. The staff are very friendly. I recommend you to take a bracelet in which you can put money for your expenses (ex: lunch). At the end of the day, they give you the money back.

Great fun day out. We visited with our two teenage boys who loved it. Worth getting there in the morning because there are no queues however even later in the day you never waited more than 10 minutes. Best water park we have visited - well organised and lots of sun beds.

Poor both in winter and summet. Bad people and quality control, massive queues and poor quality food in the winter, you have to carry your tubes with you which leads to nightmare queuing. Even trying to get into the park is awful with no crowd control and we waited an hour to buy tickets even though we got there early. I've also visited in the summer where the ground is too hot to stand on. It comes down to the venue trying to shove too many paying customers into the park which makes the entire experience awful from start the finish. Avoid!

Great day out but expensive. great rides although not many for younger children. Way to over priced though for food and drinks but did enjoy the rides. The staff and life guards are very friendly and helpful

Worth the visit. Slides for everyone at this park. When we were there the childrens area was closed for construction but that didnt bother us. The slides were great, though I miss the surfwave that some of the other parks have. You can also go to the beach to relax if you need the break. The food is great for being "waterpark-food". We had indian butter chicken.
Excellant value. Excellent value and monorail very regular. recommend get there early as does get busy in middle of day but queuing still minmal. Shark Attack and Slitherine are must do rides

great fun. Very good! keep you fund for the entire afternoon!btw, i worried about water temperature before I go, since my visit is in winter (Feb 9). but it turned out to be no problem. a little bit chili when you are in the shade, but water temperature is great (warmer in the water than get out of water), and no problem when you are in the sun

Great but not perfect. I had a fantastic day out at Aquaventure. Highlights were the Poseidon's revenge and the Leap of Faith. Some rides are exceptional bumpy where the flumes are connected together which bashed up my back a bit. The whole park is signposted so badly that it took us a long time to get situated. The beach is the place to hang out and cool off and all the better rides are at the Tower of Poseidon. Food was very basic and expensive and the canteens a little chaotic even in an off peak part of the year. Felt like a kid again, had a good time, but wouldn't visit again as it lacks a real variety of rides I think to keep you interested.
Really Awesome. Lots of Fun, the expanded it so more action rides. It is really fun for people of all ages, make sure you go to the big rides as they are the best ones.

Died and gone to HEAVEN.... This waterpark is hands down one of the most luxurious and best water parks around. You can slide ride into a shark cave or be blasted into water space through Poseidon's Revenge. Did I mention you can even go for a swim at the beach!! One of the best places in Dubai hands down. Admission is free if you are a guest of the hotel!

Best waterpark visited till date. Visited this waterpark along with my wife.Had a great time as there are lot of rides which are so awesome that we ride several times. The best part it is well connected and one can just move from one place to another in the water boat.There is continuous flow of rapids and showers in different areas.There is also good locker facility however it seems expensive after spending almost 5500 per person on tickets. But overall good place at location and with Atlantis at the front the experience is awesone

Such a great day, So much fun! You MUST Try the leap of Faith!. Our group of 6 had such a great day here at the Waterpark. We had been on every single ride in the waterpark, some rides multiple times we loved them that much. As we did not have any little ones with us, we were not affected by the maintenance taking place on one of the children's areas, however the beach part of the waterpark seemed to be packed with happy kiddo's. Poseidon's revenge and the leap of faith are super scary but they are fantastic to try! The parks relatively easy to get around and they offer a golf cart shuttle to quickly travel around. I would definitely return!
Aquaventure. Great fun at the water park. There is also a very nice beach. However, I am against the captivity of dolphins, so that is why this resort is only getting 3 stars.
