water adventure. Not for the weak heart this has some amazing rides.... ideal for family or friends...take a lot of sun tan as its very hot

Not what we expected at all. First of all the rides are very misleading as the entry and exit were very confusing, the rides are quite short therefore before you are ready it already finish. The rides are spilt into two towers the tower of neptune and the tower of poseidon. For the tower of neptune it got the leap of faith and most of the river rides, the leap of faith look more scary that it is therefore is worth a try. But the river rides is a bit confusing as the entry is a bit confuse we need to keep asking for direction as there are one river rides which is not in the tower itself, also be prepare as your bottom will be bumping on the slides as the water wasn't too deep the best way it to lift your bottom higher during rides to avoid injury. Entry is not back to found beside one for the tower of neptune but is where you exit is the problems as you always end back up in the river and you need to almost go around half the river before you can get back to the entry of the rides..Where as the tower of poseidon the entry is a bit more confuses im glade there are some staff there as there are about 5 rides entry in 1 you need ask which is which as there are no direction on which is which. but the good side is that the exit is very close to the entry therefore you can very easily going back into the queue.If you are going as family it will be great as the rides are suitable for different age group if they are a bit older you can just let them go wild and enjoy the sun on one of the sun bed yourself, but be prepare to get woken up by noises if you are sensitive.

Good but not the best. Having kids we have visited many water parks over the years. This one is attached to the Atlantis Hotel on the Palm in Dubai. It is free to use for residents but if you are not it is approx£50 per head for a day visit. The park is large and very clean and all the staff are really friendly. However although the ride are good fun I found that they were limited in nature. There is actually that many to do compared to other parks I have been to. That said good day out and good fun for families.

Slideaway. This is the water park rides are brilliant best I've seen Poseidon revenge the highlight feel as you have fell of a building the wait for rides is very short so you can get on everything that's there

First class waterpark. Lovely waterpark with so many different rides especially the ride in the fish tank where you are sealed in a tunnel but have amazin views of the aquarium. Plenty of large bath towels supplied and you have access to the lovely beach and sun beds.

Super fun! . This was the most memorable part of our dubai trip! The kids had loads of fun because of the freaky looking slides! All the rides were super enjoyable and the weather was perfect too! Definitely a must visit if you're traveling with kids

The most thrilling water adventure experience...... We had just a great time enjoying all the thrilling and fun rides that this park have. Wow! What an experience.... the highest slides I've tried in Dubai and the coolest indoor aqua museum & aquarium. Just amazing & memorable. We love it!!

Very well run waterpark. My wife spent a few hours but left early because it was too cold for people from the tropics like us. The air temperature was in the low 20's but with constant breeze from the sea while you are all wet makes for a pretty "chilled" feeling. Park is very well run and staffs are very friendly and helpful. We paid up for sun chairs in a separate VIP area which was most useful for being served lunch by the staff, saving us time to stand in line.

Thrill of Atlantis. I went with my cousin, his wife and my brother. I wanted to go there for quite a while. The place is fantastic. Food is pricey so better to eat after your finished for the day. The Leap of Faith was the best ride. Adrenaline till your throat. Tower of Poseidon is best with family. Tower of Neptune is fantastic. I loved the Shark Tank and Leap of Faith. Theres a pool which goes throughout Aquaventure. The Rapids and torrents were fun. Got a free day? Go spend the day at this enticing place. Try visiting the Dolphin Bay to swim with the dolphins which have their own chambers. Theres a sea lion point to hug and hang out with the cutties. I'd love to visit the Sea lion point and Dolphin bay

Nice one for Children !!!. We went there on 2nd Feb 2016 evening at the time of Sunset, the view from the Mono rail was absolutely awesome, Children will definitely enjoy this lovely water park.Though the entry fees is high (around INR 5000/- each) if we go as a family with children it is worth spending for the experience we get and this place is a photographers delight, we took some fabulous photos and videos to cherish.

One day is not enough!. I visited Wild Wadi years ago. But it was completely different. 1st of all it was much bigger,I'm sure no one can do all the rides and see the whole park in one day. You'd better manage to eat full before going to park,because inside the park everything is extremely expensive. One food costs about 50 AED!!! The Locker is 35 AED,but it is very small, only one small bag can fit in it. Don't forget to take towels,..inside.The rides are very safe and nice. Although it was somehow a cool weather in January,but it was still a bit crowded. I'm very sorry which I couldn't go to the other side of the park,because I didn't have time.

Very good time. Visited the water park with family celebrating.Very good facilities, changing rooms busy but very clean Staff helpful throughout the park Water rides very clean and a wonderful experience Safe as left bags on loungers and remained there till we returnedOnly gripe will not allow own food in the parkIf hijabi be aware only burkinis allowed.

Excellent water park with good variety of rides. Visited with a 3 year old so wasn't sure how much he would be able to go on. He loved the rapids and didn't want to do anything else so for us it was perfect but after walking around he would have been too small for most other rides. The pools are really clean and its really well organised. You get a wrist band that you can load money onto for food and drinks and also one for your locker. You can leave all your belongings in a locker and you literally don't need anything else with you all day. You can hire towels and life vests for little ones. There are plenty of sunbeds and shades around all the pools and also on the beach. There are various gift shops. Food was quite expensive and not many healthy choices but we ordered a pizza and a club sandwich and they were both quite good. Our little one loved the shark tank and watching the rays. Locker rooms have showers and hair dryers etc so everything you need has been thought of and I would highly recommend it for a good day out.

Waterpark with all the trimmings. Definitely a fantastic day spent in the park, the long tube rides are definitely enough to entertain you for an entire day (one "round" trip takes over 1 hour. Again, friendliest staff and a safe environment for the kids. The prices are out of this world though, but perhaps that is just a dubai thing.
Amazing. We had an incredible three days at the park. Lots to do; great rides, plentiful food and a quiet, relaxing beach. Five Stars plus!

Was expecting better rides. So far not the best waterpark I went to. Rides are small, and you get to do everything very quickly. Good to spend time in the water but don t go the thrilling experience of their rides.

Avoid this place. Avoid this Aquaventure at the Atlantis, it's not worth your time let alone the entry fees. It's also not friendly and the security acts like any non hotel guests are not welcome! A business that allows that to happen doesn't run it well. Much better places in Dubai to enjoy.

Excellent waterpark. Not as many rides as Yas Waterworld in Abu Dhabi, but more relaxing. It is the only waterpark in the UAE offering discounts for local residence, which makes it the cheapest waterpark to go to.

An amazing day with my family in the aquaventure. After reading many reviews regarding the aquaventure we have been all the family for a funny day.First of all take with you the towels from your hotel because they will charge you 20 aed for each towel.After payed for the safe ( if you have money,credit card or bags is much better take it) we finally walk in to the park.It's huge and you need to be ready to wait for your ride.Personally we loved the rapid river which go all around the park through fast river and then slow again.The kids and your wife probably they will be lovers of aquaconda (try it!) I agree.So if you want spend one day in relax you need to be ready to spend a lot of money this is the right place.One thing be careful with sunglasses or phone mobile take a case waterproof.Highly recommended

Great way to spend a few hours. It's a very nice waterpark, i can't lie, some of the rides are quite thrilling. The only reason i gave it 4 stars is because it's insanely expensive. We got one of the two tickets for free(birthday ticket) and even then was still expensive.But i would recommend this waterpark to my friends, we had good fun there.

Get there early.....avoid the crowd. We arrived at the park 15 minutes before the official opening time but they let us in. This meant we were the first into the park, first to get chairs and enjoyed literally no lines on any rides for about an hour and half. Walked onto all the rides with no wait during time- it was awesome! The park filled up by noon and lines formed at the popular rides but not too bad given it was the off season. The leap of faith and Poseidon's Revenge are both good slides for thrill seekers. The big tube rides at the tower of Neptune also provide a bit of an adrenaline rush. The park is very clean and the staff are very friendly. Our 9 year old loved all the rides and had a great day- be aware that if you are not 1.2 meters tall there isn't a lot to do other than ride the lazy river. The one complaint we had was that the signage is not adequate and we found ourselves having to try to figure out our way around a few times as the park area is actually quite large- staff were helpful though. The consession food is typical theme park food- just OK and over priced. It's not a cheap day but it is worth it.

such fun!. can't recommend it enough! U feel safe, looked after, everyone (staff & guests) is polite, fun & helpful, no matter nationality & language barriers! Rubber rings are plentiful & the flumes are the best I've ever ridden btw

Water park. There is no need to book this you can pay at the gate when you arrive! If it's an all day fun you want this is the place to go! You can spend all day here!You can rent lockers to put you valuables in and once you have place your towel on a sun bed we found out no one removes it it's yours all day giving you time to go around the park!This place is well worth the money and a great place for kids and adults a like!
Best water park ever. This was one of the best waterparks i have ever been too. amazing water rides all the staff are very friendly and happy to help. Had the best time ever.

The best fun I have had in years. We spent three full days at the Atlantis Hotel, and two of them in the waterpark! Even then we did not manage to go on every ride. We found the best ones for us were the 8 seater ones; thrilling! Plenty of room throughout the waterpark for everyone, and loads of rings (no queuing, no waiting for rings to become available). Not to be missed.

Thrilling water fun. Aquaventure water park is attached to the Hotel Atlantis in Palm Jumeirah and provides many rides for all ages to enjoy. Being in-house guests of Hotel Atlantis, the entry to water park was free for us. If you are staying in the Imperial club room, then you can get the entry wrist band from the Imperial lounge to avoid the queue at the park. You can then walk into the waterpark by flashing the wrist bands. Towels are provided free for in house guests and you can carry water from the room. Lockers are charged at 40AED and they are big enough to stuff quite a lot of things (There is a bigger locker if you pay more). The Waterpark is spread over a huge area with a long and winding lazy river. The river is quite interesting and provides different experiences. At some places, it is a calm river that moves very slow and at others it is a gushing stream that takes you on a fast ride. Kids have a separate play area with multiple options of slides and water falls. There are a lot of staff who ensure the safety of visitors. Artificial beaches and wave pools provide ample space to relax and have fun. There are many high-thrill rides for adults in the Tower of Poseidon and Tower of Neptune. A couple of pain points - 1) You need to carry the gear all the way up by climbing stairs for every ride and 2) Quite a few of the rides are for couples (If you have a young kid and one of the adults need to stay with him, then you cannot do many rides). Shark attack is highly recommended as you come down below a shark infested aquarium and you can see the sharks swimming above you. There is also a serene beach towards the inside of the palm (overlooking Burj-Al-Arab). One can either walk to the water park from the east side of Atlantis or take the hotel buggy from the pool at the west side to get to the park. Overall, a very good water park where you can easily spend about a day (If you are in a hurry you can do most of the rides in about 3 hours)
very busy but refreshing. Go there in the morning you will be more confortable and avoid long queues! but for sure a lot of fun and water, water, water!!!!

Bad boy rides. Awesome place to spend a day. Be it with family and kids or a bunch of friends. Loads of rides, some scary and some that thrill without causing you too much stress from fear. Good areas for bits, plenty of beach space, kayaking and dolphin shows also a available. Food expensive though.

Fun for the family. Kids loved this one... prices are a tad expensive, especially for the photos taken... but the picture quality was very good. Overall, it was a lot of fun. Park agents gave me a hard time with my shorts that had pockets, but eventually let me get into the water.

One of the best family holiday destination in Dubai. I visited here with my family. We spend whole day. Time passed very fast. Rides are excellent. We enjoyed a lot. Must visit place when you are in Dubai.

Excellent day out for everybody!. The waterpark facilities were excellent, everywhere was well kept, clean and tidy. There were several add-ons such as the locker rooms ad towel hire. Unfortunatly, we were not made aware of the pre-paid wrist bands that you could use to pay for drinks, food etc around the park. We wish this had been offered to us at the ticket collection booth as it was a moderate nuisance to keep returning to the locker rooms every time we wanted to buy something - also a loss of potential revenue on their part as I'm sure people would spend more with their credit card on their wrist!All lifeguards and staff were extra friendly and helped to :)

They have a wonderful high tea. A friend and I went to high tea there. It lasts for 3 hours and includes either juice or champagne and is 5 small courses. It is expensive but we did this in lieu of dinner that day. It was most enjoyable if you want something a bit different and elegant.

Awesome!. Go for it! The new tower and rides are amazing. Zip line is a must but buy your ticket on the way in and you save 25 dirhams. Quieter on the new side so best to leave your stuff on a lounger there. Can get free buggies back to the hotel if needed.

Excellent birthday treat! Dolphin experience is a must!. We were looking for something special to do for a birthday treat, we have visited the Atlantis but never visited aqua venture.June booked our tickets and she was brilliant, great sense of humour and very friendly. She promised to sing happy birthday in Swahili when we came for our visit.The day we visited it was cloudy but the water park was still a great choice, enough people about not to feel crowded and enjoy the rides. Our dolphin experience was booked for the afternoon, after a briefing on safety we started our Royal swim experience, we had the lovely jasmine to play with and she was great. The experience e is a must if you have never done it before, it's something we will never forget, the dolphin team were great very friendly and looked after you, and ensured you got a great experience with the chosen dolphin and plenty of photo opportunities.And to top it off when exiting the changing rooms there was June and her colleagues dancing and singing happy birthday Swahili, a special treat, if not slightly embarrassing but great fun!It is expensive but well worth the money, the only thing I would watch out for is the photos they are v expensive and can cost the same as the experience itself.

Great sunny day. Great rides for adult, but not for really small kids. Kids love the lazy river ride. The ticket is a bit pricey, so make sure you are always on the move. Make sure you are with a big group before renting a cabana, it is not cheap, but it's good to have a little private area.

Fun filled day out in Dubai. I came here with friends whilst on a 3 day trip to Dubai. Such a fantastic water park. By far one of the best In the world. All sorts of different slides and rides. I loved the lazy river(one of the longest in the world)Fantastic ameneties and brilliant spacious lounge area's.If it's your Birthday within a week of visiting the park you get free admission(you can get a voucher online and show your passport on arrival to avail)

Not worthy of what they charge.... A portion of the park was closed....even during the DSF period.... Except leap of faith none if the rides were thrilling.... Zip-lining was way to slow....food inside is good and inexpensive.

Kids will love it :). Fantastic place to keep the young ones engaged for the whole day. As guests staying at The Atlantis, we had free access to the waterpark and we enjoyed it thoroughly. Very clean and very safe, with lifeguards to assist you at every corner. The leap of faith is amazing. In addition to that there are other paid attractions within the waterpark (prices are quite stff though). Would love to return :)
Family Fun. Great place to spend a day relaxing while your kids have loads of fun. Rides are amazing, safe and enjoyable.

wow as always with all things dubai. a great place - hugely priced and very hectic and tiring. but a must go and a great educational and enjoyable action place for kids and young people. wish we could cater for such places for 99% of the kids in the world who cant afford this ever. cause kids need to experience all things good i wish some day someone will make it free for kids for 2 mths in a year and not think about just earning but sharing and giving .

A great way to spend a day. I came here twice whilst in Dubai, it's a little pricey but it is an all-day event and the rides are really fun! I'm not really a 'water-baby' so I wasn't too bothered about the rides but they are excellent! I think there was only 3 rides I didn't do because they really weren't my cup of tea! The selection of food seems a bit limited there, but it's not too bad. We hired a GoPro which was totally worth it, the picture quality is excellent and captured some great moments! The wait for a taxi home was the only downfall really!

free entrance for guest of atlantis. its very nice with nice offers for kids but many attractions kids can only use above 120 cm.. so be aware of that.. otherwise the entry is expensive when you are not guest of atlantis

Nice way to cool down and have fun for the whole family. Entrance to Aquaventure Waterpark is one of many attractions included for free in the Big Bus 48-hour ticket. Great variety of rides for everyone from thrill seekers to those that just want to chill. Was expecting much longer waiting times for the rides but the lines moved quite fast which made it even more enjoyable.
Fun in the sun . Staff friendly and fun. A very pleasant experience. Safety is a priority which is very reassuring. Very safe for kids. Could spend s day there. It not for kids under 8 years
Good Water park. Good Water park for Children as well as Adults . Leap of faith Water Slide is nearly breath taking. over all Good.

Kids love it. Well organized, clean, good rides, no complaints. The biggest challenge was to get out from there. We stayed till the very end and the taxi ques were long. I would advice either to leave earlier or to organize a ride from your hotel. After waiting like two hours, I would not mind paying even a lot more that the taxi fare just to get out. There is also the train, but it only gets you to the other side of the Palm road and then you have the same challenges again. Perhaps still better option.

Family day trip . The Aquaventure Water park is suitable for all ages. They have water games for children less than 10 years and for Adults. To enjoy all the games your height must be more than 1.22 meters. The Aquarium is beyond amazing same for the dolphin and sea lions show.

Awesome!. A really cool water park with a good atmosphere. If you are a guest with the Atlantis hotel it is free entry, towels are also free; but you must pay for a locker if you want it. I'd recommend people to take swim goggles and a mobile phone waterproof pouch to take pictures - these items are very expensive in the park.The food in the park is reasonably priced with things like burgers and fries etc... There is a beach with sun beds and sun beds all over the park, there is a kids play park which is also fun for adults, a lazy river you float around in tubes, Rapids and wave machines which you use tubes for and many rides.The water around the whole park is shallow and doesn't require you to know how to swim, all slides go into shallow pools of maybe 1.2m depth. The lazy river and swimming pools are about 1.5m deep. I am 5ft6 and never had water above my chest. The only place the water can get deep is the wave machines in the lazy river, the waves are deep but take one second to pass and there is around twenty seconds between waves. You have a tube to hold onto anyway. So non-swimmers can also have fun.There are showers with all toiletries and changing rooms also. You can use the waterpark for free on your checkout day from the hotel. We found it was a good place to spend the final day as our flight was at night; so we enjoyed our day then could shower and be fresh for travelling to the airport.
It's very nice !. Nice water park , we have really enjoyed very nice attractions. Only the thing is that lots of q, but people likes to come for nice place so , I understand . Thanks a lot !

The best. Everything about this water park was brilliant. Some of the best water rides I've ever been on & visually they look fantastic too. I can't wait to go back and experience them again. For anyone who owns a GoPro, you can use them around the park, obviously using the chest mount. The lazy river was amazing too. We could have spent all day in there - the torrent aspect of the lazy river was our particular favourite - you'll understand when you're there!We can't wait to go back.
Great fun.. Great for kids and adults, so much to do you could spend the whole day and not get bored.lazy river, water slides and plenty of sun beds when you need to rest.

Amazing Day. Myself and my husband spent a day here and OMG it was brill from start to finish. We went on every slide and just had soooo much fun. pleanty for all to do here, you can just lie on a bed and enjoy the sun or you can be a thrill seeker on the slides or just relax in the lazy river. We had the best day ever, plenty of choice for food too

Great day out!. We couldn't decide which water park to visit as there are a few but we decided in this one as we were unlikely to ever stay in the Atlantis hotel so we may as well visit via the water park and we did not regret it! The best day! All park attractions are thilling! The water slides are the best ever! Warning to 'Poseidon's revenge' riders... It is the scariest thing letting the floor drop beneath you but if you can handle the walk up to all the rides in this tower then do it! The rubber ring boat rides are great too! Some of the slides do hurt on the way down as you are reaching some speeds in a plastic tube with joins in but the thrill out weighs the slight pain! You can relax in the lazy river afterwards! The best water park I have been to!

A lot of people, but fantastic waterpark. You will need at least one day to go through the park. We visited the park in the christmas holidays and it was packed with people. Even though we booked tickets up front we still needed to stand in a long line.. frustrating. But when we got in to the park it was amazing. Relaxing down the lazy river paths and the take amazing rides was fun. The park was pretty packed with people so it was a bit queue in some of the slides. The beach is extremely nice and you get a nice view over the city.

A great day out. We stayed at Atlantis the Palm and had free admission to the water park. The slides and Rapids are great fun. The rapids can take you away from your lounger for almost an hour as there are numerous different routes and Rapids to try. The slides attract queues and in general are quieter in the morning and outside of the Arabic weekend. Food is very expensive when eating in the water park and if possible I would suggest bringing a small bag with children's canned drinks and crisps, buns and rolls as appropriate.

Best of Dubai. Even for kids or adults is a must try in Dubai! Enjoying special and unique slides and from the top of the tower you have also an amazing view . If you are exhausted from the slides you can easily relax at the white sand beach too at the side of the park! It worth to ask for a ticket with the entrance to the aquarium as well . Huge tank with billions of fishes take you to enjoy a special underwater world.

What a day!!!. Well I'm 40 years old and regressed to a small child, absolutely thrilling day!! Float around in a big hoop round the lazy river, rivers off to the sides take you to all the different slides, the rapids are a must, and if you are really brave do the leap of faith, it was phenomenal, I screamed like a banshee but it was great!! The park is immaculate, the restaurants are fab, the gift shops are a bit expensive but not majorly. Be prepared for a full on day, and to leave very wrinkly!!

The best experience till date!!. we had a lovely moment. The rides from each tower was just fun filled and I still get goose bumps if i think about some of the rides. The crew is highly profession and crowd was good. Main attraction is under water walk.
Great Fun!. Visited in December - lots of fun, rides suitable for everyone. Queues were not too bad - only bad ones were for the really scary ones!
amazing. this is fantastic but not too busy. My daughter did the dolphin visit while she was there and it was very good too. Highly recommend

Its just ok and very expensive !. Me and my wife went there yesterday.We had high expectations for this park.This turned out to be a normal waterpark like other we have seen. Nothing extraordinary just that one ride which takes you through aquarium.This is money printing park for atlantis. They charge 40dhs for water bottle which we get for 2 dhs outside. They charge 6-7 times costlier for everything.Like always , i read in reviews, one tower is closed. Same happened with us, tower of posiedon was closed so it was like pay full and Njoy 50%.You got to have no worry regarding bucks then you can Njoy completely with dolphin bay, sea lion show and others.

What a fantastic day. As a guest at the Atlantis Hotel this came free as part of the hotel facilities, equally so the same facilities are available to visitors if the pay to enter. It was disappointing that we could only spend a few hours there because the facilities are vast, we know we would have had a whole day of fun just based on our couple of hours.The other great thing is that there were lots of rubber rings for everyone to not have to be disappointed, there were little or no long lines to have to wait in…defenatey need to go back for more of this.

Great way to spend a day!. They say you need about 4 hours to get through the park, but it can definitely be an all day trip! We ended up going on a day with overcast and still had a ton of fun, and the lines were small.We made an oopsie, and ended up doing the lazy river paths for a few hours first, which, yes, its lazy, but its still tiring. Then we went to one of the towers that required you to walk up a lot of flights of stairs, and were too tired to do it more than once.I would recommend doing the towers first, and then the lazy river. The towers have some of the most incredible, and thrilling rides I have ever seen. I can only imagine how great this place would have been on a sunny day, and if we had more time! I would go back just for the water park!
Great place to unwind. This is a good place to spend time with kids.we visited while staying at the Atlantis. It has some thrilling rides.i loved the Lazy river as well

Absolutely worth a visit!. The waterpark is quite expensive but really worth the money! We had a great time and there is plenty of good rides for both adults and children to enjoy. However I would recommend to bring along own snacks because the food at the park is just pricey junk food. Also the entrance ticket doesn't include a locker so make sure to ask for that if you need one!
Every time I visit the Dubai will go to this wonderful place. Of the coolest places in Dubai.Very fun for all ages, everyone is big and old and small enjoy.Very wonderful water sports.

Great experience and fun. We had a great time at the water park along with dolphins bay, the encounter with the Dolphins was great , the water park games are incredible and lots of fun for both youngsters and adults, it's suitable for all ages, management of water park is superb and all kind of facilities are there from food, drinks, snacks, ice cream the security is high and their are life guards in all places, the only thing is that it is very expensive

Full of fun. If the season is perfect, nothing like aquaventure water park. It is in Atlantis hotel. It is free for hotel guest although anyone can go for a day trip by buying separate ticket. It is connected with the beach as well.
Must visit. Everyone from our group (ages 4 - 40) loved it. You just grab a floating tube, sit tight and enjoy the man made tides. Ride freaks also had their pie with Leap of Faith.

Doesn't appear as big as everyone says it is.... This is the problem with expectation...everyone constantly "bigs this place up" and in your head you're expecting a waterslide in the eye of a tornado. When really what you get...is a water park!Of course, it's nice! You have 3 different sections and you get to do a whole bunch of stuff (it's a LOT of walking and climbing stairs...by the way, so be prepared).I recommend you get there by 11 or so, if you want to take photos etc. We got to the slides by around 1pm and finished everything by 4:30pm. Post lunch we had some time to spare around the wade pool. But my poor husband didn't get a chance to take any photos.The 2 Towers are easy enough to navigate your way through. The "lazy river" is a bit tricky though - you have to keep your eyes peeled so you don't miss anything...we almost did :)Bring down the family...or enjoy it as a couple...it's heaps of fun...if you're with the right company :DP.S. - I highly recommend you take the pass that includes the food voucher - meals cost more than double the amount compared to a regular mall.
Best places to visit in dubai. Must visit destination, highly recommended as they have rides to suit everyone of the family, a good day to spend in Dubai

Fantastic, just fun and more fun. If you like water park then this is not to be missed, especially In December when the temperature is not unbearable. There is fun for all family, young and old. Go in the lazy river or go for a thrill. Pure fun.

Good 1 day occupation. Its a beautiful water park of the Atlantis Hotel. One can spend a comfortable 1 day enjoying in the lazy river with the rapids as well as some of the other huge slides. There's a dolphin area too.

fantastic family fun. my whole family enjoyed two days at this water park with rides to cater for all of us. My husband floated about the lazy river and my daughter and I took on some of the more adventurous slides. Great fun - lifeguards EVERYWHERE so very safe!

Perfect for family and children!. Really enjoyed this place. Would love to have bought children here however was with some friends on this occasion. Seems very friendly appealing for families. I would recommend.

A little pricey but worth a visit . Living in London a theme park ticket would cost £30 this cost almost £50 per person. Which is almost reasonable for a couple but for a large family not really affordable. Also there are no Buy one get one free vouchers available:( On the plus side this is an amazing water park with great rides and very good for thrill seekers! Would recommend some swim shoes to wear on feet as you have to take your shoes off on the rides and there is a long walk back to get your shoes on very very hot ground.

Average waterpark at much higher than average price. This waterpark is very large in a lovely setting but overall the rides are nothing special. The queues were immense so I only managed to go on three rides in the afternoon with it closed by the time I went for the fourth. We only went here as we stayed at the Atlantis overnight but wouldn't suggest it would be worth going to if you weren't staying there. Even though we were staying and thus did not have to pay the high entrance fee, we were disappointed to find there were extras fees for a locker and this was certainly not cheap. Make you sure you eat before entry too or you'll be bankrupted!

Best Waterpark experience compared to at least 3 other waterparks around GCC!. I didn't know what I was signing up for when I decided to go to Aquaventure, as the video seemed exciting. It was much more thrilling than what I imagined and completely blew off my mind! The rides are amazing and the whole area overall is amazing! You will not find another Waterpark like this one around UAE. There are several but this one tops all of them!
Best water park. Had a great time here. The rides are amazing. If you combine it with the dolphin bay activities it will be the most memorable activity. Friendly staff.
Fun day. We spent one day here and the place is perfect for grown ups and children. We had a lot of fun at the water park.
Good one day trip. Overall nice experience very mast rides ...if you have a day at leisure u can always visit the place while going to Palm jumeirah

WOOOHHH and AHHH'sss great rides and great fun. Aquaventure Atlantis is great joy for all ages be it 2ft,4 feet or 6 feet tall. great place with really good slides and range of option depending upon your taste and comfort.entry is fairly price. the facility is very well maintained....the park is very strong in terms of security...lifeguards and security are seen at almost every few meters in the park... keeping the accidents in the park to a very low level. safe for all most all ages....rides or let me call it slides - very good range and options available. the facility is very neat and clean changing rooms are also state of the art. towels and lockers available at the part on chargeable basis. if you are carrying a big bag make sure you take a big locker as well my only advise to the park management is to move the towel cabana closer to the changing rooms makes it easy for a lot of guests.

Nothing out of the way.. If you have done other big water parks of the world, this is very small. Nothing great about this. You can finish off fast and then may be relax on the beach or play some beach games. The Dolphins and sea lion experiences are very expensive and they don't perform any shows for the general public.

Fun for even the big kids. Spent a full day in the park, got in early to be able to get on the slides without too much of a line up. We spent so much time on rides and in the water, I started getting sea sick. This place is amazing, be prepared to spend a full day there in - take sunblock! Food in the park is not too good though, with a couple of places to grab a bit of junk food.Imagine cruising though a shark tank on a rubber tube - its awesome and we are an adult couple, no kids!

Don`t miss this place.. We spend the whole day there. Its perfect for children and adults, a lot of things to do, if you combine with visit by the dolphins this experience become unforgettable.Just great time, fully recommend.

Wonderful. I was really impressed for their entertain collections. Fantastic day out! Felt like a child again. Awesome experience.There wasn't any bit of a downside. Yet, I'd come back there when I'm in Dubai next. Highly recommend it.
Great for all ages. Some scary rides but the beach and pools are good and the Lazy River brilliant for kids of all ages.

A day of fun and relaxation in one!. We visited the waterpark with our five children, age ranges between 8 and 14. we are waterpark regulars on any holiday so I am always a bit nervous it doesn't live up to expectations, but I have to say, no long lines for queues, always able to access places around the park easily, friendly staff and food not too expensive for the country. The children were occupied for the whole time we were there and could have stayed far beyond closing!!
Average Waterpark. not that much fun . very slow rides only two or three rides are exciting. overall experience average.

Adrenaline seeker. Excellent place to visit for those seeking adrenaline experiences. Slides like the ''Leap of faith'' and ''Shuttles'' will give you thrills. You're definitely going to enjoy. My advise would be to visit during week days. The place is very crowded during weekends and you'll waste lots of time waiting for your turn at some slides (The most interesting ones).

Great fun for the whole family. During our Dubai family visit, we spent a day here. Just our luck that it started to rain, which I never though would happen in Dubai. Anyway, we had great fun. My 7 year old daughter and I did many of the rides, even the scary ones. She loved it. A bit crowded in some parts of the park, but it was ok.

Good but not great. Found this quite expensive for a water park, especially as one tower with a number of rides was not open. Staff were friendly and kept things moving well. Hard to give a really fair review as we couldn't use a number of the rides, which would have made the day more enjoyable.

Day fun. Great time here apart from the odd occasion some lazy parents could not be bothered to use swim nappies on their kids. Loved the lazy river and Rapids it goes runs for a while which is a bit confusing if you wanted to get off.
Best Waterpark in South East Asia...!!. Aquaventure Waterpark might become one of your best ever waterpark in you life. Its simply amazing and extra-ordinary. Must visit place during your Dubai Trip.
Thrilling. Great water park with something for everybody - nice lazy river for those not thrill seeking but a whole host of other options for those who want the thrills!
Awesome!!!. Very well planned and well managed place to be. Staff is courteous and well mannered. Good fun ...keep up the good work. Very satisfied and simply loved the waterpark experience
Brilliant!. Fantastic day out! Felt like a child again. Awesome experience. However my flip flops got stolen, which was a bit of a downside. Yet, I'd come back there when I'm in Dubai next

Spend the day in an awesome lazy river!. No better way to beat the heat and enjoy a world class waterpark. The slides are unique and offer daring frills for individual riders and exhilarating group rafting experiences! The main attraction is the waterparks lazy river which offers a "choose-your-own-adventure" style of fun. Tubers can opt for easy floating to charging rides, waves, and rapids by simply selecting their travel route! Bring sunscreen and re-apply often (best to bring your own as prices are steep once inside the park).The waterpark is on the pricier side and add-ons such as zip-lining and aquarium diving are also available.

Wow Wow Wow. My husband and I stayed at the Atlantis resort. we visited the waterpark on the second day of our stay and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The slides was simply amazing and very well worth the money you pay. The lazy river with the rapids was so much fun. We felt like kids once again. I would definitely recommend the waterpark for families, both kid and adults will have an amazing time.

Felt like we were being robbed. The plus side of this visit was that the staff was very friendly, and in general it was a fun experience (nothing out of the ordinary, definitely not the 'best waterpark in the Middle East and Europe' as it claims to be). We went exactly when they closed off one of their 'towers'. We were warned about this at the entrance to be fair. However, we were shown one ride on what looked like a large map and told that one was closed. This was fine, one of many rides, right? When we went in, we realised that there are really only two 'towers', each containing a few rides. Essentially, half of the park was closed down and yet the full admission fee was charged. To me, this is equivalent to robbery. There is no respect for the customer. We felt cheated. If half of your water park is out of order, you should not be charging the full admission fee. The rides were alright - nothing special, nothing you can't find at most water parks. The price was too steep for what we had, and too steep in general I feel. Oh, you aren't allowed to bring outside food, so you're forced to pay like three times what you would normally pay for a small pizza in the food court in case you're starving. I wouldn't recommend it - there are better ways to spend your money and probably better water parks too.
Relaxing and fun all in one!!. We had such a great time here. Allowed 2 days and it wasn't enough time to thoroughly enjoy all this park offers. So...we'll have to go back :)

Overpriced Fun. We visited here during the peak season, 4 adults and 2 children. It was overcrowded and the ticket prices were hiked exorbitantly! There are few rides though they were awesome. No go for kids under 10 as there is only one little kiddie area and the price of the tickets is not justified. No food allowed inside, but what you can buy inside is like paying for a five star and eating fast food. The souvenir photographs cost dhs 100 each so make sure your looking your best while getting clicked
Very Entertaining. The rides are amazing. The atmosphere in the park is also great. Highly recommend this to all travelers to Dubai
Average Water park. It is a very Average Water park, typical rides, not much of thrill except the 90 degrees ride and the Rapids.

World best!. I can never get anything better than this anywhere! The best water rides and thrill! A well organized waterpark! Do visit in January..you will have a ride within a fish tank! And you will also try a big float going 90 degree! A dream for kids too because they have their special area:) the best part is this is very near to atlantis hotel so you can enjoy the view and it is in palm island!

Great way to cool off!. Spent four hours at the water park as we had to be ready for a night safari so we didn't have time for sharks, dolphins, or some of the other fun extras you can purchase. Better than any water park in the USA . Loved the rapids version of a lazy river!

Disappointed. And irked about a number of things. Give yourself lots of time to get there with the metro, then a tram, then the monorail - all of which give you a chance to see the area and get a view of the Palm Island. Then it's a bit of a hike to the waterpark.Then - even though it's not a busy day or peak time - you'll wait in a long line, whether you've pre-purchased your ticket online or not. Because when you reach the head of the line, you'll have to make additional purchase decisions about locker rentals, meals, etc. practically blind. I already had some idea about the prices, etc., from reading the website and these reviews, but I also had time to go to the other side, where there were more details posted. Be aware that the lockers are inside the dressing rooms, so you have to plan if you want to share with someone of the opposite sex. You can put money on your cashless wristband and get a refund of what's left at the end of the day. There was no lineup for that when we went for the refund. My guess is that they profit on those who forget or can't be bothered with another lineup.And I'm jaded like that because of one thing: you save money by pre-purchasing online, right? Always a bit of a risk in case someone is sick or the weather is bad, but okay. Except here's the thing: they offer good meal deals to on-the-spot ticket buyers which are NOT available to the online purchasers. So we ended up paying more for food than the others. GRRRRR We ultimately saved only a measly sum and the goodwill is GONE.Onward to the fun part - but the maps are not very good. You don't know where you're going or what the attraction is. You cannot see much, if anything, so you don't know whether or not it's something you want to do. I'd looked at everything online, but who remembers them all?So you walk around in a bit of a daze for awhile, until you figure out that you're supposed to find a tube somewhere, and keep it with you. It can take awhile to get one. There's a weight limit for double tubes - so be aware. A lot of people didn't realize it.We went on one ride that slammed us around a bit - and yes, it shook me up and hurt. I shudder to think if it had been my head that got slammed. And that wasn't even a ride known for being a wild one. After that we were much more cautious and actually afraid to try much because there was so little information. Staff tried to be helpful, but without standard ratings, it's often a matter of interpretation. Some people love the wild rides. I want to know - just how wild is it?It's the only time that we have not loved a waterpark. Plus there's the bad taste left about feeling a little ripped off over the pre-purchase deal/no deal on food scam.

Wet wet wet !! . We stayed in the Atlantis so we had unlimited access!! Well worth a visit if your in the area. Lockers are excellent and changing rooms . Plenty of rubber rings about . All the rides were great, loved the lazy river and the rapids . Safety is paramount plenty of life guards about. A great fun day out you won't want to leave .

So much fun!. I never liked waterparks and a friend that was visiting me in Dubai asked me if we can go. So reluctantly I went with her. After spending half a day in this great place my opinion changed: I love waterparks, at least this one. The rides are super fun ranging from exploring the relaxing river track in a giant inflatable donut to the super scary free fall (which is a lot of fun!!). We were there on a Friday and there were no or just very short queues. I don't know if that is the case every Friday but not having to wait for the rides too long and the relaxing atmosphere made our visit to Aquaventure an awesome experience!

Family holiday. Had a day trip with my family and 3 sons. Enjoyed the water sports to the maximum especially the lazy river. It was a good experience for my young kids who enjoyed at the kids area especially the rainfall dance.

Good for my kids but expensive . I took my kids to celebrate a birthday so 1 kid got free entry. It is worth getting the meal in the entrance package as it worka out cheaper.I was shocked at locker price 40aed. Lockers not v large. Take your own towels if you can.Rides were good for the kids, we went on a weekday in jan, so never had to wait in a line. Kids also enjoyed the younger childrens play area.I was upset at the end as my younger so was going on all the rides as he was just at yhe cut off height. He would be checked every time by different life guards. However at the end of the afternoon, 1 lifeguard decided he wouldn't let my son go as he was too short! Despite telling him that we'd been doing yhe same rides for the whole day, he was unreasonable and we left the park on a bad note.

There is not enough time to explore it in one day. It's a nice huge park.unfortunately the Poseidon tower was under maintenance during our visit.book your ticket online or better by a tourism stations but check if all the rides are working before your visit.

Good Family Fun for About Four Hours. Always book your tickets online. Cheaper than on site tickets and you can escape the queue too. The place is well maintained , safe because of the numerous life guards and is good fun for all ages. Only hitch is it can get crowded and it involves a lot of climbing for each ride.One tip. If a family of four are planning to visit this park , it makes sense to book a night's stay in the Hotel Atlantis itself if you get the room for around 500 USD as the entry to the park and the lost chambers is free. If you do the math it is a good bargain.
over priced. paid full price only to find that half the park was closed. although informed about this at the desk i didnt realise until i went in how much this affected the experience
Good one. Good One.. But there were limited rides.. Carry your towel else u have pay for towel also.. Everything is very costly there.. No eatable allowed..

Must visit place . Best thing is that every one is going to help you And the rides are amazing so many life gards So no need to worry make sure to bring your towal and swimming trunks cause the shop there is very expensive so come prepare ✌️

Quite nice. We wanted to visit the Wild Wadi since we are against the use and abuse of dolphins among other animals, but they were closed and I learned that you pay separately to watch animal abuse, which meant we did not participate in this, so we decided to go! It was quite spectacular. The rides were cool and different and it was not too crowded at this time of year. We went on a Saturday. Everything is insanely expensive though.
Excellent . It is a good with kids and family. You can spend full day.Try to reach early at 10 am to avoid rush.

Average nothing special. It's an ok park I have been to better ones and would recommend one in Italy Near Rimini.There is actually not that many rides id say 10 but it will take you all day to do them because of the queues. Everything in there is super crazy expensive food and water. They don't let you bring in water or food so make sure you either bring a lot of money with you or wait until you go to a restaurant. They charge you around £10!to buy the refillable bottle but then you pay extra £5 every time you refill.I would personally not go and save my money as it was ok place but nothing special.Don't forget to bring a towel as they charge for that and for lockers. So if you go with a big family it's worth bringing towels with you.All in all, it's ok but not the greatest park to visit.
world of wonders. we celebrate birthday at this wonderful place, very nice present - free ticket! you can find enjoy for everybody!
GOOD FUN. All good fun! Some amazing rides, and the Dolphin show is really lovely to watch. Would definitely go back again.

Aquaventure Waterpark . We visited the water park during our stay in Dubai in January. We went with a couple of friends, expecting to spend the entire day here. We were a little disappointed when we arrived to find out that that one of the main towers was closed, which ruled out around 4 of the water slides for the day. We did receive a small discount for this but we paid on the day (not sure where people who booked in advance stood with this). We book the ticket which includes the park entry fee, a meal, and access to the aquarium. We thought that this was worth the extra. The meal was a decent size and tasted good (and the aquarium after was also really good). While we were in the Waterpark we were also informed that a few more slides we're currently closed but would open again later (this was in addition to the already closed tower). All in all this meant that we really didn't get to go on as many slides as we had planned throughout the day. I think this would be an enjoyable day out (more so if all of the rides were open), but we spent about 5 or so hours here in the end. Worth doing once, but for the price I probably wouldn't visit a second time.
Great Fun!. We went there just for a few hours but could probably have spent the whole day there. There are many rides with varying degrees of adventurousness... Highly recommended!
Great fun. Great water park, stuff for all ages but obviously can be busy so you do have to queue. Best going towards the end of the day during the week.
good laugh. worth the money, awesome rides food is just standard nothing special and didnt even see the dolphins and still had a good time.
Great attraction. Lockers available. Make sure to wear waterproof sunscreen.There are two main towers with water slides. Don't forget theres another tower. Many people don't see it right away.

Thrilling rides. The Aquaventure WaterPark is located in Atlantis. It took us one hour to make an entry even after having pre booked tickets, which was a pain point. But once you enter the water park, the sheer size of it mind boggles you. There are plenty of rides which one can take. Especially the shark attack where you move through the aquarium. A must go

Fun day for all ages. Great fun day for families as well as couples. Lots of activities and rides to chose from, but if you want to do anything extra besides the park it self, for example swim with the dolphins it can get a bit expensive. Make also sure to either book the trip to your hotel in advance or get out early because the taxi que can get long.
Good fun worth a go. Good fun definitely worth a trip and good for all ages we went and the weather wasn't great but that didn't stop the fun, only down point is all the food options are fast food.

A great day ! Fun filled adventure with plenty to do. We were staying at the Atlantis Hotel so the waterpqrk acess was included. An excellent hotel nonetheless. The water park has an excellent lazy river which has plents of shade even in 50c heat ! It takes around 40mins so a great choice. The other rides including te sharl tank ring ride has an amzing view and the pyramid ride is really fast and excilliarating. Must reccomend

Average waterpark which was only half open. After staying at Jumeirah Beach and finding Wild Wadi was closed during our stay, my partner and I headed to Aquaventure instead. We used the online booking system and paid prior to arriving. We were informed upon arriving entry that Poseidon's tower was closed for private use for the day. Having already paid for tickets and transport there, as well as not realising how much was part of the tower (we assumed it was one ride and soon found out the major water rides in the park were all on this tower). There is far too much of this in Dubai, people with too much money for their own good who have no regard for other's interests (we even overhead one guy book one of the few open rides out for an hour; what about everyone else in the park?)Compared to waterparks elsewhere in the world the rides are not groundbreaking, they last 5 seconds. The one tower that was open kept shutting off 75% of the rides throughout the day which was frustrating on top of the rest. The rides in Poseidon's tower did however look great including the world's biggest water ride. To summarise:- - If when I went to book online they explained half of the park was off limits so customers fully understand, I would not have booked and waited for another day. Or at least offered a reduction off full price considering the major attractions were off limits.

Eight hours of Adventure. The lifeguards were amazing ,my children enjoyed their adventure...Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and passionate about the city of The Palm in general.He kept us engaged the entire day by providing us with some very interesting facts about the adventure

2 crazy water rides. Unnecessarily expensive.. It's a part of Atlantis, The Palm! Obviously it's bloody expensive. The food inside not worth the price and they charge for lockers too. The entry fee is also a bit steep. If you're going with <15 year olds it might be worth it cause most rides are not very scary and are just like any other water park. The way it's made is spectacular and deserves credit for that! Poseidon's Revenge and Leap of Faith were the only two rides that give you the creep! Those two are crazy and you'll love them if your are a thrill seeker. Others are for leisure and good if you want to spend some good time with your better half or kids. I've rated the water park 3 but the whole trip to the Atlantis, the view, the beauty will add another star to its rating! It's a good place to go to! Plan for this if you have time in your hand.Tip: you can get there early (by 10) and leave by 3-4pm so plan something else for the evening! It is tiring though, so keep that in mind too!

Wet fun. Didnt expect it to be that fun, I liked it very much and I have extremely enjoyed the SEBAG race and another water ski game. I highly recommend that you visit it in a week day to avoid the crowd and queues and I recommend that you put on a swim suite (with a shirt) because you will be wet and you will also walk around till you get wet again

Great Craic. We went to Aquaaventure last week(11.01.2016), it was just my husband and myself but we had a truly great time. We are big kids at heart. There is food court loacted on site, it has a great selection of dining options on offer, it is very clean and reasonably priced. There is also access to the beach from the park, which is nice to relax after the day. There are lockers and very good changing facilities available, there is also an option to get a barcoded band for your arm that you can pre load credit on to and use this to pay for items all over the park rather than carrying cash. I thought this was a great idea and any outstanding balance is refunded at the end of the day. Enjoy :-)

Great time at Aquaventure Waterpark. you definitely have to try the fastest waterslide they have there, it is a great adrenaline kick, don't worry about being scared, it's so fast, you don't have time to get scared.

A world of fun!. They sure pack a lot of fun on this piece of the palm. If you love water, sun and fun packed rides.. say yes, just do it! We've been a few times and have left at the end of the day tired and thrilled with our day!!!
Super fun...must go.... A whole day event.. should go... especially for water and adventure lovers.. worth the value, time and experience

Fantastic waterpark. We visited this park after hearing how unique it was. It was such a great day out and I would recommend it! It is great for thrill seekers and calm riders alike! There is something for everyone and really brings in the uniqueness of the underwater aquarium in the water park. It's a fantastic experience and a must see and do!

Aquaventure a bit messy!. This is the best Waterpark to me but when it is opening time tickets counters are always a mess because space in the hall is very limited. I guess they can improve and create a different entrance for the Dolphin Bay experience. It happened to me an my guests that park was not opening for rain but Dolphin Bay guests could enter as they were going in a separate area. Unfortunately all the other customers do not know this and they got VERY angry as only a part of the group was admitted. Also please in case of rain an information board should be placed, announcement should be given and tickets not sold. Maps are now missing from the reception and they have become a rare goods
Kids loved it. Spent a day here, it was fun. Some long lines at the rides, and rude arab men, but fun nonetheless. Wont bother going again though.
Great fun, but pricey. Loved our day here, all slides are great fun. Just wish all slides were open. 40AED for booking a locker is a joke however.

Over Rated Under Performing. Its a very small water park catering to a very large number of people. A combo ticket price for Acqaventure and Lost City costs decent. And there is not much that you can do once you are inside. The ticket gives you access to only the water park, a deceptive beach and lost city. Lockers are tiny that cant accommodate much. The water bodies are filled up fast and people are oozing out all over. The River ride is pretty ordinary. Options of eating inside are also limited and very steeply priced.
Brilliant experience. it was an brilliant experience.managed to do all attraction. Safety is super. managed to do all attraction.

Day trip to Atlantis. Was visiting Dubai and spent 2 days at Atlantis. We did not stay in the hotel, we purchased day passes for the waterpark. Purchased the passes online, Usually about $100 dollars a day. Easy access to Atlantis from the subway, we took a cab. They ave lockers for rent $$.Lots of places to buy food. Its very over priced and crappy food. burgers fries chicken fingers etc. The waterpark is amazing. The "Lazy river" is a never ending ride. The slides were amazing. Make sure you try the one where the floor drops out from under you. The beach is amazing. Warm water and great views.Loved this waterpark, it is a must if you are in Dubai.

lots of fun. Great day out here. The lazy river seems to last a lifetime which is great! the huge ride that is almost vertical is an absolute must but be warned it is a seriously intense ride. My advice is to hold your breath at the countdown otherwise you end up not being able to breath properly because your mouth is full of water!The only downside to the park is that cost of food and drink which was quite expensive. None the less its a fantastic day out. But if you go here you have to try Wild Wadi also!

Amazing!. I visited Aquaventure a couple of years ago. It was AMAZING. It's clear that someone thought out every detail. I highly recommend this place. It's best to go early, before the crowds. Also, it's best to go on a hot day!

Good mix of dare devil and simple rides. The place is amazing, very large and has lot of rides and activities to perform. The entry ticket grants you access to all the basic water pools and slides. However activities such as Dolphin swim, scuba dive etc are all additionally chargeable. The most thrilling rides were The plunge and free fall.

Such terribly long queues never made it inside. Ok so I can't honestly say I can review the rides however I would have liked to, but with queues to even buy tickets of over an hour, we calculated that with the volume of people and the number of rides that the queues inside would be worse (we heard from others, that persisted with the queue, that we were right), so sadly after getting all excited ans waiting over an hour and the queue only moving a little.over half way we decided to leave the queue.The only thing I will say was that it was eid, so would explain large numbers however the organisation and crowd control was terrible, barely any staff presence, no indication of waiting times and the entrance prices had been raised in honour of the holiday- very disappointing.

Brilliant waterpark - worth the money!. My second time visiting this waterpark and it just gets better and better! We visited on a Thursday and there was no-one there. So quiet which meant there was no queues for the rides - even better! Food and drink aren't too expensive too which is great. Worth every penny for a fun day out!

Skip it . If you want to go to a nice water park in UAE then visit Yas water world or Wild Wadi.
Give aquaventure a miss until you are staying at atlantis and the water park is free for you
Vibrant. It has such awesome slides that you are an adventurous person you would surely enjoy. Just to name a few slides, Leap of faith, shamal ride, tower of Poseidon.
Holiday . Absolutely fantastic day out. Saved the leap of faith for last. Got to go on everything once or twice didn't really have to queue

Queues were long . Queues were long and you can't buy a fast track / gold ticket.
Didn't like going into the lazy river after every ride.
Preferred Yas Waterworld in Abu Dhabi.

Wild Wild. i like this water park .. suitable for all ages , from family to couples to kids to teens .. its got rides that would fit all needs and ages ... totally crowded on weekends so i would avoid completely but thats coz im not a big fan of crowded cant breathe spaces but weekdays its also crowded just not as crowded.im not sure if they have locker systems in place but last time i was there didnt really find one and thats essential if you are not a resident of the hotel Atlantis

Great fun on a hot day. Travelled back from Europe and stayed in Dubai for 3 days at the Atlantic palm Hotel. Enjoyed being able to access the waterpark for free, although it was well in to 40s temperature wise so the water was warm not quite refreshing. Glad they sprayed the footpaths with misting water as it was too hot to be barefoot on the concrete paths.Excellent water rides highly recommend

Nice place to spend the day. . Nice water park with plenty of rides. Bring your costume with you as the ones they sell at the park are quite expensive. A two piece suite for my daughter cost me around 10000 rupees. All the rides are good. Plenty of staff for security. lockers are small so don't bring big bags with you. Bring your waterproof mobile phone cover with you as the photos they click will cost around 2000 rupees each, although they take really good photos. You can go for them if money is not a concern. Overall a nice place to spend the day.

Best Waterpark in Dubai. Great selection of rides suitable for thrill seekers through to families. Plenty of sun loungers. Usual greasy waterpark/theme park food. Can be long-ish queues but never seen it very bad.
a park IN the hotel. Atractions never seen , swimming between sharks and other great fisches . 1 day is not enough to visit them all

Amazing!. This water park is amazing for families . My advice is rent a cabana if you have small children or rent a seated area as it's very busy and then you are guaranteed good sun beds. The rapids are great for kids , even my 18 month old daughter loves it. If you are in dubai them you have to visit.

Real fun for children. my 5.5 year old son really enjoyed the park-so did I- my wife and 8 month old daughter enjoyed the sun and relaxed- we were the guests of hotel atlantis so the entrance was free- the water slides were fun and my son enjoyed the children section- definitely a family friendly environment- will be back,of course
Great fun. Always fun to spend a day or two at the park especially if ones staying at the hotel. A must do if ever.

Buy tickets online! Too much add on cost!. We loved water-park, it is small but still has amazing attractions, pools and slides! You have enough time to try them. We recommend Leap of Faith and Closed tube for thrill-seekers! They also have great view of the park.Good for all ages. Staff is great!!Day ticket is approx. 65 EUR if you book it online; 80 EUR if you buy it in park. Some packages include meal - TAKE IT - food in inside restaurant is crazy expensive (15 EUR for 1 burger).Ticket doesn't include use of small locker (which you most definitely need). Keep in mind that small locker is SMALL, show them your backpack if you have one, you might need bigger locker - there is 10-20 EUR add on cost.Take your own towels with you, renting a towel will cost you 10 EUR.In tickets is included beach access, however, not access to Hotel Beach (from where you get great picture of Atlantis hotel).Too much add on cost!

Excellent water park with security at its best!. Recently we visited this water park during our family trip to Dubai in December 2015. Excellent water park with adventure water rides! Even though there are multiple adventurous rides they are well protected by security guards and life guards every 15-20 feet! Even though there were many people in the waterpark, we did not feel so because of its huge size! Rapids were added attraction! Enjoyed Rapids a lot!!!

Good park!. This one is good aqua park but be aware, foods and drinks are extremely expensive. We ended up spending 150 dollars on 3 burgers and 3 servings of chicken wings. The facilities are very nice and the kids will love it!
Great day out. Love it here, always good fun and best to go on a weekday to avoid the bigger queues. Would also go to wild wadi as both very good
100 EUR per person just to get in.. They say it is the biggest aquapark in the world. May be it is. But it is definitely the most expensive one. 100 EUR just to enter.

Good for fun with kids (7-12 years old). We liked the aquapark. It can be quite fun. It looks very nice too. I think it's ideal for a family with kids around 7-12 years of age. When it comes to adults, the rides are not challenging / fun anymore. They do like nice though. Good infrastructure around.

Aquaventure Dubai. Although this place is beautiful I think it is highly over-rated and over-priced. If you book online you actually save a huge amount of money and it is very easy to book. Staff at ticket counter are not very helpful. I had booked snorkeling online for the family and directions given from the start sent me all over the place before I actually found out I was supposed to be at the Lost Chambers and this came from a non-staff person. Almost missed our time slot due to having walked a fair distant away from the Lost Chambers before we had to return. The snorkeling is awesome and the kids thoroughly enjoyed it (staff here are very friendly, engaging and helpful). Lost Chambers itself is a good combo of sea life which kids will love. I like the carpet and cushion seats in front of all the big tanks so that you can relax and watch the fish.Good fun for kids and adults alike. The rides are thrilling and some not for the feint-hearted. Food and confectionery is very expensive. The towel and locker combo is ideal but alone works out to a lot. The loungers by the pool areas are easy to come by and safe to leave your things and come back. Although being the festive season as well as the shopping festival period the park closed at 5 which was a bit disapppointing. We went in January and although the weather was a bit cold, it wasnt overly busy and ques for rides were not long which was good but I think it was because we went on Sunday.
Best water park. Experience all rides which are amazing, don't miss the lazy stream.Plan properly as time not sufficient with package. Don't miss lost chambers worth seeing.

Great thrilling rides. An excellent selection of thrilling rides, and a great "bucket list" moment for me riding the "leap of faith." A little chaotic - make sure you get there early to avoid the crazy queues, and grab a floating ring as soon as you can and hold onto it. If you can afford the time, try for toe days to give yourself enough time to get to everything and also have time to relax.

A good day out. . Very expensive for what you get really. The lockers are a must to hire. But they are really small. So small family will need to take 2. They are also situated in the ladies and gents toilets so keep that in mind. Signage in the park is not great but you can stumble around and find out what is where!!Onto the advice!- most rides need a tube so find a double or single depending what you would like and hang on to it for as long as you want to ride be in the water. The aquarium is not great at all. Very small. We went through it in about 15 mins. Don't buy coffee inside by the locker rooms as its not great at All. Leaving the place best to Hope onto the tram and get off the palm them grab a taxi. Complete chaos trying to leave when the water park closes at 5:45. Don't think I would go back as I still think there are better ride and tubes in South Africa.

NOT going here is criminal !!!!. We were a group of 9 with parents along and the fact that even for them this was the best place in Dubai means something. The rides are great, enough and more for kids and for oldies to laze around. The people manning the rides are extremely professional and helpful. One tip : as soon as you reach there do the water park first and leave the lost chambers aquarium visit to late afternoon. Didn't stay there but my friends and they say it was awesome.

Take the plunge. This waterpark i have to say i rate as my second favourite in the emirate states.It was also my first waterpark that i ever went too. It was a fantastic and wet experience that i have repeated numerous times. Great with family or friends or both. The rides are fun, the staff are friendly and helpfull, the stairs are plenty.A favourite of mine is Poseidon's Revenge. I am yet to try the ziplines (they are an additional cost).From all the things to do in Dubai, Id make sure that Aquaventure was on my to do list.

Designed for show - not quality. Found this (as well as Atlantis more broadly) to be tired and outdated. It gives the appearance of being cheep - in contrast to many other quality hotels in the UAE. Be wary of untrained, unempowered staff. There is little recognition of children's needs - with the set rule of one person per tube being enforced even where children may need supervision. Use your brains. The water was unclean with litter visible in places in the water - very disappointing given the cost.
Awasome Place for the family. The place is awesome for the family when you are guest at Atlantis. Other wise for some, it may not be worth for some limited rides.

nice water park. i have been for few time this place and was had fun and amazing place. the place in the palm island. Dubai metro can bring you there or you can take taxi. a lot of games / slider. i love this place and i will be back if possible.

The best water park / resort in UAE. I have been to all the water parks in UAE , but my favorite is Aquaventure ... why .. here is the reason..- The slow river is the best in UAE , it takes you , up , down , through rocks and you can have lot of fun with the river on your tube alone , in case you don't want to go toward the slides.- The slides are full of supersize and thrill as well , i love the big drop which makes you feel like free fall , passes through the shark pool and you dare to keep your eyes open.At the other hand , food sold at the water park is the most expensive ,,,

Water delights. Best attraction by a mile if you love water, thrills and excitement. This was one of the highlights of our stay. The family ride was epic. Wish they offered videos of the rides but photos were good.

Too crowded in December. Tried to book online in December when we were in Dubai but the system did not allow it. I called Aquaventure and was told to just select any dates but it still didn't work. Gave up finally and went straight to the park but there were many people queuing. Decided to skip the queue so paid to have a deck chair, the cabanas were sold out. There was a locker inlcuded, 6 water bottles and some fresh fruit served. The kids enjoyed the rides and leap of faith. When leaving at 5 pm, found that the only showering facility is near the entrance and it was a huge hassle to get the buggy to the front. There were many people rushing for the shower facilities as everyone got out the same time. After that a queue of about 100 people for the taxi. So I guess do expect that when visiting in December.

Great Day Out. A fantastic Day Out. This Park is very reasonably priced and you are definitely guaranteed to have a great time whether you are a child or an adult. Minimal queuing for rides and wait for it .............. free sun loungers! The Park was litter free and adequately manned and sign posted.

Very popular. Not a cheap place to visit but worth it. You get a barcode wrist band which you pre load with money to buy drinks, snacks etc and also for locker use. You can have multiple wristbands sharing a pre loaded amount of money. Be warned get there early to get loungers as it gets very busy. Expect to queue for most of the slides. There is a beach as well which faces towards the Dubai coast with a cordoned off swimming area with plenty of loungers available. Food and drink are not exactly cheap but then you are in Dubai! The park closes promptly and the changing rooms get very busy at this point so much so that getting a shower is almost impossible. If you're driving you get bused from the car park and on leaving expect to queue for the bus and queue to get off the palm.

just ok. every attraction in dubai was great but these water park was just ok. we expected more...like more slides & more fun. yes the place is well maintained but there is not enough ADVENTURE in it!

A definite must-do in Dubai! Free entry in your bday week!. Last time we visited Dubai our relatives too us to a waterpark (Dreamland) about 1 hour out of town, as the park was supposed to have more for younger kids (some of our kids were under 120cm at the time), and it was cheaper. Dreamland was OK but pretty much like every other waterpark we've ever visited. Aquaventure is a different experience entirely, and completely worth the cost! Kids (aged 6 and 8) loved the lazy river, as it had so many different avenues of adventure. We liked the Leap of Faith (although like might be the wrong word), as well as the other flumes on that section. The wait time was max of 20 mins, and we seemed to be there on a busy day (NYE).Also, if it is your bday, sign up on the website, and you get free entry in your bday week (just remember to print out the voucher they email you, as they don't accept it if just on your smartphone etc). I would also recommend buying the meal deal. We were told the food wasn't great, but were pleasantly surprised with the options offered at the Baracuda section of the waterpark. It's at the back, so not as crowded as the one near the little kids water section towards the front, has better options, and lots of seating.
Kides and young kides. Its a very good place for young kides they like and enjoy whole day here but u go there befor noon then u can enjoy everything,

Thrilling experience. This waterpark is very similar to The Valley of waves in Sun City South Africa. Lots of fun and thrill rides. Well organised, great service, friendly and efficient staff. The park was busy but we never really waited in lines. Will definitely visit again

Best water park i have ever been to. I considered this to be a pretty cheap day out in Dubai. It worked out at approx £50 per ticket for access to all water rides and the beach plus towels and a sunbed for the day! The slides and rides were brilliant and definitely not for the faint hearted! Food was also reasonably prices and great portion sizes with not only fast food to choose from.we paid extra to do the 'shark safaris' and i would highly recommend this! It was a once in a lifetime experience and all staff were amazing!

weekend in Dubai. brother and I went here for a long weekend 7/1 - 11/1. weather was great, park was pretty much empty and slides and rides absolutely brilliant. Looked at reviews before we went and saw alot of people complaining about waits for the rides.
