We went around 10 am on the weekend (were staying at the adjoining hotel) and ended up walking straight onto every ride and even had to wait for more people to join us on the 8 man ring rides! very tidy and clean, great place for kids and adults alike. We didnt buy food in the park (took a packed lunch) so cant comment on that Im afriad but otherwise a faultless experience!

Fantastic and will recommend it if in Dubai. Spent the whole day with my family from 10am in the morning till 5pm. Started with the Lost chambers and then carried on with the highlight of our day - the amazing rides. The lazy river is fun and really nice to go on together as a family. The children had so much fun it was hard to leave. It was also nice to let off steam and enjoy the day. There is a lot to eat and drink. Best to get a locker for the day.

full of fun and excitment day. you can enjoy the lazy river a lot while taking the sunbath, sliders are the best vibes and music is so refreshing. try to book the VIP pass so you don't stay in the long queues of the weekend, best time to come in is march and april

Great for the kids, lifeguards everywhere!. This is a great activity for families and the Moms and Dads can feel secure with all of the life guards on duty. Lazy river(s) are fun for all ages with options to take or avoid the "rapids."

Enjoyed extended water park. We visited every year, due to extention of water park its less crowded and mostly rides you can go and enjoy especially lazy river was very fun and there was photographer who scan your water park band and you can review your pictures.

Great adventure to spend a day with kids. Must visit place if you stay in dubai with kids above 1.2 meters high. Almost everything would be allowed. If you have kids less than 1.2 then you will be limited to splashing zone with warm water and park river with some rapids and waves. Try not to go there on Fridays and Saturdays as during these days might come too many locals on theirs weekend generating long qius. Also you can go to sea beach to swim.
Wow. We travelled here with our 2 boys and they had the most amazing day ! i don't really like rides but went on them all. As you imagine this place is expensive but worth it. Loved it.

Fun place, with a few mistakes. We visited the Aquaventure waterpark with our family a day before new year. The place was crowdy and we had to queue for about an hour in, although we had bought our tickets already online. The locker system was weird and it took a while to actually get the locker. There was no information about the system or how it works. But, the rides were great like the staff too. It would have been nice to know where each slide is and to know, what kind they are. The Aquaventure beach was a beautiful place to relax, but there was a little bit too much rocks in the sand.The food at Shark Bites was expensive, like always in places like this. The worst was getting out from this place. There were no taxis in front of the exit, and there was a huge queue to taxi, even though no taxis came there. We decided to go with the Monorail. Inside the place where we had to buy the tickets for the ride it was chaos. Only one of the three ticket automats was working and there was no staff behind the information desk. There was hundreds of people trying to get a ticket. Luckily, we got a ticket and got in the train pretty fast. I think that Aquaventure is an amazing place to visit with kids or friends. I would go again if I had the chance. But there is also many things that need improvement!

Splastastic!!. From the moment I stepped into the park, I turned into an excited kid!! Now the thought of screaming kids, smelly flip flops, soppy towels, endless queues and fights for sun loungers may not sound that appealing, however if you have had a water park experience before and the aforementioned brings back negative memories, well perhaps this one can change them. The park is huge with so many areas to decamp and leave your things, ride queues at least before 2pm were negligible and moderate, ie. 15 minutes post this time. The rides are excellent, modern, clean and fun for all family members. But if you are like me you will just want to sit in your inflatable and go round the lazy river. Now lazy river gives the impression that nothing really happens except sitting in your ring and drifting around at a slow and cumbersome pace, well sorry not at this park. This is a 45 minute round the park journey which includes conveyor belts and rapids. It was really awesome. We spent 6 hours there with no problems at all. One tip, we left at 4.30pm, and the taxi queue was pretty long, so I would suggest either organize a car or grab one of the executive black taxis which will cost you about double the standard ones. A small cost to ensure the day was not tainted at the end. Have fun and remember it is OK to become a kid for the day!!

Very Expensive but enjoyable.. This is one place which is visited by tourists to get a feel of Atlantis Hotel. There are better water parks in Dubai not to say that this is not good. But people come to Aquaventure to get inside Atlantis premises. The rides are good and some of the rides look extreme dangerous for weak hearted. All the food stalls are damn expensive. A Veg Burger costs 50 dirhams which is equivalent to US$ 14 or INR 950.You can book private Cabanas or you can rest on General Cabanas spread all across Aquaventure. But a nice place to enjoy a day out

Water Park.. A great day out, you have to do it, the rides rate thrilling and fun, the lazy river a must, the Life guards are very at tentative and helpful. Plenty to see and do for all the family of any age.

Do carry your own swimming trunks/costumes. It's a nice water park with 2-3 amazing rides, but don't forget to carry your own swimming costumes, If you forget to carry your own, you will need to buy it from an only shop available there which sells it at a very high price, approx USD 80 to USD 100 for a costume.
one of the best water parks ever. it was one of the best water parks ever when i visited in the summer soaring temperatures and to was so fun to cool off and have loads of fun amazing must visit.

Wow. The rides were really wow. Must visit the waterpark if you are visiting Dubai with children. You need not take any eatables as you will have to leave the same at the entrance . Everything is available inside

Pleasant experience in waterpark. Part of Atlantis, it is always crowded. But once you are inside, it is great feeling.One needs to go prepared.Firstly you need to rent a locker which unnecessarily very expensive, but very essential, availability and need is not well articulated. Many visitors miss it and struggle later. Also there are strict on the attire. It has to be to their specs. Many were stopped for want of right attire.Pl. check and carry the right ones.Once inside you need to wait for long in queues for each of the ride. But overall an enjoyable experience.Food available is very expensive.

Awesome. Water park is huge with a lot of rides. It has some of the best rides involving LEAP OF FAITH and POSEIDON REVENGE. Water was clear and lifeguard are friendly too. A must visit for the guests staying in ATLANTIS.
amazing. The lazy river .....isn't lazy!!! The rides are great - you need to be brave!! Good little waterpark section for small children

Really bad day. Long wait for getting the tickets which were made in paper (in a waterpark!!). Of course after a few rides they broke and lost them.Small locker and the rooms were really dirty.It's not worth the nearly 80 € that I spent for one ticket.
Wanderland!!!. I was there a lot of times and for sure will go more! This please looks like paradise with a lot of fun)
Woooow. I liked it soooo much.... it's one of the causes to visit Dubai again in the future.... but I think the price is over... and means of transport after we have finished were defective
New water park . Good park plenty to do an lots of shaded area. Great beach and rides. Lazy river is more like a crazy river at times so not for little ones.

Fun be slow service. We went in the afternoon which was great, almost no line up for the rides. Beautiful, clean park but staff is quite slow with serving at the manned desks but once we got into the park it was great. Food is priced as per any theme park. Awesome to go on the slide through the aquarium!

Wow . Very good with awsome rides. Leap of faith was just thrilling. Lots of ride end in crazy river. Sea beach swimming with fishes is also good. Lot of food options and something very costly too. Better go on weekdays as less queue for most rides and u can enjoy more. .Full on Entertainment. ....must go...

Enjoyable visit. Top tip, if you are not staying at the Atlantis, get there early. The queuing system, even if you have pre-booked tickets, takes a long time. We queued for approx 1 hour. Towels and lockers can be rented. Once in, we did have fun. The lazy river is fun, with rapids at various places along the route. There are a number of rides where you sit on a tube which are fast and great fun. You can also relax on the beach.

ZOOM DAY. Aqua venture is the largest water park. The slides are daring but the high quality security puts your apprehensions at ease. The floats are a must do at any age.Be prepared for long queues at every stage. However the going is fast.Do not plan during summers as the scorching heat will be a hindrance to walk on the stones
Nice. Very nice facility. Unfortunately not much for children under 1.2 meters tall to do. We loved the sea lion experience

BEST PLACE FOR FAMILIES!!!. With my family, we went on eid holidays.when you are going there go by taxi and do the bookings in net itself!when we reached there, there was a crowd. so go by 10:00am .do not forget to bring your swimsuits,cause the staffs wont allow to go for rides with normal dress and ones which they are selling is expensive.If you want to take pics or videos, buy a waterproof case from outside because in the stores it costs AED120.there are life guards in the rides after every 5m which makes us feel safe.there are restaurants,we enjoyed alot.when you are going back,go by monorail then tram.so u can see both.we enjoyed alot.

Rip off - not safe!. we enjoyed our day here but for £60 per person it does not represent value for money. The rides are good but we had our towels taken from our sunbeds. When we mentioned this to the management they didn't care and said it was our fault. It was really busy and there is no public transport to the park. We got a taxi there and queued for 2 hours to get a taxi back to our hotel. I don't know what the other water park is like in Dubai but we certainly wouldn't return to this park or recommend it. Save your time and money there are better places to go to.

Fun day out!!. My wife and i visited on January 2nd on a hot sunny day and it was fun galore. We enjoyed the water slides next to the Leap of Faith, the rapids in the canal and the zip line. Overall, a great and fun day out though not cheap. We paid AED 750 for approximately 4 hours of adrenaline-filled enjoyment. Check it out!!

Lots of fun!. Had a great time at the park! Lots to do for all ages! Suggest you book tickets online and get there at 10am! We had almost 2 hours with very few people. If you can go mid week as well! All the staff are very friendly and the rides are awesome!

It's fun but expensive. I came here with my boyfriend and it was 324 aed each and we got the saver ticket with the meal for extra 20. I recommend this because you will be paying more if you don't. I recommend chicken shawarma too if you do. The park is big and there's a river and rapids that can take you to different parts. Bring your own towels as renting is silly expensive.
Nice. Children liked it. Based on the pictures I was expecting a bit more though. Trafic arrangements to get out of there in the evening don't really work. Maybe the monorail would work.

Fantastic place to go. We enjoyed the time spent in the park. Kids were super excited. Well organized, clean and with a friendly staff. The price is a bit high, but emotions and experience there is fantastic. Recommend.
Excellent Fun. It was very fun with great amount of new unique rides and is for everyone. Some rides are scary to take but otherwise overall was an great expierence.

Too expensive. Overrated. We spent 1,000 dirhams for two adults and a 10 yr old. I felt it was too much and if I compare with Singapore's adventure cove, I'd choose adventure cove. The fun you'll get from these 2 waterpark are almost the same, but adventure cove is way way cheaper. We were there before the opening and left at 3pm. We didn't have problem getting a taxi but I heard others who left at a later time had a difficult time getting a taxi. So better go early and leave early if you really want to go.
amazing slides. The water park was what my kids enjoyed the most. The themes and different types of rides and slides makes it so interesting and entertaining

Beautiful Location and Fun Rides. My children were too scared to go on many of the rides, but I got to go on a few. I really enjoyed the lazy river because it was more interesting than most. The lines can be very long, so be prepared to wait. Yas Wayerpark is better, I think.

Water park is average at the best, crowded. We visited water park for a day bought tickets ahead of time in the Dubai airport . We were told we can directly go to a counter to exchange for wrist bands. Upon arrival we found the place is very crowded and they asked us to stand in the regular line despite having tickets. Staff are stressed and less than courteous . Water park is okay . In US we have seen much bigger water parks better priced. Some one in family forget to bring swim wear and we wanted to buy there. That is the most expensive place to buy (swim trunks ~100usd) .so go prepared . Children thought the rides were okay ! In my short visit to Dubai I should have skipped this place to visit some other attractions .

Great Activity both for kids and seniors. brought my senior parents here and our young kinds (age 7 and 8) and all of them had fun. we came on December so the breeze was quite cold. the lines to the rides were really long and the queue for buying entrance ticket took us around 1 whole hour.do book your tickets online ahead of time to avoid this. we were able to go to almost all rides except that they closed early at 5PM and we were not able to try the Leap of Faith which was their most extreme ride. my dad, who is 73, enjoyed the slides too.

Come to visit the park as early as possible in the morning. Specially during the weekend, the park can get super crowded, starting from noon. Try to go in the morning, the park opens at 10. From 10 to 12 you will be able to do all the slides without queuing anywhere. Then you can have lunch and use the afternoon to relax by the pool or at the beach of the park.

A great day out. full of things to do a classic waterpark on par with those in America. Clean and well organised. The only thing I would say is the food can be expensive if your feeding a family. It worked out to be £20.00 for a burger meal with a soft drink.

Waaaaaaaw .. It's a great experience . If you didn't go to the Aquaventure Waterpark till now , do your best to go there . My kids were enjoying every moment with a friendly staff, me and my wife was enjoying alsoThe price is a bit too much but you will forget about it and just you will remember the experience
Great Place to Spend hot Day. It is a great place to spend a hot day there.There is a lot of fun for all the family and the aquarium is great place to visit also

Super fun day!. My boyfriend and I spent a few hours here on one of our days in Dubai. We were pleasantly surprised by the extreme rides! Our favorite was Poseidon's Revenge, but it's definitely not for the faint of heart!

Expensive - but glad we visited on a rainy day. We visited on Jan 3, which happened to be a rare rainy day in Dubai. The park had a delayed opening due to the rain, but there was limited communications about when they would open the doors. Finally the park opened over a hour late.We had pre-booked online - I would NOT recommend doing so, as you can get a discounted tickets on your way through the airport. Also, while tickets are good for 4 months, they DO NOT refund, even in the event of park closure. The response we got was "come back tomorrow" - which was an impossibility for us, as we only had one day in Dubai.The park is well laid out, but poorly signed - making it confusing to get from place to place. There is one tower that requires the use of tubes - but they are not stocked anywhere near the ride entrance. The staff just pointed to the "beach" area of the rapids ride and said "get tubes there", meaning you had to haul them a long way.We met others in the park who had been the day before - telling us of 45 minute waits for rides. Since the weather was bad, we had no lines. If we had to wait, the park would be a complete waste of money - limiting you to about 9 rides in 7 hours of opening time. Food in very expensive and you have carry money in the park. Where as Water Bomb in Bali has bracelets you can put value on and get a refund of unused funds at the end of the day, making it really convenient to purchase food.While we had a good experience, we would not return.

Never to old. The most thrilling experience of the holiday, a must for young and older, at 55 i went on all the rides apart from the big drop where you stand on the top of the tower and the floor gives way and you drop like a stone, the lazy river ride was not lazy, with rapids, water falls, and drops, brilliant, the water rollercoaster amazing, and the drop in the dark to the shark tank was fast and fun, food was reasonable typical fast food bars, cost around £45 GBP for the day that includes locker, and food.
cool place. nice rapids good fun also family friendly and great location with loads of nice restaurants in atlantis

Totally stunning. With the most beautiful backdrop in the world and seeing the world best resort while whizzing down thrill rides or even zip wiring across the park. Aquaventure however is very expensive and our 7yr old was charged as an adult which was a total shock. However overall it is a fantastic experience.

The best. Stayed in the Palms for a week and visited the Waterpark on more than 1 occasion. You need enough time to cover the park as there is just toooo much to do.It is extremely safe and we left the kids to go on their own. There are lifeguards every few meters - I have never seen so much staff.The rides are lots of fun and the big family rides are the best!Enough food and drinks available to ensure you don't go hungry or thirsty. Also a Starbucks for coffee.A must outing with kids!
Long queue's. Queue's were too long and that was on a quiet day. They were out of Engligh language package option leaflets when I visited.
Kissing with dolphins. A real water wonderland .. Zip lines crazy slides bad the highlight kissing a dolphin ... Prices are crazy .. Atlantis in its backdrop a real stunner ...

Great place for family fun!. We visited in late December and loved that the water was heated. Our 8 and 6 year old children had a blast. If you don't have your own, rent the Go Pro camera and relive the experience for years to come.

Exhilarating Waterpark. If you love water slides, then you'll love Atlantis Aquaventure Waterpark. We started off with the scariest, Poseidon's Revenge, absolutely terrifying and exciting at the same time. They have two where you can go down at the same time with someone so you can share this gut wrenching experience! The minute the floor drops from underneath you and you go hurtling through a dark tunnel your stomach drops, a powerful adrenaline rush. Afterwards, we went on the giant tube waterslides which are an absolute must. After all the heart pounding excitement we took it easy on the Atlantis Lazy River which wasn't too lazy with the rapids, our favorite experience in the entire park. The park itself is well designed, very clean and well attended, highly recommend!
Visit to aquaventure waterpark. I m gonna visit dubai in febuary, i will pregnant by that time. 2 months. Is it safe to go aquaventure waterpark?. And go for rides ?

Amazing Park....most mismanaged!!. Very Bad experience of Long Queues, Long Waiting, Computer Systems Crashing, Rude Staff & Immediate correction actions missing....BUT.....BUT once you're inside, it's again a lifetime expereince.Must njoy all rides, they look fiery but extremely safe. Hassles of carrying personal swim tubes (available free however) could have been avoided but for management being more pro-active towards understanding the inconvenience of carrying 1-2kgs of 1mtr wide tubes across 2-4 floorsBut net of net clean water, takes a while to understand the park & facilities....very expensive food & souvenirs

good family fun.. the park is big so does not feel crowded. food is expensive and very average. make sure to be there early so that you have the whole day. more fun for a bit older children as most rides have 1.2m height restriction on them.

Brilliant Day Out. The water park is fantastic for all ages. I highly recommend buying the food package as it works out cheaper. Water park for all ages, we took my 13 month old daughter, the have an amazing children's water park bit. You also get to use the beach which is beautiful.

Off Putting. we spent a day at the water park at Atlantis. The park was okay however I would have to question whether i would go there again after having to wait for over 2 hours for a cab to leave the water park.this is not even the issue that upset us - it was the absolute lack of information / assistance / planning which is the least someone would expect after dropping US$ 500 on a day out. Completely put us off and was very Un - Dubai like service that we have gotten accustomed to....very surprising and I felt they could have done much more to keep the crowd moving...

Great day out and no queues in December !. There are several great rides with connecting slides and rides along the way. A couple of scary rides but a great chilled out park all in all. Very busy during school holidays and long queues but I go back about once or twice a year and I live in Dubai.

Amazing experience but a little pricey. . We paid 300AED each for a day pass (which included a tour of the Lost Chambers aquarium) and whilst it was one of the better water parks I've visited, its clear the price is highly driven by the Atlantis Hotel as one of the more recognisable Land marks in Dubai. Changing facilities very clean and as you expect lots of fun, the rapids were great and even though it rained on our visit the water was warm enough. Not unlike similar attractions you couldn't take your own food and the price to get something to eat was at least double what you pay for similar food in other areas of Dubai. The staff were friendly and helpful, you can also access a public beach and sit and relax on a sun lounger if available. We also paid an extra 50AED for a locker and towel each which was probably the most cost effective part of the trip. Word of warning however, please ensure you have booked a taxi or using public transport (such as the monorail) when leaving the park as the only taxis available outside are in high demand and are Black Lexus cabs who charge you double what you would pay with a normal Taxi. Enjoyed the day, but wouldn't do it again for the cost.
Outstanding. What a treat this was. With teenage children we couldn't go amiss. The rides are amazing. We left full of smiles and slept soundly. Worth booking a cabana.

Days of fun!. We had SO much fun at the water park! So many laughs and memories made. You had the option to lay around the pool or take a rubber ring around the rapids. Ideal for families or anybody seeking a little bit of fun.

Best water park. Great fun place for families. Slides were amazing but little scary as well. Many rides have restriction for children below 120 cm in height. Food was expensive inside. I was impressed with the safety arrangements. There were life guards at every 100 m distance and all rides were well managed.

Go early and leave early. Went to Aquaventure a few minutes before the park open and it was good decision. Went to the Poseidon's tower and has lots of seats available. There is also a locker area near the barracudas cafe which is close to the Poseidon's tower. Did most of the slides 2x as no lineup during the first hours. Should have bought my ticket online as it is cheaper if book online or better yet book a night with the hotel and the waterpark access is free. Looking back I am thinking that we should have just book a night there so no need to hurry out because if you leave the park together with other guest it might be hard to get taxi going back to mainland Dubai. I also explored the beach area which is quite good but the water is cold. The river rides are good and has many options for one to choose so definitely a good thing for those who aren't thrill seekers. If I could get a good price for a night stay then I would say this is an excellent experience.

You must go!!!. We're waterpark obsessed, always trying to stay in hotels with them or visiting when on holiday. We spent the day here, and I'm not sure we'll ever find a better waterpark!! The rides are fantastic. The 'water-coasters' amazing - if you work it out carefully you can go on several rides without having to walk anywhere! The whole day was fantastic, it is absolutely worth the money. Only slight issue is the floor is so hot, everyone is running around hopping from shadow to shadow, but that's part of it, and they do sell some little sock things you can wear.If you're in Dubai, you must go!!
Will go there again. we loved this waterpark!since last year they have added a couple of more rides which we enjoyed.keep in mind the best time for visit is 11am - 3pm, later it gets very crowdy

Amazing . Visited here on 30th December with a young childTook over an hour to collect our pre paid tickets in the heat of the dayOnce inside there were loads of sun lounges and food was reasonably priced and cane out quickGreat for kids of all ages

Great day out with friends! . Overall this was a good experience. We went on one of the few days it rains here which made for virtually no lines at any rides. Staff were friendly and accommodating. Rides are very thrilling and cater for all levels of thrill seekers. The food is the only thing that let's this place,but honestly no one is going for the greasy chicken!
Another great Dubai Waterpark. An excellent water park located in the iconic hotel of Dubai. Great layout and attractions for all the family.

Very average . I had very high hopes for this waterpark after hearing friends from home really rave about it. I wasn't disappointed but I definitely expected more. We went on a day where it wasn't completely packed, the most queued was around 30mins. However there are certain rides that require rings and there is no specific place where you can get these from you have to just find them around the park. Also there are no clear signs to where certain rides are. Furthermore there is not a lot of people around the water park that can assist you when you need help so you have to find your way around yourself. Lastly something I realised is that is not very disability friendly. Overall I think it's an average water park, I prefer alton towers and Thorpe Park!
Great time for a hot day. Bit expensive . It s a really nice place to go to and its plenty of "roller coasters". It's a bit expensive though (300dhs or so). Really nice place to go with kids.
Kids loved it. We took our children for a day at the waterpark and it was a fantastic day we all loved it was good value for money

Top 5 places to visit in dubai. Fantastic place to be...especially with small children. Prepare to spend the whole day there, get there early especially if you decide to go on a Saturday. Good food, great atmosphere, courteous staff. Fantastic fun in Dubai!
great Day. lots of fun for all of us, kids and adults. Lazy river was awesome with rapids and the slides great fun.

Great for helping with jet lag!. We came here on our first full day in Dubai. We choose this excursion because we wanted something stimulating and something outdoors to help us to quickly convert to the time change in Dubai - and this really helped. It is smaller than Aquaventure Water Park, but for us this was good since we were tired and didn't want to walk a lot. Like other places in Dubai, they have you put a "credit" on your credit card when you buy your admission so that you can use it for various size lockers, towels, souvenirs and food. They give you a wrist band and scan it for all of these charges so that you don't have to carry your wallet. If any credit is not used, they will refund it via AED (good for taxi fare) when you check out to leave (don't forget to do this! - it is an extra step). There was no direct metro station for Wild Wadi, so we needed to take a cab here and back to our hotel.

Worth a visit but not the best water park we've been to.... We've been to quite a few waterparks during our travels and we had high hopes for Aquaventure. Unfortunately, we've definitely been to better water parks and it doesn't beat our favourite, which is Siam Park in Tenerife.On the day that we visited, it wasn't too busy which meant that we didn't have to queue to enter the park and we hardly had to queue for the rides. We paid for one locker as we had brought one bag between us but there are no mixed locker areas which meant one of us had to wait outside the changing rooms for the other etc. Not really a big deal, and a lot of couples seemed to be in the same boat. The lockers are also at the entrance of the park and as it is quite large, I'd advise taking everything that you are going to need with you.We eased ourselves in to the park on the rapids and what became apparent quite quickly was how cold the water was! It was freezing on what wasn't an overly hot day (early-mid 20s). We ended up taking a dip in the sea which was much warmer, although the beach area in general wasn't that great.The park was split into two main areas, Tower of Neptune and Tower of Poseidon. It isn't very well signposted and we only came across the Tower of Poseidon in the afternoon, which has the most thrilling rides. The rides at the park on the whole are good (although the water was freezing!) and Poseidon's Revenge was simultaneously the best and worst water park ride I've ever been on!! It was terrifying! Check out the Youtube videos (or maybe don't!) before you ride!We enjoyed our trip, but next time we visit Dubai, we’ll definitely give Wild Wadi a go instead.Just one final thing to note, if you take a GoPro, you can take it on all rides but only if you have it on a wrist strap. Selfie sticks and poles etc are not allowed.

It was raining but very good water park. This by far is the most fun filled activity in Dubai but only if the weather is good. We went in December and it was raining and cold so it was a waste of money and time. So my conclusion is dont go in December if you really want some fun.
Fantastic day out. We loved this place lots of rides slides for everyone some ques but nothing much loved the ride that goes through the aquarium

Amazing Water Park!!. I went with my family and had a great time and experience. Lots of rides and activities and fantastic facilities. yes it can get a bit expensive however this is a decision you need to make if you willing to pay for quality time and facilities. I will go again and recommend this to any family. You can have a fantastic time with family full of joy jut getting lost in the maze of activities. The staff are friendly and very helpful!! Highly recommended place.
Too expensive . It's too expensive and too crowded and too be in q for long time and then later it's too much to then again to be in q for the ride could vist again

Excellent day out.... . We got a taxi to the Atlantis water park form the Hilton JB for £20. We pre ordered our tickets but the lines were all mixed together (pre and pay on the day) so basically there was no point in pre ordering... which was disappointing. The queue went down in about 45 mins. We got a locker and headed to the rides. The rides were really good for all ages. If young kids take your towels and head for the beach area and bag a sun lounger- all day. A bit annoying when we wanted to eat as had to sit on the concrete as all lounges taken and no one on them!!! The food within the park is pretty good. Hot dog, tuna roll, chicken salad with three waters was about £30. We left around 4pm with everyone else or so it seemed!!!! Waiting for a taxi in the line out side took one hour!!!! Be prepared for queuing all day!!! Still a nice sunny day so was ok.Worth going though.

Thrilling experience. Leap of faith and capsule are must experience ride on Aquaventure. Rides are thrilling and must experience. All rides are restricted to 1.2m height so if you have kids shorter than that please be careful as they have only two rides to do. They are very strict about closing time and park closes at sunset, doesn't matter what time it is. Staff won't let you be there after sunset, no matter if you like to get some munching for kids.

Expensive for the experience. It's a cool place and on our "list" but one hour in line to buy a ticket and another hour lining up to " get wet " I'm thinking A$ 500 per ride in an afternoon is expensive ... Even in Dubai.. I'm glad we went because it's so " Disney " but I wouldn't go again

Great water park . A great place to visit.lots of rides for the family and for thrill seekers. I feel it was worth the money however they need to be more clear about price add ons. They advertise 40aed for a collectable soft drink bottle with unlimited refills.and it's not until you get in til you find out that it's an extra 8aed to refill. Signposts are good around park however needs to have more explanations about what each slide does.you have no idea what the slide does until you ride it.the staff were very helpful with explaining the slides nonetheless.i old go back again and would recommend to go.

It's "OK". I've been to many Waterparks and I gotta say I had bigger expectations for Dubai's Aquaventure Waterpark …Let's say it was very big and not organized well. I think it got too much inspiration from Wild Wadi waterpark that was absolutely terrible experience … The beach side of Aquaventure Waterpark was just very poor (maybe not just completed yet?), and the lines just to go anywhere were too big … It took 30min just to wait in line for a simple waterslide, not to mention more interesting ones …

Good aquaventure waterpark. We went in the waterpark between Christmans and New Year and was very crowded - we waited more than one hour to get in. Inside was also very crowded with long queues for every ride. I really don't recommend this period for visit.Some of the rides were very palpitating. I expected even stronger ones, the waterpark describing himself as being the best in Europe and Middle East.
Fundays. If you wish to spend some money and will have fun..then is this the right thing. Nice rides with the rings around the park and great fun for all which are above 1.20meters...

Great fun. we visited this park with our young family whilst staying at the Atlantis. It has a lovely setting, it is very big and has something for everyone. It is very popular and gets extremely busy so be prepared to wait in queues all day. some rides are spectacular. the one glass tunnel slide was rather claustrophobic and hot like an oven and after one time experience I would not do it again. one day is not enough but unless you have free tickets it can be expansive to visit often. There are sufficient eating places. of the 6 visits we did not succeed in securing a sunbed. As it is on the beach front, to escape the crowd you can just enjoy the beach / sea. If you do not mind crowd and queues it is definitely worth a visit.

One of the best waterparks. The rides are amazing. The queues are really long so it's best to go in the mornings. Do not miss the ride where you can go through the aqurium tunnel, it's an amazing view;watch out you can fall in there. I wouldn't say most staff talk a lot. All the rides are good to go on, I enjoyed most of the rides especially 'rapid'.

Such a nice day, very relaxing! . Aquaventure Water is a very nice place to spend your day, alone, with friends or the whole family. We went in January 2016 and it is really worth the 230 AED general admission per person. The park is build for all ages, even some really spectacular glides with few seconds free fall. Can recommend this place for your stay in Dubai. Tip is to leave early, because it is a nightmare to grab a taxi when the park is closing. Metro is also available next to the park, that's maybe a better option for your transport back to the hotel.
Lots of water fun!!. Arrive early to avoid the long queues on the popular slides. Food and drink is terribly expensive so take you own.
Good Day Out. Mixture of activities for the family. Access to beach for free, many restaurants and lots to do! recommend.

Perfect day out! . Great day out for all the family, Minimal amount of queuing during our visit, especially in holiday season, never waiting long to go on any of the rides! Would defiantly recommend for people of all ages & families with children, something for everyone! Only issue was getting a taxi at the end of our visit, very busy as everyone was leaving at the same time and there didn't seem to be any organisation to the taxi service, would recommend booking your own private taxi in future as we had to wait for over an hour!

Fun Fun Fun!!!!!. We had a fantastic time here. We went on Christmas day so the lines were minimal and we were able to go on every ride. Had a fabulous time. It is rather expensive and we paid for entrance and a meal but the meal deal was so limited we would have been better off just paying for entries and paying full price for our meal. I would highly recommend bringing your own towel as they charge 30dhs also I would not recommend using the lockers near the entrance as they are a bit of a walk to the rides compared to the other lockers. Worth using ones near a restaurant. Remember to get a wrist band on all the rides to get your photos on the rides at the end. We missed a few so couldn't find some of our photos. Best way to get around the park is on the river or on the golf carts (they say they are to shuttle people staying at the park but anyone can use them). Really really worth a visit. Also check out the night club.

Great for kids and adults too!!!. we stayed in the Atlantis the palm so, did not had to pay for our unlimited visit. we were 4 adults and 5 children and enjoyed almost every ride very nice. My nephew was just a year old and he enjoyed the kids area. lots to do here and had very nice western food with lots of ice-creams. Lovely experience.

Great waterpark !. Loved the whole experience Water games for everyone and a huuuuge lazy river They have a very big aquarium and there is a slide called shark attack where you slide inside the aquarium in a glass tunnel amazing experience you can see sharks and gigantic sting rays !!

Well worth the money!. We started our stay by swimming with the Dolphins and stayed until the parked closed. A bit difficult to get sun beds - people leave their belongings and are away for hours. Possible to rent locker, easy to get food, clean toilets and fun rides. Getting home after the park closes is a nightmare!! After queuing for a taxi for ages - we ended up taking the monorail to the main land and a private taxi from there. I advice that you arrange for transportation in advance.

Great day out for all ages. Gramps, granny, mum and 2 (nearly) teenagers spent a great day there. Gramps and teenagers were able to build up the excitement from gentle floating along "rivers" to different rides which increased from easy bumps (Mind you granny got worried even on this one) to screamingly wet high drops.Break for lunch found reasonable fast food eateries. Note there are are a few different eateries and it's worth checking out where the best ones are located e.g. Near the Poseidon rides.Afternoon meant some wanted a more peaceful relaxation on the beach there.However it's reasonably close to Poseidon where there's more excitement including the highest ride where gramps survived a heart stopping drop as a trap door was opened under his feet.Don't miss it but go early to find a less busy area to sit in.Beach is quiet most of the time, but a bit away from the rides.

Fantastic. This waterpark , I would rate as one of the best I have seen (but then please bear in mind that I have not seen too many water parks). Jokes apart, everything was nice about aquaventure...the people working there were very helpful and cooperative and on a sunny day the rides and the water just made it perfect for me and my family.
Lotsa fun. Removed from the busy shopping and eating spots, this is something fun to do on a hot and dry day. Lots of water and buckets of fun!

Fun Day. We had a fun day at the Aquaventure Waterpark. I didn't know that Dubai, sitting on a desert, can have so much water. There are many rides and they were great and thrilling. It can make you forget your age. And they are safe for all ages. We had so much fun there and we will go back.

I love that park. I love being in the water and having some fun with slides and so on. This park is huge and you can have a lot of fun either alone or with your family. The only inconvenience is that most of people are wearing clothes into the water which is not hygienic .

We had a Splashing time! Do it!!. Probably the greatest waterpark you could ever visit. Although busy there is something for all the family. It is not signposted so well so you have to find your own way round but we had a great time and highly recommend the water rapids!
Brilliant day. We absolutely loved our day here. There are lots of rides and we never found ourselves queuing long. The park was very clean and easy to get around.

Horrible . They have no idea what customer service is. They have no idea how to manage crowds.
And they are overpriced ! They have just 2 rides, the rest of them are all derived and is all useless.
One thing I regret would be this.

Crazy is the only word for it.... Must do the Rapids, shark tunnel, and the stinger..
If u love the rush in ur body the make sure u don't miss the Leap of Faith and the Poseidon.. They are superb!!!

Great for adults and children!. Great for adults and children! Tou don't have to book online as there was no lines (in December 2015) but we had to line up with online bought tickets! Remember to topup your credit to your wrist band at check-in! This was not told at the counter should be stressed. You need to pay the credit beforehand to the wristband! Had a great day of sun, swim and sand!
Great for all ages.. . Well organised great water park! Lockers are available and accessible by wrist band which you buy with tickets, rides for all ages and access to the beach also! Great day out
Tremendous fun. Everything you want from a waterpark: friendly staff, good rides and an expansive lazy river. You can easily spend the whole day here.

Awesome park. We went to Aquaventure waterpark in November 2015. The rides are really worth it. I personally believe that it is worth the money spent. The best rides of my life were - the Poseidon's revenge (which looks more like a coffin ride :P), the leap of faith and the zoomerango. A MUST VISIT place when in Dubai.

Fun and adventure at aquaventure. - If you plan to visit aquaventure within a week after your birthday, book it online and you will be allowed free entry. You have to show them your passport as proof when you redeem your free pass. Important to carry a print of the free entry booking.- Carry your own towels. They rent towels for an expensive rate.- Locker rent is also a bit steep. 40 DHS for small / 75 DHS for large. Small locker usually does the job.- Eat well before your enter. If you are hungry, you may not be carrying money and wont be able to buy anything.- Make sure you do the POSEIDON ride. It is scary but worth the experience.- Special attraction is also a shark tank through which your tube rides go through. It is a fascinating experience.- There is also a dolphin bay but we did not experience it.

Fun day at the Water park. There are many water rides ( some scary ones,too!) and a zip line ride. Those with young children would enjoy the pools and the family oriented rides. Definitely worth a visit

Nice day out. Apart from the dreadful over crowded and poorly run entrance/payment kiosks this was a great day out. We booked a Cabana and it was well worth the extra money for our family. The rides were not very crowded despite appearances at the entrance, so the Queuing time was quite short. The rides were exciting. The food was OK and at the Cabana you got your own very helpful server who brought your ordered food and drink. It was a lovely spot near the sea and the beach was pleasant. All in all a good day out. Just sort out the queues at the front please, especially as the Cabana gets VIP entrance and we had to fight to get this.

Useless, a nightmare to go around new year, don't go. We planned to go there with our friends on the 30th of December and the whole experience until the entry was so horrible that we decided not to go inside.The parking is a total nightmare as the little parking there is on site is not even signposted or available. The taxis there are blocking the spaces for the cars, what kind of useless Organisation is this!Then after you park the car, you have the take a shuttle bus to the park! What a waste of time. Then one has to walk through the completely busy hotel and then you encounter a queue of millions of people and another million of people possibly inside. Forget it, don't go at this time of the year! Or don't go at all as the whole place is not organized.The only good thing was the driver from Avis, Rahim, he was polite and helpful. He told us today they would have more than 10000 visitors compared to normally 3000-4000 people! If you can avoid, avoid.

Surprisingly enjoyable!. I wasn't looking forward to going here as I thought it would be too crazy/manic but I was wrong.Yes it was busy but there was ample places to find a sun lounger if required or the beach connected to the park was virtually empty so could find some quiet time there.I loved the rubber dingy's that you could sit on and go on a long loop around without getting off. It meant you could chill out on the water and go places without ant real effort, taking you back to where you started was pretty cool.There was plenty of food places in the park although I was slightly disappointed there wasn't many healthier options. It was all very poor food choices.You can park you car in the car park next to the Atlantis and get the bus to the entrance. I would say that if arriving at peak time (pretty much anytime after opening) the queues to get your ticket (regardless of whether you had paid online before) takes quite a while and is a little frustrating. Would recommend for anybody of any age to visit here if you get the chance for a day of fun in the sun!
fantastic ,. I had a same experience in Antalya turkey but this one is beigger,more optios.in addition you can find very polit and expert staffs that help you and support you very patient.

A Dubai must do. Not only do you get the experience Palm Jumeirah but the waterpark is incredible and comparable to some of the best in the world. I have children ranging in age between 3 and 20 yrs and they all loved the park. This is the second time I have visited and the experience is always a winner.

Lovely day out for all ages. I went with children aged from 7 to 13, and my dad, and it was a lovely day out, with activities for all. It's quite spread out with two main areas for rides, plus the lazy river and beach access. It was expensive and wouldn't go again without some kind of discount, but we did have a fun full day.

Ques! Ques! Ques! . Visited Aquaventure today while on a 2 day stopover to Dubai.As its the christmas holidays it was absolutely bunged and we had to wait a good 30 mins to pay the entrance fee (approx £65 including meal). The park itself is great.... lots of rides for thrillseekers and space for relaxing at the private beach.Avoid at peak times if you can as we waited about an hour for the slides. If you need to get a taxi back from Atlantis, prepare for a mighty wait in the que also. Next time we will try Wild Wadi... Aquaventure not really worth the money.

Very crowded, overpriced, terrible transportation. We came to visit park few days before New Year and it was very crowded and it spoiled whole visit.We had to wait more than 30 minutes for tickets than we were looking for a long time for a free sunbed. The queue for all attractions was so long, we tried just once and then we gave up and spent the rest of the day on the beach and in lazy river, which was quit good, but there was mostly no sunlight so after few minutes we got pretty cold.The best thing in the park is a slide which ends under water in a big aquarium so you can admire sharks and sting rays flowing around you.On the way back there was a line for a taxi for about an hour, so we decided to take monorail, but it took us to the place where was no taxi at all, so we had to walk back to our hotel. I would expect better service in a place like this.

Be sure to book your cars / pick ups. Our second visitSpent whole day in the park- Dolphins in the morning, loads of rides in the afternoonVery busy (as it was this time last year) but very organised so little in the way of queuingA few tips:Pay for a locker when you check in - they're handy If you're struggling for a bed in the park proper use the adjacent beach, get more sun and less busyThe kids favourite rides were the Rapids / tyres and some of the large tyre rides like Zoomerang)Based upon the lesson learnt in first visit last year book a car via your hotel to pick you up or be prepared to wait!! We treated the kids a booked the hotels Bentley which made it extra special and an extended part of the dayI'm also not sure id go there with kids under 6 as i think it would be a bit limiting rides wise

It is a very enjoyable theme park. We were here on our visit to Atlantis Aquaventure. It is a water adventure park and quite a good one at that. The rides are greatly enjoyable. Some are scary...I tried and left as I got cold feet. The rapids ride in a donut is quite enjoyable. The thing to notice is the sheer number of support staff, at almost every 200 metres. You cannot get lost, or be in trouble, as help is at arm's length, everywhere. We tried the rides of Tower of Poseidon, quite nice. The place was not too crowded, hence no long queues. That was great. The dolphin show was good as welbl. One needs full day to do all the rides..not just a few hours. Do carry swimwear and towels, as it would help. Although it is available on hire, at a rental. Worth a visit, if you are in Dubai!

Best waterpark ever!. Great slides, for thrill seekers and regular visitors alike. Very clean and well kept, a must visit for any waterpark enthusiast. Tip: Take the lockers at the Barracuda restaurant, they are far more convenient during your stay.

Excellent but extremely bad connections . To downgrade a place from 5 to 4 solely based on taxi line says something... 1h+ to get a taxi is not even remotely ok.
Place is however great, just about the only thing to improve would be free wifi and better food. Rest is perfect!!!

Brilliant day out in the sun. Not cheap, but a nice collection of slides. Had a lot of fun with the Poseidon's revenge (free fall slide) & Zoomerango (tube based). We went there shortly before xmas on a week day, and had absolutely not queues - the low throughput freefall slides were always available without waiting, 5-10 people were queuing for the tube based rides for most of the day, until it got slightly more busy late in the afternoon.

A great day with the Family!. Arrive early to avoid the queues or buy your tickets online, also this will allow you to ride some of the attractions without waiting for too long. Make a plan in advance as there are some many experiences to enjoy. Do not take food or drinks with you, they will not allow you to take them in. There are many food options to choose from. It is a full pack day of action...you can also relax on the beach.

Great for family fun. Spent there an afternoon and we had a lot of fun. It has all sorts of slides-kids friendly and more exciting for adults. Great eating places and stuf really helpful! Def a place to visit during your stay in Dubai!
Great Adventure at Aquaventure!!!!. Fun place to go with family & friends. Helpful, caring & joyful staff to assist visitors at all times.
Fantastic place for the whole family. Pricey, but offers a lot of entertainment for the whole family. A lot of attractions for all ages. Fun, water, emotions. Go for it!!!

Wild!!!. Great place to have fun with your family and/friends. Better to plan to spend the whole day and pass through the most of attractions. Safe for children, fun for adults. A number of restaurants inside with variety of dishes (The majority fast food). Highly recommended!

Fun for all the Family. This waterpark is awesome and if you stay at the Atlantis Hotel like I did , access to the waterpark is free. You can come and go as you please all day everyday.There is enough for everyone of all ages. The leap of Faith and Slitherine are not for the faint hearted and certainly will get your heart rate chasing.. The family and i went on all the water rides everyday.

Great Day Out!. We had a lot of fun visiting the waterpark on Christmas Day this year. The park didn't seem too crowded and the longest we waited in any one line was probably around 20 minutes or so. Their are a lot of activities to do for both kids and adults and the food at the park was reasonable for an amusement park. The family and I really liked Aquaventure and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking to go to a waterpark in Dubai.

Aquaaaaaaaaaaaaaventure..! wat a place ..!! a must go. One must for this place ..! wat amazing rides.. especially the posiedons revenge, the leap of faith and the slitherine,.. the family rides were very good too.. truly an out of the world experience ...!! must go..!!
Ohh. I must say this is really scary experience. My daughter nearly broke her rib on The Leap Of Faith but overall all the rides are amazing. Don't be scared, just be careful!

Great park but a little expensive . Went their on our honeymoon and had a lot of fun. It is definitely UAE's best water park, rides are great and it's good for a day out. You can easily spend 5 to 6 hours there. food is expensive and is not that great. I wish they had fast food chains. I also felt it's unfair and quite expensive when you have to pay for literally everything (e.g. Swimming with dolphins, lockers, etc)The beach is very nice and clean and the hotel is amazing.

Fantastic day out!. This was our second trip to Dubai and previously we had been to Wild Wadi. We did both parks this time and had a great day at Aquaventure. The park is well laid out, very clean and has lots of different rides to keep you busy all day. Well worth the money!

Extremely enjoyable. I never imagine i would enjoy the visit as I did. I am not an aqua park person. And I actually though it was a kids plan, but this was one of the best parts of Dubai. It was so much fun that you can spend the whole day in without noticing it. It has all type of adventures, from very frightening ones to very relaxing ones. This is a must in Dubai.

Incredible. Incredible waterpark - the best I have been to. The rapids are amazing and take a good 30-50 minutes to go all the way around. There are two main towers with plenty of different water slides, fun for everyone.Order your tickets online beforehand to jump the queues and get a better price. If you are close by, you can go to the waterpark and buy tickets for the next day at an even cheaper discount.Tram goes up and down the length of the palm but is not connected to the main metro. I found taxi the easiest way to arrive. There are also "Boris Bikes" around the palm, but a day at the park is very tiring!

poor management with awesome rides. For the amount paid ($100) i expected much more. Yes the rides were thrilling. But everything else was disappointing. We had booked tickets online. But still had to q for a long time to collect the wristbands. 40aed for a small locker. Expect 0 customer service. From the counter staff to the lifeguards. No one was friendly or answers ur qns properly. There r no proper signages abt the rides. Even when u r q-ing no pictures no info abt rides. The strict attire guidelines on the website is basically not followed. We saw guests with t shirts etc gg on the rides.Bucket list at the aquaventure which r not to be missed:zoomerangRevenge of poseidenLeap of faithAquacondaBesides the awesome thrilling rides, there is nothing else to rave abt this park. One visit time is enuff.

FUN. Sunblock and a Owen from guest kiosk and you can have fun from 09:00am till 18:30. This makes adults feel like they are kids again. The best ride shark attack it takes you through the the aquarium .
Second time -last time. It is my second time and I have to say I regret paying so much money for not that much of variaty I guess one time is enough
Fun for all the family!. I went here with my family for a day and we had lots of fun. All the rides were thrilling and I would definitely recommend going there.

Excellent familly outing. We are an older family with grown up children 21 and 22 and still had a lot of fun on the rides. The park is large so that even a lot of people do not bother each other. The staff and lifeguards are all over the place and keep you safe. The tickets are a little pricey sold at 320 EUD at the entrance but you can get a discount if you go through an agency. It is the high season after all and December is certainly the best time to visit Dubai. There are additional activities not included in the price of the ticket and it is best to pay everything at the entrance with a discount i.e. zip lining, bonding with the dolfins, swiming with the sharks or visiting the lost chambers (aquarium). Bring you swim suits and towels to save a few EUD.

Good day out . My husband and I came here together . First of all I must admit I am not a fan of water parks and therefore I am thankful that there is something here for everyone . I did the lazy river which was nice, you sit in the float thing and it takes you around the water park . There are also a number of pool lounge areas to relax by with sun deck chairs available.My husband did all the rides and there wasn't too much of a queue . He seemed to enjoy it but the main qualm he had was that it was very confusing to get around which is true . The signage for the rides are very poor. The map is also very poor, it doesn't explain what each ride is and so you won't know whether it is for thrill seekers or not . And also majority of the time you need to have your float with you which it doesn't state in the leaflet . Again it could be better explained in this. The water was also very cold especially for this time of the year and I guess part of me thought it would be heated or at least the pool areas but they are not . There are many lifeguards and members of staff present which is great to see. You cannot take food in, so my husband and I had food outside and then came back in as we couldn't seem to find something to suit us and didn't want to walk for long trying to find the different restaurants as they are scattered around the water park . Food is pricey but to be expected for Atlantis.In terms of drinks you cannot bring this in, although I do think they should allow you to bring water and bottled soft drinks as it is expensive .The locker rooms are well maintained but again pricey , bring your own towels otherwise you will have to pay . The beach area is lovely and relaxing, the water again was cold for this time of year , although as my husband and I got closer we could smell the sea water and it smelt a lot like sewage water so decided against paddling in . Overall a good day out and not sure we'll come back, maybe next time we'll try a different water park just to see what others are like but well worth visiting . Atlantis itself is stunning and you do need to take a cab if you are not staying there, the line for the can to get back was huge.

Great fun every day!. Great for the kids and there's a life guard every few metres so you feel safe with the youngsters. All very clean and sun beds readily available with good facilities and easy access to food and refreshments.

Thrilling and fun. Aqua venture is my happy place. My 3 year old daughter really loved the kids play area and had a complete blast. I loved the slides with the tube like the plunge and the surge. The leap of faith was breathtaking, literally. The wave was fun and the posiedon tower was thrilling. Over all a great experience for a family.
best ever experienced. it was great fun spending time with family, will recommend this place to everyone.My kids enjoyed alot planning to come back with all my friends and family.
Huge one. I am sure that you will find a kind of activity suitable for all age groups and spend the whole day with rest or fun. It is a very safe place for the ones WHO do not like risk taking.

Great water park. Expensive, but mostly worth it. The water park is situated in Atlantis The Palm and is quite unique in a way. The rides are great and it offers plenty for everyone for a great day out for family.

WONDERFUL . it was a windy day, yet we had a great time..amaaaaazZzzing .. Everyone were friendly.. The Zip-lining is a great idea and the new rides are more than fun ... Love this place .. a heaven on Earth ❤️

Beware and don't be fooled to throw away your money!. We visited today, a Tuesday, as we read that is the least crowded day and that seems to be correct as we never had to stand in line for any ride. Also we arrived a few minutes before 10 AM which of course helped...Everything works very well but the ticketing is painfully slow so make sure you buy your tickets in advance or get a voucher from your hotel!If I were to rate the rides, cleanliness, and overall experience this review would be a five star one. The rides are great and we had a blast!We had added money to our wrist bands for food and drinks inside which is very convenient. At leaving you will be able to cash back the remaining amount, however this is where the one star comes...Upon leaving we had to us her all the kids out and trying to get all our belongings with us at which time a "friendly" staff come and ask if we want to remove and trash our wristbands. Stressed with packing up we said sure, please, and he helped getting them off and threw them in a trash can with about 1000 other bands.This is where it hit us, we had money remaining on the bands!There was no use trying to find them in the trash... They where gone... About 400 AED in the trash...Exiting the reception area we heard another couple who had done the same mistake, the staff had taken their wrist band with money remains as well.This feels a bit fraudulent to get the bands while we are busy with other things. It would be much better service with a big sign with "Don't forget your money"!Well, we had a really good time, but with a bad ending...

Rides and Tides. This is one hell of a park where I enjoyed every moment.Keep your things in a locker (small locker AED 40) or keep them on a sun beds (At your own risk) because you will cry if you want to come back to lockers to take something,The way to the rides is a bit confusing but thanks to the friendly staff who helped me till I was familiar at the end.Be ready to carry your tube to the top level for most of the rides and do not forget to take a free buggy at the station near the beach to go to the other rides and to the Dolphins area (chargeable if you want to touch and play with the Dolphins).You cannot bring your food and beverages, so be ready to spend out some cash for not so worthy food inside (Small water AED 13, Soft drinks AED 18).Once you are done with all the fun in the park then head to the beach and lay down to relieve your soul.

Great day out. Stayed at the J.A ocean view. Hotel 15 min by taxi to the aquaventure water park. Got there for 9.30 had booked and payed before we left with our agent. straight in headed for the dolphin centre where we had a 20min talk about the Dolphins, then 30min with the Dolphins in the water. Rest of the day was in the water park on the rides. Over all great day out for the family
fun times. whatever you do, DO NOT STAY AT ATLANTIS just to go to this park. Just stay at a nearby 5 star resort and buy access to the park. It isn't worth the headache. The hotel sucks.
the aquaventure. it was a nice waterpark with few drawbacks....we have to carry the big tubes by own to the water slides which was really very tiring

Such Fun!. My wife is not generally a fan of water activities. ("My hair takes ages to dry afterwards.") However from the moment we went down the first slide, we both turned into excited kids. We skipped along from one slide the next.Neptune tower was epic, only surpassed by the thrill of poseidon tower! This is a must for couples and families in Dubai. SUCH FUN!
Amazing Waterpark. Really enjoyed the waterpark, very friendly staff and on site at Atlantis Resort. My daughter enjoyed it also and that's what counts :-)

Great Aqua adventure.. Very thrilling and exciting Aqua adventure to experience in Dubai. Spend the whole day here with good eatery places to enjoy some snacky foods. You have to be in a swimsuit the whole day here. Worth a dip in the lazy rides if you are not in for the thrilling ones and different rides for different ages according to height too. Enjoy the beautiful atmosphere around the big pool area too. Amazing monorail ride to view the palms from above.

Such a fun day. This is the best waterpark in the UAE in my opinion. It is so well designed. Even when busy there is not much queuing as they have travelators to pull you up in the rubber rings. It is also very large and covers a big area so people are spread out. It is really an enjoyable day. Kids aged 10 and 12 had a fab time and also the grandparents in their 70's. Nice beach to relax on if you want some chilled time. Been here a few times now and always had a good time.

Water Rush!. Great place with excellent rides - variety too.Free for patrons of Atlantis.Buggy rides available at regular frequency for transportation. Swim suit available for sale inside.Locker systems and photographers are also there.Proper full fledged team available to ensure safety.

So much fun!. Excellent attraction!Lots of water slides split across 2 areas, be warned some slides are not for the faint-hearted!Also has beach area and pool-side loungers. Lots of food venders/restaurants dotted around the park.Tickets are cheaper online. For a small charge you can hire a towel and locker (operated by wristband), the changing rooms also have shower/hairdryer facilities.You can also load money on to your wristband for buying food/drinks/souvenirs so you can be wallet-free and leave your valuables in your locker, without having to go back and forth throughout the day. Any money un-spent will be refunded back in cash. Definitely worth the money - you can spend the whole day there. Just remember to buy tickets online.

Awesome Water Park.... We stayed to "Atlantis" next to the Water Park. We went almost everyday we where there. Everyone had a great time. The water is heated. The only bad thing is if you have young children under 48 inches . There's not alt for them to ride. But it's an awesome time...

Nice water activities. Must visit this water park, if you really enjoy water slides. Bad thing is that you have to carry your tubes every time upto second and third floor to enjoy water slides, its very tiring and boring process. Atlantis management must take serious steps to solve this problem.Charges are very high should be reasonable.Free wifi to be provided to all staying guests, its basic facility which is not free here.

It never fails to amaze.. I brought my friends to Aquaventure in Atlantis The Palm and I was very happy to see my bestfriend enjoying my treat for him. He seemed like a kid. My other friends enjoyed it too. Especially the Leap of Faith.
A must in Dubai. There is definitely something for everyone here. Children's pool, small slides, big slides, ring rides and a lot more. Definitely a must visit when in Dubai.
Overpriced and poor in attraction. The park is overpriced, it's a money making park, who don;t really car about the fact of being a water-park! You need more ride and more excitement in it...
FUN, LAUGHS AND SCREAMS!. unlimited access when we stayed at the atlantis at the beginning of the month and couldn't stay away from here.. so much fun and laughter and memories loved it!

Sunday was a great day to go. Not as crowded as the Friday/Saturday weekend. We saved money by buying our food with our ticket and shared a meal for lunch and supper. We also noticed the day we went, that we could have bought our tickets on line a week in advance and it would have been half price. The rides were great. But the staff were the best! Most were very helpful and friendly and fun. A great day!

One of the best. I love this waterpark the most. More because i am lazy and u dont have to walk up the stairs with wet costumes. U can take a tube lift up and because of that, i will keep going back. LolSo many food options as well as light food which i prefer such a nachos or iced drinks and more. Amazing rides for everyone. The rapids are the best. Its chilled but for a few seconds u get to enjoy the thrill

Disappointing!. We expected a few dry rides as well, but were disappointed as there weren't any. The water rides were a bit confusing to find, and weren't mapped out well. Each adventure was placed far apart and getting round was not easy. The buggy's that took people around were only for Atlantis hotel guests. The park is exaggerated and too hyped up. There are huge crowds toward afternoon and evening. The food and water here is over priced and they don't let you take your own water inside, neither does the park have water filter's to quench your thirst if you get thirsty. The water is cold so I would suggest you warm up well after the rides, and take your own towel.
Time well spent. I was there with my brothers and we had a lot of fun. Logically, this is the place where kids can play almost a day and be completely tired.

Amazing Waterpark. This place is a bit pricey but for any UAE resident there is a resident's rate. Once you get there you'll definitely have a day of fun. Lots of attractions but even if you're feeling low key the lazy rivers are great. Children's play area is also quite nice.

Fun, great views need little improvements. It was fun, park is quiet big and enough attractions, Really like artificial river and tower of poseidon. Next to this tower there is beautiful beach where you can enjoy some sun and make cool pics. Love lost chambers, didnt expect that it will be that big. I found park a bit overpriced and comparing it to Siam park in Tenerife Aquaventure is loosing as Siam looks way cooler! Anyway definitely worth of visiting if you coming to see Dubai.
delight!. the waterpark is awesome for all age groups. leap of faith and the group rides (4+ member slides) are a must go. you get good food inside, and the park is very well organized
great waterpark. We stayed at the Atlantis hotel, so went to the waterpark everyday. Great for kids and adults. The food & drinks are expensive.

Fun and relaxing. This is a great place for family. There are things to do for people of all ages. Of course water is the theme so it's good to be prepared. Take your own towel and save AED30 and bring a lockable bag so you save on a locker. look for vouchers on line and save on all day rates. Don't bring your own food-it will be confiscated upon entry. Bring some sandals and sunscreen and a hat. Timing is essential when you go to a certain slide or you could be in line for a while. Best to go during the week so there is less traffic. Get a set of deck chairs and have someone occupy it while you take turns on the slides note: birds may eat you food. Although the water is pleasant in terms of temperature, it gets windy and cold towards the evening to bring something warm. My favorite is The Leap of Faith - not recommended for anyone with a heart condition.
Amazing waterpark !. This waterpark is amazing !! It is very nice with palmtrees and pools. Best water attractions I've ever did !!

Fun for the kids, fun for adults who are kids at heart.. Located on the Palm, we took a Taxi from the Mall of the Emirates at the cost of about AED25 (keep in mind that a return journey cost more around 50AED due the nature of the way the exits from the Freeway exits are organised). We arrived at about 10am, and left at about 4pm. We rode most rides and had a relaxing time too. We found that the park was busy from when we arrived and cleared out by about 2pm. The food quality isn't typical for a fun park. It is better, however it is the typical cuisine (burgers, fish and chips etc). After eating some, you can walk to the beach which although completely man made, is nice.

nice waterpark. The rides here are amazing.,, loved the way e pool and surfing the most. Some of the other rides are pretty tough for adrenaline junkies like the 90 degree drop on a slide food was good and recommend in the winters as summers are horribly hot and water is salty.. classic combination for a skin burn
amazing. Amazing, wonderful, fantastic, fun, there is a lot of words to discover this place which is I couldn't even say it. everything was great, will be back again

Brilliant water park and dolphin bay. This was by far the best for my daughter it's very hot to walk around though! The dolphin experience was amazing originally I had booked a lower package for my daughter but staff allowed her to upgrade on the day as they had availability and again couldn't do enough for you complimentary drinks were given at the end to everyone.

Good Fun for all ages. I've visited this place in various group types, with and without kids, and its just as much fun for Adults (big kids) as it is kids.If you go during the summer months take some flip flops are the stone and tarmac walkway areas can get super hot and burn your feet moving from ride to ride.Food available in the water park is average, I'd suggest eating after you leave as there is much more choice in the Atlantis.

Yay!. Was super fun! I so wish we stayed at the hotel as we didn't get enough time as the park but we will definitely return! Lots of slides and the staff were great. Great weather too. The place can get expensive if you aren't staying at the hotel so do bare this in mind. No one does water parks like the Atlantis! Woohoo
Excellent park. Good water park, included in our hotel (Atlantis) so not sure of value for money but good rides. Lazy river/Rapids excellent. Good food available. Overall good day out.

Enjoyable, minus the queues!. Aquaventure was a good family experience and houses more rides than at Wild Wadi. However, it's a shame that the rides were often teeming with people and queues were the bane of our journey. The park has good facilities and a food court that provides various foods including pizza, shawarma and burgers. The park is also well spread out and the area is pretty to walk around. I was also able to take part in the dolphin show, where participants can ride, dance with, kiss and hug a dolphin. The whole experience was enjoyable and I would recommend a visit, although be aware that you'll spend the majority of the day queuing!
Great day. This is our second visit to this park it was great ,the rides get busy so better in morning ,eating here was reasonable and good selection

Great day out!. Me and my wife visited the water park during our Honeymoon in August. The waterpark was extremely good fun and we enjoyed going on all the water rides. One thing I would recommend is wearing wet shoes because we left our flip flops at the beginning on the sun lounger before going on the lazy river and ended up burning our feet trying to find the location where we had initially put them!! We will definitely go again if ever we were to visit Dubai again :)
Excellent day out for all the family. Excellent day out for all the family, after swimming with the dolphins we spent the rest of the day at the waterpark. Something for everyone.
Must do!!. We spent a day here......it was simply amazing - there is a lazy river and loads of slifes - the best part is that there are lifts so you dont even have to get out your rubber ring!!

Great Waterpark. It's different then Wild Wadi and even Yas Waterworld. The rides resemble more to reflect Atlantis. We went as a family and stayed at Atlantis, the waterpark was great, it had something for every age group. If you are choosing one waterpark to go while in Dubai, I would highly recommend you pack your bathing suits and take a trip to Aquaventure Waterpark.
Love the dlophines. I loved swimming with the dolphins, take the rides through the shark tanks, I enjoyed all the rides there.

Fun in the water. Aqua-venture got a lots of exciting water games and amazing beach to relax You are not allowed to bring food from outside so you can consume their expensive food, but the place worth a visit.Stay away from the crowded Fridays and try a weekday so you can enjoy all the games, several rides.
Amazing. This is a place where you can enjoy the full day by trying the activities and the aqua adventure.....it is good for adult and kids.... extra charge for swimming with the Dolphins...

Family getaway for a day. Best waterpark in Duabi. We visited the waterpark duirng summer in Dubai (August). It has best water rides. Only point is during summer its gets hotter outside water and in winter the water gets a bit colder, although they have temperature controller. Must visit.

Place for whole family or couples. I like this watermark more then any. It can be considered as a park for not only kids. Grown ups will also enjoy. Nice slides, aquarium, access to beach and few restaurants.

Great family day out. Coming in to Atlantis is breathtaking! The hotel is so BIG! There is a shuttle bus that takes guests to the Aquaventure park - this runs very consistently. The entrance is inviting. Coffee shops, restaurants, cafe's and other shops along the way. I suggest heading there early as the park does fill up fast. There are however plenty of sunbeds in the different locations around the park. There is also access to the beach for guests. I also suggest pre-purchasing food/lunch upon entry. Food is over priced if purchasing. For entrance to The Lost Chamber and a meal combined - 90 AED. Food and a drink alone for one person can come close to that same amount. Overall, a good day out and a bucket list tick.
Fun rides, Full day. Run rides, well organized, places to eat, beach option. Definitely wear flip flops and tight bathing suit!
