Very Cool. One of my favourite water parks .. nice ambient .. amazing water games especially "Leap of Faith" the highest game in the park .. part of park is specialized for kids ..

My Favorite water park in UAE. One of my favourite water parks .. nice ambient .. amazing water games especially "Leap of Faith" the highest game in the park .. part of park is specialized for kids ..

You don't even have to get off your tube to get on the next slide. One of the best water parks I've been too in ages. There are plenty of slides too which helps keeps lines at bay, and a lazy river that connects almost every ride. The only downside is that there is a dolphin enclosure which I don't feel proud about supporting.

Great fun, but please prepare lots of money. This has always been in my bucket list so we had too especially for The Leap of Faith. That slide was pretty amazing and made my life that much cooler. Waiting time was alright. But in December it was so cold and we were shaking while queing for the rides.The absolute turn off was everything was overpriced. Yes I understand this is Dubai but the price of everything in the waterpark was just crazy. aNd as we were with kids and on a holiday we could splurge and thought of it as a one off thing, so just be prepared,

A good family day out, and a well maintained park.. Set in Atlantis hotel, Aquaventure Water park is set across a large site, with a private beach, myriad of water slides, loads of lagoons with sun loungers, food areas and an awesome lazy river which takes at least 30 minutes to go around.We've spent plenty of days here, floating around the river to lower our heart rates after using one of the white knuckle slides.The only downside of Aquaventure is the queue to get in, which can easily take an hour.

Lots of fun. Had gone to this water park sometime back with a friend. Its located in the Atlantis hotel. The rides were great. Water was clean. Lots of fun. Suitable for any age group. You have to be of certain height to go on some rides.

Fun waterpark. We went during a quiet time so there wasn't any queues- however be prepared to do a lot of walking up the two towers which house all of the slides. Getting back up from the bottom takes a while. Nice touch with the aquarium a part of some of the rides. Most of the rides at the one tower uses tubes which you will have to walk up with. The kids splash area is lovely - unfortunately whilst we were there it had to be shut off thrice and restarted - not sure what the problem was. Food and snacks are pricey , the beach area is a bit dull. The entrance ticket is also pricey . However a nice fun day out.

One of the best in the world. This is one of the worl'ds best water parks, it has amazing stuff to do, the poseidon revenge, the aquaconda and others are just amazing. The park also has a big park for kids that it's amazing as they can have a lot of fun there. There are lots of chairs to put our stuff here ans mmd let the kids stroll. We webt to the beach but here the sand is not like other beaches, it's more rough to touch.
Great waterpark. Many rides and plenty of snack shops and places to soak up the sun. One of the best I have been to and I highly recommend a visit while in Dubai

Great rides.Perfect with your Atlantis stay. Rides are awesome and they have made few which are toddler and baby friendly. which was great. Completely thrilling. You can easily spend a whole day there.Hot months are pretty hot, and the walk in between ride zones and to and fro the locker area can be scalding on your body.They ought to have more refreshment areas and a bit more affordable too. It was quite pricey for basic water juice snack considering they dont allow outside food in and with kids espcly babies and toddlers thats very cruel. Good thing was we combined this with our stay at Atlantis so change shower and rest wasnt big problem with a baby. The Shower and changing area are ample and clean enough.
Fun Place. Nice place to spend the day. Good fun, good rides. Excellent for families. Children will absolutely love this place. Not too expensive. Totally recommended

Some heart-stopping rides. Like any waterpark, it's good to get there early to beat the lines. It's next to the Atlantis hotel and accessed by walking through a mall (typical Dubai style). Once there you book the tickets (be sure to check for any promotions before you book tickets, as they always have something online). The park is huge and long and crazy. Lots of sunscreen is required. The highest slides should be priority, especially the one where you shoot out through the glassed in aquarium. When you're tired out it's fun to just float in the river that winds around the park. Beware that even in winter the Dubai sun is still very strong so stay hydrated and take breaks. There are some food stalls in there and they give you lockers but the food is not restaurant level and the lockers are teeny tiny, so pack light and essentials.

Adventorous, Thrilling, Awesome. We stayed in Atlantis, so got the entry passes...very safe for kids and everyone, there is separate zone for kids, Dont miss the "Leap of faith" and ride in underwater aquarium..Need to pay for lockers and towels..Tips: Keep a waterproof Pouch for the mobile phones,so that u can click photos and videos..Or u have to pay 85 dirhams for a single snap

Aquaventure experience. Just 6 rides split over 2 towers, need to find a rubber ring, to go on most rides, fun slides and interesting build but not worth the price and does not allow access to Atlantis hotel or aquarium

Part of hotel package. Stayed at the Atlantis and the water park was part of the package. Its excellent for all ages and the staff go above and beyond the call of duty ! So so Helpful and friendly epically to our young kids of 3 and 9 months, if your a skywards card holder present the card and you get 15% discount on lots of food and other bits We will be back before we return to uk

Best waterpark!. We pre-booked our tickets for the waterpark in the uk, and saved 50% - bargain! We spent two full days here, which I would definitely recommend as there are lots of rides and one visit would not be enough! Food, lots to choose from all at quite reasonable prices. Not the strongest of swimmers I felt very safe here, Lifeguards everywhere!

Brilliant fun with the family. A rare moment for fun with the family while on a business trip in Dubai allowed for a trip to this place.There were lots of people there, but plenty of things to do, with loads of staff on hand to help.The rapids are clearly the best part of this place, despite there being loads of other stuff and we all spent hours going round and round in rubber rings through rapids and waterfalls.Great fun if you have kids. If you don't - borrow some and go anyway :)
Awesome Water park visited. Aqua water park is a really nice place to visit with the family, my kids had an awesome time. This seemed like one of the most largest sofar
Very expencive. Everything is very expencive there you cannot take your own picnic lunch with you and have to buy snacks etc. which is very very expencive. Nice day though.
Great day. in my opinion this is the best water park in the region.it can get crowed but that does not ruin the experience as it is a big park, though it can be pricey.

Family day out. We spent all day at the Atlantis resort. What a superb day. Easily the best waterpark we have ever visited. It obviously caters for all ages but our teenage son and daughter had a fantastic time here. Numerous ticket options are available so we opted for the day pass with meals with proved very good value. It was quiet too so there was minimal queuing. The lockers are also extra but very useful. The only dissappointment was the private taxis outside presumable hotel owned are twice the price of the ordinary taxis with coloured roofs. We felt that this was a bit of a rip off but apart from the we would recommend without a second thought. Did not visit the other parks so cannot compare but are reliably informed locally it's the best.
great. it is very crowded place in hollidays so it is better to visit it not in hollidays it is amazing place esp for kids

Great waterpark, the lazy river was not lazy :). We had 3 days at the waterpark. plenty to do for all the family, the lazy river has two sections, the waves which is still quite gentle and fun or the rapids, which was great, even if I did get a mouthful of water while laughing :)

ONE OF THE BEST WATERPARK IN THE WORLD!. Still our favourite WATERPARK in the world! No match to this one soo far. Very Clean! The slides are connected so you are surprised every time you thought you are done. The kids love it! Adults can't stop having fun. Definitely a must for all adventure seekers. Take that leap of faith and the Sharks await you down below. Friendly staffs await you too. Entry tickets may be expensive for some but you must fork out the dough if you have children. They will never forget you for the rest of their lives.

Good day out . It's worth the money if u spend the whole day there. We spent £56 for reserved beds which were worth it as lockers, towels, water, service was all in. Food was not that great considering price!

Great Day at waterpark. We spent a Friday here and was a great day out. my favourite being the lazy river with the odd rapid wave you could go through. We arrived early and got good loungers which would be advisable as it picked up very quickly.The food just beside the loungers we were on was great also.Great day out
Fun for kids and grown ups!. We went there on Friday (our own mistake). We only had 2 hours and most of the time we spent for waiting. The slides are awesome!

Very Good. We travelled to the water park with high hopes. But like many, they are expensive and the thrill wears off after an hour so and standing in long ques.However it wasn't like that at all! The park was well prices and fortuntely not very busy! I would recommend this park to anyone who is a thrillseeker. There was also the advantage of the attached air conditioned mall with shops, cafes and the indoor Atlantis aquarium which was available for all public to access. Only downfall was feeling slightly uncomfortable with the way I was dressed, as I was dressed to be at a water park I still wanted to remain respectable when walking through the centres. I would recommend taking good cover-alls or shawls.

Great way to spend your day. Lots of different rides for all ages, very well organized and what should not be missed it is actually connected to a beach where you can relax and get some suntan in more or a less quietness. It's a great way to spend the whole day in Dubai and you probably do not the full day there in order to experience most of everything they have to offer.

not to be missed. small and fun waterpark. its not too big and overwhelming but its still fun. we espacilly liked their lazy river, it connected everything so neatly.if you stay at the atlantis you can use this water park as many times as you want for free.
Nice Waterpark. Me and My Family enjoyed the place and my kids enjoyed it the most because it has Kids Zone which is secured and safe.
Fun with Water. >Good place with many water rides. > I did not had much time to try all of the rides> Some breathtaking rides for adults as well.> some rides exclusive for families.Worth visiting
Very fun. I have been to waterparks at Disney in Orlando, and this place is just as enjoyable as that. Fun with family.

Visiting atlantis . Average ,not impressed at allStaff not friendly We booked at nassemi beach restaurant via the concierge.,when we arrived ot was for indoor though it was half empty outsideWe spent 15 min in argument with the manager who insisted we booked inside ..it took 3 min to arrange the table in an empty restaurant. .I would not recommend a visit as it's like any other water park

Lots if fun for the kids. It was a family day out with my friend and her kids. There's lots to do for both adults and kids, the watermark is fun however the food isn't that great. Best to dine at the hotel if you're not into junk food.Worth experiencing.

Great place, well worth visit. Great day out to Waterpark. Park is so clean, and staff are brilliant. Was a bit overcast today, so water bit chilly for me. But plenty of sunloungers for me to wait will sister did the rides. She came back n had a brill time. The lazy river that goes into rapids looked brilliant. Can't wait to go back.
Brilliant day out. Best day ever according to our 6 and 10 year old boys. So much fun and worth every cent. Can't wait to return!

Best water park in the world. We have been to florida 5 times now and one of the high lights for us is the water parks, however the water park next to Atlantis the palm in Dubai is the best, it has more rides a mad mad mad lazy river, but it's not all that lazy, it has around 1.5km of river Rapids ( just get in your inflatable and hold on for dear life), then there is the wave river, it's a 8foot or so wave every 15seconds that hits you and pushis you down the river, your trapped between two walls so the waves stay high, lots of fun, there are just to mean things to say about this park, but one thing stud out, the staff here I don't think I have been anywhere and found the amount of life guards that's are here, there is one life guard every 15-20 feet on the lazy river, it is very. Very well staffed, YOU GOTTA GO THERE,

The Best Waterpark in DUBAI!!!. Aquaventure is plain simple fun! from joy rides, lazy rivers to the super scary leap of faith. Kids or Adults; Tourists or locals its a wonderful getaway for all alike. Keep a full day for this activity best time to start is early in the day immediately post breakfast complete all the rides and then just lazy in the lazy pool or soak up some sun at the private beach. - Full day activity- Good for Kids and Adults- Great inhouse facilities (food, restaurants, changing facility, etc)- Clean- Best enjoyed in a group (4 or more people)

Rides are very kiddish. This is a right place for kids. The rides in this place are no where compared to an adult water park. The rides are very kiddish and not scary at all. According to me if you want to enjoy water rides, wild wadi is the place for you. It's such a famous place that everyone feels like a must visit. But other than the architecture of the hotel nothing else is worth. The water park isn't worth it.

Awesome!. Incredible! I've been to the park 8 different times. It never gets tired. It's really cool! And if you are a residence, it's even better cause there's nice prices for Residents in UAE. Wonderful!
Amazing fun. This one of the best day trips in Dubia. Great for all ages and some scary rides for older kids and adults!
Aquaventure Waterpark at the Atlantis. The Aquaventure waterpark is very good for the Kids as well as Adults. Its really a must go place in visiting Dubai. Its a full day activity attraction

Brilliant day out for the kids. My 11 and 6 yr old kids loved it. We all loved the 'leap of faith'. My kids were upset as 'Poseidon's revenge' has a 45 kg minimum limit. 'Slitherin" was the most boring ride. The family rides 'Zoomerango' and 'Aquaconda' were fabulous.

Wonderful family time. We've been to Dubai quite a few times now and Aquaventure is by far my children's favorite place to go... mine too. Lots of different slides and places for younger kids and older kids to hang out and enjoy the water. Great place to spend the day

Lazy river I could spend all day in. Had such good fun here, there is a lazy river that takes you around most of the water park and even has tunnels and lifts that take you and your rubber ring up into a ride, saves queing on foot.Also if you aren't up for queing for rides you can spend all day going around the lazy river which includes torrents and rapids. Laughed so much in these it was a shame we didn't have time to look at our photos.

Wonderful fun day!. We stayed for a night at Atlantis and got unlimited access to Aquaventure which was a fabulous fun outing for the whole family. Our kids (4 and 8) loved the Kids Splashers Area and spent hours happily trying out all the slides. Though its peak season and it was long weekend holiday (hence very busy time), we only had one 15 min queue at Shark Attack ride and got to do all the rides at least twice without waiting. Shark Attack with the tube going through the aquarium is good fun as is the Surge and Plunge. The rapids are great even with the little ones. There are sufficient child safe tubes, there are lots of lifeguards around, very clean washrooms, the food outlets serve yummy fare, lots of places to sit with loungers and with the park spread wide, you never have the feeling that it's overcrowded even on very busy days. Also it's very nicely shaded with natural foliage and umbrellas so you can relax and sit back before heading off to more fun. Overall, it's a great outing for everyone for the whole day!

Atlantis The Palm AQUAVENTURE WATERPARK. Very nice experience ... a bit smaller than in Atlantis the Bahamas which has positives and negatives. A few different rides than the Bahamas which is a positive, but the Lazy River is not as nice as in the Bahamas which is a very minor negative.

The most fun ever!. I thoroughly enjoyed this water park. The rides were exciting and fun and the place was easy to navigate around. If you drive you park in the car park and a shuttle bus takes you to the water park, I think they leave every 10 minutes or so.Definately visit this place, with or without kids!

day out at waterpark. lovely waterpark ae got our tickets half price as we booked them on line before we set off. you have to pay for towels round about 8 pounds unless you take your own. very busy tho when leaving que too big for taxis so id advice to get a tram
Artificial enjoyment. Crowed, packed of people here and there. This place is terrible, with a lot of marketing campaigns running but it´s not worth a visit at all.

Great day, especially if staying at the Atlantis. Visited as we were staying at the hotel. Slides were great, I braved the Leap of Faith and screamed the whole way! My boyfriend was braver and went to the other tower to do the slide which is basically a vertical drop! Queues can be long and signposting could be improved but this is great for a day and free if you stay at the hotel. I may have been disappointed had I paid to get in. We didnt do any of the dolphin/sea lion activities due to lack of time. All slides with inflatables are great fun, faster and sometimes steeper than you think!
Fun waterpark. We had a great time there as it was during the weekdays. However already after noon the queues got longer, so I would not go during weekends or holidays. all in all lots of fun!

Good place to go. Could get busy. On our second day of our stay at the hotel we decided to go to the waterpark that is attached to the hotel. With being HB the entrance fee is included. The day was cloudy with no sun but still quite warm. Towels are free to use. There is a charge for the lockers and don't make the mistake like we did... We grabbed our towels and found a couple of loungers then looked for a locker.... These are at the entrance of the park and it is a 5minute walk from the main area. (So grab your locker at the entrance) There is a zip line that is payable at the entrance too. (75AED if paid at the entrance or 100AED if paid at the zip line) the zip line is unlimited but we only used it once which was a little waste. There are plenty of rubber rings to use but with the weather as it was I guess it would be busier if the sun was out. I was also told to avoid Friday and Saturday as they are the busiest days. The lazy river and Rapids takes a while which is good and there are a few different ways to go round that soak up some time. We didn't hardly queue for any of the rides at all. All very clean but the concrete floor can be very slippery if bare footed so be careful. I noticed a few snack bars for food and drinks but didn't use these. All the lifeguards are pretty friendly and there are plenty of them. I haven't given it 5 star as I missed out on a couple of rides as I don't see them due to poor sign posts and I think lockers more central in the park would also be better than having the long walk to the entrance every time. Other than that worth a visit.

Worth Every Penny. Book this beforehand online. We spent 3 hours here and did not even cover 1/3rd of this waterpark. We got really bad weather and didnt have the time to take full advantage. Admission comes with access to the Atlantis beach and the Aquarium (which is great also). Tower of Poseidon has a many rides but requires a walk up quite a few flight of stairs. I would suggest coming at opening with internet purchased tickets. You can easily spend a full day here or more. Access to the beach (which is right there) allows for a nice break if you spend the day there. This is a must in Dubai!

What an Experience...!!!. Should Top ur "To do List" in Dubai. Wonderful Experience. Specially the Water Slides. Reserve a full day and start early. You'll love it. Definitely a place I'd come again...
A family location. Suitable for all age groups. If you want some thrill please do try 'Leap of Faith'. Other rides are with tubes so very safe.

Best , amazing . Best awesome , don't have words it's a great place to enjoy , although food inside is very expensive u will get burger and fries with small coke for 53 dirhams . But it's a bit place for kids and couples to enjoy. Great changing rooms with all facilities , lockers etc. One of the best place in dubai to go.

Good One. A nice place in the man made land called palm jumera...you are in the one of the worlds biggest water park in front of the one of the worlds biggest hotel Atlantis...Nice place having many rides especilay you should have tigers big heart to have some big rides.But overall very good place for having fun for everyone.
Good athmosfer. The place is unic u feell in the same time in to the jungle and on the beach Staff verry friendly and well prepared .....Verry nice slides and pools
Great but nothing extraordinary. Ok types rides, the way they charging, but it is treat if you staying in Atlantis, best rides are Leap of faith and the capsule one. Go ahead only if you staying

Great water fun!. Massive water town in the Palm Island... Lots to do and caters for all. Expected more rides but still plenty! Food was great but pricy. Too much there to do in one day! View fromIsland seeing the sky scrapers is amazing! Rides are thrilling and specially the mini river passage which is a ever lasting and many twists along the way and leading to many drops, socially the one which puts you though a massive aquarium tunnel! A must do
Good to see numbers of marine animals in one place. Good to see numbers of marine animals in one place there are so fishes very good but I was quite disappointed because its very very crowd. .

AWESOMEST water park I have been to. awesome water park. As we were staying at the atlantis we got access to the park for 2 days. It usually get crowded in the afternoon. Best time is to go in the morning at 10 am. That way u can pretty much do all the rides twice. The rides are thrilling. probably the best i have ever seen. park is huge and lots of rides to enjoy.

Really nice familiy attractions!. Nice attractions! It was a bit confusing and a lot of que to buy tickets and quite noisy in the hall before you got in to the aerea. Recommend to have sandals or something like on your feet because the stoneplates will get very hot when it´s sunny.The food was not so exciting. They offerd hamburgerrestaurants and thats all.It was clean and nice aera so also the showers and the dressingroom.
fun day out!!. one of the best waterparks to visit in dubai. Must do: leap of faith. however, this park has something for everybody. from water lovers to non water lovers.

Great waterpark to escape the heat. This is a great park to visit to escape the Arabian heat! Be fully prepared not to take in any food or drink from outside, they confiscate everything! Lockers can be hired but they are only small so if you have more than a small backpack ask to pay extra for a large locker. Park offers plenty and line ups for the larger rides were minimal at the time we arrived however by approx 1.30 we had approx half hour wait for each ride. To avoid this there are plenty of rapids and pools to just chill out in. Private beach at the palm at the back of the park was great and a little escape from the crowded areas. Be prepared for hot walking areas - especially the stepped areas near the shark tanks!
BIG. Just a fantastic water park. Make sure you give yourself all day, it's massive. Try the six man ring ride over by the dolphin pool, awesome!!!
Great waterpark. Not many waterparks are this good. It is quite the experience, with some of the longest and fastest water slides in the world.
Here again. This time it was not crowdI really happyI have done all the activities there in a short timeBut the weather was a little bit cold but wonderful

fun & thrill for the entire family. This certainly has to be one of the best water parks. very clean. a variety of rides for all ages. the ride at neptune tower and poseidon's revenge qualify for the two rides with the most thrills. one aspect that impressed me was the quick availability of first-aid. i had neck pain due to a sudden jerk in one of the rides, and the first-aid man arrived promptly with a suitcase full of medicines, relispray, etc.

One of the Best water park in world. Water and cleanliness was remarkable.You can't find dirt anywhere in that Big park.Well maintained and well made.Rides in Posiedon section are just mind blowing and Fabulous. All 4 rides in Posiedon needs brave and big heart to do.Rapids , torrents, all these were also good and theme on which this is been made is tremendous.It's entertainment for all.Keep it up.Regards, Sunil
Enjoyed. Loved just amazing all rides enjoyed must visit place underwater was best ride and beach was also nice who didnt stay in atlantis

A MUST DO!. A few months on and the thought of Poseidon still sends goosebumps down my back! Amazing waterpark. Even after spending the full day there i could have gone back for more. Great rides, really relaxed and an awesome experience
mesmerising. great slides, great artificial sea shore, aquarium. one can enjoy full day and totally new experience.

The best aquaventure waterpark! . Love this aquapark!!!! ❤️ there you can have fun if you have 10years or 50years :D ... There is also attraction for small kids and attraction for crazy people who need adrenaline they can try poseidon's revenge !! :) You can have there also restaurants,snacks like ice cream,potato chips etc... Try to see on youtube videos from this waterpark and you want be there as soon as possible :)

Waste of time. Like everywhere, you spend hours in the queues!!! If you're the one person in the park, you can be in and out in 20 minutes, but instead you are made to stand for hours and hours in the queue. For rides with tubes, you have to run here and there looking for the tubes. Instead, the tubes should be made available by the management at the start of the ride. The queue looks unnecessarily long with people carrying large tubes in their hands, moreover it is extremely inconceivable. Shame on the management. You spend AED 275 (INR 5,000) for just 8-10 rides. The Essel World in Mumbai offered equally good, if not better, rides at a less than INR 1,000. Overrated park. Can miss it.

Outstanding. We had the time of our lives at this waterpark. Like nothing I have personally experienced before. Spent the entire day there and never got to do everything. Lots of screaming, laughs and pure enjoyment. Highly recommended.

Great fun!. Went with my partner and we had a fabulous day! The park itself was really quite pretty and luckily for us it was reasonably quiet so the queues were practically none existent! The entry was very pricey, but we knew that when we decided to holiday in Dubai. There are lots and lots of staff which makes it feel very safe and everything was extremely clean. We were there for a good 6 hours, with a few stops to soak up the sun. Great slides too but it's an all round good day out!

Fun...but crowded. Spent half a day here and it was really fun. A lot of slides....especially the awesomely high Leap Of Faith. Or u can just enjoy the lazy river and float around the park. Food price a bit on a high...but not much. But the crowd is overwhelming. And someone need to control the queue coz some ppl like to jump queue. Not very nice. Definitely recommended if u have kids and looking for some family fun.

Day of pure fun:). My wife and I had entry tickets to the park as a added bonus for visiting the Dolphin bay. This place is a lot of fun and very popular.Get ready for some fast water rides as well as lazy paddle around the "river" with a rubber ring lolGreat fun

Hmmmmm...... Great fun for adults and children alike, but seriously expensive on entry. Height check is very low on children so that they can be charged adult rates, yet not allowed on many rides as too young....! Slight irony to this.

Top water slides. Stayed at the Atlantic so got in free and around 15 minutes before the public also as an Atlantic guest you get a fast track line in the restaurants & you can use your half board option in there, we went on all the rides but the top two are the leap of faith & Poseidon death slide

Great Day in the Sun. The park is great to spend a day out in the sun. My wife and I visited on a Saturday to get a bit of a tan and do something in between flights. You can easily spend a whole day in the park with lots of space to sunbathe or sit in the shade to just relax.The rides themselves are some of the best I've been on at a water park. The lazy river is the main feature of the park with lots of rings floating around so no fights needed! The lazy river has direct access to some of the rides so you just float around in your ring and a conveyer belt takes you up to the start point. This lazy river also has 2 sections, Rapids and Torrent. Torrent gives you a bit of a tidal wave at first, but gently pushes you around after that. Rapids are obviously a bit faster, but nothing to worry about and children seemed to be loving it!There are other rides (I think 6 in total) that require you to get out of your ring and carry it up to the entrance. These are definitely worth doing with the highlight being a journey through a shark tank. All in all, a good day out and it's located on the Palm so worth a trip out.

SO GOOD!!. My boyfriend and I were in Dubai August, and were planning on going to the Wild Wadi water park but we were looking online in the hotel to book tickets, and this looked better so we took the chance. We were also hounded outside of Wild wadi by a guy trying to sell us these tickets because becase..hmmIt was great!! I would reccomend wearing your sandles as the ground was very hot lolMost of the fun was giggling at other peoples reactions when on group rides haha :-)Did have to have a break half way during the day as my blood sugar got really low and I was dizzy - snow cones sorted that right out. FabThank you

wonderful experience. Please ensure you go with your sport short (cotton is not allowed). start price for shorts on-premise is 200 AED. I had couple of this at the hotel and had to buy on-premise.It was a wonderful experience

Try it worth. Amazing place, having fun , the slides was amazing
the games at the park for the adults are amazing
there is a place for the kids also

If you find better, let me know!. This park is fantastic. We spent 7 days in Dubai back in November 2015 at the hotel adjacent to the park. We probably visited the aquaventure park 5 times and never got bored. It's gigantic (there are actually parks linked together by a man-made river) and there are enough rides to fill several days of fun. Our boys are 14 and 11; the both loved it. (Fast) food is available in different locations at prices that are typical for an amusement park. Heavily recommended!
Fantastic waterpark, highly recomend to visit. If you buy it online in advance tickets will be a bit cheaper. The park is easy to reach by public transport. All slides are a must

One of the best water park ever seen in my life. very very extraordinary water park having all facilities out there.Nice rides like leap of face. anaconda and waves.only problem is cost of water bottle. They charge @ 20DHMS

I must say fantastic. Visit atlantice waterpark.Had a great day out felt like time is not enough and really one day is not enough for this place.All rides superb children's was very very happy they enjoyed a lot.One if the best place of Dubai.But I think they should not charge for a locker already the price of entrance is not cheap.If you go anywhere for swim or water activity they provide locker for free.Very disappointing.Need to look at this matter.And their locker opening system was fail when we was there it's took long to open the lockers.I think they have to change the hand band.Because when it's got wet the bar code is not working properly.Do think about it.
A day for fun. Nice water park. Impressive toboggans which pass through the aquarium!!!Nice views from the Palm facing Burg Al-Arab and Burg Kalifa. Food is ok. They could improve the quality

Awesum. Its a beautiful and fun place to visit. To reach this place u need to first board metro den at damac station change to tram and den change to monorail. Try this mode of transport its awesumm. Although there lost chanbers aquarium is not worth visiting it has just 8-10 aquarium. Plzzzzz carry your swim suits with u. They charge hefty price for the same. Only towels available for rent not swiming clothes. Best is to carry lycra not cotton shorts and lycra t shirt. Lockers are available to keep valuables. Its a huge place so go in the mrng itself. And in the evng there is a huge queue for cabs. So the best way is go back frm monorail and get down where monorail ends and then u can take a cab from dere. No queue dere or else take the same route u came from in the mrng. First monorail den tram den metro.
2nd best waterpark in Dubai!. Great waterpark but still prefer Wild Wadi as latter more relaxed. Best ride is "Zoomerango." Get there early as takes an hour or two to fill up.

Very good waterpark. Not quite of the standard of Blizzard Beach in Florida. but a very good effort. We went on a Thursday in November; and there was plenty of ring / loungers to go round. Food is dire / expensive - but the rides are great - which is the point.

A must do with kids. Was staying at the Atlantis with my wife and my 6 yr old daughter. The aquaventure park entry was free with our stay at the Atlantis. The park was amazing, there were only a few rides for a six year old, but the rapids ride was a lot of fund and my daughter loved it. Just a suggestion, if you get a raft with two seats keep it with you for the entire time, it is difficult to get one. It was a fun day and my daughter did not want to leave.

New rides aren't half bad - but service so so. I was rather annoyed upon arrival that the entrance price has increased by 20% - and the website doesn't make this clear. Make sure you buy your tickets online and save yourself 65 aed per person - as the online price is cheaper. The old and new rides were all great and lots of fun was had, great to be able to use the beach on site also.

I loved this place.... & can be revisited. I feel its a must visit water park with access to beautiful private beach. Beach is not accessible to outsider I mean those who not staying at the property but Aqua Venture with water rides can be visited bu Outsiders as well.

Excellent family day out!. A truly fun day for all the family. Lots of rides you can go on together as a family, and individually depending on how brave you are. A great selection for food and beverage outlets available. Clean and plenty of life guards and assistance in all areas of the water park.
Refreshing. Had a wonderful time last week at Aquaventure Water park. Enjoyed all the rides. Had a fun day. It has very good rides. Enjoyed with the girls.

A fabulous day of fun fun fun. Had a great day here! Took advantage of all the rides - try them! Lockers are chargeable and are located as you enter the park. Locker rooms are segregated. My first visit to a waterpark and I loved every minute of it

Good place for Kids. Kids would love to visit this place... It would be their fav. place. But for Adults... I would not suggest... as similar rides are already there around the world.... there are only 1 or 2 rides which are new and different... Overall... for me i wouldn;t suggest to go...

Fantastic . Great water park for all ages. We took our 2 year old on the rapids and the torrent and she loved it. We were staying at the Atlantis so we were in and out of the water park most days and it's great. I preferred the beach there than at the hotel.

Wow, Wow. It would be a crime if you do not go to aquaventure in atlantis while your visit to dubai. Its an amazing place for both adults upto 50 and young kids.Make sure u have all your bathing suit from before because my mother didnt get the approved ones and she had to pay 400 dhs just for a pair of swim suit.Keep like 400 dhs with you while in atlantis for food and water.Poseidon's revenge is a must for every thrill seeking individual.Try and get a groupon deal or any deal online. Reserving before hand is also good.Try going from monday to thursday to avoid heavy traffic.While going back from atlantis use the metro to go back to your hotel to avoid heavy office returning traffic.

Fun day out . Amazing water park with some quirky rides. Partner who doesn't really like water went on every ride except the one which terrifies all!!! Relax by the beach under the palm trees when you,ve had your fill. Also had extremely good thai curry in the restaurant here. Well surprised.
Best aquapark in our lives. Great for kids 6+ and adults. You will really enjoy yourself, but be ready to spend there minimum 1 whole day. Unfortunately many attractions are overcrowded.

Amazing! . We visited on a Sunday and we arrived for it opening. We spent the first three hours of our visit on and off the rides without any queueing - I would recommend arriving early for this reason! We then had some lunch at the shark bites restaurant and walked along the beach. After lunch we went back on another few rides but there were lengthy queues. The only down point is that we came back to our sun loungers after lunch to find that a family had decided to lie all over our beds on top of our towels and they were also lying on another couples bed to the other side. It wasn't until we told them to move and take their own stuff off our beds that they moved. The woman then sat back down, we decided to move beds completely after this and so did the other couple. We only left some clothes but make sure you don't leave any valuables just incase anything gets stolen. This didn't ruin our amazing day but just something to be aware of!

Allocate about 6 hours and enjoy. Once you enter the water in the pond and ride inflated tube-one hole or pair of holes, you loose the track of TIME. seriously !One must try, "rapids", here, if not already had a chance to experience. It is at the extension of "Lazy River". The depth is about 4 ft. only, therefore, in case, one gets dragged to the wrong direction, or the tube moving too slowly,one can jump down into the pool, push and can even ride the tube, again. Among various slides sitting in the inflated tube, i personally likes " Shyamal" the most, as they transport you at an elevation, sitting in the tube, by a conveyor and need not climb up 4-5 floors, high towers !

Fun filled day at aquaventure Dubai . Visited on 15 November with two of my friends & we had a lovely time.Our favorite was the aquaconda & the Zoomarang. We also loved the experience on the Zipline but 2 out of the three got a bit stuck on the line because of the wind situation. Tough the Zipline sounds a bit scary because of the nature it was not one bit scary. It was rather pleasant than trilling. The rides were more exciting. There are four Zipline that takes you in 4 different heights. We only took 2 just to have enough time for other slides before the park closed for the day at 5:30Finding individual or double tube for the first set of rides were troublesome. It would have been so much better if the tubes were arranged to be collected at the ride entrance like on the Aquaconda\zoomarang. Carrying tubes up & down a crowded stairs case was not the ideal arrangementIn this pleasant weather it's a fun way to spend some time with family & friends. If you are from a place where you don't have exciting water parks then this is a must do.Taking some googles will help in some of the body slides Hope you enjoy your day at aquaventure

World class water park. initially I was quite reluctant to go to the aquaventure as I'm under the impression that water park is only for kids and teens. I'm turning 28yo, and I'm totally in love with the water park, super Fun and everything is world class

Great park, too hot. This water park caters for big and small kids alike. Lots to do and keep everyone in your family amused for hours. The only down side was the heat, so I would recommend people go during winter to really enjoy it.
Lovely!. Its one of the safest water park i had been with most awesome water rides, there are safety personnel standing at every other 10 m

Great slides and rides. Compared to the US parks, this one is definitely on the more expensive side, but so is everything else in Dubai. Set in an amazing location - next to Atlantis hotel and beautiful ocean, this waterpark has it all. It has rides for all ages and thrill levels. A must visit if you are going to Dubai.

Great day . We spent a day at the water park and it was great fun - I'm not really into water parks as I'm petrified of rides, but there is something for everyone here and my boyfriend enjoyed the scarier slides and rides whilst I relaxed on the lovely beach which has amazing views of Dubai. Whilst we were there we booked to do the "shark safari" which was an amazing experience and the staff that were on the experience with us were very professional but friendly and fun too. There were a couple of tiny gripes that I had though; I think it's really unnecessary to charge for lockers when there's quite a high entrance price anyway, this is something I feel should be included, or should at least be a very small cost. I think 40aed per locker is excessive!! Also the toilets/changing rooms after a couple of hours of being there were disgusting, the smell was awful. there was a cleaner in there every time I went in but they were still horrible so I'm not quite sure what she was doing - maybe she was just there for decoration. I understand it's a busy place but for an establishment of that standard I don't think they were acceptable really. Other than that we had a great day :)

Large water park with a small amount of slides. Large water park with a small amount of slides. Long queues at slides at the weekend. There is no normal map of attractions. A lot of people at the weekend. Small locker for extra charge (40 dh)

Expensive, over rated and too crowded to enjoy the facilities!. As water parks go this is only average and the queues to get in and departure taxis are horrendous. Despite getting there around 10.30am as recommended we could not get a sun lounger anywhere and ended up sitting on the beach quite a way away from the rides. There were long queues for every ride with everyone pushing and shoving to get ahead. By contrast the aquarium was great with very impressive displays of marine life - well worth a visit. We retreated to Gordon Ramsey's new restaurant - Bread Street inside the Atlantis and had a lovely relaxing lunch and a few cocktails. Much preferred to the melee outside. I am only glad we didnt decide to stay at The Atlantis as all the day trippers over running the facilities would frustrate me.
Wow Place. Can plan half day activity here, leap of faith a must do!! souvenir Shop has varied options to chose. All PArk activity are well maintained.

Had an amazing Day!! 5*. Could not fault the park, spotlessly clean! Life Guards were amazing and everywhere.We bought tickets in advance, we joined a different line to get in which was very quick, we paid for a locker which was in the form of a wristband - we could go back to the locker many times in the day.Food was excellent quality too, albeit fast food but very tasty a little bit pricey but you would expect this!Myself & My family had an amazing time and would definatley go again the only downside is when you exit the park the Taxi que is horrendous, we waited for an hour and a half this really was disappointing! and very disorganised.

Atalntis -Aquaveture. Aquaventure park timing:10:00am to sunset.In the winter season it varies from 5:00pm to 5:30pm.When we visited it was closed at 5:30pm.You should enter the park by 11:00am to enjoy the rides & atmosphere inside the park.It is verygood & adventurious.Inside there is a Zipline,Dolphinbay etc on additional charges basis.

Expensive but worth it! . We did a day trip to Aquaventure, we booked online approx 500 AED just to access the waterpark. Locker and towel is 40 AED on top of that and you're not allowed to bring in drinks or food so it's an expensive day out! A tip- it says no food and drink allowed on the website when booking but at the ticket entrance/ bag check it states 1 x 500ml bottle is acceptable. The rides were great and there are some quieter pool areas and the beach if you want to escape the noise. It goes without saying that it is busy at Aquaventure ( we went on a Monday) but I imagine it's even more so at weekends so get there early! Also queues for the taxis are long and we left at 4.15pm so worth bearing in mind if you want to stay until closing time- you could be waiting a while. Fun day out

A MUST VISIT !. It's an amazing and huge water park. Terrific location. Exciting water rides. One must try getting on Leap of Faith and Poseidon water rides if they're brave enough. Just a bit pricey considering one has to pay separately for locker, costumes and towel as well as for many activities but still worth every single penny spent !

Great fun, daft priced soft drinks. Brilliant staff everywhere, very clean and most importantly great fun, however you reall need to STOP your daft prices for soft drinks and get some water fountains (FREE) in places. I suggest you do what Disney do, charge a single price for a drinks bottle, bar code on the side and then help yourself to free drinks afterwards. I'm sure some people would abuse the dispencers, but we spend over £150 on soft drinks alone on the day....!

For the love of water. It is just amazing that you can enjoy both the rides and the beach in one location! Everything is organized, and because the park is spacious you won't feel crowded by visitors. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The food is good too.

Thrilling experience. Before i was there i knew the journey to AquaVenture waterpark will be full of Excitement and thrilling. As i assumed it was above my expectation. We purchased a ticket for AED 295 inclusive of a meal with a choice of two restaurants i.e Barracuda and Shark Bite. I visited these two restaurants and i highly recommend Barracuda as they had vast variety of choices to make in comparison to Shark Bite.All the rides at Aquaventure were able to fulfil my desires specially the leap of faith and poseidon's revenge.Try your best to go during weekdays and go early as possible to avoid queues and disappointments. When you are returning there will be a huge line waiting for taxis, my recommendation is take the mono rail from water park to the gateway from there take the tramp to atlantis and from that point you can go in the metro for your final destination. Please note that i was staying in Deira.

High quality park. Having been to Will Wadi also in dubai along with numerous other waterparks in the US, UK and other countries this is by far the most superior. It's excellently run with staff who clearly enjoy their jobs. The enterence fee is steep if not staying at the hotel (£54+locker fees, etc) but well worth it. Get there early. It's packs out after midday. We didn't queue at all in the am. The rides are fun, fun, fun and the shock and surprise factor runs on them all. recommend the combo meal plan in the ticket as you save over half price on food and 1 meal is enough for 2 for lunch - they are generous. They let you take your own water into the park too.Only complaint is charging £8 for a locker seems unfair. They should hire the enterence if really necessary & let everyone have a locker upon arrival.Suntan lotion could be readily available too as would be at cricket matches, in oz and us parks.

What an experience. A whole day affair. Firstly one should find out the details of the rides bcoz the maps/guides are not helpful. A single access has 6-7 slides. Some of the slides are really scary and some are exciting. Family rides too available. Avoid on a sunny day, it would become tiring

great8 place. we stayed in Atlantis and really enjoyed lazy river is exallant, must visit, excellant place for kids and also for parents
lovely facilyy worth loving it

Great fun day out!. This is the place for kids, one we frequent every time you visit Dubai - fun rides, variety of thrills for all age groups. We have noticed it has become a lot busier and crowded each time every year. Tip: go early to avoid queues.

Very expensive, but will visit again.. We were there at 10 am. With online booking everything was ok. They offer you to have a GoPro for your stay it will cost you 200 AED. Lokers 40 AED, towels 30 AED But you can bring your own towels. After few hours we get to Bite Shark ....well two burger menu 110 AED was not testy.... but the view outside tables worth it. :) What I did not like is that there was not enough double and single belts in the beginning around 11 am to 12 am. There is an attractions that you need ONLY 2 seats lifebelt to get on it....there was not around ! What I did not like also is that they was doing some cleaning or constructions on the river and no one told you it will run after 2 hours for example. Why we pay? To see how they are closed or to enjoy?

Bucket List fulfilled... a friend told me about the leap of faith.. As an adrenaline junkie I knew I had to try it.. ⏩⏩as I arrived I couldn't contain my excitement.. I told my friends about it and they were dying to try it out.. When I was done all I said was AMAZING!! Now this isn't the scariest stuff there... The Zoomerango won that. Next to the drop or Poseidons revenge. .. Then the leaP of faith. The lazy river was that.. . Lazy... Er, be sure to try out everything.. . The only thing is, getting a taxi when done is tedious.. Very long waiting line. Easier and faster to use uber.
excellent. amazing ride.clean water.we miss the some ride as there was no clear instruction on total rides.overall perfect & worth visiting

Would not go back!. We visited the waterpark during half term and it was far too busy. For the price of what they charge I would not be going back.The lazy river is good though, if you are after a chill out for a few hour to catch a bit of sun then this is great.
Super day out!. Make sure to get there early before it gets too hot. Some of the rides are a little scary so make sure you prep your kids in advance!
Fun day out - posideons revenge is a must. GO WEEKDAY. Great day out with the Mrs - the concept is great but make sure you go midweek and fly around the various rides

Didn't disappoint1. I have been wanting to experience the Aqua Park since before I moved to Dubai! I finally got to go 2 weeks ago and my goodness, I couldnt believe how amazing it was. Yeah the food and drink are over priced but what else do you expect. Love love love it!

Very expensive, but worth it. For three adults, it was about £60 each, but as my brother is a resident we were able to get some of the ticket price reduced. very clean, lots of choice of beds,plenty of shade if needed,food was surprisingly good for an amusement park, and rides were amazing, of course!!
Spectacular. Really Good. Had a Blast. Lot of Stuff. The Shark Tanks are extremely interesting. Must visit in Dubai.
Excellent Water Park!!!. Excellent Water Park for whole day fun. Many slides for all ages. Some thrilling slides as well for thrill seekers. Very clean water park and friendly staff.

Excellent waterpark. You can spend with your family a very nice day in this waterpark. They have some plays adapted to young children. Meanwhile, they have variable plays for adults, some of them are horrifying. My advice is to go early to catch all plays, as the park closes at 5:30 pm.

Must visit. An amazing experience you will never forget and you will want to go there everyday. A year ago, I booked for the dolphin encounter with my daughter and it was amazing.. Unfortunately i forgot to pick up our photo so i kept calling them for several weeks after to pick up my photo and i had the date saved and the name of the dolpin but they couldnt locate it although they stated that they save your photo for quiet a while after. I still regret it to this day because it s a once in a lifetime experience and now we have no memory for it

Excellent family attraction, but below par in thrill. Aquaventure is an excellent family attraction, with many family friendly games and slides. With the recent addition of the new tower, some thrill can be expected, but still not comparable to what you can find in other water parks in the UAE. It is still an excellent destination for a fun day with the family or with friends.

Great fun. Lots of fun with many great slides but there is also a quiet beach area if you want. Make sure you get over to the newer slides at the rear of the park (Zoomerango and Anaconda) which will keep you going back for more. There is also a really good kids area for little ones if you need

Great water park. Fab day spent here. Lots of rides and something for everyone. Very safe and clean. The package that includes lunch and entry into the aquarium is reasonable value for Dubai. There is a nice beach there also for relaxing in between rides. Highly recommended.

A very good water park.. Aqua venture offers rides for all tastes, from young children to adults and is an excellent way to lazy away on a warm Autumn Saturday, but it may be a bit too hot to do it in the middle of the summer.

Shark safari - once in a lifetime experience!!!. Once in a lifetime experience!! Swam with sharks, Ray's, and marine fish for approx 20 minutes. A personal scuba driver takes many photos of you, which you can purchase after. You get the opportunity to feed the marine fish with some lettuce, which was cool as they swarm around you :) helmet is heavy to begin with, but you don't notice once in the water.

A fun day for all. I have been to Aquaventure a few times now, with friends and family, and every visit has been so much fun. It has something for everyone, whether you just want to lie in the sun by the pool or beach, go on some scary water slides or just relax on the lazy river. A variety of food and drink available, some may be pricey, depending on what you want, but plenty of choice. I think it's something everyone should do on a visit to Dubai, you won't be disappointed. It's such a fun day. A great way to see Atlantis too and get some lovely photos of the amazing views around you.

A great waterpark - plenty of adrenaline-filled rides but equal measures of lazy-river calm. Located between the Atlantis and the Sofitel on the outer crescent of the Palm, Aquaventure Waterpark is a must-visit attraction in Dubai. There's such a great collection of slides and water-based rides that it is definitely worth getting here early to get the longest amount of time possible in the park.From the entrance to the Atlantis right next to the monorail station it's just a short walk through a shopping precinct to get to the Aquaventure ticket area. The rates for pre-booked tickets online are slightly cheaper than on-the-day (AED250/275 respectively). It's well worth going for the ticket with an inclusive meal deal - at AED295 it's only a small premium to pay, and the food itself was surprisingly good for what we thought would just be very naff fast food. In actual fact, the chicken shawarmas we had were excellent. The included drink is also something you'd definitely find yourself buying if it wasn't already included as you work up a real thirst outside in the heat walking between attractions.The backbone of the whole waterpark is the lazy river, where you can float around literally all day on either a single or double inflatable ring. For a lot of older people visiting the park with younger family it would be a great way to enjoy the park without going on any of the proper thrill rides, and even on the lazy river there are some really fun rapids sections.Most of the bigger rides are ridden on the same inflatables from the lazy river, which does mean carrying them around the park and up more than a few flights of stairs for most rides. They're not too heavy but would be fairly strenuous for smaller children. There are two main towers within the park from which a number of rides start. The one closest to the front of the park (Neptune's Tower) is the starting point for around 5 different slides/rides. The Leap of Faith is the only traditional slide which you ride without an inflatable - this is a fairly intense drop from the very top of the structure, straight down a near vertical slide, and into a pool at the end. Once you've gone down the sheer drop you zoom through the middle of an aquarium tank filled with sharks and rays, but even trying to keep your eyes open to take this in the slide is so fast it's impossible.All of the other rides from this tower need inflatables. The water coasters are all similar but different enough to make each one memorable. The Shark Attack ride has a section where you are floating inside a glass tunnel inside a giant aquarium - from here you can enjoy watching the marine life as you float by.There is a water coaster which starts a short distance from this first tower called Shamal which is pretty spectacular - instead of going up on a lift you are pushed uphill by the power of water alone. You get absolutely soaked but again, all part of the fun.The second tower (Tower of Poseidon) is right at the back of the waterpark. There are four main different rides starting at the top of this tower. You don't need to take an inflatable ring for any of these rides. The first two water rides here are raft based and can seat up to 6-7 people. The better of the two rides by a long way is Zoomerango. It starts off fairly sedately but has an incredible steep drop that really does give you that dropping feeling. There's a similar raft based ride called Aquaconda which doesn't have as big a drop but is still great fun.There are two side-by-side water flumes which have timers on so you can race whoever is next to you - these seemed to be a bit hit and miss with the people I was with; some people would fly down them and others would be struggling not to grind to a halt midway down. I didn't have the time or inclination to go on Poseidon's Revenge, but it did look great. It starts near vertical with the rider stood in a chamber which has a trap door at the bottom - once the chamber is sealed this drops away and the rider flies down into the slide below.All in all, a really spectacular day out in a very well run resort environment. As mentioned at the start of the review, definitely go for the meal deal ticket which is great value for money. If you're staying at a hotel then I'd suggest bringing towels from there if you don't want to pay to rent one for the day. A small locker (which would still take most daypacks) was AED40 to rent for the day. The admission isn't exactly cheap but for an entire day out with nothing else to pay, it really is great fun with some brilliant rides.

Fun and free on your birthday!. This is the most exciting water park I've ever been to. There are rides for the youngest child and biggest thrill seeker. We spent the morning hitting all the rides, and relaxed after lunch in the salty, cool ocean and on the (not so) lazy river. Most exciting, it's free to go in the week following your birthday! Just remember to print out your voucher.

The best water park in the uae. I have visited many times now. The new rides installed mean that Aquaventure is now the best watermark un the UAE. If you are visiting from Abu Dhabi I would recommend Yas. Aqua venture has all the latest rides, great views of the Palm and access to the beach. There are options for additional extras such as the zip line and dolphins bay. It's always high on the list when we have visitors

Expensive but Good Waterpark. I spent all day here so really good slides and also a nice stretch of beach to relax on. For me there are only 2 negatives.Price is on the expensive side and discounts are very hard to find.It was impossible to get a taxi off the palm at the end of the day and so had to take the monorail back.The slide that drops you into darkness is absolutely amazing !

Something for everyone...a great way to spend a day. This was our second visit here, the first time being earlier this year with our (adult) kids. On this occasion it was my wife and I and we thoroughly enjoyed our day. There are a great variety of rides there and you feel very safe with numerous lifeguards on duty. We spend the morning doing the rides and the afternoon on the beach. Overall I think it was decent value given the choice and standard of the whole place. You are in Dubai so there are certain times when you pay more than you'd like for things like ice-cream but hey-ho, given the overall location and its quality it still feels worth it somehow. Travel-wise, we took a taxi there (from a hotel near Mall of the Emirates) and we paid 50AED there and 40AED to come back. Don't hesitate in trying this place out, the backdrop of the hotel is almost worth the admission fee.
Amazing. This park is something else. Clean, safe (lifeguards everywhere!), varying, and pretty much with a sun guarantee. Yes a bit pricy, but that is Dubai.

Fun park. Book your tickets online. Its cheaper. There are combo offers online which don't exist when you buy on the spot.Tip - carry rubber slippers, towel else you will have to pay more. To get to aquaventure - take a tram till palm jumeirah and then the monorail. Its cheaper and offers you good view too. You have to walk for roughly 10 minutes to get to the monorail from the tram stop.
Impressive. This is the best water park we have been too very impressive. They have all the ride you could ask for also a private beach cant go wrong

amazing day, get there as early as you can. amazing place, very clean, there are lockers for your stuff which you do pay extra for but you will need to take appropriate clothes to wear to get into the aquarium.not millions of rides but they are all very well staffed and the queues move quickly, they did slow down as the day got on.something for everyone, a few i wouldn't go on but my teenagers and husband loved. the lazy river is brilliant, jump in a single or double doughnut and drift around the whole park, they have a rapids part but you can bypass that if you wish.when you have finished you can go back to the locker room and get changed into appropriate clothing (no bikini tops) to go into the aquarium. its stunning, the large tank is HUGE, we were all like small children! there are places for you to sit in front of the tanks, but its so big you wont get crowded out.there are lots of places to eat but we didn't, only because we were so tired.when you come to leave there is a huge queue for 'normal' taxis, there are hotel taxis but they charge double. the monorail does run back to the mainland but no signs or people around to tell you how and where. if you are staying as a guest at Atlantis you get into the attraction free.only downside is the floor as you are walking around gets very very hot in the sun, take flipflops and carry them on the rides!

Best Water park experiance. This is one of the best water park I have ever visited. There are so many rides probably you won't be able to cover all(I couldn't), however, each ride is different in itself & will leave you with some new experience. The whole water park us spread in a huge area with various activities to do thru out the day. This is one of MUST visit place

Great waterpark. Stayed at the Atlantis so received free entry into the water park. Great slides had lots of fun
Make sure you get there early gets very busy around lunchtime

Simply excellent!!!. Price is not cheap bit this place is amazing but busy
Your kids will enjoy the water rides
What is nice is that you take the rail on Dubai palm amd you have a great view on the Atlantis hotel

Fantastic. Probably one of the best aquaparks I have visited. I did hurt myself on the elevators that take you through on the rubber rings but do make sure you lift your buttocks up while on them as it does hurt. But all in all a great waterpark.

Great fun. We went as a group, the park is full of great rides and places to eat, you can even find Starbucks !!! If you feel like chilling you can pick one of many lounge chairs easily accessible with towels provided. Great service and yummy drinks
Fun for kids. This is the best water park in dubai. Enjoyed monorail and shallow water encounter with dolphins. The rides are safe with lots of life guards available.

Great Family Day out. We spent a wonderful day here. The dolphin experience was great for the kids, then the kids really enjoyed the rides that they were able to go on (height specific)
Again you are trapped in a facility so the only option for food and drink is the park provided but you accept that as part of the event.

superb waterpark fun. spent the day at aquaventure for my daughters 18th birthday. forgot to print off complimentary voucher ,but had this on my phone electronically. no good- the desk staff need to staple the receipt to the printed voucher!!!! So charged us full rate. what a load of rubbish- this is the 21st century ..wont accept electronic versions of the document!!! please!!besides this annoying start to the day, the waterpark is absolutely fantastic fun in the beautiful Dubai autumn weather. we have visited many waterparks in Florida and Spain, but this is by far the best... but make sure you take your paper printed vouchers!!

Atlantis. Very nice, no problem to spend a day or two here!I got a free entrance due to birthday during the week, so that is a tip to other birthdaycelebrators :)Nice rides, the children has a hightrequirement of 1,20 m but then you can ride everything

Awesome. Loved this place, and the fact you can hire a Go Pro, the staff are very helpful. Lots of pools and rides to keep you entertained all day. And access to the private beach was also a highlight. Price of food was very reasonable which was surprising. I would return to this place again.

Best waterpark in Dubai so far. Visited this place at the weekdays (Sunday till Thursday). The park is not too crowded and there won't be long queue to the rides or other activities. They have plenty of fun water rides. Even the small kids will enjoy the kids waterpark area. You can stay and relax by the pool or by the beach. The beach area near Baracuda restaurant is nicer, with palm trees and some grass, so you can stay on the shade. They don't have beach umbrellas unless you have arrangement with the hotel. Yes, it is part of the Atlantis Hotel. The only thing that disappointed us was the quality and price of the foods. We had lunch at the Shark Bite restaurant. The package of the burger, fries, drink and small fruit salad cost 90 aed. And the fried chicken for 3 people cost 140 aed. We know that it's usually like this if you dine inside the hotel, but at least we should get the quality equals to the price. Here, the chicken was dried, it was like it has been prepared and cooked from yesterday. KFC is way much better, I would say. Overall, we had fun with all the rides that they have.
Very good place for water fun. One of the best aqua parks in Dubai , you will have a lot of fun with your family, best time to visit is October till May

Nice place. The park is really nice, and has many rides to try, however, the park is over crowded during the weekends and the public holidays, it is advisable to visit the water park on a week day, especially after schools start, to make sure that you will enjoy it, also to avoid undesirable people.

Wet and wild.. From adrenalin fuelled rides that drop you vertically down a tube to relaxed float on a rubber ring. Something for everyone including those who simply want to chill on a beach or play a game of volleyball. Great day trip.

Aquaventure. Another super day at this water park. The only downside was leaving the park at the end of a fun day. As you can imagine literally thousands of people leave at pretty much the same time and it's chaotic to say the least. Changing rooms manic then 2 hour taxi wait! It's probably worth leaving an hour before closing time! However yes I definitely would return again.

Th best water park in dubai - don't accept anything else. Have been coming to dubai for 15 years and back in the day Wild Wadi was the place to go - trust me it is not anymore - for thrills, quality of the rides, overall look and feel , aquavebture is easily the best - if you are going with a family buy The Ebtertainer dubai family app on your iPhone and get half price admission - worth buying the app which is $100 - for me the best water park anywhere
Tremendous fun. With the heat in Dubai I loved everything. Although I didn't attempt the highest ride, it was enjoyable. I preferred the lazy ride: bobbing up and down . . . slowly.

great day out!. had a great time here. luckily went there early (10am) so there weren't many queues and got to do most of the rides with little waiting. however later in the day and in school holidays I can imagine this place is (too) busy. ...get there early to avoid as much of the queuing as possible.
Dubai fun . A must visit. Very very neat water. One can see the face clearly. I was surprised how could they maintain so much neatness inspite of unlimited usages..... An awesome journey
the ride hurt me and have a big bruise. the flunge ride hurt me with a big bruise an the waterpark people did not care one single bit very disappointed as tickets was expensive

Fantastic day out. We prebooked tickets online for around £40 per adult as on the gate they are about £60 so definitely worth having a look online before you go. Added on a locker and towel package which I think was £10 for 1 towel and 1 locker (bear in mind these are small and will only really fit maximum 2 bags in) The rides were great, some had queues which were expected as it was a Saturday when we visited. Lifeguards everywhere so felt very safe while on the rides, there is also a beach area you can go to if you would rather. Food and drink was basic (chips, chicken, burgers etc) however weren't as expensive as I expected. I think there is a restaurant you can visit so this would probably cost a little more. When leaving the taxi's do higher their tariff to pick you up from the waterpark so be aware of this.

Fun for both kids and adults . Loved Aquaventurer. It was so much fun. You can easily spend your whole day here, with the many restaurants and pools. The slides and rides were great fun but there wasn't as many as I assumed. I didn't go on the notorious 'The Leap of Faith' slide, however, it's hilarious to watch those screaming as they come down. For the less brave, like myself, I loved the Shark Attack ride. I went on there like 5 times. Overall, most defiantly the best water park I've ever been too. Highly highly recommend it to both adults and kids!!!

False advertising.. Though the website clearly stated that the park closes at 18:00, it actually closes at 17:30. We arrived quite late and, therefore, that extra 30 minutes was the difference between us being there 2 hours or 1.5 hours. Also, they have a ridiculous policy of giving you a cheap paper ticket to obtain your towel. But there are no towels in the locker rooms. This means that you are forced to leave the ticket in your locker and then walk and get your ticket and then return to the place where they hand out the towels to get one. All of this means that you just wasted an extra 20 minutes to get your towel when you only had 1.5 hours in the first place, since the website lied to you about closing at 6pm. In all, a VERY disappointing experience! If it were not for my daughter, I would never have come after finding out that they lied to me on the website.
really good fun. we had a good time at the water park, only down size were the queues to some rides and the fact the 4 year old wasn't tall enough to use many of them. but other than that it was good

Good fun. The water park was the reason we booked with Altlantis. It was good fun, we both can not swim but it did not stop us having fun, every morning my boyfriend got up and went down to the park like a kid. It is very convenience to use the park for guests of Atlantis. really good family fun, few places you can eat in the park and icecream.....

Ask for lockers for sure.....choose big or small.... The place is gr8.....have yur lockers chosen wisely...we took 3 lockers and paid for each one of them....later found one big locker was big enough.....the rent is not reimbursed like ski dubai.....take some money too inside or yu have to run all the way out for purchasing food items.....

Amazing day. Been here with my friend on a sundayPark was very clean, nice and very relaxing.. Staff were very nice/ friendly & polite..I ve done also the shark diving.. Had a really good time... Would recommend

Better than Wild Wadi ?. I'm not sure if this better than Wild Wadi Park. But nevertheless, the kids will surely enjoy this waterpark. We were able to get a 1 free entry since one in our group is celebrating her birthday. Be sure to check their promos before booking your tickets.
Dubai. Great water park. Lots to do for all. Cannot take food or drink including water into park. Cost is for rides only eveything else is extra.

Expensive so make a day of it. Great fun, but expensive to eat. Rides spectacular and lots of staff on hand to help. We left our bags on the beach area whilst we went on the rides. Safe environment and the lazy river was wonderful. Long queues for one ride but others moved pretty quickly. If you have birthday coming up check out their website as my son got free entry.

Big day in the sun. This water park may be big but has the best way to get around the entire park, getting you to all the water slides… via a water path. Lay on one of the inflatable tubes and it takes you around the entire park. This avoids having burnt feet at the end of the day.Get in early and on a week day to avoid the ques and do the bigger attractions first. Best option is to buy the entry combo, which includes a meal during the day and locker hire, as this is worth the extra money spent.This is a family attraction but still well catered for a group of friends
A must visit. Travelled with 2 boys who loved this place. Something for everyone and fantastic day at waterpark. Would thoroughly recommend..

Great!. Till coming in it was terrible! We had pre-purchased tickets, but through it we should wai about 25 minutes, with the child it it not so comfortable. The second surprise was the locker, you can bay it for UAE dirhams only. If you don't have any id, you can't change the many. But any way you don't need this locker at all, you can take your things with you to the area, there are enough sun lounger you could put it on. The rest time was great! I love the river around all the aquapark, you can just swimm in a rubber ring arround all the territory all the day :) In any case, if you sited dawn in this rubber ring you don't need to stand up, there some ways, wich take you everywhere to all the slides! You need the money wit you too. Drinks and food you can bay there to pay it right now only. And you can take your towel with you, if you don't want to pay for the towel rent. There is beach too, if you'd like, you can enjoy the sea and sand. And we didn't notice some raw to the slice. It was to the "shark attak" slice only, but it took 10 minutes only. For the children it great! For the adults too :))

We all love it here!!. Family of 5 (13,16,17,47&53!) been lucky enough to come here for the last 3 years as the kids (and the big kids) just love it! This year even us oldies braved Poseidon's Revenge having conquered the Leap of Faith in the previous 2 visits! Wish we'd done it sooner. Love absolutely everything about this place. It's clean, huge, fabulous rides for all, eateries, chilled areas, shuttle rides to Atlantis etc etc. Thrilling and fun.

A rip off, and a really badly planned one. This is my first really bad review ever, but this place deserves it in my view. We are a family of five (father, mother, three children aged 8, 5, 5) and unfortunately this one really ruined our day. We had booked our tickets online and had paid AED 1300 (USD 350) for them (for a five tickets, two adults and three kids). A little pricy, but we were looking forward to it. The first negative surprise was was at the entrance, where there was an entire list of stuff that we needed to pay extra for. Towels (USD 40 ... just for the day's rental), Plastic cups to get drinks (USD 40, only the first drink is free!), and a large locker (USD 20). We were now at USD 450, and that still did not include lunch! When we got to the locker areas, we saw that the lockers were either in the men's or in the ladies' areas. This meant that we could not really share our family locker and had to run in and out until we had all undressed and gotten our things stowed. Shortly after that, we discovered that all six main slides were only for people taller than 1.2 meters. This excluded our two 5 year olds. Nobody had told us this, neither when we bought the tickets, nor when we picked them up. When we brought this up with a manager, he mentioned that it was part of the terms and conditions and that everyone needs to read all terms and conditions before buying something. I thought of iTunes and didn't say anything ... naturally, one of the grownups had to stay with the little ones, which means that only 2/5 of us paying guests got to enjoy the main attractions after paying $450 for the day. We then went to get our $40 towels, only to discover that they weren't really useful since one cannot take them on any rides. We had to leave them when we got onto the "lazy river" ride and of course, they were not there when we came back. Apart from this, it was extremely crowded with guests ... and with lifeguards every 5 meters who educated us on all the things that we were not allowed to do. Some attendants were also taking pictures. These were for sale at the exit for $30 (in print) or $135 (in electronic format). For some reason, they also manage to keep the locker information on the arm-band (on a bar code), but are not able to do this for the lunch or towel vouchers.
