This meant that we had to run back when we needed to eat and when we needed to get towels. So, there you have it. Our worst experience in Dubai. We had been to Wild Wadi Waterpark - Jumeirah before and should have gone there again! Ah ... the food is junk food at best

You have to see it to believe it. We visited with our little baby not really knowing what to expect and it exceeded our expectations. We booked a Photo Fun experience with the dolphins - which was fantastic. We also took the baby in the pools - they provide little floating seats for babies which makes it really easy. My husband went on Poseidon's Tower (a massive drop slide), and there are lots of other pools and rides - depending on how daring you are. There are changing rooms and toilets available as well as plenty of sun beds and places to get food / drinks. It was super clean and the staff were very helpful. We went on a Saturday and the queues weren't too bad. My tip if you are staying until it closes - leave a bit before if you are getting a cab as the line is huge!

Great waterpark. This is probably the best waterpark in Dubai. There are plenty of water slides available, thrill seekers and families alike will enjoy this park. At 310AED it's not cheap, but you can spend all day here so you get value for money. We used the palmMonorail to get here from the tram, which helped beat the taxi queues at the end of the day. A must see place if you're in Dubai
Congested. I went in the school holidays as I just happend to be in Dubai it was there weekend as well it was manic that said it is a good day out although it is expensive for what it is

Best day! . This was one of my best days spent in Dubai! The slides were great, and it was so fun being able to just float around on the lazy river to the different slides! Queuing was minimal which made it even more fun! Would defiantly go back!

Amazing day out. What an amazing day we had at atlantis water park. So many different slides from fun and chilled to extreme, spotless, friendly and helpful staff, can highly recommend to anyone looking to visit and will certainly be back again. Combined the day with the shark safari to complete the package there which again well worth it for a brilliant experience.

So much fun. I have been there while staying on vacation in Atlantis hotel, and this waterpark is one of the best I have ever been. My family and I were going there almost everyday. Very clean, staff really friendly. Can't wait to come back.

Fantastic dolphin experience. Had a lovely day out here with my two children aged 5 and 8. Fantastic location, we enjoyed the monorail out to the park and back. We enjoyed the shallow water encounter with the dolphins. Which we all thoroughly enjoyed. I purchased the summer package deal which included lunch fantastic value for money. Worked out cheaper to go hear that it did wild wadi. The height restrictions were a little bit of a problem throughout the park, which limited the slides for my five year old and for this reasoning wild wadi was better. It definitely is a must do experience on your holiday in Dubai.

Fantastic day at Aquaventure!. We visited as a family of four (2 adults and 2 children - oldest age 5 and youngest age 22 months) As it was the day after my birthday I was able to visit Aquaventure for free. I just printed the voucher from their website beforehand and brought my passport as proof of my birth date. We booked tickets for my husband and older daughter on the website too, as apparently this is slightly cheaper than buying tickets on the day. My daughter is under 1.2m so her ticket cost less, and my younger daughter was free as she is under 2 years old.We used to City Sightseeing open top bus to travel to Atlantis/Aquaventure, which was great. There are plenty of attractions here for all ages, and wait times were ok. We ate lunch at Shark Bites, which wasn't actually as expensive as we expected. I had signed up to Emirates Skywards as you are able to get 15% off food and drink at Atlantis, including Aquaventure. The beach here is also lovely. Highly recommend a day trip to Aquaventure!

Great park!. All guests to One and Only hotels receive free tickets to Aquaventure.It was a great park with plenty of activities and the lagoon with the tubes was my favourite. You can either head towards the rapids, the slides or the torrent and you'll never be bored because it's so relaxing in the tubes.My only issues were that the smokers section seems to be right at the entrance to the park so you are forced to breathe in a whole lot of second hand smoke as you enter and exit the park which is pretty gross for a non smoker.Also, if lockers were spread out amongst the park it would make navigation a lot easier. The only locker location is at the bathrooms/washrooms at the entrance to the park and is very crowded due to people waiting for their family members outside the locker rooms, once again also right next to a cloud of second hand smoke. Massive kudos to the photographers who took some great photos and the bands are a great idea for find our photos later on.A good day out but not sure if I'd do it again.
fun fun fun. great day out with the family, struggled to see everything in 1 day as was enjoying the lazy river!!

Buckle up and give it a whole day with fun fun fun!. This watermark is amazing. My sister and i thought it would be a waste of money, but when we entered there was a whole other story to this park. We decided to try out the slides, and yes our lungs were beaten up pretty bad (in a good way). it was so much fun, and you could never predict what was coming up next in the slide.Worth every dime. And if you get hungry they have all kin of food in a "restaurant" near by. The funniest part is that when we entered the slide we exit somewhere else and the we thought, damn, now we have to walk barefoot all the way back to the enter point but no. That was not any issue when we saw the buggies, they drive you wherever you want inside the waterpark for free. Of course you pay for the ticket but still it was free. And the drivers were hilarious too :)
love love love. the experience with my friends was a beautiful one, the leap of faith ride is definately on to try #notfor the faintheartedthough

Crazy Rides...Good place for friends and family. Good place to chill out plus try some crazy water rides...The place is divided into 2 separate sections and the entrance ticket gives you access to almost all the rides...my favorite was the leap of faith. Best place to buy tickets - Online..you get some good deals on the site food seemed a bit expensive than other places. very courteous and friendly staff. Best time to visit is during weekdays.

Not suitable for family with only small kids!. Not good with 3 little kids under 120cm -as they are not allowed to do a lot! And the water playground 3 year olds are afraid as well to slide down! The adults were not able to slide down neither and you are not allowed to slide together with your kids down between the legs. So a lot of wasted money for 3 adults with 4 kids in total!

Great but get there early. We went last week after booking tickets via attraction tix. We did get 1 free ticket as it was my son's birthday ( via the official website). Make sure you print off the voucher or you'll be sent to the hotel to use their printer ( happened to the person in front of us in the queue ). Transport - we used the monorail and metro - took about 45 mins fromJbr but mainly because the monorail only runs every 20 mins. Monorail busy especially at park closing time Queues to get in- took best part of 30 minutes even though we had pre booked tickets. Get there early! We got a large locker but actually as we just put our valuables could have got a smaller one. Changing rooms male and female, well maintained and v clean. Sunloungers- head to the beach if you can't find one.A great park, particularly the lazy river and Rapids. The actual rides are not vast in number but queues were not too long and inside so no worries of heat stroke.Eating options- plenty and not too inflated prices.A fab water park once you get in which was a bit shambolic on the day we went
Do not waste time and money for visiting this. Yes, do not waste time and money for visiting this. This waterpark is similar to so many others in your respective countries.

Average, expensive, and very crowded. Very grateful not to have booked this hotel. It was mobbed and very impersonal, and so busy. We spoke to people staying there at the time who were hating it. The waterpark was good, and the kids enjoyed it, though not spectacular, and not as many rides as expected. But fun nonetheless. Though We wouldn't go out of our way to go again!

Great Waterpark. Had an excellent afternoon in the water park. It wasn't too busy so didn't have to queue too long to get onto the flumes. The bit I personally enjoyed the most was the lazy river and the rapids. There were plenty of places to get snacks and drinks and you could access your locker easily to get your money. The changing rooms were large, clean and not over crowded on our visit. The grounds are very well kept and there is even access to a beach if you want to spend your time there.
Was a good day out. Had a bit of difficulty finding a lounger - but eventually did. Family enjoyed. Lines weren't too long even though park seemed full.

Excellent but taxis terrible. Great park. Rides were awesome. Entry price was high though for what you got. Signage round the park could have been better and larger site maps with you are here on would have been advantageous. The only nightmare was getting a taxi at the end of the day. Not enough were coming and we queued for over an hr. We still didn't get one so took the monorail out. This did not link to anywhere so had to wander the streets and beg a hotel to help us find a taxi to our hotel. It took us 2.5hrs to arrive at our hotel, instead of half hr!
Aquaventure Waterpark. Aquaventure Waterpark - With family a must do. Super clean and safe. Take your own towel if you do not want to rent for ADH 30+. min 4-5 hours required.
Good day out. It's great fun, especially Poseidon, and the river Rapids are fantastic but I didn't think it was as good as some of the Florida parks. Reasonable value too.

Beautiful waterpark. Enter this park through the monorail which gives you the complete view of Atlantis. Do not carry any food stuff. Rides are superb and we'll maintained. We enjoyed a lot. A very good experience
Aquaventure waterpark Dubai. We went to the waterpark in October. Highseason did not start yet, so it was not crowded. We had so much fun. Well kept, lots of guards .

Great day but could have been better. The park and rides are awesome however the administration needs attention ie were not asked if we wished to load our wrists bands up with money for food and drink, found out at a till when purchasing food resulting in having to go back to locker room to collect cash and then back to main reception to load the wrists bands. Asked attendant in the park where the guide to the attractions was answer main reception - another trip. Inflatable donuts have to be carried around by yourself as opposed to Wild Wadi where they are within the attraction. Nightmare getting a taxi at 5.30 PM

good fun. My family visited here during half term. We pre booked tickets before we came.We arrived by taxi and easily found our way to the waterpark entrance. I was a bit surprised we had to queue to collect wristbands even though I'd pre booked tickets, this queue took at least 45 minutes which was unfortunate and a boring wait for our young kids. Once we collected our wrist bands we had our bag searched (didn't find my secret stash of kids snacks) and made our way in. Collected the kids life jackets from the towel cabana and attempted to find a couple of sunbeds. It was very busy and most sunbeds were taken. We eventually found 2 beds in the back row opposite the kids splash park. We loved the lazy river although I wouldn't call it lazy as it has a large section with waves that push you down and has little side sections you can go down with rapids. We loved it though and thought it was great fun. We went on shark attack which looked quite tame with a little float through a tunnel in the aquarium. The start however is fast and pitch black but great fun.Our son loved the kids splasha park which has numerous slides, buckets and sprays throwing water over you and sprayers you can control yourself. We didn't have the opportunity to go on anything else with the little kids but still had a great day. We had lunch there, 4 meals with chips and 4 drinks which was 220 aed and was reasonable. The park closed at 5.30 as it got dark then. The taxi queue to leave was awful so we decided to get the monorail which was a big mistake as had a 20 minute wait for the next one and then no taxis at the end of the line so in future would leave just before closing to avoid long taxi queue.Quite expensive for the day if you are taking young kids as you are limited to what you are able to go on but a fun day out regardless.

A great full day. We visited Aquaventure in October. A wonderful experince with the family. We enjoyed the Dolphin Bay as well as the rest of the park. Very fresh and clean and many water activities. Would advise to book in advance and arrive early. The food was a bit of a dissapointment, expensive and poor quality.

the best among the rest. From all the water parks in Dubai and Abu Dhabi I must say this was the best..
The slides were family friendly, huge area, and great view.
will come back nextym!

A great family day out. I am probably not the best to write a review as I am terrified of water and not a great swimmer. My two step daughters and husband loved it and went on every ride and slide in the park. I did go on a few rides and felt very safe. We never had to wait long to get on any slides. My only disappointment was with our meal deal we got with our ticket the food was very poor cold stale chips meat was awful in burger.

Brilliant! !!! . This waterpark was fantastic. They had rides and play areas for all ages, with sunbed areas for parents to watch their children while they play. There was also a chance to go around the whole of the park in a rubber ring, and to make it more interesting you also encountered the odd rapid adventure on your way round. A ride that lasted about 1/2 hour. Brilliant place.

Queues...Queues...Queues and Queues. First getting there is one hell of a trip, second I wanted to buy tickets and reserve a shark snorkeling activity online then after 15mnts the system crashed and gave me an error and a number to call, when I called they said that the shark activity was sold out and I have to come and buy tickets at the doors, where we saw the first Queue just to buy the tickets we waited 15mnst, and we had to pay to rent a locker which was very far from any slide or the beach and a 15mnts walk just to bring my wallet, the slides were amazing and they were a lot to try but the problem was there was no description so we got lost on the stairs as the names are confusing and no picture were presented , it’s a bit hard to know which slide you are going to, and of course 15mnts wait is the minimum for each slide, the food court was ok but the staff were very unhelpful, zip line staff were very rude and another Queue was there as well, even upon us leaving getting the taxi was the hardest part of all as the Queue was infinite, where we were forced to take a Lexus just to get out of there.

Fun fun fun. What can I say? We had fun. There are some really great family rides. The lazy river has a 'rapids' and 'torrent' section which are a laugh. It's very expensive unless you've staying at Atlantis, but Atlantis is pretty hideous so I suggest you stay someone else and put up with the cost. If it's the school holidays get here before it opens to avoid having to queue, then when it gets busy you can find ourself a sun lounger. Best thing about it is probably the Flor ice cream. Flor is one of the best gelato shops in Rome and whaddya know - they have it here too. Hardly anyone was eating it when we were there. Try the yoghurt flavour - it's heaven in a cone.

Amazing water park - great fun for kids. Aquaventure is a fun water park within the Atlantis Resorts. It can be somewhat difficult to reach given Atlantis is located at end of Palm Jumeirah.The place offers some great rides including some adrenaline filled rides like a slope into a Shark tank, one of the largest lazy rivers and even options like dive with Sharks. It is a great place to relax for a day - especially with kids.The place can seem slightly expensive though.
great waterfun. must go there, and remember to take away food along with the visitors. excellent water activity and great fun time.

Good fun for all ages. We were staying at The Atlantis so entry here was included in our package. It was very busy when we visited and so difficult to find free sun beds. However, the facilities are very good and meet the needs of all ages. Childrens life jackets are available in a variety of sizes.
Waterpark. We spent a day in the waterpark and has a great time, variety of rides for all. Don't forget your suncream!! It is huge park and you could easily spend a week in there.

The best aqua park in Dubai. I have visited all the adventures park in Dubai and also Abu Dhabi. This one is the best for families with children around 6-15. You can find here a lots of interesting slides.

Not for me . Getting there from deira is the hell od the trip. First you need to take metro,than tram and than onetrack rail. First annoying thing - after spending really a lot of money for a tickets you need to spend more - you need to pay for locker. Park is quite big, but second annoying things is there are no paths on pavement for people who are going without any shoes - so you have to choose to buy some water shoes or bring one from home otherwise you will burn your foot. Slow river is great but after burning my foot I really didn't want to spend to long time there.
A Lot of fun. It's a good water park.But the rides are not enough for me.The food is terrible and the weather is very hot in August and it can bother you.
Great water park as usual .... I really enjoyed another day at Aquaventure with the family ... All perfect a usual in a very family oriented park. Well done ... and great staff
Incredible lazy river. It's expensive for a family but great fun, kids raved about it and we'll worth getting the credit card out for !

Aquaventure. Excellent fun. Although busy, queuing not too bad. Great rides for all ages. Don't leave though without doing the major 2! Warning - getting a taxi at the end was s nightmare. Massive queue and an hour wait. Tip - leave a little earlier than closing time.

Great waterpark BUT...... We had a great day out at Aquaventure! Slides for everyone and the lazy river is really handy for getting to and from different rides. Loads of lifeguards and staff around who are very helpful and friendly. Food choices are a bit limited apart from the usual fast food selection. The only issue was leaving the park. We left an hour before closing and made our way to the taxi queue. It ended up taking well over an hour to get a taxi. I'd hate to think what it was like for people in the back of the queue...quite an embarrassment for such a great venue and for a city like Dubai. Judging by reviews it seems like this happens all the time so surely they should do something about it!!
Great fun . Highly recommended for a group of friends or families. Loads to keep you occupied for a day. Lots of places to eat and drink. We really enjoyed our day here and would defiantly go back

Expensive but fun. I managed to get free entry because it was my birthday during the week we visited which was useful because it is very expensive. There are lots of fun slides to go on as an individual, in pairs or as a group. We did have to queue for most of the rides but the queues did go down quite quickly and you are in the shade while you queue. There is a nice real sandy beach area in the park which was good to use as a base. We bought food in the park and the costs were actually quite reasonable and there was a good choice, mostly 'fast food' though.

Good fun!. Lots of fun in the waterpark. Lots of life guards every where making it safe for children to go round alone. Good variety of rides. Photos ridiculously expensive - don't bother, just take your GoPro!

Good fun. Recently took my my family to the park, my son is 9 and he absolutely loves the rapids and lazy river. The park is large and takes approx 40-50 mins to do a circuit in the lazy river. There are lots of places to relax and then get into a lagoon to start the Rapids. There is with all these places a large queue to get onto the other rides but you are always moving. The restaurants are nice and the food quality especially for a child's meal is good, they all seem to come with fruit as well.The only gripe I had about the water park was on leaving, there were precious few taxi's outside and a large queue. We were staying in the palm and decided to start walking and flag down a taxi, this was a lot cheaper than the hotel cars at a minimum of 90Dhrs even for a 2 mile ride. I worked out that if staying on the palm then it would still be quicker and cheaper to get the mo oral back to Jumeriah and then get a taxi back to the hotel.
Great family day out. great place to spend a day with the family and kids. The older the kids the more you will be able to experience together.

Excellent family fun day!. This waterpark was fantastic.We used a buy one get one free voucher from the entertainer book, which kept the price down.We got there at opening time and had no problem in getting sun beds.We went on the lazy river/Rapids first and had such an amazing time, we probably stayed on them for about an hour they are certainly different!The family raft rides are a must, really good fun.The queues were fine, and nearly all of them were in the shade which was welcome in the heat. Plenty of food outlets but as expected slightly on the pricey side.We took the palm monorail back to Dubai centre which was easy and had good views.Overall we had a great time and would love to go again.

Worth a visit!. My son and I had a great day here. The park is clean and well run. The rides are well stewarded and it all felt safe but fun. Prices of drinks/food etc weren't too bad/broadly comparable to UK theme parks. The only snag was the taxi line for getting home. We left the park before closing and joined the queue before it looked too bad - still took over an hour and a half to reach the front. Maybe we were unlucky but taxis were very sporadic. If you can arrange alternative transportation for the end of the day, do so.

Brilliant waterpark. Excellent day out for all the family. We had teenagers with us but there are slides and water areas for all ages. River Rapids were really good, fast slides awesome! Use the lockers at the main entrance as other lockers are at far end of park. Bought the meal deal on entry which was good value, but there were limitations on choice in the food area, but it's all fast food so no big deal anyway. Only problem was leaving the park the queue for taxis was 60 minutes, either leave early or use the metro, if that is convenient for you.
Brilliant water park. We were on free entrance to the park, as we were staying at the Palm. Excellent day out, must recommend that visitors get there early as it gets very busy late morning onwards.
Good day out. Great day out here - massive place - loads of rides - good fun in the sun.Perhaps a little expensive but well worth visiting if your in Dubai.

Amazing. An amazing day with family and friends, one of the best days out in a while! They offer things to do for everyone, fast slides, kids area, rapids and even just sunbathing! The lifeguards and staff make the experience even more enjoyable, funny and helpful! Highly worth the money!
must do for children and adults. excellent experience for children and adults both as lot of ride options....rides for small kids also.

Crazily Awesome!. Beautiful surroundings. Huge Place, Very busy waterpark. Crazy slides! You wouldn't think you are in the Middle east. There are no pools where you can just relax and swim in. Other activities are way too expensive.
Just great. Safe, exciting day for young and big kids.No real queues, food, drinks quite good and plenty of sun loungers.

Adventure at its BEST. Well Maintained, Well Engineered, Best adventitious Rides.
Its Dubai - Beach, beach sand and then well Maintained Grass.
This Park has the best rides - leap of faith is one of it.
Downfall - too much of waiting. be prepared, be patient.
swim attire is a MUST - cotton shirts and shorts not allowed.
A lot of hype.. There are better waterparks in UAE. Only 2 or 3 decent rides here. Directions to various parts of the park are very confusing and misleading.
Best waterpark in Middle East. Fantastic rides, attentive lifeguards, beautiful surroundings. Best place for a relaxing day and a great escape from routine.
Awesome. Awesome. Went on a birthday and was given free access during that week for one visit. Just take passport and print off the voucher from their site.

FUN. So I went with my husband and 2 kids. We absolutely enjoyed and had the time of our lives. The water park was hugee getting lost like two times but I had the map with me so it was okay. The slides were fast and really tall so we had to walk up stairs to get to this one ride but it was really fun. The downside was the waiting in the que since it was really busy. It was a blazing, summer day so we had some ice cream as well. Love this water park, my favourite for sure

Great water park. - Friday and Saturday is the weekend in dubai. Try to avoid if possible-the line for a taxi between 4 and 6pm is very long as everyone exits the park, and this is the time in dubai with the least taxis (as the shifts change). We left at 3.40 and had no line. Worth it for a quick escape. -lockers are expensive 40 dirham so try to bring just one bag with everything in it-food was insanely expensive. A burger was 55 dirham with no chips!!!!- bring a water proof camera or a water proof pouch for your camera. You can also buy or rent these here.- there's an option to put money on to your wristband and use this to pay for everything while you're inside. Very handy because no wet money. You can easily redeem any unused money when you exit the park- book online in advance to save money!! You can then present your phone/screen shot when you arrive to get entry. AMAZING water park with EXCELLENT rides and extremely clean and safe. Highly recommend
Awesome and huge. Very huge water park, lots of amazing rides. The crazy river is also fun. Different towers for different types of rides. The kids splash pool is fun for toddlers

Good fun. We visited the waterpark while in Dubai. We were torn between which one waterpark to go to but decided on this one as it has the tank you go through with the views of the sharks. Plus we wanted to see the Atlantis hotel.Great waterpark. My other half loved the slides they had there and the rapids were great fun.There is also a beach you can chill out on.You have to buy a locker there if you want to store anything and this is done on a wristband which you swipe to get in and out of your locker. They werent cheap though and im sure you dont get the money back from the locker as you pay to rent them. You can also put money on a wristband to buy drinks/food etc with and this is a good idea so you dont need to carry money around with you. Any money left on the band you can go and get this refunded back to you.The only thing that was annoying about this place was getting a taxi after you left, the queue was like an hour long. We tried getting a taxi further up the road by the Atlantis but that didnt work as they wouldnt stop on the road. In the end we hired a private car which wasnt to much money but saved waiting for ages for a taxi.

Loads of fun. We went on a Saturday which meant there was a lot if people so for each slide we had to queue for at least 30 mins, for the most popular rides it went to 40 mins. But it definitely was worth the wait, the slides are really good and you will have fun guarantied. As soon as you enter try to cover the most crowded ones so you will have some time to relax a long the channels. Try to leave before the park closes to avoid having to wait for a taxi

Great fun. My kids saw me laugh! A fantastic day out and the kids had an amazing time It was so much fun and the pool was fab The canteens were a bit odd - they should be sheltered in that heat! Puts anyone in a bad mood queueing in heat like that! But was an amazing day Must must tryMy kids are 5 and 7 and they were perfect for it!!

Best waterpark in dubai - no doubt! . Went here with my wife - we're both 25 years old. I have been to wild wadi a few years ago. This place is better in every way hands down! It is bigger - A LOT bigger!! The atmosphere is better the rides are better the place is better. Its a great way to experience Atlantis and its just an amazing place to visit!

We had a great day. We were at 10 in the park and there were hardly any ques. The attractions were great, both for children and adults. It was very nice to sit in the shade of the coconut trees at the beach. Besides that there was a Starbucks, with nice cold drinks. Unfortunately their food was sold out during lunch time.When we left around 5:45 there were no taxis and people were queuing, make sure that you leave a bit earlier!

amazing fun waterpark. amazing slides in an amazing setting...great for all ages. My favourite bits were the slide through the aquarium tank which was magical. the lazy river is the longest I have ever been on and fun and relaxing. a bonus was the real beaches you could spend time on and it was great to get a chance to swim in the sea around the palm. amazing day!

A "q" venture. The title says it all.Endless lines for all rides/slides and even for the online booking redemption.Reasinably good slide rides with one or two exclusive ones.Very few food outlets with limited choices.The "tubes/swimrings" have to be carried along till the fourth or fifth floor of each tower - that was a put-off. Some waterparks have automatic belts which bring the tubes to the boarding area - that was missing here.Overall a good way to spend a day in the heat of Dubai; albeit an expensive affair also.If u have kids along - don't think twice - they WILL enjoy. Not exactly a "romantic" destination for couples - so if thats ur idea - think of what else u can do.Overall i would rate it a 3/5

Very crowded, nice for families and kids. Had an amazing day, but it was very crowded during the weekend, there is a package for 330 AED per person including a sandwich, you have to pay additional 40 AED for the locker, the view is really beautiful, there is shops out if you forgot a flipflop or sun cream... but the prices are astronomically.Most of the whole adventure i really enjoyed, but by the closing time at 18H you will face a big issue with the showers, i should say that it's not smart to have just few (around 10 probably) in a very small area , with all that crowd, it took me more than 25 min to just enter to shower for 3 min and a huge queue were waiting !!
A fun day out. Great place for a day out in the water - many great rides and lazy river is complex with lots of options

A great day out but some important things to consider .... This really is a fun day out for all ages but there are some important things to consider...1. Cost is 310 dirhams (£54 approx) for adults and 265 dirhams (£46 approx) for children so not exactly cheap!!2. Majority of the water rides have a minimum height restriction of 1.2m.3. Rather than taking in cash you can top up your wrist band at the ticket booths with money and use it in the park. Any money left on the wristband is refunded at the end of the day. Saves you getting your dirhams wet!!4. Buy a waterproof phone pouch. Cost approx 120 dirhams (£21) but allows you to take your phone with you into the water rides and take pictures etc. definitely worth getting.5. A locker will cost you 40 dirhams. One locker enough for two people. Anything more than that and you will need another locker.6. Towels are charged at 30 dirhams so just take your own and keep it on one of the sunbeds around the park.7. The ground gets RED HOT so take your flip flops with you or you will be hot footing around the park when you're out of the water which isn't good.8. Don't bother with the 'taste the fun' meal deal ticket. It saves you 25dirhams but you're restricted where you can eat (barracudas and shark bites) and they have massive queues for lunch. Just eat at the food booths around the park and use your topped up wrist band to pay.9. Get there early and you can save queuing on the rides. I didn't really queue on anything, however it was a Wednesday. 10. Avoid going on a Friday or Saturday, I have heard it is very busy because it's the weekend in Dubai.11. When it's time to leave you will queue over an hour for a taxi. Very frustrating when you've had a long day. This is for two reasons. The city taxis change shifts between 4pm and 6pm so it is difficult to get a taxi anyway and second reason is everyone leaves at the same time. Best advise for transport is either try and leave before 3.30pm or just book a private taxi in advance and arrange a pick up time (that's what I did and my car was waiting for me). Cost me a little extra but definitely worth it when I saw the taxi queue at 5.30pm!!10. There is also a beach there too so worth checking out.Any questions let me know.Enjoy your day
Amazing Day. Had a wonderful day at the water park. Not so crowded so was relatively easy to get to your desired ride. Place very clean and well maintained.

Too expensive for Dated Waterpark. Went here when it first opened and had wow factor but now seems very expensive to get in for family of five and once you are in park they certainly know how to charge.Also watched lots of arguments due to lack of rubber rings.Actually bit of a let down.

Full on fun. We stopped here on our first day in Dubai and It was absolutely amazing. you do have to pay for lockers to store your belongings as there is no where to really keep them but there are so many adrenaline filled slides and for those who just want to relax they have that covered as well. On a not so busy day it took us 6 hours to go on every ride once, so if you have children account for at least 2 days :)

Awesome rides but food is expensive. We paid for dolphin adventure so had free entry to the waterparkWe paid extra for lockers and at the kiosk I asked them to top up credit on my wristband as I did not want to carry cash around. The machine was down so it took them about 20 mins to load up. Food is pretty expensive and not the best quality. But there is a wide selection of fast food outlets insideThis is by far the best waterpark in this area. The rides are well manned. As expected queues form at the popular rides. I personally just loved sitting in the float with my son floating around to wherever the river takes us. The floor is pretty hot in summer so you may want to take your flip flops with you but then you have the hassle of picking them up after the rides.If you have to buy tickets to this place; towels and lockers are separately charged so quite expensiveIt closes quite early at 6pm ( sunset) and you can take a buggy back to the entranceAll in all a fun day out

I love this place - and hate it.... The water aspects of the park are mostly great - staff, were really welcoming and helpful.The huge caveat - 1) dining facilities are really weak, 2) the exit - whether via taxi or monorail is ridiculous - there's no efficient alternative (perhaps driving is ok?) - it's either wait in line for 60 minutes or pay triple the taxi fare or take an expensive, inefficient monorail, 3) and the co-location with Atlantis is absolutely orchestrated to make anyone not staying at the resort feel second-rate. To use a mass market comparison - if you go to Disney, you generally feel great (or at least not like pond-scum), regardless of whether you stay at the Swan and Dolphin, at least they don't go out of their way to make the day visitors feel like they are not wanted. Regrettably, this facility seems deliberately set up to make non-resort guests feel unwelcome. Weird and ultimately not good business.Atlantis, and their property Aquaventure, absolutely miss the mark hereNot sure that there's a better water park alternative, but set your expectations accordingly. If you're at the hotel, you're probably great, if not, be prepared to be meat.

Aquaventure Waterpark, amazing Waterrides. The Waterpark is amazing because of the slides. The rides are crazy and kind of scary at the first time but you will get used to it and it's a lot of fun! You have to try the Zoomerango at the Tower of Neptune! It scared the hell out of me but it was sooo fun!!
Fantastic experience. All the family loved this experience... The waterpark is beautifully maintained, the staff could not have been more charming or helpful and the rides were excellent.

Rude rude rude. I have been to Spore and Hong Kong and this far has one of the rudest staff ever, specially a person called Roshan at Tower of Poseidon. The waiting for taxi is about 90mins and this is the worst which can happen if you are with kids. I would suggest to try Wild Wadi

Awesome adventure. Great place to visit with family. Travelers if you can visit during the week it would be best. We went on a Friday and the lines were not too bad. The beach was empty and the water was still. I loved it. Bring your own towels or be charged to rent it. The zip line was fun. Overall my family had a great time. Traveling this time of year is also considered the cooler time, off season. Weather was hot but not too unbearable at all just humid.

Possibly the best, but flawed. We were staying at the Atlantis hotel so got in a few minutes before the general public.Busy after 13:00 to the point where it isn't fun anymore.Some parts of the lazy river were closed for a large part of our 10 day stay. A couple of the premiere water rides were not working too.There were some irritating things like no Yoghurt was delivered for most of the week, so smoothies were a bit odd.Smoking is permitted in the park, but only near the obvious waste bins. SomeGuests ignored this, but staff were happy to politely remind them of the rules.If you don't have a bed by 11:00, you have a search on your hands.Some reserved areas are available for 800AED per day. They can be booked in advance, which gets round the whole issue.The park is divided into three main let's. A lazy river, which isn't very lazy with plenty of rapids. A circuit is about 40 minutes.There is the tower of Neptune and Tower of Poseidon. The "leap of faith" is the most vertical ride and opens when the park does and is in Neptune. Poseidon has some big group rides, but opens at 11:00.There is a zip line that has three sections and buying a ticket for 75AED, means you can ride as many times as you like.We didn't eat in the park, but there are plenty of snack food places to choose from.There are lockers when you enter the park, but the consensus was they were expensive and neither we nor anyone weMet had had a problem and provided you take sensible precautions, it would probably be OK.Don't forget toKeep electronic gear out of the direct sunlight, as they will fry.

Such a fun day out. Amazing water park. We had a fantastic day at Aquaventure. It is expensive to get in, but most large water parks around the world are. The only downside was queuing for almost two hours for a taxi back to our hotel at the end of the day.

Great slides and lazy river. This water park was awesome. Two main adventurous towers, one with 8 slides and one with 4 slides. Tried everything except the glass bottom vertical drop. Lazy river had a rapid section and a wave section. Brilliant. Lots of lounging areas. Food average. Bring your own.

Excellent rides - frustrating paperwork/organisation. We had a great visit to Aquaventure that could have been much better without some really daft paperwork ideas. Firstly they offer a free entry if it's your birthday week. Worth knowing and search their website to see how to get the voucher. They then need you to print the voucher which is often pretty hard to do on holiday. The ticket office pointed us to the hotel business centre which was a 15 minute walk away in the Atlantis hotel. We enjoyed seeing the hotel but this was very frustrating as most places will accept a view of the email on screen? We then bough a meal deal which needed us to take the paper recipe to be able to redeem even though it was noted on our wristbands. Paper receipts don't work well in a water park!!The rides were excellent and pretty well organised. The queues at the furthest away rides were less and moved faster as they had larger capacities!Finally being at the end of the Palm Jumeirah, there is not a greta deal of passing trade for taxis so we had an hour wait at the end of the day. Organised buses to the nearest metro or other convenient location would have been great.

Very bad organisation - go to other water parks. We booked our tickets in advance but still had to queue for an hour to be told we then had to go and print the tickets out despite them being on my phone. After we complained to the manager they checked their system and found our tickets. It's not a very well organised or signposted park, maps to carry around with you would be useful. I would try the other water parks before this, we spent a lot of money to get in and our day was not a good experience. Food was overpriced and not very healthy.

Great day trip. Really good day. Bit of a queue to collect pre booked tickets and by time we got in not too many deck chairs left. But simple to use lockers and loads of good slides, with lots leading to different aspects of a lazy river (which itself contains different mini rides like torrents and rapids) which helps to elongate a lot of the rides. Poseidon's revenge is great and not like anything have seen at other water parks. Also the shark attack slide which takes you through a tunnel running through the centre of a shark tank is great. Decent range of food (we went back into atlantis hotel to eat at The Burger Joint.) quite expensive but great day and way to chill out when weather so hot. There were queues on rides for most of day though.

Very Good. When we went it was extremely hot, more than usual for that time of the year. Ensure you have water shoes on, not flip flips, as the ground on the paths was soo hot that it burnt your feet as you left one slide to go back to get your flip flips or to the next ride.

Love it! Want to go back. Great day at Aquaventure. Did all the rides many times over and loved every one. If you're going I really recommend going early so you have the pick of the rides without queues. We went in September once things had begun to cool down for Winter and yet the middle of the day was a little toastie. I would really recommend not doing this in summer as you run the risk of seriously overheating!

Day out. Enjoyed a lot at the aqua venture park. The aquarium is definitely not worth visiting. You do get lost in away that it ends abruptly and it's called the lost chambers. An over rated place in Dubai.

Fun in the Sun. A great family fun day. The water slides are a great way to cool off in the hot Dubai sun. You don't have to be a guest at Atlantis to go you can visit when ever you want. There's a train that will drop you off right in front of the park.

Fun. Had a fab day at this place. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful. If you are staying at the hotel do make use of the buggy cart service that can transport you for free to various stop points. Food costs here are like any other adventure park you would go to in the UK so yes the prices are inflated.Would definitely recommend the adult rides however some are not for the faint hearted!!
Been to far better. Not impressed and had to pay £20 for lockers even though we were staying at hotel not as advertised .

thrilling. very nice and advanced and big water park, has many many water sliders and other thrilling activities, a bit crowded as you need to wait between 20-40 minutes to access some games, but its worth it! highly recommended.

Best waterpark in Dubai. This waterpark is perfect for families! Either if you want to experience the rides or relax at the beach, it has everything!
Try to get one of their offers with the Entertainer or any other vouchers, you might end up paying half price!

The Adventure with the dolphins. One of the most amazing experiences for family fun. However, the time for dolphins was scheduled for one hour so we thought we would have ample time to go on all the slides in the water park. The Adventure took about two hours all together. We only went on two slides because if the long questions. So plan on going early and the park closes at 5:30.
Amazing!. We had a brilliant day at the waterpark and found it good value for money. There were enough slides and rides to keep you entertained all day. Everything was clean and tidy.
Outstanding. Aquaventure offers fun for the whole family and is very clean and well kept and with professional staff. Not to be missed.

Full day fun...... The most advised place to visit if you are in Dubai, this will require one full day to explore this place with fun filled water rides and activities. Children will surely enjoy this.

Best day of my Birthday week. I went there on 23rd October 2015 for the first time ever in my life. Just walked through the ticket line and waited for my turn. When I reached to the counter, showed them my birthday voucher and got the pass.. I even got the access to the voucher. But seems like there was some problem in the system, as I tried opening the locker, it took so much tries to scan. And when it was scanned, it opeend a locker, where there was already someone's bag. I went back to the counter to talk about it. Which utilized so much of my time. Though inside overall experience was good. But your staff in the zipline were often rude when I didnt know what to do when they were fixing the rope harness around me, one was Indian and other was I think from Phillipines or Nepal. I admit it was my first time on the zipline too, but they should be humble enough too. But I wont deduct this point from the water park as this is issue with the staff. Kindly proper train them on how to behave with the visitors. Food was OK. But too less for the price of 45 AED.And the gift shop items are too expensive...Overall the experience was good, will come back again. But please train the Indian and Nepalese staff of zipline to behave.

Happy Birthday to me. I was issued with a free pass because it was my birthday, we had brought our 8 year old nephew and I was,nt expecting to enjoy it however what a 53rd birthday treat it was the most thrilling birthday I've ever had. Would highly recommend anybody of any age to come here

Great fun way to spend the day. Although expensive, this is a must do experience when in Dubai, it is one of the best water parks in the world, with a huge lazy river, and a great number of fun rides, ranging from easy to very hard.Book your tickets online to avoid the queues and make sure to rent a locker with a combo towel.

Good but not great... It's worth the visit if you have not been before, there are a few rides but nothing amazing apart from 1 that sinks you down and through the shark tunnel!All in all it's overpriced but worth heading down once to see the views of Atlantis, kids would love it!

Great water park -clean and modern. Extensive water park with great rides to suit everyone. We enjoyed the Aquaconda ride among others. The lazy river was not so lazy at times as there are chutes every now and again and also some gentle rapids. Nothing scary but definitely makes it interesting and fun. The park is well laid out with a nice beach if you want to get away from the rides for a bit. Very easy access for Atlantis hotel guests. Overall, well worth a visit.
Amazing Attraction park ..... One of the best water park i have been to ...Large choice of Activities and Try the drop attraction a must....

The best slides in the world!. Aquaventure is simply amazing! I visited 5 years ago but since then they have now practically doubled the size of the park! For families there are big adventure play areas, lazy rivers and tame slides, but for those who like adrenaline rushes you also have the Leap of Faith which is a 60 ft near vertical slide taking you straight through the shark tank, or the new Poseidon's revenge where the floor drops from under you to send you shooting through the shute! There are also additional actvities you can chose to do as well, such as walking on the floor of the shark tank (this is at an additional charge) or even just relaxing on the private beach that's also attached to the park. We managed to just about do every ride in a 7 hour stay. A couple of tips- the floor is extremely hot, so keep your flip flops on while walking round the park- they let you carry them on the rides so you don't blister your feet like we did! Oops! Also due to the heat they will allow you to bring up to a litre of water per person into the park- i highly recommend doing this as even though refreshments are readily available, it will save you a bit of money!

Lovely day. So much to do and see definitely a jam packed fun filled day! Reasonably priced, but take your own towels/food/drink save yourself a fortune. A lot of people wore shoe type things as the park floor is incredibly hot!! If we returned we would 100% first of all go find a sunbed and leave some water there, as we left everything in locker due to not knowing the layout etc my poor mother got sun stroke!! Make sure you have plenty to drink and cover up it gets super hot! Apart from that brilliant day out for all ages. Will return on my travels.

Absolutely brilliant! . Absolutely brilliant enjoyed every moment of this visit! We were staying in a neighbouring hotel and was very easy to get here! The only negative I would say is with most places like this the food and drink inside was very expensive but what do you expect I suppose! Other than that iid love to go back!!

Best thing about this was the sting ray feeding. The water park was nice but I feel like it'd be better for kids - I thought the chairs were a bit naff for the price you pay to get in and our lockers took forever to unlock. I did however pre book a sting ray feeding experience and that was just amazing. The staff were brilliant and it was such an amazing thing to experience. Totally worth the money.

The best waterpark in Dubai. Great fun for adults and kids alike! My advice is to visit on a weekday and get there when it opens (10am). Do all the big slides early on before the crowds roll in, because it does get very busy and queues start to form.Head over to the Tower of Poseidon for a quieter place to get sunbeds and chill out.
Dreamy. It was fantastic but crowded then we spent a lot of time to the rank of ticket, locker ,.. And rank of every hobbies.when time goes out , we didnt use all of hobbies unfortunatly.

West side Italian beach side dining.. 7th October:After the water park and a magnificent swim in the sea we had lunch, dripping wet at this restaurant. The name escapes me, but its on the West side of The Atlantis and offers Italian cuisine, where as the East side offers Mexican. The service and food was great. We did not feel pushed into purchasing anything we did not want (happened at the East side) and felt very comfortable and welcomed. Excellent beach side/pool side dining with fabulous staff. Congrats!
Full of fun. This aqua park is a real "must try" one. There are many different attractions for both small children and for adults including extreme actions.

Time at the Alantis waterpark. Ok, having been here before it is not as expected. Service was down and Lea ing by taxi or limo results in over an hour long wait when park closes. Average cost is 500 AED for dat trip including food before dolphin swim extras etc which is approx per person £100 . So pricey for . This is for teenagers as well as adults . Plus expect an up to an hour long wait for taxis or limos on leaving the Atlantis waterpark which I was extremely disappointed with as no one knew what they where doing. Concierge was so unhelpful even after explaining young children and pregnant women where queuing and Al they needed to do was call taxi central line it seemed beyond them. Worst customer service In Dubai ever and least value for money.

Awesome. Spent 3 days in here and staying at the hotel meant it was only a golf buggy ride away! Wristbands were obtained from Club room reception and you could go in as many times as you wanted, with the golf buggy to take you back to the hotel when you had finished.

Lots to do!. The longest and most advanced 'lazy river/ rapids' I have ever been on a great ride for all the family to enjoy. The bigger slides are good fun and the set up of the whole place is amazing, you can just walk around the place and be amazed. The best thing is just how safe everything is, we placed our belongings on the beach and sun bathed, then decided to walk around the entire place for hours and came to back to find our bags perfectly fine. Apparently this is normal which is a pleasant surprise.

Fun slides and beautiful surroundings. This water park is great fun for anyone who loves an adrenalin rush, as well as for those of us who prefer the more quiet "lazy rivers". The park has an intricate weave of rivers that range from quiet to class 3 rafts. Lots of fun, and lifeguards every 50 meters minimum. The beach is beautiful, as well as the entire water park. It is very well maintained.We also did the zipline which is new this year I believe. It's 100 dirhams, with unlimited number of rides, so it might be worth doing this as one of the first things, and the revisit later in the day.

OMG AMAZEBALLS. If you are in Dubai - make sure you go here no matter what your age, its fab to look at , ride on or what everbook a cabbana for the day and jump in - plan for a whole day from opening to closing and just enjoy itoutrageous fun

Worth a visit if you've got the money & time spare. My boyfriend & I (mid 20's) visited Atlantis Water Park for my birthday in July. Pro's: Huge area with so many different rides (most are for the thrill-seeker!). During off-peak season there was hardly anyone there so we could jump straight on any rides we wanted. Be warned there are LOTS of stairs to get to any of the rides. We used Uber to get there & right throughout our trip which saved us a lot of money. Great electronic locker system in the toilets to store your items in while you're in the park. Loved the crushed ice cones to stay cool, & they had a stall selling some kind of meat & cheese wraps which were amazing. Cons: Firstly, look up costs as the entire place is expensive to get in. We didn't get there till 4pm & the price was the same as being there all day, they closed at 7pm. We went in July so it was extremely hot & unfortunately all the pools were hotter than air temperature which wasn't very refreshing. I had cotton shorts that I wear as board-shorts & was not permitted in the pool as they were not allowed - it was my birthday & I was worried I wouldn't be able to buy board shorts my size so this was extremely upsetting & I cried quite a lot but thankfully found some board shorts that fit from one of the stores. countless flights of stairs to any of the rides, also have to carry up tubes for a lot of them. (good way to tire the kids out I guess) Wear shoes around as ground can get very hot. Summary: Worth it if you've got a large part of a day to spend & money isn't much of an issue, Would recommend if you have kids 8-18 as they would get the most out of the rides. I personally wouldn't go here again unless I was staying at the Atlantis Hotel but it was still good to have seen.

Great FUN for families!. We had a great time in the waterpark! The entrance fee in our opinion was too expensive but the Drinks and Foods' prices inside were reasonable! Ugh, they took our Doritos - I felt bad about that !!!!

Great for kids and adults. a perfect balance of rides and activities for kids and scarier rides for adults. Immaculate and extremely helpful and friendly staff. Very safe with loads of lifeguards every few feet

Definitely do this!. The waterpark is fantastic with a range of rides for young and old. The family favourite was Neptune's slide.They have lockers available for valuables, but I would recommend taking a plastic cover with some cash and a card in case you want to buy refreshments and food. Unless of course you're staying at the hotel in which case you can charge to your room.

That's a really wow!. I have visited many water parks but that is really amazing. During my business trip I had a half day to enjoy and I had fantastic time. I had a free entrance because of my birthday! Remember to get a locker with a towel combo!

Best water park in this universe. Situated inside one of the best hotels (Atlantis) of this world. A day in aquaventure will make you speachless. During my last visit in January 2013 I missed an opportunity to visit this hotel and park due to less number of days in Dubai. This time I went for 7 nights and chose aquaventure park on my last day in Dubai as i wanted to have the memories last longer. I have been to many waterparks across the globe but found this one as the best waterparks till now. 1. Rapids in the pool will make you feel adventurous and full of thrill. 2. Leap of faith slide will take you to next level. The one you cannot forget your life. 3. Other water slides are scary as they are in dark and ends inside the aquarium but are fun.4. Small slides made for children but elders also enjoy these a lot due to new style and it let's you to be with your children.5. Atlantis beach. You get your access to Atlantis beach which is out of this world. This beach is connected with Burj al Arab beach and gives you a great and beautiful view. No beach can stand its beauty.6. Dolphin bay 7. Multiple food outlets. To conclude I would recommend every person to visit Dubai just for this waterpark. You will feel awesome and you will be speachless after your visit.Few suggestions for the management:1. Slippers should be provided inside the waterpark for all visitors. People not carrying their slippers feels very uncomfortable due to immense heat on the floor with bare foot and even scratches your visit. If cannot provide then it should be strictly mentioned in the vouchers to carry your own slippers. The cost is very high for a general slipper inside the waterpark which was around 169 aed (minimum) which is around 3000 rupees. These slippers would cost no more than 10 aed in general market. 2. Complimentary Towel should be given to every customer visiting the waterpark as I don't understand the reason to charge 30 aed extra for a single towel. The ticket is already 315 aed which should include general stuff. 3. Complimentary access to lockers. Currently, 40 aed is being charged for a locker which is very small. I could not even fit a normal backpack inside the locker easily. That's just not fair from the managements point of view.If these actions are taken and considered then I assure you that this water park would be the bestest park and would enter its name in book of records not just because of its rides and slides also because of its service. One should not forget that tourism is dependent on customers and customers are not dependent on tourism.

Great experience!. Had a great experience but the food was too costly and it is not allowed to bring food inside so you better prepare your wallet or you should full your stomach first before you go there.

Release your inner child. Fantastic day out at the waterpark. Felt like a kid again running around with the excitement of going down BIG slides! A couple great knee jerkers, the leap of faith and the drop! The drop didn't have much of a q, thats when you know its a scary one. Stand in a little box and hear a 5 second countdown, next thing the ground disappears from underneath you and you are off!!! Nice beaches to relax on aswell if not into the slides which maybe they could use a couple more of. Everything extremely expensive once inside. Can imagine a family day out being expensive.
Busy and happy all day. It has something for everyone and little buggies that move you from one area to another if required. There are little food stalls around with reasonable prices.

A must do. Had a great day at the water park. Impressed with the abundance of lifeguards who actively moved in and out of the water checking that children were safe.Different options and routes on lazy river was fun and water slides slick.Go on a non weekend day to avoid queues on slides.

Go and get splashed. Liked getting there early. The cheerfull staff. Make sure you wear jelly shoes as the ground gets hot hot hot and it's funny watching people hopping aroundDisliked they had one part that was closed
Wonderful for kids. My 3 year daughter enjoyed the park to the fullest. The slides, lazy river were just apt. However being in a 5 star hotel the food cost is too high.

Excellent Day Out!. We visited the waterpark whilst staying in The Atlantis hotel. This gave us free entry, otherwise it is quite expensive to get in. It also allowed us to arrange our entrance wristbands in the hotel, which was good, as the entry to the park was very busy, with long queues. The staff were also not very helpful as we entered, as no-one mentioned we needed to pay for a locker at the entrance, so I had to go back to get a wristband for that.Once inside the park we found it to be spacious and well laid out in the way it cleverly spread people out, although this was outside the main holiday period and the larger rides look set up for handling big queues, so I reckon it could be much more congested in the busiest parts of the holiday season. The rides themselves were all very good and my 7 year old loved the whole experience and as he was over 1.2m tall, he could go in every one. A problem came on the lazy river / rapids however, as unused rings carry on down the ride and when they get to narrow points, they cluster together and block any movement. This means that riders have to get off their rings to clear the blockages, while the lifeguards watch from the side (often laughing at the congestion). If the lifeguards are not allowed to enter the water for routine matters then the park should provide marshals who can help keep things moving. The children's play area was also great fun and suitable for kids from very young ages up to pre-teen. Just a word of warning too. There is plenty of shade around the park, but the lazy river and many of the queues are out in the sun, so you can be exposed for extended periods. Make sure you use lots of sunscreen and have footwear and a hat to protect yourself (I tucked my flip flops and hat into the back of my shorts or UV shirt on rides and held onto my sunglasses which worked fine).We had a great couple of days in the park and had no major complaints and I would recommend this attraction as exhausting fun for families looking for a full day out in Dubai. We all slept very well after visiting.

Very crowded, little bit expensive and very fun. The price for enter was a little bit to much. You also have to pay for transport out to the palm and then for lockers and towels if you need it. The attractions was fantastic, but too much time spent waiting in line. Food inside was also very expensive. The Beach was Nice and clean.

Leap of Fate. One of the Scariest water slides I have been on but its a must try. Its 60 ft ride, its an adrenaline rush, it will only take around 20 seconds to reach the bottom. Good Luck !!! Scary but worth it.

Family Fun getaway. We visited during the start of the Eid holidays, and it was quote busy but still a good venue for kids.The only downside is that the bathrooms need to have more staff to clean with the amount of footfall they experience. When the park can accommodate such a large crowd, they should really expand the number of changing rooms/showers.

A fun day out no matter how old you are!. We had a great day at Aquaventure. Perhaps the most endearing part of the trip was that it offered something for everyone. The kids (11 - 14yrs) were completely safe going off on the water rides, the ladies were happy on the lazy river and the beach and the men could mess about and pretend to be teenagers again! It was incredibly clean and seemed to offer different experiences depending on your budget, with the people in front of us making good use of vouchers. Next time we will look at some of the different things to do besides the rides, but it was a fun, safe, laughter-filled day out for all the family where you can stay and play all day long.
Waterfun at 35°C. A beautiful park with a wide range of activities and beach access and if wished with butler service. The only disadvantage is that you have to line up a long time for some slides.
Good aquarium. Good aquarium not very big but vaity of fishes is good and the tunnel you can walk in and many seats to rest and enjoy the fish around

A must if u got kids. Reception well organize. Do, reserve from ur hotel, its cheaper, and almost no wait in line once u get there. Take ur towels, unless u want to pay a bit extra for towels. Lockers have to be rented, take a small one, unless u a large family. Rides were great, wait line depends what time u there. We had no problems. Our, 7 year old loved it. Its great for adults as well. There is a beach there, so u can go and relax. Yea the food and drinks r more expensive, but its all the same in all other parks like this across the globe. Plenty of shade. We had a blast. The only negative is the taxi wait line, which u have if you leave once the park closes. You can take train but, there is not a direct line, so a change over is a must. We had to wait about 40 minutes for a taxi, because, so many ppl were leaving at the same time.
"Best of Dubai". A whole day at Aquaventure Waterpark is the best i spent. Too much rides & activity of Aquaventure Waterpark make a big name.

Julie. We recently visited Aquaventure Waterpark which was fab, it has a few things that may need addressing but all in all a very enjoyable day. On entry into the water park you get a wristband (for everything), we opted to take the pre paid wristband so we didn't have to mess about with cash or anything. We used the money in the wristband, but we had to go back to the entrance to top up the band, which is a nightmare as your already in the park!! When i asked to top up i was told that we cant top up, we have to have another wristband? I already had an entrance, locker, and prepaid wristband on, so i now have four wristband on....nightmare. On entry we opted for the towel hire too which is great, but your towel hire receipt is a paper till receipt, and when you but this you are advised that if you loose the reciept you cant exchange your towels?? We opted for the meal deal, great value for money a definite must. We purchased the meal deal were you have a variety of restaurants to use. We ate at the "sharks bay" restaurant and was just perfect. We had the burger and chips deal and it was huge.The staff in the restaurant were very polite, professional and very very helpful. Nothing was a problem it was a pleasure to be served by efficient and professional staff..excellent service in the restaurants well done :-) The water park itself, is immaculate. Its not huge and not many rides but we loved it, we had a fab day and i would highly recommend it and the meal deal is a must, fantastic value for money.

Amazing Slides, Very Hot Water, Pay for Towels. I have visited both the Wild Wadi and Aquaventure and there are bonuses to each. Aquaventure has a nice balance of relaxing, fun and thrilling choices. My top recommendation is that if you are thinking about the Leap of Faith, DO IT! Major downside would be they charge for towels and the water is too hot to be refreshing.

Extremely exciting and exotic Experience. The place is in Atlantis Palm Jumeira. Water park is outstanding with world class facilities. Superior quality services with exotic touch of luxury will baffle you. its a lil expensive as compare to the rest of water parks but its really worth it. the open sea embraces you in its vastness.You can reach there via Metro. Board metro at any station and alight at Internet city metro station which has the tram link. Board the tram and alight at Palm Jumeira metro station which connects to the Monorail. Monorail will take you to Aquaventure. the name of the station is Atlantis Aqua venture station.

Gets a bit complicated at first but great day.. Things we got caught out on, first we bought the drinks deal the refillable drinks deal that turns out to not! Be refillable . You can purchase 4 cokes there for the price of one in a pretty cup. Lost shoes repeatedly so please find a spot preferably not where everyone else's are as chances are some wee child will think your child's shoes are theirs and walk off, we got all our shoes but that's because most there are very honest. You can bring those wee water none slip slipperetts and they will allow you on with them, now they keep the intense heat from the ground away from your feet while walking back! They sell them there. The meal deal is great and good for veggies like myself. If you are wanting a meeting place the restaurant is the best place as it's easy to find and great for weary parents who have the good luck to have slightly older children.

Thrilling. I'm scared of water so not the best place for me but I had to stay cool as the heat is unbearable. I stuck to the wave Machine and Rapids. Some of the rides when we went on Sunday were shut and they don't tell you this in advance and the zip wire was at an extra cost which I thought was a cheek seeing as we were guests at the Atlantis.

Good But Expensive . We visited on my birthday and as such got a free ticket as they currently have a promotion on which is very good.Once you get inside the prices are rather high, but you expect this as it's the same wherever you go, just be prepared that you will need more money than you perhaps would usually spend in a day.The lockers are £8 so try to keep the amount of belongings you take to a minimum! The lazy river runs around most of the park and from it you can access lots of the water slides something we thought was great, you don't even have to get out of your rubber ring! We had great fun exploring and trying out the various slides, particularly the one that goes through the aquarium, it's a very surreal experience! We were unsure about the leap of faith but eventually threw ourselves down, it's nowhere near as scary as it looks, my advice is just go for it or you'll regret it later! You also have access to a beautiful beach which is great if you fancy some relaxation after all that sliding.Plenty of choice regarding food and drinks however like I said it is quite expensive.The park do not permit food or drink to be bought in however they will allow a litre bottle of water per person so this is a good way to keep drink costs down in the heat! Enjoy

WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE. Aquaventure Waterpark, is a very nice park that is full of water fun and several water rides.But i thing these idea of using height to determine the entry ticket cost should be reviewed. If you are having a child rate lets know is a child rate and not having purchase an entry ticket for a child, and only to get point of ticket conversion and you will be told his height is above a certain limit so therefore he pays a higher fare. this is bad.But in all is a nice place to be with children

Best in Dubai. There are many water parks all over the UAE, but this is the one that keeps me coming back. It's not the cheapest but it is the best value. There is plenty to keep the visit interesting for many hours. I have never stayed there for less than 3 hours. If you are in Dubai and you're considering a water park, I wouldn't recommend driving to any of the faraway ones because the trip is not needed. Aquaventure is right here and still better than all the near and distant ones. Advice: order tickets online in advance to cut through the admission queues. Bring Dubai resident ID for a discount.

Great Fun. Had a great time there. It felt safe and everyone was nice and helpful. If you are staying at the Atlantis, The Palm hotel well you get even greater service. Went to get lunch and there was a special line for guests, so no waiting got serviced straight away. The amazing thing they catered for my food allergy's The slides are fun and my husband did Shark Safari. He loved every minute of it. We are both in our 40's and we felt like kids again. Go have some fun.

great fun with the family. We spent one whole day there and enjoyed every moment. My recommendation is to go there at 10 o'clock when it opens. After it becomes too crawded so in every slide u have to wait in the queue

You just can't get enough. Perfect place to deal with the heat of the day.. The theme.. The games.. The beach..you'll have a satisfying adrenaline rush. And you just can't get bored.. By the time you try all the activities once, the day is already over. Waiting in queues can be a bit annoying but its well worth it. Looking forward to go there again.

Clean, Beautiful, and not too Scary!. This was a very nice waterpark with a lot of seating, shade, good snacks, and fun rides. Nothing was too scary- Not even The Leap of Faith ;) The Shark Attack slide was probably my favorite- Not thrilling, but a cool experience to go through the tunnel in the middle of the lagoon. Fun!

Superb. Just came back from our stay at Atlantis the Palm. We used this waterpark on 4 of our 5 days. My 10y old son loved it and my wife , who is scared of water , thought it was the best water park she had been to. It's spotlessly clean, has some great rides and plenty of well trained enthusiastic lifeguards keeping you all safe. No need to bring towels for hotel guests it's all free. Buggies take you from the hotel and back again so no need to walk. A real treat for all ages .
crazy waterpark !. Leap of faith specially is crazy.best part of the place is that once you're into a ride all of them interconnected , with little or no effort at all , you reach other slides.

Amazzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzing. What a water park this is. Has a decent number and variety of rides suited for all age groups. One can spend the entire day enjoying here and still yearn to be back. Even if one misses the scarier rides, there are enough rides to keep all age groups from 3 years to 65 years entertained.

Great fun, get there early. I am gonna tell you straight up: Get there early. We arrived around 9am and were able to ride every single ride (sometimes twice) and no line up was more than 10 mins.A bit expensive in the scheme of things, but considering you are in Dubai, and get to spend the entire day there, alright, fine. Food at the stands was generally what you would find at any amusement park, but expect it.The strange thing, though, is that if you get a locker it is only in the dressing room, so if you are with people who ALL want to swin, or go on rides but need your phone or some money with you, you might feel strange just leaving it at your seat. Course Dubai is quite safe, you never know- right.The rides are all excellent, and the lazy river was nice, and uhm, lazy. Oh and Poseidon's Revenge is amazing, and scary, but just keep telling yourself it is only 7 seconds long.Thumbs up all around.
Very good. Our visit to dubai to aqua venture and atlantis stay was really memorableThe rides we took the slides from up was really wonderfull sure one has to visit this theme park once in their trip

Birthday boy day out. Our sons birthday and he wanted to go here whilst we where on holiday, a friend who is a local advised us to register him on line with the waterpark as he gets a free entry cert for his birthday - it worked saving $100 - great tip. Then we spent the day lolling about down water slides, tube rides and everything else - was there for 6 hours and he was asleep in the text before we got back to the hotel. - Great day of fun

Great fun day for all the family. Well thought out attraction. With water rides to suit all the family. A fun day with some quirky extras that i haven't seen before at other water parks very enjoyable
Weekend. the best water park in "Dubai", reasonable prices, they have beach access for extra price. Try the Brave Jump. Highly recommended.

Best, safe, and fun!!. This waterpark was pretty awesome!!!A lot of rides to go into!All are safe and super fun!!Lifeguards all over the place!Bringing my slippers with me because the floor was like hot LEAP OF FAITH (the best!) seems to be heart wrecking (it is) if you wouldn't try! :) it was super fun! Tried 3times. God blessed me. Still alive here! And happy :)My first waterpark experience. Overjoyed!

Perks of staying at Atlantis. Great bonus to come and go when you stay at Atlantis. Rides were good but stopped alot. Wish there were more rides as the day went quick. Expensive to get a locker so if you stay at Atlantis leave stuff in your room and go.

Lots of FUN. Excellent park with great staff life guards in every corner. its so big and all the slides are so far apart from each other so takes up a lot of time. Food at the park is very over priced so take your own snacks.

Go to Wild Wadi instead. I went with my wife and kids: they enjoyed the aquapark but not more than Wild Wadi. The prices are excessively high, Wild Wadi is a way better! They make you pay for everything and seen the amount of money you have already paid, you tell yourself, okay some more won't ruin you but you end up ruined!The only thing Aquaventure has more than wild wadi is that artificial beach. Being Tunisian grown near the sea, I know what a real beach looks like and was very disappointed by the almost still water and those "construction site souvenirs" ( those small grey cement stones that you can find if you trouble over some sand).One positive thing is the availability of metro and of small golf cars to take wherever you need, you don't have to worry about transportation.For photographers like me, you can take your gear and take as much photos as you want, staff is friendly.

Getting lost in the rapids!!!. This water park is brilliant, it's my first visit to a proper one and it didn't disappoint.There is so much variety in the slides, you can spend an hour or so in your tube and still do multiple different slides without even getting up.The weather is almost guaranteed as it's Dubai, and it's so nice to spend the day in the sunshine and just having a nice dip in the cool water to chill out.There are some points to consider as they aren't too clear at the start...The cashless wristbands have to be pre loaded from the start, not just pay at the end. Understandable as it would be impossible to police after payment under the current setup.Don't store your flip flops in your locker, take them with you. The floor is very hot.
