Maybe obvious but had an unnecessary paranoia about them getting stolen but it's very safe there.If you manage to get a view of the sharks in the tank on the Leap of Faith then I'd be very impressed! The speed of the slide is awesome. Brilliant day.

What a hoot. Going to the Aquaventure Waterpark was like being a kid again. We had a ball. There were plenty of rides to go on and enjoy. The leap of faith was without a doubt the best. It was totally safe with a lifeguard on duty on every bend in the water ride.

Fun for all. Visited on the 25th September and had an amazing time. Highlight was having the courage to do the leap of faith, but the lazy river was great fun.
Would recommend getting there early and going on most of the rides before dinner because the queues can be quite long.

AMAZINGGG!. I have been several times here... Little bit expensive BUT totally worth it in my opinion!Great day, fun slides and attractions for all ages! It is a MUST do! Book in advance! Works out cheaper! (250 AED in advance or 275 AED on the day)... They also do like meal day offers etc. (295 AED for entry with lunch)..Tip: Take towels and try and leave valuables at the your hotel... This way it saves you about 50 AED for 1 towel hire and 1 locker... Cash you can charge to a wristband so you don't have to leave it in a bag at your lounger! You then get a refund of any money you aint spent at the end off your band - great idea! (i used it when i needed water etc. and didn't want to treck to my lounger from the other side of the park! Ohh and they do bag checks so you can't take food or drink in!

Aquaventure . Aquaventure water park the best water park I've been to. I was staying at the Atlantis I had free unlimited entry to the water park. Leap of faith and posedions revenge are a must. The lazy river was good. You need to spend a whole day at the park to go on all the rides. The waterslides were brilliant. 10 out of 10
Great . Awesome place and we were lucky because there was no waiting and no crowds. Water was amazingly warm and just great overall.

Such an adventure . I'm so afraid of water but this water park definitely made it a fun and fearless experience, the slides were very daunting at first but I can't deny it was worth getting my hair wet. I didn't go on the leap of faith but my partner did. A must see if you do not go to the water park when your in Dubai you haven't had the full experience.
Great fun remember extra footwear.. Great water park awesome rides, remember bring thongs or old sneers to wear as the concrete burns your feet, you'll want to be wearing them between rides.

Not good customer service.. It does not look like a well organised Park. It is beautiful but staff has a lot to work on, yet.I was not advised on bumpy paths which hurt my back, as an example. I miss all my pictures, since I got so upset at the end, reception couldn't speak proper english, or he did that on purpose, just to trick me on the price of the pictures they take at the best moments of this adventure. He many times said that USB stick will all pictures, including those I couldn't take on my own, call it "Shark Safari", was AED 150. Then he was willing to charge me AED 650. I asked for supervisor just to find out USB stick was AED 250. I would have paid for it, if I wouldn't have been upset for so many different prices I was told. Please hire good customer service staff. I still want my pictures and made a formal complaint with no replies so far...

The best waterpark I have been to!. Brilliant! Had a blast at the Aquaventure Waterpark by the The Atlantis! Awesome rides, scary yet safe, good entertainment for everyone.. Well designed, Loved everything about it!

Great day out. A wonderful day our with the family. Caters for all age groups. The queues to go on the rides were at most 5 minutes. It can get rather expensive as they do not allow you to bring food or drinks from outside. They check all the bags on the way in. Don't forget to bring footwear to walk to the rides as the concrete pathways can get very hot.
Fun Day. Beautiful water park. You can float on a ring in the lazy river all day it's good if summer its great as there's something for everyone. There's a lot to do but expensive.

Amazinng fun for all ages. Visited the water park with my wife, despite the desert heat, the park is incredible fun, the park as amazing rides for all ages , from slides to a lazy river with exciting twists from torrents to large fast slides, also fantastic sting ray feeding and the dolphin experience with ini the Dolphin and the here team was just awesome credit to the girls who look after them

A must try when you go to Dubai.. I have been there several times with friends and family. It is a must try when you go to Dubai. Try all the rides and go in a tube and let the water lead you around the whole park. It is a fantastic place. If you are a family, buy the Entertainer books and use the vouchers there and the rest of the book is paid for. A little too warm during summer months.

Enjoyable but have been to better. We had a great time but it was a quiet day so there was no queues and therefore could go on as many times as we wanted . Liked the river that goes around the park with the Rapids etc . It beat walking around in the heat . Plenty of life guards on duty . Was well laid out
Fun Day Out.... It would have been really helpful if you can pay for things by using your wristband so you don't have to keep going back to your locker to get your purse to purchase anything.

Good water park but not as good as expected . The Park is great and beautifully clean and tidy. There are two main ride locations and a huge lazy river. It's great fun with lots of family rides and one or two terror rides. I don't think it compares to the Florida or Tenerife water parks which have many more individual type slides and great wave pools. Good day out but not the best park we have ever done

🌀thrilling fun🌀. I was very happy with this water park. They worked really hard on adding good quality detail to the park. And they made rides as safe as a hamster. But the food is a tad expensive but tasty. Also most of the rides are a bit too scary for younger children but they do have this sorted because they have a super fun childrens play area. I recommend the lagoon ride as a fun and relaxing way to travel around the park. I also recommend the shark attack ride as you go through a tube in a tank full of fish ,stingrays ,and sharks. Also the rides in the Poseidon tower were scary for young children so I don't recommend it for family visits. But you should bring sunscreen, quick slip on shoes, a hat and a towel. Note don't bring food if they find any they will throw it out. Lastly it takes about 1⃣ day to do most of the rides. Over all In my opinion this is the best water park in the universe❗️ Written by Harry our 9 year old.

Not very exciting. For the price we pay, the number of rides are very limited .. Only 2 rides (Leap of faith and revenge something) i liked and found to be exciting.. rest all are for kids.. Water was clean.. food and lockers are very expensive.. try to take as less as possible so that u can dump everything in a small locker.. next bigger locker size is twice the price..And in that scorching weather u have to carry the tubes by yourself climbing 3 floors.. very irritating..

Fun Day Out. Although being quite expensive in comparison to other water parks previously visited, my partner and I had a fantastic day here. We visited on a Saturday during mid September and to our delight barely had to queue for longer than a few minutes for any slide. The park itself is very well maintained and lifeguards are situated everywhere. Prices are expensive in the park but you are allowed to take a liter of water in per person, so recommend doing so!

Perfect place for fun. Initially I was reluctant to go considering it was just a water park but I am glad I went. It's an amazing place with awesome rides. I took meal combo with my tickets and loved the huge burger. They have an amazing system whereby you can take refills in the bottles you once but with just 8 AED. Staff was helpful and polite. It was clean and well maintained. Enjoyed a lot

Holiday. Aquaventure waterpark which is in atlantis the palm . This is a man made island in dubai which shows tree shape when you see from helicopter . This is one of the best , finest and fully fully secured and highly safe . They two lifeguard person standing in each single ride that was very amazing which i never seen in any water park which i have visited till now . Its tottally family waterpark with everything inside . So must must go.

Just the place with family. Kids will not want to come out. Adults will be worst than the kids numerous activities all for all ages. You should try some adventures rides - just awesome. Never miss to visit.

Pretty Average Park for the Price. I was disappointed with the water park, I know a lot of people have loved it but once you start adding all the costs for the day, to do most of the activities, it becomes very expensive. Maybe we are spoilt in Australia, but our water parks have lots more slides and rides than this one.

Brilliant fun! . Went with my young son early on a Friday morning expecting it to be very busy, but found it reasonably quiet so no big queues. Found all the staff very pleasant and helpful. Gift shop and food prices are expensive, but we just loaded up on breakfast before we went in, so no problem! Great fun though, with sensational rides.

great. I recently come back from Dubai.and I visit this water park with my wife and 3 children. kids are so happy that the have the chance to go to this attraction.is very big and u can spend easly one day there.is very well mentain.many lifeguards around. so u can be sure kids are well lookt after.i will visit next year for sure
An amazing day. We went to Atlantis for a day visit and visited the Lost Chambers Aquarium and the Water Park. It truly is amazing and worth a visit for sure. Had an enjoyable day.

Great day rude staff . Expensive entry and some of the staff are rude. We had a great day regardless but once you've been you don't need to return. Lockers broke and some poor lads stuff was dumped on the floor by staff so somebody else could use his locker. Very unsecure and not safe at all!

service. taking the time for Aquaventure at Waterpark we his chose this place service was fine during enter the water park we enjoy all the facility all the time we playing water water and water can't wait come back in this place all staff so friendly helping us anything

Good fun and very clean. A good water park, but not the best. Tenerife Sian park and the Florida parks are better in my opinion. However, great fun and very clean. Take water shoes or you will burn your feet on the paths. Listen to instructions and lift your bottom high on the dinghy rides or you will get bruised! As I found out lol. Food and drink expensive in the park.
My experience. This waterpark is amazing and in the heart of the city. Plenty of parking spaces and rides are superb !

Best Water Park. Wow, what a great time we had at the park. Stayed at Atlantis and entry is included in the package. We went twice and tried most of the slides. We did not get tired of floating around in our tubes between slides. Staff were helpful and friendly. Reccomend a trip to the park

Expensive but worth it. It costs about $570 for a family of 4 for both the water slides and the aquarium, as well as a fair sort of a lunch. It's a pretty good water park and really for a day's entertainment or shopping in Dubai the price is comparable. Take sunscreen hats and H20!The best slides are furthest from the entry and Sunday is the best day because that's the first day of the working week, no queing!Plan your exit by 4pm or suffer the gridlock traffic from 5-7pm.
Love Aquaventure. Really great water park. The attractions and slides are all very good, and its just a fantastic, fun day out. Keep coming back again and again.

Paradise on Earth..... This place is amazing. Atlantis has some of the greatest views of Dubai. When u walk to the top of every ride you can see the entire skyline and Jumeirah Beach. The rides were extremely fun and my daughters 4 and 7 enjoyed themselves. Make sure you get on Leap of Faith and Posiedon Revenge. The beach is on property too for guest and visitors who purchase admission into Aquaventure. You will enjoy every minute of Atlantis. We took the Skytrain from the metro. It was pricey but worth the views.

Keeping cool in the heat. Just the place to be on a hot September day! Plenty of fun for all the family, we only wished we'd been staying at The Atlantis so as to stay til late! It wasn't as busy as we'd feared but then it was so hot the locals probably know better than to be out in the sun, water or not!

Wonderful waterpark that the kids never got tired of.. Stayed next door in Dubai at the Atlantis resort and the the waterpark was included in our package. Have to say that this was the best waterpark we have ever experienced having been to many all over the world. The kids never tired of heading out in the morning and enjoying all it had to offer. Good value for money and a welcome respite from the heat!

Great family fun. My family had a great time on the slides and the tube river. Food is a little expensive but there is plenty of shade. Staff all very friendly and helpful. A great way to fill a day that is enjoyable for all.
Great day out. Had an amazing time here. If you have kids and are visiting Dubai you simply can't afford to miss this place.
Overpriced! . I visited the water park on 21st September. I enjoyed all the rides but found the entry price expensive for the rides that were on offer.

So much fun! A few suggestions:. Atlantis was a blast! It was a bit expensive because you almost have to rent a locker (we split the rental between two people to save cost, and that worked well), and you can't bring food or water in so you have to buy it there. It was worth the cost though if you can stay all day! There is definitely enough to do. After we got tired of going on all the big slides and waiting in lines, we just spent a long time on the lazy river to rest up. There is also access to the beach for relaxing! BRING FLIP FLOPS! The ground gets extremely hot when you don't have any shoes on. On the rides you can just hold them in your hands or leave them at the bottom of the stairs.
The new one . It's good and the games are more excited and adrenaline will jump in a little bit. You should tryout this adventure when you there

Good Fun with Company/Family. Really good family fun. It's a water park for all ages. We stayed at the Atlantis so it was easy to access, but the wave pool is nice for families to just chill and go around, whilst the more adventurous rides are good fun for people who enjoy water.

Great day out!. We stayed at the Atlantis hotel so we got unlimited access to this water-park, now I hate rides, but my Fiancé made me go on a few, mainly the biggest ones(!!) and I did enjoy it in the end! Great day out!
One of the best waterparks. Surely one of the best waterparks I visited and I saw quite some of them. It is a whole day full of attractions for a whole family.

So much fun. I absolutely love water parks and this is one of the best! Loads of really fun slides, we were lucky that queues were minimal but you can see from the queue barriers that you could be waiting a long time on busy days.Top tips-Their website offers a voucher for free entry if you visit within 6 days of your birthday-Buy tickets in advance, they're cheaper then on the door- Wear flip flops/ water shoes around the park, the floor is scorching hot and you will burn your feet without them, however they make you take them off on the slides-You are allowed to take a gopro on the slides but not allowed the attachments to hold it with making it pointless to take and a nuisance to carry-Get there early the park was probably 3x as busy by lunchtime
Lots of rides. Easy to spend a whole day there. There are rides for almost everyone. You don't even have to get out of the ring for most of them.

Lots of fun!. Spent a great day there, it was crowded but well organized. Never had to wait too long at the slides. Great kids area, my 19 month old really enjoyed it. The ride that goes through the aquarium is amazing. You also have access to the beach area but we didn't have enough time to experience it.

For the money. Best to stay at Atlantis for 3 or longer days. This for the whole family. The water park in Nassau, Bahamas is better. But for what it is you will enjoy yourself. The staff is always helpful and nice.

Awesome adventure. awesome rides all over the park.. Especially the slide.. It's not for the faint hearted !The lazy river n the beach side s good for calming down the nerves after all these rides.. Very clean n safe

Beat the heat. On the bank of Arabian sea at the end of Palm Jumairah The park is very well located. Full of greenery and lot of rides one after another. The entire day can be enjoyed with family and friends. Heaven for kids and teen age group.

Good Family Destination. This park was much bigger than others in the area as the taller slides are separated from the family areas. The size of the park is my only complaint other than confusion and a lack of park map visuals. Bring money for food and drinks. Also, don't forget to bring sunscreen. Towels are a separate rental purchase fee, but are large enough to accommodate several children. Visitor parking is separated from the park itself and requires a bus shuttle to the entrance of the resort. Overall we had a great time but would only come back if tickets are discounted as I feel that other water parks in the country are much easier to manage for families with small children.

Fun for the kids................... What a nice water park.This offers activities for all ages,even for the toddlers-a nice water play area with lot of activities for the small ones.,All the activities are a great fun and all ages can experience a great day out.A must visit if you go to Dubai though this is a little expensive

Good fun but not cheap. Went to the waterpark as a couple for the day, I enjoyed it but my wife hated it, went down some of the slides on a double float but she kept falling through it and so didn't enjoy the rides. Some of the big rides are amazingly scary which I was not expecting.We paid for a combo ticket which included towels, changing rooms and the lost chambers. The high tech changing room lockers went wrong when I went back to change my wristband kept opening the wrong locker the staff didn't believe me until they bypassed my wristband and opened the locker with my clothes in plus somebody else's belongings,no apologie. Costing £150 for the day,done it wouldn't do it again
Beautiful waterpark. I loved this waterpark it is connected to Atlantis resort and me my husband and kids really enjoyed our time there to the maximum ..totally recommend it

Best Waterpark in Dubai. This is the best waterpark I've seen so far and we loved every bit of it. we were given full access to the park for two consecutive days and still we didn't finish all the rides. the park is over crowded during holidays so expect queues and long waiting time (half an hour or so). the rides range from the easy-going lazy river all the way up to the "leap of faith" and "Shamal" thrilling rides. one annoying thing is you need to "hunt" for rubber rings whenever going for a ride. the management has to do something about this !All in All: very enjoyable park and we're definitely going back againmy recommendation: to fully enjoy the park I suggest you arrive as early as the opening time , and buy your ticket online as well to avoid long queues. the park is crowded from mid-day onwards and over crowded on holidays.

Ideal waterpark. Enjoyed the slides with my family for the eid al adha holidays.The management had ensured the safety of all the visitors inspite of a heavy rush .The waterpark has different rides for all ages and no need to worry for the food as there are all types of restaurants inside the waterpark. One can also visit the beach and take rest if tired of playing the slides.Really one of the best waterparks I have seen till now..

Nice but.... It's a lovely big water park and the mall before the entry is lovely but there are a lot of undesirable looking people, particularly hairy men... I'm talking about yeti hairy... swimming with children. It's very crowded so it's inevitable that you'll touch someone's hairy back which is very repulsive. Do not go during Eid also because you will be dying of thirst, parched from the clorine and there's little shade... not a good combo.
Atlantis Water Park. This is a excellent water park, it has slides for all ages as well as play areas for really little ones, the lazy river is great fun and all ages can experience a great day out.

Great value visit to Aquaventure. An absolute must do attraction in Dubai if you have kids (or even if you don't). The best value is to have an overnight stay on the club floor at the hotel. This came with two day passes to the park plus afternoon tea and an evening happy hour. We did this as a "stay vacation" when living in Dubai on a number of occasions, great value and great fun!
Heapsnofnfun for kidsmof all ages.. It provides lotsmof water experiences. However it was very hot when we were there so not pleasant in cues or sitting out of water.

Move the Changing Rooms!. Good day out although i was quite disappointed with the slides as most required a ring and my preference is for none.
Changing rooms are poorly located at the entrance, resulting in people having to walk someway to go back for things such as cash etc.

Best Waterpark Ever! . The lazy river takes around 2 hours to get around and takes you up to the top of slides without having to get out of your rubber ring!!! What more can you want.. This place is soo good, you will never want to leave. I took my partner (free entry as it was her birthday, just take your passport)! She had the best day, we stayed for 5 hours and still didn't get time to do all the rides. Highly recommend walking across to the beach too, the sand is crazy soft and the sea is as warm as the bath. It's an experience in itself. Also if you lay still in the sea for a couple of minutes you will be surrounded by lots of fish. Well worth doing. The slides are great for all varieties of thrill seekers, some are very big, fast and scary.. Others are the opposite! This was my favourite Dubai excursion by far. Highly recommend!

Fantastic - birthday girl goes free!!!. Visited for my 30th birthday... If it's your birthday you get in free! Just visit their site, print a voucher and take some proof (your passport). We spent all day there - the lazy / not so lazy river / Rapids, the slides and the beach is fab! Keep your flip flops on... Floor gets HOT!!!Find a sun longer and leave your towel - a great base to come back to! Lots of food and drink places. No real queues when we went - a Saturday in September. Not sure what it's normally like but wasn't painfully busy!

They squeeze every dirham out of you. The attractions are very good but the staff are not very friendly and helpful. They also asked way too much money for a pair of flip flops when you have forgotten them in the car. My son had to pay 144 AED for a pair of flip flops that is just outrageous this price. We have also been to Yas Waterworld and Wild Wadi maybe the attractions aren't so great but the people that work there are much more friendly and don't have a kind of attitude like in Atlantis. We have seen it done it that will be it.

Free is your staying at the Atlantis, good fun.. Not normally our cup of tea, but we gave it a try and didn't regret it, great water park, with a few wild water rides, little or no waiting time on the rides.

The most fun you can have with your clothes on!. Super fun morning out at Aquaventure Waterpark. Family safe aqua park; with rides to suit all levels. Laze around the wonderful water river, safely policed by lifeguards at every turn. Adrenalin rush at some of the more steeper slides. My top tip here is to arrive early, and go midweek - very few queues to maximise your stay. Take your own town, also wear flip-flops in the park - as the floor is scorching!! Just try to remember where you left them!! Opt for the no-cash option with the cashless wrist tags. And constantly top up on the sunscreen - it's hot out there!
Best aquapark in Dubai.. Get the discount for residents as otherwise it is very expensive. Go early and you can spend time on the beach if you don't want to play whole day at the aquaventure
Great time. Had an awesome time here. Rides were great but be sure to grab the tube floats before most of the rides

Wonderful. Nothing better than this water park in Dubai specially on this hot weather. Slides are amazing and you can spend a full day here, you can also swim with dolphins if you find availability. Highly recommended.

Great rides, bad hygiene :(. Went with a friends and their children. We visited a year ago in Ramadan and had a blast but this year going at Eid (public holiday) was an absolute mistake.The staff could not control the large amount of crowds pushing and squeezing their way through from the parking lot, lobby, doors, locker rooms and even park. There should have been a maximum capacity. The place was so packed with people swimming in their clothes, abayas, shoes, you name it. The park pools were filthy dirty. I highly suggest management add additional showers with rules for people to shower before entering the waters.The staff were so overwhelmed that they couldn't provide accurate information to anything really. Entering the locker room was like walking through a mosh pit at a concert being dragged in and out. Muddy floors, baby dippers on the grounds, people climbing on each other to get to a locker or a sink. In short, the park has some great rides. But never ever visit on a weekend or public holiday. Atlantis, you need to better manage your park to avoid bacteria, accidents and discomfort.

Fun day in Dubai. this is a fun day out especially considering the heat in Dubai. there is a good selection of slides and pools. Nice grounds if staying at the Atlantis you can stop by everyday even if just for an hour, great for the kids, we loved it.
colorful park. one must visit here who loves rides and crazy for it. I am crazy for rides so I visited this place. awesome thrilling rides with splash of water.
Kids paradise. Kids paradise.... superb rides and we had a wonderful time together as a family !!! my 5 years old daughter just freaked out....it was excellent

Great way to refresh. My 5 year old daughter enjoys every splash of it. Me and my sisters enjoyed it as well. We went there from opening till noon only because we need to check out in the Palm, we avoid the long ques.

Fun Fun Fun. Staying at the atlantis this is the main attraction . As a family we went every day for a few hours and had fantastic fun. there is something for everyone and if you time it well you can aviod long lines.

Nothing Like It In The World. What a waterpark!!! Something for every member of the family. Very clean and well organised. We also visited Dolphin Cove for the second time and loved our dolphin encounter. This place is a must for anyone visiting Dubai. Actually you won't be able to go just once - we have gone three times on this trip!!!!

Fun day out. This place is not only a waterpark, it is also great sightseeing! Located on the palm, with lots of palm trees, ancient-like towers and aquarium with sharks and rays, it is really cool! Good deals tickets for residents.
expensive. A nice water park but one of the most expensive parks I've been in and I travel a lot around the world since I'm Airline Staff

Probably the best water park in the world. Simply the best water park I've ever been to. The rides are just on another level to anywhere else. If you've ever dreamed up the perfect water ride... they probably have it here. Sudden drops, super fast slides, rings that go into a half pipe.. you name it, they have it. Plus I was pleasantly surprised by the onsite food. Normally its pretty bad at places like this but it was actually very tasty. Thumbs up from me.

Great waterpark but staff needs more training. Aquaventure is indeed one of the great Dubai attractions. Thrilling rides, kids water castle, etc. Unfortunately, we had scary experience here today. My 7Y old daughter and her friend were riding on a double tube in the river. I was following them on another double tube. We passed 2 rapids with no issues. At the third rapid, lifeguard let the girls go but stopped me saying that it is not allowed to use double tube while being alone. How should I know when previous two rapids no one said anything?! In the meantime, girls disappeared down the river... After some shouting, they brought me a single tube and I could continue. Of course, the girls were gone. It took me 15 mins of running around to find them in crowds of people. Not so funny experience for parent!

Good fun. A nice place to go especially on a slow day (i.e. not during weekend, school holidays or public holidays). The rides are fun especially for the daring (Poseidon's Revenge and Leap of Faith). For those without the desire to increase their heart rate dramatically there are less adrenaline pumping rides, but equally exciting nevertheless.The location at Atlantis is interesting in itself so worth exploring around the Palm if time permits. The food was not bad either. One tip if going during the hotter periods of the day is a pair of protective sand shoes to protect the soles of the feet especially if walking between the rides on the hot stones as the distance is quite a way.

Fantastic thrills!. Hello, My name is Bogdan and last summer, on September 2015, I have visited Aquaventure Waterpark at Atlantis The Palm. I have to say that is a very high tech water park surrounded by huge water slides that will offer you the thrill of your life! The ticket is not so cheap but it worth to spend half a day in this outstanding waterpark! Best regard, BogdanRomania.
expensive ticket . Unfortunately expensive ticket with no car parking enough and some restaurants poor food. There is another choice with less pay and more enjoy

Loved It . Great time for single couple in Mid Thirties. Awesome way to keep cool. Stepping into the Indian Ocean was an experience I'll never forget. This park is a must do. Let the inner child come out for a few hours.

Amazing experience and helpful staff :) . Highly recommend!! They have something for everyone from adrenaline junkies to lazy bums. My fav rides are leap of faith and Poseidon’s Revenge, must try. However if you go on a weekend you will get long queues since it's such a popular waterpark therefore I suggest that you go on a weekday. One thing I would like to suggest is if they could clean the stairs and the shower rooms more frequently, they were a bit slippery and dirty. Overall an amazing experiences, highly recommend for someone visiting Dubai!!

More details for Aquaventure. We plan to visit Dubai in October and to go in Aqueventure on my daughter birthday.Just want to ask can we take our own towels, food and water. Is the park provides towels?thank you
Total Thrill. Oh what a lovely place, rides are fantastic. As a family you cant ask for a better day than visiting this place and enjoying some thrill rides
Best place to go to cool down and enjoy. Best place to visit for a whole day. We aimed to go onto every ride possible. It's a perfect place to go with family and kids.

So cool. We really enjoyed our time there, we visited aquaventure waterpark and later the aquarium.It was really a great experience.Fun games, great pool, delicious food.But you have to make sure that u need to to rent a small closet to keep your private things.

So very good.... The greatest water park. We were there very early and tried all waterslids without any waiting. Around mid day more people came, but still little waiting. Visited on a Monday. Only a decent pool for swimming would be nice. Slides are great.

awesome day out. awesome water park. Because you can float around on a ring in the lazy river all day its even good i the summer. Its great as theres something for everyone. Great thrill seeker rides and then also the calm lazy river, beautiful beaches and sun loungers for those that would rather chill. Lots to do and beautiful views.

Fun, but.... I would like to say that my friends and I weren't guests of the hotel. The place overall looked really beautiful and fun. There are many adventurous rides. The facilities are better than standard. However, I think it is a bit overpriced. First of all, they charge for almost everything. I was disappointed to find that you have to pay additional money for a locker, towels. These should be amenities that come at no additional cost. Definitely bring a gopro if you are the type with the stomach for the daring rides. Also bring your own towels if you don't want to pay for them. Please don't forget your flip flops we went around noon and you can't walk the ground barefooted, it can get very hot.

Awesome Waterpark - Fabulous rides that go on forever.. The Plunge is the best ride ever. Well worth the trip to Dubai just to go to this Waterpark. Make sure you buy the Meal included deal as it works out cheaper than buying the entry ticket and then food once you are in there separately.

Family trip with 3 year old. YOU MUST DO THIS - what a sensational day we had. Our 3 year old could play at a section dedicated for younger kids with loads of water cannons, and slides and lots of lifeguards. Plenty of spots in shade to relax. The best part was the massive rapids course - you could use double inflatable rings so that our 3 year old could come too by sitting in a special childrens version with a flat bottom seat. The rapids are totally safe, yet designed to give a thrill. Very worthwhile.

Brilliant. Went here on my birthday and managed to get in free as they had a birthday offer on (check website before you go). Totally and thoroughly enjoyed it and as someone in my 30s I was pleasantly surprised. There were plenty of beds for relaxing and the beach was empty so we practically had all the sea for ourselves. The 'rides' have just the right amount of action and relaxation and I spent at least 2 hours just floating. Good places to eat too and I would have gone back the next day if there just weren't so many other things to do in Dubai.
Amazingly fun. One of the best attractions I've ever been to so far. Awesome rides/slides. Relaxing lazy river ride. Nice kids playing area.

Awesome. One of the must visit place in Dubai though the hotel stay is expensive. Everything is perfect. a day is not enough to enjoy. Superb hotel service as well. It was humid outside and DSLR didn't work well because of the moisture on the lenses. So I use mobile to take pictures most of the time. The imperial club option is really worth. Kids can enjoy whole day. Recommend to stay two days from Mid October to March season.

Amazing lazy river!. Although it was quite expensive, this waterpark is definately worth a visit. The best bit for us was the lazy rivers link to some of the rides, so we didn't get actually get off the dingys for about an hour or so! Very very hot (August) but the staff let you take your flip flops on the rides so you don't burn your feet (take a spare pair just in case). There are lots of restaurants/fast food outlets for dinner but you can take your own water in.

Honestly looks better from outside. First of all if you are planning to go there as a family of 4 take a taxi it will be about 10 Derhams more on each trip but a lot faster we chose the metro cause I personally believe there is no better way to know about people but getting on their public transport which I was wrong cause metro in Dubai is designed for workers and tourists any way after getting off at station 36 we were told we need to take the tram and get off at jumeirah station which can be a bit tricky cause we missed the stop and had to wait 20 min for the next tram and we were not the only ones after that we had to get on the mono rail and for that you have to leave the tram station walk out about 4 min and there another 20 min wait began so you see taxi is better . If you are on budjet dont forget to bring your towel and a pair of slippers . The floors can get hot.most I mean all of the attractions are around the zigorat so thats where you need to be. In all I think wild wadi was way better than this one but non is as good as Yas water park in Abudhabi.Yas is Bigger , has more rides, way cleaner,the water is cold which is a blessing in that heat, there are Free Free drinking water fountains all around the park but again never forgets your slippers cause the floors are scorching hot ans slippers are 99 Derhams.

Pricey but fun.. Lots to do but very very expensive before adding locker rental and food. Rides were great but some of the slides really batter you on the way down, still terrific though. The shark tunnel is a really interesting addition too.

Ok, not brilliant. Went here with hubby & my 6 year old, it was July boiling hot little 1 just wanted to sit in the pool & not move, quite boring not much to do not that many rides same boring big water rings going round & round in circles, very expensive the park & the food in the park, I would not go here might try wild wadi next time I found this park very boring not much to do

Always a fantastic time. I can't fault this waterpark. You are definitely guaranteed an awesome and amazing experience and I have to say that it is the better of the two compared to Wild Wadi. There if you want to chill or are looking for a thrill, then this is the place to be! You are perpetually hydrated. Enjoy!

A real Adventure. If you want a great day with lot's of water, slides, exitement and fun. Your kids will enjoy it all day long. Safety level is very high over there. No risks are taken. Great views from high up. Worth the money.

Superb waterpark. What a place, great rides, loads of space, no queues when we went, stunning views, we booked the dolphin experience which is great value as you get entry to the waterpark included.....will be back
It's awesome!!. This place is amazing!! There are lot of tracks and some of them are really terrifying, others just for calm floating. Anyway it's worth to try this water park.

Quality water attraction. This water attraction is one of the best in the area. Facilities at at an expected high level supported by a professional staff. This not my favorite water park in the area but is well worth a visit for all. For easy parking use the Palm Monorail.

As expected . I simply love this place been here many times and never get bored of it. There is always something for everyone!!! My son love every minute of it.Hopefully will vist again in future.Highly recommend.

Enjoyable..but not the Best. I wanted to go ''Yas Waterpark - Ferrari world Abudhabi'' but due to maintenance work it was closed, i had a flight next day my mood was to go to water park so i had two options Wild Wadi or Atlantis Aqua park, after some suggestions from tour guide and hotel staff i choose to go atlantis. Rides are almost similar in both parks but atlantis has other activities too, its huge.i loved Leap of Faith 90 ft high - 5 times i slide from it, scary when you see from top to bottom gives you goosebumps once you are on it ....vrooooom like ferrari.while climbing up for all big slides being wet you can slip its concrete stairs be careful...Other Rides are good too, but not Exceptional.one of the Lazy Ring Ride passes via Glasstube its fun surrounding with fishes and small sharks.kids zone is fun. Food is expensive.Do remember they give you a tag kind of on your hand if you misplace it or washes off in water you need to punch it again from the counter without that you cant open locker. Metro train is available but not directly you have to change 2 times to reach there Must tell you its Wonderful experience going by it passes via Palm Beach Beautiful..you can hire a car or go if you have your own transport. Enjoyable ...

Nice for one time only. Well, we had high expectations! Atlantis Dubai, I guess you have to try this waterpark once. This is fun for sure, activities are great but I will not go there more than once. It would have been great to have lockers/towels included in the entry. Anyway this is a touristic place and they know it. For people visiting Dubai as tourists, yes, you can go there, with your children, it's fun!

Great experience!. We had a very nice stay and very quite lucky as it was not crowded so the average time in queue was like 5 mins... :) The attractions are very good and we had many shot of adrenaline :D Aaah! When we finished we saw that there was an option to borrow a go pro for around 200 AED!! There was no information anywhere, only at the end so don't miss to get one as photos are extremly expensive. Around 80 AED per piece.... I think. The only bad was that there were like 2 towers with a total of ~6 kind of extreme rides, so it would be great to have some more. Anyway we were able to use the time without feeling bored for a second :) Must go!

Rides for everybody!. I'm not normally a waterpark fan but this was a brilliant park, it was huge and there were plenty of rides for everybody.There was the big rides, with lots of loops and drops, but also a nice mix of lazy rides, or rubber ring rides, which actually is one of the best ways to see the park.All in all a great day out there, if you want a break from the rides there are sunbeds to lounge on and plenty of refreshment places.

Good for all ages. Great park attached to Atlantis - lots of slides for big and small kids with a lovely little water pool and play park for toddlers - our 2 YO loved that area - great way to cool off in the heat!

Great waterpark. This is the best waterpark I've been to. Most of the rides are based around sitting on a tyre on the lazy river with lots of different tunnels taking you to slides, rapids, waves etc Nice eating places but expensive. For drinking you are cheaper to buy a refillable cup.

Fantastic day!. My partner and I went on a Sunday, with a delayed taxi service we expected to be queuing for some time - we arrived 10 minutes before opening and were the first to enter the park. It remained quiet all day, allowing us to go on every slide multiple times!! The park itself is beautiful. The staff were fantastic. Especially the lifeguards on the Torrent and rapids who made both my partner and I laugh as they spoke to us. All in all, a great day out to stay cool during the Dubai heat.

Rivals the American water parks!. Visited this water park on two occasions during my stay at the Atlantis and loved every second of it. Having been to one of the world's first water parks in Orlando, Florida (wet n' wild) I knew this would need some oomph to beat. The cleanliness of the park was impeccable and the friendliness of the staff was outstanding. A special mention must go to 'Athula' who was working on the zip line ride. His service alone has set a benchmark for all future hospitality services in my opinion!The rides at the park, most importantly, were awesome, and I really enjoyed the leap of faith and the Rapids! I can't wait to visit again and hope to come back in 2016!!

Best Waterpark! (but go in the quiet months). Aquaventure is truly amazing. Imagine not having to que for the next water ride... because you bob along in your donut and take the nearest water lift (a bit like a conveyer belt) which delivers you to the top of the ride... while you sit and relax. Or a water ride that ends with you sailing through a huge marine life fish tank... yes the ride goes right though it so you can see all the fish swimming above and around you. Very cool. One issue is that if you go in the busy periods (Winter time) its just too overcrowded. I tried to go at Xmas time and we couldn't even get in the door so we just turned around. In September you will be able to walk in with no que. The only issue is surviving the heat!

Excellent. This waterpark was great! Lots of slides and between this you can go down the lazy river which is good fun! My only advice is don't forget to reapply suncream as you will be in the sun all day! Also Fridays are the busy day so expect queues if going them!

Fantastic time here.. Me and my partner went, both late fortys and enjoyed it. I went on rides I did not think I would and felt younger than I had in ages. Great place, very clean and staff friendly. It was my partners birthday and he was given free entry which made it very reasonably priced for us. If you sign on to website prior to visit there are offers on there. Fab experience and lots of fun.

You just can't get enough. The park cannot be explored in a day until you have great stamina. It's better you stay at least for a night in atlantis to explore the park fully. We book atlantis for one night and got aquaventure pass for two days. As we took the band on the day of our checkout which allowed us to use aquaventure for the whole day. The park has many parts and mind blowing slides. Kids area was as good for adults as it was for kids. The lazy river connected whole park, and during river trip you will experience rapids and tornados. The ride was worth taking. It took lots of time to complete river activities. The food was good inside the park. There are buggies to take you to park. Take a waterproof camera if you want to take selfies.
Superb. We had a thoroughly enjoyable time at this resort. We can't wait to go again and would highly recommend this for families and grown ups alike.
Great fun for everyone . It is great fun & the slides are awesome, but you have to carry your tubes everywhere with you.take water from hotel as its really hot.

A hot hub for water games. Was lucky enough to visit there. Took a taxi there as our hotel was off from public transport. There are some extra charges of using the locker and towels which the ticket price (AED250 / adult) is not included. 40AED for a small locker (around 50cm x 40cm), 75AED for a large locker (around 1m x 40cm), and extra 10AED for a towel. The locker is inside the changing room, so if you are visiting their with your partner you may find a bit annoying.After getting the ticket and other supplementary items, the staff will give u a wrist band with bar code on it. The locker is assigned by scanning the barcode on the band and becareful of choosing X to continue using that if you unlock the locker. Quite a lot of activities in the park, but its mostly water slides. The shark attack one was decent as you will head to the aquarium after the slide. Most of the area is exposed to sun so better get yourself prepared.Quite expensive though still cheaper than wild wadi. Worth a try anyway.

Could be scarier. Only half the park was open when I went and would have loved to do Poseidon's revenge, leap of faith was awesome but for a real thrill seeker I wanted more! It's great for the family and feels safe. My daughter had a lot of fun in kids splash park. Would definitely visit here again but more thrills.
A Great place. Its a really cool and amazing, wonderful in every way great service really know how to treat guest.Best place in Dubai especially when the sun is beating down

Fun for Everyone. Lifeguard on duty at all times of those who not water confident... Lots of fun and activities to do all day... swimming with the dolphins was an amazing experience... Food is available all day.

A full days super, unforgetable experience.. Fantastic experience.Be sure to take or hire a towel and a locker.The optional cheaper meal voucher gives a poor cheap meal.Load some money on your tag for a meal of your choice.Some 'rides' are not for the faint hearted.Chill out by thge pool or at the beach.Plan to be there the whole day.Unforgetable!
Best vacation ever!!. My 8 and 10 yrs old loved it. In thier words best vacation ever!! As matter effect we liked it so much that we are visiting Dubai again in 2016. IA
It's Okay. Not bad. I didn't like carrying tubes around. Too big with very few attractions. It's okay to try it.

Brilliant Park!. A fantastic park, spotlessly clean with great rides. Our kid's loved every minute of it and as guests in the hotel we had unlimited access. We spent part of each day there and the children did every ride. They loved the zip wire and the option of heading back to the hotel for a rest on the complimentary golf buggies was a real bonus when it got particularly hot.

Amazing Experience. I was unsure to get fun in this place but I was an excellent decision. The surroundings was amazing and deserve to go there. The parking of Aqua Park is huge and there is a shuttle bus to Aqua Park every specific time. The stuff there were very helpful. Tickets buying took around half an hour due to long queue hopefully to get it earlier or from internet. They prohibited any kind of foods carried in your bag. I rate the park as a luxury and huge place and equipped by many of games suitable for all ages. Really it was out of my expectation which I spent half of day there and I will visited again.

Aquaventure beats Wild Wadi !. Has surely surpassed Wild Wadi, as the best water park in Dubai.
Lovely touch is the option to rent a GoPro camera for 200 Dhm, to make excellent videos of all the waterslides!

Dubai and good experience. Bought ticket included Dolphin Experience and entrance fee of Waterpark. First had a special experience with dolphin, played and kissing. Then tried different exciting slides.
All staffs were very helpful and friendly.
Must go if you go to Dubia !!

Great fun day. We pre-booked or tickets online, which made the entry quite simple and relatively quick.A locker can be a good idea if you haven't got someone to watch your belongings, and a small locker will fit a decent sized backpack or bag. But you need to decide at the time of booking where whether you want it in the men's or women's locker area.Food and drinks are expensive, but you can come out and eat a cheaper just outside to park (in the general mall area).The water park itself is awesome, but make sure you put on sunscreen.Easily spend the whole day here.

Not s how stopper. Expensive and longer queues for everything we much preferred Wild Wadi. However some of the rides were really good and we spent the majority of the time on the lazy river in various places. Getting to the park took some time. Getting tickets was a really long queue it the worse queue was Trying to get a taxi at the end of the day.

Wow - Huge and Awesome. Amazing Waterpark, has just about everything you could want.Lazy River - This is like nothing i have ever seen, i have no idea where it finishes we couldnt stay on that long, must have been on it for 45 minutes. It has lifts, rapids, slides, and also just some floating about. Crazy but awesome.Slides - Again a spectacular collection of slides, queueing was relatively short and we went on a Saturday. Great collection of slides for couples to do at the same time.Pools/Beaches/Sunbeds - LOADS of all these, and the resort has a side that backs onto the beach for those who just want to sit there and soak it all in.

Fun, really, even for parents!. Great place to have some thrilling waterfun. Start with the ride through the aquarium, you will scream/laugh your head off. Next hit the Rapids and other floaty rides. Towards the end hit the Leap of Faith (wear goggles!). After this you need the final thrill of the zoomerang and annaconda. Go off season, like middle summer. Wear a hat, take slippers, and you will have all the rides in one morning, without any waiting! Start at 10 am, and have fun.Best part is propably you can take your Go-pro or watercamera, and enjoy the screams again at home.
great time. It was a great experience for a family trip, there are all sorts of playing areas from kids to young duds. perfect for a day out.

Overrated. When you come to Dubai on holiday with the kids the day time theme is usually water parks. We've been to Dubai every year for 11 years now and are always satisfied at Wild Wadi but this year we decided to go to the Atlantis waterpark. The first thing to say is it is ridiculously expensive to get in. 2 adults and 3 kids cost about £225 just for entry. The irony is that the kids were actually classed as adults and I had to buy adult tickets for 5 people. The queues to get in (and get lockers etc) were very long and the waiting areas outdoor and poorly air conditioned. Lots of people were turning up with vouchers and the staff processing them were fairly incompetent. I queued for 15 minutes for a locker then gave up. A friend of mine had booked one, we shared. They try and sell you big lockers when the small ones are big enough.The next most ridiculous thing at the waterpark is the lack of facility to put money on your wristband. So effectively you have to leave your money in the changing room. So every time you want a drink or food you have to make the long walk back to the locker room to get your notes! A complete waste of time. The rides themselves are plentiful but you have to find and then carry your inflatables up to the ride. The kids found this difficult and then when you get to the ride they're all very short and over before you know it resulting in the need to carry the inflatable back up to the top again. Suggest the investment in the motorised pulleys that take the inflatables up to the start of the rides for customer ease - a clear lack of investment! It's a big water park you can fill your day in it, the kids thought Wild Wadi was way better.The staff were helpful and courteous. The food was reasonably priced for the resort.I have to say we left 1/4 hour before the end and made our way out to the taxi queue. The chap marshalling the queue was timid and had no idea what was going on. People were pushing and shoving and what should have been an orderly queue turned out to be a disorganised crowd which was out of control.Having been there and sampled it that was enough. It was a very hot day, there was limited shelter and everything was so far away. I'm not in a rush to go back. You can have so much more fun at Wild Wadi and for a fraction of the effort!

The BEST Waterpark in UAE. If your into your water-parks then Aqua-venture has to be on your "to do" list... By far the best water-park I've been to in UAE (Yas and Wild Wadi) Situated at the Atlantis Hotel on Palm Jumeirah... The park has Great slides to suit all the family and also kiddie area next to the wave pool which is slightly enclosed for safety. Life jackets are also provided for children and adults (at no extra cost) Food and drinks available throughout the park at reasonable prices. Also if you have time or in the area for a few days checkout the dolphin and seal show (separate additional charge)

Perfect Venture, Great Rides, Supertastically Awesome!!. The best Water Park in Dubai - UAE. Its the AquaVenture Water Park in Atlantis, Amazing and thrilling rides, lovely place. Please make sure you come in the morning around 11 and make full use of your day. Do not have heavy meals, I repeat, do not have heavy meals. Lovely Rides to Amazing relaxing long river which takes you to other rides. I dare you to do the "Leap of Faith" and yeah I did it. It's a Lifetime Experience!! No regrets when you leave this place. Dubai boils during summer, so I reckon you do it before summer sets in or after summer. Every Slide gives a new experience. Had alot of fun, made memories. Dubai residents (residence visa) get discounts, so avail the offer. Make sure to look up when you do the leap of faith to click your face clearly and collect the photos before leaving. Its dam worth the price of the photo for a memory although its a bit expensive. Cheers!

Loved aquaventure!!. My family and I visited here only last week and absolutely loved it! We were staying in the Atlantis so the park and towel rental was included which was is a lovely bonus. I have really bad asthma so walking up loads of stairs to get to rides in other parks is a problem for me, so the best part for me about aquaventure is that the lazy river/Rapids can take you right up to other rides without even leaving the water/your tube. Yes there are some rides that this is available for and you do have to climb a lot of stairs for but this was a great help. Staff are so helpful and were great fun. This is one of the best water parks I've been to. Our group range from my niece who is 2 to my gran in her 70s and there was something for everyone! Would definitely return!

Felt like kids again!!!!. This was something my wife and I were definitely looking forward to. We were there with a group of friends which made the whole experience even better.All the rides are a must, specifically the tower of Neptune and Poseidon. Lazy river is a great way to see and get around the waterpark.It can get extremely busy so I recommend getting to the park before 11am (ideally when it opens) so you can get some rides in straight away before the queues build up.The only downside I found was getting hold of a 2 person tube was almost impossible.Would highly recommend a visit here, specially if you are there with friends or your kids.

fantastic. the park is very cool. attractions blend toys with aquariums and we can still enjoy the delightful beach opposite the park.Annexed to The Palm Jumeirah Hotel, it is a water park very well assembled, with great attractions. There are swimming pools, rapids, a walk under a large aquarium (including sharks) and a private beach.Amazing experience in Dubai. This water park is fantastic, especially for the organization and the attractions. That waterside passing in the middle of an aquarium is TOP.

Heaps of Fun! Safe! Should have an Express Lane for Imperial Club guests.. This attraction is fun! It is very large, with restaurants and refreshment locations all over. There are plenty of resort staff everywhere. I think there should be an express line for Atlantis Imperial Club guests.

Taxi scam when leaving Atlantis!. After a fantastic day at the water park with a memorable trip to sea lion point it was thoroughly ruined when leaving the complex. Upon our exit from the building we were greeted by an Atlantis hotel staff member whom ran the taxi rank, we were asked if we wanted a taxi and where our destination was. We were walked to the nearest car in the lobby which was a standard Toyota car, the hotel member passed a slip of paper to the driver which we assumed stated our destination, we were then driven to our nearby destination at the foot of The Palm. Upon arrival at our destination we were passed the slip of paper given to the driver by the hotel member which stated the price which was a colossal 90UAD (far more than the 22UAD paid in the taxi on the journey there this morning!) and that the vehicle was not a standard taxi but a hotel car. Both the fact that the vehicle was a 'hotel car' or that the journey would cost 90UAD were not advised when we got in the vehicle. We were asked if we wanted a taxi by the hotel member and if we had been advised of the above by that hotel member we would have made alternative arrangements or negotiated the fare with that individual. An hour long argument with the driver pursued outside our hotel destination which included him attempting to drive back to the Atlantis with us still in the car! The fare was only settled by our hotel concierge upon coming to an agreement to pay 45UAD. Still more than double the fair on the way there! This certainly soured our trip to Atlantis and we would like to make everyone aware of this scam. I'm sure we're not the first and that we won't be the last to encounter this issue.

Great park and rides. Great rides and facilities for all the family. Take water shoes as floor very hot. Hang on tight on big rides as thrilling. Some parts of lazy river as not lazy but frustratingly slow.

Best park ever. I have visited many a water park, USA and Europe) however this has to be one of the best ever, great selection of rides for all ages, of which the majority are accessed via the river rapids, no need to walk about...great idea

WATER. I am not keen on the water but managed the rapids and torrents. I thoroughly enjoyed it along the lazy river. Had the lifeguards in hysterics - fell out twice of the inflatable !! I would imagine the children would love it
An absolute must!. What an incredible full day out ranging from relaxing floating in inflatables to exhilarating rides!

Memorable Adventure in Aquaventure. A memorable day when i have enjoyed a lot of slides and each slide provides you with a new experience.. The plonge is the most dangearous one .. You feel that you gonna die but it was really impressive and poseidon tower is a new addition which is very worthy.New adventures..new friends..amazing place to chillout and relax.

Fun-filled day out!. had the most amazing time here-fun, relaxing, thrilling-ideal for small kids, big kids, couples, families and even those observing religious garments...everyone!favourites- The Rapids were so fun and thrilling! And the torrent was just wonderfully relaxing yet exhilarating!Would definitely recommend this to everyone! the staff are plentiful and funny and make your experience a whole lot better!everyone was well behaved and respectful in the park. The park is clean in line with the main parts of dubai.Food options are varied-a little pricey though.i.e £10 for a shwarma meal and £6 for frozen yogurt!The showers were a little cold and quite small considering the number of guests...The other bits and bobs like a water proof pouch are also quite pricey at £20, so I would recommend buying one before you go if you want to take pictures whilst on the rides Overall, a trip to dubai is not quite complete without a visit to the park!Only criticism is the monorail to and from the park needs to be more frequent! if you miss it you have to wait 20 mins for the next one! Also the park should offer plastic bags to carry your wet things home in and should have the wringer machine to dry swimming costumes in...it's not fun walking around with a wet towel!Until next time...!

Great fun. We had a lot of fun at Aquaventure. We used an Entertainer voucher to get a buy 1 get 1 free deal, which made it a great value. We rented a locker but brought our own towels (otherwise you can rent them). Lots of great fast rides. Wish the tubes were available at the top of each ride so you didn't need to carry the tubes everywhere. Recommend that you get there early. We got there at 10a and there were no lines at all anywhere. We weren't staying at Atlantis but there were plenty of taxis waiting at the exit when we left.

Bring some footwear. Fantastic water park with a lazy river that takes you all around it, and conveyors that transport you up to the slides. Beware, Dubai is so hot, the water is warm and the walkways are too hot to walk on in bare feet so BRING FOOTWEAR... flip flops or beach shoes etc. The slides and rides are excellent. It is very hot though, and we only lasted about 3 hours.

Average Place to see. I liked this waterpark very much. The admission fee is reasonable and there are plenty of things to do for everyone in any age.Can get crowded, so suggest that you get there early. There aren't that many rides as expected so it doesn't take all day to be there. You can hire a lock/towel but you can bring your own. No food/drinks allowed.

Loads of fun!. So much fun and I love the lazy river which takes you around to most of the rides. Such a clever idea. Loads of attractions here too including flying fox and interactive animal experiences. Not to be missed!
Super fun. We had such an amazing time at Aquaventure. My dolphin adventure ticket included the entry for the park too!The slides are super fun and definitely try the shark lagoon!

Excellent park, average service. The park is excellent with a great variety of rides, even those to suit the most daring of thrill seekers. Not so much for kids as most of the rides have height requirements, although there is a small children's section. We had a lovely day after we had tackled the customer service. We booked our tickets online before we went and were not informed of their rules about no food allowed into the park until we tried to enter. We had packed a lunch and weren't even allowed to put these in our locker or leave them outside of the park to collect on the way out. However, once inside the park we saw lots of families eating the food that was obviously from outside of the park.Also, is the restaurant we were told if we paid 40 AED for a cup that we would get free refills all day, so we did, only to find out that it was in fact 8 AED each time you wanted to refill.Lovely place but be on the ball.

Favourite part of our holiday in Dubai. The best waterpark that we have ever been to , we arrived at 10 am and didn't leave the place till 5pm . The Slides are so much fun and there is something for everyone to enjoy there . Only advice I would give is bring flip flops as ground is extremely hot to walk around on barefoot , also plenty of suncream as you get burnt so easy as you are kept cool all day in the water and don't notice yourself burning. If we had longer time in Dubai we would have definitely returned to this park as it was the best fun ever
Nice place to spend one day. Nice place to spend one day special for families with kids. In weekend the place is too crowded but is nice.The kids will not be bored for sure

Outstanding ! So much family fun !. Outstanding fun ! The range of rides and options are great ..You can do lots or do little ... You chose to float on the rubber rings throughout the park or tackle some of the amazing rides which have various degrees of heart pumping action Great for our kids (8 and 11) and for mum and dad too We had unlimited access via our package deal with the hotel -Atlantis , The Palm

Short visit. This waterpark is massive. Be sure to carry a hat, a cozzie, slops, sunglasses and sunscreen as it is scorching. Very pricey as to be expected with Dubai attractions but lots of great fun.

SIMPLY AMAZING. AMAZING ADVENTURE PARK! WOW! Must be seen to be believed. No expences spared on this place. Need a couple of days to really enjoy the whole park. Truely amazing place for both adults and children. Please, please do yourself a favour and go if stopping over in Dubai. Highly recommended! Looking forward to our next holiday there

Wow!!. What a fantastic water park with rides to suit all. The lazy river was brill and the more thrilling rides certainly made your heart beat faster! We were lucky enough to take part in dolphin adventure too and this truly was an extra special experience. Food and drink was reasonably priced throughout the park.

Adrenaline Rush. Thee best waterpark in UAE by miles.
For the most exhilarating thrills Aquaventure Waterpark is the place to be.
The Tower of Neptune and Tower of Poseidon leaves your tummy in your throat, its such an unbelievable rush !!!

Fun Fun Fun!!!. Aquaventure in Atlantis is simply amazing with lot of slides which will make sure that you feel the adrenaline rush. Poseidon's Revenge, Aquaconda and Zoomerrango was terrific. The Lazy River allowed us to beat the heat of Dubai by allowing us to take some rest but rapids make sure that you dont miss out the fun. A full day is a must and this place is highly recommended....The locker facilities were available but paid.

Brilliant part of the Hotel Atlantis . This makes it a true resort here , as this swimming park is attached to a dolphin aquarium , and other aquariams that can be viewed no less from bedrooms in the hotel suites for a very high price . The waterpark keeps families happy all day long , with lots of slides and pools .
Im a fan. THE best water park I have ever visited, bring your family your nan your sister you mum or your uncles and defo the kids fun for everyone, but be prepared to be scared

A Quality day out. On the second visit to Aqua adventure it didn't disappoint we spent the day floating around from one thrill ride to the next very clean and presentable as always only my thinking but there did seam to be a few rides missing the bowl etc but still enough to keep us entertained for 6 or so hours a great escape from the winter heat just be aware of one factor when we left the park we were politely asked if we wanted a cab and we did the conseige pointed us in the direction of a row of Lexus style vehicles DO NOT use these use a regular cab as we did these are classed as limousine's once you park yourself on the back seat you will be given an invoice for around 160.00Dhs this is for your ride back to your accommodation USE the regular cabs we did an 11km journey for 34dhs be aware

All day fun. It's just a great water park to visit. I would recommend to stay at Atlantis Hotel there you have free entrance to the waterpark no standing in line for the entrance tickets and the golf car gets you to the location that you want to stay for the day. We go at least twice a year with family there and we always love it specially with the new rides they got.

Lots to do for all ages. we went hear for 1 1/2 days and still did not manage to do all the rides - the heat really does take it out of you. It is a fabulous place with lots to do for all ages. The food / drink venues are reasonably priced and well positioned around the park. There is lockers but to be honest it is a safe place - most people left their belongings on the sun loungers when they went on rides and it was safe.

REAL ATLANTIS. Great water fun with heaps of wet rides and fun.
Spend a whole day here and add the Aquarium in the two park pass worth it for sure
family time. a good park to enjoy and theres everything for everyone here.. the thrilling rides and the relax boat rides.

Preferred Wild Wadi. Tried Aquaventure this year having been to Wild Wadi last year. AV has easily more thrilling rides but the park is a bit of a nightmare. Real lack of maps/signs to navigate. We even had to get a golf buggy to some attractions because they are just so far away. Because of this, the park does seem quiet. They sting you for water too, like most places. Our lunch was cheaper than 4 bottles of small water!

Atlantis palm holiday . Stated st Atlantis and had free entry to this water park. My 2 elder children spent hours over 2 days here exploring all the trill seeking rides and activities. They made mobile videos of themselves screaming through shark water rides and the look on there faces tells the story in itself. My younger 3 year old had me running all afternoon in 45c heat at the kids section of this water park. She was having a whale of a time while poor old daddy was knackered. Tip buy yourself a waterproof phone walker cover and save damaging your phone and also take snaps and videos of yourselves.
Sooper coool and awesome.. Awesome place for kids and family. It has got several water rides and lazy pool. My kids had a blast.

Great Fun!. This is a must do activity for the those who like water and to scare themselves! We have taken our young adult children here on their visits to Dubai and have had a great family time full of laughs and no electronics! You can easily spend a whole day here between slides, floating in the river, and sunbathing. If you get the combo ticket with lunch and lost chambers included it is a good deal - food is OK with a good choice and the lost chambers are really good

Best Waterpark Ive been to. I loved this place. I arrived just after 10am which was opening time, and only intended to stay a few hours but I stayed all day, until after 6pm! The lazy river seemed to go on and on forever, with lots of different turn offs you could take, some had some really good rapids you go through. The slides were so much fun, and the good thing about it was most of them ended you out into the lazy river, where you could float back around again and onto a conveyer belt which took you back up to the slides. - no need to get out of the water and stand in a line! I really enjoyed my day here.

Fun day out. This was a fun day out, we hired a Cabanna as we were a party of 6 people, we had complimentary water and a bowl of fresh fruit which was delicious. The lazy river took you all round the park so if you did not feel like walking you could float to the next ride. The Beach on the edge of the park and is worth going to have a dip in the sea. If you do not feel like walking then you can take the lazy river and float between the rides. it is a good way to spend a day but I would not recommend for small children.

Great day out for the whole family.. This is a fantastic waterpark for all ages. My wife and I went with our two boys aged 10 and 8 in August 2015. It's easy to spend a full day here. The park is spread over a large area.I would recommend popping to Sports Direct (UK) and get a pair of Hot Tuna Water Shoes made from the same stuff as a wetsuit for a couple of pound. The lifeguards won't allow you to wear any other sort of footwear on the slides. The concrete is hot, the slide won't finish where you took your footwear off and will take the enjoyment away if you need to walk back to get your flip flops etc.SlidesThere are a good selection of slides for all ages. Most of them can be accessed from the Lazy River so there's no need to get off your rubber ring. Annoyingly, some of the slides on the day we visited were out of action. Plenty of double and single rings available.Signage and information:- I have to say this really has in my opinion let the waterpark down. It would have been nice at entry if a detailed map clearly indicating all the slides and the thrill level, and this could be backed up at the slide itself.FoodThe food is typically what you expect for this type of attraction (Burgers, Chips etc). The quality of the food is above average but expensive.CabanaWe hired a Cabana for the day which came complete with Table, Chairs, Sun Loungers, Bean Bags, Hammock, Fresh Fruit, Iced Bottled Water, Towels and Locker. I felt this was worth the money to provide shelter from the sun and guarantee getting a lounger as by the afternoon the park had really filled up.Summary:- Fantastic waterpark but unless you are staying at Atlantis you need to spend the full day to get your moneys worth. If your child is 1.2m or taller, you pay the Adult price. Would go again when in Dubai.

Great place to spend the day. We visited the waterpark with our children and weren't disappointed with the rides and the activities. There is water rides for all ages, some are a bit tame and some scare the life out of you. We took advantage of the meal deal which was very good value and for a family helped in getting out of the heat for a few minutes. The beach was very clean and is lifeguarded which is always good to see. The dolphin area was good but unless you have a real desire to touch dolphins then it can be very expensive. In regards to transport we took a taxi from JBR which cost approx. 70AED, there is a 5 AED charge for picking up at the hotel but what I would really recommend is taking one of the hotel cars, a little bit more expensive but as they say you get what you pay for.on the whole a good day and would recommend to all

Great fun but it is expensive.. Atlantis is one of those bucket list places. I had mixed feelings about my day at Atlantis, I completely enjoyed my time at Aquaventure, the waterpark. It really is a must do. Go on a weekday (Friday and Saturday are weekends in the UAE), I went on a Sunday and there were no crowds, no waiting in line. Even if you are not into water parks or the thrill rides, it is still a fantastic day. I have been to Wet n Wild and White Water World on the Gold Coast, Australia and think Atlantis is much better. It you have the extra money, try the Shark Safari. A couple of recommendations: Take your thongs/ flip flops everywhere, even the rides. The concrete is ‘burn the soles of your feet’ hot. If you are going with a group of people, spring for a Cabana, it really is worth it. Go across the from the water park to the beach and have a swim in the sea. It is so salty (like the dead sea) you just float, odd feeling but so much fun.A stop at the TBJ for a burger and fries is perfect after swimming and rides all day. I was a little disappointed with the décor of Atlantis. I guess I was expecting something different, a little bit more refined. I would definitely go back to Atlantis and it is a fantastic place to take the family, if you mind paying. You are unable to take food or drinks into the park and all bags are checked. So it can be and expensive day for a large family. There were people in all forms of swim wear, having to cover up is not an issue. As long as you don’t wear a thong bikini you should be fine. I did find the staff kind of unhelpful from the ticketing office (we had already booked Cabana online) which took ages to just get tickets. Our group only dealt with our Cabana attendant and he was more than helpful.

Its ok - Sunday morning's are great as no queues. Maybe our expectations were too high. We visited the park on a Sunday morning, which was great as there were no queues at all and we got round the park very quickly. The rides are good as you would expect, but we felt that there should have been more, I have certainly been to better water parks. It is very expensive, but luckily it was my friends Birthday the day before so he got in free. If we had paid full price for the 2 of us, I would have given it an even lower score.

Good - But not better than Wild Wadi & Water World. They have good arrangements for Parking.The Food Court is good Enough.Must be there at 10AM to Enjoy all Rides, Unlike Water World AUH, there is no Premium access, so you have to wait in long Queues.
Kids loved this.. We took our kids to this waterpark they lived every second of it. So much to choose from definitely give this waterpark a visit because it really is a must.

Lots of fun. Had a great day in the water park lots of great rides, lots of sun loungers great fun for adult and kids, I came of the ring in the water Rapids and banged my head and went under the water, the life guards were there straight away to help me out which I was very grateful for they got me a ice pack for my head and some water,they then called for the medical team to come and check I was ok, all in all they were very good

Straight of the plane to Aquaventure. Knowing our flight was an over nighter from Heathrow we decided to go to the park on arrival in Dubai as the rides would keep us active and awake. We had the bonus of a free ticket obtained on the Aquaventure website as it was my son's birthday. We had a thoroughly enjoyable day and by going midweek , we'd during the off season the park was not at all busy which made it all the more enjoyable. The meal deal package was reasonable. Also it may be worth checking with your hotel concierge who give out discount coupons. Will visit again next time.

Great park for everyone. We were staying at Atlantis so went to the park a lot.The park had everything for everyone, the slides were good and good atmosphere.I would say that for younger kids, Wild Wadi is better.
Atlantis the Palm. A very nice water theme park..Children this is your place to enjoy.....Atlantis Aquaventure got so many rides to enjoy. don't miss it
