Brilliant. We have been here a number of times and is it brilliant. Yes it gets a bit busy but there are some quiet areas if you seek them out.

Don't go in summer. Staff were not helpful, nor did any of the rides communicate how long they were, Rapids goes on for every. Sure plenty of people could enjoy in cooler months, but I found too hot and not that friendly.

Great fun!. I spent a day at the water park with my friends and it was so much fun. The slides were thrilling, not to scary (for me). Water is clean and clear. When you're tired, you can go to the lazy river. Good day in general!

Really fun. Great day out with family. Left young kids at the children's area with an adult and the rest of us ventured round the park going on nearly every attraction. Leap of faith was the most thrilling. A must place to visit when in Dubai!

Worst experience of my life due to rude staff. I have visited aquaventure today for the first time, as I have always been a fan of wild wadi, and heard alot about their tallest ride "leap of faith" . I have never in my dreams thought of coming back with such bad mood and a lot of wasted money. Since I was wearing a covered but skin tight dress one of their nepali team leader came shouting , grinding teeth and staring saying if you can't wear a bikini don't come to a water park. Although in all the rides we are suppose to be in a tube . Their is literally no customer service or complain centre and she told all her colleges to not allow me on a ride.so basically kicked me out of the park since I couldn't go on any ride .I and my husband came back to ticketing office to complain but looked like they couldn't do anything in front of team lead. overall a bad experience and alot of wasted money
Good fun. Really good fun,pretty hot on your feet wear flip flops or you will burn your feet.lots of experiances there.

Very good but also much walking in the sun. We liked some of the rides and esp. the Dolphin Adventure (a must). However, the area is quite large, walking ways are long and there is not much shadow. Restaurants and included meals are rather low level fast food. So, nice in some aspects but we liked Wild Wadi more.

A Brilliant Time. We had unlimited access to the waterpark as part of our package staying at the Atlantis The Palm hotel. It was by far one of the best waterparks we have ever been to. Well organised with helpful staff and the rides are awesome. Would not hesitate to go back.

spectacular. If you are in Dubai, save at least half a day for the Aquaventure.We went there to swim with dolphins and afterwards enjoyed the waterpark. They got some really fun but also scary rides. Being locked in some sort of capsule and after the countdown the floor under your feet is gone so you literally fall into the slide pushes so much adrenalin into your body. Great fun!Also got some family rides there. ;-)Great fun, would go again.

That's quite something. We could not miss the opportunity to take a ride after a nice swim with dolphins. As many other previous reviews mentioned, this is a 5* water park, a must visit attraction. It is actually a nice refreshment on a hot day in Dubai considering that you won't get dry until and unless you stop ;). That's a good thing but it could be a bad if you get burned by the sun as I managed to... Who cares, there's lot of fun to enjoy.

Loads of fun at Aquavenutre. My 17 year old son and I had a great time at the Atlantis Aquaventure Waterpark. We went down the "leap of faith" which is the world's steepest waterslide. There are lifeguards every few feet on each ride which is really re-assuring. The park is very clean and well run. Great views from the park and monorail. Worth the price of admission.
amazing. nice and worthy to visit....5 star quality aqua parkcool and all in all must visit in dubai. it's number 5 in trip advisor ranking waterparks

Fun day out, at a price. We had a fun day out here with our two children (10 & 13) The park belongs to the Atlantis hotel, is situated on The Palm and is run extremely efficiently. We pre-booked tickets on-line and saved 10% (I think lots of the hotels offer discount vouchers too) Lockers and towels cost extra. There were plenty of food kiosks dotted around the park and surprisingly, cold drinks were quite reasonable. There are lots of rides but not many for the feint hearted. Our daughter is a little wary and so there wasn't too many traditional water slides to use, apart from the little children's play area (which was ace) We did have a good day but for the price and variety, we have been to better parks across Europe.

Brilliant. Absolutely brilliant day out with people of all ages, including young children.Loads of rides for all ages plenty of food places to eat entry was £44 per person. Well worth it.Great day out defiantly need to visit!

Definitely the best water park that I have been.. Water park is amazing, huge, water is warm in all slides, lazy rivers, show with dolphins is expensive but also amazing experience, lost chamber is excellent you can relax and watch all kinds of sea creatures... Definitely the best water park that I have been.

Great for all the family. We had a great day out here. Scary rides, gentle rides, pools to relax in, and a water fun house with small slides for kids (and adults too) You can hire a go pro, we have fantastic videos and pics of the day, including on the slides and underwater. It has a strap to wear on your wrist. Well worth it.Tips, get beach socks you can wear on the slides and then don't burn your feet walking on the paths (we bought in sports shop in Emirates Mall for 45dirhams, and nice for the beach back home as well)Tip 2, LOCKERS are in the changing rooms, and unlocked by strap on wrist, if you want to visit locker separately you would need two lockers, We had four towels, flip flops and change of clothes for four people, needed large locker. You pay for locker at same booth that you present your ticket and are issued with the entrance wrist band (note you need a separate one for locker, we saw many people confused)You are allowed to carry 1 litre of water per person ( no other drinks allowed, and food)We didn't eat there, and drinks were a bit pricey inside (500ml soda 18dirhams, and 500mil water 13dirhams)We spent around 6hrs there (kids would have stayed much longer)
Fabulous. A great day out for all ages. My kids loved it. As weather was very hot being in the water all day made it bearable. I could relax on the beach whilst children enjoyed the water rides.

Fantastic. Great park for this kids. for those going on the leap of faith be ready for the leap. We ate the Shark Bites restaurant and felt it was overpriced but i suppose most attractions are like this.

Good Day Out. Can get crowded, so suggest that you get there early. Kids will love it and will keep them occupied. There aren't that many rides as expected so it doesn't take all day to be there. You can hire a lock/towel but you can bring your own. No food/drinks allowed. Take some flip flops because it gets very hot there. Good private beach as well which hardly anyone goes to. We combined it with the Aquarium which gave it a good break

Fantastic fun. Great place for big and little kids !! Lots of fun rides and an exciting play area for little ones. Could do with more choices for places to eat. I was staying at Atlantis and entry was complimentary but had to pay for the locker....this did prove to be expensive.

fun day for all. different to other water parks especially because of the rides that go through the shark tanks, Leap of Faith is awesome ! you could just as easily spend hours going around the lazy river and still have fun!

Great fun. We went here after we had been to dolphin bay as part of our ticket which was a great addition. Took a bit to suss the layout but basically there are two main towers with half a dozen slides on them and then a lazy river and zip wire thrown in for good measure. There are little shuttles to get u around which helped because the ground was so hot to hot to walk on even though my husband invested in the shoes they supply in the shops. Go in a good pair of flip flops in the hight of the summer. We didn't have to que to long at the rides. You need to buy a locker to store your personal effects small lockers are quite small changing rooms clean as is the park. Staff helpful and friendly. Our towels from dolphin bay were used at the water park so if u come from another hotel as we did to enjoy both the Dolphins and park no need to worry about a towel. Fab day with good rides maybe not as good as the water parks in the U.S. But a brilliant addition to the Atlantis

Great!. I liked their waterpark very much. The admission fee is reasonable and there are plenty of things to do for everyone in any age. For me the day in Aquaventure Waterpark remains the highlight of my trip to Dubai. Would visit again for sure.

Omg super fun day out. This will bring out the kid in you again. It's an amazing park. Note vouchers for this are not included in the entertainer book. So it's an expensive day out. You will probably need to hire a locker. Bring your own towels to make it a bit cheaper.Also most importantly DO NOT abandon your shoes in the mid day sun next to a ride you don't know how you'll get back to. You will see most people keep their flip flops on their wrists or tucked into the handles of the rubber rings. Seriously we nearly burnt our feet on the concrete.This park is way more fun in my opinion than wild wadi.
Fantastic. The best water theme park I have been too could've spent the whole time there it was so much fun and enjoyed every minute of it
enjoyable. the water park was pretty cool. no irritating queues like in wild wadi. had so much fun there with the kids. even in the kiddies section

Amazing. This is the best water park by far the we have visited. We were actually staying at the Atlantis hotel and visiting the watermark was included. We went every day. Our 13 year old son loved it and did myself and my husband. The lazy river was the best attraction for me. Tip- buy a refillable cup whilst there saves a fortune.

great waterpark. id wanted to visit here for years and was totally gutted that when i got there i wasnt feeling to good but i tried to make best of the day as much as i could, we did a package where you got the access to the waterpark, aquarium and you also got lunch i csnt remember the price but it was a pretty good deal, make sure you wear your flip flops everywhere because the floor gets boiling hot, it has some great flumes all day fun for anyone
Unbelievable. The biggest waterpark I've been too.....No line ups, you float around to the next ride. Food was great, everything was so clean. I would recommend this theme park.

Best aquapark in UAE. We enjoyed all day in aquapark riding all different attractions and just having funAmenities is very nice and it is very clean Do not try visit this place on weekends as it will be very crowdy
Not great. Rides were limited when compared with Wild Wadi and very confusing to navigate through park. Worth a visit if your due to explore the Atlantis.

Fun!. We enjoyed our day here, the rides are good my son especially enjoyed the leap of faith and the shark attack. The only couple of negatives I would say is that in August the ground is so hot and we found ourselve walking on the boiling hot floor when we came off the rapid ride and couldn't find our flip flops as the stop points aren't numbered. At Wild wadi the system is much better so you know where you have left your shoes, which is a must in the August heat. The other is that there are not enough shady areas in my opinion I.e umbrellas so we did found ourselves overheating a lot.
Aquaventure. though the entry charges are very steep, Acqaventure is for those people whole wnjot the adrenaline rush of the water rides,

Good little water park to amuse all ages. This is probably worth a visit for the kids. I can't speak for the larger slides as I didn't try then. I was with small kids but the tube ride that goes across the whole park is good fun for littlies and adults alike.A few hints:Go in the morning, it opens at 10, before it's too crowded.Take your own lunch/drinks as it is very expensive in there for any kind of snack.The ground gets very hot so suggest you take some kind of slip on wetsuit shoe you can wear in and out of rides.

Awesome trip with friends. Went here with some friends on a stag-do. Really loved it. Best water park I've been to. I recommend wearing Crocs using the strap. The surface is blistering hot when walking barefoot, and got caught out when floating around the the river with my floatation ring and getting out without my slippers. If using Go-Pro, bring the head setup. The sticks are banned from some of the slides.
Famy holiday. Wonderful if u have young kids mine are 5 and 11Very busy in August.Good fun with kids kids are allowed on rapid with a adultLeap of faith is a must if ur brave enough

Brilliant ... Get here early . Very busy in afternoons and UAE weekends (Fri / Sat) ; try and get here when it opens at 9.45am for hotel residents . Excellent park , make sure you try leap of faith and posideons revenge , highly recommended .

Things I wish I knew before I went. Overall we had a great day. The rides are fab and we had very few queues.It's not a cheap day out though, here's how you can minimise the costBook in advance. The website states entry was 250 Dirhams. No mention of it being dearer if you just turn up. IT ISentry cost at venue was 310 Dirhams. That's about £11 dearer. That cost us as a group over £40Buy pool shoes or pool socks before you go. You will prob need them. The ground gets very hot. Saw loads of people hopping about in pain We bought them in the shop before you get to the ground and paid about £25 a pair. We were glad we bought them but wished we'd paid less.Go in your birthday week. If you pre-register you can get in free.Buy multiple bottles of water - water inside was 13dirhams a bottle but you could get 4 for 40dhs or 6 for 55dhsHowever there we did find one water fountain inside the park which we used to refill water bottlesThings the park could do better.More water fountains dispensing cold water (the one we found dispensed warm water)I assume they don't do this to make more money in sales (poor if so given the cost to get in)Cold showers - you will get really hot and it would have been good to have cold showers to cool downA map should also be given to explain where the dudes are, what they are and how you get to them.We also hired a small locker which cost another 40dhs (just under £8) again given cost to get in I think this a bit much.The cost of the day was high, however it was a great day.

The best waterpark in Dubai. My girlfriend and I stayed at the Atlantis - giving complimentary access and it was so amazing we visited it both days we were there - and then returned on our final day in Dubai even though staying at another hotel. Some amazing rides to give you the thrill, also plenty of space to relax on a lounge chair or float through the rapids all day. Was simply the best fun!

Fun for everyone.. If you like a mix of adrenalin rides and lazy river rapids this is for you. Kids will love it too. Great variety of activities to keep everyone entertained. Try the group rubber ring rides at your peril!
Day trip. Must visit. If nothing else can keep cool in lazy rivers. Great park. Bring drinks rather than buy there and waterproof case for phone for photos.
ALL DAY FUN. I never get tired of this waterpark - so much to do and great fun!Suitable to visit with Families and friends for a super day out - you never want them to close the park!
Take Me Back. AHH take me back. AMAZING experience for all the family members. No matters how old you are you will LOVE IT.

Fun day out but extremely HOT (August 2015). Went on Saturday 29 August 2015 to Aquaventure. We arrived at 10am which is about the time the park opens. There wasn't a long queue and we managed to get our tickets fairly quickly. Price for adult is AED310 and resident AED 185. We got one small locker (this can even fit a small/medium sized bag inside. The wrist tags have a barcode which lock and unlock the lockers. This is super convenient.The park is much larger than wild wadi and has more thrill rides. There are numerous slides and lots to do.The time we went (August 2015) there weren't many queues and you could easily go on a ride twice or thrice the only downside was that it was extremely hot. I liked the fact that they have a beach section which everyone can access. This allows you to have fun on the rides and then relax by the beach front. There are two towers which contain all the main rides: Tower of Neptune and Tower of Poseidon.Tower of Neptune has the shark attack, leap of faith and water coasters. We finished all the rides on this tower before moving to the next tower. This was a fun tower. Note that you will need to collect a rubber circle from downstairs and bring it up as at times they run out of rubber circles.Tower of Poseidon has aquaconda, zoomerango, slitherine, Poseidon's revenge and slitherine. This tower does not require any rubber circles for the ride.Note that climbing up and down the towers can be very tiring so make sure to hyderate yourself.I found it frustrating that at times they didn't have enough rubber circles stocked up at the top of the tower which meant you needed to carry your own rubber circle around (can be heavy after a while). My wild wadi experience on the other hand was that they had enough rubber circles available before each ride!A key word of advice is to have water shoes. The floor gets extremely hot. On most of the rides you can go with the water shoes. For the rides that you can't wear the water shoes they allow you to hold the shoes whilst going on the ride. You can wear fit flops however these will always need to be thrown down the slide before hand or held onto when on a ride. The restaurants and food stalls at the park are very expensive. Small water bottle is for AED 13, lemonade is AED 26! Food costs way more but since options are limited you have no choice but to purchase their items.In terms of the restaurant there is shark attack and barracuda. Barracuda has more of a food court feel and variety of different cuisines (thai, indian, pizza, burgers, fried chicken) to chose from as opposed to shark attack which is more limited to just fast food (burgers, pizza and fried chicken). If you are in a big group then would recommend making the trek to Barracuda. Both restaurants have indoor (airconditioned) and outdoor seating.

Amazing!!!. Just book and you won't be disappointed! You will have so much fun here. The park itself is within the Atlantis Hotel. You can either travel direct by taxi or jump on the metro and get off at the Mall of Emirates and get a taxi to the Atlantis Hotel!!!!

Tons of fun - and lots of lifeguards. So much fun! Kids & adults enjoyed 5 consecutive days of fun here (believe it or not!). Sun was hot in August so this was the perfect way to cool off and stay active. Park does get busy but the lines are rarely more than a few minutes. We didnt have trouble finding a sun bed to park our stuff. TONS of lifeguards - many more than we expected. They were being tested one day we visited. They were all alert and professional. I was impressed!

Could be better. Since 2010 we have visited the park four years. It is an astonishing waterpark. However, year by year we notice that the park's popularity is becoming a boomerang in terms of value for money. 325 euros for a family of four, I find it not worth it anymore. It is about 10 euros more, than what you pay for a combination ticket for both Ferrari World and Yas Waterworld in Abu Dhabi. 5 years ago when a "leaf" was in the water the lifeguards would jump in to remove it. Shower water was cold and running sufficiently. You could see no garbage or any dirt in any of the park's areas. This year, apart or because of the fact that it was overcrowded, you could see garbage, food, empty bottles and other items on the floor. The attraction is always a must see when you are in the area, lots of rides, probably the best ones in the area. Food and snacks are reasonably priced. Lifeguards are as always sufficient and you get the feeling that they really watch out.Very good park, but overcrowded and overpriced.

Amazing. one of the best water parks .... I love ittttt , al the attractions fun & thrilling to the maximum. We went as a 2 couples from the morning till closing & we couldn't had enough enjoyment.. I highly recommend it for everyone
Fun day for the family. Great day out. Staff were great very helpful. Our children loved it. Not cheap but worth it. Would definitely go again.

Would be good but the crowds make it almost unbearable. We only used this once during our 10-day stay at the Atlantis because it was so crowded first time around that we gave it a wide berth after that.

Atlantis Aqua Park - great place on the palm. Also known as Atlantis water park - I've done a review on this comparing it to Wild Wadi WPIn essence its the same thing costs around the same probably has a similar number of rides / eateries - although the main restaurant shark bites is bigger and air conditioned nothing similar i noted in WWWP - you also have access to the beech which you don't in WWWPThe cost of lockers is similar again if going as a family cheaper to rent the larger lockers We saved around £6 per person going through Arabian Tours Company in Dubai - the cost of both is around £50 per person with a height over 1.2 mThe kids area is similar size with two large buckets which empty on a regular basis our 6 year old loved itThe lazy river - tube you can float on has a few nice surprises as is better and longer the WWWP - it ends in the wave pool which is disappointing - the wave pool is much better at WWWPThere are several fast rides and our 11 year old loved them, including Neptune which is a near vertical drop There is a Zip wire - there is a separate payment for this It looks wonderful and is well landscaped and has access to the beech - but this also makes the rides further apart compared to WWP which is much more compact NO free WiFI here you have to pay for it All in all teen kids would love Atlantis and younger kids will probably like WWWPWe eat at shark bites prices are reasonable for Dubai Tip - if getting the refillable drinks (up front cost and then 8 Dh to refill) - only a few places refill and they are far part and i though it was a waste because the kids couldn't be bothered to walk to get a refill!

Leap of faith!. Beautiful water park in the beautiful Atlantis hotel.Best to get tickets in advance to avoid long queues.Several shops available to buy swimming gear although quite expensive.Fun rides for kids and adults. The Leap of faith is so exciting and sure to give you a boost of adrenaline. Not for the fainthearted but a visit to the park won't be the same without the leap of faith!

Fun fun fun! . Had an amazing day at Atlantis Aquaventure we started the day with interaction with the Dolphins,it was breath taking and would highly recommend. We then went to the water park and enjoyed floating around the rapids in a donut ring and going on the slides. We also spent a little time sun bathing and on the beach area. Food, drinks and I teams could be purchased we had burger and chips it was nice but over priced. They also provide towels that can be exchanged when wet. This day out was one of the most rememberable whilst holidaying in Dubai.

Waterpark. my 5 years son loves hotels that have water-park.and if a hotel does not have it we can not reserve that hotel.because his height is lower than 1.20 meter he was not allowed to go to adult part.but the children part was very exiting for him and me and his mother . the whether was hot and there were water falls in the park and it was cool for adults.plus we had allowed to use two slides there that was enough for my wife and me.we where there three hours a day for four days.it was great,great,great but there was not any music .only sounds of water.it is better that music play runes along day.the lockers and bathroom were great.but food was very expensive in the park.

Good but a little bit expensive. It was a decent experience there. The parc is large with a lot of games to try and they are all very exiting. Water is clear and clean. When we went it was crowded. For famous games you can spend half hour in the queue. Food is prohibtied and you have to buy from inside restaurants which are expensive.

A great day off work. 9 of us working on a project in Dubai took a day off to have some fun.And that is just what we had! The lines weren't too long, the longest being maybe 1/2 hour at the peak of the day for the Shark tank slide. The only knock I have on the park is they really should do something like running water on the sidewalks, they get insanely hot in the sunlight. Wear your sandals or pick up a pair of the Pool-Shoes they sell, they will save the soles of your feet.We rented the medium cabana for 9 of us, (1,000 UAE) split up, a good investment as it includes a locker, bottles of water, plenty of towels, chairs, a day bed, and we got a complimentary chilled sliced fruit bowl! A nice touch.A great day indeed!

Great Time!. We had a great time!! We went to the activity with the Dolphins which I recommend 100% and we decided to stay all day in the park!!! Many people but it doesn't seem as because is very big.

Amazing Day Out. We visited the waterpark as we were staying at the adjoining Atlantis hotel so visits here were included as part of our package. The park opens officially at 10.00am but we got there before this time on several days and the park was already open and we certainly weren't the first to be admitted. If you are staying at the hotel then towels are included but lockers aren't, these cost 40dms for a small locker which was big enough to take a bag for a family of four. As you might expect the floor gets so hot so it's worth investing in some water shoes as you can keep these on when you go on most of the rides. The rides where they ask you to remove your shoes they are more than happy to let you hold them so you don't have to re-trace your steps to retrieve your shoes. There are 2 main towers where the rides which drop down start from and if you need a tube you do have to carry these up. In August there were hardly any queues which was great and the lifeguards always made sure you were safe before they released you to start the ride. The lazy river has several rides leading off it which makes a nice change and most of these linked so you didn't have to walk up lots of steps which was a bonus. I wouldn't say overall this park had a huge amount of rides but we did enjoy ourselves and kept going back for more. The food at Barracuda was good with a good choice and you could eat in an air conditioned building which did come as somewhat of a welcome in the 43 degree heat!Plenty of sun beds for everyone but we tended not to need any as we were one the go from the minute we arrived to leaving. Finally, the changing rooms were really nice, lockers, showers, hairdryers and kept very clean.

What an amazing day!!!!!!. So I visited Aquaventure in August 201 and you would have to be completely insane if you weren't expecting 43 degree temperature. However, I found there were lots of opportunities to be in the shade, cafes/restaurants has air conditioning and lots of opportunities to cool down in the water!! They have lockers which you can hire and you're given a wristband so you don't have to worry about locker keys etc... Whilst visiting, I paid for the dolphin encounter (in this package you get entrance into the water park for free, free hire of towels and water) it was amazing and I would highly recommend it!!! They take care of their Dolphins too!!! All staff are lovely!!!! There is even a private beach!!!!IMPORTANT FIRST HAND ADVICE!!! Take flip flops!!!!!!! I would recommend not wearing your best flip flops. You will absolutely need them to walk on the hot surfaces but they do let you go down the slides holding your flip flops!!!!! Unlike other water parks I didn't burn my feet once. This is a huge advantage of this water park. They do also sell 'water shoes' you can wear. I recommend this place so much!!!! It's brilliant. If you are visiting be sure to try out Poseidon's revenge and leap of faith excellent for thrill seekers. There is also a large shark and fish tank (one of the slides goes through it - perfectly safe of course) Have fun :) x

Great family day out. We were staying on the palm so this was about a ten minute taxi ride away.Hardly any queues to get in and prices / Deals clearly labelled as you're waiting. We booked a deal which included 2 x adults and 1 x child; a locker and towels. Just seemed easier than worrying about having our belongings with us. We also took the offer of pre-loading our wristband with money so we could scan it in when buying drinks - much easier than carrying cash and anything we'd not spent was refunded back when we left.This Aquapark has something for everyone. Staff are friendly; lifeguards are in abundance and the lazy river / Rapids had travellators so you didn't have to keep getting up and carrying your rubber ring.Kids play area was well supervised and fenced in so we had 2 x sunbeds where the only exit point was, knowing we could watch our son whist relaxing and he didn't feel we were standing over him as he was trying to play!It's not a cheap day out but it's well worth a visit if you like this sort of thing. We visited Wild Wadi as well because we had free entry as Jumeirah guests. This was also a good day out (obviously free!) but we felt Atlantis had the edge when it came to points of comparison.

The best waterpark experience I ever had.. Aquaventure is one of the best water parks in the world.There are thrilling, breath-taking rides for the thrill-seeker and calm , floating rides on the river for ones who aim for relaxing. So there is something for everyone. The queues are long and walking upto the rides ( climbing fleet of stairs every time for each ride) is really bothersome otherwise, the best water park experience I ever had.

Fantastic water park. Unfortunately we didn't have very long here but the time we did we really enjoyed. We visited on a Saturday in July and were surprised that we didn't have to queue for too long for the rides. Would go back if I was ever in Dubai to experience it properly
Waterpark Atlantis. Absolutely loved it! Me and my boyfriend had such a laugh! Fun day out! Great way to catch a tan too!

a great family day. We had a great day enjoying all of the rides some of them took your breath away! Wear water shoes as the ground is too hot to walk on and you do not need to remove them for the rides, a waterproof and sunproof top was also great for being outside all day in the heat. It was very clean but the photos they take were expensive. Once you get a ring or double ring keep hold of it for on the rides.
extremes fun water. Very Extremes......and very family places, so expensive but is so very nice and very hopefully come back to dubai and this places....

No more aquaphobic . I used to be scared of water rides, slides and so on until I visited the aquaventure waterpart. I had to think of how much I paid to get in which was about $70 and not do anything? Heck no. I did a lot of fun stuffs until my battery dies. But enjoy some amazing pictures I captured. This place is age friendly, no pets, and kids are welcome to.

Great waterpark. Great day out here. Not the best waterpark in the world but definitely up there. Would recommend just for the experience. Beware that cotton is not generally allowed on a lot of the waterslides and to wear shoes which can be carried on the rides as the ground gets very hot. The food is also very expensive so unless you're willing to pay bring your own.

mediocre park at best. Useless locker system . After going to the fantastic wild wadi water park in the first week of our holiday the aquaventure park was not so good. Over priced , over hyped and a useless locker system. Staff ok at best. Some staff a bit on the rude side, compared to over customer service staff in Dubai. The locker system seemed to be faulty on our visit, the front of house member of staff was telling me, she said some times after 5mins or so, they pop open!! Which she said must have happened in this case. So all my stuff was taken by lost and found dept. instead of just closing the locker. So on my return my wrist band opened 2 other lockers, instead of mine. Not the safest! When I managed to get a staff member to take me seriously and go to my locker and override the lock, there was someone else's stuff in there.so in a panic I was taken to lost and found where they had my stuff, but oddly gave me my wallet with cash/cards in and my phone , but refused to hand over a rucksack and daughter passport. Till I proved who I was. Surely the safest and secure way would be too keep everything, till I proved who I was! Also maybe check my booking to see who we where as it was pre booked. Would I go again. Simple answer "no". Go to wild wadi instead. They don't seem to be as up them selfs as here.
Decent Theme park. The theme park was alright. The rides were fun though the place seemed a little small. As it was close to the beach it was a good deal.
Great Waterpark. A great day of fun. Will definitely need sunscreen.Require min half day.Food/Drinks are a bit pricey inside.
Amazing. Cool nice slides very very very very very good, the new Wild WadiExcellent, you just can't describe it the whole Dubai

Not as expected. Came very excited but wasnt so much impressed. The only thing worth to do is THE LEAP OF FAITH. The rest are soso.. the most disappointing part is the free towels located in the middle of the park. There is none near the showers so you have to go back to the park to get 1. Food prices are so much overpriced. Wont come back if its not free.

Best Waterpark in the UAE . Been to Aquaventure a few times with friends and family and every time I've gone I've loved it. I've actually been to all the Waterparks in the UAE, I love Waterparks, and this is the best by far. As well as your usual water rides it also has a zip slide. For an extra charge you get to experience zip sliding over parts of the park. It's really slow so thril seekers would be disappointed but it's perfect for children and adults to experience something different and also get to see the park. Also it has its own private beach which the other Waterparks in the UAE don't have. Highly recommended.

Great family day out. Pre booked before we arrived in the UAE to save time with queues but when we arrived the queues were almost non existent. Locker and towel cost 50dhm which I thought was a bit excessive and the lockers are a bit of a treck back from the slides. We have been to wild wadi and there you get a cashless band which was great but here you pay in sash unless you are a hotel guest so a bit of a pain. The lazy river was one of the best I have been on. Rides are built in so you never need to leave the water unless you want to go on the bigger rides. Couple of top tips, wear your flip flops otherwise in the August heat you will burn your feet! If you are in a group then agree in meeting point if you get separated, it took us forever to find each other when that happened to us!! Food was ok pretty much the usual theme park food water fountains are scattered around the park if you need them. For the money a good day out just make sure you put on plenty of sun cream.

Amazing Break from a hectic work. Located at The Atlantis, this is a must visit. The park is quite big with private beach for playing sports like volleyball and football. The best part is you get huge discount if you are a resident of UAE upon the presentation of your resident card. However, the number water rides is quite low as compared to other water parks in Dubai.
mind blowing water park. it is an water park which is linked with atlantis hotel...it is situated on the palm which is an island made on the water
Super fun. Super fun places to be with friends and family alike. More so with kids. Both for water fun and thrill seekers. Very interesting water rides.

Wear a lycra surf shirt to avoid backburns on the fast slides, cotton not allowed. Had a great time here though it was a bit hot. Tip is to get there at opening to avoid queues, it is too hot to queue. I think it needs one more tower of scary slides as we had enough after 3 hours. Recommend you wear a lycra surf shirt, I wore a cotton shirt and was asked to remove it for the very fast slides? Then I got friction burns all over my back. The rapids were pretty good and relaxing. Also a nice cold pool would be good. Overall it was a good slide park. It was awesome sliding through the aquarium. The floor drop was so so scary, wanted to do it again but it hurt to much without a shirt. Also wear thongs as you might want to carry them on slides to avoid walking back, my leather sandals got a bit unglued. Ground is too hot for bare feet.
Activities for the whole family. You could spend all day at the Waterpark. So much to do. Loved the lazy river with the rapids which kept us cool during the heat.

A must . Our friend works out here so had some vouchers for a day out here. What a scream we had! Never laughed so much in my life!Rides for all age from the youngest of child to the biggest adult feeling like a kid!Adrenalin pumping offerings will make your heart stop and then it will race so much you will feel like it's jumping out your chest!I didn't get to swim with dolphins as I wanted to make sure it looked like they were well looked after first. From what I saw, it looked very well thought out. So maybe next time.
Worth a visit. Had a day there with three teenagers , They enjoyed it a lot of different slides to one in Bahamas . Food very expensive .

Great day out. We visited the park several times as we were staying at the Atlantis. The rides are suited for all ages, great place to visit or spend a couple of hours if you want a break from sun bathing!
Best Waterpark!. It has always been my favorite waterpark ever! It is so elegant and creative. One of the most things I love about this place, besides the slides, is the classy crowd.

Must go!!. There are rides for adults like a Leap of faith and Poseidon's revenge. If you are for a adrenaline rush go on Poseidon's revenge, that was first ride in my life that I was actually a little bit scared. Spend there almost a whole they. Went on snorkeling with sharks, also must go!! see the Old chaimbers.

The best water park in UAE. The best water park we ever experienced in Dubai.Me and my family celebrated my birthday here.We really enjoyed every activities here.So much fun,trilling and exciting rides.

Swimming with dolphins. We had many a great day here as we got unlimited assess as part of our staying at the Atlantis
It was a fantastic place and the slides and lazy river were brilliant
We went swimming with the dolphins and this was a lovely experience and Diana was very helpful and helped make the day a memorable one
great day out. well worth a visit. We added the sealion experience which was very good and not as crwded as the dolphin one.

Worst experience. There is nothing great about the water park.If you have visited water parks in the USA then you will be very dissapointed.it is so very expensive.you have to buy a plastic pouch at 120 dhr for your money as you need it inside to buy anything.they should give this pouch on rent as it is waste afterwards.it is so hot in august but hotel is least bothered about the middle aged and elders.their is no system for rides.when u climb five storeys to take a ride u find out u need a inflatable for d ride and again you have to break the queue and go in search of that.my husband lost his breath in such hot weather and bad arrangement.we discontinued our adventure and came back to our room.we again went in the evening when sun was a little cool.overall atlantis staff is nt very concerned about your needs.they ate least bothered about your comfort.they are just minting money after the hindi movie HAPPY NEW YEAR. Crazy indians are flooded all over atlantis.everything in atlantis is over priced nt worth

Not the best waterpark, especially in the summer. This was a dream of our kids to go to the waterpark at the Palm in Dubai. In this summer the temperature reaches 48*C. At these temperatures it is not nice to be in the park. The watertemperature is around 42*C and the showers are ridiculously hot. The only airconditioning is at the toilets. After two hours our heads were like tomatoes. The slides are definitiever good but all a bit the same. We like the slide 'n splash in Portugal better. More variety. Maybe this is better in another season. Quite expensive.

Loads of fun but pricy. We spent a very nice day at the park however one tower had 2 slides out of order for a full day which was a bummer. Specially as the ticket price is not cheap! In my opinion it is something you must do, but you must ignore the price...We arrived at 10 AM which was perfect as we did not have any waiting to do to buy our tickets nor for the slides. In the afternoon the waiting times grew. We went on a Monday in July.

Amazing!! Fun!. We attending during the August period. There were three of us and it was our first time. We also rented the go pro camera as we were all going to be going on the rides and no one would be holding our phones etc. In this situation I would highly recommend go pro is rented if you want pictures and videos. We had our own towels and put them on a sun lounger. Queues were not too bad the rides were brilliant the leap of faith is a must do! Food is expensive but we just had the sno ice, too hot to eat. Also if anyone is worried about wearing their glasses it's a good idea to get prescription sunglasses and attach them to the string around your head which makes it easier to look after when going on the rides. Don't forget to buy some aqua shoes as the floor gets hot! Overall a really fun day out! Would go again!!

A must try thing in Dubai with family. We have visited Aquaventure and Lost Chambers on August while our family trip to Dubai. Kids enjoyed it pretty much ,I would not say we didn't as it was really much fun. Will defenetly go back not once however Aquaventure is crazy expensive.....paying 300 dirhams for only entrance ticket and then being asked to pay 30 dirhams for 1 towel?!! Well get ready to pay for fun. One bottle of water 10 DHS,1 bottle of Coca Cola 21 DHS.One ice cream 40 DHS. One photo small 70 DHS and big 110 DHS.Lost Chambers is amazingly beautiful with a lot of marine animals to see and wonder.

Brilliant. Brilliant, not many paces to shade in. Definitely buy the refill cups.Expensive to get drinks.
The lockers were great. The beach was lovely too. Very busy towards the end of the day.

So much fun. Booked tickets to go here on my first day going almost directly from the airport. This plan actually worked out well if your on a short holiday here. The lazy river/rapids are the best I've ever been on. The best vertical slide is a must do, it's not that bad at all and in very scared of heights. However don't expect to see the "shark tank" go down the slow slide to get a good view. Also I took my own towel but they have their own to hire very cheaply. Lastly drinks inside work out as £4 for a bottle of coke. There is a vending machine inside the monorail station just outside the hotel where they are 60p but I think you can only take limited amounts in.
fun. loads of fun. especially for teenagers and younger people. Its worth spending the whole day here....

Near best water park in the world. We went today while staying at the Atlantis, and as usual it is great. The only real thing which would make it better is the height restrictions on some rides I feel 1.2 meters is a bit high as my 5 year old as been on bigger rides in the USA who are ultra sharp on health and safety.
Atlantis water park. Great place to be. Have slides for both kids and adults. Loads of activities for all. August is too hot so better avoid visiting during this month.
It is really good don't miss it. I wanted with my family and we spine very good time to see and play and jumped it is really nice place to go

High prices for basic wterpark. Nothing exciting about this water park, very high entry price even with discount from our hotel. You would struggle to spent a full day here, section for kids, lazy river with option of some Rapids, 2 or 3 other big slides but you need two people to go on at one time.A bit of a let down.Changing faculties and lockers are good but obviously again come at a price.

Omg. One of the best part of the teavel, sincerely this is a must. You have to get there earlier to enjoy it, because the place is huge. I loved it, it's most for adults, the kids also have their play and water area, but it is design for teenagers and up...
Busy and hot. The water park gets very busy but never as busy as the water parks in the States. It is extremely hot in there as well.

Great Waterpark. Great waterpark fun for all the family, you wont be disappointed, I would suggest taking a whole day out for this as it will take a lot of time, but great for all the family anyone of any age there is something for all.

Wet and Wild. Good family fun had by all... It was hot and I would recommend you keep your flip flops to hand or you will end up with burnt feet... The rides are all good and the park is clean...we arrived at 11.30 am and the park was quiet which allowed us to do all the major rides 2/3 times without queuing for long...... Food and drinks are expensive but this is the norm I suppose for any theme/water park...

Huge waterpark on the palm. There's nothing small or understated about Dubai and Aquaventure is no different. This waterpark is huge and not that easy to find your way around. Maybe it was our jet lag but we couldn't seem to find any maps and the signposts didn't point the right way some of the time! Luckily there were always staff around to direct us. The rides are great fun and there's something for everyone - whether you prefer something gentle or love a frightening ride. The add-ons are expensive so consider bringing your own towlels and sharing a locker if there are a few of you.

Thrilling. Our day at the park was very exciting. The children had alot of fun. Great place to spend the whole day with the family. It's quite expensive so go early to really enjoy your money. If you fill up your stomach before going in you can save alot on food. Getting a big taxi for a family of six was difficult when leaving. So we had a long and tiring wait before we finally got a cab. There is a more convenient monorail but I believe it cost about AED25 per person. But great experience overall. Though I'm not sure i would go back any time soon.

Lots of fun!. A very enjoyable experience.Good service from all the waterpark staff.Lots of lifeguards around.Didnt take long to queue up for the bigger rides usually 10minutes max. The waterpark is very vast try to go as early as possible so you can have a full day out.There's also a beach running along the edge of the waterpark you can visit whilst in the park.Overall lots of fun and the perfect way to cool off during the day.

not great - too many flaws and badly laid out park. Let's get streaight to it - I would not recommend this park - too expensive and too many flaws - goto wild wadi instead much better. Here's why I would not recommend: so we went as a family of four to aquaventure in atlantis dubai. there are some major flaws to this park in how it is run and how it is laid out. so first the positives - you can get meal combos which work out a bit cheaper and also you can get towel and locker combos - but this is offset by a hefty entry fee of 310 aed - about £55. The staff are really nice - you can get buggy rides along the path to the beach even tho it says hotel guests only - the drivers will say hop on which is really good and shows they are looking after guests. now the negatives. there is no monetary system in the park - its all cash. so the management expect you to walk around with soggy cash or walk back and forth to the lockers to get cash. plus the meal deal is on a voucher so you have to go back to the lockers when you want to eat to get your voucher. managements answer to my complaint about this - buy a plastic pouch which they sell (they should give it free no? - it's only a bit of plastic!!). the meal voucher is a printed voucher I dont understand why they dont add it to your entry barcode (have a different colour strap for paid meals and then when you have had your meal - swap it) - saves hassle for the customer - but alas the park management are not bothered about whether customers have a good time. now my biggest bug bear - some of the rides require things like double inflatables. Now I would expect if I need a double inflatable for a particular ride that the double inflatable would be at the ride - no friends - you have to go find a double inflatable then bring it back to the ride in 40 degree heat. so you have this crazy thing where guests are travelling about with inflatables. the management should hire staff to bring what you need to the rides so there is always a stack there for guests. I would not treat my guests like that. managements response when I complained - we have a number of parks across the world and they all operate like that. the final one is small one but the paths are not sprayed and so are boiling hot (you can carry and wear your flip flops but it would be nice to not worry about such things). The rides are ok - the family ones are the best.

Totally wild. An amazing day out for my family. We hired a cabana for the day which was well worth the money, all the little extra s like cooled water, ice cold flannels and fruite bowl. Kids had an a,axing time on all the scary water shoots, family rides also brilliant but not for the faint hearted. Would recommend taking flip flops as floor is very hot in August. Will defo be going back and people are really friendly. Awesome !

AWESOME!. I'm not a fan of theme parks, so I was quite reluctant going to the waterpark, but for absolutely no need! It is so much fun!! There is something suitable for all ages and can easily spend the whole day there ! I was with my family including a 7 year old nephew and we went there every day for a couple of hours doing the lazy river then a lot of the rides, which you can do in pairs too. Also if you are staying at the Atlantis too there is a gold buggy doing shuttles all the time so you can hop on and head over whenever you want :)One thing I would say though is that I visited in August and the ground got VERY hot, so some sort of protective socks would be advised to those with thin skin as once you leave you flip flops and hop on the lazy river you won't be seeing them for a while !

Family travel. I did most booking online for the activities. It is not lways not very clear on the exact place/location of each one. ex: the diving and snorkling are in the same place but the ray /shark safari in another. I suggest you plan 1 hour for each activity and at least 30 min between each.On the negative , it is a bit expensive but it is really really fun. kids love it.

Journey out of time to Atlantis the lost Continent. This is out of the world a trip to real Atlantis, great for family activity if you have kids between age 3 to unlimited you will enjoy it, best waterpark by far and the view is just perfect from all the hotel room, if you are not staying at the hotel you can get one day activity ticket and you will enjoy the great aquarium

Epic but better in winter than summer!. This waterpark is absolutely epic! I've been twice now, once in summer and once in winter. However, Dubai winter is like a regular day anywhere else. In winter, it's about 25 degrees celcius, sometimes 30, so the perfect weather to enjoy a waterpark in! In summer, the air temperature can be up to 49 degrees (it was the day that we were there!) and the water feels like a bath. I'd definitely recommend going in winter because the ground isn't too hot to walk around without shoes. Also, surprisingly, it's less busy in winter! The rides at this waterpark are great and even if you don't want to go on the slides you can just float around in a tube all day! They've just added a bunch of awesome new rides aswell but you can't miss the one which goes straight down and through a tunnel with sharks on the outside - EPIC! However, don't forget to bring sunscreen! One of my friends paid the equivalent of $54 AUD for a tube of sunscreen in Atlantis - and the food isn't cheap either! A snow-cone will cost you around $12 AUD!
Fun filled Waterpark. A beautiful waterpark - with thrilling rides as well as rides for family. only issue is - after 9 hours in the water park, one still wants to spend more time there :)

Satisfaction guaranteed. We were on a family vacation in Dubai and this was definitely the highlight of our trip. All the rides are amazing and even after spending one full day at the park we wanted one more day there.

Great escape. My teenage son and I loved this waterpark. The endless river is great with quiet and fast-flowing sections and various routes that can be followed. There is a great choice of slides. The tower of neptune has several interesting tube slides and the raft slides (seating up to 6) at the tower of neptune are great. Overall, we found the water to be crystal clear and of exactly the right temperature. Highly recommended for escaping the heat and getting some excitement.

Best family- day ever. This was probably one of the most fun activities we have done as a family. We booked the 'swimming with the dolphins' which gets you access to Dolphin Bay and to the resort. The kids were so happy to be so close to the dolphins and play with them. After our time with the dolphins were over, we went back to the water park which is really big and has a pool or a slide for everyone. Even young kids will have a great time here. My daughter, who is braver than the rest of us, went down almost every water slide in the park.I would recommend going early as there are so many slides and pools to try. You can get a meal at the park, but the food is very basic.Make sure to get a map at the front desk and map out what you're doing first so you don't waste too much time walking from one activity to the other.

great birthday treat. Went to the park as a birthday treat. Great day out. Maybe a little to spread out for the younger kids to enjoy fully. Nether better or worse than Yas waterworld. To spaced out and sometimes to busy on the younger kids area. Shame the day ended with a minor problem. The photo counter refused to accept the birthday photo voucher issued on the park entrance.
truly amazing!. it was great coming here. the rides are thrilling and I enjoyed every bit of my time here. leap of faith was truly the best of all!

Best waterpark in Dubai.... The best waterpark in Dubai, the family love the Atlantis. The rides are great and for all ages. The park is extensive, the only issue is there a number of rides which involve climbing lots of steps, this can be tough in 45 degrees but when you get to the top the rides are well worth the climb. Make sure you wear flip flops or suitable footwear when walking round the park as you can burn the bottom of your feet. The lifeguards let you hold your flip flops or you can leave them at the bottom of the ride...it is a must if you go to Dubai...get yourself to the Atlantis water park....ps you can take up to 1 litre of water per person, make sure you take it as it saves you a fortune (top tip).....no food allowed though....

Nightmare. We visited this park as a treat for our kids whilst stopping in Dubai. We booked it via Virgin Holidays whilst there. On arriving we asked about the Cabana's you can rent on entry but they seemed too busy and pointed at a long queue, we decided then to just hire 1 Locker with 2 Towels (bad move). On entering the park ready for water action, we had let my wife have the locker wrist band so all clothes, money, phones etc were in there. We proceeded to the towel station, which seemed a long way from the lockers (basically in the middle of the water park) we collected the towels and went on the first ride we saw which was the Rapids..... Unbeknown to us, the Rapids go off in to different areas, a figure of eight, myself and one son had been on it for 45 minutes before getting off (after asking a lifeguard how long was it to circumnavigate) 15 minutes he said. After an hour and a half we had to put a call out with the park staff as my wife had been on it nearly 2 hours. I had no money for water as it was in the only locker we had hired. We eventually found her and my other son with only 2 hours left, so we crammed the other rides, leap of faith etc in quickly, but I must admit was disappointed with the park and layout. They were frazzled after being on the maze of the Rapids for so long. The drinks a very expensive too £20 for 4 ice slush drinks. Wouldn't rush back, but can say we have been there and done it!!

Fantastic. A must do in the very hot climate of Dubai. Did the "Leap of Faith" and was great. A tip is to make sure you wear footwear, the ground gets excruciating hot (I ended up with blisters on my feet from walking on the scorching hot cement). So many waterslides to do that would suit any age
COOL!!!. My favorite water park in Dubai. The area is huge and very clean. the attractions are very much and also there is an option to relax by the seaside.

Great Day - Cabana expensive but a lovely treat. We booked a cabana as a treat - had a butler for the day ring the bell and he appears. fresh fruit provided lots of ice and a safe hammock table and chairs bean bags and loungers. We were escorted to our cabana by gold buggy as soon as we arrived and went on loads of slides which was great fun. My daughter swam with dolphins which she loved. Lazy river goes on forever - Tip take your flip flops with you on it so you don't burn your feet as you can get off the lazy river in various places and go on rides we didn't queue at all.
OK. Fun but too large for our liking.great views though Very very crowded, couldnt get a place to sit. Too touristy but still a great place to spend the day

Really Good Waterpark. We visited this park a couple of times during our stay at the Atlantis. The secret is to visit at the right time when there are no queues which appeared to be first thing in the morning and late afternoon. There are some great rides in this park which we both thoroughly enjoyed.

Great day out. W existed the watermark during our stay in Dubai, my children swam with dolphins, great waterpark so much fun, dolphin swim was expensive for the short time they had compared to other places we have been , the zip wire is an extra charge which is frustrating when you pay so much to enter, overall a great day though

Good fun. Great fun here! The lazy river is amazing n so are all the rides! Definitely not for the weak hearted at all. Spent a few hours here with the whole family and apart from the heat and the seating areas all being directly in the sun, it was good fun! Only gripe is that all the rides apart from Leap Of Faith required the plastic floaters and nobody tells you!! You spend your time and energy walking all the way to the top (stairs access to most rides), n then you find that you have to go allllll the way back to the main area to get the floater and drag it with you back all the way over there and up the stairs! Another improvement they can make is having central areas for the floaters too as you have to carry it around with you from ride to ride as if it isn't tiring enough going up and down the stairs just add a huge floater in the mix! Once you come off a slide and hit the water, you have to drag the floater out with you and off you go with little energy, 40+ degree weather and a huge floater in tow ! Lol. All in all, majorrrrr fun apart from that. Love the #SharkAttack it was my fave !!

Average. Two Buildings with a few slides on each. I was expecting a lot more. The wristbands given on entrance are meant to be able to get scanned at kiosks for drinks, food etc but apparantely this has stopped. Not many people take cash to a waterpark for obvious reasons so this was disappointing.

Great water park. I cannot speak highly enough of this water park, we went three times and being hotel guests it was a simpler process!Our favourite bits were the water slide and the rubber ring water rapids trip. There are plenty of snack and fast food areas that supply average/basic needs for this type of experience

Free to residents- available for day pass for others. Very busy and some very good slides- just don't do August if you struggle with the humididty like I did! Im fine in the water, but queing for ages and it made me, and others feel ill in the extreme humidity at this time of year! (do it in their high season and pay the inflated prices then!)Food- very expensive as to be expected-staff- helpful most of the time, and so many around keeping the place ticking over.

Good to do on a hot day!. It was very busy while we were there so had to queue quite a bit for some of the more popular water slides. I would recommend visiting although a bit overpriced for what you get,.... but the staff are amazing and really friendly!

A great day out ........ This is great for all ages there literally is something for everyone. I can't get over the amount of lifeguards on duty and having seen them in action I am so impressed with their observational skills! The Posiden Tower is home to our favourite slides particularly the family rides but they're not for the faint hearted!

Very expensive and not many slides. It was very expensive i went there with my boyfriend even if i had a voucher and i went for free he had to pay a lot of money just for himself.I was expecting it to have more slides not only two towers i did enjoy the day but there were not many things to do there totally not worth the price we paid.

Fun fun fun!!. A fun day at the water park at 106F. So many rides and things to do. Dont buy the combo food package with your entrance fee , they will only let you choose between a hamburger or fried chicken and a soft drink.- bottle of water is not included!. If you prefer a salad or something else, you will have to pay cash. Do bring swim socks when you walk around the water park, most of the rides wont let you on with flipflops. The pavement is very very hot from the sun.

Bit of a disappointment.... We visited Aquaventure Waterpark on our 4th day in Dubai as we had heard how fantastic it was supposed to be. We arrived at 11am there was some waiting around in queues but not for too long when we got into the waterpark we already had our swimming gear on so just took our top clothes off outside as the changing rooms looked abit busy. Most of the rides and slides were really good but when we came to one particular ride with a conveyor belt type lift to get you to the top we encountered several problems: the member of staff on duty couldnt work out how to operate the ride for 15 mins, once he figured it out he said our dinghy wasnt pumped up enough (after waiting at the front of the queue whilst he tried to work the ride) so we lost our place and had to find someone to pump it up for us, when we got back to the front of the queue and onto the conveyor belt in our dinghy the ride stopped (no explanation was given) so we were sat waiting in 46° heat for another 10mins...all i can add is that it was a relief to finally get back into the water! Overall our experience was dulled because of poor attitudes from staff

TERRIBLE. I did not like it as my legs got burnt.You charged us extra money when you did not even tell us what we can get with it.I hope you teach your receptionists to tell visitors what their ticket is valid for.The park was not very well sign - posted.

TERRIBLE PRICES. The rides were great fun which we all enjoyed I would like to come back but it was very expensive which I was not happy aboutThe staff gave us a expensive ticket when we asked for the cheapest one and did not even tell us the correct price.we found out online and were very angry at your staff
Fun day out. The water is too expensive 3 £ for a small bottle the general rides are good fun but the price of food and drink spoils the attraction

A good day, but expensive. It's a nice clean park, good rides and a good family day. It is very expensive do considering there really are not that many rides. The river ride is a nice relaxing way to spend time with a few enjoyable parts within it, the rides that are here are good, queues are too long and the park is kept very well. It works out at roughly€100 each per adult which to myself seems high. The wild wadi park has more for the same money.

splash out!. If you're with the Imperial Club at the Atlantis, get your wristbands from your dedicated reception (complimentary). Then get the hotel buggy straight to the Poseidon Tower in the morning. It's at the far end of the water park and away from the main gate, so you'll avoid the queues and get on Poseidons slides straight away!

Amazing waterpark but Expensive. We decided to visit Aquaventure rather than Wild Wadi on recommendation from Hotel. The park was amazing with rides for the whole family. It was extremely hot so much so you couldn't walk around without your jandals. The park layout was a bit confusing with rides not seeming to link to the next.Food was extremely expensive within the park which was quite shocking. I understand it it to be expected but $79 NZ for three little toasted sandwiches and two drinks is crazy.Apart from these things the rides were great fun and our wee girl had a blast riding the lazy river over and over and over!I will probably give Wild Wadi a go next time see if it is just the fact Aquaventure is tied to The Palm Resort that makes it so dare.
Be a kid again. My son and I loved it here, it was so hot and cruising around the Lazy river on tubes helped keep us cool. Remember your sunscreen.
Not great as thought:((. It is disappointing water park that had an awesome image which it does not worth it .. Other waterparks are more amazing

Kids loved it.. Beat the crowds and get in at 9.45 a.m. We stayed at the Atlantis and took the buggy to the Aquaventure Water park. It was brilliant. The rides are all great. Not in the league of Disney World Florida but definitely worth a visit. The kids visited every day for a week! I loved the lazy river. Traveller tip - the new tower which is a bit further down the walkway/buggy way doesn't have much crowd.

Had a great time. Nice place to go luckily we went on a quiet day so had a wonderful time. Plenty of chances to sit on the rides evan multiple times. Can relax on the beach also. Only drawback is the food and drink prices very expensive. There are other attractions close by too. Can spend an entire day here.

Best thing in Dubai . The aquaventure park is one of the best things in dubai it is really fun and has a massive number of slides that are fun and some are scary but it is really fun it's a great place if you had teenagers or kids.Disclaimer:not all ages are welcome.-wael almotlaq

Good waterpark, but busy. This waterpark is big but very by. The lazy river is good, and has some pretty fast rapids that mean you can spend a good few hours just on this one ride. The swimming with dolphins is good, but probably a one time thing to do

Insanely overpriced!. This water park is totally average. One kiddie pool, one lazy river tour and the main attraction: the two water slide towers. Nice and inexpensive food in the park. The entry fee is just ridiculous.

Great!. A must when in Dubai. A great water park and we didn't even get to see half of it. If you are family don't miss out the family rides, we did which we are really disappointed about but apparently they are fabulous!

Aquaventure need to review their business. I went there in August 2015 with my family (3 young kids included), and was dismayed to see that on some of the rides, we were expected to carry your double inflatable seats. Now I am not one to shy away from a bit of hard graft and consider myself quite fit, but I had 3 young kids who wanted to go onto the so called 'better rides' - which happened to be on the fourth tier of the tower! Therefore I had to carry 2 double inflatable seats (which do weigh quite a lot) up four flights of stairs in the scorching summer heat of dubai!To do this once was quite a feat, but if the kids went to go on the rides again, then it was the dad who suffered! This is not practical, particularly in the hot summer months. I wouldnt be surprised if someone passed out climbing all those steps carrying the double inflatables - ESPECIALLY IN THE HEAT.Wild Wadi waterpark is smaller, and maybe the rides arent as good compared to the aquaventure, but at least you dont have to carry your inflatables anywhere. If you are here for more than 3 days, I would recommend getting the re-fillable plastic cups 40AED, where you can top up your drinks for 8 AED each time. Works out cheaper, and you will need the drink.Food is way too expensive, and as a business, Aquaventure need to review this side of their business. People would eat more at the food restaurants if the prices were at least 25%cheaper. Fast food Restaurants were completely empty, no queues and its all because of the prices, not just the heat.I didnt use a locker. I left my phone, SLR camera and money on one of the many vacant sunbeds with my t-shirt over the bag holding my valuables. Used the park for 5 days (as it was free for me staying at the One and Only) and there was never a problem with theft. And I suppose there never is in Dubai.Kids were happy, they loved the family rides - and so did we. But my kids werent carrying inflatables around...

A definite summer survival tactic. Summer loving happens so fast .... We had fun splashing around! Oh sorry, those lyrics from the movie Grease just popped into my head all of a sudden and luckily I can just write them and not inflict my voice upon you all. But boy did we have fun splashing around, and slipping and sliding to boot. There' snot much you can do in a Dubai summer if you want to spend an extended period of time outside, so a water park is the answer, and this one is just excellent! There are good areas for all ages, so it caters for the whole family. We had a staycation at Atlantis, so we could rest our weary water-parked out bodies in the absolute luxury and comfort of a beautiful hotel room afterwards. Yeah baby yeah! A great day out. Summer loving, oh what a blast!

A lot of fun. Went here with a few friends, and thought it was great, although for some of the waterslides there were 10-15minute queues it wasn't bad considering how many people were in the park. All the slides were great fun.

Lots of fun. It was very fun and refreshing! But be careful with sunburn! Don't forget your lotion or they also have small shops with all you may need and souvenirs. I loved the slide that gets into the shark tank..

Excellent day out. Went with my family for the day, kids loved it. Booked it for the Thursday as weekends definitely busier. Plenty of good rides for all ages with the longest lazy river I've been on. Good value for money . A must to do!

Amazing. I'm not a huge fan of water rides but I braved it any way and had a fab time, the floor gets very very hot, especially the tiled flooring (ouch) I hooked my flip flops to my hands so I didn't have to brave the hot floor, for me and many others who were hop skip and jumping around. U can but shoe/sock things there but they were a waste of money to me as I wouldn't use them again. They do also sell these amazing waterproof phone cases so u can take ur phone around with. We also did the dolphin experience when we were here and it was amazing. The biggest dolphin enclosure I have ever seen. They spend ages briefing you on their amazing creatures. You can tell they love their animals and they are equally as happy to be there. Amazing experience.THANK YOU

Best Waterpark in Whole UAE!!!. Tons of Thrilling and Excitement Rides for Family and Teens. Getting here is quite tiring coz a Little bit far and expensive if you ride a Taxi, but if you have a Car so its fine. The Entrance when we got here was so cheap because we present our Emirates Residence ID then we got a discount. The Rides are safe yet full of adrenaline rush. A MUST GO PLACE! I Swear, ITS WORTH IT!

Great fun. The water park is great! They can have large queues so arrive early believe me you will be there for the whole day! Make sure you take sunscreen and when the lifeguards tell you to lift your bottom do it! As you can get some bruises! Great family fun, I rarely go on rides and did everything apart from the leap of faith!A couple of the rides go in a tunnel through the sharks and aquarium! Which is quite amazing, we missed half of the park, which I only noticed when we were later on the monorail and noticed more slides further along! The heat is made better by being in the water but don't forget the ground is hot so wear flip flops or water shoes, the sun is beating down reflecting on the water so wear sun screen and take drinking water! There are lots of places to eat dotted around ! Not that we had the time as we were busy enjoying ourselves! The changing rooms are small and can get very crowded, the ladies at the ticket booths are rather unfriendly, don't forget to get a locker tag!But most of all enjoy! The experience was a memorable one all for good reasons, great fun and even the lifeguards are good fun too!

A good expereince.. Great for kids - but take your sun lotion. It gets very hot, and you re exposed to the sun all day when floating around the lazy river. Lots to do for one day, but better to go for a couple of hours each evening if you are staying in the Atlantis. It's expensive - so be prepared.
Great day out. Free access to the park when staying at the atlantis. Great day out to keep the kids and adults busy , lots of life guards on duty . Food selection is limited as you may expect.

Go go go!. I'm a big fan of water parks! I go often! I love this place even more now when they have the second pyramid with rides! This place have something for the whole family! Stuff for younger kids, beach for mom and dad if they aren't into slides, lazy river with nice surprises and a few pretty awesome rides! I still feel like they need to get a few more rides since a lot of them are pretty much the same!

Hot weather is best handled with a visit to a water park. This is a fun water park but gets extremely busy. Arrive early and if possible purchase a ticket in advance. Once there; you have to queue again to acquire a locker and wrist band to enter the park. Locker's are quite cool. If you plan to take a taxi back afterwards; expect a long queue (almost an hour) if you leave at closing time.

Good Day Out. We always stay at Atlantis during Ramadan as its a small piece of sanity during a difficult month. The children love the water park which is free to hotel guests. Generally clean and with an abundance of seating we have never had difiiculties in finding a place to sit. Food & Beverage facilities are adequate and maybe a bit on the pricey side. The rides are varied and keep everyone happy from the sedate to the adventurous. All in all its always worth a visit and a great day out.

Great waterslides!. Aquaventure Waterpark Dubai is not just an average waterpark. Like everything in Dubai it's bigger, longer and faster than what you have experienced in Europe.I personally like the "Leap of faith" as it is extremely fast, but all slides are fantastic. The river rides are very long and there are so many, that you could easily get lost. There are also several activities like Ray feeding or a shark safari, but we decided not to do that, because of the prices. It is very expensive, but also that is a general thing in Dubai.A nice thing is that there is also a beach that you can use, so you can easily spend a full day here.We like it a lot, and it was a great experience, but it was quite expensive.
Fun & fun & more. Fun & fun & moreVery nice daily visit This made our kids so happy and pleased with its activitiesThe best is the slippersComing back next year hopefully

thrilling and big. it is great! lots of fun! my only problem was, the directions were not very clear inside the park, and we kept getting lost. the rides are a lot of fun and you have a variety to choose from. my favourite ones were shark tank , flood river and Shammal. dont miss it ! and dont forget to keep water proof covers for your cameras/phones and rubber booties for your feet. the floors get hot!

Good time for the whole family. . A very nice time with all the water slides you want. Everything is expensive so if you're a big family be prepared to bring out the big wallet. If you book and pay online you can save 60 AED per ticket and if you stay at Atlantis the entrance is included.But beside the money it's a very fun day with a lot of water and more water.

mid march was nice and quiet. nobody there mid march, enjoyed a giant and very fun water park with virtually no lines. lots of stuff for young ones, and more than enough stuff for thrill seekers. I am usually pretty gutsy, and some stuff I wouldn't do.

Atlantis - far out. Atlantis Aqua adventure, was quite expensive , Bought expensive refill bottle then they ran out of least expensive refills , refused to give the bottle drinks at reduced amount. Seemed a lot of money maing orientated, not the fun and game s for guest to enjoy. How best and quickly to give your cash. loved the wrist band locker idea, and the photograph station viewing by wrist bands

A bundle of watery fun. A great day out but very hot in the summer and the water is not cooled so come prepared. Towels and lockers cost extra unless you are staying at Atlantis...then just lockers cost extra

Brilliant fun. This will definitely get you the exercise needed, the water rides are exhilarating and the zip ride is worth the money of 75 dinars. The food is a bit expensive work every minute though, to enjoy the waterpark schedule at least 4 hours.

Great. Came here two years ago just whilst they were building the new rides. These are now open and enhance the experience- great water park- probably one of the best in the world- go early to avoid the crowds- it is very hot and the water is not really cooling as it is not chilled.

A Super-Park!!. This waterpark has the best drop ever – The Leap of Faith. It must have been 75-80 degrees down slope. It lasts for a mere 5-10 seconds but the heart pounds faster than ever. The other attractions are also great. The water park shuts by 7pm so I advise you to go earlier. One bad thing – the heat, It becomes too hot to stay out of the water. There is a kids section as well. Locker facilities are available. The ticket will cost you 250 DHS. But worth it.Rent out a GoPro Hero 3 from there. Its 200 DHS but you will be able to click pictures and take videos in the water as well.

Very fun. We spent 2 amazing days here. 1 day we booked "Ultimate Snorkel" and "Shark Safari" and had some great fun on the water slides.
