The second time we had a free entrance because we booked Dolphin Royal Swim. We have spent the entire day after that trying all the rides and slides. Leap of faith was really exciting.
Top class all year waterpark. One of the best in the world, we have been to the Orlando waterparks and this one is as good or even better, worth every penny you spend there

Fun but expensive lockers. Great day out. It's very big & lots of water rides & different areas. Suitable for adults & there are big family slides as well. I was worried about going in the very hot weather in July as you're outside all the time but as long as you go in water regularly it's fine. There are rules about what you can wear in the water - must be proper swimwear. Cameras allowed but not selfie sticks. Wear flip flops & take them on the ride with you or buy the shoes you can wear in water - once out the water the floor is very hot for bare feet! The rides end in a different place to where they start so you will have to walk back to your shoes if you take them off, which means getting burnt feet. There is a beach area which was quiet & a nice area to sit away from lots of people & noise. You can easily spend the whole day here going on all the water rides. Only had to queue for a couple of them. It's expensive but glad we did it as it was really fun. The lockers are a complete rip off - very expensive & not that big (enough for 1 bag) & you really need one if you're going on rides & don't have someone to look after your belongings. Lockers should be provided for free considering the cost of the entry ticket.

All the Orlando water parks make this look amateur.. Terrible layout and lack of cash preloading wrist bands make this a poor neighbour to the parks in Orlando. Not enough water fountains or rides for smaller children. Even miss out on the little touches like water spray to cool the walkways. Wouldn't come back here again.

A great fun day . We had a great family fun day at Atlantis The Palm Water Park. Kids had the obstacles rounds and enjoyed it. The water splash was even better and stayed in the water for almost six hours. I would recommend it for families with young kids...it's a worth visiting place for a day out. Ensure putting plenty of sun cream and take fluids during the hot weather.

Super fun day!. The aquaventure is really fun and has a lot of rides which range from extreme to mellow. The lazy river allows you to move through the park without exiting the water which is great when the floor is hot around mid-day. Not too busy between May and September which is absolutely great (5-10 minute wait for rides only). Great for a family day or an outing with friends!

Good Water Park. Okay the good things first: I had booked and paid online for the tickets, at the venue i therefore went through a separate line that was fast. The locker rooms are clean, however the changing rooms and the WC's are very dimply lit. I was with my 5 yr daughter and she did not appreciate this dim lighting at all. We spend most of the time at the children play area that is just at the entrance of the park (this is the second attraction after you enter). The water is clean and there are adequate number of the staff manning the place. Now the okay things; we had lunch at Shark Bites Restaurant. As with any touristy place, they tried to hard sell the entire meal to me rather than just the sandwich. I caution: The Swarma is too big, if you are ordering for a child, 1 suffies for 2 children. The Sno Ice lolly is also very nice. Overall worth the time and money spend.

The Palm hotel and water park. it was wonderful next time we need Moore days to explore more. The water park is great staff is very friendly and the Palm hotel is real good. Room was clean and service is great.all staff is friendly.we went with my wife ,daughter and mom. It was great experience.we like to go again.
Wonderfull experience in aqua water park. Due to busy trip schedule we could not get sufficient time in Aqua water park. Burt with the limited time we had a wonderful experience

Very good but not impressed with their "refill" drinks offer !!. Had a great day here - we were a group of 8 including 4 young adults/teens aged 17,19 and 20. Fortunately we booked online before we travelled which was approx £45 pp - I would strongly recommend doing this as on the day it works out about £20 pp more - a huge saving if done beforehand !.On arrival you have to hire towels (unless you take your own) and are encouraged to buy their refill cups at £7.27 each (AED40) - this is a bit misleading as you think that you are getting free refills all day (as is the case in any Disney water park) so we bought 8 cups - 1 for each of us ....however it's AED8 as long as you have a refill cup instead of AED18 - that was the actual offer - but in the extreme Dubai heat still a good idea although considering their admission prices to offer FREE refills would be the least they could do.The food was also quite expensive in their fast food restaurant.The rides were good, and the lazy river was one of the best I've experienced as it had Rapids and slides incorporated en route.

Best Water Park in Asia and Europe. It is defiantly the BEST water park in Asia and Europe. The lazy river linked out the whole park and different slide. The Poseidon's Revenge is definatly a highlight of the park. Free fall from a 85 degree tube is insane but so much fun. Aquaventure is a must go for anyone who loves water parks.

Great fun, fab rides, good day out!. We had a fabulous day out at Aquaventure and thoroughly enjoyed our trip here. We got the metro to the palm and then transferred onto the monorail. All very self-explanatory, cost effective and easy to do. Once at Atlantis we queued for our tickets which worked out just over £50 each, which I thought was quite expensive! Hence the reason for not giving it five stars. You can then pay for locker and towel combo (50 AED, about £9), which we did. The wristband you get given has the entrance into the park and the barcode for the locker. The rides were very good and there was a variety to suit all needs/abilities/ages, including a childrens playzone area. Due to the 40 degree heat we didn't sunbathe although this could have been an option at the park. We spent our whole time on rides. Queues went down quickly, only spent 20 minutes maximum queuing on the day we visited. Although there is a lot of rides to go on, and they're nvery good, there wasn't quite as many as I thought there would be. There were areas of shade on the main pathways but we decided to wear our flip-flops and take them on the rides, as did many others. We didn't purchase food, however drinks were expensive, as to be expected at an attraction. You can take in one bottle of water per person.Would recommend when in Dubai, its a great day out!

best water park. My children loved this place. The water was so warm there was no fear of the kids catching cold from staying in the water for so long. There were so many life guards, i felt my kids were safe and there was no fear of anyone drowning. The slides were scary but awesome. I could not get myself to allow them on the leap of faith though, scaredy my, maybe next time, they will be older and taller.

Rides are thrill, Marketing hyped.. They say the best water park in Asia or whatever, i suggest go with moderate expectations. It is only a little better than some water parks.Value for money & we surely had a lot of fun but the place is surely super hyped.

Wow, watch out disney. This is a large water park, well themed with some exceptional rides for all the family.Other activities which were extra include shark tank dive and dolphin swim, which were excellentFood is of the fast variety with special offers on refills, much needed in the 45c heat.

A wet and wild time. We visited this park mainly for the Deep Water Dolphin Experience - which was fantastic. Entry to the park was included and it features some great thrill rides as well as a lovely 'lazy' river. We were at the park for a full day and still didn't see everything. It even has a kids play area for younger children which was great.
Excellent waterpark. Wide collection of underwater life. Excellent presentation. Good location. Entry ticket should be half of present rate.

Good slides, but VERY expensive. Getting to Aquaventure is an experience in itself as it's right at the end of the huge mainmade artificial plam island.The prices displayed on the mobile version of the resort's website are not honoured unless you book and play 24 hours in advance, although this is not clearly stated. This meant the already expensive price increased bu AED 60 ($US 16) per person, meaning a whopping $US 84 per person! For a family of four, this was a huge expense.Some of the slides are excellent, especially the thrilling Leap of Faith. You drop in a second from a high tower then via a glass tube through a shark tank! However, given the engergy-spaiing heat (46 deg C), I don't think Aquaventure provides value for money.PS: Hiring a large locker costs AED 75 ($US 21) extra. Security guards search your bags on entry to remove any food although you are allowed to bring in water.It's a fun place for a day out and a few thrills, but consider your budget carefully and investigate booking 24 hours in advance.

Great Day for Big Kids. My husband & I visited here in July and had a fabulous time.Try and book online in advance if you can as you get a slightly better deal, but the queues were not bad on arrival. It is on a big site so there are plenty of deckchairs and places to rest in the shade.Loads of things to do, even for those that do not want to do the very scary things. The lazy river had plenty of different options and kept us ocupied for hours. Going though the the tubes where you could see the fish in the aquarium was a highlight.We had food included in our day pass, but it was of a very high quality and there was a good choice. Drinks thoughout the day quite expensive.It was a really hot day, so would suggest you have cheap flip flops or something to walk around with as walkways got very hot.We preferred this to Wild Wadi, but only slightly as both are a great day out.

A fun experience for everyone. We were a party of 4 adults and 1 child and we all had a great time. We found rides that we can ride together as well as other rides which you can ride individually or as a couple. You will definitely find a ride that suits you. Moreover, the staff are so friendly and helpful. The only down side is that the queues are so long that we ended up going on only 4 slides the whole day so make sure you get there extra early.

Great fun. We were lucky not to go on the weekend so we had a great time and managed to try all the slides without waiting too long in ques. The camera weren't always capturing your shot, we wish we had more photos

Very nice !!!. Very nice to go there on a hot day in summer.
Especially with kids. there is enough to do for kids from all ages.

Left with a Sinking Feeling. Having visited the various marine life interactions at Aquaventure previously, I was extremely excited by the prospect of spending an afternoon feeding the resident rays. Whilst not a resident at the Atlantis hotel, I had enquired on two occasions during my visit to Dubai regarding the timings and price of this attraction. On both occasions, and from two different sources, I was informed that the cost of this attraction would be 175 dhs. Due to past experience, I made a point of enquiring as to whether visitors would be expected to pay for entry into the Aquaventure watermark in addition to this cost. I was informed that this was not the case on both occasions via representatives from the Aqauaventure watermark.However, this was not the case.On arrival at Aquaventure I was informed that my companion and I would not only have to pay for our ray experience, but would be expected to pay for entry into the Aquaventure waterpark, despite making it explicitly clear that we did not wish to spend any time at the park. This was simply not acceptable. We had done the research, we had asked the appropriate questions in advance of our visit, we had paid the taxi fare onto the Palm (and back) and of course- we had take time out of our vacation to make our way across to Atlantis. A complete waste of time, effort and money.It became apparent that this attraction, which promotes itself as a family orientated place of fun for all, is simply out to take as much money from naive tourists as possible. After enquiring about a behind the scenes tour of the Lost Chambers, we were informed that we would have to pay for entry to the tour on top of the admission fee. Even observing the lagoon at Atlantis would cost an additional 30 dhs. Yes- it may seem impressive on first glance, but a similar 'large fish tank' can be observed by shoppers and tourists free of charge at Dubai Mall. I couldn't help but leave Atlantis, minus a ray feeding experience, with a sinking feeling of utter disappointment. I will not be returning or recommending this attraction in the future.

Definitely worth a visit. Definitely worth a visit. Good range of rides for all people. Rapids were especially good and benefit of these is that they go the whole way round the park. Rides could do with a bit more information re. What they entail and more signs around the park would be useful. Plenty of sun beds around the park to choose from and as the Rapids went full circle it was fine to set up in one place.
Funtastic😃 !!!. The best place where you can take your best friend and enjoy all the rides until you can't get up the stairs anymore. And you really need to try all of them.
Splish splash. Great day with the family splashing and sliding. Good food options but little overpriced. Nice day out from exploring the city.

Lazy River was great fun !. Having a 3 year old with us we only went to the Splashers part of the park which is geared to young children, my son absolutely loved it never having been anywhere like it before.

The rides are mostly fun, the rest ISN'T. After having been to Aquaventure multiple times prior, I've had mixed experiences. I figured maybe this time it would be a better one, but it wasn't. Here are the various things that made it so:Firstly, you have to take a bus from the car park if you aren't a hotel guest at the Atlantis for some reason. The bus is always a tiny thing with a driver that doesn't speak any sort of language and just grunts at people and performs strange hand gestures, and also kind of decides what he wants to do and when, rather useless in my opinion.Secondly, after arriving at the hotel entrance you can walk through the hotel and do what ever before going to the water park, but once you get to the water park area you have to wait to organise tickets and everything OUTSIDE which is utterly useless, who wants to stand outside in 100 degree heat in a queue to get their tickets!?!Thirdly, the staff are rather incompetent, like ALL of them are. The guy at the tickets desk was literally only interested in begging for my credit card and wasn't helpful with any questions I had.Fourth, the seating is horrible. All of the sun loungers are solid with no cushions on them at all. A rather stupid idea for those who actually want to sit in them for more than 5 minutes at a time.Fifth, the flip flop issue. Now if you go in any of the summer months like we did chances are it's going to be over 100 degrees fahrenheit, which means you absolutely have to have pool shoes with you otherwise your feet will start to burn after just a few seconds of standing on the pavement. Not a problem you'd think if you could just leave your pool shoes right before the ride, but most of the rides there seemed to be no designated area and everybody just threw their pool shoes at the steps. This was a major issue on one of the rides which you have to carry a pool doughnut up a roasting stair case without flip-flops on! Then guess what happens, my pool shoes get stolen! Very convenient because there weren't any security cameras on the staircase to see who took them. I wasn't too bothered about having to go and buy new ones but actually having to walk without pool shoes is hard enough. After buying my new flip flops I just decided to take them on the rides with me and not listen to anything the useless lifeguards say.Sixth, speaking of lifeguards, they're useless as well as the rest of the staff. Now typically I never listen or pay attention to these people because the only thing they are there to do is moan at you for some reason. I'm not sure if any of them have actually done what they are supposed to do which is save lives. I feel that the ones in this particular water park should be named "Party Poopers” so I shall call them that for the rest of my review. Some of them were fun and joked around which was all good but then I tried to go on one ride and the party pooper starts shouting "GO PRO GO PRO GO PRO." I had no idea what the heck he was shouting for and I think I would have better luck communicating with a gorilla, but anyway then he came over and squatted next to me and told me I couldn't have my GoPro on a selfie stick which was at its shortest length and secured safely to my arm. I would have rather he just told me I couldn't extend the selfie stick but of course I randomly wasn't allowed to even have the GoPro attached to it at all despite having it the same way on other rides. No no no, the party pooper just removed MY GOPRO from my stick and told me to carry both of them. Yeah that makes total sense, you'd rather I hand hold my GoPro where it could fly out of my hand and hit someone in the face, rather than have it on a fully collapsed selfie stick that wouldn't have moved if I dropped it. Utter idiot. The party pooper don't stop there with their random rule making. In one of the slides that had water jets pushing the doughnut in partially enclosed tube (not sure of the name), only DOUBLE doughnuts were allowed for some random reason. So rather than go on with my family members the party pooper told one of us to go on the ride with a random sweaty dude. We of course walked away from him at this point and didn't go near that ride again. The whole park in general just wasn't a pleasant experience. I'm not saying you shouldn't go, because the rides were good which is the most important thing, but it is likely that at least one of these factors will affect you on your visit.
Family FUN. So much FUN! It is one of the best thing about staying at the atlantis, just a short buggy ride away from this amazing park. Plenty of rides and a lot of fun for the whole family

Overpriced and small . After having heard so much about this place, I decided to visit. The entrance is very expensive 50gbp per head and honestly that is daylight robbery. It's small in comparison to wild wadi which has a lot more variety. They need to introduce the concept of loading money on your wristband. In the scorching heat you have to trek all the way to your locker to get money and then trek back to buy and trek again to put wallet or money back I will not be going back and was severely disappointed, waste of money. Much better water parks in the rest of ten world and significantly cheaper.

Great rides!. If you go to Dubai and like water parks then you must go to The Atlantis Aquaventure, as it's brilliant! Even as a mum of three I thoroughly enjoyed all the rides as did my children. The only downside was the heat /temperature as it was about 45 degrees the day we went. As you put all your belongings in. Locker you don't have any water with you and after a few hours the heat really drains you. A visit here is a must!
A totally fun place. If you love roller coaster and you are a big fan of adventure then this is the place you should visit.
Great fun!. Great sun loungers by the edge of the water which was a must in 48 degrees. Good facilities, lockers, towels, restaurants etc. Great rides to suit all.

Spectacular !!. Dubai has changed over the years. Traveling by metro, tram and monorail we reached Atlantis. Lovely place !! We saw the Lost Chambers Aquarium with varieties of marine creatures.Must see this place in Dubai !!
Best choice ever . Very good choice.. we had fun today :) everybody should visit it.. had fun to the max.. will visit it again and again

lot of fun!. the waterpark is amazing! we had the dolphin encounter, which was such a unique experience! it comes with the ticket to the park.after the Dolphin, we went to the area for smaller children(my kids are only 6r old), and they had lot of fun for them! i wanted to go to the rivers(same as lazy rivers in Las Vegas), but these are really FAST and FURIOUS! running rivers! but ended up not going.i would definitely go again, and buy the package tickets with the lost chambers. it's also beautiful and a must to see with younger kids. the fast foods were soo expensive in the park, and actually not that worthed. maybe it was cheaper to get out to the park, eat good food, and then go back, if it's not cheaper, definitely better quality! which is something i would definitely do next time!the waterpark is free for hotel guests, maybe next time i would stay @the Atlantis Palm for couple of days! before i head to Jumeirah beach hotel.

Think carefully about the time of year you go. Aquaventure was a great day out with fun activities and exciting rides:) we were most happy to find that the queues were minimal (not like other parks where you end up queuing for the majority of the day) the longest queue we were in was about 20 minutes and in the shade which was a help as we visited in August. At lunchtime we went to the 'sharkbites' restaurant which was good, we were relieved to be in an air conditioned room and again we didnt have to queue long, the food was a little expensive but reasonable prices for a water park. We had a normal burger and chips which was very tasty and also surprisingly filling! Although the park is fantastic i would advise to go to the park a different time of year as despite the short queues the heat was exhausting, it was just too hot unless you can deal with extreme heat however this was no fault of the parks only ours. Great day out

Fantastic. Great waterpark, no queues.Free as long as you are an Atlantis guest, towels provided and no issues with wearing a t shirt or sunglasses, as 42 degrees and I would have fried! Lots of lifeguards and all in good humour loved the rapids!

Good but Not suitable for children. I was there on 5th of August 2015. Good waterpark,large, compared to other waterparks is not the best, first is better for tickets online reservation because there is a big difference between the prices online and at the box office, for me I enjoyed, but not as Yas waterworld or wild wady, my kids did not enjoy so much, my daughter with 8 years old, didn't have choice but to surf beach, the life guards in children section did't know how to deal with kids, food and beverage prices within the park very overpriced, and must pay cash and not like the rest of the waterparks in the stores balance the ticket, and this made me had to carry my wallet with me, I can't leave it in locker and I can't leave it in my bag, so if I want to swim i have to be close so i can keep my eyes on my bag
Great Fun. Very enjoyable with a good mixture of rides. The rapids were fun in a double tube. The queues were minimum. We visited during the end of the afternoon when it was a little cooler.

adventure overloaded. Fun filled Adventure.So many water activities that one can never think of.Simply jawdropping experience.Must go if you love water sports...absolutely safe with life guards around to help if needed.
Crazy fun. Family fun full adventure, my old ladies had crazy fun, a big thank you to security for finding my side who got carried away on the park

Must Go Water Park for Many Reasons. Aquaventure is the most go tourist place to have wonderful experience in water park activities, as well as you can have relaxed ride to the canal of this water park by just sitting in a tube & it would take you all around the water park with beautiful people around you who also passes by you by giving a nice smile & great bikni bodies you can have look around as everything is just next to perfection in this waterpark. Every staff of the water park would greet you & also would help you out in best possible manner. Many ride here can be enjoyed as couple though singles also have many options in this water park.

Short queues and thrilling rides!. The waterpark has one of the more thrilling water theme park rides you can find (especially compared to those in Asia). The queues were short as well which was fantastic - we actually managed to finish almost all of the 11 slides in 3 hours! Something you probably can't do in most of the other theme parks.

Health and safety nightmare. I feel sad to write this as my holiday was so magical but I feel that this information should be shared.I visited the park with my son, the surroundings are beautiful and looks impressive however the health and safety side of the park left me feeling quite negative.We went on a slide called shalem (i think) its a ride where two people need to ride. We began moving up the the top of the drop on the ride when the ride halted, sitting in 43 degree heat after a few minutes we started to get very hot , still sitting ten minutes later we were over heating and feeling pretty unwell. I shouted for assistance and no one came, we were just left to sit high up and swelter ! eventually when no one came to our rescue I took the decision to walk up the side and get off to some shade before we fainted !! this was a scary and uncomfortable task but had to be done. As soon as we started to move suddenly staff appeared and were shouting at us to sit down, there was no communication from them previously ! I ignored there advice and got my son to the top of the slide and to shade where I nearly fainted and my son felt very ill. I as so very angry as the situation was dangerous and left us both feeling very dehydrated and ill.The other cause of concern was the size of the children being allowed to go down the leap of faith, the slide is very steep, high and fast. whilst waiting for my son to go down the slide I saw 2 children who were very young come down the slide, one nearly did a somersault and the other was completely out of control. The people watching all screamed and went over to the landing area to see if they were ok.The use of the rubber rings to go downs slides is in use on a majority of the attractions, the problem with this is that you have to carry them everywhere with you. Queuing on very crowded stairs each person holds a huge ring which was very dangerous as people were being knocked with them. I dont know why they do not use a system where the rings go round automatically and you get one at the to of the slide.I am disappointed in my day and would advise people to be aware of the safety side of things as they were a huge cause of concern for us .

Amazing Waterpark. If you are in Dubai then make sure you visit this waterpark..It has great rides and exciting fun for all ages...Good place to go with family especiialy if you have kids...although a group of friends would enjoy it equally well too.

Best place for fun in Dubai. Me and my family really enjoyed Aquaventure, access to it was complementary to my booking in Atlantis the palm resort. the most remarkable thing there is the high level of safety in all activities. you cannot resist staying there all the day.

Loved this place. We stayed at Atlantis for our vacation and visited twice. It was July and it was very hot but coped well and the lazy river helped cool you down. Longest que was leap of faith and was around 30 mins. Everything else there was no que. Found loungers and parasols no problem atall. Did the shark safari which was fantastic and good value for money. Didnt have enough time to visit more.

Best waterpark!. It has a lot of games which are so fun! I went there a lot and never ever have I seen the place dirty or out of service! Although there was one situation that has happened in one of the games but when we told the manager about it they were very kind to us. So even in disturbing situations they are amazingly helpful and the satisfaction of their guests is their top priority!

A fantastic water park - Worth a visit...or three!. As guests at the Atlantis, we visited this park every day. In the heat of the Dubai sunshine, there is nothing like spending the day throwing yourself in and out of the water. The rides range from the gentle (ish) lazy river through to the more heart stopping Leap of Faith and everything in between. As a guest, you get free towels but lockers are chargeable at a rate of £6ish a day. This park is fantastic. As with most things in Dubai, the food and drinks are very expensive but it is definitely worth a visit...or three!
Exhausting but thrilling. Brilliant water park ! Spotlessly clean, and well organised, with plenty of lifeguards to provide reassurance.

Go early and avoid local holidays.. Have visited several times. Plenty to see and do, safe for kids with numerous lifeguards and medical attention if required. Go early and avoid the crowds that appear around lunchtime, also avoid local holidays or you'll queue for hours for some of the rides. Food inside could be better.

The best aquapark. We were not staying in Atlantis, but we came to visit Aquaventure and it is by far the best aquapark we have ever visited.
Amazing combination of adrenaline and water fun. Highly recommended.
Aquaventure Waterpark. Love this place. Best attraction is the large Crazy River. Plenty of lifeguards gard the park and everyone is very friendly

Good time for all ages.. Great time to be had at the water park. Slides are great - as the go from extreme to easy day in the lazy river rapids. A great day. I would recommend leaving prior to close, as we were there on a Friday (Weekly Holiday), and we ended up closing the water park down and the locker rooms were nothing more than chaos. A good way to spend part of the day though.

Wowwwww!!!! Super fun..... Been here many times with my family each time we are in Dubai. Excellent water fun, beach and quarium. A place never to forget. All day fun and enjoyment for all ages and specially the kids will go crazy. All in all it is supper fun.

Nice day out in the sun!. A great waterpark but the ground is very hot and they don't have any sprinklers anywhere. We considered buying the socks but honesly AED 130 per pair is just a rip off! Better than Wild Wadi, not as good as Yas Waterworld.
Aqua view at atlantis. Worth a visit to this hotel even if you are not residing there.So much to do and see as they have dolphins to view, a huge aquarium and many varieties of marine life.

Worth a visit. The park is amazing with the many pools, attractions and slides suitable for all ages. Services at the waterpark are great, snacks, towels, fruits and lifeguards, all is taken care of.. Very nice place to spend the day... Avoid high seasons, it gets really really crowded.

Aquaventure park at Atlantis the Palm.. Very good water theme park. A must for everybody who likes water sports. Few rides I found are bit risky for kids below 5yrs. The whole park is not shaded and I got my skin tanned with in an hour, so don't forget to carry the UV cream.

Aquaventure . This is the best waterpark you can ever go to, me and my family stayed in the hotel, Atlantis, and came here everyday, for the whole week we were there, it is child friendly & everything like tha ygm braa? Me and the squad had unreal banter there and I recommend it to everybody of all ages, the staff are well pleasant nd everything.

Super fun!. So fun! Arrived a little after 2, I recommend going earlier and spending the whole day there. The water cools you off, no need to worry for the hot weather. It was a little packed and pricey for admission, but totally worth it!

Best waterpark ever. Hardly any queues, amazing drops and slides in a great setting with sharks, Rays and the Dubai skyline in the background. Golf buggy transport was a massive plus. Not a long walk but in the heat was appreciated

Great visit. We went in May when they were selling tickets online for AED125 per person and we really enjoyed it. This was our third visit after 2 years and had lots of fun. We visited on a Monday and it wasn't too hot. In fact it had rained that day in Dubai so the weather was perfect although it got hot later in the day, The rides were all very fun and there were no lines at all. The new rides were also lots of fun. Great visit and good value for AED125 per person. Not sure if I'd be happy if it was more than AED200 per person though. We also got 2 small lockers for 3 of us. We were thinking of getting 1 large and 1 small locker, but the cashier advised us that 2 small lockers were enough so that was very nice of her!

A great waterpark for young and old. We thoroughly enjoyed our multiple visits to the park. It was well run with plenty or lifeguards and staff as well. The young kiddies are taken care of with a water 'tower' with multiple slides and water jets. Its a shame some of the rides have what appear to be overly cautious height restrictions, especially when parents are with them. Overall, well worth a trip and plenty for grown ups to do to release the inner child!
too hot. it was too hot...they should put more shades on all the activities. we could only stay for about two hours..feet and skin got burned

Great place to go. Weather was hot naturally but the rides were great. Never seen such a long rapid rise and it was brilliant. Plenty to do. One downside is due to the heat bare feet on concrete is impossible so had to carry things on rides and would have been nice to have cool showers not hot around the park when trying to cool down. Overall would go back again

Family with a teenager, a child and a toddler😊. Went for a one day visit.Its definitely the most advanced water park so far.Something for everyone.Vigilant staff.The staff at the ticket counter was particularly helpful.However very less shower rooms and restrooms as compared to the enormous number of people coming to the park.Secondly I wanted to buy a sovenier Atlantis bag for my daughter but the shop was already closed when we reached the exit and I couldnt find it anywhere else

Best watermark, but a few problems with the new rides!. Stayed at the Atlantis for 11 nights in July, we love access to water park but the only problem for us was that during our stay poseidons revenge was closed due to technical faults, which really should have been sorted out a lot sooner, the engineer has to come from America! I would have thought that with the ride only being open for a year Atlantis would have had a priority for that company to get somebody out to mend it sooner.For Atlantis this ride must have been very costly so I would expect the company who created the ride to have been quicker at solving the problem, flights are available daily.That said the staff working there are the best in the world, friendly and helpful.One last thing, golf buggies say for Atlantis guests but day visitors end up riding about obviously trying to access the hotel, on several occasions they did make it in, this is quite annoying when your waiting to go back to the hotel and have to wait around while the buggies ship them backwards and forwards.

Great day out.. Really fun day out, although very busy. The trick is to go early to avoid queues as Aquaventure is part of the Atlantis Palm hotel. Tip: Try to time your visit with the weather, don't go when it is peak summer heat...
Worth it!. This waterpark is the best because even if you can't swim (like me), you still can enjoy ALL the rides! Must try: Leap of Faith! Too awesome, shouldn't miss it for the world!
Nice park. Worth a visit! a water bottle cots 13 dirham so better to buy a bottle at the entrance which u can refill for 8 dirham. will recommend to visit the park between oktober and april

Splasharooney!!. Fun! Excitement. Thrilling rides. Relaxing lazy river for the misses and some crazy frisbeeathronic circle thingy ride a yolk! Just some cool stuff!
Wear some aqua shoes as the ground surface is roasting and maybe shower back at the hotel where you are staying!
But great fun and a small bit pricey!

A big place!!. Well....you cannot say you are bored here. There are that many options of "experiences" that you can do its overwhelming.My husband did an assisted dive in the lost chambers tank and enjoyed every minute. He got a good briefing session and then got over 30 minutes in the water. What a memory. The water parks huge. Quite Spread out. My husband queued for an hour for the leap of faith slide. He said it was well worth it.We also met the Dolphins. This was lovely. Well set up and run by trainers who were friendly and knowledgable. The dolphin area is massive. A lot going on, but everyone well cared for.All animals seemed very well looked after and cared for. The whole place is very clean and maintained well. The main walkway to the water park gets very busy and quite touristy. Worth a visit. Everyone we spoke to recommended this water park

Viator very poor and the venue isn't great either!. Very disappointed with our visit to Dubai Atlantis world and Viator (the booking agent) as they refused to accept Viators voucher as it failed to specify the number of guests booked. I will never use VIATOR again( tri advisors company) not for this issue but for notdealing with my complaint properly. I will not bore you with the detail but it will be interesting to see if trip advisor are interested or bothered. In regard to the venue make sure you take your own towel, travel light and they don't like you taking your own food so that you buy everything from their stores. The 'leap of faith' (slide) is the best thing and some people are very bad a queueing. It's expensive and not great value in my opinion.
Great fun, for adults as well as kids.. A huge, sprawling waterpark. All sorts of adrenaline pumping rides, and lots of chill out time as well. Highly recommended.
Do not miss it!. Amazing, exciting, lot of Fun! I have spent the full day there, repeating and repeating lot of times all the amusements!
Amazing waterpark. the best thing I like about this water park, that it is connected with a beach. so you can plan relax and have the full water experience
Water park fun. Enjoyed this quite a few times as we were staying at Atlantis. Clean, well laid out, lots of staff and lifeguards. Great place to spend fun time with the family.
Great fun. Great day out for adults, teens and kids alike. Lots of different slides to try out. Thoroughly enjoyed the Rapids.
Awesome!. This water park is amazing! So many rides and the best lazy river I have ever been in. A bit pricey, but worth it for at least one trip.

Aquaventure waterpark the Atlantis. Excellent kids really enjoyed all the rides worth it. Please do not buy tickets from the airport as we did, had to pay more at the entrance. Go early so not crowded. Crowded after 1

Top fun for the family!. The water park located at Atlantis The Palm is an all day fantastic experience. Both with and without rings to float around.Second time we visit this park and it has expanded with a new tower with insane tubes!Check out website for details.A cost saver is to check their website for offers. Might be cheaper than to pay at the entrance, 305 dhs for people over 120 cm.Remember your flip flops always as it is super hot roads to walk on in between rides.

Great day out. Having grew up in Dubai and spent many days at waterparks such as wild wadi (another fun water park in Dubai) I was delighted when this park opened and I must say it is excellent. You can easily spend the day having a fantastic time on all the different slides. My mum even enjoys this water park and enjoys the lazy river and even the Rapids ! The park has a very good selection of slides, pools, Rapids and some family bigger ring rides. I'm a bit of a wimp. And did chicken out of a few of the rides my friends and family went on.At the park there is a good selection of food. But do go early to get a subbed as can get busy in peak times. The park is very clean and the staff very friendly.

Expensive, but worth it.. The entrance fee is steep, but we thought it was worth it for a fun day.Almost all the rides are using an inflatable tube that you sit on. We first did the river and I couldn't believe how long it was. I guess it takes about an hour to do the whole thing. The tower rides were very exciting. We had a blast.

The best waterpark, ever! . Registered my birthday with Aquaventure and received a complimentary pass! This place has abundance of lockers, they even provide shampoo and shower gels in shower rooms. It gets really hot during summer, remember to bring flip flops or else it will be difficult to get around the waterpark! The rides were amazing, especially the leap of faith. I would go for it again but the queue were tremendously long!

Lot of fun at Aquaventure. Tons of fun, clean, safe and well organised. It is very convenient to have a room in Atlantis. Take care with the sun. The first attracion you'll probably see when entering is a long water path with few cascades, which surrounds the park. It takes nearly 40 min to complete the path and most of the way is permanent exposure to sun! You could exit at any time, but to do so it is convenient that you don't go barefoot. Floor might be too hot.You must pay for lockers, but we didn't need them.

Good Waterpark after ages. Visited a waterpark after ages I guess thats why I enjoyed itMy expectations were that it would be huge but it wasnt that big with most of slides from 2 locations causing overcrowding.Plus takes hell of a time to reach there Metro, Tram, monorail...c'mon man. I wasted 1 hour of the day pass.Second I booked my tickets online. Whats the point of doing it online if I have to get in que again. Why not all options available online--we buy what we want--and a guy puts in the wrist bands. This again wasted 1 hour.I bought food meal coupons outside the waterpark before entering. The rule is Iuse it before 5:15 pm. WHy??? Why cant I finish enjoying the place and then have food. Anyways it closes at 7 pm.I started to get a feeling that the place is strategically designed to waste your time. :p No deep pools or atleast deep enough for 6 feet guy. On torrents and rapids used to hit the bottom every now and then.Wouldnt want to visit a second time. WOuld go for YAs waterworld Abudhabi instead. Heard good things about it.
great. the reason we stayed at the plam was for this for our kids as guests get to go in free everyday but still have to q for wrist bands
Excellent activity if you are with kids. Excellent activity if you are with kids. My kids loved the lazy river:-) Food available is also decent.
Loved it .. Kids loved it. Lazy river and shark tank very nice. Nothing super thrilling but entertaining. Good service. Though a bit spread apart.

Good fun. Spent a couple of hours here - fun rides, not that many but Zoomerango was the most fun - my younger teen and I did that one twice! Ground gets really hot - ideally wear beach shoes. We had flip flops which we worked out how to keep with us on the rides so that we didn't have to brave the heat without them. Use showers regularly to try and keep yourself cool, even though the water is hot, not warm, hot. There is a nice tunnel at the Tower of Neptune for respite from the sun if like me you find the weather unbelievably hot.

V Hot, don't try and do it all in one day. Long queues for lockers, changing rooms very busy and surprisingly, not looked after to the usual standards here. Food and drinks expensive, two waters and a fanta, 45AED (8GBP). Remember your sun screen, expensive too.GoPros available to hire.
Best waterpark. The best waterpark ive been to also visited wild wadi which was great , id say Atlantis has better rides , wild wadi better if visiting with children,
Fun filled day. Plenty of loungers and very clean. Fun family day out with water slides to suit all. Various food areas which are reasonably priced.

Great day out. I love water parks and I think this one is good but not great. The rides are ok, there aren't that many, I think a total of 8-10 rides/slides total plus the kids section. The rides are ok, there are a few that are good fun and the rest are OK. Tips:-Bring your own towels (you will get charged if you don't)-Bring a waterproof mobile cover -Bring lots of sunblock-Bring water (or else pay 13AED ($4) for a small bottle)-Bring flip flops or waterproof shoes (UAE IS HOT IN THE SUMMER)-If you have an Emirates ID you get 40% discount on the entree fee!!!!
ATLANTIS WATER PARK. Had an absolutely fantastic day here with the family. We all loved it. Try out the Zoomerango ride !!!!
Best Place Ever. Bestest in Dubai for thrill seekers. Do buy the waterproof mobile cover to click amazing pictures. Very bad staff in changing rooms.

Good Fun for the Family. This park has some very good rides, from the thrill seeker to the relaxed. All of the slides are awesome and i thoroughly enjoyed exploring the waterways- it goes around the whole park and has a couple of adventure section including the rapids and the wave run, neither are too upbeat but they do provide a bit of action instead of just floating around. The water ways are a great way to get around the park as there are exits to all of the major sections of the park and you need to take you tube with you for the Tower of Neptune tube rides.I would recommend wearing your thongs or even better getting some water shoes because the ground gets extremely hot and also quite slippery for bear feet.My only other gripe is the fact that there is only one locker area and it is a fair bit away from the rest of the park and given they don't have the ability to pay using your wrist band like other parks i have been to you need to walk back to the lockers to get money every time you need a drink or want to eat.On that topic food and drink is very expensive, i would recommend getting one of the souvenir cups because you will save in the long run. It will cost you AED40 to buy and then it is AED8 for a refill of softdrink or water. Given water is AED13 and soft drinks are AED18, you'll make your money back if you are there all day and you can keep it and use it whenever you come back.
excellent. it is beautiful but small, what you could see from outside is almost all ,there is no need to go inside and pay money

Easy to spend a lot of time here!. We thoroughly enjoyed Aquaventure - we were staying at Atlantis so took advantage of the free entry. We were there during Ramadan and it wasn't busy - the only ride we queued for was Poseidon's Revenge, the rest we were straight on to. No trouble getting sun loungers and the towels were enormous! Food a bit expensive but we expected that. All the rides were good fun - some would be too much for small kids but the kids' pool looked great too. Very well staffed - lifeguards everywhere. I'd recommend wearing a rash shirt and one-piece - too easy to lose half a bikini on some of the rides!

overpriced for average service. quite good fun though. very (very) expensive. ridiculously small changing rooms area, for such large crowds. waiting time before rides can be very long, even off season. some rides are very thrilling though.
Enjoyed the water sports. The water sports over here was excellent. Specially the kids zone at the last. The weather was hot and the kids zone water was cool. Besides other rides were also good.

A very exciting waterpark, but never go when it's crowded!. We decide to visit Aquaventure for the very first time during Eid, and that was a bad choice of timing simply because it was way too crowded.The ticket queue was pretty long and it was too hot to stand in an area without air conditioning (in a 48 degrees weather) just to wait for tickets. Well we really were there already so we waited for our turn anyway.We finally got our tickets, they checked our bags quickly at the entrance for security reasons, and then we got inside. I headed to the locker rooms first to put our bags. There were 3 of us and we hired only one small locker for 50 dirhams (the bigger ones cost 75 dirhams) - we didn't like that the locker was way too small and it hardly fit our things. Anyhow, the locker rooms were clean and so were the showers. We took the lazy river first, then the leap of faith and shark attack rides. Those were absolutely lovely. We didn't find trouble with finding a sun lounge to put our towels on or anything as we had already arrived earlier than most of the park visitors. Here's what we didn't like the most - everything inside the park is ridiculously overpriced. A small snowcone cost 40 dirhams, a small bottle of water vost 15 dirhams, and a fizzy drink was for 25 dirhams and more. It's just inconvenient that 3 people would visit the waterpark and pay over a 1,000 dirhams in total. Some things are priced without an explanation. My advice: Go on a weekday. Never on a weekend, never during a public holiday.

Great family fun. Had a wonderful family day here, swam with Dolphins this is an extra cost to getting onto the park, but worth it. The only thing I didn't like was that there was no information about the rides. I really don't like the big scarey rides, but you had no idea what the rides was like until you was on it.

Lucky it was off season. lots of fun and thankfully we were there in July during the height of the heat but not the crowds. The queue barriers were a reminder that a visit in peak season could mean more time in queues than on slides - which are amazing
Excellent. a great way to spend the day. One of the best water parks we have been to. Loved it the creativity and originality.

Destination in itself. Fantastic and Fun Fun Fun. We stayed at the Atlantis so we went to the water park every day and never got bored. THe best water park ever! They also had zip lining for the kids for 1 price all day. We would love to go back there

Great day off. I had a day off due to Ramadan on my business trip and decided to visit Aquaventure. I visited in July, so given the incredible heat in the city this seemed like very nice option.When I got there the staff was very helpful, I decided to buy the entrance+lunch+Aquarium deal and it was worth it. Had the luck of finding very little people at the park so no waiting anywhere. The slides are really fun, the rapids are great and the lazy river is perfect to relax. After having a nice lunch (fast food, I had the chicken shawarma, really good) I decided to finish riding the slides and call it a day, the heat was killing me. So I went out before everybody (mid afternoon) ad found the showers all to myself. Had a nice COLD shower (they have liquid soap and shampoo for you to use in the showers, which are very clean by the way), very much appreciated in 45°C heat, changed and went for a relaxing stroll in the air conditioned aquarium. Shopped for some souvenirs and called it a day. Would recommend this to anyone, whether you're with yuor family or by yourself, it's a nice way to spend a day.TIPS:- Bring crocs or water shoes or anything you can wear and wet, paving tends to get REALLY hot and you'll see people struggling to go from place to place barefoot.- Get the value deal for entrance+lunch+aquarium, well worth it- Get the prepaid wrist band for spending. I missed this one when I bought my tickets and ended up not being able to buy anything since my wallet was in my locker.

Fun for the entire family during our vacation in Dubai. Our family visited the Aquaventure Waterpark in June 2015. We including our three children (ages 10 – 17) spent an entire morning at the park.Since we were staying in a family suite at Atlantis – The Palm hotel, we received complementary access to the Aquaventure Waterpark. We took a stroll down to the walkway near the hotel pool and took a short 2 minute ride to the waterpark. The hotel has several golf cart type buggies that shuttle guests between the waterpark and the hotel.Arriving at around 10:00 AM, we found plenty of open (and shaded) seating space. We proceeded to spend the next few hours enjoying all of the rides. Cafeterias were conveniently located and gave us easy access to water and snacks.A suggestion to those visiting during the summer months – make sure your kids are wearing their flip-flops when they walk around the waterpark. Though the temperature of the water was very enjoyable, walking bare-feet on the concrete walkways was very uncomfortable for our children.

well orrganised. 1- very nice slides, around 7 2- very safe, lifeguard every 10 meters3- get prepared to pay the extras for towels 30 AED, lockers 40 and 75 AED, also drinks and food ( small water 13 AED)4- nice beach 5- i expected it to be bigger6- a bit expensive comparing with prices in Europe and america ( double price)

Just not that fun!. We went on a weekday so not too much to complain about in the way of queueing or organisation. My main problem is that it was all a bit tame. Having been to waterparks in Gold Coast, Australia and Hanoi, Vietnam in the last 6 months, I must say this does not compete for exhilaration. The 'leap of faith' slide, which is supposed to be the best at the park, was ok but certainly not worth queuing 30 minutes and didnt match up to ones I have riden at other parks. The surrounding rides in the Neptune area were almost zero thrill. A quick up and down a small dip and a brief slide through a black tunnel and its over. What I find strange is that there are 3 rides in this area which are all near identical to one another and are all pretty lame.The other area, Poisendon, provides a few more thrills and the queues are shorter, which did improve my view of the park. Yet still nothing that really got my heart racing.It was nice to laze around the river. If you are a thrill seeker I recommend falling out of your ring in the rapids. It's slightly dangerous with a few plastic rocks in the way but it was the biggest blast we had.Alright experience but definitely overpriced for the money!

wonderful place. This is a well run water park and clean and tidy. Gets busy at weekends. The rides are fab and lots of rubber floats and rings for everyone. the rapids and the waves are great and the lifeguards are so nice and friendly. There are little buggies to take you back and forward to Atlantis free of charge if you are staying in this hotel.

Great day out. We went here with our 3 year old and 9 month old. We had the best time and it was so much fun. Lots to do with both children despite being so young. Staff are really friendly and helpful. The park itself is kept so clean.

Awesome! Would visit again.. Awesome!!! Loved every second of it! I went there today with my cousins and nephews they all enjoyed it! there are a little bit of negatives though :/ 1- the prices are expensive2- very crowded! Especially in July, lines are long but at least they move fast.3- lots of walking and stairs, me and my niece where very tired from walking, and climbing stairs to get into rides. lol.Tip:if you want to go there just avoid riding the lazy river It's very dangerous, and try not to ride the abyss or the leap of faith or poseidons revenge! Those are very scary.Recommendations:1- I strongly advise going to the shark attack! It's amazing, it starts out dark but then you enter a a big aquarium like thing and you get to see sharks! Amazing me and my niece rode it, and we loved every second of it! (Single and Double riders only)2- Family ride, oh my gosh! Family ride is the best! You get to ride with family and friends, it fits about 4-6 people I'm not sure but we entered as 5 people.3- the rapids, oh boy I'm gonna get hate on this one.. The Rapids was very fun! I would suggest riding it alone, I've heard that many people fell of or something, but my daughter is 12 and she survived it she even wanted to do it again, I think we where safe cause there were at least 10 life guards scattered around.4- water coaster, it's super fun, I recommend going here, it's like a roller coaster.5- zoomerango, it's super fun as well sometimes scary but mostly fun.That's all! Hope I helped

No. 1 water park in the area. Visited the Aquaventure many times with my family of 10/13 YO kids, last of which was during July' 2015. Unbelievable experience, all family members had fun despite the tough weather. Staff are professional, water is clean, queues are organized.We remain fan of the aquaventure.

Great for Kids and Adults. I visited Aquaventure with family and all of us enjoyed to the hilt. As a guest at Atlantis, The Palm, entry was free for us. You have to pay for Locker facility, but being a guest at the hotel we did not use it. If you are a guest at hotel, suggest wearing the bathrobe over your bikini if you do not want to roam the hotel in it. Toilet facility was present throughout the park and neat. Towels are also provided at many locations. You get paid vouchers for food before entering the park and the food at Shark Bites was good. If you want to take photographs with mobile suggest buying a cover for it. Swimming with Dolphin and Seal Lion is paid so we did not take it. My kid loved the River Ride and wifey loved the water slide. One day is enough but you can spend more if you are into it!
Will be back :). Had a good day at the park. Will be back again in few months and will go again, food at the park was ok not much choice but the rides and day itself was great

Relaxing or adrenaline rush, you choose. It is the best of both worlds, you can get your heart racing on the many high speed slides, then completely chill out and float around the river ride. You really do need to go with at least one other person as many of the slides require two people per tube. The adults only area in the middle is a bit of a sanctuary to excape the hoardes but is purhaps not really worth the money

Overpriced and disappointing . We went to the aqua entire water park yesterday and found it to be a let down. After reading about it as one of the best water parks in the world we were really disappointed. It had a handful of great rides and a good water rapid but it was spread out which was a problem because the paths were very hot underfoot, I could have worn shoes but then would have to carry them on the slides. It was really expensive and not really worth the ticket price so I would recommend to save some money and go to WadiWadi.
Cool. It was great to visit water park this day because the weather was very hot. We have excellent impressions about the attractions of the park.

A Day of Fun for everyone. I loved this! I was apprehensive because I am in my 50's and thought that this might be a young person's attraction. I was wrong! I had a fantastic time and the day went too quickly. It is very relaxing to float in clear water wafted along by underwater currents. I tried some of the more exciting slides too. Well worth the entrance fee. Recommend wearing a t-shirt over your swimming costume - the sun is hot and it is possible to stay deceptively cool.

Non stop fun. I've never been to a water-park before so do not take my comments too seriously.We came here twice during Ramadan, First day was a Friday, quite more full than on Monday when we came again. At this time it was full of family and children as well as teenagers and adults. There was something to do for all ages, from what I could notice.Some of the rides are vertiginous and we enjoyed it a lot, specially the Leap of faith (and I tried it several times) and poseidon's Revenge. Also Slitherine, zoomerango and acquaconda. There is nothing I can't say I didn't like it. You can also do some diving if you pay extra and play with defines.We had a great time. Enough for 1 day.

Exciting Park. The Water Park offers some really thrilling rides. There is one in which u go through a tunnel with the entire aquarium around you the experience of that is amazing. They also offer you to dive with sharks. That is one of a kind experience. It was the best experience I had at that park.The best way to move around the park is the wave pool which connects all the rides. Saves you from burning your feet in the heat. The only issue with this place is that in Summer your feet get burnt and only hot water comes out from their showers. It was a real pain in the heat of July.
Awesom. Underground ternel different types of fishes and in different colours. We really enjoiyed. I love dubai.

A real Aquaventure. We stayed at the Atlantis hotel, and we had free unlimited access to the facility. It seem fairl newer than wild wadi . It is more family orientated and a high level of safety as there was heavy presense of lifeguards all around. The queues were not too long besides the main attractions life the leap of faith. The Rapids, the beach etc were relaxing and fun. Overall we had great fun!

Great water park!. This is a very nice place - green and clean with lot of amusments. The entrance is free if you visit the park during your birthday! A really great place to have fun, even if you're pregnant! The water temperature is very good - the most important thing when it is 43 Degrees by Celsius! Thank you for the great birthday!

Wonderful place but a rip off. A great to relax and have fun with the family, possibly combined with a very exciting dolphin experience. Very clean and very friendly staff. But: the only thing they don't charge extra for is breathing, or is it feels....want to watch the kids doing the dolphin stuff you pay extra. Want a towel, pay. Need a locker, pay...and thats after not having to pay micky mouse money to get in....

Great day with the friends. I went with some friends to spend the day in this waterpark.We arrived in a car and the parking is next to the park, anyways there is a complimentary bus taking you to the entrance of the waterpark.It was really good that we went in summer, because its not crowded of people and you don't have to wait doing lines half of the day.The slides are in perfect conditions and all are really entertaining and fun.However, I got really sick, because outside is really hot due to the Dubai summer and when you go to the restaurants its freezing cold.
Not as good as Wild wadi. Its ok, but the park did not seem to flow properly. Not great having to carry the rubber rings to majority of the rides.
Fantastic fun. There is something for all ages at the water park, if you want a quiet beach and sun yourself or go on thrilling Rapids it's all there.

Excellent water park. An excellent water park that is every bit as good as its rated to be.A lot of the best rides need you to walk up a lot of stairs.. So be ready for that. Depending on when you go, there could also be long queues though we have been lucky enough never to have had that problem.Tip 1: you don't want to be walking our queuing barefoot as the ground gets really hot and people *do steal your slippers*. So get those slip on water shoes and avoid burnt feet.Tip 2: Take a large water with you.. You're going to need it... You can buy drinks everywhere, but it's not cheap.Tip 3: best value options for drinks is to get a meal with refillable drinks... It's a big saving if you need to top up your drinks (still not cheap but way better than the regular regular).Tip 4: The complimentary golf carts, close to the beach, are a great way to get around the rides a bit more comfortably and to get you back to the east or west towers if you're staying there.

Lazy Day. An awesome waterpark with loads of slides. We were quite happy to just lay about in the lazy river and go round and round all day, but there are still plenty of other things to do within the park!

Brilliant. Aquaventure is amazing. We stayed at the Atlantis Hotel and therefore the waterpark entrance was included in our stay. It was very hot as we visited in July, 38-40 degrees but there were lots of umbrellas that you could use to get shade. The lazy river is a lovely way to keep cool, floating in the rubber rings. The rapids certainly cool you down when you are getting soaked. The rides are fabulous. Im not a massive lover of waterparks or theme parks but Aquaventure is different-visited 5 days in a row!

So much fun!. What a day out and if you are visiting Dubai it's an experience you definitely have to go through! We where staying in the Atlantis anyway so not too sure on ticket prices etc as we got free unlimited access but you have to come and go on the big slides. I won't lie it took me about 20 minutes to go on Poisdons Revenge but once I'd done it I wanted to go on it again and again..... The staff in the waterpark are lovely and I had many a laugh and a joke with them! All the rides are really good and the lazy river is good if you just wanna chill. The main tower is a really good ride too try and open your eyes when you go through the aquarium (I know I couldn't) haha saw many celebs whilst at this waterpark too! Enjoy your time at the waterpark when we return to Dubai I know we will be going back to Aquaventre
skyhigh. It's all pretty slick ,,,, you wouldn't think you were 124 storeys up. makes you feel kinda Ton Cruisey

20 something couple. Came prepared for the day out, brought our own towels, no point in paying extra as we hardly used them, only to dry before leaving. Carried our flip flops around with us, which was welcomed as we noticed many people dashing about trying their best not to burn their feet. Queues were very short considering it was half term. Plenty of shade available, didn't feel too warm whilst queueing. Felt a little conned by the 'cup drink deal' as each refill had to be paid for, unlike in most theme parks where you pay for the cup and refills are free. Neither of our scanning bracelets worked and therefore didn't have the opportunity to purchase any photos, which I suppose it's more their loss than ours as we had used a waterproof cover on our phone to take pictures anyway. (fairly reasonable price to buy at atlantis, however we had already purchased our own before travelling) Had a great time on all of the rides and spent a little time chilling out on the beach before getting a taxi home, which at the end of the day, did take a long time.

The best day in Dubai. The best day in Dubai - great rides, palm trees, beautiful beach, the birds are singing.. You feel like they took a little part of the Bahamas and put it in the desert. My wife had a birthday so she entered for free ! My ticket was around 70$ + 30$ for food,locker and towels. Definitely spend all day there , i went only for 5 hours and it wasn't enough at all.

Awesome day out and great way to keep cool in June.. This was the best waterpark we have ever been to, there is something for all ages. We loved how you could do a full lap on the river rides and it brought you all the way around. The staff were amazing and it was great to see there was lifeguard training happening too. We will definitely return.

it is okay but not so impressive compare to the US water parks.. it is okay but not so impressive compare to the US water parks. My. teenage girls were not so impressed either. I think the "Dubai" image had a lot to do in their high expectation... anyway, water park is always fun. So they enjoyed and also the beach

Wild family water fun.. Oh my, these rides are awesome. My family and I had a great full day at the park and enjoyed every second. Splashing around in the rubber rings and riding crazy rides. Life guards were all over the place to take care of the safety and to make fun with us at the same time. Great place that I would love to visit again

Great day out cooling off from the heat. I went on a Sunday in July and found the waterpark to be a great way to cool off in the heat. The park seems well organised, with a rapids run around the outside, and two key areas for slides. I felt signage towards the rides could have been better. I had very little wait for any of the rides although my top tip if you are tubing is not to take the ride to the top but to walk up the steps. If I'm back in Dubai I'll stop over here again!
Bursting with excitement. Full of excitement and fun and enjoyable timewater tunnelsYou can also enjoy the water for hours in the sun
Amazing!. Brilliant day out, had only planned a couple a hours but ended up staying until closing time! Slides were incredibly especially the leap of faith! don't overthink it just go for it!
Great day out for all ages.. Spent all of the day at the park and didn't even know we had. The sun can get the better of you in this time. So many fun rides and things to do.

Modern park. Modern park with many different rides. Some of them are very relaxing (on purpose) and some of them are really thrilling. So even teenagers can have fun here, not only kids under 10. We were there on off season so park wasn't overcrowded.

Best WAterParks. If your hot in Dubai and looking for a place to cool off Aquaventure is the place to do it. The lines are not long at all, plus you can move between most rides via the lacy/rapid rivers. did the shark attack the guides where excellent, the individuals that were frighten they were coaching through the all event. I can only say it was one of the best waterparks I have visited.

Simply Amazing. A beautiful theam park. Has well demarked zones for all the facilities. There is kids conor where small kids can enjoy playing in the water. There are various rides with various degrees of steepness. Depending on each individuals levels for thrill, you can take the ride. All the rides are all inclusive except for Dolfin Pool, where you have to pay to enter. Also you can have a swim in the sea, where you have safe well demarketed areas to swim in. To move around the park there are electric buggies which keep moving at a duration of few minutes. All areas are will marked with directions given at each junction. On entry you have the locker units with changing rooms.Just one word of caution - when entering the park, do not carry any eatables as you will not be allowed inside.

Awesome park but not much shade. I visited with my wife and 3 kids (10, 7 and 2 years old) and it is a fantastic water park. It caters for all ages with an excellent fodder splash area which enthralled my 2 year all day. The entire splash pool is wading depth and includes numerous slides and water features. For the older kids there is the Tower of Neptune and the Tower of Poseidon. In the latter there is a giant slide where you can race one another - this kept my two older boys entertained for a long while. For a more relaxing cruise, you can start at the Tower of Neptune and float all around the park. It is slow but relaxing.While there is ample seating with lots of umbrellas, none of the pools or slides are in the shade. This means that kids can get sun burnt very easily if you don't keep reapplying sunscreen. There is also the potential of getting really hot by being out in the sun for extended periods. The only other negative is the price of the food. We had lunch at Shark Bites which is no better than a food court - and the price of 3 kids + 1 adult meal was AED 220. If there was more shade in the pools and food was a bit more reasonable in price I would have given it a 5 out of 5. However, as a water park it is unparalleled anywhere in the world.

Fun Place but very crowded. Its a great place to go to , there are attractions for children as well for adults .the only min point is sometimes the waiting times and to much people in the park .When you want a little less busy park you can go to wild Wadi , this is smaller but also very fun.

How to have fun with your family. This water park is a place you need to go with your family, it is a great way to enjoy your day. Sometimes it gets extremely hot, and by going there, you avoid the heat and have fun at the same time !

Unforgetable experience with Dolphin. We enjoy our experience swimming with Dolphin.The staff gave a good orientation before we step in the water to see and feel this beauiful sea creature. The program is very educational for my children too. We learned so much about Dolphin. Yes it cost a little but this experience are priceless. And I hope they use this money to provide better care to this animals.

Lots to do..... We had prepaid for our tickets so queued separately to those buying on the day, ticket collection was painfully slow. Our queue took the longest to go down so we would have been quicker buying on the day. Changing rooms were clean and there were lots of lockers to use. We got on our rubber ring and spent the day round the lazy river, lots of good slides to go on. You can easily spend a day here. The area where the sun loungers are was packed but we left our bags there all day and our things were safe. Great for kids and adults.

Not a waterpark fan before, but now a convert. Was a bit apprehensive before we arrived (burn at the sight of sun and never quite know what these things are like) but we were lucky with the weather, hot but cloudy so wasn't shockingly bright. Used UV protecting long sleeved shirts which were great. To be fair, the whole thing was fantastic fun! Yes it was slightly expensive, but when you consider where it's built and the infrastructure involved in creating it and the sort of fun it involves you kinda do the math. Was worth it. I guess we were lucky in that it wasn't rammed to the gunnels ( could imagine if it were, the queuing might be a pain) All the attractions were working fine and staff were friendly and helpful. Favourites by a country mile were (I) Poseidon Revenge (terrifying but stunning) (ii) Leap of Faith and (iii) Slitherine - absolutely fantastic fun! Food choices were a bit limited, but in context were fine and not overly outrageously expensive. Go prepared and have fun.
Atlantis. The water park is a lot of fun with many slides, pools and a very fun lazy river. lunch is ok here and it was tasty and reasonably priced,

Amazing. . This place is really magical. When you enter the front gate everything is in typical dubai style, large and brilliant. The Aquarium where you buy your tickets is gigantic. Then you begin the rides. It is brilliant. They have lifts to take you to your ride so you don't need to get out and walk up steps. By the time you reach the top you are already dry!! The service is really good and I can't get over how clean the entire place is. Everyone is so calm and the workers there are brilliant. I could easily spend days in that place. I would go in the meaning rather the afternoon because of the heat.

Unbelievable Fun. If you are seeking water adventure and having a family fun day so this is the right place for you.Atlantis Aquaventure Waterpark is one of the best and safe waterparks I have ever visited. The whole family can enjoy the day there.Highly recommended !!

Nice but very expensive waterpark, spacious and fun slides.. Nice waterpark but everything here is very expensive. We were happy to find a healthy meal, being a sandwich and a salad, next to all the fast food here. We went on a Sunday and it was very quiet in the park. No queues and lots of space to lay down. I went with my boyfriend and we are quite tall, be sure to get a 2 person tube which is blown up hard otherwise you will get stuck in the slides! We liked that you can take many if the slides together in a tube, this really enhances the whole experience. The staff was nice and helpful. We took our flip flops with us in the slides, which was ok, to avoid having to walk on the very very hot stones bare foot. For this some other people had water shoes which looked as a much better idea!

adventure at its best. its the best water perk in dubai....the leap of faith was the best though u had to climb a lot if stairs to get to the top but its worth the effort plenty of activities for kids and adults must visit

Great place to stay cool!. We loved the whole park and I cannot say anything negative about Aquaventure. It was just amazing. The staff were so friendly and so good with children. They had plenty of slides and we didn't have to wait to go on any slide.

it wasn't a pleasant experience at all. I had been to Aquaventure Waterpark with my family on 13th Dec 2014. We hardly spend 2 hours inside the park and cut short the trip due to an unpleasant incident. My children were taking the Shamal ride after standing in the queue for about 45 minutes. However, immediately after the ride started (just after 2-3 minutes), there was some technical problem and my children (And only them) were asked to vacate the ride without giving any explanation. Even more shocking was that the person in-charge was very rude and asked my children to go out and stand in the long queue again ! We did lodge a written complaint after meeting the Ticketing Supervisor (Mr. Mahmoud) and the Operations Manager (Mr. James) and they even promised to send us a email response. However, as expected, nothing happened till date. Though we spent 1,000 dhs. for entering the waterpark, it wasn't a pleasant experience at all

good way to recover from jet lag. went on a quiet day (Friday) during ramadan which meant no queues, got a web all in one deal. spent the day floating around on a ring and dropping down slides with an 11 year old.

Water madness. Fantastic day out with the family from dusk to dawn, plenty of eating options, value for money. If your going around the week of your birthday, register on their website to get free entry

Best place for those with a family. Staying at Atlantis the water park is included. There is no better place to stay in the summer heat. The gulf wind & plentiful water keep you refreshed. Yes it's hot, but it's July in TheArabian Gulf, don't come here if you can't stand the heat.Food & drink are expensive, but the same can be said for every international destination. Keep the drink & icecream flowing & enjoy.
Good Fun. One of the biggest water theme park in the middle east, lots of thrill , fun and great place to go with kids.

Amazing place . Slightly apprehensive booking this as I had my 18 month old daughter and I was not sure it would be a place that she'd enjoy? She didn't enjoy it, she loved it and so did I. Although slightly pricey to get in my daughter was free and there is a really big kids pool and slides and plenty of sun loungers and parasols. There is so much to do from slides to shark pools, that's there's too much to list. Some attractions incur extra costs but if you check the website it tells you what you get. I didn't try the other park in Dubai so can't compare it but it would have to take something to beat this one. The hotel is pretty impressive too!

Visit with 2 x 11 year olds & 2 adults. A fabulous place for a fun filled wet family time.My advice - don't go at this time of year Unless you have good stamina. It was so hot and the water was not at all refreshing.Having said that... We soldiered on and had an amazing day. The place is impeccable .... So clean, staff so helpful 10/10.A few tips:1. Take your own towels2. If you have those water shoes (wetsuit material type) wear them all day and on all the rides cause the ground is so hot.3. Take plenty of money as everything extra costs heaps.We loved it and would definitely go back on our next visit to Dubai.

A thrilling day out. I came here with a friend and we had an absolute ball. The cost of this water park is definitely worth it. I went on some thrilling rides that day. I would recommend 'The Surge' water slide and 'The Falls.' Also, of course, the 'Leap of Faith.' The park offers drinks, burgers, pizza, slushies and lots more.
