There are also some relaxing rides if you are simply looking to chill. I know that you get free access to this park if you are staying at Atlantis Hotel, which is another highly recommended place to go in the wild city of Dubai. If you get the chance, don't miss out on either of these places!

funventure. awesome experience with adrenaline rush. full of excitement. great rides. lazy river, torrents etc leave great memories. try to reach early as the waterpark closes at sunset. no need to use lockers as its very safe to keep your belongings on the benches. for rides swimming costume is a must. if you stay at Atlantis then waterpark entry is free. there are few rides for younger kids too.

A fab waterpark. We were staying at the Atlantis so a day at the water park was a must and we loved it. It was so clean and the water was as clear as anything. We were there in Ramadan so it felt quiet, which was good as we didn't have to queue for rides. A must for any water lover.

Visit to Atlantis and Aquaventure. A large water park
Can be quite expensive for a large group of people . So pl check rates
Lot of good rides for all age groups
Kids area is normally Overcrowded with parents , children and nannies around.
Lots of Fast food stalls around the area
Changing facilities and locker facilities are good
Over all Good

Very good, but too many people. We did go during the holiday season, which meant that their where people everywhere. the water rides where good and we found lots of shade to keep us out of the sun. it is a good afternoon, if you run out of things to do

Great activity options. Often to full.. we have been to the Atlantis water park now 3 times. It has a great variety of options for slides, river, tubing. The only thing that I would add as an improvement is that there is more space needed for the amount of people that go to the park. It can be a challenge to find a spot to with beach chairs. Also due to the crowd sizes many of the more popular slides have long wait times that can go over an hour. We will definitely go again but during the week to try to avoid the larger weekend crowds.

A very hot walk. We had a great time at the Waterpark, we have seen many Waterparks around the world but Aquaventure Waterpark was the best so far. I would recommend to bring some Water Shoes/ Aqua Socks, specially for your children because the walkways get very, very, very hot.There was only FastFood available and that was the only thing we didn't enjoy. A fun day you will never forget.

Very good day out for whole family or friends... Only problem is heat on your feet. So i have now been to the aqua park 3 times, the most recent one was to spend time with their dolphins which was brilliant and highly recommended... As part of our ticket. We got free entry into the main aqua park so we had an hour or so before we had to leave so spent time going om a couple of rides... There is a great range of rides and for either individual or group thrill seekers...My only real complaint is the amount of tarmac and or paving stones that they have around that you need to walk on... They dont allow shoes on the rides for obvious reasons ao every leaves them at the entrance steps to the ride but this is not the same place as where you finish the ride ao you spend time without your shoes whilst you walk or run back to collect them but you are walking on these boiling hot stones... It was extremely painful this last time due to the heat of the day and it is off putting for you to enjoy another ride... Also, we put our towels down in a big pile whilst going on the rides and then people came snd helped themselves to our towels whilst we were away...However, there is little else negative to say about this park...Buy the waterproof containers for your phone and money as you will need money to buy water and food or keep receipts safe snd dry for your food if this is included... Also, out your phone in it, you get some excellent under water or action footage through the plastic container...

Great fun day out. The best watermark in Dubai.Fantastic rides,from good fun to really really scaryAs it's based at Atlantis, you have access to a great beach.Go early gets more crowded in afternoon.Easy parking

Good. If you stay 2 nights at the Atlantis The Palm, Aquaventure is free during your stay.You think that it is a big waterpark, but there is not so much to do at the and. But is is fun.Only 1negative thing, for some attractions you need to carry the buoys. Need to improve this.

New rides - got better!. I've been to Atlantis a handful of times since relocation to the UAE and each time has got better. They do a great discount for UAE residents. They have opened new rides which are thrilling and fun for the whole family! It is also beside a lovely beach extension which make it less "water park" and more "water reservoir." Tip: Bring flip flops durable in water etc. The ground is HOT!

Lost my flip flops :(. A pretty good day out with friends. Some pretty scary rides, but not very many. Reasonable food outlets, all the facilities it says on their website etcThere is also a beach you can use there which is lovely.Long queues at peak times.Discount with Emirates ID.Good lazy river, could have spent all day on that.Now, the flip flop incident. You could not walk around without your shoes on as the floor is too hot, so you had to wear your flipflops, or whatever, and leave them at the bottom of the ride entrance. Now, half an hour later after queuing for a ride I came to collect my flip flops and they were gone! Someone had half-inched them. I doubt it was done in error as they are quite different, I think someone must have "upgraded" so I was left burning my feet off with nothing to put on them.Thanks mate!

Best water park in UAE!!. The best water park as compared to Wild Wadi and Yas Waterworld. While those water parks are fun as well, Aquaventure now with its new rides that have been added to the new wing makes it the most complete and entertaining ride. Food is a little overpriced but they have shisha so that's a plus. Highly recommended.Note: There is no wave pool.
Fun in the water!. A really fantastic waterpark and I am not normally a fan! Clean, spacious, comfortable - excellent rides from 'lazy river' to the thrills and spills sort!

great day out.. if you like waterparks then you will love this place. large waterpark with plenty of slides, pools and private beach. opens at 10 am and close at 6pm. booked online at a cost of 250dirhams/£46 that included a free meal at one of the many fast food outlets. don't forget your flip flops for walking around the park as the floor gets really hot. tips: take plenty of sunblock,if you burn easy take a rash vest or buy at the park for around£40. buy a waterproof case for your phone before you go as we paid £23 for one at the park normal cost is about £3-4 on ebay. you are allowed to take one litre of water in with you. don't forget to get a locker at a cost of 40dirhams/around£7 small lockers will fit 2 rucksacks.

Fun. It's a lovely day out but not a massive amount of rides. It was too hot to leave flip flops at the start of a ride so it was a case of holding on to them between the knees. It did not cause an issue. It's fun but the cost of beverages etc is rather steep. We stayed at the Atlantis so could sign for stuff we bought which was handy. I do recommend the waterproof cell phone holder so you can take your own photos and videos.

Not that great to be honest. Don't go if you have children under 1.2 metres as its a lot of money for what they get. Found the lifeguards very unapproachable and some rude but all unwilling to help which is not in keeping with our experience in Dubai (everywhere else was amazingly good). Felt like we owed them something by coming to Atlantis park. An example was we went on the flowing river with my 6 year old, put him on my lap on a single floating hoop. Went passed 3 lifeguards who didn't tell me that I couldn't only to get to a point where I couldn't go back to be told I had to get out and get a double hoop. Did the same thing, passed 3 guards to be told again I needed a double with a child seat and had to get out of the river and go back to start again, asked the Lifeguard where I could get one he shrugged his shoulders and said "look". I did for 20 minutes and he didn't move a muscle (there were 4 lifeguards together). Had enough so finally said to the lifeguards that I wanted to speak to the boss, low and behold the boss didn't turn up but the correct float did within a minute. Not all bad as the slides were good although felt like I sliced my back on a few. Certainly not worth the money, I would go to Wild Wadi next time as this was better and looks better. Much better views also. To be fair to Atlantis this was a free birthday ticket but this to entice me to bring others which I and spend 1000AED for them.

Great fun. Great fun for all! Rides are really good and the park is really well laid out. Plenty of life guards on so I felt comfortable letting my 12yr and 10yr old go on rides without adult supervision. Excellent access if ur staying in the Atlantis......definitely worth a visit or two :)

Disappointed. Although this place was very good and had high chances of getting an excellent review this is not the case. We have enjoyed all the rides and done them all and were quite happy with the restaurants available. But thats about it with the good things. The downside of the story is: 1. after you pay quite a lot of money , i don't see why you have to pay for a locker separately - this place is trying to make money out of everything. 2. although you get a bracelet as entry ticket, we couldn't get towels without the receipt for some strange reasons which we of course left in the locker3. again they are trying to make money out of everything, taking you pictures around the park and then charging ridiculous amounts for them 4. although we weren't very bothered with the above points, this has really annoyed us. As we come out of the Hotel a 'nice' man comes and offers us a taxi. As we didn't expect such a posh place will offer us a 'scam' taxi we went with him. We said the address to the man which then gave a ticket to the driver. As we have noticed there was no meter we asked how much is gonna be , and the price was the one we paid to come there so we accepted. We needed to get to Pearl Marina Hotel Apartments. After 10 min drive the driver stops in the middle of nowhere and says thats where it is. We have said thats not the place and repeated the hotel name. Then he says that the man from the hotel said we are going to Palm Marina ( which I don't even think exists) and then said it will be double the price to get to our hotel. As we didn't had any other options we had to accept and go with that. Very disappointed that a place like this will do such mistakes which we had to pay for and I do think they should give to their customers metered taxis which are the cheapest or a fair priced taxi.

you will never get bored or fed up of visiting this place. I cant remember the exact date or year but iv visited a coupl of times and always been a amazing experience even for us adults!id definitely go back again as every time u go back theres something new, different or something u missed last time, you could never get fed up or not want to visit this place!make sure to go visit! another attraction you will be upset about if you miss it!

Wasn't as good as expected. Wasn't as many rides as I thought. Luckily we were staying at Atlantis so we didn't have to pay to get in. Our stuff (2 iPhones and clothes) were supposedly locked in a locker and were nearly stolen (someone opened our locker and moved our stuff to another locker)

Great Water Adventure Park. We stayed at the Atlantis Palm, so admission to Aquaventure Waterpark was free of charge, which is excellent as it costs about £50 per adult for a day's pass otherwise. We went twice, late in the day, when it was really quiet, and also not too hot. Do bring flip flops with you as the ground is really hot and you don't want to walk around without some form of protection on your feet. There are lockers to leave clothes and valuables in. We brought our own bottled water in, and there are towels freely available. The rides were very good and we were impressed by the huge number of lifeguards on duty throughout the Waterpark, and felt very safe there. Only complaint is we got a bit disorientated on our first visit there, there aren't enough maps saying 'you are here' so you can find your way back to where you left your towels etc. Great fun, and lovely to be able to do the rides as a family or as a couple. Recommend.

Great Fun. I loved all the rides, the Lazy river is a great way to get around, walking is not good unless you have something on your feet as the pavement gets very hot. Great day, definitely worth a trip.

Great park, worth coming back. Kids loved the water slides, The Leap of Faith was a big favourite with them. I enjoyed riding the rapids and the wave pool, the Zoomerango was cool too. The package for Ziplining, 4 for 100 Dirham was a steal since it cost 50 dirham per person. Did not do the Dolphin Bay as we found the prices too high.Food offerings were good, a nice selection of Asian, pizza, middle eastern, chicken, of course Italian gelato. Overall seating and resting facilities are good and always available. It was not too crowded but we had the "good luck" to be there on some of the hottest days in Dubai in recent years. So the crowds arrived late.Next time, we may plan to visit during another time, summer is definitely too hot to spend in Dubai.

Family fun day. The staff were all very nice and really paying attention! The lazy river, rapids and slides were all really fun. I did not give a five only because it could have been a bit bigger as we did everything several times within the first couple of hours. The park is very clean, even with the crowds there was no lines to really complain of and everything was suitable for all of us (even me the wimp who is scared of everything). The only ride I did not do was the one that the bottom drops out, I got my heart rate raised just watching. It really is a park for all ages.
Amazing. We found it the best place ever to have fun with family including teens and small children. We loved the tour in the floater and the slides were scary just enough to be amazing. Loved it.

Atlantis a fabulous experience.. We had a fantastic time at this place, exstreamly friendly staff, butiful views of the ocean and Atlantis massive resort from our room balcony was sight we would,never forget. Even on a rainy day we had so much to do, one can practically walk miles inside atlantise itself shopping, dining and exploring without even noticing the day has gone by. Downtown is just a boat ride away and filled with tourists from cruise ships. We had issues getting our room door open, they took care of us while the issue of as being addressed and compensated with complimentary dolphin cove expire for the whole family, what a treat, my kids were super excited to play with dolphins.
very good. i went there first time with my family and enjoyed a lot.there are several rides which are very exciting and aquarium view was-awesome..But ticket is very expensive..

Fab way to cool down. This water park is huge! It is the perfect way to cool down in the heat. You can choose to laze around next to a pool or spend the day on the water slides. The lazy river is also a relaxing way to spend your time in a rubber ring - make sure you try the rapids!

Better than Yas and Wild Wadi!. I went to Wild Wadi last year in summer (~June 2014) on ladies night... Not great. Reasonable rides though. I went to Yas Waterworld in June 2015... There were four schools visiting on that day and the rides kept getting stuck!Aquaventure is beautiful to walk around and the open beach is a nice hang out area.With residency discount we got a pretty good price and despite being at a hotel the lines were miniscule and it was really fun! Loads of different rides, we didn't go on all of them but we went on at least 10. Some rides were short, others dropped into the lazy river were you could stir yourself into a loop to keep going up or to get in line for a similar ride.The shark attack ride goes through the aquarium and was really relaxing!You need to carry the floats around a lot though to take them on different rides. :)Overall, amazing experience. Spent 3 hours there and would have loved to have spent the whole day there! It does close early! 7pm in Ramadan, 6pm normally.

Must go. If I decide to visit Dubai again, it is just because of this amazing aquapark. I will miss it!!! The entrance fee was 250 derhams for each adult +40 for a locker +45 per meal. Games were absolutely fabulous .I loved every one of them. We used each of equipments at least 2 times. If you enjoy being in an aqua park , it is one of the bests. There were various facilities for children also. One of its best parts was that they rent go pro cameras in the entrance for 200 derhams and then give you all photos and videos free. In my opinion this one is better than the wildwadi if you need to choose. More beautiful and various. Have fun and don't forget your slippers. Stones are really hot
Nice. amazing place for family , no one visit dubai without seeing AV , its an icon on the palm , i love it

One of the places to enjoy in Dubai!. Very good rides and fantastic environment. The only bad thing about it is its parking. You need to park and be transferred via bus which wastes more than half an hour of yours.

fun loving water sports. good to enjoy if going with family especially kids they have separate shallow pool and small slides where kida can enjoy i went in the month of june and was in the water park in noon ....once ith water u forget the heat of the sun and start enjoying tower or of neptune is a must do river ride is fun anyone can enjoy all together worth going

Happy kids, and adults too!. We spent a good part of three days here and were still happy to stay longer. Children are 8 and 10. They did everything nearly all the slides and mum and dad did everything! You can take in 1 litre of water per person, much needed in the heat. Food and drink service is as normal in the Waterpark, even during Ramadan. The reusable cups cost 40 AED to buy but then only about £1.40 to refill and are good value if you are returning. The lazy river is not always quite so lazy! We all loved the Shamal ride!
Fun for all! . Great water park..... Lots to do with a beautiful beach area and view. I normally don't do the water rides but had so much fun enjoying the slides and Rapids! Great fun for all ages!
Thrill seeking water park. Loved it, lazy river and rapids are fab just remember to take flip flops everywhere with you as it's so hot.

Great fun in the balmy heat. We visited here a couple weeks ago and took advantage of all the great slides and rides on offer. There were enough sunbeds to go around, the queues weren't too bad and the restaurants were also reasonably priced. Tip: Ride the Leap of Faith, it's well worth it!

Good fun but long queues. A group of us went for the first time. We pre-booked but sadly even the queue for that was very long! Once we got inside we camped out on the beach as the rest of the park was packed. There was one ride which only allows groups of 2 so if you in an odd number some needs to sit out or go with a stranger. The food court have a good selection however the staff are not at all capable of working under pressure and parts of the order was missed and the service very slow.Back to the park the rides are very good but again I come back to the long queues and in particular the locals inability it stand in a queue without pushing in.

Amazing! . Absolutely fab, so much fun - the laughs and excitement is endless. Even if you go on the same ride repeatedly it just doesn't get boring! The rides with the tubes are great, really good fun and we loved the Shamalar ride which shoots you upwards and you drift straight into another flume without having to get out. One warning though- bring sea shoes or shoes to wear around the park as the floor gets so so so so hot it feels like it blisters your feet!! The best ride by far is the Shamalar or the ride that brings you out into the shark tank!! Amazing!!
worst. worst water park, staff dis-orientated, service very slow and miserable, staff should learn more about service with a smile

Very Amazing Place to enjoy the summer in Dubai. I have been there and it was really unforgettable experience , i like it too much , my wife spend good time with my kind in the kids area i played 2 games there and it was awesome , staff are very friendly and helpful and very positive.Thanks to all of you

Definitely great waterpark.. Waterpark is great. It is great to have the buggies to drive back and forth for Dolphin bay, the hotel, the waterpark. Staying in the Atlantis affords you some extras to. Discounts on activities and we were given water at multiple stations for free witho ut hotel bands. Very nice and worth a full day of fun.

waterpark to its fullest. My experience with Aquaventure was truely thrilling and adventurous. All the rides were so good and thrilling that I didn't want to go back to my room. The leap of Faith, Splurge,Tower of Neptune and Poseidon, Poseidon's revenge, water coasters etc were absolutely amazing. the best part of Aquaventure was the safety and the number of life guards present at each and every point. Too good an experience
a mesmerizing spot in Dubai. So much fun and frolics making you loose whole day without any tiredness. Best place for children's to relax also.

Beautiful and fun!. Since this was my first time in Dubai, this was so cool to experience. I mean. The waterslides, WOW! You can also just chill and relax by the water. Or maybe enjoy some food, or ice cream. I recommend this to everyone!!!
The best!. I really like this park, where you can spend the entire day enjoying the organization as well as the quality of service.

Expensive, great rides and fantastic beach. So its expensive - yes very expensive - It is part of the Atlantis hotel and if you stay there you can get free entrance if its part of the package - its very crowded at all times - you have to wait in lines for all the rides and slides - the waiting is longer by a factor of 30 times compared to how long the rides last - but hey isn't that the same everywhere. You have to of course go down the slide that has a very steep slope and after you open your eyes you see you are in the middle of this underground tube with all sorts of sharks swimming around you. However, make sure you want to get on this slide - it's not one of those that you decide to go there and you sit your position - and decide to not go - there is no way to climb out of the steep slide especially with water jets under you. So just release the bars and put your hands close to your chest, and hope for the best - at least when you hope here you may actually get what you want unlike the hope that was prettied to us by Obama - we got nothing there and so at least this one you will arrive safely and can say you swam with the sharks. There are probably discounts available but I paid full price and tried to find shade when I was not not he rides - the kids had a fantastic time and went a number of times down THAT slide.

Totally worth spending a day if in Dubai for long period. The Atlantis water park is so much fun and totally worth the money. It is located at the tip of the Palm Island. We got to spend the whole day here. The food and drinks are toooooooooooo overpriced so make sure to grab a hearty breakfast early in the morning before going so you don't spend money on lunch there. You are allowed water so we brought 2 huge bottles. We paid for the locker and threw all our stuff in there. The rides were very fun. We went on a Friday and we were warned it would be especially packed. The morning we got lucky and not so packed. But after about 3 hours, it was full of annoying kids that ruined the fun a bit. So we're happy we got all the main rides we wanted to do in before they all attacked. Make sure to pack sunscreen. You don't feel the burn because you're in the water but you definitely get red! Make sure to reapply.They have free carts that take you to different areas of the park. There's also a beach for those that want to but you don't spend the money to sit on the beach, so don't bother.

Aquaventure. The rides were nice but eventually got me bored. It was exciting only on the first try but the succeeding tries were not as much as exciting as the first. The park itself is kinda small and there wasn't much rides as I have expected. I finished all the rides in less than 3 hours queing included. I think it's kinda pricey for that amount of rides.
Too big for me!!!!. A big waterpark with lots to do, loved the lazy river and the Rapids, loads of places to settle by the water.Dislikes none really just too big for me to get round

Must visit- should not miss. We visited the aquaventure in April 2015. My husband and I celebrated our first wedding anniversary in Aquaventure and I simply love it. We even missed our lunch because of the fun.I will highly recommend booking online before going there since you will pay less online and you will also avoid a long queue

Great but too spread out!. I have not been to Aquaventure before as previously when I visited Dubai we went to Wild Wadi. I thought there were loads of rides but it was just too spread out when it didn't necessarily need to be! The lifeguards were all very friendly and staff nice! Another issue is that when you come into the water park you get your locker but then have to walk quite a way to collect your towel, which is annoying when we wanted to keep our towel in our locker! Also the current on the lazy river was not strong enough, so one of us would have to get out and push us along in the rings!

Amazing. The best water park I have ever been to by far.
Can even swim with dolphins here.
We went as a family of 5, ages ranging from 16 to 45, everyone had a great time and enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere with crazy and modern watersides and rides.

Best all around wet experience. Every attraction/slide becomes perfect because the climate is hot and the water is at the perfect temperature ,do take or buy wet socks the pathways are very hot in the summer and flip flops are alright but not as convenient as socks to come down the water slides .Unmissable's: leap of faith and revenge of Poseidon (this last one as nerving countdown and can be done in simultaneously for best fun, the floor drops you vertically and you have to breath in to start) and if in group try the round buoy for 6.Make sure to try both pyramids and enjoy all the options on the lazy river.Book on line for the best deals specially the all day pass with lunch included( my best deal)

Hot on the feet, lots of dark rides, some double inflatables have a child seat..... Take your thongs/flip flops/jangles with you. The paths get extremely hot. You see grown men wincing in pain as they sprint from shade to shade. There are no water path sprinklers. A lot of the rides are in the dark for longer than a few seconds. You have to be 120 cm or above to ride most of them. Try and get a double inflatable with a child's seat - the hole in the front filled in for a smaller child (if that applies)! The lazy rivers are good. there's one with waves and one with quite turbulent Rapids, best take smaller children in a double inflatable. The child's waterpark area is Huge and excellent.Food and drinks are obviously expensive but if you're a guest at Atlantis they can be charged to your room. Hotel guests get complimentary use of the waterpark each day of their stay and can get free rides in a buggy to and from the hotel/attraction. Bathroom facilities are plentiful and clean. Animal interactions are offered.
Great adventure. Loved everything about the stay. The rides, the food, the ambience. Great staff. We spent a birthday weekend, and everybody celebrated with us. That was awesome!

Did not enjoy water - winter time, but felt good. We choosed wrong time, could not enjoy water, due to weather, Pros: Nice location, rides, nice aquariums, quite clean, feels good to be there.Cons: You will be tired till you reach there (long walk needed to reach entrance), very expensive food, not friendly staff (We are Indian family), long queue for regular taxi (thanks to Uber/Lexus, which we took for extra cost)

Amazing. great water park, got free entry after swimming with dolphins and spent all day here, very clean,not to busy lots of places for drinks and food, would pay just to go in not great for younger children lots of the slides you had to be over certain height so restricted on what we could use but a great day

Water Fun. Great Fun as always, plenty of different rides to appeal to thrill seekers, family members of all ages or just sun loungers. Food and Beverage outlets plentiful, prices in line with 5* Hotel rates. good value was the combo package that includes access to the water park, Lost chambers and a meal. In terms of safety, plenty of trained life guards on duty, friendly and helpful staff.
In top 3. Nice and clean water park in heart of Dubai. Plenty of diverse actions for a full day of action packed fun with family. Plenty of activities for smaller kids as well.

Amazing. Best water park I've been to!! Dolphins are a bit pricey !! £175 each that includes entry to park and a meal! Take a waterproof case (they sell them there) as you can get some good videos and photos !
Fun time. Something different from rest of our holiday in Dubai.Also the only thing where the heat does not matter much.

Fun! Fun! Fun!. Our whole family spent the day at Aquaventure Waterpark and all enjoyed it tremendously. The park was clean and well staffed with friendly, helpful people. My kids felt our experience there was a high point of our trip to Dubai. My even son lost his camera there and one of the staff members, even though it was closing time, helped us search for the camera at several different locations then ultimately helped us file a claim at lost and found. Amazingly, enough, the camera was found, turned in, and shipped to us. Super customer service.

Fun, but could be more fun!. Our trip to the waterpark was excellent, and it made the extremely hot day bearable. The rides are great but a little outdated. The water is clean and is a great temperature, the staff are great as well, and are really helpful, especially when you get lost in the huge park. Overall the trip was great, but if you're looking for more of a thrill I'd suggest Wild Wadi Water park, which is also quite close to the palm!

Must do. This is located at the end at one of the palms. It was definitely worth going to the aqua park, fun - but maybe more for kids than to adults by themselves. But we had a lot of fun, and also bought the tickets to see the hotel's aquarium.

Good day out! . The water park itself is very well thought out with the lazy river taking you to a few rides. It wasn't too busy as I imagine it's off season so we waited less than 5 mins for all of the rides.The floor is very hot so make sure you have something appropriate on your feet to walk from attraction to attraction. We paid the 300 for the summer experience which included the lost chambers and a meal deal. This was a rare chance for us to enjoy food during the day as it Ramadan. There were a lot of lifeguards around so you felt safe wherever. You pay an extra 30 for the towel and or 50 for the towel/ locker combo. So if you wanna save yourself a little bit of money, bring a towel and maybe a bag with some water etc inside. Overall good day!

Nice Adventure.... This is a good water park, well distributed areas that avoid congestion, nice rides and very clean. Its a place that gets crowded but since the place its so big, you can really tell. The rides are very nice, entertaining but the access to some of them its a little confusing. Still, you will probably ride more than once every ride and still have plenty of time to enjoy peacefully the pools or the beach that is in the back. The price its not the cheapest, with a 250 Dhs day pass (around 70 USD) plus all the things that you either have to buy or rent inside (towel, locker, etc). Still, its a nice place to hang out if you want to relax for day and a specially good one for families since you can rely on leaving your kids wonder around.

What an amazing place!. The Aquaventure Waterpark is just a few minute's walk from the shops of Atlantis but seems a world away - a haven of fast-flowing rivers, heart-stropping flumes and plenty of sun loungers. The park is navigated by path or lazy river - the park's lazy river stretches for several kilometres and provides an easy and refreshing way to get to the slides. There are even conveyor belts to save you from climbing stairs to the slides!And the slides are amazing - fund and thrilling in equal measure. There are countless water coasers which shoot you backwards or forwards dwn and up hills before ending at the lazy river again plus there are several larger slides including the classic Leap of Faith which drop 9 storeys down the front of the slide pyramid and through a shark tank (safely inside a tube of course!).There are also shuttle cars which take you between the slides as they are a bit of a way apart, making it easy to get around and stay cool.Make sure you visit - it's an amazing place.

WATERific Escapade!!!. If you crave for some thrill and adventure... This waterpark is for you...seriously...every rides are very worth it. Tried all the rides..and it was really really awesome. I would love to go back there..:) Cheers!

Best fun-EVER!!. It is the most functional water park I have ever encountered. Extremely clean with beautiful clear water and surprisingly cool considering how hot it was. Despite being in our 50's we spent 5 hours there & loved every minute. We went on all the slides (I chickened out on 2!!). The staff were very friendly and helpful in guiding you around the enormous park when you're unsure what to do next. If you have kids of any age it is a must. If your flying solo because the kids are all grown up I suggest it's even more fun!!
Brilliant. Value for moneyReally clean fun ridesSpace to chill outThe rapids and lazy river are so relaxing Free lunch is a real bonus

Disappointed. I expected many things to be better than what we really experienced and given the expensive ticket price.Pros: Nice rides over a wide space.Cons: 1)You can only park the car at a parking that is far from the park and take a shuttle bus. After a long day and in very hot weather (Dubai in June) we had to wait for about half an hour in the hot weather until the shuttle bus came. It is not acceptable that with such expensive ticket and in a modern city like Dubai, there is no control on such buses. We waited for half hour and we did not know if there is a bus coming or not. There is no sign and no one to ask, kids were tired and complaining and lots of people waiting until the bus came at 7:30 pm without a word of apology.2) There is no transparency or standardization in the tickets prices. In the same tickets queue you can find people who paid 250 Dirhams online, others paid 185 Dirhams online, others paid 185 Dirhams and got free meal vouchers. The park website is very unclear about this even if you are a resident of the UAE. In the ticket booth you feel frustrated when you come to know all this illogical range.3) The food is terrible and very expensive in Barracuda cafeteria and you wait for a very long time until a simple order is ready.I believe the park management needs to do some effort to address all the above issues and other similar issues.

A Great Day Out. We did the dolphin experience and then onto a day in the park.Great fun and great memories of enjoying time with the amazing dolphins.Well worth every penny.My daughter loved it ... and so did I.We were one of the last parties out of the park - I'd still be there now if I could afford it.As it was February, there were no queues all day.The variety and quality of things to do can't be faulted.The food doesn't quite get the same rating, but who cares really when you're having fun?Food is just fuel for more fun.We took a taxi from Jumeirah Beach and believe it to be the best option - not too expensive and quick. To get one home we just walked out to the road and negotiated with the drivers as they stopped to offer their service.Hope we go back some day.

good break for a day.. Nice break on a hot day, i stopped at dubai for a while and going to the water park is best way to get over jetlag. I have been to Atlantis in bahamas, so i went for just the water park. Nothing fancy, but can spend about a day. There is a access to beach from the auqa park, the beach is quite average. Good fun for kids. The parking is pretty expensive at the park, so i would park at the skyway station and take the train. The station parking is very tricky to locate/take exit from the highway.

Maybe worth it afterall. Its a lil expensive for it has to offer and only two thrill rides that are barely for few seconds. But, since sun bathing or swimming in bikinis isn't still 100% okay in public beaches of Dubai (although you can find people on the beaches doing the same), this is the best place to go to if you wish to do the same. In short, you are paying the fees to get access to a private clean beach with a small park with rides beside.

The best water park in UAE. One of the best Day out activity in Dubai. Very good rides, environments. Lot of rides for kids as well. Tickets are expensive but worth. I have also visited outdoor water parks in Bahrain and Qatar but this one is the best.

Great day out! Lots of fun!. After swimming with Dolphins at Dolphin Bay we were allowed free access to the Aquaventure Waterpark. There were lots of rides and virtually no queues to go on them. The water was warm and refreshing, and definitely recommend the rides that are two person rings.It is extremely hot on the floor so come prepared with flip-flops or watershoes that you are allow to take on the rides with you. We originally tried to walk around barefoot and kept burning out feet.Lockers are 14 dirhams which you don't get the money back unfortunately, and towels also need to be rented however we bought our own.Excellent day out and suitable for all ages!

Spectacular fun for all ages!. Highlight of my visit to Dubai - great fun for 4 hours, splashing through the rapids (and tearing my swim shorts in the process!) and whooshing down the 6-storey pyramid slide. Expensive, so get a discount voucher from your hotel concierge, which gives a discount for entry after 3 pm.
Great waterpark. A great water theme park that caters for children and adults, there are some very interesting rides that are more suitable for adults and many fun children activities.

it is in dubai mall. dubai mall,subai fountain,n burj khalifa r at 1 place n this place also u can see from outside only if u likr diving in sea then u can spent money otherwise it is good from outside once u havee to see

Nice place. It is situated along with Atlantis hotel. Again, kids will have a lot of fun here. The difference between wild wadi and Aquaventure are dolphin interactions which we don't find at wild wadi and also a few rides.Also the aquarium is good at Aquaventure.

Best water park in the UAE. Having been to them all, Aquaventure is definitely the best of them. It has the most rides and more importantly the best rides. The park is large and I recommend pre booking and getting there early before the masses arrive. You will be in long lines as the day goes on but they are bearable and worth the wait

Awesome. Expensive but well worth the experience. Great rides and a great day out. The Leap of Faith is the one....even my 8 yr old daughter took the plunge.
Can hire towels lockers and get a meal depending what type of ticket you purchase. But happy fun memories. Would definitely put in the to do list if visiting Dubai.
Awesome!. Unreal waterpark especially for guests of the Atlantis. They drive you right from the hotel to the slides. Well worth a trip!

Bday visit. Decided to use bday offer for dad's bday. Had onlune voucher, yet was not easy to convience cashier that "going green" is important. Was little to burocratic. Ones inside was normal experience, food offers gets better and pleasant surprise was that you can bring your own water. water pruces are far to high. 13aed for half a littre bottle? Far to much. Overall was ok.

LEAP OF FAITH. Awesome fun with the family. I am a sceptic as far as rides are concerned, but a first visit to a water park changed all that. Took the leap of faith literally!! Awesome. A great day spent

One of the most amazing school day trips. I don't usually review about a school trip but I can't go on about how great this experience was for out students and the teachers thanks to all the staff and timing of the year. Get there just before the water park opens at 9:45am. We were helped by the fact it was Ramadan so many people are not up and about so early but there were no queues - at all. The staff were so relaxed and attentive (they were driving around in buggy carts and offering lifts to people or at least giving thorough directions to areas around the park) and of course the rides are, in my opinion, the best water park rides in UAE. As far as the heat is concerned, this was not an issue as the water is cool and there is plenty of shade and refreshments within the park. Wear sunblock of course and flip flops (the ground gets really hot). I would never have thought it would be such a pleasant experience.

Awesome Place.. Amazingly Awesome place. wow rides. absolutely must. such beautiful place. such beautiful views. u need a full day to enjoi each n every rides. very good lockers and Showers services. Definitely a must for everyone. kids adults... its a place for all.

Fantastic day out!. We visited Aquaventure today, arriving at approx 11am. We paid 40AED to rent the locker for the day, which is a bit pricey but worth it as we both took our phones. The park itself is amazing, with fantastic views of the palm and burj al arab at the top of most rides. My favourite part of the rides is a lot of them take you out into the lazy river for a nice float around before opting to go on another ride. I really enjoyed the leap of faith also, very daunting at first seeing the drop for the first time but the rides over within a few seconds so worth doing a few times. We got round all of the slides doing most more than 5 times due to only a few people waiting for the rides, if any! I have read in other reviews weekends tend to be busier so i would highly recommend visiting during the week. There are loads of photo took through out the trip so, which you can few at the end, although we paid 85AED for a photo, there are different packages available if wanting to purchase more than one. HUGE tip, ground is unbareable to walk on so take a cheap bare of flip flops and you can actually put them over your hands on every ride! Over all a really really good day out and i really enjoyed myself.

Great fun....depending on your age. I went to Aquaventure with my wife and 3 year old daughter. As she was under 1.2m there was very little she could do - basically the splash area and one lazy river ride (which she found not so lazy and therefore didnt enjoy it). The park itself is massive and has plenty of rides and would be an excellent day out for kids who are older and independent enough. Personally for her age/height group I would not recommend it as its not good value for money and is a physical strain unless they can walk the entire park on their own in 40 degree heat. The day started badly with the terminals going down and us having to stand around in the heat for almost 45 min until it was sorted. Eventually I had to make my way to the restaurant to get a towel/locker rental which is a good 10 min hike away from the changing rooms, and then back. No compensation was offered.The park itself has good rides and is very safe with life guards everywhere. Food and drink is expensive inside. Beware if you buy the entrance ticket with meal deal you are very restricted in terms of menu options. The food itself was quite good at Barracuda which one of the main eating places. One recommendation would be to have aqua shoes as you cannot walk around the park bare feet due to the heat. Flip flops are not suitable for rides and not allowed on some. Also avoid weekends - fri/sat due to crowds. Another good tip is to buy a waterproof case for your phone to take pictures. Atlantis do sell them but for almost £25 for a piece of plastic or £40 for a digital camera for the day. Can get one on ebay for about £5.

Good Fun. The water park is very well placed within Atlantis. We stayed at the hotel, so entry to water park was included in the package. The buggy service to and from park was very very convenient. There was no line ups for the buggy as there were running almost every 2 minutes. Water park nice and clean. Some of the rides were very enjoyable.Food, drinks and souvenirs were expensive, however that's the case with all the theme parks or water parks. Allow yourself atleast half a day if you reach here early in the morning when park opens.

Fantastic. What a great day out, lots of rubber rings floating around and was not overly busy. Very safety conscious, so many life guards dotted around the water park as you go around on the rubber rings. Quit a few nice eating places lots of sun beds, lots empty, only down side was not enough umbrellas for shade only a few dotted around, great water slides, just sit in the rubber rings and go round and round the large water park, just remember where you left your towels, you can pay for a locker but they are quite expensive and most people were leaving bags next to or on their sunbeds. Definitely a place to put on the bucket list.

Loved it!!!. We went in here as part of our Dolphin bay experience. I absolutely loved this water park despite a slide and a very small area of the lazy river been shut all day during our visit. This didn't matter though as there are so many slides and attractions.I loved the lazy river feeding into most of the slides with a conveyor belt system taking you up to the chosen slide in your ring without even getting out of your ring. I went round the lazy river most of the day. It is the biggest, longest lazy river I have ever been on.The pitch black slide that suddenly goes bright and you are inside the shark pool in a clear, Perspex tunnel was amazing but our favourite was the 2 slides with the round boats that drop down and then fly up the sides (can't remember it's name but if you go there you will know which one I mean as you go past it when you first go into the park).For a quieter chill for parents who are not keen on riding the slides, you have access onto their lovely sandy beach or free use of loads of sunbeds scattered around the park or you can wander round the souvenir shops in the main hotel building or visit the aquarium (extra cost).I can honestly say that this is definately the best waterpark I have visited so far (and we have visited All the mainstream water parks in Orlando). Good work Atlantis

Great water park. We stayed in Atlantis and the water park is connected with Hotel.Great experience, we enjoyed mostly water rides. all are very good.park is very big, if you want to enjoy all the park you have 2 spend 2 days for that.

Day at the park with friends and family. Excellent day had by all, we hired a cabana for 8 of us that cost a thousand dirhams. Well worth it a bit of luxury, we all said that the day went really quick and wished the park was open longer as we hadn't done very much, the park being so big.
Very fun, safe and big waterpark!. Lots of water fun! relaxed atmosphere. Plenty of rides for children and adults. Lots and excellent professional staff

Well worth a visit. Located in the beautiful Atlantis hotel, I loved spending my full day at this water park with my wife. And to choose one of the water rides I would say the leap of faith , the adrenaline rush you feel in this ride is surreal. Well worth a visit just for this ride alone

Awesome for Adults. Great rides, generally quite hard core - even the lazy river has rapids!, so not suitable for very young children or anyone who does not want to bounced around.The hard core rides really very good and inventive.Top day out. Top tip 1: Go early for when the park opens and ideally avoid the weekend, for 2 hours of no queues.Top Tip: Wild Wadi is better if you've got young kids or want a less exhiliarating experience.

Great fun whole day. Massive!Very busy and crowded.Must bring flip flops as floor is hot!Lots of rides and attractionsVery easy to navigate!Safety is good with lots of life guardsPrice is good for tickets Can buy food in foodCourt decent prices

Fantastic day. Wouldn't like to stay in the hotel but a visit to the watermark is a definite. We visited in June and it was very hot (43') flip flops are a must to get around. Rides are fun and you can spend a full day at the water park

Not for the thrill seakers. If you are after heart thumping, blood rushing, thrill seeker rides you maybe disappointed. The rides are mild and everyone can give every ride a go. There is a large section of the park for relaxing and floating along. We did not have to wait in any lines and were able to complete every ride at the park within a few hours. We got a summer combo entry which gave us entry to the water park, aquarium and lunch at selected food outlets this was good value for money. When you are at the park take your shoes everywhere with you! The concrete gets very very hot and is almost impossible to walk on. If you have reef shoes bring them!
LOVE THE LAZY RIVER!. Love the lazy river! One of the best I've ever been to! Not those boring sorts, as these one can be fast and slow and has different things to look out for!
Breath taking. The best in the world. The highest fall at the leap of faith is breathtaking. All other sports are well kept with life guards at every location.
Absolutely awesome!!!. We had a day at the water park just relaxing and enjoying the water rides. The friendly and efficient staff delivered not only excellent food but a great service.

Aquaventure for inexperienced swimmers. I have visited Aquaventure during my stay in dubai. It was really a great day! I am inexperienced swimmer so I was a bit apprehensive but for those who worry- most rides are fine :) you can find info about each ride and skills you need there. My only warning would be 'the torrent' part of lazy river... Drunk quite a bit of water there when wave took me high up and then down under water ... Life guards there but non actually helped. survived... Overall, great fun.

Great Day Out. Had a great day out! Fantastic rides. Family friendly. Queue's weren't as long as I expected. (maybe 10/15 minutes wait) Staff were all nice and helpful. Its around £50 a person but rides are excellent and its an extremely fun day for everyone! Highly recommended!

So much fun. Decided to do this last minute with my partner. I am 29 and he is 31 - we are big kids at heart and love waterslides and adventure activities. We caught a taxi from JBR to the park. Arrived around 10am, just before the crowds arrived. We brought our own towels and hired a locker for our bag. The lines weren't long, but it took an unnecessarily long time for the ticketing officers to actually issue tickets and passes. We waited about 30 minutes and there was only 3 people in front of us. Once we had paid, we dropped our bag off at the locker and walked towards where the fun begins. First up, we did the Tower of Neptune. Ended up launching ourselves down there 3 times in total. We went on every single waterslide possible that day. Food was quite expensive, but we had eaten breakfast before we left and had a late lunch once we had finished. We bought a couple of bottles of water inside the park, which were priced pretty average, but what you would expect from a waterpark attracion like most around the world.We left our towels and shoes on the beach chairs at the bottom of the rides, and they were safe. Of course, if you are carrying a bag or valuables, common sense prevails and you wouldn't leave it lying around unattended. The river ride around the park was pretty boring for us, but we were after high thrill seeking fun. We had researched which park was better to visit - Wild Wadi or Aquadventure - based on reviews obviously this had one. It was a great day and by midday it became extremely hot. If you were there with young kids, get there early and you can get an umbrella with chairs near the wading pool for the shade - or they might tire out by the time the heat arrives. We were in the park for a total of 2.5hours and were able to do all the rides and half of the pool ring ride. We didn't feel the need to spend any more time there than what we did. It was just long enough and the park not to busy.
Fun in Sun!!. a great place for everyone. escape the scorching heat of middle east with all day water sports and adventure. try to reach as soon as the gate open to enjoy every ride.

Great place with areas of improvement. Amazing Waterpark! June on a weekday would seem like the best time to go as there are no queues or if there was it would be max. 10 minutes. I do have to point out some areas that could improvement:1. Resort knowledge and information -Aquaventure is massive and quite overwhelming. It could've been very useful if we were given maps or even a bit of an orientation on what to do and to see2. Service-although we were generally met with very nice and accommodating staff. There were just some that came across as unhelpful. But with this in mind, there were still members of the team who stood out and offered great service. Thank you to the Shark Safari Team, Ahmed who sold us to idea (haha) and Melody who helped us with a go pro and Richard who found my slippers. Overall, it's a great park with crazy activities fit for families and groups of friends

A great day for childish adults. Me and a group of friends recently went to Aquaventure - we went in June (very hot) but were surprised at how well we were catered for. The only issue is the floor was soooo hot. The park was so quite that we barley queued for rides and there was an abundance of tubes. There were plenty of lifeguards and everything felt very safe. Lots of places to get food and drinks - even though it is Ramadan. We had a great day pretending we were children again. Expensive if you pay full price - would recommend using entertainer vouchers as it is then buy one get one free.

Amazing water park. This place is great for the family. Try go in the morning before lines gets long, and do the popular rides before the rides come. Access was complimentary as we stayed at the hotel, and was impressed by the staff service and cleanliness of the whole park. Highly recommend.

Great experience. If you are not sure if this is worth the visit, stop thinking and go!... it is a fun place for kids and adults!!! We arrived around 10:30am which was very convenient because we enjoyed most of the rides with NO LINE AT ALL!! it was a matter of walking from one to the next - in about 1 hour we had covered most of the rides, so we decided enjoyed the rapids. There were enough activities to keep us entertained until 4 p.m. I recommend applying a good sunblock and also wearing a baseball cap if you are worried about getting too much sun in your face- i was allowed to do that as long as i kept it secured while in the rides.Also, the lockers are 40 Dhs for the entire day, but you can access them any time (as for re applying sun block or getting some money)I loved this place and would definitely go back
Fast ride. To be honest I thought I will go to all attractions. As I saw the most dangerous I reconsidered my choice :D
Best place to go in Dubai. Great place to play, not for quiet relaxation. At peak season much overcrowded, long queue to buy tickets, nowewhere to sit...
Wonderful place for all water-adventure lovers. Unique and attractive place for all water-adventure lovers. You can spent whole day there and not be bored
BRILLIANT!!. Everything was brilliant. The slides, the childrens areas, very well organised, it was brilliant, an absolute must in Dubai.

Very disappointing. After going to wild wadi, this place was very disappointing. It was quality built and very clean but wild wadi would knock spots off it. At £50 entry, it was not value for money and we only stayed for two hours as there weren't many rides. We stayed at wild wadi all day and didn't want to leave. Wouldn't go back again.
Water theme park. Nice place to laze around and get sun tanned!! Good for kids to enjoy and you can spend the whole day.
Expected a little more. It was a fun experience, but i expected more rides. very limited but one of the rides was relaxing and fun.
Atlantis Waterpark. Brilliant fun! You can leave your valuables (within reason) - phone, cash, sunglasses, clothes on a sunbed under a towel with confidenc. Be prepared for very hot ground.....

Amazing! Definitely recommend!. I would definitely recommend going! We went in June and I didn't find it too expensive. I agree with other reviews that food is quite expensive but you can take your own food. I would recommend bringing flip flops or those shoes you can wear in water because the floor was super hot! We hardly found any queues and had to wait no longer than 10 minutes for the rides. Staff was super friendly and funny! I really enjoyed it!

A Day Well Spent. Aquaventure Waterpark is a must go place if you are visiting Dubai and a fan of beach and water sport. There was a long Que at the ticketing counters but fortunately we booked our trip online and got in quickly. The place is packed usually and you have to wait on popular slides but its all worth it. The beach is very nice and relaxing with free sunbeds. Try and get in early to enjoy the whole day and experience all the slides. Don't forget to take sun screen otherwise you will come back with a sun burn for sure. Also, take aqua socks to avoid burning your feet from the ground. Take water bottles with you as they are insanely expensive inside the park (something which bothered me a lot).
Dirty. A dirty horrible place. The water is filthy and I am sure if you have any cuts or you swallow any water you will become sick.

Cool Yourself. It was very awesome. It has clean changing rooms and they provided clean complimentary towels. One full day is less tyo see all water slides of the park Its very big. My kids went to Children pool and did not wanted to come out of it
fabulous. The best water park we've been too , simply fabulous place too spend a wonderful day out , i cant rate it highly enough

Excellent waterpark. Excellent waterpark,leap of faith was my favourite attraction. Splash area for kids is so good that my son did not want to go out, only the downside was that someone nicked my slippers hehe. Floor is getting extremely hot so make sure you have some footwear.
Very Nice visit for a family. it was very nice and better than the lost chambers aquarium, a family experience and good value for money. Visting only one aquiarium is enough in dubai
"Awsome experience ". It was really awsome experience., had lots of fun, specially Posoindons revenge. And Leaf of faith...

Great day out !. A great day out with fun filled rides and activities for all. Though it's a place which specially the kids will love and have a blast. It takes around 3 hrs or so to cover all the park/rides. Summers weather is harsh but water n rides will make up for it!

biggest water park ... Memorable Experience. great experience and value for money .
largest waterpark in the region
must visit place if you are coming with the family

Great if your staying at Atlantis. As far as waterparks goes it's quite average. The slides are good and the lazy river with sections of rapids were good but there really wasn't much else. But since we were guests at Atlantis it was worth going for an hour or two each morning during our stay. I wouldn't recommend it as a day long stay.

Brilliant day!!!. Amazing day at the water park. We got there for 10am on a weekday to avoid ques :) small locker was 40dh which was quite big. It fit my beach bag plus two handbags squeezed in. Remember to take flip flops as the floor is boiling hot!! Lifeguards are everywhere so very safe!! Lots of sunbeds available in the park plus many more on the beach as you get access to the beach also. We were there til about 7pm as we looked around the aquarium as well. Overall a brilliant day :)

So much fun!. Best rides i've ever experienced in a water park! Make sure you avoid busy days like weekends or holidays so you can enjoy the park to the maximum! Enjoy your visit :) Added excitement, visit the amazing dolphin bay as well!

Best Waterpark in Dubai.. This is the best water park in Dubai. Your kids will love it. Loads of things to do, many rides that are suitable for kids and lots of activities. I would recommend not going on a weekend as its crazy busy and it ruins the overall experience. Just go on a weekday.

Great for kids and family. Pretty awesome. Quite large and done up very well. Staying at Atlantis, you get a free pass to the park and the kids just love the slides, and splash area. The beach is very good with the tunnels taking you around the park. Quite sunny in June - and we all ended up pretty dark after the day at the park. Has good food options and clean toilets to change, etc. The towels, etc are available easily. Very clean, well staffed and well maintained. Good safety measures for kid areas.

Great day out. Arrived about 10.30 and there wasn't any queues. Make sure you look for the special offers, the re-refillable cup was good value, with refills costing half normal price. Ensure you take water shoes as the floor is boiling hot, there were loads of people bare foot having to run to shaded spots to stop their feet from being burnt. The zip lines are very tame and not worth the money. The new rides are excellent and only enhance the entire experience. Well worth a visit.

Great place for a day of fun!. Really enjoyed the waterpark with all the rides and things to do. It was very busy, yet there was no lines we needed to wait hours in for a single ride, which was amazing! The places to eat offered great food in the park, for fast easy to eat food. For what you pay all is great however, the only thing I would say was really a let down was the fact that there is no water points in the park to stay hydrated with the heat. With this said the only thing that was really over priced was the water they sold... So on a note for tips, make sure you take enough money to by water as you do tend to spend a lot of time in the sun and you will have tons of fun!

Excellent rides. Loads of excellent rides to keep you busy or just float around all day in the lazy river.Try to avoid weekends (Friday/Saturday) as can get quite busy however didn't have to queue long for rides

Great Day Out - but plan ahead!. We had our two young children ages 2 and 4, so we knew neither would be going on the rides, and we planned our day to spend it in the Splashers area and on the Rapids/ Lazy River.You can take 1 litre of water per person into the park - that's it - but if you can carry it - it's worth it as prices are pretty expensive! Food is expensive too - but if you eat a big breakfast, and try and eat light for lunch (we shared 2 'meals' between the 4 of us), you can save some money.If you are on the Rapids with little ones, try and get one of the double inflatables with the child seat, it's safer and more comfortable for everyone!The ground is incredibly hot - like almost blister your feet - so be careful with little ones. We tried to walk around without, but ended up getting our flip flops from the lockers! The lockers aren't too bad value - so definitely get one.The best value item we found was the hire of a GoPro Hero! They were renting them out from the entry. Get there early as they do book out, but it cost about $100 to hire for the day, and you get to keep the 16GB chip. They will replace your batteries at any time during the day. When you think of the cost of photos to buy from the official photographers - this works out to be great value and we ended up with about 500 photos and an hours worth of video footage, including underwater - amazing memories to have! So pleased we did this!Is it a cheap day out? No! But with some planning, you can save some money and have a great day (and have the memories to keep)!

Wonderful Water Park - Not wonderful prices. Water parks are often filled with endless queues and chaos - Aquadventure is completely different! The longest queue we had was buying the tickets before hand which took no more than 5 minutes.The rides were well located and the water park offered areas for those who wanted to just sunbathe and relax, the hotel provides buggys to travel to the other "towers" to access rides which are slightly further away.I have never seen so many lifeguards on duty! It was fantastic to see that safety was key. The rides were great for all ages! The only downside I would have is the prices of drinks - the day we went it was 43 degrees and the temperature is just unbearable. Your bags are searched when you enter the water park and it can be very costly for the whole day to just ensure that you are hydrated enough!!

Underwhelmed. It was clean, spacious, not too busy. It was just, well, a little boring. The rides were really very very tame, and having not visited a water park for some years, I really did come away a bit disappointed.

Awesome!. It was awesome! I was pregnant, but my husband loved all the rides! I would suggest going in October through March...the sun in the summer was wicked hot. 111 degrees plus humidity was not a good mix...but so much to do and see! it was amazing!

So much fun and so safe. Visited everyday as part of the free admission from Atlantis - with my work yer old son and his grandparents and we all had a great time very day - whether he lazing around on the various tube rides or go for some more adventure - good fun for all

Best day of the week. Went from being 20 to 10 years old during this day trip. Was definitely the best part of my holiday. The Neptune slides are absolutely amazing, with a variety of different drop heights; starting from small drops sliding through giant fish tanks full of sting rays and small sharks to high drops which questioned whether I had the guts to go down them - until I saw young children just throwing themselves down the slides I knew I had to man up. The food on site isn't too bad either - fast food but wasn't as bad as we had expected. Also managed to get some good photo opportunities from the beach.

Fun!. We stayed at Atlantis so had free entry to the waterpark for a few days and it was really good fun. Even though it was quite busy it still had a relaxing vibe about it and the queues were fairly short - we managed to do every ride several times over each day. The leap of faith is an absolute must, as is Slitherine, Zoomerango and Aquaconda.Lots of places to eat arund the park including Starbucks, various ice cream/yoghurt outlets, burgers, snacks, etc.The only downside are the locker placements; there's only one location and it's at the far end of the park so retrieving your wallet/phone/valuables etc. multiple times a day can be cumbersome. If you're staying at Atlantis you can use your wristband to charge food and drink to your room but otherwise I'd suggest getting a waterproof lanyard for your money/phone etc. to avoid using the (chargeable 8UAD) lockers.Fun place!

Kid Heaven...literally!. There are several water parks in the Dubai area and if your looking for the kids to have a great time, this is a good one. Not too many crazy rides but a good number to choose from for the kids. It gets crowded really quickly so plan accordingly. This is a magnificent location at the palms and very well maintained

Great for kids 8+ but limited rides for children under 120cm. We took our 4 year old and 7 year old to the park several times during our stay at Atlantis, The Palm. Given that it was included in our hotel package, it was excellent value. I probably would have felt differently if I had to pay separately. It gets very busy from noon onwards, so head out as early as you can. Make sure you are at the park before 10am so you can get it and try the rides on the Tower of Neptune first (these have the longest lines later on). Then move to the Tower of Poseidon next and complete those rides.I personally didn't like the Leap of Faith because the water blasted my eyes all the way down so I couldn't open them. The Shark Attack was cool but very slow at the end and the sun is beating down making it your own personal sauna-slide. Therefore, do this slide as early as possible!If you have a child who is less than 120cm, grab a double tube with a kid's seat and ride around the rapids. Then sit in front of the Splash area whilst they entertain themselves for an hour or two. My husband and I took it in turns to ride the slides with our 7 year old and then sit and watch our 4 year old. Therefore, make sure you prepare your under-120cm child for not having all the options the older children have.The food is crazy expensive. A combo is about AED50-65. The best value drink is the AED40 refillable cup with AED8 refills. I brought one of these and then shared it with the kids. Sure we went through each drink quickly, but I could refill it when finished with a different option. Also, only about 3 or 4 kiosks offer refills, so don't stand in line for ages only to find out you can't get it refilled (I did this once). Ask when you first purchase where you can refill so you don't waste your time.Towels are offered at the towel cabanas. You can purchase bathers and goggles if you forgot, but the mark-up is high (AED119 for goggles, for example). There are free vests available from the some of the towel cabanas for the young ones. Remember the sunscreen and hats! However, these can also be purchased, should you forget (again, at a high cost).If it is all getting a little hot, you can seek solice in the air conditioned toilets. They are dark and cool.If you are part of the hotel, the park opens at 9:45am. Otherwise, it is 10am for those visiting for the day. It is a good day out but I am so happy I had it as part of my hotel stay so I could visit several times for only a few hours each. This made it a fun outing without having to feel the pressure of fitting it all in at once. Monday to Wednesday appears to be quieter if not during school holidays.

Great fun !. Had a great time. It is very hot now , but still fully enjoyed it :) thank you Atlantis for my free entry for my birthday ! For all you can get it online and is valid for seven days from day of your birth . Do agree with other reviewers that it is expensive , if you pay full price AED 250, then to use small locker AED 40, small bottle of water cost you AED 13. Remember to take with you flip flops as is too hot to walk bare foot .

Friends day out. We were excited to try the new rides in the tower of Neptune. So we went for Aquaconda and Zoomerango which was fun.My friends tried slitherine as well. It has good variety of rides for everyone.

Excellent place for family and friends alike. Staff friendly and the crowd that comes are not cheap. There is ample of rides for all ages and thrill seekers alike. Had a blast with a couple of friends.

The Best in the UAE. I've visited this park multiple times and you have to love the layout. The lazy river lets you relax in the water while it guides you to the rides through conveyor belts. Plenty of rides and a lot of fun.

Overpriced and no value for money !. Iwe went with 2 young children and there was only literally one water adventure with slides and a small swimming area, the price for a child is few dirhams less then an adult charge. The food and drinks inside is very much overpriced and they don't allow you to take anything from outside, charges for locker and towels to pay extra too.

great rides and well set out. Some great rides and mostly well set out. Although you get on the lazy river at one spot and you never seem to find your way back to the same spot. You end up anywhere but. A fun water park with some interesting rides. If you are visiting Atlantis for the day, worth including in your ticket.

Really good fun. Loved the variety of rides and slides. Personal favourites included the huge lazy river which took around an hour to do the full length of the river and the slide which is a sheer drop through a shark and manta ray filled aquarium!

Best waterpark. There was loads to do for all ages. Lazy rivers and not so lazy rivers. Slides and lots of rides with the rubber rings. We didnt have our son with us, but the kids pool & play area looks amazing!! You need flip flops or socks as the floor is too hot walking from ride to ride! As is it so big the lockers are at the beginning so my only negative is you have to go back n forth to get anything out. The waterproof wallets people had looked like a good idea. X
Woooh-hoo!!!. Gr8 experince.... Gud fun.. Gud 4 all ages..!! Nice area.. Beach rides drinks etc worth a visit .. This is part of Atlantis Palm.. If u r staying der then it's free2 enter!!!

A disappointing and dangerous visit. There is a design fault on one of the water rides. On the way down, I was flipped from the ring I was sitting in and dragged down the slide till I reached the bottom. The slide was not smooth, as expected, rather it was rough like sand paper. As a result I was injured and had serious scratches on my arms, legs and my trunks were ripped open on the side. When I reached the bottom, I found a queue of 8 people waiting in line for medical treatment. I was dripping blood from my right arm, right thigh and my buttocks. When I complained to the first aid attendant that there was a problem, I was told that I had fallen out of the ring!!! I have never been back and have seen many reports in the papers complaining of the same thing so there is no doubt that there is a design problem with that particular water slide.

super fun water rides !!!. all the rides were great and different. there were rides for kids too.very clean and well maintained.the staff and the guards were friendly too .they have good package price for water park , lost chamber aquarium and food together, which was cheaper than what we paid to our travel guy,better to book directly.food for vegetarians is not a problem.try the tropical snow ice cream.its too refreshing.dont miss the poseidons revenge ride,its scary but still thrilling and fun ! all rides are good and we did everything.we went in the monorail and saw the palm atlantis.it was nice,saw lots of apartments and houses and buildinga on the way.then we took metro from there.if you take metro in dubai you have to walk a lot,so not suitable with kids.the aquarium was not satisfactory.

Fantastic fun. A great day out! Yes, it's relatively expensive but we were entertained all day. We liked having a double ring as we are a young couple. The best ride in our opinion was the Shamu slide, with the added bonus that midway through, you could switch to shark attack! Lots of more relaxing options too- beach, lazy river, looking in the shark tank etc. Lots of options for lunch and all reasonable priced. As others have said, keep your flip-flops on!

Overrated. This park does not have too many rides, there is a lazy river + couple of rides, nothing great. I understand the location, its structure etc. but 300 AED is really not worth it.There is a beach in the resort and very very clean. If you want to relax, good place to do so. The lost chambers are also in the same location.Be sure to be there early as the queues can be serpentine.Try to catch the monorail to reach the place, 15AED each but its nice.
OKAY..... Not that great...very expensive....sun lounges cheap white plastic seats.....kids liked the rides...but been to much better waterparks in Dubai/abu dhabi.
Amazing. Spent the whole day as there is so much to do. This was a really good experience had such a great laugh. Would recommend this place to everyone!!

Great Rides & Staff. Fantastic range of rides for all ages, very clean and the lifeguards were all very friendly and helpful. Have been to Wild Wadi as well and definitely think Aquaventure is better especially being linked to the Atlantis hotel.Couple of areas for improvement would be to have more child rings as we had to wait quite a while to get one on a couple of occasions, also, the floor was extremely hot making it really uncomfortable to walk without shoes. I know it's Dubai and it's always going to be hot but think they could spray the pathways with water or put some special flooring down to stop you burning your feet.Apart from that, the place is excellent & would definitely recommend it.

Amazing Fun Time. Aquaventure is what made our holiday. The slides, rides and water inflatables are suitable for all ages. The splash park is great for small kids. I recommend the food from Starbucks for lunch, near Dolphin Bay, especially for vegetarians. Good quality food.

Excellent family place with kids. Excellent place for a family kids enjoy it it's safe and fun being there . If possible avoid a sunny day as it gets very hot . Good place for a complete day out staying in the resort or not .

Good day out. This is the second time we visited and oh my did not disappoint! The queue for the tickets were quiet and a smooth flow to the lockers and to the park. There are plenty of beds to leave towels on! As we have a 4 year old it's great for children as they have a splash part for children and a lazy river! My child loved the river Rapids and the torrent (high waves) I love my big rides but this time I couldn't go on them as I have just he surgery on my knee but did go on some of the rides and the lazy river! The only thing I would say is that there should be more inside dining! Apart from that brilliant day out for all types of groups!

have fun. I went to this place with my 9 years old daughter,lucklly the weather was nuce at end of May . we both enjoyed a lot and had a great fun. playing in different areas and play make the day very excited and juyful. recomme ded place specially from kids from 5 ro 15. wishing yiu all a nice day.
A good a well maintained watermark with tonnes of activities. A good a well maintained watermark with tonnes of activities. The dolphin bay and sealion are an added attraction and a must visit
The best watermark I the world. This is a must, it's so well planned and something for all ages. You could stay in there for days and enjoy every minute. Don't miss it
Best waterpark.... Best water park experience... Water rides are awesome... Loop of Faith is just out of this world experience...

Greaaaaaaaat!. Took a lot of courage for the Leap of Faith. The waiting time wasnt long. Went last year when it was the hot season. Gotten tan lines underneath clothes. Be prepared to use tons of sunscreen
