Not well organised, frustrating experience which could be so much better.. burnt my feet on the baking hot walkways! why dont they put some floor covering down which doesn;t heat up to 100 degrees?! everyone was tip toing around between shaded spots. Also they have NO WATER available anywhere in the park unless you also happen to be carrying (wet) money in your swim shorts. brainless profiteering. Dolphin experience is too short and packed full of people. Huge queue at the entrance for tickets - 40 minutes line. Why dont they have automatic ticket machines?! Other than that the park is fun and a good day out - but could be so much better!

very good. I visited the park during my stay in Dubai. it was a very good experience. clean and pleasant. Staff very helpful. Rides were well manned by life guards. I would definitely recommend this attraction.

The Best Waterpark in UAE!. This was one of the best waterpark I have ever been to. Very nicely maintained, friendly staff, the rides are awesome as well. I went here with my 8 and 4 years old, they really had a blast all day long. Too bad the rope ride is not free of charge, otherwise it would have been perfect. Some more tips:1. wear beach shoes as the ground can be scalding hot.2. try to go on the weekdays to avoid the crowd. Some rides can take you 30-40 mins in queue3. if you are resident here in Dubai, make sure to grab a deal from entertainer vouchers. Trust me, you will save a lot! Using Citibank credit card gives you discount as well.

A fun day in the water. They've got some real breathtaking water slides at the Aquaventure waterpark at Atlantis The Palm. Whilst staying at the resort, we spent a day checking out the pools and slides. I tried the Shark Attack (not bad) and another one with a large tube enough to fit a group (I forget the name), and it took the wind out of me!There are other slides, as well, but some looked too daring for me. There was the Leap of Faith, and several other cool ones. Lots of nice pool areas and sun bathing stations, as well. Some good snack stands, and a nice food court.

Best Waterpark of entire uae. In our last trip to dubai we went to wild wadi and this time we visited in a group consisting of 3 families 7 adults and 4 children. I being the leader was double minded between Aquaventure or yas world in abu Dhabi. I literally read all the reviews on trip advisor and comparisons of these 3 parks wild wadi, Aquaventure and yas world. Conclusion I got was yas but after trying all 3 Aquaventure is far ahead of rest 2 due to 1. Number of rides.2. Fun factor.3. Quality of rides.4. Layout of park.5. Value for money.Please remember to wear sandels or beach shoes as there is a long walk inside the park between rides and specially in summers as we were there this June. Another tip is you can save a handsome amount on tickets specially if you are a large family like mine by buying tickets 1 day before from the counter. You can save roughly 45 dirhams per ticket but I am not sure if this offer is all year round. It's also advisable to go as early as possible coz time flies there its so much fun and you cannot take all the rides in 4 to 5 hours!!!! Highly recommended super fun.

such a terrific day!. The staff here were lovely and friendly. We had a fun time and it was nice that we could use the private beach as well as the pools and rides. I would recommend, the earlier you go the better.
wow....one of its kind. nice rides ...one should go with their friends to enjoy it perfectly.As i was on a business trip but still i enjoyed a lot.

Great Park, Great Shark Safari and Great Temperatures!!!. We went on the 1st June when it was around 44 degrees Celsius, make sure you bring aqua shoes which are allowed to be worn on rides! I saw a few people running around from shade to shade to avoid burning their feet!The temperatures were really nice especially when in the park, their was no lines/queues for rides most likely due to it being the low season which made the experience even more fun.The staff here are second to none, the level of service I received was extremely good and the staff are a credit to Aquaventure!The shark safari was amazing, even though my second time I still enjoyed this a lot with my partner and she did as well even though she was worried at first being unable to swim, the staff however did an amazing job at making her feel secure and safe during the activity!
Amzing. Amazing place , too many rides to complete in one trip. One must make sure to be there at the opening time else you will go back with a feeling of having missed many rides

Clean, different. This place although slightly expensive is a good water park to visit. No unruly crowds as you may find in wild wadi or elsewhere. Most importantly, its clean. Located next to the Atlantis Hotel it is also has an aquarium which is also deserves a visit

Fun Day Out. Had a fun afternoon with family. Overall an enjoyable outing but expected more slides . Went in May and the water temperature was perfect.But the fact that they don't have a system of putting a credit on the wrist band is something which I totally don't undestand. All water parks around the world have this system, The only way you can purchase food and drinks is to carry money in a plastic thing worn around your neck which they sell at a ridiculously high price. Another way of making money, rather fleecing money.

Best Waterpark in Dubai!. The Aquaventure Waterpark, located next to Atlantis The Palm hotel. Im not sure how much the entrance fee because it's included with our accommodation. This waterpark have two main tower, each has their own slide and ride. This is said to be Dubai's best waterpark and I do agree with that claim. Its unique landscape with aquariums, rivers, and tunnels will amazed you. They do have different excitement for you to try such as aquarium dive, zipline and much more. You gotta experience it yourself. Check their website for further details.

Where kids can be kids and so can the adults.. Fantastic day out, safe, clean, friendly staff, something for everyone of any age. the rides are great from the slow and relaxing to the heart stopping. plenty of sum loungers and green areas. Food onsite was good and well priced. always a must when visiting Dubai.

YAY WATERPARK. So, if you want to come to this water park you should come for a whole day from the morning to the closing time. When I go to this water park I know that I should wake up early (9:30) because it opens at 10:00. Then I need to bring SUN CREAM!!! This is a very imprtant part because of you don't bring it you will die from sun burns. I love it in the aqua park because there are the best slides, nice life guards and people and everybody is just laughing and having a AMAZING TIME! Can't wait to go to the water park soon.

Great place with kids of all ages. We stayed at the Atlantis with our two teenagers. Bonus of staying at the Atlantis is free admission to the park and towels. The kids loved the rides and went on them all many times ! We loved the lazy river, good fun for all ages. Plenty of areas to sunbathe or read a book. Casual dining, burgers and chips etc.... Normal fare for water parks. No alcohol in the park, no cocktails on the beach :(. Overall a great environment if you like water rides or have children of all ages !

Very Happy Birthday from Aquaventute. Don't you know how to celebrate your favorite holiday? Simply register and get a gift of free access to the world of joy and adrenaline Rush from breathtaking water and dry rides (Aquaventute Flyers). Moreover you would never become so close friends of the dolphins and fur seals anywhere else. You will absolutely fall in love with them! Have a pleasure being welcomed to the truly best Waterpark not only in the Middle East but for sure one of the best Waterparks in the world!

Full day fun. Amazing trip. my kids loved it, the activities were simply great. the lockers are expensive so travel light but with kids you have to carry everything. snacks are available. you can not carry own snacks and fruits.

Brilliant!. Fab day out Access to several pool, lots of loungers, free and plentiful towels, lots of shops for drinks and ice creams and access to the beach. Lots of lockers too at the start. I just took my beach bag with sun lotion and inexpensive items which I just left on the sun lounger and it was fine! Floor is really really hot so take sensible shoes, unlike I did, that you can take around with you or better still keep onFantastic childrens pool areaSo so many lifeguards it's brilliant and really takes the worry away We never had to queue more than 2 people for rides went around 3pm - 5pmHighly recommend - especially as entry was included in atlantis guest package!

Best waterpark. I have been to that place many many times & my family can't get enough of it, we enjoy every minute, slides, food & the atmosphere with the lovely smiles of the staff.This is a must visit place in Dubai.

I'm not a fan of water parks and had a Good Time. Traveling with three older teenagers, my boyfriend and I were looking for a great family adventure and this was it. I'm not a fan of water parks but enjoyed the tubed water costers and the lazy river. The teenagers and boyfriend enjoyed the more adventurous coasters. Make sure to check for discounts online for we were able to take advantage of a free day pass and photograph due to my boyfriend celebrating his birthday week.With a day pass we were also able to leave the park, rest, grab a bite to eat off site and return later.

Awesome Day Out.. Best 10 hours in Dubai. Such an easy way to enjoy the day, enough rides, some adrenaline and keeps you cool throughout the day.Rapids were an awesome way to travel through the park. Loved the whole day.

Still as good. Really good water park, loads of rides from extreme to the lazy river with rapid, torrents etc. Good tip is to take wet shoes as the ground is red hot and in bare feet you are hopping from shade to shade!

Brilliant Adventure. We were staying at Atlantis and what a great opportunity to have this included! So off we went and spent a morning at the park, we arrived for opening and were pretty much firsts one in. So the big rides were achieved first- Leap Of Faith - excellent do it! Then the Poesidian Revenge stomach churning but worth it! All the rides were great loved the lazy river it was so so lazy! And the pools around were fab for relaxing. Lots of places for drinks and food but one tip - don't forget your flip flops the floor is very very hot!Have fun

Waterpark. Now this place was BRILLIANT..Being Hotel Guest@ Atlantis, it was included in the price, so we could pop I'm& out all day..My Daughter, who has mobility problems, fed the Stingray, she was so looked after, they really went out of there way to help her down the steps etc..Best bit, they had Buggys that you could just hop on and off wherever you needed to..Once again, I really couldn't fault anything to do with The Atlantis... X

AwesomeVenture. There are loads of slides to go and very enjoyable! i didnt go to Wild Wadi as this one was recommended to us so we chose this one but we had such a fun day. definately you have to do this.

Amazing Water Park. This place is bigger than you think! The rides are fantastic. The Leap of Faith does exactly what it says on the tin! The river rapids all link up so you think you're going on one ride but can end up taking in several in one go- not a bad thing but just slap on the sunscreen as you can be exposed for some time. And one top tip is think carefully about footwear - the paths get very, very, very hot! It sounds obvious but you leap in to the water and don't think about it until you get out and that may well not be where you left your flip flops so think about sandals or similar, the pain does make you want to cry! If you have the choice, go weekday rather than weekend for obvious reason but it still is that bad for queues etc on weekends.A must do if in Dubai! ! !

Fun Fun Fun. Since I stayed at Atlantis so it was included and part of my package as I was staying in Atlantis and overall experience was awesome as overall ride and experience was awesome and mind blowing. From surge to spike. And from torrents to rapids everything was gr8. Tower of Poseidon was awesome and leap of faith was wow. It's a must visit place. Since I was staying at Atlantis so I was not charged for anything and it was unlimited entry to water park and rides. But have to pay for locker as it was 40dhs for small. Go and enjoy it's a must visit place

Great day out for all the family. It's a great watermark with plenty for all the family, mega clean and with lifeguards every 30m.We rented a cabana that at £140 was worth every penny, covered seating area, locker, wardrobe, 4 x loungers, parasol, hamack and 2 x beanbags with free fruit and waiter survive to the table. It was right poolside and in 44 de heat great as we were in and out the pool ever few minutes.Rides were great and no cues (june) but beware as I bruised my butt on inflatable ride over a hump.All in all great full day out and the first watermark I did not want to leave before it closed

Probably the best water park in Dubai. This is possibly the largest water park in Dubai and you'll need the whole day to enjoy it. The queues are reasonable, although the "death" type slides tend to get busy towards the end of the day as I suspect more people pluck up the encourage. You can hire lockers, but towels are provided. Great fun - but remember to grease up, the sun is really hot!

Great day out. Arrive as early as you can because the queues to get in are long, we waited half an hour. It was a really fun day out, pricey I'd expect if you were a family on holiday (you get a slight discount as a resident) and decided to eat and drink there but definitely a good treat day. Rapids are really good for lounging and soaking up the sun and a good selection of slides. The park could do with better navigation and signage as we kept getting lost.

Great day out. This has to be one of the most safest,clean,fun water parks I have ever been too,even better then the Disney parks in Florida.The water rides are brilliant,made for all age groups.The lazy river is long and flows at a gentle pace and there are of lots tube to go around.There are life guards every couple of feet who are professional and friendly so you and family feel safe all the time.The water rides are the top class.and the food is fine for lunch time.We never rented a locker as we had only a couple of item but remember if you need one pay for it on entry.The dolphin swimming was excellent,it cheaper here then in Florida.There is separate area you need to go to for this but the buggy takes you there.They provide you with towel when yo go to the dolphin area ,There are plenty of sun beds but it does get busy are 11-3 so get there early if require a sun bed.The queues for the rides vary from 2-15 min

Birthday Celebration. A great escape from the scorching heat wave of Dubai. Few good rides - Leap of Faith was a daring one. Photographs are a bit costly, if you are ready to spend 75 dhs to cherish the memories. Make sure that you are fully equipped with your swim wear and sandals, since these are over-priced.

Worth a try. If you are passing by the city and have time to drop by- the water park is definitely worth a try. Between the two in Dubai, this one is the only one that serves alcohol at the park. Otherwise, they are both quite unique and similar at the same time. So it would be good to try both to be honest.

Still outstanding. Look for packages or deals from your Dubai palm hotel. Esp in June and July the rates in Atlantis Hotel are quite low and entrance fee for Aquaventure is included in the hotel accommodation. But in any case it's worth the money. Easy to reach with the tram!

Great for people every age!!!. This water park is so much fun. It´s great for people of all ages. If you are a beach lover like my husband and I are, I recommend it over other water parks in Dubai, because it offers a wonderful beach area where you can sunbath,and chill out after riding all the thrilling rides.. We were impressed with the park´s service, security and organization. My husband got a knee scratch when playing football /soccer on the beach. Since sctratch was bleeding we asked the staff for a band aid, we were surprised to see 3 paramedics arriving to provide medical treatment. A few tips: 1.Bring you own towels and dont bring huge bags. Towels and lockers are charged additionally. Lockers are very small. For families you would probably have to rent more than 1 locker.2. Book your tickets online before hand3. Visit the park preferably during Dubai week days. During weekends it gets very crowded. (Weekend in Dubai is Friday and Saturday) Sunday is first day of week4.Try to arrive erly to avoid long lines at entrance. 5. Have lots of fun!!!
Dreams come true. I was so surprised by the gift the gave to me on my birthday,a free access to the whole park for a day! Awesome,i had my birthday over there it was truly fun, don't miss it!

Fun in the Sun. Had a great time with the kids at Aquaventure. A child over 1.2m is classed as an adult, and adult entry is circa £50, so for 2 adults and 2 children (10 and 13) it was £200. Pretty steep! That said we were on holiday and it was a good day out. It's the 2nd time we've visited and they've introduced another tower providing multiple extra rides with greater variety. We visited during Dubai working week (Sun to Thursday) which meant we got on most of the rides within 5-10mins max. waiting. Overall I'd recommend but go when it's not too busy!

Exhilarating!. We stayed at Atlantis so had access to the Waterpark included. We caught a buggy from outside the West tower and they are frequent and you never have to wait. The Waterpark is open from 1030 to sunset. It is great if a little confusing. There aren't enough loungers to dump your towels (which you just pick up when at the waterpark and leave behnd when finished with). The lazy river, rapids etc are all done on tubes (single and double) and there are masses of them everywhere and you never have to wait for them. The water temperature is perfect too.

Exact replica of Aquatica in Orlando. Exact replica of Orlando (Seaworlds Aquatica). We were staying in Atlantis, so admission was free. The kids had a great time. But if your child is less than 120 cm tall, then that he can't do any rides.Food is reasonably prices for a touristic area, £8 per meal.

So much action. There are so many rides,slides to keep you entertained for hours. Extremely clean and safe. I witnessed a guard rescue a small child who fell from her tube whilst negotiating the torrent wave. Top tip for an ice cold top qulity drink go to the Starbucks restaurant next to the Dolphin Bay. The prices are not escalated paid 66AED for three medium sized frapacino's

Over Hyped Park with limited rides. Was so excited to visit Aquaventure but it is ok only for one time, every thing is over priced & life guards were also not friendly may be due to over work shamal ride was good bit different. Bathrooms were ill maintained specially near changing room.

Full Day of Fun!!. We went here over going to Wild Wadi mainly because we wanted to go to the Atlantis and the watermark did not disappoint!! It was a full day worth of water slides and lazy rivers! The whole park is connected via a lazy river which is pretty cool and all the different slides kept us busy all day long! Personal favourite slide was Poseidon's Revenge!!! Well worth the money and I would recommend adding the meal option with the purchase of your tickets! Takes lots of water and sunscreen!!

Very fun!. I've visited there twice. I like it very much as I can just be floating. I don't like to swim, just wanna play with water, so it's perfect place for me.When I went there second time, it was so crowded and I could not feel relaxed but still enjoyable.

One of the best!. I was staying at The Atlantis so had free entry to the waterpark, took advantage of that and visited almost daily - a fantastic waterpark with brilliant rides & facilities. There were few queues for rides and was overall a fantastic time! Younger siblings also enjoyed the waterpark, going round the rapids multiple times.

Great for adults and kids alike. amazing water rides................something for everyone to do, if u r a daredevil then some amazing high thrill water rides or just grab an inflatable donut and relax on the smooth waters........

World Class waterpark in Dubai!. Always feels like we are away on vacation when we visit Aquaventure even though we are Dubai residents! Great rides, hands on staff and an overall amazing family day out. We have been there 4-5 times and never tire from it!

Great Fun at a price. It is actually cheaper to purchase tickets off site! Excellent rides, with something suitable for the whole family young and old alike. If going as a family not sure package deals are cost effective as you don't each need a locker or a towel for that matter as you'll dry in minutes when it's 38*c outside. Would recommend you bring a small waterproof bag as for some reason the tickets for towels, zip line ride, meal deal are printed on paper and we all know what happens to paper when it comes into contact with water.
Good day out for one and all.. Aquaventrue is located at The Atlantis hotel on the Palm of Dubai and is a good day out for all the family.

I love waterparks!. We enjoyed almost all rides and the private beach. The best decision is to go early as the admission line can be sooo long. You cannot bring food from outside and the quality in the restaurants are not very good.

Family fun. Lovely day out. Perfect for kids of all ages. My little ones loved the aquarium and the waterpark. A must to get away from all the malls. Perhaps buy food and bring it along. Not much in the park and what was available was too overpriced.

unstoppable fun!. clean gushing waters...toddlers running around ...slides and rides perfect family funn...if you can ignore the sun tan :).Do carry loads or sunscreen which is water proof and keep applying everytime you come out of the water.carrying food and water inside the park is not allowed but I found most of the familes with kids did carry many water bottles and candies and cakes.everything in the stalls inside is too pricey

Worth the money. I'm a student and can't afford much when I travel, but I had promised my friend to join her when she was going - and it was worth the money! I can recommend buying the tickets online and bringing your own go pro camera (worst case you can actually rent one when you are there for 200 AED) or else they sell waterproof phone cases for 140 AED or something. They have WIFI in Shark bite restaurant, in case you need that. All in all - worth the money, because of all the good rides! :D

Great Fun Day Out. Well worth budgeting in a day to head out to Atlantis to visit Aquaventure Water Park. I enjoyed the Lazy River and also the 'Shark attack' slide.The Lazy river has river rapids in them and it was great fun to float around the park, you pretty much don't need to get out of the water to enjoy most of the activities. We even caught a conveyer up to the Shark Attack slide.So much Fun and if you have time be sure to visit the lost chambers aquarium at the same time!

Fun day out. Fun day out especially if you've got children. Signposts around the park are a bit confusing, took a while to locate the towels. Lots of stairs to climb, and some of the rides are not for the faint hearted. I lost my voice from screaming and laughing so much.

A great family adventure. If you stay at the Atlantis then Aquaventure is free to enter, otherwise their are different packages available for day entry. Discounts are available with vouchers from Time Out (check web site).This park is huge and beautifully landscaped.The inner beach area overlooking Dubai is pristine. Guest buggies are available within the park for getting around.There are so many rides with different thrills to suit all. The 2 new raft rides are brilliant.You can add the dolphin experience in Dolphin Bay which is next to the waterpark. If you have young children then worth getting a Cabana (at extra cost).Lots of shops and eateries around the park and a point of entry. Worth taking in the Lost Chambers aquarium on entry or exit at an extra fee, again discounts are available through Time Out.Park was open 'till 7pm when we attended. Kids were worn out at the end of the day. A great day out all round.

Great fun. Had a great day out all throughly worn out after all the rides. Considering it was half term time the queues were not bad. Only problem was the mega hot floor to get around on I suggest buying the special shoes available as you can keep them on, on the rides and don't get burnt feet I between!.

Just not enough time. What can i say but this is the place to spend with family and friends. The rides are not only fun but make you wan t to go on and never stop. Did not have enough hours in the day. Highly recommended. Poseidon and Leap of Faith are must do rides. The zip line is cheap to go on.

Great waterpark, good location. We are used to the water parks in Florida and did not expect this to rate in comparison. I thought that the rides were great very organised and safe , my daughter did the feeding the stingrays which was excellent the staff were very informative. The park itself is in a lovely location , great views of Dubai especially from the top of the slides

Great Fun. We went to the park as a family of 4, 2 boys aged 6 & 8 who were fearless. The Leap of Faith was indeed that and i am sure my butterflies are still at the top of the slide! Excellent for the full family
Great fun!. This is a must for anyone staying on the palm. Great fun for the day, something for everyone. Food and drinks were reasonable. Plenty of sun beds dotted around.

Fun, Fun, Fun. Amazing waterpark, me and my friends enjoyed it so much. Its not as crowded as other waterparks that makes the queue so short. We enjoyed all the rides. Very family oriented and staffs are very pleasant especially on the food court :) I love the the restaurants surrounded the area too. So after a day of adrenalin rush you can just pig out easily. Thumbs up!

Kids had a fantastic time. We all had fun and enjoyed most of the rides. Would have liked to have started the day earlier as there was so much to do. Loved the rapids especially and the kids went on the 'white knuckle' flumes. All around - happy

For all ages, The Water Park with attitude. This is definitely a must for all ages, amazing rides to suit all ages, doest matter if it rains (very seldom) the fun starts as soon as you enter. It gives you a rest from shopping!

Aquadventure Waterpark Fun. Great day out with loads of fun to be had. Allow a full day or two to do this park. So many different things to do I only had a few hours here and did only a couple of things. Rode on the lazy floating tubes and did the easy run and the rapids. Also got one of the waterslides in that went through the aquarium. What a super fun couple of hours.
Great day. Brill, rides amazing and cool. Value for money 100%. Spotless clean. Advice wear your flip flops everywhere or burnt feet
Great for a family day. Great for a day in the heat with kids. Only small kids (under 1.2 meters) cannot do many slides, just the kids' play area.

A fantastic day of water rides.... The park is amazing - more water rides than you can imagine. Having to line up for some rides is a problem, but no worse than at any theme park. The best ride is the Leap of Faith, an almost vertical drop into the shark pool (no you don't actually go into the pool, rather you ride a glass tube through it). Make sure you wear some sort of footwwear, probably the neoprene shoes are best, as the walk from waterslide to waterslide can burn your feet off (it was 40oC). Also, be prepared to wait for a taxi when you want to leave!!

This is how to make a waterpark!!. Simple steps to build an amazing water park:1. Make a lazy river that takes you through the entire park2. Make all rides end in the lazy river3. Make "conveyor belts" that take people from the lazy river to the start of the rides4. Build an awesome aquarium5. Make rides go through aquarium tanks.Welcome to Palm Island's Aquaventure Waterpark! It may cost £60 for a combined park and aquarium ticket but it was completely worth it. My only disappointment was that the one ride I really wanted to go on, the vertical drop "Poseidon's Revenge", was closed for maintenance. Either way, we got to fly down the Aquaconda - the worlds largest water slide and spent a good 5 - 6 hours experiencing and re-experiencing everything the park had to offer. Food, as expected, was extortionate at £7 for a potato twist and £10 for a snow cone! Doesn't stop it from being a fantastic water park though. The aquarium is also superb and unique in its theme and I definitely recommend doing them both saving the aquarium to wind down in the evening.

The BEST day. The five of us had an absolute ball. The weather was hot and therefore the water was amazing. The price was pretty average for a theme park. One handy tip - make sure you have something to wear on your feet when moving from one area to the other as the ground is unbareably hot

Fun for parents and kids. My son and I enjoyed our day out at the water park. It was so much fun. The lifeguards were quite friendly, and were quite helpful.We went in the summer and the pathways to the different rides were boiling! the attendants suggested we keep our shoes/flip flops on (or you can buy water shoes from the store).The rides were quite good. My son's favorite was the Zoomerango and Aquaconda. Keep lots of water with you for drinking as you can get dehydrated without realizing it.

Fun day out,. A really good apwater park with plenty to do for everyone with the added bonus of being able to relax on the beach. Very spread out but the lazy river takes you to most places you want to go. Ques can be very long for the main rides and the water when we went in February was freezing.

sharks comin for you!!!!!!!!!!. the best spot after the suncitydubai desert safari it was a crazy place lots of fun activities , you will be blown away will the lost chambers and the dolphin bay great , highly recomended

Mehxpensive. Ok place, easy to get lost, prices horrendous. Security disorganised. When me and my family went to visit this attraction, we weren't too overly-impressed and a bit disappointed in the quality of it. First, we went to the Dolphin Encounter, which was fun and enjoyable for the people there. Then we went to the actual water park and the quality started to droop. The rides are fun at first, and there's a variety of different rides for different people but after a while they all start to look the same. But considering how big the water park actually is and how crowded it is, it is very easy to get lost there.

fine, but more for the 'younger generation'. I thought it was a bit overpriced but still had a good time. Only grip was the constant hassle of photographers who want to take your picture to sell to you at overinflated prices. Rides are Ok enough to keep you busy for a few hours.

Great Day!. We visited this water park on more than one occasion as we were guest at the Atlantis, it has a 2 1/2 Mike lazy river which is great to just kick back & chill out on but along the way you'll blind little exits that if you take them you'll enter other fun water rides but 'hold on' some of them are pretty fast! If your not a guest it can be pricey £45 pp & remember the weekend days in the UAE are Fri/Sat so these days are busier...there's lots of fun water shoots dotted around the park & also little coves with beech area to sunbath all in all a great days fun! Enjoy
Excellent. Very well maintained water park. They have activities for all ages. But life guards need a brush-up training to be courteous.
Adrenaline Pumping. If you love a bit of adrenaline rush then the slides at the Aquaventure are just the thing for you. A real deal, fun and exciting too!

FUN FUN FUN. Great time! and CLEAN!When we arrived at the Atlantis we were approached by a staff member selling packages for the park.We ended purchasing the Adults only cabana area for an extra AU$100 (I think).WELL WORTH IT! we could leave all our belongings on our sunbeds and had no issues! they do provide security for the area although it is not fenced off as such.You could ring a bell and order drinks and meals from the pool boy.The park itself is fantastic! we loved all parts! while im not the biggest thrill seeker my fiancee is.I did do the Leap of Faith I thought if im here do it never goingt o get the chance again! OMG what a rush! although was going to fast to see the sharks! Lazy river always fun but I think we spent most of our time chasing the waves in one part of the river! so much fun!We did all the tower slides and the ramps are even better No large amounts of stair climbing.Spent the whole day here, we were eventually kicked out of the water!
Super fun. if youre a person who enjoys water, its definitely a place for you to visit. good water rides. A little expensive in my opinion but you can have fun and make it worth the money.

Big kids day out.. This is an excellent watermark and well covered by lifeguards. Beware the walkways get very hot, so wear water shoes. So much fun and it made me feel young again. I really enjoyed this but not as much as my wife did.

Staff needs education in hospitality. Odd as it seems, except a few, most of the staff didn't seem to like their job. No much courtesy. Hints of disregard for some nationalities. The rides were well-maintained and were fun. Overall the park was clean, decent and fun to be in.

Great fun for all. We spent the entire day and could have stayed longer. Great experience for everyone. Had so much fun with other travel agents exploring. Spent most of the day on in the water. Even found a ramp that takes you back to the top of the water rides, so you don't have top climb the stairs everytime. Purely lazy river.Food all good however a little pricey. The one thing is make sure you take thongs/sandals/jandals. The ground was too hot to walk on and two of our team ended up with blisters on their feet.Can't wait to take my family.

Had a great day. We had a great day here, a lot of fun with all the slides and everything.What makes us not give it a 5 is that for example if you do compare it with wet and wild in Orlando they have some more slides that are fun for 2-4 people, here they where more or less a couple of them that was as good as theirs.Tip. If you want a good selection of food walk to the opposite end of the park where there is a food court and a lot of different options for you to eat from.No kids with us so but from the look of it, if you don´t stay at the hotell it's a pretty expensive baby pool, if the kids are something like 4 or older i guess they will have a lot of fun in some areas.Still, this is as much for the adults as it is for the kids i would say.

Superb and so clean everywhere. Awesome time and cleverly designed so that all of the rides are contained within two massive towers so you don't have to walk round everywhere. Staff are super friendly and can't wait to go again.

Good but not great. We celebrated our 9 year old's birthday here. He took a 7 year old friend and our 12 year old son also took a friend. The good thing is we all got a GCC residents discount making it much more affordable for 2 adults and 4 children. WE just showed our Emirates ID when paying for the tickets. I should have registered our son for his birthday as they give you a free ticket if you print off the ticket. Oh well next time. As for the park it was heaving at 10.30am. The queue to get it in was huge. The park itself had wait times of about 10 minutes per slide so not that bad. The issue is you must find a tube and keep it with you as none of the slides have a stockpile. WE aid extra to have private area to keep our possessions. It cost 600 AED for the 6 of us to have a lounger in a small quiet area and there was food and beverage service. It was pretty slow. The food was great it was Thai. The children were able to go on all the rides as they met the heights. There are no maps to show you how to find anything and there were a few unsavoury teens in the lazy river picking on younger children. I felt I needed to supervise the kids all the time. I prefer Wild Wadi. I think it is safer for families with younger children and has better slides.
Lots and lots of fun. If you love waterslides this is the place to be. Amazing slides and a perfect area for couples or families :-)

Great fun. We stayed on after the dolphin show it was quiet time of year so there was no queueing for rides. Little tip, if you have visited the Dolphins and had your photos on a memory stick (you have to pay) the water park will add you water park photos onto you memory stick For you at no cost.

A top, top, TOP day out!. My wife and I were really sceptical about going here. But boy were we glad we did! Both in our 30s and without kids, we thought it would be a bit ridiculous. But the place brings out the kid in you as cheesy as that sounds. The park itself is full of great rides, the most thrilling one being the Leap of Faith, an almost vertical drop down through the shark tank. I dare you not to scream. There are a good selection of restaurants and fast foods and all accept card. The only thing that could make this place slicker is if they allow you to buy stuff by swiping your wrist band and then make you settle the bill at the end. It saves you from having to carry your stuff/wallet around the park and then having to leave it somewhere while you go on a ride and end up somewhere totally different, especially if you're cruising down the Lazy River! Other than that, this place has it all. Worth the money.

we had a great time!. our friends came for vacation and we visited this water park.In the beginning we were not sure which water park we should chose but at the end it was clear that we will show them Aquaventure.This waterpark is just amazing, and got even better after they opend the new slides.So if you are here in Dubai, visit this place. You will definately not regret it!
Blast!. Had an absolute blast, yes it's pricey! But it's worth the money. Loved the set up of the park and being on top of the Palm Island. Great slides and beach.

still the top water park around. much better than wild wadi. especially the 4 new attractions. but still a bit upset , having booked imperial club at atlantis, would have thought the rental of locker would have been complimentary
get chilled and thrilled. my kids had a great time chilling at the aquaventure park, its a must see if you are visiting dubai with your family and kids.
Weekend Getaway. My friends and I went here on a Friday to avail their free birthday pass. We had a great time! I loved Poseidon's Revenge and Leap of faith. I'll definitely go back.

Private Beach, Tropical, White Sand, Fun day Out!. There was a lot more to it than we thought! Great view of Dubai from out in the middle of the ocean. There was a calm water, white sandy beach with sun lounges to enjoy in between your waterpark fun! We loved it, very relaxing, yet lots to do. It was larger than I expected. We live in Dubai and had never gone. A must I think for people visiting. Gives you a rounded experience!

Great fun but take shoes!. After getting the mono-rail which is highly recommended just for the view of the island you walk through the resort to the tickets. We chose the Aquaventure & hidden chambers deal for 300d. locker rental is 40d but one is big enough for most. (We had a 50d voucher from our Concierge at the hotels ask yours if they have them) It is essential to get some reef shoes or slip on soles to wear all day, flip flops or crocs are not allowed on the rides, slip-ons are. The ground is volcanic hot! Walking between the rides or around the resort is scorching hot on bare feet unless you enjoy fire walking, the park is huge and the lazy rivers so long you will cover a lot of area. We went on a Tuesday and it was not too busy, the wait time is no more than 5 min for the popular rides. A great day out but there are height restrictions for younger children which will limit the ride choice severely, there is an excellent kids area though. The Hidden Chamber is amazing, the aquariums are packed with all manner of sea life and the chambers have interesting displays with video points to explain, much better than the aquarium in the Dubai Mall.

Good fun - but there isn't much shade. This is good fun especially for children although there are height restrictions. You can take in a litre of water per person and I recommend doing this as once inside the park bottled water is AED13! We pre-booked our tickets but ironically the queue to pay on the day moved more quickly than pre-booked as they had more booths open. We bought swimming t-shirts because there is not a lot of shade available (especially where you can sit) and I wanted to protect my skin from the sun, however they are quite expensive and as it has the resort name on it you are frequently asked if you work there. It was over 40 degrees on the day we visited and so whilst the fully enclosed areas like the toilets and restaurants are air conditioned there aren't even ceiling fans in the semi enclosed areas and they become stifling.

Jetlag cure. We got off the plane after a 12 hour flight, and went to this waterpark. Best way to spend a day in a haze. We have been to Australian waterparks, and Dubai def do it better. The lazy river, which turns out is not so lazy with rapids and massive wave areas was a good way to get around the park and relax. Enjoyed floating through the hydro-slide through the aquarium. The only Con was that the ticket price is expensive, which was fine but then there are also all the hidden extras like the special train to get out there, locker hire, towel hire. Everything at a hideous price. The food and water is also expensive as you have to buy their, for example $6 for a small water.

Just great. We have been here both as hotel guests and as "normal" visitors. We have never been disappointed . The splashers area for the children is great with plenty for all ages to do.It is not cheap but you can make the most of it by staying at the hotel. The slides and slides and slides.... yes they go on and on.... are fun and safe. The zip.li e that is currently in place is a lot of fun... my 4 year old loved it !!!!
A "must be". Spend in minimum one day to visit this parc and be sure you have fun! The best expiriance was the rapid water slide!

Dolphin bay. By far the highlight of our trip we did the dolphin photo fun and it was well worth it! The water park was not that impressive as I have mobility issues and could not use any of the facilities apart from the beach but even that was difficult getting the wheelchair down to the beach

A waterpark with a little bit extra. I am usually not a fan of going to waterparks. Aqua venture is different. It also caters to the needs of mum. No need to go on wild rides (only if you want to), but beach or poolside also available. Must say I quite enjoyed the river, especially with the children. A really nice family day out. Drinks and food were very expensive though. That was the ONLY disappointment

Best Waterpark Ever! . Loved every bit of Aquaventure! Excellent rides especially 'The Leap of Faith' which is a must to do if in Aquaventure. Loved the staff who are so welcoming and friendly. It has a private beach too! The environment is nice with everyone just minding their own business. Would love to go there again! :)
I love it . It's deserves every Derham in it nice sightseeing nice games nice people how's work there and you have place to rest and complete your journey I love it

Fun, creative rides; marred by poor service. Whilst the rides were good fun, exhilarating and ideal for us as a couple (double rafts available) - the day was marred by rude staff from the off.Upon buying entry to the park with a small discount provided by out hotel we also had to buy a locker - accessed through the wristbands this didn't work first time around. After hassle and wasted time trying to get to the bottom of the problem we were took back to the ticket desks to have the wrist-band reprinted - the attendant was totally unapologetic and smirking at our clear annoyance. Our hassle and wasted time we thought deserved a refund of the locker price or at least an apology - both of which were strongly denied.On the whole the day was thoroughly enjoyed - the park truly is an experience (even for us big kids), although perhaps the rides were a bit repetitive/ samey.A word of warning: it was as we returned to the entrance to Atlantis to find a taxi that an attendant quickly came to our aid and briskly escorted us to a "taxi, sir" - which turned out to be an overpriced hotel car - both the attendant and driver were insistent we remained in the car despite us requesting a regular taxi until we forced our way out to find more simple transport.

Leap of faith was........... Quite scary actually .....though I'm glad I did it....this place is ace, added benefit was the free entry everyday as part of the Atlantis residence package, really great fun, certainly at least a full days activity, kids of all ages ( including me at 46 ) will be mesmerised by this place....water slide through a shark tank....I mean, come on.... Doesn't get better than that now does it.....?? If your in dubai, treat yourself to a day here.... Don't forget your flip flops though ...the ground will take the skin off your feet....hot hot hot.......

Great experience, not too be missed. Had a fabulous day here enjoying the water park rides. The food served at the restaurants is delicious too not the usual sub standard food you get at theme parks. Plenty to do here or just chill by the beach on one of the loungers

Ok oK. In India we have better water parks. It was really hot and they do not allow you to take even a bottle of water inside. It costs 10 dirhams for a small water bottle inside. You can skip this waterpark.

nice experience but...... Nice and new experience but very crowdto try a game you may wait for an hour or moreat the end of the day also you will wait along for the shuttle bus to drive you to the parking areanot very good for young childrenthe food and drinks are extremely expensive
Perfect place for a day full of Advrnture Water Sports. It's my 2nd visit to Aquaventure and this place is full of fun. This place never disappoints anyone and is full of exciting rides.

Amazing experience!!. A great place to visit with the kids. We took the dolphin encounter package, and had a complimentary admission to the waterpark. The dolphin experience was just amazing, and we will keep wonderful memories about it. The waterpark was also great, and we could enjoy thrillingfeelibngs on the slides as well as a great relaxation in the pools, and children had great time in the kids water playground.A journey not to be missed!!!!

Go there for the Experience. Its a great experience but very pricy - the tickets are expensive and just about everything is plus plus. The food is below average so I would suggest filling up on fries and slushies and eating when you leave the park. The other outlets in Atlantis have much better food. The rides are great - especially for high thrill seekers - but I wouldn't advise going there with children below 120 cm - there really isn't a lot for them to do.

too big... its too big to cover , all the rides are fantastic , plz try to visit from sunday to thursday , in uae , friday & satrdy are holidays so lots of people come to visit & there is a big queue for every rides , plan your itenary accordingly.

If you like masses of tourists and standing in line for getting your prepaid tickets, go for it!. Buy tickets in advance and you get a much better price (50%). But be aware that nonetheless you have to line up for getting your prepaid ticket and pay for the locker (if you need it, it is very small!). We stood in line for 1 hour to get our paid tickets! This is not worth it. Waterpark itself was ok, but not worth the price.

Aquaventure - Atlantis awesomeness. he Atlantis Aquaventure water park is great for a fun filled day out in Dubai!There are many water attractions such as a kids play area, Aquaventure Falls, Lagoons, Rapids, Shark Lagoon and Torrent River, as well as many water slides. These include: Stinger, The Falls, Shamal, The Surge, Shark Attack (water slide that flows through a see-through tunnel where you are surrounded by sharks and other creatures!), The Plunge and the big Leap of Faith!There are also many shops and places to grab something to eat and drink. Open 10am - 6pm daily.General Admission: (excludes towel rental, locker rental, meals and souvenir item)Adults: AED 225 Children: AED 180Dubai Entertainment Discount Coupon: AED 225 for 2 peopleTowel Rental: AED 30Locker Rental (small and large): AED 40 and AED 75Towel and locker rental combo: AED 50Combo Packages: Aquaventure Water Park and Lost Chambers Entrance: AED 275Silver Package: AED 275 (includes admission, towel and locker rental)Gold Package: AED 310 (includes admission, towel and locker rental, meal and drink)Platinum Package: AED 335 (includes admission, towel and locker rental, meal and drink. souvenir item)
stunning. wild, wet, crazy and enjoyable adventure although its a bit of expensive the entrance but its worth it especially young adult. my family love its and they wanted to come back.

Excellent Experience. It is one of the best Aquaventure I tried.Huge place, good variety of options for adults and kids.I tried the most of them it was amazing, also I tried the one for kids with my familyI recommend to go any time during the year except summer period, it is too hot

Theme Park fun. The location itself is amazing. Located in The Atlantis, Aquvaventure is a good water park to visit. The rides are great, the food is slightly expensive but that's what one has to pay at a water park. Great fun for kids and families

Aquaventure Waterpark in Atlantis the Palm Dubai. The best water park I've ever had..whole day isn't enough to spend here...I love it!:-) there are around 8rides different height levels..wild rivers waves...The leap of faith...oh wow!it's 90feet high..you have to slide there and in just few seconds,you will lose consciousness coz the impact is too fast...very nice!
excellent waterpark. really good modern waterpark. unfortunately my 6 year old was a bit short for 30% of the rides. generally better and newer than wild wadi
Nice place. Vey nice place. Kids liked it, but could be more, and a more varied water slides. But overall a great place.Liked very much the number of lifeguards there. They were everywhere.
Leap of faith. You can try to beat my record of surfing out if the tube, 3 m from the back wall. The new free-fall tube, I love it!

Brilliant waterpark. One of the best water parks I have been to, having been to the two water parks at Disney World Florida and the water park at Portaventura I would say this is probably the best out of all four ! Huge variety of rides to chose from and access to a man made beach with free sunbeds. I would advise people to book there tickets online, we went to go one day and the queue was so big we decided to book them online and return another day which worked out better. The only down fall I have of the water park is I found it expensive especially for the food, but other than that I would highly recommend visiting this waterpark.
Amazing. Amazing and free if staying at the Atlantis, perfect location and plenty for all to do, whether it be swimming or sunbathing. Definitely worth a visit.

Get wet and chill. Great water park with lots of good rides. Liked leap of faith and capsule ride the most. Leap of faith and shark bite ride opens under huge aquarium which is sumthing really great experience. Well managed and not much crowded. Good park to have fun.

Not Worth The Money. Its a good place but not worth the amount of money spent on it.Not many rides.Dolphin Play , Scuba Dive and rope games are chargeableLEAP OF HOPE is a must do thing in the aqua venture.take a combo ticket for aqua venture and lost chambers
Great time. Really enjoyed the river rafting over the rapids and floating down the various rivers. Also enjoyed the dolphin experience at the Atlantis.

Amazing rides. Value for money.. Great rides. Friendly for all age groups. Quality crowd. Lots of places to eat. My favorite was the leap of faith and the shark safari where to get to swim with the sharks.

Don't go on a weekend. Unfortunately I did not heed my own advice and went over a weekend. It was very crowded and queues were quite long. Go on a weekday instead, and before you go, make sure that they do not have a ladies-only day on that day (at the time of writing, ladies night is on Thursday night). Crowds and long wait times aside, it is a fun waterpark to check out, but I personally prefer Wild Wadi in Dubai.

simply amazing fun!!. i was unsure what to expect when planning this visit. being part of the Atlantis empire it could either be horribly formulaic and unenjoyable or it could be wow.it is unquestionably the latter!i took my 10 year old daughter and her friend who are both water babies but have never really been overly adventurous in terms of attempting adrenaline inducing ridesoh boy, did Aquaventure change that!!!within hours, i had to keep up with 2 thrill seeking adrenaline junkies who just wanted everything 'higher, faster and wetter!!'one of the most memorable experiences of all our lives so far, the layout is well planned, the services available good and even the food choices are not bad.i hope they keep upping the ante with new rides and thrillsget there early as the queues form quite quickly :)
Dont Miss!!!. Set in Atlantis!!!!! Its just amazing!!!! Don't miss the walk with the sharks!!!! That's for first time divers!!!!

Better than Wild Wadi. fresh atmosphere and user friendly - not very crowd and modern slides is here also you can use the sandy beach there close to the park . nice people and couples so i recommend it to families.
Awesome waterpark.. Waterpark of palm atlantis is awesome. one of the best place to visit. nicely maintain and very good rides. kids also enjoys it very much.
Amazing Water park. it has the steepest water silde.. you need to dare to do it. there are other interesting slides too.. a must visit.

A splashing day!. We went to the water park at Atlantis . We booked the reserved seating which gives you a secure area with two sun loggers,towels ,umbrella and endless cold water and a punnet of chopped fruit. All your valuables are see in these areas as there is a security check there.The rides were fun and the Any river takes about 40 min but you can get off at any time. It has Rapids no wayer slides encorperated into it. You may have to wait for a inflatable ring as some keep them for the day which I find a little unfair and I think the owners need to review this!, There are plenty of eateries but it is Very expensive . You cannot take any food in to the park with you.The lost chambers are worth a look as the aquarium is awesome .The showers rooms have shampoo etc provided as well as hair dryers .

Perfect morning entertainment with kids. We stayed at Atlantis and would spend 3 hours at Aquaventure every morning after breakfast - which we'd eat at the French restaurant in Atlantis by the entrance to the Aquarium and Aquaventure. The Rapids are great and we would spend hours floating along, and the flumes were also great. My husband did every one and loved them. The kids particularly liked the racing flumes and the giant family sized inflatable flumes. Great fun before the sun gets so hot that your feet get burnt on the floor between rides.

an anamzing way to spend the day. OMG this place couldnt be better, it's so amazing in every way, relaxing for the whole family, couples, friends, or solo.. it's basically an amazing way to spend the day while in Dubai.you just CANNOT skip the Leap of Faith at any cause whatsoever.I didn't like thast the Zip Line costs money seperately from the enterance ticket but other than that, it's juat perfect.

half of the day in queue!!! dont go there specially on week ends!!. I went by car, in this case we had (me & my family including two kids) to queue twice! the first one were waiting for the shuttle bus to transfer us from the car parking to the ticketing area (almost for 45 min under the sun on 40c temperature!!!!) the second queue was almost for 2 hours in an open area without any AC (good that was in shadow!) to get our tickets (although we booked & prepaid online!!!!!!!!!) So the conclusion was spending half day on queue and spoiling the full day for a really very average water park!!!!!
Fun day. Yep. Just been today. 1 small kids under 6 grab a child friendly rubber ring with the bottom filled in...floor gets mega hot when walking around...really great day

This Just Very Baddddddddddd-I felt like they opened park to rob. I had purchased online three tickets on promotion. Reached at site on 15th MAY 2015 10:AM Friday. There only four counters to serve to-thousands of people. It was a unhealthy situation for who is not booked online too.Waiting time to get the hand badge for entry after a online purchase was two hours.Purchased Locker on an extra amount. After entering the park we were informed locker system are not working. One hour to get the lockers repaired. On top of that manager was explaining that he is ready to give a refund for only for the lockers if its not working and he expected to carry our bags to a water theme park. He is least bothered the time passes away from my permitted time. we were not able to complete the rides on time due to heavy rush. They were in a hurry to close the park on time if the customers are in a huge Q to wait for a ride. They are strict on the point for shutdown. Mismanagement is the answer for the same.I felt like they sits there to rob........EVERY THING IS EXPENSIVE LOOK AT WHAT I PURCHASED EXTRAWater small bottle - 20 Dhs. Out side - 2 dhs.Hot roll- 38 Dhs- Out side 5.00 Dhs.Chicken 8 Piece Bros ted Combo-140 Dhs-------KFC charges only 59 for the same. We have still cheaper options outsidebecause no other options Just squeezeSatisfaction level to every one was 0000000000000000000000000000000000not only me everyone who visited they had same experience.

Not the best system on a weekend. Avoid visiting on a weekend, absolute chaos even if you have already booked and paid for your tickets. The queue was out of the doors on Friday. We didn't know where we needed to go so joined the line (or crowd). With paper confirmation in hand we asked someone where to go, the guy said join the queue pointing to a snaked line of people. We waited in the boiling heat for around 1.5 hours just to get our already bought and paid for tickets..meanwhile people who hadn't booked waited the same amount of time the other side of the hall. Pointless. When picking up your tickets don't forget to ask for a locker key, otherwise we were told to queue up again!!! Sunbeds are gold dust so once you find one make sure you put your towel down. The waterpark is okay, I wouldn't say it was the best in the world or anything like that. It was surprisingly average. Not worth £50 each. Wouldn't go again.

Lots of fun for adults and kids. It's a big waterpark but not so big that you feel you have missed out on anything by the time you leave. We (2 adults + 4 year old) loved the lazy river. The Rapids were fantastic, our daughter loves it especially! They have child seat rings to ensure your child is always above water which is something we've never encountered on a lazy river at a waterpark before (and we've been to a few)Lots of fun fast slides for the big kids (adults) we especially loved going down the dark slide and ending it by floating through a large fish tank! The kids splash section was great and just as fun for us. You can sit back and know your child is safe and having lots of fun, or you can join them too! Tip: you MUST buy the waterproof phone covers from several of the shops there. So handy when taking pictures and videos on the rapids and slides! You can wear them around your neck and take pictures all day long. We have some great shots!Lockers are available so you can keep the rest of your belongings safe and dry.
Great fun. Lots of fun rides for kids and adults. The park layout is very good and well spaced out with good facilities.

Atlanta the palm water park. We booked our tickets at the waterpark, £50 per adult .we went on a Tuesday there was no que for any of the rides, try to avoide Friday and Saturday because this is there weekend and can be more busy. Food and drinks are not allowed to take in, they check your bags at the gate. The food court is reasonable priced similar to home. We had a really enjoyable day at the park I would highly recommend it.

a dream come true. this was like visiting disney land. the hotel itself was majestic and too luxuriousthe rides were thrilling and exciting.only thing was there wasn't much variety for things to eat in the hotel itself. we had to take a cab and drive all the way out to the nearest mall to get something so everyone in our very large family could enjoy. all in all a one time go for everyone
Faboluos. We loved this water park from the first to the last minute. Was like a kid again with many wonderful and fun activities. Everything was really top class and it was organized.

Amazing. Having recently discovered trip advisor i want to share my experience with you all!!What an experience, having the floor fall out beneath you and whooshing down that slide. Very clean and the staff all very friendly and happy! What a fabulous day out!

Aquaventure water park. My daughter and I were were staying at Atlantis so had free entry into the waterpark. We both loved it. I preferred the lazy river ,the rapids and torrent while she preferred the many water slides. I ended up going on the all the slides that you could use rings to sit on and despite being nervous I had a great time .

Cooooool!!!!. Get ready for unforgettable and active day in this waterpark! Don't forget to get equipped by GoPro and share your feelings with your friends. Awesome experience! Waterpark is very well organized; friendly, multinational and multilanguage staff. Don't be surprised if you see singing or dancing lifeguards )))) There are lots of rides suitable for extreme lovers, family holiday-makers and kids.Highly recommended place to visit.

so much fun. LOVED it although I am not a big adrenaline seeker! I would go back there anytime. was expecting it to be less scary but we went with few people we know onsite and it was a really good day. I recommend

Amazing . This is with out doubt the best water park I've ever been too. Went in May there wasn't much of a line for any of the slides. The tower of Neptune is not for the faint hearted. If there's a group of you, the Aquaconda is excellent, see who's up for the challenge.

Chillin' at Aquaventure. Reached at 10am and waited for 10 min. to hop in the free shuttle ride. Thought that the ride would take longer but in less than 10 min. we reached the hotel drop off point. Its a long cue at the ticket booth as its Friday. Took almost 1 hr to get out. Paid Aed 285 for day guests and 185 for UAE residents with valid UAE ID's. Kids resident charged 165 plus dont forget to print out your voucher should u got a free bdy pass! Water rides and slides are almost similar with other waterparks except the Leap of Faith which Atlantis is very famous of. Food shops are everywhere so its not an issue if one place is crowded. One more good thing with Atlantis is having their own beach. Their high-tech locker rooms amazed me and felt stupid for a while while trying to figure out how the bar code works to open my locker! However, my shower experience could be better if toiletries are available. Nevertheless, my trip to Aquaventure is oK. Shall be looking forward to come again and try other activities like dolphin encounters and diving. Also, thinking to book a hotel room and have a priviledge to try their very relaxing spa and free access at the Lost Chambers. Suggest u wait for their aniversarry promo as you will enjoy more as u get more...only @Atlantis the Palm DXB.

Best waterpark I've been to. Without doubt the best waterpark I have ever been in. The place is very clean and there are loads of rides to go on. We went on a Thursday and the queues for the rides were very short. The lazy river and rapids were excellent, but the bigger rides were even better. Some very high rides where the adrenalin rushes through your body. Would highly recommend a visit to this park if in Dubai.

Best Waterpark I know. Aquaventure is really an amazing place with a lot of great attractions and a stunning view of Dubai. For Atlantis hotel guests the entrance is free. What we enjoyed the most was the Leap of faith and Shark Attack slides at the Tower of Neptune, where you go through a wonderful huge aquarium with sharks, rays etc. The Leap of faith does seem quite horrific (the steepness of the slide) but it's really great fun if you overcome your fear ;)Just 2 advices: 1) Friday and Saturday are days off in Dubai, so it was quite crowded there on Friday. Try some other day if you can. 2) Our box office lady did not understand well and sold us different tickets than we wanted (without a locker), so just check if you have what you wanted.

Great Day Out. Its a really fun water park. I didnt feel uncomfortable in my bikini and flip-flops!The beach is clean and water sparklingThe rides are designed for every sort of person and child. Very well thought out and organised park. Loved it!

A Must - with or without kids. OMG!! this water park is incredible. OK, so it is expensive...very expensive. But if you are on holiday (and in Dubai) you need to put this behind you and enjoy this park for what it is. At least once you are in, you don't pay for any rides.The endless range of slides for all ages is incredible. If you have young kids they will love it, especially the shark ride. We were there in April-15 and there were practically no lines. Lazing in the river as you float around the park is brilliant.The staff inside are great.My only negative is that were were not allowed to take snacks inside the park for kids...we had to buy the rubbish food they had on offer. I think this is very poor in this day and age to not allow you to bring snacks for your kids....especially at the prices being charged.
FUN FUN FUN. if you wanna hang out, go on fun slides, just tan at the pool or beach area, enjoy some food or if you want to hang out in the water on some tubes all day...you can do it all

Expensive waste of money. Went swimming with dolphins which lasted just over a half hour and got entry into the waterpark complimentary (swimming with dolphins cost over €250). The swimming with dolphins was a waste of money and the waterpark was worse! We had to pay for photos, a locker and a ridiculous amount for food. The two slides that we went there for were broken all day! I would never recommend anyone going to this place. Go to the other watermarks in dubai.

TOTAL BLISS. Never did the rides, but the the aquarium portion is just amazing. A must visit, has this huge tank with all kinds of fishes and bolsters to sit down and just merge with the amazing fishes in the tank, very informative and educational experience for all ages.Who does not love watching fishes.

Very well done.. This aqua park a part of Atlantis hotel is very good. True to its name, this amusement park is maintained very well. Whole family can enjoy the facility. Especially lazy river, rapids, shark attack, roller coaster in water in complete darkness were great fun.

Fab fun... just get there early!. So, I as a writer I've used the phrase "Only in Dubai" a lot in the last few years, and why... because there are things which this mighty Country offers that nowhere else does. Yep, sure there are waterparks in a lot of countries, and yep, fancy crazy rides and lagoons to rival those in the US which started the whole thing off, but in Dubai, things are just done with that finesse everyone talks about!This is a great waterpark albeit it is now quite old with two more parks created, one in Dubai at the Jumeriah Beach Hotel and one just out towards Abu Dhabi, Yas Waterworld, this is the one which started it all off in Dubai.There are rides which take you through shark infested waters (ok, so they are enforced tanks with 2 inch thick lexan between you and your predators but nonetheless still amazing) and the shark deck which for those who aren't that bothered about going through the tunnel as they are hurtled on a rubber dingy down fast moving water slides. The more fearsome among you can watch the screamers making their way through from above the ride on the shark deck!Go early. It opens at 10am and starts to get very busy around 11am. Use sunscreen and take it with you to put in your locker (which are provided as standard and are close to the rides in the changing rooms) because whilst you don't feel the burn as you are in the water, you sure know about it when you leave a few hours later!You can't take your own food, understandably because some try to take liberties by taking in literally massive cold boxes full of stuff which just attracts unwelcome critters and way too much litter to clear. The park have rightly banned that and any consumption of alcohol. Rightly so, because you really don't want to to be boozed up on these rides! Food and drink is available in various forms across the park. You will need to take cash. Unlike Wild Wadi where you can put money on your wrist band, only cash is currency in this park.You may need a hat too if you are going in the warmer months. You can't really escape the sun so if you do get burned, take a hat and keep your t-shirt on. There is no restriction on dress in the park but to be fair, the park does try to make things comfortable for everyone and a bit of respect for everyone is always good idea. Yes, bikinis are common place, but people do tend to ensure they are all practical. Small triangles are not a good idea on fast moving rides, if you want to keep a bit of dignity!!

Great !. We loved this park which is very clean and safe. Moreover, it is on the beach which brings a wonderful holiday spirit. The sand is white and it is very quiet. It is expensive, but like everything in Dubaï. It is not only for children, adults will also spend a wonderful day there ! Please note that the queue for taxi at the end of the day is huge

Brilliant fun day out!. This was a brilliant day out, and yes, you need to spend the day there. We went on a Thursday and hardly any queues. Unfortunately there were no signs to say what level each ride was rated so we started on 'The Leap Of Faith' and it left me feeling so sick for the rest of the day....we later found out it was the highest level and we should have started on the lower level rated rides first and worked our way up. Nevertheless, we had a brilliant day, my husband went on The Leap of Faith 6 times and 3-4 times on the others, the queues were minimal. The facilities on site are marvellous, hot showers with shower gel and shampoo and hair dryers. It cost £6 to hire a towel so you could save if you had your own. It was a bit expensive at about £75 each for 2 adults including the aquarium and locker, but it was definitely an experience. We avoided eating and drinking there though because it was a lot more expensive, and the shops were more expensive than in town. I paid £20 for a pair of swimming goggles. We wouldn't go again at that price but it was something we had to do and we'll remember forever. Yet another great experience in Dubai.
Good FUnnnnn. One of the best in the world, very busy but easy access to all attractions, have to take taxi , or if you stay in Atlantis hotel - it is free for guests

Day trip. we had a fantastic day out here,booked online so a little cheaper,we went on a Thursday and there was hardly any waiting time for the slides!we ate in the main restaurant,I had the butter chicken and rice it was simply divine!!we took our own towels and I'm so glad as if you hire there towels there all the same and you will have trouble finding your bed!the not so lazy river is great fun and absolutely massive! You must take your flip flops with as you cannot walk on the concrete unless you want 3degree burns!!i had read on here about not safe to leave them by your beds but we left ours under the bed(both Lacoste)and they were fine! A great day out for all ages!!

Well Worth it. It's a good idea to purchase your tickets online as it works out cheaper then when you arrive. Or if you stay at the hotel the activities are included in the accomodation . We arrived just after opening as we planned to stay as long as could but still leave just in time to beat the taxi rush. We did visit midweek so we did not have to line up for long periods of time. I would not like to go during the Friday Saturday weekend as I could imagine it would be quite busy. All four of us loved it and were kept very busy for the whole day with different activities for all ages. I wouldn't say it was a cheap day but it was a day well worth it. It is well run with plenty of staff and a safe environment for our family. A credit to Dubai!!

Great Fun. We were lucky enough to stay at the hotel, but well worth a visit. Stay somewhere else and come for the day, it's much cheaper. Weekends are busy but weekdays not bad at all. Loads to do and could easily spend a day on the lazy river alone, however the kids will pull you in every direction.Loads of sunloungers, so not a problem to get a seat.

good if you have small kids with you, otherwise, pretty boring. Overall: I'm glad I checked out this place (in terms of whether we would take guests here) but both me and my husband didn't think it was worth returning.Pros: - I had registered for free entry for my birthday, so I left work early and we got there around 2pm on a weekday (mid-April). On a weekday mid-day it was brilliant - parked, got straight on the shuttle bus, got tickets within two minutes, walked straight in, very small lines for rides.- The arm-bands to gain entry and to use the lockers work brilliantly. - Bathroom and showers are very clean - and they provide shampoo, shower gel, and hairdryers! Cons:- Thank heavens I got in for free, because in my opinion the entry fee is far too overpriced! - You're not allowed to bring in your own food (can bring in one litre bottle of water for each person), so you have to buy food there - poor quality and over-priced.- While the waterslides here could be deemed 'exciting' by young children, as a 30-year-old Aussie I am used to rides far more intimidating. I found the waterslides here to be pretty tame. - While we had very small lines, I can imagine this place would be packed on weekends. Some of the ride barriers indicated lines could be up to 300m!- If you have small children this place is great, but as an adult there's not much to do. As the crowds were very small we were able to get through everything quite quickly. But if you were waiting hours in line for each ride, it would take you all day.- The complex is huge! If they have large crowds I imagine this is a crowd-dispersing technique. It takes a long time to move between attractions - take flip-flops because if you go in the middle of the day the concrete is crazy hot! Take shoes you don't mind losing as well - one guy almost took my havianas because he thought they were his (not sure how genuine that 'error' was though!).- I think I suffered a bit of heat stroke - I recommend wearing a hat you can get wet. And lots of sunscreen if you're not wearing a sun-shirt! And drink plenty of (expensive) water!- The free e-photo you get if you come in on the birthday voucher is not worth it.

must visit. Excellent visited in April.We were there for 3 hours before they closed. But those three hours were so much fun and thrills and adventure. I totally enjoyed the slides. The kids are small so they could only be in the kids water slides.
All day fun. A great place to spend a day or even two. Nice water rides, relaxing Park areas and beach. When get tired you can spend an hour in the magnificent Lost chambers aquarium.

Great fun!. Visited here and had a great time. Sadly we arrived in the afternoon and didn't get the most out of what we paid but we enjoyed every minute. Very tidy locker rooms, helpful staff and the rides and set up of the whole thing was awesome. Would definitely go back but making sure we spend a whole day there to get our money worth

BEST WATERPARK IN DUBAI. Excellent visited in April. The park is massive and the variety of rides is great - everything is there to suit every one e.g. kids to thrill seekers. The rides were fantastic and services were 5 star.I would visit again.

Inconspicuous start but turned out to be a nice day. We had booked tickets online so one would think that picking them up would take mere minutes - it does not! For some reason the pick-up takes ages (probably because you are being sold up) so that wasn't the most impressive of starts. Once inside though, this is soon forgotten. We were there on a weekday and it wasn't too busy meaning we got to go on all slides without too much waiting. The facilities are clean and high-quality, the staff friendly. Only recommendation would be to bring slippers if you have them as the paving gets very (and I mean very) hot underfoot. All in all a nice day with some nice views overlooking the Palm Dubai. In short, a perfectly nice day out for the family.

Must visit. Great concept for Asia and very clean and kid friendly, went with my 9 year old and she was thrilled to bits. all the rides are very safe and really good fun, you must allocate half a day to spend here, book online and get there by 10:30, some great F&B also there

Aquaventure - don't go!. We visited Aquaventure and I have to say it was probably the most disappointing day we have had in a water park in the UAE. A deal had been advertised and widely distributed online of 125 AED per person, the offer was valid for the weekend and had to be bought online, however the online system was not working and we had been assured we would get the deal at the park entrance. We were planning on going to Yas Waterworld and so wished we had! The deal was not honored at the door and we were told you could not get the computer system to work so could not be bothered with the deal anymore. We were upset by this but had come so far so paid and entered the park. We had measured my daughter prior to arriving and she was 120cm on the dot. The park then said was too small and woudn't let her on any of the rides. Aquaventure park is next to useless for a child just below the limit, they can go on the lazy river and playarea. However throughout the day she was allowed on some rides and not on others. I wore a hat and glasses all day (with a protective band) and was on the last ride told I couldn't wear them despite having worn them all day. We had lunch which was for the children utterly disgusting. Paying the same price for a child's meal as an adults is terrible but for the quality of the child's meal to be so bad is just adding insult to injury.
