Spongy chicken nuggets made of reconstituted 'bits' and soggy pizza.. This was an expensive day full of disappointment made worse by bad food, inconsistent policies.

waterpark is O.K. beach is not. the water at the beach is dirty, the sand is not nice, the view is terriblegrass and palm trees compensate somewhat, but not enoughwaterpark is great, very well organized, the food and drinks are expensive, but you are allowed to bring one liter of water per person
Fun Fun Fun!!. Fantastic place. Very safe for young children (mine are 7&8). The area was very clean, staff fab and the food at the cafe was great.

Great rides. The Leap of faith was brilliant! get there early to make best use of all the rides before things get overwhelming with too many people. The food options are pretty appalling and you can't take anything with you.

Fantastic fun for adults and kids. Spent 2 days there with 2 adults and 2 kids. Disappointed that the Poseidon ride was closed but there was still plenty of adrenaline producing fun. Significant amount of life guards on duty - felt very safe. The staff were a lot of fun and interacted really well with the kids. Don't take any food - security will confiscate it (even fruit - I only had 3 apples and a banana and they made me throw them away). You MUST do Leap of Faith ride!

Great but need more activities for kids. I went there on a Saturday; it was a great experience and it wasn't very crowded, I expected much more. You better book online; it's cheaper and you will avoid a long queue. Just dont forget to bring the same credit card you booked with coz they will ask for it. I have a 6 years old kid and i just felt there should be more activities for that age. The place for kids there is small with few activities and slides.Beach is awesome; dont miss it.After everything and a long tiring day you will really enjoy the hot showers in the changing rooms where you will also find a private room to change, a locker if you want and there are hairdryers too if you need :)If you are in Dubai; that's a no miss place.

Brilliant, a real highlight!. We got free entry as we were staying at Atlantis and went twice in a week! Bit disappointed the Poseidon revenge is closed and has been for a month apparently. This is the one where the floor disappears, so would have been a wow however the other rides are fab. A few tips; take a towel if not a hotel guest as they are expensive. Free for hotel guests. Lockers are expensive, apparently nothing will ever get pinched in Dubai but we didn't want to take the chance here, but we left clothes and Ray ban sunglasses on a lounger all day. Food again expensive but you can't take any in so just be prepared to pay about 90AED per person. Don't queue for the plunge ride (same level of neptunes tower as shark attack) instead queue for zamanga falls which is off the lazy river on the main path way, this is an awesome rollercoaster that leads you into the plunge ride. We even started getting off before the plunge and going up a level to surge and leap of faith. If you've had double rubber rings, get two singles for a go on torrent (if you can get someone to push you towards the wave maker, some life guards will even do this for you) it's fab!! On anaconda and zoomerango it's a different experience with 4 or 6 people. With 6 the weight improves the thrill massively! The floor gets hot walk round in you shoes and leave at the bottom of the towers!! All in all a great way to get out of the sun!
gr8. Good for water Rides , some ride is very typical , Enjoyed, Dont take any food items there not allowed,

Yes, yes, yes you have GOT TO GO!!!. Water rides were magnificent. The whole park has a great wow factor and the serious water park chutes are not for the faint-hearted. I must admit I am not a Waterpark lover, but this place is really worth a visit for all ages. I am 59 and I did all the chutes and the big ones really let you know you are alive GREAT!!!!

Amazing place. We visited aquaventure park for a day and had an amazing time. The park is clean and safe, as there are generally lifeguards at every turn. Whilst the food, drinks and photographs are expensive we didn't feel that this was anymore than any other attraction in Dubai. The rides and slides were great and all thrilling. We went on a Monday during the last week of the UK's Easter break and in general the queues were relatively short. We stayed all day, visiting the Dolphin Bay in the afternoon, which was also magnificent. In the afternoon the queues were worse so best to go early.

fun time. We decided to go to the Aquaventures waterpark and before we went there I called their call centre to collect some information. One of them was about their vallet parking, which I was informed it existed and that I just had to go the entrance of the park and use the vallet parking. Upon arrival I am informed by a security tht the vallet parking doesn't exist anymore and that I could drive a little bit back and I would find the parking for the waterpark, and after this had to take a shuttle back to the waterpark. From my point of view is going too many ways around to reach the same point.When we arrived at the parking lot we had the shuttle bus waiting, we sat inside and waited and waited. There was no info about the timming for the shuttle and how it works. After asking the driver he sad he would leave in a few minutes. For a person that just wants to go inside the waterpark having to wait for a shuttle bus is a total nonsense.The shuttle bus doesn't even stop at the door of the corridor that takes you to the park, it stops in a designated area from where you have to walk 2 or 3 minutes to reach the entrance for that corridor with shops, and after entering 2 or 3 more minutes to reach the actual entrance of the park it self.This could've/should've been thought more carefully.After loosing 20 minutes in all of this we arrive to the ticket line where we stood for almost 30 minutes just to buy our tickets. Again, a lot to improve here.Tickets are pricey, I know I shouldn't complain because I got a disccount for being a UAE resident, but still it is pricey.About the rides.... they are really good :D, 5 stars, totally loved, and the variety is so big that you literally spend the time there and you feel you would need more time.Food: we went for the sharkbites restaurant. nothing special about the burguer we had, quality wise it could be improved. If you go around Dubai you will find better burguers/fries for the same price or even less. They should put an eye on their "competition".A few tips, take your towel and will save the money on the pack that offers you towel/locker. You don't need a locker, the park is really safe (like anywhere in Dubai) as long as you don't leave values on plain sight.I recommend the park.

Great Park Great Facilities. The Park is inside the World famous hotel Atlantis though its not compulsory to stay in the hotel.......It is having a variety of slides including the best one that is 'The Leap Of Faith'.........Not much long waiting lines but its worth it..........The best thing there are many towels lying on the chairs from which you can pick anytime.......Also there is an awesome playful thing called Dolphin Bay....The place where you can play with dolphins.......Although it charges extra but then its worth it..........

Great waterpark but.... We were very excited to go.Very disappointed that the main slide was shut.Had no idea snacks were not allowed in the park, and with my sons nut allergy it's very hard to buy things out safely.We had to throw all the food in the bin, such a waste.You have to pay for lockers and then they are actually in the men's and women's changing room, so like us, many families who bought just one were stood outside passing clothes and shoes to go in and out the changing rooms. There are plenty of sun beds and the queues were ok.But people saved the rubber rings by their sun beds when they were clearly sunbathing not riding, very selfish. On the whole the beach is pretty, the setting is nice, the park is huge, and the slides are fun.

Awesome. Great rides but only expensive snackie food is available. The park is large and well organised - there is even an attendant to keep an eye on your flip flops if you take them off before going on one of the larger water rides.

" Amazing days out ". Aquaventure Waterpark is the most beautiful waterpark i have ever seen it has a lot of things to do when you get there. From there you can go and visit Dolphin Bay and swim with them and relax on the beach an the Palm it is a perfectt experiance.

Expensive. It is a great water park but it is more expensive every year. The entrance fee is AED 285 (checked on 27th April 2015) and there are no more Vouchers in the Entertainer Book as well for this water park. Very disappointing.

Great day out. We booked this and expected to spend 2-3 hours here max but we left the park and hour before closing and that was only to avoid any possible rush at the metro. Such a great day and something for everyone.

Another Waterpark. Aqua venture is a good Waterpark to visit and has great rides. A good day put for all the family. Queues can be a bit too long so it's good to get there as soon as it opens or go midweek when the kids are at school.

Am amazing water park. Beautifully laid out. Great rides and unlike some parks the queues were minimal. Very well organised with buggies to move you along the path in the 40 degree heat! Wear something on your feet as the concrete pathways will burn your feet.

Busy enjoyable visit. Be prepared to queue to get your pass. If you can take your own towel it saves you 30 dirhams per person. Once you are inside, it is a fun place.ideal for families of all ages as there are rides to suit everyone.

the best water park in the world. i have visited water parks all over the world and i could live in this park it is amazing, my one tip would to be splash out (pun intended) and get a cabana makes your visit that extra special

Aquaventure - the cabana. We spent the day at Aquaventure as a family of eight. We rented a cabana which allowed us to stay together as there were eight loungers, a hammock, inflatable chairs, umbrellas and a dining area. We had our own locker,chilled water and a waiter to look after us for the day. As far as we are concerned, this is the only way to visit Aquaventure in the future. If you have children with you, it gives you an area totally to yourselves. You are supplied with menus and your waiter brings everything to you. A great idea which we will definitely use again

thrilling & chilling. Brilliant rides, especially the new Poseidon tower which is yet to be found by the masses. Great mix of mental slides and lazy rivers. Only downside, the paving is hotter than the sun from April onwards, wear flip-flops/aqua socks to avoid 3rd degree burns.

Expensive but what a thrill. I loved the rides. The names are too many to remember but there were 3 which were just a whole lot of fun. Then the changing rooms were another delight. A pity you must still pay AED18 extra for the towels given that the entrance to the theme park is already so expensive (AED300)

Beautiful place with fantastic water activities. Don't forget to take your complete Swim wear (As cost of same at venue is sky high) & Towel (if possible).All reviews on so called restrictions about the dressing, for women, is FAKE.

Star attraction closed!. This waterpark could be so much better, it is such a shame.We paid 250 dirhams, which is already very expensive.We didnt know that for that price you had to pay an extra 70 dirhams just for a towel and a lock!!The most disturbing was that the star attraction of the park was closed. We werent told before and yet the price remains the same.Add to that HORRIBLE and ridiculously expensive food all throughout the park.So yes we still had a good day but really it is overpriced and just a few tweaks could make it much better

So much to experience!. You could spend your entire holiday here if you aren't careful! It is simply awesome! And fun for the whole family! There are quite a few activities to engage in and the sheer size of it is something to behold. A great time! Loads of fun to be had!

Enjoying . Twice been to this lovely aquapark ..Lots of rides and fun..Little expensive but worth it..Will enjoy more while residing in Atlantis Hotel..For food and drinks you should have enough credit as they are expensive..

Best waterpark ever!!!. Loved this one because it has lots of exciting rides... Usually waterparks have 3 or 4 cool rides and many "not so crazy" ones, but not this one, it has like 7 or 8 supercool rides!!! We also went to the other waterpark which is also nice, but aquaventure is much bigger... #1 for me!!

Best days out. We have visited this park a few times now on our visits to Dubai, we have such an amazing time at the park, it's a great way to stay cool in the heat. We went swimming with the Dolphins, was an amazing experience. Park is very clean and staff are friendly. The floor gets unbelievably hot, to the point It burnt my feet while running from ride to ride, I would highly recommend the waterproof sock things they sell.

Amazing day out!. Staff were AMAZING! We decided to visit the Aquaventure on our last day in Dubai as a last minute decision. We got a cheaper price for booking it there one day in advance and saved approx 75AED per person. There was plenty to do so we wernt bored at any point on the day and we really enjoyed ourselves. The food and souvenirs are overpriced, but aren't all amusement parks? I would say it was a similar price to Alton towers if you are from the UK (so I was not disappointed!)All in all, great day out in the sun which has successfully worn me out for my flight.
Florida better. Been spoilt in Florida. Few rides,food crazy expensive.Lovely beach nearby and tropical fish lovely.

Excellent day out!. Not having been to a waterpark for a good few years I wasn't sure what to expect but I loved every second. We got discount and queue jump vouchers from our hotel concierge which was a good start. Went on a Sunday so it wasn't too busy and the most we had to queue was for ten minutes. Lots of rides you can do in the double rings together which is nice if you're there as a couple. The slides were awesome. Lots of screaming as we whizzed around and dropped down in complete darkness. Make sure you keep your bottom off the floor or jeeze it hurts when you hit the bottom of a dip. Not cheap but good quality food at lunchtime and lots of sun beds especially if you go further away from the entrance near to the dolphin area. Loved every second!
Great spot but expensive. It is a very nice water park with all kinds of great rides and an amazing lazy river system. But there is no free water anywhere and prices are high.

Nice but.... Lovely place with exciting rides, but unfortunately not much to do with three kids under 120cm. There is a hight restriction on all exciting rides so the young kids can only enjoy the Rapids and the waves.

Best place for a fun day out. Loved being at Aquaventure, we got there just after it opened and I would advise to do the same as otherwise the queues can be ridiculously long. They no longer do 241 vouchers in The Entertainer which is a shame but they still get a lot of visitors so I guess they aren't loosing out on anything. I would suggest getting a ticket that includes a locker and food as you'll save money than doing it separately but not a lot. There are a good amount of rides to go on and easily keep yourself busy for the entire day. The beach at Atlantis has some lovely views and is the perfect place to take a rest from the all the rides.

Dave. We stayed at the Atlantis resort so entry is included in your room rate which is really good. The slides here were really good. Plenty to choose from. We went is late April and the queues were very short the longest we queued was about 5mins for the leap of faith.Food and drink were far too expensive. Although I guess they are trying to target the upper class families. Sunscreen was $50 Australian dollars which was in town for $10 Australian dollars. So bring your own.Overall prices too high but we all had a great time and would recommend for a one off experience.

Expensive but a good day out. Best place to be on such a warm day is hanging around pools to cool down. I found the place to be one of the better water parks I have been to although it could have done with a wave,pool. I booked in neptunes retreat also and the staff there were fantastic and really looked after me. Great place to just relax and have some fun.

Good but not great. I had very high expectations of Aquaventure, being at the iconic Atlantis and in Dubai where everything is bigger and better than anywhere else! And I must say I was a little disappointed! Firstly, it was expensive and the queues to buy tickets were huge and not very well managed. We couldn't find a map to navigate our way around the park and see where the rides were which made it difficult to plan our day to ensure we had a go on everything and got good value for money.  It was a real struggle to find a sunbed so I would advise to get there super early or go later on when the morning crowds have left.  The rides themselves were very good but there didn't seem to be very many in comparison to other parks I've been to and there didn't seem to be a lot for kids under 1.2m.  All in all it was a good day but it wasn't the best water park I've been to by a long shot. Siam Park in Tenerife is definitely better.

Great place - get there when it opens. It is a waterpark - if you want to get all the slides in - get there when it opens - great fun. We stayed on the Atlantis property and this fun park is just steps away. All the slides - like Leap of Faith are well maintained and tons of eyes watching you to keep you safe or floating on the lazy river

Poor for the young ones. I wouldn't waste your pennies (and it will cost quite a few of them to visit here) if your going there with children under 1.2m. The only thing for them to do is join you on the lazy river or go on the few slides at the kids play area...NOTHING ELSE. Great if your over 1.2m tho.Slight downside to the design of the place is that the lockers are a long way from the towel pickup and activities, and there are no sprinklers on the paths which lead to burnt feet as you try to run from shadow to shadow...

attraction is good but the prices are ridiculous!. Family of five of us with kids aged 15,11 and 7. We really enjoyed the rides but hubby doesn't think the entrance price is justified. they do not allow you to take in food and drink. 1 litre of water per person is allowed. The prices of everything was just silly. It cost something like 40AED to rent a locker. If you go to the swimming pool in the uk you put in £1 and get it back when you empty it. Not the case here. Its non-refundable and works out about £8 for the small size locker. The food and drink was also stupidly priced. We ended up leaving earlier so that we didn't have to eat there. The rides were great. My 7 year old loved the Leap of Faith!We went and bought our tickets the day before. We bought them on a wednesday and the tickets were cheaper. Makes a real difference when you are paying for a family.
A day in the waterpark. A lot of attractions for everybody. You can go even to beach if you need more privacy. Most popular is the fall into the water from height ca 15 m.

too expensive. i decided to spend the day at Aquaventure. they dont allow you to bring in food or drink from outside which i understand as they have a lot of food and beverage stands available, however the prices are out of this world. i ended up not buying anything as i can not justify purchasing something for AED 25 when i can get it for AED 5. they really need to reconsider their pricing.The entrance tickets itself are expensive and then after you need to pay for everything else including any pictures taken by the photographers around the waterpark.To be honest, it was a total waste of a day and i would not go back there again.
Children loved it. Children loved it but to get the ticket you should buy in advance otherwise you will be wait for long queue to enter.

Great day out. The water park was a great choice. A little expensive but if you plan to spend the day there then worth paying it.Most rides include tubes which is great to go on in pairs and the fast rides are great so worth a go.Defo get a locker for the day although you do have to head back to the main entrance when you need stuff it means everything is safe for a few pounds.
Loved it. as an adult i thought this place was good, i chickend out swimming with dolphins which is a shame. recommend a visit.
not to be missed. This has got to be the best water park ever. there is just not enough hours in the day to enjoy it all, from little ones to grans and grand dads, a wonderful day out.

wet and wetter. spent the whole day at the waterpark after you have done all the large rides you can pass the time of day just floating around the park finding out where the different turns will take you very safe there are plenty of life guards all over the place the water is only 1 mtr deep

Awesome fun, an expensive day out.. One of the best water parks around. Rides for all ages. A few rides can only be done in pairs. Expensive drinks so make sure you take water with you. In the summer the sand and stones get very hot, we take water shoes with us and wear shorts and t-shirts for the slides. The beach and sea on the palm are lovely and the waterpark has a nice stretch if you want to rest for a while. Easy to spend a whole day there.

Definitely a must visit when you stay at the hotel. The place is so fun. We go there everyday during the stay. Great fun with kids. Again if you go during weekends expect quite a lot of people even locals love to go there.

Great place for a family day. There are activities for all (starting with young kids as soon as they enjoy being in the water) but be warned that it can get extremely packed. Book your tickets ahead of time and avoid the week-end if possible.

Free entry for your birthday. We visited both water parks (here and Wild Wadi) whilst in Dubai and here was probably our favourite. If it is your birthday week during your visit then you can register this in advance and take the voucher and ID and the birthday person gets in for free - what a great perk, we did this for my boyfriend and it saved us nearly £60. The rides are great fun - especially the lazy river ride, we spent hours bobbing about in the sun and the fact that a conveyor belt takes you up to the flumes was brilliant, so relaxing and easy. there were lifeguards everywhere you looked and we felt so safe - they were friendly and took their job seriously, much better than then surly youths you seem to get in European parks. The food was usual attraction park grub - but actually a higher quality than normal and more reasonably priced than we were expecting. There are loads of sun lounging areas and you can also access the beach - we could have easily returned here, there is more space to lie out than Wild Wadi so if I had to choose just one waterpark I would go here. Only fault is the sign posting - it was terrible and we weren't given a map, but we soon found our way. Well worth the money!
A Wonderful Waterpark. In this waterpark, there are equal opportunities for people of all ages, children, young or old. Our son, daughter-in-law and their daughters enjoyed a lot in the waterpark.
chill out place...... nice place with your family and frds.... visited twice.....staff is very helpfull.... specially kids love it....there is someyhingg for every one..,,nice place...

Fun for all. I spent a day at the Wild Wadi and enjoyed it. It's an attraction mostly for families and young people, but there's fun to be had by all. The only negative note is the limited seating places...especially for the aged like me!

Fab day in the sun. Everything spotless and very well maintained, no wait time for the attractions when we visited. Great to have beach access. Make sure you get a Dubai taxi there and avoid the private over priced ones.

Great but it has issues . Visited this waterpark on a weekday and it was extremely full. I purchased my tickets beforehand and hoped it would make things go faster. While it does put you in a shorter queue the queue still takes forever to move. Once inside the park, the park is well maintained with great variety of slides however again the issue would be queues and poor management of these queues. The master blaster slides have really been designed poorly and don't link up as well as other parks. At certain points unmanned areas lead to people jumping the queue and thus causing even more chaos. The shark attack slide was extremely average with grubby glass and I literally saw no sharks or pretty much anything else. All in all its a good day out but after visiting yas waterworld the next week atlantis just seems average to me and this is purely due to the running of the place

one of the best water park. If you are in Dubai with your family, do visit to this palce with your kids. They well enjoy for sure. Another masterpiece by Dubai people to this world.
the water park is clean, well run and varied. theres loads to do - lazy river, or the leap of faith - up to you. just do it!

Great fun for all the family. This has the potential to be an absolutely brilliant day for all the family. But can also have the opposite effect and turn into a nightmare day. I went with a group of friends and was told to arrive early (the waterpark opens at 10am, we arrived to get our tickets at 9:30am). We also went during term time, so queues were much quieter which meant more time on the rides. Another group of friends went during school holidays and said they spent most of their time in lines for the rides and didn't have time to have a go on every ride, so definitely plan when you are going to the waterpark.There is plenty of rides to suit all ages in the family, from a children's play area for the very young to the beach area for older family members maybe just wanting to relax. Some great fast food at shark bites as well. The only problem with the waterpark is you have to keep going back to the changing rooms to reapply sun cream and get money, as these are essentials you can't obviously carry around with you.

Not a special water park. You must really love water parks to take the trip out to Aquaventure and not be disappointed. A very average experience as water parks go. There were hoards of people and only 5 showers and 5 WCs in the main changing area! Security at the gate taking all snacks/drinks out of bags prior to entry. If you must go, buy your ticket in advance... it is cheaper and the queue to enter the park is shorter.
recor gines. you don't miss it, is the bigest aquarium inthe world, with all kind of fishes, and not only.better to avoid to go during weekend due to a lot of visitors.

Fun day. Tips for your day:- Definitely get there at around 9.45; we didn't have to queue more than 10 minutes and the main rides also had very short queues for the first hour or 2 of the morning.- Take footwear around with you, the ground was painfully hot! It can be confusing however as some rides originate and start in different places, so we braved it but it was unpleasant.- Shark restaurant has a nice shady terrace overlooking the beach.Very well kept, well staffed, lots of canopies so the heat/sunburn wasn't too much of a problem. Nice and spacious grounds so it never felt too busy. Expensive, but these places always are!
Great Fun. Well laid out and a great bit of fun for all the family. The private beach is also well worth a visit.
something for everyone. the water park is clean, well run and varied. theres loads to do - lazy river, or the leap of faith - up to you. just do it!

Good day out. Very easy to get in despite it being busy. Massive place with loads of loungers and plenty of space to relax while the kids go crazy. We ended up down on the beach as it was deserted and absolutely beautiful. A must do if you have kids.
Life below water. If you are in Dubai with your family, do visit to this palce with your kids. They well enjoy for sure. Another masterpiece by Dubai people to this world.

A £500 rip-off!. I booked this for a few friends, 2 Royal Dolphin Swims plus 2 extra entries to the park. Cost circa. £500. We were staying in the Al Qasr which is part of a complex having its own water park (Wild Wadi) but I'd been told Aquaventure was bigger and better. This wasn't the deciding factor on where to go though - the Dolphins were only available at Aquaventure.I rang my friends half an hour after they arrived and asked them what they thought of it. I was extremely disappointed (as were they) to hear they'd been charged extra for towels and extra to watch the two with the Dolphins. I'd pre-paid for what I thought was everything bar food and drink. £500 for a water park, even with the dolphin experience, is a lot of money in my book, and I would of expected towels to be included at the very least! On top of all that, one of the towers (there are 2 in total) rides had broken down - maybe they'd get 50% off the admission price .....? I don't think so!Not somewhere to be recommended.

GIve it a miss in peak periods unless you are a hotel guest.. OKay … too busy to upkeep well .. and newer water parks like Yas are better for younger kids. Hated the queues and the food stand near the kiddies pool area was way too busy! THe portions are hugs but so are the prices so either bring a lot of money or make sure the klids are full. Towels are not changed for dry towels once rented so bring your own - you can save a lot of money ! The bathrooms are okay and not well serviced during peak periods. My son feels the "rides" /attractions are better here but being a mom with younger children I feel the kiddies pool area was overcrowded unlike the ones at Yas Waterworld. The food court had better food choices and fewer people. I didn't know this … hmmm !

The best!. We did loads of waterparks. This one is the best ever. You get in one of their tubes and before you know it 2 hours have passed and you never got out! Fun! We went with our teenage son and had a fantastic famility holiday!

A dream that ended in a Nightmare !!!. We are a family of four with 2 teenage children 14 & 15. We visited the Dolphin Bay & the Waterpark & paid around USD 720.; This is a beautiful place & my children enjoyed it; Just before the park closed, my son was getting out of one of the rides & was trying to go on it again. The exit of this ride was slippery as I saw many people slip in the same place. In this same place there is a plant/Tree with sharp edged Bricks/Stones surrounding this plant. As my son got near those Bricks with the slippery floor, he slipped & fell on the sharp edge of the Bricks & his knee was split open on its side around 2.5 inches. The life guards called the Nurse & he came along with the managers. They called the ambulance & we moved him to the hospital & then back home for an operation with a torn muscle & 7 stitches. We did not have travel insurance & the operation cost us USD 3,500. & we had to buy new airline tickets to get on the next plane home; When we asked the park managers about the park medical accident insurance, they said "We don't do that"; Then they said, "Don't Call us, we will call you"; They never Did...
Andy. Always a very popular place to goSometimes it's very over crowed when we went in May got there around11 crowded at the entrance to pay next time I pay for the fast track tickets online
Nice place to have fun. A nice place to have fun, entertainment and adventures. It really makes your day. Total enjoyment with full satisfaction.
best classy splashy theme park. its the best the thrilling rides and amazing food fun with dolphins :D leap of faith :D it made me crazy

Atlantis Water Park. This is a fun place for both young and young at heart. During peak times arrive early to ensure you miss the queues both at the entrance and on the adventure slides. Care should be taken with sun protection because the water is deceptively cooling so it is very easy to come away with a severe sunburn I would recommend a factor 50 rash shirt and a hat! November - January the water can be cool. Locals can get a discount on presentation of local ID.

One of the best Aquaparks I've visited.. Excellent for all type of ages.If you are a fan of water attractions, you should definately try "the leap of faith" slide! All the others are cool as well. Of you are tired, you have easy access to the beach. Dolphins attraction is also great, but expensive.

Great Day Out (if a little pricey). The waterpark is very good, but probably not quite as good at Atlantis. It is safe for kids and the new kamikaze ride is amazing if you are brave enough!! It was overcast on our visit, so the water was a little cold.It is expensive, so would suggest getting a voucher from Entertainer to save some money.

Great experience. Absolutely the best waterpark in Dubai. You can easily spend the full day, as it offers the access to the beach, which is a valuable addition. The place is clean, safe, you see life guards every metter. Attractions and food are great. I really appreciated the space so eventhough the park was busy, you don't feel it. The landscape is manicured. Locker and shower area gets congested at the end of the day.

Terrific fun. Great day out. We arrived when it opened and were one of the last to leave. Brilliant fun and the staff were incredibly friendly (all of them ). The food is the usual burgers etc but it was good quality, which is rare in these type of places. A definite when in Dubai!

Great fun. This water park is set on the palm, part of the Atlantis Resort. The water slides ranged from enjoyable to heart racing. Most rides used the freely available tubes and the lazy river circled the entire resort so you could just jump on and let the water take you.Most of the rides were based on 2 central towers with 3-4 different rides per tower. The best part was in April is was still out of season and so the queues were very small, and after 4 most of the locals go home so we had endless fun for the last 2 hrs without any queues.There was a dedicated kids pool with the largest water play area I've ever seen, it was little a mini city lol, and there was even a dedicated adult section.Our hotel had discount vouchers and I'd definitely recommend the meal deals, upgrade your drink, it's only 2AED, but in 30deg the normal drink went down too easyA definite must if visiting Dubai.
Great familypark. Brilliant. Tons of slides.rapids.waves etc.Fab day out, or 2, for the whole family.Got beds together without issue.

Very Clean. Great place for the family to spend the day, we went at 10 am and it was not busy. My 3 year old love the splashers pool. I loved that the park was clean and well maintained. It does get busy after 2 pm. Loads of fun.

Great place for kids!. As I have a 3-year old, I can only be at the kids area and the "lazy" river! My son has great fun every time and I will definitely take him next time in Dubai. For older kids and adults, there are various exciting slides but there are usually long queues and it is a hassle to return to the slides.

Water Fun in the Sun!. Our admittance fee was included with our Dolphin Bay Program so I do not know the cost. I do know that it was a lot of fun. The day that we went, there was not a long line for the rides, the wait was 10 - 15 minutes at the most for the more popular water rides, the Tower of Neptune Leap of Faith and the Tower of Poseidon. I was not brave enough to ride these rides, but my husband did and he loved every minute. I enjoyed floating around the lazy river and I thought I wouldn't float under a waterfall or get a lot of water but You Will Get Wet!! We had an enjoying stroll along the private beach and there were lockers for our personal belongings and several places to eat inside the waterpark. The weather was approximately 85 degrees so it was a very enjoyable day!
Brilliant place. The best place I have ever been. I went alone but it was amazing. It is a must visit. But I stayed in the hotel so free entry. Great slides, great rides. LOVELY AND AWESOME.

Wet n Wild. Spent the day here with the family and had an amazing time. Queue times were acceptable and the slides were fun for the whole family. The food was not overly expensive like it is in most theme parks. My only complaint would be against the other guests lack of courtesy. Don't be surprised if your towels and personal items are moved from your beach chairs if your not sitting at them. We had 5 Chairs reserved with our towels and when we returned from the slides we only had 2. Other than that no complaints.
Thrilling. Loved all of the rides especially the steep slide but sadly I couln't go on Poseidon's revenge,the best ride of all time because it was unavailable that day but is quite expensive

Must Visit. Very nice defiantly recommended, except long queues, so make sure you get there early to enjoy. It's better to pre-book your tickets online, otherwise it's more expensive and long queues pursuing them on the day.

Brilliant as usual. Travelled with two teenagers who had a great day here. We have been 3 times now and always make this a must when we come to Dubai. The only niggle is that we had bought tickets online, but when we went to collect them the service was so slow it gave us no real advantage. More staff are needed and they need to process things a bit quicker. Other than that - it was great.

Great day!. My husband and I were so excited to take our 7 and 9 year old boys to Aquaventure as they were too young last time we were in Dubai to fully enjoy the park. My three biggest tips:1. Go early. Be there at open and make a dash for the waterslides.2. Don't go on a Friday or Saturday, the weekend days.3.Buy your tickets online in advanced as they cost 285AED and not 250AED. We had to purchase at the gate as we had a voucher for 1 free adult from the Entertainer, but if you don't have that, plan ahead.We arrived just before 10am on Wednesday, queued for only about 10 minutes and purchased one locker to be used in the women's changing room. When I checked-in with the wristband, someone had put their bag in the locker assigned to me. Don't do this! If you take an open locker and shut the door, you are not getting your stuff back unless you have the wristband that opens that locker. I simply took the bag and put it in another locker, without closing the door. Two trips back in the day and it had been moved to the floor. Either pay, carry it with you, risk losing it or park it on a sun lounger.We dashed for the Tower of Neptune and did all those slides (except the Leap of Faith!) and then dashed over to the new Tower of Poseidon and did all three slides there. We did the family slides twice each, and the race slide once. All of these were done with virtually no queues. Once it was busy we did the Lazy River, rapids and torrents. Lunch followed. The boys played in the Kids watermark. We did stand in a couple lines around 2pm, nothing longer than 20min. Did the Lazy River again. The longest line was probably the one my husband stood in around 4:30pm for the Leap of Faith.We had an amazing day, our kids had a blast and it was well worth the money.

Good fun with the water! . Went here with my partner and I have to say it was great fun! Some of the slides are pretty hair raising and the other half seemed to spend most the day either screaming or laughing. Good day out - free if you're staying at the Atlantis....!

Included if you stay at Atlantis palm. Clean beds and helpful staff. Loads of beds and lifeguards. Lazy river was superb and plenty of rings. Zip line Stingrays getting fed all need booking and extra. Overall would recommend.

Good Waterpark but expect long waiting times. May be because I went on a friday. But for each ride, there was a waiting period for 45 mins minimum. This is clearly not worth the wait. I would strongly recommend the management of this waterpark to limit the numbers so that it doesnt screw up the experience for others. Very limited food options and expect long queues.
Lots of fun. Liked the adventure and environment. Dislike that they don't allow entry of any food and beverages. In general the place is day advanture with lots of water and lots of fun

Brilliant Water Park. Great water park which is a lot of fun. Particular favourite are the family rides which are exhilarating and fun as all 5 of us could get on together. Get in early as gets very busy and beds are at a premium after 12.

Family friendly park. We spent 3 days in row in this water park. It is very family friendly. We found it excellent that almost all slides can be used by two persons (the rings are for one or two persons). The Zoomerango and Aquaconda are for 6 (rafts are used). We also loved the water channels connecting different beaches. The water park has also an excellent area for smaller kids with small slides. The only downside of the park is that it becomes very crowded in the afternoon with long waiting for certain slides. If you want to enjoy the slides without queues it is really worth to come at 10 am. The peak hours are 1 -4 pm, then it gets less crowded. It is difficult though to predict which slides will become popular as it differed every day.

Wonderful!. Some of the best rides and slides ever, really amazing to do the leap of faith and Poseidon's revenge. Only gripe is that they let our son in but then he was not allowed on a lot of rides as he was told he was too small (despite not being told this at the ticket office).

Great place, but long waiting time. We purchased the tickets online, hoping we don't have to cue.Well, you do have to queue to get in, then you queue to get your wrist bands. Total waiting time nearly an hour.The place was packed, hard to find a spot.The rides are great, staff friendly and obviously enjoying their jobs!Overall experience great, if it wasn't for the waiting.
Great waterpark. Very clean waterpark. You feel like you are in a Disney park. Great rides for all ages. Lovely beach as well as sunbed areas for the adults. Really enjoyed the park and will return.

Oh My Goodness, A Thousand Times Yes!. We went to Aquaventure on a Monday, so there wasn't as much crowding as a weekend/summer/holiday visit might have. I'm sure that played a role in how much fun we had, but halfway through the day there was not an inch of space for another person to arrive and sit down, so the park wasn't empty, either. I would strongly advise anyone planning a day at the park to arrive right at opening. You can find a place to sit and umbrella shade if you get there in the beginning - a necessity for me, as I tend to burst into flame at the slightest hint of sun. However, if you want to up-spend, the cabanas are AWESOME. Just be sure to get on the staff via email about reservations. We tried to get a cabana in the morning and they were all reserved. It would have been helpful if staff ever actually answered hotel emails. If you are comparing the park strictly to American water parks and the number of rides they put forth, Aquaventure would come up short. There are not as many varied sorts of rides as there are at American water parks. However, the lines also aren't as long, the park is CLEAN,the staff are polite and helpful, and the rides that are presented are a lot of fun. Did I also mention how safe the area is? Our kids actually had a much more active and relaxed day at Aquaventure than any other park they've visited.It is super safe - we were able to let our kids go about on their own with check-in times so we could make sure they were behaving. The beach is also a big plus - it is absolutely lovely and the water is clean and warm.The only drawbacks are the price of tickets (above other water parks in the area) and the price of food/drinks in the park. You will not get away with a cheap day at Aquaventure.

Great time but plan ahead. Fantastic place to spend a good long day whilst in Dubai, always on our list to do with visitors. Be warned to plan ahead, it will make your day that much better.Buy your tickets online and check out the packages, you can share a locker just for car keys and wallets. Carry some cash to spend locally and get there early for the best sun bed locations. Queues can get busy at the weekend so plan ahead on which rides you want to do and only queue when you have to. There are plenty of rides to choose from.Sun cream and rash vest is my last tip, enjoy the day!!

Don't you dare Miss. its an opportunity you cant miss.... amazing rides can be enjoyesd by all from a 1 year kid to 80 years old,,, well planned kids area , view of beach created water bodies... moreover hotel atlantic

Slippery fun. Went to the waterpark when we stayed at Atlantis. It's a bit of fun, quite spread out. I found it difficult to navigate which was annoying, you spend a lot of time wandering around trying to find the entrance to rides. Make sure you collect a tube to ride when you start. staff are not particularly helpful. No way to carry money with you (like the bracelets they have at wild wadi). Most annoying thing was that the lockers and toilets were so far from the rides.
WONDERFUL!. Great place, you must visit and I hope you will enjoy like we did. Been there with my family and kids enjoyed so much...

best experience in Dubai. it may be expensive - however you can get a free ticket if you are visiting during your bday period. Rides are amazing and great fun, and if you dont want to experience them then you can float on the lazy river or sit on the beach. The food howevver is pretty dire and the queues for them are horrendous. But well worth a trip

Nice day out with the family. Get there early and there is no waiting at any ride of your choice. The afternoons become very busy with long lines. Getting from one 'tower' to the other tower is a bit of walk. We wished there had been a wave pool, but parts of the river system compensated with rapids and the 'torrent.' Nice electronic bracelet system for renting a storage locker. Food portions are big.

Not much fun.... We had booked online. On entering the park complex we joined a queue. It was moving but took us a good 20 minutes to reach a point where the queue was then divided into two queues; one for online booking customers and one for ticket purchase on arrival. At this point it became clear that there had been no advantage in booking online as both queues were the same size. Another 20 mins or so queuing for the entry bracelets, locker etc.Out and into the park proper where we joined more queues. Not much fun, but clearly good coin for the Atlantis.

the best waterpark I've ever been on. wonderful attractions, the waiting time in the queues is minimized by the existence of long rivers surrounding the slides where a huge number of people circulates

A funny day !. I really enjoy myself too much at the park with some friends of mine. Try to reach the park as soon as it opens at 10 a.m. because in the afternoon it is very crowded and you must stand in a queue for every attraction.

excellent water park. very enjoyable....excellent rides...life guards were really helpful....the soveneirs and swimming accessories were really expensive since this park is situated in the atlantis hotel....overall a must visit if you want a day well spent..

Great day!. Great fun for all the family but make sure you have plenty of sunscreen on! The rides make this the best watermark I have visited in the world - beats any water park I have been to in the US

Nice waterpark for children but expensive in everything. Nice waterpark for children.Price is expensive, everything has to pay and not cheap. Even to rent a towel and a locker is aed50.Food is very expensive but we have no choice have to buy it, kind of ripped off. Even in US or Paris Disneyland, food is not as expensive as here. Photo also very expensive, they have cameramen everywhere to take pics of guests , but they charge 1 pic is Aed 125, unbelievable!! Once time is enough to go there.

Poor showing. There's not much more that I can say other than when it gets busy this waterpark is truly useless. My wife and I did go on a busy Sunday or Easter weekend, but we sure didn't expect to wait an hour for each of the slides. On top of that they didn't have enough rafts or lounge chairs. I get it that it was a busy weekend, but it really wasn't worth going when the park can't handle over a certain number of people. I'm sure your experience could be different if you went on a normal week day, but really watch out for weekends or you risk wasting your time.

Fantastic waterpark. It was the second time I visited this waterpark and it didn't disappoint! Since last year, they have decided to let each person bring in 1 litre of water each. Great considering the cost of food and drink in the park. Although it is a costly day out, it is possible to get discount if you book and pay online and there is a reduced price for residents. Also, some of the restaurants currently offer a 15% discount if you use a Citi bank card. In terms of food costs, it is about 50 dirhams for a good sized pizza and 15 dirhams for a regular size soft drink. You are not allowed to bring your own food in. The slides are great fun and the lifeguards are very friendly, helpful and make jokes. Slides for thrill-seekers include: the Leap of Faith and Poesidun's Revenge which are for single riders. Then there is a family ride with a pretty steep drop called Zoomerango. The other rides are more tame and could be suitable for the whole family, but some may still require you to psych yourself up!

Full too Water Park. Had stayed at Atlantis and enjoyed Aquaventure Water park. Once you are in Atlantis you are altogether in a different kind of a world. you won't feel like coming out of Atlantis, because there are too many in house activities inside Atlantis of which one is Aquaventure park. You can spend full day at Aquaventure. Water rides were amazing with full safety and security. Crowd inside was very decent and hotel staff were very helpfull.
Great Waterpark. many facilities inside the parkthe park more expensive than usual also you need to pay more for lockera lot to do inside you feel fantastic with the water games.
A fun day out!. Visited with friends, we don't usually visit water parks but this was very impressive!! Would visit again!
Aquaventure water park. very enjoyable - not as busy as we expected despite it being easter. Do book online though to avoid the entrance queue

Adrenalin rush. This place was included in the room price of our stay at the Atlantis. Due to limited time I was there for opening and it was very quiet. Not a single queue! The rides are fantastic (if a little scary sometimes). I would stay the Atlantis again just to go to the waterpark again! :-)

can be too expensive if you are not really into water parks. Try to get after midday since the lines in the mornign after opening are very long. And by 4pm most families will have left so you´ll still have a couple of hours to hit the main attractions without all the waiting lines.

fun activities for a whole day. we just couldn't finish all the activities within the day... had to move quickly among all the rides... to enjoy every part... kids loved the kids pool and some exciting moments with the shark pool...
staff could be more courteous!!!

Awesome place, must visit. Highly recommend to come to this attraction. Awesome time you will have with your family if you have kids. The water slides are very good, the pool and the views from the beach are very good too. Nice restaurants to go and eat. There are locker facilities , so no need to worry about carrying things around. The place is very easy to get to, as metro and monorail are located nearby.

Quite good fun. On the whole, the water park was good. We found that it wasn't very well signposted so sometimes we were unsure what ride we were queuing for or how to get to what we wanted. As mentioned previously, you also have to carry a paper receipt to be given a towel however as we weren't lounging by the pools this wasn't really possible. However on the whole was a fun afternoon.

Amazing Water Park. By far the best water resort/park i have been to yet. Amazing rides and add to that an actual beach to relax on. Fun for all ages. Only downturn is the long queues for the rides, but they are totally worth it. Very clean and well managed.
Awesome day with my family!. Highly recommended. Slides, pool and beach, all in one place! Great restaurants, very easy to get to.

On a sand storm day. I had stayed previously on the twin Atlantis on the Bahamas and I wanted to do the amazing "free fall" slide again... I booked online (with some technical errors that cost me a little fortune because I had to call them to solve those issues) and I was not sure how it would work as I had no printer available and just took my phone as a way to prove the payment of my tickets... But it all worked in a very smooth and professional way.This was an even better version of the aquatic park I remembered some years back at the Bahamas. The slides were great... I loved specially those slides with water jets that take you up instead of falling down...Unfortunately, that morning we woke up with a severe sand storm... The park was open (the offered the possibility of changing the day but that was our last one on Dubai) but the temperature was much lower than usual... It is incredible to say, I was cold several times during the day in Dubai!!!! It was 26 Celsius, witch is pretty cold out there if you get out of a 30 Celsius water....Due to the lower quantity of attendants, the park had a lot of activities closed, which was pretty annoying and unfair for the ones who went there. The storm disappeared after noon, when the wind changed from the sea, taking quickly all that sand away from the sky... But many of the activities stayed closed, namely all the small food corners, forcing us to the main restaurant.I bough the "feeding Rays" activity, where you go in water and hand to mouth feed those marvelous animals. Great experience!!! I cannot recommend enough.We had a very nice day, despite the initial "sand...y" morning and the annoying closed signs on several stores, spots and activities.

A huge waterpark. We spent about 4-5 hours here, and we really had a good time. The park is really nice, everywhere clean and it has good security. Everywhere there are life guards looking that everything's going fine. However, we spent surely more than 50% of our time only waiting in the long queues. At the most water slides you need to wait quite long. We waited always between 20-60 minutes to drive a water slide. We booked our tickets online so we could go to the fast track, but there we also had to wait 45 minutes until we could enter the park. So, before you decide to go here - plan in advance good time.
Ok, not as good as the Nassau one. Not that many rides compared to the one in Nassau. Food was extremely expensive compared to the Disney parks.

Relaxing place to be. Looking for a fun, relaxing place? Aquaventure is the place to be. It is the most amazing waterpark I have been too. It has rides, play area for kids, zip-line glider (cost you around 50 Dirhams extra), eating place and above all, the beach. For me it was a fun place all in one. Although the tickets along with the other expenses is a bit expensive, but the experience is definitely worth while. Had to buy a swimwear which was very pricey for about 385 which was a bit put off but all in all it is a fun place to be. So do pack your swimwear and dont go in tank top :P
A lot of fun.. Get there early so you can spend the whole day, it is a lot of fun!! But personally I like wild wadi better.

Fantastic Experience ruined by photo chaos. We booked the Dolphin Encounter for my son and his friend and they loved it. They also loved the water park experience and we enjoyed relaxing in a private cabana.BUT our whole day was ruined when we left the Waterpark and stopped to get our photo's.What an ordeal. It took over an hour to complete the photo collection process - fairly long queue - rude staff - wait - rude staff - wait - choose photos - rude staff disappear - printer doesn't work - rude staff come back - rude staff ignore you - eventually complete your order - pay a fortune for your photos.This is a totally unacceptable way to treat guests at the end of the day - especially as we had spent almost AED5000!
Fun. Water thrills. had fun down the slides. Not as crazy as the water rides in thorpe park uk. But it was good fun. Fun that wouldnt give anyone high blood pressure.

Average. Some slides etc were good but the whole park is confusing. Nearly every slide ends up in the lazy river thing but that is so confusing you have no idea where you are and which part of the park you are in. There were parts of the lazy river that we could see whilst walking around but had no idea how to get to them when in the river. There are so many different routes that you can take on the lazy river yet the current is so weird that you can never seem to get on the one you want to be on. This was very tiring! The currents were good in some parts and then rubbish in other parts. There are hardly any signs / maps around the park so you have no clue how to find things and then when you find the slides none of them are labelled so you have no idea which slide you are going on. Needs updating to make the park clearer.

Great day out. A must visit, great attractions giant slides, fun for all ages. Get there early as it does get busy, you can easily spend the whole day here as we did 7 hours in the water. Worth every penny.

Great waterpark. Alone to see the hotel Atlantis up close, this water park is worth visiting. The beach is lovely and quiet. Great views. Prices for food and drinks are ok. The water was lovely for March. We had really fun on the slides. The best thing though was the lazy river with the amazing rapids. I was already in a few waterparks in the US but never had that before. There are always enough rubber rings. We had a great day!

My favourit. this place is such an amazing place I love it, compared to the other waterpark places in UAE this is the best, u just set on the wheel and relax it will take u to the game, it is away from dubai mall 20 mins... nice thrill and extreme... i rexomment it for families as well...

Great day out. Went there for the day and wasn't disappointed. This is a fun park what ever your age with lots of different attractions for all to enjoy. I think I covered all areas started with the lazy river that was fun but there were more exciting rides to come. I had a fantastic day to the point one of the staff members asked me what age I was, I told him 60th but I felt like I was 6 that day fabulous fun, recommend to all ages.

Never seen on like this before. To all the adrenalin junkies this is a must to visit and experience the rides. Aquaventure is an amazingly planned water park in the Atlantis premises. It provides enough well managed rides to maintain the excitement, fun and frolic. There is a lot of activity that is happening all around. The wash areas are clean and well equipped, the lockers are spacious. Food Joints are disappointing and very expensive. There is enough area to relax.
Lovely day ☀️. Can't be faulted. Can't beat a waterpark to draw all kindsa people together. Old, young, fat, thin, black, white, alien! Smiles all round 😍

maybe good for children. They are selling the tickets for faaar too expensive to compare things you can do inside.I have been in some waterpark in different countries but I can say I had better experiences for much more cheaper.They best advertisement to slide between sharks.But come on. You can see those sharks also from the aquarium. Even with a better view.But if you still go, buy tickets before. If you buy one day before from your hotel or you just walk in to one hotel and you can get the price for 225 dirham. Usually they sell for 250 but somebody told me they have the option for 225 also. In the entrance the price is 285 dirham.On sunday (first working day in Dubai) can be around 30 minutes waiting time for slides. In the morning less people. From 11am and 12am start to be busy.No food and drinks alowed to take inside but we managed to take ours so we were lucky to avoid the high prices they have on foods and drinks.When you finish around 5pm (open until 6:30pm) outside will be maybe an hour waiting line for taxis. But there is a free bus also which takes you only to Mall of Emirates. Ask about it.The train which takes you to the beginning of the palm is 15 dirham.

Huge waterpark - that's Dubai!. An interesting place to visit and lots to do, but really too big for a day visit, especially with the long queues to get in - even with a prepaid ticket! Also long queues to the lockers - better to carry your stuff around. Glad to see the Palm, but the beach is not as nice as the real beaches. Good fun sliding through the aquarium on the slow slide. I'm told you couldn't see the fish on the ultra-fast "leap of faith", though it was too fast for me to try. Food wasn't too bad considering the location and the fresh pineapple was lovely.
Great slides. Fab day out for all the family, love all the new slides added and more fun as suitable for groups up to 6 to ride at once!

Aqua + Adventure. Aquaventure is an amazingly planned water park in the Atlantis premises. It provides enough well managed rides to maintain the excitement, fun and frolic. There is a lot of activity that is happening all around.The wash areas are clean and well equipped, the lockers are spacious. Food Joints are disappointing and very expensive.There is enough area to relax for between the rides. The Water Park has a beautiful layout and is well connected. Most of the rides are fun. Safety measures are followed strictly. Some of the rides, like, The Leap of Faith and Shark Attack are experience in themselves and are very unique. Rides like Zoomerango, Aquaconda are very fun from kids' perspective. Poseidon's revenge is the star attraction and not for the faint hearted. It is worth all the expenses. One of the life experiences, I would say.River Rides like Torrents and Rapids are Okay.Special mention to the staff who are highly courteous and amazing at what they do.One of the additional benefits is that you get to enjoy the Palms, Atlantis and the scenery around because of the high altitude of the rides. You can watch the golf course, the dolphinarium, the hotel area, The palms around and the beautiful sea.Though on the expensive side, This water park is worth it.

Great Facility. Spent a day with the kids at the waterpart - really cool thing with great variety of water attractions. There is also a Dolphin Bay there, as well as the Lost Chambers Aquarium. Take the combo, and it will be a day well spent!
Really Cool. My husband and I went, and it was fun even for 2 adults... Really like the fact that there was a private beach apart of the park. Also make time to go to the aquarium.

One of the best water parks!. When at the Atlantis, do the Aquaventure!This water park is huge, very well planned, extremely well managed and has the most amazing rides!It's super fun for the entire family!Lots of fun attractions and activities to keep you busy through the entire day!Aquaventure access is free to staying Hotel guests and for people who have paid for the Dolphin bay!

Exciting experinece. This is a very nice aqua park with some exciting slides and great view over the golf and sky scrappers across the horizon. I have been about a year a go and paid around 40 ish quids for a day ticket which includes the park, the lost chambers and a meal. I didn't really think much of the food but it was alright. Some rides are certainly adrenaline rush and the more you get on the same rides the more you get excited. There are some spaces if you wish to just relax and catch the sun or if you wish to relax for a bit. Restaurants are not particularity great in terms of options available but they are adequate for a drink or a bite. queuing to get on the rides wasn't an issue really and it doesn't take you long to get sliding. Good choice for a muggy day

Great fun, great experience! Loved it!!. Just what you expect from a Atlantis to be- great fun, great atmosphere, just amazing!Slides are great, some scary, some just nice and funny!Lazy river is great, I was in tears from laughing so much :) Loved every minute!

Book online for best prices!. Not usually a big water park fan....but have to say that aqua venture has changed that!Had one day stop-over in Dubai and friends had raved about this place.....we checked it out online....got quoted 205 DHM per person for the next day....but failed to book....turned up on the day and paid gate price of 275DHM each.....bother!If you're travelling with smaller kids....up to 7 or 8 ....look out for the double rings with kids seats.....particularly if you get there early...as these get snapped up v quickly and people don't let them go!...these are v useful for going of the rides and make it loads easier for younger riders.....Loads of loungers available....loads of food places too.....you can't take your own food in....we didn't know this and turned up with some fruit and snacks for the kids....and the very nice man on the check in turned a blind eye.....Great range of rides....we spent 4 hours here ...but could easily spent much longer....Like lots of these places there are always ppl trying to get you to buy extras......you don't really need them....apart from the lockers....which are very handy!....Would definitely recommend!....but book online!

„The only one disappointment in Dubai”. The water park is situated at end of famous palm beside Atlantis Hotel. The simplest solution to go there if we choose the magnet train which is very exciting by itself. We can go to the water park across the Atlantis Souk. The guests are surprised at first when they paid the tickets in advance at home via internet and they don’t have any advantage when they arrive to water park. When we arrived to water park we were driven to an incredible long lane and in a half hour we could get into and during standing in line some people tried to join the queue incorrectly way and the Staff didn’t keep an eye on them. Next surprise was when we realized we didn’t have dressing locker in dressing room in other words locker wasn’t connected to in advance paid ticket. When we bought the tickets via internet there wasn’t any opportunity to choose this option and unfortunately at the cashier the Staff didn’t remind us to buy locker. After all we had to find a free place in crowed water park beside a lot of swimming-pools with our dresses and packages full with values in our hands but it was impossible because every place was reserved. At that time we felt us very lost. In our fit of despair we found free places on sandy beach of water park, which was very nice, civilized and more calmer than beside swimming-pools. In addition in the sea we saw rays near beach. After it we started to go sliding. At slides was the next surprise because of 20-30-minutes standing in the line and some people didn’t want to stand through and tried to join queue incorrectly way too like at main gate. Naturally the Staff didn’t keep any eye on them too. It was very annoying. The buffet is very expensive which is crowns our all trial. The water park is amazing with good design but because of the shortage of good organization and the carelessness of Staff it was only one truly negative experience in Dubai.

Stay away from this park Serious and inappropriate problem resolution . I was with my two friend there and we try to enjoy our day off unfortunately we face a lot of challenges most important one the hygiene problem and the way how it was our problem resolved and the staff attitudes (Mr.Hany operations manager as per him ) and (Maurice in the line very poor attitude ) and I don't think this deserve to be visited there plenty other water park where u can be welcomed

Good place nice rides and slides but.... It's a very nice place when you can have fun and feel like a kid again.Only problems are : The staff not well trained to answer basic questionsThe floor burning your feet while walking from a slide to an other. The solution would be to put water on the floor like they do in Wild Wadi which make your day better and more relaxing as you don't have to run from a shade spot to an other ! Place to see but not from april to october if you care about your feet and don't want to get them burned by this floor on fire !

Awesome. Had an amazing day at Aquaventure.All the ride were great and some quite extreme!It's really cool going through the Shark tank.Lots to do and when we were there it was fairly quite so no queues which was a bonus.

Ridiculously expensive but nice. Entry ticket 4 times higher then at Singaporean Adventure Cove! this hits your pocket quite hard. Inside hardly you can try all rides within a day time. Water is cold if not a sunny clear sky day. Food is just french fries and burgers, we had to leave it for a family lunch at a nearby restaurant for healthy food.

Brilliant. Love visiting Aquaventure Waterpark. This is a great place to visit there is some very scary water slides and rides which I was too frightened to do but I loved the lazy river and my kids which are 23 and 25 absolutely loved it here so much so the visited several times
I love it!. I love this place, makes me feel like a kid again! Everything here was fun, lots of staff there to ensure safety. I'm definately going to make a splash on my next visit to Dubai
So much fun. I loved it here, beautiful weather, spent the day on the water slides and relaxing on the private beach, definitely worth a visit
awesome. awesome very nice way to have fun .......nice food ..nice drinks .. nice stuff always with smile on their face ...
Epic!. This has got to be the best waterpark in the world. Clean, well run, safe. Even the lazy river is crazy! Will definitely return. Have fun people!

amazing day. Me and my husband went to the Aquaventure for our birthday! very nice and well managed.
we loved so much Neptune temple with rafts!!!
well-recommended!!!!

Great fun for adults and kids alike. The Aquaventure waterpark is best visited early in the morning. Their website does not mention what time park opens, assume around 09.30am. We tried to avoid the crowds by going on a weekday (Sunday) but due to Saudi holidays, it turned out to be very crowded as the day progressed. The attractions are great and the earlier in the day the fewer people in line. Apparently birthday kids get free access in the week of the birthday; check out the website (perhaps it only applies to UAE kids).
Perfection :). For those ones who love water, fun and adventure... I love all slides but buffet food was disguisting, visit also dolphins bay :)

Incredible, Fun and Unique Experience. My Wife and I had an amazing time with perfect weather at the waterpark. It has very unique rides such as water rollercoasters, huge waterslides with drops from scary heights, and the most fun lazy river I have ever been on, complete with rapids, and multiple paths to take.I expected the park to be a little bigger, but you can still easily spend an entire day and get on all the rides. Beware of long lines during peak seasons as with any park.

water logged fun for all. Aquaventure is excellent for all ages from waterslides to meandering down river on an inflatable tube all ages are catered for in this waterpark, many tourists wearing normal bathing costumes set aside a whole day to enjoy all the park has to offer
brilliant day out. A great waterpark with loads to do. The rapids are so fast and great fun. The lazy river has big waves going round which carry you around quite fast. The Poseidon ride is amazing

Great Day Out. Visited waterpark as part of benefits staying in Atlantis,Kids had a ball and so did we.Plenty to keep you occupied for the day from the lazy river to tornado alley(and will keep you cool on a hot day)Tip:Don't sit under under the bed canopies as it get really hot/humid.We didn't have any food but there is plenty of choice.All in all great fun!!!!

Good Fun for Kids. Its a good fun for kids. Its bit overpriced but worth visiting once. If you are visting Abu Dhabi then visit Water Park there instead of Atlantis. That's better.Ensure you don't carry any food as they will throw out everything. Food is availiable inside including Jain meals thou bit expensive . All rides are excellent
Amazing experience! . This is by far the best waterpark I've ever experienced, lotsa crazy rides, the place is huge to roam around, lots of chairsa nd sun decks. Enjoyed there...
Short and Quick.... Amazing place, was not very packed when we were there so no lines to wait in. lazy river is awesome and so is the Poseidon slide.

atlantis the best... It is a place where u can have unlimited fun. whether u are with your family or friends. This water park has many kinds of rides.
It will take you one full day to see whole water park .And i m sure that u will enjoy it.

Good Rides. Posieden revenge is good .. Access needs to be improved ..Should have more visibility to Atlantis as well. You have to carry your tubes .. this is not good .. in other water parks you the the tubes at the spot.

Very good. My wife and I went today and had a great time. Good tips if your going:1. Go Sunday to Thursday inclusive to avoid local weekend days which are Friday & Saturday. 2. Go on the water slide rides first until you have had enough. After that do the single or double blow up ring rides later. This avoids any queues. The ring rides take about 2 hours to complete the whole lot. Great fun. When you get your double ring just keep hold of it and drag it off to all the chutes and rapid rides you want until you have had enough. 3. Take bare essentials to avoid humping stuff there and back unnecessarily 4. You can take waterproof cameras phones and selfie sticks with you on the rides !!!!!! Good luck you don't loose it down a Shute. 5. Don't bother with the unlimited souvenir drink container. It's not worth the price and you still have to pay a reduced amount to refill. You will be to busy on the rides etc. 6. By tickets from your hotel they are a little cheaper. 7. Plenty of sun lotion 8. Leave aquarium till last. It only takes about an hour to go through when you have had enough of rides. I've done loads of water parks and although this isn't the biggest we still had a good day there and didn't bother with a locker just took enough cash to eat drink and get back to hotel.

a relaxed day with the kids. it was a relaxed day with our kids!we had fun at the slides and the kids just loved the whole surrounding!For families with younger kids there not so many slides to enjoy! I think that kids that are not afraid to use the slides alone have more things to do!Also, I beleive the prices are really too high!It s a pity one has to pay so much to enjoy a day with the whole family there! Not only the entrace fees but also the food is very expencive!I beleive if you have kids at younger ages( 5-9) you should try the wild wadi since it is so much cheaper and for these ages the kids have more activities to enjoy!

Fun fun fun!. Myself and my partner thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and will most certainly be back again at this water park. The best thing about the water park was the way the lockers were issued. No keys or anything of that sort they give you a wristband that's water proof and you scan it against the reader in the locker room and it opens. The locker facility is an added extra in the few diferent types of day packages you can purchase on arrival.As a non swimmer I was quite nervous but I had so much fun and the water really wasn't that deep. There are a whole load of stairs everywhere, which could be tiring at times but all in all I had a fantastic time and will definitely be back. The lack of queues was an added bonus we could just breeze through and get on the rides with no hassle. If any ladies are curious about what to wear, anything goes. Bikin's and swimsuits but be mindful of cover ups as they won't let you on the rides in them, health and safety I guess.There's staff everywhere if you need any assistance and they're so friendly and welcoming it made the day so fun.

Exceptionally well laid out water park. We had a fantastic day at Aquaventure, all the rides were open and it wasn't too crowded (Longest wait time was 3 - 4 minutes).I have been to a few water parks but this is by far my favourite as we only rarely had to get out of the water!! Many of the rides are intertwined so that you can transition from one to another in the water rather than getting out and climbing stairs (There is some of that though!).The river that circled the whole park was great with actual rapids to wake you up a little. The open stretches needed a little more current to push you along but it wasn't a hardship at all.Lifeguards were positioned every 10m or so and were all very friendly with a smile & a wave as you bob past. The staff in the water at the start of all the rapids were also exceptional.Great day overall, only doing a few rides more than once we spent around 6 hours at the park.NB: For families - you don't have to exit through the gift shop!! This seemed like a great idea for those with kids who want everything.
great fun!. I visited this park on my first day in Dubai.The atractions are many, it's quite, refreshing ehehSome of the atractions were really...heart-racing! I loved it!

Fun all day. Went with a 7yr old & spent all day, she was able to go on every ride, although I didn't let her go on the plunge. I did & it was scary!!Nice area for small children, lifeguards everywhere so felt very safe. Beach area is nice & very quiet considering how many people go, You can get in free if it's your birthday, you just need to print off a voucher & use within 6/7 days of birthday.

Best waterpark in dubai. Stayed in Atlantis and visited the waterpark every day!Great waterpark not to busy even though a lot of people visit every day.The park is well maintained and the staff makes your day

Visit if you are staying in Atlantis. Is the waterpark good - Certainly YESWill I pay some money specifically to go to this waterpark - NOShould you stay at Atlantis because you get a free entry here - YESCouple of slides are good/adventurous . Slides start getting repetitive, More than the slide, the view from the top (where you climb the stairs to slide) is breathtaking.

WHOOOO!. You'd be stupid not to go. Really. If you visit Dubai and don't go there… don't tell I didn't urge you to do so. Lots of fun, and you don't even have to be a suicidal maniac. Instead, you can choose a floater inner tyre and float around the waterpark in the steady slow stream and catch some sun at the same time.However: don't trust the locker room lockers, they were notoriously malfunctioning. I had a personal shocker there, when my wrist band opened a wrong locker, and only after a few retries it managed to open the one that I had rented… also, a Swede tried to lock his locker, but the door objected. Instead, use a water proof backpack or a 10 liter dive pack big enough for your sandals, shirt, shorts and sunscreen.

Very Long wait for tickets, but before arrival. We wasn't overly impressed with our visit to Aqua adventure.
