The waiting time to get our tickets was well over an hour and in the heat with 2 children this was not ideal. When we had our tickets, we arrived in the park and found that there was a long cue for each ride and my husband and son were apart from me and my 3 year old daughter most of the time as she was too small for all of the rides. The small area where our 3 year old was allowed on slides was very over crowed and no beds were available to us to relax while the children played.

Fantastic!. After swimming with the Dolphins we had the full day at the Aqua park and I must say it was fantastic! Some of the slides are for serious adrenalin junkies! Like myself! I thoroughly enjoyed this fantastic place and it is a must visit and do place for everyone regardless if your into water parks or not. It's like a Alton Towers theme park but in water. Really enjoyed it and will definitely be back.
atlantis. try the water part its expensive but the rides are amazing, beutiful made in palm jumeriah, try to reach by 10 atleast

good but not enough. Aquaventure has about 15 or more rides out of which only a couple were thrilling for adults which children are not allowed, leap of faith & poseidons revenge.Children will enjoy shark attack where on a slide you come out through a glass tunnel surrounded by sharks, piranhas, stinger & other fish. Next time choice would be wild wadi waterpark as there is more bigger rides, about 30 plus to enjoy from including surfing board one of the very few from around the world. Price is fairly same for both.

Best waterpark ever!. We were in Dubai in the middle of march 2015. Weather was perfect. We decided to leave Waterpark for our last day just to have a great end of our long travels. And were totally right. We booked our tickets just a night before. 300 AED per person for Aquavernture plus aquarium. Waterpark opens at 10 am. At 10.30amp were already trying all the slides. And no lines at all. It was a weekday. We tried all the attraction (not only once) by 1pm. It was wonderful!Aquaventure offers you to rent a GoPro if you don't have one. Female and male bathroom with lockers are very clean and new. On the waterpark's territory you can find a lot of food kiosks, restaurants and clothes/beauty shops. Please check the official website for more details.My only tip is not to wear a bathing top with buckles. You may risk to hurt your back.Rather than that it was fabulous!

Awesome!. There was so much to do and it was really cool. I went on the leap of faith and it was so exhilarating! Make sure you have a suitable swimwear for it as they don't let you wear tshirts. They also kahf splashers for children which my son loved! We were staying at the Atlantis so were allowed in early which was perfect.

very cool. very nice water park.. it is a bit crowded. we stayed in the ticket queue for 1.3 hours! suggest strongly to take an online tkt before going. the water park was fit for all ages. even the little ones had a lot of fun.
Wonderful!!. Do not miss on the Shark Tunnel! Also, get a combo tickets for the WaterPark and the Aquarium known as The Lost Chambers. Very Beautiful inside with full of Ocean lives preserved well.

Best waterpark in Dubai - see the sharks and rays up close!. My second trip to Dubai, this time with my adult son. We were there February 2014 and the weather was a little mild, so when you are standing at the top of a ride waiting to go and you are wet, the afternoon breeze was a little cool. Regardless we visited a couple of times as we were staying at Atlantis. Aquaventure has something for all ages and lots of variety and is worth a visit if you are staying at Atlantis. It can get very busy and crowded, but that's typical of waterparks anywhere in hot climates.Staff/lifeguards were everpresent and helpful. The park has some really innovative rides where you go under/through water tunnels and see the rays/sharks/fish up close so that's pretty cool.

AMAZING!!. This Water park has entertainment games for kids, family and also for the most adventurous. It has a lot of original water games and staff was very nice and helpful. It also has a beach which has the view of the most important buildings in Dubai and the water is just amazing. It was the best experience in Dubai.

Great family fun - even for a toddler. We used Aquaventure (the waterpark) almost everyday for a week as we were staying at The Atlantis and particularly liked the "buggy' service to take you there. At Aquaventure our two year old tried out the Rapids ride as well as the Splashers kids area. It was great having this quite literally on our door step (East Tower Atlantis is beside the entrance) and all of us had fun there. The loungers by the splashers area do get really busy and we preferred to use the quieter pool loungers up near The Tower Of Poseidon. We went up regularly to Dolphin Bay and Sea Lion Point to see the dolphins and sea lions but decided in the end not to do an "experience" as I think our son was too young to appreciate it. On a previous visit to Dubai my husband and I had fed the rays in the shark lagoon and thoroughly enjoyed the session. The food wasn't a culinary highlight at Aquaventure but we didn't expect it to be, its never good at any other theme park either. The beach was immaculately clean and incredibly quiet throughout the day, we loved being the first to make foot prints on the freshly raked sand. Getting a lounger on the beach really was no problem at all. Overall a really great water park.Only critique would be for more "family friendly/baby" changing facilities including nappy bins etc.

Great fun!. A varied, unique waterpark! Attendants everywhere for your safety, if you like water, this place is so much fun! Slides, rides, you name it! Especially if you have kids, they will love it!
mind blowing. Brilliant, must for all visitors to dubai. The rides are amazing and breathe taking. The condition is that you have to be in swim suit

Much better (but different) to Wild Wadi - worth visiting both. If you only have time for one waterpark then head to Atlantis and go during a weekday (much quieter). Wild Wadi is still very good (mostly solo-rides) but not as "fun". If you have time, go to both!There are so many fun and varied rides to choose from, which will keep you busy all day.There are group-ride and solo-ride areas, along with a few inflatable ring slides to choose from. If you're too dizzy, or exhausted from all the excitement, there's a nice beach and sea to chill in.Advice: Be prepared for a long entry queue, go during a weekday. Food can be expensive, but there are some more affordable restaurants in the far corner of the park. Check the maintenance schedule (January I think, when the entire park shuts done).
Well geared up for family fun. Loved the giant rubber ring ride around the rapids. Just so much fun! Safety first priority with life guards everywhere. This is two people in their early 50s talking!

Fun fun fun!. Absolutely loved this place!!! At first I thought there wasn't much to it till we found the rapids and the slides! We had the best day ever here! The rapids were amazing and you could into this area all day and never get bored!! The slides are really scary and fun- some were in the dark and really thrilling! Would love to go back again! This was the highlight to our holiday.
If you like theme parks you will love it, but..... ...I thought the place was awful. Unbelievably busy - poor signage and just couldn't wait to get out!
Great fun!. Great family fun in a spectacular setting.Loved the fact that we were able to eat at the famed Ronda Locatelli for lunch and allowed to resume activities. Beautiful beach a bonus too.

A must do. This was fantastic fun and also relaxing on the lazy river. Food was delicious and such a good selection - the Laksa was divine.
Great way to wind down
what an experience. have never seen fishes so close. amazing fishes...extremely beautiful..sharks and other fishes..so different..such variety...wow

get there early. amazing but not for the feint hearted. I hate rollercoasters and lets just say I've had my lifetime fix of them after visiting here! lockers are small so cannot really be shared. great value for money. could do with maybe slightly better signposting as towards dolphin bay outside barracudas there is a whole new area of hellraising slides, and, its not really clear that a rubber ring is needed for most. would definitely go back but imagine queues will be a nightmare in UK school holidays/easter and Fridays and Saturdays. we booked in advance for sunday (Dubai's Monday - they are all back at work) so this helped and queues were non existant. take own towels to avoid more cost. the 'peetza' at barracudas is fab and great value.go go go - from a waterpark hater!!!

Great fun!. had a great day out here with our two adult sons who immediately regressed to the age of 15 and dragged me with them! Expensive add one for towels, lockers etc and so come prepared!A tiring day up and down steps, especially as we didn't ever have to queue (it was a Tuesday) and so once down a slide we were back up another!
Great waterpark. One of the good waterpark in Atalntis, Dubai.... Though it doesn't have huge numbers of rides/slides but the present rides are very good.....
INCREDIBLE. THis was such an amazing experience!!! you must see this. Absolutely amazingly beautiful fish and exotic fish that you would never see anywhere else

Very Nice Experience. Dubai has 3 main water parks, Wild Wadi, Yas water world and Aquaventure.I can say that the three of them are great and fun, Aquaventure is the second in my opinion.It's vast and big, probably you will miss some activities if you didn't make attention but you will enjoy evey moments.Prices are not exactly like they keep mentioning in the ads because at the door you will discover than locker are not free, towels are not free, any additional request as well (fair enough, but when they mention 242AED and up, it's not practical unless you will carry all your stuff with you and keep them on the table while you're away!)

Fun day. We had a great day at the waterpark tickets FOC via our hotel. Compared to other water parks visited in the USA this park is smaller but still good fun, well organised, fast food averagely priced. You will need to hire towels and lockers for the day (2xtowels 1xlocker 80diram approx). Worth a visit.
Tonnes of fun. You get the benefits of the waterpark and the private beach! We went on a Monday so the place was not crowded. There are plenty of waterslides and pools for a great time.

Such a fun place. I spent my second day of Dubai visit in this Park. Amazing rides. I love water and i love slides so very good for me. Lots of fun and scary rides. You can even go to the small beach. Very fun. We booked ticket online which saved us long queue on admission. Lockers and changing room are great spacious and we could actually get on all the rides without queuing for hours. Poseidon's revenge was the most scary one but glad i did it and do try Leap of Faith. For AED 45 you can get a meal deal as well and i highly recommend taking go pro. All our photos turned out amazing. It is a bit pricey at AED 200 per day but they give you memory card for free and you capture all your fun moments on it.

Amazing watermark but very expensive. This water park is superb. It is full of ring rides and has a not so lazy river that is 2.4km long with conveyor belts that take you up so that you never have to get out. It also has a pretty spectacular aquarium, through which two of the rides go through in glass tubes. You can also dive with sharks, swim with dolphins etc. It is very expensive to get in though - 250Aed ish. Food and drink inside the park is also a extremely expensive and try won't let you take your own in. It is worth the visit though.

Dubai's Best Water Park. Get the adrenaline pumping with record breaking rides and slides, get up close and personal with sharks and rays or kick back and relax on 700 metres of pristine private beach or in the new exclusive reserved seating areas. Come and get your thrills, spills and divine relaxation at Aquaventure Waterpark.

Great day of fun. This park is a wonderful place to take the kids! There is just so much for them to do and it is so well laid out. We were there from 10.30 till almost closing time and my grandchildren were on the go the whole time. They loved it!
Cool respite.. A great spot for the young at heart and families. Would be very welcome to cool down on a hot day. Well worth a visit just to see the dolphins at Dolphin Bay.
Loved it!. Fantastic rides, incredible facilities and very helpful staff. The only downside is that the food is really expensive.

Waterpark. We won two tickets to this park in a competition. As an elderly couple we found the park to be okay to look at but not to participate in. It would be really good for younger people or a young family with plenty for them to do. Some of the rides looked pretty amazing for the younger ones.

Amazing day out. The new Poseiden ride is the scariest water ride ever!! Also the new raft ride next to it is also great (can't remember the rides names). As usual, the "lazy river: (called the rapids!) is a great way to spend an hour floating around

A lovely place to spend time with family. Lot of space to enjoy and have fun. Lots of eateries...but too overpriced food and water. We pay almost 4 times what we pay outside for food and water. Its clean lots of water activities and love the place.Dolphin encounter on the other hand is over priced. Especially with kids they should give a little more time and the photographer who clicks the pictures is not very friendly.

You must try "The Leap of Faith" Waterslide.. My wife and I were staying half board at the Atlantis the Palm Hotel so we had free admission to this amazing Aquaventure Waterpark. We visited here in July 2012. There is plenty to do for adults and children. If you want to chill out on the water try the lazy river as most of it is calm, but watch out there is parts you can get put off-balance and overturn. You can sunbathe beside the pools (if you can bare the heat and not fry or pass out). Try Aquaconda, the world's largest waterslide (it was at the time any how) in the Tower of Poseidon. If you are brave try "The Leap of Faith" waterslide in the Tower of Neptune, which is 9 storeys high. You initially slide down the vertical waterslide then pass though a clear plastic pipe (there is small sharks swimming around the outside of the clear plastic pipe) and at the other end you drop out into a small pool. You get a great view of the park and the hotel complex from the top of this attraction. A great place to pass the day. You really need to spend a few days here.
Loved it. A very nice day for adults and children. The rides are awesome. You actually need more than a day to experience it properly.
so much fun. I'm not usually a water park person! Not a lover of water slides but this place was great!! Was such a great day!

Great Water Park - Better Suited to Older Kids. My family of 4 stayed at the Atlantis and visited the water park almost every day. The facility is extremely well maintained and service is exceptional (yes, there is actually service at a water park). The rides were very good but tailored for older more "gung-ho" kids. There is one large little kids play area and the lazy river has parts that are very, very calm (as in you pretty much need to move your self). However, there are no "rides" that are suitable for younger kids (eg. 6 or 7 years old) - even in a two seater float with a parent.

Dancing with dolphins. Went there with family of 3. Youngest is 2. They were mesmerized. It is quite moving. Dolphins are sensitive, playfull beings. Definitely recommend trying. The environment a bit too commercial

Great fun for families. The Installations and attractions are great. It is fun for the entire family. The best is the rubber float rings. Very nice ride: close your eyes in the dark tubes. It is very good. It is a nice added value to the high Atlantis hotel prices.

Adults reliving childhood!. One day in the Aquaventure just was't enough for me and my husband to fully enjoy it all. We have done it all, well shall i say my husband and his friend done it all i stayed away from the Poseidon's revenge - pretty much vertical fall through a see through pipe :-) We started with the slow moving rubber ring river rides. We have also went to the Zoomerango and oh my got, my adrenaline has shot through the roof (mind you i didn't do the Poseidon's revenge nor the Slitherine and leap of faith so not the highest adrenaline drivers). I have gone on to the double water coasters which was great. We had so much fun and not enough time. I'm glad we have gone in November though because it was still really hot but nothing like in the middle of summer. So if you are not a great lover of 50+ degree celsius then plan it from October. Also the fruit huts near the beach are amazing, i had a virgin pina colada in a pineapple, absolutely beautiful. If you are looking for some nice eating places though you might struggle as there is lots of fast food places and not anything posh. If you are in Dubai you definitely should visit just get there early enough so you have longer to play around :-)

Whooooooshhh :). It was beautiful experience at the Waterpark, especially after all the enthusiasm and adrenaline rush from the Ferrari World rides. Yes we were pretty tired as we spent the morning hours in Ferrari World and then set off to the Waterpark. Could not try out all the rides but whatever we did was amazing. Just that it gets toooo crowded by the afternoons, so I would suggest having a separate day trip only to Aquaventure Waterpark so that you have enough time to experience the fun it has.

Best waterpark in UAE. Lot of fun and plenty of activities, ideal for families, beach access is included for hum don't like to slide around in rubber ring all day long. Food & Beverage available for purchase.A must visit location for a funny day.
Atlantis water park. Good water parkBut would be very expensive for a family if not staying at Atlantis Rides and slides were excellentNo waiting in early march
Loved it. Sit in the rubber rings, and float down the rapids, great fun. Better though, arrange ray feeding in advance. Having big rays swarming round your legs sucking food is terrific fun.

Love love love!!!!. Me and my fiancée spent the whole day and absolutely loved it. We did go on a Monday so the park was not very busy which was great. As there was no waiting time for any of the rides. Avoid coming on a weekend as I hear it is rammed. Also, rather than hiring a towel, just bring your own from your hotel and save yourself AED40!

2nd greatest, Wild Wadi is better. By all means, go visit this park if you have an opportunity, but for pure water fun, I think Wild Wadi is better organized and offers a bit more fun.Aquaventure is larger, has fancier architecture, and the rides are marginally higher... But larger area of the park means that you'll be spending more time walking from ride to ride, and less time riding. I took one point away for awkward organization - many things are rather inconvenient and not thought through. I.e. you come to a ride, and find that there are no balloons required to ride, to find the balloons, you need to walk to the other end of the park, wait for an appropriate balloon to swim by and fish it out of the water, competing with other people who are trying to do the same. This all takes away time from riding, and actually quite annoying. People start saving balloons, because getting them is such a hassle, and this exacerbates the problem of finding one that's available.

Kids loved it.....me not quite so..... We had entry complimentary as part of the Dolphin Experience and I did become slightly annoyed at being asked if we were hotel guests or not...No we are not....relevance please? Anyway as water parks go, we had a good mix to do with kids of different ages but there was no 'chill' area. At Wild Wadi, the wave pool is a central meeting point that is very pleasant to sit and hang out. At Aquaventure, all the lagoons seem to link in a way we did not work out and we kept losing each other, not so relaxing. If you are going to pay to go in, I would recommend Wild Wadi instead.

Horrible Service. We were visiting family in Dubai and decided to go and check out the waterpark. We got there at around 9:15am and the lines were snaking around with chaos everywhere. Even though we purchased our tickets on-line, we had to line up for the pickup, which is fine, but can they make the process faster. We stood in line for over an hour. First the staff told us to stand in one line, then when we asked why its taking so long, they made us stand in another line. Believe me, I was not the only one getting so frustrated. There were so many families not happy with the waiting time. When we get to the counter, they asked us to produce my husband's credit card, which we were not carrying at the time. They refused to let us in to the park. No where on their email mentioned for us to bring our credit card. Apparently they needed the credit card to verify the purchase. Since we didn't have it, they cancelled our purchase and would not let me use another card that I had on me. They asked us to leave the park as it was very crowded. The staff was extremely rude and not helpful. It was total chaos!!!! I would never return to this waterpark again. Went home after wasting almost 3 hours trying to get into the park. Hope those who go there have a better experience.
Great Lazy River. Great water park. Plenty of sunbeds, and lots of lifeguards on duty. lazy river is great, best one I've been on. Food is good quality for fast food.

Incredible Water Park. We are a family of 2 adults and a 21 year old daughter who have literally travelled the world. This park was clean, well laid out, has direct access to a wonderful beach with helpful, friendly staff members posted everywhere. Lots of rides and diversions available for any age group. We were there on the first Monday in March so we had beautiful weather with no crowds. We have been to Disney water parks and while one reader said they were better, we do not agree. This is the place to spend a wholesome, fun day in a safe, immaculately clean environment.

Great fun, thankfully not crowded. Loved the fact that the park was not packed with people and hence did not need to queue more than 5 minutes for a slide. Staff were super friendly and were happy to share a laugh with you. Disliked the greedy prices for food - Over $25 for a burger, chips and drink. Food was great quality, but it was hard to swallow when you know what it was costing.

4 words...brilliant,amazing,unforgettable,a paradise!!!. Iam really thankful to be a part of atlantis team.they gave us a free ticket for aquaventure waterpark as one of our benefits.today we are celebrating the birthday of one of my closest friend and one of my sisters.iam really happy coz i made her day which is my aim for inviting them to be here.aquaventure is such an amazing and unforgettable experience!you will feel that you are VIP.everything was provided.the place are neat.staff are very Approachable especially kenyan and filipino people.iam really thankful for this nice opportunity and everlasting experience that you made to myself and to my special friends.Keep it up guys!rides are all safe and amazing.view was such a paradise.a place which bring you in paradise!gorgeous...really perfect!added to that even you leave your stuff it will be really safe.everything was organize.some few comments regarding with the ticketing staff just give smile and warmth welcome to visitors.the one who assigned in main entry was rude.staying even for 1 hour was really okey for my friends dont be treat like you doesnt want us to be there.it was late.but we want to celebrate the bday of my friend.

Best water park ever!!!. Highlight of our trip. It really cools you down in the heat of Dubai. Went on all the rides and just about finished all of them before chilling on the beach with cool drinks to watch the sunset! Smashing.

Fun day out. We visited as 2 adults on a Thursday in February. No queues at the entrance around 11am (after asking for directions from the monorail, signs would be useful!), and we easily got tickets & electronic lockers. We eventually found a way to enter the lazy river on inflatable rings and enjoyed touring the park and going through the rapids. Then we tried the water slides, which were great fun, especially Slitherine where you race each other down twisty tubes. We enjoyed lunch of hotdog, fries & onion rings which were freshly cooked and generously portioned. The park had got busier and we struggled to find a lounger as lots of people had reserved them. A fun day out, even with no kids and we spent around 5 hours there.

Great Waterpark - very safe!!. Visited this Park with my wife and boys (11/15). We all enjoyed ourselves greatly. The thing that stands out is the life guard crew. Everywhere there could be even the smallest risk crew is posting. During our stay there was training for the life guard crew ongoing. As we are from a country were each and everyone learns how to swim life guards are rare. But as this isn't the case every where its gave us a very comfortable and safe feeling.The slides aren't only joy for the kids but also for the parents. Direct access to the beach area is also very nice,

For big kids of all ages!. Visited in June. The weather was pretty hot so Aquaventure seemed the ideal way to spend a day. TOP TIP ... If you do visit during the HOT summer months, buy yourself some cheap flip-flops to wear whilst your there. The ground is too hot to walk around bare footed. We saw a lot of people running from one ride to another to avoid burning their feet. Take your footwear off and carry them onto the rides with you. Don't leave them at the entrance to a ride as often the ride finish in a different place to where it started.The rides are fantastic! The rides are safe and the staff are friendly and helpfull. All ages are catered for. The Lazy River is very popular with everyone and as you can access it from various points around the park it means that you can get on or off wherever and whenever you like. Don't be fooled by the name though as this Lazy River has RAPIDS around ever other corner and an alternative route which takes you on a crazy ring roller coaster before throwing you back onto the River again!Overall its a brilliant day out and with lots of facilities onsite. If you do get a bit bored with the rides you can find a quiet sunbed on the private beach with stunning views of Dubai!

Decent water park with no idea for execution. Family trip to Atlantis water park. Already have visited Atlantis in Bahamas. We had reserved water park tickets online. When we arrive the next day, first there is almost no one around to explain the chaos and lines. The long line right into hallway is for ticket purchase. If you have reserved online walk ahead. Once I was up front there was another line for online purchases. You still have to get to a window and get bands. This took us close to an hour. Yep hour to wait in line after having purchased tickets online. The execution and functioning of staff at this point is absolutely disarray and chaotic. They have no idea what they are doing and how to handle crowds. Apparently the day we went was busier than normal. The staff can answer questions but they are clueless and lost. People were allowed to cut through the lines, there seemed so much chaos which was unexpected. At the tickets counter I fail to understand why would the staff be sitting behind high glass. Communicating with them through the high glass is challenging. Not to forget English is not their first language. You have to foot money for towels and locker. Advise carry your own towel. After 1 hour I had my bands finally.You can have all the ideas and money to execute the ideas, but execution and customer service is something that cannot be bought. When you enter inside, there are no clear signs of where you would pick towels or locker. When I went to the staff for a map, they said I would need to go back to the ticket counter, Really, you are going to tell me that after 1 hour wait at the counter. Again no idea of execution and clueless staff. The park itself is nice. Rides are good for kids. Nothing scary. My 8 year and 10 year old enjoyed the park. Water rides were relatively less crowded. Somehow water was cold, maybe to maintain the levels. Food is available inside and there is decent variety. Had a good time inside the park but definitely different story outside the park.

What fun!!. We went to here with visitors from the Uk who were amazed the weather was nice enough to go to a watermark in November! :-). They were blown away with the scale and layout of thus park. Our good experience started either the queue to get in - it moved quickly and the staff were helpful and nice to us. We used our entertainer tokens so felt like we got a bargain too! The park wasn't too busy and we didn't need to wait in any queues for the rides. The lazy river is really fun! Personally I didn't go onto many of the bigger rides but our group did and they LOVED them hahaha they went on the same rides about 5 times each! Will most definitely come back.

Great for Kids. This water park is located at the Atlantis hotel where guests in the hotel can use it for free.Others can buy an entrance ticket and make use of the watery park. It is essentially for children who can enjoy it most and adults can also have some fun. There are twirly slides to zoom down into the water.

What a waterpark!. We were there as it was free to go with our hotel stay. There is two way to get to the waterpark, by golf buggy or walk indoors.Golf buggy : From the main entrance walk outside towards the pool and the beach. Walk pass the pool there is a little road. There is loads of golf buggy running and get in anyone u will get to the different part of the waterpark. They will ask you for you room number and give u a paper waistband as entrance ticket. Then u will get off on the beach side of the park. There nearest changing room is near the hotel side tho so if u wanna get there to get changed, walk from the hotel via the below instruction.Walk indoor from hotel to waterpark: go towards big aquarium to the lost chamber entrance. From there you can see the entrance through the waterpark. ( the exit between Asia pacific and burger place) once entered turn left and change room is there.There is loads of other place u can get changed. You have to pay for the locker inside tho. Security is good and leaving stuff behind is very common. Just remember to pick them back up! Most rides requires height of 120cm so be prepared if children are too young they might not be able to go on some rides. None of my two daughters can swim and we tried the Ripids and the bubble that my husband and older daughter did turn over and the life guards were there in a spit second. There are at very goods. They don't dive in for everything tho, coz loads of kids are playing games with them. But when there were a real danger, they are on it. Walking around in swim suits bare feet are very common and ppl not swimming have full cloths on with no problem. Anything goes so enjoy!

Second time here and still loved it! . I first visited on a conference in May and only had a limited time here but this time visited with my partner and loved it! The lazy river is great but the other rides you do on the rubber rings were also fab! Such a great day out for all ages and groups! As it was two of us didn't do it but if revisited in a group would def look at a cabana in future

Poseidon's Revenge Is Just Simply Wow!. A must visit when you go to Dubai! Great for kids, teens and those who can still go to the highest slides... They say that the Leap of Faith is the scariest but for me and for most of the people I know who have tried it, it's Poseidon's Revenge. Every slide is worth a try. Take your time in climbing the stairs. Just relax in the river with your floaters when you get too tired.Before going inside the park, get a locker for your stuff. You may rent a towel too but I suggest that you leave first the receipt in your locker and claim it just before you take a shower. You don't need a towel going around the park and someone might just take it for their use if you leave it on the daybeds available for all the guests. You may also leave your slippers inside your locker. It's actually better to leave all your stuff in your locker. Just bring your water proof cameras or you may purchase those zip lock bags for your phones with camera and for money just in case you get hungry or thirsty.After going around the park, you may proceed to the beach to relax before leaving the park.

Great pleasure. Earlier this month I was invited by a friend to visit this amazing Waterpark. It is huge and very well organised. We had a wonderful time and enjoyed all the attractions! No time to get bored.
Great day out!. Second time at Aquaventure and had another great day out. Plenty of good rides but can get very busy. Getting very pricey now and the price of lockers is a joke.

A must visit place. Aquaventure is situated in The Atlantis in Palm Jumera . Its a must visit place if you love waterpark and slides. Have amazing slides and you have option of swimming with the dolphins and other sea animals.

royal swim with dolphins and waterpark. We booked the royal swim with the dolphins and this included entry to aquapark.we spent whole day here and it was great the rides were really good not loads of them but enough. We hired a water camera from park 200 dinars and you get the memory card. We did the dolphin swim in the afternoon it was an amazing experience, expensive but worth it. I was just going to spectate but read reviews that you don't get a good view, but spectators could stand on beach side and had great view. I am glad I chose to participate even if it cost me 500 dinars for memory stick for photos. The food and water is very expensive but you can take 1 bottle of water in with you. Massive queues for taxi when park closed so maybe arranging your taxi for return a good idea.

Good times. I have just been here this month but have also been twice in the past years.I love this place and gotta say its constantly improving. Every time I have been the ques have been reasonable times, the lockers are a little bit of a walk located at the entrance of the park, entry includes private beach access too!We hired a go pro camera with the head holster which cost 200AED this came handy especially underwater.

Great day for the kids. The kids really did have an incredible time here, it's a nice atmosphere with literally hundreds of staff watching every activity to check on kids and their safety. Only minor downside was lack of good/large locker space for people visiting from outside the hotel like us. Pack light!

life time experience. just enjoy enjoy and enjoy. awesome rides. cool place to hangout.How to reach: taxi is always available. If u are a budget traveller, get on a metro and get down at Damac properties Metro station. walk through linked foot bridge for 2-3 mins and get to Dubai Marina tram station. Take a tram (Aed 3/free if punched within 30 mins from punch out from metro) to Palm Gateway station. Walk for 3-4 mins following the sign boards and get to connected monorail station. Get on Monorail (aed 15 one way/head or Aed 25 updown/head) and get down at last station which is atlantis and u will be at the water park.Book the tickets online as its cheaper than on spot booking. we didnot go to Dolphin Bay, but booked for one day pass in the aqua park. after entry all rides are free. Take ur own swimming gear and towel. This will save u money. u may hire locker small or big as per ur luggage u are carrying. smaller lockers are good enough to keep clothes, showes, towels, water bottes for 2/4 ppl. u may carry water inside but no food. u have to buy food there. buying food coupon at the ticketing counter is cheaper. Food portion are big. One food coupon is enough for 2 ppl. we purchased individual food coupons and ended up in wasting half the food.All the rides are good. Leap of faith and poseidon's revenge are quite scary but fun once u complete it. Those who say no other rides are good except these two, dont believe them, either they are completely bored of life or showing off or on drugs.its worth every penny. go for the full day i.e from 10 am till 6 pm. else u wont be able to complete everything.
The perfect day for kids and adults. What a place fantastic fun fun fun . So many great water activities a must to do when you go to Dubai

Our boys loved it. We used an entertainer voicher, so that kept the price down. No queues in Feb, nice weather, great facilities for a 5 and 11 year old (both water babies). Very helpful staff. Gentle rides and not so gentle rides. Gorgeous beach.

loved this place. Im not one for waterparks in general and usually go along to keep the kids happy but I really enjoyed this one as its so well organised and clean! There was just enough surprise to give us a fright but not terrifying! Well worth visiting.

Fantastic water park with tallest water slide.. This is a part of the Atlantis Hotel and guest staying at Atlantis will have free access to the park any no. of times. It is a well maintained water park with many watchful life guards. There are rides for kids and aged and the adventurous teens. A worthy place to visit/
Not as great. Can be easily skipped. Not as great. Can be easily skipped. There are 2-3 rides which are great. So you can go there if you have plenty of time.

Wetter is better. Having been to quite a few water parks in the US over the years I wondered if Aquaventure would live up to the likes of Blizzard Beach, Wet Wild etcI'm thrilled to say it did. Whilst there isn't a great deal of ride variation the rides themselves are very good. The intensity of the slides over on The Tower of Poseidon were superb. Much more thrilling than I had anticipated.Poseidon's a Revenge is one of the best water slides there is. My advice? Don't think about it and just get it the capsule.For those that are happy to just sit and sun bathe the beach there is beautiful. It offers fantastic views of the mainland with gorgeous blue sea to cool off in. There's also a lazy river you can float along in. Just be careful you don't take a wrong turning or you'll be thrown into the Rapids which again are superb.There's an area for kids, and big kids, too which looked like fun. We went for the Gold package which included your ticket, locker, towel and a meal voucher. The food was typical of any theme park but as you can't take your own in you're left with little option. Even though the website says no beverages you can take in up to a litre bottle of water, or so we were told on our visit.A great day out and highly recommended for anyone who enjoys a water park.

Best day of our holiday!. This is a must do in Dubai. There is so much to do we were there from opening to closing and still could have stayed longer. It is so clean and spotless and very well maintained.

Lots of fun in the Persian Gulf. The park is quite small, but the scenery is really beautiful, the rides are fun, the decor is worth it. The staff is friendly. There is a lot to eat when you're inside the park. You should totally spent a few hours there while in Dubai.

I hate water and I LOVED this place. Can't say enough great things about this place. Lots of rides. Short queues. Really well organised. You can't take food in so expect to delve deep into your wallet! I'm not a big fan of water, but I'd jump at the chance to go back here again. Brilliant place for a day for fun for adults and kids of all ages.

Expensive but amazing. Entrance fee is very expensive, but after we decided to go for it we didn't regret it. Maybe if you consider it as going to a theme park (like Disney) instead of going to a pool, then it puts the cost into a different perspective. The park is really amazing; it's huge and with many great rides/slides. We were on the rapids for about 30 minutes and I think we still didn't finish the whole lap. It's fun and exciting, also for smaller kids. There are many lifeguards present, it gives a very save feeling. My daughter is 4 years old and below 1m20, which meant she couldn't go on any of the slides, except for the kids area. The kids area is very cool too, but considering the entrance fee to the park I think it's best to go once your kids are above 1m20. One slide takes you through a fish tank, which was a lot of fun. So overall it's expensive, but I would still recommend it.

The Best. Without a doubt the best water park I've ever been to. Beautifully presented, clean, feels really safe with some great rides for everyone from the nervous to the most adventurous.Thoroughly recommend it for a great day out.

Nice water park. its a nice water park do not boot in advance with your agent as they will charge extra commission,just visit there and buy tickets on spot.no pre booking required and do not forget t carry towels.

Great day out. It was so nice to go to a water park that was clean safe and fun. I took my five girls age ranging from 10-18 and they all had an amazing time. They swan with the Dolphins which they loved. They still talk about it now. The staff are all cheerful and very helpful and the rides are fantastic a little daring for me but my partner and girls loved them. I was quite happy on my doughty ring on the lazy river. This water park is a must but I would advise water shoes as the floor gets extremely hot and my daughter burnt the bottom of her feet walking between the rides.

Fantasic!. You must try the leap of faith even if you scream to whole way down! We loved the tower of Poisidon especially the aquaconda and zoomerango! The lazy river and torrents and rapids are amazing, just hold on tight and take a trip round the whole park! We went every single day of our 5 night stay at the atlantis and I turned into a big kid again!!

Had a awesome time.. It's all good but the place is very expensive if you forget your swimming suit. Before you plan to visit there just be sure that you are with you swimming suit and the necessary stuffs. And I think there should be more ticket counters bcz of the crowd. Long que and a big time waste. Other than that it's all awesome. The rides and all.

Water, Water everywhere. It was great. The log floom/lazy river was relaxing and if you wanted to stay on there were river rapids at nearly every corner. The food was fantastic. There were plenty of slides and tons of room. The only problem was that we had to wait an hour and a half for a taxi. If you leave after 5 o'clock then you are guaranteed to be waiting the same amount of time for a taxi. You also want to be going to dinner early as it gets insanely busy in the restaurants so I would recommend before 12 or after 1:45. Amazing would definitely go back

Good Park But worst management I have ever seen. We have booked the tickets through a travel agent and the agent sent us tickets well before the date. We reached the park on 19th Feb at around 11.00 am. I was happy that I purchased the tickets well before as I saw a que which had more than 100 people. However that happiness faded away as I was told to stand in another q to collect the wrist bands. This Q was moving like a snail and had more than 50 people... I told him that he must be joking. I had to stand in a Q for more than 2 hrs to get the wrist band. This is the worst managed park that I have ever seen. Atlantis PLS COME TO INDIA AND SEE ESSELL WORLD where they manage it much better than you. There were senior citizens standing in a Q as well, but no senior citizen Q. Forget abt a separate Q there were no chairs where they could sit. They sat near the entrance to which the security objected by saying that this is a Five Star hotel and not a park. Let me PUT IT TO ATLANTIS, you are WORST FIVE STAR HOTEL who don't show some compassion to Elders. If the management of Atlantis is reading this review pls try to improve upon it.Inspite of me entering the park near 11, I could get inside only at 2. So half day lost. After the above frustration we entered the park. My enthusiasm was already dead. The rides are good. There are life guards at various check points who can assist people. Food within the park is expensive, but that is the case with most of the parks so no regrets. My daughter loved the slappers area and couple of rides. Over all average experience. Word of advise : If you are accompanied with kids of 4-5 years Pls avoid going to this park

Good rides but poor customer experience. The rides are cool. My 5 and 6 year old kids loved the lazy river (one with waves, one with "waterfalls"). It's all really well supervised by lifeguards and they are very friendly. It's a very expensive place though. Not only the entrance tickets are pricey, but also you need to pay separately for lockers (40 dirhams). It's worth buying food pass for 45 dirhams when you get the tickets at the entrance (you get a burger meal worth 55 dirhams for it - it's huge, can feed 2 people). We also spent a lot for taxi to and from the place as it has very poor access to the city. On the way back we had to que for a taxi for one hour! It's ridiculous IMO that they don't care for their customers better and not provide any shuttle bus to get customers to metro.

Well worth a visit. Great water park with lots to do. We booked the Dolphin Royal Swim which was great. We were told no camera's when we booked but everyone else had cameras and it turns out you can have them on the beach just not in the water.

Family fun. Great waterpark, and lovely setting, but always so many people... The only way to beat the crowds is to arrive for opening time, and stay until closing, when there are slightly fewer people in the queues... Some more options for food would be appreciated - a couple of rice meals for those who can't eat wheat...

Great for big kids too!. We've been to this waterpark on 2 different trips to Dubai (2012 and 2014). We had a blast both times, staying as long as possible. There were some queues which is to be expected, go to the main rides first as they get busier in the afternoon. The floor is scorching hot!! It's worth investing in some water shoes to protect your feet. It's quite expensive too but worth it. Food/Drinks are available, not great just standard stalls serving the usual chips and burgers etc.

Nice park not cheap . We got there it was packed. 45 minutes in a line up is a statement. The costs 285AED entrance fee no towel no locker included. The park is large and clean. You find a lot of benchs at the beach with a nice view towards Dubai Marina. A large amount of guards serve a good feeling of security. The slides stunning but the waiting time easily reachs an hour. Make sure where you line up as you might be frustrated as the slide is not the on you were expecting. Any change prior the slide was negated by the service personal. On a crowded day...check your transportation leaving the palm, as a big line up for the cabs might be given.

Great fun. We visited two days in a row whilst staying at the hotel, entry was included in our stay. The park seemed very quiet which was great for us as we didn't have to queue and got to go on everything we wanted too. Lots of different slides that I've never seen at a waterpark before. The kids area was also fantastic for our little ones. We had a great time! Lifeguards everywhere, clean and plenty of sun beds. There was only umbrellas around the kids pool and no where else which was a shame. Drinks are expensive and a kids bucket and spade worked out about £20!

Brilliant Park. An impressive water park, well organised, very clean with rides for all ages. Despite the park being very full there were no long queues to get on rides. The best lazy river we have ever experienced and as Florida fans that says something. Enjoyable and well worth a visit.
I was expecting more. It was ok but the big attraction was closed and we didn't find information regarding feeding the rays etc until it was already late.

Great water park but a real expense with no options to save some money. the waterpark was great. A real lazy persons park as you could ride back up again on your ring (which you have to grab and guard all day). The rides at the back are the best I thought with 2 high speed tubes and 2 great large raft rides. The ride through the fish tank was ok but you saw more from the outside. All in all a great day. Downsides are price and extra. You can only take in a small bottle of water each no food or snacks. This left you at the mercy of the park so have your credit card handy. Also getting there the monorail was our first plan but it's in the middle of a high rises car park and does not run until 10.10, park opens at 10 and you want to be in early to avoid the q. The pice to the monorail is much more than a taxi and the taxi was so much easier. Be prepared to q for a cab home. We stayed to the end and waited over an hour for one. In summary great park, poor access and over priced food oh and £15 for a locker for the day!
Fun. Fun for all the family, rapid rivers, slippery slides, underwater aquariums rides. Only thing is if you are not out the park before 4 you need to queue for a taxi about a 40 mins wait.

Lots of fun.. Well organized and interesting aquapark with good infrastructure around.
We were in January it was not crowded at all. There is a right place to send a day ( if weather permit) with kids.
The attraction is free for guests of Atlantis Palm hotel.

fab day out. 2 visits in 1 week really good. barracuda restaurant food fab sit up that end to get a lounger. lovely Kenyan lifeguards a brilliant family day out. LOng queues for pre booked sort this out its not good enough but otherwise great

The best in town. Hands down. Lots of rides, lots of fun. Good organization at the door. Some really thrilling experiences and the areas around the river are clean. Always a large number of sunbeds so you won't find yourself seating against some tree when you had enough. Beach is a bit lame (no wave and lots of jelly fish) but that's not why you're here anyway. Summer can be tough on feet as the walks between rides are long and the floor is boiling (bring flip flops).
Must go when in Dxb. Super fun for kids and adults, great putdoor swimming and relaxing activities, dont miss the dolphins( expensive) .
Love it. A great waterpark. Fun for everyone regardless of age. Good variety of rides. Recommend having dinner at Atlantis afterwards.

Great place, shame about the cost. Call your bank manager for mortgage extension. Brilliant waterpark with brilliant staff, but the food and beverage prices are ridiculously expensive for what is basically high street fast food (think Burger King, KFC standard). You're not allowed to bring your own food inside, so you have no choice but to buy drinks at Dhs 15 or 18 per soda and the cheapest burger meal on the menu is 75 dirhams. A family of four can reasonably be expected to spend approx Dhs 500 on food and drinks on top of the entrance fee and optional extras.There is something really irritating about big businesses that squeeze their tourist visitors so hard the pips squeak. It left a sour taste in my mouth (pardon the pun). On a plus side, you little darlings will thoroughly enjoy every moment of each ride and will love you for looking ridiculous as you pitch forward down the rapids screaming and laughing in equal measure.

Great memorable experience. Get the adrenaline with record breaking slides and rides. You can get closer to the shark. Every ride is an amazing and breathtaking experience. If you are in Dubai, do not miss going to Aquaventure.

Excellent. My 10 Year old Daughter enjoyed it so much as did my Wife and I, in fact I think we all enjoyed it as much as each other Great Fun. Exceptionally clean, well managed with helpfull staff, not to many queues and enough good quality sun beds around the whole Waterpark. Overall a real fun experience over the several times we visited, in fact 5 times in a week which must tell you something.

To feel young. It was my boy(9 years old at time) who enjoyed so much it, but I had to accompanied him so tried almost all slides of the Aqua venture Park, so crazy but I felt young. I promise to my youngest boy to return there on October.

Great fun. Visited this water park while staying at the Atlantis. Shuttle bus to and from the water park is great we were never waiting more than 10 minutes.The park is huge so lots of walking to find everything we kept topped up with lots if water as temp was peaking at 50 so hot hot but the water n the water park didnt cool u down. There were no ques as we visited first during ramadan but then again after and this was much busier.Lots of slides for all ages and great fun
Excellent experience. I visited the park two times,I enjoyed alot with my family the rides was suitable for all of us including 6 years old kid
nice experience for the hole family . I went there twice one as a couples and the other with my 3 yers son it was nice experience for the hole family I would like to go with my friends
Nice day. Enjoyed activities. Well organized, clean, and fun. Go during week day when not too busy. Fun for family and friends. Food is average, but can eat at hotel.

Such Fun even for an Oldie!!. Really well thought out and spotlessly clean aqua park. Great fun rides, some scarier than others - delicious 'fast food' and plenty of 'drink' stops. A super day out for all ages.

Great fun and great slides. We spend one day here and would go again. As people have mentioned it is quite expensive, we bought tickets at our hotel (Towers Rotana), but we still had to wait in line when we got there. One thing that was good with the prepaid ticket that we got, was that it included lunch for the same price and if you find it expensive, then this helps a bit. A couple of recommendations: -Get there when it opens, you can do a lot of the rides before it gets to crowded. It is also easier to get a sun lounger where you want. -Get sun loungers on the beach, it is quieter and nicer (not so many people). -Do not bother stopping at the changing room near the entrance, go all the way inn to the Tower of Poseidon and next to the Barracudas you find toilets, changing rooms and lockers, there are no showers here (that we found).
Thoroughly enjoyed. Water rides were fantastic and some of them scary too :) River rafting with kids was fun...............

I Love Atlantis, Its My Fave!. I have been here a few times.. I just love the place! Out of all the waterparks in Dubai (I also went to Yas Island) this is by far the best. My advise would be to pay the extra 100dhs and get the private cabana as you have lovely beds, towels, 5 bottles of water and fruit salad included along with excellent service in a private section of the waterpark. Great fun for all ages :) Such a beautiful hotel and luxury beach! Lots of cool things to do other than just go on the slides such as dolphin bay, sharks and stingrays.. many different fish and an aquarium. Also they have a zip line which is very thrilling! 10 out of 10!

Fantastic. We must have gotten extremely lucky to go to the park on an off day in the first week of Feb. It was warm enough to be wet but not a hot day. There were essentially no lines for most of the slides. We occasionally waited behind a handful of other people, but often just walked up and got on. As a result, we were able to ride all the slides many times each. My kids (ages 8 and 11) and I had a terrific time.We've been to several large water parks around the world, including the one on Sentosa Island in Singapore and the Raging Waters parks in Los Angeles and San Jose (USA). (We can't compare it to Wild Wadi, unfortunately, because that park was closed for renovation while we were here.) The variety of slides at Aquaventure were better than anything those parks have to offer. Only the "hydro-magnetic" slide in Singapore stands out as something distinctly different from what Aquaventure has to offer. Also, all of these parks have some kind of "lazy river" but the one at Aquaventure is much better because it includes some fast-moving, bouncy "rapids" sections. All in all, a great park that we'd highly recommend as long as you can go there on a day that won't have awful crowds.

Fun but over priced. It's so much fun for kids lots of activities and things to do but I think the entrance fee is over priced. Good food in all Restuarants you should go early in able to do all activities and benefit.

Aquaventure: a fun filled family water park. I have been to Aquaventure three times. April and September of 2011 as well as Decmber 2014. They were all great visits. However, in December we went during the week between Christmas and New Years Eve. It was the most packed I'd ever seen it. Having said that, the water park did not feel crowded but the line to get in was very long and it took us a long time to enter the water park even though we had purchased our tickets online. we arrived around 11:30 and were were told that had we got in as soon as they open ( which I think is either 9:00 or 9:30) we could walk right through without any lines. The other spot that was crowded as well was the long line to the leap of faith (the near-vertical drop). Nonetheless you get a nice variety of rides inside with different thrill levels plus some relaxing rides. Toddlers and young children have their own special area and the variety of food options is good. All in all its a great place to spend the day. Given the price to enter and the amount of things to do, it is recommended you go in as early as possible.

Water, water everywhere and not a drop to drink!. I / we love this place! Even in August 50c or in Dubai's winter 28c this place works. The rides and scale of the park mean that queuing doesn't even exist! A little pricey but it is worth it, book on line as the line at the ticket office can take an hour if you don't. Also get there for 9:30 am to enjoy at its best. We have two children 7 and 16 and both love it. Plenty of shade for toddlers too. Have fun!

fun place, but lack of seating. Aquaventure is one of my family's favorite waterparks. the only set-back is that there are not enough sun loungers and so seating can be a bit of an issue. this is the case whether you are a day visitor or a guest at the hotel.

Get Ready for a DAY OF FUN IN THE SUN!!!. I love Aquaventure - I typically go to Wild Wadi over Aquaventure because of the wave pool and the slides are bit more thrilling, esp the Jumeirah Sceirah, but Aquaventure has a beach (HUGE plus) the food is WAY better (How hard can it be to nail hamburgers and hot dogs?) and there are more slides - albeit a little less thrilling than Wild Wadi, but more. Now that they've added ziplining and a completely new area of slides, it's definitely worth the trip. You'll love it!
Expensive and crowded. We just went to take a look. Some people like this sort of thing! Far from Dubai at the end of the palm but the monorail trip was worth it for the view

Fun. Had good fun....will do it again...Maybe some of the staff need to enjoy what they are doing a bit more as most don't seem to be friendly or smiling. But otherwise, it is a great place & we enjoyed it.
Good but.... Not so cool for kids under 120cm because they can only do 2 things: river + kids playgroundVery crowded...

Brilliant place!. You may think this is expensive, but I would definitely recommend this. Very clean, amazing fun and great relaxing atmosphere. Staff were so friendly, especially the life guards. Can't be a easy job, but they were really nice to the kids, which added to the day. Spent 8 hours there, and could have spent longer!!!

Rubber Ring Paradise . We booked to visit Aquaventure after reading the reviews on Trip advisor and decided that it just pipped Wild Wadi on write ups. We were not dissapointed !Top tip . pre book your tickets online its 250 each for adults otherwise it's 285 if you pay on the day (plus the line is far shorter for pre bookings).The day absolutely flew . We stayed from. 11am to 5.30pm and could have done another 3 hours easily . The rides and slides are fantastic and the "leap of faith" actually made me scream and close my eyes . It's a shear drop, you reach speeds of 60kmph !.Stuff there for everyone . Plenty of rubber rings for everyone and the park is huge . There is so much there its hard to go on everything in a day . You won't be dissapointed . My wife and I didn't stop smiling all day . Fabulous attraction.

Cheep service. This place was nice : - Too small - Terribly expensive (285 dhs / person)but we had good fun - Too crowded ticket place ticket line was full and I was looking for someone to assist us unfortunately I have found one gentlemen i think name call Mr.deen and he expect something $ from us to process quick ticket. even we pay 200 AED extra money to him get quick tickets because we don’t want stay in long line but .still we had to line up for the games it’s not worth money I had pay for fast track in front gate .I was very much looking forward to this water park but ended up being very disappointed food so expensive and if we want get quick tickets we have to pay extra money to front desk agent this is so cheap service ever I had in my life. I will not recommend to anyone…

Excellent Waterpark. Great day out, clean, organised and plenty of places to sit and relax. Unfortunately my daughter had an accident on the Rapids, her first ride and badly damaged her eye. The medical staff were brilliant, gave her a thorough check and allowed to stay in the medical room and recover as long as she needed. Thanks to Lauren, Hanu (?) and sorry, can't remember name of first medic that got to us ! As it was a birthday treat, Hanu (?) made sure the rest of her stay was as enjoyable as possible and we were given a cabana, with a bowl of fruit and drinks for the rest of the day. She did manage to go on a couple of rides later in the day. The only slight problem was the life guards, they didn't seem to react when she was in trouble by getting her out of the water, but they called for assistance from medics immediately. This said, I would still recommend the park for an excellent day out.

Great day out at a price. Really enjoyed it, went on a Thursday so queues minimal and we barely waited for anything. The rides are really good fun for all ages and very well supervised and clean. It is too expensive though and to bleed you for more (or try) for things like photos and the zip wire is wearing. Slightly spoiled at the end by a 45min taxi queue. Maybe be were unlucky and failed to account for it being the start of the weekend.
Great for adults and kids. Great place for all ages or even if you want to just chill out and sunbath for the day. Rides for all ages. Our two year old loved the rapids.

Atlantis .... Its in atlantis palm, you need at least 2days to complete atlantis, evening walk at marina, aqua venture, lost chamber, shopping arena and lots to do....better plan 1 or 2 night stay at atlantis....ask for east wing corner room will have 2side view of ocean....

Best waterpark in new dubai. This is a water paradise in new dubai inside the atlantis hotel. The price is a bit high, but be sure to but the entertainer book to get a buy 1 get 1 free offer. The rides are great and a perfect day out whilst you visit Aquaventure.

Atlantis overview. You feel excited that the water park is built in Atlantis, but you cannot enter the water park through main entrance they have separate gate for Aquaventure water park, The water park is just amazing, separate area for kids water play - lazy river and many more rides to relax- you can easily spend the whole day. You can enjoy the lost chambers when u go for the water park.
Finest water Park in the World. Wooooow. You will find everything here. Best place to travel with Kids,,,enjoy and enjoy...You cant miss this place from your Dubai list of sightseeing.

Great day.. There are rides for all sort here. From scary vertical drops to gentle bobs in a ring. Be aware that you have to walk up A LOT of steps to access most though, I felt like I'd spent an entire day doing legs at the gym. (Not that I know what that actually feels like). We arrived early and left when it closed and time flew. We chose Asian food for lunch (between 35-55 dhms) and the quality was excellent. Finding a taxi at the end of the day was a bit difficult but a walk to the hotel next door sorted that easily.

most fun had in years. where do i start? went to aquaventure with girlfriend thuoght £40 was expensive but got 2 for 1 voucher from entertainer brochure, spen 10 hours here & still want to leave IT WAS BRILLIANT much better than wild wadi. better & more exciting slides& rides. if you to dubai you must visit this wonderful waterpark
Worth a visit. Dubai does everything bigger and better and waterparks are no exception. We visited the hotel one and found it excellent.
Amazing. Amazing day out with the family. Food can be expensive but apart from that the family loved it. Liked the trip on the doughnut.

Amazing value for money. We swam with dolphins and got unlimited access to the entire water park. It was an amazing day, I was shattered by the end of it all. The rides were crazy, suitable for all ages and had a good variety. A must go if you're in dubai!

Great Day. Worth the money. We went on a Monday and arrived for the resort opening. There was no queue to get in, nor any queues for any of the rides until after lunch. Even then we only had to queue for was shark attack (the ride where you finish by going through the middle of a big fish tank) and this was only 10 mins. Worth bringing a rash vest if you have one. No picnics allowed except baby food and water but food in the park wasn't too pricey considering.

Great Fun!!. My wife and I visited whilst on honeymoon today and had a wonderful time. We booked online in the UK for the dolphin experience and water park package and it was amazing. Dinitta the dolphin and her trainers were great, then we enjoyed the park and all the rides. There were hardly any queues, the staff were brilliant and we felt safe at all times due to the abundance of lifeguards. We took water in but bought lunch at 'tbj' which was reasonably priced and tasty. We were also given the free pass to the aquarium, but didn't go as we were put off by our aquarium 'experience' in Dubai mall......The only thing missing from the park is good signposts, which would make life easier there, but other than that, we were both blown away. Ps, be sure to try the 'leap of faith' if you want a thrill!!!

Fun day. Fantastic day! Would recommend buying 'skip the queue' passes and a private Cabana where your suff is looked after by your own attendant you have sun beds hammocks etc and he also gets food and drinks for you, it also comes with a lovely fruit platter at a time that suits you

A wet and wild day out. Not the greatest fan of water parks...then some are better than others.Every emirate has at least one and this succeeded Wild Wadi as Dubai's newest when the Atlantis hotel opened.Time it just right and you'll avoid the legendary massive queues and have plenty of time to test your nerves on some of the vertical plunges and gravity-defying slides.The range of food is better than similar parks and the lazy river is enormous and imaginative, if a bit slow and tedious at times.Given the choice, I'd say Yas Waterworld has more variety and innovation among its 'rides' but Aquadventure does 'big', and that includes the entry price.

A fun day trip. Would recommend catching the monorail in and spending the day here. The park has water slides (most are tube slides) as well as a beach and I think this sets it apart from the Wild Wadi. Do the shark attack ride - was thoroughly impressed with bobbing through a glass tunnel with fish, sharks and stingrays around.

Sunshine and waterslides. Had been waiting for this visit for a while and was expecting amazingness! And it was! loved the rides and the long river with different paths to choose from as you were floating away. The few things we were annoyed by was the fact that the locker that we rented to put our stuff in was close to the entry, and had to go back over there to get money for food, and then go all the way back there to put them away to be able to go to the slides again. It was pretty awesome anyway. And i will go back there next time I visit Dubai!
great place. there are around 6 slides with great fun.You don't need to wait for seconds.I love this place and will visit anytime.

Slides.. I'm not a huge waterpark aficionado, but I really enjoyed Aquaventure. The five hours spent there (minus lunch) went super fast going through the slides. The river around the park was fun but maybe a bit too easy. Not much queueing to the slides, but our visit might have been a bit off-season.Advice #1: try to have at least five hours there. Preferably more.Advice #2: try the Poseidon’s Revenge slide. Drop down a tube for two seconds. Reach up to 60kmh. Be sure that you are a dead man. Don't die after all. Repeat.

Half the park closed. Half the park was closed for maintenance/construction when we were there, so there weren't that many rides available. We had great fun nevertheless, but nothing spectacular.
The park is really beautiful though, and has a very nice beach area where we went to relax after the thrill of the rides.

This is a proper and fun waterpark!. I don't go to waterparks very often but I really enjoyed this place much more than Yas Waterworld.This place has a very wide range of rides if you want to do more than soak up the sun on a sunbed or while cruising the lazy river.If you're not faint-hearted, try their high-drop water slide where the ride starts with a floor trap door to release you with an adrenaline rush.Also, take some time to go to their private beach. A chance to swim in the Arabian Gulf from within the Palm Jumeirah.
Great fun. Great fun for all ages! By far the best waterpark i have visited, it has a range of waterslides to suit everybody and a private beach.

Really fun rides. I went with my husband and son - Poseidon's revenge ride is super scary but just do it. No waiting in lines when we visited early Dec in the morning. Get some money added to a wrist tag at the gate so you don't have to keep going back to your locker. Great for teenagers and fun at heart adults.

Great water park. If you're staying at Atlantis you get free access to this fabulous waterpark. It is absolutely spotless and has a dolphin bay and sea lions which you can access for an extra, quite hefty charge.

Very nice rides but expensive!. They got some really nice and crazy rides and the place is nice for smaller children as well. The entry fee is high as well as everything inside. For example, a burger meal = 90dhs, a bottle of water = 10dhs

Something was missing!. Aquaventure is divided into two sororal parts namely Tower of Poseidon and Tower of Neptune; the latter is smaller but no less in pursuit of fun. The Rapids connect the two parks, its a very long lagoon with many exit points, it is advisable to have your child in the same tube as you to avoid confusion. Tower of Neptune has a ride where you slide through a glass tube passing through a very large aquarium full of Rays and Sharks which the kids loved. All in all the park has something for all ages including scores of deck chairs around water bodies, it is well equipped with manpower but most of them are like statues in uniforms as they are not very communicative and helpful. You want to know more about this attraction and many others read my blog www.joyfultravelpie.com
Amazing. If you are in Dubai but do not visit the Aquaventure Waterpark you have missed everything. The visit is a whole day enjoyment with family or friends.

Well thought and planned rides!. Best waterpark visited so far. When you get to the top for rides, the view is amazing. When I reached there, Leap of faith and Shark attack was not quite operational, I was so angry and then my prayers were answered. All the rides were exceptional. Poseidon is my favorite, it takes gut to ride the revenge. Watching Dolphins from far was fun, getting near them is expensive. Spending time and playing on beach was fun.Suggestions:1) Wear glasses else once on ride your eyes will be closed and you will miss the beauty.2) Locker can be avoided.3) Carry a waterproof bag for your mobile and camera to shoot the moments else you will have to buy one there.4) Carry a Hawai Slippers or waterproof footwear to wear. They are allowed on rides too.5) If you have money rent a GoPro Action Cam.Con: Lots of Walking and climbing.

Really good fun!. You can spend a day here having fun. The rides are really good, although there are not many signs explaining the rides before you get to the start point. Loads of lifeguards around as well as food and beverages. A must if you are in the area

fun for the whole family. My family and I really had an awesome fun filled day here.We went on every ride available .The setting was so beautiful .Absolutely love this place .The only downside is that we found the snacks and refreshments to be quite pricy.But nevertheless money well spent and a totally fun outing .

Great fun, new rides too!. Aquaventure has new rides, which was a real surprise! Great fun, they include one with large tubes with upto 4 people in them, and a scream! Of course there's the ride through the shark tank, and the leap of faith(you will be screaming all the way).Parking is a pain, its miles away from the park, and you have to take buses, for which queues can sometimes be very long. There's alot of variety in terms of food, paratha rolls, the usual fast food, ice cream, waffles etc. The food is alot better than Wild Wadi.

Favourite water park in Dubai. Having been to all of the water parks around Dubai, Aquaventure continues to be the family favourite. Great for small kids and big kids alike. Food on site can be a bit expensive, so bring your entertainer vouchers. Also, if you are a Dubai resident you get a discount, so bring your Emirates ID card.
Very fun!. Very fun. Went with my husband and had a great time. The surfing wave was very cool. Great view of the Burj from the park. Hold onto your bikini on the big slide!

Check that it is going to be Open, before you go!!. We went virtually half way round the world to find that half of the park was closed for maintenance for two weeks. One tower was open, which has four rides, but the other was drained. We were very disappointed with two teens that they had not told us when booking, nor when they sent us updates that the Aquaventure would be half closed.
check they are running. if you are wanting to go to the aqua park just check first that they are open as we got there end of January and was told it was closed until early February for maintenance

park was partially closed ! but still the best !DONT FORGET COSTUMES OR U GET ROBBED. park was partially closed due to maintainance , it was mere cheating by luring the guests ! but the running part covered the most as the partially open park was also not bad at all thought the main slides were missed , DONT FORGET TO TAKE SWIMMING COSTUMES or you will get robbed by dirty ones at 20 times the price !!!!!!! rest no complaints !!

Very nice. It is the second time that we visit this waterpark and my kids always have a good time there.I, personally think that They don't have the same quality in the equipments that we find in disney complex, but I also think that They are working well. My suggestion? Trainning is necessary, for a resort that hire so many foreigners, it is vital to do that.

disappointing fun unfortunately. more expensive than wild wadi, less organized, online booking does not give any benefits, u still have to stand in q to get ur entrance, on high day can spend significant time in chaning room to find locker, although lots of free lockers with broken locks. So u might chase locker for a good while. In general less organization than in wild wadi. If too many visitors u might expect to "battle" for your ride doughnut as all of them would normally be occupaied. The famous ride from top of pyramide is always crowded so u can expect to spend good 45 min in qu. Not fun at all. It felt like the park let in much more visitors way beyond they can manage. I crushed my knee in one of the ride connections, where it was absolutely unexpected. In general day was lost waiting for ticket, for locker, for douhgnut, for ride, and finally bumped knee. Towels distributed in one outlet only which is not that easy to find. I did not want to waste another good while waiting for shower. No more plans to return there. Nothing to compare with wild wadi, keep sticking to my tradition.

Fun - but. Do all the rides have to scare the living daylights out of you - some texture to the available rides would be great - i.e. some gentle, some in between, some scary..... this water park misses the middle group.
Shut. We were told that some of the water park was shut but most of it was. Just one ride was open. One restaurant was shut also.
Brilliant place for children. Lots of fun as a family time out. Very clean and lots of lifeguards on duty. Would definitely recommend it to children and couples of all ages.
We spent very good time. we had so much fun at Aquaventure, all the slides were amazing and we enjoyed every moment, we went at 10 am and left at 6 PM and we didn't take any rest so and have fun ;-)

Awesome Waterpark at a great location. This is a really cool place to go, even if you do not enjoy theme parks. It is big enough that it did not get crowded at any point, the rides are awesome, and the scenery and decorations of the park are all very impressive. The lazy river is amazing, and even my girlfriend who hates waterparks, enjoyed the river. There are some rapids and wavy areas, but those are just fun, and mixes things up a bit. Actually, our cabdriver did not find the entrance, and we didn't find it at first either, but that is probably the only drawback. Oh! And you should take the monorail back to mainland once you're done. The line for the taxis is crazy. And the cost for the monorail is close to nothing (about 5 AED i thing...)

what a show. the dolphins were really great.. the show and the stunt men were really well cordinated with teh dolphins... they also bring the crowd into the game and make the whole experoenmce much more attractive. this is a show worth spending every money.. great show.

Day in this waterpark. It was our best day in Dubai. We rent a car to go there almost 9 kms from the hotel. It´s at the end of The Palm Jumeirah beside the Atlantis hotel. Inside the hotel there is a shopping with restaurants and the place to get the tickets for the park.We rented a tent/cabanna with all the stuff to protect the babies to the sun, fridge and a safe box. To move there they offered a small car to transportate families with small kids, We enjoyed the tobogans the lazy rivers and one place like a play ground but with water falling everywhere. Took a lot of time to discover all the places because it´s a very big place.Don´t worry about the safety!! there are a lot of life guards around taking care of the childrens.
