Great fun even for adults. The park is massive and has easily enough activity for a full day. The lazy river that runs through the whole park was especially fun as it so massively long. The quality of the slides and rides was good, the staff were helpful and usually in a good mood. There could have been more maps / signs as it was sometimes hard to find the correct place
only 3 rides are available. During my visit only 3 rides were operating. Free fall is a different experience altogether. I wanted more rides.

Amazing!. Went to the waterpark with my parents and siblings. We all love adventure and the scarier the ride, the happier we are. Most of the rides were average but 2 rides - Leap of faith and Poseidon's revenge were simply super. Do not miss Poseidon's revenge and you will come out with a new found appreciation for your courage!

Brilliant. We love it here, you can rent a private cabana for the day for around 800 aed, it's really cool to just chill and have your own space. The rides are fabulous, the cabana includes, towels, fruit basket, locker, fat boy bean bags, sun loungers, table, water and your own private space. Worth it.

Amazing to go with kids. We went their , nice clean waterpark. should go if travelling with kids.
Its clean, lots of eating options, can go for dolphin show or dolphin swim if have the budget.
Great fun. We had such fun on the lazy river/ water rapids. Other rides were great too. Food was excellent and staff were incredibly helpful and friendly.

half closed. We used this last year with my grandson but we now too ancient to use it .
Half of it was closed for maintenance this time so they had put up various inflatables for the younger children.
Great place; take a package with Dolphins and get free entrance ticket. We love this place, in my opinion this is best water park in Dubai. Go to swim with dolphins it is great experience.
Under construction. Closed down for renovation in Jan, which we only learned at the park. Crazy price for just 3-4 open slides, none of which would've been fit for our small children.

A place for young and old. Aquaventure is a very fun place to go, doesn't matter what age. Young or old, everyone can find some activities in this waterpark; swimming, floating and chilling on the lazy river, slow or high speed slides, and the best is it is not even necessary to know how to swim here! F&B offering is also good. Several small booths are available as well as normal restaurants.Even after a whole day in this park, one will not get bored here. I’d say this park deserves the title of best water park in Middle East.

Never ending fun at this water park.. Full day attraction (till 5PM). Lots of water rides. One need not to know swimming to enjoy these rides. The adjoining beach area is beautiful with lots of chairs to relax. Food is costly, they not allow outside food in the park. They check the bags at entry. Indian vegetarians can take a veg burger at shark bite, which is enough for two people.
Waterpark with nice ride. During our stay in Atlantis we visited Waterpark twice. That was not totally in use but we enjoyed the ride.

Partial shut down for maintenance but still brilliant!. We visited Atlantis the Palm's waterpark in Jan 2015, as a party of 4. The waterpark was undergoing scheduled maintenance at the time, so we were offered park tickets for £27 per person. Some of the big attractions, such as the shark ride and shark attack was closed, which was disappointing. But the rides and attractions that were open were incredible and so fun!!! I think that they could have closed down less rides, and kept more of the park open (I.e., only maintaining two attractions at a time so that guests could still enjoy more), as I was disappointed that all the shark rides and the lazy river were closed. Furthermore, they could have offered guests to maybe see the dolphins or sea lions as a alternative to the park being shut. Having said this, what a brilliant park! Will definitely be going back to Dubai just to experience this again! Would love to book for the hotel too on my next visit!

Great Waterpark. I gave 4 out 5 to the waterpark just coz I visited it right after Yas Waterpark in Abu Dhabi which was fantastic. I would say Aquaventure Waterpark comes short of of its rides variety. If you don't plan to visit Abu Dhabi, the Aquaventure Waterpark is a must go place in Dubai. What I liked most about it was a ride in the end of which you appear to be arrounded by aqurium and can see fish through the glass around you. The feeling was amazing, I tried the ride so many times.

Thoroughly worth the entry price!. I was in Dubai with my mum and we were debating going here or to Wild Wadi as we have heard pros and cons about both of these. In the end we decided to go here and paid online in advance.We got to the park at opening time and the queue was about 15 minutes long to pick up our tickets we had pre ordered, if I'm honest I think most people order them online as oppose to just showing up! We decided to purchase the meal deal option once we got there as it worked out cheaper than most of the food outlets in the park and was easier than carrying money around all day and worrying about losing it. The park itself is massive and the beach is joined to it so there's plenty of room for those sun worshippers that want to find a sunned. I was really worried that the queues would be really long and my whole day would be spent queuing. This was not the case at all though. There's so much to do and so much lazy river that the people are spread out everywhere and I only had to queue about 5-7 minutes for the leap of faith which seemed to be one of the most popular rides. The food was AMAZING. For the cheapness of the meal deal combo I expected to have a burger with a few fries and a fizzy drink but when you go to the outlet where the food places are, there's your choice so if you don't want a burger then there's plenty of other options. We had a traditional shawarma meal which was absolutely huge and was full of salad, not at all like the fast food you get here in the UK!I was really pleasantly surprised with how much you got for your money here, it was a great day and well worth every penny. One of the best trips I've had in Dubai and I will definitely be going back next time I'm there!!

A fantastic water park, would go again. My partner and I spent 9 days in Dubai and on our very last day decided to go to aquadventure waterpark. We're certainly glad that we did, it was the best We've been to. We purchased a day ticket from our rep in the hotel and got a taxi to the Atlantis hotel where the park is situated. Upon arrival we handed in our vouchers and purchased a large locker hire which is definitely a must. The lockers are based in the male or female changing areas so you have to decided who is going to be the bag runner which is slightly annoying but no huge deal.every member of staff we came across were friendly and very pleasant, there was alot of them as well and even though it was a quiet day they were all in good spirits. The park was clean and tidy, couldn't fault the cleanliness at all really. A bonus, which we weren't aware of until we checked, was that we got our lunch included in the ticket, so we took this voucher to the correct restaurant and chose from a set menu. The choice was very good and the food was nice, it included a drink as well.The rides themselves were so much fun, they are mainly either a one or two man rubber ring and you pretty muvh floaut aroubd on this for the majority of the day going up and down and round and round.We would 100% go again!

Partly closed Maintenance in January. Parts of the park are closed for maintenance and will fully re-open to the general public on Sunday, 1 February 2015.I spoke to Mary at the Atlantis only 1/2 hour ago and she advised that only 4 rides in the entire park are open.....plus the beach.The rides are in the Tower of Poseidon and includeAquaconda - Slitherine - Poseidon's Revenge - Zoomerango Please note, you must be over 1.2m to ride the above.Mary confirmed all other rides are closed.Mary advised they are charged AED 150 per person per entry, however there are only limited tickets available on a first come basis. I think the regular price is AED 250, so this at least is decent of them I guess.As we booked our January 2015 holiday in March 2014 and printed the prices off in November and did not see any mention of this maintenance, it has made us somewhat angry as this was the main reason we booked our trip through Dubai.As it stands, I don't want to visit Dubai again and would not have booked Dubai had this maintenance closure been advertised on their website 12 months ago.We are still deciding whether to go or not, although with 3 children, there is not a lot in Dubai for them to doIf Wild Wadi and Aquaventure had put their heads together and performed maintenance at separate times they could have taken advantage of exclusive openings. I just don't get it!

NICE & FUN. To get there: take the Metro to the closest stop on the mainland (Dubai Internet City) and then a taxi there: it costs 25 DRH. Expect long ques, to wait more than 30-40 min to enter. Inside if you don't find enough seats go to the beach, there you will find the sun beds. The walking distances inside are small. Prepare for great fun, small ques at the main attractions. Stay until 4 PM
Best site of Dubai.. only three words for praise. Outstanding , Mind blowing, Class.And yes its very well organized. Especially kids and families will be more happy to visit this park.

What a fun park!. We had a great time in the park. Everything is very clean, the park wasn't crowded when we visited it. There is an abundance of tubes and rafts for the lazy river and rides that require them. All rides were open, were very well supervised by staff and everything seemed very safe. Would definitely recommend.

Waterpark maintenance January - don't bother!!!. Im sure in other circumstances it would have been amazing, but I was really disappointed to find out when I got to the park that they were doing maintenance, which meant ALL but one of the more average slides were CLOSED. I later took a look at the Website, which says that "the waterpark will be partly closed", which makes you think maybe 1 or 2 rides at a time, not 98% of the park. Tickets are 100 AED cheaper, but still I didn't feel it was worth it to enter.Just a warning, because I don't want others to make the journey there and be let down like I was. Things may change, but make sure you call ahead, because the website does not advise accurately.

Great day out. We decided to visit a waterpark during our holiday in Dubai and after doing some googling decided this was the one to visit! We had a fantastic day out, it's great for families, couples or a day out with friends. We will definitely be visiting again! It was good value for money and we even had our food included. It's easy to get to as a couple in our late 20's early 30's we had a good laugh hurling around rides.

Best Waterpark I have ever been to!. I am not exaggerating when I say that this is among the best water parks in the world (if not the best). Have never been to a cleaner and better organized place.The slides are of top quality and they have something for all types. They have a large area for kiddie slides. The lazy river has a lot of rapid sections which add to the fun.Just load some money on your wristband and you are set, you wont need to worry for cash anywhere in the park.They even have an artificial beach and a dolphin bay also which unfortunately I couldn't check out because I was too busy enjoying the slides.Tips: - Carry your own towels and store them in the lockers (I strongly suggest you hire one) - Visit on a weekday (Sunday-Thursday) to avoid the weekend crowds. - Wear a full body wetsuit if you plan to go multiple times on the long solo slides. Ones with sensitive skin can get scratches.

Great park, go with Entertainer coupons. The Aquaventure waterpark is situated at the tip of the Palm, by the famous Atlantis hotel to which it belongs. Deciding in which park to go, we chose this one, as we were in Wild Wadi 8 years ago, and we didn't regret it. The park is better than Wadi, and it's Palm location makes it a must see. It's easy accessible by car, and there's also a metro station right in front of the entrance.The entrance fee is little bit pricey, 250 Dirham (60 Eur) which makes 240 Eur for family of 4. But, there's a magical Entertainer book (DO buy it), which on a coupon basis 2 for 1 makes a grand total of 120 Eur, so it was OK.The rides are really good. The concept of the park is based on two towers (Neptune and Poseidon) from where all the thrilling rides (more than 12) start. I would point out the Poseidon revenge (terrifying capsule speed drop)and the Leap of Faith (great kamikaze ride where you pass through an aquarium) besides many other funny rides in tubes, rafts,...Apart from the rides, you have an access to the beach, so you can have a dip in the sea as well. Throughout the park and on the beach, there are enough sunbeds, but take your own towels, because their for rent are expensive (7 Eur).

Off season is the best. We visited the park off season!
Amazing, easy and not a single que.
The food is awful, don't eat at the shark place
A real water park. I enjoyed with my family the place so much. All the slopes were fun. There is a big one specifically for children. I was sad to leave the place!

Family Outing. We went to this place in Dec'14. The rides are average in comparison to Wild Wadi but the water quality is excellent. It does not stink of chlorine like in other places. Normally a day at any aqua park leaves you with the stink of the chlorine but this place is not the same. Lot of lifeguards. Friendly staff. Good tube rides for kids + adults. Food at the food court is pricey but good quantity & quality. We will go back to this place only because the water quality is excellent.

Super fun!!. All age groups who enjoy such splash rides n water park should go there.. It's filled with so much of fun.. Leap of life 70 degrees 90 degrees was actually thrilling.. All the rides were super exiting n had a get grt time there..
Family Fun in Dubai. Great day in Dubai with the kids in the Atlantis Waterpark, the river rapids was the most enjoyable ride. Very helpful and friendly staff.
Nice. Great for people who love tube rides. Great place for families, too. Very safe with lifeguards everywhere Very expensive drinks and food.

Wonderful experience. Good waterpark, good variety and intensity of rides.. quite a long lazy river and wave pool is small, but enjoyable.. There is no way you won't have fun.. There is something for everyone here..

fun fun fun. I went 2 times to Dubai and i visited the aquaventure in the 2 times , its really big and you will enjoy a lot of fun and thrill rides in the park. the queues were very long but the rides deserve to wait for.

Great fun New Years Eve. Had fantastic time with family friends. Hardly any questions most rides walk on. Was easy to get the rubber rings on lazy river. The golf carts were really handy as it is a big site

Fun in the sun. Visited on a particularly crowded day- it was difficult entering the waterpark because throngs of people were lined up to get tickets. Good thing we pre-ordered our tickets online hence could skip the queue. We bought a combo pass for this and the Lost Chamber's Aquarium for 300AED. The waterpark had plenty of lounge chairs (because we got there early) and we situated ourselves in front of one of the lazy pool exits close to food and drink stalls. Floaties were a plenty and you need not hoard one and carry it all over the place like other waterparks. Towels are also free to rent. I injured my ankle whilst on one of the water rides and the paramedic in charge was fantastic! The way the staff at the waterpark handled an injury situation showed professionalism and great care even if I was not one of the guests staying at the hotel. I only made it to the one water slide, but it was extremely fun whilst it lasted because I got to see a small bit of the aquarium on the way down.

Fantastic day out. We visited in September and had a fantastic day - would highly recommend!Having pre-ordered our tickets online we collected them and avoided queuing, making sure we got into the park early and ended up staying all day.We loved the fact that there were no queues for most of the rides and even the rides with the longest queues these were only 10 minutes and shade was provided from the midday sun.The rides were interesting and unique in the fact that you are able to stay in your rubber ring floating around the lazy river and float off onto a ride; flat travellators take you in your ring up to the top of the ride without having to leave the water!Great day out and good value for money.

fun in the sun. amazing attractions at atlantis with lost chambers variety of marine life, waterpark is huge with vertical slides in tower of neptune and leap of faith, rapids and excellent facilities......A MUST TO VISIT BY ALL

good location too crowded. The park is well located but the lines for the entrance as well as the slides were very long. I thought it wasn't meeting the expectations. Food was very expensive. Also hard too get a taxi or other means of transportation out at the end of the day. Only after one hour of waiting for a taxi we were abkevtontake a free bus to the mall of the emirates.

January 2015 a bit cool but we still had fun. We like the water parks in US so were looking forward to this park.Was expensive to get it but my 2 teenagers aged 17 and 13 loved it!!Weather was around mid 20's and I felt cold in the water at 11am but kids didn't notice!!We arrived at 10am and left around 4pm park was quieter than we expected.No drinks or food allowed in. We got the meal deal when we paid to get in and was glad we did as this saved money.

Well worth the money spent. Inspite of the long queues in the rides, the wait was well worth . The rides were interesting and unique. The wait for taxi at the end of the day was horrible . We waited for about 1.5hrs in the queue. Should have taken the monorail+metro.

Definatly great for Kids. We decided to spend a day at the Waterpark - it was very quiet - we expected it to be extremely busy.We arrived there at 10am (gates open then) and it was very quick to get in,Great rides and I think kids will really enjoy this.Very clean, lifeguards at every corner.The beach is lovely and quiet - lovely views.In my opinion just buy the waterpark tickets and not the combo for the aquarium - the aquarium is pretty basic and not worth the fuss - best to go to the aquarium at the Dubai Mall.Be prepared to wait in a line for taxis leaving Atlantis - we waited for an hour.

Great for the kids. Entrance needs a little better management as quite long. Park itself great. Beach was perfect - quiet - yet accessible for the kids to keep coming back to. Was at Siam Park in Tenerife in the summer and would say that Siam Park was much better. Having said that Aquaventure is great and the kids thoroughly enjoyed themselves - they said that whilst the park was relatively small compared to Siam Park, the rides lasted much longer.

Good waterpark. Been there on december, 21 2014.Not so crowded, it was sunday which is a weekday in Dubai.General entrance for adults AED 285 (1 AED = 0.27 USD).Before going I suggest that you check with your hotel concierge. We were guests at Fairmont The Palm and and got a voucher to pay AED 250 each.The park is very well organized and clean.The attractions are good but not the variety you found at Orlando (USA) water parks.A nice space with attractions exclusively for kids in a private "beach".Speaking of beaches, you have access to a beautiful Gulf beach, with a lot of umbrellas and chairs for use, very, very nice. It's a plus, no doubt.Lockers: AED 40 each.Towels: AED 30 each.Combo towel/locker: AED 50.I think it's better to bring your own hotel beach towel. We did that.A not so good thing: the lockers are situated at the very entrance of the park. If you stay at the beach it's a long walk to pick up things from the locker.The park is part of the Atlantis Hotel complex and I believe that guests at the hotel have some privileges at the park.

Such a blast. I wished I had more time here. I really only had about an hour and a half, and it wasn't enough time to do the exploring I wanted to do. I loved that you could go to the beach -- the ocean -- while you were there too (which is IN the waterpark). Heaps of slides, rapids, and so much fun for families.

Excellent attreaction. I went to Aquaventure on the palm. The sight is beautiful when you look out to sea. When I went in march the queues were not very long. I was amazed at how large the park was and how many rides there were. the queues weren't awfully long but are probably longer in the summer. It is a great place for kids to and have a great time. it is a stand out attraction. Was annoyed I didn't get to go on all the rides so would definitely recommend staying at the hotel. the food was standard but overall I thought the rides were exhilarating. anyone who wants an active and relaxing day, visit Aquaventure. Warm through the year.

Absolutely amazing!. I'm not the kind of a person who actually likes visiting water parks but my wife insisted that we must visit aquaventure and how thankful I am to her for making sure we went and enjoyed to the maximum. I've visited many many water parks in Asia but this one stands out from the rest. It's amazing. The rides R fantastic. It's a very well organized park. The prices R high but so is the standard. Food is very expensive at the park. Loved our day out at aquaventure.

amazing waterpark. Aquaventure is an amazing waterparki recommend going early morning because its much less crowded and also to get the entertainer vouchers to save on the entrance. Lovely place and a must when in dubai

Had a great day with the kids, there are some buts though.... To start with we had a great day, end of December with the sun as weak as can be in Dubai (close to the winter solstice). I did not, fair skinned as I am, need any sun protection and the temperature out on the Palm was about 23-26 celsius. Conditions where great! I had a great time on all the waterrides. We arrived at 10.00 and left at sun down at 17.30. Staff/guards where effective and friendly and all together we had a great and memorable day wiith different kinds of rides being thrilling or lovely enjoyable. There are plenty of places to relax at and even a beach! The beach held at least two volley ball courts!there are plenty of places to buy food and drinks - maybe not much quality foods but ok burgers or sharmas.Now to the buts:-Being a western woman I was at one point approached by an arabic man at the childrens water climby wooden castle - when I was occupied with dodging falling water in a shadier place of the play castle I was approached by a man from behind that put his hand on my bum and feined an interest in what I was doing and then he followed me around the play-castle. I was a bit chocked and took refuge by standing in an open sunny place - but the feeling of beeing lightly molested did not feel good. I would warn other female visitors of "touchy hands".-when we arrived at 10.00 (opening hour) it took one full hour just to buy tickets and enter the park as the ticket sales could be better planned.-the park is rather pricy but still you have to pay extra for lockers and towls - I strongly think this should be included in the price.Except for these buts I loved Dubais Atlantis Aquaventure and would definitley visit it again!

Fun fun fun!. The Aquaventure Waterpark at Atlantis The Palm Hotel is a wonderful place to visit to have fun & enjoy a day out. The water amusements are fantastic. The big slide is awesome! Make a trip of it and stay at Atlantis The Palm Hotel. Recommended!

Must go there. We had complimentary passes as we were staying in the hotel the waterpark is brilliant plenty to do we've got a 3 yr old and 11yr old and plenty for both to do the slides the lazy river with the Rapids we went to wild wadi and there's not much in it but I think I prefer aquaventura better

A fun family day. Get in early and beat the queues and this will be a great day. We arrived shortly after 10.00 am and had been on most rides by midday. After this the queues got progressively longer and more time was spent waiting than riding. The favorites for the big kids were "The Leap of Faith" and "Poseidon's Revenge" while "Shark Attack" and "Anaconda" we're popular with all. The food options are the same as all theme parks - terrible. As bags are searched on entry to prevent you from bringing in food of your own (one bottle of water per person only) it is just something you have to live with. Overall a great day out.
A must do.. Brilliant water park-one of the best I have ever been to. Well maintained and run, we had the best time. The rides are very thrilling!

water work park at Atlantic Hotel. Hibeen here several times in the past - however this year waited 1 hour to collect tickets that had been pre-booked . Organisation poor the time for purchasing tickets was about 2 hours otherwise. Previously 10 mins This section was chaos was understaffed Once in things were great - however overall great. The water in the past was heated well - cold this time . Lots of kids shivering . Not sure why not heated this time - maybe cutting costs considering above two Overall - great with kids but be prepared for a wait if they do not sort out entrance issues

Fantastic water park. Stayed in Atlantis and had free unlimited entry to waterpark. The waterpark as a whole is a great sight and provides excellent views if the Persian Gulf from the top of the water slides. The best water slides I have ever been and no big queens even in Christmas holidays. As a hotel guest you get a buggy ride from the hotel to different parts of the park

Great fun!. This is just great, whether you go with or without kids. Great facilities, even when you're no big fan of fast slides as I am. Children had the best day of the entire holiday I think. Not cheap, but worth the expense. Didn't go for any dolphin or seal activities.

Good fun. Visited this place a few times on our trip. The service is inconsistent, some of the staff are very rude especially one of the park manager/supervisor.Good fun and the restaurant within the park is good.Only down side is the long queue and not much shade. We found it difficult to find a Sun lounger with the shade attachment attached which is strange in September when you would need the attachment.

Fun, variety but transport out slow. Great day out with dolphins and varied water slides. Bit of a battle to get in with crowds. Go early if you have a booking with dolphins or similar. It takes an hour to get in on a busy day. Getting a taxi there is easy. Getting a taxi out is a battle. Few taxis go there. Rather take the monorail out to the last stop and then hail a taxi or take the tram.

OKish. We enjoyed our day here.It's not the best water park I've ever been to... but probably the most expensive.If you prebook online, you save about AED40 per person. However, you'll end up queuing in the prepaid line for ages to get your admission armband.Lockers and towels are extras on top of the admission charge. We took our own towels but still got stung AED40 for a locker. Food and drink in the park were poor quality and expensive. They have a stop and search to prevent you from bringing your own food in...We went on Boxing day and expected big queues but they were OK. 3 or 4 slides are good. There's only about 12ish in total so you'll find you've done all the slides by lunchtime if you arrive at 10am when the park opens. The park is similar to Siam Park in Teneife. The biggest ommision is the lack of a wave machine.Avoid the private beach as it is stoney, difficult to walk on and has stagnant water.. (goto JBR beach which is nearby, free, has beautiful sand, breakers and a promenade with restaurants and facilities)If you stay right to the end of the day, be aware that taxis queues will be long and you'll sit in a traffic Jam waiting to get off the Palm.

Not bad. We visited the water park a few times as we were staying at the Atlantis for 6 days. Im not a water baby so wasn't as excited as husband who loves going under/in and on water. Me.. not so much. It was very hot in september about 40 + degrees and i found it difficult to find shade at the park whilst waiting for husband to finish his water rides and slides. You must take lots of bottled water as its so hot and they'll only get you buying expensive drinks if not. A couple of times i had to go in a shop as i felt like i was going to pass out with the heat even though i had a hat on and had water on me. Husband went on the leap of faith a couple of times but waited until the end of the day to go on as it was a lot quieter. I was 'persuaded' to go on a very gentle water rapid ride where you sit on inflatable rings together and glide through tunnels and swells. I must admit i enjoyed that although there was a couple of hairy moments where the rapids picked up a bit and i thought i was going to fall in and drown....Slight exaggeration on my part!! Husband managed to calm me down and it was ok in the end and i went on it twice.Just take water and high sunscreen!.

Nasty Rola cola. Me and my partner went for the day in the middle of December, the water park was great and we didn't have to queue for ages as it wasn't peak season I'm guessing... However the only thing that let the place down for us was the staff at one of the two restaurants on the complex. We ordered food and two coca cola's. Sat down, drank my coke and it was flat and left a dodgy taste in my mouth my girlfriend agreed describing it as "Rola Cola" but they were selling it in trademark coca cola cups. This sounds petty but when I asked the staff to change the drinks they gave us more Rola cola! We decided to have sprite instead which after a few minutes they reluctantly gave me. When I told the manager behind the counter that this was false advertising he suddenly forgot how to speak English and did the old "smile and nod"They make plenty of money on the entry fees, please don't cut corners selling cheap nasty fizzy drinks at high prices, nobody likes to be ripped off.

Hours of lines. First off, I like to think positively and make the best of any situation, however Aquaventure made it difficult for me to do so.I understand that the park may be busy, especially at this time of year, but it should be noted that any attempt to visit this park should be under the knowledge that you will not be able to get very much done.We were in Dubai, a city of many wonders, for 2 days, so with minimal time I had to choose my most desired sites to visit, the Aquaventure being #1. Purchasing tickets online seemed to be the best option to avoid queues, but alas there is a queue to pick up those tickets, 30 minutes.Once inside, the water park is crammed full. It takes far too long to be able to enjoy the slides. In four hours, I managed to do 2 slides before giving up. I had to leave the line at the Leap of Faith as they let people slide once every 30 seconds. Calculating the amount of people in the line meant that if wait for 40 minutes after waiting nearly that time already. At the top, people were too scared to go and wasting time for everyone.Even getting a deck chair is hard because people just throw their towels all over them.I understand it is busy, but if park management is going to let in thousands of people and take their money, they need to cater for these thousands of people.I was looking forward to Aquaventure but I left feeling bitter and cheated of my money. Some people may have a great time there, and I am genuinely gladFor them, but in my opinion I wasted a day here that could've been spent better paddle boarding or enjoying another Dubai beach.

Not so thrilling after 2 rides.. If you are looking for thrill, I guess you just need to do two of two rides: The Leap of Faith and Aquaconda - the rest may sound unique but are not as thrilling and much different from the two. However, you can easily spend the entire day and have a great day if you come with toddlers. There is enough you can do with your little ones as well. If you are considering visiting the Lost Chambers, I would suggest you rather visit the Aquarium & the Underwater Zoo at the Dubai Mall.

Good fun. Yes - as quite a reviews said, it's not cheap (hey you're in Dubai so go figure!?)I also don't know if there's enough to do for a full day - we went to the park as part of a joint ticket including the Dolphin Bay experience (which I've reviewed separately but is super) - as such, half a day was ampleThe lazy river is great, the big splash house area was loved by our young(ish) two sonsThey also really enjoyed the large tyre slides where you kind of whiplash around (scared the wotsits out of me!)Some of the more extreme one person tubes frankly freaked them out (and me!) Reckon young teens up is the sweet spot for all the ridesAbsolute recommendation is you book a return car - the queue for the taxi rank upon leaving was humongous! We'd booked the hotel limo which worked well.

Fantastic day out. Had an amazing time here! Tips....go early so the queue for a ticket isn't too long. Also, don't take a taxi there because the queue to get a taxi at the end of the night is ridiculous. Take the metro or drive. There is parking and it will be free if you get a stamp at the ticket office.Lots of thrill seeking rides. The longest I queued for was about 45 mins but that was for the big vertical drop one ( leap of faith) which was awesome! I chickened out of the doing the ones where the floor drops beneath you. A variety of rides for all ages. Plenty of sun loungers. I would definitely get the towel and locker combo...the towels are huge and keep you warm and snug when you lounge about ( I went in winter so there was a little chill at times when I got out) the water wasn't too bad...not hot, but not freezing. The food is pricey though so brace yourself. We had a mini chicken sandwich which was 38aed ( £6) and drinks were around 13aed ( £2:50) you can't take in food but can take in a bottle of water per person. We did finish the park within about 4/5 hours and decided to get changed and lounge about on the beach. That it itself was enjoyable. It's a pretty big park with lots to do for all ages. The ticket is pricey as you would expect but we had the entertainer book which has buy 1 get 1 free. I would recommend it as it also has the same for the kaleidoscope buffet and the lost chambers aquarium.

Clean, not too crowded and lots of fun!. Our family of four (two adults, children of 13 and 15 years old) went here Christmas Day. We did not experience any waiting time at all untill 1400. There are lots of sunbeds by the many pools, and the beach is also nice. Tip no 1: come at 10 am to experience the most popular rides for some hours before the queing starts.Tip no 2: bring one bag for your clothes, a book and sunscreen (and a towel if you don't want to hire an expensive one there), to place by your sunbed when you arrive. And bring one small bag to put your camera, money and other valuables in, to be placed in a locker. Tip no 3: You only need one small locker per family. There are several locker stations, so choose one close to your sunbed area, to be able to get your money and camera when needed.Enjoy!

Very long and badly managed queue. Having read a number of reviews on and off TA we decided to book online (thoroughly recommend this - cheaper and shorter queue) and visit Aquaventure over Wild Wadi Waterpark (hard to choose between them and we haven't visited WWW so can't compare). We have three kids, 10, 8 and 5. We arrived at 11:30 (park opened at 10am) and parked in the car park. All went smoothly. Short shuttle bus trip to entrance. Appeared quite quiet......UNTIL WE TURNED A CORNER INSIDE THE ENTRANCE SHOPPING ARCADE TO HEAD FOR THE PARK AND HIT A MASSIVE QUEUE. The worst part about this was how badly sign posted and managed it was. The staff were all pleasant and friendly (actually overall this was the case throughout the day) but it was very poorly managed and tensions began to run very high as people queue jumped (innocently or otherwise) and others started to take policing the queue into their own hands. It took us 1h10 to collect our wrist bands so we could enter the park and we were lucky that we stumbled into the right queue. Had we arrived 10 mins later it would have taken another 30 mins just to get to someone to ask which queue we should be in. I reckon the queue to buy tickets there was probably about 30 mins longer than ours. I recommend you get there at 9:15. We actually had a fun day. A few other things I would liked to have known:1 - you can rent towels - 30 AED2 - take a big locker rather than a std one 75 AED vs 40 AED or take two, one for boys and one for girls 3 - the last ride closes at 17:15 so it's quite a short day - another reason to get there early4 - we bought the park and aquarium combo - I wasn't expecting much having been to plenty aquariums but this one was very well done and kept the whole family entertained after a full on day - also queue was minimal even at 17:45 when everyone was leaving the waterpark5 - drive - the queue for the monorail looked huge at 17:15 as the park closed and the queue for a taxi looked huge too when we were leaving at around 19:306 - the food in the park was actually quite good and not extortionate the way it sometimes can be (eg awful and v pricey at Disneyland Paris!)7 - the place, esp inside the park, was v well staffed with really friendly people and endless lifeguards. Always felt like the kids would be safe - even though they were always with us. 8 - a lot of the rides have 1.2m height restrictions so it's quite limiting if you all want to ride together and the younger member(s) isn't quite tall enough yet. 9 - ride queues weren't that bad10 - beach was really nice to relax on11 - get to the change rooms around 16:45 before the actual close - it gets very full and very messy as everyone tries to get changed once the park has closed We would have given the day a 4 star rating had it not been for the awful start. A park like this run by a hotel group like Kerzner Int should be ashamed of the appalling crowd control and expectation management they presided over this morning. Come on guys, you can do better.

Loved it!!!. Great place for any age group, something to do for all be it the lazy river for the less crazy or the 100ft death plunge for the sheer crazy. It gets busy most days. Price is approximately £40 per person slightly cheaper for children under 1.2 metres.You can get deals which include towels/lockers/food. The food in the Barracuda is very nice with a wide selection to choose from which includes a bottle of water.Down side on a busy day is trying to get a taxi at the end of the day. This is definitely a problem I can assure you.

Good but let down by long queue to purchase a ticket. The rides are good and the beach area relaxing and the food at the barracudas restaurant better than most theme parks.. So what more could you ask for than to improve on the chaotic ticket purchase hall. You are well advised to purchase online...the blurb on the website implies that you get through quicker by doing this. If you think you might need a locker for your stuff the go for a silver or gold package deal which means you have a small locker and a towel thrown in rather than pay for the locker separately. We got 2 gold tickets in a party of 5. This enabled purchase of a locker for the ladies in their changing room and the fellows shared a locker in the men's room and we got 2 towels thrown in plus 2 meals. We the bought 3 day tickets to make up the 5 entry tickets. We did pay for the zip line experience but found it a bit tame. Getting to the venue by tram and monorail may work out quicker as big queues build up for taxis and the like especiLly when the venue closes inthe evening.

fun day out but little chilly. overall a nice park with fun slides and good facilities. We liked the beach areas for some quiet time as the park itself was very full on. Lots of people even though it wasn't warm but no real lines so that was great. Overall a nice day out but with the water being quite cool it was a little bit too chilly for me.

Best Water park In The WORLD. Been to a lot of water parks, and this is by far the best.Amazing slides, incredible fun and sometimes a little nervy! TipGet the big rides done first thing in the morning as we did, the ques after 12 were massive, where we just walked straight on.AMAZING

Good attraction but pricey. Normally I write about the positive, but here I will help you with what to watch out for. 1- extra charges. The ticket price is misleading as you have to pay lots of extras. Towel, locker, and if you dare to bring in a bag of chips it will be taken away. This happened to my son who was not happy to have his snack taken. Also the traffic is horrendous. If you leave when the park closes get ready to wait one hour for a taxi. Only one taxi company in dubai and coming out to the palm is a pain for them.

Fun for all. We stayed at the Atlantis hotel so we wanted to make the most of the water park, it was FANTASTIC!The variety of slides was brilliant, there was something for everyone and it was easy to navigate, we visited 4 times throughout our stay, sometimes just for an hour and other times for a whole afternoon.We really enjoyed the water park, it was a fantastic facility of the hotel.

Good fun / water COLD. Enjoyed the water park during recent visit to Dubai. Rides available for kids, adults, daredevils, etc. Only comment is that water was freezing cold and this was a turn off for a lot of people.

Clean spacious and beautiful surroundings. This place is the best water park around for young families its immaculate maintained and there are many areas to sit and eat, the park has a clever design so if you going around in the lazy river it will take you back to your seating area. The rides are brilliant and you can spend the day on the beach as well and there is plenty of other fun for the whole family.
Maximum enjoyment for the whole family!. Absolute fun and maximum enjoyment.That's my opinion.The best waterpark in UAE. Worth every cent.Highly commendable.Hope to go back there again and again.

Fun even with smaller kids. Went with my 5 year old and 7 year old. As the younger one is shorter than the required 1.2m we decided to skip the more extreme slides. Despite this they both thoroughly enjoyed the splash zone and all of us could go on the torrents and rapids which surround the entire Park. The park was very clean and well organized with excellent staff always at hand! A few bits of advice. The park opens at 10 and that's the best time to get there. If you have younger kids the tubes with "child seats" are needed for the rapids and torrents. These tubes are easy to find earlier on but as the day goes on they become much tougher to find. Grab yours and keep them with you! Same goes for the deck chairs. They go fast (especially those in the shade and around the splash zone). Put your towel on it and stake your claim early! Finally the park closes at sunset. Try and leave a little before closing time. We could not get a cab back after waiting for over 45 minutes with 2 whinny tired kids. Eventually settled for the Atlantis hotel car and paid three times what we paid getting there! Although we were assured by the staff this is usually not the case and that this was due to the increased rush around the holiday season.

Waterpark Craziness. This was my second visit to the waterpark and I think it's fair to say it's becoming a victim of its own success! Whilst there are lots of rides which are fab its a little bit crazy, arriving closer to lunchtime we struggled to find any sun loungers so had to go the beach! Not ideal when u want to be close to the rides, you expect there to be enough room for the number of people being allowed entry. The changing rooms were manic at the end of the day also with no room to move never mind get changed ! If you want a relaxing day poolside this is not the place to come if however you want fun rides at a spendy entrance fee then go for it!

Waiting 2 hours in-line for getting the tickets is not acceptable!!!. How could be your day if you have to wait 2 hours in-line in crowded uncomfortable area to get your tickets while your family is waiting standing up waiting for you?

good fun. Pretty pricey if you do not have any discount coupon, we managed to spend a full day without feeling bored at all :)The steep entrance price will also make sure that you have none or very few queuing time, which is very valuable when it comes to amusement parks.Changing rooms / bathrooms are on the other hand a disgraced, dark and dirty.

Atlantis water park closure. Thank you for sharing. I have just discovered this myself today :( closed for 3 days out of the 5 we are staying in January very disappointed but not as much as my 9 year old son will be. Booked this holiday 4 weeks ago and no mention of the park closure!,

Expensive but a good day out. I spent a day here with friends, it felt like a refreshed and upgraded version of the now tired Wadi Wadi. The park is well sign posted and we were able to navigate and return to rides we wanted to experience again. The staff were fun and encouraged us to be brave. The aquarium was well placed to visit after dinner and allow food to settle before returning to the park. It's not cheap but that was to be expected given the attraction. We travelled by cab which was pain free. Worth going for a day out with family or friends.

Expensive but great entertainment for the kids. You drive out into the actual Palm. Parking is in a nearby carpark and you then take a shuttle bus to Aquaventure and Lost Chambers. Queues are ok but inside, the cost of food, feeding the sting rays and the dolphins are mind blowingly expensive. So have a BIG breakfast before you head there! The kids are oblivious to the cost and they just have an excellent day.

A good day of fun!. We spent the whole day at Aquaventure, we did not get bored! There are many things to do, the queues are reasonable (a few minutes to wait), and staff is friendly. Kids under 1m20 have less things to do but they still have the pirates boat and the river (with an adult). A lot of lifeguards supervise the pirates boat where the little ones play. We particularly enjoyed the "leap of faith" and the "sliterline". We found the dolphins attraction to be excessively expensive and we did not take this option. In the end, I'm bit sure in one day we have had enough time to do all the waterpark + the dolphins so no regret.

CLOSED FOR WORK! from january 11th 2015. BEWARE! I have just learnt from others that this attraction is in fact CLOSED for important work from January 11th 2015 so take care if intending to book for such a visit or with chilldren.

WOW what awesome fun for all!. We visited here as a guest of the Atlantis Hotel and loved our day filled with fun! We had two children aged 3yrs and 5yrs which meant unfortunately the little one was not tall enough to come on the bigger rides (which he was not happy about), but he had loads of fun anyway. The children's area is awesome with slides to suit all ages and confidence levels. There is lots of seating and amenities nearby for parents. The lazy river rides and rapids are huge fun and the double river chairs have a child seat to ensure your little ones are not going to slip through into the water. It is great fun and also as relaxing as you want it to be. For the more brave, the bigger slides are huge fun and the Leap of Faith is a true adventure! Just remember to keep your eyes open when going through the shark tank :-) The tube rides that shoot you up and down and through dark tunnels are the best fun and my 5 year old loved it (as did I). There are secure lockers for your things. Lots of food places, shops with souvenirs and essentials etc. I think it is expensive if you are paying for it (it is included in your room rate as a Atlantis Guest), but worth the money as its great fun. We will be visiting that again on our way back through Dubai!

Very good experience. I stayed at the Atlantis resort and access to the waterpark was included in the stay. I visited over two days.Overall I was happy with the waterpark. The lines were not long when I attended however I could see there being quite a wait at times.Staff were friendly and spoke English well. A lot of the rides require a rubber inflatable tube and there were very few single tubes available. If you attempt to go on some of the slides in a double but with only one person you will be refused entry. Food at the waterpark is outrageously priced and not of very high quality. Most of the food available is fried and there is very limited choices for vegetarians. Be prepared to spend upwards of AU$25 per person for a meal which is similar in nature to what you would get from McDonalds.Towels were available free of charge. Make sure that you arrive fairly early as there is only limited sunchairs, especially by the main wave pool.

A day is not enough. The rivers are great for relaxing rides with some excitement thrown in after every few minutes. One just cant get tired of it.The slides are real fun. The queues can be a bit long. The dolphin bay allows you to play with the dolphins but it is costly.

Funfilled day. We had an amazing time at the waterpark. There are rides for those who may have health issues too. You can spend a good 3 hours there. If you can buy the entertainer Dubai you would save on one ticket. We used the buy one get one free coupon.

A Worst service of all. All the service staff is picked at its worst and no one is at help. All are like policemen answers like Dont come here....or Go away from here. You are not allowed !!!.... Like this statements to all..Not suitable for family with kids aging from 1-5. As you & kid will not be allowed in 80% of rides.

Fantastic fun for the whole family. Visited the water park on 18th December 2014. You have to park your car in the car park and get a shuttle bus to the water park. My advice is to arrive around 9.30am as this all takes time and the park opens at 10am. I was initially worried that the water would be too cold in December but it was fine, a little on the chilly side but it didn't bother us at all - we were having too much fun!!!The rides are fantastic, especially the new Tower of Poseidon which has the Aquaconda, a 6 person raft adventure and Zoomerango - another 6 person raft ride. Then there's Poseidon's Revenge - if you're brave enough!. Two capsules have trap doors which suddenly open and starts you on you slide experience where you'll travel up to 60km/hr through a tube! Oh there's also the new zipline, which we didn't go on as it's extra but looked fun. The rest of the rides were all brilliant too. If you are in need of a little relaxation then the lazy river is fun but remember there are rapids along the way so it all makes for a brilliant ride! The one ride I enjoyed most was probably Shark Attack which is in the Tower of Neptune. We took a double tube though darkness emerging through the shark-filled lagoon giving you time to spot all the fish and sharks but safe inside the see-through tube of course!! The food available was of a good standard but not the widest of choices and mostly fast food. I really fancied hummus, tabouleh and chicken kebabs but no luck. I'm gluten free and it's always tricky to find something I can eat but the guy did offer me plain grilled chicken and salad so can't complain.Overall, a fun-filled day and out of all the water parks I have been to through-out the Middle East, this is my favourite one. . Can't wait to visit again!

World Class waterpark. It has everything that one would want in a waterpark and has some never seen rides in it. Also, you get access to the wonderful beach of Atlantis (jumeira), so reach there on time. Opens at 10AM so reach before that because locker and changing might take time.NOTE: 1. there are local travel agents in Dubai who can get you good deal. Will get it for cheaper than online website rates-so check that option out. 2. They dont allow food or even water so better not to keep anything with you unless you want it thrown at the entry. 3. The restaurants (Sharks restaurant, and Baracudas) inside waterpark are a lot cheaper than those stalls on the Aisle. so avoid the stalls, which sell at exorbitant rates.
A must visit with family and friends. The experience was amazing we had so much fun in the five hrs we spent there and will go back on our next visit.

Amazing Waterpark. After 2009 this was my second visit at the Aquaventure, already back then I was very impressed by the park and the rides. Since then they even added further rides, like a looping ride with a 'rocket start' (Poseidons Revenge), one of the most breathtaking sliding experiences. But of course there are plenty of rides for all tastes. From calm to thrilling. The Waterpark also has access to a private beach with a beautiful view on the dubai skyscrapers and the Burj Al Arab. We almost didnt occur that we had to wait for going on a slide (maybe because during the week, and seasonal). We just had to wait at the two slides that go through the Shark Aquarium. Admission prices are somewhat high, we paid about 50€ per person. Additonal to that a 10€ fee per locker (optional). The staff is very friendly and attentive, and sometimes even funny.We spent almost the whole day there to manage to go on a ride on every slide (as mentioned almost no queues), so I suggest to plan a whole day for this.In conclusion: Be careful, the slides are really addictive ;)
Worth a Visit. Brilliant day out for all the family! The slide that takes you underwater is a great experience and the I enjoyed the water rapids!
Great day out. Amazing water park for all ages! Definitely somewhere you have to visit whilst in Dubai! Very clean and lots to do, with a restaurant for after your fun!

Best water park in the world. Iv been to many and none this big and so clean, we were lucky it was empty suppose it's the time of the year so no queuing at all. The rides are quality and you can get some great pictures also. I would highly recommend it what a fantastic day

Best water park in Dubai. If you are planning on going to a water park in Dubai, this one is the best! Weekdays, arrive early and enjoy the lack of crowds. Lots of fun slides on the new tower (bit of a walk over) but seems to less busy then the one closer to the entrance. Keep your samdals with you, I know this sounds strange but the cement is really hot and you always seem to end up where you left them after getting off the slide. They also check and take water away if you have it in your baggage - such a pathetic thing to do but nothing we can do. Enjoy!

Brilliant fun. We used the Aquaventure waterpark everyday of our stay at Atlantis and loved it. Great rides and loads of fun. Also great for laying in the sun and relaxing in between floating around in your rubber ring. Loads of places to get drinks and food and not to badly priced

The best park I've ever been. I've been to the lots of aqua parks all around the world also wild wadi in Dubai. But it was the most interesting & adventures one. Lots of scary games that really need courage to try them. Surge & leap of the faith were two of the lovely one that we tried more the one time.Being beside the beach is anothe point that we loved it. Try it for Sure ...

Huge!! So much to do!!. This waterpark is just huge with so many slides and activities! We started with the rapids which just went on and on...and on!! Then the kids splash area which is amazing!!! Massive house to climb up with buckets of water to tip, water guns to shoot, so many things to twist and turn - the kids and us adults were in heaven. 5 different slides here and our 3 year olds loved them all - the life savers were also first class with looking after kids who come off the slide and connecting them with parents coming down to collect them. The park is extremely well covered with life savers all of who were so happy and friendly, really made it fun! Food was normal fast food but not terribly expensive.My warnings here if coming with small kids is, firstly, it's cold water this time of year!!! My kids teeth were both chattering a lot! And secondly the park is huge - so if you leave you towels etc in one section you may have a long long walk to get back after some rides!!

Love this place - best water park in UAE for sure. This place does not disappoint. Kids, adults all catered for with safe slides, pools and equipment. Combine it with lunch at Atlantis or Dinner for a great day out !

Perfect had so much fun. best place i have ever been. you could spend the whole day here it has so much plus many places to eat and there is even a beach. very clean place and the rides are thrilling.

Amazing. Thrilling, adventurous and fun. There are rides for all levels of thrills. The new tower Poseidon is really exciting (and scary!). I have been there once in 2010 and now again in 2014. Worth the 2nd visit. This time we spent some time on the beach as well. Good fun.

Had a blast !. Read tons of reviews to decide which aquapark to choose both advertise to be the best but i combined my experience with a dinner there so i went with the Atlantis resort. This was my best day after the safari . Had a blast, the staff there is great, placed my towel on the beach in the green area, the view of the city is magnificent and the water slides are the best i`ve ride . Definitely a must do again .
Best water theme park!!. Best water theme park that I had visited. Dolphin adventure, shark safari and what not. Best water rides with so much fun. Not to be missed!!

Costly, but worth it!!. Had a fantastic day out with the Joseph/Anderson family. Its about a 30dirham taxi ride away and we used vouchers as well, which halved the price. 2 adults and 2 children would normally cost 990dirham about 400 ish dollars.
TIP: Be an early bird to secure good seats.

Awesome water journey. One of the best water parks I have ever been to. Don't be afraid of the 'scary' stuff - they are the most interesting. A whole day is not enough. Tip - in the longer days the park closes later, we stayed until 7pm.

"TO DO ACTIVITY" when in "DUBAI". Just be there & experience the fun. its an great family place too where one will have life time memories. Water rides here are just beyond imagination & needs too much of guts to take each ride.
Just book it & Enjoy !!!!

Best water park !!!. This is the best water park. Is amazing. We spent here whole day. We paid just 1 entrance, because we used entertainment voucher. We also used locker and towel. The price includes access to the beach.

Fun!. Had so much fun! Shame it closes at 5pm. We went for a couple of hours. Wish we went a lot earlier! The 'Lazy River' I think that's what it was called was good. If you have little ones they will love that one. Enjoyed the rapids bit.

Awesome. Loved it! Myself and fiancé went there while staying at atlantis. Went on every ride (some very very scary!) and enjoyed every minute. We would've gone back the next day if we weren't checking out. We didn't actually use a towel all day until the end because we were too busy going on the slides. FYI there is a weight limit for some rides (120kg) and some for other rides (136kg) and a height minimum for some of the rides. Lucky this didn't affect us but it may affect some. The tubing around the place was quite slow so we mainly opted to get off and walk to the next slide. FYI - i was concerned about clothing - I wanted to wear a top or sarong over my bathers however was advised online and in the rules that only swimsuits to be worn. I ended up doing this and didn't care as I was too busy having fun. However I did notice some people wearing street clothes (singlets, leggings etc). So I don't think they patrol it much. Overall it was so much fun and we would definitely go back!
Amazing .... I advice you don't go on weekend because so many people there wants to have fun like you .. Best park ever .

Outstanding fun. What a great kids adventure play ground. My nine year old girl loved every ride, the layout and quality of rides was excellent. I was particularly impressed by the friendliness of the staff. We found it was cheaper to travel from downtown Dubai by taxi than metro and cab or bus.
So much fun!. Me and my fiancé had a great time! There is enough rides to keep you busy for the whole day..not too big but big enough and own private beach. Loved it!

Great fun!. If you are in Dubai for any length of time, I would certainly recommend going to one of the water parks. We picked Aquaventure for no other reason than our friends had been there before. It's quite expensive, but none more so than going to somewhere like Alton Towers for the day. Plus it's great fun! There is a great selection of rides and for the most part you don't have to queue for too long. There is a good mix between more sedate rides and the quicker, darker, twistier ones that get the adrenaline going. There are plenty areas to sit and relax and soak up some sun too!

The perfect way to spend a warm Dubai day!. I was really impressed with the quality of this waterpark. Well thought out and constructed the park provided hours of entertainment. I especially liked the chute where the floor drops out from under your feet and you drop almost vertically into darkness!

Fun for everyone. It's a great place to have fun with the family. With several rides and slides for different ages and adventure preferences.Have to remember the spot where you will leave your things if not using a locker as you could end up getting off at the different area of the huge pool.Make sure to set enough time to enjoy the place as it is a big park.Have to pay for the locker and towel.

Amazing! . We booked a day trip to Atlantis waterpark with the lost chambers & aquarium as a package. I don't rate the lost chambers and aquarium really as it was only small and not so much to see. Dubai mall aquarium is a must!!! Aquaventure made up for this! Great waterpark!Be prepared to put your hand in your pocket when visiting Atlantis. Everywhere you go there are 'extras' When arriving you get a wristband to allow u to enter the waterpark. There is a charge if you want to use a locker. You also have to pay to hire a towel for the day.We got the combo although I really had to squeeze everything into a small locker.1 Towel 1locker combo 50aed (small locker)Large locker available extra chargeTowel 30aedWristband given for use of the locker.Security check of bags before you enter the waterpark.. No food/drinks to be taken in. Changing rooms are men & women separate no family room. They are really quite small rooms too which I found hard work getting me and my 2 year old ready. Hairdryers available in changing rooms. :-)To get a locked just scan your locker wristband on the infrared screen, the locker is assigned to u in that section. Easy to use. We took our 2yo to the children's area she had a blast, lots of slides waterfalls the water isn't too deep. There's a big bucket that fills with water and tips every so often everyone loved it!! Fast food available everywhere shark bites offers the usual burger chips hotdog... Barracudas more choice Asia Republic express... Shawarma... Pizza. We ate at Asia Republic which was great. Also check out dolphin bay, at 2pm we got to view the dolphins and see people who got to swim with them. Overall a great day out.

Ride and relax!. This water park offers something for everybody. If you don't fancy the rides, you can just relax on the sun beds either by the pool area or on the beach side. Don't get frightened when you see the crowd at the gate. Everybody can easily fit in as the area is very large. We didn't feel like standing in the queue, so we paid 300 AED extra (for two adults) and took a private cabana. They guided us to the cabana personally. In cabana you have sunbeds for the whole day, water and fruits. You can order food there as well. Very good service. There is an age limit though for this cabana service, so if you have small children, you should choose some other option. The area is beautiful and clean and well maintained. It was a lot of fun to try different kind of rides and slides and at times have a break and just relax on your sun bed. Go there early, as the time flies when you are in the water (the place closes after sun set). If I had to choose between this and Wild Wadi - I'd definitely choose this park. If you want to avoid that ridiculous taxi queue after closing – leave well before the place closes or take the Monorail to the “main land” and take a taxi from the station where it stops. We did that and it worked well – although had to wait for the Monorail for 15 min. Still didn’t see many taxis passing by the queue during that time… Have been in this park twice and would definitely go again. Good fun for adults as well!

Leap of faith amazing experience!. Myself and hubby visited this water park and had an amazing time ! Everything is amazingly clean and the pools and rings etc are maintained to a very high standard .The swimming with dolphins is as much fun to watch as it is to take part, the beach is gorgeous and spotless too with fab sun loungers to stretch out on all around the park.My fav bit here was doing the leap of faith slide, it is so steep your adrenalin pumps just looking down it !I never thought I would do it but I'm glad I did, and you go so fast down it u don't have time to change mind ! Absolutely brilliant , the park is a definite " must visit"

Splash Splash. We arrived int he morning and were offered a VIP section with cabana for an extra price. We took this offer up as the cost was just a bit more then if we had bought the items separately. The water park it self is quite nice and the lazy river just goes on and on lol.. only downside is the park is fully closed by sunset which is a shame.
Brilliant . One liner " don't miss it if u happen to be in palm jumeriah " me and my wife had one of the most adventurous day offer lifetime.

Amazing fun field day. Even having lived in Dubai for 6 months now, this was my first visit to Aquaventure. The whole day from start to finish was excellent. Car park was empty and well organised with a shuttle bus right outside the Avenues where you have to buy your tickets from. Again very well organised and very helpful staff at the ticket kiosk and even better !! discount as a resident of Dubai !! Very good locker system in place. The rides were out of this world and only one down side was the fact that all the rides from Neptunes Tower lead you back into the lazy river which after a while gets a bit monotonous. Posiden tower are where the real adrenaline rides are and a must is the posidens revenge but not for those of a heart condition !! Thoroughly enjoyed the day and even the lunch at Sharkbites restaurant was very good value for money. Be sure to keep your wrist band on if you have parked as this ensures you get the free parking. Great day and will be a regular visitor from now on !!!! Posidens revenge here I come again !!!!!
Wow. Highly recommend it. It was fun fun fun. Good beaches, great service, friendly staff. Great rides:) Greta day out!

Loads of fun!. Had a great day here and some of the slides are brilliant! Visited both waterparks and Dubai and this one was definitely better! The big family raft rides were brilliant and so were the rubber dinghy 'water coaster' type rides they have. I even saw John Terry in the queue - I didn't warn him not to slip though! You also get beach access at the park and it gives some great views of back across the city. If you get 'The Entertainer App' for Dubai you get 2-4-1 entry at this waterpark too.

Best day out!. Go here!
You will have the most fun regardless of your age.
The waterpark is huge and has rides suitable for everyone from the timid to the adventure seekers.
This was the best day I had in Dubai!
X
Out of this world. Aquaventure a must in dubai beautyful place to be . If u go dubai and don't go aquaventure you have not seen anything

Great fun for all the family. We were in the park at 1. Dec. No queueing, lots of fun and great rides, which is accessible for you kids when higher than 120 cm. We had a ball the 4 hours we spend ther, and the only time we wasnt in the water was when we had our lunch. The food we had was standard with lots of fries and oily stuff. Not really to our likings, but who cares. We were Not there for the food. Highly recommendable.

One of the best waterparks with exciting slides!. Visited the waterpark on a Saturday...arrived at around 1pm but was not very packed probably because the weather is starting to get cooler so we didn't really have to queue for any of the slides..ticket was at AED300 for ticket + locker + tower..however as my friend has the emirates silver card we get the deal for AED150 which is such a good bargain...i tried all the 8 slides and completed within 2.5 hours as there was really not a lot of people...most exciting slide would be Slitherine which is free fall at the beginning...the next would be leap of faith which is a really steep slide but super fun! also you can see beautiful views surrounding the waterpark and you can take pictures of burj arab from the beachawesome experience and strongly recommended!

Great. Probably the best Water Park in the UAE! Great rides, great views, great services. The best thing is definitely to book a Cabana through the hotel to get your own private space + butler. A place I visit with each of my visitors and never disappointed me.

Full of surprises. This has certainly been the best waterpark I have ever visited, including those in Florida. Our 3 grown up boys loved it too and found it thrilling enough for their daredevil needs. The risers in the lazy river were probably my favourite.

Great Fun Day Location for the whole Family!. Fantastic rides, Great Burgers and Fries, efficient and friendly staff and if you get a cabana, you can have privacy in a water park! What more can you ask for?

Definitely a must... In case you have a Bucket list, Aquaventure Waterpark should be definitely in it... Simply Amazing Fun, great Food, great mood.. I guarantee you unforgettable memories.. Simply Plan it, do it, and share your experience right back here...
Awesome place . Awesome place, awesome rides, awesome bikini babes must visit. One of the best waterpark in Asia. Very beautiful views

Fun fun fun!!. I am writing this after the visit of yas waterworld! I prefer the Aquaventure way better!More f&b choices, much lesser queues to wait for! as exciting rides! I will return to Aquaventure soon!!

Nice waterpark, but avoid the restaurants!!. The waterpark is nice and it has some epic rides. A very good idea is to bring a lycra t-shirt or anykind of shirt to protect your skin in the individual slides (whith no tube). Otherwise the skin on your back will be bruised preety good. Almost everybody had red bruises on their backs. I think that happens due to the crazy speeds on those slides, but maybe some work could be done to try to solve this problem! The worst part by far was the food!! we ate at Shark Bites and it was by far the worst meal of the entire 1 week vacation!! It's a Burger King or McDonalds style fast-food, only with mutch worse food and at least 3 times more expensive. If you can, avoid eating inside the park! Overall the park is realy fun and it's worth visiting!

The best water park in the world.. We spent everyday on holiday staying at the Atlantis. It was amazing for the kids and us as parents loved it as well. So much to do we never got bored of it. The lazy river ride was so chilled and fun you could soak up sun rays while keeping cool.They have shallow pools where you could lie in and sunbath and keep cool. Amazing place......The rides were first class from kids rides to really scary for the brave!!!! Each day the family got bravier and on the last day we did just the hard core rides. It's fit for all age groups and you could be involved as much or as little as needed. I think our holiday was enhanced by this water park. In the hot days you were comfortable and did not burn. We loved it and say it was a first class attraction and will be coming back. And last of all the staff are wonderful and made the place safe!!

Quite expensive but worth it! Don't miss the dolphin bay!. Amazing aquatique park! A little expensive but worth every cent! Very beautiful, clean and big location so it's better to arrive early at the morning (the sun goes down about 5 pm in november) to have time to see the entire park, try all the crazy tubes, but also the beaches ant the dolphin bay. You'll find a lot of restaurant and coffee place to have lunch (if you don't want to spend a lot i recomand you the local fast food, food is good, specialy the falafel and the chicken).For the dolphin bay you have to order online your swim a couple of weeks before, it's expensive but it's a realy great experience, as for adults than children.When the park close you'll see a very big quew for taxi, so it's better to have dinner there and ask for taxi later, when they will be available again.
Awesome. Spent the day here. Chilled on the lazy river for about 2hours, time went by so quickly. Lots of water slide to go on. Didn't have the guts to go on the big slide :-(

Fun day. The rides are really fun (especially the one with the fishes). The park is for any kind of visitor : you can relax on the beach/deckchair/rubber ring or be more adventurer. Bonus : the views from the beach and from the two towers are nice.

Amazing!!!. Love Love Love this place!! We visited every day for a week whilst we were staying at the Atlantis Palm hotel. The kids love it. Food is a bit pricey but lots to see and do. Would definately recommend this.

The best Aquapark. You can never get bored being in here,even if you are the lazy type or the more adventurous type.If you are lazy you can lay down next to the pool or on the beach only to watch.If you are the adventurous type you have things to do all day long without getting bored or tired. It is really nice and if you want to keep the memories you should rent a GoPro

Great one of a kind. Very great water park with one of a kind slides. Very Good worth to go and a must go while in Dubai. It has beach connected with it where you can play football. Also very good since majority of the rides allow child with adults.

awesome aquapark. It's a must to go to an aquapark if you're spending your vacation in Dubai. I recommend the aquapark from the palm, but don't go in the weekend (Friday and Saturday) because it will be a little crowded. Also try to go early in the morning and bring a towel with you because otherwise you have to pay in order to get one. You can bring 1 liter of water per person.I tried every ride and the coolest one is the leap of faith, you have to try it, even in you're a girl/woman :)We didn't choose to buy the tickets using an agency because it's too expensive. We arrived there using a taxi and buy the tickets from there. Be aware that at the exit there are lots of people waiting for the taxi, we were waiting for 1h, so I think it would be better to leave 30 min or so before closing.

Over hyped water park.. First of all I feel it's a overrated and over priced Water park.Better to go for Yas water park or wild wadi if one is really interested in Water park but if you just wana check Palm Jumiera along with this park then it's a good experience.The lost chambers is a must visit.Specially for Indians we have so many water park like this at a very reasonable price.

Needs a few shows!. To complete the family experience they need the shows, attractions to keep the little ones entertained and the family busy. An exceptional venue, a little remote, but you can see in 10 years time, (when there are another 30-40 attractions around it), this will be a major venue. Yas is getting there, the F1 weekend showed what is possible, now they just need the other 52 weekends sorted!

super slides, come early. visited with friends and came 20 minutes before the park was opening. There was already quite a queue but it progressed quickly. We enjoyed all the slides and streams especially the one with the looping. There were no queues at all at the slides until we went for Lunch at 1:30 after that the waiting was quite annoying. But definetly worth the visit (despite the high prices).

Surprisingly average. Unlike most Americans and Europeans, most of us Indians are scared of getting tanned on a beach or a waterpark. I was no different.It was difficult to choose between Aquaventure or Wild Wadi. We chose aquaventure just for the sealife. There was marginal difference in prices and number of major rides.But I was disappointed as all I could see was a couple of ray fish in one of their best ride which has is a glass tube. The other rides were average - many of them similar except for their layout. Luckily there was relatively less rush that day so we were able to try out all the major rides from the 2 towers in about 3-4 hours and got out of the park.The ticket costs are higher than its worth. At least they should include a small locker with every 2 tickets. Overall, I would suggest skipping it if you are visiting Dubai for 4-5 days. I felt the waterpark at Sentosa, Singapore to be much more fun and value for money - at least they have a small free snorkeling area filled with lots of fishes.

Relaxing Family Time. This is a good place just to relax and chill with family and friends, the water pools are very well kept and clean, with life guards every few meters. The water slides are also amazing. A must go for all.

AMAZING !. A very large water park next to Atlantis hotel. Easy to spend all day there, lots of slides & flumes to go on, some quite scary tubes in the dark. Lots of places to eat & loungers. Calm "river" to relax in, on one of the many inflated rings.

Expensive, but good fun. It may not be among the best waterparks in the world but the aquaventure is pretty good. Very neat and clean, well organised and they have a variety of cool water slides.The one standout for me was the slide which takes you through a tunnel and out into open water. The tunnel is made entirely of glass and the water around it is filled with sharks and sting rays. So you literally pass though these magnificient creatures within the safety of a glass tube. Great stuff this.There are other play pools and a lazy river for the younger guys. Entrance to the waterpark is included if you happen to stay at Atlantis, and it's good to spend half a day to beat the heat.Locker facilities, changing rooms, washrooms etc make the stay comfortable.

Loved it. Rapids are a bit scary if you don't know swimming .. rules should be laid out more visibly even though the lifeguards there are very active and vigilant . Rides are cool . one day is enough to do the whole place (not incl dolphin bay ) if you are not staying in Atlantis .
Amazing and never gets old. I have been to the Aquaventure Waterpark 4-5 times and it never gets old and they do add new ride from time to time, a must try in Dubai
