best attraction. although we had not visited wild wadi water park and yas water park but the feedback from locals was that this water park is best for all age groups with couple of other attractions clubbed together like aquarium and dolphin show.
Outstanding Good Fun. Went on nearly all the water rides and each and everyone was just as brilliant as the next!! And on some of the rides i went on them multiple times as they were just superb

Amazing and huge attractions. I have got very good experiences. There is a lot of amazing attractions. Everything is huge. You must try every attraction in the both towers (Poseidon and Neptum).
But yet i have two disappointment. Tickets are really expensive and a box for clothes isn't included in the price. You'll be asked blow all of the food.

A fun place. Our 2nd visit. Yes its busy yes you may have to hunt a ring.
There were some new rides this time .We all had a great time,as we were staying at hotel we went 5- 6 times
Fun day out. This park is well worth the visit, a little pricey for tickets, towel, locker and meals but the rides and the lazy lagoon make up for it

Fantastic Experience. We visited the waterpark with two young children (2 and 4) and they had an absolutely fantastic time. The place is clean and there are plenty of supervisors on duty which makes it all feel very safe.
Two exhausted but extremely happy children.
Not worth the money. Expensive not enough rides , pool area for children? None i dont think i would visit again with the chidren once was enough

Great Fun. Bought a day pass (cost above 250 AED) with added package(towel and meal for extra 90AED). This place can get very busy during the weekends(Fri and Sat). If you're travelling from town, you can get the metro to Dubai Marina, then take the tram to Gateway and get the monorail from Gateway to Atlantis the Palm. Fares cost about 20AED for an all day pass to use on the tram and metro, then 15AED for one way on the monorail. Would definitely return again, great rides!

too busy and way too expensive. if you are visiting Atlantis Waterpark as a non - resident - be prepared for some hefty charges - when you include locker, towel rental its the best part of $150 a head which i think is just too expensive. the rides ate are great fun - but it seemed overcrowded to me

Fantastic. We were staying at the Alantis and so had free entry to the park. We spent at least 4 days there and enjoyed every minute. My husband braved the Leap of Faith and Posidons Revenge and really enjoyed them both. We also did the shark safari one afternoon which was a great experience.

The waterpark that should be on your bucket list. Fantastic. Even after two weeks at the Palm Atlantis, the kids could still not get enough of it! The life guards dotted all over the place were a very reassuring sight. The only negative thing is the heat in july (45 degrees!!), but that did not stop the kids or me from enjoying the slides and zipwires!! Would definitely visit again, but in spring or autumn ( don't know if these seasons exsist in dubai...)

Great fun, even if you're not a fan. I would normally avoid waterparks, because I have the impression that there are too many children and teens, so as a grown-up I wouldn't feel comfortable. We had a Dolphin experience booked in the afternoon, so we spent part of the morning and part of the afternoon in the park, lazying down "the river". It was a very hot day, but bearable with all the water and shade around. The towers are thrilling, a bit scarry at first, but really just great fun. People working there are nice. If you planned it or if you have extra time while in Dubai, I recommend it.

Fun in the sun. A great day out - perfect activity for the hot weather. Well organised and modern. I have, however, tried Wild Wadi, as well. Given that Atlantis had a competitor go before them, I would have thought that they would pay more attention to what they needed to live up to. Aquaventure doesn't have water sprayed on its pathways - too many people doing the hot sand hop, as it's most practical to go barefoot, but too hot to do so. The other drawback is no payment system to buy food & drink throughout the day. Wild Wadi has a wristband payment system which you settle up before you leave. At Aquaventure it's cash, which means returning to your locker to get cash when you want to buy something. Depending where you are in the park, that can mean a 10 minute walk, each way. Don't get me wrong, it's a great day out. The views from the high slide towers are amazing and the facilities very good, but once you've tried something better already a number of years ago, you wonder why they didn't spend the extra to keep up with the competition

The best water experience. Although this waterpark may be on the pricey side, it really does promise to be a great day out for the entire family.The inflatable tubes will become your best friend! The slides are quite an experience and it's well worth going early and staying until late. The best Dubai experience!

Amazing water park. I'm not an expert in water parks but thought I should visit on my penultimate day at The Atlantis and was duly impressed if not blown away. I'd Definitely recommend a visit as a family or with friends

Unexpectedly brilliant. I have a deep dislike of public swimming pools, the prospect of coming face to face with someone else's discarded elastoplast or a rapidly dispersing pocket of toddler-puke is not something I relish. I fully expected to hate every minute of my visit to the Aquaventure Waterpark, but unexpectedly thoroughly enjoyed it! The water appears clean and flotsam free and the rides are exciting. The kids loved it! Have the Chicken Schwarma for lunch!
Thrilling experience..... the tower of neptune,the tower of poseidon were amazing.even the river rides were good.helpfull staff.child friendly.kids will enjoy for sure.

Best acqua park. Been there only from 12am to 5.30pm, not much to appreciate all that this venue has to offer. Rides are incredible, you can also chill in a sand beach, play soccer and volleyball, I think we didn't see it all in that little time, but we had a great experience !!! Just there could be more rides, I think that when there are a lot of people there will be long queues for every ride !!
So much Fun!!. Like being a kid all over again! Rides were fantastic and the queues were't to long on the day we went. Definitely worth the visit!!
Worth spending a day. Aquaventure is a good water park. May be too cold between December and March. Slodes which you go down with the inner tube are better.

Nice to enjoy but very tiresome. We went for our leisure trip and visited Aquaventure.. rides are great.. waves, ripples, leap of faith, etc etc.. But at the end it will drain out all your energy so make sure that you keep enough of enrgy drinks to get the kick of instant energy

Wow it's a really memorable . Such a nice environment and lots of fun I have been in several water park but I prefer to all its big space and it's in middle of the sea and so crowed it's so fun when there is several people wow Atlantis
Amazing. A great water park for a family holiday. Buy the food deals at the ticket counter. Use the first locker room near the hotel, as the other one does not have any changing or showering rooms.

such a fun day out! - and a great discount for UAE residents. This water park is such a fun day out and its absolutely massive!theres plenty of rides to go on - some that you can do solo, others that you can go with a friend in twos or threes.or simply just lie but the wade pool or head to the private beach which has plenty of sun loungers and umbrellas. Though the food is a little over priced its still yummy. All in all a fun day out for everyone!
So Much Fun. No matter what age. The lazy river you could go around in all day! and the slides are like the movies!!! so much fun and so relaxing at the same time! top class

great waterpark!. was given free complimentary access to the water park after taking part in the dolphin encounter. it was very fun for all ages and not that much queueing due to quiet season. the staff was friendly and informative. the only thing i would say is to have clearer signs to all the rides and more maps around the park.

Loads of fun at Aquaventure. probably one of the finest waterparks anywhere. Special mention to cleanliness, safety of rides and guests with a huge army of lifeguards posted across every 20m. Total Approx 20rides including the famous ones like Leap of faith, Poseidon revenge etc.Spotless clean and dry Washrooms, towel cabanas, sun beds in abundance everywhere. Loads of eateries strategically located in the park. Guides and Security are un-obtrusive but very supportive in acse of any query. Atlantis guests have unlimited and priority entry thru another entrance directly from the hotel by batter driven buggies.Openign timings are 10am (945 am for Atlantis guests) to sunset , around 5:30pm.

Excellent!. Personally I prefer the Wild Wadi but that's not to say this is not worth visiting.Superb slides, single and multiple occupancy (up to 4), lots for the kids. Feels a little cramped as there are loungers bumper to bumper.If you have a disabled family member or pushchairs there are a lot of steps up and down and across the site (and less access ramps) - not a big problem as long as you know where to go.Drinks and food reasonably priced. Lots of changing space and lockers. We had an incident where one of our party needed first aid and they were very good and efficient.

Fun, big. There are two waterparks in dubai. This is the bigger one.The lazy river is more interesting and generally speaking, the rides are a bit rougher in here.A bit steepCan only eat junk food ... As always

Brilliant fun. We stayed at the atlantis so avoided the queues to get in. Even at peak half term, the water rides weren't too busy, never queued more than 10mins. Great range of lazy and fast rides to suit all. Plenty of shade around the place too

You have to experience this. If you are the fun loving type then this is the place for you. Lazy river is great, you grab a spare dingy (just ask the guards where you can get one) and u just go floating around through various courses which includes rapids & a type of tsunami thing which is all good. Really good rides especially the leap if faith and other one that had a count down & the floor beneath you drops & off you go (good luck with that one lol). Had a great time, it is very expensive, but enjoyed the experience. Make the experience what you want it to be, enjoy.

Fantastic. As guests of the Atlantis, entry was included. I visited with my son & was surprised at how good this was. The lazy river is very long indeed, but beware of the Rapids every so often. Very clean, well organised, beautifully maintained, well worth a visit if you have a spare day. We went on a weekday, I would imagine weekends are busier, but we had no trouble finding a lounger, although these are very close together. Food is expensive, as you would expect!

Great Fun for the Family. Loved every Aspect of the Aquaventure, perfect for the entire family, everyone had something fun to do, the kids loved both the beach as well as the Kids Splash. Its a must on every Dubai trip.
Awesome Water Park. This is a must if you have kids or if you just fancy a fun day out. Clean tidy, safe and loads of rides for all to have fun on.

Too busy and expensive. Queues were huge. Even the 'fast track' pre-paid queue to get in took over an hour to get through. Once in the park each slide took approximately 50-60minutes to get on which is uncomfortable in a 36degree heat whilst carrying a double rubber ring! If the park had not been so full I have no doubt that we would have had a great day but, unfortunately, it was just too busy and we couldn't even find available sun beds except for those in full shade in a food court!

Fabulous. A fantastic waterpark which has suitable rides for young and old. Try to go early or later (if you are staying at the Atlantis) when it's quieter and no queues. It does get busy during the day...

Simply the best!!!!!!!!!!. Wow what a place!!Totally amazing!!Brilliant day. The rides are unreal. Spent the whole day here and di not get bored once. I have been to such a amazing waterpark. So much entertainment for everyone.

Fun day out. This is a brilliant place to visit. We did a diCe with the sharks then stayed on for the afternoon to enjoy the watermark adventures. It is great for any age, as long as you can swim. Some of the rides are truly spectacular.

Best aqua Park ever . I've stayed so many times at Atlantis, main reason is aqua venture. This place really is fun and entertaining. I had gone there with my family, my son was 2 years old and really enjoyed it. I also went there twice with friends and really had fun and great experience. You enter for free if your staying at the Atlantis Hotel. Which is great indeed. Great staff, great slides, awesome photos at exhalirating slides. My son is almost 4 and I will take him back soon next February indeed. Highly recommended. P. S take waterproof mobiles or covers so you take cool pix

not so lazy river. It was very very Busy getting into the water park but once inside it was worth it. The lazy river was an adventure in itself with so many alternative routes it took ages to get back to where you started, great fun. Waiting time for rides was about what you would expect. We spent the whole day there and enjoyed all except trying to leave. The changing rooms and showers were far too small for the amount of people trying to use them at the end of the day. On leaving the water park the line for taxi's was the longest i have ever seen! not what you want after a long day of fun!

Good enough!. I wont consider it better then the yas water world in Abudhabi... bt its good enough! We had more fun nd enjoyment in yas rather then here... the shark attack slide was the best one with us in a transparent tube slide and the sharks and fishes around us! It was beautiful though it looks scary in the beginning bt its not! Bt ofcourse had a great time..Meals and tickets r ofcourse quite much expensive

Great day.. Get there early and, if you can, get a Cabana (they're big compared to many other water parks I've visited). Earlier in the day is quieter. The park closes earlier than you might think - so check before visiting. Ideally leave at least half an hour before everyone else as the queue for a taxi took around half an hour.

Great days fun. Excellent day out playing in the water and on the slides. Can work out quite expensive unless you have entertainer vouchers but on the whole a worthwhile visit. The food at shark bite was very good too. And the refill cups great value

a lot of fun. the place as expected was huge though a little bit crowded but you still can enjoy. I've been through the other water parks in U.A.E but this one is da biggest, so many rides to chose from which you'll never get bored. Everyone must try the leap of faith ride! a lot of food outlets as well to choose from. best time to go there is around 11 not yet so crowded and the weather is still not harsh.

Great fun and love the new slides. Fortunately, being a hotel guest meant park entry was free. Not the only reason we stayed at Atlantis but knowing my 8 year old would want to go to the water park most days and we'd booked the dolphin encounter, the economics of that certainly played a part in our hotel decision. Easy entry for hotel guests too, jump on a golf buggy from the hotel pool down to the wrist band hut and job done. No queuing among the masses at the main entrance!The park itself is great, the water slides, rapids, lazy river all still good but the addition of the new area is very good. The big tyre rides were certainly popular and great funWe were there during half term so queues for rides were longer than previous visits.Two things that need some attention:1. The time it takes to get served and lunch food in the main food hall.....sooooo slow (and expensive)!2. The lack of shaded areas: With so many families with small children there aren't many shaded areas. We found a spot under the trees down by the beach but that got very busy by late morning.Very enjoyable, always go at least one day every visit to Dubai

Superb. Atlantis has created a oasis of water body in the desert of Dubai with amazing water rides and fun. It has everything for a small kid to grownups and provides you with fun, fear and testing your adrenaline. Leap of Faith and Zoomarango are rides which provides you with rush of pwer inside you and takes you to limits.

Wonderful Experience. Wonderful rides, security and safety was well managed. Out of the world experience. You need the whole day up to 6 pm to enjoy the complete water park. Many tour operators pickup by 4:30,, in that case you will have to only hurry and will not enjoy the place to its fullest.
Expensive. The tickets are really expensive. Overcrowded and the food again is expensive. Also you cant go to the hotel area and you are restricted even after paying so much.
Impressive water park. It took three days at the park to feel satisfied with all the rides. Park is well planned and a lot of fun for the whole family as long as you are at least 120 cm tall:)

Not enough slide variety. My wife and i have visited Wild Wadi on 3 occasions and fancied a change of waterpark scenery. In comparison to Wild Wadi there wasn't the variety of slide experiences that i'd have hoped for and the 2 main stuctures where the slides are entered were a long walk inbetween. One thing that the park was definitely lacking was water jets to keep the paths cool, on one occasion i had to jump into the nearest cool spot, which happened to be manicured shubbery much to my wifes amusement. Wild Wadi is better.

Be a child for one day. Here you will find attraction for kids and adults. must try "leap of faith" and the "tower of nepture" don´t forget to read you bracelet on the way in so the photo camera will catch you. will have a great photo in the end. you can also dive with sharks and dolphins.

Simply the best !. Are you a family man ? Are you simgle ? Are you in love ? Did you just ger married ? Are you a teenager ?Whaever your status, you simply cannnot miss the acquaventure waterpark. It is pricey, but the rides and the space is simply exceptional.TIP : Buy tickets in advance - for next day or later - and get hefty discounts. Carry lots of suncreen and dress skimpy.

Perfect for water lovers!. Loved the Lazy River - lots of different entry/exit points so you can stay afloat for as long as you choose. Safe for active kids too - Lifeguards everywhere, smiling, friendly and eager to help. Great children's play area with lots of slides. Awesome 'grown-up' slides too!
Awesome. brilliant especially the new rides - park has had an extension and the new rides are a thrill a minute

Could be better!. It is expensive, buy tickets online for lower price.Be there early to avoid being stuck waiting to come in. Food was okay, for a fun park, but for us the service was horrible and it took forever.It's good fun but it's not spectacular in any way.I guess the best way to get if the palm is by train, taxi took forever.

Wasn't upto my expectation.. Yes it is a super fun place for kids but for the rest of us it wasn't that pleasing. After having a general image about Dubai that what ever they build will be really good, aqua venture doesn't fit that image.I really thought that for every ride where we needed to use tube we would get it from the entry of the ride but that is NOT the case, you have to carry your tube everywhere no matter how far the next ride is or no matter how many stairs.In pictures you can see a ride where you pass through a tunnel surrounded by sharks, sounds exciting, right? but after climbing so many stairs with a tube and waiting for approx 30 minutes in the que, we couldn't see the shark coz the glass was very dirty. Was really disappointed. In my personal opinion even if you do not visit aqua venture I am sure you wouldn't regret.

Amazing rides. Excellent waterpark, the kids really enjoyed and so did I although I don't really like rides but the lazy river albeit not quite lazy, as there are some fast bits, tunnels, etc but all in all an amazing place

Wild Wadi Experience. Wild Wadi has lots of exciting water rides for everybody in the family. My grandson when visiting me in Dubai loves to go and never tires of it.You are not allowed to take food and drinks in but, there are quite a few cafes for with different cuisines.It would be okay for wheelchairs I am sure but better to check first.It is a very enjoyable day.

Awesome Aquaventure. We went for the weekend and had a great time. For the price, staying the night and getting the park for free is a great deal for a short vacation. Plus, roaming around Atlantis is quite fun! The park has something for all ages.

Must visit with children. On our recent visit to Dubai, we visited aqua ventureWe used our entertainment passes, got 1for 1 for children and adultIt was hot day, we thought we will not be able to stay more than 2-3 hrsBut we were still there when it was time to close, so stayed there for 7 hrs and full of thrill and enjoymentIt has activities for all the ages, but children >6 yrs will enjoy it fullestSo plan and do it for full family entertainment

Would get a better mark if they got organised. We did a day and as it is very expensive we made the most of the day. You were limited in the amount of water you could take it yet they charged a premium for drinks. As you are a captive audience and paid nearly £50 per head to in it not right to rip you off for water.other drinks it would be expected. The park itself is great. Clean throughout and lifeguards everywhere.Our problem was at the end of the day. Everybody tried to leave together and this caused major problems at the changing rooms and trying to get away. We queued for over one and a half hours for a taxi. The staff were good at keeping the queue togther but terrible at actually getting any taxis. Eventually my daughter passed out and was sick due to the heat. Suddenly a taxi was available however the attitude of the staff was very much "get them off the premises". A disappointing end to an expensive day.

Fun Fun and More Fun. Had a lovely and wondeful experience was very hot and humid so the lazy river came in handy and they have tubes all over the place.The place can be quite overcrowed the trick is to come early we booked for the dolphin experience at 10 and since you get to use the park at no extra charge we hit the water park immediately after and spent the whole day, its starts getting crowded around 1pm but by then we had covered most rides.Dont forget your flipflops(and ones that you can keep on through out) as the distance between rides can be far and the ground is pretty hot.The rides are super cool and not for the faint hearted super thrills ...i almost got a heart attack in one of the rides"leap of faith". Make sure you have lots to drink as you can be dehydrated in between rides as the waiting in line can take too long upto half an hour but it is worth the wait. Would reccomend for families with kids to come here my 13 year old couldnt get enough of the rides.!!! Oh lots of stairs before you get to your ride you need to be fit otherwise you will only do one!!! Staff are all over the place and friendly smiling always willing to help and assist. Had lots of fun.

fabulous. A well laid out exceptionally clean attraction. Suitable for all ages plenty of tube rides for families, thrill rides if you require! Only allowed to take water in everything else has to be purchased on site. Lockers 40 aed, flip flops a must for walking on the hot floor.

Take a dip and cool off. The water park was a nice break from the heat. It is not cheap but when you are in Dubai during summer a day in the pool is a good idea. Atlantis takes a day in the pool to a whole new level. We probably spent more than an hour just drifting and chatting on the lazy river. There are more adventurous activities too but the tubing and relaxing is more my speed. I did not like the beach, the sand was just not like a real beach but the water park more than made up for it. Be prepared to stand in line for a while waiting for a taxi back to the hotel but the best things come to those who wait.

Fabulous. Having been to Wild Wadi I would say that this place is by far the best for children aged 6-10 , despite school hols ques were minimal and rides excellent. No food and drink allowed in the park but food sold inside was good value and of reasonable quality . Got two for one with the Entertainer vouchers so great value too !!!
Best in uae. Most clean waterpark ive been to.It beats yas Waterworld. . Wild wadi and all others.No comparison.

Wonderful Water Park. Aqua Venture is wonderful Water Park in Dubai near the spectacular Hotel Atlantis. It’s located in the Jumairah Palm the man-made largest island. It has lots of water attractions and features. It has a private sandy beach. There are many restaurants and cafes to have meals or snakes. It’s suitable for all family members. It’s open from morning until late night. It has amazing water-slides like The Tower of Neptune, The Tower of Poseidon, and Splasher's Children's Play Area. No need for advance booking, locker rooms are available for Men and Women. Water Park souvenirs shop are located inside the Water Park. Many restaurants are located in the Avenue adjacent to the Water Park inside Atlantis Hotel.

Water park of all water parks. If you stay at the palm this attraction is complimentary to your stay, if not this is a pay on entry.. Best time is to go during the working week as at weekends tends to be rather busy.. Great day for whole family

Good Waterpark. Enjoyed a fun day at Aquaventure. There is a good selection of slides and raft rides. Some of the raft rides are connected so you can stay in the water when it is really hot outside. Great deal with buy one get one free deals in the Entertainer books and UAE resident rates.

Great time with children. Aquaventure was highly recommended to us by friends living in Dubai. We went there in the month of August, when the weather was still pretty warm. So we decided to reach the park by late afternoon, being well aware that we'll end up having just 2-3 hours to spend there. Bad decision, because we really wanted to spend more time there. There's a lot of rides to take, and other stuff to do. There are late evening beach side activities as well, but we had to miss those as my two boys were tired and sleepy and wanted to go back home.All in all, a great family fun day.Fridays are usually super busy there, so you may have to wait a bit for most rides. That's the only drawback. Again, a great place for kids, modern rides, some really fast and adrenaline-pumping ones for grown-ups, a lot of emphasis on safety, cleanliness all around, good food on the complimentary vouchers that we got as part of the promotion.Must visit at least once. We plan to go again with some friends who might be visiting Dubai in the near future.

Fun for ALL ages.. Make a day of it. Aquaventure has it all. Book online to avoid the long seasonal lines. Arrive early to get lounges in the much needed shade. Visit the beach for terrific views of the Palm Island and the Dubai Marina. Great memories. Enjoy.

Fun day out. Having been to Aquaventure before 5 years ago I was interested to see what had changed on this visit. Queues to collected pre booked tickets were as long as on the day tickets which made me feel I had wasted time pre booking. We arrived early at about 10.30am and were definitely better off doing this. We found sun beds easily to pop our towels on and also shared a locker since there were only 2 of us. The lockers are run on a barcode system where you have a wristband with your code on. This is in addition to your entrance wristband and photo wristband- it was a good job I was not adverse to them!! We started off on the lazy river- you need to collect a plastic ring (single or double- to go on some ride and float around the river. I recommend you arrive early as later in the day people were struggling to find the rings although there were plenty if you went further into the park. The first Aztec style pyramid is home to 8 water slides including the Leap of Faith which drops you vertically from great heights before plunging you through a fish tank. Queues built as the day went on so do it early. The other rides required a ring and some were accessed via a conveyer belt from the lazy river. The second pyramid was brand new- you did not need a rubber ring for these. 2 rides were a body flume experience- nothing special and a ridiculous queue. Think it was called Slitheren- I would call it don't bother-in. There were also 2 slides which involved you sitting in a raft for 6 people and then plunged down a slope with the finish being you riding up the other side- great fun. The final piste de resistance is Poisidon's Revenge. You were loaded into a coffin shaped module at the top of the pyramid and a glass door is closed on you. You are then counted down before being plunged downwards (I won't ruin the surprise). Food outlets are typically fats food but OK and portions are large. Fab day out for all the family!!

busy. waterpark was complimentary to our stay at The Palm Atlantis. we could go whenever we wanted. For one day visitors it might be somewhat busy. the different attractions take a lot of your time standing in line waiting for your turn.

Average rating aquapark. The aqua park was nothing special. I expected it to be scarier and full of adrenaline. However the tubes were very few 4-5 and not so frightening. The dunes were really crazy and funny. Unfortunately there was not a big pool so you could swim, there was only small water zone.. The prices of the stuff selling there were extremely high like the water and soft drinks were 10x more expensive than in the supermarkets. However we spent a good time, but I advise to visit the water park in YAS island, Abu Dhabi. It is much more better.

Amazing Day with the children. We had an amazing day here , the queues were a bit long for certain rides but well worth the weight. My only moans were not enough photos were taken , we were told they took lots of photos, so didnt bother taking our camera with us, big mistake, we only had photos taken on The leap of faith n one of the family rides. The lockers and food and drinks were overpriced but that's to be expected I suppose. We still had a fantastic fun day and kids of all ages will have a fab time

Amaaaazing. Kids loved it. The parents loved it. Fantastic variety of slides and rides. Kids water park was great. Lazy river was amazing. I did the poseidons revenge (don't wear your sun top), and the Leap of Faith - amazing. I would go early to avoid the heat and the crowds. Overly strict on the height for some of the rides.

Great place to have fun. . It's amazing place to enjoy with friends it's really beautiful, beach was good but was full of jellyfish the good thing that lifeguard will warning you before let you in to the sea, only one thing the price is really high inside I mean regarding food and water.

Great Fun!!!. Despite the cost, this was a great day out. Towels available to rent plus lockers, but as with everything in Dubai, very expensive. Very hot with no water available to drink unless of course you bought bottled water. The rides / slides were excellent. Some queuing, but not too long despite the number of people there.A good laugh and a good day out. Must be unbeatable heat in summer tho!

Great fun if you can swim!. Nice waterpark, opens at 10am until sunset (closing time varies each day). Plenty of rides and activities. Towels are not provided. You can only take water, no outside food. Taxi drivers rip people off on their way out.

Just another waterpark.... Having visited waterparks across the world, this is nothing special. The queues are long (including the queue to get in there - 45 minutes). There aren't many sun beds so most guests end up on the beach. The rides aren't fantastic and as I heard one gentleman say 'long queues and no thrill' sums up most rides. It's something different to do in Dubai, but considering the reviews I read on here, it left me feeling a little disappointed. It's also quite a trek to get to, if you're not staying on the palm as the monorail is not well supported by other modes of transport and taxis are likely to become stuck in traffic.

Excellent day. Excellent day and fun for family lots of fun slides and sun beds to relax only down side which is relevant is that you have to que about 30/40 mins to get in and would recommend having a 241 voucher

Queues Ruined the Experience. This is one of the worst water parks I have ever been to. We arrived about 10 and queued for an hour to get in. The rides are very limited and the signposting ridiculously bad. After 2 hours we had only completed 2 rides - we gave up and went to the beach area (best part of the experience). As the park is so expensive we decided to tackle the queues again. We managed another 2 rides in 70 mins so gave up to go back to our hotel. Everyone must have had the same idea and there was an hour queuing for a taxi!!!! My advice - Don't bother - the management here need to visit Florida to see how it is done.

My favourite water park. I love this water park, have been to various ones over the years and this is one which is great for thrillseekers and the more sedate visitors alike. Have been again and again and enjoy each visit as much as the first.
Water fun. Great fun but not enough for children just under the 1.2m height as main kids pool was too full and babyish

Relax while having fun in Dubai. Spent the morning and beginning of the afternoon at Aquaventure, before heading back to our hotel to go on the Desert Safari adventure. I have to say it was a good way of setting up our day, but we had to squeeze in lunch a bit in a hurry to make it back to the hotel on time, around 3pm. Had a lot of fun at Aquaventure. Arrived around 10:30 and there was already some movement to buy tickets so we only got in around 11am. Perhaps getting there a bit earlier before opening time would be better. A lot of rides can be enjoyed in couple, so that's nice. Make sure to check out the beach and some rides that are a bit further away, otherwise you might miss half the park. If you own a GoPro, take it with you and make great videos while enjoying the park. The ride we liked the most was Shark Attack! in the Tower of Neptune, where you get to go through a transparent tube at the end, and see the sharks and rays swimming around you, it is really awesome!

Fun day in the sun, but meal deal is not a deal.. Aquaventure is located next to the Atlantis Hotel at the end of the Palm. The hotel offers free valet packing for the water park, but it fills up fast. We got there at 10 am and it was already full, so we had to park in the parking lot, which is quite far away and then wait for the bus. The queue took more than an hour to buy tickets as no one seemed to be in a hurry. It was a weekday and we were early so the crowd wasn't unbearable yet. This is where we got scammed. Instead of the resident passes we normally buy, we were told we had to buy a package deal which included lunch and the Lost Chambers. Being a resident, I had already been to the Lost Chamber twice, so this was a waste. The prices for food inside the park are high, so I reluctantly bought the tickets. We'd already lost two hours, so it was too late to back out now. We did manage to find tubes and a sun-bed easily as it was quite early. The queues for rides also were not bad yet. Everything was working except for something called the Aquaconda. I will say that Poseidon's Revenge is not for the faint of heart. It's basically a 4 meter straight drop. After being there about two hours, I managed to lose my glasses in the Rapids. The staff were not very helpful on this account and pretty much directed me to Lost & Found. I thankfully had a spare pair with me, and checked Lost & Found throughout the day to no avail. Next came the adventure for lunch. I took our voucher to the restaurant near our sun-bed, to which I was then told it could only be redeemed at one restaurant. That restaurant ended up being on the other side of the park, and had over 300 people in queue. Basically they forced everyone to buy vouchers for one restaurant, then failed to adequately staff the restaurant for the massive amount of people who would then come to redeem said voucher. Very bad planning. So we waited close to an hour for a burger. They were out of condiments, so it was a dry burger. Great value for money right there. We stayed and rode rides until dusk. Then went to lost & found one last time, and left my number. I no more than got off the palm, when they called me. My glasses had been found and were surprisingly not damaged in any way. Most likely someone from the staff found them, and kept them on their person until the end of the shift. They were quite expensive, so I was just glad to get them back. Overall, this wasn't my best trip to Aquaventure. The mandatory meal tickets were a real money scam to take advantage of the spring rush. I can't believe they force even residents to buy them.

Terrible. We have visited Aquaventure on a number of occasions but this was by far the worst. Our first ride Shark Attack broke down during before we had a chance to try it, after 20 minutes and zero interaction from the staff we learnt from other people that were queuing that is was out of order. We therefore proceeded to Shawarma ride another 45 minute wait due to two delays. Coupled with the chaotic scenes in the barracuda restaurant I will avoid Aquaventure until the summer months. Way too busy and stretched to the limit in the winter months.

Splash Splash. Aquaventure was an awesome experience to beat teh heat , the thrill of jumping into the No. 1 water park in the Middle East and Europe is awesome , over flowing with 17 fun-filled hectares for all ages. Experience adrenaline pumping waterslides or race down the world’s first dual slide within a slide, If you combine your visit with a Dolphin Experience in Dolphin Bay entrance to Aquaventure Waterpark is included in the cost.Receive preferred entry when you purchase your tickets online.

Another good water park. make sure you take your GOPRO cameras as the ones you rent there are about 200 AED, make sure you finish the water park first then go for the aquarium as aquarium is open till 10pm

Don't bother .... Terrible experience, the staff are just plain rude. The staff contradict each other, complete liars. They need to enrol on a customer service course or maybe have a training day in dealing with different types of customers. Awful awful awful!!! Wild wadi is waaaaaaay better!!

Very well. It is at the end of Palm near the Atlantis hotel . If you got a hotel in jumaira so this park is free for you . For example if your hotel is Atlantis you go to the park free . It is better than wild wadi because it has more water games and restaurants . It also has beach . it cost about 50 DHS from city center to this park .

Not my favourite. The queues to buy a ticket were terrible. As were the queues for the rides. There is very little for little kids to do. The sign posting for the rides is nearly non existent. I would recommend driving to yas rather than going here

great fun. We used a voucher from The Entertainer for entry which made it good value. Not a bad taxi ride as you get to see The Palm and Atlantis Hotel as you come in.The rides are really good fun, I still have the bruises from Poseidon's revenge (YouTube it!) and Leap of Faith!Things are a bit spread out but there is a nifty way of moving around, the rapids! Grab a donut and let the rapids take you around the park at a gentle pace!

Start entry at 3.00 pm instead of 11 am. In water park , considering dubai's heat if you enter in at 10-11 am , you will be tired by two or three,and you will not get veg food and food is very expensive , so you will not enjoy much.first do lost world(actually it is not worth),after water park , lost world is not comfortable.do mono rail before water park in day light.evening is less cloudy and pleasant at water park..recommand to go..

Disappointed after such good reviews in Tripadvisor. We visited AV in half term so expected it to be a little busy but surely so did the park.We arrived at Atlantis at about 10.15 to find a booking hall in absolute chaos with several different queues for different windows. We'd booked online so expected to get in fairly quickly...wrong!It took us an hour to get our wrist bands, much of which was spent fending off Russian queue jumping families with no help from the staff who caved in when challenged and let them use the wrong queue bypassing those of us who had followed their instructions 30 minutes before. It got quite heated when one guy challenged one such bloke who had weaved through the queue.There were at least 4 windows unmanned so questions must be asked regarding the staffing levels by Atlantis.That started us off on a bad footing but It didn't get much better inside the park, we only managed 4 slides in the 2 hours before lunch. Unfortunately one of the queue jumping families ended up in the same area as us during our lunch break. They took one of their kids for a wee in the bush behind another families sunbeds rather than walk 50m to the toilets!!!Sunbeds were in fairly short supply, we ended up sharing ours with two other families who had hijacked them whilst we were on a nearby slide. I guess if you are intending to spend most of the day sliding then you shouldn't really reserve a sunbed but the lockers were quite a walk away from the main slides.The slides themselves were good but you have to take your own tubes up the stairs unlike wild wadi where machines took them up for you. You carry your tube around with you and most of the time there are spares floating around the lazy river. Compared to Wild Wadi I didn't rate Aquaventure at all. The queues were bigger, the slides were about the same, the staff weren't quite as friendly as WW but the biggest difference were the clientele. For some reason Aquaventure attracts high numbers of ignorant idiots.

It's great fun!. TIPS:Take some water and some snacks, they search your bags but aren't too strict. For snacks we took cut vegetables, who is going to confiscate that?!?Take your own TowelsGet a map on entrance, the place is a maze and really poorly signposted with only a few stationary maps to look at!If you have young kids you can get special tubes with child seats, just ask the lifeguard nearest to you for help finding them! Luckily for us the park was relatively empty as schools still hadn’t broken up for half term, so we got to ride pretty much every slide, some 2 or 3 times! The little ones had a whole area dedicated to their age group for them to explore and the lazy river rapids were seemingly endless! We spent all day here, from 10 am - 6pm and were suitably knackered afterwards, but fun was had by all.

Overcrowded and wide spread. i was very excited to go there. but after reaching there was very disappointed. the way they have made up is very nice, but its very widely spread. and it was so over crowded that i could hardly do 10% -20% of the rides. as for each ride i had to wait for 45-60 min in line, which indirectly makes you tired instead of enjoying. all the rides are very far so one has to walk a lot. its advisable for people who stay there as they can reach early and maybe do it in couple of days.

Great family water park.. Nice family attraction. Probably the best in UAE when think of water parks. Great slides and a lot of fun. If you go with children be sure they are 120 cm and above as most of the slides have height limits. One thing that is unacceptable is the quality of food in the park... even though you go there for water attractions you usually spend a full day there and need to eat.Tip: start your visit in the morning so you have a chance to see everything and not rush.

Fun day with a high price. We had an exciting fun filled day. Even though the day was hot, lazy river experience did not let us feel the heat. heart throbbing attraction was leap of faith. The food was expensive, you are not allowed to carry outside food, this leaves you with no option except to eat there. Buy your tickets online to get good rates and avoid long queue.
Good for One time. The Waterpark is located on Palm Jumeira. It has four main areas offering rides, slides and true beach relaxation for all ages. It was fun.

Fun day out in the sun!. My husband, daughter and I had a fun day at Aquaventure. We arrived just on opening and didn't have to queue too long to get in. The changing rooms were a bit disorganised but we managed to get ready fairly quickly. We quickly got our inner tubes and started on the rapids and torrents. My daughter had an absolute ball!All in all we had a great day and would gladly come back.Just a couple of suggestions to help improve the park. Instead of making people carry money or credit card, they should use the same system as Wild Wadi where you have a wristband with a chip that allows you pay for food and drink. You then pay everything upon leaving the park. They should consider hosing down the paths to keep them cool. It is often extremely hot and you risk burning your feet walking from one place to another. It is a bit of an inconvenience having to leave your flip flops around the park as you might get on a ride at one point in the park and get off another.

Hugely disappointing. Our family of 7 visited Aquaventure yesterday for the first time. After queuing for tickets for 45 minutes we gained entry to the park and managed to get our first ride on the Rapids which frequently became 'log jammed'. Another wait of over half an hour and we had our 2nd ride on Shark Attack. Other rides also had huge queues so we made our way to Splashers, the children's area, which was also crowded. There was nowhere for us to sit and fully clothed adults were sitting in groups in the water, we even saw one man washing his ears out and showering under the water which had a strong uric smell. We then queued at the nearest outlet for lunch only to be told they had stopped serving pizzas and could only offer burgers. The next closest food outlet had no tables or chairs free. The toilets were awash with 'water' and the smell was revolting, overflowing bins and dirty sinks. Poseidon's revenge was a hopeless attempt - over 200 people waiting so at 4.00 we realised it was hopeless trying to get further rides and left. The park could not cope with the volume of people and we felt quite cheated at having paid so much money to simply queue and will be making our views known to the management. We frequently visit Dubai and enjoy the first class customer service it has always offered but this experience was dreadful. Aquaventure is over run, over priced and over rated and should be avoided. For a fun filled family day out Wild Wadi is much much better.
Everything to make a splash. Went here for 2 days and still didn't fit it all in. The pools were suitable for very young children and the water rides for all ages. It was great.

Expensive day out but very fun!. This is a huge water park with lots of slides, pool areas etc. we only visited the childrens area, private beach, and dolphin bay as we had a toddler and baby so could not use the adult rides,but the childrens area was lots of fun and you could easily spend the day here. I would recommend arriving early if you want a sun lounger, and warn visitors that the food and drinks are horrendously expensive (but we were not expecting it to be cheap!). The private beach was beautiful and very quiet, food was average fast food from what we saw and consumed. The park was busy but it did not feel overcrowded. A very fun day out.

Fun!. Allow a whole day there. Though very hot and long queues, its worth the thrills. Average Queue times for each ride is about 15-45 mins depending on ride. Loungers and chairs get taken up very quickly. Plan to arrive before 11am.

We had a good time. We had a good time there. We loved it and we enjoyed every second. We tried almost everything they have and we relaxed also on the beach. It is quite expensive but it worth every cent.

Full of fun for all ages. Amazing day spent here...even though I am not a water park lover I loved the experience here and my husband certainly had his money worths with all the water rides...Its well woth a visit.

AMAZING FAMILY FUN. If you are looking for fun this is the place for it, Super fun waterpark, I had a wonderful experience spending the whole day with my family, Super rides, quiet zones to relax, access to the beach, good food.If you are visiting Dubai you can stay at Atlantis the Palm Hotel and you will have a full access of Aquaventure Waterpark. If you are looking for fu come here.

Lots of fun. Spend a whole day at Aquaventure and it was lots of fun. There are many thrilling rides which guarantee fun for everybody. If you want to take a break from the slides, there is also a beach where you can relax. There are several food outlets, offering quick and simple food, at a reasonable price and of very good quality. All the personnel are very friendly, engaging and ready to assist you with anything. Aquaventure is great for people of all ages, from the little ones to the grown-ups.

Could do better but also excellent. Really enjoyed the water park but would like to provide some feedback to make it an even better experience. When you arrive you need to figure out the best package for your group. We wanted to do the water park and the aquarium. They do provide a combo package for this but we also wanted the package to include a locker, towel and a meal but ithat is not provided as a combo deal with the aquarium. So we ended up with a gold deal and bolted on the aquarium. Sounds simple but the last thing you want to do on a day out is maths.When you pay you get a wrist band with a bar code on to use this to open your locker - so far so good, but then they give a paper receipt for the aquarium another for your towels and another for your food deal. Why can't all this information be added to your wrist band bar code? Then to add to this madness as you go on the slides they give you a another bar code wrist band for finding your photos - why not use the first one? So three bits of paper and two wrist bands and off we go and we loved it. It was a busy day so we had to queue a bit this is understandable but at other parks they use entertainers to distract you. The life guards staff were plentiful, happy and fun. We had arrived by taxi which was easy but when we left to go home the queue was very, very long so we decided to get the monorail to the mainland assuming that we could hook up with taxi, bus or the metro from that end. But at the end of the monorail there was absolutely nothing! We ended up walking to the marina area on the side of a busy road until we eventually found a taxi. (A suggestion would be a shuttle bus to the marina metro stop). In short the product of the water park and aquarium were excellent but the end to end experience needs some work.

So much fun!. I loved Aquaventure ... I wish I had got to the hotel earlier (we were also staying at The Palm, where Aquaventure is located). I just floated around and relaxed for most of the afternoon, but we were transferring to the Palm from an airport hotel, where we stayed the night before, and unfortunately overslept! So I only got a couple of hours at Aquaventure, which I regret. Still, just means I'll have to go back! We did take my four-year-old to the kids play area, which was really well set up, but he was a bit scared of the big buckets of water that filled up and then tipped (with little notice) lots of water down on top of anyone who was underneath. Unfortunately, we were unprepared when we first arrived in the kitchen area, so he got a terrible shock when the smaller of the two buckets of water tipped up right on top of him, so it was hard to get him to do much else in that area afterwards. However, for a child that is less timid, I would definitely recommend it! There is so much to do there, for all ages, that I would recommend getting there early in the morning when it opens because you could spend a whole day there easily, and that's what I'll be doing next time!There was also a strong presence of staff (i.e. lifeguards) so my family and I always felt very safe.

Rapids, Torrent and Ziggerat - excellent fun. Use the entertainer voucher and book on line. Pay for a locker, plenty of room for 2 people. I would highly recommend you wear - sea/beach shoes as the concrete is very hot. This was an excellent water park with ample space and plenty to do. We came for the day and shared a locker. However, be aware that the locker is assigned to one of the barcodes on the wrist, so if sharing that person will always need to go back to the locker to open it. Not a problem for us but for some it might be. Excellent facilities, plenty of sun beds and places to eat. The food at the waterpark is quite expensive, as are the drinks, so take some snacks/drinks along. There is an option to go on the zip wire, if you pay the front desk it is 75 dirhams, but if you pay at the beach it is 100 dirhams! This is for unlimited use all day and each section is about 50 metres. It is not vast or particularly challenging but something else to do.

full of fun. excellent rides and highly recommended with family. one spend whole day in park and few rides really give you thrill like leap of faith.even one is not keen for adventurous rides there is plenty to enjoy.

Kids and adults love it. First class, with new rides this year. But be warned - we were caught out by not having enough money to cover the new Zip wire experience - 75 Dr in bought on entry, but 100 DR in the park - per person. No flexibility on options

Great Family fun. After 2 weeks touring Europe the family had a 2 day stop over in Dubai to relax before heading back to Australia.The plan was to give the kids a break by spending a full day at the waterpark. we pre booked the waterpark a & aquarium before we left and saved close to 50% entry fee.What was meant for the kids endeared up great fun for mum & dad as well ( went on all rides several times)Take the time and spend the whole day, recommend to by the food package when entering as you save a fair bit by doing so.Great family fun.
Best water park for families in Dubai. Aquaventure Waterpark is much better than Wild Waadi @ Dubai.We & our children love going there coupled with stay at the Hotel.

OMG. If you want fun this is the place for it. It is part of the Atlantis Hotel complex on The World islands. Fun fun fun. Thrill seeker yes that's me. A whole day for this is a must. Check out the wall aquarium at the Atlantis while ye in the area

Exciting fun.. For anyone in the family this would be a treat It is a good way to escape the heat also. Many slides to ride and lots of choices for foods. Just the queues are quite annoying but that goes for such a popular place.

It's awesome fun! . We were worried when going that this might be more of a family fun with children thing but turns out it's also amazing for adults. We are pretty go getters and love a little bit of risky fun and we got it there. The two best ones to ride are: Leap of Faith and Poseidon's Revenge. When doing Poseidon's Revenge, be prepared for a huge adrenaline pump from the exhilaration! Brilliant place

Amazing. Having visited both Wild Wadi and Atlantis Aquaventure, we preferred Atlantis. We really enjoyed the lazy river and the various fun bits were there was rushing water or rapids. The main rides were also very exciting and enjoyable. Food was expensive but that is to be expected. The change rooms were so clean and well cared for. Definitely we would go back !

Best waterpark in the Middle East. Super fun waterpark. just sit on the floatation ring and the lazy river will carry you up the tower into the numerous slides of the waterpark. It has places for people who want peace and quiet, and for people who like thrills. With its huge land area, one day is not enough to enjoy everything. Be there early in the morning as the crowd starts to swell in the afternoon.the fee is 220 drms during weekdays plus locker rental of 40, during payment ask the cashier to deposit 100 dirhams (atleast for one person) into your waterpark bracelet. The bracelet had a barcode that stores the information on how much you deposit. the deposit can latter be used inside the park for any purchases of food or souvenirs, no need to keep wallet or paper money when moving around the park. Unused money will be refunded.The only downside of this waterpark is there is only one changing room, as the park closes at 6 PM, the one and only changing room is packed of people all lining up for shower. I wish there could have been more changing room...
Fantastic. Small queues, thrilling rides, plenty of choice, clean, safe and relaxing. Fantastic day out. The rapids are an excellent way to enjoy relaxing in the sun.

Best way to deal with the heat. While pricey, this is a good way to spend your money. Four friends and I visited the park in mid-October. There are tons of things to do and we literally spent the whole day trying new tubes and activities. Couple things to keep in mind: 1) buy your tickets online. That way you won't have to spend an hour standing in the line and you will even save some money (tickets are cheaper online). 2) Have a big breakfast because the food inside the park in really expensive. The good thing is that you can leave the park and come back as long as you keep the bracelet. And finally, 3) stay away from the water at the beach. My fiance and I got stung by a jellyfish pretty bad. Luckily the lifeguard had vinegar and a medic came right away with a relief cream a after a couple hours the pain was gone.
The best waterpark in Dubai. I enjoyed the whole day trying all the pools and facilities, A real must if you are visiting Dubai!!!

Atlantis Waterpark - Good Day Out - Go Early & Book Online For Cheaper Entry. Aquaventure Waterpark is part of Atlantis The Palm, Dubai. Entry is 250 Dirhams if you book online in advance and prices can vary if you turn up and pay at the ticket office. We paid 285 Dirhams p/p at the door & an additional 40 Dirhams for a locker.There is an additional charge for beach towels so take your own to save on this & they allow 1 litre water to be taken in per person. Bags are briefly checked upon entry. Anything you take in can be left in the locker.Overall, some good water rides and a nice day out. I suggest getting there early to get around quicker. The park opens at 10am & gets busier after about 1pm.

Absolutely Amazing Experience!!!!. I had a wonderful experience spending the whole day with my family in the park. Amazing place to be spent with a Family. Not only for children but for all ages. I would recommend anyone to go there if the visit the land of the camels. cheers!!!!!
Best in UAE. Super experience, space is huge so don't seem too crowded. Super rides, quiet zones to relax, access to the beach, good food..... my kids had so much fun, will go back.

BIG KIDS AGAIN!!. Loved it! We didn't not stop going up and down the flooms, it was amazing and we felt like big children the whole day. Its too big, we kept getting lost but that was al a part of it. We only spent the day here but I f I go Dubai again I will stay at the hotel too!

Aqua park Atlantis. No queues. Great staff. Super clean. Great rides. My kids (14 and 16) LOVED it. It's not cheap but it was worth it. The 4 person rides are amazing and going through a shark tank on a rubber ring takes some beating. Food is standard fast food but fresh and served with the usual Dubai courtesy.

All day experience. This is an excellent water park which seems to have been based on the Disney experiences. Lots of slides for all ages and well staffed to support an enjoyable experience. Remember the sun cream
Family fun. Our children loved the water park and visited it a few times during our holiday. Whilst the park was busy the slides did not have very long queues.

Great Fun!. This place is amazing! We did not stay here but made a day trip out of it. So much fun. We swam with the sharks and had a blast on the water rides. We did all of the tall slides and they were so worth the wait!

Best time of my life... and Im a grown up!. I will never forget the floor disappearing from under my feet on that incredible ride... never again but so glad I did it! We started our day on the dinghies floating around the entire park to get a feel of what's there and where to go. We went on all the rides and the queues were more than bearable, the staff were efficient and made you feel safe and it was overall a brilliant day out for any age.This was a birthday celebration day and it was a lot of fun, lots to do for everyone and some great places to eat and drink. It is quite a big park and I can imagine on hotter days that it would be a little harder to manage so time your visit well. After all the adrenaline, it was lovely to walk around the chambers aquarium to calm the nerves so I recommend getting a pass for both in one. Have fun!

Make a splash!. The water park is enormous. Because we were only there for a few days, we didn't manage to see everything.Some of the water slides are wild but thoroughly enjoyable (unless you're of a nervous disposition) and the Leap of Faith slide was so good I had to do it twice. Hurtling down a near-vertical slide and then through a perspex tube inside a shark tank is an experience I will never forget.

Horrible Waterpark Hygienics. I came to the Atlantis Dubai with my family (3 kids) to enjoy the amenities and Aquaventure Waterpark.The waterpark has very poor hygienic standards and is flooded with non-Hotel guest.Most of the guests can't even afford a bathing trunk and they come in sweatpants and t-shirts.Why is that that so many bums are in Aquaventure??You will mostly see unkempt hairy men with fatty hairs in sweatpants in the waterpark.Futher, a lot of guests in Aquaventure have significant and obvious skin problems/rashes. It smells like rotten animals and cheesy feet when queuing up behind those people for the slides.The locker rooms are a catastrophe, they are way to small and stinking and haven't been cleaned in ages.Management, why don't you have a swim in your own park and see what you are doing to your so called "5 Star Hotel guests"?
Great fun. Loved the lazy riverGreat that you could just come and go as you pleasedWonderful for kids and adults

Excellent but you pay for it. I feel bad giving this 4 stars as it is amazing and I knew the price before I went in but is it really worth £50 each? On balance the answer is yesThe slides etc are amazing, there's little queuing from what we saw and don't worry about Dubai's strict rules, bikinis etc are fine here
Fantastic. Fantastic fun for the kids & adults. Have a flavored snow cone they are the best and pack sun cream because it will set you back $50.00 Australian dollars :(

Great fun!. We enjoyed a trip to Aquaventure Waterpark as part of our Dolphin Bay Experience and it was great fun. The rides are awesome and different to many other water parks and the 'lazy river' ride was good and relaxing in the sun. We would definitely return.

A lot of fun but Yas Waterworld is a better choice :O. I went to aquaventure before Yas waterworld had opened and I absolutely loved every bit of it. I went with my girlfriend (now wife) and had a blast at the park. The only thing was that the food was a bit expensive but oh well what water park in the world doesn't sell slightly overpriced food? The rides are great and full of thrill and it is quite easy to get to places as they are clearly marked. Only thing is that if you go in the summer, make sure you have alot of sun screen on you because otherwise you are going to burn yourself with in the first hour or so. After visiting Aquaventure I visited Yas waterworld and I have to be honest, it is just a level up from AV and I had an even beter time there so hence the 4 stars but otherwise I would have given it 5.

Good. Had a really enjoyable day at aquaventure, prices not bad although we saved lots with the entertainer voucher, the refillable cups were a godsend on such a hot day and also a nice souvenir to take home with us. Food was the usual fast food as at most waterparks and slightly inflated prices but as expected. lots of good rides we liked that we could slide through a shark tank very fun. and the river ride goes on for ages!!

Fantastic. We didn't stay at the hotel but just visited for the day at the waterpark and we had the best time. It is one of the best waterparks I have ever been too. A must do is the leap of faith if you have the guts.

Great Waterpark. This park is very relaxing and refreshing in the Dubai heat, along with a great load of thrilling water rides to keep you going, My only negative was that the ground was sooooo hot that your physically could not walk from ride to ride and the pools without the help of jandels, so dont forget them as you will regret it and pay the crazy prices at the shop for a pair. Other than that the day was great you can access the beach from there too which was nice and the water warm.
Great water park. It is a complete water park, has lots of pools and slides. Many green spaces, and several dining alternatives. The kids had a great time.

"Good enough...". It's expensive for just one attraction in Atlantis. Better to book a room in the hotel and get a free pass in this park. This is great fun for children but if you are seeking for thrilling water rides it's just so-so. Foods are not allowed. Queue is a bit long, if you are a guest in the hotel there is special lane for you. Have lovely views and good for picture backgrounds. Lockers are available with a fee. Showers are very good with shampoo, soap, and hair dryer. Overall, the place is clean, have all the amenities, and with excellent staff.
Fun. The adventure park is awesome for young and old and is totally safe as they have loads of life guards

dubai aquaventure. its a totally fun park with lot of rides for adults . bt very few rides for kids . however they have few pools which have artificial waves and the kiddos jst enjoy v mch . i did the leap of faith ride and few more heart pumping rides are there . no prob in snacks and alll ,. they hav it all with restaurants and snack counters

Fun in Sun. An excellent venue - clean and neat with opportunities to enjoy what is an excellent water-park. The scan and rent lockers were excellent as this made stress-free fun in the park easy. food, plenty of rides and lots of fun made for a wonderful experience.

Best waterpark in Dubai. Considering we had been in wild wadi the two days before our expectations had been seriously lowered . Much to over surprise this place was legend , great fun , lovely fun and friendly staff. We did not feel we were robbed like in wild wadi . I have to say I would come back , but make sure you have your p20 on it gets hot. If you want a fun day come here
Amazing. Fantastic trip to the waterpark, spent hours on all of the rides. Great value for money. Good day out for couples/family.

the best. one of the best water parks ever . best part is the tube lift that takes you up to the slides so u don't have to walk up SO many stairs in wet clothes like other water parks . really love that since the walking is tiresome . lots of great rides for all types of thrill seekers

Collected Moments. The water park was awesome. A lot to do for all ages. Good variety of slides and water attractions. If you're planning to visit Dubai, Aquaventure is a must to visit. Mark and Denise really enjoyed it so much. I'm the chaperon.....

Extreem waiting time with a three year old !. Although we had booked a combo from Switzerland with Lost Chambers, Dolphin bai and Aquaventures, we he had to wait with our three year old child for one and a half hour in order to get the entrance badge. After we had finished the dolphin bay it was 4.30 in the afternoon. The Aquaventure is closing at 6 o'clock. So we did not get to use most of the attrations. Me as the grandmother decided that I wanted to book one night especially in the Atlantis hotel so that my daughter and granddaughter would have the chance to enjoy all of the Aquaventure attractions. When I tried to get to the Lobby at about 6.30 pm it was impossible for us to get there. Although I explained everything to the security guy at the stairs that lead up to the Lobby, he jelled at me that this is not possible at all. He told us that he has got the power to send us back !!!!! I asked him if I was supposed to take a taxi with my three year old granddaughter in order to get to the lobby. He replied that it did not matter to him he was not going to let me pass to the lobby. This is a family hotel ??????? I will never book a room at this hotel again !!!!! Compared to years ago, when I was there, the customer relations service dropped to zero !

A day of fun! . So much to do at this water park! Poseidon's Revenge is the scariest ride ever! The floor drops and you are plunged into a water slide of darkness! This park is A LOT of fun and well worth the visit!
So much fun !!!!!!. it's really fun , many things to do.Amazing games , but hope to add more games.The most amazing thing is that you don't to wait too much time to play a game.

Garantueed fun!. Good for a few hours of water pleasure and fun! A little complicated after the entrance but as soon as you are in the water it´s all very clear. The lockers are only at the beginning.

Huge!. We took our children here for the day and its somewhere we will be visiting again as we didn't have time to see half of the park! We arrived before the 10am opening time to the public but were able to get changed and put our stuff in lockers. We headed to the children's splash area and picked a shaded spot. Our children, 1 & 3 loved the area but some of it was a bit much for our younger one. I managed to a double ring with child seat for the lazy river, these can be hard to find. So grab one if you can find one. We purchased some lunch from a kiosk which didn't have much choice other than chips with something. Found the food options a little disappointing but you don't have a lot of options as you are not allowed to bring your own food. By then it was mega busy and we decided to leave. It pays to arrive early!
Fantabulous. The park is spread over a vast area. The rides are very scary and world class. Some of the rides will sweep you off your feet or rather will take you to another world.

Unforgettable experience!. If you visit Dubai,do not MISS to spent a day at Aquaventure! Get it ticked from your bucket list! They have thrilling, fun-filled slides to try that would absolutely awaken your calmed nerves. They have a very excellent service to all guests (two thumbs up). I highly recommend this place for family and circle of friends. It's definitely worth every penny! :D A lifetime experience!
Crazyyyy. If you don't like this kind of water fun, don't go, because this one is the best ever. I've looked like a kid running with my husband all over the place. It's more than value money.

Very enjoyable, but not outstanding. I found the park to be enjoyable, with the shark dive a safe must do for anyone. The lazy river was among the better ones I have floated, especially the rapids sections that were fun but not dangerous in any way. Definitely get there early enough to get you seats or cabana, and be ready to commit a day. Park pictures are as expensive as you'd expect. I'd suggest to the park to create more directional signage around the park, and to make the entry process easier. As well, allow pictures to be purchased online, as we saw some of our photos but missed some important ones because a wrist band was not scanned while others were. Additionally, maybe eliminate the multiple wrist bans in favor of a single one to scan everything from. A nice thing to do in Dubai, but you may consider other parks as well.
Best of its kind. One of the best water park i have come across. Must visit for a Water Frenzy. Full marks. Good Job!!

Great Time. Indeed had a Blast!!
The more you are the more fun you have!!
Try all the hardest attraction first then after that just relax in the lazy river...

Best activity to do for all ages. The most wonderful experience and so much fun. Well organised and the staff are very helpful. getting a locker is a bit expensive for what it is, particularly when staying at such pricey hotel.

Expensive fun. It was fun and trilling experience for me and my hubby. The waterpark is huge and awesome. Crowded of course. Food and drinks is way too expensive. Other than that everything is good. A must waterpark visit in Dubai.

Good rides but very poorly designed layout. As stated in the title, the layout of the park is what lets it down majorly. Whereas Wild Wadi is designed so that you do not spend much time out of the water, Aquaventure is unfortunately designed in such a way that after almost every ride one has to climb the same tower or or go along the same route to get to another ride. I think this is one of the major things that lets the park down.In addition, the flooring can get extremely hot during the day and is a nightmare to walk on barefoot. Almost everyone had trouble walking in certain parts of the park and as a waterpark, it is not practical to have footwear on at all times.Furthermore, entry is expensive compared to Wild Wadi and I do not think the rides make up for it. As such, if you had to choose, go to Wild Wadi for an all round better experience.

Can't wait to visit again and again and..... I have visited few water parks around the world and the most fun I had was in this one. I loved everything about it. We were unlucky as we visited during the sand storm but on the other hand it meant there were not too many people and we didn't have to queue for any rides. Leap of faith was quite scary but definitely worth a try. This is an amazing water park with everything you need for day full of fun. I will definitely visit again once back to Dubai.

Atlantis Resident. As an Atlantis resident, my advice should save you time and money!! Me and my partner went to Aquaventure at 9.50ish. We didn't realise at the time, but you can access the waterpark directly through The Avenues. We spent money on a locker which is 40Ed, but in hindsight I wouldn't do this again as we didn't need anything!! As we arrived so early, there was no queues for any rides. We managed to do all rides in 2 1/2 hours. Including a long lazy ride in the lazy river.The lazy river all flows into a few rides, so you can do a few rides without leaving your ring! As we let at half 12, the queues for outsiders coming in was manic. We didn't get a bed, or anything, and after we did the slides we just went back to the hotel pools. Leap of faith is scary to initially go down, but super fun when you take the plunge. The poseidens revenge was very fast and fun. Would recommend to visit

Fun filled attraction. But nothing outstanding . We decided to visit the place via public transportation. Hence it was indeed some experience switching from taxi to metro to taxi to monorail. It was worth the experience though. The park is really huge with lot of rides. I loved the leap of faith!! However the fairytale ends here. Most of the rides were replica of ones in other countries, or rather they have adapted these rides from here. The rapids and torrents were good. So was the food, although quite costly but nonetheless worth the money spent. We went there on Tuesday hence didn't experience long queues. There are plenty of lifeguards and water park staff to take care of you and help you out. Might not come here again But the journey to Atlantis was amazing.

Not worth the hassle and money.. First of all, the waterpark is nice and in good condition. But the rides aren't all that, and the whole experience was a bit disappointing. Both for me and the 12 year old kids. The Leap of Faith, might be fun, but you should try the other rides from the Ziggurat as well. There are a fair few that is decent fun.BUT, there is NO place to cool down. The water is too hot, everywhere. No single place to get a cooldown. Very disappointing.And here is the best tip for the day out. Either book a taxi, or a private "limousin" to pick you up after when you're finished. You won't believe how long the queues were in the afternoon. We spent 2 hrs!! And the Metro-station is NOT connected to the city-Metro, it's just an attraction on the island.You can't bring your own food, and the food is ridiculously priced. 40 AED for 4 small bottles of water is the best buy...The lockers are really small as well, so beware - you won't get all the family stuff in 1 locker...Also, bring footwear, because the ground is SO hot, you can't walk around in the park without any footwear.
Looking for fun. This what outstanding. If you need to cool down, just have fun at aqua venture. Lots of places for you and your family. The park is big with lots of various rides.
Chill out. Chill out whilst having the most fun you could possibly need in this amazing water park. It's worth the entry fee if you are into water slides and chilling beside the pools.

Paradise park. I thought it was fabulous lots to do, dissapointed there wasn't a wave pool, I can understand why there was a beach, but we didn't use it as we have our own private hotel beach but great if your staying in the city, you could spend every day of your holiday in here. We used our entertainer voucher so saved lots of money on entrance and locker towel combo. Food is not as bad as I thought and have read, it's just the same as any theme park you go to, you pay extra, but hey your at the Palm and the prices are good. I could have got burger fries and drink in with my locker combo, but don't eat that type of food. I got a lovely icream 3.00 pound. The views are to kill for here, you are in paradise. Watch out for the lazy river rides you can end up on a bigger ride than you expect. It's worth going early and go on a Wednesday 10am no queues the pick of a sunbed, turn up at 1 or 2pm and you won't get a sun lounger, and really need one of these to have a break. Make sure you have flip flops, I got myself some beach shoes to go into the water and you don't have to take them off and leave them, the floor is really hot. you don't need a locker your stuff will be ok on your sun lounger. Best thing about getting there early, no que on entry. A good tip for taxis, we got a taxi there it cost 4.00 pound, we came out of the park and only hotel cars were there with people trying to get you into there cars which cost a lot more, 5 times more !!!!!! Walk past them onto the road turn left 100 yards up the road will be you regular taxis. Worth doing. Photos!!!!!!!! A lot of photos are taken of you as you enjoy your day be warned they are very expensive. Have fun.

Best waterpark in the world?. We have been to the water park at Atlantis hotel three times now and each time seems to get better and better!On our last visit (last week) we were delighted that there were some new rides. The lazy river is, as the name says, lazy and a great way to soak up some sun without getting too hot!
