The staff are excellent and on all the rides there is not one part that is not monitored by a guide which is great if you are visiting with children. We were lucky this time (travelling without our children!) to enjoy a place in the restricted area which included two sun beds, a large umbrella, an ice box with bottles of water, towels, and fruit at lunchtime. Well worth the extra spend!We have been to Wild Wadi as well and definitely think Atlantis is far better.

Excellent Fun. This was our 3rd visit and I still love it as much as we did the first time. Although it does work out to be quiet expensive once you have paid for 2 adults, locker & towel combo & food I think it is a fab day out. The rides cater for all needs. There are several restaurants within the park. Take flip flops as the floor is very hot. Would recommend.
Best aquapark in Dubai. I have been to Yas World and Wild Wadi but still love Aquaventure more than any of these places. We always have good fun there.

waterpark disappointing. Although the Atlantis experience and location great, we have experienced better waterparks in europe, restaurants (fastfood) within the park poor and signage snd staff could be better !

Average Waterpark. Average waterpark, we saved quite a bit by using the Entertainer vouchers. Few rides were closed :-( Next time I'd like to try Wild Wadi as I've done this waterpark twice now. We paid for the meal combo when we paid in so we didn't have to deal with cash once inside. Take some flip-flops with you as the floor is boiling!

Awesome. This is the best waterpark in Dubai and the world. My kids enjoyed some amazing rides - in particular the "leap of faith". I am not a ride person and preferred to float around on the lazy river ride. Had to drag my kids home after 6 hours (or they would still be there). We are a particularly "tall" family and entry prices are based on height. If members of your family are under 120cms, entry will be cheaper but they will also have limited entry on to rides. Didn't eat at the park so unable to comment on the food. Entry is cheaper if you use the entertainment book voucher. If you only have time/money to do one activity in Dubai - this is it.
Waste. If you have water pasrks in your country - do not go. Nothing extra but extra price, crowdy, Disneland-like. I am sorry I went there
splish splash. Plenty of variety of things to do from small kids pools ,rafting , zip wires to the leap of faith for the brave hearted
wow wow wow. The most amazing waterpark I have ever seen covering a huge area with plenty of lifeguards - wonderful place for people of all ages

best waterpark. You have too go to this park it's fabulous. I went swimming with dolphins a present for my birthday from my sister and brother in law. It has lots of rides aquarium shopping , lots of choice of foods. It even has free buggy to take you around. A real must x

best water park we have ever been too x. all water park lovers must visit this, The place is huge and has something for everyone of all ages, loads of rides to try out and some scream experiences too. Plenty of sun loungers to relax on but food and drinks are expensive, TIP *place your flip flops on your wrist when going down the rides as the ground is to hot to walk on in your bare feet in-between rides.

Fun day at waterpark. Getting into the park was a bit baffling. We drove, sent to a parking lot, then because we were a bit early had to wait until a lady with a parking ticket could give us a ticket, which then had to be validated, but then no one was there to take our ticket upon exit, so it was a big exercise in futility. Once paying the $100 USD to get into the park, and then $30 USD to get more sunscreen we forgot, it was from there an enjoyable experience. You will save $6 per person by pre-buying a lunch combo at the front desk. The slides were fun, plenty of tubes available, and friendly staff.

Brilliant Place!. We went here twice during our stay! Had an absolutely brilliant ball of a time! went to the beach, did all the slides and lazy river, ate in the restaurant all really good! The little buggies along the beach walk are great! They bring you up and down from the entrance all the way down to the Dolphin enclosure! so handy! and they are complimentary which is great! saves the walk in the heat! Be careful if swimming in the water at the beach though as the second time we went we were warned of tropical stinging jellyfish and not to swim which was bit of a pain but better than being stung anyways! anyways lovely place will definitely go again! :)

Bad experience - rides out of order and poor maintenance. This is a small, poorly run water park. Most rides are very similar, so variety is lacking compared to the other Parks in UAE. (Dubai and Abu Dhabi.) You can visit in about 3 hours - not a full day - poor value for money. Rides were out of order, others with poor maintenance - the tubes you shoot down are not smooth inside. Two people in my group were injured. F&B offering was poor - you know what to expect - fast food etc. but even that said the quality is poor and the service very slow and complicated. When I spoke to the Manager his rational for the slow service was that the order takers have to up-sell! LOL. Not the best reason. Give it a miss.

fun without the kids. we stayed at the Atlantis so got free entry to the park,on our first visit because it was just the two of us we had a locker for our belongings.this cost 40 dirhams.we went on all the rides (except the Poseidon ones,the first one was enough for me,I then went back to the gentler ones,being a wuss when it comes to any kind of ride) we went a second time this time I didn't have a locker,just taking minimal money etc and left my bag on a lounger.it feels a safe place to be able to do this.its worth going ,especially if you've got free entry.food and drinks are expensive inside but that's expected as it is Dubai.

HOLD YOUR BREATH!!. We went for a few hours - as adults this is all you really need once on a rise is really enough.. Each ride is good fun and as we got admission for I was more than happy. The best ride is the sheer drop one - I literally couldn't scream, move or breath!!!! Awesome!! It was very very hot and no breeze so we striggled with the heat a bit and the sunbeds are quickly taken. I recommend not going on a weekend as the queues are long. The food is limited to say the least - but you are not really there for that!

Lots of fun. We stayed at the Atlantis so had free access to the watermark.The park is very pretty, lots of things to see, and fun water slides. Plenty of sunbeds to sit on in many different areas.Very enjoyable

Heaps of Fun. I purchased the Waterpark+Lost Chambers combo ticket online. Getting here - either take a Taxi directly to Atlantis hotel, or take a taxi to Palm Gateway station and then Monorail metro to Atlantis, whatever suits you best.Must Bring - a towel each + shades + Water bottle + beach slippers + sun screenMy wife took one locker @ AED 40 and kept our valuables there. I changed into shorts in the Mens' room and left my clothes in one of the many changing rooms. They were there when i came back after several hours! So don't worry, nobody is going to take your clothes away...We did not occupy a particular sun lounger and preferred the Lazy river instead. Just take an individual tube or a couple tube and start lazing around. You'll soak some sun! Rapids now and then are great fun. Rides - Must Do's are Anaconda+Leap of Faith+Shark Attack. They are all equally FUN! Don't be scared. They all get over very quickly.There are guards sitting everywhere...just ask them for any help and they are happy to respond.Food - is expensive but fine. Photos - you get clicked! These very nice photss are available @ AED 85 each.Lost Chambers - uniquely designed not-so-large aquarium. I enjoyed it.Overall - a very good experience. Enjoy youself!!

Not as good as the Wild Wadi. Compared to the Wadi, it is bland , not so much fun staff not quite so helpfulI felt getting around was a bit of a chore.The rides are not as much fun short rapids followed by lengthy periods of maneuvering yourself to the next section not that much fun

Great waterpark but beware of going in the sea!. We had decided not to book our tickets in advance and were glad we hadn't since we could buy a combo package at the gate which included a locker and towel at a discounted price. I had been apprehensive about using the lockers having read a previous review here which stated that they opened spontaneously and people came back to find their belongings gone. I suspect this was actually due to the slightly confusing symbols on the confirmation screen when returning to your locker. A tick represents 'end my locker session' while a cross means 'continue using locker'. The rides are varied and the majority come with in-ride photo opportunities (photos can be purchased outside the aquarium). The lazy river/rapids has many points to get on and off and allows you to go around and many times as you want. Shark Attack! was a particular favorite since the ride include a leisurely trip through the middle of a shark tank. There is also a great water play area for children.If you're going in summer you will definitely need footwear of some kind. The ground quickly becomes too hot to walk on. Flip-flops can be left at the entrance to each ride (so don't worry about carrying them on with you) but even the short walk back to retreive them was unbearably painful when walking on ground that had been in the sun.We took a break from the rides to go down to the private beach. If you choose to go into the sea beware since there are (non-deadly) jellyfish (and probably other creatures) but no signs to warn you of this. Having grown up near the sea I slowly waded in and didn't kick up sediment so that I could keep an eye on what was around me. This let me see the fish (and a jellyfish) which was an amazing experience. Another family chose to swim right in though and one of them ended up getting stung (a lifeguard called the paramedics) so beware if you choose to go in.

Great fun. We swam with the dolphins and therefore had access to the water park. However, we wish we visited the park before we swam and made the most of the day because this park was excellent. We would really recommend this park
Fun for the whole family. So much fun for the whole family; the dolphin experience is also great. Expensive though hence the 4 stars only.

It is massive but you will enjoy only in good weather. It has only a few rides but good ones. The concept that I liked is that you stay on the tube and you can take turns for the rides on the tubes itself. The escalator will take you up with you on the tube to the top... so you don't need to climb much with tubes... it becomes more relaxing. But again it is expensive and not worth the price... An Aquaventure + lost chambers combo will cost you AED 375 to AED 400 with transfers. Other activities like sting ray feeding, underwater walk etc are chargeable extra. And one important thing... PLEASE CARRY YOUR OWN TOWEL, SLIPPERS AND WET POUCH... it is deadly expensive once you got inside... we had to buy slippers for AED 150, rent a towel for AED 50 and bought a wet pouch for AED 100... So we spent almost the price of a ticket on these :( And you will need these... the floors are very very hot in sun... So please read this and save some money :)

best waterpark ever!!. It was so hot when we were in Dubai so was the ideal thing to do. There is tons of pools a massive light rapid cruise around the whole park and tons of rides. The biggest best water rides I had ever been on. Leap of faith was amazing and so were the rides where you both sat in a double ring. There is a few ques and it is very hot so you have to stop for hydration but it is really worth the visit.
Fun!. Complimentary tickets whilst staying at the Atlantis. No queues at all, which was great. Variety of rides not fantastic but fun for a couple of hours. Very well kept waterpark.
Fun fun fun in the sun. Great for any thrill seeker! Great for families and great for everyone in between . Safe, well maintained facilities

Super fun. Aquaventure delights in making a wonderful day out with the family. Great rides, with levels that can be exciting for everyone. Do try the leap of faith and the tower of Poseidon. the shark attack isn't what it claims to be but is good fun. Recommend it as a day out with kids.

It was satisfying. Everywhere were different guidance how to get there, apparently Dubai Internet City metro st is nearest and from there you will have to take a taxi to the park. The monotrail is expencive. The slides and devises are all pretty much the same. On ticket office was a little paper saying Poseidon's revenge is out order. You have to pay extra for a small locker and towels, 80 aed (16€). In September there were no ques. Beverages and food is rather expencive. No one at the staff didn't know anything about the Wi-Fi. Which was mentioned at the e-ticket.

fun for children. The Atlantis water park Dubai is a wonderful experience for the family. Suits the slightly daring but it is a great thing to remember. My 10 year old son's words!! I wasn't daring but had a sun lounger so I was happy!!

Great fun but hidden extras are annoying. Really had fun in this water park. The lazy river kept us mused for almost an hour then the various slide rides added some adrenaline filled fun moments. The leap of faith is exhilarating, in particular the first few seconds of free falling. Let's of food places. Only negative is the extra hidden costs of obvious things like lockers and towels. Increase the price and make them free. £10 for a locker and £5 for a towel. Yet only £40 entry. This means in reality £60 per adult all in before food and drink.But that is not the way of the Atlantis...make it look cheaper than it is and make sure that we rinse every penny out of everyone is the strategy!

Beautiful place. We went to the Atlantis waterpark and having seen a few bad reviews I was a little uncertain - we booked for the dolphin bay interaction which included waterpark entry for AED660 (£120?) and it was amazing!!! The waterpark was clean with so much to do and the lazy river/rapids went on forever. Waterpark has it's own beautiful beach to chill out on too. Don't forget flip flops though as the floor gets so hot and will burn your feet!! We went in September and it wasn't as busy as I would of expected which was nice as didn't really need to queue for anything for long.....except to get in as we had prebooked our tickets but were directed to the wrong queue. Highly recommend.

Well worth it!. I recommend you take your flip-flops with you.Atlantis aquaventure is a lot of fun and I dare say 1 day is not enough to be satisfied by that water park. On my next visit to Dubai, I will lodge there over a weekend and enjoy at least two full days in the Aquaventure.

Loads of fun!. We went into the park straight from Dolphin Bay and therefore free entry and free towels (these are normally an additional fee). I think it was a better waterpark than the more popular Wild Wadi, cheaper and a more relaxed feel with access to a lovely beach to enjoy between rides.

Excellent time!. We went here as we stayed at the Atlantis and entry to the park was included. Some excellent water rides however I was not brave enough to do the leap of faith. To get to each slide you go via the lazy river which is brill with rapids on the way round. Definitely worth the visit.

Brilliant waterpark. As seasoned water park people having been to some great ones in Orlando we were so impressed with aqua venture, it's probably the best park we've been to! Huge, no queues, fantastic rides, not expensive really, we loved it! The huge lazy river and the slides were brilliant, the raft rides were great also, just can't say enough about it, it's a must if you're in Dubai.

not that special. I was really eager to try this waterpark since I've been crossing it almost every week.The locker system is really good and easy. the facilities wel maintained and clean.First advise always take your flip flops with you otherwise you will burn your feet.They also give towels so this is something you dont need to worry about.The lazy river lives to its name, it is lazy and take almost 1h to be done, for this reason I had almost no time to enjoy the rest of the park.
Great rides, food outlet places and friendly staff.. This place was fab a good selection of slides etc, however we were there with our 2 yr old and they didnt really cater for children that young.

Good fun. Based on the cost of entry rated only average, as I would expect to get what we had and more for the price charged. If the cost of entry was more reasonable I would have rated this as a great place to come.

Aquaventure Atlantis The Palm. This is my final review on Dubai some may be pleased to know!!!!!!!!!!! We spent the whole day here. The park itself is very clean and well maintained with beautiful flowers, palm trees etc. everywhere you look. The water rides are varied from lazy river rides to hair-raising rapids. These rapids are extremely fast flowing, and I personally have never been so scared or screamed so much in my life, but boy was it exhilarating!!!!!!!!!!!! You can step of at any point once you have reached a lagoon, then join somewhere else along the way. A bit disappointed in the food on offer. Quite pricey for basic things like sausage or burger and chips. The beach itself is lovely and very clean. It has plenty of sunbeds complete with the all important shades attached. Across the water you can see the fantastic, modern Dubai architecture. Although we enjoyed our day spent there, I am not sure about returning next year. We still have plenty of new places to explore and a couple of return visits to favourites.

Not as special as made out!. Our trip was however spoiled by the problems at entry. Having seen online a 3 in 1 promotion ‘for summer’ on their website I booked this is advance (on 7 July) for the two of us. The promotion included lunch and entry to Lost Chambers. There was no mention of when the promotion ended. On arrival what was billed as a separate checkout for those who purchased online turned out to be long queue with 2 counters – so nothing special really. But the ticket clerk only gave us entry to the water park and when informed her we had purchased the promotion she said saying the offer had finished. We pointed out that the offer was still being advertised at the airport the day before. After she refused to entertain our comments we asked for a manager who told us the offer expired on 23 July. Again we pointed out that it was still being advertised at the airport and that the promotion was for summer and summer did not end on 23 July. We insisted on them meeting their obligation and eventually the manager agreed and we got our tags. This took several minutes of arguing to the frustration of those in the queue. You can rent a locker and towels here.Eventually we gained entry. The locker room and shower area were nice and clean. The park itself is big and the water rides are relaxing as well as heart in your mouth stuff – just like most other decent water parks in the world. Just take your pick. The special feature here is the water slide through the aquarium which was really special though very brief.There are several negatives. The biggest let down was signage which was minimal and often just disappears leaving you in limbo in the heat. Another was having to carry your tubes – whoever came up with that idea - even up the stairs? No shade to relax and unusually for a water park no waves! The ‘beach’ was no better with water slimy colour.Overall, this was a disappointing trip especially considering the high price charged. Would not go there again, wild wadi is better value for money in my view.

Splashing away the heat of Dubai. Great park for kids of all ages life guards everywhere! Parts of the lazy river are ok for small children with a parent in a double inflatable ring with one end that has a plastic floor to stop your little ones disappearing on you! You can walk parts of the river in case you want to push two small kids!! Ice creams don't break the bank either about €1.50 each if was anywhere else it would be €2.50 at least plenty of towels rubber rings and different pools to sit around great day out for family don't forget flip flops or crocs as the floors are super hot and the kids won't be able for the heat!!!Great value as tickets are included in our hotel package "imperial club"Which I have to say is worth every extra penny!

Whoo hoo!!. Wife hates water parks, she dragged me along here 3 times in a week! Not really extreme flumes but great fun, great place to relax in the sun, rapids and torrent are a great way to spend a couple of hours.
Love it. Great. A little out of date but reallt like the no frills park and no lines for the rides. Great for kids as well!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
OMGgggggg ;-). OMGGGGGG !!!!It was a great day with plenty of attractions. Water everywhere! Slides everywhere. Fitness, fun and adventure all in one place. Fantastic for young and old.
Nice but short. the place is awesome specially in summer of Gulf countries.. yet it closes at 6:30- 6:45 which is sooo early when sunset is at 7:15pm

Wonderful place to relax. We love coming here it has been extended since our last visit. Free entry if you are staying at the Atlantis. Plenty of sun loungers and different areas, quiet or lively as you choose. We stay on baracuda beach on the rapids loop of the lazy river. The park is clean tidy and staffed with wonderful friendly staff
Slides as water coasters!. Amazing water slides, fast, horrible but so safe.don't miss the water coaster, at tower of Neptune!
Superrrr Waterpark!!!. I like everything in Aquaventure Waterpark! All my friends had fantastic fun there! I will recommend everyone to visit Waterpark in Atlantis!!!
so much fun. the double rings are nothing short of excellent for going round the water rapids - can't remember the last time I laughed and screamed so much!
fun. Not a fan of water parks but aqua venture will blow you away. a lot of activities. You can spend all day without realising how time fly fast. Definitely an adventure to try

Excellent park, no waiting time for the slides. 2 years ago we were in Dubai, having stayed at Atlantis the Palm. This September we returned to The park is bigger than 2 years ago, because a new tower (Tower of Posseidon) has been built. There are some new slides, which are amazing and thrilling. You must ride them. There are two capsules, while you're standing in the capsule, the floor will be removed and you will be falling into the deep. There are two big slides, which you can ride at least 3 of us (max 6 people). Screaming and fun are guaranteed :)The park is absolutely clean, you can find many restaurants, cafes, bars, where you can grab a glass of Coke, for example. There are a load of sun beds and umbrellas, you are given complementary towels, you do not have to pay for them. Moreover, you don't have to worry that you won't find a free sun bed.There are rapids and lazy rivers, which touch all the parts of the park. The 'old' part of the park is connected to the new tower, which is cool.There is a huge playing area for kids, all ages can find what fit for them the best.If you stay at Atlantis, you can enter the park everyday for free of charge. You can charge everything (drink, food, etc.) to your room.If your accommodation is with half-board, you can use your half-board voucher at Aquaventure, as well.I was highly satisfied with the park, even my Dad (65) enjoyed all the thrilling new rides :)

Great if you are in the hotel. A nice water park but only if you are in hotel as a guest. Otherwise, not so special. The other park Wild Wadi is a much better bet. It might be smaller, but really the rides and comfort zones in Wild Wadi are a must visit in Dubai. If you have time, you can visit both the water parks. If not, than only visit Wild Wadi.

OK for First time. I took the tube ride twice round the park, got off at the wrong location did not have my slippers , I got my foot burnt; Took a tube ride through the aquarium which was quite a view. The water park has only tube ridden rides, a slide and a zipline ride, nothing exciting, the water park is also over whelmed by day trippers; drinks & food is expensive in the park, be prepared to spend, arrive late and you will not find a sunbed with hood, as these get taken away as they become vacant; Of my six day stay I did not revisit the water park as this was not to my liking, there was no pool by its own where you can relax. All exposed to heat;
Fabulous. Fabulous..... was a wonderful excursion.. Enjoyed with friends... Food prices are over hiked up. went in Aug & the temp was on higher side.
Great water park. Relaxing and exciting at the same time. Great for kids and adults too. Can't believe how big it was. Would definitely go back.

Once in a Lifetime Experience!!!!!. The park is just Amazing, clean water, super rides and excellent water park.The amazing part is ,it has a palm one beach in the water park itself , which is very rare.Just one word, Awesome!!!!!!!

Could be better. Whilst there is plenty to keep older kids entertained once they reach the front of some lengthy queues, the offering for little kiddies (under1.2m tall) is more limited. And of course the snack food is ridiculously over-priced. There were plenty of friendly attendants on duty, but we heard a staff supervisor barking orders at one of them and instantly felt sorry for him. Well done to the staff for continuing to smile!

Fantastic Experience, Very Well Managed.. This was free to us as Atlantis guests, it is very well looked after. The lazy river was brilliant, just laying back on our big inflatable letting the current take us along on this imence journey was heaven. It has life guards approx every 20 metres! and it is dotted with little rapids which are so refreshing. We went on one of the many rides (we are in our late 40s so don't feel the need for speed) and had fun.Every lifeguard greets you and are so very polite.Oonly negative is the lockers located right at the start, which require a payment of 40-75 Dirhams, these should be free to guests of the hotel too, after all we are paying a lot of money already.But this is a minor point in a very well maintained waterpark.
One of the best waterparks I have been to. Brilliant waterpark, loads to do and free for guests staying at the Atlantis! Best to go first thing in the morning when it is quieter and cooler.
Slam Dunk. Excellent..... Amazing and wonderfull... Enjoyed the whole day with kids... Food Slightly over priced, more options to be added

Great splashing water. The September sun was a bummer for us Indians. But it was a great overall experience. specially the Dolphin park. Can't compare this with the big water parks in the US., but a great place to spend a whole day.

Most fun at a Water Park . My husband and I stayed at the Atlantis Dubai as a stopover on our way home to Sydney in September 2014, and as a part of staying in the hotel we had unlimited entry into Aqua Adventure Park. It wasn't ridiculously busy the day we went I think it was a Wednesday, however it was 45 degrees outside so you could imagine the heat and humidity. We went from about 11am until around 4pm but in the whole time being there we were doing something different. This is an amazing place to take a family or just a group of friends or even a couple. The rides are state of the art, and the staff are happy to help with anything. There were rides for children and hen others for adults, my favourite were probably the Leap of Faith and Slitherins revenge. There is also an amazing rapids torrent and then a seperate torrent for just relaxing. There is a seperate area just for kids with a water playground and small wading pool. There are towels available for hire so you don't need to take your own, large families can hire cabanas and there are plenty of beach chairs available. I would recommend anybody going to dubai to check it out as it is a good way to keep cool and have some fun at the same time.Just a few tips:- it is very hot in the park and not ridiculous amounts of shade. So hat, sunnies, rash shirts, sunblock and water are a must. - you can wear bikinis etc etc in the park they don't have cover up rules so you are able to wear your normal bikinis.- if you can get things or shoes that you can go around the park in they are very useful as the ground is soo hot it burns your feet running from ride to ride.- there are a few rides that will take you back up the mountains so you don't have to climb every time, keep an eye out for them.
SIMPLY SUPERB. This is one place you should not miss when you visit dubai.The rides are marvellous and you want to be in the waters for hours togeather.One particular ride is really scary

Part of our dolphin experience. Included in our dolphin experience was entry to water park When we arrive for the dolphins we were given lockersAfter the dolphins we asumed lockers would be included for our water park visit but this was extra which we thought was a bit muchDrinks at the park were very expensive The park was ok but not one of the best

Superb fun!!!. Got there early - 10 am - no queue ! Loved the fact that you can just stay in your ring all day cruising the lazy river, peeling off to go on different slides. Loved the conveyor belt rides upwards which meant no walking !Lots of different rides - loved the rapids and going though the shark pool. My partner did Poseidon's revenge - not for the faint hearted. Ideal for all ages right down to the tiny tots and us older farts !Excellent value for money - well worth the visit .

EXCELLENT. AMAZING water park! Definitely worth a visit! Get there early as you will need a whole day there as there's so much to do! My partner and I are mid twenties and we had so much fun, it is for any age. Went to both Wild Wadi and this (both same price) and would always recommend this over Wild Wadi! You will never be disappointed here! There are scary rides and what feels like miles of rapids which you can enjoy in a rubber ring.
good but a little overrated in my opinion. good day out but expensive and overrated.personally i prefer Wild Wadi.great fish tanks there though lol
had a good time. this Park is very expensive. had a good time but definitely not the best. Rides where good, Rapids was nice, ok to pass the day with kids.

A brilliant day, especially for toddlers.. My husband & I visited here 4 years ago child free and were so impressed with the place. I was a bit weary of taking my 2 young children into this water park (2 & 3 years old). I emailed Atlantis a month before to ask about height restrictions, life vests, age requirements for the rapids & didn't get a response. We were guests of Atlantis so had free access anyway. This is such a fabulous water park. It still feels new even though its going on 5 years now. Its clean, the water is crystal clear, the staff are friendly & you feel safe. There were double doughnuts with a blocked in bottom as a child seat that my husband & I could easily take 1 child each & float around in knowing they were safe. The torrents & rapids were safe for the littles but the rides had a height requirement of 1.2m so my 2 were not tall enough. Understandable.The childrens play area is marvellous & there was plenty of life guards to pluck a child out of the water at the end of a slide when they come down a bit fast. It was also a great shaded area to sit in the water & watch your little one play. Much much MUCH better then Wild Wadi (which ive also reviewed).There are plenty of life vests which my 2 didn't end up wearing as they weren't needed. Locker hire is AED40/day even for resort guests and everything is done with wristbands so no cash needed. Ice creams and any food is expensive, I did take some snacks & left them in the locker as the change rooms are air conditioned. The new rides, Tower of Posiedon, are excellent but not child friendly. Wear a hat/sunnies & cover up, use loads of suncream & enjoy.

The thrill of Ziggurat. Hated the distance...its way out of town. Access is free to Atlantis hotel guests. It was lovely, as gentle or thrilling as you wished. I loved the steep slide and landing in the midst of sharks. Arrive early as there's lots to do
Atlantis aquaventure. It is not as great as Yas Wateworld. The rapids were so slow and it was annoying that we had to carry those floats for most of the rides. There weren't many slides
What a fun place. This place was the highlight of our holiday, the water rides were amazing and I would highly recommend visiting here if in Dubai

Great Fun. We enjoyed 3 days at this place in the scorchingly hot sun, but it was great fun. My favourite ride was the Torrent, you should try it. Better to plan your visit here during cooler months, the sun can get annoying to some extent.
family escape. the entry prices are quiet high, but you can have lots of fun during the whole day, recommended for all family members, one of the attractions that must not be missed.

Totally unexpected experience. I am not one for water parks but this one far exceeded any prior experience and expectations! My wife and I went with a group of friends and had a blast. It seems a bit steep in price but with a voucher its definitely reasonable considering the experience. Have not been to Wild Wadi, but have heard from every person that has attended both that Atlantis is much better. Enjoy and keep in mind its not your normal water park!

Just isnt Wild Wadi. I visited this when staying in Atlantis but it just doesn't meet with the brilliant Wild Wadi I visited on my last stay. Most of the slides and rides just seem tame in regards to Wild Wadi and it lacks a large pool with waves and some deeper water. I didn't find anywhere where the depth was more than a meter.

Great thing to do on a hot day in Dubai. Nice mix of rides with some for thrill seekers and the very enjoyable rapids/torrent for those wanting to be a bit more relaxed. Lots of opportunity to buy food and drink (of course) but bags checked on the way in so do't be tempted to take a picnic as it will be confiscated. thoroughly enjoyed The Lost Chambers aquarium on the way out which is one of the most beautiful aquariums I have seen if not big on educational content.
''okay'' but not ''amazing''. Long queu to enter. Limited choice for meals. You need some luck to get a place with umbrell and chairs.Kids just love it!

Enjoyable. Get here early to beat the crowds.. Went at the beginning of August. Arrived around 10:30, I believe it opens at 10. Get here around then because we beat everybody and were able to go on all of the main water slides at least twice each.. Without having to wait in a queue. Especially good for the slide where you slide through the tank of fish... Because the queue was huge by 1pm.The lagoon and rapids combo is very good. Even better so that you can queue for rides while still floating around in your tube. Innovative, perfect for somebody like me who wanted to relax but not miss out on the rides. The change rooms were always clean and felt safe. Hair dryers are provided. Only thing is that lockers are in change rooms, so if your visiting with a different gender then you won't be able to access your things if you have given them the locker pass. Alternatively you can each get a locker, but for the expensive entry price we didnt want to spend anymore money. So we stuck with one locker. It's manageable but a little annoying.

One of the best waterparks.. period!. This waterpark was really expensive (around 100 euro per person), but it was definitely worth every penny. They park is so beautiful and it's an amazing environment to spend your day in the water. The only disadvantage was the organization at the changing rooms (way too crowded) and the fact that they didn't have a system to pay with electronical bracelets like Yas Waterworld has (that was perfect!). We also went swimming in the tank with sharks and very beautiful fishes, that was amazing!I will definitely come back to this waterpark!

Excellent Rides. We went on a very hot August day, but it was worth it. The rides are excellent, for both children and adults. Loved the fish tank ride. My kids loved the kids area. Food is extremely overpriced. Good value for money.

Absolutely great for everyone. Having stayed at the Atlantis in August we used the waterpark and our son and daughter loved it there lots to do for all the family, splashers for the younger ones and the adrenalin water rides for the older ones.1 tip on the first day in the park buy the metal drinks cups then you can refill all day at AED 8 a time saving you lots of money

Loved every minute. Loved everything, my son is 4 and he uses armbands but they had life jackets available. You can get a drink for 50 AED then refills for 8 AED. The lazy river and slides are great. Minimum height required for the slides 1.2 meters

Aquaventure Waterpark in Atlantis. Hubby and I had such an amazing day in Aquaventure. Awesome rides, esp. Shark Attack. It was memorable day for me in Atlantis (both Aquaventure and The Lost Chamber).Aquaventure entrance: AED 275The Lost Chamber entrance: AED100

Wild Wadi is better..... We spent Monday the 25th August in this waterpark, It was our first vist here.We spend nearly every other day in Wild wadi as it is free for us because of our hotel location.There is plenty of ride choice at Aquaventure and most of the rides are fantastic.I really loved the wave that pushes you around the Lazy River that was really fun.The only down side to this water park is the staff who work here, They are very miserable and very un-pleasant.At wild wadi they every single member of staff and life guard say hello, and have a laugh with you and treat you so nicely.Aquaventures staff and life guards do not even smile or say hello etc.....It really annoys me how we had to set our selves of on every water ride.This is very un professional and dangerous, Do these people not care??We were on rubber ring slides and we had to push our selves down the slide as the person told us to do it our selves!!Also do not expect to return to your sunbed without at least another 5 peoples clothes and shoes on top of your things, This water park seems to attract more rude members of the public.Wild wadi has much more class and friendliness.However it didn't spoil our day as we made the most of it......
Great Fun. Excellent water rides for adults and kids alike. The only down side was the long queues when checking in.

love it. One of the newest aqua parks in Dubai..so beautifully built with amazing water games .. Kids and adults enjoy their time there for sure and if you stay at Atlantis ..the admittance to the aquaventure aquapark is complimentary ..my family and I go there all the time

Lovely water park. What a nice clean water park. Arrived early so loads of sun beds available. Used the entertainer Dubai voucher so only paid for one instead of two. Bought the teenage son a premium entrance which included a locker, meal and drink,Make sure you take pool shoes with you as the floor is unbelievably hot and you couldn't walk on the floor at all.Great slides - you got a ring and didn't know where you were going and ended up on some great slides and adventures from the lazy river...Bought a refillable drinks cup which was well worth the price, after the initial price of 40 aed for the cup every refill was only 8 aed and believe me you needed loads of them.A fantastic day out.
Awesome. Better value for money than Wild wadi. Rides were great fun and lots more space to chill out between times. Good changing rooms as well

Excellent!. We went to acquaventure at the peak of Dubai Summer time - June :) Oh boy, what an experience. Killed the heat and what a blast of fun. the water rides are a real thrill, especially the leap of faith - literally takes your breath away. Don't forget to keep extra cash with you in a water proof pouch as you need to buy tickets inside for the zip line experience (unfortunately they don't tell you that at the entrance). Keep a water proof camcorder handy :)

Lots of rides but Wild Wadi has the edge. Ok so what's good about it.......lots of rides and loads of variety. It was lovely and quiet when we went, kids going back to school and all that. So the best thing was the variety and quality of the rides.I think there are a couple of things though that Wild Wadi does a bit better. No one offered us a map on entry. The rides aren't all linked together so it's not very intuitive to find your way around....I went back and asked for a map which helped,but you do need to ask. Also if you go I recommend you wear some nylon board socks or something like that. They don't spray water on the floors and there is no where to put your flip flops so your feet roast trying to get from one place to the other....really impractical.It was very clean but also very expensive, the staff aren't as customer focused as at Wild Wadi either.Overall it's a good few hours out.

Brilliant fun... I took my eleven year old daughter to Dubai mid August for a week as a special last minute treat before starting back at School. I knew it would be very hot, having visited Dubai many times myself, but also knew that if you are sensible with the sun, you can still have a very good time. We stayed at the One and Only Palace of the Royal Mirage, and apart from it being my favourite hotel in Dubai, it also offers free tickets to Aquaventure! I had myself only ever visited Wild Wadi, which is also great fun, but now having visited Aquaventure..three days in a row, I personally prefer it. We liked the wave rides and low level rides, and also shark attack, but I would have liked a few signs to show the different levels of rides. Perhaps a few photos to show how daring or child suited etc. The ground is burning hot, so take flip flops or similar and be prepared for having to pay for lockers and towels with no money back. You pay, not rent. My advice, take a waterproof wallet for around your neck to put some cash and a credit card for safekeeping. Travel to the park with a small rucksack full of non valuable essentials, sun cream factor 50 for August, and then find a sun lounger, (there are hundreds), pop it under the sun lounger along with your flip flops and jump straight in the water for the day! We did the locker and towel thing on day one, then realised what others do on day two and went from there as just explained. We went from 10.30 -6.00 each day, kept applying sun cream all day, drank tons of water available from many outlets around the park, did not burn or get sunstroke and had the absolute time of our lives. A lot of people have written about burnt feet. It's easy, just don't forget your flip flops! Food outlets are below average, so we actually didn't bother and just had a big breakfast, then drank water all day and had a big dinner later. Staff were all friendly and helpful, and on day two my polo cap flew off on shark attack and I lost it. On day three I went to lost property and could not believe they had it!Shark attack is a ride which you climb a lot of stairs to get to the top..so don't forget your flip flops, then you ride on either a single rubber ring, or in our case a double one. It's a big drop, then a dark tunnel ride, and at the end you come out in a see through tube through the centre of a tank full of sharks. Great fun. We clearly enjoyed Aquaventure as we went three days in a row, although had we not had the free tickets from our hotel, we would have only gone the once.

Aquaventure Waterpark - Dubai. This is an amazing place with amazing crowd. Lazy river is favourite of my kids. The rapids version of lazy river complete the requiremnets of adults as well. Shark ride is wonderful because of the last leg where you pass through an aquarium full of fiches..On the low side, everything is too costly inside the park. number of rides for adults is lesser than what we get in India.My overall experience is GOOD at aqauaventure and I would definitely look forward to revisit the place.

Dissapointed. Acwaventure Waterpark has decreased in class and attractiveness over the course of the last two years.We had to wait 40 minutes at about 1100 hrs. to buy an entrance ticket last weekend. Standing in line for all this time is a real put off with people of every description jumping the queue and its quite warm in the heat of Summer.Having to pay 150 AED for a large locker is really extortionate.Finding a sun lounger to relax on is almost impossible and its time the loungers are replaced as they are showing there age now.The buoys on the lazy river are uncomfortable to say the least.Food of course is expensive to the captive audience. The quality of ice cream is low.The attractions are all good and we appreciated the new multi person buoy rides.The staff around and along the water attractions are very attentive and serious in what they do and we were happy that security seems to be a number one priority. Some of the staff not surprisingly seem a little bored.The public sanitary areas are very clean. Thank you.Probably will be back with the family.
Awesome experience with kids. My kids luved it as it has a huge area designated for them. And we as adults enjoyed the other water slides n rides. Simple great

GREAT WATER RIDES. We had a lot of fun at all rides, but specially at one in what you step into along with 3 or 4 more riders in a huge wheel and then feel like youre skateboarding. Don´t miss this one.

Busy. This was the best fun the kids and i had in dubai. But it got so busy after 12 we had to leave. Also i dont know why they can not cover most of the lazy river and slow ascent for the rides specially in the summer heat...

Bring flip flops. It was fun but I honestly burned my feet just from walking around. It was so hit and apparently nobody put any thought into the choice of stones used because they were HOT- you couldn't walk a metre without seriously burning the feet. The beach was disappointing, not very pretty but calm. Couldn't swim because of jelly fish.also sad was that I could't do one of the rides on my own, you need a second person

Expected more. I have to tell the truth I expected to have more slides in the park. It is nicely built. But there are no shades where you can escape from the heat. I just expected more after all the advertisment I saw.

A great time out!. Aquaventure is another world: where all are becoming at their 18 year age. All rides are thrilling and enough to pumping the adrenaline. Love the fall on "leap of faith." We visited during Eid holidays where property was congested. To enjoy at max better visit during weekdays.

Superb!!!This is an awesome experience i ever had..... everything is perfect... love the slides so much!!!! We are all. Its really amazing! Good for group outing and family bonding. Fantastic view and certainly funny slides with excitement and thrill. Really having fun. Enjoy!!!! I will suggest this to my friends, colleagues, loved ones and other people especially to my family. We will make sure that we will visit here againThe slides are all really enjoyable. The security is always there so its easy for the parent's to play with their children. They can really enjoyed all the sites i love the mechanical wave as well. Its fantaboulus. Amazing. All i can say...... !!!!! Congratulations u did a great job... for all the staff and the management of the company. For sure u will have a successful business everytime
Great escape from the city. I stayed on Sheikh Zayed road and visiting Aquaventure was a great escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. The slides were amazing, especially "Poseidon's revenge"!
5 Star Facility. Rides are like other water parks in UAE and comparatively costly but nice location and five star facilities. Well maintained.

Abit overpriced. The kids loved this but I think it was a bit overpriced. I went along as an observer (I was did not intend on going on any of the rides) but I had to pay a full price ticket regardless. My daughter did the feeding of the rays, again abit overpriced but she did enjoy the experience.
Great fun. Very clean and great atmosphere. A very good selection of activities. Friendly and courteous staff. A great day spent there.

Excellent (again!). Spent two days at Aquaventure earlier this month - we love this place! Not a lot to say about the place really - it is brilliant. All the staff are very friendly and they interact with you at every opportunity. We paid extra for the zip-lines both days and got on quite good terms with the staff there, as most were the same ones both days. The admissions staff were really helpful too - we visited on consecutive days, but forgot to buy our return ticket for day 2 as we exited on day 1 (there is a discount). Returned the next day with our admission wristbands from the previous day and it was no problem for a manager to give us the discounted rate. If visiting when it is really hot in Dubai, make sure you take footwear of some kind you can wear / take into the water with you. The paths / walkways get VERY hot in the sunshine - the stage where is is uncomfortable to walk on them. Some of them have water sprinklers on them to help keep them cool, but when it is 43C in the shade... you need something on your feet. If you do the zip-lines, you definitely need footwear, as the launch / landing platforms there get very hot. The lockers are similar sizes to the waterparks in Florida (so a bit small - but ram stuff in and lock the door!) They are, however, located in the locker rooms, so if you visit as a couple, you'll need a locker each to make things easier.

Just brilliant. Had a fantastic time at this water park. Brilliant rides, well set out and with great staff. I have never seen so many lifeguards and this gave us reasurance to let the kids go free on their own
fantastic. expensive ,but worthy, you can spend all the day without feeling boredom,many water games,there is area for the kids.despite hot wheather fine.

New rides poor. Having been to aquaventure in the past the rides had become a bit boring but returned this year as excited to try out the new rides, unfortunately they did not live up to my expectations. The initial race slide was slow with at least 10 seconds between the two of us and some rather red backs after hitting every joint in the tubes along the way, nice little souvenir bruise as well. Worse was to come was getting stuck in the Poseidon's revenge slide, my fault apparently as I unfolded my arms but absolutely terrifying to be in an enclosed space with no help shouted down, luckily there was a hole to climb out of, the attitude of the staff was awful and the offer to give it another go was declined. It's a lovely park for a first visit but the new rides just didn't make a return visit worth the money unfortunately.

fab again. We were staying at Atlantis Hotel and so had complimentary unlimited access to aqua venture - perfect for the august heat as some days it was so hot you didn't know what to do with yourself!! We found the best time to go in to the water park was around 3-4pm it was just a little bit quieter queues to get on rides and there were plenty of floats available - unlike when we visited last april and everyone was fighting over floats!! Staff here are brilliant, happy to help but also have a fab sense of humour going around the rides especially around the lazy river/rapids. You can purchase photos for rides/rapids although be warned when we had our wrist band scanned at the end of our day the photo wasn't of us and this was made out to be our fault, the guy had a right strop when we asked him to find our photos - not exactly our fault and they should appreciate the business for the amount they charge for photos!! Regardless of his huffing and puffing we demanded them anyway- these were a memory for us that we wanted to keep. Last time i enjoyed the dolphin experience, this time the sea lion experience. Another faultless fantastic experience which i thoroughly enjoyed. My partner was able to take pictures as well which were lovely to add to the collection as well as purchasing a USB with the professional photos taken during the activity. Staff are brilliant and happy to help and answer any questions. Be warned you do have to wear a wet suit - a bit of an experience if you have never worn one before!

AWESOME STUFF!. While staying at Atlantis for 9 nights, my husband, son and father-in-law visited the Waterpark 5 times. The rides are brilliant and, most importantly, safe. There are lifeguards everywhere and there's plenty of things to do for all ages. Whether you like a lazy swim or something more adrenaline rushed, you'll find it at Aquaventure. Residents of Atlantis get complimentary admission and can get in before the general public which is great for avoiding any queues. We didn't have to queue for anything as we went in the morning, but we noticed that the rides were much busier in the afternoon. Get there for 9.45 to beat the rush! If you want to scare yourself witless, do the Leap of Faith and Poseidon's Revenge rides!!!! If you dare!

Had a great time. Great time with the small amount of water slides. Made the mistake of going around 4pm meaning I only had about 2.5hrs left of the day. Very costly considering I was only there for a short time but being a Tuesday there was short wait times for each slide. Facilities were well kept and better than any of the Australian water theme parks I was use to. Pity the sharks are all so small! Bigger ones would make it more exciting! Definitely a place for kids more so than young adults but fun can still be had. Expect theme park priced drinks and food. It's always the way at these places.
Laughed all day!. Great fun for all the family young and old! Queue times were short even park really busy.Staff were happy and waved as you sailed last on the river rapids and some even joined in!

FUN!. We stayed at Atlantis (average) but the treat was the water park. For us 2 adults who are both nearly 50, we had a ball. The water park is quite large and you can easily spend an entire day there soaking up the sun and enjoying all the water slides and attractions. Highly recommended for any age.
Fun and thrills. Easy access from the hotel and free if staying there. A huge variety of rides with something to suit all ages. Wide range of food and drink available

Water Park. We stayed at the Atlantis and used the water park practically every day we were there over our 10 day holiday as my 2 sons aged 12 and 10 liked the more extreme rides.Leap of Faith is great and my sons enjoyed Posidon's Revenge and the 6 person tyre ride.However my younger son did get stuck in the shute for Posidon's Revenge as I think he was too light to get round the loop and he was wearing a sunvest.However he was rescued very quickly by staff and next time got round when he didn't wear his sunvest as there was more friction with water.

Better water parks around like WILD WADI. I was so looking forward to this part of my trip and had even pre paid for tickets before we left London. I had been to Wild Wadi before and had high expectations for Atlantis. What a let down! The rides do not out do Wild Wadi, unlike WW the lazy river only offers 3 rides. In WW you seem to go on forever going down alternative routes. The Shark Tunnel is a flop. Inside the tube you cannot see the fish very well and it's a very short part of the ride. The signage is almost nil! The rides are not marked to identify how extreme they are. It's difficult to get around, offend ending up in dead ends. You have to carry your tubes everywhere, even clubbing up flights of steps, many flights of steps unlike WW which colour codes rides and has tubes waiting for you.There is no wave machine, no surfing, NO SHADE. Yes it's expensive and to swim with dolphins and string rays it's another £20 or so extra on top of the £40- £50 entrance fee dependent on where you buy them. Lockers are another £8.00. Water is £2.40 which is cheaper than the hotels but expense when you do need to keep topping your intake up due to the heat. Staff are very good in the park but on entry, We had to queue with our fast track tickets. We were not told you can put money on your wrist band, thank god I knew this as others were walking around with money. Flip flops are a problem. In WW you leave them at certain points, here no such points are provided and you certainly cannot go bear foot without a visit to the burns unit.I have also been turned off staying at the Palm Hotel. Yes it attracts people of wealth who use the park free of charge however many of them seem to have left their manners at home treating other guests as second rate. I have not experienced this in other places in Dubai and if I come back would rather stay at the Royal Meriden that I cannot fault, it's excellent.In all, so disappointed and no match for WW.

Shark Attack was Great !. I went there with my two teenage sons during Ramadhan last July. We stayed in Atlantis hotel so we could go this water park anytime we wanted. The rides were great ! I love shark attack because it was mild attraction, not too steep slide, but the interesting part was when you were out of the slide, at the end of it you were in the tube made of glasses which is located inside the big aquarium where sharks swam around. So you can see the sharks so close while you were also wet in the water. What a feeling.... Anyway, since it was July, it was very hot, we could not stand it for more than 2 hours playing outdoor and we needed lots and lots of water. The drink sold there in the water park was quite expensive, but gladly we stayed there and the hotel was very generous about water bottle. We could have as many as we needed. Simply recommended if you visited Dubai especially when you traveled with kids.

Great Park! - Very Spread Out! Plus Access to Atlantis Beach!. This was a father & son trip (my son is 10) and I was told that the park is primarily for kids and not much for Adults so I wasnt really looking forward to it (as we've frequented Wild Wadi a Lot, and that has many thrill rides). In camparisons to wild wadi the changing rooms are top-class with great shower facilities. However, please don't try to do this park without slipers ... its is VERY spread out, and the walkway stone are HOT!!! To my suprise there were a lot of thrills here, specially the newer section made at the further end of the park. In fact some group tube rides were way too scary! . . . there was also amazing zip lines across the park. For me one of the highlights was access to the palm cresent beach thats something that's not offered at Wild Wadi The downside was that the childrens park slides are right at the entrance and quite away from the adult rides, so you they both feel cut off from each other. The other strange thing was that the tube to ride on were not near the slide (one had to go to the wave pool, pick it up and take it to the slides....and everyone became very possesive of their own tubes).They have some great combo deals of tickets and meals (I strongly advise taking them as they are great value). The restaurants are at the last section of the park ... so its a bit of a walk, but its quite peaceful once you get there.Me and My Son Loved the park... will definately go again
Excellent day out. The children will enjoy it, worth your money and time. great rides can be crowded at times, but enjoyable experience.

Great. My friends and I had a great time here!! The rides are brilliant and the new part with the group rides etc is just phenomenal!! You are sure to have a great day here, improvements could be made in regards to food. Its expensive and far from quality, watershoes are also AED130 here and the exact same ones are available at Wild Wadi for only AED60!! I just wish Wild Wadi had my rather large size.I would recomend anyone visiting Dubai to make Aquaventure their first choice water park!!
Amazing. Loved the watermark especially the lazy river ..a must when visiting the palm and Atlantis park xxx had so much fun and sun

Aquaventure Atlantis Palm Dubai. Very frustrated at quality of service in watermark . Simply no water tubes with child seat. I spend 45 mins looking for one. Staff do not help and simply ask you to walk around in 45c to find out. Witnessed customers fighting over one. Bad control from park staff as they let grown ups use them. Also allow customers to just keep them when not in use. Terrible waste of money. No service or appreciation for hotel customers.

Great day out. Overall had a wonderful time. Lots of slides to go on. Most rides have a height restriction of 1.2m. Great children play area. Lots of food cabins, selling a variety of different foods to suit everyone's taste. The ice snow balls were awesome especially in the hot climate. Staff very friendly, polite and helpful. An expensive day out but well worth it. Entrance fee around £50, each. Extra if you want to go in aquarium, zipwire, etc. water not deep, so if you're a non swimmer it's won't be a problem. Don't be put off. Would definitely go again and surely recommend.

Great day out!. We had an excellent day out here as a couple.By far the best water park we have been too. Very clean, rides were very varied and different and had the perfect balance of relaxing on in the rings down the rapids, or going on the crazy water rides which make your heart skip a beat. There's certainly something for everyone of all ages.The only down side was the charge for a locker. Thought 40 dirrum was a bit of a cheek after having paid for the tickets and considering you need to get a locker it was just a bit of a downer.But overall - fantastic!

Had a fantastic time at Aquaventure!. I'm not a good swimmer, in fact, I would say I can't swim!I felt very safe and had a great time at the Atlantis water park with friends!High costs can be expected for food etc, but water accessories are free! :) Top tips; share a locker with a friend and get there early for a good spot! Took over 30 mins to get tickets!

Fab!. Absolutely great. Rides are fab. Rapids are great, a mix of lazy river and rapids. Staff on the whole are really friendly and smile and interact with the visitors. Height restrictions on some rides (including Leap Of Faith) of 1.20m. If your children are at 1.20m or just over, I would recommend asking one of the staff to call over a manager to get a blue band. The manager will measure the child and if over 1.20 will put on blue wrist band which means that they don't have to get questioned and measured every time.

One of the best waterparks in the area. It is the 3rd time we visit this waterpark since 2010. Slides are wonderful. Last year a completely new tower was being build, adding slides to the park similar to those of its competitors. With a general admission ticket of around 50 euros, it is priced similarly to other big water parks in the area. Food and snacks is reasonably priced. There are rides and slides for all the family. Adrenaline seekers, or not. They will not allow any food or drinks when entering the park. Towels are not available for free, you get one only if you rent it. Be careful when buying other stuff, like sunglasses, accessories, sun creams, etc. A sun spray priced at DHS 50 at a local supermarket, was DHS 115 at a shop in the park.If you visit Dubai for your vacation, it is an attraction you have to see.

A good day out. Book tickets in advance as you save 10%, it is expensive but it's a fun day out. especially if you have kids (we got there 10:30 and left at closing). The queue for the taxi was very long, we waited about 45mins so you might want to book one in advance.

Such Fun!. I bought tickets online as like to be organised BUT my hotel sold discounted tickets! We took our own towels and some bottled water (your not supposed to take drink in! 18Dhr for Coke 20Dhr for Ice cream) Don't take your valuables as you wont then need a locker. Get there early for opening, find a lounger and dump your stuff, seems quite safe. I had my iphone in waterproof holder so no valubles left. Get some water shoes as the ground is pretty hot (got mine from Aldi £4!) Also advisable to were a UV top as its was Hot in August. No many shaded areas for non participants to rest in!The best water park I have ever been to! Its design is just brilliant. Not having to leave your tube to navigate between the rivers and the slides! New slides are a great addition the racing slides are a bit slow though (odd). The highlight being the Rapids/Torrent lazy rivers! Food is just fast food it didn't look too nice. Showers and changing facilities were fine to use on the way out. A great day out. The Lost Chambers are ok took about 30mins to walk though looking at the fish exhibits, great themeing. Worth doing the once.
Very pricey!. £150 for a family of fun. Great fun but pricey for the following:1. 70 AED for a large locker. 2. 200 AED for a pair of flip flops. 3. 40 AED for soft drink with 8 AED refills.

Awesome place, a must visit!!!. Myself and my girlfriend wanted to visit one of the water parks when in Dubai and we also wanted to see Atlantis so this made us choose this one! We absolutely loved this water park, the slides are great and I really recommend going on Neptune's revenge! I won't ruin it for people who haven't visited but it's definitely unique and a great experience! The lockers here are expensive however we didn't take valuables with us so were ok to have our stuff on us and a lot of others seem to do this too. I recommend anyone going to dubai visit this park as it is a must see for everyone!

Amazing. I am not a fan of this type of park, however let me confirm you that Aquaventure is an amazing experience.Slides are fantastic (especially the Leap of faith and the Poseidon revenge, but for this second you have to be brave enough, believe me!).Atmosphere is funny.Food selectionis very poor and very expensive.To ve visited in the morning,less busy...

Love the new rides. Stayed at the Atlantis for two weeks in August and have to say the water park have added some fantastic new rides since our visit last year.Always have loads of fun early in the morning or later on in the afternoon when the park is a bit cooler and the slides don't have any queues.The only down side is that I thought the laws in Dubai were so strict that people wouldn't take any of your thing but be aware when visiting here, they will. We dropped our iphone and amazing enough it never turned up, I know this park is open to the public and I don't blame the Atlantis but if Dubai did stick to the laws and punish a lot more tourists then we could of got our phone back.We also lost a pair of designer sunglasses in the torrents and never saw them again either, when you do go to lost and found they seem to have a lot of cheaper sunglasses or fakes but people don't seem to want to give you back the more expensive items, again more strict laws for tourists in the parks.

Great day out. Great day out with a friend apart from a couple of perves, personally I think wild wadi water park is better but still had a great time, very safe and you don't have to worry about leaving your belongings unattended which I liked

Good entertaining Rides but bad experience with the Lockers. I went there last week on 14 Aug, the queues were long and took us 45 min to enter. Over all the water park was fun and the the rides were really good. Only bad experience was in the end due to the lockers. As you see Aqua venture authorities paste a plastic strap on your wrist which is your ticket and locker key also(which is good and doesn't fall off). You have to scan it on a reader which opens up a locker for you to keep your belongings. At the end of my tour, when i came back and scanned my strap on the locker, it opened up a new locker for me instead of my old one. I was very sure which was one was my locker so I started to look for security staff. That's where the bad experience started,no security staff was present near the lockers room, had to ask the main gate security man to call some one towards lockers. took them 20 minutes to come and they started asking me questions about what was in the locker and my details. After writing down everything , he put in his master codes and inside i looked and was What the F..... someone else's stuff was inside it and my stuff was gone. My 400 Dirhams, Hotel room card, mobile, sunglasses, digital camera, and clothes all were gone. The security man said to me we have to go to Lost and found now. I hadn't bring passports or more money and left at my hotel but was still in shock over my stolen items. The security guy escorted me to the lost and found stand where another guy started taking my details. He asked to show something to prove my identity to which i told everything was in locker and i dont have any thing on me. Now he I told him the main thing is my hotel card on which my name is written and other stuff exact details also. But he kept on asking like any friend or reference in Dubai who can confirm my identity. At this point i started to get frustrated and got in a little argument with him and had to ultimately say sorry as he was the only person who could help me get my stuff back. After finally writing down my details and signing an official paper, he handed a big plastic bag to me . I opened it and all my stuff was inside it. All this process took 1 hour and another security guy told me that this type of incident occurs daily. I wonder why Aqua venture is having lockers at all if people are getting these issues on daily basis. How can my locker be assigned to some one else and my stuff end up in lost and found.

Fun way to spend the day!. This water park is in the posh palm jumeirah region next to the famous and expensive Atlantis 5 star hotel.We took the combo offer (water park + lost chambers aquarium + lunch) for 250 AED per person. The water park has a lot of water slides , a few of which are really scary and exciting!you can choose to laze around for a while in the pool and in the canals.Make sure you have SYNTHETIC shorts or proper swimwear because cotton shorts aren't allowed..Buying one there will cost u 195 aed as my friend found out which is like 50 USD !also get flip-flops coz in summer, the ground is as hot as an oven and walking can get very very painful

Good but pricey.. This is part of Atlantis Palm complex wich also include Dolphin Experience center and Atlantis Palm Hotel in Palm Jumeirah, Very popular with tourist and for Dolphin Experience center must book in advance,If you want your pic taken when going on ride must scan your wrist band,Pics will cost you AED80 per pic.Also has mono rail but I believe its just a limited service from Mainland Dubai to Palm Jumeirah. Lockers will cost you AED40. Staff can be rude so be prepared.Make sure to go early to get your money worth.

Brilliantly fun and terrifying at the same time!. Never have I been so scared in all my life looking out over Dubai just before plummeting down some of these rides but absolutely brilliant!A really fun way to spend the day with friends and well set out for families with young children. A varied colleciton of rides for all ages and enough there for real thrill seekers!

Good getaway, average experience. The Aquaventure Waterpark is located in The Atlantis Hotel on Palm Island in Jumeirah - it is about 30 mins drive from Downtown Dubai (will cost you around AED 50 for one time trip). The hotel has a fantastic location, located right up at the end of the Palm Island. Travelling to the hotel is pretty easy, as there is a metro train that connects Dubai to the park. We took a train from Business Bay to the Dubai Internet City metro station - a minimum taxi fare will take you to the Palm Jumeirah Gateway monorail station which takes you to Aquaventure monorail station.The waterpark in itself is pretty average - some of the rides like the Poseiden's Revenge and Leap of Faith are fabulous. Most of the other rides are pretty much the same and will require a double tube (After a few rides, we were basically bored). A good experience to visit this park especially during summers. But please be aware that during summers the park is boiling at 45°C and it is pretty much advisable to carry slippers and sun lotion.A good place to visit since it offers a very different experience in the city of Dubai.

Really enjoyable day!. Spent the day on the beach/at the park. It's nice that the park backs onto the beach, giving you the option to flit between the two. We 'based' ourselves in the shade under a grassy area on the beachfront which was quieter and less busy. There are a lot of really good rides to do as a group/pairs/singles that range from the terrifying to the more gentle. There are also several 'rivers' for floating around the park, which also include 'rapids' and 'torrents'. If you get a picture anywhere around the park and want it at the end of the day, don't pay the 85 DHS they initially ask you for, they'll go down to 50 (it's a bit of a fiddle the attendants can do) for just a print. Great day out though!
Aquaventure Waterpark. The Aquaventure Waterpark offers something for everyone - wether you have little kids or want to go on the huge slides - this water park is right for you!

A real Joy. I have been there five years ago in the beginning of its opening and had a great time in one day experience.I went there this May for a second time and found out there are new rides which were amazing.Even though you are there for rides , there is a beach for beach lovers and parents who want to relax under the shiny sun. Also there is a dolphin pool which you can go there and playing with them.you need to book one day before your arriving in park.I recommend to experience one of the best water park in the world.

Fantastic.. Our boys loved it!! I was even brave enough to try a few rides! There were plenty of food outlets, and places to grab an ice cream or sno cone, which we all discovered we loved. Mornings were a little quieter, so a good time to go. I saw another review on here that mentioned a lack of shade, and I agree. They could provide more. the lazy river was great, as were the rapids. loved it!

Fun time. A family waterpark with amazing rides at all the three towers.If you really like adventuring, start from the third tower which has the vertical drop ride (Poseidon, not too sure of the name).Kids below certain height are obviously not allowed on all rides, like all other water parks.Also one should try the pina colada drink served near the beach (a little pricey) but worth the money.

Rapids of fun. Great time in the water park go early especially in August hot, the park is only open to Atlantis guests from 10 am to 11 am so you can get all the cool rides before any queues, despite this I found the park to be quite quiet we stayed one day until 1 pm and no queues also going from 4 pm until it shut at about 7 pm meant you definitely didn't get burnt as the sun starts to go down at 4 pm.

Excellent rides even in the desert heat!. Spent 2 days at the park with teen kids, while we stayed at the Atlantis. You don't get and early entry but staying next door to it makes it a lot easier, specially in summer. There is a direct covered indoor walkway from the hotel to the guest entrance which is great in the heat.If you're staying within the Imperial Club at Atlantis you can get your daily wrist bands from the Imperial Club reception desk on the 12th floor.You don't need to take towels as these are available free from kiosks and though they ask for your room number you can leave them anywhere in the park to be collected by staff.You can have food charged to your room at certain eating outlets within the park as well.If you don't fancy the walk from one end of the park to the other there is a golf cart type shuttle service that runs along the beach which you can use, there are pick up points along the route.Torrent river is a good way to have a look at the park as you float along in the tubes, but this is no lazy river, with rapids waves and waterfalls and its LONG! Its worth have a look at the map to see which branches you want to explore, you can even get up the Ziggurat tower from the river.The Ziggurat tower is where you slide down and exit through the fish tank while riding on a tube or you can do the steep drop (leap of faith). This tower has numerous tube rides and is a good starting point.The Barracudas tower has the large ring rides where you can sit in groups 5 or 6 and go on a tube ride. It also has the drop slide where you stand in a capsule and then the floor drops away beneath you - very scary!The restaurants are air conditioned in the park so great way to get out of the heat.
fun at its best!. Despite the heat, had an extremely fun day at the waterslides! favorites were the poseidon and river rides...who said only children can have fun? a must for all ages ;)

Loved it. Stayed as a guest in Atlantis for 5 days so entry to Aquaventure was included, we visited every day! There were always sunbeds free and it wasn't too busy at all, maybe it was because we were there mid week in August? Longest queue we waited in was 10 mins for Leap of Faith, loved the lazy river, raft and ring rides. The torrent was so much fun, we are 2 young adults in our 20s and spent full days here 5 days in a row! Loved sitting in front of Leap of Faith at the end of the day watching people coming down the slide.We bought a refillable cup for 80 AED (£13) with refills for 8 AED (£1.30) was definitely worth it for us as we got 5 days use out of it. Ate in one of the restaurants but was just fast food wasn't the best, try the restaurants near the entrance instead TBJ or Asia Republic. One of the days we hired a Go Pro like camera, the staff at the entrance have them and charge 200 AED (£32.00) it's a waterproof camera that you can strap to your wrist and take about 2000 photos and hours of video, your allowed to take it all round the lazy river and on all the slides, quality is excellent and we've brought some fab photos and videos home with us on memory card. Top tip take cheap flip flops your allowed to take them on most slides and on lazy river floor is unbearably hot without them!

waterpark. Good park for family and thrill seekers. Recommend getting a cabana.
We were staying at the one and only and were given complimtary tickets, the hotel also runs a shuttle bus to the park.

Great Fun, but Muslims beware. This review is in two parts - One General review and one for Muslims:GENERAL REVIEWThe waterpark is great fun. There's three main waterparks to choose from within the UAE:: Aquaventure, Wild Wadi and Yas Waterworld. I haven't included Dreamland Aqua park as this is a little further out and I haven't been there but you can get some good groupon deals for that one so it's worth looking into.I had an Entertainer voucher for Aquaventure so we got half of our tickets for free (buy one get one free) so it's worth investing in an Entertainer booklet if there's 4+ more of you in a group as you'll recover the cost of the book just in using it here.There's lot of fun activities at Aquaventure for people of all ages. KIDS - The Splash Play area for kids is awesome, in fact the adults look like they enjoy it as much as the kids!! There's also a beautiful beach and the water rapids that take you around the park.
