If you have young children, pick up a rubber dingy that has a child seat. For thrill seekers there's lots to do on the two main buildings: Neptune tower and Poseidon Tower. Leap of Faith is a must do..awesome! On Poseidon tower there's a ride where you stand in a tube and floor dissapears leaving you in a freefall. another MUST DO.Negatives: This waterpark doesn't have shoe racks next to it's attractions so you have to just put your flip flops somewhere 'on the side' or carry them with you on board. In the summer months the floor is very hot and therefore when you leave a ride to go and collect your flip flops/footwear you will end up getting very hot/burnt feet! They don't spray the floor here like they do at other waterparks so beware!Be prepared to have a workout! you need to go and find a dingy and then carry it with you up all those stairs again and again for many of the rides that require a dingy :-( it get tiresome. They should have a system of just collecting it at the top of the tower. There are 7 rides on Neptune tower. 6 of them require a dingy so if you do all of them you'll be climbing all those steps holding a dingy! Despite the above, it's a great day out and still worth it. Tip: Make sure you put some money onto your wristband when you buy your tickets so you can go into the park and buy food etc without having to carry money. The remaining amount on your band can be refunded at the end of the day. BEWARE: They check your bags before you enter the park and won't allow you to take food or drinks into the park, so they can force you to buy their 55AED burgers (!) and high priced water :-)MUSLIMSThis is not a good place for us to visit unless our sisters go on a 'womens only' day or they start doing 'family days' where the dresscode is strict. On a normal day, there's just too much flesh on display due it being a main tourist attraction and the amount of sin we accumulate cannot justify the visit. Unless they start doing a 'family day' I will not be going back. There's a masjid at the park entrance, so no excuse to miss salah.

The best water park in the UAE. I have been to all the water parks in the UAE (wild wadi, Yas Island, Ice Land and Dreamland), and by Far Aquadventure is the best.Sometimes it may get packed but if you choose the right day, you will have lots of fun.

Everything you'd want in a waterpark. Super fun day out - just the right amount of rides and slides without the park it being too big. Plenty of big scary ones for thrillseekers! The lazy river is endless, so great if half your group want to lounge on a rubber ring and sunbathe instead of go on the flumes! Would definitely recommend.

Most exciting day I spent in Dubai. One of the best things about the park in my opinion is being located in a truly exceptional location: Atlantis resort in th middle of the palm island. Apart from all the exciting slides and fun things to do, there is a strip of sandy beach where you can relax away from the buzz, and have a view of the city jungle that cannot be seen elsewhere. Could stay there all day.
Great fun. very thrilling slides, loved the general atmosphere, queues were not that long. the water coaster and leap of faith are must dos!

Exceptional. I went to Dubai for my honey moon , on November 2013 I stayed at the Atlantis and went to the Water park early in the morning I was the first one to arrive so I got to try the slides so many times , the experience is amazing and the staff is very friendly and they kept on waiving their hands to me all the way .

The best waterpark I've been to. Admittedly I haven't been to any parks on the American continent, but here is what I thought of Aquaventure :Top service and care at the first aid station : no, I didn't have an accident in the waterpark, it was a jellyfish sting in the sea. They still attended to me in a very professional, considerate and friendly manner, and I believe this should be pointed out, as a waterpark is not only rides, but people too.About the fun now.....I think if I say we had to leave because it was closing down, I summarize pretty much everything ! Was there only in the afternoon, and it wasn't enough to go to all the attractions. Queuing time was acceptable (possibly due to the time of day and month ?), favorite slide (don't leave without trying this) was Posidon's revenge. But I only went to the Poseidon part of the park.You need to pay extra for zip lining....I think it is an unnecessary thing to have in a waterpark.In a nutshell, lots of fun, lots of laughter, don't miss it if you are staying at the Palm Hotel or nearby.
Not bad at all. We enjoyed all the rides.My suggestions r that do all the rides first than do the lazy pool.Because it takes about half an hour .Very relaxing.

First Class Water Fun. Not quite as good as Discovery Cove in Florida but still pretty awesome. We stayed 8 hours, I was burnt to a cinder - the lazy river is so addictive you don't realise you're cooking!

Park going downhill. . We have been going to Aquaventure since it opened. Charging for water is outrageous. We just were at Wadi Adventures in Abu Dhabi which has free fountains around park. Bring Mosquito spray as whole family all were bitten badly all day. The new rides we enjoyed by family but broke down often due to hear and traffic of people. We queued in three rides that had to shut down due to malfunctions. 3 out of 5 stars because we used local residents rate promotional offer at 165 AED per person.

Great waterpark. Located at Atlantis hotel, the park has many water rides. Go early. Prices tend to be high, but if you buy an entertainer book from any supermarket there are usually buy 1 get one free coupons.

Fun!. We were guests at the hotel so had free access whenever we wanted but it would be worth paying to get in too!Lots of things to do for children and adults. Lots of water slides, sunbathing areas, restaurants etc. There is also lockers and changing rooms with showers for people who are not staying at the hotel, although these can get a bit crowded at closing time so I would recommend leaving earlier if you want to shower!We visited everyday and never got bored!

Fun, fun and lots more fun under the sun. My family had the most wonderful time in Aquaventure. First was the breathtaking scenery of course from the moment we arrived up to the time we went home. To make this review more helpful, here are some pointers. 1) To make your day enjoyable, I suggest you book your ticket beforehand on the web. You can choose the type of ticket you'll be buying for your family which saves you lots of time. (the lines are very long in the queue)2) If you book one with the Aquarium package, go take a dip in their pool 1st before sightseeing in their "The Lost Chambers Aquarium"...Why, you might ask? Well the aquaventure only opens up to 5 PM then closes; while the aquarium remains open till night time3) There are lots of pool sides to choose from, but make sure you memorize your place and remember the signs else you will get lost... It is a very big place4) There are lots of sitting areas, food stalls and juice coolers so you and your family won't have to worry about "little tummy cravings"5) Life-jackets are available for free and so are their floaties which you can use to ride along the pool that makes a circuit to all their other pools 6) Their are many slide choices for adventurous adults and all of them are exhilarating7) The staff are very professional and they are very friendly. They monitor almost everyone and that is very calming for me who has a little boy who can't keep himself away from the waterNegative1) It is expensive, but worth the smiles, giggles and lots of splashing from your family...Enjoy! I know we did....

So much Fun. We all loved this place. From my mum who's 60 down to my youngest who is 6. So much to do, we never even got to try everything and we went twice. There are scary and not so scary rides which is great. Sun loungers were there and we left our bags on there and went exploring and everything was safe (just covered with towels). Would love to go back here as very fun

expensive but kids enjoyed. it was brilliant and the kids aged 9,6 and 4 had lots of fun in the kids pool but I think it is just too expensive especially the food its approx. £10 a meal. I would recommend not to purchase the lockers unless you really have to because they are pricey and not many people use lockers they just leve there things on the sunbed
Great fun. Great fun loads of sun beds lots to do Lots of changes since we last visited 2years ago and I would say for the better We'll worth a visit

Lots of fun. We went here after the Dolphin adventure, my kids really enjoyed it and didn't want to leave, my daughter who is 5 loved the river rapids and torrent. Nice and clean, plenty of space and not silly queues for the rides... a win in our book.
Nice. Its so nice place for families and youngs ,,, all pools are nice and the beach is so relaxing ,, I highly recommend this place

The best waterpark we've been to, ideal for kids. The waterpark offers numerous attractions, with different levels for all ages. It can be enjoyed by all the family. F&B inside the park is of good quality and not more expensive than the average in Dubai. We advice to stay in the Atlantis Hotel because it includes the entrance to the park on day of arrival and departure... although the hotel is always very crowded.
Great for kids!. If you wanna try the Leap of Faith slide, think over it again! My wife is still shaking... But it is really safe and amusing.

Cool down required. We have been holidaying in Dubai and stayed at atlantis for a few years now and really noticed this year the lack of shaded areas at the waterpark...it's getting bigger and busier and surely if the beautiful plant life can be watered constantly the walkways and patrons can be too ! More shaded loungers and water sprays required.New barracudas was great ! Supercool and friendly staff and nice food too !

Bloody Indians!!. I went to aquaventure on8th august for my birthday.its a wonderful place with so much to do.however the staff were rude(maybe because it wAs too hot)One thing that i wanted to say.we used a buggy service to take us near the locker,wen we reached the place the driver (roshan) rudely said get down.i told him i know i hav to get down..while me n my huSband were walking he told his collegeau bloody indians.we reported this to mark the recreation manager...he said he will speak to the guy!!!will never return to this waterpark and atlantis for the training they give to their staff.

Great experience mostly. Only had half a day to explore this wonderful place. Also did the lost chambers aquarium which was very unique. Completed the leap of faith slide which was scary but would do it again given the chance. lifeguard lied to my wife about the intensity of one of the tube slides which resulted in heavy bruising due to hitting the slide through the tube. this meant our day was cut short due to pain. shark attack slide was good. just make sure to take suitable footwear as ground gets very hot!

Great fun at Aquaventure. I visited Aquaventure three times during my 10 day holiday in Dubai with my Husband and Son.The water park is quite busy but very enjoyable, we were guests at The Atlantis so I cannot comment on the price of the entrance.We didn't do too many slides as my Son who is only 5 was not tall enough, he did enjoy Splashers though :-) Shark Attack is amazing and highly recommended! I was stupid and did Leap of Faith, but hey, I did it! Very very scary but one to be experienced.We all loved the water transport that runs around the park in the form of River Rapids and Torrents...great fun for the whole family and you could just stay on it all day and get a good tan whilst keeping cool :-) Not much shade in Aquaventure so go prepared with lots of sun cream and try to keep cool
Busy but excellent waterpark. Very busy over Eid, but still spacious enough to cater for all. Food outlets are good. The lifeguards are very attentive. Would definitely return.

Does not match up to Yas. I recently visited yas waterworld, and anyone confused at which watetpark to go to should definitely choose yas over aquaventure. I felt that this waterpark was quite disorganised. There was almost NO place where one could find shade or cool off in the water either. The pavement is waaay too hot to walk on barefoot and there are no boxes near slides to deposit your belongings, hence I had to leave my slippers unattended and they were actually STOLEN. Overall I suppose if u go in decent weather you will probably have a lot more fun as the slides are fun and exciting.

Be a child again. If you are around Dubai don't miss out this amazing water park. To be honest at first, yes entrance, food and drinks inside are expensive, like in every park. Check out Aquaventure's own website for special packages (with tresor, towel, food, etc). These packages are also avaiable there. With or without kids - use the refill offer (it is cheaper all over the day) because do not forget to drink enough. Inside you will have an amazing, funny, thrilling day. But you can't hide from the sun (on one side really good, because you will be in the waters all the day) but you have to take care of your conditions. And bring some beach or water shoes to wear all the day because, clearly not in the water, the overheated walking ways will burn your feet. So leave behind all your days problems and become a kid again. There are water slides for nearly every age and the fun factor is for sure - if you like water!

Fabulous day out!. My husband had free entry to the water park following his dolphin encounter so we only paid for me and our daughter. Being 5 months pregnant I couldn't do much so my husband got to go on all the rides on his own. My daughter and I found a row of sun loungers next to one of the accesses to the lazy river. My husband grabbed one of the provided rubber rings and "poof" he was gone! We thought he'd be back in 10 mins so we sat on the steps in the river and waited......and waited......and waited! An hour went by and he eventually turned up, I thought he'd found some rides whilst on the lazy river but in fact this river goes around the whole water park, so no wonder he was so long! I loved it even though I didn't do much apart from splash around in the lazy river and sunbathe. My husband thought it was amazing and definitely worth a visit when we are next in Dubai.

Great water park. Been here several times whenever we visit Dubai. It's a great waterpark and they've now opened up a new section with @6 more rides. Never had to queue for more than 10 mins which is great with young kids. Lots of rides for both young and young at heart!Only reason for not giving it a five star is price for entry and food inside

Great value for the family. We are a family of four adults who experienced a wonderful day here. We had a lot of fun and many laughs on the many water rides. Anyone visiting must not miss the aquarium too!

A Splashing Day Out. A great place for a day away from sight seeing. It's suitable for the whole family as there are children's pools and slides as well as plenty of rides for adults. The advantage of Aquaventure over other water parks is that it has it's own beach. There are plenty of loungers with canopies around the pools and on the beach so you are spoilt for choice as to where you want to be based. Food and drinks are expensive and you are not allowed to take in your own so add some extra money onto your wristband to cover the cost as this is a cash free area. We have been here many times and always enjoy it.

Disappointing. Stayed at Atlantis with my family (children aged 5 & 8) and made a couple of visits to the water park. Entry was fee as hotel guests. It was rather disorganised, difficult to find your way around, and my younger daughter was not tall enough to go on many of the slides. Lacks shade, and pavements get too hot to walk on. Very crowded and difficult to find free sun loungers. Maybe some of the slides would have been exciting, but not so if you can't all go together (unlike Wild Wadi where we could do everything together).
Exhilarating slides. Im not fan of a thrilling slides but left without any choice since Im with my boyfriend who loves it. But I enjoyed every bit of it with a lot of screaming.
Great water park. Really clean and lots of rings for everyone. The rides are good and lots of variety from gentle rapids to extreme slides.

Nice stay. That's huge and well maintained park. If you have smaller kids (below 110cm) that's good place to spend time here. There are many attractions where you can go with them away there are pontoones on lazy river where they can swim together with you and its not boring. Good food facilities which was a surprise. Easy to find place to sunbed.

Great day with friends!. A group of us went during Eid Holiday...had a fantastic time. We thought it would be really busy but was surprised. Great tip...they give discount if you have an Emirates I.D I think from 285AED ticket is discounted to 165AED. Rides are so much fun and there are group rides too which made it even more fun!
Unadulterated fun. Ease getting in advise pre book tickets easy to get around lockers to keep valuables safe.Plenty of space either on beach ar choice of many poolsDo it
Great time. Had a great time here, fun rides for all ages, facilities were great. Lots of sun loungers if you would prefer to chill and access to the beach.

Great water park with lots to do & lots of great rides!. We arrived to no queues, great, paid and went straight through. The place is big, so we found some sunloungers, got our towels and enjoyed the numerous rides. One takes you under a tube like aquarium, others are like flumes with the usual twists and turns and then there is the one with the huge drop, the leap of faith! It looks mad, I didn't have the nervous but next time, I will. Great day, lots of fun for young and old. Recommended!

No water Chillers in 45 Degrees Heat and 80% Humidity?!?!?!?. I am writing this review so extremely disappointed after our day at Aquaventure.Today I took my Mum and Dad (on holiday from the UK) for a day at the water park. After being previously in spring break we were looking forward to another great day of fun!It was so unbearably hot today and there was no escaping the heat to cool off in the water as it was like a hot bath. I CAN NOT believe that a 5 star resort like the Atlantis has no water cooler in the pools in this country!!!! My father over-heated and could not cool down so much so that i had to go home via the doctors to make sure he was ok.Last week in almost identical weather conditions we made a trip to Wild Wadi Waterpark in Jumeirah and I have to say it was 100% better than the Atlantis, as the water was perfectly chilled it gave you the opportunity to cool down and refresh before you moved on to your next ride.After spending 875AED for entry to the park and only managing to stay for 55 minutes, using only the lazy river, my son only using the children's area, I can say I am so very disappointed and annoyed at wasting all this money. If I had known the water was going to be so very hot there is no way I would have come along here today. It is unacceptable and should not be allowed to be operate in these conditions without appropriate cool water.I spoke with an Assistant Manager to try and ask for a % refund as never got our money's worth at all - she advised as we had already gained entry to the park this was not possible and gave me a general comments form to complete. Will wait to see what response I receive... But not holding my breath. Please DON'T waste your money or risk your health from over-heating!! Go to Wild Wadi in this hot weather!!
Best waterpark in uae. one of the best waterpark in UAE. very good for families.time will fly if you are here.leap of faith is a must try slide.

A little bit overpriced. I have been to Aquaventure Waterpark on 28 July, Eid time, and there was a lot of people there. I have booked it few days in advance and came there with my online ticket, and did not have to wait a long lines. I booked a small locker for 40 AEDs, the meal was 55 AEDs (fast food style cheeseburger with soda and fries), and the entrance price was 250 AEDs, so it was really expensive. A lot of slides and rides, and an open beach were really great, some of the rides are so good that you want to try them more than once or twice. There are probably a lot better aquaparks around the world with cheaper fares and prices. You could rent towels for the prices of 3 towels somewhere outside, so you better bring your own or buy somewhere else. When I was getting out I went to photo counter and they told me a photo is 85AEDs, but I could get two photos for 100AEDs, and that was the option I took. The photos come in hard copy in frames but they give you a link and a password to download them from the internet as well, so you also get a digital copy of the photo. Nice but expensive.

Good fun - but not quite Typhoon Lagoon. We visited the park the other day. Accessed near e impressive looking Atlantis hotel the park was relatively well priced, but seemed cheaper online.We established base camp near the lazy river on well specified loungers -each having individual sun shelters attached (essential later in the day)The rides were good, if not a little tame compared to the U.S Florida parks. However Poseidon’s Revenge got the pulse racing when the floor dropped away and a level of chaos ensued. The rapids were extensive and we enjoyed a good float around the park.Food was reasonably priced as was the drinks - quality was good. Offers are also available on entry. My only word of warning would be to bring adequate footwear as the flooring heats up quite considerably by the afternoon.
Good adventure. Excellent waterpark. Good games. Huge Water river (around the whole park). Didn't appreciated the highest slopes: very strong sensation but too fast to enjoy the game.

Fun but could be better organized. We frequently go to Dubai. Our child loves aquatic parks and wanted to try the Palm Aquaparc so we thought excellent idea! However, we were a little disappointed. The rides are varied and lovely but the place sadly lacked in organization. It was crowded, no shady places were organized (while lots of young children were there…), the staff were friendly but a bit overwhelmed. The wait for getting to the rides was (1) long and (2) full of people pushing around. We also thought that while life guards were present and helpful on e.g. the Rapids, some rides were not organized safely (e.g. my husband, who's very tall, got his big toe caught in a net when starting a ride, you can imagine the pain…). So… mixed experience… We'll try the Yas Waterworld in Abu Dhabi this October and hope for a better experience.

Poorly organised. Very poorly signed within the park. Limited shade - crazy situation were flip flops have to be removed to go on the rides and then you are left in the situation of walking bare foot across very hot pavements to retrieve them! Limited shade. Generally thought this attraction was very expensive for the facilities and rides that it offered.

Find your inner child again. Any waterpark that allows you to use travelators in the water to get from one ride to the other, simply has to be great! Can't fault the place - great rides, very safety conscious with lots of friendly life guards around and located right by the Atlantis hotel. We bought the double ticket allowing access into the aquarium. Definately worth it and a great way to get a break from the sun and heat during the day. Plan on staying the whole day and let the kids go for it.
Nice but can be better. Very nice waterpark. However im not sure whether if its for its size or staff, its definitely missing something.
Fun day out. If like us you are not huge fans of this type of entertainment, as a hotel guest go early each morning and beat the queues for the best rides and good banter with the staff.
A great day. A variety of attractions for the whole family. New rides were a much needed update. As usual with these parks food and drink quite expensive. An experience not to be missed when in Dubai

Biggest and Best waterpark ever visited!. Clean, organised, HUGE. Aquaventure is my favourite outdoor activity! Im new in town and I've been there already 3 times. Price is fair, but you should wait for the discounts, they really worth it ! Queues were fast every time I visited the Park! And the attractions are really good. Most important everything looks new and takes care of. Changing rooms are nice and clean.food was OK.Will come back!

Great day. After booking the adventures of Dolphin Bay we then had a free access pass to the Aqauventure Waterpark............$ ladies that booked all loved it. The so called lazy river was fab, thought we would be back to our sunbeds in 10 mins, but it was an hour and a half later! Well work a visit to this place.

Not cheap but a great day out. We visited outside of the summer season during Ramadan whilst they had a promotion on to visit the waterpark, get lunch included and visit the aquarium so it wasn't too badly priced. What i liked was how easy it was to get on the rides, no queues whatsoever and a good variety. We made the mistake of joining the wrong line at one point and ending up on a slide which basically the perspex floor gives way and you suddenly drop through a tube... great fun but not for the faint hearted.The food wasn't bad either and even serve during Ramadan. They have their own private beach which we didn't frequent but were very impressed by the shuttle service along the beach front for those who don't fair well in the heat.A lovely lovely day out.
FUN WATER PLACE. It was all fun from the beginning to the end. The waters were shallow which allows for non-expert swimmers to also have fun and the had safety team all around the place.

Super day. We had to pay for tickets this year as we were staying at a different hotel so we spend a good part of the day here, no queues as quieter maybe due to ramadan, we went on almost all rides, the new ones are a nice addition, clean park, we took advantage of the lunch offer - food excellent for a fast food outlet, lockers worthwhile and small one is excellent size.

What a way to spend the day or days... Stayed at the Atlantis, so this water park was on the door step, and so glad it was.... we was first in there at 10, and then on the lazy river, for 2 or so hours, every ride, is a must, you cant go there without doing them all... food places on site, which are very good. Loved everything about it.... so want to go back........... When you get in there, go and get your ring straight away for the day....
A great water park. The kids are very safe here as there are lifeguards every few feet! Loads of different rides for all ages.
Excellent water park. Can not say more than, you will find all the water fun you are speaking for. It has many water adventure rides suit adult and children. Donot miss it if you will visit dubia

Great fun. We visited the watermark on a few occasions during out stay at the Atlantis! It's great fun!We were disappointed when we were approached by a worker, who called himself Donte, and who proceeded to try and get our numbers and told us to meet him on the beach later that night!!!! We were shocked - not only is it something you don't really expect in Dubai, you definitely don't expect it on the Atlantis grounds. This was the only thing that dampened our holiday and our time at the water park!

Waterpark with a difference. Aquaventure waterpark really brings out the kid in everyone. As a hotel guest it is free and offers numerous rides to suit all needs, including shooting through tubes with sharks swimming around you!!! Really exciting.
Something for Everyone. Amazing waterpark. Childrens area is great fun. Rapids and flum rides very good. Tower of Neptune is amazing!
Amazing. Fantastic water park, the rapids go on for miles, and the rides are incredible. There is lots of space and plenty places to eat. The whole water park is very clean and tidy.

Thrilling and exciting. Conquered many fears about fish and high vertical drops thanks to this amazing water park. I reccomend treating yourself to easier and less frightening rides first to build your adrenaline before trying out the big boys.
best waterpark i've been to. it is amazing with activities for all ages. I have been there 3 TIMES and i do no find it boring. Can't wait to go again!

great surfing experience. i can recommend this really exciting
what a top place
need a coach they have it
go surf and u get hooked for more
small and big waves

The hot Experience of water Park!. We was there at thursday 24th july, during RAMADAN.It was great. many long slides ,many adventures, exellent atmoshere, but the weather was very very hot. you should drink cold water more to be able remain there.Tthe beach was very clean and good. The ticket was very expensive, 250 DHS for a person. پارک آبی بسیار خوبی بود. سرسره های فراوان آن هیجان بسیار داشت و اکثر آنها به رودخانه وحشی ختم می شد، بنابراین با هربار سرخوردن یک دور هم داخل رودخانه میشد زداما هوا بسیار داغ بود و بدون نوشیدنی نمی توان دوام آورد. ضمناً میتوان از ساحل دریا هم استفاده کرد، یعنی با یک تیر دونشان زد. ما 24 جولای در ماه رمضان آنجا بودیم و هیچ گونه محدودیتی برای خوردن و آشامیدن نبود. در کل تجربه متفاوتی از پارک ابی به دست آوردم که شاید ارزش 250 درهم را داشت،

worth the visit. went here on the Sunday, weather was very hot! so a nice day to spend in the water, in all honesty we spent the day going round the lazy rivers and the river rapids, as we had small children with us so didn't really get a chance to go in the bigger slides. the young ones play area is very good, with lots of water fun to be had for small children. if you do go here please speak to your concierge at your hotel, ours got us a large discount and for 4 of us the total came to 855 aed with access to the atlantis and a meal included. would also recommend if you are visiting to get some money loaded onto your wristband. as we never knew about this so had to walk back to lockers to get cash for drinks.

Great rides. We visited here on recommendation from a couple in Wild Wadi. The rides were great the waterways more exciting and even my wife who is not a water fan enjoyed the experience. Great day out.

Brilliant water park brilliant hotel. We stopped at the Atlantis Dubai September 2013 with our 2 children 5 and 6. The water park was included with the hotel stay we went in everyday of our 10 days stay. The only problem we did find was our 5 yr old was too small for the big sides but too big for the "baby" area. My 6 yr old loved the leap of faith, she went down it 6 times! The new sides had just opened the week before we got there and they were brilliant also but again our little one was left out. We will be going again without a doubt!
Fun fun fun. A good range of activities for all ages....time went by so quickly we all wished they stayed open longer

the aqua blogger. the slides are awesome i could and will go there again
now this time i will be more adventurous there is so much Aquaventure Waterpark has to offer

Great family day. Great day out for all ages!!Spent a sweltering day here and loved it! Loads of life guards on rides and totally on ball don't let anyone mess around! Great band system so everything goes in your locker, then the band is scanned for photos etc. rides for all small kids area, fast & Scary rides and some for those wanting more slower lol!! If you fancy pushing the boat out hire a cabana makes a nice chill area! Must do if in Dubai
Wow. Great rides ,safe for kids. Tube ride 2km long. Water warm. Super clean. Crystal clear water. One day is not enough .

Great fun for kids and adults alike. In the blistering heat of Dubai, the water park was a great way to cool off. There are guides on hand for every ride, so you dont have to worry too much. We could do with more options for beverages, or maybe it was because we visited during Ramadhan; that said, there were no provisions formore stands. A description of what to expect on each ride would be helpful, I skipped out on the rapids and waves because I didnt know what to expect. Love the buggies, and cooling of walkways. Many options of rides too. On the whole a great experience.

Fun! Fun!. Great place to hang out on summer. The place is huge and have different rides with different theme. Staffs are friendly and willing to assist if you need anything. I like this place than Wild Wadi :)

Good but not the best. Went here with my partner during ramadan, and there were no queues to get on any of the slides which obviously improved the trip. My main issue with the park was how epensive things were, there were no water fountains available and since it is very hot you have to keep buying drinks all day which obviously adds up! The slides were pretty good, since the park is fairly new, the slides don't hurt your back when you go down them, and there were a few more adventurous slides, but it was quite annoying that on every ring ride you would end up in the lazy river at the end, and then you had to go right around it to get back to wherever you had left your flipflopsOverall, we had a good day here but bring lots of money!
wow. i will never forget the rides and all the fun i had in this amazing place . I really recommend it . it is more than excellent . Heavennn !

very big but not controlable. aqua venture park is a really big beautiful water park but the biggest problem is that first of all it takes a long wait to get a tube and also the second problem is that you should carry around your tube to all the slides because there aren't any tube available for each slide separately. the slides are really good and adventurous but there's a main water play that you start with it it's too long and boring. there isn't a complete and explicable map for the slides or at least i didn't find any. but totally it is a good water park.

Great day out. We went here not long after moving to Dubai and its a great day out for everyone, whether you are young residents or a family on holiday. The water park is huge and has loads of different areas so you don't feel like you are on top of people. There's a great variation of rides, thrill seeker or something less scary (me!) I think the price is great compared to what I've paid at other water parks and you get a meal and entrance to the Lost Chambers included too. I caught a bit of skin on my foot and had to get medical assistance, these guys are great too. Even though they must see loads of daft people all day they don't make you feel an annoyance to them. If you don't fancy rides or water there are loads of places to sit in the sun, by the pools or down on the beach looking over to the main city. Would deffo recommend this to everyone and will be taking my parents when they come over for a visit.

Fun and safe. Loved it, well designed, brilliant staff lifeguards are Alavert and professional and plentiful. Rides are brilliant and well themed, clean and everything is though of buggies so you don't need to walk, water sprayed on walk ways as they get so hot.

Brilliant Fun!. This is a brilliant water park. Perfectly laid out so not too much walking, the best rides ever! We thought the rides were better than or at least as good as T.L and B.B florida. Really great service that you can pick up a buggy lift from one zone to the other. Great water park and a brilliant day out or great to pop back and forth while staying at the hotel, just go in your swimming gear, no need to take anything else with you.

brill waterpark. One of the best waterparks I have been to, loved it. Loads of brill rides to some that are slower. Was busy when we were there but never had to queue.Used an buy one get one free entertainer voucher which saved us a good bit but still had to pay extra for lockers. Loads of sunloungers around the pools but we choose to lie at the beach. I left my wedding ring on my lounger by accident but when I went back hours later after noticing it was missing it was still there. Would defo go again.

Good aquapark. It's a really good aquapark, with lots of fun for everyone. The only reason why I gave only four points to it, is that it's a bit overpriced. I know it belongs to Atlantis, but even then... They even charge you AED 40 for the use of lockers, which should be included in the entry fee, it's such a basic thing... The food is ok, but could be better for the price. But apart from the money, it's very good! I didn't try, but there's an opportunity to swim with dolphins, which is quite uniqe, but of course for an extra cost.

Our amazing adventure. Me and my family were so exited and I would know I am only 11 we first wanted to go to the big rides then we went to the smaller rides I really do think it is suitable for all ages and there are a lot of places to eat and especially if it was a hot day you would like to splash a little and have fun with fam I really did enjoy it and hope to come again

Fantastic. Can be busy but well worth the effort. Free to guests staying at Atlantis as we were and wristbands can be obtained at the hotel so no queuing, lockers are 40 dirhams per day so a little costly but if you have a wristband for them you can charge drinks and food to it rather than carrying cash... a great day out.

awesome. i would recommend anyone to go here the water rides are really good and there wasn't much of queuing for them. there was lots life guards so i always felt safe. sun beds where very comfortable and all had their own shade this is ideal as some people need shade i.e children and some don't and the shade comes over or you can put the shade down.

Dolphins were amazing the rest is normal. We spent an afternoon at the park but 2-3 hours was with the dolphins. Thwy are amazing and the experience was fantastic.The waterpark is like all other waterparks i have been. The shadows are few, the attractions are good but a bit too much further apart from each other.

Loved it. We had a short visit to Aquaventure during our recent trip to Dubai. None of us were particularly bothered about going, but we figured we may as well as we had free access. We ended up having a great time, and will definitely visit again next we're in Dubai.

wear flip-flops. good watermark, located next to atlantis hotel.. cost AED 250 each to get in. Kids over 1.2m are classed as adults, but they have a deal on currently that includes lunch and access to the aquarium. there are many rides here and all suitable for kids 10+...there is a fun water park section for smaller kids with smaller slides, fountains etc.one major tip...take flip-flops or buy the feet covers there...the paving gets unbelievably hot in the sun and will burn your feet as you move between attractions.

Aquaventure!. This was possibly the best day we had during our stay in Dubai.Located on the amazing Jumeriah Palm the Aquaventure waterpark offers so much, definitely something for everyone. We booked in advance online and booked a 3 for 1 offer which included the waterpark, the lost chambers aquarium and also a meal voucher to use in the waterpark. If you are visiting this month during Ramadan you may be glad to know that you can eat and drink at the waterpark. We found the lazy river and the rapids to be the best rides at the waterpark as it was a very hot day and this allowed us to relax and have fun at the same time.Lockers are not too pricey. I believe a small locker cost us 40 Dhs which was about £7. All in all a great day out and money well spent!

No shade, hot pool water, bad service. The title says it all. Beautiful hotel but that's where it stops. Took 40mins to get in, in a line of 5 people. The rides are ok but too spread out, barely any shade and the water was warm when it needed to be cold. On a positive the aquarium is the best we've seen and lunch (hot dogs, chicken and fries etc) was really tast for that type of food. Not worth the big price tag and Wild Wadi was a ton more fun,

Great Family Fun. A wonderful water park with many rides, its great that you can get onto the beach as well. Staff are really friendly and control all rides very efficiently. Only negative point was the exorbitant price for the food and drinks that we found very expensive.

Fantastic waterpark. We were staying at Atlantis the Palm hotel and spent most days at this fabulous clean waterpark. Very friendly staff & life guards. Amazing rides especially loved the rapids & the ride through the aquarium. Would highly recommend a visit.

Did not exceed my expectations. We went to Aquaventure with kids ages 2-6 years old. The only two areas the kids could enjoy were the lazy river and Splashers. Splashers is a kids splash area with slides. My husband and I were very disappointed that we could not take our five year old daughter and her six year old friend on any of the other slides due to height restrictions. This was surprising to me since my husband and I took our daughter when she was four years old to Yas Waterworld and she was able to enjoy all of the slides and was not just restricted to the kids area. Our favorite ride was the lazy river with the rapids. I have been to many water parks and I think Aquaventure has the best lazy river ride. Other than that we were not impressed with the place. If you go to Aquaventure and you are NOT staying at the hotel, BRING YOUR OWN TOWELS! Or you will have to pay Dhs 30 for each towel!! Water is also a rip off at Dhs 11 or Dhs 13 per small bottle. I have two prices because we were told two different prices at the park. Since we are UAE residents and it was Ramadan we were able to take advantage of a 3 for 1 deal. One price for the water park, aquarium and lunch per person. That was a good deal and I suggest going to Aquaventure during Ramadan when there are not waits for the slides, not crowded and you can save money, otherwise it is not worth it.

Top day out. This was a terrific way to spend a hot day in Dubai. Just a short Monorail ride and you arrive at an impressively huge expanse of water adventure. Whether you just want to lounge around in a tube or experience the slides and rides there is plenty to keep you amused all day.It's not the wildest of places but very relaxing and is terrific for families as well as couples like us who just want a chilled out day with a bit of fun for a laugh. We got the deal with free entry into the aquarium and a free lunch which was pretty good value.

fantastic day out. We stayed at Atlantis one night and were able to access the park on both days, mixture of activities for different aged kids. New rides were fantastic. One down side I would say is they need more sunbeds with shades especially for families as if your not there early you will not get something in the shade and it is to warm to be in the sun all day especially in summer months.

Pricey and not that impressive. Aquaventure Waterpark is over-rated compared to other water parks in the region - probably because of Atlantis! The ticket is pricey, the rides give you a low adrenaline rush and the staff is not that helpful.If you are looking for much more fun and thrill at good value for money, I highly recommend to try out either Wild Wadi or Yas Waterworld! On the other hand, if your aim is to just go to any waterpark, chill out and not think much - Aquaventure is a decent bet.
Favorite Adventure. I go crazy like a kid when I go to Aquaventure. It is amazing. The cues are horrible though. I totally recommend the Leap of Faith. Adrenaline rush!

Lots of water. Big waterpark with many different activities. Take water shoes with you for comfortable moving through the territory. I like their concept with lots of trees and water. We should come back again for sure.

Great fun for all ages. Located on a man made islet, this water park is a fun (but hot) day for all.Towels can be hired, as can a locker to keep things safe (although it is a bit of a walk back from the tube rides if you want some money to by a drink!). We had an 11 year old daughter and 14 year old boy who both found plenty of rides and both fast and, slow activities to keep them amused for many hours. Remember to bring some footwear as the ground is very hot and bare feet get burnt by the afternoon. Well worth the effort to take travel weary kids to.
Fantastic Water Park!. I've been to this place with my family and enjoyed a lot! Lot of water rides and slides! Facilities are very good and very decent and clean place!

Awesome. I've been to a few waterparks on my travels but this has got to be the best.the river system means you can stay on your tube and just float everywhere, it even takes you up to the water slides . Brilliant . And to float through an aquarium is just a great touch. But the pathways get extremely hot so keep your shoes on.
Great lazy river. Make sure you take some flip flops or water shoes as you WILL burn your feet! Lots of places to set up camp.

Adventure and world record slides. It's was my 1st time to visit aquaventure waterpark located in Atlantis the palm dubai. The place is amazing the largest man made island in the heart of dubai. The waterpark is safe,clean and I must say that the number of activities inside the park is unlimited. The slides are state of the art, we are thrilled to ride it. The queues are not that busy. The open beach access ,the pool in all kinds and the sea water creatures all over are unbelievable. We surely plan to come back by August and experience the dolphin encounter with my son. I can't wait. Overall experience is excellent.
Needed more time!. For the length of time we were there, this amusement/water park was very nice! We definitely will go back and spend more time there!
Fantastic day out!. Really enjoyed the day the water park, I would recommend that you arrive early as the sunbeds get taken up pretty quickly. The park is very clean and tidy.

Awesome family memories. Great fun! .. We all enjoyed the rides from calm and serene to rapids and screaming drops. We like adventure and have 14 year old boy and was an excellent all day activity. Clean. More life guards then tube riders. Free towels and seating everywhere. Cheap lockers and drinks etc. Would recommend to all and we are going again today.

Great way to spend a day. Stayed at the Atlantis for 10 days so had to visit the adjoining water park ! the whole place is spotless. loads of staff / life guards which gives peace of mind. and slides for all levels of bravery ! Free entry for Atlantis guests but you do have to pay for a locker which was 20 D i believe

Great Fun!. Lots of rides, nice and clean and no restrictions during Ramadan. It was relatively quiet when we visited so we didn't have to queue once or struggle to find loungers. Before you visit, check with your hotel who will almost certainly be able to give you a voucher for admission to the Waterpark, Aquarium (which is stunning) and lunch all inclusive and at a very good discounted rate. Ask your hotel for towels as they are expensive to hire!

Great Great Great. We have a season ticket to Dubai (or so I wish!) and have stayed at Atlantis the Palm with our three year old twins since they were babies. Obviously the guests have free access to Aquaventure and it is very handy indeed. The Leap of Faith is amazing! When we visited my husband went on it first and came back all full of himself and sent me up there. His advice was to get on and go for it. It was great. Although probably not best for wearing a bikini!! We had a great time exploring all the rides with the girls and without and it is worth a day trip if you aren't a guest at the hotel. If anything you can do the Dolphins and visit the hotel too and really make a day of it.

Splash. Great slides, great safety. Very straightforward to get to and from. Staff could not have been more helpful. Look online, as offers are available should you wish to do several attractions on the site.

Worst rip off ever. Bevare drunk Russians smoking everywere. We went there full of expectations. We realised very early tha this is NOTHING FOR CHILDREN. Our son six years old could only acess the small splash zone. Ther was no rides for him just the Lazy river that was so boring. I talked to one of the employees and I told how dissapointed we was. He said that meany people with small children like Wadi better because there is rides for children. And if the employees tryed to tell the management this they got fired. This is a place for All inclusive people that preferes to get drunk, and misbehave. Except thet you were alowed to smike everywere people was dragging round with the rubber rings so the bounced in to people they met. Dont go there. You can afford Wadi three times fore the cost of one day in Atlantis. Atlantis a terrible place Just skip it

Fantastic. Were a family of four with 2 teenage boys.We had 4 days in Dubai on the way home from Europe.What a fantastic day we had at the water park.We didnt get out of the water for hours.So a locker for your belongings is a must,dont worry about a key for the locker its a barcode which is on a waterproof armband that I wore.The park was spotless.The change rooms were fantastic.The ladies change rooms even had blowdryers.All of the amenities were as clean when we were leaving as they were when we got there.I was concerned about the dress code but there was no need to worry.There are plenty of lifeguards around keeping an eye out.If ever in Dubai again we would defiantly go to the waterpark again
Man what a place !!. Fantastic place to have fun in the water !! So many different rides, some of them SCARY !!!! but fun :-)

Epic day out!. The whole place, the concept, everything is epic about Aquaventure. Great to see so many families out as well as tourists and couples. Just an all round crowd pleaser. Almost had a heart attack on some of the rides, especially Poseidon's Revenge - didn't realise what it was until I got to the top of the tower and saw what it was all about - obviously couldn't back down at that point so went through with it. So glad I did - Amazing! Booked the summer deal which includes lunch and free entry to Lost Chambers Aquarium, these were both great, lunch was surprisingly excellent quality considering it was free and Lost Chambers was a great way to wind the evening down after the thrills of the water park.Overall, a totally epic day out, and not hugely expensive either.
Splash!. Who doesnt love to spend a day here?Many attraction to try for kids and adults.Tips: come early so you can try all attractions and before it get too hot :-)

Such a fun waterpark!. Oh my goodness, this waterpark was so much fun. It had a great selection of rides - at least 6 that were a little bit scary but still family friendly and then 2 which were definitely not for the faint hearted! Plus a long river that you can leisurely float along and a rapids section which was pretty fun and rough enough to tip one of our friends off her ring. We went during Ramadan and it was really quiet - we didn't have to wait for any rides and there were no queues anywhere including the entrance, the foodcourt etc. We only went on each ride once and had lunch and still spent over 3 hours there - you could easily spend all day if you wanted to laze around in the pools and go on the rides multiple times. In terms of attire I wasn't sure what to wear to be culturally sensitive so ended up taking a bikini plus a quick dry t-shirt which I felt comfortable in. Most people were just wearing bikinis though - apparently wearing t-shirts/rash vests slows you down on the slides. I would recommend eating at Barracudas which has 4-5 standard takeaway options. There are options for vegetarians which is great. Lockers and towels are available for hire but you really don't need a towel as it's so hot you dry off after being out of the water for 2 minutes!

Wet nd Fun. 8 adults nd 5 kids; totally amazing place, kids loved it, mothers loved it. The dads were left with the kids at the kids section while mothers went on the rides. The kids thoroughly enjoyed themselves same as the mothers. The water park left everyone exhausted and the kids were asleep before we got back to the hotel. A must go place for the kids in Dubai. Lil on the expensive side but really worth every single Dirham paid. Suggest you get there early so as to spend enough time .Please note if you leave too late there's usually a long queue to get a taxi.

Fantastic day out!. Visited for a day in June with my husband and 4 year old daughter. What an amazing place, fantastic! My daughter loved the kids area, my husband loved all the waterslides (someone had to watch our little one! :-) ). We all loved the dolphins (see separate review). One day not long enough to get around to see all of the place, but we loved what we saw!
Great days out. With staying at the Atlantis the waterpark was free for as often as you liked. Brilliant. Clean. And fun

Aqua venture water park. Superb..very clean and neat..good drives..excellent food. Good place to rewind for about 4-5 hours . Being Ramadan we had the offer of getting free lunch and free entry into "lost chamber" aquarium.
Great day out, loved it. Great for older children, easily spend the whole day there, great surroundings. Avoid busy periods and public holidays, gets too crowded

Relaxing. A very nice place to go, nice views, nice place, nice attractions... it is also very relaxing to lay down on a rubber ring and let yourself flow around the rapids. A cool way to spend a hot day!

Fantastic Fun. We went to Aquaventure for the day and we had a fantastic time. We booked online so managed to get into a shorter line to collect our tickets. The rides were amazing fun and made you laugh and scream. The white water rapids were good fun and the large slides were scary but brilliant fun and once you were brave enough for one go you wanted to go again. We ate in one of the fast food restaurants and the food was ok - nothing special but filled a hole. The loungers were plentiful and easy to find and very close to the water. We would go here again next year as it was great fun
wet, wet,wet. wow!! forget any other waterpark, get yourself over here guys, good value for money big kids will love it too

Great addition to a great hotel. We stayed at Atlantis, The Palm. Fortunately this meant we had free entry to this park and we took advantage of it on our first day to fight off the jet lag. The park has a fantastic selection of slides with something for everyone. We only had half a day here but we could have easily made a full day of it if not more on a longer stay.

Splash & Slide through the Dubai Heat. The Aquaventure Water park at the Atlantis is an Exciting, Thrilling & Fun Filled Water Slides & Rapids park. Easily the best place to beat the Dubai heat. Click selfie with friends and family or purchase the candid shots clicked when you splash and slide through the water park.

lost adventures. we had gone with some friends for a reunion with some school friends in Dubai.. we found our lost adventures in life in Aquaventure... amazing rides and we all were kids once again... had a fabulous time at this place with well organised waterpark with friendly staff we just loved the experience through out the day.. a must visit..

For someone that normally hates water parks we had great fun. Normally my wife and I will avoid water parks, but we ended up at the water park and had a really enjoyable day. The way the lazy river allows you to opt for various water rapids torrents etc is relaxing and fun... The shoot rides we also found to be great fun, also going in the end of June we had no queuing for rides.

Best Water Park!. My partner and I were in Dubai for 4 nights only, one of the days was spent at Aquaventure. We had an amazing time, there is so much to do. The best thing was when you are tired out from all the excitement of the rides, you can go chill on the beach right next to the Atlantis! A must do is the leap of fate!

Not worth the money!. Queued up over an hour!!! Tickets were sooo expensive.... We had our one year old with us and we were unable to enjoy the full park! It looked massive and the kids bit looked fun! Queeued up for one slide an hr and i gave up half way thru the slide as it was taking forever to end. It was too hot for our baby so we had to leave! I wouldnt go back and if i do i wouldnt pay full price or take my baby with me. It was very very busy!
Best to go after 4pm. We got in for free as we were guests at the hotel so we went almost everyday and we loved it. The best time to go is at 4pm as other guests are leaving.

Total fun. I enjoyed the day so much ,I loved it ,I didn't try all of the rides there,some of them for me were high with my 2 little kids, but overall it was an unforgettable day ,the only drawback was the ground floor of the beaches there ,they are not smooth and very hard ,they hurt my husband's feet,so I believe some people need to wear some kinds of shoes to protect their feet or they need to smoothen the sands there.

FANTASTIC!!!!!. By far the best waterpark in Dubai. Fun in every slide, staff is really friendly and the fast food is sooooo tasty, better than Mc, KFC or Burguer King. And the sights of the Palm and the Atlantis are a huge plus! Don't forget to visit the Lost Chambers Aquarium. Really hoping to swim with the dolphins next time!!

Fun filled but could be much better.. Its a good water park, and we had great fun at the private beach and the lazy river but:1. All main rides are really high up - so u need to climb many floors for each of them. For me - climbing three floors to get a thrill of 1 minute was worth only 4-5 times. After that i didnt want to climb so many stairs - carrying water tubes for such short fun.2. Rides are scary and similar - they just make you climb up and throw you down. Even the rides with different names are actually very similar in experience.3. Locker rentals are separate - but if you don't carry anything expensive, you can just leave you stuff on one side and go.Now the positives: i loved the lazy river and the private beach. Lazy rives is very well designed - it has rapids, torrent and waterfall. Looked very safe with life guards at every spot.

just OK. We visited on a very hot day of 46 degrees and there really is no shade, the locker rooms are air conditioned so you could return there for a break from the sun and the showers were cold. Drinks not too expensive considering its a water park.

Expensive but great fun. This is a fun day out for all ages. We were in the water park about 8 hours. I would recommend but be warned it is pricey. Go on ebay and buy the entertainer voucher. It cost me £12 but saved me a fortune. Water 15 aed, only 1 or 2 in normal shops. Make sure you have a good meal before you go in.

The most exciting and fun water park in the World!. Absolutely phenomenal water park at the Atlantis Resort. Fun rides to suit every one, from the children's play tower to the thrilling jet shoot slides. Plenty of areas to sit down in and relax, even allowing you to sit inside the A/C restaurants and cafes to cool down now and again. The lazy river is so relaxing and there are plenty of rubber rings for everyone. Not once did we queue or wait for a ring. I absolutely loved the 'Torrent' ride that takes you around a little river with continuous waves carrying you along.Worth the money and is a must-do in Dubai on a hot day!
Awesome park. Clean, fun, zoomerang, my favourite ride ever!!!! Wasn't brave enough for leap of faith or Poseidon but my daughter did, she didn't repeat Poseidon though,truly scary!!,

Amazing adventure. It is a full day attraction with lots of slides tunnels river rides torrents and waterfalls kids and adults enjoy equally food served at restaurants is very good and beach is relaxing

Enthralling experience.. Beautiful experience altogether. Tried most of the rides, except for a few which were kinda hidden from the main attractions. Do try the 'Leap of Faith', probably the best ride there.I had an amazing time at the beach. The beach itself was so beautiful, but I had fun playing the beautiful game there. I don't have beaches back at home, so beach football or futsal was an amazing experience for me.The meal coupons were sumptuous and worth the money. I availed on the Shark Bites which had burgers and all.Its better to leave your shades and flip flops in the locker or they might slip on the rides or get lost. I lost my glares and never got them back. Roaming around bare feet is absolutely normal but beware, the floor gets scorching at times. And they've got great locker facility too.

Fun in the sun. Considering we visited Dubai in mid-June, we had no choice but to indulge our inner kids and book a day at Aquaventure! What a superb day it was. It's like a tiny city of lazy rivers, rapids, slides, rides (Zoomerango, Leap of Faith & Poseidon's Revenge were the best!), aquariums, restaurants, cafes, beach and so much more. We spent all day here!We also happened to get a 3-for-1 offer which meant for just AED250 each, we had access to the Park, Lost Chambers Aquarium as well as free lunch at Shark Bites (a restaurant) - lunch was actually really good (burger & fries with soda) & a generous portion too.A word of warning however, do not leave you flip-flops unattended outside the rides as our Havaianas were stolen :'( Just take your oldest pair so if they get stolen, it's not too much of a fuss. We reported it, and were given a replacement no-name brand.

Very Good but not great. As a guest of the Atlantis, this was an amazing free amenity but I am reviewing it based on going and paying for it. First thing is, lockers split by gender which means you have to pay for two or ask your partner to store things for you and have to pass your stuff outside. I understand UAE culture but Yas Waterworld in Abu Dhabi has mixed locker rooms for couples and families. The rings for the slides are far from the slides and are just randomly on the edge of a pool. There are good slides and they are all conveniently located in 2 towers so you don't get lost looking for the slides. The river is a good mix of relaxing lazy river and exciting rapids. The river also connects to one of the towers meaning you can get to the tower with slides without any steps via a upward sloping escalator. Very good waterpark but not as good as Yas Waterworld in abu dhabi or Aquatica, Wet N Wild, Disneys Blizzard Beach in Florida.

Simply the best. I've been to numerous water parks around the globe, but there is nothing like the Aquaventure. The adrenalin-rush doesn't stop till you leave the water park. The best ride there is the Leap of Faith, don't miss it! All in all, you will have the time of you lives (as far as water parks are concerned)!!
Fun. This waterpark is very big and has lots of slides. Staff are so friendly and the lazy river is so relaxing. There are nice places to eat and get icecream and a lovely lounging area.
FUN FUN FUN!. Specially enjoyed the SPLASHES. the kids had a blast there.I personally enjoyed the river :) Hope they increse the tube that have child seats though. But it was all-day fun!

The Cleanest. compared to few other waterparks I have visited, in particularly in USA I would say the aquaventure is the cleanest amongst others. the staff is super friendly and the park is the perfect destination for kids and adults

Water Fun!. Going into Aquaventure Waterpark is like going into a maze! There were so many things one can try. If you have a small child, you can go to the Splasher's Children's Play Area. The water playground has slides and climbing features, etc. Your child will enjoy it and not want to leave. The Tower of Poseidon Water Slides is worth the climb. We did the Aquaconda and there are 6 of you in the raft. You hang on to your dear life and hope you make it all the way! Certainly heart pumping and not for the faint hearted! One day is not enough to see everything in Aquaventure Waterpark.

Over Hyped. There are just 3 types of rides , rest are all variations of those rides , no variety in rides . Everything inside the park is very expensive, 500 ml of water costs 18 dirhams. Should carry water there , as 1 lit per person is allowed . This park is avoidable , Wild Wadi , or Yas water world is much better as we heard from our local friends.
Best Waterpark. Whenever in Dubai, a must visit attraction for all.Best waterpark I have visited so far.Clean water.Polite staff.A memorable visit.

Nice place to spend a day away from heat.. This waterpark is quite popular in UAE, so we decided to try it. I would definitely recommend to buy tickets online as you can save a lot of time on waiting in queue. They will give you a bracelet with access to the park. But for some stupid reason - if you need a towel (obviously you need one) you have to get a paper receipt and !!! carry it with you until you decide to get a towel from a counter located in the middle of the park. And it's in a waterpark, btw. How you suppose to keep a small piece of paper while using rides? No idea. So you either take towel from the start and keep it somewhere(no idea where) or use rides, then go back to your changing room, take paper, go back to the waterpark and exchange it for the towel. Ridiculous. You will get another bracelet if you want to put some money to your account. Place is a bit overcrowded. There are not too many rides, btw. But you definitely should try the main one - "Leap of faith". Try not to close your eyes as the view is amazing, you will get through aquarium with sharks. Fascinating! Long wait but worth trying. The place is cowered by trees and palms so overall it is not too hot inside. Try to come early and avoid weekends to enjoy the time without waiting.

A fun day out. Aquaventure is a fun day out whilst in Dubai. There are lots of rides so there is something for everyone, those wanting to relax can take a rubber ring around the lazy river whilst thrill seekers can try many of the parks more adventurous rides such as Leap of Faith or my personal favourite Poseidon’s Revenge! (not for the faint hearted!). There are also lots of 'beach' areas for anyone who just wants to sunbathe or wait for family/friends.We visited on a weekday in May and there were no real queues which was nice. I can imagine it would get busy at a weekend though so probably best to arrive early if you want to go on the most popular rides. The park was clean and the electronic locker system was easy to use and worked well (providing you do not lose your wristband on the rides!). Lifeguards were friendly and added to the fun.The only downside we experienced was trying to find a double rubber ring at the beginning of the day! It was not made clear how to get one and given that half of the rides require a rubber ring it would have been nice to be directed towards them. Overall though a great water park that's definitely worth the visit.Useful Tips: - If anyone burns easily it is worth wearing a UV protection top (available in the UK from Decathlon) as you can easily burn whilst out all day - especially children! You can buy them at the park at an inflated cost, although they do come Palm Atlantis branded.- In a summer when the temperatures rise it is worth taking flip-flops/reef shoes as the paths around the park gets really hot and will make getting around quite unpleasant.

Great water park, improved since it opened. Our hotel provided free vouchers, despite this we had to queue for an hour as they only opened 3 of the 8 service windows. It was hot and irritating, once we got to the window they simply took the vouchers and gave us wrist bands in less than 30seconds! Just bad management, sorry!The park itself is just brilliant, we've been to the Florida Parks and for us this is just better...

So Much Fun. We went to the water park because it came with our Dolphin tickets , i do not normally like theme or water parks but this one is great fun and we had an excellent day. Slight rip off that you have to pay extra to get a locker overall fun day

Great Waterpark . One of the greatest Waterparks I have seen. So many types of slides and rides. water is clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful. well organized. try to come early and avoid weekends.

Amazing!. The Aquaventure has many fun rides and thrill glides; a perfect day out in Dubai! And recently they have added new thrills! From rapids, to the lazy river, the shark attack and leap of faith, it's the most fun day out in Dubai!

Fantastic. Probably the best water park around, great day out for all ages, plenty to do. Get there early opens at 10am and you will enjoy a near empty park, get busier as the days go on. Very safe lots of life guards around.

Very clean and fun. Compared to American waterparks, the facilities were pristine and you felt comfortable walking around barefoot. The rides were fun, there were plenty single rides and double rides. All in all a great time!

So much fun!. Aquadventure is a beautiful water park, it is always spotlessly clean and never particularly busy. I have stayed at Atlantis 3 times now and as a hotel guest you get unlimited free entry to the park, you can also get a buggy to take you from the hotel to the park. There are a lot of rides at the park mostly off the lazy river, this is a great touch as it means you don't have to get out and walk to the rides which means no burnt feet! The rides are good fun and mostly aimed at adults which is good as they are not boring, especially the leap of faith! I think all the rides require you to be over 120cm tall which means there isn't that much for smaller children to take part in, however anyone can go around the lazy river and the rapids. The side where the newer building of rides are is usually much quieter and there are a lot of sun beds available, it is also right next to a cafe and changing rooms which is handy. Aquadventure is on par with disney and other watermarks in the US, even if you aren't staying at Atlantis it is definitely worth a visit to the park!

Great afternoon spent at Aquaventure. Love Atlantis, the whole complex. And this waterpark within it is excellent with a very good variety of waterslides and tube rides. Expect to pay for a cabana, for lunch, for lockers, to get in, etc. But it was worth it as YOU ARE ON VACATION...GO HAVE FUN!!!

One of the best places where you can spend the whole day!. Seriously I really mean every word, I went there for the whole day and didn't feel doing any kind of boring activities, it is truly awesome and very competitive especially for the very high slides, MUST TRY!! you will be amazed how young kids, like 10 years old are doing it!! the only thing that I didn't like maybe because I am really an active person is the beach, it is some how very relaxing most probably trying to target the old people just to chill out there. otherwise enjoy the slides!! try to get the ticket a maximum a day earlier, they will be cheaper!!

The best part of my visit to Dubai. A number of friends were telling me how awesome this place is and I got the chance to go with some friends. There is so much to choose from and so many amazing rides especially leap of faith and anaconda been my favourites. My friends and I loved it. We could relax on the beach and just take the park at our own pace. This park is very big and if going again I would go there early to try do all the rides. So good if having a day out with friends or families. Some of the rides are a lot bigger than you expect :)
Fun Fun Fun. My family and I planned to spend a few hours in aquaventure and ended up spending the whole day! It is so much fun for all ages with tons of things to do!

Crowded and expensive. There are many waterparks in the UAE, this is not the best. Much better value at Dreamland in Umm Al Quwain. There are not that many rides here and the cost of water is ridiculous: 13 dirhams ( just over two pounds) for a small bottle. They are trading on the Palm name. Go further afield for more space and variety of rides.

tons of fun. Great place to spend the day, though a bit expensive yet worth the overall experience. The rides are much fun, with some daring ones too i.e. leap of faith. It is a must do adventure if you are visiting Dubai.

Nice. Had a very nice full of excitement and fun. Had some trouble to find the lady to rent a locker and to open the lockers but finally made it. have to pay for lockers and towels. Attractions are very nice. Currently (June period) there are not many tourists so did not have to queue up for the attractions, you can do the same one over and over again without having to wait at all which was wonderful. We were there in the afternoon, when the sun was down which was perfect moment as it was not too hot. Many sun loungers to relax at.

Great fun. We had an option to choose between aquaventure & Wild Wadi due to time constraints,ultimately we decided to go for aquaventure & it was a good decision. It is expensive no doubt but the rides make up for it,the best water ride was the family ride which is quite exhilarating,both my son thoroughly enjoyed it. The only disappointment was the lunch which we all felt could have been better. Overall a good experience.

Excellent rides and fun.. This is not just a pool, where you just swim. There are rides, such as rapids, torrent, slides in the tower, water is constantly moving, just sit in the tube and enjoy. For the adventures one, take a Leap of Faith slide, or the new one, Poseidon's Revenge.It is not for the faint hearted though.

Very well set up. Went in June so it was crazy hot, didn't expect much from a waterpark but was very impressed, te rides were really fun and most of the queues (not that where were many) you stayed in the water which kept you cool. Takes about an hour to do the loop in a tube including the rapids, the slides were awesome, and some scary as heck.
Great day out. This is a fantastic waterpark with loads of rides and very spaced out. The rapids are amazing and are perpetual, we stayed on for an hour and only just manage to go all the way around!

Great Place to Go with Kids. It was really an amazing aquapark. Especially Poseidon's Revenge and Leap of Faith must be experienced.I went there on Monday and it was not crowded (this might be because of the 42 degrees of temperature). We could easily tried all the slides and we could found free places almost near every pool.The staff was very helpful and friendly.If you will eat there, I recommend you to try the pizzas.The only problem was there are too many stairs to goto the slides. They built a very big park and that's why it already makes people tired to even walk for sometimes, so it would be great if they could solve this problem also.Anyway, if you want to go to an aquapark in Dubai, you must visit here!
Great. We had a great day here the kids loved it esp the water rapids n my youngest loved the splash area as well
Brill!. A great water park with all different slides and rides for solo or family! A lazy river/rapids you can relax on in a rubber ring by yourself or in 2's.
Better than Waterworld, not as good as Wild Wadi. Fun to go to if you don't stay at Atlantis, nice amenity if you do stay at the hotel. Average park in above-average setting

fun - go at off peak times. We went on a Thursday afternoon from 3-7pm in late May. Not many people and still not unbearably hot. Bring flip flops - the cement is hot by then. The lazy river had surprise twists and turns that took me down rapids and falls. Also, took about 30 minutes to do, which was nice.Great fun. Clean. have a shave ice - they're really good.
Best water park in the world?. We went today and it was great, we have been to loads around the world and this is the best better than Florida even. Rides great kids part great weather great.

Fun! Fun!! Fun!!!. My kids wouldn't leave until they turned White from floating around in the floating donut..didn't like the fact i had to buy water to drink for 30drahams. It's was a fun experience for the kids and us too.

Fantastic park. We have been here 3years in a row and just love sitting in the rubber doughnuts and floating around the lazy river. Can get on water slides from there too or go down the rapids. Not too scary for my 6 year old from when we first went there. Food I have bought has been great too, can get kids meals and discounts if you have a Skywards card from Emirates. Cart will take you along the beach to the park from the pools if staying in the Atlantis hotel.

Fantastic Day out with the kids :) :) :). We were lucky enough to be staying at Atlantis the Palm, so entry was free for us. We arrived around 11.00ish and left around 6.30 pm, could have stayed longer, but had to go on somewhere. The whole family rated this water park higher than the ones in Florida! We had brought UV vests for the whole family, and swim shoes from the UK, as didn't want to burn and waste time creaming up every hour or so. This is well worth doing, as it will be extremely hard getting your kids (and adults) off the rides to cream them up. I don't like fast rides etc, but throughly enjoyed the lazy river and the rapids which join on to them. Great fun had by all.There are plenty of lifeguards everywhere, and they are a real good laugh. They started recognising our children, and spinning them on their rubber rings before going down the rapids. This was great fun for the kids!There are plenty of places to buy drinks, snacks, food etc. Came away exhausted, but fab time had by all. Wish we had more time to do it again.

wow - so much fun :-). We went in April 2014, had a blast !!! the rides are great and the queuing was minimal, we struggled to fin 4 sunbeds as it was very busy, it was the Easter School holidays for many countries in Europe.The other thing issue we had was the walkways in places (mainly near the beech area) were so hot it burnt our feet - where sea shoes if possible.That said, wow, it was great, the fast rides were fast, the lazy river was long and slow, perfect, will go again for sure ;-)

Great water park, although go early. Great waterpark although there's a fair walk between flumes but if you go early it's lovely and quiet, we went round the lazy river and had a very relaxing ride although I must admit did squeak a bit at the rapids! The food was second to none, cooked fresh and very tasty not your usual theme park fayre. We were guests at the Atlantis so park and towels were complimentary so can't vouch for prices. It seems a very popular attraction so they must be doing something right. Definitely worth a visit though.

Great park, but let down by poor information on rides.. Used this park as part of our stay in the Atlantis. River rides were great. Let down as no good map explaining what the rides were and poor signs so didn't always know what to expect. The main waterside through the shark lagoon was great, but made me scream. Not too busy with plenty of sunbeds. Missed some of the new rides which looked to be closed.
Great park. Very relaxed, not too busy, good variety of water slides, also received free lunch and tickets to the aquarium

Expensive but enjoyable day out. This was my second visit to Aquaventure, having previously visited in October 2012. Since I last visited an additional tower of slides had been added which I really enjoyed, though possibly not great for those afraid of heights!We bought buy one get one free vouchers from the Entertainer voucher book (via Ebay) for entry - admission is usually £46 per person.
