We did however discover after paying that standard entry in May/June included lunch and entry to the Lost Chambers aquarium - sadly not with our vouchers, but we'd previously visited the aquarium anyway.It does get quite busy, not that this meant we had to queue for slides etc but we did find getting a lounger, particularly a shaded one difficult. I'd recommend walking a bit further through the complex and going near the Barracuda food outlet as there were plenty there. Barracuda was also much quieter than the other food option, shark Bites.

Amazing, Fun !. We had booked the dolphin adventure and got an entrance for free to the WaterPark. The Dolphin experience is nice, a must do at least once in your lifetime. It was a busy day in the waterpark as it was a Thursday, but having done the dolphins in the morning you have plenty of time to enjoy all of the rides and go more than once until 7pm. Would definitely do it again !

Lots of fun.. Aquaventure was fun, well laid out and not overly busy for our visit. The rides were safe, easy to navigate and offered something for everyone. It was worth the cost, and we got access to the Lost Chambers too with our tickets. The Atlantis is visually stunning, and the waterpark is great however I wouldn't choose to stay in the hotel as the hotel itself is a bust 'attraction' and this is off putting.

Great fun with the kids. As we were staying on the Palm and had complimentary tickets courtesy of our travel agent, my wife, two sons and I visited the waterpark with some friends. The place is stunning with tremendous attention to detail in the architecture. The rides were fantastic, many unlike anything I had been on before. We all had a ball! Just beware the long queues for taxis when you leave.
Been to better. some good rides, but not loads. A criticism would be that there was no umbrellas on the beach or in the waterpark.

Fun day for waterpark maniacs. I don't like waterparks but I went as part of the group preference for the day. You can use their lockers at 40AED and they had a package of 250AED/adult for park entrance, combo meal and entrance to the lost chamber aquarium. To dive with dolphins is around 700AED depending on which ride you want to do. The great idea is that almost all slides takes you to the same current river that circulates all park and you can go from one to other very fast. It will only depend on your strength to climb several times the stairs. But, without been a fun of this kind of attractions, I thought it was a great fun at the end. The slides are easy and fun and if you want to stay far from the noise, you can relax in the beach. The aquarium is beautiful and it is similar to other Atlantis one (i.e. Paradise Island in The Bahamas).

Dont Forget Your Flip Flops!. Arrived at Aquaventure Waterpark just as it opened at 10.00 via the Monorail and after finding our way to the entrance queued for approx. 20 mins to get tickets - out of 9 ticket desks only 3 were open. They are currently running a 3 for 1 summer deal where you pay 285UAED/adult for park entrance, lunch and entrance to The Lost Chambers attraction. I noticed that as you move through the turnstiles a member of staff would check all baggage to prevent people bringing their own food into the park - hence they can tap for everything!Towels & locker hire is available in a combo for 70UAED/pp - note: the lockers are small but quite deep so you can get a reasonable size back pack in there and they operate via a wrist band with a bar code.TOP TIP: now that the daily temperatures are in the 40's do not forget to keep your flip flops on! By the afternoon walking from the lockers to the water is almost impossible as the floor is so hot. Also, once you're in the water the bottom has a rough texture which can also damage the soles of your feet. Next to the lockers is a small kiosk - if all else fails they sell lightweight pool shoes which you can wear all the time including on the rides. I wish I’d of found that first as my feet go trashed over the course of the day which slightly spoiled the event.There have been points made over the food combo deals. Yes most of is deep fried but there are healthier alternatives to the usual burger and chips. I found the only real problem was the time we had to queue to order the food even though we left lunch until around 14.30 thinking it might be quieter, and the park wasn’t that busy - pot luck I suppose!Overall I enjoyed the day there. We had intended to only stay for a few hours but actually stayed for nearly 6 so it can’t have been that bad!

Brilliant. Overall a brilliant experience with lots of fun and exciting stuff to do - a brilliant addition to the Atlantis hotel. The rides and slides are so much fun, the place is clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. Lots of places to stop for food and drink so no reason to leave the park.Overall a must-do when visiting Dubai
Atlantis Waterpark. Excellent day out. Thoroughly enjoyed the rides particularly the river ride and Slitherin. Definitely worth purchasing a rash vest before you go.

Just as good as Aquaventure Bahamas, yet different.. We stayed a week at Atlantis in the Bahamas a few years ago and now came to Dubai wondering if it was going to be exactly the same or somehow different. Yes, it had the same style, but the waterslides were indeed different, except for the classic "Leap of faith", so it was a wonderful experience again, we had a lot of fun! We came for a day visit and the ticket included lunch AND access to the aquarium... so that was a great deal! Besides, the beach was also avaiable and beautiful with chairs included, a soccer and voleybeach area, and more.TIP: buy the ticket online! The lines were 30 minute to an hour long that day.. you can skip them with online tickets. We didn't had them so we ended up buying the ticket using the WIFI provided by the Restaurants there at Atlantis (passw: dineatatlantis). It saved our morning!

Atlantis water park. Get there early to avoid queue to get in and to get a sunbed. However we ended up with bed at the beach which was quieter - Rides are great and Lazy River is best one been on, with areas of rapids. No map of park which is a downside and queue for food took 30 minutes. Children over 1.2m pay adult price - check with your concierge as they can provide discount

lovely relaxing day. had a lovely relaxing day here. we were lucky as it was quiet, only had to queue for the "leap of faith" and that was only 5 people. I was impressed with their emergency practice of the life guards. we brought our tickets on-line, which save us money and included lunch and the aquarium. you can dehydrate without realising so make sure you keep your fluid levels up

the best day of my life. i don't have a word to expresd how much i have fun in this place so much fun very clean very freindly worker from all over the world all have smille on their face i booked online for a full day and an entrance to the lost chumber for 275 aed about 80$ and it deserve every cent .

Nice park! Expensive, though!. The Aquaventure waterpark at Atlantis is filled with great slides, a dolphin bay and a variety of food/drink areas. Here are some pros and cons:Pros:1) the water slides are very creative and fun. The perfect family experience!2) staff is friendly here and willing to help.3) admission includes a meal and a visit to the aquarium inside Atlantis4) huge park with a wide variety of attractionsCons:1) inconvenience: unlike its counterpart, Wild Wadi, there are no special 'watches' to put credit for food and drink. You can't carry cash around when you're going for water slides.2) the park is not always obvious to navigate, unlike other parks I've visited. Often, there's only one path to a ride.3) the food is at best mediocre from my experience4) expensive: I mean, for the price you pay, they ought to give you a locker and towel. It seems like they want to rip people off.Overall, a fun experience! I'm not sure it's a place I'd visit again, though.

A great way to relax in summer. I had a visitor in town for a few days, we opted to go to Aquaventure because we could not use the beach during the summer due to the heat - this was a great way to relax outside just floating along in our tubes. The F&B was a bit pricey and there was definitely a lack of healthier snack options, but that goes along with the fact that is is after all an amusement park.

Not bad, was expecting a little more. We went here for a day-out whilst in the UAE. Some of the big rides (leap of faith, poseidons revenge) were good but there's not enough of them and they're quite spread out so you'll need to walk a bit and will certainly need flip-flops - or better, those diving shoes you can wear on the rides.The small kids splash area is brillian and beware of the lazy river - it's a maze and DOESN'T go in a circle.Good trip out for the day though.
Excellent park. Well worth a visit. You will get more out of it if your children are over 1.2m. Lazy river is fun. It is a busy park and can be hot to arrive early to get a shady location.

DO IT - YOU KNOW YOU WANT TOO! :). What can I say... A day full of laughter and funMy and husband I went to the Waterpark (In our mid and late 20's) and had an absolute blast! We didn't pre book our tickets as we wasn't sure what day we wanted to go however if early I.e. 9am ish the Que's won't be bad at all. I think it works out at £45 GBP per person roughly, which included for us as we got a deal, unlimited drinks and also lunch! However I have a feeling as I said we was lucky to get the dealThe Waterpark has plenty of rides which actually since returning I have a feeling we missed 2-3 of them. You won't be bored, that I promise and there is plenty of sun loungers, umbrella's for those who want to take time offCamera's around the park will snap you if you time it right and I believe these photo's worked out £15 GPB roughly same price as Alton Towers etc in the UK so not a bad price at all really. IceCreams etc of course are all going to be expensive remember you are at a tourist resort however if you go with the package, although it doesn't include ice creams it does unlimited drinks and food. We also got to bring home a lovely Atlantis Water Park Giant Drinks container that I am sure we will never use again! LolIf you want a fun day out, let yourself go at the Aquaventure Park! You won't regret it - Any questions send them my way! x

Not value for money. It wasn't as great as other water parks in the region. The rides are not as thrilling, nor the staff well equipped to handle the crowds. There are only 10 showers for a huge crowd, which leads to a long waiting line. Not worth the price paid.

Even better than Wild Wadi!. We have always loved Wild wadi but I am forced to admit that Aquaventure makes it look truly inferior!!! Quite expensive but buy one get one free vouchers available in the Dubai Entertainer book. Too much to do in one day and plenty of healthy food options.

Fun fun fun. I went to the park with my grandchildren not really expecting too much , wrong what a fantastic place to go for the day. There is so much to do for little ones and big ones. Great viewing areas so that you do not need to do the faster rides but can watch others. And what a surprise we went for a fast burger for lunch the food was NOT what we were expecting real proper burgers freshly made delicious. Staff everywhere were lovely would definitely recommend to anyone coming to Dubai well worth a visit. But get the extra ticket for the lost Chambers well worth a visit.
Free entry with Dolphin experience. Brilliant almost as good as wild wadi! Not many food outlets here but ok for light snacks. The sharks bite had a very reasonably priced menu

Great day out. Absolutely great day out everything you could possibly expect from a waterpark lazy rivers aquazooms and even ones that go through the shark tanks. Highly recommended to anyone visiting Dubai.
waterpark. it was ok, expected more stuff to do there.. got abit boring after about an hour of the rides etc etc

good day out. As we were stopping at the Atlantis we had free access to the park, does get busy ever if it is not a school holiday, so get there early, the sun loungers go quick and are really crammed in, so you are really on top of each other, the rides are ok, but not planned well as you have to walk around to get to them, leave your flipflops at the ride to go on, the run back as the ride does not end where it starts, on the very hot floor, and in my case find someone has taken your flipflops!!!! Not the best the USA parks have it covered better.
Fun place. Had a great time, a cabana rental is a must and well worth the money. Not many rides for smaller children under 1.20 there is almost nothing. But fantastic otherwise .

An amazing day. Take care of( Posidon revenge)
It shoked me :-)
me and my wife had a great day there.
my advise is going early to avoid rush hours.

Great fun. Me, the kids and my partner arrived at the Atlantis adventure park well before the opening at 10 so we could have a look at this amazing hotel. Hotel is very beautiful and well kept. We arrived at the park and notice that the priced for the 3 for 1 offer changed over night from 250 Dirham to 285 for adult and for kids from 205 to 225. On top you should consider the towel 35 Dir each towel and 25 for the locker. The kids under 1.20 mt can go only to the kids play area that it's ok for half day. After that it's getting boring. On the 3 for 1 offer is included: 1) entry at the park.2)lunch that it was very disappointing, misleading. The 2 restaurants are inside the adventure park so no same level of the hotels. Very bad. Same level of McDonald.3) The Lost chamber that is a magnificent aquarium.Overall it's a good package but the lunch is upsetting, they should advert a snack sandwich. Rides are good but the best is the lost camber where you can see the divers feeding the fishes.

Fun for All. This was the 4th time iv visited Aquaventure. They now have a brilliant summer deal on for 250 dhs. It includes the water park ticket, a voucher for lunch and an entrance ticket for the aquarium.They have 4 new rides which are brilliant. I have always preferred Atlantis to Wild Wadi and now with the new rides it is even better.The only negative is having to pay for the locker on top of the deal price and having to wear a paper babs all day to access the locker.All in all though a great summer deal with the opportunity to visit both the water park and aquarium!
Excellent. Excellent piece of work. Soo many different types of fishes have been collected. Turely Excellent. Must see it atleast once.
Leap of Faith. It was a scary ride but doing it at least once in a lifetime is a must! The waterpark is big and very interesting rides available.

Lots of rides, never get board. If you can afford to purchase the VIP tickets it will be a good idea on weekends and prime seasons as you will wait in long lines. Many people don't mind as its nice to have a drink and socialize in between rides. The staff and life guards are very attentive.One unfortunate issue that arose in front of me was a child in the toddlers/baby area and she was not wearing a baby water diaper and had made #2 in her swim suit and the nanny that was with her did not do anything, I point it out to the guard and they just let things continue. I of course took my kids away from this area and moved them to the older kids area.

Lazy Day on Lazy River. Superb visits to Aquaventure - second visit was very busy so had to queue for food and rides but first visit was just heavenly as not many visitors that day and walked / floated straight upto to everything we wanted to do. Say hello to the lifeguards as you go around as they are a great bunch if people who often get ignored.

Thrilling water rides. Since we had booked the Dolphin interaction, we also had access to the aquaventure water park. The place is huge and there are plenty of rides and slides. We first located a double float in which my son and I anchored ourselves. We started afloat on the lazy river, then laughed our way through the rapids and the waves. We got a bit adventurous and started on the slides. One of the most enjoyable slide was shark attack where in we floated through a tube in an aquarium full of sharks and stingrays. It was cool and my son was thrilled. The later part of the day we spent in the childrens water area where there were smaller slides. Please take your own towels and wear flip flops.The food was very expensive and we enjoyed the frozen yogurt available just outside the park where we pick the photographs. We spent time at the beach and admired the huge pink structure called Atlantis. A very enjoyable day indeed.

Wonderful Family Water Park. The park itself is in excellent condition, they have a slide or water activity to satisfy the entire family. I especially love loading money onto my bracelet so that I don't have to keep running back to the locker room for cash!

Very good fun in Dubai!. This park is well kept and big enough to enjoy yourself for a whole day. It has various activities for children and adults. For adults there are 8 main slides (split in between Neptune towers and Poseidon towers). The slide Leap of faith is very scary and Revenge of Poseidon is EXTREME as you feel quiet close to free fall.What you should know and recommendations: - The queue to get in can take as long as 1 hour on a busy day.- Bring your own towels as they ll charge you AED30 for theirs.- Dubai being a for-profit spirited city, you also have to pay for a locker AED70 if I remember well.- The park tickets include a free meal in one of 2 selected restaurants. I don't know about the other but Shark bites is a low quality fast food (chunk of fat in the burgers, garden salad is actually fresh) where we queued and waited more than 1 hour to eat.- The ticket includes access to a nice and relaxing aquarium (perfect after a long day outdoors)- Put waterproof sun protection as you can be in the sun for a while like in the rapids- Wear a T shirt in the slides where your body is in direct contact with the tube (no donut or other type of rubber ring) as it can hurt your shoulder blade a little.This park is very very fun and the perfect activity on a hot day for adults (or children bigger than 1m20) looking for a thrill!

never again.... i have to say this is the worst water park i have ever been to. the staff are very rude, problem after problem over silly little things - managed to get my money back from them - never again!

Excellent day out. We visited the aqua venture water park on our recent trip to Dubai it was a great day out even without children, combined waterpark with the lost chambers and lunch included, it was a very enjoyable day. The Atlantis is a lovely place. There are plenty of rides and slides and even if you're not brave enough to participate its great viewing. The only bad thing was we forgot our water shoes and the floor was boiling, too hot to walk on and I burnt the bottoms of my feet. Water shoes are a must. A fantastic day out though. I must say there were plenty of lifeguards present too, I've never seen so many, so no worries there. Also small or no queues for the rides. A1

Brilliant. We had complimentary access to aquaventure due to us booking the dolphin interaction at dolphin bay. There was a nice collection of rides and kids ride area also. Thr only drawback was that the paths were not cooled as wild wadi therefore making it difficult to walk upon without flip flops. The other drawback was the food was very costly, along with the drinks but the overall experience was excellent. Also there was no where for us to store the kids strollers.

Good Fun. When I was in Dubai it was extremely hot and humid so anything with water was attractive. I enjoyed the attractions at the water park not only for the slides but being able to keep wet and cool. Dubai gets very hot and humid in the Summer months.

A good long weekend with joy at waterpark. During a long weekend at UAE it was a good time at Aquaventure Waterpark of Atlantis. After having so many such water parks’ experiences in different countries, we can say it was an average experience. Good to spend cool time especially when heat is taking its peak of the summer. Rest all rides were common as found in other water parks too; only one unique experience of Poseidon’s Revenge ride was thrilling. Here at first one get thrilled to enter the capsule, but then for sure mind rethink of getting in with heart bits rising. Very exciting seconds once the base floor falls and our body get through the capsule with gravity. No words to say about it. Such rides are getting in at many new water parks now (I was told even Yas Waterworld opened recently during late 2012 at Abu Dhabi is having this ride), but frankly we experienced it for the first time.A beauty of this water park is that for adults there are two towers – Tower of Naptune and Tower of Poseidon. Each tower has 6 and 4 rides respectively. So we don’t have to move around to different places to find the rides. Same for the kids rides too.A water park with beach around and indoor river feelings all at one place to enjoy summer time is felt really good and comfortable.Staff members at sites are very nice and make you feel of hospitality and services they are ready to give. Food options are many, but really tooooo much expensive. A small water bottle of 13 AED and soda drinks starting 18 AED. One can think of food costs! This is our common experiences at UAE. Unlike South Korea, by not allowing outside food and drink items all such tourist places in UAE are selling food and drink items at extremely high cost. At the end of the day you end up spending equal amount for water and food w.r.t. entry ticket.At the end of the day our group of four families had good fun and joy. Got relaxed and enjoyed very well. Worth visiting once to have fun from many such other options of amusement and water parks now available in UAE.

Best Waterpark in the UAE. For me Aquaventure is by far the best water park in the UAE. It has the best slides & doesn't tend to get too busy - the park is large and also has a beach which overlooks the palm, Burj Arab & Burj Khalifa.The majority of slides are accesses from with the two towers. The Tower of Neptune contains the leap of faith & Shark Attack - both of which send you through a shark tank so you can view the sealife within the aquarium.The Tower Of Poseidon contains the newer slides including two awesome raft rides & Poseidon's Fury (the best slide in the park) which drops you through a trapdoor.For younger guests there is a kiddies play area & the rapids are great fun for the whole family & take you on a circuit of the whole park.Sun loungers are everywhere & you can always find one no matter what time of day (especially at the beach). Queues are well shaded, but you will definitely need flip flops as the ground when walking around the park gets unbearably hot in the Dubai heat!Food & drink is very expensive within the park & you are not allowed to bring you own, locker hire is not included as part of the ticket price & start at 40AED.The staff are friendly & lifeguards are everywhere, the toilets & showers are super clean & really well maintained. Parking is free, but you do need to get the ticket stamped when collecting your waterpark tickets.The only downside to our visit was that we had purchased tickets online, but it took over half an hour to queue up & collect them upon arrival! There is currently a good promotion which gives you waterpark entry, free lunch & access to the lost chambers aquarium for 250 AED for tourists & 165 AED for UAE residents - but this must be purchased online.

Leap of Faith. For those with plenty of courage to take a leap of faith, you must try the special attraction slide called "Leap of Faith". Otherwise take the "Shark Alley" where the slide goes through a tunnel inside the aquarium where you're sorrounded by sharks and sting-rays

Awesome. Excellent water park. Rather expensive £10 for a locker on top of entry price. Definitely worth getting tickets online. We got park entry, lunch and aquarium for about £40.Plenty of rides, loads of lifeguards and very small queues wish was the best bit.Showers available

Exciting Rides. Great fun...but be prepared for long long queues :-( Went with two young children and spent a long of time waiting for the water rides. Also we have to pull tubes up by ourselves. Very difficult for small children to do so!

What a place...a water park like no other.... We stayed at the hotel and used the waterpark between 4pm and 6.30pm each evening. By that time the park seemed very quiet and could get on all the water rides with no queuing. Everyone was incredibly friendly and a big shout out goes to all the lifeguards on duty...great fun to chat to them going down the rides every 20 meters or so...Well worth a visit and I'd go back to the Atlantis just to have the waterpark next door any day!

Excellent Waterpark. Very clean, suitable for all ages. Try online before you buy tickets, we managed to get a combi ticket which allowed access to the aquarium for the price of a normal ticket.
Watch out for the jelly fish on the beach though!

Great for kids. If you have any kids they'll love the slides, waterfalls, pools, waves, play areas etc. You can easily pass a couple of days in here and your kids won't be bored, too much fun for them. If you're staying at the Atlantis Hotel the entrance is free, you should get your ticket for each day on site.

Great day out. Spent a day here. Yes it is pricey, yes the food is expensive but it is an enjoyable day, very clean and safe. Rides are good fun.Would recommend but haven't tried other water parks in UAE
Amazing. You have to visit this place if you there in Dubai .. but go there at 10 am o have full day full because you will not leave before 6:45 when it close :)
Very good!. It is a very wide and big waterpark, all family members have lots of fun, the prices are very very high though, also in Wild Wady!
Great fun!. We loved visiting this water park. I can't honestly say it's the Best, but it was a perfect visit for us when we were there.

Helpful staff, very clean well thought out.. This park is great, if your child is under 1m 20cm there are rides that they cannot go on, but there is so much to do it really doesn't matter. The lazy river and the rapids are loads of fun and so is the playground with slides and the obligatory tilting bucket.The water is sparkling and there were plenty of tubes to go around.A nice touch was the music being played around the resort, it was a little "loungey" for my taste, but I think it was nice and generic.Please be aware that food and beverages are expensive in this place so have a big breakfast! They are no more pricey than any other theme park worldwide, but is it as well to know in advance.
Amazing Waterpark. One of the best waterparks all the Aqua Games are amazing, and the stuff so helpful Many games and everyone can enjoy starting from the kids & the adults

Better Experience Compared to the Big Three. What Aquaventure differs from other big water parks here in UAE is that it's within the famous Atlantis Hotel. So expect the ambiance to be a bit more cozy than usual. For UAE residents, both locals and expats, this great park gives great discounts and offers including free food stub and free entrance to The Lost Chambers Aquarium which is also a must see when in Dubai. They even updated their slides as to keep up to their competitors. This is a good place to stay both for families and group of friends especially the adventurous ones!
Good rides. Everything was excellent the rides are very good only thing the snacks are expensive the water rides is the fall of faith and other slides and also there is childrens area
Best waterpark in Dubai. Much better than Wild wadi, has a good number of slides and experiences , also worth checking out the aquarium

Good water park. Very good watermark.
However I think it's vastly overpriced for young kids under 5 that are too small to go on most of the bigger rides.
I did enjoy the rapids with my 3 year old son though.
Spent 4 hours here no problem
Pool Day!. Hired a private cabana with friends to ensure shad for 3 babies - had a great time. Quite pricey but well worth the visit

Fun place. Been there on my Bday. For the past 4-5 years my Bday falls on Ramadan. This waterpark open during Ramadan timing, music is playing plus food can be served on the public places within territory of the park. If you are tire of water slides and splashes, you can go to lay on the private beach with amazing view on the Dubai SkyLine or go to watch performance of the Dolphines in Dolphine Bay.Personally I prefer this waterpark to any others in UAE

Fun Fun Fun. Fun fun Fun for everyone who likes rides and water. one should go there already in the morning to have a relaxed time for all the joy rides and also for finding a free sun-lounger chair. plz book already money onto your wristband so you can than buy drinks and/or food without having to walk all the way back to your locker or having to take cash with you
Excellent. I would go here over Wild Wadi anyday! It's a good place to relax and to have fun, I took my 2 year old nephew and the staff were very friendly and considerate!

Still in construction It feels... The newest water park of dubai, Havent been to wadi and chose this one instead as our water park experience. Amazing experience, lines move quickly on a good day and the rides are there to excite. IT feels unfinished and the BIGGEST issue is the wayfinding. Those guys know how to build, but they dont know how to traffic manage people. The lack of signage and clear instructions is quite amazing. Some of the top rides are not even signposted and its like a choose your own adventure. IF you like that you will love this. Quality venue and will get better over time.If you want a quiet break go to the beach on the side. nice view and free sunbeds. Also the best way to do it if you have unlimited cash or are silver spooned is to stay at the atlantis. Then you get access to the golf carts and they take you everywhere. Space is not an issue in dubai :)

Good Place to Visit. Excellent rides and like the fact that most rides are designed to be accessible from the same place so you dont have to keep walking hours on end to visit different rides.. the ticket which included a meal at the fried chicken place was the worst food I have ever had in Dubai, I have been to Wild Wadi and the best thing about it excluding the rides that I remember was having the burger! The food in Aquaventure was extremely dissapointing and very poor however for the rides it was very good. Tip to get a GOPRO cam to record and take pictures for the day, they give you a memory card and you can take thousands of photos through the day, well worth it and saves you carrying your mobile around with you!

Nice place to check out in Dubai. I haven't been to a water park before so hubby said since we're in Dubai, where practically everything is over the top, he should take me to Aquaventure. the slides were awesome, it's a good way to conquer fear ( I can't believe one Amazing race contestant refused to do the slides leading to their elimination.) but a lot of the attractions were closed. The Chamber of secrets were closed, which is part of our ticket. I asked for a discount but they refuse it give it, telling us that we can come another day ( we were bound back for the US early the following day.) The slide, I forgot what it's called where you can ride a lifesaver and see marine life is closed. The zipline which is freaking 75UAD is a total disappointment. It was supposed to be the longest zip line in the middle east, but the reason for that was because it was broken down into three sections, so you just launched and you're back on a platform again. Dubai seemed to have thought of everything in their bathroom but Aquaventure forgot to at least give courtesy bags for wet clothes. It was a spur-of-the-moment decision for us so we weren't quite prepare, and we have to lug wet suits with us all the way home to our hotel. Don't forget to bring towels, as they charge almost $11 for those to rent. You don't have to rent lockers which we did the mistake of doing, costing us another $11. All in all, it's a one time adventure to go to, but won't be back again.
Busy, expensive. Again the experience and swimming facilities are wonderful but the drink and food are very overpriced
Best Dubai waterpark. This waterpark has it all, great rides, good selection of food outlets, clean changing room and you have access to the beach. For a waterpark you can't fault it.
Add the Aquarium tour. Well recommended to add the Aquarium tour to your ticket (if for no other reason than to jump the queue for the general admission ticket)

Nice place to spend a day out. The waterpark is next to Atlantis Hotel, full of attraction. I had to choose between Wild Wadi and Aquaventure, and I must say I am pleased I chose Atlantis. I has brilliant slides, a very nice beach, where you can swin in the sea, do sunbathing. Slides are for everyone, but 3 of them are really taught : Aquaconda, Poseidon's Revenge and Leap of Faith !Food and beverages are very expensive !! We went on a week day and never waited in a queue more than 1 minute / slide.

New attractions closed and delayed start times. Oh Atlantis, I know you don't care about us people who live in Dubai because you rely on the tourist trade but there's an awful lot of choice in this amazing city of ours and you need to raise your game.A small sign at the ticket window (tickets have gone up, again!) said the new anaconda ride was closed - of course you're not going to go home at that point are you? Atlantis has been pushing these new attractions all spring, to get there and find they're not working is pretty poor. No discount, like it or lump it because there's plenty more where you came from.... Also many of the rides weren't open for the 10am start time, maintenance works were still being carried out with the promise 'they might open later'. Food in the park was worse than I remembered, nothing that isn't deep fried and utterly tasteless and having to pay extra for attractions, lockers and towels once inside is really sneaky. The new rides just basically offer the variety Aquaventure was lacking before but certainly don't bring it up to Waterworld standard.... And no water fountains here like they have a Wild Wadi.One redeeming feature was the promo which gave me free entrance to the Lost Chambers (a delight!) but the other members of my party didn't qualify because they used an Entertainer voucher... Won't be heading back again.

Great day out. This was our first visit and having visited a few water parks globally before, our expectations were high. We booked on line the day before to get their '3 in 1 deal' so we had access not only to the water park but also a lunch and access to the aquarium.The rides in the park were brilliant and there were hardly any queues. There were plenty of sun lounges with clever little canopies on them so you were protected from the sun if you wished. The lazy river was excellent as it had small rapids and there was never a lack of rubber rings. The aquarium was impressive. The only disappointment was the lunch. They advertised it as 'eat in one of our 7 restaurants'. It was basically 2, what I would only call a motorway services cafeterias and it was pretty much burger or chips or nothing. Very disappointing. But, we paid Dhs 285 each for the day and thought we got our monies worth.
Awesome and Fun Day. This water park is fantastic. Very clean and very helpful staff. Plenty of rides and activities for all ages. Plenty of lifeguards to give parents piece of mind. Well designed.

7 hours of non-stop fun!!. We went there on a packed day but apart from the 45min wait to get tickets, it was great from there on! We were 3 adults and 2kids aged 9 & 7, and there was something for everyone! The kids area is great fun, and there are def many other rides that my 2 kids could join us in. I'd recommend buying the food combo with the tickets at the main gate as it does end being a lot cheaper than paying separately later in the Shark Bites area. I also recommend buying the Gold Entertainment book as that gives you vouchers of buy a ticket and get one free which makes it a lot cheaper! We took our own towels and didn't bother getting a locker as it is quite safe. We just left all bags etc on the sun lounger. I wouldn't get too stressed if you don't get as many loungers as your party number as you only need 1 to dump you stuff on as you will be just running from one ride to another with a huge grin on your face!! :-D

A day of fun in the sun (and water). Thrilling rides for a day of water filled adventure! The park boasts different kinds of waterslides with or without inflatable tires. Some take you through an aquarium which is pretty cool. We had a lot of fun in the park.

bad security guard. the facilities are good, but the security guy who working at entry is gangster, very bad man with rude attitude. I will not go there again, It's absolutely not seven star service. not at all.

Not for young children. This was not a success for us! My 3 year old hated it and refused to go in the children's area as there is a large chest that fills with water and empties over them every 5 minutes - this really scared him. We eventually got him on the lazy river on a double ring, but they are hard to find and took 20 minutes to get one. My 6 year old was slightly braver but still didn't go on much. Expensive for a very average day out. Perhaps more suited to older children.

Crowded and not so safe. There are excellently trained staff that are like guardian angels, but they can nothing if there are too many people. We were there when the place was invaded, and we thought some of the rides was like a bunjee jump experience: safety was not in our hands, when you jump cross your fingers. Yes, they say it's safe. Not sure of the cleanliness/chemical rate of the water, we were very itchy coming out...
Always fun, everyone happy.. A great day out, outdoors. Probably the best fun outdoors in Dubai.Non stop fun, no matter your age. Highly reccomeneded for all age groups.

Feel like a kid again. We were three adults and had an awesome time going down the slides. There are slides for all tastes but our favourite was definitely Zoomerango which is a big 6 seater tube that offers a truly zero gravity experience. Very clean, well organised and well laid out.Tips: Get there early, be IN the queue by 10am especially if going on the weekend.Take sandals, the concrete gets really hot.We got a bit of a bad stomach from the food at shark bites, but we had such a great day we can't knock it. It could happen anywhere.

Amazing experience. We finished our last day of our month long overseas trip by visiting this wonderful water park. Advised by friends to choose this park, we were not disappointed. We arrived early, as advised and paid around $70 each (Aust $) but also paid an extra $235 to have our own private cabana which gave us a covered shaded area with table and chairs, sunlounges, hammocks, lockers, fridge and fruit platter topped off with our own butler for the day ! We spent 9 hours in this wonderful park having fun on all the rides and making use of all of the facilities. The staff in the park are amazingly friendly and it is so clean and easy to get around. We were there mid week and did not have to wait for any rides but was told weekends can get very busy so getting there early is a tip or arriving later in the afternoon when it is a bit cooler. Bring plenty of sun cream, a rash shirt and thongs as the heat is intense and the concrete paving around the park gets very hot. This place is a must see for all travelling to Dubai, not only for families but anyone who wants a great fun day out.
All what you expect. For a great day of fun and feeling like a kid. I appreciate the safety and cleanliness. The queues are just horrific, even with on line pre booking, we queued or an hour.

Fantastic fun for the family. This water park is definitely designed with the family in mind. My sons are 12 and 8 and were able to access all of the slides/rides. The lines moved quickly and the layout of the park was very well designed. It felt very safe as lifeguards were stationed throughout. I would definitely recommend a stop here for families with kids looking for a little adventure!

Perfect Waterpark. The park is just perfect. You have to go early to have a nice spot but having kids forces you to be close to the Kids paradise. Also the rides are very nice for adults. The hit is the Rapids and Lazy River

What fun! Excellent rides and really enjoyable. Well, it was a hot day and we were looking forward to being in the water and wanted to see what it was all about...we were not disappointed. We entered the park and tried the water slides, the best one being Shark Attack where you slide down on a tube with a second person and the clear tube goes through a water tank filled with fishes, sharks, rays and such. Wonderful experience. Other rides include lazy river with rapids option (which was the best ride for my 5 year old daughter since she was below the height limit for most of the rides). Tip: Awesome waterfalls in the lazy river in one end which is the best back massage you will get....just stand under the falls and enjoy! :))Do not bring food into the park, since it might get trashed by the security. There are lots of food options in the park, restaurants and food booths. The park is very clean and service is very good.

Brilliant!. I went to the waterpark in November mid week with my partner. As soon as we arrived there were no lines. We descided to go for the full package because we had vouchers from our hotel. Once to got in I thought the locker system was brilliant, I didn't need to worry about losing my key; they give you a band that you scan to open your locker. The locker rooms themselves have hair dyers, shampoo etc. once on the rides WOW! The best park park I've ever been to. I love water rides these were amazing. I can't remember the one where you got into the tube and the door closes and your drop well anyways I couldn't do that. Also my partner and I swam with sharks stinraes ect which only cost £45 pounds each. We went onto every ride time and time again with no lines. The rides are amazing nothing like Spain. There is something for everyone at this park... Even though I didn't go to the kiddie park they looked like they having a lot of fun. Right tip- when the waterpark closes there is a HUGE line for taxis. What we did is walked through the hotel to the main entrance where there were loads of taxis waiting for people. You do have to lie and say your staying at the hotel but a little lie never hurt anyone. It saved us 50mins. :)

Great for all ages. We went with 2 children (5 years old) and we all loved it! The prices weren't cheap as ever in Dubai but everywhere was clean and the children really enjoyed the rapids and the children's play area.

Day filled with Fun :-). we were a group of 4 adults & 4 kids ( age group of 4-8 yrd olds ) and reached the park around 10 am ... we missed getting our swim suits and so we had to buy it in their in house store and it was very very expensive ... pls do remember to carry all your stuff relating to the park requirements. we had a pre-booked internet ticket and we were saved standing in the queue ( it was quite long ) .. we hired a locker and towel from the counter ..the water park is brilliant and we were able to engage the 4 year old ones also very effectively ... Leap of Faith is the top ride and is mostly crowded .. thereby do this early in the morning and then you can move with the kids at peace in the river ... all rides are good but mostly crowded and so you might have to plan the rides a little .. we did not do so and so spent close to 85 minutes waiting for our turn at leap of faith .. the experience was however worth it :-) my son & me did all the rides and it was too good :-) ... this is one of the few parks wherein you get double dinghy's and so i was able to accompany my daughter in the rides and keep her smiling :-) ... the kids play area is just outstanding and we all had a blast herein .... my daughter refused to move out of this place and the only thing which convinced her was the river ride & the rapids :-) ...................food was pretty OK but we found it to be a touch expensive .. Camera is not usable here unless it is 100% water proof and so relax and have fun and remember the experiencemy reco's for the park are1. Come early2. Carry all park requirements like suits, sun screen (hot country and you will need loads of it :-)3. Water proof wallet to keep your cash ( the neck hanging type helps )4. Get your double dinghy early and hang on to it :-)5. Try all the rides and spend the day with family, friends and children

Kids will love it. This is an awesome waterpark with loads of fun for kids of all ages as well as adults. I have to confess that I enjoyed it even more than my daughters. But you need to keep aside a minimum of one full day to enjoy this park. There are many rides that wont satiate you till you have experienced them multiple times. We were staying at the Atlantis so got to enjoy the park at leisure over 2 days. But if you are not staying at the Atlantis, make sure you reach the park early so you can experience it in full.

Staff using toilet should wash hands. Our children made us return to Dubai because of how much they loved this waterpark. It is pretty special. Kills anything we have in Australia. I never usually notice prices but the food here is a little bit expensive. If you are on a budget eat before you go. But the real reason for this review is to pass on a message to Aquaventure:While using the toilet at the main pool area a staff member came in, did his business and left WITHOUT washing his hands. I walked out after him thinking he was the cleaner who keeps this place spotless, but he walked straight into the closest food outlet. I know you probably hire people with limited educations and pay them minimal wages so they are not rocket scientists, but you have to teach them the importance of the basics like washing their hands. Left me with a sour taste!One tip.... as we left we saw thay you can buy day 2 tickets for (i think ) 100 dhm less.Our 5-year-old hated the rides. The 11 and 14 year olds loved them as did I. Brilliant park as long as you don't want to eat.

Cool Friends Destination. This man-made palm shaped island is a combination of Waterpark and great beach. Few of Yas Waterpark famous games are available in in Aquaventure i.e. Poseidon revenge. There is telefreak that allows you to see an overview of the waterpark. I advise you to buy the tickets online instead of waiting an hour inline to buy tickets. The lost Chamber (the aquarium) is not a big attraction and if you decided not to visit it then you are not missing a lot. Finally Aquaventure for sure has less games than Yas waterpark yet this one is easier to get to since you will not spend an hour and half in the car/bus to start the fun as in Yas waterpark.
Family waterpark. A wonderful day for the family. You will get exhausted at the end of the day. You will see a fabulous aquarium with various fishes and sharks.

A Must visit.. We went for the first time this year and WOW what a fantastic day out, we all loved it and out little boy we had a job to get him to leave to go back to hotel. Lots to do and great views of Dubai from the Palm.
Perfect. Loved everything about it! It is perfect for teenagers children and also adults! A wide variety of things to do.Would definitely go back

Good place to have some fun. I've been there second time (first one was back in November last year). This time it was little bit crowded but anyway queues didn't last long (max 5-10 minutes for most popular, not craziest :D). It is truly amazing with relaxing river rides and breathtaking slides. A little bit pricy but nothing is cheap over there. Locker and towel for an additional cost. Also you will not see information about discounts for residents which are significant and could be found online.

Very big. This was a great location to take teenagers. The beach in the resort is a haven for the adults forced to come and a good meeting point which is indispensable if you ever plan on finding each other again, the dolphin experience was magic too :-)
queues. Lots of exciting water slides, a bit complicated when queueing, not sure which queue is for which ride. queues were quite long too. Helpful staff.

Fantastic Slides. Visited waterpark following my daughters dolphin encounter at Dolphin Bay. We loved it so much we came back the following day. There is a wide variety of slides ranging from Thrill to family with and without inflatable rings. Park is huge - it took over 1 hour to go round the lazy river (not all is lazy, the rapid sections are excellent). Didn't have to queue for long at the slide (which having done waterparks in Disney was great!!). Good quality restaurants at reasonable prices. Also enjoyed their fantastic beach. Entrance fee is fairly expensive but well worth. The best waterpark I have ever visited.

Not worth all the hype!!. Planned a day trip with the kids few days ago during our vacation. Our first mistake was scheduling this visit after we had seen Yas Waterworld. We arrived at 12 noon on a TUE and had to wait 45 min in the scorching heat to get our tickets, so that already put us in a bad mood. After securing our locker we continued inside to put our towels but here again after 45 min of walking about, we despaired and just threw our things on the side just like all those visitors. we were 9 (including 5 kids) and we could not find a single sun lounger!!The key word at aquaventure is queuing! Every ride takes 30-60 min to get on so you end up doing 4 or maybe 5 rides the whole day. Even for getting food you have to queue for 20-30 min.Overall we were disappointed and would never go there again. It really pales in comparison to the newer and better spaced Waterworld at Yas island so go there at least you will get your money's worth.

Modern and exciting. My husband and I went to both aqua venture water park and wild wadi water park. We had a lot of fun in both but I think wild wadi river ride is longer and I liked it more. In addition its famous sceirah is more exciting. On the other hand atlantis was more modern and the rides are more various. Both have kids friendly rides too.

Amazing. So much fun! Definitely pay more and get a VIP cabana. Ask for it after you get inside the water park because they always say they are full when you buy tickets outside but if you ask a park attendant, you can usually get one. They make a huge difference as you can stash your bags there and there are "free" towels and it is away from the madness. Very well thought out water park, with access to the beach and some very scary but fun water slides. The rapids and children's splash zone were fun for the kids.
Excellent adventure. We'll run with great rides and not many queues. Lifeguards everywhere, even the lazy river was good fun,

A nice day out. Me and my boyfriend visited this waterpark recently on our trip to Dubai. Overall it was a good day out.The lazy river and rapids were the highlight of our day! We spent hours just relaxing in the rapids going round and round. I'm not one for going on rides on my own but there were many where there was the option to go in a double ring so that was a definite bonus for me.A downside is that there was nowhere near enough sunbeds for everyone. We got there within an hour of the park opening and couldn't find one free bed. There were even areas that people had reserved and I can see why now!Also one major downfall was the floor....the floor was boiling hot everywhere!! Some areas were bearable so obviously there are floor tiles available that don't burn your feet, however most places we walked we were running into the shaded areas and we saw many others doing this also. My boyfriend had expensive Nike shoes on so didn't want to simply leave them by the side of the pool.Overall it was a nice day out though with plenty of rides to choose from and nice places to eat.

Very good and beautiful park. The park was visually impressive and the safety is total as there is lifeguards EVERYWHERE so you feel very secure even if you're a bad swimmer. There is different kinds of attractions for both people who like and don't like adrenaline !A special good point for the trap door water slide which was really sensational. There was a problem with the floor of the changing room which was wet and dirty, very unpleasant to walk on, they should invest on some special swimming pool floor. The electronic locker system was blocked at the end of the day which made a pretty bad mess as everyone was waiting for a single employee to open their locker manually, bad luck?

By far best waterpark I visited. We had just 2,5 hours after the work, but it was amazing experience. Revenge of the poseidon and leap of faith are really adrenaline... speed in the beginning is near free falling experience. Enjoyed also other attractions. Queues not so bad close to closing time. Definitely recomend for people with kids 10-15 years old and for adrenaline freaks

Coooool... Given the heat of the day, a day at water park is ideal, though the climb to the rides is a tad hot on the feet whilst walking on the concrete. Lazy river is very cooling and relaxing. Great adrenalin rides. A must visit. Free for guests of the Atlantis so a big plus.

Great day- only took half a day. A must see. It didn't take long to go Around and see and do everything. The lines were quite small. No longer than 30 mins. Going on the slide that goes through the Aquarium is a must.

Great day. Long queues even though we had bought our ticket on line, bit of an organized chaos, set up a bit like disney but no where near as smooth. Great park, lovely beaches and great that u can lie on a sun lounger whilst the kids run amok. Good rides really enjoyed the park, food available a hell of a lot better than disney, go early and plan to spend the day

Very high standard of water park. We had bought our tickets beforehand but unfortnately still had to queue for some time. However, the park is unbelievably clean and the rides are good. My son did the white knuckle rides and didn't have to queue for more than 20 minutes. If you have been to any of the Disney water parks, this is very much similar to those. However, what impressed me most was the service and cleanliness in the restaurants - just fantastic and in fact better than Disney. Would recommend this attraction.

Amazing. spent a whole day here. went to both lost chambers and aquaventure. the lost chambers were an amazing experience. the rides in the park were also very nice. the tower of neptune was the best one.

FAB DAY. We spent the day at the waterpark. We arrived at 10am and it was packed out we thought if we arrived early the queues would be ok but they was'nt we spent about 30 minutes in the queue waiting to pay. We had the combo ticket which got you into the park and into the lost chambers. Worked out around 990 dirhams. There is different options you can have like just entrance into the waterpark only and you pay extra for the cable wire if you want to go on that. There is extras for lockers, towels etc too but we took our own and kept our bags with us as it seemed easier than keep going back to the lockers which were by entrance. The dolphin experiences are opposite the tills for the waterpark and they were alot quieter. I went on the beach as i could'nt use the slides as i had an ear infection but my little girl and partner went on all the slides they had a great time. They did have to queue for most rides due to how busy it was and there were little sunloungers available round the pools etc. The beach was great lots of sun loungers, water was warm but lots of jelly fish. Lots of shaded areas under the trees. There is plenty of places to grab food it is over priced but it always is at attractions. The tropical sno hut is great they sell like slushes but looks like a snowball 3 of them cost 90 dirhams for the small size but worth having one. Def worth going but try and book online to avoid the queues and i think its a touch cheaper online we paid adult price for our 10 year old daughter so bear that in mind too.

EXCELLENT. Fantastic water park with a difference,lots of rides,slides and areas to relax if you dont feel like venturing. the staff all round the park are very helpful and lots of life guards positioned all round the park.
New rides!. New rides added recently give this waterpark the edge over Wild Wadi. Excellent facilities, friendly staff. Avoid the weekend as the queues become quite long.

Big kids!! . Two 28-32yr olds in their element. Spent 6hrs in the park & did every ride, there are 2 towers Poseidon & Neptune so make sure you go to both. There are a 2 scary rides... The leap of faith and the revenge, both were amazing with kids around 12 giving them a go. Although be warned the revenge hurts your back as you're suspended in a tube before launch & the sections were the tubes meet are not quite flush. Lunch @ shark bites was reasonable 70AED for a double cheeseburger meal (huge patties) 50AED for 2pcs chicken meal both with drinks. I would definitely book online beforehand. I did ours the night before as we hadn't decided which day of our trip to go & the queue was half the size. Waterproof camera/go pro if you have one take it!! We captured some amazing pictures & video. One on shark attack going through the tube surrounded by sharks and sting rays!! Just like on the adverts... Incredible :-) Words of warning... These rides throw you around so a scantily clad bikini is not appropriate! If you have a large chest you can get a rash tshirt from Atlantis for 210AED I bought one at the end of the day as I had a Nike sports bra (the non clasp ones) on to keep my dignity. I saw several women having to cover themselves up mid ride and one lady even lost her bottoms on one ride as it propels you upwards using jets of water... The 50ppl at the end of the ride including children did not find it very amusing. We finished off our day with a walk around the lost chambers which we found fascinating. We sat for around 20mins in front of one tank just watching in awe of these majestic creatures. Although it could be seen as an expensive day out especially for a family, you pay more for Thorpe Park & Alton Towers whilst this is probably a once in a lifetime holiday I would say go for it as the memories are worth it. Happy water sliding!!
Very Good but Needs more Rides and Shade. Its a very clean and good waterpark, very good crowd but needs more shade to protect from the sun and a few more rides for children.

very expensive and crowded but fun. a really nice place which cost sooooo much! it was super busy when we went and we had to queue quite a bit but we had a really good day ( especially on the lazy river ! the best ride with no queues and super long and refreshing:-))

Best Waterpark in Dubai. This is by far the best water park In Dubai. In visiting this and Wild wadi... This wins hands down. The Waterpark has a good selection of rides for all from relaxing to thrill seeking. The staff are very helpful and friendly. I will be returning to this park and not Wild wadi on my next visit to Dubai

Awesome. I did the snokelling experience with the sharks and rays which was brilliant, great day out, fantastic place
Didn't like how busy it was but I suppose that was because it was Easter and a weekend

Good watermark, clean and spacious.. We arrived just after 10am and looking at the queue wished we'd booked on line, however after 20 minutes we were in and basically had the place to ourselves until 12.00 when the masses descended. There are many rides although they were often very short. Nice that you can use the beach although we didn't. We got changed and had a great lunch in a serene Italian restaurant in Atlantis.

Best attraction on 'The Palm' island. Aquaventure waterpark is one of the most advanced and fun-filled water park with an amazing variety of rides that you can find on this side of the planet.It is a paradox of sorts that you can enjoy this in a desert city of Dubai which itself is a man made wonder.Don't miss the main ride of long tube slide that passes through an aquarium filled with sharks! A great experience.

Enjoyable. Not our favourite watermark in Dubai although it was an enjoyable day out. There were too many completely dark enclosed rides for my liking which reduced what I was able to go on. Given its fairly new I was expecting a bit more, they are not up to the variety and range of American Universal Studios or Disney water parks, which is a bit surprising considering they are aiming to be number one in everything!We hired a cabana for the day which was great and they do a good job in looking after you.

Changing the goal posts. our daughter just came under the height restrictions for some of the rides. i did protest but all this did was attract attention to us and subsequently we couldn't get her on any ride with a height restriction. however my wife did go on some of the rides and reported back that the height restrictions were sensible and they were right to refuse us. however they were letting other children on much shorter than my daughter so this should be of concern to other parents visiting> the height restrictions are there for a reason even if all of the staff don't impose the rules.

Great Day out. Really inventive lazy river with rapids optional, else rides are quite extreme. The place itself is clean and tidy with plenty of places for snacks. Getting there needs to be a taxi unless you are staying at the Atlantis

Fun and excitement. Modern and joyful water park with lots of rides, must see water park in Dubai. we had fun moments there. Good escape form hot weather. Highly recommended for whom seeking excitement and joy.dislike : far away from the city, expensive.

One very expensive disappointment!!. I had very high expectations for this water park but was left very disappointed and out of pocket! For two of us it cost us quite a bit! Slides were good but not as exciting as shown in adverts, the tubing through the shark tube was a massive let down you blink and you miss it. Not a great selection of slides for the adults. However for the children there did seem to be a wonderful area for them. Service at the resturants was shockingly bad no-one seemed to know who's order was whose, lots of confusion and staff yelling at one another. Not good! The best part of this water park is the lazy river and not alot else. Very disappointed.

Brilliant place!!. Have been here twice this week with my partner and both times we had an absolute ball, it's very well staffed, spotlessly clean, plenty of food options, the price for tickets may seem high but once you are in there it doesn't take long to find out it was money well spent!

Aquventure = Aqua + Adventure. I visited the water park this April 11th 2014.. The water park has 2 main stations tower of Poseidon ant tower of Neptune. all the water rides are amazing. they have rides for all age group. cleanliness of water was very good. lifeguards are everywhere. Park has its own beech which is also very clean. Enough restaurants are there for food. Special family rides are there for the families of 4 to 6.. i enjoyed a lot there.. the best ride is leap of faith. dolphin show is also very good but charges are separate for dolphin encounter. A very enjoyable experience indeed. one must visit this park once.

An absolutely fantastic water park. We spent a full day at the water park; Dolphin encounter in the morning & then water park in the afternoon - Best day of our holiday!The dolphin experience was incredible. Not too many people; as you are divided in to groups. The dolphins choose to interact with you, so it doesn't feel forced. My children were in awe of the dolphins, as were my husband and I.The water park is similar to Wild Wadi but larger and didn't seem quite so busy (we queued at Wild Wadi, but didn't as much at Atlantis). Slides for all ages and all levels of bravery!
Nice Waterpark on the Palm island. Nice waterpark for young & old with extreme slides and nice beach too. Good access since it has a monorail coming from base of Palm island in Jumeirah.
Health hazard. All my children ended up with ear infections or vomiting and Diarrhoea after visiting this park clearly overcrowded and water quality not regularly checked especially in kids area

Lazy River & Adrenaline Pumping Slides. Has a little of something for all ages and all levels of excitement. We stayed at the Atlantis hotel, so we usually did a half day activity and then spent the remaining half of a day at this waterpark. We loved the ease of going back and forth to the hotel and availability of food. Plenty of free towels and places to sit and relax around the pools. Would do this again.

Amazing time. What a place! Buy your tickets online to save yourself a massive wait to get in. The wate slides are awesome, and the lines for the individual slides very well managed and quick moving. Posiedons revenge is not for the faint hearted, but is awesome. Food is a bit pricey but great.

Best fun I had in Dubai . We booked online and got the combo with the lost chambers for 300 AED each. We were at the kempinsky mall of the Emirates and decided to go by taxi which cost us 30 AED each way. We avoided the mono rail as it isn't connected to the metro and had mixed reviews on trip advisor. We were there in 15 minutes. The lines are long even the prepaid ones, you'd wish they had barcode printouts that they would just scan and print but it's manual entry and takes a good 5 mins per person. We rented a locker at 40 AED it's big enough to fit a 15' laptop backpack and can be opened multiple times, just that the barcode key they strap to your wrist is a little difficult to operate. We also got us a meal combo at 45 AED each. Consists of a burger / shwarma /hot dogs with fries and a drink. Based on reviews we read we carried our own towels and avoided additional rentals. There are ample pool chairs at the resort and finding one isn't tough. Travel to the resort in flip flops and Bermuda and tshirt, it's entrance is totally separate from the palm and no formal dress code is required. The rides are amazing and you will want to do each one again for sure. We did each ride an average if 2 times each. But walking up the taller rides starts taking a toll later. Especially since you have to watch your step on the chipped edges of most steps on to the leap of faith and watch your hands on the make shift railing on parts of the stairs on the way to Poseidon's revenge. There's a lot to walk as well in the park so come prepared. I regret having purchased the lost chambers ticket it wasn't up to my satisfaction, quite brief and can be done with in 10 mins. 2 Large tanks and a few small tanks of jelly fish and some others. You may want to skip it in like of the aquarium at the Dubai mall. Have fun and enjoy yourselves.
Beautiful Day. Of the most beautiful and best days I spent in Dubai and Aquatics lived atmosphere is nice with the breeze, where water sports and dolphin enjoyed the time Can not forget

Extreme. A fantastic park with rides for everyone. Great options for the thrill seeker or moderate rides for the family. Food options available but very expensive. Everything you need on site. Definitely worth a few hours or a whole day. The lines aren't too bad bud give yourself time to get around.

Great fun. Great water park, equally enjoyable by adults and kids. Some rides are somewhat scary but that is exactly the fun of it. Another pyramid with a whole bunch of new rides has recently been added, making it even more fun. Definitely worth a visit. Better make it on week days if you can.

floatastic. I went today and with a few friends. Ok i admit that some of the rides look and ARE a little bit scary, for example "Leap of Faith", "The Plunge", (It was either) "Aquaconda" or "Zoomarango". The ques are quite long but i promise you that it is worth it when you finish the rides. It is even better if you go in doubles because you have someone to talk to. The lockers are very good because you only just have to swipe your wristband and then it tells you which locker to go to. Then the stuff you need to get out of at the end you need to swipe the same band and click "Finished for the day".

Aquaventure. Excellent waterpark that equals, if not surpasses anything Disney or Florida has to offer. Great for adults and kids alike. We had free access as Atlantis residents so I can't comment on value for money, but we had some full days in there. Care with the "lazy" river though. It's not the sort of thing where you just gently float round in a circuit. It does get a little "rough" in places.

Very good day out. Excellent day at the waterpark. Great rides and lots to do for all ages. Went with 2 kids aged 6 and 2. 6 year old went on every ride except 2 and thoroughly enjoyed dragging me around to all the rides. Despite having a morbid fear of heights I did the "Leap of Faith" which I would highly recommend. Overall the park was busy but we had no problem with queues or at the entrance gate. The only slight negative I can come up with is that around the childrens area there isn't enough shade and the beds with the portable shades aren't that great. When it's 35 degrees it would have been nice to sit in a shaded area which didn't seem to be in abundance unless you hired a cabana for the day which were all hired and not that many there anyway. Would definitely recommend but remember to cover up!

Fun day out! . Our second visit to the water park it was better than our last visit as there are a few new family orientated rides which were very fun. Visited on a Sunday the queues to buy tickets alone were very busy, lockers are expensive I would take your own towels as this is also a rip off. Queues for rides were long and there is no time estimate from the point where you are standing this should be used as this is a very busy water park and there is no way of telling how long you could be waiting. To say the beach is man made there is a lot of gravel and some coral fragments in the water as soon as you walk in. Why would they make it like this? Overall the rides are good fun but everything is quite overpriced and busy!

Brilliant. Must visit watermark in Dubai very clearly designed so you don't have to get out of the water whilst navigating the watermark as all the rides are off the rapids, plenty of food and beverage outlets, only minus point is the lockers cost alot

Good fun, but many people . We went two adults, and two small kids and a toddler on a Sunday. It was all good fun for the bigger kids, but there are not that many activities. Ques for water slides were REALLY long and slow moving, and you have no idea of how long to wait, as they spand several stairs. They should manage this better and could post wait times for each ride. The river ride around the park is good fun, and there are many lifeguards posted along the way. There is a water playground which is fun but also noisy and crowded at times. A little too much for a toddler, but there is not much else to do for this age group. You have to pay extra for a locker and towels if you didn't bring it yourself. Even though we had prepaid tickets, we had to que for 15-20 min in order to get our entry wristbands. Upon entering the park, they search your bags and any food will have to be removed. Inside the park, there are kiosks, primarily selling junk food, but the restaurants does sell some healthy foods, eg salads. All in all a good day, but value for money could be better.

Superb water park. We visited this park having booked and paid in advance. We arrived about 945 and were able to go straight to the changing rooms. The park is beautifully laid out and the slides are incredible. We stayed until 6pm ! Even though it was a Saturday in British school holidays there were few queues and even when we did queue it was no more than 15 mins - beats Florida!! Food was varied and plentiful but expect to pay quite a bit - £3 for a small ice cream or milkshake. Our favourite rides were at the temple of posidean where we loved the large raft rides but my husband and 7 yr old also loved the almost vertical leap of favourite. The park was spotlessly clean, the toilets and changing area were just lovely. Make sure you pop up and see the dolphins and take a look at the shark tank ( which you can ride theough!!)

Worth the money!. Went with my friends and took part in all the rides. It takes almost more than 3-4 hours to complete and once done, you feel like doing certain rides a couple of more times. Really enjoyable if you attend with a group of friends. All the rides are 100% safe. However, didn't have time to explore other areas including the aquarium and the dolphin bay. If planning to visit, I'd like to recommend to be there early to prevent any disappointment at the end of the day for not covering most of the rides. The queues could be quite long in the weekends so try to visit early on weekdays.

Wicked Day out. We had a fantastic day at Aquaventure. We went as 5 adults and 1 baby. I would strongly recommend that people arrive early; we arrived at 1130 and got on all the rides really quickly with no queuing - this was not the case in the afternoon. Equally, I would suggest that people walk through the park and get a sun lounger on the beach where you get a lovely breeze. The park doesn't really cater for little babies (ours is 9 months) with a lack of shade but overall I would absolutely recommend this as a great day out.

Fun Adventure, even with Little Children. Our visit to Aquaventure was included in our hotel stay with Atlantis, and the staff was helpful enough to let us use the water-park for the full day even after we checked out of the hotel without an additional charge. The water-park has rides for everyone, across all age groups. The Splasher's play area for children is a lot of fun for the little ones, and our 3-year old spent most of his time there and in the Lazy River, which is slow-moving stream of water with 2-3 waterfalls in between. Other than the rides for children, the park is mainly divided into two towers - Neptune (NT) and Poseidon's (PT). There are water-rides and slides of all levels of adventure, starting from plain fun to extremely scary rides. The ones that we found scariest were Poseidon's Revenge (in PT) and Leap of Faith (in NT), which look like quite a suicide, but are good fun at the end of it. The park is open between 10:00 a.m. and 6:30 p.m., and is relatively empty before 11:00 a.m. and after 5:00 p.m. with no or very less waiting time for the rides. In between (11:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.), it is extremely crowded and the average waiting time for any water-ride is easily over 30 minutes, even on weekdays. So you can hardly do too much during these hours. It's advisable to make use of 10-11 a.m. and 5-6:30 p.m. time. Without the long queues and waiting time, the water-park is easily coverable in 2-4 hours. I found this the best part of our Dubai vacation, and I would highly recommend this waterpark

Great fun, but annoying lockers and not enough hairdryers.. Overall a great day even for adults! The digital lockers are a bit annoying though. The staff at the ticket desk told us we could fit 2 big bags in a small one. Not a chance, so we had to queue up again to get a 2nd one which was very irritating. Other than that the rides are good fun, even if you're not a great swimmer as the waters shallow on most. I avoided anything that you didn't go on in the ring, I wasn't brave enough! A pity you can't see more of the dolphins and sea lions unless you pay extra as the water park tickets alone aren't cheap. Don't count on using the hairdryers ladies. Only one was working when I was there which people were fighting over and it eventually over heated and turned off :) I took my own but couldn't find a plug apart from in the changing room entrance where there were no mirrors. So if you're planning to get ready there to go onto dinner at the palm after it isn't ideal. We got the aquarium/ water park combo ticket. The aquarium is lovely, its calm and great to chill out after the park. It's not very big though. I'd recommend buying tickets for the water park online as we were told to buy on the day as the queues would be short, but it took at least 20 mins to get ours.

7 hours of fun. We spent 7 hours here as a family and loved it. Starting with the lazy river and couldn't believe how long it is. It is about 25 mins right round. The younger kids play area was mayhem with water shooting and falling from all directions. The Stinger ride is great. The Zoomeranga is one that the whole family can do together. The drop is terrifying so be warned. The double rings area great for an adult and child to ride together. The staff was everywhere and they are great fun. The only minor criticism is that there does not seem to be enough double rings with a sealed bottom child seat. Once you get one you need to hang onto it. But the water park is highly recommended and even the food was good.

Brilliant - even with little ones.. We were trying to decide whether to go to this water park or WildWadi and after reading some of the other reviews we decided to try Aquaventure because it seemed the better park for small children. We went with friends and children who are 3 & 5 and I have to say this park was perfect. We got there at about 11am and were able to secure some beds near a nice shallow pool area within easy walking distance of the children's play area and food and drink outlets. Both children adored the children's water area and I really liked the fact we could play with them on it and also use some of the slides. The lifeguards were fantastic, interacting with both us and the children and making sure that we all had a fabulous time and were also safe. The lazy river was great once we found the joint rubber rings in which the children could sit at one end. My not very brave 3 year old didn't like the rapids, my 5 year old loved them so I guess it depends a lot on the child. The adults took it in turns to visit the more adventurous rides and the queues were very manageable. Food and drinks were fine and the portions plentiful. Wouldn't hesitate to go again.

Brilliant water park in great setting. This water park is located near to the grounds of the Atlantis The Palm hotel with spectacular surroundings and views. Purchase your tickets online prior to attendance, its quick, simple and cheaper to boot and can be done five minutes before you arrive, just give the ticket desk your reference number on your phone or print the receipt prior to attendance. Also try and attend on a weekday as weekends can be busy, I attended on a Friday and it was brisk but not too busy but I can imagine on weekends it becomes unbearably busy. The park charges for towels and lockers so if you can, take towels with you and unless your carrying a suitcase full of stuff or are taking a lot of children the smaller of the two lockers should be big enough for a couple.
