Be mindful not to take food or drink into the park with you as during entry they check your bags which I find quite rude. Prices for food and drink from park vendors isn't cheap but its normal highly inflated theme park pricing in action.Most rides we got on within 10 minutes, only Leap of Faith had queues longer than 20 minutes. This is the parks main attraction thrill slide and although it is very exciting its not all its cracked up to be and over before you know it. For my money the scariest slide is Poseidon’s Revenge. This slide was awesome, once inside the standup capsule you stand on a clear perspex floor with a black hole below. As the clear perspex door traps you in a voice counts down 3-2-1 and the floor falls out dropping you down a near vertical hole. The lazy river and rapids were good, as were the numerous rides requiring inflatables. There are numerous loungers with canopies littered around the park, all invariably around pools. These are free to use and plentiful but depending on when you arrive you may have to go to the rear of the park to find empty ones. The grounds are stunning, as is the beach which sits on the inside of the Palm. We had a great day and it was well worth the money.

Worth it. We were deciding between this and Wild Wadi water park, and glad we choose this one. So many fun slides to do. Could easily spend a day there. Food not as expensive as we had anticipated. Plus you get free access to Dolphin Park. I think many people were unaware of this because it wasnt very busy at all. Plus, you cant gp to Dubai and not see Atlantis! Fun for people who dont enjoy the slides as there is a lazy river plus free access to the beach. 100% reccommend it.

Excellent !!!!. As a person who is not a waterpark lover, this changed my mind !! Amazing layout, Jawdropping rides, laughs galore for all the family !! You may think it a little pricey but if you get there for opening like we did and spend 8 hours having lots of fun, its fantastic value for money !!!

Awesome Day. Spent the day here after finishing my meeting on a business trip.Thought the price was very reasonable, go the locker, lunch and ticket combo.The Slides are awesome and provide great views too.The lines arent to big and always run smoothly.Heaps of staff for safety too.Will be going back

Water Wonderland.. Ignore the miserable sods who say it didn't live up to their expectations, I'm struggling to think if a better water park. We didn't do the Dolphin or Stingray experiences, as the Stingrays being touched by humans is known to be stressful for them and we don't like to see Dolphins in captivity.That aside, great rides, not too many queues (apart from getting in) so either arrive on the dot or mid afternoon.Hold onto you hats folks AND ENJOY!

Brilliant afternoon in the water. We spent an afternoon here combined with the Dolphin Adventure at the Palm, Atlantis.The water park is huge and well managed, they seemed to have staff everywhere, the lazy river is huge, with hills in it, rapids etc.. We also rode on one ride which was like a roller coaster in water which again was excellent.Food at the waterpark is reasonably priced too.Top tip if its hot take some cheap flip flops walking on the paved areas around the water is painful with the heat.

Great Day Out!. Just got back from a weeks holiday in Dubai with my wife and 15 month old son and have to say that one of the highlights was definitely the day out at Aquaventure Waterpark!We got there early as the park was opening so didn't really get slowed down by any queue's, and also went mid week which I would imagine in general means the park is a little quieter too, so if you don't like to queue, then definitely something to try and also do.I had visited the park previously about 4 years ago and the overall experience this time was certainly improved as they have developed additional rides, eating areas as well as other things to do, so it really is a full day out.My 15 month was too young to go on most of the rides but did still love the Lazy River and Children's Park, and my wife and I took it in turns to go on rides so that we didn't miss out.I have to travel to Dubai a few times each year with work, but will definitely go back to the waterpark again for another fun day out!

Fun, fun and fun..... Amazing water park, with so much fun for everyone from three years to any age. "Leap of Faith" really test you and your dearness not for weak heart people. "Lagoons" & "Sludge" was awesome.Must visit with family, friends and lot of kids also.I assure you, you will collect a lifetime memories there.

Not as good as expected.. I was looking forward to this waterpark, but I was really disappointed. All rides end in the lazy river and when its busy it takes ages to get back to the next one. The overall image of the park is really amazing and relaxing, but for the overall thrill of the rides there is really only one good one 'Leap of Faith'.Since I visited they have opened up several more rides, so it will be interesting to see it now.
Fun day out. Make sure that you make it to this theme park. Great fun for the whole family. Just be careful of the beach, there were jellyfish floating around despite the nets being in place
Superb Visit. One of the must visit places in Dubai, wear your self out with all the aquatic activities and indulge yourself at the amazing burger joint at the entrance

You don't need kids to enjoy!. I went here with my boyfriend (26 and 32) and we had a great day out. You can float around the whole park using the rapids and opt for which rides you fancy when you want, some of them are connected to the rapids. The park provides single and double rubber tyres and we stayed together the whole time (good if you're a bit scared on the rides) and you use these on most of the rides. I didn't go on the 180 degrees drop rides when you don't use a rubber ring as I don't like heights/speed/being enclosed (!) but they looked awesome.There is a private beach which all park users can use free of charge that had lots of trees for shade and some grass which would be useful for people who didn't want to spend all day in the park. We dropped our stuff on a sun lounger and came back to it throughout the day, very safe. There are also lockers (not free) to keep any valuables. We didn't know whether to go to Wild Wadi or here so I asked a Dubian family member which was better and she said Aquaventure as it has more things to do and the beach was a definite plus point.

Excellent fun although the queues can be bad. You have to queue a LONG time to get in so get there early. The queues for the rides can also be very long and the queues are in the shade so you can get really cold! Fantastic good fun though. Worth paying for the meal voucher

A great experience. The park is well spread out, and has some great rides for all ages. Its also clean, well maintained and convenient dining options scattered across. We enjoyed the leisurely, long river on a tube which has some fun rapids on the way. Access to the private beach is an added attraction

Great Fun...expensive!. Great idea in a great location. There are ample rides throughout the park and cater for all ages. Fascilities inside the park are ample (sun chairs, towels, tubes). Everything comes at a hefty price though. For visitors that aren't converting GBPounds or USDollars into AED's it is a very expensive day out. Lockers are available for your bags etc but also come at a price, the small lockers are just big enough to put a pair of shoes and a few items of clothing. Anything bigger will require a large locker. Best advice would be to go early, get yourself a suitable sun chair and leave your bags and towels on your desired chairs. This is seemingly the done thing as most good chairs are "reserved" before lunchtime. To save a bit of money look into buying "The Entertainer Dubai", this book comes with near 2000 buy one get one free vouchers which include Adult, Children and a locker vouchers. Vouchers can also be found individually on eBay. If the meal offer is available when buying entrance tickets take one, the meal is big and a lot cheaper than any of the food available inside.

Fun fun, well thought out, a dream of a park. We live Gold Coast Australia near many theme parks, aqua adventure Dubai tops our list. It is so well thought out, the interconnections between rapids and rides is brilliant. You can join the rapids at any spot and be easily glided to the rides. I'm not big on thrill rides myself so some rides were too much for me, but my family loved them. Me I couldn't go past the shark attack and rapids float and thrill mixture.The new Poseidon rides are sure to thrill adrenalin junkies. This new section is not as muli interconnected as other rides but rapids will get you to barracuda bay where you exit and leave you float ring to join Poseidon.By interconnected I mean you can even stay in your float ring and join a lift up to other rides without needing to get out and walk and carry your float device. Sit back relax float see where you end up.We LOVED it.

For my birthday. Excellent day with great water slides. Leap of faith was so scary though lol. Only downside was those annoying lockers where u had to scan your wristband. I was there for about 10 mins trying to allocate one. Opening is hard to because the screen just would scan at all. Felt like giving up. Could do with more showers and hairdryers especially in the ladies changing room as we do take abit longer to get ready. Definately will be back
Best place. Excellent rides and place not to be missed..... Infact will want to visit the waterpark and the atlantis hotel again.....I loved each and every thing in atlantis....

Great place to visit with family and kids!!!!!!!!!. Visited the park in December 2013 with kids and we had great fun. December is a very busy period so you need to be patient as you will encounter long queues at the entrance and for all the rides except for the lazy river. I recommend that you buy tickets online so that you don't have to wait for a longer at the park entrance. All the rides are every exciting and you do tend to get a thrilling experience on some rides which are obviously not for the faint hearted. Food is on the expensive side and let me qualify this and say it depends on you budget (burger and chips would cost about AED80.00).We used the locker for valuable items and brought our own towels. The place is very clean and the workers are also friendly and offer satisfactory service. Will visit again!!!!!!

Fab for europeans - too cold for locals!. Went at the beginning of March when the temperatures was about 25 degrees - the locals avoided the water as it was too cold - by about 4pm there were only about 10 of on the rapids and no queues for any of the watersides. The water was at bath temperature - perfect for europeans!!!

scary, and not worthy.. Me and my friends from Glasgow and Nottingham were amazed by the user reviews but when we went their we fell like something is missing,im not sure how to explain but its not worthy for that price,but I love the idea and concept behind this waterpark.washrooms are messy.

Many options. Very big water park and a lot to do! All the slides were crazy but we enjoyed! Only minus was expensive food inside and i hoped a sauna or something how to warm yourself after a day in a water.
Fun for young and less young. Want to spend a day in the water ? Go visit Aquaventure but make sure you got sunprotection. There are no beach umbrella's available.

Great all day fun. I've not been to many Water parks but this place is brilliant, you can sit on a rubber ring all day and go down the many different chutes and falls and when you get to the low point you just stay in your ring and get brought back up to the top via a conveyor belt. Many scary but fun slides too. Food and drink not exactly cheap but what do you expect in Dubai
Water park. Excellent! Had great fun even without children. Food not cheap, photos approx £12 -£15but good souvenir. Lockers approx £8 and towels £2

amazing. this place is really cool. being beside the atlantis hotel, it is 'atlantis' themed which was excellent. some really good (and really scary slides), really fun rapids for the rubber rings, and a big shark pool (which some of the slides go through the middle of). All in all, a very good day/afternoon activity

Fun day. Visited Aquadventure in October just after the new tower had opened. Had a fantastic day. Plenty of attractions. Lazy river was fun and no so lazy. Beach was lovely and water so warm. Take flip flops with you as the floor was so so hot. A much better waterpark in my opinion than Wild Wadi.

Nice Rides. I like this place. It's less trendy that Wild Wadi but you hardly have to wait to go on rides. It's got some pretty scary rides.It's not that big of a waterpark but good enough to have a wet day out with your friends. Brings the kid back in you.

Fun Day Out, but expensive. Aquaventure is a fun day out, with lots to do and a range of really scary rides to the more mundane. It is expensive though, with entry a little cheaper online and a lot quicker when you arrive with lots of lines (and we went in early Spring). Make sure you look around for food, as we stopped at the first place we saw and it was 80AED for a burger and drink! There are definitely better options so don't go there!Others have had bad reviews about the lockers - its a bit hard to scan the barcode at first but overall the system is fantastic with a barcoded wristband linked to your locker and there's a lady in the ladies locker room at all times who can help you if you have any issues, so I would definitely recommend you get a locker.The only major issue we had was getting there when we werent staying at Atlantis - we got a taxi from the nearest monorail station and it cost about 22AED each way so just be prepared with time and money to travel there.
great waterpark. it is very nice palace and I liked very much you can spent full day and enjoy for children to parents must visit
FUN FUN FUN!!!!. Great laugh! loads to do and have fun!! Great rides and loads of choices to eat- can speand the whole day there !

So much fun! Go early to avoid the queues. We aren't really water park people but had free access as we were staying at Atlantis. It really was great fun and the whole park was very clean. The beach was great too to dry off from the water. Highly recommend for all ages!

High Expectations not met. I was looking forward to visiting after comments and also a visit to Yas Waterworld but I was actually a bit disappointed. There is a real lack of slides that are different to each other and I wouldn't pay to return. I visited on a Friday morning and did the park and ride - TIP - Park in the avenues to save getting on a dirty minibus and having to wait for it to be full before it leaves. We used the entertainer voucher and paid for a small locker which was actually big enough for a large beach bag and two large towels so unless a family i wouldn't bother with the large size. As expected food is quite pricey and is just the standard burger, pizza, chicken and chips fast food style. It did get much busier in the afternoon but by this time I was bored and went to the beach to relax. I definitely prefer Yas over Aquaventure. Yes there are large rides but they are so similar it lacks any kind of excitement after a while and I also thought the water level was quite low and in the lazy rivers meant that one person had to push you around.

Very few rides - disappointing. Expected a lot based on reviews - very few rides - each ride takes 15 minutes to complete - no escalators to rides - given the high price.. Positives : Some good rides like Leap of Faith, Poseidon revenge etc. Negatives : Few rides, far apart, no escalators to ride - given the high price for tickets.

Worst waterpark to visit - Aquaventure. I visited Aquaventure park just last week with my family, and i was thoroughly disappointed with the whole experience. With the heavy ticket price they charge they do not give even a penny worth of value.The staff is unfriendly and do not help you with anything, unless you are buying something from them , like the dolphin experience etc.No map, no directions, you will be lost, where to find what, and what are the rides that you can do, which ones your kids can do? Some places you are even expected to carry your own float almost to a level of first or second floor.They want to make money in everything, towel rental is 30 dirham, which is just crazy. The big locker is 75 dirhams and if you open it once, your money is gone, you will have to hire the locker again, which again is just absurd.If you have kids who are below 11, they don't have much to do, as most of the rides are huge, and the kids get frightened just looking at the heights. So the kids just end up doing lazy river and the kid splash area, for which going to this place is just waste of money.Food is exorbitantly priced, with not many options too.It might be a good place for a couple but not at all friendly to family.I felt cheated, by choosing this place to visit in Dubai.

Just like a kid again!. To be honest if it wasn't free to go in the park as a resident at the Atlantis we probably wouldn't have gone in. I'm so glad it was because it was so much fun, ended up there three times we loved it.

Awesome fun for kids and adults. We arrived at 09.50 and they open at 10.00. It is my recommendation to come early since the place gets crowdy around and after noon.Club cars are available free of charge along the sidewalk next to the beach. Highly recommended and easy transportation. If you want someplace calm you can walk down to the beach and find a place under a palm tree.Upon arrival we got an awesome reception by a guy called Bashir? (Forgot the name but he handled order ID: 208718). He really knows how to serve and explained all the information we needed to know AND the information we didn't know we actually needed. Very stand up guy! Lots of kudos to him.There are rides for all categories of people. If you like adrenaline or like to chill there is a ride for you. I strongly advise you to invest in a waterproof-pouch for your smartphone (bought one for 110 AED/22 EUR). That way you can record and snap videos/photos of all the fun.Food and beverages are available on the premises. Although pricy it was worth it. A bagel, fries and soda for 68 AED. Very good taste and quality so it was definitely worth the money. Since you can't bring your own food I would advise you to plan on spending that kind of money for food.All in all we are very satisfied with our visit and we will definitely come back. I want to finish with some tiny detail room-for-improvement feedback:1. The massive queue for taxi at the end of the day was less funny but I understand if it is out of your control. I feel for the parents with tired kids wanting to get home. Since everything was awesome it wasn't a big deal for us.2. The animation for your armband when geting in and out of your locker shows an arm go back and forth when it actually should be up and down to scan the bar code. We got frustrated a few times but it was good that you had personel just around the corner to help.3. My friend is a bit of a fraidy cat and it would be good if there was a grading system on the rides. I.e. Easy, Medium, Hard, Extreme. :-)

Must do in Dubai for families!. We just got back from Dubai and set aside a whole day for Aquaventure and it was worth it! If anything, I felt we didn't have enough time!! Obviously being at the very end of the Palms, the taxi fare would be a lot but we were lucky in that our hotel offered a free shuttle to it's sister hotel in the Palms and we just got a taxi from there. We got the Entertainer Vouchers prior to getting there (from eBay) so it was Buy one Get one Free for the adults. It is very expensive to enter so try to get the vouchers. Take your own towels if you do not want to pay for hiring them. The lockers are situated right at the very beginning of the park which is really annoying if u need anything. We left valuables in there and took towels/sunblocks and sandals and kept on a lounger. The locker system is a bit fiddly at first and the change rooms are a bit small for the amount of people visiting the park. There is hot water in the showers and 2 hairdryers in the ladies.I'm a massive adrenaline junkie so loved every ride! There are two massive 'temples' or towers where all the rides are on. Most have height restrictions so not for little ones. But the kids section is more than adequate for them. The 'Leap of Faith' is the most daring slide and def worth it and the Shark attack tube ride where you can enjoy the sharks and rays. I went on every one and loved it! Yes you do have to wait a bit to get on the rides and it does get chilly waiting to get on and some of the rides are electronically controlled and it is health and safety so can't complain. Food is not as expensive as I imagined. There is a meal deal at the entrance when paying for tickets, which is worth it. Plus there is a beach as well. Can't go to Dubai without a visit to Atlantis Aquaventure :-)

Well crafted waterfun for kids. Coming from a nice resort hotel Aquaventure was a bit of a culture shock. There's a lot of people, lots of noise and lots of rides. The Leap of Faith is truly something for one with fear of heights. Wouldn't go a second time though, the resort pools are much nicer.

Best waterpark I've been to.... I've been to several waterparks in Europe and the US, but this one beats them all. They have some pretty extreme rides for adults, but also plenty of fun things for the less adventurous. The staff were all very friendly and liked to joke with the visitors. It was difficult to find seats where we could leave our towels, but other than that it was an amazing experience overall.

Must visit for Kids and Adults. We spent a whole day here. It is a great place for adults and kids alike. Just the joy of seeing grownups running around like kids to get on swimming rides. It was a very fun experience.

Try to get out without injuries. Atlantis promised a lot but didn't quite live up to the hype. Most of the rides were good fun and I picked a time of year when crowds were low which obviously helped.However be prepared, the slash surge rides don't come with a warning to sit up in the tube . It drops you down and if your over 6 foot like me slams your backside on the deck. I left with my turned purple. But that wasn't the worst. The poseidens revenge, a tube of terror. I got there and there was not one person waiting except a girl trying to get the Dutch courage to go. This should have been a warning, as no one goes on this ride more than once. This ride is a tube where rhe floor drops away. To make matters worse the scared girl pressed the button. After that all I felt was pain as I dropped foot first on free fall and smashed my ankle. As I winced in pain I was sandblasted by water in my face until the ride ended. 3 days later I still can't walk . Why this would be called amusement is beyond me, stick clear of this ride but enjoy the rest

Great for the family. Took my son there for the 1st time as he's almost 2 and he loved it.Beena few times over the years and the new rides are a great addition must try to be honest.Lazy river even good for little ones.If in Dubai check it out but use a voucher as loads around...

WOW !!!. We have been to a lot of waterparks in Florida and this blows them all out of the water - AMAZING, We only went on 2 rides as the rapids/lazy river took most of the day, really good fun, we went on a Sunday so it wasn't crazy busy either. The thing that I found most exceptional was the food , REALLY REALLY good and exceptional service , which I have to say is unheard of in most waterparks.The water[ark is attached to The Atlantis hotel and represented the hotel well , id love to stay here now , if the water park is this good imagine the hotel !! 10/10 !!

Hot Hot Hot!. What a great water park. We visited the water park in August which is probably not the ideal time of the year to go due to the heat. Make sure you drink plenty of water and wear lots of sunscreen. The park is lovely and clean. There are lots of different attractions. The slides are awesome.

One day in the park. When buying the Dolphin Bay Experience, the access to the waterpark is free. We had the dolphins in the morning and stayed at the park throughout the day. It was very packed and the only place we found was by booking a private tent (a secluded area with private sunbeds, chairs, shade and a "butler") which was on the other side of the park from where we wanted to be. The kids area was extremely packed and we could not get even one bed. Not a good place to visit with a small child. He would prefer a quieter hotel pool instead, I believe. Fot teenagers - this place must be heaven.
family fun day. what a great relaxing weekend. the kids loved the beach and slides. it's like two waterparks in one. the lines weren't long and we were there on a weekend.

Amazing waterpark - Probably one of the best in the world!. I absolutely loved Aquaventure. The rides were fun, everything is very clean and in perfect order and the staff ensures that everyone has a safe experience. I recommend to get there as soon as they open (10:00 AM) and spend the whole day, as it is plenty to do. If you book your tickets online, you can get them slightly cheaper than at the gate. I liked all the rides. Perhaps my least favorite were the 'rapids' as at times they were kind of slow. Overall an amazing place for both, kids and adults.
Must visit while in Dubai. So many different attractions for every taste and adrenaline level. Feeeding the sharks was very memorable.

Aquaventure. I haven't been since some of the new rides were installed, but it's a fabulous place. Let the teenagers go off and enjoy themselves whilst you chill out on the beach or just float around the lazy river. Great way to spend a day.

Cash sponge. Top tip- get a room in the hotel because for a few extra pounds you get the park entry. Take your own towels and walk to the far side of the park before you get changed because there is another changing room over there which is empty and new to some nice empty lagoons which form part of the lazy river. Otherwise you end up in the maddening crowds trying to get a deck chair. Awful.Food is expensive and they search your bags. If you stay in the hotel you can come and go as you please. The cost of food probably makes up for the extra cost in the room.Book your tickets the day before because you get a discount. Check groupon, they sometimes have offers. If you live here then emirates ID card gets you discount. Same with an EPC if you have one.Rides are good, the staff are excellent and seem to enjoy their jobs and always say hi and chat. As with most places in Dubai they are fantastic with kids.If your hotel is not on the palm, consider using the monorail which runs the length of the palm and takes you directly to the entrance. Otherwise it's a drive in bad traffic to a car park and shuttle buses anyway to get you to the same door.Make the effort to get there for opening time if you want your pick of seats to camp out.

The best Waterpark in the world. The biggest and the most fantastic service ever.... We visited the Waterpark today, spent there all day, the rides are best of the best, staff VERY professional (i had never ever experienced such professional staff in any waterpark)

rocking slides.............. fun & relax ..really a good place for everybody.a visit for every water lover.beautiful beach .However, the stores in the park are quite expensive, especially the sun screens, swim wear, towels, etc.

Fun, Fun and more fun!. We had an amazing time in the waterpark! Despite we are in our late 20s we were like kids! Running from slide to slide, there were not much of the waiting time for the attractions, although finding a spare chairs by the pool was a bit of a challenge! Overall great experience, but get there early so you can find a good spot your your things.

Dont miss!. We were with a 22 month old baby and couldn't spend too much time, but it was a great place to go to. She didn't really enjoy much (though they have an excellent kids area and slides), but its great for slightly older kids and adults.Wish we had booked in advance though as its quite expensive buying tickets on the spot and there were discounts for advance purchases. Do carry your towels (as you get charged extra otherwise) and swimming gear. Very neat and well maintained. The slides were fantastic, especially Leap of Faith.. did it twice.Even shark attack, where you feel like you're swimming in the sea was a fantastic experience.Would have liked to spend more time and will definitely want to come back!
Wet and wild. Loved this, and as it was complimentary with our stay at the Atlantis we went everyday. It was not too busy and plenty of room for all.

Not to be missed!. Started the day with Dolphin Encounter and are so glad we did. We got to kiss, hug, dance & play with Hilma a 12 year old female who we discovered at the end of our experience was totally blind so all training was done by sound & touch. The session was informative & we really felt that the dolphins were incredibly well cared for & happy.The watermark was also fabulous. We didn't get to all of the rides but those that we did experience were excellent and good for adrenaline junkies! The lazy river, rapid etc we're great fun too.Every single member of staff was courteous & helpful and we felt very well looked after.We wouldn't hesitate to recommend the park and dolphin encounter and can't wait to come back

Fun and relax. Admission was included in our "Dolphin swim" ticket. There is fun for the whole family. Very well organised, very well kept. There are lockers available. Attractions for kids and not so young kids. You can have lots of fun or just relax in a beautiful setting. There are life guards all over the place. Lots of possibilities for food and drinks. From the beach there are very nice views of the Dubai skyline.

Pricey but worthwhile!. We were 2 families with three year old kids and had a great time at the best waterpark we have ever been to .. The rides are just incredible from the most basic to the most nerve wrecking ones! the lazy river is great for passing time and floating around at leisure. MAKE SURE you carry your swimming gear as we made the mistake of not carrying it and paid a fortune to buy it from the shops there.

leap of faith Atlantis Dubai. We have just been to Dubai , fantastic trip. Went to Atlantis waterpark for the day March 2014.Cost was 250 Dirham per adult or $85 NZHad seen videos of Leap of Faith and psyched myself for it.Wanted to do it. Plucked up courage and did the ride..wow fast and mind blowing exhilarating. Enjoyed it so much I did it again!It does take courage and not for everyone but give it a go !!

A great day out!. We spent a full day at Aquaventure and it was great! We sunbathed on the white sandy beach and then cooled off in the pools as well as braving the slides and rapids! We got the Platinum package which included towels, lockers, lunch and all day soft drinks as well as entrance to the Aquarium.A great day out with something for everyone!

Water water everywhere in a Desert!. Awesome is the only word, one look and you can't even imagine that this park has so many scintillating rides. As i was staying there I went there 2 days to have extra fun!!!Worth a visit for every water lover. Esp - Poseidons revenge - Dare to do it and you then understand the power of gravity!!The rapids and torrents spread across the entire park is a good way to relax and luge around the waters all day!!

Great experience. We enjoyed all the rides. Plan for the whole day. The leap of faith (in the Tower of Neptune) and the Poseidon revenge (in Tower of Poseidon) are a must do for the adrenaline junkies. Note these are not for the faint hearted.

We had a great family day...... What a great waterpark. We arrived straight from dolphin bay and on first glance there doesnt appear to be many rides because the park is so well designed. But we spent a whole day at the park and just managed to get around everything! My son is a bit of wild child and was amazed at one of the rides which he says out weighs the disney rides! The rapids link most rides up so you can even use them as transport round the park! Towels are provided - obviously a 5* park. We had a fabulous day and highly recommend. If you go to dolphin bay you get park entry for free.

greatest of water park. leap of faith and tower of poseidon makes every dare devil shiver.did all the rides multiple times and got the best of thrill.one should go @ 10 am / 4 pm to avoid sun burns.zip lining was not up-to mark as compared to casela bird park ,mauritius.overall a great place.
kid birthday. its was my childs birthday so we booked it at atlantis and it was great we got a private cabana and access to the watermark wow it was her best birthday

We had a nice time.... My daughter really enjoyed the park, but personally we had a great time. However, the stores in the park are quite expensive, especially the sun screens, swim wear, towels, etc. Its worth to carry your own. Be sure, you are in store for a great time...

Fantastic Day out!!!. As 2 very 'big' kids we loved this place! We had a fantastic day and was really impressed at the variety of rides. We also loved the fact that we pretty much spent the day going from ride to ride in a double ring together. We liked the fact that lots of slides joined up with others and we didn't need to get out and start queuing again.rides). It wasn't long ago we were in Florida and did 2 of the big waterparks - this is something Our only complaint would be the lack of park maps and signage (inc descriptions of the different Dubai could learn from. We saw a number of lost children (which wasn't surprising based on this) however, from the incidents we saw the staff handled the situations extremely well.It's not a cheap day out but check out ebay before you go to buy a 'buy one get one free' voucher - it cost us £12 but when it costs £35 to get in and does save some money. The guy we used delivered the vouchers to our hotel - great service.If you have children this is a must day out! If we go back we will def look into swimming with dolphins - looked like a much better quality experience than that in Florida that our friends have done and out us off doing when we went there. Although we haven't done it, if you are considering it, this might be the best place to do it from what we saw.

Nice afternoon. Great place to visit and relax. A lot of rides if you enjoye them, basic food. We purchased tickets a day in advance, 130aed cheaper per 2 persons. A lot of sunbeads at the beach. Great fun swimming with sharks!

check the kids heights. This place has the best lazy river ever, huge and takes a while to get round but really is not a lazy river at all! rapids and waves and lots of places to get off for flume rides. If you have a kid that is less than 120cm then beware they are very strict on height restrictions and it applies to all of the flume rides. My little one was stopped a couple of times as she is 119cm, no exceptions. We got round this by getting her to jump up and down shouting "again again again" she is a good swimmer so we were unconcerned about 1cm but fair play to them they have got rules.

Water heaven. Fantastic water rides and features,beautiful gardens and beach,very spacious,lots of loungers and tubes to ride with.different rides to suit any age and speed.lovely area for kids,clean washroms and lockers.use vouchers for money saving.go for the full day.food is good,very basic

hilarious fun! free if u stay in atlantis hotel!. 3rd visit, new rides! I didnt get any braver and have bruises to proove what a great day had here. Its so clean and well done, makes florida waterparks seem so old and grubby! Great time of year to go in feb although water v.cold, but summer is just too hot! Fab time had by all,new family ride is a gem! Terrifying delightful !

Aquaventure waterpark. Our eight year old and three year old loved this water park, there's something here for everyone. Can't speak more highly of all the life guards around the park, seem to have eyes in the back of their heads!! Get there by opening time as you need all day. We were there in January so no long queues and plenty of seats. The low point is your can't take any food into the park and food and drink to buy in there is REALLY expensive...so be warned take plenty of cash!!! Would love to go again :)

Water Fun in Dubai. Excellent facility especially when traveling with kids, facility has a variety of water sport you can expect in a water, the facility is well designed, clean and well looked after..
Wicked experience. Briliant. Stayed in atlantis so was a must for me to go and it was a hell of an experience. was there for like 7 hours also went swimming in dolphin bay. loved it

RATHER ORDINARY. My party traveled to Wild Wadi only to find it closed for the day (no explanation). Back in the taxi to Atlantis and Aquaventure. Just buying the (very expensive) entry tickets was an ordeal--long, slow-moving line. I did not time the wait in line precisely, but it was close to 45 minutes.Inside at last! Locker rooms were spacious and clean. Strangely, though, no "towel station" near the locker rooms. Finally found a sign directing us to towels--and then beach chairs. The park is not that large; hence, long lines. Aside from the "big slide", the chief attraction is the raft (tube) ride--a meandering stream through the park and rather dull in comparison to other water parks we have visited. All-in-all, a good day, not a great day. Admittedly, the long wait to get to the ticket counter colored my mood--not to mention the cost of entry (but, after all, this is Dubai!)
just laze around. my kids just loved it. there are not a lot of rides so you are not like running here and there or standing on long queues.
Perfect day. We had a perfect day spent at the waterpark. It was really comfortable for us, cause we spent our evening in the hotel right next to the park :)

A day well spent. Aquaventure waterpark at Atlantis is enjoyable provided that you have the heart to try all the rides and not skip any. The park opens in the early hours and closes at 6.15pm. So, make sure that you reach well in time to enjoy the rides at leisure. The park is far. So, the travel has to be a combination of metro and taxi.You can book the tickets online to save up on a few dirhams. If you have seen better aquariums, dont bother to buy a combo ticket as it is nothing extraordinary.Other charges are as follows: Towel Rental: 30, Locker (Small) Rental 40, Locker (Large) Rental 75, Towel and Small Locker Combo 50. The small locker has a bare minimum storage so make sure you dont carry too much stuff.There are about 10 rides divided into two towers - Tower of Poseidon (about 4 rides) & Tower of Neptune (about 6 rides). All of the rides are great fun - seem to be safe and there is staff all over the park to assist you. The revenge of the Poseidon and the Leap of Faith were the two rides that had a few takers but make sure you do those even if you are scared as they are both an experience in itself, especially the Leap of Faith.All in all, great fun

Very good rides. Some bit expensive. It was a good visit to this aquapark with multiple rides which many of it where exciting. This is definitely better than wild wady aquapark. The main disadvantage is that its price is expensive 225 AED and the locker is for 40 AED. Do not book for the aquarium. You can see a good aquarium inside Dubai mall for free.
Very good !. Worth a visit. Comparable price to the Wild Wadi but much better in our view with more rides and nicer atmosphere.

Get there early to avoid the queues. My wife and I planned to spend the whole day but ended up spending half a day as we got there early at 10am. I got on all the rides without queuing, went round the lazy river and spend time lying down pool side until around 1pm and that was good enough for me. It did get busier by midday and didn't fancy staying the rest of the day to queue for the rides. Its worth if you have a 2 for 1 voucher or if your staying at the resort. Glad I went but wouldn't feel the need to there again
ok - not great value for money. £50 each including for my 8-year old. Was ok but wouldn't go again for that kind of money. Got bored after a couple of hours

Best day!!!. Had so much fun! Four adults running round like kids! Laughed so much and didn't want to leave! Spent the whole day here, 11am until about 6pm.Advise to visitors, take your own water as it's costly to purchase. Food in General was also pricey, although the quality seemed generally good.

For Older Kids. The slides were awesome and my 8 year old loved the shark attack, the surge and the rapidsMy six year old spent the entire time in the kids area and loved every minute (we had to literally drag her out to go home!!!!)
Fun for the kids.... Kids loved it, some good slides & large areas for younger children but but be prepared for expensive pricing & plastic food! A bit like Butlins with more sunshine....

Good fun. We spent most of our holiday time here at the aqua park. We liked the fact that they took health & safety to the heart and had life guard posted every few feet all along the route of the water park and the pools. That was really reassuring given our youngest (10 years old) was not a strong swimmer and felt comforted that help can be at hand if she got into any difficulty. It is very popular attraction so do try to get a pool side sun bed early as you can and the fact that many people selfishly leave there belongings on sun bed (to reserve the spots) all day even when they left for lunch or to the beach, was the downside.
fantastic water park. Fun for all the family, everything you will expect from a water park and more...will definetly be visiting again
Lazy river ride is a must. Good day out, although finding a sun lounger can be a bit hard to come by if you do not get their early
Wow. We all loved this. Our four daughters aged from 9 to 22 also loved every minute of it. We were there from opening to close. It was great.

A fantastic day. This is a top class attraction, very clean and tidy the life guards are fantastic helpful and cheerful they interact well with the kids which is nice. Good choice of rides and types to suit all ages and levels of bravery! Food was good and not overly expensive.

lots of fun!. We visited the waterpark following our Dolphin Experience. It was a lovely way to spend the day in luxury, with huge fluffy towels and comfy sun loungers. Not forgetting the fun of the rapids - although we thought it was just a simple lazy river! The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful, and encouraging if you weren't sure about going on certain slides!

Just go!. Went with my 13 year old and found my inner child again! Tried everything she did ( except the terrifying Leap of Faith, which she said was fantastic) and enjoyed every bit of it. Lazy River with rapids great fun, water really warm. Gets chilly in Feb around 4 so go early, opens at 10, you'll get 4to 5 hours of great fun. Only downside for us was the food, burgers poor quality, and choice just fast food. But I'd go again in a flash, we've been to Florida Disney and Universal water parks, this is right up there.

byot (bring your own towels!). or pay 30 dh for each. and 75 dh for a big locker. and no outside food allowed, they do check. deck chairs run out seriously quickly, so be early and find yourself a base. rides were fun enough though.

Superb waterpark. I was not sure whether to visit here or Wild Wadi so ended up visiting both. This was better, hands down!!!Lots of slides, awsome rapids which can get you around the park and stunning views of Burj Al Arab and Jumeirah beach. Great food choices, plenty of space for sunbathing and enough rides to keep you amused all day.Im not sure whether we got given an old map but there was a whole part of the park not showing which we found next to Dolphin Bay with more slides... be warned one of these is not for the faint hearted!!!i had booked to swim with dolphins and so entry to the park was included in the package.... if you have always wanted to swim with dolphins definitely head to Dolphin Bay. One of the best days I had in Dubai and I will be back!

wet but warm. Free admission if you stay in Atlantis. Great rides for all ages.Staff very friendly. Never seen so many lifeguards, every few yards. Vey clean. Lots of snacks available for purchase & prices not too bad.With a disability I was somewhat limited .Plenty sunbeds.If you stay in town there is a monorail service to the door.
Too many outsiders. As guests of the Atlantis Hotel there seemed to be no priority given. We had free access to the park but still had to pay for a locker. RIdes were very good.

Amazing location and superb Waterpark..... . One of the best waterparks visited..... Pros... Cumulative rides avoid running here and there.... Huge complex with private beach...... Friendly staff..... Terrific rides... Leap of faith.. Shark attack... Posiedon revenge.... Anaconda etc.......
Fun. The aqua-venture is really thrilling experience to enjoy with friends and family some really amazing rides to have fun and beautiful beach to relax

Needs more for smaller children. There were some great water rides but the fact that my 5 year old daughter could not get on many rides meant she didn't have as good a time. The fact we still had to pay over 200AED for her was not good. The meal deal was excellent value though and it was good value for older guests

We'll run and spacious.. Excellent facilities here enclosed in a large park, lots of space to roam around. Lazy River and Rapids huge, all the rides involving inflatables the best ones. Not so great tube rides without inflatables. Food and refreshments expensive.

Superb Water park in Atlantis!!. its a superb place for kids and adults who love water..You can spend 5-6 hours here..it has a number of slides for kids and adults, big pool, lake etc.it is a bit expensive but worth visiting once..you can get the tickets from Atlantis main entrance..

A relaxing afternoon. Included in the Dolphin Bay experience and a nice way to spend the afternoon. Quite a relaxing few hours and we advise getting a taxi to/from the Atlantis resort as the Metro train was 3 times the price of a cab!!

Ok for Dubai, but nothing special if you're a waterpark enthusiast. The best part about Aquaventures is the slide that ends in the fish tank. You're in an enclosed see-through tube and slowly float to the end of the underwater tunnel, all the while enjoying the view of the fish swimming around you. I've never experienced anything like it! Otherwise the slides offer nothing above and beyond what you would see in other water parks, even in Wild Wadi which is a short ten minute drive away.

Best Place in Dubai !!!. Aquaventure water park deserves an entire Day .... This is the best place in Dubai. Our little one enjoyed this park so much. Loads of Rides, a private Beach, Kids Play area with water cannons.Best Rides - Lazy River with Rapids, Leap of Faith (Not for the Light hearted), Shark Attack.The best ride of all is where you slide through an Underwater tunnel filled with exotic Fish.If you are staying at the Atlantis, nothing like it, but if you aren't, still this park is not to be missed. The sheer magnanimity of that place is awesome. Tip : Be there early and get to the rides straight away. Post Lunch is a good time to avoid queues at the Bigger rides.Carry Large towels. Worth every penny spent.

Great way to spend a day…or more. We had unlimited access to the Aquaventure Waterpark with our Imperial Club room at the Atlantis resort. We enjoyed the lazy river that took you all around the park. We ended up calling it the crazy river because every so often you got to take a short ride through rapids. There was also other routes that would take your tube down a water slide or through a wave river experience.There is something for everyone.
Amazing Experience. We enjoyed all the rides at the park, all the rides are a must try. The most scary was the slide which passes through the shark chamber.
excellent. loved it. we are a middle aged couple but there is lots to do at the water park. \we spent all day there and it was one of the best days out.

Amazing place with plenty to do. Very clean
Plenty of restaurants
Water slides
Beach
Locker room on site and towels provided
For adults and children

Amazing!. been there 2 times with my kids (4 and 7 years old) and, my relative who is 18 years old, and we all had a wonderful time! there are lots of amazing rides for all ages!the staff is friendly and, make each ride much more fun!highly recommended!

Not only for children!!. Our second visit to Aquaventure and again enjoyed it thoroughly, though this time with older son aged 18 (for his birthday) instead of the 11 yr old (who went first time and was gutted to not be going again)The Park was fairly empty most days until after lunchtime which was a bonus for us as queues were non-existant. All the remembered rides are still there plus a couple of new ones which were scary and thrilling to this 50 yr old mummy and her teenage son. We had several goes however !Aquaventure works best and easiest if you are staying at The Atlantis (as you have immediate and free access)but waiting in line for admission tickets etc did not seem much of an inconvenience to those who had to and the cost seemed a worthwhile expense for a whole day if you were a casual visitor.The entire place is very clean, with plentiful facilities and sunloungers, many eateries and the abundance of Lifeguards ( who work in and out of the water) is comfortingI defy anyone of reasonable age who is game for a Waterpark day to not enjoy this place.

Good fun but expensive and looking dated!. This was our second visit the last was in 2011.It was still as much fun but the £200 for 2 adults 1 child and the taxi journey was a bit much!The place it's self looked a bit worn. The towels were a bit thread bare and the sunbeds looked dirty and mouldy. They were clean but did not look good. The toilets by the end of the day were also not good. Food was ok but expensive. Probably wont go again.

Brillant Water Park but the Non Helpful Staff. The Water Park is brilliantly built . Its neat and clean . But the Staff is Non Cooperative and Rude. We were staying at the Atlantis , Palm but still service is an issue here.On the first day my younger daughter 3 yr old was playing at the Childrens Splash Pool . Around 4 pm in the evening she came running out of the water that she was feeling cold. I quickly wrapped a bath robe around her. I also requested a guy standing near the lounge chairs to get me a towel as my little one shivering. To my utter horror he completely refused. So service is a big no no.Also Its overcommercialised and everything is costly here.

A great day out!. The Atlantis Palm Hotel's waterpark, - well, I have to say I've been to a few waterparks but this was definitely one to top the lot. We decided to start off gently on a 'lazy river' type ride, where you sit in a huge rubber ring and gently follow the 'river' through the park. We found a two person ring and found one of the many entrances to the river. The next minute, our rubber ring is cajoled onto a conveyor belt, going uphill! Mmmm, can you see where this is going?! After a slow climb, we reached the peak, and lucky me sat at the front had a bird's eye view of what was to come, ... Yip a huge whoosh down and we were off, twisting, turning, and then having been plunged into pitch black continued twisting and turning, whilst gripping on screaming at the top of our lungs - not quite the sedate and gentle start to the waterpark, - but great bloody fun! We the continued on the not so lazy river, enjoying the various rapids and other rides, within the overall ride. More rides, one of which took us though a clear Perspex tube in a massive aquarium - I loved it. We did decide to skip the 'Leap of Faith' pretty much as it sounds - crazy fools push themselves of the edge of an almost vertical drop of a slide, where you reach speeds up to 60kph!! We did however, brave it and give all the others a go, - I don't think we've screamed or laughed so much. A great day out, for adults and kids alike.
soooooo much fun!!!. would definitely recommend going to aquaaventure - we had so much fun on the rides and the lazy river is very peaceful.
fun n enjoyable. its a really nice place to have fun with families and friend . life guards are really helpful and friendly awesome ride . beach access is the most nicer part of aquaventure .

Wow On top of Dolphins. This was the best experience and also the most expensive one in Dubai but if it suits your pocket a must Do if not Dolphin even Aquaventure was a nice day spent. Readers please view the Combo packs available online Lost Chamber+ Aquaventure / Aqua+ Dolphin / Lost+ Aqua + Dolhin gets cheaper if you book in advance online so for those who can please make use of it.
Super rides ... though there could be a few more. Poseidon's Revenge, Leap of Faith are great rides. Zoomerango and Aquaconda are good too.. Well organised. Reasonably good eating options too

So much fun!. Aqua venture is the best waterpark I have ever been to. As a pair of 30 year olds my wife and I came here for all the thrill rides... And we where not let down. There is a wide variety of super fun, super fast thrill rides and even a speed slide that goes through an aquarium. If your coming with children there is also a wide variety of more tame slides for the kids a huge wave pool and also a big circuit of rapids you float around Ina tube to pretty much every part of the park. If ur after a day of fun whether it be as a family or as a thrill seeking couple, then you must come to Aquaventure!

best water park in middle east. the No. 1 water park in the Middle East and Europe, over flowing with 42 fun-filled acres for all ages. Experience adrenaline pumping waterslides that catapult you through shark filled lagoons, scream through the planet’s largest slide or race down the world’s first dual slide within a slide. Fly high on the longest zip line circuit in the Middle East. Or just relax on our private beach surrounded by lush tropical landscapes. Plus younger children will love Splashers a play area designed just for them

Atlantis Adventure Park. had a great day, very well organised and laid out well, lazy river goes on forever, with lots of rapid rides, all taking you to seperate pools, the rides are exhilirating, with little kids adventure area, easy access tot he beach with shuttle taxis backwards and forwards to the hotel

Excellent day out. Kids and adults will both enjoy Aquaventure. Lots of different slides and activities. The adults seemed to be just drifting around in rubber rings while the kids went on the rides! I would like to say that the staff here were amazing with kids. I saw them comfort children who were too scared at the top of slides etc and it was fantastic to see.

Better suited for grown ups. This waterpark is kinda different of what I've used to. There are no usual pools here, just lot and lot of rivers where you float around with a air-filled tube. Very relaxing, some of the rivers offer wild rides too. Make note that the place closes when the sun sets, go in early. Place can be costly, but I think it was worth it.

Great place for fun. ME and kids enjoyed our visit to water park, it is great and the games there are wonderful. i am planning to visit it again but not in winter because the weather was very cold for us

Excellent.......Good fun for childrens. We had a great afternoon at the Waterpark. Lucky it was quiet as it was January so we didn't have to queue to go on any of the slides. We went in most of them more than once. Fantastic experience..........Out of the box experience @ Atlantis......

Excellent!. I had been to Wild Wadi on a previous trip to Dubai and decided to try Aquaventure this time instead. I have to say I 100% think that Aquaventure is better - there is plenty of rides, plenty of sun loungers, and even a beach for you to relax on. It is somewhere you can easily spend your whole day relaxing in the sun and having fun on the slides. Brilliant day out!
Amazing. The Aquaventure Waterpark is an amazing place to enjoy your summer vacation in Dubai. Will definitely visit again!
Clean, friendly, loads to do. This park was attached to our hotel and my kids did not want to leave! Plenty for all ages and well looked after. Also attached to the beach if you prefer to sit there.

Great Fun. We had a great afternoon at the Waterpark. Lucky it was quiet as it was January so we didn't have to queue to go on any of the slides. We went in most of them more than once. The best was a big donut style ring for about 8 people the slide was fab I've never screamed so much!! We were staying at the Atlantis so going into the park was included. I'm not sure if I'd like to pay to go in as I believe it's not cheap and there's not enough to keep you there all day! Still we had so much fun even though it was freezing cold!

Awesome day out. Spent a great day here. Went nice and early to beat the crowds which really started to build up about lunchtime. Lots of great ride / slides for grown ups. Not so much for little ones though. Make sure you cover both the main zones and do all the rides. Some will scare you witless ! But well worth it all of them. Lots of places to stop and recover with drinks, snacks, ice cream etc and plenty of spaces to lounge round in the sun or shaded areas. We took the metro to the palm which gave great views on the way in takes you right in. Watch out if you want to eat inside at the Atlantis - insanely expensive even for Dubai. We ended up sharing a burger and it was £10 ! But all in all a fab day out.
More than enough to keep you entertained for a day. We combined this with Dolphin Bay. Good mixture of rides and lovely location at the Atlantis which is an experience in itself.

Some great rides but limited. It is a nice waterpark but i find it had limited rides. The ones that were there were actually great and very thrilling! Once more as everything in the Atlantis resort, they just try to milk money from everything from lockers to photos.
A great day. We went to the water park two days and I really enjoyed the slopes and the attractions. There is possible to shower and change and lock things in there.

fun. we went with our friends and we really had fun here. Do try the leap of faith. it's scary but quite fun. Also don't forget to try the games in the new tower at the other side of the park. The guides can help you find the entrance.

Great Value, NO LINES, NO WAITING, GREAT FUN!!. The water rides had no waiting, very fun!! All of the perpetual wave rides were so much fun that I didn't want to leave, and I'm not young!! Bring the children and stay the entire day!!

The best water park in the Middle East. Having been to a few water parks in Australia and the USA we decided to hit the Atlantis as it looked great in the brochures.Well this is one place that lives up to the brochures and more.1/ its very clean.2/ its very safe.3/ the staff were friendly and helpful4/ the rides were a lot of fun and there was a great mixture of extreme and softer rides to suit all types

Bigger and better than most. Although on the expensive side especially if you taking a few people, it offers alot of water slides for the price. The slide that goes through the shark pool , the leap of faith which is extremely high, some of the slides that push you upwards in a tube, the river rapids and torrents are all amazing. The views from the leap of faith are stunning so take your camera up there if it's water proof. The queues were quick when we went but allow several minutes to get back to the starting point as most slides end up in the river and take you on a ride to the end. The dolphin experience is ridiculously overpriced so we skipped it. The aquarium inside the Atlantis hotel is not really worth paying to see - give it a miss if you have seen some decent aquariums before.

Brilliant. We had a great time here and would highly recommend the leap of faith!!Make sure you keep topping up on the suntan lotion as going in and out of the water you can easily forget how hot it is and end up with very red shoulders!!

Fun day!. The waterpark is not that big and closes early, 5pm or 5:30pm. But, we had a fun afternoon in the park. My kids really enjoyed the rides and the pool. Beach area is nice and with the view of Burj Al Arab, Burj Khalifa and the skyline. Overall, it was a really fun day!
Swim with dolphins!. It was brilliant! Get up close with the dolphins and then you have the water park to round up your day. There are some pretty amazing rides.

Kids & Parents Day Out. Aquaventure gives very relaxing yet exciting time. Starting from the giant 3 buckets down-pouring every 3-4 minutes will start the mood, followed by "LEAP OF FAITH" from Walls of Neptune will pump the extreme adrenaline into even the most fearless souls. The tube rides will make you to repeat it without counting. Only your physical condition will remind you of returning from such a wonderful place.

Small, But Fun!. My husband and I stayed at Atlantis and had free admission to the waterpark as part of our hotel package. We wanted to spend a day in the sun at Aquaventure.There is a small selection of slides. I am not sure about right now, but when we were there they had almost 1/4 of the park under construction for some bigger attractions to be built. I wish they were open while we were there!Food is typical theme park junk and, if there are no lines, you could finish all the rides in the park in an hour like we did!The staff was great and the park itself was clean, so no complaints there! If I was the type of person to want to lounge in the sun for the day, this would have definitely been the place to do it!TIP: If you are staying at the hotel, they let you in the park earlier than those who are just visiting for the day!

somewhere to relax. the water park has been located inside the atlantis hotel in dubai.we didnt stayed at hotel but the lobby and decorations all apply the name atlantis while all have traces of water and marines.anyhow,we just used the water park here,as we had heared that it is newer and much more better than the wild wady park(we didnt experience the other,but did according to our hearings).we used the swimming pool which was ok with some turns in the ways which lead you to other turns for fun. other facilities like bar for drinks was available. you could rest there and have fun,and if not fear,use the high water slides for enjoyement.even there is shop that you can buy whatever you need for swimming like sweamwear,slippers,etc. if you need.we bought one pair of slippers but it was too much expensive for our money,but seemed ok for dollar users.in general,it was ok,and if you have time,you can go to atlantis hotel and enjoy the great view of the PERSIAN GULF at it's entrance, and many other facilities and games like beautiful aquarium,pools,etc. as well. enjoy it!!!
Excellent attraction specially for kids. the only issue is that you need to be 1m20 tall at least for all attractions (save for the kids corner)

Had awesome moments....,. This is the best waterpark I have ever seen in my life.....it has the slides which anybody could not think of......All our family from small kids to adults had fun here and enjoyed a lot

Boring!. Hardly any rides.... the rides that are there are ok! The slide off the side of the Atlantis was an excellent ride - good virtual drop and you slide through a tunnel of sharks and fish (you cant see it very well as you're going so fast). The refresments are ok but we ended up leaving really soon after arriving - theres just not enough rides and the ones that are there aren't life changing.

Fun day out.. I loved this water park. It isn't cheap, but it was great fun. In a nice location with good views. A good selection of rides and a nice beach area. I went in November on a week day and there were barely any queues.

the water park on the palm. I didn't like this water park it was very expensive, very over crowded, so over crowded I was concerned about my children, there was no space to relax, very few water rides, food was ok,could not find my way off the lazy river, it is an accident waiting to happen.

3 visits and I still enjoy. Visited Aquaventure before Christmas to check out the new rides and they were fantastic fun. I thoroughly recommend it. My only negative on this visit was the pesky kids!!! I normally travel out of school holiday season so in previous visits I have the pleasure of going on all the rides/slides without having to queue.
Fantastic. Great rides and lots to do. Took around 2 hours to get around, go early avoid queues. Had a really fantastic day here. Lots of beach loungers to relax after all the slides

Great fun. Had a fabulous time here, I went to the most scary to start - an almost vertical slide which then went through an aqaurian - for those who could be brave enough to open their eyes! then dunked into the swimming pool to exit - brilliant. Lots more fun activities then finished the day calmly sitting on the beach watching the Dubai skyline, whicj even with all its high rises, is very pretty

Brilliant day out. Aquaventure is a brilliant water park. A great variety of slides and park layout allows for a full day of fun and excitement. Downside is that the place gets very busy and food offers can be overpriced. This park is ideal for friends or even fun dates. Great overall experience.

Fun!. I never got to visit when I was living in Dubai and I decided to be a tourist on this trip. So, my friend and I used her Entertainer voucher so it was 2 for 1. It was quite a busy resort but the beach was quiet so we soaked some rays before going on the rides. The water is not that clean though so I refrained from swimming. The rides were fun and we almost stayed till closing. My friend lost her 'Argo' movie hat though after it flew away on one of the rides. No one returned it to lost and found. Shame.

so many attractions!. It is one of the best Aquapark where I have been. There are 2 sections (Tower of Neptune and Tower of Poseidon). Top attractions are The Leap of Faith (no queue) in Tower of Neptune and Slitherine, Zoomerango and Poseidon’s Revenge (limited queue) in Tower of Poseidon.Remember to bring only slippers and swimming costume (but you can buy there). Towel is provided (renting) by park
Fun time. Really enjoyed the water park. Some great exciting slides. Best one is the Revenge where the floor drops from under neath you and you take a great plunge.

overpriced and rammed with visitors. The lazy river was good, but the sheer number of visitors made this a less than pleasurable experience.Take your own food too, else bankruptcy may be making a call. We went to Dreamland last year, and although it was an hour away from the centre of Dubai, it seemed a much better time, with perhaps more rides for younger kids.....

Real good fun. We were told that Jan is not agreat time to visit this park. But thats wrong. Its awesome with great rides lots of variety and my kids aged 10 and 12 loved each one of them. I would love to go again on it. Some of the rides are so much fun that we went 2 times on each of them . Keep it up.
Superb Enjoyment. A very good & beautiful place admist the Arabian Sea. A well designed water park with a number of rides to enjoy with full family. Even a full day is not enough to fully explore.

Better than butlines lol. with the Dubai voucher book (two for one) this was great value. lots to do, great location and decent facilities. Taxi about 29 dhm each way to Mall of Emirates Barsha area. Not such good value without the voucher book (approx 45gbp per head not including towel and locker hire)

Dissapointed doesnt meet expectations. I dont know if its because of the link to the 5* resort next door but we really were disappointed with this water park. First of all get some signage at the front - our driver dropped us off at what looked like a Chinese restaurant, it took us 5 minutes to realise this was where we went in! No directional signage whatsoever so we ambled through a Mall and eventually fell across the entrance to the water park. We asked meeter and greeter where to pick up our pre booked tickets and were ushered into a queue which was longer than the queue for buy your tickets on the day - brilliant so the fact we were organised and allowed the company to budget takings for the day was being penalised! Then we discover after 25mins queuing that we are in fact in the wrong queue - perfect and got sent somewhere else - cut a long story short it takes over an hour to get through the gate. Then we head to the changing rooms - now i am all for technology, i love my ipad, my mobile that takes pictures etc.. but computer controlled lockers where there are no instructions and only cleaners that speak the one language is a recipe for disaster and it was. So then we go out to the water and try to find a place to base camp from - and given this is January im assuming we can find at least a single sun lounger from which to stroll without the accompaniment of bags/ sandels /sunglasses etc.. apparently no we are relegated to a bolder at the end of a walkway from which to perch and store our things. We had lunch, it was ok the usual inflated prices you would expect but it was tasty so that was something, then we headed for the beach. Now i am not sure if because of the hype made around the palm or Atlantis itself if i was expecting a mirage of beauty or panacea itself but it reminded me more of Watford Gap services - the monorail kind of gives it that industrial logistical edge! Put it this way i would be gutted if my 12K a week room at the Atlantis looked out on that! So do i have anything positive to say... my thumbs up start & end here - there are plenty of lifeguards this is one thing they get right - you can be sure if you're little cherubs wander off/get into difficulty/act up they will be seen, they will be seen quickly and things will be ok with the world! Other than that i would say stay by your pool or try Wild Wadi!

NIce but overpriced!. Nice waterpark. Slides/rides were good, park was very clean & service was very good, but I think after visiting the Yas Waterworld in Abu Dhabi a few days earlier we were not so impressed with this 1. Even the kids preferred Yas Waterworld.

Great Park but Overpriced and Unorganised. We visited Aquaventure, Atlantis on the 5th of January 2014, having purchased tickets online. We arrived by car and parked at Dolphin Bay Parking, which requires a Shuttle Bus to actually take you to the entrance. The parking is 25AED, unless you get your parking ticket stamped once you've spent over 150AED in food/beverages - what a rip off! While we were easily over the 150AED spending requirement (prices for food/beverages are very high!), we were at a water park and weren't looking to carry around a parking ticket all day. For the price you pay for entry, this is a rather ridiculous addition.Having purchased pre-paid tickets, we expected entry to be quick and hassle-free. Not so. We queued for over 45 minutes (we would've been faster in the General Admission queue), and the staff behind the counters were incredibly slow and unhelpful. As a previous reviewer mentions, it was CHAOS. The park was nowhere near capacity and still, the entrance was chaos!The slides were great fun, queues for each slide weren't bad at all and staff here were very friendly. Once you're inside the park, everything works well: there are shuttle buses to take you around, many of the slides actually have lifts which take you to the top inside your tube. The highlight for me was "Shark Attack," a slide in the dark which ends inside an inner tube in a shark tank. Amazing!Overall, a great day out despite the entry/parking hassle, albeit a very overpriced one. There were 4 of us, and we spent almost 400AED just on food (we had 3 lunch sandwiches, and 3 fro-yo's combined). A great day out.

Fun all the way. We a family of 4 went to Aquaventure in December. It was a great place and the kids and ourselves had a lot of fun.We reached the park the 1st thing as it opened and were there till 4 p.m. The slides were great and so were the family rides in the tubes.Did the leap of faith and but scariest was the Free Fall called Poseidons revenge.Expensive but fun place to be at. Use the Entertainment vouchers.

Bad experience. We visited the park on the 30th Dec at a peak time and overall the experience was a nightmare. Entry was total chaos there was no control over the crowds and very few staff trying to help it was just a mad crush with people jumping queues and tempers getting very frayed. Once inside there wash't enough beds so people were using grass verges etc. The food outlets had massive queues and the quality was terrible. I've given a 2 as the rides were good albeit a lot of waiting. I'm sure at less busy times the park would be good but avoid during peak times.

Potential to be better. This attraction looked good from research. The highlights of this park were the rides which traveled through the shark pools as the view was awesome. The return journey was automated which negated the need to lug around the heavy tubes. The rapid river adventure was high quality and was lots of fun as it had many options to choose from. Entry was overpriced and small lockers to store gear were also quite expensive. From the lockers to the rides was a considerable distance and due to the Dubai heat, shoes are recommended for this as the pavement becomes scorching. It was good to see that plans were underway to extend the park as what was on offer was limited. Be aware that access by public transport combines Metro and taxi as this attraction is not in close proximity to other attractions.

Loved every minute. We booked into the hotel so that we could spend minimum 2 days at the Waterpark. We are waterpark fans and this has been the best waterpark we ever visited with amazing rides. We loved all the rides and although it was chilly on the days we visited we stayed as long as we could and did not waste a minute. Highly recommended if you are a waterpark fan!
No relax at all. Long queues, short attractions. I strongly recommend to buy ticket over the internet. But you still have to pay 40dhs for the locker at the entrance:-(

to feel like kids again. great experience and something that you want to go back and do it again and again, especially the rides that you upwards and the leap of faith are something to remember, the only down point is that it is addictive you end up going back to the favorite rides and you are dead:) by the end of the day, but FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE

Great time, joy & fun !!. I didn't expect anything from the park, but felt good after that.I and my family stay at the Palm Atlantis, so we're able to use it with no extra cost.To me there're 2 major magnets of the park, the tower of Poseidon and the tower of Neptune. Each of the 2 towers contain couple of water adventures, so you may have to claim up of each for several times to play them all. For those who fear the adventure you can have water rides. There're several simple rides, but fun along the way.There're lockers to rent with different sizes. I rent the biggest one and it cost me around 76 AEDUnlucky that we didn't have much time to play there, but it was a good experience and everyone of us went out with joy and fun.

Take the "Leap". We had a day pass to the waterpark (a group of 10). The rides were fun. The lines were relatively short. Access to the comfortable chairs on the beach was an added bonus. Towels and lockers are available for an additional cost. Showers are clean and available for use.

Good not Great. We went with a group of friends, this was a great day as there was a bit of something for everyone, with the beach to sit at or the lazy river, Myself and a couple others went for the thrills of the rides and wasn't to impressed, we went on the leap of faith first and it was about the most exiting one of all. We were all hoping for a bit more excitement. The tickets for the lockers are a bit confusing as well but as friends live in dubai we were warned about this beforehand. I would still recommend it but it just wasn't as thrilling and exiting as i was expecting

Great return visit. Returned to this park 1 year on, visiting over the Christmas period. It is still my favourite waterpark anywhere, thanks to the generous size of the park, a nice mix of slides and long lazy river - which includes some white water sections, and lush landscaping. It is well staffed and well maintained. The new tower adds some extra slides, including two family raft rides. If white knuckle body slides are your thing then this park still only has a few, and you would probably enjoy Wild Wadi more. Bring your own towel or be prepared to pay for one. Getting back from the Atlantis can involve quite a wait for a taxi (the monorail is pretty useless, as it is infrequent and does not connect with the main Dubai metro) but staff should be commended for managing the taxi line very well.

Need more clarity and directions. We Visited the water park on 30th Dec 2013.The park was nice, clean and the rides interesting.The main problem was that the instructions came in as pieces (eg they dont tell you that the locker is not included in the ticket until you go to the locker room which is a five minute walk from the ticket counter, so you need to go back and come back killing 10 minutes + the time in que (it was 15 mins when we went)Similarly, they dont tell you that the towels are not included untill you go to the towel booth which is a 10 min walk from the locker room (meaning, since you are in a swim suit, you need to go back to the locker for your purse and then another 5 mins to the ticket counter. There are not enough signs for rides and directions to them.

Fantastic full day of fun!. We were initially annoyed that even though we pre purchased tickets, we still had to que to get wrist bands. Once in the park, it was awesome! The slides were fantastic and really well laid out. I think we had at least one turn on every ride and had so much fun! The attendants and life guards were so friendly and helpful.....we could not have asked for better service. The food was typical theme park food, but not too badly priced and the staff were so lovely. We were very impressed with this place and would recommend it to anyone with kids over 120cm (height limit for many rides). Good value for money as we spent the entire day there and it is all the kids (14, 15 & 16) have talked about since. We took the free shuttle to Mall of Emirates which was a great way to end the day.

Great fun. Loved this water park. Great that a lot of the rides take you up on the tube via a conveyer belt so not as much running up stairs!! They have just added a new set of rides and they were awesome.

Best thing Dubai has to offer. It's the best water park i have been to. The park is amazing for thrill seekers as well as for relaxing.Has really good facilities - the locker/shower's and food facilities are of very high standard and decently prized.
