Water proof camera for rental are available to capture the memories. While it has 10 rides the one's worth going on are Tower of Neptune ( Only One Good Ride)Leap of Faith. It was crazy..the first 5 seconds when you slide down 9 stories are amazing. Tower of Poseidon ( Four Amazing ride)Poseidon's Revenge. The Best ride i have ever taken. Its scary. One moment you are standing and the next floor open on you and you have a free fall inside a tube. Its an Ultimate experienceAquaconda and Zoomerango both are 6 person craft rides. They are fun and mid level thrill rides. Slitherine is a normal slide ride, found it to be better then the ones at tower of Neptune.If one know swimming Dolphin Bay is a must try.

great place , day well spent .. well , we actually spent 3 days here . we were staying at atlantis with unlimited entry into the park . the park is huge , even on peak days like weekends and christmas holidays , the park didn't feel very crowded .hardly any queues . foods expensive in this resort . also what i like is they don't go after you to buy the photos for every ride as they do in some american or european parks .superb place and very fond memories

great fun!!. brilliant waterpark, i just love it!many people in the park but it was well worth the money.we bought the dolhin experience and got free entrance to aquaventure (well, the dolphin bay itself is inside the themed park)

Excellent day out. If you want a nice relaxing day out in Dubai then I would highly recommend a visit to the Aquaventure Waterpark at Atlantis on the Palm. We visited just as the The Tower of Poseidon opened and it didn't disappoint. The tube rides are ok, quite short but the slides are really good.I managed to cut my arm in one of the slides as I didn't have them in the correct position so I told one of the park supervisors and before I knew it they sent out a medic cart and cleaned it up and put a bandage on it. It was amazing to see the amount of care they have for the patrons, top service!For the adrenaline junkies the Poseidon’s Revenge is amazing. The sense of feeling you have when the floor your standing on just disappears and you drop into the tube is insane. I managed to get some amazing footage of it with my GoPro.Then there is the lazy rivers which you can just chill on the whole day. Grab a tube and flow down the river and pick and choose the areas of the park you want to goto. The slide that goes through the shark tank is pretty cool and the slides that thrust you up and around the park are good as well.The food was reasonably priced and as expected at a theme park. Didn't find anything really to complain about. I have not been to Wadi Wadi so can't really compare the two.
The best thrill in Waterpark. The Jaw Drop adventure in waterpark is here. Enjoy some of the best rides in Middle East. On top, its freee for unlimited times if you are staying in Atltantis the Palm.

Expensive and disorganised. Having been to Dubai 5 times now from the UK. It's a city we love, because of its sleekness, quality and ambition. Sadly, the Aquaventure water park was a real disappointment.Over £100 to get in, for two adults, 1 five year old and 1 1yr old who was free. I then was charged £15 for the hire of a locker and 1 towel! Non refundable! A towel each would have been £30, so we decided to share. The park it's self was ok, not particularly busy, but lots of people selling popcorn, candy floss, water squirters etc. We had a meal which was cold and tasted poor, and expensive! The rides were fine, fairly tame and not as good as wild wadi ( nothing was as good as wild wadi) I felt this was more about maximising the cash out of me as much as possible. As we left I was astonished to see a huge queue for taxis which after 45 mins we eventually got one. Hardly any taxis there so we literally were all waiting to get into cabs others had just left. The roads out and the entire infrastructure of the palm is not geared up to handling a major tourist attraction. Last time here, next time back to Wild wadi.

Need a full day. Stayed at Atlantis and free entry to waterpark was included. There was so much to do you would need a full day. Lots of rides for all ages or even just floating around on the tubes. We didn't actually go on any rides but walked around looking at everything and had we had children with us, it would have been a fantastic day. Definitely a great choice for families.

Confusing and overpriced. Spent Christmas day at the waterpark but it was not an overwhelming experience, signage is poor spent a lot of time trying to find the start of the rides and the range of rides was a little lacking not worth the entrance price and to charge 75 dirhams for a photo is a little steep, water parks in Florida are a lot better.

Aquaventure at Atlantis. Great Waterpark, something for everyone, thrilling slides, whitesand beaches, lazy river rides etc. We were worried about transport away from the park at sundown but the queueing was orderly and efficient and we only waited 10 mins for a taxi. Try and get 2 for 1 vouchers from the Dubai voucher books or your hotel may have a discount arrangement, Sofitel did. Warning -Posiedens Revenge is not for the faint hearted. Its no ordinary water slide, ( its on YouTube if you want to check it out first !)
Wet and wild. Great fun for me and my dad! There are plenty of flumes to choose from, including a massive death drop and the rapids! Had a great time here and got very very wet! Recommended!

Awesome family vacation. It was a great day to enjoy the good weather and wholesome entertainment with food and rides which are truly engaging with my 8 year old enjoying the day at the park.The food and service was worth the time spent waiting for and we would love to come back again next year.The beach was lovely with the warm sun and sand and the beautiful winter weather adding to the location.Enjoyed our time spent and the crowd which was GREAT.
Kids love the experience. Lovely place kids didn't want to go back to the hotel......the queue was rather long and winding....but it was pure fun....FUN....FUN..

atlantis water park. Good fun. Not sure I agreed with the extras the locker cost £15 non refundable. Also food cost a fortune outside the park so eat before you go! Don't go on their weekend had to wait 90 mins for a taxi to get off the Palm.
Impressive in all respects. Big, thematically interesting, many levels of difficulty and excitement that cover all needs. Most of all, safety. Every 10-20 meters there is a safequard watching!

Ok. To begin with queues are long so probably better to book on-line. Two grandchildren aged 9 and 10 were charged adult price as they were over 1m20c - how insulting, profiteering on large scale.I accompanied them on tyres floating around and then going down rapids!! Really. I was underwhelmed. Kids took off to the flumes which they enjoyed whilst I found a bed on the beach. Overall 250 x 8 persons albeit 2 were children amounts to a hefty AED2000 = £340.adding insult to injury when we emerged there was a 100 yd queue for taxis -we decided to try the monorail only to discover it was closed 27Dec as they were preparing for New Years Eve fireworks when they hope to create a World record. Getting a taxi eventually took over 2hours. Goodness help anyone who goes to watch fireworks it they may need a tent for the night as getting back will be practically impossible. Story Atlantis I cannot recommend this it us not anywhere close to value for money.

A good day out but expensive. A whole day can be spent at this waterpark with loads of great rides for the whole family. If you don't want to go on any rides but have to go in with your family there is no reduction in cost which makes it pricey. Would be nice to have a band that identifies you just as a guest.

Good. The park is very state of the art, lots to do; we arrived just after 10am and left after 6pm so you will need a full day. My only criticism is that is very costly with not much variety when it came to food etc. Otherwise the experience is good and the location is lovely .

Mind Blowing. I would rate this as the top most activity in every travelers' itinerary, Though a bit costly, it is worth it. please carry each participants' swimming costume and towels, as Inside these facilities are very costly, and they permit you to bring your own piece.

One of the best aquaparks I've seen.. The park itself is quite large, the rides range from fun to scary. try the ones on the tower at the far side of the park, just past the beach. The sea was quite muddy so the beach was not that attractive during my visit. I especially liked the conneciton of the small rivers running through the park and between the rides. You always end up at a different location in the park, that was so fun.The entry fee is quite steep, so is the locker room rent. One small locker would be just enough for one full backpack, so don't bring too much stuff. you will be running around all the time anyway. Overall it was a very enjoyable experience.

Water Rides. Its pretty easy to navigate your way around. There is an area for small children which is away from the main slides so if you're older looking for fun you don't get slowed down by families, equally if you're there with little ones, you can enjoy the children's area without getting pushed about my teenagers heading towards the more hair-raising slides! Thanks Country Travel Mart for all the arrangements made durig our entire dubai trip

the kids love it. we stayed at Atlantis for one night just beacause we wanted to do this waterpark , and as house guests we got free access to the awter park for both days until we were residents ,the kids just love and want to the rides again and again, the place very neat and clean. only thing we could hv appreciated was more options in the food category as there was too little option and that too exorbitantly priced ,nevertheless we wouldnt mind going for the water rides again
Aquaventure Waterpark. Located by the Atlantis hotel on one of the Palm's the park is great fun. We spent almost the entire day there. Recommended!
Great fun. If you like rides and water you will love the aquapark plenty to do and to see.... But suggest visiting in summer and it can get cold after your wet

Atlantis Aquaventure Waterpark. Brilliant day out for families and couples who enjoy a thrill. Lockers are in 2 sizes and full showering dressing facilities are available. Do not bring food or glass bottles, you are however allowed to bring 1 litre of water per person.

Wet thrills for all!. There are so many compelling 'rides' to try. The plunge is, for me, the most scary. The family enjoyed Poseidon's revenge.
Good food and gelato at Barracuda food hall.

Beats Florida's Water Parks By Far. - A Fantastic Waterpark -The lazy river at Aquaventure is fun for everyone, you can while away your time floating along the calmer sections or go across the rapids, even take the rubber ring escalator to the top of some of the slides. The park is massive and has some unique water slides for the more daring, be warned though, as you will be pulling your swimming shorts/trunks/bikini from out of your bottom as you will be coming down those slides at some pace ! An action packed full day out. Highly recommended.
Atlantis. Like Wild Wadi, there's rides for all ages, and is also one of my highest recommendations for first visits.

Better than Wild Wadi.. Its at Atlantis and you can get the Monorail down like a good little tourist, give them something to do as the trains are always empty.They have stopped serving alcohol in the cafe's for some reason so you cant get drunk and go on the rides. This saddened me greatly and has knocked it from Excellent to Very good in my review.For those who arent raging alcoholics, you will have a good time and its better than Wild Wadi.Maybe give Yas Waterworld a go as well. You might love it.

Concussion happens on kids slide!. The lazy river is excellent even for young kids in the two person rings. Unfortunately my wife was concussed on a kids slide and ended up needing an MRI scan and seeing a neurologist in DXB in the midst of our holiday.The concussion was was obviously not the fault of the resort, but i would challenge the assertion that they had never had any such accidents before, as the neurologist at the Saudi German Hospital said she was the third patient of the day he had seen from the resort. The medical room in the waterpark did take care of her, and they provided complimentary return day passes.I am sure it is an enjoyable trip for the majority, but our experience is somewhat tempered by the fact there is no warning re adults on kids slides, and there are painful consequences.

Excellent Beach but limited rides. Compared to other water parks I've been to, this is average. The major + is the nice private beach; this is where I spent most of my time during my recent visit. They also have lots of lounge chairs which is good. Limited rides and not many options for young children. Excellent staff.

'ONE OF BEST WATERPARK IN MIDDLE EAST '. I been to Aquventure 2 weeks ago and i want to say that the ride was amazing but there are no much ride , but the Leap Of Faith slide is very amazing , the staff is kind,the park is clean . i think i will stay at jumeirah beach resort to try the Wild Wadi Water park. average the Aquaventure is good.

not many rides. the park is very clean and the staff is very good but there are only about 6 rides and the vertical 90 foot drop is on for very little time. the swim with fish is not as amazing as you'd imagine but the park is fun

A great place to spend the day. adults and kids will love this place but the downsides are reaching it with the bus (u actually drive into a parking lot and get picked up by buses) and another one would be the number of people over there. expect a big Q

Probably not the best in Dubai.. The good part:#Very nice changing rooms.#The Leap of Faith was scarily amazing!! It was at a tremendous height and the vertical fall was blink-fast!#Nice beachThe bad part:#One has to climb up a lot number of stairs to get to the start point of slide. There must be escalators or so. #For every water slide, you have to carry your tube all the way up. There must be automatic delivery of tubes.#Except the Leap of Faith, all the other slides are more or less the same with small modifications. Most of the part of the slides are closed which does not bring much fun. #The shark tank in either of The Leap of Faith and Shark Attack did not have visible sharks. The Leap of Faith scratched my back.#All the slides end in a common stream (kind of a lazy river) which ends far, and from there you have to go to the other end for other slides.There could be more advanced slides and RIDES.

Okay, but not great value and food inside is hugely expensive. We bought a package ticket for aquaventure and lost chambers....dont. Just go for aquaventure because there are several other aquariums in dubai, such as the one in dubai mall which looked way better. Lost chambers was comoleted in about 10 minutes!Aquaventure waterpark itself was large, but young kids below 1.2m dont get to play on many things, so be wary of that. For adults, it hugely fun, but i would suggest parents with toddlers or young children to go for the whole day and take your own food if possible. We spent over 60 pounds on snacks inside the park! add to that the locker price and we spent close 80quid all in all.

Getting better. The introduction of some more rides means this is getting better. The new rides were great (although 1 new and 1 old were closed) and some better than wild wadi. Overall I still prefer Wild Wadi

Nice water park. Nice water park. Landscaped well. A bit disappointing signage is poor and hard to know wat slides r where, which require tubes etc. Nice beach free to use. Definitely not up to European water parks i have been to.
Best Water Park in Dubai. This place is an oasis in the middle of the desert. One of the best place in dubai to cool down in scorching sun.

Awesome waterpark. My wife and I had a fantastic day at aquaventure. Going on a Monday there were almost no queues and we went on most rides multiple times. Additional fees for towel and locked is annoying but to be expected. Great day out.

Pricey but worth it. Quite a pricey waterpark, so go for a full day rather than a few hours, there is plenty to do anyway. Nice little beach where you can swim in the sea, a range of rides from gentle to terrifying, places to eat, and the most smiley staff I've ever seen.
Scariest water slides in the world. What ever you do go to this place. The rides are out of this world. Give it a go I dud and my legs are still shaking.

AQUAVENTURE EXPERIENCE. Nice Place To Be For A Full Day Outing . Nice Rides. Clean Areas And Easy Access . Good Getaway From The Busy City Life. Lockers And Towels Were A Little Bit Expensive. Nice Changing Rooms And Bathrooms. Snacks At The Shark Bites Restaurant Were Reasonable . All Types Of Rides Are Available For Both Kids , Teenage And Adults. Scary Rides Too Are Available.

Average waterpark next to Atlantis Hotel. The waterpark is nicely located next to the Atlantis Hotel but guests of Aquaventure are not allowed to go to the hotel without properly ID. The waterpark offers two main thrill rides, the Tower of Neptune and the Tower of Poseidon, a beach area and the Dolphin Bay. Entrance to the Lost Chambers Aquarium has another entrance fee. Lunch was at the Kaleidoscope at Atlantis.

Fantastic day out!!. My husband and I went here on our honeymoon (both in our early 30's). It was amazing. We was like 2 giddy teenagers but definitely something for everyone. Scary scary slides, to the long lazy river!! Lots of double and single rubber rings, lots of sun loungers and a beach too!! A must for a great day out!! Ps. Dont forget the suncream
fun fun fun. As i said in a title, fun fun and more fun. Really loved the park, slides and everything. Wish to had more time, but every fun ends sometime.

Scary but amazing. This place is a must tryIt has it all, beach games kids area food ice cream everything The rides are amazing, i started by the simplest and ended at the leap of faith which was a thrilling experience I took a train back to Dubai, ticket was 15 DH but the experience is amazing as well, the view crossing the water and looking at atlantis shouldn't be missed One thing i didn't like that towels are rented and they wont give you a dry one later on so maybe you should bring yours ( it was a bit cold the day i went thats why the towel wasn't dry enough) but definitely this place is a must try if you are brave enough :)

Interesting experience. We selected Acquaventure over Wild Wadi since we wanted to see Palm Jumera & Atlantis as well close up. This has a limited number of rides (about 12 for adults) and an area for kids (having about 6 rides. There is also a floating area which is quite long (about 500m). 2 of the rides were very scary & I did not attempt them. Like : 1. Most of the rides were thrilling / relaxing. 2. Felt safe in all rides which I attempted3. Went to the beach next to the park4. Mono rail ride from hotel to mainland5. Saw the Palm and Atlantis close-upDislike : 1. Beware - food & drinks are not allowed to be taken inside and buying food and drink is very expensive inside the park.2. Limited choice for kids below 5 years3. The photos were expensive

Great fun for kids old and young! . This place was amazing for a day trip! So many brilliant slides and rides. Exceptionally clean and well looked after the staff are always on hand to help. Loved spending the day here and when we were exhausted from the water park fun we made our way down to the beach overlooking the palm residence and marina and chilled out there on lounges with shishas for the afternoon. Definitely money well spent. Taxi from creekside approx $90 AED
Water Kingdom. Everything you would expect from the waterpark and even more - real waves generator, rapids, endless tubes, the pool with sharks. Worth to spend whole day with kids.

Great Waterpark. Had a brilliant day at Aquaventure. Paid the extra 100AED for all-day zip-wire access - was worth it too. All the slides are excellent, but Leap of Faith & Posiedon's Revenge are the best two... and most extreme. The Rapids are great fun to idle your way round a not so lazy river. If you only do one of the two waterparks in Dubai - do this one, it leaves Wild Wadi in the shade. In Orlando waterpark terms, Aquaventure is definitely the Aquatica [newer, smarter, nicer] but with some of the Wet'n'Wild [more extreme slide] rides.

Wonderful place. I liked everything in this place! I received a lot of good and happy feelings. It is amazing and very cool place.You can visit place with your family or your friends finally you will be in a good mood.

Fun - even for the adults. Great day at the park, we got free entry as we went to Dolphin Bay before hand. We were on our honeymoon and were like children around the waterpark. It was good, lots of adrenalin flumes as well as some a little more tame. The underwater fish world was good to see.

Grown up fun. A couple in their 40s running round and laughing like kids! This place is great! We had an awesome time. Arrived at 10am so no queues at all for any rides. Loads of sunbeds available.You can pre-load your barcoded wristband with money so you don't have to carry cash. This also doubles up as your photos so don't forget to get them scanned when your riding if you want photos. Lockers are expensive (40AED) but they area very safe and again open with your barcode on the wristband so no key to carry. TIP - you'll save a fortune if you take entertainer vouchers and pre-buy your food before you go in saves ou another 10-15AED each.There is a lovely private beach you can chill out when you've had enough. It's quiet and e sea is lovely. There's a great view of the Burj al Arab also.
SO much fun!!. Loved everything here from the white knuckle slides to drifting around the last river soaking up the sun.

Fun fun fun. Aquaventure is just great family fun...couple fun..whatever FUN!
You better come ready for some spending inside since you are not allowed to bring in any food or water...
I advise booties as the ground can be scorching hot...and make sure to put aside some of your budget for feeding the rays...

Not as good as Wild Wadi. After visiting both water parks, although Wild Wadi is older, there are more rides, rides are better and longer.
On the day we visited, 2 of the family tube rides were out of service.

Excellent waterpark. We had a great day here, went early morning and stayed until early evening. It is a lovely place with great facilities and not to expensive either. The rides are good fun, atleast the ones I tried! My husband went on everything and loved it. We went in October so it wasn't to busy which was good. The beach is also very nice and you can access it from the water park. We bought the combo ticket so also went to the aquarium which was great, such an amazing hotel. Worth a visit!

The best water park ever!!. We upgraded to cabanas and well worth the money. Great covered sun beds in private roped off area with changing facilities and queue jumping privileges (even private paths from the cabanas to allow you to get to the front of queue) We were plied with drinks and ice lollies by our personal butler and an amazing time was had by all.

Absolutely worth a visit, makes you feel like a kid again (im 32). Yes this place is full of tourists and its pricey but what else do you expect?Water slides are great, makes you feel like a kid again. Some of the slides make your heart come out of your mouth! (dont go if you have heart problem or pregnant) I would say this park caters more for older kids. Alot of the slides have height restrictions (min 1.2m). There is a special kids zone which we didnt go to so that might be ok however the main area is more for teenagers I would say.Leave a full day for this as by the time you try all the slides (once) and with all the queueing your day is pretty much over.Top tip - bring your own towel and dont bring any valuables.That way you dont have to rent a towel and/or locker. Note that you will also end up walking around bare feet - we were laughing at people doing so at the beginning but by the end we were doing it ourselves! If you are fussy about this then bring waterproof sandals that strap around your feet that wont fall off when on slide. Also bring change of clothing, i know, seems obvious now.......................but guess who forgot??All in all, great day out, must do.

November 13. Bought combo tickets on line before visit, lost chamber and water park, went with our grandson of 2 yrs old, he went free. As expected weather brilliant, area for children and young kids was very busy and the younger children seemed a little overcome with the number of people. Unfortunately there were a number of adults going on some of the slides which put off a number of children. Very good food facilities in the park. After the park we got changed in the very good changing rooms with showers and all facilities you could want. The Lost Chambers, in which you will see some spectacular underwater scenes and a variety of fishes and creatures. Overall we all had a good day out.

amazing just everything are perfecte. i just come back from aquaventure and i was so surprised the staff all was amazing and funny always have a smille on theie faces and are so helpful the slide are perfect it's perfect for fun and relaxing we don't eat inside so i can't give a review about the food the water are so clean i take the combo deal wich included all day in aquaventure and the lost chamber i book online and i paid 275 aed and we rent a small locker for 40 aed

Best attraction for the Young & Old alike. We went there a couple of times during several visits to Dubai. one of the highlights of the trip! Kids area is large enough to keep them busy for the whole day if they do not want to experience the rides. moreover the rides and experience overall is unforgettable.only advise is to come early morning as it gets really crowded after 1 pm. make sure u visit during working days i.e Sunday- thursday for less of a bee hive. avoid it during Muslim holidays due to overcrowding

Fantastic. What a nice waterpark. Good variety of games including the extremely scary games and the less scary ones. Lifeguards are everywhere, which makes you feel safe, especially that they are very friendly and smiling all the time. Price is a bit high though. Overall, I had a really great time in Aquaventure waterpark with my friends.

BEST WATER PARK EVER!. Tickets cost us 150UAED for an adult day ticket. We arrived early, got our wristbands, then our locker wristband (40dirhams), and another wristband which you can put money on which you can then use to pay for food/drinks across the water park, i would recommend doing this so you dont have to carry money around.No shortage of sun loungers, there is a little beach you can go to as well.The slides where all absolutely amazing, especially the double dingy ones where you go through the slide and see the stingrays and fish swimming as you slowly flow through. Also the more extreme slides like Poseidons revenge is ridiculous, an almost vertical drop, serious adrenaline rush. I would recommend wearing sandals/flip flops to walk around or buying some of those beach shoe things as in the park they are so overpriced in the park.Food was as expected prices for a theme park. 50 dirhams for a shawarma, fries and a drink. 15dirhams for a can of iced tea 13dirhams for a bottle of water.Would definable recommend going!

No desire to return.. Enjoyed my experience here but felt the prices were a little too high for what I actually got to do. I paid £170 which included swimming with dolphins and access to the waterpark but only went on one slide. If you can get there early enough to make the most of this day then I would recommend it. I would also advise you to use the entertainer vouchers if you want to get into the waterpark as they are buy one get one free which will save you quite a bit.

super fun. love waterpark? go to aquaventure in atlantis hotel. this place is amazing, once you get enter you'll gonna feel like a kids. play and fun! scream and happy. this place was create such a marvelous games ever, from the lazy river or just hit all the water slide. the extreme one was the leap of faith! super crazy yet worth to try, (beware if you have a heart problem)

Not that great. Its a good activity to do with family but I think its expensive for what they offer. I felt in a little and incomplete water park at Orlando, FL, maybe because two of their major attractions were closed... The beach is great, it took us like an hour to find a sun bed, everything inside its ridiculously expensive and extremely crowded.

Cold water!!!!!!. Aquaventure is a great waterpark, esp. with their new slides and attractions. The staff was very friendly and helpful throughout the day. Even though we visited on a weekday, it was very busy. We arrived early, though, and had no trouble finding sunbeds. Certain facilities like the sunbeds seemed quite old and in need of renewal. The food quality and variety were great but the prices were very high for fast food (Dhs73 for a pizza, Dhs65 for a burger & chips, Dhs50 for a kids combo meal). We were not happy with the mocktails, it was just a cup of ice with very little to drink. For some attractions like the zipline (Dhs100) you pay extra. The lockers are an absolute rip-off, there is a non-refundable charge of Dhs40 for a small locker (compared to a REFUNDABLE 1 Euro/Dollar in other countries ....).We visited with a baby and a toddler and called beforehand to be sure that the water would be the appropriate temperature for them. We were told that the water is heated at 30 degrees. On our visit, however, the water was really cold. 27-28 degrees. We asked about 10 different employees. Lots of people were complaining, esp. parents. We were even told that this is a cost-cutting measure by the hotel ……. It is absolutely unacceptable for a family resort to provide an inadequate environment for children. By 15:00, my toddler had blue lips and was shivering. The water temperature should be 30 degrees throughout the waterpark and 32 degrees in the children’s pool. We have raised this matter with the management and are awaiting feedback.We cannot recommend this waterpark to families with young children. The little kids can only go on the lazy river (fine even for a 1-year-old) and maybe on the rapids if they are a bit older (our 2-year-old found it ok). The play area is quite big and intimidating for toddlers with water being dropped down on them periodically from a huge bucket. Only on three of the slides, parents can slide with their children. Only 2 of these were ok for our kids. Atlantis is the only waterpark, however, (to our knowledge) that has single and double tubes with a child seat. These were absolutely fabulous. So, in summary, the waterpark is fantastic for anyone without children or with children taller than 120cm who will be allowed to do all the rides.
Too crowded. Without doubt, this is a very good water park. This is probably why it is so busy and therefore difficult to locate sun beds. It probably heightened the problem being a family of 5.

Awesome!. Do it! Brilliant fun and a great day out. Not cheap but we stayed there from open till close and didn't want to go home!! Loads of rides for all ages, lots of food available and a beautiful beach area with golf buggies to drive you around too!

Absolutely amazing. I have been to different aqua parks around the world in Europe and the USA; Disney too. And this aqua parks stands equal to their standards.The Revenge Slide was like-no-other in this world... couldn't get enough of it!

nothing special. To compare with european standard is very boring.No funny games...is big acquarium,big river to ride...I think is perfect for old people.price is not worth to come back.customer service is very poor.

Meet in the middle family holiday. Great for older kids... good to be able to use the resort beach. If you do one of their experiences you also get free entry to the park. Beware though very very long wait for taxis when you leave

Amazing!!. Visited with a friend who loves waterparks but we both had the best day ever....waterpark for her and beach for me.! Take monorail there and back...nice view but great photo opportunity on approach to waterpark. Buy tickets in advance for waterpark, approx 25aed cheaper and saves queue time. Small locker can be shared as it is a good size.If eating on site u may want to consider buy food voucher in advance though it will only cost slightly more inside. Food is not ridiculously expensive as we thought it would be and portion is huge. Defo enjoyed it!!Queues for rides were long but not too bad considering it was a weekend. Sunbeds available all over and they were comfy ones with individual shades. Beach was gorgeous, view amazing.No restrictions on types of swimwear especially for women.Only negative thing is sign post can be confusing plus lack of them. Need more staff on hand.TIP: Go early!!! Take monorail from park and pick up cab at the other end...its quicker and a nicer way to end day otherwise taxi queue from park is loooooong!Bring yr own towel and drinking water. Keeps cost down. Have flip flops to wear around park...group is hot!!
Worth it!. Very good waterpart and rides.We will come back again...I love leap of faith...Best part of hot and humid Dubai :)

Lots of fun, would go again. Husband, daughter 9 and I went to both Wild Wadi and Aquaventure during our first visit to Dubai. We went to Aquaventure first and later WW. Overall we much preferred Aquaventure. We liked that the park seemed less closed in/more open. It was a lot easier to find chairs to sit in and in a better location than WW. Although we visited both at opening time and not on a weekend day WW was MUCH more crowded. The biggest drawback of Aquaventure is they have poor signage and no maps we saw so we ended up missing some of the attractions they did have (we later learned) that we would have tried. For us the rapids and conveyor belt system was better than the master blaster type rides at WW. The locker rooms are also nicer at Aquaventure. We would definitely return and spend the full day if back in Dubai. As it was we spent almost 4 hrs there and did only some of the rides. WW lines were long - we waited 30-45 for each. We never had a line that long at Aquaventure. No idea how the food compares as we did not eat at either. Prices with the Entertainer coupons are similar. Maybe a tad higher at WW with locker and towel rental as they did not have as packages and Aquaventure did plus we had a coupon for those.

Location Location Location. A great day out for people of all agesYou can take a trip on the lazy river or one of the major slides if your more adventurousBe warned the new raft ride is heart stopping in places. My daughter couldn't stop laughingWould recommend this water park to all, entry is free if your staying at the Atlantis and the park opens 15 minutes early for Hotel guests

Best part of Dubai. Fantastic fun! They've recently doubled the park rides by building the Posseidon Tower (in addition to the Neptune Tower). The Posseidon's Revenge is excellent and even faster than the Leap of Faith. Lockers are small (and costs to purchase). Bring your own towels to avoid being charged for them too.

Tons of Fun. This was ot my first time at Aquaventure, but it was still a lot of fun.They have added some new rides which were actually quite entertaining, one of them putting you at a 90 degree angle before dropping you down.Great fun for the entire family.When staying at Atlantis the park is accessible for free while an outside visitor pays 250 QAR.

Quality water park, could do with more slides. In many ways Aquaventure is one of the best waterparks you will ever visit, but I did have one issue in that there aren't enough slides for the number of people visiting. The slides that are available are very good, and Poseidon's' Revenge where you drop through a trapdoor is the scariest thing I've ever experienced. The park is very well landscaped with lots of sun loungers, shade isn't to hard to find and the beach area is very nice indeed. So it's worth a visit but just be prepared to queue quite a long time for the slides.TIP: buy tickets in advance or online as the queue is slow otherwise
Great fun but too busy. This is a great waterpark and well worth a visit. Very busy during weekends and school holiday though

Fun, Fun, Fun!. This waterpark had rides for everyone, ranging from the little ones through to the bravest adult. a quick visit landed up to be the whole day, it was so much fun. Lots to do and great places to get snacks, drinks and lunch. They all very efficient and never any queues, such a pleasure. A great time spent, a must!

Good water park but needs bigger rides.. get in early as the crowds are crazy after about 12pm and wear footwear as the paths around the park are so hot you can hardly walk on them. but other than that a good experience

Super fun. The aquaventure waterpark at Atlantis is an amazing experience. Our families spent the entire day at the park and were still asking for me. The wavepool is probably the best. It was a 45min ride around the resort and had all sorts of rapids. There is a lot for the kids to enjoy at the park specially if you have small kids then they will love to be in the kiddie slides.

Brilliant day out. The 4 of us, 2 adults and 2 kids spent the day here during Oct half term holidays. We arrived at 10am on the spot but had to queue for 10 mins to get tickets but were able to use Entertainer vouchers to help the price.Headed straight for Tower of Poseidon before park got too busy. All the rides were great, however the capsule one did scare us to within an inch of our lives, defo most extreme water ride I've ever been on, and yes the floor is clear! Unfortunately only one of the big family rides was running so we'll have to test the other one next time. We then proceeded to hit all the other rides, which took almost all day in total, only stopping for a brief lunch of yummy corn on the cob. Queues certainly built up in the afternoon so best do the ring rides first then cruise the rapids in the afternoon. All in all a fab family day out, and worth pushing yourself to do the big ones. (On this visit we rated Aquaventure higher than Wild Wadi and the investment in new rides well worth it). Great frozen yogurt on way out too!!

A giant rip off!. The park itself was nice but the service are very poor. They admit ore patrons than the park can handle. Hardly any place to sit especially if you are a family. No order at the park whatsoever. Vendors are downright thieves. Compared to Wild Wadi or Yas Waterworld, Aquaventure does not measure up at all. Ridiculous food and drink prices. AED 13 for a half liter bottle of water??? and not a single water fountain around. Even the showers dispensed only hot water?! going back to the parking area took almost an hour!!! Overall, I would rather spend my money somewhere else.

Really good day out Highly recommended. This is a great water park, a little bit pricey but what isn't in Dubai. We booked our ticket online from the UK and the prices were much cheaper than turning up on the door as there was a special offer on line so worth checking, remember to make a note of your reference when paying as this is the number you need when you turn up to get in, we never got an email confirmation or anything like that and as the wife didn't make a note of the number we ended up having to ring the park and ask for it.On arriving at 9.50 we made our way to the pre-paid ticket desk and were served straight away, we got out bands and then paid for towels 30 Dirhams each or one towel and a small locker for 50 Dirhams, the rest of the day was a breeze, floating along the easy river, through the fast rapids and hopping off along the way to go on the great rides, I could have floated around all day without a care in the world. There are ample sunbeds dotted at the various stopping off points along the river so there is no need to run in and dive on the first set of beds you come to.The day we went it was quite quiet and the queues for the main rides weren't very long at all in the morning, I went on the Leap of Faith slide and there was only 5 people in front of me (Men, remember to cross your legs !!! otherwise it will hurt trust me i forgot) the other rides are also great as well as some of the smaller rides along the river.Food in the park is as you would expect pricey, you are allowed to take your own water in to the park but nothing else and they will check your bags on entering, food for 2 adults and a child came to about £30-£40 but the portion sizes were good especially the BBQ chicken wings. Would also recommend getting the 50 Dirham refillable drink as this is large (1Ltr) and a refill is only 8 Dihams which by Dubai standards is a snip, we just left ours on under our towel on the sunbed and refilled it the next time we floated past.We had such a good day on leaving we took up the offer of returning the following day saving us 65 Dirhams each on the entrance price so we did it all again the following day, We could easily have spent a week in the park just floating along, enjoying the rides and the glorious sunshine.Ladies there is no restriction on swim suites either which was a question we had when we went given you have to cover up in a lot of places, but here its fine to wear a normal bikini.The only downside if you can call it that is actually getting away from the park if you need to get a taxi, the queues are massive especially if you are leaving from about 4 pm on wards (park closes at sunset about 5.30PM) we waited about an hour for a taxi as they come in dribs and drabs and there are both the normal marked taxis and also unmarked Lexus taxis which i presume are private hire cabs that the taxi officials call when the queue gets large, these will cost you about 50% more than a standard taxi but you don't get a choice as to what one you get you are pushed in to whatever comes round the corner next.All in all a great day out and highly recommended.

Brilliant. OMG the water slides are fantastic they are much more exciting than the disneyworld resort ones. The shark reef one was good as you drifted slowly through the underwater aquarium after doing the fun part of the slide.We had unlimited access to this park as we stayed at the atlantis and it was great. The food served on site was reasonably priced as I was expecting it to be extortionate.We had plenty of good days there, lounging around on the beach and just doing all the slides. Worth a visit

Kids Half Term Dubai Break. Great fun for all the family. All the staff very friendly and very unlike some of the large waterparks in Florida. Spotlessly clean and well organised. A great blend of “chilling” water rides and fast exhilarating attractions. The “Leap of Faith” is and was amazing. My only issue was when leaving the event; I waited over 90 mins for a taxi??? Admittedly there was an event taking place on the Palm, but no excuse for the locals offering you “private” cabs for EAD 200, versus 50 in a regular cab. As water parks go, can’t think of anything that could beat it really. Shame about the taxi situation.

A great time had by all. Visited for the day with husband and 7 year old son, we all had a great time. The park is spotlessly clean and there is loads to do for all ages, having said that for most rides there is a height restriction of 1.2m or 1.3m. I think even the biggest addrenline junkie would enjoy the leap of faith and some of the other rides.Food and drink is expensive as you would expect at this type of place, you need to pay to rent lockers and towels as well although you can obviously take your own towels.We had a great time and we would definitely visit again.
Great day out. Fab day out. Kids loved the rides, I loved the quiet beach area... Bliss for allget 'The Entertainer' Dubai book for half price vouchers, (you can get them on ebay too).

What the ads don't tell you. Booked online to save 10% - ha ha! All of the booking form quoted prices in AED, but when receipt was emailed to me it was in USD (ie: I paid 810 AED for family of four but got a receipt for US$810) - I booked the night before and couldn't find out if my credit card was charged AED 810 or US$810 (which would have been a major budget blowout)! It turns out that I was charged the correct amount (no problem), but the staff person when I checked in wasn't the least bit interested in helping me clarify whether or not I had been ripped off a whole lot of money... the attitude was a bit disconcerting!Queues, queues and more queues simply made this bad value for money. In my country we have much smaller waterparks (we don't have a fixation and being bigger and better) where we pay less , we have less rides to choose from, but in half a day we ride many rides because when there is a queue it is managed well. On October 31st 2013 the Atlantis systems and staff simply could not deal effectively with queues that meant we didn't get to use many rides at all in half a day.My advice: See if you can find out in advance whether the park will be busy, otherwise you will spend a lot of money simply so that you can stand in a queue!

EVery ride is a thrilling one. Not for the feint hearted, lots of drop off slides with potential for scrapes and bruises but nobody seems to care as lots of fun and adrenaline pumping.... Even the easy rides go through pitch black areas and lots of speed. Everything super clean. Run to leap of faith first then poseidons drop off. Then the big ring rides same spot as Poseidon. Best thrill park wet or dry. Take your own towel or sarong. No food allowed but water ok.

good fun. I always enjoy a good water park and this one is no different. Plenty of slides and waves to get everyone excited. I did expect a little more though. This is only my expectation because they try do everything in Dubai bigger and better (which is a good thing) but this seemed to be the same layout and probably designed by the same people that did the one i visited in Sun City, Johanessberg, but the one in Sun City seemed a lot bigger. Still, a great fun day for everyone to had here. Srtill very much worth the trip

Great fun but nightmare journey. I spent a day at Aquaventure with my wife and two children (15 and 11) and we had a great time on the rides. We bought tickets in advance in the UK which were discounted and reduced the entry queuing time. The adventurous amongst us survived Leap of Faith and Poseidon's Revenge and the rides were longer and better than most parks. Food and drink overpriced and annoying that you are not even allowed to take in your own water! However, the big downside is the logistics if you don't have your own car. There is a monorail that takes you nowhere or taxis and we had to wait two hours for a taxi at the end of they day when the queue was over 200 people long!! Given the money they make, surely Atlantis could arrange taxis to arrive more frequently or shuttle buses to get people back to the mainland or nearest metro station? If you decide to go, leave early!

Great half a day. I was actually dreading coming to this water park as I hadn't really heard great reviews from those that had been. Well I can actually say I had a great time with my family. We arrived just before opening times, 10am. We quickly found a sun lounger for a base and headed off to the water rides. My son and husband did the Leap of Faith with no queuing as first thing in the morning the queues are next to none. The Tower of Neptune water slides are great fun. The lazy river is really good and i loved the little rapids. The Tower of Poseidon is just wow! Not for the faint hearted. My advise is to get to the water park for 10am, quickly find a sun lounger, and head off for the big rides. I think the longest wait for us was 10/15mins. We did the entire water park in 3 hours, we had a great, fun time.

Make sure to reserve yourself a taxi in advance!. While the park was fun, although crowded, the major adventure was to get out of there! At 6 o'clock, when the park was closing, there was a lineup for a taxi at least 150m long and taxis were not coming that often. So we decided my friend and I to take the monorail hoping to find a taxi more easily. Well… at the other end you are near a highway with no taxis to pick anyone up and we had to walk more than one km before we could get a taxi to take us. I am very surprised that in a city so well designed that they don't have the monorail connected to the main subway or they don't have tons of taxis lining up at 6pm when it closes to pick up all the tourists that are stranded there or don't have them as well at the end of the monorail… so be ready!Bring your own towel also as it is not included in the price of the ticket and you won't need a big one if you intend on using the attraction and worry all the time about trying to find it back. Better leave everything in your locker and have fun in the rides.

wonderful day out. Have been to many waterparks but this one was the best. Nice place to spend a full day. Rides are fun and full of thrill. The private beach is very beautiful. You can put money on the band on your wrist and can use it anywhere in the park. After 4: 00 pm they give 50% discount on bakery items. Lazy river is very long. Nice views from the top of tower. We loved this place.

Lovely day. This waterpark makes for a lovely day out. It has lots of attractions and the queues are very reasonable. There are a lot of lifeguards everywhere, so you can always feel safe, even with children.

Very busy. The waterpark was amazingly busy. We went at 11am and had to queue to get into the queue. Took an hour to eventually get into the park. You then realize that the day will cost. Paying for lockers drinks, food and souvenirs leaves you a little short. Yes the rides are a great way of cooling off and the kids had fun but truth be told it was a very expensive day out just to say you visited one of the highlights of being in Dubai (Palm Atlantis)It boils down to you as an individual in what you are looking for.

Not worthwhile for kids younger than 8yrs old.. Great design, nice and clean. However, no-ones tells you that ALL of the rides have a height restriction which meant we had paid full price and daughter could only go on lazy river and the little kids splash zone. What really annoyed us is that parts of the lazy river are much more dangerous than the slides so we couldnt understand the reason for this. Kids have to be accompanied on the slides - as if a parent would let them go!? However on lazy river it would be very easy to lose grip on them. Crazy! We snuck her on a number of rides anyway and she loved them and was in no danger whatsoever. If we hadn't snuck her on I'd be demanding my money back as a complete con. Also the food in shark bites restaurant takes ages to come and is appalling standard. This is the first poor review I've ever given so it must be bad! Would not recommend...
Great fun. We had a brilliant day a the water park and would recommend going there, book on line to save time and money

Beware! Looooong queues!!. Not denying this a big flash water park with some great rides and facilities but the thrills were in my opinion disproportionate to the queuing times. We booked online so managed to avoid the massive queue but still didn't escape completely - seems to take the staff there at least 10 mins to let folk though then another wait at the turnstiles, locker rooms, minor drama with fiddly lockers etc. Wild wadi which we also visited had a much better system where you credit a wrist strap - they generally seemed better organised. We arrived midday so no sunbeds in park or on beach. We managed to squeeze in about 5 rides - no queue less than 30 mins and one major ride - aqua condo - was broken the day we went. My partners's 12 year old did love it but I wouldn't give up a day of a holiday for just a handful if waterslides again. We got the aquarium visit included and that was cool but didn't offset the hassle and still cost a tenner each. All in all I'd give it about a 2 out of 10 for value for money - if queues, usual skanky junk food but happy children beat all other alternatives then go here otherwise head to the beach or pick a time when you know it'll be quiet.
I loved it. We had a wonderful time there with the family, it is a very nice waterpark full of greenery, I loved mostly the river. I will surely visit again.
Why. Overpriced so packed you couldn't get on a ride or have anywhere to sit rude ignorant staff I thought I was back in England

Best water park i've been to. Went there with my friend (we're both in our 30's) and we've had a fun day filled with lots of laughter. The ride up to the Palms is worth the extra money. Pre-book as the queues tend to be long. Picked up our tickets and went to the changing rooms (definitely recommend booking a locker though they can be a pain to get to open and re-open). Park is cleverly designed, shady areas and something to do and see everywhere. You are not allowed to bring food into the park ( they say they allow up to 1ltr water) and food and drink is pricey, as this tends to be the case everywhere in the world when you're in a themepark.We started off getting a double ring to enjoy a round (or 3) through the rapids taking you all around the park and went on 2 of the bigger slides on the way. Grabbed some lunch in one of the food courts and then went down to the beach for some relaxation (great views across to the city) and some fresh melon. Overall a great day out of the city and in the sun without the stifling heat. Will definitely go again next time I visit Dubai.

Probably one of the best water parks in the world. Outstanding park - I've never been to anything that remotely compares. Excellent rides, great facilities, would absolutely go again if I had the chance. Well worth the money.

Splash. We brought our children here during the summer. luckily for us it was Ramadan so very very quiet. Also very very hot! We spent the day on the rides and as there were no queues we got as many goes as we liked. Very clean everywhere and the staff all very helpful.

Thrilling ... all the way.. Our family loved the water park and slides: we went 5 times in 8 days. Didn't get tired of any one slide. Note, there aren't many 'tame' slide or lazy river options so smaller kids are those who don't like turns and drops may struggle a bit. Grown ups were loving it.

Great day out for the family. I think we struck it lucky on the day we visited.The EID holiday had just finished and the Dubai schools had just gone back so therefore we did not have to queue for any rides at all.The park is beautifully clean with a lovely beach (watch out for jellyfish in the sea).The food court serves a good variety of food ranging from burgers to curry.Lockers are available,located by the entrance in the male or female changing rooms, so a long walk back if you forget something.The park has recently opened 4 new rides.The raft rides are great fun ,my 8 year old daughter kept wanting to go on them again and again.You should try the leap of faith....it looks scarier than it is! The lazy river/rapids circle the park and you can float round in your rubber ring for the whole day without finding the exit (a bit like the M25 but with water) .If you are not staying at the Atlantis be aware that there is a big queue for taxis on the way out and the Atlantis staff try to get you to take the limos starting at 30aed.My advice would be not to go Thursday afternoon,Friday or Saturday when the schools are off and to arrive when the park opens as it is an expensive day out,get sunbeds in a good spot , go on the most popular rides first and start at the farthest end of the park.

Great experience! Best water park in Dubai!. This water park is great - thrilling rides and great atmosphere. Even on busy days I didn't have to wait more than 10 minutes to get to a ride and the place is big enough that you never feel that it is too crowded. The rides are very interesting - some more enjoyable than others but it depends on your taste. There is a ride that takes you through an aquarium with fish and even sharks, it is really quite lovely to see the fish so up close and yet safely behind glass. My only tip is to go there early as there are lots of rides and the park itself is very big so you need all the time possible to enjoy all that the water park can offer as it always closes right before sunset which in Dubai is around 5:30 - 6 pm.Also, if you want to visit Dolphin Bay and meet the cute dolphins - just be aware that it is very expensive and afterwards, they keep "milking" you for more money by offering you the pics from your dolphin encounter but this is to be expected really.As an overall - great experience and I recommend this water park to everyone who is visiting Dubai!

Best waterpark ever. Im going to start with the bad point and the only major concern is the long queing on the rides but thats about it everything else is great the lifeguards are very friendly and the rides are well worth the money for getting in theres alot to do around the whole park such as swimming with dolphins and visiting the aquarium its just an amazing place !!
Nice day!. It is a very good place to pass the day, beautiful beach with warm and calm water. The children had a good day playing!

Overcrowded and overprized. We were lucky that we prebooked our dolphin experience and therefore were admitted to waterpark with the same ticket. Having been to Yas Waterworld prior we were stunned by the vastness of the place- though it seems it is rather the distance between rides/attractions and the main entrance than the variety of rides. Very clean place. Not as many rides as Yas and not welcoming to travellers when wearing a t-shirt during rides...I found that petty and frankly ridiculous. Therefore I did not go onto any rides only the slow river. I was a bit puzzled to see the warning messages on the boards before one gets onto any ride- are they really that dangerous? We did not have to use the locker rooms or changing facilities as we rented a cabana. Cheaper (by 150 AED) than in Yas but not as luxurious. At the beach my younger son was snorkeling when we witnessed a little boy being stung by a jellyfish. That was the end of the beach experience for us as we had to leave the water. Food seemed overprized and the feeling was that this whole place is laid out to be a money spinner with too many tourists. They charged for every little thing. We left immediately once the waterpark closed as the restaurant prizes were off putting. There was a huge queue of people outside the entrance waiting for taxis...at least 45min wait.

Thrilling rides in a bigger water park. Beautiful setting, flowers, palm trees and a nice beach. We had a great day at Aquaventure. Maybe the size was a bit too big, as I felt we were lost most of the time. You had to walk ages from a tower to another, bummer. We rented a cabana and enjoyed its peacefulness. Kids took all the rides, loved them. I would prefer Wild Wadi.

The best water park by far.. We visited the Aquaventure water park in October 2013.During this time there was a religious holiday and the whole park was extremely busy.Barely a lounger could be found in the park after 10am, but plenty on the beach which was a 2 minute walk away.The water park is really well laid out with great fast rides for those wanting a bit of a thrill, or for the ones who just want to float, the lazy river is absolutely great - it has a number of rapids along the way just so you don't fall asleep in the sun.The whole park is spotlessly tidy and clean, much more so than any of the water parks that we have visited in the past (Florida mainly)Safety is obviously a prime concern for them, and a lifeguard is visible every 20 yards along the lazy river and plenty of other staff throughout the park.If your are planning a whole day there and there is a decent number of you going I would recommend the cabanas. They range in size & price, but you get a prime location and lots of space with loungers, seat, beanbags, tables and chairs to eat at, along with a gazebo to hide from the sun.As much bottled water as you need is provided along with ice and freshly cut fruit to keep you hydrated.

Probably the best waterpark in the world. The rides at the waterpark are sensational. We spent the whole day there and loved every minute. While entrance to the park is affordable, you struggle once you enter : food is scandalously expensive, and you have to pay for everything, including towels and a locker. Take a lot of money if you want to enjoy the day here.

Long lines at the waterpark. I was initially very hyped up about visiting aquaventure. We arrived in the morning and there was a huge line to buy tickets, anyways once we were inside the park, the lines were also huge! We only went on three rides the whole day!!! The layout of the park was nice, it was just too crowded.

Great day out. The Waterpark is a great experience and the 5 hours we spent in the water flew by. There is a good variety of rides to visit. In the morning the queues were a lot shorter than later in the afternoon. We went during Eid so we expected it would be very busy. Poseidon's revenge and the Leap of Faith are the fastest rides whereas you can relax and enjoy the park riding around the lazy river (which has some fast bits) at your leisure. It is advisable to get there early to get a sun lounger close to the rides. However,we hardly spent 5min on the sun loungers as there was so much to do for us and my younger cousin. It also has a beach with is nice to chill at after some exhilarating rides. Also has special rate for Dubai residents.

crowded during Eid...... Visited the aquaventure with family n friends during EID. it was very crowded as expected.buggy ride to the main park was good, was huge n not much of guidance. the locker room were with barcode tag which was a hassle & error ful for everyone.the kids enjoyed in the kids area which i guess was one only... apart i took them to lazy river which was fun i had. the rest atttractions had very long q...so could not have of those.there was this new attraction for 100 dhs on offer which i ride in the air, which was fun to try.the worst part is the when you exit you have to q again for a shuttle bus to take you again to your parking which was another 30-40 mins in line....over all i could understand due to rush, but the exit part is bad.but price n offer that we got was the attraction.

Great place to get lost in water world. Classic experience with all the amazing water rides especially "Leap of faith". It was fantastic experience to get wet all the day & enjoy the thrilling rides. You just forget the outside world when you are inside this beautiful place.The Lost Chambers Aquarium is must visit place to see all beautiful water species

AWESOME!!!!. This place is ridiculous - massive rides, big on design and very good on customer care.There are lots of things for little ones, but I would say this is more so geared towards older kids and adults.Lots of loungers around, very safe to leave your things so I wouldn't necessarily say to get a locker. There are a couple of bars - sharkbite and barracuda that sell good quality fast food.The newest rides are over at Poseidon's - Poseidon's Revenge is a mixture of scary but so fun and you can't come here without going on the leap of faith!

Nice but not to the expectation. A nice park but they should put a limit to the tickets they sell , as we couldn't really enjoy it cause we wasted most of the time in queues and the locker rooms are not designed to take this number of people, only 5 showers and 3 toilets and thousands of people !!! I couldn't even think of taking a shower there unless u leave earlier than the closure time of the park . The park itself is big enough with enough sitting areas. And they should consider opening earlier.

One of the best parks. This is a great water park, we stayed at the atlantis so got free access to the water park.
You can easily spend the whole day here plenty to do and the slides are amazing.
Well worth a visit.
Awesome. We stayed at the Atlantis, so the aquaventure visit was complimentary. The leap of faith is a must try.Loved the entire experience.
Awesome experience. Best in all is you get to see the Palm Atlantis hotel from the inside when you go to waterpark. Killer is the lost chamber in it..

Amazing. very nice water park with very professional staff, has many pools and games for kids and adults, it was very crowded at that time but the staff managed to get a taxi for almost everyone that has no vehicle,food is extremely expensive and no food is allowed, it was a good fun though.

Amazing. If you have family and searching for a day in a waterpark then i suggest the atlantis aquaventure. You can find many slides and pools that are suitable for families and teenagers. The view is awesome and staff is professionsl. I love it...

Good fun. Good water park, not huge or with loads of different attractions but as a hotel guest at the Palm it was very convenient. Slides are excellent and the tidal pool takes you around the park and you jump off your tube once you get to the slide etc...you want to ride. Food and drinks etc...available but not a lot of choice. Plenty of deck chairs/lounges, sun shades. Shallow pool areas and small kids themed area make it good for little one's. There are no deep pools in any case, which would be nice for a more meaningful splash but it's all good.

Definately worth a visit. We always attend a water park when on holiday and this one is definately worth going to. Great rides, a lot of variety and plenty to do. You must do the Leap of Faith, and the Shark ride where you go through the shark tank on the tubes. Brilliant! Also the new rides on the tower in the rafts were excellent too. Be prepared to queue for some, but you get that anywhere. Even the lazy river can keep you entertained for hours, with its white water rapids, and adventures on the way round!
Amazing !!!. Go head!!! It feel like disneyland but in water, i liked, and specially the rapid slide, waou!!!!and make the burj and tantrum slide, I loved that

Too slow. The landscape forces visitors to go in circles to move from a ride to the next. The "Rapid River" is not so in most of it. The slides are poor. The only exceptions are "the leap of faith" and Aquaconda.

Must do attraction in Dubai. If you are in Dubai for a few days, this attraction should be in your to-do list. I went with three stars because I expected more water rides. The water park is smaller (in terms of rides) than most water parks I have been to in the USA. A good 5-6 hours can be spent easily in this park. The lines were not too bad with about 3-4 rides where there was no wait and 2-3 rides where there was about 30 min wait time. The best ride for me was the 'leap of faith'. The web site claims ' This slide will have you falling over 9 stories in a mere second before you find yourself speeding through a clear acrylic tube surrounded by sharks and rays. ' It was an experience to remember.The locker room was a huge bottleneck for the park. The management must do something about it and this could be as simple as providing multiple locker room facilities. It took our family 1.5 hours from the time we went by the lockers. This is not great when you are pressed for time and want to spend time enjoying the park. And the park closes at Sunset (approx 6 PM). The locker security system was a joke. Almost everyone was spending nearly 10-15 minutes trying to get the scanner to scan the barcode on your wrist. And there was a long line of frustrated people. I could not see any staff around to support the issues.You can use the coupons in Dubai Entertainer to buy one and get one free ticket. We could not use the coupons because of the Eid holidays and it was a bummer.

We have enjoyed .... We were not planning to go to the Aquaventure Waterpark, but because was included in the Dolphin Encounter price we stopped there.
It was quite nice ! We have enjoyed spending the afternoon there.

Terrible for Family. I had the worst experience in any park across my life, first, you have to park your car away from the park, take a shuttle bus, where you experience the first bad queuing experience for a medium size bus, if you have some stuff for your kids it will be a night mare, the second queuing for tickets again was extremely miss, with high temperature and humidity you feel like a sauna, when I finally reached the tickets’s window, I asked for the Cabana and the employee started to give me some info about cabana, the price and size, when I asked to get it she told me its fully booked !!, and she wasn’t kidding for sure, when you pay approx. 180 USD for 2 adults and one infant for free, you go and experience the most silly lockers system in the whole world, people from all natioanalities were making fun from this silly technology, you have to scan a label and assign a locker through 3 shared screens for approximately 50 lockers per section, and you can imagine the experience with complicated process, with this limited numbers of screens and astonished people watching each others trying to find a winner, I called for help where only one staff helping the whole sections (Approx 5 time 50 Lockers ) at the same timeWhen you start your program the first thing that pop up your mind is the dress code, where you can find people swimming with their pajama and others topless side by side, with no single request to the instructions posted every where, with no single attention from the staff, people really don’t care.I have also lost some trivial things, when I reported this to the lost and found counter they told me that they cant call me because I have international number and I should have local number (International call cost approx. 0.20 US cent ) and they promised to send me e-mail, your personal stuff is not secured overall, and very limited benches for visitors where you may need to place your towels on the floor till you come back.Parks like the one in Yes islands, dreamland, Iceland all are much better, and I wont talk about value for money as I was really ready to pay to get out of this place.

Fantastic fun day. I was apprehensive about this, as both my Husband and I are in our 30's and I didn't think this would be for us. However I was very wrong and we had a really really fun day. Yes it was a little expensive but it was worth every penny. We spend the day doing all the slides (except from the leap of faith) and throughly enjoyed our day. We hardly had to queue for the slides and there were other couples of our age and older so don't be put off by that at all. I would go back here and do this again if we were back in Dubai.

But scary but fun. We spent a whole day here, arriving at 10.00 a.m,being one of last to leave at 6 p.m. Having never been to a water park before, it was amazing. They have thought of everything. Loved going round on my rubber ring, lovely staff dotted sensibly , every few metres, taking their job seriously, with a nice smile and comment as you pass them. Great rides, only little niggles, the sun beds are very close to your neighbours and the concrete gets very hot, so wear shoes, if possible. Loved the aquarium , very informative staff.
Atlantis water park. Great for steepest ride and gentle tyre rides as well as areas for tinies. Clean and again well organised. Safety people everywhere
Children loved it. I would definately reccommend this everything about it was really good, for kids and adults you and your children will want to go on everything!

Aquaventure water park. What a great day out. Whilst the cost was around £50.00 each , this included the hire of 1 small locker which we shared , and a meal deal for the both of us , which we felt was good value.Plenty of water rides for all to enjoy , and very little queueing , so great enjoyment all of the day.The other great attraction for us , was the access to the beach , and being able to swim in safety in the very warm waters.Remember to take your own towels if you can , as the rental for these works out at around £6.00 per person.Easy accessible from the Metro , Red line at stop 35 , and then a taxi ride of around 10 minutes , costing around £4.00. Always use the taxis with the green , yellow or red roofs , as these are far cheaper than the black coloured taxis.We think a great day out if you enjoy water rides.

Such fun. When it's hot, you don't want to miss this water park... This is a complete one day adventure. You have to do the dolphins encounter it's great and the slides and drops will take your breath away,, you just don't want to get out of the water. It's such fun for all ages and if you have kids, you better be able to catch up with them as they will make you walk for miles and the fun will never ends.

funny day guaranteed. This is such a fantastic waterpark. There are so much funny water slides so that I had a really great day there. The view from one of the water slides was so fantastic, you can look all over Dubai. So if you want to spend a funny day, you have to go there!

Fantastic for kids that can swim and love being wild. We stayed at the Atlantis but only went to the aqua place twice as it is tiring everything us spaced out and some things are heigh restricted I got very dizzy in the rides but my husband and boys (6&8) couldn't get enough if everything the 6 year old was the right height this time as last year aug 2012 he was too small They have a pirate ship area for younger kids that us fantastic and great fun for all the damily

A fun day out!. A fab day out at the water park despite getting sunstroke due to no shade :-( take your flip flops as the flirt gets very hot and at times you need to walk from one slide to the other! We to our entrance free as we booked to swim with the dolphins (which was amazing and a definite must if you have the cash!) Kids young and old will love this!

The leap of faith.. I was lucky to spend a week with my family everyday at this wonderful world of water which provided endless hours of enjoyment for my children not to mention myself.There is adventure for all ages with the older children able to indulge themselves in more active and challenging rides.The whirlpools rapids and waves give you a constantly moving and changing set of twists and turns and a jolly good soaking.There are plenty of attendants to supervise and guide children in this adventure and parents can relax and chill whilst the kids play.We literally spent hours and hours there in the water with no sense of time or urgency we just went with the the ebb and flow of the adventure.The whole trip was not complete without the leap of faith totally breathtaking and i did it immediatedly on arrival to get it over with scared me to death but then i am a mere mortal whilst my children are superheros and my wife always right.One word of caution the sun is intense and make sure that everyone is well protected as time goes by so easily and your skin cant read clocks.

Brilliant :). Ok, so this little experience, was a particularly pricey one, but I have to admit it, I felt it was worth it.We went during the week, so it was really quiet and we didn’t really have to queue more than five minutes for anything.We started off on the new slide circuit where the Posidens revenge slide is and worked our way up to it starting off with the smaller ones. All the slides were pretty epic, but Posidens Revenge, really did take the biscuit! You stand in a sort of capsule thing, the door shuts, the guy presses a button, you hear a countdown and all of a sudden a hatch disappears below and you drop for what seems and eternity! You then feel all the water jets helping you pick up speed as you are propelled at around 70km ph through the tube slide, including upside down, until you are spat out into daylight, gasping for air, with the ultimate wedgy. I enjoy crazy rides, but I can honestly say I now think I know how it feels for a spider, when you wash it down the plug hole.FUN JEverything else was also really good, the aquarium was amazing and also well worth paying the extra few quid.Take your flip flops as the concrete gets very hot and they save your feet

family friendly and fun. we went this summer as a family day out,it was very fun and hygienic! very well organized and very friendly personnel! We couldn't do all the attractions because my daughter got a fright of the hight! but it was one of the highlights of our family holidays!

Great day out but be warned. Great fun and very relaxing floating around on a inflatable ring all day. All the slides are connected by the water and you don't need to get out! Warning: Lifting your bottom up out of the inflatable ring on the slides is very important otherwise you can easily bruise your bottom, as I found out! I wouldn't say suitable for kids under the age of 10 at least! Plenty of lockers and sun loungers and huge beach towels to use. Quite expensive at 100GBP for two adults but a fun day out none the less, you also get to see the Atlantis Hotel up close. Metro car not really worth it over to the Palm, cheaper and quicker in a taxi. Staff dotted every 50 yards or so around the park so felt very safe, they were all very happy and friendly.

So much fun for all the family.. Theres lots to do, with plenty slides, one that goes through the shark tank too! I loved the rapids which takes a while to go round, but they're relaxing and a great touch to the park. The whole setting of the place is lovely, including the beach (although the sunbeds didnt have umbrellas!) and cafe's/restaurants. We bought the combo ticket for this and Lost Chambers aquarium, the aquarium I did not like as much, but price wise, I felt it was a good deal for a day out and what I would have expected to pay. Wish I could have done the dolphin experience, but was a little too pricey for my pocket!

Aquaventure Waterpark. I have never been to a waterpark before and this seems to have been the best place to start!We arrived early in the morning and there were no queues so we sailed straight in, we had a locker which was big enough for two people's belongings and off we wentWe started on the lazy river on a double inflatable and went on the torrents and rapids which was fun. We then went onto the slides, we went on each one once then I went back to the rapids but my husband went round and round going on the slides over and over again. The Leap of Faith was terrifying, I watched it afterwards on YouTube and couldn't believe that I had managed to go down it! The floor is very hot but they do have some sprinklers to try and cool it down but we just had our flip flops and left them at the bottom of the slides for hours and they didn't move. It was a good day and we really enjoyed it, I would recommend to anyone especially children because I think they would certainly enjoy it

A bit of a disgrace. We spent over £200 on the dolphin experience which was fine not worth £200 but still a good experience. However despite paying £200 we were still expected to pay £7 to rent a locker for a few hours which is an absolute disgrace.
