We refused to pay this out of principle and instead took it in turns to go on the rides. Really upset by the costs and the money they force you to cough up. Even basic pictures of the dolphin experience were £12 each. Insane!!!

Very Expensive but Very Good. Yes this is an expensive day out and refreshments at the park are also very expensive but it is good fun. What I loved the most was not having to climb up stairs to go on the slides. You are given a giant rubber ring, you can have a single or a double ring for 2 people. They use a conveyor system so dont really have to get out of your ring if you dont want to.Remember to take towls although you can hire them there, at a charge of course. Also good to remember flip flops as the ground can get very hot, even just walking from your lounger to the water. Bikini's are ok for ladies to wear here and it's farly relaxed but if you are a couple do not show any affection such as kissing or the attendant WILL blow a whistle at you!A good day out if not a little pricey.

Really good fun water park!. Aquaventure is a great water park for all ages. I went on a weekday in October and it was practically empty - I didn't have to queue for any slides for more than a couple of minutes! The park is easy to navigate with the use of the lazy/rapid river, which essentially takes you to each of the slides so you don't have to walk (also, it eases the queues during busy times). Most of the slides were ring slides - requiring either a solo ring, double ring or group ring. I prefer these types of water slides but if you like solo slides, this might not be the park for you.I plucked up the courage to go on the Leap of Faith (the notorious sheer drop slide that goes underwater into an aquarium) - it was definitely worth it! The food / drinks are what you would expect from any theme park / water park - overpriced and not that great, but this is something I've learnt to accept!It is also a great way to go and visit the Atlantis hotel which is amazing / slightly Disney-like! There are a number of restaurants such as Nobu within the resort which you could go to after.Overall I thoroughly enjoyed my day at Aquaventure and I would return if I went back to Dubai.

Aquaventure Waterpark. Brilliant, loved the waterpark - plenty of rides. I was too much of a coward to do some of the rides but my husband went on everything and it was great staying at the Atlantis, we were allowed in before non hotel guests and were able to come and go out of the waterpark as and when we pleased.

This place is good and the staff makes it great.. Aquaventure is lots of fun and we enjoyed every minute of it. The best part, however, is the staff. Everyone is incredibly friendly and they really go out of their way to talk to their guests. Even my children commented on how nice everyone was. The slides were great and my kids loved them. My husband and I loved the lazy river!

New Slides!. We were there just a couple of weeks after they opened the new slides. WOW. This place is a lot of fun. It's very clean, well maintained, and has more than enough staff. This is a great way to spend the day and cool off from the desert heat. Leap of Faith slide is the best!

WOW - Lots of FUN!. We have been to all the waterparks in the UAE and our kids favour Aqua Venture. The park is well maintained, the staff are friendly an helpful and there are plenty of rides to keep one busy for a whole day......or two!

Heaven. Amazing waterpark probably the best water park I've ever been to. Lots of really fun waterslides and a really long lazy river! Great for all kids at all ages and adults, I don't think there is anything better to do in Dubai.

Total fun.. Awesome place. Lazy rapid river was fun. The water rides are awesome, leap of faith is crazy, all the rides e fun. Some of them r not for faint hearted. Don't forget to wear slippers it gets crazy hot if u plan on running barefoot. Locker facility is very good, it's keyless, some kind of waterproof digital wrist band they give. So u can leave everything inside n move ard freely. Don't forget sunscreen lotion !!!!!

average. though the place is good but due to the heat one may fine it difficult to enjoy it. Going at late hour may be better as after 12 or 1pm but the park will close at 7. the changing room (lockers) are also far away from the pools.
Death slide. I'm not one for water parks, but i loved this. Go down the death slide and the rapids....... Fantastic
Worth a visit!. At this waterpark is the longest water ride in the world, which was enjoyable. The water park was clean and very well kept.
Fun!. Good fun! But too many people, especially during the weekend! Do not forget about sunprotection and hats!!

Fun Fun Fun. Hours of entertainment for children and adults alike. The best water park I have ever been to. With rides that go from the long and gentle to the short and adrenaline rush inducing it has something for everyone. A while days entertainment

super duper experience. loved the splash world for kids..beautifully set up where parents also can join the kids..kids had loads of fun. hubby tried all the other wild wild rides and did have a heart stopping time.

Fun in the Sun. It was very hot, so waterpark was refreshing. You don't feel the heat when you're having a good time, but you have to use a lot of sun screen.
Rides were fun. For a mature adult, felt like a kid again,

Great Family Fun. The Aquaventure park was great fun for our young family. The lazy river is good for children of all ages (over 2), as there are rubber rings with child seats. The waterpark and lagoons in general are very clean and well maintained.

Fun fun fun :). It was a well organized amusement park. You can pay extra and hire a locker; small one+ towel: 50 AED, big locker:75 AED. There are lots of restaurants and cafes in the area as well. It was simply fun both for kids and for adults. I strongly to go during Dubai visit.

Great day out but definitely get there earlier rather than later.. We were staying at the Atlantis Palm and therefore had free entry to the water park.The park opened at 10 am and we went straight there which was definitely the right thing to do. To start with there were probably only 5 couples in the whole park so we didn't have any trouble doing anything, by midday the park was heaving and we had to queue for things (luckily we'd done most of it by then).There are a lot of rides but I think the lazy river is brilliant and you can get on the rides without having to get off the lazy river, conveyor belts take you straight up to the top of the rides.Definitely worth it if you like that kind of thing!

Fun for the whole family. We had a fun visit to the waterpark. There is lots to explore but our favourites were floating around on doughnuts and riding the scary "Leap of Faith". The tiles on the ground got very hot during the day so bring a pair of thongs. We also left the pool during the day because the sun was just too harsh and so we went into town and returned to the pool later.

Better than expected. I have been here once before, and did not really pay any attention to the resort itself...anyway, this time I went with a group of kids and young adults and have to say I was impressed. There are lifeguards everywhere. The whole place is clean and tidy. Some of the food outlets could be a little more organised of course, for a swifter service, and to get in appeared it could be a chore with no real 'fast pass' entry system for those who know what they are doing. The cabanas looked great and I thought were good value, and as a UAE resident we all got in for half price too, which was a bonus of course. You are allowed to take one bottle of water each, which I recommend you do at AED 15 for a small water. Food and drink inside is expensive, as is usual for these places. I also suggest you get there as it opens at 0945 at this time of year as queues to get in can be long. Finally, if you can, take your own towels as they are not free, they want AED 30 each for those too! All in all though, a quality attraction, lots to see and do, safe, user friendly, easy to find your way around, just note the comments which I hope are helpful.

Don't forget the sunscreen. My 13 and 21 year olds left us for the day and went on everyslide multiple times. My wife and I took it a little easier and started off with a gentle drift around the park on a double tube. Then we took on some of the more adventurous rides, like the Rapids and the Torrent. We enjoyed a Lemon SnoTop (Shaved ice) before going down to the Beach and taking photos of beautiful Dubai. Six hours went so quick

Nice adventure for whole day. To save your money, book via internet, price is less for 25AED. You'll have to go on heated stones from locker rooms to towers, so you'd better don't leave you flip-flops in lockers. The territory is big. There are two big towers plus 1 tower for children. All towers are easily connected to each other with lazy river, so you don't need to walk a lot. The lazy river is very interesting and contains some segments like mountain river with powerful current. I visited a lot of aqua parks and I confirm that this park is worth to be visited both by adults and children.

It's bigger than you think!. Unlimited use as we were staying at the Atlantis. Brilliant rides and loved the way you can use the rapids/lazy river to climb up the water slides. Keeping walking round as there are more slides further in, and we didn't have to q for any rides!

New Attraction now open!. Last night my family and I joined a few hundred guests for the grand opening of several new water park attractions. Great evening wonderful time! My daughter and I had the chance to be the first to ride the rapids, she had so many smiles - not three years old and no fear. :)

Lazy river. As part of the 'Atlantis' package this is a must visit - even with smaller kids in tow. The new park opened while we were there and had some amazing looking 'rides' (loop the loop anyone?!), the 'lazy river' is a wonderfully relaxing 35 minute trip around the park and a great way to catch a bit more sun (with a little bit of occasional white water thrown in for good measure). No idea what it costs is you're not a resident but definitely worth a visit when you are!

best day of my life. so exciting amazing rides amazing weather great and friendly staff what more can you ask for!!!!first visit to this park heard so much about it would definately return just for the fun factor!

Fantastic day out!. Aquaventure has been recently up graded and is fantastic fun! It's definitely takes a full day if you are not staying at the Atlantis hotel. Food and drink is a little limited in the water park area but that's to be expected and there are more places to eat just by the entrance. Buy your ticket on the day at the park as the hotel reps will charge you extra as we found out with our Virgin rep which was really frustrating. It costs 250 AED per adult plus 50 AED for a towel and locker combo. You can take your own towel with you though. If you want to swim with dolphins it's extra... Women can wear normal bikinis and swimsuits although some rides can be sore on your back so you may want to take a tshirts/ rash top with you. It's definitely worth spending at least a day there..... Enjoy!!!

Great fun , also very relaxing. The lazy river was a perfect way to relax and stay cool in 42 degrees. The staff are very attentive and efficient. The family condo was great fun and quite a thrill ! The flume ride was a great laugh and fast !!!
to die for. It's made so lovely!! You feel as if you are wrapped and transported to a new region. The Lazy River is THE BEST!

Fun for the whole family. So many things to keep the whole family busy in the sun. A large variety of beverages, plenty of place to sit. And fantastic lifesavers on duty from all over the world that are so friendly and accommodating.

Lots of Fun. We spent the whole day here with tickets that allowed us into the aquarium as well. It was well worth the money spent if you know you like water parks. Nice lazy pools but lots of excitement as well. Wasn't brave enough to try it all though.

Great fun but chaotic changing facillities. My boyfriend and I spent the day at Aquaventure on 19th September. We'd bought tickets online and included a ticket to the Atlantis aquarium as well for an extra 50 Dirhams.The aquarium was great, lots of very impressive tanks with exotic creatures and a few small waterpools where you can touch starfish, crabs etc.The waterpark is accessed via the front of the hotel meaning you can wander through the lobby area and use the restaurants and shops.The park itself was great, a huge site with four or five rides. A massive water rapids route (think Centre Parcs times 10) where you go around on rubber rings through tunnels, rapids and more calm pools. The two big rides were great ( I wasn't brave enough to go on them but my boyfriend did and said they were brilliant). The almost vertical Neptune slide looked terrifying!There are quite a few areas with lots of sunbeds around them but when we arrived at about 11am they were all full and we struggled to find anywhere to sit at all. We eventually wandered over to the beach area a short walk away from the pools and slides and found some sunbeds which we moved into the shade of the palm trees. It was actually much nicer there as it was quieter and we could go into the lovely warm sea without lots of kids and rubber rings all over the place (I realise this makes me sound old and grumpy:-)There were lots of kiosks selling food, ice creams and drinks which were quite expensive but we expected that given it's a captive audience. You could also go back into the hotel to use the restaurants if you can be bothered to get dried and changed etc.The major downside is the changing rooms. There's lots of lockers (which you pay for) available. You are given a wrist band with a bar code to open your locker which was really hard to use and we spent about 10 mins trying to get it to open.The changing rooms were small, cramped, hot and not particuarly clean due to the sheer number of people using them. We stayed until the park closed at about 6pm and when we went back to the changing rooms it was madness. There were 9 showers for about a hundred people, one small area with mirrors, hand basins and two hair dryers! The women's changing rooms were just awful as there were so many people trying to shower, change, dry hair, do make-up and sort their children out. My boyfriend said the men's changing rooms were just as bad. This was a huge anticlimax to a great day. I can't imagine why they've only put 9 showers in for a park that size.We'd planned to stay at Atlantis for a nice meal after we'd finished at the waterpark but couldn't get a table in any of the restaurants as they were all full until after 10.30pm. I'd recommend booking a table when you arrive in the morning if you want to eat in the evening as with waterpark visitors and hotel guests everything was really busy. We ended up eating in the small Japanese restaurant which wasn't particularly fancy but pretty tasty. There was also a burger place if you wanted take away type food.
Wow and wow!. Brilliant water park. Rides were brilliant and all connected. It was clean and not too expensive. Also did the aquarium which was worth a visit. A must. Go go go!

Wow. Brilliant for adrenaline lovers. The slides are up there with the best and the new one - tower of poseidon - is unbelievable. You stand in a glass box and the floor goes away and you just drop through..The older rides are great too. You need to pay for a locker and towel so take a towel with you. Do the best rides first (earlier in the day) they get busier as the day goes on Food isnt great and really expensive - around £30 for fast food for two. Maybe have a big brekkie and see if you can last or just get a snackEnjoy!

A refreshing way to spend the day. The Aquaventure Waterpark in Atlantis The Palm Hotel is one of the best Waterparks in Dubai if not the best, the slides are great, it has a private sea but the water is super hot :p , it has an aquarium with possibility to swim with dolphins and/or sharks. To summarize, it's a great experience and a must if you're visiting Dubai.

Amazing!. Absolutely amazing. We stayed at The Palm so this was literally on our door step and essentially went every day that we could. It would also have been great for just a day trip, but there is so much to do you might want to spread it out over a few. The Slides are great and so Is the lazy river. My brother and I fed the rays, which I highly recommend. All the staff are so helpful and friendly, and the leap of faith is a must!

the real adventure. Great experience in waterfalls and beaches. I have never laughed like this before. Wonderful view and kind crues were the most amazing parts. I would really love to try it once more.

A great day no matter what age!. In terms of rides I think Wild Wadi wins, but as a whole experience Aquaventure wins. If you've done all the rides it's great to be able to go and relax on the beach without having to pay a price compared to Wild Wadi. The Tower of Neptune is great, shooting through an aquarium is not something you do everyday. Would defiantly recommend this!

The tower of Poseidon at Aquaventure. Enjoyed alot with colleagues at a conference at the tower of Poseidon which is newly inaguarated at Atlantis Aquaventure in Dubai. The scary rides were really very awesome & a nice experience. This kind of ride was after a long break, recently had same kind of attraction at Wonderla's water park In Bangalore - India with family. I would recommend all tourist here in dubai to visit atleast once to get those enthusiastic moment of life!!!

Excellent day with a toddler. We spent a day at the park and bought also the entrance for the aquarium, we didn't want to carry with towels and ended up renting them, keep a close eye on them because they can get stolen (we had ours stolen but we asked for another one and they kindly gave us another). It wasn't very crowded but it was a hot day, we spent most of the time at the kids area and my son loved it, he was 1.5 years old at the time, I have to say we also loved it. My husband went around in the lazy river with my son and it was about 40 mintues long, he also went in the big water slides and they were great. We spent some time in the beach, the water was so warm and you could go far from the beach and it wasn't very deep. When we changed the bathrooms were all clean and they provided shampoo, soap, hair dryer, pretty much anything you could need.The Aquarium was a nice thing to do after drying up and before going back to the hotel, it wasn't very big but it has nice decorations and loved the little story. If we would have had another day I would have definitely been back.

Little boy loved it. You can tell from just looking at this place that your kids aren't going to leave easily, right from the offset my little boy was on the slides, up and down the bridges, firing the water canons, then dashing back down in time for the giant bucket to tip, we spent alt of our holiday in here, loo ooved it.

Fun for everyone!,. I was here with a friend both of us mid 20's.. We had so much fun that we went back the next day. The lazy river is amazing you go through rapids and over watersides without having to get out of the water. The bigger watersides are great too. Lots of fun for all ages.

Hire a cabana!!. This water park is excellent - clean, plenty to do, excellent staff.We chose to hire a cabana as wanted to guarantee 4 sunbeds together and this was well worth the extra money. Bottles of water in private cooler, fresh fruit bowl delivered when you wanted it, locked storage place, sunbeds, hammock and a member of staff available to get extra food/drinks when needed.Absolutely recommend this!

Young kids are an issue. No place for baby setting, you need to book 24 hours before in kids club at the hotel for 2 years and below so adults can enjoy the place since it is impossible to leave the kids an attended.

Beach, Water Slides and Pools...can only be one place!. As residents in Dubai you can often get spoilt with the options around you, however Aqua Venture will always come up trumps! you want a day spending on the thrilling water slides, you can have it here; you want to chill on the white sandy beach or a secluded pool, you can also have either of them in the same place; there are not enough hours in a day to spend here, such a cool place; it can get overcrowded and sometimes you wish you'd have other options for lunch that fast food places but everything else is compensating; undoubtedly best waterpark in dubai with stunning views; every time we think about trying other options we think naaah, we got everything we need there, why would you go somewhere else. Plus that they are the only ones which have reduced entrance fees for residents which makes it also the most affordable. Highly recommended.
Fun. I didn't chance the Leap of Faith slide but I was cajoled into the taking the watercoasters, rapids and waves. All really good fun. There are plenty of sun loungers, towel cabanas, eateries.

It looks a bit faded and is crowded. I was not impressed. The lounge chairs are all lined up without umbrellas. You bake in the heat. Too touristy. Maybe good for families with young kids but you need to really watch them.
Excellent. This place is brilliant. There so much for the whole family to do as well as the pools and lazy rivers, rapids and water slides you can go swimming with sharks, my youngest loved this.

Good now but will be better once new part opens!. As of now they have a lazy river with rapids, a few pools that connect to the lazy river and 1 giant tower that has all the rides.. The tube rides are fun but short and the leap of faith is cool too. They are about to open another whole giant tower with more rides and stuff so once that opens its gonna be a great park!

Fun water park at the Atlantis Resort. This place is clean and fun! There are ice cream kiosks all over the place. There are clean, comfy, colorful towels. There are EXCELLENT and plentiful life guards with smiling happy dispositions spread throughout the park.There were three children separated from their parents when I was there. A life guard stayed with them and talked to them and another life guard brought each of the children a bottle of water. I don't know when/if the parents arrived, but the staff of the park were way more attentive to these kids than the parents. Kudos to those staffers!The slides and rivers were fun and entertaining.

Amazing Waterpark!. Great attractions and a good way to cool of during the hot months! The park is now expanding and I going to be even more amazing in the future! Even if you' re not a kid, you will have a blast!

Not as good as Wild Wadi.. I was so disappointed with this water park, I really did expect much more. After going on 3 or some what rides we questioned staff if there was more rides around as it all pretty much looked like the same principle and then he stated out that there are only 7 rides in the water park and we were shocked as we came to have fun. Also because they have so little rides the queues went on for ages and its so frustrating in that heat. The food and water was so expensive. A small bottle of water will cost you AED13 where in a supermarket it will cost you AED1 and a small locker here was AED40. The only good thing about this was the beach, but be careful in August as there was loads of jelly fish in the water but there was a life guard warning the public about them and walking around with a bottle of vinegar in her hand a couple of people got stung so I didn't dare stay in the water too long. Bring flip flops as it is so hot that you cant walk bare footed at all. To conclude this review if I was you I would miss this and just spend your money in Wild Wadi theres like 23 rides there and you will have so much more fun believe me on that one!

Great day trip in Dubai. Atlantis / Aquaventure We had a taxi from hilton jbr to the Atlantis.Cost 25 aed returnTo go into the Aquaventure waterpark with 2 for 1 admission from entertainer book and using the 2 for 1 locker and towel combo cost for 2 ad and 1 ch 505 Aed.It was extremely hot 40 degrees.Very little breeze.Hard to get shade.Lazy river was very long, great way to see the park.We went to the beach which was lovely and you could see the Burj Al Arab. The beach also had much cheaper drinks than the park. Could get water 13 aed and soft drinks 19 aed.We enjoyed the leap of faith, pulse, shark attack which was awesome.Pools were chaotic as everyone had their rubber rings in there as well and the loungers were all full of towels and no people on most of them which was frustrating in the heat, so this was hard.We enjoyed viewing the shark tank.We were allowed to take in a bottle each to the park of water, bags were checked on way in.Floor was way too hot to walk without flip flops.Burger and drink from fast food outlet was 68 aed.Drink refillable was 40 aed for the cup and 8 aed every time you want to fill it, prizes were extortionate inside the park.We had booked Kaleidoscope for dinner at 6pm, great idea, finished the day of really well at the Atlantis.

Excellent day out. This was my second visit to the water park and it still impresses me. The water is clean and staff are situated throughout to keep unruly people in check. There are plenty of beds to sun bath on, but get here early as they quickly get snatched up. There are a lot of snack bars situated throughout the park, however they are quite pricy for what you get. Don't even think of bringing your own drink as you get your bags check at reception. A great day out, but the heat gets a bit too much during summer months.

splash splash. where to go first... every slide is good the children's pool is very good for smaller kids, you can eat relax and go back in the pool. the rapid was awesome couldn't get my kid out of it.

Felt like a child all over again!!. Make sure you go first thing in the morning as it is less busier, and on a week day while the kids are at school. At first I was nervous it will just be children and I would look silly running around with my rubber ring. It was so much fun and everyone is so fun and helpful. It is great for all ages! I did not want to leave! There is great showers and lockers and Lots of food places and ice creams hut. We never waited for any rides and I do prefer this park more than wild wadi! You must go here, I still smile thinking about it!!

aqua venture water park. can be surely missed tha`ts why it is clubbed with lost chamber,lost chambers is a magnificient fish aquarium not to be missed.but to visit this we have to but a combined ticket with water park which costs us 85 dollars.this park is very commercial and highly expensive.don`t even allow water bottle .out side a cartoon of half litre water bottle costs 39 dirhams where as in the water park one bottle costs 20 dirhams.swimming attire will be given for rent like in many resorts you have to only buy them exorbitant prices.dolphin show pricing starts from 900 dirhams

Very Good !. Nice place, good rides and slides, good kiddies area.Less shaded areas and the ground was scorching though water sprayed everywhere. So be in your flip flops, sun cream and hat etc. Very careful and hard working staff. Since it is a huge area, it is advisable to go through the map. If visitng during Summers, Visit early morning and then later in the afternoon and relax in the shaded areas between 1-3pm !

unforgetable moment. I went there to celebrate my friend's birthday on 25th Of August. It was a great place for Waterventure. Leap of faith slides is A MUST TRY! it pumped up your adrenaline. 6 slides it's not enough, i cant wait for their new slide at The tower of Poseidon that will be open soon. But overall it is Great!

Overpriced. This waterpark was ok but their website is not very good, no details about the different ticket packages and their prices. We went for the platinum package which included entry, towel rental, locker rental, a meal and souvenir cup costing AED360 each. Think that the park could do with more rides especially for smaller kids. Dont really think there are enough rides here. Bring flip flops as it is so hot that you cant walk bare foot at all. Though it says you arent allowed any outside food and drink only at the entrance do they tell you that you are allowed a bottle of water each. Inside water costs AED13 and in supermarkets its only AED1. Ice creams cost AED20 and a meal at shark bites cost about AED55. Should have more indoor rides as in summer its just too hot.
next time I will dive. Very good aquarium with lots of things, I will dive next time to be with nose to nose with a 2 meters shark.

Great way to get away and cool down for the afternoon!. Aquaventure is an awesome water park experience located on the iconic Palm Jumeirah in Dubai. I was in the city for business and was looking to 'clear the head' for an afternoon with something different, relatively easy to get to and active whilst not strenuous.The park has a great selection of waterslides and water coasters, one of the coolest features being that once you have an inflateble tube you pretty much don't have to get off it. There are even conveyor belts that take you from the river that circles the park up to the top of the water slides and coasters.There is a speed slide through a shark filled tank and a waterslide that also gives you an up close look inside the same tank.The river that goes right around the park varies from a slow, smooth pace to rapids and waves. It is a lot of fun.The property has beach access to the waters inside the Palm Jumeirah and is in the shadow of the impressive Atlantis hotel. A mono rail leads straight up the 'trunk' of teh Palm and delivers you right outside. You can also drive or catch a cab.IMHO - Just great fun that is well worth the effort.

Blooming roasting!. This water park is awesome....but if you're going in the height of summer make sure you go early morning... as it got to 1pm all 8 of us adults that went really struggled with the heat. Also make sure you wear flipflops. My other half 'doesn't do' flipflops and burnt the bottom of his feet!! The water was warm too, so there was no light relief when jumping into the water...apparently the other water park has its water chilled :-) overall really enjoyable and our group was aged from 19-38 :-)

Water water everywhr. Location is one of the rarest ever .. end of the artificial Palm island...takes a full day to visit all rides..thr r many kids rides also .. so while buying tickets check out the options.. The park is nicely built with one of the steepest free fall - LEAP OF FAITH ride which was very very thrilling .. u can take a monorail ride from the main road till the park which gives u glances of the palm too..

Very clean and conservative friendly, wish there was more restaurants. A lovely water park, with a respect for conservative guests. I was able to buy a conservative swimsuit (Islamic swimsuit covering all body parts like a diving suit but lighter) and enjoy all of the rides with my family! I wish there were more rides that are lighter because the majority was extreme rides and I wish they would add more variety to the restaurants in the park ( very limited choice)

No venture in Aquaventure..... Theres nothing great about this water park.... its just another one...Plus its tooooo hot outside to enjoy any of its specialties... Theres a ride which takes you inside the aquarium... thats something unique....

Ducking and diving. If you have kids this would be a fantastic day out. Even without its a fun attraction if you like water and a few thrills. Bobbing gently along in so called inner tubes only to be tipped over precipices and hurled through winding tunnels. Be prepared to get wet, well it is a water park. However to do the whole park involves quite a few added extras at extra cost, ie the dolphin experience. Actually be prepared for quite a few added extras.I do recommend adding the the Atlantis Lost Chamber aquarium visit to your ticket though, as it is amazing and they must have every species of fish known to mankind and no expense spaced on the setting.

Good waterpark with no queuing. Good way to pass the day in summer. Not crowded. Relaxed on the inflated rubber rings on the river rides channels and some thrills on the rides. But modest overall.We were impressed there was no queuing for anything(Unlike disneyland!!). Take your own towel as it is not provided for free. You have to rent it for horrendous amount.food and beverages are very expensive. But everyone was well entertained for the day.
Looking for a thrilling experience?. Try the Leap of Faith with a vertical drop of 9 floors high - 30 metres! Whatever phobia you have will disappear.
Big, Beautiful, Nicely designed. Among the water parks I have visited this is the best. Anyway if you will be there in high season, you should expect many people to be there. Anyway still it is good.

Absolute thrill !. This park will thrill you at all ! They have the highest slides I have ever seen and been on! One of the slide goes at the bottom of the fish tank with sharks and you get out there and watch them all swimming around you! My heart was pumping when I saw them!

You will lose track of time. I am not a fan of waterparks normally but this manages to be a brilliant waterpark with rides for all ages as well as an amazing lazy day out in the sun for those who don't want to throw themselves down vertical drops.If there are a few of you going, book a cabana for the day. We had one for four of us but it could easily have fitted eight and it was only £130 for the day. For that we had a private area, four sun loungers, a double sun bed, hammock and fat boy chairs plus unlimited towels and a brilliant assistant (Krish!) on hand all day to help with anything we wanted.The park is immaculately clean, the refreshment stands are plentiful (and not expensive) plus there are lifeguards every few feet in the water - lifeguards who interact with the children and who go out of their way to help.A fantastic day out!

Splash. Get your heart into the sky at The Tower of Neptune and relax on the inflated rubber rings on the river rides chanels. Take a tour behind scenes and learn about marine life, have a under water shark safari walk, book the cow nose ray feeding or ambassador lagoon snorkeling. We did them all... What we didnt was Try the New Tower of Poseidon - but now should be ready for you

Wonderful place to go in summer. to have fun and enjoy time with family escape from summer heat in Dubai Defiantly go to the water park great slides especially The Leap of Faith if you like adventure swimming with the dolphins unforgettable experience also the beach restaurants near by the only problem price is a bet too high starts with 620 AED Plus anything included food or beverages is expensive not to mention photos you need to buy them at a really high rate so consider spending a high amount of money it could go up to a 1000 AED for a person which is really insane rather than that its wonderful so have fun.

Not as good as Disney watermarks. If you have a spare day in Dubai and have never been to a waterpark, then it's worth a visit. But...Ground was very hot, especially from the changing area to the slides. Would suggest water proof/surfing shoes to wear int he park.Signs for the rides were lacking. It was very difficult to know which you slides you needed an inflatable ring for, and which you didn't. Attendants weren't particularly helpful. When you did need a ring, you had to search for one at the bottom of a Slide, fight others to get one and then carry it up the steps. The part I did like was the fact that most of the larger slides were connected and you could stay in the water and get carried around the lazy river, up ramps up to the next one. Food was expensive, but it's always the same in these places.

Great Waterpark. We had a good day at Aqua venture could of spent another we got lost on the never ending lazy river. Quite expensive trip for a family of four we went for the combo tickets with the lost chambers, enjoyed the park a lot more. Fast food meal in the park is 55 dirhams but you can by with your admission ticket for 45 dirhams.

A great way to cool down in summer!. Aquaventure Waterpark was thoroughly enjoyed during our stay in Dubai. With complimentary entry from the Atlantis hotel, we visited the park everyday.Getting there earlier is definitely worth the effort as it does get busier in the afternoon. The wider availability of kids tubes was a big bonus for our kids and we were amazed to see how few lines there were.

NEAR DEATH EXPERIENCE. I am still pondering what to do about my recent family trip to Aquaventure. My mum and other members of my family came to visit me in Dubai and the kids wanted to go to Aquaventure... off we went despite the huge expense: 8 people for the waterpark; 3 of them for Dolphin experiences and the other 5 of us paid extra for passes to observe the Dolphin interactions, not to mention x8 people eating at the buffet restaurant after the day's 'fun'. Firstly, we had 3-4 packets of crisps in our bags that were removed by security and we were unable to reclaim them. Plain annoying!So, off we go onto the rings that float around and we come to 'the rapids' - well, mum was tipped upside down (she can't swim) and was dragged and thrown about under the powerful fast-flowing water for the duration of 'the rapids' - ahead of her I had no idea what had happened until I looked back and heard cries of 'help me, help me' - and I saw her distraught face resting on the side of my friends ring as she was being supported by them to keep her head above water. THEY SAVED HER LIFE. Despite all the 'lifeguards' you see dotted around nobody came to her rescue. We got her out of the water ASAP and asked the 'lifeguard' (who did nothing when he was needed) for a buggy - he said it wasn't possible and we should just walk down the 'river' "it's a lazy walk." Still in shock and unsure how much water mum had swallowed etc, we just did it. Panicking at the thought of being in the water at all, it was awful for her. So, as we're walking (mum is in a ring I am pulling as she was having difficulty walking) another 'lifeguard' says "you can't go that way" so in no uncertain terms I tell her 'Yes we are.' We come to the end of the 'river' and again ask a lifeguard for a buggy as the floor was scorching (ridiculously hot and impossible to walk) - surprise surprise, request denied again. As a diabetic with unknown injuries this was another ridiculously frustrating challenge - but again, we had no choice but to walk on fire hot ground - mum SCREAMED in agony and had to take refuge near a kiosk whilst I ran to get footwear. We finally get to sit at a cafe area and mum thinks her toe is broken, and by a stroke of luck a pleasant employee was nearby who organised a buggy to take her to get checked out at the medical centre, etc. Meanwhile we realise we're just about to miss the Dolphin interaction appointment. I called to explain what happened and they said "we'll call you at the medical centre," was obvious they wanted to verify the story first! Eventually, x3 Dolphin interactions were re-scheduled for the following day but the other 5 of us who paid app. 20GBP extra each to observe would not be allowed to re-schedule, but we were most welcome if we paid the 40GBP per person waterpark entrance again!!!!! WHAT!?Manager of the waterpark attends the medical centre and the most pressing question I had was: "Why did the lifeguards not help her?" He said he'd have to do his investigations and get back to us. Along the traumatic journey after the accident, various staff were rude, found the situation funny and sniggered - and the manager was more interested in that than why vital lifesaving did not happen. All in shock at this point, we get out of there as quickly as possible (mum via buggy).Later that day the manager calls to ask if 'Madam' was OK? She was in pain, and had aches and pains all over - but to be frank we all tried our best to steer her to the positives - she was still alive! I asked him what went wrong and he said the 'spotter' (mistaken as a lifeguard) did see a lady to come off but failed to inform the lifeguards and he had been disciplined and due to safety reasons 'spotters' are not allowed to enter the water their as it is dangerous!!!!! DISCIPLINED! Not even fired, I am shocked. What if it was a child???Two weeks later and mum is having panic attacks and the next day woke up with horrid cuts and bruises, some of which have still not healed due to being diabetic. Mum wants to take it further, which I have been reluctant to do knowing Dubai (I broke two toes on the Dubai Metro and was not even able to officially file a complaint).What to do? For now, inform as many people as possible. If you take young kids best to get a lifejacket as next time Atlantis may not be so lucky to get away with such negligence.

Enjoyable. We got our entrance included when we paid for our dolphin encounter. We enjoyed the lazy river ride staff were good fun and it was very relaxing at times :-) we were impressed there was no queuing for anything. My main recommendation would be to take flip flips or sensible footwear once u have put all of your belongings in the lockers as the floor got ridiculously hot ( this would seem like common sense but definitely worth adding in this review as it almost ruined our experience) we spent a few hours here but personally couldn't spend the whole day, nice size area if you have children and nice beach area :-) good way to experience the Atlantis

Great fun. We absolutely love this place. It is amazing for the kids. The lazy river is the most relaxing bit. The rapids are fun. We have done the leap of faith a few times, which I still find scary and take a few days to feel brave enough to have a go. The Tower of Neptune Waterslides are all great fun, but you do need to collect a ring from the bottom and clim to the top, which you don't have to do in wild and wadi, the shark attack ride, is fun, as the bottom part goes through a clear tube in the sharks tank full of rays and tropical fish.

Not so great for younger kids. I do think that Wild Wadi is better for younger kids and Aquaventure is better for older kids and adults. I liked the aquarium in the ride... but the smell of fried food about the place was a bit off-putting.

good sized water park with not very long queues. Its lovely, clean, with lots and lots of life guards which is comforting when you are with young children. The changing room s are nice and clean. Please take your own towel as it is not provided for free. You have to rent it for horrendous amount! Take a large locker if you have kids as the size is not great.

Nothing Special. As water parks go, this is pretty average. Expected more in Dubai, given its attempts to outdo everything. The rides are modest and probably aimed overall to young families. Its expensive too. Still its a day out and a break from sunbathing and shopping

Good day. You'll find you'll have plenty of blisters due to the rough surface on some of the rivers connecting the rides! Apart from that it is probably one of the nicest water parks in the UAE and will fill a full day easily! Food is slightly overpriced for the quality but worth a visit when visiting Dubai!

Okay. Personally, I prefer Wild Wadi as I think it has more rides and for all ages to enjoy. I was at the hotel and therefore this was free to use.
I thought this was too repetitive after just a few hours.

Excellent!. Great family day out. The rides are amazing and there are alot of rides. Plenty of food choices available. Plenty of floaties around for everyone to use. Enough sun loungers available. We were a family of 2 parents, 23 year old, 15 year old, 11 and 6 and everyone was well entertained. Aquaventure is much better than wild wadi in my opinion as there is more for younger children.

Dolphin swim. I visited this park as it was included in a dolphin swim. The whole day was great. I loved the rapids and lazy river. To go all way round without getting off the inflatable tyre takes about 30 min. Very relaxing. The rides were ok but I did not go for them. The dolphin swim was the best. Deep water experience, getting towed by 2 and pushed on a boogie board. The only slight downside was cost of pictures but very high quality and once in a lifetime so could put up with it.

Great day!!. Had a great day floating around the waterpark and going on slides. Park was spotless and staff very friendly. Life guard every 20 metres so very safe. Lots of Cabanas to relax on, towels available for guests and plenty of shade while resting. Would go again!!

Excellent family day out. We visited the Aquaventure park as a family, i had pre booked my tickets through attractions direct which speeded things up on arrival.Overall the park was a fantastic day out, and the kids loved the lazy river and rapids ride. Although the park was full and it does get busy but you never really feel this which is great and there was also plenty of tubes all the time.

Not as great as expected. Rides seemed a little repetative but a decent day trip in general. Food a touch expensive for what you get but that was expected given you have little choice but to eat on site.

Great day out.. Hated the rough ground in all the pools and rides. We all had cut feet, water shoes are a must if you are visiting this attraction. Kids loved it especially the slide that went through the shark tank.

spend the day there!!. Its a good place to spend the day in water in the middle of the desert.. take your own towels etc..Plan the tickets with the water park and the aquarium together for a better bargain..
Must see for your kids. Our 5 yr old boy loved the encounter with the dolphins and the whole water park experience. A place where even parents get to relax

Fun on the Palm. Getting to the Aquaventure is the most difficult part due to being limited to taking the monorail but once you are there its fantastic, great slides, nice layout of park and fantastic value for money, great day out!!!

A must do. The waterpark consists of a set of connected lazy rivers with sections of rapids. In the centre is a large aztec style pyramid which hosts a series of slides. Some of the slides you get to by being transported up the side of the pyramid on a converyor belt whilst you sit in your rubber ring; others you need to carry your ring or for the death slide you don't need a ring. Some of the slides actually you actually go though the aquarium inside a tunnel. Not that you see much when riding the death slide.
Dolphin experience. Loved the dolphin experience and the water park was great, however we felt that Wild Wadi was better than this

Great Waterpark!. Really enjoyed the visit to Aquaventure. As we were staying at the hotel our visits to the park were complimentary. The rooms are quite far from the waterpark itself. The rides are great. Something for everyone.

The best WaterPark ........ Great waterpark. A blessing during summer month when the temperature hits 50 degrees celcius. Great rides and lazy river.... The best place in Dubai to cool down from the heat in Summer.

Wicked. This place looked amazing we stayed in the Atlantis what was wicked as well I did not actually go on any of the slides but husband and brother and dad did the loved everything they even went swimming with sharks and me and my 18month old swam with the dolphins was so cool wish I could have gone on all the slides also they was just finishing there two new slides poor workers was doing so much in the heat of 47 to god know wat degrees England need theses builders they hire so many that a building could go up in weeks or months no joke and also they was just finishing the new zip wire hope I go next year n maybe the little one will b able to do the lazy river n that can't wait

Adrelanine. The waterpark is great and is definitely worth going to. loved the 'Leap of Faith' which is 27.5m tall and 61m long and you basically get catapulted through a shark tunnel at great speed! There are a few other rides that also go through the shark tanks plus a huge lazy river type ride, the rapids and there is also a beach where you can just go and relax.

Too busy. We are a family of 4 and visited the waterpark on a Monday in August. Its expensive both to get in and to buy food and drink in the park. You can hire towels and lockers at a price. The lockers are not conveniently located - they are near the entrance but nowhere near any of the sunbeds or attractions so if you need to return the lockers for any reason its a bit of a trek. You can pre-load money onto wristbands to spend on food and drink in the park and then get reimbursed any unspent money from the Refund Desk on your exit. The lazy river with rapids is great. We also enjoyed the rides but as the day went on it just got too busy. Very long queues started to amass, the floor is burning and it was just too hot to hang around waiting in queues. The water was not particularly cool, so it wasn't exactly refreshing when you took a dip - it was more like getting into a warm bath. We noticed that some new rides are being built, not sure when they open but I am sure they will be an improvment as, to be honest, at the moment they're are not that many rides to enjoy, bearing in mind the huge size of the park. We visited Aquaventure for a day last year during Ramadam and we more or less had the park to ourselves, it was bliss. This year, not during Ramadan, it just became unbearably busy for us. If we left our sunbeds, we would return to find other people sitting on them and not minding at all that they were sitting wearing wet clothes on our dry possessions. If we return in future, it would definitely only be during Ramadam when things are less hectic as its an expensive day out if you end up not 100% enjoying it.

Over rated. We went to the water park in two consecutive days. The park employees were very nice and helpful. The lazy river was relaxing. Poorly designed park as The main attraction were not easy to find and when we managed to find them they were very crowded. The shower and locker area was far from the pools and attractions. the lockers were placed inside the shower rooms and can be opened by only one member of the family member via the wrist band. Everytime one of my 4 childeren wanted something from the locker, they had to find me so i can accompany the to the distant locker!! The water seemed to be slightly warmer than body temp, I would have wished if the water was slightly colder. The most disapointing fact was that smoking was prevalant in all areas of the park. The rule is that smoking is allowed near the blue ash trays which were already distributed throughout the park and not in isolated locations. It was normal to find people walking and smoking between childeren infront of park attendants!! I asked attendents twice why they are not upholding smoking regulations, the answer i recieved in both occasions was that people get mad when we ask them to stop smoking!!

Nice opportunity to visit Palm Jumeirah. We visited waterback in summer (45° C), and we appreciated spending the afternoon in water, even if we had to stand in line a long time for each activity.Don't miss the Leap of faith (only if you really have faith).Expensive for a family (250 AED (50 Euros) for adults, 205 for children under 12). 10 % of discount if you buy tickets by Internet.

Great family fun. We have now been a few times and always loved it. Get The Entertainer vouchers. Do not sit in the areas around the pools, they get very crowded. Go out onto the private beach (great views and swimming, lots of space and a beach bar). The rides cater for all ages and the staff are usually very friendly and helpful. Leap of Faith is genuinely quite a thrill.Put money on your wristbands and keep valuables in the lockers and if you can avoid the rush at the end of the day by using more vouchers in one of the restaurants, Kaleidoscope is actually decent value.

Great Waterpark. Part of the Palm Atlantis - if a guest at the hotel you get unlimited access during your stay.Water slides are limited but they are adding more right now !The lazy river is ace as it has various rapids throught which speed things up a bit ! loads of loungers. Towels provided if a guest. Lockers are pay only. Drinks etc within the park not too pricey about 18dhs. kids meals around 40dhs.take flip flops as the ground gets toasting hot on the feet !

Good fun, but in the open. The waterpark is in the open air and therefore is extremely hot during the summer months. The humidity makes a summer visit a waste of time. The food and drinks are over priced.

Awesome!. Great place where you could spend so many hours having fun and enjoying the lovely rides in there!! can't think of any better choice, Wild Wadi is bigger and got more options but this place is also awesome and different too .

Good fun. We stayed at the Atlantis mainly because this was attached to it and was complimentary. Went during Ramadan but thankfully we could still buy drinks and food. We camped out at the kids play pool. Super hot, so make sure you try to get spots under the trees. Drinks and food seemed rather expensive and rather oily. The security like to check your bags for food and drink but we managed to just get past it since we had stuff at the bottom of our buggy (plus we needed baby food anyways). As hotel guests, towels are included as well and you have access to safety jackets for everyone (?), and the floating donuts.One of the pitfalls though was it can take *ages* on weekends (Fridays) to get the double donuts with the child seat because it's so busy. I think I waited for an hour around 10-11am and just gave up after a while. Other days seem to be fine.

Great but could be better - full review. I tried to find out how this place actually works by looking on the Atlantis website, but couldn't really find out much information, so here is a full review of exactly what to expect, to help my fellow water park goers. 1 - The parking area is set away from the park. You have to pay for parking and then get the shuttle bus back to Aquaventure, which is located in the Avenues area of Atlantis.2 - Try to get an Entertainer voucher as it's not cheap! Also, and no one told us this, and it's not clearly noted anywhere, you can pay in advance for any food and drinks inside the park, and the credit is given to you by way of a wrist band. This way you don't have to take cash with you and don't have to worry about your wallet coming out of your pockets while on the rides. Each time you buy something, your wrist band is scanned/deducted with the cost of the item, then at the end of your visit, you get any cash back that you have not spent. You cannot take any food or drink into the park so you will be spending money inside.3 - You can get a locker inside for your valuables/bags etc. You can also rent towels if you don't want to lug your own all the way to the Palm with you. The lockers are located at the entrance and are in both the gents and ladies areas.4 - I highly recommend some form of footwear. The ideal foot covering are the little wet socks - I have no idea what they are called, but they sell them in the park, and I'm sure you can get them before you go from any sports shops. They are like little booties (same material as a wet suit) with a rubber bottom. There is a bit of walking to do between rides/entrance, and the pathways are not clean/not even, plus they are ridiculously hot (especially walking up the steps to the main rides) so expect your feet to get burned! The management really should do something about this as it's not pleasant. I wore flip flops, but you have to remember where you left them, and there is no guarantee they will be there when you get back!5 - There are sunbeds everywhere and there is a beach with lots of sunbeds. These are included in the entry fee. If there is a group of you, I would recommend taking all your stuff, and grabbing a few sunbeds - then using this as your base camp while everyone goes off to enjoy the water attractions. In a larger group there are always people staying at the sunbeds so you can take it in turns to watch your stuff.6 - There is no place in particular to get your floaties for the lazy river/rapids. You have to just 'find' them in the water. This was bothersome, as it took us some time to get ours. Once you get it, hold onto it!!! You have to take your own float to the water slides, you cannot get them there - seems a bit ridiculous to me but there you go. You can get a single float, or a double. They also have floats for small children. These have a 'seat' in them, so the child can't slip out the bottom.7 - There is not much variety on the food and beverage, and they are all expensive. A small bottle of water is AED 13 (at time of writing) and a chocolate ice lolly was AED 20.8 - There are changing rooms with showers and hairdryers (in the ladies at least :-))9 - When you leave, there is no obvious place to get the cash back from your wrist band. We had to ask a couple of people who pointed vaguely to one counter or another. At our third request, we were asked to go to the 'Hotel Guest' window, where our refund was given. Why not just have a window labellled 'Refunds'.10 - It is very hot when you are in the bright sunlight - sounds obvious, but you may think that being in the water you will not really get too hot. If you are sensitive to the sun, wear a t-shirt or some kind of waterproof top, as you are burning without realizing it while you are floating along the lazy river. There are a few shady areas on the route, but not many, so each is a welcome reprieve from the sun. Management - how about some of the cool air misting machines in the tunnels?11 - All in all a very enjoyable day and my 14 year old niece loved it.

Fun day out in the sun. We all really enjoyed the water park a lot. We went there for a second time and would love to go again. Hygiene was much maintained than other water parks. Loved to be in the lazy pool with kids. Food is good and take a package deal with meal and locker which is better on the budget. So much to do, the slides, pools, dolphin bay and the beach.

awesome day. yesterday i went to aquaventure waterpark and the aquarium with my younger brother...it was totally fun...the beach was gud...the slides were awesome...one of the best thing when we have to slide from about 50m height with a speed of about 70 km/h...it was total fun...overall it was a awesome trip and i would do it again if i got the chnce...

Nice program in a hot summer. Visited the place the first time although have been living here for 7 years. The summer promotion of the discount for residents makes it more "value for money". My kids liked the lazy river a lot, even though we were not allowed in the rough parts. The kids slide/pool area does not cater properly for all age groups and I even found it dangerous for my 2 years old, there should be something for each age group there. My 4 years old enjoyed the slides a lot, the sudden flow of water on your head was not very much appreciated and the stream is quite strong even for an adult. Fastfood was available inside despite of Ramadan (whish was good for our hungry kids) but the food and drinks are severely overpriced even for Dubai. It is a good place to spend a hot day as you can be in the cool water all the time.
Excellent Waterpark. One of the best & safest Waterparks I've been to. There is a continuous pool/ slide/rapid ride that u can stay in for as long as u want. Plenty of sun beds too for just relaxing.
Nice place!. Amazing park, adventurous! Very fun and must visit. Lockers are overly expensive to rent!!!! Can't bring your food with you while inside food is not that available beside overpriced!

Overrated. The dolphin bay was amazing, friendly service and staff outstanding. Made you feel safe and welcome. Highly recommended experience. However the water park was a let down. Lack of swimming pools, slides and no wave machine. Would not recommend water park, Wild Wadia down the road better.

worth a try. -250 AED Per person.
-Try to buy it online or get a two for one voucher from the entertainer
- Definitely try leap of faith.

Hours of fun. My husband and I enjoyed floating on blow-up floaties around the park, even though we are mature adults. I wish my kids were there as the amount of various water rides is amazing. It took us more than an hour to go around the park on a floatie; you go up by an escalator and then rush down, just keep going and going. Certainly recommended for families with kids.

Wow, great adrenaline rush..... I've been to other water parks but this one is by far the best one. Great rides, thrilling and fun. Excellent surroundings and one of the best and warm staff I've ever had the pleasure to meet. But the food was bad. We ordered burgers, it was horrible.

It's good but could improve. We are currently staying at Atlantis so have free access to the water park daily. So far we go early (10am) to avoid the crowds and que less for the big rides ie Leap Of Faith. Only my 9 year old has had the guts to do that one so far! The kids splash pool is excellent for little and big kids alike. Most of the rides you will be in floats, which is handy as you don't have to keep getting out of the water, also keeps you cool. It is expensive for food and drink also lockers are about £8-10. Towels are available to all. It could do with some more rides and also some water coolers/ sprays to help people stay cool in the heat. Early evening is also less busy as people not staying at the hotel make their way home . Wild Wadi is better although obviously if you are a guest at the hotel it is definitely worth going.

Fantastic Day out!. The day we went it was sooo hot! but the great thing about it is you can just relax going through the park in your rubber ring(which you dont need to buy like other water parks). You dont even have to get out the water to go on most of the rides which is good! No Ques, and as a hotel guest we could go as often as we wanted for free!!!

Not bad but not on a hot day. The park itself is pricey. The acquariums are very impressive, rides diversified but it is really difficult to manage the stay in hot summer day. the park gets also crowded.
loads of fun. my 2 sons of 17 and 15 loved the water park with the lazy river to the rapids also through the shark tube spotless grounds plenty to do great family day out

good fun. went on a day that wasnt too sunny but still hot so avoided dreaded sun burn and back and fore the lockers putting sun screen on all day!! lockers are split between men/women as are changing rooms etc. the dolphin experience is definitely worth it and theres lots of lovely souvenir shops. you can catch on the local carts to catch a lift back and fore the dolphin part of the water park. the rides/slides are fab especially going through the rapids!! it is a nightmare to get hold of an inflatable ring so be sure to hunt for one - many people tend to take theirs and then keep them by their sunbeds for most of the day which can be infuriating but speak to staff who SOMETIMES will help out and get you a ring :)

Great for an active day or a lazy day!. We visited twice during our stay and enjoyed the waterpark. It's too warm to sit and sunbathe and gets very busy however we loved the rapids/lazy river and spent all day just going round that! It was the perfect way to cool down. If you want a locker though you need to pay for it. If you go in from the hotel you need to go to the reception bit of the waterpark and pay for an additional wristband that you use for the lockers. It was confusing and we probably spent about 20 mintues trying to figure out how to work the lockers as no one had explained this to us before we went in and there were no assistants available in the locker rooms to ask.

Awesome :). Im not a big fan of roller coasters and sudden drops but here i actually had fun. There were a few fast rides for my liking but there were enough for me to have a good time as well. I really enjoyed the river. It was a fun family outing.In the heat, it was good to cool off in the water.
Lovely and Fun Waterpark. We had a good time at the Waterpark, plenty of staff around the park, make it very safe. Clean and plenty of foods store, the whole family had a great time there.

Amazing Waterpark in The Middle East. Aquaventure is the only waterpark where you can have interactions with marine animals in their shark infested lagoon in Ziggurat. You can feed them and even wear a helmet and go to the bottom of the lagoon where you immerse brushing shoulders with sharks and stingrays. It is the largest waterpark as it is 17 hectares in area and has it's own beach access. The ambiance and atmosphere is reflective of Dubai's melting pot philosophy, as you could see all nationalities there and not a singular dominative culture or nationality unlike other waterparks. The quality of service is amazing as they are connected to a 5 star hotel.

Lovely water park and super fun!. We spent about half a day here, and chose it because it was part of the Atlantis Hotel, which we wanted to see as first time visitors to Dubai. The entry fee is not really cheap, but we found nothing was in Dubai! It is still definitely worth going to. The park is very clean, beautiful and we had so much fun riding all the water slides. I haven't been anywhere like this in about 6 years but think you are never too old! The Leap of Faith waterslide is a must do - pretty scary as it is almost a vertical drop but an amazing experience! If you hire a locker, be prepared for it to be somewhat annoying trying to unlock it - you have a wristband you have to scan, and mine was faulty. Then at the end of the day, I realised it had fallen off probably on a waterslide, so had to get staff to open it for me which took a little while. Next time we go to Dubai we would like to try Wild Wadi, but I would recommend this one to everyone! I also got great photos from the top section of the highest waterslides as there are views of the city, sea and surrounds. Loved it!

Everyday fun at Aquaventure Waterpark. Compared to Wild Wadi, it is a bit smaller but can be as much fun if you are happy spending half a day doing these activities. If you are staying at Atlantis, do not go out of the hotel for fun!

The good, the bad and the ugly... and awesome. Going to the waterpark is a great way to cool down, so I thought.We were overcharged, didn't get the towel-tickets as originally requested. When we enquired about being overcharges we were met by a young man who wasn't helpful and refused us to speak to his supervisor, because he was the boss and he did not have a boss :(We went to the waterpark and had our bit of fun. The tubes were great, the loungers were good and the beach was good and there are helpful staff or lifeguards everywhere.The only thing that could be better was the weather.The people in the restauarant Shark-Bites were most helpful in our lunch, and the food portions were rather generous, albeit a little pricey at first glance. That is until the portion arives. Top Tip... Buy the souvenir cups and spend AED8 per refill, instead of spending AED18 per coldrink. Especially in hot weather where you do consume a bit more than normal.Time flew way too quickly and it was soon time to go.Enjoy!

Well worth a visit. Great water park with some top attractions. Plenty of sunbeds, plenty of refreshment kiosks, plenty of lifeguards. Place is spotless.Well worth every penny of the £100 entry fee for two people which included towels, lockers and two meal deals.If you don't like the prices, don't go....simples.Highly recommend you try if your in Dubai.

So much fun. We spent the whole day and had an awesome time. There is something for everyone no matter what your age. They have spared no expense with this place. There is never a time you don't feel safe in the water as there are lifeguards on every corner watching you and even chatting to you as you pass. They are all so polite and friendly. Will even look for your lost hat when you loose it one of the rides like I did and they gave back when I next passed by them. It's definitely value for money all around. There are lots of choices to eat and drink as well. If your brave enough do the leap of faith it's an awesome ride if you can handle it. If you do they will even give you a certificate with your photo if you choose to purchase it. Highly recommend going.

Splashers children park in Aquaventure not sanitary. We went to Aquaventure for the sole purpose that they had the children's park. When we went to enter they first said it was closed. We began to inquire and they just said they were adding chlorine. After asking why again they said because someone had a bowel movement and they were putting more chlorine. They have no set rule about babies wearing little swimmers or even a diaper. It should be in forced! they sell them on the premises. After hearing what happened I just could not bring my granddaughter in that park our entire stay. The thought just sickened me.

Great fun. This water park was great fun for us, & free to use if your staying in the Atlantis. There are not as many rides as you may find in some European water parks. It's very clean & safe. There are plenty of life guards everywhere!
Great waterpark. This is great place for anyone to have fun. Only one thing you have to remember to travel in spring or fall. We were there in July and it was too hot, air is hot, water is hot.

Awsome I felt like a little kid. This really feels like water disney land for adults too. Never been to a similar park definately worth your money, the park might be small but the slides and the aqarium is really nice. I had an awsome day with my partner.
Brilliant. Loved this waterpark. Very clean with lots of sun loungers. Good air conditioned fast food restaurant for a bite to eat and rest from the scorching summer heat! Loads of great slides.

An enjoyable day...... Myself and husband had a really fun day! We went on most of the rides with no queues, lifeguards everywhere so safety is paramount. it is expensive but managed to get BOGOF tickets so wasn't too bad.

Average. We travelled to the Atlantis and done the joint day out of Aquaventure and The lost chambers. The water rides are good but in the heat of July, 3 hours is plenty for the water park. you can drink there during ramadan.

Great Day Out. Our family had an amazing day out here after swimming with the Dolphins. Great flumes and rides, lovely beach area and in general good day out. Sadly during Ramadan, only one food outlet open which was not too good, however, did not spoil their day.

great. Amazing waterpark, ideal when staying at the palm. Cant wait to see the extension to it opened.Lazy river was fab, The tunnel you go thru in a tube is amazing too. Just a bit warm to walk about in july.

Great, don't listen to complainers. Apart from being very expensive for all extras (food, lockers, ray feeding) - the waterpark is fantstic place for fun in the water for small, big and grown up children:-).Don't understand complaints on lacking plastic tubes - there are hundreds of tchem floating empty in the lazy river - just to pick up as many as your family needs. There singles, dubles with two holes and doubles with one hole and the other part with baby seat for small kids.They allow kids over 120 cm on all big slides (including the Leaf of Faith going steeply down to the shark tank). Smallest kids must stay in kids' pools (also fun, ut limited space). If you have kid just slightly over 120 - ask for permanent blue wrist band (they have tchem in the office), you will avoid measuring at every enetrance to the slide and every mid-gate at the lazy river, saves a lot of time and arguing as some of the Staff are judgemental (they don't want to risk, so didn't want to let my daughter in, despite her being 122 cm tall.It's great that entrance ( and skipping the entering line) is free for hotel guests - just ask for the wristband at the hotel - in the Imperial Club reception for its' guests and at the entrance for the other guests. You don't feel preassured t stay in the waterpark for the whole day this way - we were going every day of our stay for 2-3 hours and that felt just perfect.Have your flip flops handy when going in hot months - in July walking without them between attractions in the park is practically impossible unless you are an Indian fakir :-).

Family Day. The water park was ok, we have been to better ones in Queensland Australia. The kids enjoyed the day which was very hot. You need to be careful of burning your feet on the paths and be prepared to line up. Our entry was included with our stay at The Atlantis Palm Hotel which was amazing.

Hot, expensive, not well thought out. We visited only because our Dolphin Bay tickets included entry to the park, otherwise probably wouldn't have bothered. You can't take any food or drinks into the park & what is available to purchase is really expensive. £10 for a hot dog, £3 for a portion of chips. If they had slightly better priced things then we would have definitely have stayed longer in the park. They should copy Alton towers, Orlando theme parks where you can purchase their big plastic cups for £6 and refill it all day long. In 40c weather that would have been welcome. The water coming out of the little showers around the park was hot!! It's impossible to walk around for long without your shoes/flip flops and you aren't allowed them on the rides. It's one of those places once done one time you wouldn't return to.

Not very impressive.. Was a very hot day and walk ways were like walking on fire. Rides are childish and not enough of them. Not value for money. It might be worth staying at the hotel next door for a couple of nights so not to make the effort in going and paying the big box for it. The beech is useless with jelly fish and lack of waves. Again like other attractions in Dubai once done you wont be back. I might have enjoyed it more if it wasn't so hot and drinking water was a bit cheaper. Only hot/boiling water comes out of Pool side showers, how mad is that?

Great fun but needed flip flops on footpaths.... Spent a great day here, not sure we managed all the rides as the queues were so long by the afternoon. We went in mid June and the footpaths were scorching hot so had to dump our flip flops at the bottom of every ride (at Wild Wadi they have water jets to keep the footpaths cool) The rides we went on were all good, it's a bit bizarre when you go up a steep conveyor belt ramp on a big rubber ring only to go down a very small slide. The admission ticket also includes access to the beach which we visited for a short while which seemed very nice and you can tick 'swimming off the palm' off your list of things to do there (or is that just me? )

Older kids. The park is brilliant if your kids are a bit older and can go on all the rides, not worth to go with young kids, unless you don't mind spending the whole time at the kids pool or have someone to assist while one of you can go on the rides.Good options of places to eat, sufficient places to sit and rest, not very long queues, organised, clean and great fun.
Brilliant. Well worth the money to visit here, we love it, everything under one roof. Take a visit down to the beach too the views are great and the beach is lovely.

Hot hot hot. It is a fabulous waterpark but when it is blistering hot during the Summer months in Dubai, it is a punishment. We left after just 2 hours as the water was not cool and there was not a cool spot at the park ............

Aquaadventure Waterpark - Average. I think this is very good but only if you have grown up kids or travelling with a group. For families with toddler and just parents,,,, not much to do. you will find you will be going in turns to take rides.

It's all about Leap of Faith. The journey to Atlantis over the Palm Jumeirah, itself is beautiful. The rapids, the rides, the slopes are good. But what steals the show is Leap of Faith. A suggestion: Do not try the Leap of Faith at 1st hand, otherwise you will lose interest in other rides.We got some kind of discounts(though I do not remember how mush) in our ticket to Aquaventure which includes the locker cost, the towel price and also includes a snack.The usual rapids, which is common in other water parks also, are quite comfortable. There are guards all along the rapids and so do not worry. The park itself is large. One of the major attraction as I remember was Shark Attack, which is actually a tunnel ride through a lagoon full of sharks. But the slope was soo steep and you have to move with such momentum (read it high) that it was quite challenging to notice the sharks while you are in flow.Now come the best part "Leap of Faith". It's one of the steepest slopes and once you start the fall, the adrenaline rush you feel is unimaginable. But you will enjoy it to the fullest. So it's a must try. Now if you are afraid of heights and do not want to try Leap of Faith, just do not go to Aquaventure. It's a waste of money.We got a soft drink can and a Ceaser Salad as our free snacks, which was satisfactory in terms of taste and was quite a large proportion in terms of quantity.Ohh I forgot to mention, if you are upto people watching, it's a great place to enjoy.
Large and expensive. This park seems very large and the rides are a bit boring and samey. They are constructing two more chute, multi person rides but over all I prefer Wild Wadi

Good, but Wild Wadi is actually better. Aquaventure is the newest waterpark in Dubai. Part of the Atlantis The Palm hotel, it sits on Palm Jumeirah. The big draw is the Leap of Faith slide. It's intense and not for the faint of heart. However, my sons (ages 10,13) were disappointed by the other slides. At first, the park appears to have many slides; but you soon realize that they're all very similar and end up in the same lazy river.Unlike Wild Wadi, the pools are not cooled, and the walkways are not watered to spare burning feet. Also unlike Wild Wadi, there's no wristband payment system, so you have to carry around cash. It's a pain.If you can only visit one waterpark in Dubai, we'd recommend the Wild Wadi. But it's certainly hot enough in Dubai to enjoy two waterpark days!To see photos and get other ideas of what to do with kids in Dubai, you can check out our blog at www.aroundtheworldin72days.com.

Nice water park with enjoyable rides. Don't miss the lazy river!. I was a guest at Atlantis the Palm and had free entry to the water park. The water park is fun for people of all ages, it will bring out the inner kid in you in a fun way! I went there on my own and did not feel weird at all, the staff members are very friendly. I highly recommend it especially for the adrenaline junkies out there. Make sure you get on the lazy river and stay on it during its entire cycle, it is very very relaxing!

Not much to do. Its cool to see what its like, but its nothing special. We thought there would be some crazy slides, but there is actually only one. You can spend alot of money to get in, to sit in a tube while floathing in the pool, with every now and then some employee giving you an extra push. Glad I have seen it, but wouldnt go again.
