Humidity Central. We have just visited the water park in July and it was a bad idea! Temperatures of 48 degrees with 55%+ humidity plus all that water around you. There are no cooled shady areas to get any respite from the heat unless you are prepared to stand in the toilets! All sunbeds have canopies however even lying still under them you will be dripping in sweat. We got there early (it opens at 10) as we were advised by our hotel to be out before midday due to the heat. It was not crowded at all but all the water was very warm and the water flow was slow which meant that you were exposed for long periods to the heat, humidity and warm water whilst on the rapids. My family actually got off their donuts at different points as they could walk faster through the water than ride. We managed 2 hours but all left seriously overheated. Go early or very late, you need plenty of water and sunscreen and they definitely need to provide more shaded areas. Feedback from my teens were that the rides were "ok" - they were not stunned by the park though and glad to leave. Very nice frozen yoghurt stand as you walk back through the hotel! Towels and lockers cost extra.

Aquaventure Waterpark. We had a great time at Aquaventure waterpark. The rapids and rides are so much fun to either go on individually or in a tandem. As the weather can be very hot and sunny......................wear a T shirt if you burn.

mmm not great in July heat!. was 50 degrees with no real shade I honestly don't think I have ever felt so much like I was about to combust. I found it disappointing...rides were ok, but it really needs some canopied areas to shade in. Tip its open till 11pm ish so don't go till later to escape the hellish heat as there really is no shade or breeze.

Stunning Water Rides!. It's part of Atlantis the palm, if you were staying at the hotel the entrance to the waterpark will be free of charge. The first thing you have to try there is Ziggurat tower’s water slides, if you were not scared from the heights, try the "Leap of Faith" slide that falling over 9 stories, or "Shark Attack" slide, ending up in an acrylic tube surrounded by sharks and rays, wonderful marine views while spinning down. There is also Lots of water roller coasters adequate for all ages. River Rides are also great experience sitting in an inner tube and waves takes you all around the waterpark. You need a locker to keep your belongings which will cost you 40 Dirhams. And don't forget to get a footwear like slipper or sandal, or your feet will be burned. It will take a whole day to try all areas there.

A good day to go on some daring water rides. A very large water park to suit all ages. The park gets fairly busy and the main course if you get a doughnut and go around the waterpark and go off on side routes for faster and fierce river rapids. The leap of faith was awesome.

Bit disappointing. Visited the waterpark after dolphin encounter but much too hot for us. There is no proper shade unless eating somewhere in the park. Each sunbed has a canopy which partly pulls over the bed and packed together. Ground very hot. Not obvious how to get onto some of the bigger rides. Would be better at a cooler time of the year. Though it looks good we could not wait to leave.

Dolphin adventure was amazing. Very expensive excursion to belly swim with the dolphins but the best excursion we did by far. It was wonderful and you can take your camera in, regardless of what they say, everyone is allowed to take photos, so don't get caught with that. The Aquaventure park is safe and the tubing can keep you going all day.

Not as good as wild wadi. Went to this place on a dual ticket with the aquarium. The changing rooms were miles away and there was nowhere to leave your flip flops near the slides. There were also no water fountains around and being unable to take drink or food in with you it can get expensive. The slides into the shark tank were cool though but there are only really three types of ride. The 'leap of faith' vertical drop the shark attack in a ring and the rapids also in a ring. More variety definitely needed.

Heights...... even if you are scared of heights there is plenty to do in the park. However i would definitely recommend the ride that drops you from a great height into a shute where you meet sharks in their tank. !!! Adrenaline rush for sure. Would recommend you hide indoors from 12-3 as the heat drains you.

"Great Fun!". Visited waterpark with Family and friends ranging in age from 23 to 58 years old. What can I say apart from really enjoyed the day at water park it was a lot of fun. Went down the Leap of Faith screaming my head off but loved every minute of the thrill ride. The rapid rides are a lot of fun and a great way to cool off. Would highly recommend a day visit to the water park the weather is always up for it in Dubai!
good day out. we paid to swim with dolphins so you get entry to the water park included in the price, was a really enjoyable day

Aquaventure water dubai. for me it was just ok , wild wadi is better then this always , and there are many water park in the world better then this , if u r regular traveler to far east side , then you can avoid it , but first time in dubai , you can try

Great fun!. I'd not been to any sort of water park since I was a teenager (I'm now 42), so I guess things should have improved! I was staying in The Atlantis with my partner and entry to the waterpark was included in our package, so I can't comment on costs. There are 3-4 exhilarating 'inner tube' slides built around a lazy river, plus a daring waterslide from the central tower. There were small, but acceptable queues, and the attraction is very well staffed - probably over-staffed, but I guess you would feel that you and your children were safe! Lots of kids (of all ages) as you would expect. We had an enjoyable half-day there.

Not too great if you have been to Water Parks in other countries. Good for first time travellers, and for kids who have not gone to many Waterparks. All slides except Leap of Faith look similar..so you really don't get variety of adventure..Infact Lazy river is the best..Beach is good , you can laze around..but if you are really looking for variety, this place is disappointing especially for the price that you pay

Not worth the money. We went there at around 2:00 PM and I was ready for slides by 3:00 PM. We took one platinum and one Gold package in which we got lockers, towels, Meal and Atlantis Cup. I think our decision for taking Cup was wrong although it helps you to get a refill for 8 Dirham but only if you have enough time to get two to three refills or else you are wasting money. In any case, in total they have 7 slides right now, all goes from same place except one. The meal at shark bites restaurant was AMAZING! though i didn't liked the way they made the restaurant I think it should be more classy but staff was super friendly and meal was excellent. Slides are super safe. I would say if you are going there then go in morning and come out in evening or else you will not be able to enjoy fulles.

Good for one time visit, kids love it.. The park is good, but the lockers suck. Be sure to check and double check the key band when you purchase one and in most cases they don't work. Then the staff mixes up all the keys and hands them back after reactivation. I got a double locker, but the key worked on a single locker and getting a refund was another issue. There's nothing exciting there for grown ups so one can stay by the pool and keep valuables in sight, don't need a locker for that. Kids enjoy and it's a must go.
Crowded. The water park is not so big, but it is in much need of an update! Most of the floats have mold, and you can see broken things everywhere...kids have a blast though!

Fun Place!. When staying at Atlantis, the entrance to Aquaventure Waterpark was free. What a great pluss!! We just jumped on the "bus" from the hotel and over to the waterpark, and there we were in the middle of everything! Compared to the Disney parks, the choice of rides weren't the best, but still a great place to spend some hours! The playground for the kids was a success for my youngest one at seven, and the ride with the floats or what they're called were great for everyone (7 and up (65)).
Good day out. Lots of good water rides and the flames a like water roller coasters. In the heat of Dubai would be much nicer if water was a little cooler so you had some relief from the heat.

so much fun!. Great rides for older children. Younger daughter still a little short and could only do kids pool and equipment.... Which is great!Think 4-5 slides and lots of pouring tumbling water. Double tubes with kids waterseat available for wave pool and rapids. Ice creams expensive!!

For Bigger Kids. Water parks are always fun, and I had done some research on the 2 options (Wild Wadi being the other), to see which one would be better. Ultimately the decision was made for us, because we had wanted to do the Dolphin experience, which included entrance into Aquaventure.It is great and most of the rides seemed quite awesome. Unfortunately for us, our kids are borderline on the 1.2m minimum height for the majority of the rides. There are obviously some options for the younger kids, but it does limit you in terms of the overall experience. Invariably, my wife and I had to take turns on the "bigger" rides (so one of us could be with the kids), which then did not give us the best experience as a family. There are also some rides that require "double" seating, which we did not do, as we would not leave our kids alone. It is a small negative, but a consideration for younger families.All in all, the park is well maintained, and the staff were very good in the interactions we had with them. I would consider returning, but when the kids are bigger and we can enjoy the full offering of the park.

Overrun, Over priced and good for kids only. Was really excited about going here but was utterly disappointed. It isn't cheap and there really isn't that much there. Tame water slides and good for kids only. We stayed for two hours and left.

Great for kids. Went with my nephews and we all loved it. The best way to visit is to go in the morning and spend the whole day there. It takes 4 hours for all the rides and about 2 hours for the beach, if the weather is good. add an hour for food and its pretty much a full day thing.

Great water park. This is a lovely family freindly water park with lazy river and rapids which enable you to access the water flumes without getting out of the water and queuing for a ride. The water park is very Disney style. You can also access the beach and sea whilst at the park. You do need to keep footwear on if you are walking between the attractions as the paths get very very hot.

My Favorite. It's the most fun you'll have for any age group. They have water slides for the adventurer and a large lazy river for those who would like to relax. Not to forget a wave pool, and rapids in a small portion of the lazy river which you can avoid, but why would you.

Very Nice!. The Dolphin Bay Photo Fun experience is very nice but would like to add that they should increase the time spent with the children during the experience. Generally parents of children below 8 yrs only opt for this as other options are not open for this age group and the children this age need more time to adjust to the environment or the new experience.Rest would like to say a very beautiful and exciting place to explore and have fun!

Not great value for money. We bought our tickets online for this much hyped water park thinking it would be better than Wild Wadi as it is newer. There are only 6 slides and some rapids. Food is sold at over inflated prices. The park is undergoing expansion with new rides but at present is not worth the £40 per person paid

Not to my expectations. The water park was fun, but they only had about 5 or 6 slides and they were very short. I did see some construction on one side of the park, so I believe they are expanding and building more slides.A plus point is that most of the walk ways were shaded, so that is great for the hot summers there. Staff there is also helpful and friendly.I did not like the lockers facility as it is not convenient. There are separate lockers in each of the men and women's bathrooms. It would be better if they were outdoor which is easier for families and couples to share the same locker. The lockers are electric and are to be opened using a wristband which is programmed. But instead of scanning your wristband at your locker you need to scan it at a central location then go to your locker. Also the lighting in the bathroom and changing rooms was so dim. They need to put brighter lighting. They also do not have enough showers in the bathroom, which could get annoying when you have a long line in front of you. I personally would not go back to this water park.
Great fun at Aquadventure. So many lifeguards and staff everywhere. 7 water slides and 7 water rides. Such a safe place for children. You need flipflops as we burnt our soles. Need £10 for a locker.
Great fun. Great well-maintained water park with beach. Use entertainer vouchers (buy one get one free on admission). Towel and locker prices are exorbitant.

Brilliant day out. 4 of us girls went to this water park after visiting wild wadi a few days before, it was a lot better and a lot of fun! There was one absolutely huge slide which even I (usually a thrill seeking daredevil) was too scared to go on!

More cons than pros!. I'm glad I went to see what it's all about. I was highly dissapointed when I went because of many things. Out of the many disappointing things there was a couple of really cool/interesting things.So first off, it was too overpriced. For what it offers, it was too much money. I don't mind paying a lot of money if it the value is their. There are only like 5 rides!! You can get bored really quickly! And then on top of that, the food was really expensive for no reason! It wasn't that great. It's a small park you can go on every ride in less than an hour. And as a guest(not staying in the hotel) you are restricted all over the park. I was bored too quickly after paying all that money to get in the park and then eat and buy an OVERPRICED souvenir. Another thing that I got annoyed by was that the monorail on the palm from Atlantis to the city leaves you in the middle of no where! If you don't have a car you will be stranded!I'm glad I went though because there was a few things I did enjoy. The best part is that you get to be on the actual Palm Island and you get to see how cool that island is! It's really fascinating. When you on the monorail you get a nice view of the island. That was really cool. Another thing I enjoyed was the beach! The beach was beautiful safe and calm. I love the beach at the Atlantis. It was really great. No waves and very calm an a also a great view, great for pictures. The other thing I enjoyed was the slide that you go down and has sharks in them.Other than that, very dissapointed in various aspects!
Awesome!!. Visited this water park prior to its official opening as EK staff had an pre inaugural visit. It was an awesome experience and I would definitely recommend this to everyone in the family

Fun for the family. We went in June so it was really hot. As long was you are in the water its fine. The splashers pool is where we spent most of the time as its the only place for kids in the park. But kids can spend the whole day here with all the slides etc. My 6 year old had a great time. We tried the other slides as well- the falls, surge, shark attack etc. Great fun.

Wasn't worth my money. The day I went, the two main attraction slides (the ones with the sharks) were closed due to maintenance, which later I understood, was like that for quite some time. Without these two up and running the other part of the park itself is more kids orientated, because there are no scary or adventurous slides at all. Just up and down the hill, which gets boring quickly.Plus the food offered is pricey and not good. The good thing was the beach... Oh, that fine sand and that clean water. This made my day nicer :)

Dolphins!!. Had booked a dolphin encounter where in you dance,kiss and hold the dolphin.It was an amazing experience and the dolphin has the smoothest body in the world.Definitely recommended.The wave pool is fun but honestly barring the dolphin experience which is outstanding and unique to this place in Dubai,I like the Wild Wadi water park better for its slides and things.I also lost my shoes in aqua venture and when I complained to the authorities they weren't any help!!didnt expect this kind of thing in Atlantis or Dubai.

I felt like I was a kid again!. This waterpark is the best I have been to and seriously fun. Floating around the lazy river or shooting up and down the slides - amazing! You can travel virtually the whole way through the waterpark (even through the slides) without really needing to get off your inflatable that much. The fastest slide is pretty scary, especially when you end up in a tunnel with sharks swimming around outside.The whole place is very clean and it wasn't jam packed so plenty of space to lounge about and hardly any queues. The food isn't the greatest - just your average fries and pizza etc which was disappointing given the ticket price. Other than that - amazing! I felt like a big kid and I can't wait to return!

Pricey. Definitely worth going too, awesome park very clean, water rides are good. food is the only complaint, they only have Shark Bites which is really poor food wise, i went twice to the waterpark and tried different meals, proper average food that was high priced.

Get wet, have fun.. A great fun day out. Loads of sunbeds, lockers to dump everything in then a leisurely float around the lagoon.They have a wristband system that you can pre-load for the refreshments which saves worrying about cash.Great thrill rides, slides, tanks of sharks and rays and exotic fish.Hardly any queues (we went on a Thursday and pre-booked our tickets). We didn't have to wait long for any of the big rides until later in the afternoon when it got busy. The "Leap of Destiny" was a very quick adrenaline rush then off to the very clean locker rooms to change.Also visited the aquarium which was interesting. A good but possibly a bit pricey, day out.

If you wanna go.... ..then stay at the Atlantis for a night or two, because, with the hotel stay, you get to go in for free. Otherwise, the entrance tickets are really very expensive (about AED225!!) per person. We went in for the diving experience (through the "back entrance") so we got to see the place although we did not purchase a ticket for the Aquaventure park! The place looks crowded and what you read about people hogging the floats is true!! The day we went was extremely hot so the water looks very inviting!! There are many fun rides, some very exciting ones and some dare-devil types!! There are food corners all over the park, selling snacks, fruits (cold watermelon and pineapple - very nice presentation!!), frozen yoghurts and merchandise!!

Was ok...could be better. I was so excited to visit atlantis hotel water park and was a little disappointed.We got a platinum day pass which included food, locker, towel and cups to re fill for 5d. The rides were fun but very quick. The best bit was going up the escalator in a rubber ring. The rapids were boring there wasn't enough water so you didn't flow and then when you wanted to go towards the escalator the water was so slow you had to get out and walk through low water, a bit like a trench. The reason I thought it was lacking was the amount of flumes. I have been to water parks in America and they are 10x better then this park. I did however love the beach pure white and warm sea was incredible. You couldn't go in the hotel which was annoying as we hd heard great things about the inside of it. If I go again I will be paying the lowest price as i feel personally it wasn't worth it.

Incredibly overpriced. The water park is reasonably large, with some great ride. But the price of the general admission is expensive, food costs more than gourmet restaurants, and water bottles are sold for $4 ! The value is simply not worth the money. Could be visited once in a lifetime.

Had a Great time.. Arrived at the water park around 11am line was fairly long but moved quite quickly. Once inside was a bit hard to find a seat but we ended up down on the beach where seats were plentiful. The rides were great fun and we did most of them without long periods of time waiting had a blast then found a lovely place for lunch good standard of food for a water park nice fruit salad and you could even get a shisha. Definitely would go here if you had children they would love it and it is very well organized with plenty of life guards in attendance. There are lockers available to keep valuables and change of clothes which we took advantage of and if you are a big group you can rent an individual cabana for an extra cost if hot this would be a good idea. Definitely enjoyed our day here and would recommend but it is a busy place be prepared.

Heaven for me, for my husband too little excitement. I felt like I was in heaven - warm air, clean sandy beach, flowers and trees so beautifully arranged, water slides... The Leap of the faith gives everyone such a thrill. And for my husband other slides weren't so exciting as he wanted them to be, so he was disappointed.

Fun!. I live in Dubai and have been to Aquaventure several times with my kids. Ideal place to let their energy out and have a good night sleep after that!! Rides are very nice. Some pointers:1. Make sure you get your double-seater floater if you have young ones as they run out very fast2. Get wet shoes for you and your kids. they are very convenient as you can swim and walk with them. Ground would be scroaching hot3. Location, location, location! the best places to book your recliners are near the kids water park. again they get filled up pretty quickly so you better be early4. Best time to go there? Probably end Sep-end Oct and Feb-April as the weather would be ideal in Dubai5. If you are up for it, you need to try the "leap of faith" ride. This one is REALLY scary and I am not just saying that to scare you!

Great park , clean bathrooms.. Clean , smart and very friendly staff. Went to dolphin encounter which gives you free access to Aquaventure Waterpark. Golf carts travel along atlantis resort and drop you at the park.

A lovely relaxing day in the sun!. It is a real experience going to Aquaventure, you have to see the aquarium before you go in (between the hotel and East Wing), it is a must. Now yes it is busy (always) but once you get past this fact you will have a great time. Floating round in a ring, going on the slides it is just great fun. The water is lovely and warm like the sea, and the beach is really really pleasant. The water is clear and calm (as you would expect) and it is just lovely looking back in land at the Marina Sky Scrapers and the Burj Al Arab.It is expensive for what it is but hey its Dubai and they dont do cheap!
Great Fun. The river... And the other water games are really fun... Staff are very friendly and helpful ... Good to spend few hours there.. Don't miss the list chamber

Good day out. Good day out, not to long to wait to go on slides. Only problem trying to get a taxi to get back to your hotel, it gets a bit busy. Lifeguards on duty all time, very clean. Slides great.
Love It. As we were staying at Atlantis we could go every day but on this trip we only went a couple of times. Gets very busy and the queues for the main rides are a bit too long.

Pricey but great fun. Riding the monorail to the Atlantis - where the water park is situated, was great. Lovely views, and novelty value of being on 'the palm' was great. Didn't like the huge queue to pay for entry, but once we had paid it was easy to navigate the park. Really liked the fact that there are more than enough tubes for everybody and some of the double tubes have a base so children can sit in it rather than falling straight through. The lazy river was great and even our 8 month old grandson enjoyed it. We were fortunate to get 3 sun loungers for the afternoon, but they are very popular.there is definitely something for everyone.We paid for visiting the aquarium too and again it was well worth it. The monorail runs up until 10pm so there is plenty of time to do everything without feeling rushed.On the downside I didn't think there was much choice for eating in the evening.

Beautiful park in a beautiful setting!. Visit Aquaventure not just for the awesome water rides and beach, but for the beautiful setting this park is located in. Take the palm monorail crossing the Palm Jumeirah and overlooking Dubai Marina all the way to the end of the Palm where you are greeted by the majestic Atlantis hotel, the site of Aquaventure. An unforgettable experience worth your every penny! WOW! Don't miss the leap of faith for a 30 m high slide full of adrenaline, the lazy river with unexpected rapids and waves, and the fun Shark Attack.!

Amazing!!!. Make sure you get out at the top and do the other slides. Our first time we didn't realise so the next day we went back and found the much higher slides. The shamal slide fantastic and the ziggerat ones also. Try to leave everything at the hotel so you don't need a locker and just charge food back to your room.
Greatest water park in Dubai. It was awesome, my child enjoyed the kids area for 4 hours strait, we enjoyed the rest of the slides and the lazy river :)

My son loved it. It's included in our Atlantis stay and we went there without much expectation. It came out to be very good. Though it was a very child-centred visit (which means that we didn't have chance to try all the slides) but the slide where you went down a transparent tube inside an aquarium was quite an experience. Good!

A Dubai attraction not to be missed. Atlantis The Palm have done it so well, the Aquaventure Waterpark is wonderful. In two days we relaxed on the lazy river, had fun on the rapids, were lucky enough to hand feed cownose rays and then enjoyed the once in a lifetime opportunity of a deep water dolphin experience with beautiful "Sol" the dolphin. An experience and weekend I will never forget.
Great Fun. We spent most of the day here after swimming with the dolphins, which was amazing. The waterpark is very large with lots to do.

Brilliant for thrill seekers and water bugs. I'm not living at Atlantis but took a full day pass for the waterpark. The towels and lockers are a little pricey. But the waterpark itself is excellent. You can lounge around in the river, floating with the current. The faint hearted can try out the rapids which are exhilarating but not too scary. The Zigurrat or the Mayan pyramid is the main attraction for thrill seekers. It has 7 rides spread across 3 levels. The Leap of Faith is an absolutely amazing thrill. Going at this time of the year, it can get pretty hot so be sure to carry sunscreen.Overall, the waterpark was an absolute joy and I'd love to return and explore it in its entirety.

Awesome afternoon. There you can find all you wish to do... the slides are excellent and adapted to everybody. From the easy going to the crazy Leap of Faith, every adrenaline level will be reached.Prepare your wallet, though... it is a bit pricy (600 EAD for 2, combo package with the aquarius) and inside, you'll pay 13 AED for a bottle of water (3 euros / 4$)Only thing which can be missing... diving / Water jumping. :(

Good for kids. Aquaventure Waterpark is a place that kids or the young at heart will enjoy,lots of rides and getting all wet.....really not my thing!The day we went there,there was a lot of people;lots of kids having a great time with their parents smiling indulgently.All i did was stroll around,take a few pictures and get out!Will definitely come back when i have kids,highly recommended for families,but for a single young glamor puss...not my thing!
Magic place to have fun!. Very good waterpark, magic atmosphere. I only dilslike walking in some part of the lazy river because the flow isn't strong enough!

Best Waterpark I've been to. Great waterpark set in the Palm, with lots of fun slides and a great lazy river that connects a lot of the rides together. To be honest, I found the Leap of Faith ride a bit disappointing, as you travel through the shark tank too quickly to even realise you're there. That said, the drop itself was fun. The Shark Attack lazy river offered a much better alternative to see the shark tank properly. Also many of the rides seemed to have a strange obsession with you being in the dark the whole time, meant that a lot of them felt very similar. Having said all this, rides like Shamal and Shark Attack more than made up for these relatively minor grievances.

Not as good as wild wadi. Too much money and no where near as good as wild wadi. First of all there are not many rides and some are so well hidden that lull need an award to find them. You have to fight for rafts as people take them and they never let go. Defiantly not worth it. Do not waste your money

Fantastic day out. Great day out for both families and couples. They have about 8 main rides, most of them you can go on as a pair, which if you are a bit of a chicken like me gave me the courage to try on some of the scary shoots! Atlantis hotel looks amazing and such beautiful views from the top of the park. Food wise we had the chip stick which was a potato fried on a stick, would not say it was value for money. The frozen yogurt on the other hand was delicious! Staff were very friendly and playful with all the guests which helped create a lovely fun atmosphere. They have the longest Rapid ride I have ever been on, about an hour I would say. if you go all the way around sort of turns into a lazy river; would save this too last! Overall lovely day out in the sunshine. If you are worried it will be too hot to spend a day in the sun don't be. The water cools everything down and I did not feel too hot at all today with a lovely breeze coming from the sea.
Fun. We went to the waterpark late in the afternoon so that it wasn't too hot. Lots of fun on the lazy river.
Excellent water park. It is a very clean and well run water park. Fun for everyone but need to take care from the sun. Amazing ride on the inflatable tubes. Gets a bit busy on Fridays
Good Fun. Took the kids there and had an amazing time. Clean, well organized and fun for the whole family. The children area is extremely well done and the rides are cleverly designed.

Great for kids. Fantastic day and great place to cool off. We did the package with Atlantis the lost chambers as well which was good value and very well done. My little girl loved the kiddies area. We didn't go nanny if the big rides but they look good. Only negate is there aren't enough sun beds.

Ray feeding. Booked the ray feeding experience and was delighted when it was only two of us there. Was an unforgettable experience, well worth the money. Waterpark was very good as well, good rapid and travelling system on doughnuts. Worth visiting

Not very well laid out, but nevertheless FUN!!. We kept going round and round in the river without ever being able to get to the water slides. There are 7 slides on three different levels of the Ziggurat (the main tower structure in Aquaventure). The ground is hot as fire and burned my feet. There should be better methods of cooling the grounds during the intense summer heat. Nevertheless, rides were awesome. Leap of Faith gave me a much needed rush and pumped up adrenaline. Thrilling!! Ride the shark attack and take each other's pictures coming out through the aquarium. Awesome memories!!
great place. visited with family; had real fund for the whole day.the playing area for kids and the river is awesome. really loved the tube ride on the riverdefinitely a place to visit

Brilliant. We had a brilliant day out, all the family loved the water rides. The food was extremely good. Everything was very clean. Not too busy. Would go again. Can't wait to see the new water ride next time, looks fab!

exciting. I liked the safety of the equipments there. lots of kind life-guards are watching you. everything there is exciting from dark water tunnel to the high slides. it is clean you can enjoy watching variety of fishes. the food is acceptable, it is usually light fast food. juices are also available. we had a tour company to arrange transfer and ticket but you really don't need it, you can take a taxi or even the train. and lots of taxis are there waiting to get you back home.

Great fun!. Great place to spend a fun day! Clean, fun, safe and great value for money. The access to the beach makes it stand out and be different from most other waterparks. Great to escape when the noise becomes to loud and the pools to crowded.

Aquaventure Dubai. The place is good but over priced and overrated .No eatables allowed inside. You must carry your own water ,It(water) is very very costly inside.You must carrry your own slippers because floor becomes very hot making it difficult to walk.Water slides are good and safe.Should visit lost chamber (aqarium) first.Dont forget to take your cameras there.Lockers are costly ,75 AED for big locker.Seperate lockers for male and females.Taxi fare from Bur Dubai to Atlantis was around 70 AED.You can ask the taxi driver to also show you around.Sea beach was good.

A MUST. We went to Aquaventure and Wild Wadi. Aquaventure is a better operation; cleaner, much friendlier staff, better run, more beautiful, and has some great and unique rides. However, Wild Wadi overall had some rides that outdid Aquaventure. In fact, we were surprised that AV being newer didn't have better rides in comparison. Although AV has some great themed rides, going through the fish/shark tanks, the rides themselves were not as fun/exciting as WW. (We gave WW a 4 star rating)AV is a great experience, however is a bit more expensive than WW because of food costs and the cost of the monorail. That said, we thought it was worth it. Simply going out to Atlantis and AV was fascinating in the monorail with its great views of the man made islands and its neighborhoods, beaches and waterways. If you have to choose between AV and WW and care about the overall experience, go to AV. If you only care about the rides for their thrills and not their aesthetics, go to WW. Or better yet, do what we did and go to both. Its worth it.

Fun day. Had a fun day at Aquaventure. Free entrance was included in our stay at Atlantis. Liked the lazy river with its torrents and rapids, Shark Attack and the Ziggurat ride from the lazy river. My husband did the Leap of Faith, but too scary for me. Went home with a few bruises though! We were lucky enough to have a cabana included with our suite and it was nice to chill out there in between rides.

Confusing layout. We enjoyed a good day at the waterpark after we finally got our bearings. Eager to get started our daughter charged for the rapids and we eased our way around the park. However, there are many places to get out and they all look similar - trouble was that our shoes were only at one and it was too hot to walk without them! There is a need for better signs to avoid this.

Wow! Have water slides changed!. I had not been to a water park for about 20 years!! My friend and I went to Aquaventure and had a blast. We really enjoyed the Shark ride where you pass through the aquarium where the sharks are. Way cool!! We went on a holiday and although busy we found a place to sit on the beach that was on the gulf, not the "beaches" at the park. Fyi the chairs have covers to protect from the sun. The rides were a blast. There was some queuing but not much. We also splashed out and feed the sting rays. What an amazing experience. Earlier we swam with the rays which was ok but if you are going to do one I recommend feeding the sting rays. Yes, it is an attraction and like them all the food/drinks are expensive!! 13 AED for a small water!!! If you are in a big group you can rent a cabana. Don’t forget your sun screen.
Fun day. Great day but get there early and do the rides before the queues. Then enjoy the lazy river!! Place is clean and well organised.

Very good. It is a very good place to visit and enjoy a full day at Atlantis. Games are nice and fun. At the back, they have beach. You enjoy the beach after the games. After that, you can enjoy a good Shisha place by the beach facing Burj Al-Arab.

Go on weekdays and enjoy it. We went on weekdays and we did not queue at all, we used the ride several times and after 4pm the park felt a bit lonely, perfect to enjoy all the facilities without crowds.Rides are fun, and we love the convenience of the belts mechanism that takes you up without you bother of climbing stairs. Majority of the rides are connected.We had a great time.

Insane Fun. OMG - Had an absolute blast at this water park which is completely free if you are a guest at the Atlantis Hotel. A buggy will drive you the few short minutes from the Hotel, you can get a locker for your belongings for 40 Dirhams which you can charge to your room and they also provide you with towels and an endless selection of food and drink outlets. There are plenty of loungers to sit relax and enjoy the sun. The slides are fantastic expect lots of screaming and plenty of Adrenelin rushes - especially on the Leap Of Faith which I challenge you to try and keep your eyes open on and the Shark ride which plunges you into a plastic tube inside an aquarrium full of sharks - heaps of fun to be had, highly recommended

Amazing!!!. Went to Aquaventure on a special event night called Summer Nights. Not only did we have full access to the water park, but there were circus acts, a fireworks show, a dolphin show and more to enjoy.The water park itself is fabulous. It was soo much fun. The slides are all amazing and each slide gives a slightly different experience. The big daddy of them all was the "leap of faith", a 9 stories drop hen going into to a tube surrounded by sharks and rays. AMAZING! The river rides are really enjoyable.It'll be fun to take a waterproof camera (preferably around your neck) to take pictures. Take your own towel, flipflops and swimwear. They have free changing rooms but they charge for lockers and towels. The price was abit steep (we are students), but hey its Dubai, we kind of expected it.It is really enjoyable, our four hours there wasn't enough for us.

A lot of the rides are very samey...OK for half a day. Not bad but nothing special. The "leap of faith" was quite scarey but if you close your eyes for 1 second its over. Lots of lifeguards so very safe. One strange thing is if you book option to get a towell... you have to carry the paper receipt with you? Rather than doing it through the wristbands. A little odd!

Great fun in that huge aquapark. Great place to spend an afternoon or even a day when really hot and sunny (...often in Dubai).The park is really great with some really good waterslides.Tip: When you arrive: just jump on a free water-wing you see, because it's really hard to get one.

Must-Go-To!. This is a must go to for anybody coming to Dubai! we went there using a rented car, and it was very organized. When you reach the hotel, you park in a designated park, and then you go by a shuttle bus to the hotel, where you go inside and purchase the tickets.We bought our tickets online, it was a combo ticket for Aquaventure and the Lost Chamber, and that saved us around an hour standing up in a line to buy tickets, where we went to an empty window, gave them the online reservation number, and they just checked it on the system. All the slides require a tube, which you can take any empty one you find, except for the leap of faith slide, which we did not try. All other slides were really really nice, and they end up in the river, which was also really fun.You can find many kiosks for snacks or sandwiches, but they are not cheap.

Even my grandma loved it.. We went during the end of May. It was 43 degrees so we spent 4 hours in the water and 30 out for lunch. The rides were great fun, my grandma (67 years old) had fun as did my 15 year old sister. There's something for everyone.
Loved it. We all loved it here. Very clean and very well planned out. Can't wait to go again. We got the dealing lid g food and even the food was good

Good family fun!. We visit Aquaventure quite often, we always have fun there! I have to admit though that it is the friends that make it more fun as generally it is crowded; need to wait 20-30 minutes for some of the slides.I forgot to mention the extortionate price tags that come with anything touristic inside the waterpark (photos, very low quality UAE made souvenir swimming gear etc).
Average Waterpark. I have to admit I was expecting a lot more from the water park. It was a great way to spend a day though. If you like Lazy Rivers, this water park is 90% Lazy River.
great fun!. Great place to spend a day to feel like a child again:) It's good to come early to find a good located sunbed. For brave ones: Leap of Faith - definitely worth trying!

Better to go to wild wadi. Too expensive and no thrills, it's small and unexciting! The staff were extremely rude and unhelpful, from the cash desk to the life guards, no one smiled or offered polite assistance.

Great relaxing day. The great thing about this water park is that you do not have to do a great deal. Sit on a tire and floot ! there are various water shoots and rapids that you can simply turn off directly from the lazy river. Ticket cost is around £40 per person, and it is recommended that you purchase from your hotel if available prior to arrival.

Well worth a day trip. Enjoyed the slides very much, they all come out of one central place, but it took a while for us to get our bearings and find our way back as the lazy river/torrent/rapids are huge!! Am usually a big scaredy cat, but these rides are relatively short, so I managed them ok with only a few screams/swear words! Food left alot to be desired, but to be expected at this sort of attraction, especially after dining at the One and Only on the Palm for the rest of the week! dont know if its value for money as we were given complimentary tickets by our hotel, but we had a great day, just expect a serious wedgie if you take on the "leap of faith"!!!!

Fun in the sun. Visited Aquaventure in NovemberThe water park is pretty well designed and you can get to most attractions via the "lazy river". Inner tubes are provided but if you're an adult make sure you get one without the bottom - we had a friend who had to learn the hard way after his kept flipping over. The park itself is clean and there are a decent amount of small eateries scattered throughout. If you don't bring any towels be ready to pay a hefty price for rental (this is Dubai after all).If you're able to, make sure you flag down the attendants with the scanners as many times as you can so that they get photos of you throughout the water rides. The people who work there are very friendly but one word of warning. We had an accident while we were at the park - there are points in the lazy river where it turns into rapids and one of our friends had a very nasty spill that cased his head to be gashed and pretty severe damage to one of his fingers. There was an attendant standing in the water helping visitor who had fell out of their tube - our friend crashed into him and he got thrown into the water and hit his head on the floor. So be mindful of your surroundings and watch for other people in the rapids. I will say, however, that the people were incredibly attentive and they followed us all the way through the river until we were able to exit where a medic was ready and waiting to help bandage my friend up. Another bit of ride advice regarding the leap of faith. when you get to the end of the ride the exit tube is fairly long so make sure you don't start taking breathes otherwise you'll start sucking in water. All in all a very good time was had. Well designed park. Clean, fun, good times.

Good but be ready for hectic day. his is kovely water park. It again go early as it gets busy or later after 5pm. Some sun beds will have towels left and if personnel belongings are not on them, most of the time they are free. There were always beds available though. my daughter could not go as she was under 1.2 metres tall and this caused great confusion. At some points she was okay and then after queing she was told that she could not go. This caused annoyance and they can have better system. The rides were lovely but it can take time to find a float for a child. Rapids are a must and children play area is lovely. Even I Enjoyed it. A few small improvements could make it much better day for family. Lifeguards were great and very friendly. My son loved it so much we went for all 4 days that we stayed there. Tips:GO early or late in day. Take plenty of water. It can get hot so plenty of sunscreen and uv top. It is very expensive to buy one there.

Great experience for kids and adults. My kids had a lot of fun at the Aquaventure Waterpark. It was a great all day fun (closes at sunsit). But, my 4 yrs old was refused for most of the rides (even with an adult company), but there is some other activities, but you have to split the family.

Atlantis found in Aquaventure Park!. Brilliant fun, a class of its own, the waterslides were fun, fast, and what a fabulous initiative in having the tube lift back to the top for faster fun.
Lots of giggles for the young at heart.
We had a separtate area for our group, and the food and facilities were wonderful, nothing but praise for a great time!

super slides!. I had a great time at aqua venture and would say this is better than Wild Wadi - you get to see Atlantis and the Palm at the same time, there is a nice beach and plenty of rides and water activities to suit everyone.

Overall Good but not great experience. Located at The Palms this aquaventure is simply amazing. Cleam blue water, Lots of space & rides but nothing much for small kids to enjoy. This place has a private clean beach with view of Hotel Burj Al Arab.We planned a day visit but cam back in half a day.Too expensive inside the park wrt Food & other activities..

Worth a trip. The waterpark has something for everyone although many of the rides are restricted to children over 120cm in height and they are quite strict on this limit. The staff are very friendly and it is very well supervised by life guards. It was VERY busy when we were there but despite this we still managed to get on all the rides and did not feel that we spent too much time in queues. The real downside was when some child decided to defecate in the kids pirate pool.....so basically it was shut down pretty quickly much to my daughters disappointed while it was cleaned (yuck).....but this took a while. The fact is kids need to be in swim nappies why don't parents learn - its pathetic!!!
Wild Wadi is better. Very good slides. Various danger level. Inconvenient lockers. Worth to stay with kids for a day. Reasonable price. Lot of open space – hot for a naked feet.

Okay day to spend doing something fun.. I am not someone who would go out of my way to visit a waterpark. It was a very good one non the less. The best part was the private beach are they had to enjoy the sea. The rides were pretty good and fun. Its more of a park to visit with you family and kids.

***Only for the Palm***. When deciding whether to visit Aquaventure or Wild Wadi I based the decision to go to the former purely on basis that it was located on the Palm and this was something I really wanted to experience.We got a taxi from our hotel in Bur Dubai to Atlantis for 70AED including tip and were dropped right at the door. You go through a mini mall style entrance before the opening to the water park. We had already booked online which I think saved us a couple of pounds, but certainly cost us in time; we joined a separate queue and there was only 1 person serving and about 10 people in front of us, we would have been better just queuing from the outset which is a shame as you would think they would want to encourage people to purchase in advance especially on a busy day, we went on a Sunday so it was reasonably quiet.You are offered to purchase locker rental for the day, which at this point you do because you want your belongings to be safe, however in hindsight it is a waste of money and you could easily keep your things by your sun lounger as many people did.There are plenty of sun loungers for all, and they are very comfortable with the little canopies, so you can protect yourself from the sun if you wish.What they don't warn you about before you head off in giddy excitement is that the floor will be hotter than the core of the sun, and if you attempt to walk without flip flops you can expect your feet to blister up and die, and this is what happened. Take your flip flops and leave them near the slides so you can easily get to them afterwards, as less time spent with foot to floor means more skin on your feet at the end of the day.The rides certainly look impressive, however they are not. They are very average and apart from the Leap of Faith, they aren't terribly exciting. We went to a water park in Zante a few years ago and we went on every ride so many times that we never had time to sit down and relax, at Aquaventure I read my book and had a 20 minute doze, so do not be prepared to be thrilled. They have a water rapids which is meant to whisk you around, in fact we found from one of the lifeguards that they had slowed it down completely because too many people fell out of their rings; we also fell out of our ring because we had to push it round because it was so slow and boring.One redeeming factor was the beach which park users had access to. It was a very beautiful beach, very warm water with exceptional views of Dubai. The reviews for WIld Wadi look better, so I would go there and visit the Palm to go to a nice restaurant, not Aquaventure.
Splash splash splash. Free entry being resident at Atlantis hotel. Great rides, plenty of rings available. Leap of faith ride is not at bad as you expect. Be brave... try not too scream... too loud

fun fun fun. we all loved our day out at the aquaventure in the ATLANTIS HOTEL on the palm in dubai. the girls in my party swam with the dolphins the n joined us later. we were on the lazy river for 3hrs non stop ! everytime we went around we found another little channel to explore ! with fast flowing rapids on most sections and some thrilling rides ( still upon your inflatable ring) within the pyramid the fun does just not stop until you decide to have a rest yourself !! the river and rides are very well manned with life guards and everything is very safe. the only downside is the park is very expensive, £45 entry per person, 3.75 per pepsi, 6 x small bottles of water £10, so a pannini and a portion of chips to share with 2 x pepsis and 1 x burger came to a staggering £30 ! dont forget your suncream either as this will result in you having to part with approx £28 per bottle required. however putting this aside the parks and rides are worth every penny and everyone young and old will have loads and loads of fun garuanteed.

Best in Dubai at the moment. Firstly it's not going to be a cheap day out, unless you are a guest at Atlantis already, but it is well worth visiting. Allow extra time for parking up in the car park, getting the shuttle bus to the hotel, and then walking to the park. Allow extra money for a locker (a large one will do 2 of you {same sex, obviously}) and give yourself at least 6 hours to do everything, including queuing. Have taken teenagers to the park twice now, and both times they have been exhausted at the end, and not up for much more than fast food and an early night. Leap of faith looks scarier than it actually is, so a lot of the long queue is repeat business. Everything else is suitable for all ages, but there are height restrictions (1.2 or 1.3 m?) on some rides.
Wet n wild. Brilliant park, lots to do, towels included if you are a Atlantis the palm guest. Clean, supervised and a must.

Not been to many waterparks so not much to judge it by. The lazy river was great three times round. Didnt do much more till we decided to SWIM WITH THE DOLPHINS. Spur of the moment decision but one I am so glad I made. It was out of this world and well worth the money it cost. A lifetimes dream come true.
Leap Of Faith. Great day out very busy park and very confusing layout to the park. Highlight was the Leap Of Faith Slide... A must do!!!

Luxuriously the best!. No regret spending a day in Aquaventure. We enjoyed the slides. Everything is there. From restaurants inside the waterpark to the restaurants just a few minutes walk from the entrance of the waterpark. Staff are well-trained, very courteous. Well, that's what you will expect in the only waterpark located in a 5 star hotel. Superb! Will go back again!

Below average experience. Where shall I start. Maybe from the fact that a week before our day trip to Aquaventure I sent an email and until today my email inquiries are not yet answered. Dispite of that we decided to take our car and enjoy a day at the Aquaventure. I tried to find parking instructions from the web but couldn't find any. We drove to the parking area, left our car and tried to find the park. There were no instructions or signs anywhere. Suddenly a security guy instructed us to take a shuttle bus to the waterpark. I asked is there a valet parking somewhere since we had prams and a small toddler and got no for an answer. When we arrived to the entrance, there were at least 5 valet parking guys waiting for cars...After enjoying the Splasher area, we decided to have lunch and walked quite a long way to the Barracudas restaurant only to find out it was closed. I asked them how hard can it be to place a small sign saying the restaurant is closed before people walk half a kilometre to get there. They instructed us to go to the Sharks Bite restaurant. We went there only to get cold hamburgers for 50 dirhams which we had to change because they were honestly ice cold. The next ones we got were just plain tasteless. Probably one of the worst dining experiences ever. Also the price of water is ridicilous, 13 dirhams per bottle. The good thing about this aquapark is the Splasher area for smaller kids and beautiful surroundings. However dining and service was way below average. Would I go back there? Definitely not. We will rather test all the other waterparks in UAE first.
Great fun for the day. Great rides, vast layout and nice places to relax. This waterpark is a great place to spend the day. You'll have lots of fun. Fast food available and also access to the beach.

Great fun for the family. We visited the park in April and it was a great experience. After visiting Wild Wadi and Yas Waterworld it was our third waterpark in four days during our last trip to Dubai. The great thing is that each park is unique in its own way and provides great family entertainment. The rides are great and there is also a private sandy beach with sunbeds that can be used during the stay. The water was warm and there was a rather short waiting time for the slides as the park is quite large and well spread out. It is possible to enter many of the slides as well as the rapids form different entries whic results in less waiting time. The prices are similar to the other parks and the food is preety much the same standard fast food but the quality is ok. The rides are excellent and some of them quite fast and exciting. The park provides a next day ticket at a reduced rate if you want to go again. One turnoff was the parking which is quite far away from the entrance and you have to take a shuttle bus. We also waited in line for an hour to purchase tickets to enter the park as only 5 counters out of 12 were open which was rather annoying.

lots of fun. Loved the water rides, especially the shark one! It was very busy even on a week day and a bit of a challenge to find even one lounger. The staff were very helpful though, and extremely friendly. I think it is overpriced (we ended up paying the best part of 250 GBP for four people, not including drinks or snacks), but then I should probably have spent a little more time trying to get a prebooked deal, which I'm told do exist - that would be my tip to any fellow travelers! Apart from that, a lovely afternoon.

Great experience. Great park overall. 225 AED to get in, another 50 for a locker/towel. The lazy river was the best ever and the leap of faith (the big slide) had basically no line so I was able to go on it multiple times. And you will want to do it multiple times.Only downside is you have to rent a towel and water is not available anywhere for free, but you can bring in a towel and 1 water bottle so make sure to do that and use that money on food.

Brilliant!. This Waterpark is very good. Quite expensive to get in but worth a visit. We visited this park in 2010 and when we came back in 2012 we decided to only go to Wild Wadi. simply because it was free entry for us with our hotel. This park has excellent rides but quite a few are for older children and one of our children was not tall enough so we had to go separately. No food and drink are allowed from outside and buying inside is quite expensive. you should at least go once!

waterpark Atlantis. What to say, we really enjoy it. As booked Club offer, we had free entrance, and kid just adore it. Drinks and food are not so expensive as we thought, people were kind and helpfull.

I laughed all day!. This shows you are never too old for a waterpark, I'm the wrong side of 50 and there was no chance of me slipping through the rubber ring. I visited with my daughters 24 & 26. We tried every ride except for the vertical one which just looked far too scary. I laughed and howled the whole day, the shark attack is black for ages and just as I was on the verge of a major panic attack I was plunged into the middle of a fish tank - hilarious. Then there are others where you just have to leave your dignity at home as you are sitting on your ring and then suddenly you are going uphill only to be thrown down a water chute at the other side. I have bruises in places women of my age shouldn't have them, but quite frankly I had the time of my life, this is a great day out for any age group. Take a spare costume, towel and a sense of humour.

Great day. A real thrill ride. Really enjoyed my day at Aqua-adventure. Was on the pricy side and there are added essentials (towels, lockers etc) that the charge for when you get there, but it is worth it.The slides were awesome and the Rapids were great. Plenty of shade and a lovely beach. A definite must in Dubai!
Amazing. Great family fun, lots to do, will not get bored..luved the children's waterpark...and the leap of faith, shark attack etc...

The best waterpark... EVER!. One of the best days out I've ever had.Different fun for people of all ages.Loads of things to see & do.Highlight - shooting through a water slide in the dark, and coming out at the other end in a glass tunnel surrounded by sealife.INCREDIBLE.

Loads of fun, perfect for Dubai climate. Definitely loads of fun. We found it clean and the staff are very willing to assist and make sure you have a good time. If you're staying at Atlantis, it's included in the price. That means you can pop down any time, rather than queue with the day trippers who arrive in droves at opening time. A good selection of rides, although it misses having real adrenalin rides. Some interesting pass-throughs on rides/slides that take you through marine tanks with sharks, rays, fish, etc. A perfect activity for the Dubai climate. Good lockers and storage facilities.

Excellent water park in good location.. Excellent water park in the grounds of the Atlantis hotel on The Palm. Signposting for the park itself could be better, but once inside the park there's plenty to keep big and little kids entertained. Lots of slides to choose from, though I'm not sure if the nearby Wild Wadi had more. The fact that there was a private beach to visit once in the water park was a deal sealer though, and the dolphins being on site will no doubt be a big plus for some visitors also. Not a cheap day out, but definitely worth it.

The most fun I've had in a long-time. This is one of the best waterparks I have ever visited, I would have gone back if I'd have had more time. There are loads of fun things to do for all ages and levels of daring-do! You cannot take food or drink in as your bags get searched and items confiscated. Also if you want a locker, which unless you have someone to mind your bags you need, you have to buy a wristband at reception and scan the barcode on the locker screen. There are different size lockers available, we got 3 ladies bags with space to spare in a large locker. The lockers are in the changing areas so it would be quite difficult for men and women to share lockers.
Propaganda. Good place but doesn't deserve that much propaganda, Big and huge AQUA-PARK but you can see it at every city in a smaller scale .Photos and souvenirs are too expensive.
not impressed. Seriously, im not impressed. Is just the name is big. If I have to choose prefer the Wild Wadi, Yas or even ras al khaimah for its choice and prices

FUN!!!!. Got complementary tickets from our hotel so thought it would be rude not to go for a few hours. You get wrist bands on entrance, a separate wrist band for a locker (bear in mind when sharing with you partner that there are separate ladies and mens lockers in the changing areas!) and a wrist band for photos that are taking on the slides etc!You get vouchers for towels and vouchers for a cup that you can get drink refills at AED5 each time.We dumped our stuff on some sunbeds, bagged ourselves a double rubber ring and hopped into the lazy river. You can get to Ziggerat where all the slides are from the lazy river (as well as walking around the park) and there is a conveyor belt taking you up to the first level (whilst sat in your rubber ring). To get to higher levels get off at the first level via conveyor belt and then wlak up the stairs. So much fun being able to do majority of the slides with your partner on the same ring - my husband and i laughed and laughed. So much fun.Life guards (friendly guys) everywhere all around the lazy river!There are rapids which are connected by the lazy river too - good fun & surprisingly fast!FAB day out!! :-)

Hours of fun. It's amazing how much fun you can have with an inflatable rubber ring. Myself and my wife happily floated round and round up and down Aquaventure for hours. So much fun. Well organised, safe and clean. Great place.

Fun, especially for young kids. This park splits into two parts - a small area appropriate for all ages, and a much bigger part with long rides and slides for teenagers and up. The first part is truly excellent and fun for teenagers and adults as well. The second is vast, but it takes so long to get onto anything, that you spend most of your time waiting, looking for tubes, swimming down the stream etc. Plus both areas were, at least on the day we were there, extremely crowded, the restaurants are all basically fast food joints, and there is no real service to be talked about. Also, we were lucky in that it was cloudy and not very hot - I can't imagine how unpleasant it can get on a hot summer day in Dubai. So, all in all, a fun, but very touristy experience. If you are in Dubai long enough and this is your cup of tea or have not been to another major water park elsewhere in the world, then OK, but otherwise better do the dolphin experience at Atlantis and see other sites of Dubai.

Kids loved the water-park at Atlantis. Floating river, beach and kids loved the play area with slides and water falling from different sides.....Towels rent is 30 AED, you are allowed 1 litre of drinking water per person...... Kids will love it

we had the best time. we were staying in the atlantis hotel and could go to the park when we wanted. Normally we have the kids arround all day (13 and 11) but now.......we didn´t see them all day. We also did the shark encounter and had great fun..!!! if was busy, but still we had a great time and not really long waiting in line to get on the `ride` we had a blast! if you stay in the atlantis you do not have a fee!

Well worth a visit. Visited Atlantis today for the first time, having been to Wild Wadi twice before. I have to say they are both very good.My preference though is with Atlantis, there are more rides at Wild Wadi, but at nearly 50 years old it is not all about the rides. The beach at Atlantis swung it for me, water park in the morning, a few hours relax time on the beach then back to water park.
Very good place in hot weather. Enjoy all what u think of water play , children and adults who have strong heart will be so happy and enjoy , in addition to food and arjileh

Perfect way to spend the day in Dubai. The day is full of fun! Water Activities by the dozen, children's play area is the best I've experienced! So many food options from Frozen Yoghurt to Lunch at Shark Bite, treat for all ages. A must do when in Dubai whether you visiting or live here!
Wow.. Very good.The best.The nicest.A good place to go and see and experience and please do not forget to carry your camera and make sure you carry an extra battery.
The best water park in the world!. This water park works for kids and adults of all ages. Even Grandparents! Fabulous experience. If you have an Imperial Club room, the water park entry is included
Water park. Sooooo much fun for kids and adults. Lots of activities and so clean. Great beach! Reasonably priced.

Hours of floating. You can spend hours here just floating around the miles of water ways, rapids, vertical drops through shark tanks.. It's got all types of slides . Great beach areas for sunbathing and smoothy bars.

Aquaventure Waterpark. Great idea to spend a relaxing day, offers swimming, sliding, sunbathing and chill-out. Sufficient number of water facilities and slides. On disadvantage side - tends to be overcrowded in peak times with insufficient number of seats.

amazing day. i spend all day long in this Aquaventure Waterpark
there is 3 packages but its all the same in playing nothing about speed access as permum ticket or fast access so its some time feel board to wait bu its really more fun.
and there is many resturant and games you just need to go there and enjoy

enjoyable, but dont bother with the restaurants. Had a really good day here, it got quite busy in the afternoon and the queues were quite long but the leap of faith was awesome! The restaurant food however was not and we would advise you to have just a sandwich. There was quite a lot of trying to sell you add ons (buy a plastic cup or add curly fries) but on the whole a good day out , you could try lots of different slides and the lazy river river was very relaxing. We would definitely come again.

THANK GOODNESS FOR THE DOLPHINS!!!. We booked and paid for a "Royal Swim" with the dolphins on line, which gives you access to the waterpark. We arrived at the waterpark at 12noon (our swim with the dolphins was at 4.10pm) .. it was chaos!!! There is no specific booth to collect your tickets if you have pre booked, so you have to queue up with everyone who is enquiring, thinking what package to get etc etc. We queued for almost 3/4 of and hour!! When we eventually got our tickets and got through to the waterpark, we went to get our lockers only to find that we had to pay for these too!!! We had paid over £300 for our experience, so we expected that the lockers would be included!!! But they were not, so we had to go all the way back to the entrance to get our tickets for the lockers at an additional £8 cost. The systems works on scanning a bracelet ... well, that didn't work very well either - it took me trying three different lockers until one worked!!!The rides were good but the queues were very long ... you were also not able to get a map of the waterpark anywhere other than at the entrance ... don't they know that people lose or leave their maps around??? The lifeguard staff were very good, but all the other staff were not particularly helpful.The dolphins were wonderful and well worth a visit but the waterpark seems unorganised and hard work when it should have been much more fun.

Totally overhyped.. This place is totally overhyped. Very expensive. Around 4500 rs. Per person including locker. Very few rides. Only two rides were good. I guess other indian water parks are far better with entrance around 700-800 rs. Aquaventure can just provide a locker for tht much. Was well maintined and staff was helpful but rides were very limited.

Aquaventure. We enjoyed a great day out as a family, mainly going round the lazy river all day, great for kids and adults all ages, loads of lifeguards keeping you on track and helping, only criticism was the queue to get in, took hours

I survived the "Shark Attack"!. Wow! wow! wow! Now we have Sun City and it is super fun! But this Waterpark is out of this world! It is massive to start of with so take a day and spend it there with the family so that you can get your money's worth!. The rides are to die for. The child in me soon came out and I survived the Shark attack, not once but four times! Now that is something else!. The lazy river leads you to many other rides and is just so awesome - far from lazy as you keep ondering where does this lead? Be sure to ask the most friendly life savers that are all around! Oh and take some time to say hi and catch a word with them as I think everyone is so busy having fun they forget that they are human!. Visit the dolphins and swim with them too (separate cost) - if I had the time we would have done this. The Acquarium is a big wow - (seperate cost to the water park). There are just so many things to do there but please ensure that you budget for all these , money and time wise. Take the Metro to Internet City and then board a bus or taxi (easier and quicker about 28AED). Get there early. Food court is also good and ample for all to choose from - if you have the time to eat as you are too busy having fun!
Great day out with the kids. Where better to be on a hot day?! Not the biggest water park we've been to, but very good quality. And the dolphin encounter was amazing. The kids are still buzzing!

Good, but Wild Wadi was better. We visited both Aquaventure and Wild Wadi whilst in Dubai. We were a party of 4 adults, for us Wild Wadi was the better park. Aquaventure had some nice touches, there is a beach that you can use with sun loungers on it. Some of the rides were accessible via a type of escalator which takes you up to the rides whilst you are still sat in your inflatable. There are individual or 2 person inflatables, no 4person rides like Wild Wadi has. There is an odd system where you have to wait for an inflatable to come free as people exit a ride. You are best to hang on to your inflatable once you have one. Most of the rides are fairly indistinguishable from each other and are not very long. Also the concrete floor gets really hot and we burnt our feet walking from the ride area to the locker rooms. Wild Wadi address this issue by constantly spraying the floor with cold water, quite a simple thing that Aquaventure could adopt.

Good , but not much for small kids. Besides about 3 rides, this water park caters more to the teens and above. Lots of fun rides. We did realize that in the rapids and lazy river ride, the floor is only cemented and if you get off your tube, your feet are going to have bad cuts on them. Overall experience was good.

The best waterpark I visit. This waterpark is really huge and You need all day (with some rest of course) to explore it. It is built very smart way - almost all slides starting in the main tower. Really, this was the Dubai best experience.

Great Place But Gets Busy. Lots of fun for all ages - staying at the Atlantis Palm was very easy to get into. Need to get there in good time to get chairs and is very busy in the afternoon. Rapids are fun and just floating around the park in the water very relaxing, although inflatables become a bit of a premium at busy times.Definitely recommend giving a go.

Lazy river. The lazy river is what you'd expect and the rapids are so funny. Everyone who works there makes sure you get the ride of your life on the rapids pushing you against the waves and splashing you.

Just a normal water park, please read. I consider myself as a water park fan, I have been in many water parks around the world. We went with my wife with a huge expectative about this park since it is located in Dubai and all the attractions that we visited previous to this were great. Couple of things that you have to know:1- The ticket price is expensive for the number of attractions that you have there, you just visit all of them in 1 hour and are not creative at all2- The most important thing that everybody complains about and I have NEVER seen in any other water park is that there just a few lifeboat so most of the attractions requires those and if you go to ask the staff where can you that ones, they said you have to wait 20 or 30 minutes and find one of those in the swimming pool.

Loved it. Whilst Americanised overall, we found this much more relaxing than Florida, where invariably you are squashed in. There is plenty of room here with the private beach overlooking the Palm, Burj etc wonderfully relaxing. The rides may not be as plentiful, but there is still plenty to chose from. Food & drink not expensive comparatively speaking - perhaps slight grumble is you cannot take in you own cool box. Loved the sun beds with the individual shades

Awesome day out. I visited both waterparks (Aquaventure and Wild Wadi) when visiting Dubai. Aquaventure looks fresher and better maintained (it is newer as well). If you have younger kids (under 1.2m), I would suggest this park as the rides are a bit slower. If you are looking for more adventure, go for Wild Wadi.
Fun. If you want to take a quick break and feel like you're in another country, this is the place to go. Disconnect from Dubai and go down a few crazy slides. Great fun!

top tips. get tickets day before as they are cheaper and queue shorter the next day, take your own towels and water plus plenty of sunscreen, dont take valuables, if you do, 40d for a locker that a medium size backpack fits into, food not allowed and your bag is searched, burger/chips were a good portion and wonderful eaten on the beach in the shade. Go early and hang on to your tube once you have it, two of the rides can be accessed by staying in the water and going around again - otherwise you may have to queue, need footwear as pavements get really hot, lots of lifeguards and all very clean, height restrictions for youngsters. ok to wear bikinis/swimwear and/or shorts. Sunbeds get taken early on so find yours then go look for a better one and then move your towels, usually plenty of free ones by the beach. a good half day entertainment but not all day, go early and do rides then relax on beach in afternoon - enjoy!!
Unforgettable adventure!!. It worth to be the best in the middle east, it is incredible unforgettable experience, you shouldn't visit Dubai without having it in your trip plan.

terrible. wildwadi is 100 times better, the rides here seem like they will be amazing but once you go on it you feel very regretful in paying so much money not worth the money and for a resort like atlantis it is a big shame

Aqua-do you dare venture?. Staying at Atlantis and visiting aquaventure was a dream come true. Sadly, the aquaventure park visit was marred by the rude and callous behaviour of the staff. While the park is beautifully done, the management have paid no attention to training the staff, or at least tell them to smile once in a way at the guests, who are after all the reason they have jobs there. Went on a rapids ride, and spent a good half hour trying to board the tube. Looked around and found a few other couples having the same difficulties. Finally scrambled onto one which overturned and sent me underwater and got a nasty bump on my head. The lifeguard watched stolidly. Finally asked a lady lifeguard, she said the tube was flat. Asked for another and got a rude glare in return. People were expected to find their own tubes, learn to board them themselves , and all along this route the so called lifeguards stood around in hostile attitudes and never helped a single person . Not what you expect from a water park that claims to be the best in Asia and Europe according to their own site. And a far cry from the room and restaurant at Atlantis ,where the staff was warm, welcoming ,friendly and accommodating.A really really bad experience altogether...

Family Day Out. We arrived before the buggies were up and running from the back gate as our grand daughter had an early presentation to go to on the beach. We could have done with a buggy from the gate as my husband has arthritis and it is a fair stretch to the first lagoons. Perhaps a few buggies should be available as soon as the gates open.Once there we had a problem with seating. Grandpa needs a 'proper' chair with arms and the only ones around were in the reserved 'cabins'. The alternative would have been an uncomfortable hard seat borrowed from the cafe.Fortunately a very nice obliging member of staff called Sanjiv rustled a suitable one up for him, refusing any tip.........well done Sanjiv, without your help my husband would have had a miserable day.The water was a lovely temperature, the Rapids ride more than enough for me, very long, though you can leave at various points and the rest of the family went off and enjoyed everything else.There is some building going on but not enough to be a nuisance. The trees and plants are lovely. The staff helpful, at one point I got lost, sad or what?Plenty of loungers and towels, I would suggest you go in your cozzie as the only changing facilities we had up our end were the loos in the cafe, not very convenient.Perhaps management could take into account that older more infirm family members need to be considered, perhaps a few chairs with fold up trays attached, we don't want to leave Grandpa at home all the time..........As my son-in-law used vouchers and discounts it was a good economical day out so I can't comment on the price.I enjoyed my day there.

Dog with fleas!. We were offered the water park as part of our dolphin adventure package - should have looked that gift horse in the mouth!!Looks good but the management is dreadful. There isn't a waterslide you could put a kid under 12 through as they are all terrifying and rough as hell. They also all require that you have a rubber inflatable ring. Maybe through some kind of warped sense of humour the management have seen fit to supply only half as many rings as there are customers!!! Therefore the best part of your day is spent searching for rings and thereafter wrestling with Russian ex-para's who seem to think the whole place is run like a gulag catering queue!Do yourself a favour and go to the Wild Wadi. The management at Aquaventure will probably thank you also as they obviously aren't keen on the general public being part of their business model!!
