Good FUN. this been my first trip to a water park of this size, it was good good fun, the rides were good, get there at 9:30am ,carry your towels and enough sunscreen, and have fun i did all the rides by noon after which it gets packed with people, did not get to tired as the rides are connected easily by one using the lifts, the leap of faith is scary fun,, food and drinks are pricey really pricey, luckily we had eaten a heavy breakfast so we did not eat there but i looked at the prices and its PRICEY, would go back there

Fun but a bit samey. Wasn't sure whether to visit here or Wild Wadi. Went for Aquaventure and was reasonably happy with it. Some of the rides are very similar but I enjoyed the Shark Attack. I'm a bit of a scaredy cat but was fine on Shark Attack, the river and 2 more in the Zigurrat tower. I actually started to get a bit sea sick from bobbing down the river for too long! We bought the platinum package but used a voucher in the reception of our hotel for a discount. This gave us a towel, locker, lunch and a souvenir cup including a drink. We felt this was great value for money. We arrived about 10.30 and there was already a fairly lengthy queue for tickets however we had no problem getting a sunbed. There are lots of beds for everyone, you just need to be prepared to settle on the beach if necessary.I am not a fish person at all but I really enjoyed The Lost Chamber - most enjoyable aquarium experience I've had.

So Fun!!. Booked pre paid tickets with expedia, and arrived at 10am with no waiting in line.If you're a family take a large locker, you'll only get a handbag in the small ones! Rode all the rides constantly over and over again(No one managed the Leap 0f Faith, obviously faithless family!) before lines started to build up about 2pm ish. We were all pretty much slid out by then!Having been to Florida/Disney waterparks this one seems the best designed. With most slides ending in rapids with conveyor belts to take you back up to other rides, this is CLASS! Not 3 millions steps to climb for every ride and plenty of shade for queueing areas.Would recommend that you leave well before closing as locker and changing areas didnt seem big enough for the size of crowds that this place pulls.18 DHS for a 500ml of coke is a CRIME! You're wallet has been warned!Apart from that we had a fantastic time!!

Boring after a while.. We had stayed at atlantis for 1 night and went to aquaventure in the daytime.The place is good but lack a lot of rides....There are only a few rides and even those are overcrowded with people.The park could have been better if they would have included more rides.The food inside is expensive.Overall a good place to relax with the family/friends.
Great day out. Great slides (leap of faith), clean beach area, aquairum and dingy rides on rapids. Pricey but a must do in Dubai. The locker/towel combo is a must.

Not just for kids and families. Visited in oktober 2011, two adults. We spent the entire day and we had a great time! Lots of different attractions, and many good restaurants. It was clean, and there were always many life guards around. Just remember to lather up on lots o' sunscreen!
Kids loved this. Had a great time with kids at this place. Looks a bit like paradise, The beach views are amazing. You can see the Burj Al Arab in the background.

Wonderful. Fabulous water park. Spotlessly clean and loads of lifeguards to make you feel safe and send you on whatever path you want to take. Great rides. Awesome when you go on shark attack and end up in the middle of the aquarium with fish all around you.
Great fun. Went three times in six days and had great fun on the lazy river and rapids, scared on shark ride but it was fine in the end. Great place

Good fun. Majority of rides are taken whilst sat in rings. If your one for high speed rides then this isn't the one for you. If you like to take it easy with the odd quick ride then this will be up your street. If you attend the Dolphin experience then the Waterpark is included in the price.
So much fun!. Lots of water rides so nice and refreshing especially because its so hot it's so nice to be in the water.

First impression was not good. We visited here the day before Good Friday, I had booked online for our party of 4 which included 2 teenagers. We booked the combined package for the Waterpark and Lost Chambers at AED275 (only AED50 more than the basic access to the waterpark). Definitely a must to go to the Lost Chambers as it is just a beautiful aquarium. As we had booked online we expected to gain access pretty quickly but this was not the case. My husband had to queue for 45 minutes just to get the tickets whilst myself and 2 teenagers had to wait outside a cordoned off area until we were passed our wristbands and then we were allowed access. You can take water in but nothing else, no juice, no crisps, no oranges, these will get confiscated when your bag is checked. So finally after nearly an hour after arriving we were in the park. We paid AED75 for a big locker to store our belongings and then headed off into the park. We did take our own towels. Most of the rides here you need an inflatable whether a double or single. I suggest once you have an inflatable that you keep it with you as at certain busy periods which for us seemed to be after 12 until 3 it was very difficult to find a free one. If you do sit down to eat with your inflatable with you the staff will try and take it off you which we noticed on a couple of occasions with other guests.Certain kiosks only took cash which bearing in mind you are in a waterpark seems stupid (the wild wadi give you a plastic watch which you credit with money which would be more useful).We didn't eat in the park we only had drinks which were quite pricey, a small bottle of water was AED15 (£2.50). We queued for all rides (except the lazy river/rapids). The quickest queue was about 20 minutes but the big rides was for about 30 minutes. We did "The Leap of Faith" which was great and the queues were big, you do get to go through the aquarium but you are going that fast that you don't get the benefit. Although there is one ride that you have a leisurely ride through the tube of the aquarium which is fantastic.Upon leaving the taxi queue was huge so we thought lets get the monorail but the staff member said that you would not be able to get a taxi at the end of the monorail (we appreciated his honesty) because its more that you park your car and get the monorail to the Atlantis. The monorail was AED15 single and AED25 return.Overall, would I visit it again.... no I wouldn't as I was very disappointed with it overall. We visited the Wild Wadi the following day and if I had to give a verdict it would be Atlantis 0 v Wild Wadi 1

Stingray feeding. We had previously been to the waterpark which was fun but we went this time to feed the stingrays. The park is great if you have kids there is lots to do but I personally don't rate it and think it is over priced for what it is...if you want to go I would recommend staying at the Atlantis so you don't have to pay to get in. However if you get chance you HAVE to feed the sting rays me and my partner did it the first time and was really lucky that there wasn't anyone else in the group. The staff are really friendly and very knowledgeable. When you get into the water (which is very refreshing as its cold) I was a little nervous as didn't know what to expect, me and my partner both held the shrimp under the water and what happened next was amazing!! About 20 stingrays come swimming up to you sucking on your skin which is a weird feeling but it is one of the most amazing things I have ever done. We got to stroke them, hold them I really can't recommend it enough, all the other fish come and play and there was a really big string ray that you aren't allowed to feed that swims on the bottom and tickles your feet. We loved this so much we went back a week later with my mum to do it again. If you can find out how many they have booked in at each time slot as I would recommend going with the smallest group to get the full impact of how amazing this is.

My favorite UAE waterpark!. The dolphins were amazing and it is worth getting a cabana!The rides were amazing and even though my 4 year old couldn't go on the slides (1.2 meter height restriction), there were so many other things going on he didn't know what he was missing.The waterslide that goes through the huge fish tank was absolutely amazing!!! There were a few lines but went quickly.The staff were great and responsive. On the river tube ride, an inattentive couple's small children went into the river and the lifegaurds scooped them both up straight away.I would avoid going on the weekends and to avoid the crowds, if you don't have a cabana, "grab" lounge chairs by the Barracuda restaurant. It's a nice quiet area of the park.They have some construction for another pyramid for waterslides but it didn't hinder any of the experience. I can't wait to see what they have come up with next!!!

Avoid in pick season. We spent an hour to get in, and then an hour on each slide in que. after just 2 slides in 4 hours we had enough and left!
Unbelievably horrible experience. And locals look at women in bikinis like they are something to eat. Not pleasant.

Expected more for the price. We are young travellers who were very excited to have a day planned at the waterpark. We don't have a lot of money so it was a big deal paying the full price for an entry for two people. Almost instantaneously we were sadly disappointed. We had packed our own lunch in the hope of saving some money and we only had enough money for the taxi ride home as we were on a tight budget. What they don't tell you however is that you are not allowed to take in ANY of yor own food. It is not signed anywhere before you enter the park nor is it anywhere easily seen on their website. As they took all our food off us we explained that we didn't have an money to buy food and they just looked at us and shrugged their shoulders like 'oh well'. Obviously they do this just so that they get you spending as much money there as possible. The food is all incredibly overpriced American crap, about $20 (us) for a sandwich, chips and a drink, too bad for people who are on a special diet or who have young children, there are no healthy options available. They have a good idea using band s toen the lockers although i saw countless people having trouble opening them and getting very frustrated.The thing saving this place is definitely the rides, they are pretty well run and there are some amzing adrenaline boasting ones. Just takes the fun away when you have to spend the whole day hungry :(

Such a fun experience for the family!. I had so much fun at this waterpark. The food is great. The seating is great. The changerooms are great. The rides are fantastic! Especially that really big one! Such a thrill! It was a great day out with the family. Recommended for friends or family. Don't go alone definitely. The more the merrier. Waterparks just aren't fun alone.

What a Blast!. We arrived fairly early knowing that as the day gets hotter more people would be visiting from the hotel, The Atlantis on the Palm. We got on one of the trolleys at opening time, 10:00 AM. Everyone gets a wristband for day long use of the watermark. We really were only interested in the slides and the Lazy River. There were several lounge chair areas to hang around at but we planned on using the real beach after the rides. There were plenty of lounges on the beach which is separate from the hotel beach. Of course towels and snacks/beverages are available and the lounging chaises come with a shade. Swimming is lovely there! Now regarding the rides!!!!-They were fabulous, fun, scary and thrilling! Beware that many of the slides are in the dark as you spin on a inflated tube spinning as you descend down the tubes! Not everyone cares for such amusement, so if you are not a ride fanatic like myself, the lazy river may be more appealing. It was a little crowded, but not a real problem. The cost was included in our booking at The Atlantis, but the information is easily found on the website! Enjoy!
Ok fun. It was poor compared to Wild Wadi, but fun nevertheless. Kids enjoyed it and went back almost every day
Fun!. Went during an off-season, which is the best time to travel to Dubai. Great place with lots of fun water activities for adults and children!
Very Crowded. Not my cup of tea. Found it very busy and disorganised. get there early if you want a lounger or a bit of space to yourself.

Great day out. Although the water park is quite expensive if your an outside the hotel visitor it's worth the money! It's a good day out and a great experience. Park is clean and organised efficiently! Food is fab as usually at water parks it's awful! Rides are great although some height restrictions got you get children! We walked round to dolphin bay and saw some of the dolphins too! Overall great day out!

Great, fun day out.. We had a really fun day here. Nicely landscaped with plenty of vegetation to keep it from feeling like a concrete jungle. There's loads of sun loungers but it can be hard to find one since everyone leaves their towel on them. Plenty of cafes and restaurants and the price really isn't bad. You can purchase a set menu that's about $25 which includes two meals and drink. Good quality food as far as theme parks go. Rides were all okay but some of them did hurt a bit, you bang your feet going round corners. Maybe thats just tall people....If you've been to the big Disney water parks, (Blizzard Beach, Typhoon lagoon) then this won't be quite as good but it's still good. Here there are less slides and you ride in a ring for all rides. You can go in double rings but there are no group raft rides or anything like that. Overall, this place was great fun, well staffed with lots of lifeguards (some could do with smiling a bit more though) and if you get 'The Entertainer' book the 241 voucher makes it reasonable value. There's also a small mall area on the way in/out that has shops, the aquarium and several restaurants and a frozen yoghurt place.

Great waterpark, large crowds. Atlantis' waterpark is well worth a visit, but be prepared to deal with the crowds. There are many more visitors to the park than available lounge chairs, so it is best to arrive early. The park has several levels of slides and lazy river paths, so there is something for every level of swimmer. Great family outing.
Great Waterpark. Love the crazy river with its rapids, great fun and just scary enough! Leave the more scary slides to younger visitors

Wonderful waterpark. Brilliant time had here as always the only 2 downfalls are - height restriction 1.2m is no use my six year old was sad as he could go on wild wadi rides last year ! Lack of rubber rings later in day and people start queuing for specific ones to cater for smaller children that have a filled in base. They could have more ? Apart from that its GREAT and it is the cleanest and friendliest water park I have ever been to. Another 5 star atlantis feature on the palm !

If you enjoy water rides, you have to go. Big park with amazing water rides. Some are slow and relaxing and others are fast and adrenalin pumps. It is quite busy so if you go, be prepared to wait. Book in advance as the ticket lines are faster then. If you don't book in advance, you could wait for a very long time in the line for a ticket.
Not as good as Wild Wadi. Having visited Wild Wadi in the past, I had to try the newer water park. Sadly it is nowhere near as good. If its thrilling rides you are looking for avoid.

FUN!!!. Spent half day in the park with 2 and 3 years old and it's enough to drain your energy almost completely. It was FUN for the kids and adults. Definitely a MUST GO for families with children...
Ok waterpark but extremely overcrowded !!. Pros - loads to do for the kids- on a BeachCons-extremely overcrowded so long queues for everything

Great Fun - Spend all day here!. you should pack a lunch and spend all day here!The slides are amazing but you have no idea what is what, you just have to take a risk. It feels very safe as you have lockers etc. I want to go back just to go here!

Good park, but silly height restrictions and some other issues.. The 1.2m height restriction is too high and limits young speed freaks to the boring rides. It is also discriminatory against midgets most of whom are less than 1.2m. Even when you measure against a fixed post, a moveable one is used at the ride so cannot be considered as calibrated but are considered the only acceptable measure, leading to disappointment. Step changes in the height of the base with no signs and hard plastic matting which seriously hurts if you slip down it. The paving is all concrete/brick paving, which unshaded gets dangerously hot and is also uncomfortable in bare feet, sprayed water to cool, shading or timber deck would be an improvement. Most ridiculous is that you have to find a raft and hold onto it as they are not available at the rides. Consider alternatives.
Fab. We an an excellent day at the watermark,clean place helpful staff, had a great fun day, the beach was great as was the little shuttle buggies if you didn't want to walk far.

Good day out. £160.00 for the day for 2 adults and 2 kids. I thought this was a bit expensive but plenty of good rise to keep you busy. Sunbed space in main park was a bit limited but plenty of beds on the private beach.

Overpriced but good day out. The aqua park is real well constructed and lots to occupy yourself with on a nice, hot day, however it is quite overpriced for what you get. I guess this keeps the numbers down, making the experience all the better, but still feel a little ripped off by it all. Shame that a great day out is ruined by the price.
good time!. We spent saturday at the park and enjoyed it very much. It has a clean and private beach, the slides are phenomenal! We were 2 adults... and really had a great time!

Lovely!. This is a nice water park but not lots of rides if that's what your after. We had no children with us but we enjoyed going and went on a few of the rides and then had some time on the very comfy sun beds. They had their own sun shades attached to each bed which was good. Our visit was in with the price of our hotel so that was great too. We had some lovely food and drink for our lunch there. The one thing I will say I think they need lockers nearer to other areas and not just main entrance.

Overpriced - better parks oustide the city. The park is not bad but its hugely overpriced for what you are getting. If you are with kids under 8 years old, there's also not many things they can go on which is a total waste. There are other waterparks outside of the cities which in my opiniion are way more worth it. - i.e. Iceland and dreamland.

Great rides but lacking in other areas. Visited Aquadventure on a recent holiday to Dubai and used a 2for1 voucher to get in which made it good value. My overall opinion is that the rides are great fun but there are a few issues which would put me off returning. We arrived just before it opened at 10am and didnt have to queue but be warned the queues quickly build up and a long wait is inevitable. Your bags are searched before you go in to prevent you taking in your own food and drink so not suprisingly the prices within the park were sky high (18dirhams for a bottle of water and 45dirhams for a cheeseburger, Im sorry but im not paying nearly £10 for a burger!!) All the rides except the Leap of Faith require use of a single or double inflatable ring which soon became a problem, we went on all the rides straight away then went and sunbathed for a while before trying to go on the rides again but couldnt find a free ring anywhere and eventually had to give up and cut short our day. We noticed people were taking rings back to their sunbeds and keeping them for later use thus preventing other people using them. We tried waiting near the end of rides for people to discard their rings but so did many other people and we ended up queuing in the water hoping for a ring. I think the volume of people in the waterpark probably outnumbered the rings by 4-1 maybe?On the plus side, the rides were great fun the best Ive been on, the beach is a nice place to escape the crowds and the locker rooms were clean and the showers provided complimentary shower gel and shampoo.My advise to anyone thinking of going, get a 2for1 voucher, get there early and get on each ride as many times as possible to get your moneys worth before putting your ring down as you'll struggle to get one later on in the day!
Fantastic family day out. Something for everyone and all ages. I have 2 sons aged 3 and 5 and they had an amazing time. the staff where very friendly and it was really clean and safe.

The most impressive tunnel in aquarium. Nice place to spend full day. Just most of people reserve 'beds' in the morning and do not use most of the time as spend time in the pool. It might take time to find a spare one or you do the same as others :-)Take your towel in case you do not want to pay ~40 Drh extra.
Good fun. This water park is very clean and there is soo much to keep all ages entertained. If you are a guest at The Atlanis hotel then you get free entry into this park.

Fun in the sun. We've been to Aquaventure a couple of times, we really enjoyed it alot, its big and the lazy rivers are the coolest, for if you would just like to chill in the water but still get some action.I love the layout of the park, as you dont have to get up on stairs and stand in queues, it's a great idea how you'd be on your tube and the water will automatically take you to the slide.All the staff there are smiley and they add alot to the experience, a few of them were singing, it was so fresh to see how they enjoyed and loved their jobs :)I would suggest for whoever's visitng Aquaventure to leave before closing time, as changing rooms get crazily unpleasantly busy, showers numbers compared to visitors just dont do.Another comment would be the overpriced food over there, and you have no option other than to eat, on a long day in the sun.Nevertheless its a must visit for dubians :)

Poor value. I was a bit disappointed when I went to the park. It costs over £50 per person to get in and there are not enough sun beds or rubber rings for the rides. There are not many rides as well and the better ones have big queues. There's a nice beach area if you prefer lying on sand! All in all it was great to go and wander round the palm but not good value. Siam Park in Tenerife is much better.

Pretty Overcrowded place, ... long waits. Very nice Water-park, but rather smaller than bigger. But there are few issues you need to consider. To get the tickets you can wait 40+ minutes in overcrowding hot place. Paying 50$ for the entry fee they should organize this better. They will try to sell you the things you do not really need. There are only few attractions (slides) and you can wait a petty long time (30+ min) to get to attraction. We have found many people staying in lines and just waiting.... a long, There is very nice beach, where you can find nice palm trees with shade. We have enjoyed more this than attractions. Delfinarium is what you should not miss.

Good fun for just a bit. The rides in the park are not as many as they appear from outside. The leap of faith, rapids, artifical wave pool, kiddie pool are all worth one - two visits. The rubber floats for two persons feel safer than the single ones. The kiddies play area is actually more fun than the adult rides and childrean have one whale of a time. Very safe and one can leave phones and valuables on the sun decks as we did.

Superber park with great rides. This is a excellent water park situated next to Atlantis hotel. view is excellent if you travel via monorail from starting of palm islands to water park. Rides are really amazing and its a huge place. Lots of activities for all ages. kids area have their own fun of rides. lazy rivers are very nice. In fact one is small one and the other one the big one its nice. all rides are great here... Must visit.
Fun for Kiddies and families. Very busy. Waited a long time to use the rides. Food at Shark attacks cold. Not enough staff showing you around. Probably one to avoid if you are stuck for time.

Great family attractions but need improvement in logistics. We drove to the touristy Atlantis which reminded me negatively of theme hotels in Las Vegas. I was glad we stay in the Kempinski on the Palm. At the Aquaventure are extremely long queues to purchase tickets for the park. So calculate that in when you have booked specific times for special attractions. Once you are in it's a kind of hard to find your way around. Asking the clueless staff doesn't help as well. So much for the negative part.We booked a shark snorkeling tour. This was a great experience for the kids swimming with predators in a controlled environment. The outstanding guide (a former NAVY diver) calmed down the kids and dispersed their anxieties. To scubadive would have been even better but snorkeling was a great start. The kids loved the slides. It's normally quite crowded but worth to wait.
Good but not the best. It is a good waterpark, with a nice range of rides, but this isn't Disney and the size and excitement are modest in comparison.

If your child is not at least 1.2 meters tall, don't go. Our 7 year old daughter (who has been on many, many rides before) was just a little bit too short to go on the rides, so was restricted to the kid's water park and the lazy river rafting ride all day. We knew there was a height requirement, but didn't realize it applied to all but just one of the rides, so we were quite disappointed. Even if our daughter was tall enough, there were not that many rides in the park. Also, smokers are allowed to smoke everywhere, which is not pleasant for non-smokers.It was a beautiful place, though, and we liked the awnings on each lounge chair which made it quite comfortable and relaxing.Make a reservation at one of the restaurants in the hotel in advance, or else they are booked up and you have to stand in a 40 minute taxi line with everyone else when the park closes.

Good time but marred by misinformed staff. Had a good day at the park. Rides were very nice and my son had a great time. Food was a bit expensive so would advise to buy the meal deal up front. A few complaints though. Smokers are not restricted to smoking areas away from the pool. Especially near the locker room entrances so changing clothes would take you through a gauntlet of stinking haze. Second one is that the website states lifejackets are complimentary but when i tried to get one for my son was told to get a towel rental ticket first. Very dissappointing.

A splash of Dubai. A well designed water parliament.Modest in size - those experienced with the mega parks of Florida and the like could be disappointed.Park has one main set of flumes and the neat trick is that once you are on you can access the slides again from the lazy river without queuing again.Park also has the obligatory free fall.One flume passes through the aquarium at a speed you can enjoy the fish.Good feature is the Rapids - a lazy river with a twist - there are a number of strategically placed fast flowing rapids a great fun and a soaking. You can keep going round for as long as you want !!As with most Dubai facilities - spotlessly clean and well designed.Food outlets are average.Tip - if all the loungers are taken around the pool and rides - the park has it's own beach where you will find loads more loungers and a good beach restaurant.All in all a good day out but may disappoint the seasoned water Parker.

superb place. although i did not get enough time to go to aquaventure, even though it was in my must visit list. you have to go there. there is one big water slide , which takes you in a see through tunnel, where you find yourself in middle of sharks. but you are safe. so must visit

Awesome waterpark. As a guest at Atlantis the Palm, we had complimentary access to the park. The rides on the Ziggurat are scary but oh so much fun! Get there early to beat the crowds that come in via the monorail and taxis - you will get the best value then and enjoy all the rides.

Never ending fun. This waterpark is one of the best waterpark i have ever been to.Also one of the best in Dubai.Very beautifull with free beach access.Water wark, rides are so lively that you will enjoy every moment of it.It's a full day activity and man so many deadly rides are there.There is also wonderful ride for kids also.Lot of food options are available. Water temperature is very well maintained irrespective of hot weatherAdvise:1)If coming from a long distance and want to save some money, reach to Dubai internet city metro station and then take taxi ( 25 dirham)2)Monorail is there in Atlantis, however it does not link you to metro.Monorail is also expensive,but will give you different view from the above3) If don't have time to go to dubai mall aquarium, upgrade your aquaventure pass to combo pass which will also include access to there aquarium

Plan the whole day for fun and relax. This place was recommended by friends and we are so grateful for that! It's a perfect place for everyone as there are so many different attractions. What we liked the most is the servise and guests comfort. You can float at the lazy river or take more adventurous ride without jumping out of the inflatable circle as there are escalators that bring you up. There are plenty of staff/safe guards and they are very helpful. The time flies quickly in there so it's better to appoint a day for this treat.

Get wet!. We spent three days in the absolutely owesome Atantis Hotel. The waterpark is included and we went there 3 days! The kids was busy the whole time, nver get tired - exept in the evening - thanks god - but also we grown-ups has tonnes of fun there. Great slides - leap of faith was owesome, my little daugther - just 10 years old - went down 7x...

Fun and more fun!. The kids will have a blast. It is a great way to spend a day with the family..Although they should warn you that you are entering an area with a different depth. I got injured as I was kneeling in the water, and the currents took me to an area with a different depth..I should have adjusted my position to accommodate the new depth..overall it was amazing!

Great park for kids and adults. This great Aquapark is catering for kids and adults alike. Access to the park give access to the hotel beach which is really nice. The Aquapark will soon be doubled in size which promises to enhance the already rich experience.
Really good. Clean, great service, food,etc. not loads of rides but what a lovely place. We spent 2 hours at dolphin world but this is a quality day out for families. Highly recommended.

Average aquapark with great beach. Aquaventure is aquapark attached to Atlantis hotel and is very attractive to inhouse guests who can walk everywhere at any time without limits.For the outside guests access is very limited.Beach is great and very long,almost 3/4 of a mile,but there is no waves and that's littlefrustrating.Standard attractions,lake with dolphins(with extra heavy payment)lazy riverseveral pools nothing new.Except Ziggurat and pool with sharks.

Wet , Wild, Cool!!!!. if you are a water park lover you must visit Aquaventure- well known waterpark located in Atlantis Hotel. Exiting water slides, River to amaze you. you definitely will have fun! not expensive!

Excellent venue.... Sun loungers very very close together, and people reserved them all day so we had to go to The Barracuda Area.2 of the ladies got bruised bottoms from one of the small flume/ tube rides.Pretty expensive but we had an excellent day...

Good water fun overall with a few reservations. Very large park by European standards with a lot of beach area, very clean and well landscaped and lots of lifeguards around. Plenty places to eat although pricey as you would expect. Buggies available to whisk you to different areas of the park. Pretty much litter free.Children's section is fantastic as is the river ride but please be aware that the rapids can be quite fast and you may end up travelling backwards which will come as a shock when you get a faceful of water so something to be aware of if you are nervous in the water.Overall a good day out especially for the kids if a bit pricey.

Brill. Go! Even if your a fully grown adult without kids as an excuse!. Fun fun fun. Like wild wadi but with a few unique things like the shark tank. Can be a little pricey but compared with what you get in other countries it is justified.
Best Waterpark in the world. Great fun and a must do in Dubai. Unique rides combined with a nice beach area. Would highly recommend for anyone who likes a thrill.

funfilled park. the park was the best water park to visit, it is located in the palms in the atlantic hotel which has the best under water world with loads of fishes, Tip: take combo ticket to save money for underwater & park

AMAZING. Great fun for kids and adults. There's many slides and attractions. The rubber ring slides are the best. I visited the Atlantis for 4 days last summer and spent 2 days at aquaventure. I would love to go back...its good for family days out.
Excellent aqua adventure. We stayed at Atlantis and visited Aquaventure Waterpark. All of us (both adults and teens) were delighted and enjoyed our time there

Kids (and adult) had best day ever. Awesome fun for kids and adults alike. The freefall ride is probably the best but many of the rubber ring rides are great too. A note of caution though - if you are a bit claustrophobic, you may not like this park as many of the rides are in the dark.

I went solo and still had fun. Get there when they open to claim a choice chair for your towel and use lots of sunblock. Many of the tube rides are connected so you never have to leave the water...unless you want to take on the Leap of Faith and a few other rides. Spent the whole day there and enjoyed hookah at sunset on the beach! Not cheap...but hey, you're on vacation!

Very Roomy Water Park with Beach. This is another great water park with acres of space so never a problem getting a lounger. The rides down the various lazy rivers are good fun and suitable for most ages. The more exciting rides do require climbing stairs and queues build fairly early in the day but it is worth it, all are quite different. There is also a huge little used beach which provides safe swimming, the whole place shouts space which is different to Wild Wadi which is far more compact although still excellent. Food is reasonably priced and there is a fair choice available - you are not allowed to take your own food or drink into the attraction. Always check in the winter months that the whole park is open, at time of writing (March 13) half the lazy rivers are closed due to maintainance and no reduction in price!

Fun for kids and grown ups. We visited the park quite a few times during our stay at the Atlantis, admission was included in the room rate. If we had to pay, I think one time would be enough - the price for a day is AED225 for adults and AED180 for children (about $50-60), plus the cost of towel rental, locker and food which is exorbitantly priced!There is a nice area for children with lots of fun slides, our child really enjoyed it. One downside to that area is that lots of families dropped their belongings off on the sun chairs but never actually spent time on the chairs (since people are in the water for most of the time) making it almost impossible to find a chair. Seems logic to me that you don't need to "reserve" 5 chairs if you will only use one or two at one time. We had only one chair for the 3 of us every time and that's all we needed since the kids area is not a place for sun tanning, it's a play area and we were in the water with our child most of the time. The lack of common courtesy was a bit disturbing.For grown ups there are also a few nice rides - we tried them all and thought the leap of faith was the best of them (almost vertical slide that goes through the shark pool). Nothing too extreme, but fun nonetheless. The river rapids were also a hit with our child. It can be a bit hard to find a spot at the main pool, but if you go to the beach near the restaurant Barracudas, you will find lots of spots available. It's at the far end of the park and there's some construction going on nearby but it's really not that disruptive and you probably won't even notice.As can be expected, park is busier on weekends - Friday and Saturday, as Sunday is the first day of the work week in Dubai - but even on the weekend we didn't have to wait long in line. Lots of lifeguards, really lots! We never felt unsafe.

Exciting Place. Its nice, big, fun, exciting and offers so much in a good price. No matter who is traveling with you. If you love water sports than this is the place for you. If you want to feel 2secs of free fall and wants to land in sharktank than this is the place for you. Must visit place.

Can find fun here.... It is a place to enjoy with group of people. At least 2-3.Specially for adventure oriented people will find this place worth a visit.If you are not adrenaline junkie, still there are few water rides which u can enjoy, artificial beach inside the aquaventure, or palm beach, is a place where u can just lie down and relax.Leap of faith is must, if u r young and fearless. Dive in with shark and sting ray is also fun.Towels require ticket so carry it with you. Dont leave it in lockers.

Fun in the Sun. A wonderful sun and funfilled day of laughs and adventure we had! The rides were really great, the food and service was excellent and I can really recommend the complete package for AE300 (includes entrance for the day, a meal voucher, a locker and a fresh beach towel). I will definately be going back with the whole family!

OK, but only just. Aquaventure at the Atlantis Palm Dubai is OK. The staff were excellent, it is spotlessly clean but the biggest problem is this. In essence, there are only 3 rides, plus the Kids area. The Lazy River is good, with some rapids as well, the Leap of Faith is OK, but nothing compared to some other parks (supposed to be 30m high but.........), and all the other rides are pretty much the same, although they are good. The problem is that there is little variety to keep people interested, and they are charging 225 AED to get in. Wild Wadi is cheaper and has much more variety. I was bored quite quickly, and I'm 46!!

Less value for the same price. When we arrived we were told that a part of th rapids was closed due to maintenance. This was small part of the rapids and would nor affect the rides nor reduce the admittance price. Having been there before, we notice that the current in large areas of the rides was down to zero and you found youself between lots of empty floating rings paddling like hell to move at least a bit. This must have been known as in a lot of areas you had personnel from the parc pushing you forward. Compared to previous experiences, this was a very disappointing day!!

Profits over Safety. Save your money and go to Jumerirah. This place used to be our number one family vaction spot, but it must be under new management as the service was terrible and the staff was more concerned about us paying, even though we were staying at the hotel, then the safety of our child who was given an unsatisfactory flotation device and when I asked the staff to provide her with something more appropriate they looked at me like I was crazy! Next time we will be spending our 25,000 AED at Jumerirah and you should as well.
A good day out. I have been here 4 times now and always enjoy it. This last time was with family, one observation is that there is limited items for the under 3's to do

Good for family - Good fun. We went here on beginning of March 2013,We did not pay entrance, because we were guests of the Atlantis The Palm Hotel, so it was complimentary.Opens at 10h00Closes at 18h00A nice waterpark. As you can see, I am not overwhelmed. Let me discribe it.Many many lifeguards. No one will ever drown here.Mainly only tube slides. Only one steep "normal" slide.Wild water canals to be ridden on tubes.No holiday, no weekend, we were here on low season. As of about 11h00 almost all sunlouges were taken, although there are many.As of about 11h30 there were cues at many of the interesting slides. Nice thing:Most slides take you up without waliking. Either with (rather slow) escelator, or they jet you up.some of the tubes have a hight min. of 120cm.Nice big pool for smaller children, with many small slides. Again many lifeguards. BUT My smaller one was a bit scared, because every 3-5 Minutes a big bucket unloads many liters of water onto the whole construction... Even for an adult a lot of waterpressure to handle, but just puts a 3 year old flat on the water. Nice idea, but no good.This place was clearly designed by Sol Kerzner. But his first waterpark at Lost City is a lot better! A lot! Been there many times.Similar for the Hotel by the way. It is not worth the entrance price! A Burger (no chips=french fries, nor coke) is at EUR 8,- A souvenir T-Shirt at EUR 30,- even for a 3 year old.Very expensive place and nothing out of the unusual. Slides are not special, nor do they have special effects.Of course this average rating is due to the high price. Would this cost about EUR 20,- per Person it would be a "Must Go".So if you are a guest of the Hotel, its free, Go and have a lot of fun.If you are not a guest but go to the Palm extra for this Aquaventure Waterpark... Its not really worth it if you know waterparks in the world. Lost City is a recommendation.Oh yes: It was only 30 in March - I have trouble immagening the place at 40 and hotter, for I thought that there were too little shady places.

Never too old. Not been to a waterpark for years, pushing 50 and it was fab, went on many many of the rides, be warned the stinger is a bottom shredder no matter what size you are! Very safe we left our stuff ona sunbed most of the day with no problem, sunbeds tend to be a dumping ground for belongings and can be in short supply for sunbathing. Park well laid out, added on the shark safari (30 mins in tank with a dive helmet walking amongst the sharks and rays 4m below) followed by hand feeding the rays in the shallower waters of the same tank and boy can those things suck!

Fabulous waterpark. Very nice waterpark, kids corners, private beach. Great system of using tubes and lifts to get you on slides. Possible to swim with dolphins. Services are very pricy. Especially memory photos which are 20 EUR/piece.

good runs for everybody. as everything in dubai this is extremely overpriced but quite good with many extreme water runs and on the other hand leisurely long runs good for smaller children or older people. The double rings are coveted as some runs are allowed only as double. one can easily spend a day there better come early because it is crowded at noon with long queuesthe lockers are too small so you need one per person! and everything has a dubai premium!

fantastic time. we went with a little girl and an old lady... we all loved it and had great fun, the rides are brilliant and there were no queues, staff was friendly and helpful and not in ur face all the time... a great day out

Must do with family and/or friends. While in Dubai, a trip to Aquaventure (at the Atlantis) is a must-do. Its a lovely water park with water rides for adults and a massive children's pool and play area. The park also has its private beach.Carry your sunscreen along and have a blast!NOTE: There is a new water park in Abu Dhabi near the Yas Marina circuit. I did not get a chance to visit but it claims to be the best in the world. It can be an alternative to Aquaventure.

Not that safe of rides. i visited the place in Feb 2013 and to be honest its amazing .the atmosphere is great and the beach is super perfect. you can get your fruit juice pinaple is amazing ! and go to beach and get shisha or a meal or a drink while sitting on beani's the open water is infront of you and behind you is green.however , the rides are not safe they r very steep and fast which is not a great thing when the tube your using is not that inflated. the guards are so out of it they barely care about anything.our tube flipped on us and i thank god that it was near the end as we would have gotten stuck. also thee fact that the people behind us are coming and so i didn't what to do i rushed out and hurt my leg. all the guard did was ask if am okay?! they dnt look or regulate the rides properly , when they did they stopped the escalator while we were in it going up and it stopped in the middle which hurt my back even more since it was a comfortable elevated position .while in the park i saw a man getting hurt and the med team coming to help him and the thing that freaked me out was a lady who was freaking out in the river and screaming on the gaurds to help her and they just stood there doing nthn! and then she had to run to the front desk!..compared to wild wadi the team there was more tentative and caring and they are very strict for the guests safety!

A good day out but beware closed areas. A very good water park however sun ends can appear at a premium so can the rubber tubes that are used for most of the rides. If it looks busy first place to go is near to the barracuda restaurant. Two reasons, first there are loads of sun beds that most never use, secondly it's also a good place to pick up spare rubber rings. At the moment a fairly large section of the park is closed for refurb. Whilst this is made clear when you are buying tickets (except not how big it is, just stated as a section of the rapids) it should be made clear on their website and ant so once you've spent money getting there you are less likely to turn around and go back to your hotel/home. It's a large enough section that I think should be reflected in reduced prices and aren't. The other good thing about going to the barracuda side is that currently they are doing BBQ food which tastes great served with rice or veg and roast potatoes. Considering a captive audience the 110 for surf and turf was good vale

Excellent day out for all ages. As part of our package we had unlimited water park access and enjoyed this to the maximum.Only negative commentary is that not all the rides were functioning and remained this way for the entire duration of our stay.Very well supervised and managed.

Loads of fun!. I truly enjoyed my stay here. I spent overnight in Atlantis so I was able to visit the park for around 8 hours. Guests staying in Atlantis gets a free entrance. There's a nice beach, unlimited use of towels, plenty of sunbathing seats, lockers (for a fee) and nice restaurants. Kids will definitely enjoy the little slides and the pool made for them while teens and brave adults will surely get thrilled to try all those slides. Bravest ones should try the Leap of Faith, A 9-story tall slide wherein you will almost slide standing! and when you go down, you will pass by this tube surrounded by sharks! Truly a great experience. I tried it twice for the photos. Lol. Tip: The pyramid-like structure leads to all the slides. If you go directly to the water, it will just lead to the rapids!

Fantastic day!. What a brilliant water park. My son who is eight loved all the rides especially the 'leap of faith'! Get there for the park opening as the queues are short. In fact non existent in some cases. Lots of fun!

A great Splash!. Fun place for adults and kids alike. The entrance is a bit expensive but well worth it for a once in a time event. The food there is not the best but it was good. Also a little on the expensive side. Expect to spend approx 400 dirhams including tickets.

A lot of fun in very nice surroundings. Even if it is quite expensive, it is worth to spend a day there. Take the platinum package which is 325 Dhs per person, but you´ll get a towel, a locker a meal including drink and a souvenir cup which can be refilled for 5Dhs instead of 15 Dhs! You will find discount booklets at every hotel that save 40 Dhs per person! The park is amazingly designed, palmtrees all over the place, grassland next to the beach and a lot of sun loungers around. Nevertheless it was quite difficult to find an empty spot for 4 persons. The slides are great, a very steep one, tube roller coaster and a lazy river which isn´t that lazy, including rafting, the ride around the park takes about 30 minutes and is a lot of fun. Single and double tube rides, a kids playground, slides that take you through the shark tank and direct beach access with beach volley ball and beach soccer field. Definitely a great place to have fun in Dubai.

Excellent Water Adventure Park. Whow ! is the first word that will come out the moment you enter the water park . We went there with the entire family . I would advise you to reach this place by metro and on the way you can have a look at the beautiful Palm area and the entire journey is wonderful . I advise to buy the Platinum ticket which is a nice deal.

the leap of faith. This is a 27.5 meter, near vertical drop ride at 70km/h into a tunnel underneath the shark pool. very impressive experience. the park is all about waterfun. i stayed half a day and found it enough.

A Blast!. The kids (6 and 8) loved it. The layout is nice because you can just float around everywhere in a tube. You can do the rapids, lazy river or the slides as you like. There are also plenty of lounges and pools to just hang out. Some of the less crowded pools are a bit hard to find, so if you want to get away from the crowd, spend some time looking at the far side of the park.

Great!. Fantastic water park in an amazing location right at the tip of The Palm. Great lazy river rapids and some really good water parks. Don't bother with the monorail, just take a taxi right there. Private beach also included in the price, but to be honest other than the view the beach is not very good.

Brilliant. I have been to a few water parks, and this is definitely up there with the best. The queues were exceptionally quick and all of the rides were up and running which is rarely the case in water parks. The water park even has a beautiful beach where we could take a break from the high adrenaline slides. The layout of the park is great, with all of the slides beginning on the temple like structure in the center, and depositing you in the lazy river which circles around. We had a great day at Aquaventure, although we are unlikely to return as it is astoundingly expensive.

Nice waterpark, beware of taxi stand scam. This was our fifth visit to this waterpark (having previously also stayed at the Atlantis on two occasions). It is definitely worth getting the Entertainer book for the 2-for-1 voucher. Nice features are the conveyor belts which get you to the top of the Ziggurat without having to carry the tubes upstairs. And of course the shark attack ride. Plenty of seats. New locker system posed some problems for us (and others we saw as well). One of us had to go back to the entrance to get a new wristband. The one thing we were displeased with was the taxi stand, who after we insisted on a normal taxi, put us in a hotel taxi that would run on the meter (so the duty manager assured us). Upon arrival at our hotel (also on the Palm, a five minute drive) the driver wanted to charge us 40 dirhams (normal rate including a tip is 20 dirhams). We got into a discussion about not turning on the meter, we just left him with the 20 dirhams which was the correct amount and left.
Fantastic day out - we Weill return!. We will certainly return because we had such a marvellous day today. excellent value for money and every detail has been well planned.

Something for everyone.. There is a great mix of water entertainment. Definitely worth doing the single and double hoop rides. Can spend all day their, I'd take a rash type top to keep you warm as you could spend all day in the water. We bought the tops at one of the shops at the entrance.Only thing to add is that a few more rides would top it off, I understand they are building them at the moment. I'd return anyway, anytime.

Super fun. I went to the water park with my wife in Feb 2013. The park is a little way from the city and located at the tip of the Palms development. the entrance fee is a little steep at around 300 dirhams per person. This includes park entry, a locker and a towel. However, it is totally worth it considering the huge expanse the park covers and the numerous water rides available.There are multiple lagoons to chill in and the place is clean and well maintained. The ride through the shark tank is amazing and must be experienced.

Waste of time and money- compared to YasWorld or Wild Wadi. You land up here to get counted in numbers who visited Atlantis- Palm Hotel.. but then you stroll down a common market place to get to this park.. with astronomical rates..... suggest go to YasWorld or Wild Wadi if you want real water park..
FUN FUN FUN. its an awesome place to go with family and klids, great day out, its quite big too, too much to walk around, but the rides are always fun. safe too

real fun :). The park is very clean and big, but brilliant in the same time as you dont walk a lot to reach a ride, just enjoy the river and you'll reach the required ride :) I love waterparks and this one is really nice, there are some rides that will lead you to a tube inside the shark's aquarium, but I have to say that most of the rides in this park seems to be the same, only small difference, but at the end you'll enjoy it, some people was telling me that the rides in Wild Wadi aquapark Dubai is better, I didnt go to Wild Wadi so I dont know but if you have enough time visit both of them, waterparks are nice :)

Leap Of Faith!!!. We visited this water park on 14th feb 2013. We had great fun overthere. The water rides are too good... Leap of Faith is just mind blowing.. I was shocked like anything.. Must Do it!! I also loved the concept of Shark Attack rides.. Food is costly, but tasty.. The beach is also nice.. The views from the top floor of the Leap of faith is just great.. Had fun doing photo session over there :D

They might forgot the small stuff. It's a bit windy when we went there, so we spent lots of time in the water in order to avoid the wind.The slides is challenging! and also amazing! I enjoyed the most that most of the slides have a view to the giant aquarium where you can see the sharks just next to you!However, the service in the changing room (The attendance) is not friendly at all. Most of them are only taking care for the visitors who pay more for the lockers facilities. One thing that they need to add is a plastic bags (if you may forgot to bring it from home for the wet bikini's/swim suit). Wild Wadi had this and it's very helpful.All the restaurants it's very pricey, well...it's in Aquaventure...The wristband is also not really comfortable to wear, they should change with something more durable.With the ticket price and facilities, you should really have a plan to go here.

Great fun. Had a lot of fun. It's very safe and clean, the staff are very friendly, and I barely had to queue for anything. But we went with our toddler that seemed to find the water a tad too cool (don't be put off, I thought the temperature was great), so my husband barely went on any rides, which made it a bit expensive as I was the only one taking full advantage of the park! But it is fun and the views of Dubai are quite impressive. Food is overpriced, and I noted that they really did not check your bags all that much, so you might want to sneak some snacks in!!

Brilliant Experience. I used to live in Dubai and Saudi Arabia. During that time this was one of the family favourite places to visit. Could be considered to be expensive but it's relevant when looking at the location and the venue. There are family attractions and then there are those for the adults who want to experience the thrills! The leap of faith is terrifying to look at knowing that you've got to experience it to save face! Lasts no more than a few seconds but well worth it!The whole day was spent with family and friends and we'll go back when we return to Dubai.
Enjoyable time. Very nice and enjoyable time we spent three hours but was fantastic and kids enjoy itIt preferable to go from mourning till end of the day to enjoy the whole day

Brilliant, but very expensive. The park is well set out and we managed to get around everything quite a few times. Sun loungers were plentiful and there were lots of staff around to point you in the right direction.The slides themselves were ace. Very safe as there were staff member at every turn making sure nothing got stuck and that people behaved sensibly. The lunch was very nice and I would recommend the refill drinks especially if it's hot. We were able to leave our cups, etc on our sun loungers with no problems at all. My only complaint would be the price. It cost us well over £100 for the day and that was just the two of us, so a family would need to save up!

Best attraction in Dubai. Went here on a Thursday with a friend, all the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful, loads to do! Dont forget to pop down to the beach while you're there and take in the view over to the Dubai shoreline. Would definately go again.
It was fun. I did the rides, there were not many for the price. Was fun though. Only was there for about 2 hours

Lots to do. This attraction is located at the site of the Atlantis Hotel on Palm Island, west of central Dubai. There is plenty to do within this very popular and active feature from pools to beaches and water rides of varying speeds. The cost is pretty reasonable and a Silver package includes a towel and a locker to store your dry clothes and valuables while you're splashing about.A couple of notes: (1) There are a lot of restaurants near the entrance to Aquaventure, but some are supposed to be for Atlantis Hotel guests only. However, the guards assigned to restrict access to these guest-only restaurants lack conviction and most people brush right past them. (2) Although regular cabs routinely drop people off at Aquadventure, people leaving the attraction in smal;l, cab-sized groups are channelled into Lexus cabs. These cabs are also metered but they cost more than regular cabs and in spite of having advanced navigation systems in the cars they don't seem to always find their ways to where you want to go via the most direct (i.e., cheapest) route.

Good Time Pass in Summer. Clean and well maintained, almost all the seasons, looks crowded, need to know Swimming to enjoy all the attractions, for me ,i dont know swimming, hence i couldnt enjoy more. But they have separate ride for adults and Kids Zone.They have Nice Dolphin Shows and Big Aquarium. Coffee and food/ Snack Shops are available and bit Overpriced.Nice Location, You will Enjoy the Way to the Water park as it looks more cosy and the view of the Mono Rails.

Only one really fun ride... We had a great time at the park mostly because we enjoyed each others company, but we were pretty dissapointed by the rides. Most of the time you are sitting in a floater thinking it's a ride, but it's only transporting you through the park.. There was only 2 rides that was really fun, so I would choose another park if I go again. Probably fine if you have small children who can't go on the rides anyway... but then agin... why go? Enjoy Dubai!
Fantastic. Spent most of the day here while at Atlantis loved every minute of it. The rides can make you a bit sickly though!
A good day spent!. Awesome slides, especially the tallest one that has a tube through the shark tank. If going in summer - make sure you have slops/shoes as your feet will burn on the hot pathways!

Very disappointed. We went in a large group with 8year old children and we left really disappointed. It was overpriced and the lines for the rides took forever. We managed to go on the Leap of Faith (which was pretty cool actually) after a two hour wait. But it was so crowded we had to pick a secluded spot for our sun beds, which were far away from everything. And there aren't enough floaters for all the people they packed in. The food was good though. But overall disappointing. For that price you should expect more, MUCH more.

just like everything else I dubai.... amazing,cleanest water park I've seen, so many different ages and cultures there. I would if you are European be prepared to be stared at if you are walking around I a bikini.life guards every 20 meters, friendly slide guys, amazng time,chickened out on the leap of faith. wonderful day Out for all ages
AMAZING waterpark. For someone who does not like waterparks I managed to spend half a day here and loved every moment. The lazy river is so relaxing especially on a double ring

Great for all the family. Something for all ages, staying at the hotel so visited 2 days and the kids would have stayed for more if they had the chance. Could see it getting very busy at times, but never had a problem with wait times for rides

Nice to Cool off but quite expensive. We really liked how the lazy rivers were joined onto slides and went on for ages especially as the ground was so hot it burnt to walk on and my flip flops did slightly melt in the 45 degree heat. It is fun but we only stayed a couple of hours and that was enough

Fantastic day out!!! Oasis in the middle of a desert!. Spent half a day with my wife and 4 kids at Atlantis. The artificial beaches, the sun beds, the lazy river all make for a absolutely chilled out time. The rides add the fun & excitement... The best part about this is that you can remain in the water at all times on a tube and the rides come to you...

Leap of Faith. Did the leap of faith 3-4 times, the best thing to do...the good thing about this waterpark is you take a tube and laze around and the rides come to you, no queues, no getting out of water !!

Leap of Faith. Aquaventure is one of two main waterparks in Dubai. The other being Wild Wadi I would say its the second best of them. Situated at Atlantis hotel it's free for guests of the hotel but rather pricy if your not. There are multiple rides all very very good but on stands out from the rest: The Leap of Faith this is essentially a vertical drop which then goes through a shark tank in a tube and out the other end it's one of the most exhilarating waterslides ever!! Reaching over 32mph and lasts about 6 seconds it is a great hit for kids! As it has a special kids zone with climbing parts and a bucket full of water.

Great day out... well maintained park. As all parks in Dubai (we found) it is well maintained. It is a fantastic place for teens to spend a whole day.The only downside ... It is far from the city. So, you can only get there by car or taxi. Taxi queues can get long and disorganised.

One of the Best Water Park. There're 2 water parks in Dubai..we read the reviews before we made the decisions..but we found that there were both positive and negative reviews on Atlantis and Wadi Wadi..But, finally we chose to go to Atlantis..because we wanted to try the water slide - THE LEAP OF FAITH!!I was a bit scared when I saw the THE LEAP OF FAITH!!...So high and so straight...But, it was better than what i expected...coz it was so fast ....within 30 seconds..i already arrived to the bottom...actually, i didn't have the time to think about it or being scared...^O^Then, we tried several times again and again..it was really cool!!Apart from the exciting water slides, I like the Shark Attack, you could see the shark from the tunnels...it was nice!And the waterpark is so big and there are many slides you could spent a day...Also, there was a beautiful beach. The sand is white and the sea is watery green ....There are many benches on the beach and you could relax and enjoy the beautiful view ...sun ....sea breeze....

CRAZY.... it's really amazing place - you scare but you do it again, you think this dark tunel will never end, you fly in it so fast and ask god to protect you and after coming out, calmdown and doing it again, climbing to upper levels. also amazing if upon flying in the tunel in aquarium you watch different fish around the you, aroung tunel i mean... if you are in Dubai, go there even if you do not like extreme!!!

Dive with the dolphins. When you visit this Waterpark you have to consider that this will be an expensive day. You are not allowed to bring food inside and they are controlling this at the entrance. So you need around 40-50 USD extra per person (minimum) as the food inside is of cousre expensive. You need to bring your jandels along. Especially in the sommer. Otherwise you will burn you feet on the hot flooring.

A few hours of good fun.. We went to the water park after midday late January (winter) It's not overly cheap to get in, but these places never are. As soon as we got in we headed for the water slides. Almost all of them start in the main Aztec styled tower in the centre of the park which makes things nice and easy. The selections of rides is good. All very clean and modern, and easy to get to because its all very central. Compared to Wet And Wild in Australia it's great. They also have a great system where the rides interconnect or flow on to each other which eliminates a lot of walking and lining up. When we firs arrived there were hardly any lines so we were able to use each slide very quickly without queuing. It then got quite a bit busier by about 3 and lining up would have been about 20 - 30 minutes per ride. Having risen each one once we had our fun and went home. Quite an expensive three hours but a lot of fun. These places just are not worth the money when you spend the whole time lining up. So if you can avoid crowds that's when it's worth while.
Waterpark at Atlantis. Excellent waterpark, lots of ride. My favourite is the ride that takes you out in the shark tank. You also get to use a private beach there which is lovely.
Great water park. Excellent rides. Very friendly hosts.Good facilities all around. Enjoyed the big slides and diving in!

never again. The aquaventure park although beautiful is just simply okay. We spent a day there and wish we only spent a few hours. Going on some of the rides we would ask if they were safe for a 7 year old and were told yes. They were terrifying. Be careful when going as there are many dark tunnels.

A very pleasant experience. We stayed at Atlantis Bahamas 10 years ago, my son was two years old and does not even remember the water park. Although had a good time at the Bahamas, IMO the casino prevented to fully enjoy the stay as a family.We visited Dubai Aquaventure Sunday January 20. The absence of gambling and alcohol consumption made the experience more family oriented.My son went through all the rides (except for the leap of faith, which I enjoyed more than I did at the Bahamas location).My wife insisted in renting a cabana and it turned out to be a great option (more towels, not wasting time going to the locker, personalized service, etc.)I still smile whenever I remember that day.
Great fun. Kids both big and small will love it but was not busy when we were ther and would be very hard when busy

Something for everyone. We spent two days here and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! The rides are simply great, and can keep you occupied for hours. When you want to relax there are plenty of sunloungers and several areas to base yourself for the day. There are kiosks which sell a good variety of drinks, ice-cream and milkshakes. The food is ordinary however, and they seem to run out of most items by mid afternoon. To save money, I would suggest bringing your own towels. Overall, a great place to enjoy the sun.

Great as long as you are going off peak. This proved to be a most enjoiyable way to spend the afternoon. There were enough rides and actually very little queuing to disprupt our enjoyment. I am sure it was important that we avoided the Dubai weekend when it would be much buisier. Also, in January the weather may have deterred many - although for UK visitors the 24 degrees made things very pleasant but after a couple of hours it did feel a bit chilly when outside the water. Of note, our host had intended to take us to Wild Wadi as he considers it a better experience but it was closed during that month. I also understand at Wild Wadi they operate a much better system for purchasing credit for drinks etc, whereas at Aquaventure you have to pay with cash or card whilst in the park.

Abit pricey but worth a visit. Great time on the 'leap of faith' and the other water slides, we only stayed for half a day but you could definitly make a whole day trip out of the ticket as it includes use of the private beach. Make sure you get there early, it opened at 10am but we arrived about 9.40am and there was no que and by the time we brought our tickets and dropped our stuff in the locker we were up on the slides as they opened without having to que, however by 10.30/11.00am there were people lined up outside entrance doors waiting to buy tickets.

Such a Blast!. Don't compare this to a stand alone water park, you may be a little disappointed. However, if you think of it as waterpark entertainment at a hotel, you will be thrilled! There are many fun activities to do to keep you cool. I loved that the lines went fast and efficient. It would benefit from a few more areas to sit and wait in shade with misters. Food selection was good.

Such fun!. Except for no map and no available seating near the rides, the variety in the adult rides were real fun! Some of the ques for rides were about a fifteen to twenty minute wait, but once on the ride, it is really enjoyable! Worth a visit..

You don't have to be a kid to enjoy this!. As residents at The Atlantis, we had free use of the Waterpark whilst we stayed.So we made the most of it by going early, grabbing an inflatable & enjoying every ride!We haven't giggled so much since we were kids!Each ride was a surprise, especially the one going through the shark tank.I even surpised myself by going down the Leap of Faith & loving it so much I immediately went back up & did it again!Food & lockers are pricey, so take minimal gear & have a big breakfast - although we stashed our things under a towel on a lounger & it was fine. But there are plenty of life-gaurds wrapped up warm whilst we spent the day in our swimming gear.

Leap of Faith - wow!!!!. Great waterpark, well spread out and good food options. Loved the Leap of Faith however it was so fast and scary I thought I was having a heart attack when it ended. My husband did it twice but I would not go up a second time, just proud to say I have done it!

If you have a lot of time ..... We were not really impressed by the crowds in the queues to the attractions. The VIP pass is worth to buy otherwise you stand, and stand, and stand waiting to enjoy the water ride for 90 seconds. Even if the ride is in the pipe through the shark aquarium ... The See Life Attraction is really worth to visit.
Childrens paradise. As well as for grownups... lot´s of things to do and of course as anything else in Dubai...marvellous
Very Cool. Loved the waterpark and also the monorail connected to it.. Should definately go to the "Leap of the Faith" ride... Superb excitement and scary ..... :)
SUPER Fun!. I went on feb it was kinda cold,, so I recommend going on march or april when it gets a little bit warmer.. however, its the best water park! fun for all ages!

AQUAVENTURE WATER PARK AT THE ATLANTIS HOTEL, DUBAI. The Aquaventure Water Park is part of The Atlantis Hotel complex, located at The Palm in Dubai. This is a great place to go for a family day out, which I highly recommend. If you are a guest staying at the hotel itself, then you are granted unlimited complimentary access, otherwise for non-residents there is an admission fee. I have visited many other adventure water parks in the past, but this is undoubtedly one of the best I have been to. It is beautifully and immaculately presented with its lush tropical themed landscape surrounded by palm trees, with calming lagoons and its own exclusive private beach (access to this is included in the admission price for non-residents). It is really well maintained, and spotlessly clean, and the water is crystal clear. You can simply choose to relax and sunbathe or read a book on one of their really comfortable sun loungers (complete with canopy to shield and protect you from the heat and glare of the burning sun), or you can join in all the fun of the water activities on offer, of which there are plenty. There are many rides and water slides available at the park, such as 'The Rapids' (which was my absolute favourite), alternatively you can experience the leisurely tidal effect of 'Torrent River', but if you're feeling exceptionally brave, then you could always attempt the vertical water slide known as 'The Leap of Faith'. This water slide looked positively terrifying to me, and yet at the same time enormously exhilarating (at this particular juncture, I should point out that my husband, my son and I were all complete cowards and were perfectly happy to stand and watch others take the plunge)!!! Depending on your preference, this is a place of complete leisure, where you can either relax and unwind, or splash about for the duration, depending on your preference. I must say, I found it totally refreshing and a stark contrast to the sweltering heat, as I was able to cool myself down (bearing in mind we went in August, one of the hottest months). Guest safety is obviously of tantamount importance to this establishment, as there were lifeguards in abundance, who were strategically placed in 'key' areas of the park, keeping a watchful eye over visitors to the park. But this is more of a precautionary measure to ensure guest safety, which I found very reassuring, to know that they were being very vigilant and closely monitoring the park, but without being intrusive. In the highly unlikely event that someone did manage to get themselves into difficulties, then they would be extremely quick to react, so guest safety is clearly a priority, and so 'safety' issues should not pose a concern for anyone. In addition, as well as appearing very professional, they were also all really friendly and nice, smiling and waving at guests as they went round the waterways circuits, which offered additional fun to the entire experience. Food and beverages are available to purchase on site, as well as a range of swimming related products. However, I do have just one word of 'caution', and that is...don't forget to use your sunscreen, especially if you have young children, as the sun is very intense and you will get 'burnt' if you don't (actually that is in fact, '26' words by my reckoning). I actually forgot, and as a consequence of that, I suffered a severely burnt face, legs and shoulders, but that was totally my own fault. This will make a great family day out, full of fun and entertainment, but it is also suitable for friends and couples alike, as well as families. Beverly Khan.

Lots of fun despite the cold. We didn't know that winter in Dubai would be cold but we still really enjoyed Aquaventure. The fast rides are great and the river flowing through the park saves you walking around. We had a great day and would recommend it highly.
Over crowded. Poor information on arrival (with exception of one attendant very helpful with locker). Long ques and a little disappointed with some of the "rides"
Great for the family. We loved the rides. You can even take your small kids on the rapids and the torrent with the double seated tube. Water could have been a bot warmer.
overated. nothing exciting here. great for kids but if you like your more extreme rides head down to wild wadi.its also very expensive to eat and drink. suitable for guests staying at the atlantis

ADRENALINE!!!!!. On our lat day stay in Dubai we were looking for some excitement and to "kill" the day as our flight was leaving at 2:00 am. Going to a waterpark seemed as good idea - and it surely was!!!! We loved it!We have reserved the tickets online, so we avoided cueing there and wasting time, we only had to show our booking number and we could get in. We booked one locker, there you can't take care of your belongings.We found 2 sun beds, but in the end we did not use them at all - we spent 5 (!) hours in the water as it was so GREAT!When you arrive you do not really know what to expect, you catch one of these "rubber tires" for two and let yourself go through the waterways of aquaventure. There you get some speeds, get excited and splashed, but you still not knowing what's coming. The we've discovered it!!! They have some 5 or more slides some of them are harmless, but some are WOW!When we were there it wasn't too busy, so we did not need to wait for the really good slides. These are great, fantastic experience, lots and lots of adrenalin and it's easy to become addicted to these slides - you want to splash down again and again. Even being close to freezing (2 January 17.00 we were close to sunset at 17.30) we were still in the water, you simply can't let it go. When I stopped feeling my fingers and toes we decided to leave.Atlantis the Palm Aquaventure Waterpark is a must! Great fun and a lot of adrenaline, I can only recommend it!
Great Water Park at Atlantis. It has all the facilities of a water park There are lots of fun & adventurous rides like 'The River Ride' & Leap of Faith...A Place to visit with family...

OK for the a day but there are better.. Rides for our age 2 mum, dad and 12yr old not as good as other parks. Huge problems with lockers, on a bar code located on your wristband, took 8 attempts and 2 changes of band before it worked, then had to endure it all again everytime you needed access for money etc.

Go early to enjoy more. Best USP for this water park is that it is located on The Pal which is a great manmade island. The park is clean, beautiful and safe (life guards everywhere). However there are not many rides if compared with some big water parks but some of the rides are quite good. Leap of faith is indeed most interesting one. But one needs to go early to enjoy everything because once park gets crowded, there would be long queues for every ride. There is a nice beach where one can relax after tiresome rides but it has closing time (evening 5 PM I guess). We did not try the Dolphin show (found it expensive) but if you want to do that all; come early in this park. Shower rooms are clean and has good quality soap and shampoo but it’s not big enough hence gets crowded by park closing time.

A must visit with young children. Yes, it is nice place and a must visit with children above 120 cm. If below, I wouldn't visit this place. Buy tickets online in advance to save lots of time, arrive early, reserve a sun bed rapidly, and then head to the most popular rides.

Lots to do. What a great facility - and suitable for all ages.I got my parents (aged 66) who can't swim going through the rapids and down some of the flumes. My nephew loved the flumes and would have spent a whole day doing that. My niece spent more time in the pirate/monkey pool just because she's under 120cm so couldn't do some of the rides. Lots of lifeguards dotted about and although its a really busy place, it was still tranquil enough to float in the pool soaking up the rays. Get there early to grab a lounger facing the sun if you're a sun worshipper.
