Good time. Good water park but not too many rides here. We booked the Dolphin experience that included entry. We spent the morning in the water park and the afternoon in with the dolphins. I am not sure you could spend a whole day on the rides as we seemed to cover it in a morning. My daughter braved the leap of faith which she said was very good. Having been to lots of waterparks over the years I am not sure this matches up to the best one in Tenerife - Siam Water Park

Lots of fun. Great water park. Loads of different standards of rides. Sun bathing areas and lots of cafe and ice cream areas. Flooring was absolutely scolding so unless trusted to leave you shoes at start of each ride your feet will burn. Lovely for children . Adults will enjoy just as much though. Would defo go again. Very mild rides as well as scary ones. We really enjoyed it. Was v busy but expect nothing else as such a popular place. Free to atlantis residents.
Brilliant. great place with kids and was not overcrowded therefore really pleasent experience.great rides specially the free fall, may be few more exciting rides would enhance the experience.

Fun waterpark for the family with a nice beach nearby.. Get there early and prepay for tickets to avoid some lines. Get the locker/towel combo and the lunch package. Getting a cab from here was a long wait.

The most fun, jet lag and all. Landed in Dubai after an 11 hour flight and went straight to this waterpark (after breakfast). Stayed for most of the day, it was SO HOT (even though i was there in winter, go figure) and this waterpark is THE FUNNEST! Went on every ride and slide, the Leap Of Faith about 4 times! The Conveyor was good also, it takes you throughout the whole park, takes about half an hour i think. Ehrmegherrrd GO HERE when ur in Dubai!

Turns Adults in Kids!. While you are here it is easy to forget you are in a Desert. Did we learn in school that, "desert is a place where there is scarcity of Water". Dubai you have re written that one.Boy it is Waterworld! January is good time to be here as it is not too hot outside. The rides have it all, Lazy Fun-Crazy Fun.My six year old daughter loved her River Ride while wife and I loved the Ziggurat Rides. It was lovely!We took the Aquaventure and Lost Chambers Aquarium Combo and it was worth the money.If you do Lost Chambers Aquarium then you can skip the Dubai Mall Aquarium.We took our parents along, they chilled out at the lovely beach that is part of the Atlantis Complex.Remember to Carry your towels as they are expensive to rent and do not get cheap and carry food (we did :)!) it gets taken away at the entrance.In case you want to save more money you can take a free bus ride to Mall of Emirates (I am sure there are some other free bus rides back too) Remember to access all Ziggurat Rides from the River Ride side to avoid long wait.Go Ahead Relive Your Childhood!

Not so many rides. There were hardly 4 - 5 rides here apart from the usual kids pool and slides etc so it is not huge. You could spend a few hours here with your family...not one of the best water parks I have been to.

Fantastic fun. An amazing day trip for the whole family.Your kids will love you if you take them thereTIPS: Get there early before the crowds as it can get very crowded but the queues and waiting times are never too bad.Wear sunscreen!Loved it

Prefer go to Wild Wadi - more fun for less money. Ok it´s located at the Palm (which is amazing), and besides one of those 6 stars hotel, and of course the park is very clean, very beatiful and so long - but I have to confess - Wild Wadi is much more cool, and cheaper ... what more I have to say?

Come early if you want to go on the water slides!. We took a cab here from our hotel (Hilton Jumeirah Resort) it cost us 50 AED. It truly is unbelievable how they built this water park on an artificial palm island. Amazing! I have been to the Atlantis in the Bahamas & found that one to be much larger then the Dubai one. We came here right when it opened & there was already a queue to buy passes. The park opens from 10am-sunset for the winter time. I used the entertainment voucher, which saved us a bundle. We got the silver pass, which was for admission cost, locker rental, & 1 towel rental. Admission cost for people over 1.2 metres 225 AED, below 1.2 meters 180 AED. Towel & locker rental 50 AED. After getting our passes we went to the lockers, which were located nearby the main entrance of the park. You have to scan your wrist pass to activate a locker, which is a pain. Its even more annoying when it doesn't work properly. I saw a lot of people having issues with their wrist pass. There is a staff member on hand to help, but every time you go back to your locker you need to scan the pass to open and lock your locker. Afterwards, we exchanged our receipts for the towels. If you are a day visitor to the park and renting towels, this towel will stay with you all day, you cannot exchange it for a new towel. We then immediately made a bee line to the Ziggurat. We first lined up for the leap of faith. There were only 10 people ahead of us. Great ride, truly exhilarating. I screamed my head off. Totally fun, yet thrilling! We then did all the rest of the Ziggurat rides. It is highly recommended to come right when the park opens if you want to go on the rides. As the day progressed, the lines were getting really long! Also, it was very difficult to find loungers & tubes. If you want a double tube, be sure to take one early in the day, by mid day there were none to be found. The lazy river is great. Just relax & aimlessly float about. I rode around the river several times. I tend to get cold easily & I found the water to be warm.The beach at Atlantis is nice & vast, but not spectacular. The water is very calm, but a bit chilly. There were lots of loungers with umbrellas available. Day guest are only limited to only the Aquaventure or Sandance beach. The other beaches are reserved for the hotel guests. Also you cannot ride on the buggy shuttle as those are also for the hotel guests only. We did have lunch @ Shark bites & used an entertainment voucher as well for that.There are a couple of gift shops here, but I didn't' see anything worthwhile to buy. This place would be a full day event. It would also be a good idea to combine it with a stop @ the Lost Chambers. I would recommend Aquaventure if you are a waterpark fan, but be sure to come right when it opens if you want to go on the water slides. I also wanted to add another thing that is related to Aquaventure. When you do decide to leave, leave before sunset or before the water park closes. As the queue for taxi was just ridiculous & we did not see any taxi in sight! There is only one road in and out of Atlantis. We then made the mistake of taking the monorail. Which was overpriced. You have to purchase a monorail card, which is 15 AED per person one way. The monorail itself is very clean. There are 4 stops but you can only get off @ Atlantis or Gateway (bottom of the trunk). The train for some reason stops at the non open stations & it travels at a slow speed. When we did get off the train, we had to give the monorail cards back to the staff, which is a shame. They are nice looking cards, which I would have liked to keep as souvenirs. Now we took the monorail assuming there would be taxi waiting there. I was wrong. The monorail was full of people that thought the same thing as me. We follow this long path which leads us out by the highway. There are 0 taxi's waiting here! Instead we were greeted by 3 cars that offer to drive us, but they are not official taxi's! They were just random men charging high prices to drive you back to your hotel. When I was approached by these men & I told them where I wanted to go, they would refuse. They would either make up an excuse that they couldn't go there or the driver would simply walk away from me not providing an explanation. Why would you ask me where I want to go and then just say no? By now this area is full of people wanting to get back to their hotel. Every time a car pulled up to us everyone ran to it like an animal banging on the glass to get in. This really turned me off & left a really sour taste in my mouth. I was very displeased with this. It was just chaotic. I mean the taxi drivers should know that people would take the monorail here to escape the long queue @ Atlantis. Somehow this needs to be organized. Why did they build this monorail & not connect it with anything? How are we suppose to go anywhere if there are no taxis here? There are no sidewalks to get to a place that would have a taxi. I am wet, cold, and tired. I just wanted to head back to my hotel. It was really silly. They was a huge crowd of people standing at the side of the highway trying to flag down anything that would stop to give a ride. Eventually, we did get back to the hotel but we had to pay 50 AED + the 45 AED monorail cost to get back to our hotel, which was only 10 minutes away. Whereas, from the Hilton Jumeirah to Atlantis only costed us 50 AED. So again, be sure to leave before the mass crowds do or you'll be waiting around for a long time!

Brilliant waterpark. Well organised worth the money if you book dolphins it is included in price the children loved it you could easily spend hours at it places to eat Starbucks and the usual fast food plenty of sun beds and toilets good changing rooms very very clean lifeguards at every pool very safe

Great for kids, not so great for thrill-seeking adults.. There are currently four aquaparks in the UAE. This one (part of the excellent Palm Atlantis resort) is not bad by any stretch and excellent if you're on a family holiday. If you're an adult (whether young or old) there are better choices however.The others are:- Wild Wadi (nr the Burj Al Arab Hotel) - also good for kids.- Aqualand (Um Al Quain) has pro's and cons. Cons are: smell in the air (when the wind blows the wrong way), distance out of town (60-90 minute drive), age of the rides (old). Pros: You can booze on site and the BEST booze shop in the UAE is next door. Expect very cheap tax free prices and a huge selection.- Yas Waterworld (Abu Dhabi) OPENING 24th January. Not yet been but it's already boasting a HUGE number of rides and the usual fastest, longest, tallest, etc in the world. I'm keen to check this puppy out later this month!

Atlantis waterpark is a blast!. I liked that this was a no thought water park. Just grab a tube, float and enjoy. There were a few rides that required you to walk up stairs to get in line, but everything was very clean and the staff was out of this world. Life guards at every turn, should you need assistance.

Good family fun. January is a good time to go. It is warm but not uncomfortably hot and not too crowded. We have been in April before and not been able to find a lounger but had no trouble this time. Rides are fun but not too rough so ideal for younger children too

FUN!. This waterpark is awsome for kids in all ages from 1-100. The water slides are exciting, the beach is beautiful and I loved chilling in the rings. Come earyly in the morning to avoid the greater masses.

some disappointment. visited here on recommendation. not as big or as many rides as hoped, plenty sunbeds around and queues not huge for the rides. lazy river takes a good hour to get round. kids loved it and food reasonably priced.

Fun Day. Waited in line for 15 minutes to collect the tickets that had been booked on the net. The place has ample of lockers and space for changing. The lockers were quite over priced at 75 dirhams for a big locker and 40 dirhams for a small one.Not many rides for a water park. There was one "lazy river" and about 6 different types of "tube/chutes" for the adults. And there was one big section of mazes and slides for young kids.Leap of Faith is the most exciting ride there, whereas the other 3 chutes/tube rides are similar to each other.The food at all stalls was over priced and no one could do anything about it as they had you in captivity while you were there.Loved their system of bar coded wrist bands for lockers, entry and money top up to be used at food stands thru out the park.
Fun in the sun. Great fun and the lazy river was wonderful on a hot day! We could have happily gone back day after day if our trip had been longer.

BUY TICKETS ONLINE FIRST and GET THERE EARLY. We went during one of the peak times of year - between Christmas and New Year's and the park was understandably heaving. The first day of the visit we arrived at noon and waited almost 30 minutes to get in despite buying tickets online. This was a preview of the lines throughout the park and especially for the more popular rides. That said, we still found loungers in a good spot and the lazy river, Rapids and some tamer rides were walk-on available throughout. The food, however, is mediocre and overpriced. We employed a better strategy on day two.Arriving at opening time of 10am on day two, the park was empty and we staked out 4 prime loungers and could walk on to any ride at will for the first hour - Leap of Faith, etc. It is highly recommended that if you can, get there 15 minutes prior to opening and make the most of your first couple of hours, then take it easy the rest of your time there. Park is good for all ages. Would have given a higher rating if food was better, prices slightly lower, location closer to Dubai and signage and staffing better. If we had to choose between Wild Wadi and Aquaventure ... I'd choose Wild Wadi.

A Great Holiday. We stayed at the Atlantis so took advantage of 3 full days (out of a week) to enjoy all aspects of the park. It was busy but did not feel crowded. The slides were fun and the lazy river relaxing. All employees were very friendly.
fun fun fun. we had a great day with my family and the food in restaurants were very delicious. They should sell the photos cheaper.
A great place to cool off the day.. A must visit with kids... they will love it.. Start early as the water gets cold by evening and also the park closes at about 5:30.. Had a good time...
Very good. Excellent for children to play in although very small children are unable to use this. Our two year old found it too much when accompanied by a parent.

Fun in the Dubai Sun. My family had a great day at Aqua Adventure. If you like water rides, specifically tube rides, this is the place for you. But this is not your average waterpark. It has mostly rough and tumble rides with rapids in the lazy river that bounce and twirl you around, and steep drops in some of the tube rides that are not for the faint of heart. There is one body slide called the Leap of Faith which plunges you straight down at a steep angle, and can be scary for those not eager to throw yourself off a high ledge. I did see one fairly big play area for smaller children who just want to splash around in the water. Overall, it was a great day. Even the food at Shark Bites was yummy, not your average greasy fast food, but filled with healthy choices like the yummy falafel. I loved it, my teenage kids loved it, and my wife got to lay out in the sun all day - and it's free if you stay at Atlantis. What could be better?

fun filled day. its a great day out with kids big or small. great fun even for a bunch of hung over middle aged blokes. nice selection and the river means you don't always have to quwe. avoid at weekends if possible and get there early
Had a great day!. Loved that there was no shortage of sun beds, plenty of rubber rings and no really much queueing for the rides.

Not for the faint hearted!. I went to the waterpark with my sister in law who loves theme parks and rollercoasters. I love the water but do not have the stomach for all the rides. My sister in law did the "Leap of Faith", a 27.5m vertical drop into a shark tank - and loved it. As I said - not for the faint hearted. there were plenty of other less thrill seeking things to do! Went to see the dolphins - very expensive -650 Derhams- to swim with them. Overall, a great place for kids.

Great waterpark - if you like tube rides. If you like tube-based water rides (I do!) then Aquaventure is a great waterpark. Well themed and well-staffed. There are 5 tube-based waterslides and one body slide leading from the ziggurat. If you like white knuckle body slides you will probably be dissapointed. The main attraction is a long river with rapids sections and a tidal wave section. This soaks up the crowds, even on a busy day. I visited as a day guest (hotel guests of Atlantis get this as a perk) and it is a very expensive day out (equivalent of UK£40 each). Everything is an extra cost item - locker, towel rental - and food & drink are very expensive. Despite these things, it was one of the most enjoyable days in a waterpark I've had and I would definitely return. Visiting the park is a good way to see the Palm.

Better than Wild Wadi.. I think that Atlantis is the best waterpark in Dubai. I think this because it has all types of rivers like the lazy river and the rapid river. And I prefer the rides. Atlantis is good for any ages because if you have little ones there is a waterpark for them. And if you have teenagers they could go on all the rides. But how tall or short you are matters because it depends on your height. I would suggest you get there early because when you get there later on the lines start to expand and expand.

Fun Day for Adults and Children Alike. My husband and i visited on Christmas Eve 2012, for a day of frivolity and it delivered!! The waterpark is huge, there are heaps of sunbeds to go round and the sun always shines!!!I note some other reviewers have commented on the expense of both the ticket and the refreshments inside the park. Firstly buy your tickets online and you will save yourself approx 10-15%, you will also save yourself queuing time as you can go directly to the guest services line (9 and 10) and avoid the general admission bundle!! Secondly refreshments inside the park are on a parr with any captive market around the world like Disney, Alton Towers etc etcBe prepared to queue for some of the bigger slides like the Surge & Plunge, but make sure you do the ride that goes through the aquarium, it's brilliant and unique!The lazy river and rapids make Centre Parcs rapids look two bob! they take ages to go round and are a pleasant mix of exhilaration and relaxation. Hubby and I got a two person ringo and squealed like kids as we went round the rapids!! Make sure you buy your locker at the ticket kiosk, you will need one! A fun full day out for the whole family

Cracking Fun. Fair price for a good few hours. Hardily any queing and plenty of rings for rides. Could happily stay on the lazy river all day! Slides and rides all good fun. Food and drink a bit pricey but they always are to be honest. Lockers are quite small. But still a great day out!

Crowed, uninspiring, ridiculously expensive. We were terribly disappointed by Aquaventure. Compared to Wild Wadi, it has very little to offer. They also charge you a fortune for a locker, and then again for a towel. Food is insanely expensive. Go once for the experience, but never again.
loved it. really enjoyed it - as the waterpark also has a private beach. we paid for the dolphin experience. so we did aquaventure bit first, then dolphins and then beach. full day out
Fantastic. Really good mini water park for younger kids we had a great time. Rapids were good fun too. Plenty of change rooms and very clean

Clean, but a bit inconvenient. The visit to this water park was a great day spent with family. The kids area is very nice and large with controlled water temperature. There is a running water channel throughout the water park and is a great family activity. The water rides for adults are good but require everyone to carry their water tubes up the stairs. The inventory of double-tube seems limited and one has to reach early to grab one.
Great variety of rides. Had a great deal to do, with the beach, snorkelling available at a cost and plenty of rides for all the family, we loved the sharke ride, brill

A Somewhat disappointing experience!!. The build up was excellent - the location was unique but the park was a disappointment. Having visited Siam Park, Tenerife this i am afraid was not a patch on that - it had a lot of similar rides but nowhere near the quantity and for my 3 boys and their 2 cousins age 10, 7,6,6 and 3 there were very limited to the number of things that they could do it was very disappointing( being the theme here) considering the 1225 dh - which is well over £40 a ticket inluding full price for kids over 1.2m even if there weren't enough things for them do!! I am afraid £10 for a kids meal is extortionate - even if one takes the surroundings into account!

Lazy holiday-ers paradise. Frankly, I could be so wrong. There is only one exciting drop "Leap of Faith' at 27 mts, and the other stuff is so mundane. all the other stuff, no mater how brilliantly labelled, revolves around this Ziggurat, with water moving at different speeds in different directions, over different gradients. Adrenaline junkies and jaded souls (like me) will do well to avoid.

Great Fun for all the family. Best water park fun I have ever had. Check out the dolphins, the prices are comparative to what you would pay back home really. Park includes Masterblasters, speedsliders, rapids and river. All within beautifully groomed lush tropical gardens. Get fun for all the family.
Go in summer. If you stay in the Atlantis hotel , the entrance is included . Its a water park , nothing different . If you want to swin with dolphin there is an opcion there

Good full day for all. We went with 3 family groups with children aged from 3y.o to 12y.o. We got in with some vouchers from one families Entertainment Book, so I bought them lunch. Yes it looked a bit expensive but you can spend just as much going to the waterparks over here. We took in our own water which was not taken off us and took towels. We arrived as it opened for the day and left as it was closing. We got some covered sunlounges and slathered on the sunscreen. The waterpark had something for all ages. Because there were so many adults we could divide ourselves up to accompany the kids for their age group and swap around as who wants to spend all day at the toddler area. We also didn't require a locker as there was always someone to stay with our bags. But most people just left their bags on the chairs and I didn't here or see anything getting stolen from them. We spent a lot of time just floating around on the innertubes. We all got to go on every ride at least once and more if we wanted. Staff very helpful and kept park immaculate. The sprinklers to keep the concrete cool was much appreciated in the heat! The rides were a lot of fun and everyone had a great day but exhausted by the end. The only pain was having to wait for the shuttle bus to take us back to the carpark at the end of the day.The rail system goes to the Palm but unsure if it goes to Atlantis. If not a taxi would be cheap from the Metro station.

A must MUST MUST. The most exciting and well put together waterpark i have been to. Its well organised and even when busy ques are not that long. There is something for everyone here. And the dolphin experience although a little expensive is vert well done and a great experience.

Not totally worth the money !!!. The rides were generally brilliant in its quality , but were limited, and I did not find any reason for an adventure enthusiast to stay in the park for more than 4 hours. The Park has limited rides - only 6 water slides, to lure any theme-park enthusiast. Given the brilliance of Dubai as a tourist destination, I felt the park is a bit over-hyped in its ride variety, yet, one must applaud the cleanliness observed in the water, the safety measures implemented, and the quality of the rides. "Leap of Faith" ride, and the rides through the "Shark Tank" are worth appreciating. There are a couple of good options for the kids as well. If the price tag can be around $45, instead of the prevailing $65 approx., it is a great one-time visit.

Just great. Take a towel and water for a fab day. First thing to say is this is a great place for all swimmers greater than 1.2m tall. The slides were great, loads of guards and helpers, I took a 7, 15 year old and had a great day.
Very nice. Kids loved this placed enjoyed their time , as a family with 12,11 and one year 6 month baby all enjoyed it .

great place to spend the entire day. You would never know when will you run out of time when you enter this place. Situated inside the Atlantis hotel at palm jumeirah. one can either take a cab and visit here or else take a mono rail which takes you directly to this place. I personally enjoyed leap of faith ride the most since the rest were just ohk. most of the rides goes zig zag. good place for kids to enjoy. guests at the hotel goes for free while outsiders need to pay.ladies please make sure not to wear anything made of denim since they do not allow it inside the park. Also one need to take the locker facility since it would be tough to look after your belongings once inside the park.

Total blast!. This place is a total blast and great fun for the family. The kids section, Splashers, is awesome as well. (I have kids. I wasn't just hanging out in the kiddie section.) Good times, but best to go before the hot months come around--they keep a lot of the park in the shade, but I almost got heat stroke last time.

over-priced for 6 rides.. head to Wild Wadi instead!. If you are driving your car, you are required to park a kilometer away, and than shuttled in a bus. If you want the privilege to park near the entrance, you shell out AED 150, which is exorbitant!The entrance is a 15 minutes wait, and your bags get frisked and checked not for security but cos they wouldn't allow any outside food or beverages in!The entrance costs AED 225 for adult and AED 180 for a child. A small locker rental will set you back by another AED 40 and if you haven't got your own towel, than be ready to pay another AED 30!Like I said, no food or beverages from outside is allowed, and what is on offer is awfully expensive and lacks in quality. A 500ml bottle of water which usually costs AED 1 in supermarket is priced at AED 13.. talk about paying premium!! A kids meal with 2 pcs of chicken is for AED 50 and is a two-bite meal affair!Getting back to the park.. There is only one locker and changing room, which is quite odd for such a large tourist attraction and we found it over-crowded.There are just 6 water slides in all with the highlight being the Leap of Faith. But heading there require a lot of patience, as the wait in the queue is between 10-20 minutes. Being with friends may help as you can pass off the time in conversations. Also kids under 1.2m are restricted from these rides, so you may not really make most of it if you are with kids.Apart from the Leap of Faith, other rides are more like average and worth a single ride only. The two river rides.. The Rapids and The Torrents are much better than the water rides frankly, and are good for the entire family.At best, the whole experience will last you 3 hours to the max before you get bored out.Finding tubes, be is single or double seater is a challenge and the place has no maps to guide you... you just move around and help-your-self. The only map we saw was at the beach, which was on the other end of the park.The beach was simply fake and the sand felt as rough as ever. There were no crashing waves and no kids to be seen playing with sand castles or the likes. There were only a handful of people there trying to get a tan.At the price they charge, it is a big disappointment and you wouldn't do yourself any sin if you skipped it from your Dubai must-do list. Head instead to Wild Wadi and have a much pleasant half-day, enjoying splashing in the water, and soaking in the sun!

Expensive!!!. Unforunately we went there the last day of our trip and as we were thrilled from the reviews and the pictures we went to have fun and relax. But we became very sad at the entrance...Very very expensive for a water park with a fee of 225 Dhm (50 euros almost) just for the slides...Locker, towel renting, food, drink...alla extra...Ridiculous and unbelievable!!!Finally we decided not to enter...We didnt want to spend a fortune...There are so many other fun places with almost no fee at all...For my opinion stay away if you are not ready to spend around 80 euros per person without seing anything apart from slides...Because if you want to see the aquarium and the dolphins then imagine a price around 250 euros at least!!!

Great day in the sun. The rides are fun, the constant sunshine gives you a full day in the park. Only the changing rooms need help, too crowded at end of day with kids and women crammed in. They should consider a kid friendly separate facility.

Great day out for the family. We went not knowing what to expect.but it was a great watermark with something for everyone from little kids to adults.usually I don't swim but I joined in and loved it.....it only takes one day to enjoy everything the park has to offer but we went in winter and the queues were almost non existent.

Great fun. Rides great. Relaxing. Something for all ages. My 8 year old could have spent the whole day playing at splashes allowing me to sun myself if I didn't periodically drag him away to do the rides. Very similar to wild wadi- I've enjoyed both but if staying at hotel it's a grat plus as you can charge food and drinks and pick up towels and get conveyed from your room to the heart of the prk by golf buggy- very easy! Luxury!

Fun filled Afternoon!. We visited Aquaventure for an afternoon in December 2012. We had lunch in Atlantis prior and arrived at Aquaventure at approximately 1 o`clock. We spent approx 3 hours in the park (which I personally think is just about enough time)! The queue times were minimal and the park seemed relatively quiet. The Leap of Faith was the highlight although very nerve racking when you get to the top (I managed to do it twice though)! I found the lazy rivers a bit too lazy and slow!!! And a few of the rides which you rode in a dinghy seemed a little slow too however, I thoroughly enjoyed my visit and although I have visited better waterparks, I would visit again if I were to visit or stay at Atlantis. You must go on the Leap of Faith (the best waterslide by far)!!!!

Death Fall is perfect. great place to find the most attaractive crowds ,huge number of rides in the back drop of burj al arab,the death fall is awesome witha near to 90degree slide down it will pull your knockers up,(wear nylon dresses no cotton

Great choice of rides. Went with a family of 4 (kids 9 and 12) and son has no fear when it comes to water slides so he headed to the worst ones first. The rides are well designed, safety is not just a token effort and the water is exceptionally clean (something missing in a lot of the Asian water parks). We were convinced salt chlorination was being used. I had a great time as did the kids...very well laid out and well run

Water wonderland. Great rides although a height restriction of 1.3m meant my 5year was left disappointed on many of the top slides, compared to wild Wadi limit of 1.1m. Save a lot using the entertainer booklet, including entry, locker and towel fees as well as food.
The leap of faith is well worth trying more than once to get the heart pumping.

Aquaventure is my favorite waterpark in the world!. The layout and design of Aquaventure is fantastic! I love the fact that it is possible to ride on majority of the rides without waiting in lines or ascending staircases as it is possible to move through the park on your conveyor belt on your innertube. The waterpark is clean and the staff is great!

Must must must visit place. Wear simple slippers, flip flops, crocs which will work best in water. Carry sun block cream especially if you are going in summers. Do wear your footwear during the rides also otherwise the feet can get scratched during the rapids. Best time to go is winters but summers are also okay. They have a separate kids area also which elders like me also enjoy to the hilt. Water keeps coming from everywhere
very nice water park. i go with my children after joining Dolphin bay. Nice parks with a lot of slides, i am not sure if it is the best compare with Wild Wadi but it was very nice too.

Expensive. The entrance fee was around 225 dirham (£40). I had taken some of my own snacks, however upon entering i was searched and told to dispose all food and drinks contents. I thought this was a tad harsh. Makesure you take you own towel as it costs around £5.50 to hire one. Not including the locker hire which is around £7. The water slides are fun with the leap of faith being my favourite. You are not restricted as to how many times you can go on the slides. I would not bother coming to the water park if you want to experience the shark attack ride as it is hugely disappointing. The food was also expense as you are limited for choice. I eneded up paying £10 for 4 chicken wings fries and a drink. I was told by my friends to go to wild wadi park but did not listen to them.

Go for Leap of Faith. The highest slide in the park. Took my sister and I forever to sum up to courage to try this slide. It seems scary and too high and too fast..but go for it!! The adrenaline rush is incredible! And it's too fast anyway. It'll be over before you know it. Do something everyday that scares you!

Cool Waterpark but pricey. Nice waterpark, but quite large and spaced out. Pricey though and kids around 5-6 years will prefer Wild Wadi given the limited kiddies slides and more stringent height restrictions at Aquaventure
Good place to go. I am not much for rides but this was a fairly calm park with plenty of places to sunbathe. I would go back again.

Great Water park!!. Used the water park for 4 days, and it was fun all 4 days! :) The Leap Of Faith -water slide down trough the Shark pool was epic! Was living at the Atlantis, so had free pass every day! (Bonus point to Atlantis) Good fun, and diff stuff for people ind all ages! :)

Good fun. Loved the park at the Atlantis hotel, I took my 4 year old and she liked it but thought the children's area was better at wild wadi. Would defo go back, the ride that goes through the fish tank was brilliant. Lovely setting
Weeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee. Great rides but a little pricey... The lost chambers are worth seeing but its an enjoyable day all round.

Great day out, no matter what age!. We had complimentary access as we were guests of the hotel, so went along several times. The "lazy" river is awesome, with some great stretches of fast flowing rapids. It's a veritable maze, with rides branching off from all over. The park is well managed and when we visited (December) it was fairly quiet so overall, a really relaxing, enjoyable experience.

Nice and clean waterpark. with great view of the city of skyscrapers on the other side of the Persian Gulf and the self-declared 7 star hotel Burj Al Arab. The area is small but complete with water rides for all ages including the frightening Leap of Faith. The water ride down the fish tank was scary at first but it was worth ride to be in the aquarium with fishes swimming around. They even have a dolphin park but we did not enter but just stood outside looking in at the dolphins doing their usual things instead. It was totally fun and relaxing atmosphere for everyone.

Fun park although not as good as expected. Visited this waterpark on a recent holiday as day visitors. My teenage son had been really looking forward to it after reading the reviews, however after doing all the rides, which didn't take long as the park was fairly quiet, we all decided that it wasn't as good as we had expected. The lazy river, with various sections of rapids, was long but it was shown as different rides when in fact it's just one! The other flume rides are all very similar involving sitting on rubber rings. The best one was going down a dark flume and coming out surrounded by the aquarium full of rays, sharks and shoals of fish. The facilities, changing rooms, eating places, etc are all very modern and clean. It was quite expensive for a family day out. We preferred Wild Wadi waterpark which had a better selection of rides.

A lot of water in the middle of the desert.... Definitely a must. Fun for all the family. After maybe very hot days in the city, this airy complex is ideal to relax or have any sorts of aquatic adventures...

Good but not great - stick to Wild Wadi. Visiting Dubai in the summer is always gonna be good if you love the heat and the sun but this water park doesn't quite live up to the hype. Yes the big slides are great as are the various slides with the floats and the main big slide is pretty fantastic as you slide through the shark tank at high speed. The views from the top of the tower housing the main slides is fantastic, you can see over the palm and Jumierah beach.The biggest let down is the sheer size of the park. Getting from one bit to another is a real trek esp in the summer as you scorch your feet on the pavements, if you want to wade through the water to get around your feet are scratched to death on the rough bottoms of the pools and waterways. The hotel seemed very nice indeed and the park is well organised however, I won't be going back here but will be going back to Wild Wadi.Visited mid 2011
Water fun. Amazing, lots of fun and splash time. Very clean and friendly atmosphere? Changing room and facilities modern and hygiene standards were high.
the best. the great fun place in duabi to spend the whole day. the staff are all very helpful. the place is very well managed cery clean good food great cillout we had
Aqua Adventure. pros Child friendlyenviromentally friendlyEveryone used it including 60 year old grandparents!!cons Daughter freaked outCant find help when you need it
very nice place. i really like this water park lot of things for people for enjoyment we spend our time very nice. when ever you visit dubai try this.

Expensive day out for average water park. Not a huge place and not that many rides for the entry fee. Even though we went in mid-October and not in any school holidays the place was quite full - no way you would get a sunbed on the little fake beaches by the lazy river unless you were in first or very lucky - hard to imagine it at peak season. Unfortunately also very little shade available so without an umbrella hard to sit out and enjoy it. Rides nice and all looked clean etc - not a massive selection, kids probably would have loved it but as a group of 4 adults not very impressed and did not feel value for money. On the upside we booked the meal deal at the burger restaurant so we didn't have to carry cash around and that was actually quite nice - good cheeseburgers.
Great family park. Not as wild as the wild wadi but beautifully done and great to leave your kids to get on with themselves. Super safe super nice

Just ok. I guess coming from the States i'm a bit spoiled with waterparks. I'm comparing Aquaventure to some of the Disney parks and some other shore-town waterparks and Aquaventure doesn't match up. They don't have enough slides and the slides they have aren't too fun. We ended up doing the same 2 slides over and over because they were the only ones- it was nice using the beach facilities though

Brilliant!. We stayed at the Atlantis so had free access. There is a "lazy river" style loop around the park which has areas of rapids and provides access to some of the rides, which had enough variety that you don't get bored of bobbing along. The slides in the centre of the park were really good, especially the "shark attack" slide which takes you through the aquarium. The "leap of faith" is the highest slide in the UAE, and also travels through the middle of the aquarium- although you're going too fast to actually see anything!
Atlantis water park. Great for a nice hot day but take your own food as it is very expensive to buy it inside the park. It is really great for families.
Good. Its nice, but for me less than expected, wild wadi is better, there are no exceptional games. the number of games are 4 i think for adults

Brilliant. Brilliant, properly planned, beautifully landscaped, leap of faith is breathtaking ,,, almost 90 degrees and falling in the shark tunnel is like just high adrenaline and nothing less, not for the faint hearted ,,, must try though ,,, all rides are awesome, can spend an entire day here ,,,

So much fun!. Loved this waterpark. There's a good variety of slides and pools. Beware though, because it's sooo hot in Dubai, the brick/concrete paths around the park get very hot. I felt like my feet were on fire. The park would benefit from undercover walkways. Wear thongs around the park if you can!

We loved it!. Me and my husband spent a day at the waterpark with our 9mth baby. At first we were unsure about going with the little one. The waterpark is brilliant though and our baby loved every minute there. Our baby was a bit young for the kids section as it was very busy due to the eid holidays. He did however love the barracuda section.We had to queue for at least an hour to get it as it was veryyyyy busy the day we went. The queues were organised though.We bought a meal deal voucher too but would have to say the food at Sharks Bay restaurant was the only disappointment. You do not have a choice but to buy food from there as you can't take food in with you - bags are checked.We made use of the beach in the morning as it was a struggle to get loungers on the waterpark. The beach was lovely and sea was warm enough for the little one.The facilities provided at the waterpark whether paid or free are excellent. Loved the top up wristbands

Great day out. Pre-book the tickets because there can be quite a big queue if you pay on the day! There were plenty of sun loungers, plenty of rubber rings to go around. We spent most of the day riding around the rapids and torrents! The water slide rides were great fun, there were quite long quesues for the bigger flumes but they actually went down quite quickly. The shark flume ride is really good but it was over to quickly! There are plenty of life guards around the water areas.The aqua adventure beach was nice, dedicated swimming area with hooded sun loungers.The food available to buy was quite expensive, but quick service.

Great day out!!. We had a great day here! Lots of walking to be done and a bit difficult in comparison to other parks to navigate. Other than that once you get to the rides they are GREAT!! All I can say is LIFT YOUR BUM when going down the rides or the rollers can hurt (the staff do warm of this tho) Get entertainer voucher book if you can!! Saved us a fortune :)

A lot of money for an 'OK' waterpark.. I have been to many water parks all over the world and was looking forward to visting Aquaventure at Atlantis. The entry price is AED225 (approx £45) for the waterpark or AED275 (approx £55) for the combi ticket of waterpark and aquarium. We chose the AED225 option. We also had to pay AED50 for a towel/locker combi (or AED30 for just a towel). We found the entry costs quite expensive but assumed it would be a top quality waterpark for the price. Unfortunately we were disappointed to find that there were only 6 water slides, which were mediocre. The park looks nice, but I have been to better water parks for less money. Tip: buy yourself the Meal Deal at the park entrance. For AED45 you can choose a burger/hot dog/fried chicken/salad with fries and a drink. However without a Meal Deal you will pay approx AED55 just for the burger/hot dog etc without fries and drink.

An unbelievable waterpark!. I can't actually imagine a waterpark that would be better than this one; scary rides, great slides, fun things like donuts and currents, brilliant setting. Obviously great for families but I had a blast with three of my male friends too. The Leap Of Faith (or the 'Death Slide' as we like to call it) was a breathless, quite terrifying 4 seconds but for someone who's scared of heights, I'm glad I plucked up the courage to do it! I'd recommend that in your day, you try each slide and ride at least once. Downsides: the extortionate entrance fee ($50 per person) and the long queues/lines for each ride. All in all though, a must visit and a fantastic day out.
Fun Fun Fun!!. Had such a great time here, The best waterpark i have ever been too...So many slides to choose from...Loved the double tubes rides too!!

Such fun!. We had a blast! The whole experience is great, from the monorail, to walking through the hotel and the park it's self. It is very expensive however and there are not really all that many rides. The ones they do have though are excellent fun! The staff are exceptional, tons of them (this seems to be the case in Dubai) and they are all brilliant! Shark attack ride where you end up in the aquarium was a fab experience! Facilities are very good and I didn't feel surrounded by kids the whole time!
Must visit. Best water park we've visited. You can easily spend a whole day there. Have lunch at the Atlantis too, the buffet was good. Remember to use your Entertainer Vouchers

Be Careful not to hurt yourself. We stayed at the hotel so we used the waterpark everyday. It is great but make sure you are not sitting to low in the tube when going down the slides. I landed very hard on my lower back going down one of the slides, I am surprised no one has broken their back, it kind of jumped in the air and landed hard I was in lot of pain and black and blue few days later. The staff should tell you to sit little higher.
No proper guidence.. Waterpark is superb and number of life guard to watch. No proper guidence made available. Swimming costume was made available at very high price.

Even for adults. The place may have been filled with children but our adult group of six still had a blast. There was enough to do and see that we were not bothered by the groups or the children. Try all the slides. They were all fun. The large drop slide " Leap of Faith" takes you through a shark tank but... You are going so fast or may have your eyes closed... Then you totally miss it!

Amazing park. I stayed at Atlantis, so I was able to enjoy the park for free of charge.Great slides, lazy river, pool, fantastic scenery.There is a slide which goes from the bottom to the top of the tower. Amazing, never had such a experience.Great place for everyone!!!
Great for a Family. Its a great place for the family but not so great for adults only. I can easily see that if my family had been with me then the kids would have been entertained.
so much fun!. we had so much fun!!! you can even slide through an aquarium!!! we made a river ride of an hour, without getting bored for a minute! they also take fun pictures. really worthwhile!

"Never Ever want to leave". This is an amazing water park ,the best in the wold.We had so much fun with all the activities that they had to offer.Children where safe at thier part of the park.The had thier own little thrill rides with water that was not to deep or too shallow.They had a very realistic fake sea that was amazing.I loved the shark tank ride it was the amazing.I advise everyone to go here because....Everyone deserves nothing but THE BEST.

For waterbabies. An extraordinary place for children and for adults who are aqua inclined. Even if your preference is for a more natural environment, it's worth a visit - though the masses of flesh in lengthy queues may drive some in search of a dark and tranquil saloon
Fun day out. Luckily got free entry through the hotel. But would have paid if not. Not really worth hiring towels or locker.
NUL!!!!!. What can I say? a scam! Why? Can very attractive, expensive!too many people along tail.I do not recommend it, because it is a money machine!

good not great. The slide were awesome and the variety was great. You do pay a bit more for the experience though. We went in the summer so the floor were boiling hot and you had to run from shaded spot to shadded spot. We will go back for sure!

Great day out for the kids but so expensive. The kids had a fantastic time but mum and dad are now broke! And we have a child under 2 that was free! For the cost they could at least provide free towels not charge 30 AED. More signs are needed on the ride with the inflatable rings as we ended up going a way where the rapids where not the calm route with my 15 month old son. No one told us either! Thankfully I could turn back as he would have been expected to hold on himself something he could not have done. Overall we had a good day and would go back again but just need to save a bit more money first.

Fun fun fun. Aquaventure is a fab family day out. Take the extra 5 minutes to walk along the beach ( dolphin direction) to the sun loungers that aren't mobbed by other fun seekers.All the rides are fun filled with twists and turns, however if you live on the wildside go all the way to the top ride Zuggerat. Hold onto your bikinis and shorts and enjoy the 25m drop which at the end propels you through a shark tank, don't worry they can't touch you.The food outlets are better than your fast food chains and the fresh pineapple around the park is a nice treat to.

Good but the ticketing needs sorting!. Aquaventure is a great place for everyone – young and old. We were surprised to find that you actually park away from the hotel and then get a shuttle bus BACK. I guess this avoids congestion so it is well thought through. But this would add an extra 20mins travel time.As with most places in Dubai, arriving early has its benefits. However, we were quite disappointed to find that even though we had booked our tickets online, you still had to queue with everyone else and even arriving fairly early, it was a good 10-15mins wait. I really can’t see the point of booking online at all if there are no benefits and facilities to just grab your ticket separately and go.If you are there early, I would recommend doing the big slides first. Even after an hour of being there, the queues were getting noticeably larger so get them all in first. The rides themselves are great … a little confusing to navigate around the pyramid and work out what is non-tube, what is double tube only etc. I would then spend the afternoon going around the rapids as they are never that congested.If you have lunch at one of the small beachside cafes, prepared to be hungry. The portion sizes are enormous and we could have all just ordered one sandwich/baguette with fries to share between 2 people.Overall, a great day out.

Fun Day. I had fun, wasnt too crowded when I went and the Leap of Faith was a must do. The only thing I had a issue was the fact then when your in the rubber tubes and going down the paths to re ride the water slides the water does not move so you need to walk, still it is better walking in the water then walking up the stairs :)

Fun wa to spend a day in Dubai. The water park at Atlantis has several great water slides and a river that runs throughout the park that offers a wonderfully relaxing afternoon floating around on an inner tube. There are about 6 or 7 water slides, of varying degrees of scariness, and they are great fun.The park itself seems well designed, and the beach has beautiful views of the Dubai skyline.The only complaints would be that purchasing ticks was very slow and it seemed as if the staff were working their first day. Perhaps this was an anomaly, but I suggest arriving before the opening time, to allow time for ticket purchase. Also, Atlantic could be a bit more helpful to day guests: they charge for towels and locker rental, which seems a bit much since you already pay a good sum to enter the park. Then, you get one towel for the day, with no exchanges, and the lockers are far away from the slides, not near them, so you are constantly walking back to them if you need something like sunscreen or your camera. Of course, you can leave your things on a lounge chair, but not sure how safe it will be in a crowded water park if you leave for the slides. Overall, we found it a bit difficult to keep track of our things and do the water slides, as we were only two people. Lockers located all over the park and a chance to exchange towels would have been helpful.

Nice!. We opted to go to Aquaventure instead of Wild Wadi, because we wanted to see the Palm, the Atlantis and because we wanted to experience the slide which goes through an aquarium tunnel full of sharks and other fishes. However, although this slide still excists, it doesn't go through the aquarium tunnel any longer, so that was actually quite a dissapointment. For most attractions you need a tube. The attractions are nice, but if you want to go for a faster/more scary one, the ones with the tube are not the best of course. I'm not sure how the attractions at the Wild Wadi are, but it could be that the ones there are faster. We spend a good 4 hours at the park and we had a great time. You can also buy a combo-ticket which gives you entrance permission to The Lost Chambers, which is quite nice.

A nice aquatic experience. We spent around 5 hours in the Aquaventure Park, which is part of the Plam Atlantic Hotel, situated on the Palm Jumeirah in Dubai. You have in the park nice things to do : different slides (it takes around 2 hours to make them all at least once), including the "Leap of Faith" one which is very impressive. There are places to rest or take sun baths, and food or drinks booths. Expect the plae to be croweded by Atlantis Hotel guests, and external visitors, at the start of the afternoon. For "scared" parents : security is impressive, with life-guards every 5 to 10 meters in all aquatic things - I have never seen that elsewhere. They carefully look after all guests. All in all, we enjoyed this experience.

Wet and Wild. Some good slides and great rapids which have nice slow lazy sections and then some fast bits. Would have thought there would have been more slides, like the American water parks but still worth a visit if you want a break from the beach/swimming pools.
Good fun. Great fun water park, some great rides and the lazy river is good for relaxing. Very nice setting with agood choice of restaurants when you need a bite to eat.

Really Fun. Go there when it's not too cold nor hot (like November or March). As a themed water park, everything is first class. Just hoped they had more restaurants or food stalls inside, with more options to choose from.

excellent water park. Well organized, good slides, fantastic rapids all in good setting of greenery. Access is a bit troublesome unless you are staying at Atlantis hotel. Most likely the best aquapark in Dubai

Great park, but avoid holidays!. This is the newest park in Dubai. It tends to get very busy if you go on weekends in the holiday season! The good thing about it is that rides are interconnected, so you could move from one ride to another while in the water. The staff are very friendly. You could also take a peak at the dolphin bay if you haven't ever seen a dolphin ..
Excellent fun for all the family. Loved every minute. Leap of faith into the shark pool a wonderful idea for my teenage sons. Fun but no danger. Loved it and so will you!

Kids loved it. We were staying at the Atlantis so had 'free' access every day and we took advantage of it. The queues get really long very fast so it is worth getting their early to do your favourite rides a couple of times at the beginning of the day and then relaxing on the beach in the afternoon. There are so many life guards there it is extremely safe for all the kids but the food was very ordinary. We always popped back to the hotel for lunch. Overall for our 3 kids aged 11, 10 & 6 they thoroughly enjoyed it.

good day out. we got access after booking in at the atlantis. you have to pay DH40 for use of locker. it was very busy. the water rapids were good, the slides were great too. its not something that i would want to go back to very shortly.

Usual Water park Fare. I quite enjoy water parks generally and saw nothing here to change my mind. Plenty of the usual slides with twists and turns, lazy rivers and river rapids. The "leap of faith" propels you through a tank with live sharks which is interesting. Located right at the end of the Jumeirah Palm in the grounds of the Atlantis hotel which is a sight to see in its own right so do the taxi ride along the Palm. A few fast food outlets around the place ensure you never go hungry or thirsty.Lots of debate over whether here or Wild Wadi water park is better. Personally I couldnt pick one over the other as I found both to be excellent.Best compliment I could pay this place is that even after about 6 hours sampling the various rides I still had to drag my 4 year out the gate because she wanted to stay for more.
Loads of fun.... Everything was pretty awesome. Only the heat made it difficult to walk around for too long but the park itself was pretty sweet. Fun for the entire family.
Great, worth a visit. Amazing water park, long queues though so be prepared to wait!Definitely a 'must' to visit with kids

Atlantis water park and dolphin swim. Wow, we're can I start. I booked the dolphin experience as never done it before and I thought whilst I'm In Dubai for a couple of days why not. Booked the early appointment (9:10), two reasons firstly so it won't be that hot in the morning and secondly I could then spend the rest of the day at the water park. I booked the royal swim at dolphin cay, it was expensive about 1025 aed but it was worth every penny. The Royal swim is limited to 6 people per group. The price for dolphin swim also includes entry to aquaventure. You start off with the safety talk and also the trainer has some general information on the dolphins. Then the good part, you get in the water. They firstly get you as a group to lift the dolphin up to feel how heavy they are. You then get a fin ride, we're you grab in to the fins of two dolphins and you are pulled along. You then get a boogie board and again pushed along by the dolphins nose pushing your foot. It truly was a magnificent thing to do and one I would really like to experience again and would also recommend everybody to try it, it will be a memory that will last with me for a very long time. Now for the disappointment, aquaventure. After all the excitement of the royal swim I was looking forward to spending the day in the water park. Firstly the problem is, its not that big there are roughly 8/9 slides that either use a tube to sit in or you go with out one. I roughly did all the slides within about 45 mins and some of them twice as well. I mean they are good especially were you go through the tunnel and the sharks, stingrays and fish swim around you but that is it there needs to be more things to do. I loved the lazy river, this was one of the best things at the park, I spent most of my time at the park going round and round. Also in respect of the fees for the towels and lockers I think that is extortionate, 40 aed for a locker and 30 aed for a towel. If you haven't been to Dubai and want something to do, I would recommend the royal swim but possibly not the water park side of it.My rating is 5 stars and this is purely because of the royal swim.
Great fun. Good day out. Well designed and well run. Hard to fault and an excellent way of keeping cool when the temperature gets too much.

Amazing rapids but very expensive /queuing.. Wish I'd seen advice to buy tickets before. We were advised to get on day but queue was huge. It is a long way from anything so taxi expensive plus as someone else said kids are adults if over 1.2m as our 9 year old was but they can go on all slides at that height. Prices aside this is an excellent waterpark. We are very wimpy about slides but we tried a few. We LOVED the shark attack. Very fast and dark. Went on double ring so didn't spin. The sides are well designed as they slow you down quickly at the end so no big splash. We then bobbed thru shark tank. Fab. We also loved the rapids which look scary but are really fun. Loads of lifeguards who were very friendly. Kids loved kids play area. However this pace is huge. We dumped our stuff on one subbed which was hard to find again. We never sat down all day which seems the same for nearly everyone yet nearly every bed had a towel on! Lockers are extra so I suppose they had to leave their stuff somewhere. Couldn't let kids go off on own as we would never have found them again. Beach ok but no free sun beds so had a swim and perched on an abandoned one whilst kids played. Day did involve lots of queuing for each slide. Only place with no queue is rapids so went on this loads, 2 km long so takes ages. Says it closes at sunset but this was about 5 pm so didn't have time to do everything. Map is very vague and when you are at slides you are not sure of severity.Overall we did enjoy it but day a little spoiled by the hour wait for a taxi at the end of the day and changing rooms were a joke as everyone thrown out at same time. Be prepared for cost. Only bring water as they remove juice and food from your bag when you enter!

painfully overpriced. not a lot here leap of faith 30 meters straight down through shark tank only trouble is that much water in your face you have no concept of anthing around you and can be painful to everything else is inflatable related and sedate make sure your flip flops are close to hand for so much water about the paving gets super hot food is exspensive 4 burger meals will cost you £50+ and unless you are on the palm or close £20 each way in a taxi plus your entrance fees however if you are a fishy person the lost world is well worth a visit

cool down the super cool way!. Compared to Wild Wadi, Atlantis has a limited choice in terms of overall water experience but the slides are above par. Ranging from super fast (for the brave ones) to the slightly safer options, I enjoyed the experience thoroughly with my teenage niece. Just remember where you set your stuff down coz it maybe a long walk back to the loungers.

Something for everyone of all swimming abilities. A great place for the whole family. Loved the lazy river/ rapids. Some of the family did the Ziggarat the high water flume which they loved. Sadly I am not as brave but it looked great! Lots for little ones as well as older ones. Will definitely visit again.

a fun day. Upon advise we bought the tickets the afternoon before we went, which was a good idea as the queue in the morning for a days ticket was really long. I must say I find it really expensive and that children over 1.20 pay adult fare is pushing it.We bought the meal deal and the Atlantis cup with refill for only AED5, but I would honestly not do that again. Not a very good deal, actually turned out to be more expensive as the cup cost AED 40 to start with........For the attractions: there are many good slides and the day just flies away.We went to queue up for a taxi after the park closed and the queue was huge. However the hotel offered a free shuttle bus to the Emirates mall which was in our direction, so we used that. Nice initiative and cheaper option for us.

Good Day out. Enjoyed the day out here, arrived just before 10am and had to queue for around 15 minutes to purchase entrance tickets. The rides themselves are pretty good, but by around 1pm had been on everything. We had lunch at the park (you can have money on your locker key/wrist band and this prevents the need to go back to the lockers for cash or carry it around with you), usual fast food choice available. We decided to stay for another hour or so after lunch and went back on some of the rides. I was expecting Aquaventure to be better than Wild Wadi, but to be honest there's not really much difference, still worth a visit and a good day out.
Great fun!. I and my son of 5 years loved every bit of it, all the rides were fun, we could spend whole day without getting bored and my sun wanted to be there again...

You feel speachless on top of 1 million gallon of water!!!. You name a fish , and it is there, live and life size!!! saw some real shark, sting ray.and many more species...My kids went crazy and they were just not reday to come out of the aquarium. The zoo on upper floors is one of its kind, You can see Piranhas, and crabs and hunderds of other marine life, which we usually see in pictures. Just a WOW experience...

Silly towel location. The only complaint we had was that when we arrived, we had to go right into the park to locate the towels we had hired, to take them all the way back to the changing room to put them in our lockers (we didn't want to take them round the park with us) and this seemed really silly.The park could do with more signs as to where you are, although all the rides tend to drop you back into the lazy river which is nice and keeps you moving. Everyone was very helpful and the shark slides were really good. Approximate waiting times would have been helpful to list.
Especially for the young crowd. Lot of people but also a lot of staff. Children loves it. You can transport yourself around the area in a large swimming ring in canals which takes approx 40 minutes.

Expensive and not great for younger kids. we really enjoyed our day at the Aquaventure water park, but left feeling like we'd just paid a huge amount of money for something that we couldn't really get a lot out of with two young children. There is a lovely little play pool area for the younger kids, which they loved, but that was the only part we could actually use, so we ended up having to stay there the whole time. A little disappointing, but we could see how it would be fantastic fun once the children were older.

not many rides. Some of the rides go through the shark tank which is pretty cool but the tallest ride goes through so fast and with a face full of water you don't see anything.Sunbeds fill up fast.Prefer Wild Wadi.

So so great. This place is good, but for the entrance price, it should be out of this world. 50 euros is far too much. There are better water parks in the UAE for less money. I wouldn't go again. There were a lot of folk who had less than wonderful manners. One lady tossed another persons towel and gear on the floor because she wanted the lounger. When he came back, she wasn't sorry, told him 'You snooze, you lose'. She was a Brit, he mates thought she was hilarious.

Dissapointing. Too busy and not that amazing. Long lines, and not that many rides. A lot of people walking around in every directions, not easy to walk around, or even to try to find a free seat. It was the holidays....

it wasn't for me, dis-organised and disappointing. We have been to many water parks in the US and have been to the wild wadi in dubai before but have never been to atlantis. We pre booked via our agent and i am glad we did because when we arrived by taxi there was an hour queue, unless you had a pre paid voucher.Once in, we went to guest relations to get towels etc, about 15 minutes wait. They give you a wrist band to wear that you can load money onto and it operates the lockers, if you are lucky, its a bit fiddly and lots of the lockers were broken. BEWARE - if you are a family, male and female lockers are separate and so you will need 2 at 40 dirhams each.Towels are 30 dirhams each but the towel hut is no where near the locker room and i had trouble finding it at all.If you can't find any free sunbeds, which we couldn't because it was so crowded, you have no where to put the towels down, when you have them, so you either have to walk into the park and get the towels and then bring them back, or carry around the slips of paper and hope that they don't get wet before you choose to get your towels (unlikely)The lockers will fit in a backpack and some crocs and a towel, but not much more,3 toilets in the ladies changing area and some very dark, small changing cubicles, not that comfy for the amount of ladies and surprising for a newish park.Already, you may be able to see the disorganised feeling of my review.Bags searched on the way in to stop you bringing in food etc. ice-cream was 20 dirhams each, didn't get any food as we had had a big breakfast.You have to retrieve a tube from the beach area and carry it to the rides which are organised in such a way that you get on one and then get fed off onto another and another. if you are like us and not all the family are eligible or up for all the rides, you usually wait by the entrance or near where you got on to meet afterwards. in this park, this is not possible as when you get off the ride, you are no where near the entrance so its a long walk and a long wait.The lazy river has rapids that may not be suitable for some, but is quite cool. My 10 year old son and his dad did enjoy the rides that they went on, Plenty of life guards around and plenty of tubes.When we had finished for the day we went back to the lockers and did not use the towel vouchers so i asked for a refund, along with my money back from my wristband that i did not spend, NO refunds on towels eventhough i explained the issue and the management just said "that's business" so i would recommend taking your own.The taxi queue at 6pm was an hour long as well, with no alternative other than the shuttle bus into the mall of the emirates (free), but i was hardly dressed for a trip into town (shorts, vest top and a thin cover up), not expecting anything but to go from there, straight back to my own hotel on the mainland. overall i would say not worth the money, which was very disappointing.
Fantastic fun. Great rides, although the queues were pretty long at peak times. Hotel guests are allowed in a little bit earlier than day trippers, the best time to get on the Leap of Faith etc.

Cash cow. While the water park is amazing, the whole place is a cash cow. At 50dhs for a frozen yogurt and 50dhs for a kids meal, it is very expensive. Expect to double your entrance with food and drinks. The concept is great, but for really little ones they will miss out on a lot of rides so save it until kids are over 120cm.
Fun Day Out!. Very busy so would advise to book in advance otherwise you have to queue on arrival. Leap of Faith slide is great!

Great waterpark. I have visited many water parks and I can definitely recommand this one in Dubai. However, don't visit during school or bank holidays because it will get too busy. There are a lot of different water slides and you can also visit the dolphin bay where you can swim with dolphins (you have to prebook this though).

Overcrowded. The only thing we did in Dubai that didn't live up to its billing. Overpriced, overcrowded and with poor transport links. A one hour queue to enter and for a taxi when leaving allied to a 50min queue for one of the slides meant that queuing became the abiding memory. It could be brilliant however if they set a more realistic daily limit on entry numbers.

Good water park. We traveled over Eid and naturally it was very crowded. Long lines for the slides. The lazy river was great though and we ended up spending most of our time there. A bit pricey for the experience.
Best waterpark in Dubai, Atlantis Palm. Best place to take kids and have family fun. Riders are designed to keep everyone happy. Was crowded due to school break in the region.

Dubai Holiday - Water park. We had a day for water park, we had to choose between Wild Wadi and Aquaventure. We decided for Aquaventure as we heard that it is newer and less crowded. It was Sunday 28th Oct 2012, the place was heavily crowded at 10:30 AM. It took approx. 30 minutes to buy ticket in line. The fair was of thousands. Despite huge croud, didn't feel much waiting. The place was reasonably managed, clean, hygienic and supervised by many lifeguards. We were family of 6 people from age of 5 year old kid to 63 year old grandpa. it was fun for everyone. We spent 6-7 hours doing different water slides, river rides, we did all except Leap of Faith (steep water slide), which looked scary. By the time we decided to try leap of faith, the place started to close. It was a day full of thrill and excitement. A day well spent.

Great day out. We decided to visit here instead of the Wild Wadi Water Park and I think we made the right choice. Located in the famous Atlantis Resort on the top of the Jumeirah Palm.We drove there so only took like an hour from our hotel in Bur Dubai.We had vouchers for Buy 1 Get One Free entrance and also for a towel & locker combo. Prices are advertised on their website but you can't pre-book - just turn up on the day.After queuing up and then finding our lockers, we changed and went out to explore. There is a 2 km stream that has rapids and torrent sections. You need to use a tube - either single or a double. These are great fun.They also have water slides. Again using your tube. There's one called Shark Attack where go down in darkness and then shoot out the other side in a plastic glass tunnel that goes through a shark tank with real sharks! Other water slides called The Plunge, and 2 others which I can't remember. The most famous one is called the Leap of Faith. You climb up to 27 m high and after queuing you travel down fast to the bottom - great fun!A tip - you can't take any food or drink into the park as they insist on you buying stuff inside. We thought the food prices were very extortionate, so we didn't bother. For a burger they wanted 45Dhs. We went outside and on our way back we stopped and burger joint and got 3 meals for 45Dhs!!! So you can see what I mean.Overall an enjoyable day.Whilst there you can also go to the Chambers - which is basically a huge Aqaurium thingy. But we saw one at the Dubai Mall.

Very adventure and huge area to relax. Very huge area with varieties of adventure water activities. If you scared on the adventure activities, you can just lay down in the pool with the waves or else relaxing on the sun deck...

Great day out!!. This water park is amazing, very clean, safe, life guards are everywhere. You will spend 7-8 hours without noticing the time.There are different water slides but you have to use the tube in all except for one "leap of faith" it is scary slide that takes only 5 seconds to finish and your speed will reach around 80 KM/h :S bit scary!! Do not forget to get towels with you if you do not want to rent a locker And towel for 50 AED.You can do snorkeling and diving inside but you need to book for this earlier as they do snorkeling 3 times a day for small group, 5 as I think.Enjoy the water park and do not hesitate to try the "leap of faith" slide, you will do it one time only ;)

Fab day out. We went with our 2 teenage children. The only water park we've arrived at opening time and left at closing (we are big fans of the waterparks in Florida). The lazy river with rapids and torrent makes the park - the best lazy river we've been on.

Nice waterpark. The place was clean, safe and with good water park rides though the tickets were expensive .The changing rooms were clean. The shops and restaurants were all expensive .even cost of Oreo biscuit was 10dirhams or 150rupees.

Fantastic. This water park has something for all the family and has a designated children's area as well as the rapids for the adults to ride in your own inflatable ring. There are some larger rides for the more adventurous.

Full day of fun!. Our party of 2 went here in October. We managed to get 2 for 1 voucher which was great. Started on the water rides which were incredible if a little heart racing! It's nice to be very lazy and not have to climb the stairs each time you want to go down due to their very clever rubber ring transport system. We then used the lazy river/rapids. The park started to get a little busier at lunch so we decided to use the onsite beach for a couple of hours. It was beautifully calm and quiet and we could have quite happily spent a couple of days there! We managed to have a great lunch - expensive but then what theme parks aren't - and then head back to the rides late afternoon.The park was clean, staff were helpful and we had a fantastic time there.

Great fun!. The park is great to spend a day in the sun with friends!I personally don't like slides but there is the lazy river that can definitely put a smile on your face and keep you busy all day. Some parts of the lazy river makes you feel like you are on the wild water rafting! Don't forget the sun-blocker, July is extremely hot! There is something for everyone. You can go and watch dolphins or even swim with them. The park is green and clean! There is a beautiful empty beach with the most still water I have ever seen. Worth visiting!

Worth it despite the high cost. Went on the last day of our holiday visiting friends who live in Dubai and had a really good day out. We arrived just after 11.30 and had to queue for 45 minutes to buy tickets - this was a weekday, but probably worse than a normal weekday as Eid began the day after. The queues for the main rides were also long, but just on the bearable side.The Leap of Faith slide (kamikaze style - the only ride you do without an inflatable ring) was even faster/crazier than I expected, great stuff, and the other main rides were really good too. But maybe the best part of this place is the Rapids/Torrent/generally all the channels you can float around for hours, hitting fast bits and slow bits and then finding yourself heading up a conveyor belt to start one of the faster rides, which dropped you back down to float off again.Entry is expensive (look for offers) as is the locker charge - we used two lockers between four of us. Despite being there for six hours, we didn't eat but the drinks were relatively reasonably priced for the sort of place and delicious, freshly made, from milkshakes to fresh juices and coffees.Just a great relaxing day with some good, exciting rides thrown in. Would definitely recommend avoiding weekends and holidays - and worth getting there for opening when you could get on all the big rides without queueing, for your first time around anyway!

Fun but expensive. We were really excited to go to Aquaventure having heard great things about the rides and it was not a let down. All the slides start from the same central "pyramid" with the best slides (at least in our opinion) at the top. The Leap of Faith was as fast as advertised and the two seater inflatable rings were a nice touch to allow you to ride alongside a partner / friend. All in all there were seven slides and two sets of "rapids", all of which we had finished within 90 minutes of arriving (we had arrived as the park opened to avoid queues, arriving later will mean queues of up to 30 minutes for the more popular rides). After finishing the park we went to the private beach which was very nice with clean sand and crystal clear water. The only issue is with price. We paid over 500 AED (just under £100) for the day including locker hire. Drinks inside cost the equivalent of £3 for a standard bottle of coke. When you work it out on a per slide / per minute basis it's all rather expensive. Still, once you get over the price it is undoubtedly a fun day out. If you come as a family or intend on doing a lot of tourist-y activities the buy-one-get-one-free offers in the Entertainer will serve to soften the hit on the wallet.

Amazing little water park. Fun for all! The marine life here is very cool! The slides were all very fun and well put together. Most walkways are covered so our feet were ok even under the sun of Dubai!
