Ideal for families. This place is a heaven for children and parents as well. Lots of activity and it's totally safe as the guards are too many and very friendly and helpful. Actually I didn't play too much as I was busy with my little boy 11 month old. Just make sure to use the sun block as it get little hot in the afternoon and secure your kiddies with life jackets it's free. The food is a little expensive inside and no food is allowed from outside.

Fun in the HOT sun!. A great adventure at the end of the palm housing area. Get there early to get a chair near the beach. Great shopping too. Lots of rides but the food...argh... need to work on that.

Amazing. Went with a friend, just wanted to do teh big slide, ended up spending the whole day there. We are both adults but we had fun like kids, super friendly staff, did the big slide twice, really nice, make sure u get the 275 AED package to do the Lost Chambers as well. Bring ur own towels or pay 30 AED rent each.

A family must. The kids demanded we visit as the main feature of our stopover from France to Australia. It was a great choice as it kept them awake and occupied until late enough whilst leaving the tired and ready to sleep - a great combination.

Seems bigger than it is. It looks really much bigger than it is. If you're a resort guest it is free, which is a nice thing. But if you have to come from outside and have to pay extra, then I would prefer the Wild Wadi park.

Great fun even without kids!. A very refreshing way to spend the morning/afternoon in the souring August heat. The queues were not very long for any of the water slides and the rapids were great fun. Definately worth a visit.

The Best. We went here a number of times as we were staying in the Atlantis palm which entitles you free entry. I think for a family of 4 entry is around 100 Pounds sterling. The park is immaculate and the numerous lifeguards are very friendly and always smiling. My kids are 7 and 5 and we felt totally safe all the time even if they were a little out of sight on the rapid rides. There is literally a lifeguard every 30 metres it would seem. Make sure your kids are over 1.20m tall so they can go on the larger rides. Staff are strict with this rule and often check (it is for their safety afterall) My son is 1.25m tall and even so from the top of the Pyramid ride on a blow up tube he was not heavy enough to make it over the first hill, he came to a stop half way up. Again in this instance the lifeguards were immediatly on the radio. As one guard came up the steps at the side the operator turned off the water allowing my son to slide back down. Lifeguard met him at the bottom and got him safely off the ride as I followed down the slide only to meet my son at the end, he was back in the water behind me all smiles. One thing I would say is do not get a locker as they are about 8 pounds for the day. Your possesions should be safe enough left on the sun loungers ours were. Visit soon and enjoy!
For Kids of ALL Ages. For four hours, we floated and floated and floated. The slides are a blast and the atmosphere is all fun. Can't wait to go back in November.

Great Experience. It was a very expensive entrance free, but we managed to get discount for buy 1 get 1 from a discount book (entertainer book) u can purchase it in bookstore. we visited when it was just 1 day old, newly opened on 2008. My husband loved it so much. Shark aquarium for the highest slide is a very good idea. we know everything will be expensive, so we dont buy anything. we didnt get to see the dolphin show, we waited for 1 hour, no show yet, but we enjoyed the pool with starbuck cofee.

The best in the world. Linked to the Atlantis this is a 5-star facility! Lovely loungers a plenty, restaurants, ice cream stalls, yoghurt, etc. The Leap of Faith is 27.5m tall and 61m long and you blast through a tunnel that goes through the shark tank! The best rush ever! The tube rides are crazy! It blasts you UP HILL and the are conveyor belts that takes you to higher levels to enjoy the rapids. Magical!
Excellent. I have been there many times. Its just awesome. Many rides, good for kids and adults / family. During weekends it really gets crowded.

Great waterpark.. We were on a family vacation and tried this waterpark out. Would highly recommend it. Lots of places to eat and purchase what you need. Comfortable water temps and lots of help if you need it.

Family safe water rides. Great fun in the water for the whole family esp. the rapids and the different slides with thrills for the most daring. Food and snacks are as one expects at theme parks. Lots of deck chairs and shade to relax under. Ask about discounts to enter as most credit cards as well as residents get some % off the basic ticket price. Yes its expensive to enter but it is quality, safe and very clean. We stayed until the park closed at 6PM opps taxi que was very long so we took the monorail back but it dumps you at a half constructed station called Gateway where if you are lucky you can flag down a taxi on the speeding road outside, but best to walk towards Marina (no footpath so you must walk along the road side for about 1km), to the traffic lights, cross over and you will get plenty of empty taxis within a few minutes.

A nice park... with rooms for improvements.... I had been here along with my friends... the place is nice, organized and but nothing like a Must Visit attraction or something.First thing, i would like to write about is the Restaurant, Shark Bites. We took out meal voucher along with the Entry Tickets... now, being a part of Atlantis, we expected the food to be of better quality and taste. And, when we started eating our burgers, sandwich and fried chicken, to our surprise none of them was good in taste... We even felt the chicken was really stale one and just dint like the food. Their are few small restaurants/shops with in Park, which i felt had better eateries though it was absurdly costly.And, secondly, we wanted to take a few of our photos that was clicked while we used the rides (leap of faith). The cost is AED 75 for a single photo and if we take more than one it is AED 50 each photo. And, when we selected few of our photos, and they said that they could only print the photos and give it to us where as we wanted the soft copy of it. Even after telling them that we would provide them with our USB they still denied it. They say they have a policy that only 10 and more photos could be given in the USB (USB provided by them). We were pretty upset with this... hopefully they come up with a solution for this.Apart from these... we felt It was a nice one day excursion.
Had a rapid time. The rapids were great fun, but make sure you get used to being in a rubber ring for 2 hours.Lockers though at 40 dirhams were expensive and should be included in the price

Great day out. I loved the fact that all the rides are in the one spot and that thanks to the travelators you barely had to get out of the water all day. The double tubes were great fun. We ate in Shark bites (with the entertainer vouchers) and it was nice as far as fast food goes.

Good to experience if you have time.... Not like those you may experience in US, however at this moment its the best in Dubai. It is located in Atlantis resort on Palm island and rides can get quite crowded on weekends. The experience overall is good and its worth a try.
Best aqua park in Dubai. This waterpark is beautiful. There are so many different rides and slides. Very scary ones toones for children. there are beautiful long beaches, drinks, bars, great staff!
Aquaventure indeed!. Brilliant fun but make sure you apply lots of sun block and dont think the water will protect you! Would definitely visit again but also want to try WIld Wadi next time in Dubai.

Great time. There is something for everyone, whether you want to chill in the rapids or get a thrill in the leap of faith, this water park is great,just don't buy fruits in the park,they are overpriced

Stay in the hotel and use it for free. I would say the best way to experience Aquaventure Water Park is to stay a night or more at Atlantis Palm Jumeirah Hotel where this Water Park is one of the hotel's attractions. You can easily fill a full day with your family and there are several rides to enjoy.

Fun.. Fun... Great number of slides for all ... adults and kids alike. If your child is above 1.3mts, then all the more better, he/she can ride majority of rides. If not, then only option for them is the children's pool which is really amazing...... and the rapids... lazy river.... But either ways, its worth going there... Pretty expensive.. 225 AED /person.. I suggest buying the Entertainer book of dubai and looking for "buy one, get one free coupons"...

Good Fun But .... The kids had fun and so did we BUT ... it was extremely busy when we were there and the queues were simply too long given how expensive it was to get in. The food and drinks were also too expensive. The kids (aged 10) preference was for Wild Wadi as the rides were more adventurous.

NICE for a warm afternoon. For me the main POSITIVE POINT of going to the park was the amazing view on the BURJ KALIFAH hotel tower ( very close)Was a bit upset cause there are loads of lifeguard that prevent you from touching your friend while swimming in the wave pool ? asking you constantly to "SEPARATE"?so we ended up having fun all on our respecitve side!!!Otherwise nice attraction park with only 3/4 mains slides so it gets quite repetitive after a while
Great day out,regardless of age.. Came here for the day. Had a whale of a time as a married 20/30 something couple. Great rides and lovely to cool down in.
Get a private Cabana. This was an excellent trip to the park, but it was so full that we opted to get a private waterside cabana (which cost just under USD 200) but was well worth it!

Great day of for all. With Entertainer vouchers this is an affordable day out, bit pricey without! Ate at Shark Bites, also had vouchers, hot dog was huge! The nice part about Aquaventure over Wild Wadi is that you can chill on the beach after lunch before heading back to the rides. Love all the rides especially the one that goes through the tank.

Brilliant. Preferred this to Wild Wadi as preferred the 'Torrent' and the rapids, they are great fun. Best Lazy River i have ever experienced. Also different to end up riding through a tank of sharks and fish at the bottom of a slide. Different! (Obviously not literally)

Nice Park but rides too short. Been to a number of waterparks and this one has been themed really well and is clean and pleasant.There are around 8 rides but most are really short unless you include the tame float down the river afterwards - not really worth the 225 AED entrance fee.

Excellent. My family and I enjoyed the water fun all the day with free entrance to Atlantis guists. We went the whole two days as soon as we wake up till the close up at the sunset. Actually we travelled to Dubai for two reasons, the Atlantis & aquaventure and the SkiDubai.

WOW!. I stayed at the Atlantis and we got free tickets. So we took advantage. The park is a TON of fun. Lost my sunglasses, totally my fault. There are slides for everyone and there are relaxing pools you can sit at to if you like. Lots and lots of covered beach chairs. I suggest wearing modest swimwear. It's just better that way. I had a great time. Covered all the slides and lazy river. TIP: If you eat at Shark Bites Cafe, realize, the food items look small on the menu, but when they arrive it's like they trippled in size. The hot dog is nearly a foot long or more.

Aquaventure Beats Disney Waterparks!!. Having previously been to only Disney waterparks, compared to them Aquaventure was brilliant!!! It definitely makes the Disney lazy rivers look very boring!! You can just grab a rubber ring and sit in it all day, floating from one ride to the next via conveyer belts!! The lazy river has a rapids and torrent wavy section which adds to the excitement. I didn't do the leap of faith but went on all the other tube rides, a lot of them are in pitch black but they aren't too scary!!It was a great way to cool off in the hot temps and have some fun with a group of friends!!

Amazing Day!. OMG we had the most amazing day ever! We arrived at 11am, were there all day and finally sadly dragged ourselves out at around 6pm. The day went so quickly because there were so many different things to do. I feared we might spend most of the day queuing, but not at all, we spent a lot of the day going around on the rapids and torrents. We used an entertainer voucher so we got Bogof on the admission and a towel and locker combo. I recommend you but those wetsuit shoes thing because otherwise you would spend the day carrying flipflops around and having to walk on the rather hot floor.Would definitely go again! :)

Amazing. 14 different rides from scary-leap of faith to scary all the others!, after you finish a ride just stay on your ring float around the park on your ring to the next ride where you get pulled up on a conveyor belt to the next ride, a day well spent.

Third visit and still the kids want to go again!. Great day out and experience. Well run, loads of rubber rings. The ride where you go through the underwater tank is amazing and a must. We went Christmas day and was treated to father Christmas parachuting onto the beach.
very nice to do. the leap of faith is very thrilling, I'm glad I did that one ;-). The shark adventure is also great.

Another great day out!. We are a couple in our forties and had a great day at Aqauventure.Like everywhere in Dubai, it is clean,well organized and staffed with friendly cheerful people, for whom nothing is a problem.The locker system and money wristband made it easy to enjoy the day without any baggage.The sun loungers all had great sunshades on them and there were plenty everywhere.The river rides were great fun and all interconnected.The Shark Bait ride and The Leap of Faith were amazing.We used our Entertainer coupon making it a great value day out, but the prices are very reasonable and better than those in Australia.Worth every cent.A great day out.The only thing that detracted from it was that lots of the tube rides were in the dark and made me a little seasick.None the less, we had a terrific time at Aquaventure, would recommend it to everyone and can't wait to come back again.

Most relaxing day of the holiday!. I absolutely loved my day at Aquaventure - we thought we'd spend about 3 hours there but easily stayed for twice that! The lazy river gobbles up hours of time - and I don't think we even covered half of it! So many different routes to take and some take you to the major slides in the ziggurat tower.Fantastic way to cool down from the desert heat, and loads of fun!There are several cabana areas around the park, and it's quite safe to leave a few of your belongings there while you enjoy the water, though we left our more prized possessions in the lockers.Leap of faith was incredible - I think the whole park heard me scream! The slide that ends in the shark tank is also great though it took me so long to get the water out of my eyes I didn't get to see too many!Definitely recommend if you have the time - if I ever end up back in Dubai I'll be visiting again!

"Wet and Wild!". We didn't know what to expect, and to be honest, we hadn't planned to go, but the tickets were complimentary with our room. Needless to say, we had the time of our lives and we are glad we went. My daughter, husband and I took turns watching over our "stuff," (instead of renting a locker), while the other two sampled the rides. Being left with the stuff isn't so bad because if you position yourself wisely, you can be entertained by people-watching, observing sharks, sting-rays and other fish in a large tank, or just lounging on a sun bed while reading a good book. There are rides and attractions for all ages and sensibilities. And they are very strict about adhering to the 1.2 meter height rule on certain rides. The lines are well organized (think, Disneyland), and even when there are lots of people, the lines move quickly. The park is very clean, lush and green. It is a shame the park closes at dusk, so one has to be in the heat and the sun for this particular adventure. It's expensive at about $70. if you are taller than 1.2m, and about $50. if your child is under 1.2m. Food and meals seem to be eaten outside of the park, but I noticed there are restaurants in the mall next door. This is a perfect place for kids, especially teens, but even us "adults" had a really fun time.

Aquaventure. This was included as we paid to swim with the dolphins, was ok floating around on the floats and going down a few slides but nothing special. Do like the fact that they give you a wristband which you can put credit on so don't have to carry money around with you!
Do it. Great fun day. Don't take towels with you, hire them at the centre with a locker. Ensure you get money on your wrist band to avoid having to carry money with you.
Funfunfun. If you like water, rides and adventure then this is the place for you. Plenty of sun beds to relax if you want to sit out and people watch.

A must try. As expected from Dubai, a fun, very clean, safe and adventurous water park. we loved everything about it. great for kids. you can enjoy the river for hours, the kids play area seems like endless fun for adults and kids, and there are the big rides, the real thrill, some real fun. Do not miss it. avoid going on weekends (Fridays and Saturdays). and do not miss the dolphin show, the lost chambers and the walk around the Atlantis.

Brilliant Day. We were lucky that we didn't go in peak season, it wasn't over crowded. The staff are very friendly and there are a lot of slides to chose from. Not for the faint hearted though, some are in the dark and a bit scary!! They have various different packages to chose from we paid £100 for 2 on the Sliver Package, really enjoyed it

Brilliant. Brillian, lazy river kept us entertained for ages with rapids and torrent, lots of ways round it, expect to get wet. Slides were pretty fast. Could do with a seperate swimming pool just for swimming, other than that it was fantiastic value as we had entry free as we were staying in the hotel, also hotel guests could pick up towels free whilst in there. We stayed a couple of hours each day topping up our tan going round the river then returned to the hotel for a rest.

Loved it!. I stayed at Atlantis The Palm with my two teenage sons and the water park was free for us to visit. We spent the whole day here and had a great time! The boys went on all the thrill rides several times each, and I even went on a couple myself that were slightly tamer. The one where you go through the tunnel underwater surrounded by fish and sharks was very exciting, but my favourite was the one where you are on a blow-up raft in a man-made stream and you're taken with the current around the park. Lots of fun! Thoroughly recommend this for a fun day out with the family.

Excellent water park. Get a double tube and float and slide for the whole day without lines. Very relaxing and a ton of fun. Enjoy this with Atlantis. Dolphin experience and the Lost Chambers for a day you will never forget!

Fun. A one day trip to this place is surely going to keep you occupied. There is water theme park, marine adventures, spa, restaurants, helicopter ride and so on. Aquaventure’s famous ride is the “Leap of Faith” which is a near straight down drop of 27.5 metres through an underwater tunnel into shark infested waters. Don’t worry, you come out alive. Read my travel experience in rashmisreedharan.blogspot.in/2012/08/arabian-adventures-atlantis-palm-island.html

Loved it. We got the dolphin bay package so a day in aqua venture was included. That makes it worth it. It is a small park, full of fun. My family and I had a great time, although we felt that sone of the games were redundant. It was clean and well kept. We did not buy any of the pictures taken there because they were not good. We had complimentary towels from dolphin bay and we took them with us when we went to aqua-venture, if you don't take dolphin bay package, you will pay 30 AED for towels. We also rented a locker for 40 AED. We paid a lot but we had lot of fun in return.

Good fun but expensive for what you get. I went to Aquaventure last week for a day trip. The entrance fee is approx £45 per person and considering that the water park only has 7 adult rides (6 of which are waterslides, the 7th is the lazy river with a route to do the rapids section) we found the entrance fee did not offer value for money. Four of the six water slides spit you back out into the lazy river where you can chose to re-enter the slides using a conveyour belt or just continue with the lazy river (and do the rapids if you like). We arrived at the park at around 1015am and found that we had done all the rides by 1145am. The park is not as big as it seems. We found that in the morning, the water levels were a little low which resulted in the rubber rings getting stuck at various points. We were not able to complete a lazy river circuit without getting off our rings and pushing ourselves off the walls. The rapids section on the other hand were a little dangerous. Twice I was flipped over by the current and unfortunately the second time I ended up scraping my arm against the bottom which caused it to bleed and resulted in me having to seek first aid treatment.On entry to the park, your bags are searched by security to ensure you're not bringing in any food or drink. The food sold at the waterpark is of low quality and grossly overpriced (e.g. 2 burgers and 2 chips both with drinks cost us £25). In addition to this locker rental is £10 per locker for the day so all in all it does add up to being a costly day out.Having said all this, the rides - although short were extremely good fun. At times I did feel I was about to flip off the ring due to the sheer speed at which you travel through the tunnels. One ride, namely Shark Attack results in you ending up going through a mini aquarium where you see sharks and rays swimming around. The Leap of Faith - another very good ride does require nerves of steel and if you're a gent - I would advise you to cross your legs at the ankles to avoid being in pain by the water that shoots up between your legs!We didn't experience any big queues but the floor is too hot to walk around comfortably. There were plenty of rings and sunbeds to go around.Having done this once, I don't regret going but I probably wouldn't do it again due to the sheer expense involved. If you compare this to a UK theme park - I believe these offer a lot more value for money.

Fun Day. We were staying at the Atlantis so Aquaventure was free which is great! Go early as it gets busy in the afternoon. I came home with a huge bruise on my backside from sitting on the inflatable donut (ouch!). Going through the shark tank on one of the slides is fun. There are about 6 or 7 slides and also rapids and torrents. The ground is very hot when you are walking to the slides. Good fun!
Excellent rides. Husband and son enjoyed the slides at aquaventure better than Wild Wadi. A newer park with better facilities.

Its Good Better that other Atlantis park. the park is very good, every thing is very clean but their no to mani people to help you. they have saveguard every where but at lunch time their no to many people

Small but well worth a visit.. Very nice water park and great that you never really leave the water to get to the various areas. Queues were never too long and plenty of tubes always available. Lots of attendants so you can relax feeling safe and secure. Never used the lockers as we just left our things in the room. As a guest you have towels when needed and can also charge to the room.

Amazing. This was truly outstanding, the leap of faith terrified me! It is well worth getting a cabana if you are in a large group or meet up wih another family out there as the water and snack are free and it can save you are fortune. I thought it was well laid out and had an amazing day here, I can't wait to go back!

Wet and wonderful. Fantastic, spent the whole day here, most of it in the water. The rapids were great fun. The rides weren't for me though, I like to see where I'm going. The leap of faith was awesome although too scary for me.

Great Day out for Young and Old alike. We planned a day out here and so bought our tickets online before leaving UK - on arrival there were no problems.The price of lockers are 40DH (non refundable) a bit steep , but very little alternative. We took towels from the hotel , however, for an extra 10DH you could hire a towel saves lugging a soggy towel around.Having read tripadvisor we bought a cheap pair of wetsuits boots to stop our feet from burning on the concrete paths when moving from various rides - and I highly recommend UVA/UVB t shirts as the sun even whilst bobbing around the lazy river was blisteringly hot. There is a shop onsite next to changing rooms to buy these items if you choose.There is a monorail which services Atlantis to the begining of the Palm- however, taxis are plentiful and cheap.we spent approx 3hrs there (we are both mature 40 year olds) before the heat and tiredness got to us .thoroughly recommend it

atlantis water park. excellent water park, great fun for all ages , plenty of pools to relax in if you don't want to do the fast slides and rides, lazy river also for the more sedate ! but, if you like white knuckle thrills ,plenty to keep you going all day here !!!!!!!!

loved it!. Love love love this place. You get to be a big kid for the day! I am not a fan of water parks as I dont like the big slides but I still had a great time which says alot considering I hardly went on anything!

A must for water lovers. Truly an amazing place. Contrary to a recent review we went today to find many loungers and rings available. It must have been a quieter day as we were ther from opening till after 6pm. The slides are pretty exciting and the rapids and "torrent" ride are nice lengthy lazy river rides. Although food and drinks are a little pricey we went expecting this to be honest. It is simple business sense and is probably the same at almost any other attraction in almost every other country. The staff were very helpful. We only used one locker and found it fine to store everything as we didn't need anything with us except sun cream. We put some money on our wristbands in preparation when entering so I didn't have to keep going back for my wallet.We also did the dolphin experience which was amazing in itself.Would recommend to anyone. Also, you cannot leave without doing the "Leap of Faith"!!!!!
good fun. how can you not like a water park, great day out, good fun plenty of rides. only down side floor is hot walking around in summer heat

not as good as it could be. Having been to the likes of blizzard beach in florida my family and I were looking forward to aquaventure as most attractions in dubai are bigger and better than the rest of the world. The cost of £40 ish per head wasn't too bad considering location etc but that's were the plus sides ended. Overcrowded, not enough beds/loungers, free for all with the water 'doughnuts' one set of lockers per sex at the beginning of the park so you had to trek to and from if you needed any valuables ie money. The main bug bear was the cost of water/soft drinks, as dubai is very hot and you need to keep yourself hydrated this place maximizes on the fact that you cant bring your own, at £10 for 3 small (330ml) bottles of water I consider it to be extortionate, so must other people because when we left a bag with two unopened bottles on a lounger while we went for a swim someone stole them, left the googles, hat etc but pinched the water. There are only 4 or 5 slide options all in the same area, there is a small section dedicated for smaller children which looked quite good. there are rapids, and a lazy river, so lazy you have to get out and walk or have someone push you. Would i go back no, wish I had tried wild wadi as I think you are paying for the Atlantis name and nothing else. Best past of £200 wasted for an afternoon for 3 people.

Very unhelpful. We booked a dolphin shallow water interaction costing £250 (stirling) this was a special present from my daughter for my 50th birthday. We honestly thought it was booked for a Tuesday 28th August 2012, but on the Monday 27th my daughter checked what time we had to leave the next day..... OMG we realised it was for the 27th so we rang the water park that afternoon to explain what had happened and the receptionist was not bothered AT ALL, she said it was a "did not show" and they would not help us. We Explained it was our stupid fault but they had spaces the next day and could they not out of good faith give us another slot,but all we got was NO, the Hilton where we were staying tryed as well as our tour operator Thompsons but they would not help at all. As I say this was our fault but I would have thought a place such as Atlantis the palm/ attraction world would have had better public relations than they have, it's not every day some one does this and they did have places the next day, so be aware people!!!Brenda harrison

Love it. I love this water park. It is so much better than Wild Wadi. The rides go in stages from slow to high speed. The leap of faith is the main slide, it is a straight drop into a tank full of sharks, rays and big fish.
Best waterpark in Dubai. If you go anywhere in Dubai, you must go to Aquaventure. It's the best waterpark in Dubai. It's not huge but it's really clean and the rides are great. Nice setting too.

Great Fun for Everybody!. Stayed in Atlantis for several days and got unlimited entrance to Aquaventure Park. It is cool. It offers diffrent slides and pools for all kind of age. The Leap of Faith is quite scary, but worth to try. Some of the rides are long and you can swim around for 3o minutes. I did ray feeding which was cool experience. The staff was friendly and helpful there. A great way to spent a day with the friends or family.

Good all round experience. Give Wild Wadi a miss even though it's cheaper it really does show. Aquaventure is fantastic with varied rides, slides and pools. My only niggle is that if you're not there to sunbathe then there should be a towel cabana near the lockers, saves trapesing around looking for one when you've finished. Lockers expensive but unfortunately you are a captive audience.
Worth it if staying at Atlantis. Excellent for all the family. Although some of the longer "rides" around the park, rather than down a quick shoot take about 40 minutes to go round!
Great fun. Food is very expensive inside. Double cheeseburger menu costs 70 dhs! Lockers are also paid 40 dhs. Dont be scared to take the leap of faith.

LOVED It!. Me and family spent the day in Aquaventure while we were out on holiday in Dubai. My daughters loved the rapids and the kids play area in Aquaventure. Locker areas are available for you to store your belongings but you can also leave non valuable items on loungers like towels and flip flops. We spent nearly 2 hours looking for our flip flops as the park is really big, so please remember when you leave your items on the loungers. We were going to purchase some new flip flops but found the prices to be extortionate 150 AED for a pair of flip flops for my 5 year old. Food is also available and again at high prices. I spent 240 AED on just hot dogs and chips! Overall we loved our day out in Aquaventure and would say its a must do in such high temperatures.
Excellent. We had a great day - first visit and we will be back. Not too busy so q's were short unlike in the high season. Very clean good choice of food outlets. Perfect for all ages.

Busy,busy,busy!. I like the fact I could show my skywards card and got 15%off entry, the place is huge however we were with friends so there were five of us and trying to find sun loungers together was a big problem as it was packed , I also saw the 2 loungers next to mine which had people's clothes and bags on were emptied by 2 Russian girls and when the owners returned an argument started and when they reported it to staff they were told the beds didn't belong to them so basically it was tough which I found to be rather rude. My husband liked the rides however I didn't and the bottom of the pool is very rough and tore mine and my friends bikini bottoms so beware.

Great way to cool off.. As adults with no children we were unsure if we would enjoy our day at the water park but were pleasantly surprised. Yes the entry is quite pricey and so is the food inside but the food was actually quite good. We spent the whole day at the park and did not get bored once and were reluctant to leave when we did. Only warning is if you have thongs that are quite common maybe keep them with you as my Husbands went missing resulting in us having to buy another pair at the end of the day.

great day out to keep cool!!. We had a lot of fun at the Aquaventure water park. It was a fantastic way to keep cool, whilst still being able to top up the tan. It is great for families, couples and friends. We went just the two of us (my fiancée and I) and we could laze about in the rubber rings and alternate with a bit of an adrenaline rush on the rides. The rapids were really fun and not scary for a wimp like me. The top rides though aren't THAT scary- even for me. My fiancée went on the 'leap of faith' water slide and he only did it once, he said it was a bit boring. Downsides are that you have to carry your rubber ring around with you and also that the ground is very rough and BURNING hot!! Also, be careful in the sea, I ran out almost instantly because there were jelly fish- the beach was pretty much empty. The lifeguard did move it out of the way though. We went on a week day, so it was really easy to find a secluded spot as most people sunbathe close to all the slides, we went a little further out and almost had our own private pool. We would definitely recommend visiting, even just to experience being at Atlantis. The location and the way it has been done is really beautiful. Would we go back? Probably only to stay at the hotel, but it should definitely be tried at least once!

Good Workout with a side of fun. The park is based on the Mayan architecture with a pyramid like structure in the middle of the park with rides shooting out at different levels and all ending up in a lazy river. The best is obviously right at the top - The Leap of Faith - a crazy steep drop from a vertigo invoking height. The workout creeps in everytime you finish a ride and walk the stairs up to the next one.
Fabulous water park for kids.. one of the best water parks for children in the town!have been there 4 times and it never is boring...

Aquarventure. This is proberbely slightly better than the other water park in Duabi. However with most water parks there are some down falls. I injured my leg just on the rapids as in the water there was a hidden step. This i noticed was covered with plastic padding in other areas just not the one i hit. Also during the summer months the path ways get very hot and the small sprinklers dont seem to do much with the short time they are on. Rides were all good though

Disapointing. Expensive morning with mainly underwhelming water slides. You would be well advised to take rubber shoes with you as the paving is very hot and the water rapids are rough underfoot. They did not explain how to obtain credit on our locker key which is a must. If you leave your shoes at the stairs like everyone does then you will walk miles without them. The so called rapids were very slow and frustrating. I remember Wild Wadi being much better.

Fantastic Fun!. We were staying at Atlantis, on The Palm so entry into the park was included as guests, this was great and meant you could avoid the queues at the entrance.Often we would pop in to go down the rapids to cool down, ideal. One thing you would notice and this is with Atlantis overall is there are lifeguards everywhere and in the water park every corner you turn there is at least another!! Including on the slides.My husband did The Leap of Faith - I did the similar ride in Florida so skipped this but it was amazing - also you can get a wristband and all of your pictures throughout the day get scanned and you have the option to purchase all or 1 and also you can combine more than one wrist band worth of pictures!

Great family fun. Excellent fun for all the family. We were staying at Atlantis so the park was free for us and we avoided long queues at the entrance.The Leap of Faith is extraordinary, a must try even once. The rapids were a great way to keep cool while floating downstream. The place was clean , friendly and well staffed, lifeguards every 50 yards on the rapids and attendance at every water slides top and bottom. When my daughter got a slight scrap on her knee it was dealt with swiftly and competently. Recommended.

Fabulous!. Entrance is a bit costly but the quality of everything makes it so worth it! We were in the water pretty much all day, only coming out briefly to re-apply suncream and grab some lunch! A lot of the rides are joined together so you can bob along through the rivers from one to the next on your inflatable ring (or double ring with your swim buddy). There is plenty of shade and lots of sunbeds so whether to bronze or not is your choice. The food is expensive but you would expect this in a place like this I think. There are lockers that you can hire (which we did) and you can charge your wristband up with money so you don't need to keep going back to your locker to get money when you want drinks.I would recommend you get there as early as you can to make the most of the day, and prepare to have a great time! Oh and the floor is absolutely roasting so either wear water shoes or leave your flip flops near the edge somewhere (they will be quite safe as everyone does this) otherwise you'll be cursing all the way back to your sunbed!
Good but hot. Great day out - but beware if visiting in the summer there is a lack of shade and the water isn't cooled so prepare to be hot! Better to visit later in the day

fun, fun, fun. Our day at The Palm, Atlantis was fun from beginning to end. We arrived on the mono-rail which was awesome in itself. Then we got tickets for the Adventure Park. The area was well equipped with sun loungers, which all had shade hoods (much needed) on the day. Little kiosks with plenty to drink were never too far away. We immediately got tubes and started our way bobbing down the water way. There are many different routes to choose from and all are different and a great deal of fun.Lunch was good, your normal pizza, chicken, burger choices, but all good food. We spent a little time on the private beach, which you have entry to with your day ticket. The highlight was swimming with the dolphins. An experience that was given to me by my family for my birthday and one I will not forget in a hurry. What a treat!!!!!

Family fun at its best!. There are areas for everyone including the kids' splash area which included several climbing and sliding structures with water sprays. We enjoyed The Rapids fast paced whitewater-like tube ride as well as The Torrents calmer lazy river and wave pool.

Great Waterpark. We only visited for the day to go to the waterpark. It was great, the kids had so much fun. The rides are fantastic although there are some lengthy queues. Far better than Wild Wadi. We also went to the Dolphins at Dolphin Bay. The kids and my wife had a great time with the Dolphins and it was certainly a day to remember for the rest of their lives. The Dolphins for three was £500 but money well spent and it is worth it.

A Great Day Out!. My husband and I got to be big kids for a day and had a blast at Aquaventure. We only intended on staying for a couple of hours, but we got carried away and stayed for about 7!!!! The rides were great and in most cases, the lines were minimal (our only big wait was on The Leap of Faith, which is understandable as it is the park's main attraction).

Fantastic fun!. We enjoyed a day out on our break in Dubai last week at Aquaventure. Great fun on the rapids and the various slides. The 'Leap of faith' was worth doing - a great experience. Hope to return one day!
Not worth the money. And the food is terrible. The lazy river is great but there just isn't enough to do, the rides are all very similar too. Your money is much better spent elsewhere in Dubai.
Super fun day out. really good, a great waterpark with rides suitable for all. Nice restaurants and beach and not too pricey.

Chaotic organisation and limited rides. We went here after the brilliant Dolphin Bay experience as it is all in the same complex in the Atlantis hotel; our tickets for Dolphin Bay allowed us into Aquaventure so we did not pay anything extra. If you are going to do it this way I recommend that you get your Aquaventure locker key and deposit any funds for food/drinks before you go through to Dolphin Bay otherwise you end up queuing again for all this. The problem with Aquaventure is that it has now got so popular that at busy times the ticketing area is too small for the number of people wanting to get in and very unpleasant when it is hot and humid. Also the changing areas soon become crowded and chaotic with the few staff there trying in vain to keep them clean etcThe actual number of rides are quite limited but fun and so in the end it was a rather disappointing experience.

Great place, very big!!!. Loved it!! Really big and great for all ages. Not enough sunbeds but not that you need them a lot, nice to have a base though. Main slide not open when we visited which was a real shame but the rest was great!

Great Fun. My son and I had a fab time here. The leap of faith was closed so I was slightly gutted but the rapids etc and all the slides were great. I loved the conveyor belts as they saved my old legs climbing up and down

Fun but simple. Has a nice area but compare to Wild Wadi it's simple, only few slides and games but its still nice, having access to the beach is a big point also you can visit some parts of Atlantis Hotel if you haven't been there before.
Hot day ruined experience. It was quite a nice waterpark but I think the day was ruined by the sun I got burned and the floor was hot so you had to run to get to places. Leap of faith q was too long.
Next door - how convenient!. Absolutely amazing fun. All rides use rubber rings apart from Leap of Faith. Exciting stuff and we had free access with the Imperial Room

Very limited. Quite pricey when you think it is so hot and unbearable you really don't want to be outside for long. The floor is burning so swim shoes are better than flip flops as they're always with you. The rides are all done on a rubber ring which disappointed my eldest as seemed too safe. Also each ride lasts a long long time and so easy to lose your party and also get carried away with the flow of water. A couple of rides were closed whilst we were there and we actually only spent 3 hours there so wished we'd opted for the cheaper late afternoon package.

Fun but really hot in August!. I enjoyed the rides at this place and it is very similar to 'Wet n wild' on the gold coast. The staff are very friendly and the place is safe as there are life guards wherever you look. Vey much fun for kids of all ages and if you are in Dubai it's a fun day out with the kids. Just be aware that the summer months are stinking hot and you probably can;t stay there all day. Would I go there again? For sure!

awesome!. Food and drink over-priced, lockers over-priced (and have to be paid for!!) and can get crowded. It also closes at sundown, which is a shame.but...it is fantastic!took a 3 year old and a 7 year old.Both had a great time. The lazy river and rapids, along with the kids play park kept the 3 year old busy for hours, and the 7 year old was old enough to go on all the rides, and loved the Leap of Faith! Fortunately, there are less fun police there than at the equivalent in the US or UK or Europe, where there would be a ridiculous age restriction on the fun stuff!so, go, have a good time, but avoid the food and drink - take your own (probably not allowed, but do it anyway!)

Aquaventure. The waterpark is fab! The only problems where that after one day here you have massive blisters in your feet and they are so scratched that it is very hard to walk! The cafes where very overpriced and it cost £40 or 231 aed to have 4 small meals with drinks.

Spending too much effort and money with very little value... simply not worth it!!. - overcrowded with less than expected variatey of games
- only one changing room which is not sufficient for the number of people in
- they search your bage at the entrance not for safety reasons but to make sure that you don't bring food inside to force you pay the over priced food which is outrages!

A great way to spend a day and to cool off. We were travelling with our teenage children . They had a fantastic day going on all the rides. The roller coaster through the aquarium was amazing. Good shower rooms and lockers to put all personal items.

Cool runnings on a hot day. The park is huge, you have deck chairs and towels available to you on entry. Be wary of the 40 Dh charge for locker use - it's not a deposit!There are water rides, slides and beach areas in the park. There's a brilliant childrens' section for younger ones to share the fun too.The Ziggurat rides are well worth the visit alone with slides and if you dare - the Leap of Faith, with it's 27m drop.

Great fun, even with little kids. After procrastinating for two years, thinking my kids (7 and timid, and 3) were too little for this all-singing, all-dancing waterpark, we tried it out. It is brilliant, even for the little ones.The 3YO was too small to go on the big rides (you have to be 1.2m high) but still really enjoyed the "lazy" river - i say "lazy" because there are rapids and torrents that make it very exciting. You could honestly spend all day circuiting the park in a ring - it's such fun. The 7YO liked the kids' water structure play thing, but the 3YO did not. There isn't much shade, there, either, so we all go a bit hot and bothered.it's an expensive day out, but worth it, especially if you take up any special offers they're running. Much better than its competitors in Dubai, Umm Al Quwain and Ras al Khaimah.Food was average, probably slightly better than I expected (the pizzas are very good). If you purchase food vouchers in advance at the ticket sales office, it's a bit cheaper (AED45 for combo meal) than buying it inside.

Brilliant fun. Whether you want a relaxing day on the lazy river or a wild time on the rides, Aquaventure has something for everyone. It is fairly expensive to get in, so make sure you go early to get the most out of th day. The best rides are the slides where they can have many different endings. You can chose how long you want it to be and where you want to come out. Brilliant fun, makes you feel like a kid, no matter what age you are!!
Fun. It's fun but there aren't many slides so don't expect a full day of slides and thrill... we went in February, so there wasn't any long lines but it got a bit cold after a while...

Great fun for all ages. We loved the lazy river and rapids. Especially using the double rings so I could go along with my daughter. The lazy river lasts up to 40 minutes. The rides are quite hair raising. Be sure to wear a swimsuit (or hold on to your bikini bottoms) as the rubber escalators can pull on you at speed. My 6 year old did not like the scarier rides.

Great Day Out. Went there with my wife and our 6 year old son. Although he didn't make it on all the rides because of his height, there was still more than enough to occupy him for the day. It's good value for money and I was really impressed by how many staff there were on hand to help.

Fun day for the children. This is great for the children. I particularly enjoyed the rapids. Not sure about carrying the water rings up and down stairs...they should have a system that take them back up to the top without people having to carry them. Also they should be pulling out the empty water rings from the rapids. Signposting was not good.
wow. we spend a very good day in this amazing waterpar. very clean and very sunny... the staff was helpful and they found 2 seat for us... thank you

Not as good as Wild Wadi. I love activity stuff no more than a water park in 40degree heat but this was a disappointment to all the expectations, no wave pool, the paths are scorching hot, no water fountains to drink, rides are too short. They are close together so that's a bonus but the lockers are to far away from where the rides are!

Aquaventure Adventure. I and my fiancee visited Aquaventure just last Friday. We enjoyed our time there but the only thing that annoyed me a lil bit was the hot sun around 2:00pm. Beside all the nice rapids and slides, it has spectacular pristine beach which is a must if you visit Aquaventure. Please keep in mind that you are not allowed to take any kind of drinks with you to the park. I think it is not fair since the coffeeshops inside are veryyyyy expensive. You had to pay 40Dhs only for one small juice. The guards at the front door took our drinks and told us that you are not allowed to drink them outside the gate since it was Ramadan. But only one step from that point, you could drink. Don't forget to take your flipflops with you since the earth is boiling at summer. Overall, I think Atlantis is better than wildwadi in terms of the people who visit there.

Much Hype !!. Yes, for those who have not visited Water Parks in Florida, this may be a great place to cool down, otherwise you will be disappointed, and all rides eventually culminate in to half a mile of floating on a tube. there are no waves.. only slides and rapids.And its very Expensive for its worth.

What a great experience it was !!. There is a bit of something for everyone.....the kids had a great time and so did us. The rides from the tower are amazing and the kids area was so much fun for adults as well that it bought the kid out in me. Its better then Wild Wadi....which now shows its age. Its highly recommended incase you visit Dubai.

best way to cool down. A great break from the heat in Dubai. Make sure you take your flip flops to the pool area or you will have to pay 170AED for a pair from the shops. Make sure you go on the leap of faith ride it is amazing.
Huge!. This aquapark is home to the best aqua facilities and is located on the palm, a prime location. The waterpark has a lot of entertaining facilities too.

Not what we expected. A bit small, one hour and you have done all the rides, the floor is roasting hot, so make sure you take your flip flops. Food and drink is very expensive. No changing rooms, so get changed in the toilet. all in all there are much better parks in Europe, they might have nailed everything else , but not waterparks

Brilliant fun!. We pre booked our tickets through Expedia which you just take to the counter. You don't need to state which day you want to go either. As it's The Holy Month of Ramadan we were concerned about eating and drinking there but it's not a problem at all. The little booths are open for snacks drinks etc although they are quite expensive. We hired a locker and towels although we didn't really use them. The lockers are right by the entrance, so it's easier to change and leave everthing there and just go back when you need something.We picked a sunlounger, put our towels down the grabbed a rubber ring and set off on the runs. The main run is a loop around the park with exits/enterances to the sunloungers so make a note of where you put yours as it looks the same. There is no shortage of lifequards, every section is well covered. By lunchtime it was busy and there was a shortage of rubber rings but they do appear after a short wait. At lunchtime we got changed and went into the hotel to eat. The food area is screened off but you can still eat. We had a wonderful Wagu burger which set us up for the afternoon. After applying more suncreen,which is a must as there were alot of burnt shouders,we managed to do all the slides. The Leap Of Faith was closed but I wasn't going to do it anyway! At great day out,it's not cheap but then Dubai isn't but it was a welcome after a week of intense sun.

my son loves it. there was a time we had to travel to dubai almost every other weekend just to take my son to this place. It's a bit too pricey if you just buy the entrance ticket, but it's a great deal if you stay in Atlantis (which we always do). avoid summer time, you'll enjoy the ride without realising you are getting the sunburn.

memorable. we had the most awesome time with my family and grandchildren. we came with a driver so we got off at the avenues entrance, otherwise a shuttle takes you from the parking lot 6 mins away. the water rides were fabulous, and there was one where we went straight into the aquarium. the childrens water area was fun as well, quite a thrill for them.

Something for everyone. A great day for kids old and young. We managed to keep a 10 year old, 8 year old and 4 year old entertained without any problems (not forgetting parents). Life guards have a lot of common sense and the attractions were varied. Queues built up in the afternoon for some of the more adventurous rides. Worth while taking some time out to visit the aquarium too- we went early afternoon and the break for the kids was worthwhile. We rented one locker which was big enough to keep stuff for 5 in it. If in Dubai with kids a definite must visit.

Loved it. We loved it … the weather was hot (we went in late June) but there were plenty of sun beds (with shade covers) when we got there at 11 in the morning and the lazy river was perfect in the heat. The park is definitely expensive (as is the drinking water once you are in), but if you like waterparks you will love this place … the whole family are already planning a return to Dubai and this waterpark already! I would definitely take the deal for lunch and towels and get a cab from your hotel to the park … it was cheaper than the monorail for the 3 of us and we had a 35 minute cab ride.
Whats wrong during Ramadan. The hotel should inform beforehand that the floor would be superhot and we will have to shell to buy slippers , guys pls provide value for money for the rates you seek

My favourite waterpark. I've been four times, I love it! Lazy river with rapids, slides you don't have to climb loads of stairs for and waterways so you don't have to get out the water. This is definitely my sort of lazy day out!

STILL A GOOD FUN DAY OUT FOR EVERYONE. this is still a great thing to do and has something for everyone, just watch out as ground is burning and shoes do get stolen and crocs are £50 in the park to buy. take some swim socks with you.
Aqua park. Had a great time. Only downfall was the pushy swim photographers. I didnt want to go under the waterfall, but got pushed under anyway and ended up loosing my sunglasses.

its a beautful place. the park can not be considered as just a water park as it has many activities, resturants and additions to it. It is crowded and some slides will take maybe 30 min for you to be on, however if you know the techinique and that nearlly all slides are the same you will choose a one which is normally easy to get in and have all the fun you want. the Park however should improve the que system because jumpers are all over the place. Moreover the surface has to either be cooled or all visitiors are given free slippers as the ground is exremly hot. The Park is water passgae way is a nice place to explore and enjoy. make sure you locate your looker because the tag you take will not show your looker number. Moreover I recommend that all visitors are asked to take a shower before going into the park for hygine reasons.

WOW!!!. We had such a fun filled day there. Sure it was blistering hot (summer) and you definitely need your flip flops (the ground was scorching hot), sun screen and sunglasses. the rides are sensational, imagine going down a fun slide that ends by you going through a tube surrounded by an aquarium with fish, sharks you name it! And so much more. It is truly something special.
Lots of fun. Loved the rides, food and staff was very friendly. Didn't dislike much but just regretted leaving :(

Great Fun!. Took my grandkids for the day and we had a great time. Because they youongest child was only 4 he was not able to go on many of the rides, but he had a great time in the kid's pool and loved the rapids tube ride that went all around the property. We loved it so much we stayed on it for over 2 hours! My oder grandson, 9 years old, got to do all the water slides - he had a blast! The Shark attack that goes thru the aquarium and you are surrounded by the fish was great!

Best waterpark in Dubai. I worked two months in Dubai and got to experience a lot of what Dubai has to offer. When people ask me what to do in Dubai this instantly pops into my head. I really enjoyed my stay here. I like the mix of both exciting rides and just floating around in a pool ring getting a tan. There is also the possibility of enjoying the immensely hot waters of the Persian Gulf on the private beach located inside the park.The fact that this park is located on the Palms is another bonus, as this man-made island is something you should go visit when in Dubai.I also visited the Wild-Wadi Waterpark during my stay and it is safe to recommend Aquaventure over Wild-Wadi.

In the dark. The sigth is one of the most important senses, and when all the slides are either in the dark or ends up in the dark - its spoils a lot of the fun for me. The first hours you a runing around trying to find the big slides. The information in the park is not that great. We liked Wild Wadi better even though is smaller.
not much excitement. enjoyed the rapids ride which was the longest ride ever. a good 20 minutes. not any exciting different style rides. no wave pool

Great Place. Great Water Park a full day of entertainment for all ages. It is not very cheap but it is a great experience. The only downside is the young Arab males who love to queue jump, which is very frustrating!!This place is a newer version of Wild Wadi with some great attractions. The only problem we found was getting to and from the water park was not very convenient (lack of taxis on the island). The palm island is worth visiting though.

Fun in the winter sun!. Went with the family in December. Those of you thinking Dubai doesn't get winter - think again. It was pretty cold that day. They do heat the water at the Water Park but if you come out of the water you will still find that you are cold. A lot of FUN for all ages!! Good rides, lines get long but I guess this is the norm at any fun water park. A definite must-do when visiting Dubai.

Hooray- they serve food during Ramadan. Looking for a way to cool off in the Summer and get the kids something to eat during Ramadan? Atlantic Aquaventure ticks those boxes.Lots of rides for kids and adults alike including an area that is perfect for toddlers or those not confident swimmers.Make sure you at least attempt to do the ride that flies under the sharks- it's a pure adrenaline rush!
Aquaventurous. This place was fun, and the rides were very long and enjoyable. All of course but the one that goes straight down!
A great waterpark outing for all ages.... One of the best waterparks in this part of the world.... though a bit high priced and away from the city......

Worth the money. This place is situated on the grounds of the Atlantis Hotel and is best reached by the Monorail simply for the great views. Its a full day out for the family and keeps everyone entertained. The best part is the slide called "The Leap of Faith" which takes you through a glass tunnel through shark infested waters.

Best water in Dubai!. I loved Wild Wadi before Aquaventure opened, but Aquaventure is now definitely my favourite. The lazy river is great, and takes you off to different rides if you want to, or you can stay on the river and keep going round. Go after 2.30pm as they charge you half price to get in!You can also go on the beach of the Atlantis hotel if you get bored at the water park.

Shark Attack - also for +50ies!. We, two adults +50 with two grown up kids had fantastic day in Water Park, and especially the Shark Attack! I am also thankful that I was informed IN ADVACE that the beginning of the "race" in Shark Attack is in darkness (pitch-black!) but once you are out and in the tube, you'll experience a fantastic world of fishes and SHARKS!Amazing!And don't forget to visit the beach of Atlantis - beautiful view to Burj al Arab and Dubai.

Awesome!!. First of all, I have to say I'm nuts for water parks! I absolutley loved this place. If you're a little nuts these places like I am, I recommend getting there as early as possible for the slides on the Ziggurat. A few of them look like they dip quite steeply straight away & they do! The upper slides seem to form big lines in the arfternoon.I ran myself raggered here getting in as much as possible. When it's done, if you're not staying at Atlantis, take a look around, it's amazingly beautiful!I visited April 2011, not August as listed.
Fun but staff not as fun. lots to play on in the water but staff not as friendly as Wild Wadi. Strange that the same customer service skills can't be copied from the original water park at Jumeriah.

They try REALLY hard, but...seriously?. So its very well constructed, and the children's area is good for about 2, 3 hours tops. But adult attractions are not very "adult oriented" and they're in short supply. You spend most of your time walking because there's only one set of lockers next to the entrance, and the attractions are a good 5-10 minute walk. Torture in Dubai's heat.The restaurant facilities are stark and uninviting, and the food was mediocre.Otherwise, it's pretty pricey for what it is, and considering the money you pay, you sort of expect to spend more than half a day. Once the sun is gone, so is the appeal of this place.
Busy but good place to go. Get there early to get a sunbed if you want one else you might be disappointed. Lovely place to relax and unwind
wonderful. great park for all ages, amazing rides, very nice place to be with lots of fun

A good Water park amongst other options available in Dubai. I went this summer and spent whole day there with the family.They have a very nice Kids area and it;s very clean and safe.Adults also have a loads of options available to enjoy.They have different rates for residents and visitors..so please keep your valid UAE ID for avoiding extra fees.

Fantastic experience. Amazing place that has been cleverly put together, clean and well equipped. The tubes needs more air and they need to find ways too cool down the walking surfaces with water sprays as walking barefoot between rides is like fire walking. Take a lesson from Wild Wadi they spray most of the exposed surfaces with fine water jets. Overall a fun place with hard working and friendly staff who do a great job keeping the place running smoothly.

Absolutely fabulous at Atlantis. We spent a day here whilst staying in Dubai. Loads of great slides and sunbeds. Very clean and satff really helpful. Went for a walk around hotel grounds just because we could!! Absolutely gorgeous the sand looked like it had been hoovered. Had great day out even though no kids with us this time!! Definately like Fantasy Island in the day! Gorge place an absolute fantastic time. Thank You
Oh my god. This is the greatest fun warer park, there are a lot of rides and not too crowded. Go and enjoy
this place rocks !!. most amazing waterpark ever clean cool water never feels crowded !!! and jus well organized and clean !!! i love this place ive been literally maybe 8-10 times

Aquaaaaaaa :). As the name says...the water park is a very big...if u r energetic enuf...then u can go to all the rides ...they have some giant water rides & under water rides also...whr u get a glimpse of the underwater world also...the river rafting is also a gr888 add on thr.. :)

Nothing That Great. The aquaventure was nothing like what i had expected. There arn't many options like the other water parks i.e slides, pools and so on.
The wild wadi water park is more better and reasonably priced
Aqua venture adventure. Brilliant! Had a great fun packed day out here with my husband!!
Kids will love this place. A lot of fun and a great reprieve from the heat. Some rides have height restrictions for children.

Fun day out. Similar to Wild Wadi, not a lot in it, good fun for a day out and definitely worth going. Only gripes are lockers are 40 dirhams, which is outrageous, and they could have used decking or something on the paths as you can burn your feet pretty badly getting between the rides (or getting back from the end of the ride to the start, where you leave your shoes). It's also a bit odd that you have to carry your rubber ring around everywhere, at wild wadi they give them to you at the start of the rides.
Unbelivable experience. When we first saw how high it was, we were slighltly worried but it was exhilerating, exciting and just sensational. So many rides to explore. The service was excellent too.
so much fun!. i stayed for 2 days and couldn't get enough of it! stayed open until late, and the slides were great - not a long wait to get on them either!
HOT. TAke you flip flops with you as you might burn your feet
Excellent Fun. Excellent tube rides and you can go through a tube through the aquarium which has sharks in it. Loads of fun.

GREAT FOR THE LITTLE ONES. The kids had a ball.Stayed open till about 7pm,lovely late in the afternoon when the sun is going down,you just float around on the tubes and relax.Probably not the best water park in the GCC for teenagers,does not have waves like Wild Wadi or Bahrain Water Park but still GREAT especially when it is included in your room price.The waterpark and Lost Chambers are both included in the hotel room price.GOOD VALUE
Great Fun!. The slides were amazing, and the rapids were fun but a little long.
My fav Waterpark. Amazing fun water park. Must try it and spend a whole day there.

Love love love. I loved being here. My friend and I went at 10 am and came out a little after 4pm. It was a very, very hot day so it was nice to be in the water. The only thing was that when you got out of the water the ground was so hot it felt like the skin was burning off your feet. The locker rooms are a really good idea and the fact that they had showers with shampoo and body wash and they provided hair dryers for all visitors to use in the locker rooms gets a big plus. A BIG tip if going in the summer months is take and wear lots of sunscreen, the sun there is lethal.
Great day. 2nd visit here with my wife, 2 years difference.again had a great time definitly recomend to anyone.Do yourselfs a favour get the entertainer voucher book. you save a fortune!!!!!!

Fab water park.. I especially loved that you can get into your rubber ring and never have to get out the whole day. You're directed to the slides while still in your ring! Slides are varied and excellent. Get busy just after lunch but that's to be expected.

Good one. its good to be in water in the hot weather of Dubai. well its a nice water park. if you compare this to wild wade, this one is bigger and has beach as well. but I donno why I prefer wild wade more than this one :)
fun!. visited during the "not so hot season" in dubai. good for children and adults alike!

good for couples. this water park is good for a day out. There are not a lot of rides, so you will end up going on a few of them two or three times in the day, but they are very good rides so you wont mind. It was very busy but we managed to get on all the rides within a 5 min wait, and got sun beds easily even though we didnt arrive until about 10 in the morning. After about 11 it is packed so you wont get a bed or a ring for the rides. It is good for couples because all but 1 of the rides are designed for 2 riders, on a double ring. So you wont have to go on anything by yourself which is nice. The changing facilities and food services are good, and the cost to get in was reasonable.

So much fun, for all ages!!!. Wow did we have fun!!!It was absolutely brilliant. There is one vertical ride, I was nearly doing myself. Had it not been full of people behind me waiting and watching, I would have chickened out!!if in Dubai, go, you won't regret!
'Biggest Aqua Park EVER'. Biggest, yes - but not with the most rides. There is a lot of ground 'wasted' with parkland
Great Fun For All. Absolutely brilliant, would visit it time and again!
Will go back, the kids love it.. Just keep floating around, get on those high platforms to slide down is just fun. Only problem is the car park with irregular connecting buses can upset you.
Great Fun. A must visit when in Dubai. Better than Wild Wadi Park. Great fun and a good way to stay cool. Just remember to cover up from the sun or you'll fry!!
Fantastic!!. The kids loved this. This was the highlight our trip. It is safe and fun.

Waterpark. The slides and lazy river were great fun. It is so hot at this time of year so you need to take your footwear with you to avoid getting burnt feet. The best time to go is in the morning as it can get very busy in the afternoon.
wooooow. This place is lots of fun... easily spend 3-4 hours. The slides are fun...especially the shark attack. float around the park in leisure. A little expensive but a good fun experience.
Excellent. The kids really enjoyed it and could not get them off the rapids
Fun. If you want a fun day out this is the place to go the rapids are great the big slide is not for the faint harted good to watch people who are brave
Atlantis. It is definitely an alternative for Wild Wadi as it is really huge in the area and the rides are better.
good time. the slides are great experience, full day can enjoy the water games. little bit expensive but not to be missed if in Dubai
Expensive for what it is. Although it is a fun day out, it is overpriced. There are few rides especially for younger kids and it tends to be very crowded although it is an experience.

Another Fantastic Water Park. After the dolphins we then spend the day at the water park it's awesome the water seems a lot cleaner than Wild Wadi for some reason, the rides are good and shark attack is a must for everyone, leap of faith got to be done its just a drop and don't blink you will miss the sharks. For the younger ones the Children's rides and slides are good even you can join in as well, all in all, a good day out
Crowded and expensive. Rides are basic. Nothing new if you have been to Wild Wadi which in my opinion has better offerings. Ridiculously expensive!
it is good. there is limited slides and not big park, but its good to visit it if you stay in atlantis

Great Fun!. Myself and my family love this place and have been a few times. My children are 7 & 9 and always have a great time. Make sure you put enough money on your watch thou as food is very expensive. Also, my son's flip flops were stolen when we were there this time :-(

enjoy a fun filled day at the park!. the part is set in a beautiful location great calue for moneyenjoy the lazy river with the rapids and falls.go down the thrilling slides and see the sharks as u end!i will defintely visit this park again:)
Nice waterpark. nice rides. Not too many though. Great for kids and adults
Wild wadi is better. ground was very hot it burn your feet , sun is direct over you head . summer is not suitable time to visit

Worth a visit!. We had a great time at Aquaventure! There's a wide range of things to do and allows for hours of fun! From the pools and lazy river, the rapids and the crazy water slides. We stayed at the Atlantis so had access to the park already, but we didn't tire of it at all! The thrill of the rides is brilliant but of those who want to sunbathe theres places for that too! Lots of sun loungers with shades if wanted, but also access to the beach, which is really relaxing and peaceful. There are a few fast food restaurants in the park for drinks and food, but also a beach bar on the beach that serves drinks, shisha and fruit, on bean bags on the sand, which is lovely! The waterpark rides were so much fun, cannot wait to go back! Try the big ones, they may take guts to get on but they are so worth it! The river and rapids are lots of fun too - see how many times you can get around without falling out of your rubber ring - IT'S A CHALLENGE!! ENJOY!

Super fun and well worth the visit!. Let me start off by saying DON'T GO TO WILD WADI......it's dreadful. Aquaventure is in a different league to Wild Wadi. There are great rides, everything is really clean, staff are friendly and the lazy river is the best I have seen. Some reviews I read complained about the difficulty of finding free sunbeds or how they had to "hold on to their rubber rings". Having just visited in June I can honestly say these complaints are nonsense. We arrived at around lunch time so it was already busy and we found two free sunbeds in one of the larger pool areas within around 3 minutes. The sunbeds are great as they have individual canopies so you can shade yourself from the sun whenever you wish. As for the other complaint about having to watch your rubber ring - there were literally 20-30 free rings every time we got in to the pool.If you have children this is a fantastic place to bring them for the day. I have never seen so many lifeguards - there is a lifeguard posted almost every 50 meters.The two things I enjoyed most were The Torrent and The Rapids - both were part of the lazy river. They are suitable for young kids too once accompanied by an adult, but great fun for adults too. I spent most of my day on these while my husband did some of the more adventurous rides such as the Leap of Faith.It is reasonably expensive but really worth visiting!

Loved it!!. We had again booked to visit Atlantis Aquaventure in advance (to save time as it is a very popular attraction) and had such a fun day! We upgraded our tickets to include a "meal deal" plus locker hire and towels as it works out better for value.
intersting. the beast water parh that I ve seen, I ve been in many water park but this one is better than the others
Fun in the heat. This has one of the best Lazy Rivers I've ever been on. From gentle floating to crazy rapids, rubber matted lifts to higher water, water shoots and tidel waves. Over 2km of fun.

A must .... We were staying in the adjoining hotel but we made time each day for the children to get their 'fix' of the water park. There really is something for everyone from the timid water folk to the adventurous. It has been so well done and queues are minimal. Don't miss it!
Fun fun fun!!. Really good day although was very hot but as long as you're in the water who cares!!! My son really enjoyed the rapids
Worth the trip.. plent of good rides, and plenty of loungers. The lazy river isn't so lazy and really good fun. We snorkelled with the sharks at a very reasonable price.

Great day out!. We spent the day at the water park which was a fun filled day out, take towels with you but you can hire them there aswell as lockers! Food & drink wasn't too badly priced. Very nice friendly staff too.

Another brilliant day!!!. Atlantis is just a gorgeous hotel in a great location, we had a brilliant time here on all the rides, also the beach is just fantastic. Swimming with the Dolphins & the underwater Chambers just great. This is a must, you have to go!!!!!!

Fantastic!. Brilliant day out! I love waterparks where you don't have to spend a lot of time walking barefoot on the hot floor so this place was ideal with all of the river rides you can use to get around the park with. Very clean with lots to do. Recommended to anyone visiting Dubai! Expensive again but what in Dubai isnt?!

I prefer Wild Wadi. It is always a matter of personal preference whether you prefer Aquaventure at Atlantis or Wild Wadi. I am definitely a Wild Wadi fan. For me Aquaventure gets a little overcrowded and consequently there are more queues. The floor seems to get very hot at Aquaventure, whereas Wild wadi has sprinker systems everywhere - but most importantly the rides are less varied here and basically you climb up steps and slide down tubes. Also at Aquaventure you have to carry your tube around with you all day, where at WW you just collect them at every ride.

A great day out. We spent the afternoon here after a morning of diving. We struggled to find a lounger in the main areas when we arrived (after lunch) but then realised we were in the main areas and soon found lots of empty loungers a little further away. Would recommend this to everyone visiting Dubai, is a great way to keep cool and have a great day. We didn't eat whilst at the park but found drinks and icecream to be quite reasonably priced. I would recommend the leap of faith, I screamed the whole way down after a 30minute wait but was definately worth it!! Others rides had much shorter queues.

Lots of family fun but highway robbery in action!. Excellent place to go and enjoy with the entire family. We went there with a group of 10 people with the youngest 3 year and the oldest over 70 and all age group in between. It was lots of fun. Everyone enjoyed the rides, the slides and the river rides, etc. To avoid the summer heat, we went late afternoon and the place was totally crowded but very well behaved. Now the but part starts:1. With the kind of entrance fees charged you would expect at least one free towel but we had to pay for it. Ridiculous2. For a group of 10, I would expect a free locker but we had to pay for it. More Ridiculous3. The main ride area was closed at 6:28 pm. Can you even imagine this? The park staff wanted to 'clean' the pool on my ticket time. The official closing time is 7 pm. Extremely Ridiculous4. The river ride area has a Rapid section which was closed at 6:40 pm and I was told that this is normal. He asked me do I want to risk my life without a life guard in that section? The normal closing time is 7 pm. Do I need to say this is most ridiculous thing I have ever heard.

Great day out. I visited the waterpark with my three young children, husband and my parents. We all thoroughly enjoyed the watermark especially the water rapids. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only negative for me was the lack of shade anywhere in the park on a hot day with three children under 6 the heat became a little unbearable. Every sunbed has a canopy attached to it which you can pull over the top of the ed but this didn't really provide any real shelter from the miday heat.

good fun for a few hours. we stayed at the Atlantis so access was included also towels are free for guests. Other than the young kids play area there are about 6 rides including the leap of faith and are all fairly similar, but still good fun. We got there as it opened at 10 and for an hour or so its not too busy and you can get on the rides easily. By 11.30 it was packed and for this coming later hand this it is very hard to find sunbeds and rings for the rides(particularly the double rings).
