The rides require rubber rings and unlike other parks we’ve been to you don’t collect your ring at the start of the ride and give it back at the end you keep it. if you have a break and sit on a sunbed for a while the rings can get pinched if you’re not watching them. The park is very clean and all in all as long as you get there early it’s great for a couple of hours but not as good as wet and wild in the states.
Fun filled!. Great water park. Lots n lots of water! Great rides and play areas for all ages!
great day out. very clean lots of life guards plenty of sun beds and places to get drinks.fun fun fun

best way to spend the whole day if at dubai. i went there for two days because i was at atlantis and the guests of atlantis have unlimited visits to the park the slides are enjoyable and there is a setup for children too the best slide goes through the shark tank and leap of faith is very thrilling............
Great Day Out. There are only two water parks in Dubai and for me this has the edge over Wild Wadi.A great day out, guaranteed!

Nice day out. We visited Aquaventure in May. I was a little surprised at how much it cost for the two of us, about £100, that included 'the lost world' aquariums (which were fantastic) a locker and two towels.As it was my wife's 50th birthday I thought we could have a look around at the rides, get a Sunbed and relax!!How wrong I was! We were 'on our tubes' for four and a half hours! Without getting out of the water!The leap of faith was saved for the end of the day which was very good, a little too fast to see any fish or sharks when you go through the 'tank'Overall we had a nice day, if a little expensive.
Great time!. Amazing water park great for families and couples in the heart of Aquaventure Hotel
Great. Great place, very clean lots of lifeguards and lots of fun

A great day!. Wonderful water park! I could have spent all day on the lazy river! A must is to go for a swim in the sea, which is cordoned off to guests. The water was lovely and warm and the views were paradise! Yes, it is expensive to get in, but worth every penny!
Great way to cool down. Bit disappointed with the amount of rides but still great to get out of the 40 degrees heat. We were told Waldi Wadi was better but didnt had a chance to go
Great fun for families. Brilliant place, do not feel the heat, time flies!
Impressive. It's not cheap but it is impressive. There is more variety than Wild Wadi and the entry in to the aquarium is a must.
Aquaventure Fun in the Sun.. My kids and husband really enjoyed the rapids and would definitely to again!

brilliant. ahhh to get on that rubber ring and lazy my way around the waterpark was wonderful in that heat, i must say the lifeguards are about every 20ft all the way around the park, never mind the children we loved it too, how lovely to not have to worry about leaving your cameras and things on a sunbed while you go around for an hour or two each day, where else could you do that apart from dubai i ask myself, amazing place

Great day out for the kids....parents not so much!. Kids loved the themed water park. Bit busy for parent and not a lot to do other than relax and sunbathe. Prices for food and drink in the park are in fact reasonable and the quality is good.It gets very busy early on and there is a bit of a scrum for sun loungers and get this.....inner tubes! Despite there being plenty of inner tubes for everyone, some people still adopt the subbed mentality of taking 'their' inner tubes out to the water whether are not using them! This makes it harder for everyone to to get on a ride!Anyway, this aside, the kids will have a great time and overall value for money is very good.
Great Fun on Offer. Well worth a visit on a Parr with the best of the parks in Florida. The lazy river ride via the rapids was very relaxing and great fun
Nice water adventure property in Dubai. It is well designed water park to keep all family occupied for 4-6 hours.

it is worthy to try once!. Comparing to other waterparks that I've been, aquaventure is very clean, and modern.the problem is the long queues at the top of the building so it is difficult to take some rides.also we should carry the tubes 3 floors up to reach to the beginning of the rides! for me it is impossible to go there in the summer because of the heat, best seasons are spring & fall.the beach is excellent & the restaurants are good but expensive.

Great way to spend half a day. I'm a big fan of Aquaventure. it's a fantastic way to spend half a day and bring out the big kid in you. personally I prefer it to wild wadi as for me the rides are better although if you are more into standing waves and surfing you might prefer wild wadi. a great place to beat the summer heat!

Waterpark - expensive day out. Very expensive - cost me £160 for me, my husband and two daughters to get in and it really wasn't worth it, especially after we had been to Aquaventure two days before. Overcrowded, too many rings in the water, and not enough variety, with many expensive extras once inside. Not worth the money.

Even if you don't normally 'do water parks', chances are you'll still enjoy it. Dubai is hot - water cools you down. So why not go somewhere, that you can just jump onto an inflatable ring, and drift around for hours, being cool.Tip - get a towel straight away and settle yourselves/your things on a lounger somewhere, as the later in the day, there won't be a spare one to be found. You can always just return to your locker (obviously keep valuables locked away), but to have a lounger would be much easier.Really easy to put money onto a water proof bracelet, and scan that at the food/drink kiosks too.
Excellent. We really enjoyed Aquaventure, the rides were really good. Food was a little on the expensive side, but really nice all the same. It does get really busy at the weekend!!
Very tired looking. Thought it was worse than Disney, to many people, sun beds looked grubby !!

Great, but more double tubes needed.. We had a gret time, but was annoyed that it took over 40minutes to get a double tube at one point so we could all enjoy the lazy river. There wasn't enough order in the way these are handled. Everything else was fantastic though.
fun in the sun. plenty of rest areas, plenty of water sports and easy access to the water from the beaches
moderate. Good lazy river. Few water rides enclosed slides. Not as good as Florida waterparks. Not worth £40 entrance fee expensive for a family. Half a day is sufficiant

Afternoon at aquaventure. Had a fun afternoon but this operation bleeds every penny from the unsuspecting tourist- 30aed to rent a towel, I am just glad we didn't have any kids with us askin for everything availableFromAn extra 100 here to snorkel in a pool with rays and small sharks to 30 for an ice cream. A good day out however! Lost chambers very good although tank that Queensland gropers are in is way way to small!

I really enjoyed it. Its a really a good place to spend ur day with friends. i liked the whole thing. You can even go and play with the Dolphines (with extra money of course). The only problem is that you have to carry all the time the float to play any of the games there

Slides, Rays and Sharks. Slides were ok for an afternoon, but best thing about Aquaventure are the experiences. We fed the cow-nose stingrays one morning and then did the shark snorkel the next. Feeding the rays was a definite highlight of the trip - I'd do it over and over again if I could. The shark snorkel is in the same tank and isn't as daring as it sounds, although still a thrill.
better than wild wadi. you could easily spend a whole day here having lots of fun

Great organisation. Was a nice comparison to Wild Wadi, newer and larger with lots more sunloungers, but the walking from ride to ride was a bit of a faff compared to Wild Wadi where they are all linked and you just stay on your rubber ring. Great fun though and good value.

"Plenty of Fun" A Fantastic Experience. Thanks Atlantis. The best water park in UAE. Located at Atlantis On The Palms. This water park offers plenty of fun and adrenalin. Plenty of things on offer for everyone from the young to the older. Open from 10am until sunset. Price is Dh 210 per Adult and 165 per child (Free for Atlantis guests) Locker and towel combo for an extra Dh 50.Staff where extremely friendly and helpful throught the day. Always smiling and willing to help in anyway.The park has to offer a private beach. Water slides and river rides that will amaze you. A kids section for the young ones, plus plenty of lagoons with plenty of sun beds.Dolphin bay is also located at the park which costs extra and you can go swimming with the dolphins. Plenty of price options available. If you wish not to pay. There is a viewing area where you can watch for free.Plenty of food options available. Also a combo meal deal can be brought for Dh 45. I have been to this waterpark twice and recommend all to visit for a great day out in the sun with plenty of fun and adrenalin.
Brilliant. Do not miss this - we had a wonderful time. Take loads of sun cream and drink loads of water - the rapids and lazy river a favourite of mine
FUN FUN!. Luv the rides, there is something for everyone, it was so much fun.
Advise to stay away. We loved the day but 2 out of 3 of us were put out with stomach bugs forthe next 3 days. I have heard since that this is common.

I am lovin it. Beautiful water park at tha Palm. Great slopes, really enjoyable for everybody. Even my Mom loved it (age 53). You can spend the whole day there, without you recognized. Friday is always busy. Go there on weekdays, if you can. You can get great discount , if you have residence Id, or have entertainer voucher. Fast food is ok. Go for the burgers, it is really big portion. We never rent lockers. The place seems so safe. All the lifeguards and the staff are nice, friendly, helpful people.

Aquatastic.... for a price. Great day out although the Shamal was closed - get ready to climb ALOT of stairs. Lockers & towels should be included in the AED210 entry fee, the food is pretty pricey and the queues were long even on a weekday. Cooking in a rubber ring is a serious hazard, nevertheless it's a whole day out, filled with thrills and well worth it!
the best water park ever .... this is a must while you in Dubai . they have great amenities and you will have to get out of the water to go to the rides

Fun fun fun. Aqua venture is an awesome water park, perfect for kids of all ages - including 'big' kids! a little on the pricy side if you don't have vouchers but a fabulous family day out - just take your sunscreen and get there early to reserve deck chairs!
Great place for family. One of the best if not the best water parks in UAE.
avoid the heat. a gteat day out plenty of sunbeds and room .The rides where fantastic and you can if required go on to the beach

Good but pricey. Good slides, nice fish tank and the ray feeding was a good touch. However, very pricey on the food & refreshments. Buy your children a 40 AED cup and get the refills for 5 AEDs to save some cash!!!

Be ready for a screaming water adventure!. I love Aquaventure Atlantis ! not only the water slides are steep but dark inside the tunnel, and the zigzag rides are too strong (or should i say the water current. You would feel like your going to be thrown out of your floater. Dont miss the highlight, The Leap of faith! iTS 27.5 M tall, and 61m long it catapults you to a shark filled lagoon , dont worry they wont bite you you only get to see them through the transparent tunnel.. it looks really scary from afar specially when you see riders screaming (and cut short shrieks).. but when you get to the top it's even more scary hehehe..but you will love doing it again and again.. we never had a chance to try it again though cause it was the last day of a long holiday and people are just everywhere... The entire day i guess was not enough for us to try everything so be early !Since dubai has a tormenting summer specially between june-sept be ready with your loads of sunscreen and water to keep you hydrated!Food is available ,lockers( hair dryer available) provided but for a fee. For UAE residents you can avail of the discounted entrance fee if you show your national ID or emirates ID.

Leap of Faith!. Great waterpark with loads of amenities, particularly if you are a guest of Atlantis Hotel which it is attached to. Do the leap of faith which is a sheer drop into the transparent shark tank. Great fun for kids and adults.
Great for families. Worth a visit especially if you have children with you...easy to spend a day there with some great rides,lazy river etc and ample sunbeds
brill day out. we had a great day lazing on the river and fun on the rides ,
Good. All-in -all we had a really good time here. We didn't care for some of the water slides and the fact that you are in the dark but we really enjoyed our day.

So much fun. There's something for everyone... From relaxing on sunbeds, cruising in a doughnut or gettiing on one of the crazy rides.
Love it every time!
Great fun. Especially on their Wild Wadi river!! Very relaxing floating around.

Amazing Atlantis - Awesome Aquaventure!. We have been to Atlantis twice now, and are currently giving our third visit careful consideration! It is truly amazing and made better by a visit to Aquaventure, with it's thrill rides, lazy river ( some parts quite less "lazy" than you think!) kids area and dolphin bay, it's our favourite water park in the world! The leap of faith just has to be done, although I admit , I made my husband check it out first!! If you can visit dolphin bay too then do, it's an amazing experience. Highly recommend to anyone.

Perfect place for family time. Prepare for a perfect day with all security and support you may require. This place is full of variety and options... Consider them wisely and you may end charmed.Beware of the end of the day and the time lag to get a cab... Friendly advice ;-)

Expensive - but WOW. Dubai's greatest ability to extract money from you. We went to Atlantis, and decided to spend the extra to get private Cabana, and were pleased we did (although I suspect that the Japanese family who were unceremoniously booted out by the staff to make our cabana available were less pleased). I just wish we had arrived earlier in the day to get the best out of the rides, which are amazing. We all had a blast - especially our kids (9 and 12).

Good Fun. Aquaventure is better than other water parks in UAE... I have been to all of them and find Aquaventure better than all... It's a bit pricey but there are plenty of rides for the kids and adults... My favourite is leap of faith - a must do for all adults !... The park is very well maintained and the staff around is very Friendly... the park also has its own artifical beach... I would recommend to bring your own towels... and just rent the lockers. There are plenty of good places to eat but all are costly so be prepared to pay a bit extra for the food... Overall a must when in Dubai.

Nice place. Really cool place, very clean facilities for a water activity. May go again. Consider taking your own towels if you are not comfortable renting ones there (rental towels are also clean). Kids water vests are provided for free. Very friendly staff.Entry price differs between residents in UAE (UAE nationals & legal residents) and visitors (I was a visitor - higher price- and paid AED210/pax (~USD60/pax))
Lost of Chambers. Unfortunately couldn't drop in Aquaventure park but walked in Lost of Chambers cage. Liked!
good park for kids!. Liked it, but, it was just average as a waterpark.

A fresh and new waterpark with cool attractions. Here you have something for both the daring and the more relaxed, either take the 60 meter free fall plunge or just float down the canals on a flotation device. Great for the whole family. But be there early, it gets really crowded with long queues after lunchtime, although that's probably a general advice for any attraction of this kind.

Good day out with the family. had an awesome time with the kids at this waterpark. Having been to the other two that Dubai has to offer, this one tops them all!Good facilities for changing, good choice of food and great service from the staff.It can be very busy during the weekends, however if you arrive early with plenty of sun cream you should avoid the crowds! The payment wrist watch system works very well, avoids you having to carry cash around for purchases....Lazy river was good, so were the water slides and children's play area.

Amazing and Scary!. We booked our tickets on line via Atlantis's website. We arrived at approx 9:30am on a Friday and it was very quiet so we managed to get sun loungers no problem. By about 10:30 - 11:00am it became very busy and almost all of the sunloungers in the main areas had become full. There were some others further along that weren't too busy.We didn't seem to have a problem getting one of the rings to go on the rapids, the double rings for two people seemed to go very quickly. Usually you don't have to wait around for the rings, but as it got busier, sometimes it took about 5-10 minutes to wait for one. I did notice some families, hogging their rings, i.e. sitting on their loungers for some time with their rings piled up next to them.The rapids were very good as were the waves. The slides are interesting. My husband got me to go on the slides, one of them which I think was the Stinger? scared the life out of me. I couldn't talk after it had finished, it was the first part, it was really steep and then plunged into darkness going down and round. Shark attack was more my kind of thing, not to steep, but still pretty quick and you finish in a glass tunnel surrounded by sharks, rays and other marine life. The rides are great fun, and for me a little scary, but I had a great time! I did notice towards the middle of the afternoon queues for some of the rides started to get bigger. One thing I did notice that they didn't really just have a swimming pool which would be a good idea. Otherwise it is the slides and rapids only.You can also have access to the beach which isn't that busy and lots of sun loungers. Prices for drinks and food is ok, not overly expensive. They have changing rooms and showers available and you can also hire towels (30 AED each) and lockers (40AED each) too.The Metro is also linked to Atlantis which can make it easier to get too. They also have a taxi rank outside with metered taxis.

Its good but not great. We did it only for our son...he loved it...we did a few rides but mostly lounged...The chnging rooms a very well equipped and neat but wish there were more hair dryers installed than just 2.And locker booking is not mandatory...ur stuff will b safe.for double safety ,loop in ur neighbours to watch out...they will.

Must Visit!. It was a Wednesday that we visited, the weather was very hot but the park was not too packed. Suitable for a family and a group of friends to go with. Love the no cash carrying idea. We stayed at the resort and charged things to our room but you can get a wristband to charge before entry.
Nice place for kids. Great experience. modern waterpark. kids really enjoyed it

We had so much fun. Our family of 5 (children aged 8, 11, 14) loved this place. The convenience of being at Atlantis was a definite advantage but had we not been staying there, we would still have travelled there to enjoy the rides, the rapids and the children's area. A fun fun place to include in your visit to Dubai, especially as it takes your mind off the heat!

Really Enjoyed it. Got tickets included with our hotel so thought we'd give it to a go, have a really nice day and there's some really good rides.Only downside is that it's quite confusing to get round, keep coming out in different sides of the park but all in all really really good.

Fun way to spend the day. Really fun way to spend the day if you love the water. This water park is at the Atlantis resort. Be sure to experience the aquarium as well while you are there. There is a train stop just outside the hotel which is convenient and makes the trip out there cheap. Stunning views of Dubai from the elevated train.
Great Fun for Children and Adults. Great fun. Atlantis hotel guests get in for free (although you will have to pay GBP 8 for a locker) otherwise would be very expensive. Arrive early.
Worth watch!. Simply amazing! Go for a ticket which enable you to see the Aquarium tunnel, The Zoo, Boat ride at the top and a discount coupon for shopping

Expensive 'must do'. We visited in April 2012. It was hot and the water park seemed like a good idea to whale the time away. The ticket queue was long and slow (65min slow). The wrist band entry passes didn't charge the first time so back in the queue... The Lockers are located next to the main entrance, difficult to operate and they are very, very far from the slides and swimming. It is impossible to take any bags, sun screen, water or money with you as there is nowhere else to leave your items. So, long trips to the lockers...Food on the premises is of the 'fast food' type - unappetizing, overpriced, long queue to order, long wait for it to be ready....The Lazy River going around the park is great for all ages - slow, relaxing floating in a rubber ring. You can mix it up by venturing into the Rapids - few twists and shakes, faster speed and more fun. There are various 'scary' slides that add a bit of punch and excitement to otherwise very commercial operation. Not all the slides are suitable for everyone and younger children are very limited in choice. This place would be most suitable for teenagers and young adults. Be prepared to get hot, frustrated, spend a lot of money and queue for everything. There is very little shade and it is best avoided during the hottest months (May-Oct). If you use a Taxi, please try to use the standard marked Taxis with a sign and not the Hotel assigned cab company. Hotel cabs are very difficult to trace if you lose something or want to comment, and they don't operate by the same Service Contracts and Standards.
To do absolutely!. Wow, great experience to do and do again! Nice attraction in a nice location.

VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!!!. First and last time! not worth the money spent on this water park!! Wild Wadi is still the Best in Dubai.The rides are not exciting and no thrill, if you are a couple or family you will never be able to find a double tube to enjoy the rides. If you want a double tube good luck in finding one, I see most of the people carrying the tubes and guarding them with their life!!! Atlantis has double trouble with double tubes!!! including the single tubes as well!!! Go to Wild Wadi you don’t have to fight for tubes and the rides are more exciting and enjoyable.
Boring. This place sucks. the lazy river is crap and theres not many things for familys. dont like it atall

Man Made Water Park - Lots of concrete. We went here. Know some of the team that work here. Beautiful water park. 7 Star facility. Stunning facilities. Pay to hire a bath towel at the reception when you pay to get in. You can come in and out as the wrist band allows you back in. Take your camera. Different eateries there. We had a snack there. Reasonable prices. You cannot bring any food or water in here but its not that expensive. Great for couples, families and friends.

Amazing. a wonderfull time in an amazing place full of fun...i personally liked the kids area.. splashing on people running around and having lots of water fun.. also so safe.i liked the fresh fruit kiosk with the pinapple and watermelon.. wow just amazing.. also the leap of faith is a must.one of the best attractions in dubai, it's really a monthly must.

Aquaventure VS wild wadi,,, waterparks. Aquaventure  And wild wadi both are really good water parks,, different experience... To me both are must try water parks,, however if I'll have to pick just 1 as a favorite hmmmm I'll pick wild wadi

Good day out for family and friends. We spent an afternoon here in March (late review) and mind you it does get quite cold then. We were shivering when we were just sitting in the donuts and when we were waiting to get onto the slides haha! It's pretty big and there are some awesome rides including the Leap of Faith which is a must-do, something different to other theme parks. Food and drinks are quitely costly so byo. Byo towel if you can too! Definitely recommend a visit if you're comin to Dubai for a trip :) Pics here : http://liloneoftheashes.wordpress.com/2012/05/11/atlantis-aquaventure-the-lost-world-31/
Loved it here. Excellent water park, the rides were so much fun - could float around the lazy river all day

!Very busy!. Too many people. Shower/chnaging rooms very dark and cramped.
Much prefer Wild Wadi!
Clean and fun. I loved the swim with dolphins whilst my husband and son had lots of fun on the water rides

Nice way to spend a day. Being so hot in Dubai this May we chose the water park for some respite in a lazy river. This is a nice water park, clean and well kept. Whilst the sun loungers are a bit packed in they have individual sun shades which is handy. Something for all ages here, tots swimming pool and water play area and the slides are somewhat more thrilling than those we have encountered in the US esp for a relatively small park, leap of faith and even the rapids are not tame.Its a bit pricey, unless you are resident as entry free if staying at Atlantis the Palm. The deal on entry, towel and locker saves a few dirhams. Once inside drinks are ice creams are high end price.Unlike other water parks, here folks held onto their 'own' rubber ring, as they dont seem to have them available at the start of the ride. So we saw them stack up at the side of the 'owners' sun loungers. Top tip - bring water park shoes / flip flops as bare feet are at high risk of burning on the stone and concrete floors.
Lovely place to spend a day!. Great water park, lovely aquarium, excellent beach and expensive food!

Beware of Lifegaurds!. Been to Aquaventure on numerous occasions and enjoyed it up until the last visit. Myself and my husband went on a double doughnut on the lasy river ride (we are in our 30's ). to cut a long story short the life guard that was standing in the water grabbed our doughnut as a huge wave comes from the wave machine, pushes us backwards into the 20ft wave, we somersault in the air, I come crashing under the water scraping and gashing all my sides, foot and toes open, whilst this bl00dy wave is pulling me under the water. So I ended up in the emergency room, half drowned with bruises, scrapes and 2 toes gashed open. My husband also lost his new Ray Bans.Lifegaurd asked us not to put in a complaint as he didnt want to be fired and then deported so we didn't. I now have a foot full of deep scars thanks to him. We have been on that ride countless times since Aquaventure first opened and have never seen any lifegaurd grab anyone's doughnut at all to do what he did. needless to say I havent been on a water ride anywhere since this happened!
Great for kids. I went with a bunch of friends who have heaps of kids. The kids exhausted themselves on the rides while we lay in the shade, dipped, drank and chatted. A grand day out.
AWESOME!!!. Feel like a kid again! This place is so much fun! Awesome waterslides. Fun!

A great day out!. The park has a fantastic area for children. Massive water buckets fill and then tip. There are plenty of water slides ranging from very short to hugely long. Climbing areas and rickety bridges make it a magical place for kids. I could have spent the day there myself! The main area is the Ziggurat. A tall tower that sprouts 7 amazing rides. Some are dark twisting tunnels and others are transparent and travel through a fish-filled lagoon. The 'Leap of Faith' is a must. Food and drinks are available but can be pricey. Towels and lockers are available for a small charge. They provide you with neat wrist bands which you load with cash on entry so you don't have to carry cash round with you. Any credit left, at the end of the day, is refundable at the exit. Well worth a visit !!!!

Excellent waterpark!!!!. I don't know why people here keep complaining of the price. In Australia, wet and wild - a water park costs around 70$ to get in. Aquaventure is about the same... There are 7 slides to keep you entertained for hours if it is your first time in the waterpark. The waterpark is so cool, they didn't care that I bought my water proof camera on some of the slides! They have world famous slides such as the leap of faith (been shown on the amazing race one time) and shark attack where you go through a tube with sharks around you! I loved this water park and would recommend it!
Great day.. Enjoyable day with the family and friends. Water slides were a lot of fun.
Worth the monorile ride to Atlantis. Worth the monorile ride to Atlantis through the palm Jumeriah, well mainataned place, definetly not worth the exhorbitant price for a water park.
A great day out. With impressive rides and slides, Atlantis is a must for families. Be warned, it is expensive. Take the monorail to Atlantis for a great view of the palms
fun. good day ou, would be better with a few more rides though.
Great family fun. I loved the water park. The changing rooms could be cleaner but otherwise no complaint. If you have kids (of all ages) this is unmissable
Aqua Park. Great way to spend a day, lots of walking and not great for small children under 5.

okay - expensive. an expensive day out. the best part is the drive up to the atlantis! the hotel looks amazing
the rides were so-so. expesive

One whole day of good fun, for families with young children. Between Wild Wadi and Aquaventure, we decided to go for Aquaventure in the end. We really, and still doesn't know which is better, but our children (3.5yo and 6 yo) had a great time at aquaventure where we spent one full day. The children water play area is good, and we enjoyed the wave pool and the river rides that are connected to it. Being still little, they could ride the 'scarier' rides of course, and we were content to go to the private beach where we spent a good part of the day swimming, picking sea shells and building sand castles. My hubby and I took turns to be with them, while one of us go off for the challenging rides like leap of faith, shark attack, the surge etc. I think if it's just me and my hubby, we would have finished all the rides very fast. But the no. of rides (really not many), and the private beach makes this a suitable water theme park for those with young children, who aren't so much into exciting rides anyway. The family entertainer book have 1 for 1 vouchers for the shark bites restaurant inside the park. Useful for lunch. :)
Wow!!. Very good; queues not too long; lots of fun! Locker charge too expensive!

FUN!. This is a really enjoyable place! A vacation hottspot.. We stayed at the Atlantis resort so we could unlimited free passesto Aquaventure. We went in the morning which is the best time since there isnt lots ofqueues. Not many people visit the park in April/May so thats the best time to go! The waterslides and tube slides are so much fun! There isnt SO MANY rides but still a fair amount..This place is for absolutely ANYBODY, small, old, big, young etc etc.The entrance fee is 210 if you are NOT staying at the hotel. If you are, then its free!Enjoy the aqua fun!

So much fun !. My partner and i went there for the day as it was included in our Club room package at The Atlantis Palm.We are both 40 years old and we felt like a couple of teenagers and had such a great time. So many rides and plenty of sun beds, very clean.

Excellent waterpark - loads of fun!!. This waterpark is expensive but definitely worth the money. We spent the whole day there and absolutely loved it, one of the best things we did in Dubai. Very clean and organised. The only bad thing was we wanted 1hour 30mins for the food in the cafe, very poor service, so be prepared for a long wait otherwise definitely worth a visit.

Great family experience. This place offers attractions for small and big. Lots of different water activities including slides, labyrinths, torrents, shark experience, etc. Food and drinks are rather expensive as its a part of overpriced Atlantis complex.
Well run water park. A very well run water park, nice things to eat and drink, clean and tidy and great staff.
cOoOoOL!!!!. A place for the whole family to go and have fun. It is a bit pricy, but then again every where else in dubai is.

Never mind the kids the adults got carried away to. This location was awesome, I went to it with my brother who was keen to go onto the water slides, It has acesses to the beach which was great, good food, right next to Alantis Hotel on the Palm Island and good water adventure park eventually got me carried away and I ended up on the slides.
Heaven for kids. Be careful if you get thrown out of the dingy's as the surfaces are sharp. My son got grazed quite badly on elbows and knees, but despite this he went straight back on !

Great fun!. Loved the Ziggurat rides, especially the slide that takes you through the aquarium with brilliant views of the sharks, rays and fish. Something for everyone here - beaches to relax on (both real ones at the waterfront and fake ones by the pool), a brilliant children's play pool, and excellent slides & rides for adults & older kids - including the Leap of Faith, which will take your breath away. The rapids were also a big hit for us!
expensive. good fun but cost a small fortune to go as a family of three
Free!. The water park was great and even better because it was free and we could wander up whenever we liked!
Atlantis Aquaventure is Amazing!. A 5-Star experience! They have thought of everything to make your day fun. Extremely clean and the staff is very helpful.

Worth the drive. While this is a bit far from Dubai and main attractions, it's worth planning for a day trip. I visited several times and had always enjoyed it... the place in Um al Qain sits close to the beach area, a lot larger than Wild Wadi, there is more space and sitting areas are less crowded. Also, a lot more relaxed. I enjoyed the wave pool and some of the tunnel rides, also the flotation pool with very heavy salt water. Very relaxing, friendly atmosphere. They also have some bungalos, so you can rent them to spend a night. The food choices have also improved, compared to earlier years. Take your family and enjoy a relaxing day with loads of water.

FUN FOR ALL. Amazing water park with slides for young and old alike. Tip: Book online to save the queues.Downside: I felt that the prices were quite expensive (200 Dirhams), however, once there you have to pay extra for a locker and for the hire of towels.Drinks were quite expensive too.But what a fun day out for all the family.

Up market water park.. Part of the Atlantis hotel complex, this place has a five star feel to it. For the adrenalin junky "Leap of Faith" is a must, but be prepared to queue at least 30 mins, or get there early. All the other rides are much of a muchness, but still worthwhile. Snack bars are OK. Sun beds seem to be in larger groups than Wild Wadi, so has the effect of feeling really crowded. Double rings are hard to get so hang on to it once you've got one.
Great Day Out. Kids will love it.Food is good and the rides are good fun.Better than Wild Wadi in my opinion

Great fun, even for grown ups!. My husband and I went to the water park on the first day of our honeymoon to let our hair down and have a laugh. What a great start to an amazing three week adventure! Aside from the overpriced inedible food and expensive under water camera from the gift shop that produced poor quality snaps, the attraction itself was great fun. The rides are great and the queues moved quickly and there are great views from the top platforms. Next time around we might give the tower free fall slide a miss but we were glad to do it once (though never again!) for the exhilarating thrill of the ride. We chilled on the beach afterwards to recover from the excitement.
Fun at the water park. Good water park, very crowded even on a week day, Leap of faith is good.....food in the park is expensive

So clean!. It is fantastically clean and has great rides although does get very busy. The downsides are that it is very badly organised with towel hire, lockers, sunbeds etc all being quite a distance from each other meaning that you are walking to and fro a lot to lock away your belongings each time you want to leave your beds and go on the rides. Quite expensive but my daughter absolutely loved it.
Amazing day. Great time and experience, many thinks to do, full day, go there early beause it is getting busy later on the dayExciting

heaven for kids (and adults). This place is amazing. a family destination of the best kind. the kids went ballistic (or the opposite) on the "leap of Faith" slide. the lazy donuts are a sweet ride too. The place is ultra clean and serviced well. I recommend it 100%. Dubai does it better!

too crowded. After spending some time deciding between WADI and Atlantis we decided on AQUAVENTURE as it was also an opportunity to visit ATLANTIS palm. Despite it being an out of season weekday the place was rammed to capacity (over?) The ticket sales person did mention it was busy, but after making the effort to get the whole family there, we didn't feel like turning around. The park is certainly impressive but the fun was tempered by the long queues and the ridiculous priced drinks and snacks . . and the "beach" is disgusting!

So much to do. This is a great place if you love water and rides, the rapids were great and not too hairy just like the torrents. The Falls and Stinger were a bit more like white knuckle rides! Can't wait to go back

Go early. Stayed at the hotel attached and we were able to get in early before the crowds and queues, the lockers were too far away from the action and didn't end up using ours. Great fun, but it was very, very, busy.

Great day out for the kids. The queuing was inconvenient as it was so hot there but the rides make up for that when u get inside there. The changing rooms were clean and so were the bathrooms. The staff were great and try the Shark restaurant for the kids. The food was good too.

Great Fun. This is the 2nd time we've chosen to go to Atlantis.... A great day out and used the entertainer voucher which helps in cost.... We are not major water park fans but love the rapids, torrent and lazy river options....
wow. children loved and would have spend all day at the water park.. its amazing...
Lots of Fun. As long as you don't go on a Friday or Saturday this is a great day out otherwise it is hard work with the queing. Parents can chill on the beach while the kids entertain themselves

Brilliant. We spent the full dau there very funny and nice. My husband tried the Leap of Faith very thrilling but if you have kids under 120cm height then you can't take them with you on some attractions.

Atlantis Aquaventure water Park is fantastic!. We did enjoyed our aquaventure water park experienced and we also booked double cabana and it is worth. You have your owned tent and privacy and there is a waiter to serve you. the place is nice and clean. It's for everybody who loves splashing and swimming pools for kids is fantastic. It is highly recommend to have aquaventure water park at Atlantis.
Overcrowded. The place has potential to be a wonderful addition to the Atlantis Palm. However, it is overcrowded and mostly like a day at Lego Land (UK) over a hot summers day.

FUN- tastic!. I have been there quite a few times, it is great fun. There is something for everyone! It can be very crowded. Do not miss the river rapids, just lie on the floating tubes and laze around. Just be a bit careful as there are some places where people can topple over, nothing dangerous as it is not at all deep. If you are brave enough, take the leap of faith (27.5 m jump). If you have kids, there are floaters meant for two people, use that else it is very easy to go different ways if individual floaters are used. Too many activities to list!

Fun for a couple of hours. Great place to go with kids, probably less slides than most people would expect, clean and well maintained. Worth a trip particularly if it's free (i.e. Atlantis guest), not cheap if you are not. Combine with the acquarium.

Great FUN!!!. Great fun, although note that you're not allowed to take in your own food, so lots of people turning up with picnics had to leave all their food at the gate! Also no signs to warn of shallow water on rapids, my partner fell out and had a bad bang on the head! Lifeguargs didn't seem to bothered and didn't even flinch! All very good fun though!

Thrilling experience!!!. A lot of people, a lot of chaos, but beautiful attractions and great attention for security. Don't miss the ziggurat Leap of Faith experience but be prepared to a 27,5 metres jump! Be careful with the Rapids and the River rides as kids go through different directions and they may go out of your sight!
Great fun day out. Super day of sun and water fun, loads of area to laze and lots of rides and slides
The best waterpark in Dubaï.. The Aquaventure water park is the best waterpark in the Dubaï area. You are granted free access in it with a stay at the Atlantis the Palm.
Good Fun. Leap of faith..is a must...and the rapids was great fun too...the kids had a fab day....'big and small' ...lol
water park in atlantis. many activities that can be done and its a good place to spend the day and play with family lockers is not at the center of the park

Terrible lifeguards. Let me start by saying the park itself is clean, well-maintained and there was lots to do with a toddler. My toddler and I had a great morning on the slides and lazy river.However, our day took a turn for the worst when our raft overturned at the start of rapids, throwing my toddler and I backwards into the water. I smacked my head very hard on the bottom, but thankfully remained conscious and was able to quickly lift my son above the water as we were floated further down the river (he was in a life jacket but had quite a scare).There was no life guard when we turned over but when we got to the nearest one, I asked for help. He was in no rush to assist. Thankfully my son was uninjured, but I asked for medical assistance because of the hard hit to my head - the medic took several minutes to arrive (I was told the medical station was all the way at the other side of the waterpark), and essentially told me to walk it off since I wasn't bleeding. From the life guard to the medic, there just seemed to be absolutely no urgency or concern. I shudder to think how long it would have taken the life guards to get my son out of the water (or me for that matter) had I been knocked out.
Small and crowdy. Avoid it, if you can! It's very crowdy, small and modest as features.

Great Fun!. The lazy river and rapids are great fun, it seems to go on forever. We went on some of the slides, the shark one is brilliant. None of us were brave enough to go down the leap of faith but judging by the screams of those that did it sounded amazing!
Disappointed. A map of the park with directions to start points of rides would have been helpful. Staff were not very helpful.
The Best Water Slides and Rides. 10 out of 10 for Fun in the Sun. The water rides are unmissable. I did them all, but chickened out on the Leap of Faith...next time!!

Overpriced. Wadi is a much better waterpark and has much more for a family. The Aquaventure has a great lazy river rapid and a couple of slides but aprt form a kids play areas that it. Also very overpriced so fish around for a deal, there are plenty about

Brilliant water park. I've stayed in the Atlantis a couple of times in recent years, and visited the Aquaventure Water Park regularly while there (you get free admission as a resident of the hotel). It's the best water park I've yet to encounter, with some amazing water rides which actually propel you along, almost as if you're on a roller coaster -- on some, you even end up shooting UP slopes as well as down!! It also features a long, rapid-packed lazy river. There are plenty of loungers. An aquarium packed with sharks, rays and other cool fish. And one or two more frightening slides for older or more adventurous types! I've always had a great day out here.

Water Fun, Fun, Fun!. I particularly like how this park was structured - the rapids going around the whole place with easy short-cuts if you want to go back to the Ziggurat was a great way to ensure guests get their fare share of adrenaline and the chance to try out everything the park has to offer.Despite the crowd, the place was very clean and there were staff in almost every corner keeping a careful watch to ensure the safety of everyone.For the thrill seekers, they have The Leap of Faith and for those who like to just chill, sitting on the tubes as it goes along the current in the Rapids is enough to guarantee everyone a fantastic time!

wwhhhhooopppppieeeeeee. Quite pricey at £50+ plus locker charge but a whole days fun. Was warey of burning but its quite shaded in the tunnels etc. Lots of people were covered up so it wasn't a problem to wear shorts and T.Shirt if you wanted.We ate at Shark bites and had the most enourmous real chicken burger I have ever seen, great value food and actually real nice! Not a rip off like normal theme parks or expensive Dubai places. We went end of March and it got busy around 11 - 4 but only qeued for 10 mins max for the big rides. Started to get cold by 4 and we left. They have shower gel in showers but obviously bring towel etc. On your way out go via Cold Stone creamery, ice cream in a cocktail bar style, a great experience with singing staff and icecream everywhere.We did the lost chambers too which was good to see, but actually the aquarium in the mall etc was as good. Taxi qeue was ENOURMOUS after 6 so we went on the monorail which only takes you off the palm to get another taxi so pricey but we didn't wait and got to see the Monorail.
Its so so. i did not wow me. not a very bog selection of rides, and i dont like that they dont jave a central pool.

It'a all About the Rubber Rings. Our trip to Aquaventure was supposed to be the highlight of my week off work but it was a huge disappointment. The ticket queue was a joke - taking 20 minutes - despite it being quite early. Once inside I was appalled by the way the people were crammed around the kid's attraction - the bucket tippy thingy. It was impossible to move around because those who were not fortunate enough to have one of the (mostly towel reserved but not in use) sun loungers had to set up camp in the walkways.We moved on to see what rides we could use. We found after a while that we had to find and retain rubber rings with the 2 sweater family type very few and far between. Honestly, there were people trying to take a ring away from my 10 year old whilst I was trying to spot a double for us to use. We found that all of the rides we could do with the children required the rings so once we had them we had to keep them - or spend another 1/2 hour trying to get another.The lazy river and rapids were good fun but that was about all we did - which was not worth the hassle or the expense. It cost a fortune to get in and then you are robbed for food and drink.If you have the choice go to Dreamland or Iceland. Perhaps it would be different if we did not take the kids but I doubt it. Just the look of those sun loungers crammed in together so tightly is enough to put me off.

Great fun. What can I say, well I didnt think I would enjoy my visit to 'A water park' how wrong could I be - we spent hours drifting around the place without a care in the world, with the occasional 30 seconds of hanging on for dear life as we went through the rapids, which seem to have different levels of intensity (or maybe it was just me?). f there are two of you make sure you get a double ring its much more fun than two seperate ones. Also keep you eyes open for the 'Ruggarat' rapids which are off to the centre of the park, I wont spoil it for you but they are awesome and disorientating, but you probably want to do them again just to confirm what you just went through :-)

It's all about the rubber rings. Our trip to Aquaventure was supposed to be the highlight of my week off work but it was a huge disappointment. The ticket queue was a joke - taking 20 minutes. Once inside I was appalled by the way the people were crammed around the kid's attraction - the bucket tippy thingy. It was impossible to move around because those who were not fortunate enough to have one of the (mostly towel reserved but not in use) sun loungers had to set up camp in the walkways.We moved on to see what rides we could use. We found after a while that we had to find and retain rubber rings with the 2 sweater family type very few and far between. Honestly, there were people trying to take a ring away from my 10 year old whilst I was trying to spot a double for us to use. We found that all of the rides we could do with the children required the rings so once we had them we had to keep them - or spend another 1/2 hour trying to get another.The lazy river and rapids were good fun but that was about all we did - which was not worth the hassle or the expense. It cost a fortune to get in and then you are robbed for food and drink.If you have the choice go to Dreamland or Iceland. Perhaps it would be different if we did not take the kids but I doubt it. Just the look of those sun loungers crammed in together so tightly is enough to put me off.

Fun fun fun. A waterpark for people of all ages!The place is like a tropical wonderland, visually stunning and just epic fun!! It doesn't cover a huge area, but it's easy to spend your whole day there. From the sedate torent wave ride, to the rapids and then onto the many water slides, all of which are great fun each time you do them (whether it's your first or fifty first time!). Then when you're brave enough you head up to the Leap Of Faith.... and it really is that. A near vertical drop followed by being surrounded by marine life in the aquarium, whilst travelling at speed. An unreal waterslide.It really is fun for the whole family, and is recommended to anyone aged from 6 to 60.Great facilities, locker and towel hire and photos available that are taken around the whole park. The photos are expensive though, and the best ones are always from the leap of faith!I'll definitley be returning on my next visit to Dubai.

Go in the morning. We went in the morning before big crouds. Very clean, towels easy to get. Chairs packed together. Liked the cover that is attached. They had so many float tubes for the lazy river I wondered how it would feel if they were all full! Didn't go on big slide. As far as water parks go, don't go out of your way to come if you are not staying her, go to Wild Wadi
Good. But thought that Wild Wadi was better overall. Loved the really steep drop ride though - frightened the life out of me at the top!

Leap of faith..... Good fun half day activity for adults probably a full day if you have children. You can use your wristband to purchase items in the park if you top it up in the admissions area. We stayed until the end, and we would recommend you leave before this point as there were extremely long queues for taxis (40 minutes)
Superb water theme park. The leap of faith is what you see on in the picture. The highest and fastest ride in the park. It was a day absolute fun. I'd recommend to everyone who's in Dubai.
Nice park on the Palm!. One of the great things in life is beeing in the water. Check all the slides which are great! And just relax, therefore this waterpark is excellent! Really a must in Dubai!

great fun & relaxing day out. great day of fun with family & friends at Aquaventure in Dubai.plenty of rides to go on with a good variety. get in a tube & cruise around all day long.the big gushing water near the rapids is the highlight in the double tube!numerous areas to relax on a lounger or take the younger kids to the water playground.

Best Water Park Ever. This place will not disappoint. First off it's at a beautiful hotel, at the famous Atlantis. Cost will run you about $60 a person. Warning the water isn't heated so it's a tad cold. I did every ride but the big one, The Leap of Faith. I stood in line for that ride but chickened out. The rides are pretty good, much better than water parks I've been to in the US. The wait lines aren't too bad, at least they weren't bad when we were there, but I bet it's different in Aug. Also the entrance to the park includes beach access. Sadly the ocean water wasn't warm so I didn't get to take advantage of the beach. You can relax and smoke Shisha on the beach. Also they sell alcohol at the park, you can get a beer to a Pina Colada. I can't wait to go back to Dubai so we can go back here again. Also this place is located on the tip of the man made island, The Palm. So expect a bit of a scenic drive through The Palm

great waterpark!!. I didn't stay at the hotel, but went there with my wife and familia for a day trip to the water park. AWESOME!! worth the price of admission!! We had a great time and would definitely come again!!

Leap of faith is worth the admission alone. Good place to spend a day. Leap of faith ride is top quality, even if it only lasts 7 or 8 seconds. Other slides are ok but much of muchness. I cut my foot on rocks on the side of the rapids which seemed to be a common injury. First aid was very good. The ticket gets you free admission to the Atlantis beach which is excellent. I also recommend a dinner at cocktails at Nasimi beach restaurant and bar.

Thrilling Day out, Best Waterpark ever!. My husband and I are in our late 20s but this experience made us feel like 10 year olds.Amazing lazy rivers that stretch for ages and ages with twists and turns, waves, river rapids, bumpy turns, soft swirly bits.My husband and I spent nearly 2 hours just floating about on a double rubber ring in the lazy river.Was the most fun ever!Amazingly well organised with a lifeguard posted practically every 2 meter stretch.My husband even spotted some kind of park officer who randomly throws in plastic baby dolls to see how quickly life guards who have been sitting around all day, spot it and react!Good news is they did and they do!Very attentive , very safe, smoothest set up I have ever seen.The drops and tunnels were amazing. There is even a ride where you float through a tube in a massive aquarium through a shark's enclossure. How random!Excellent day out, beautiful pools and loungers everywhereFood is a bit expensive (2 hotdogs and fries meals came to about £26)My gripe is that the overall day out however is VERY expensive, heres a break down:1) Burger meal for 2 = £30 2) Park entrance for 2 = 400DHM = £753) Towel hire for 2 = 30DHM = £54) Locker for 1=40DHM = £7Altogether its not a cheap day and if you factor in the cost of getting a cab to the Atlantis also, its quite a big cost!My husband and I had the best time ever but we did say we would struggle to recommend this to our friends or family who have kids because it would cost a fortune for a whole family.I think perhaps it maybe worth it to get it all for free if you are staying at the AtlantisAmazing day out, I havent been to Florida Disneyland but I picture this is what it would be likeWe only had to queue for 1 ride and it was a short queue, nothing like the close to 90 min queues for rides at Alton Towers UK.Very safe and very smooth setup as mentioned beforeBut perhaps safe a few quid by bringing your own towels and sharing lockers.Food you have to pay for though because you are not allowed to take in any food.
Visited as part of the Atlantis package. Great value to have it included in the hotel deal - kids loved it and as it was included we could nip back to the hotel for a midday nap too - fab!
Great family outing. Spent the day here. Lovely loungers with shade. Go first thing as it gets busy by noon. Water warm for the kids. There is something for all ages here. Would love to go again.
Fabulous rides. Even though there's not many, and not too kiddie friendly to other waterparks it has an exceptional standard and unique settings especially with the sting ray feeding bay area....wow

Too good.. Thrilling and exciting. river The rides except for the lazy are definitely not for people with fear of height and darkness. The only downside was the long wait for the Taxi's( more than an hour) after the tiring day.

Great experience for a family...but pricey.. Our family has been dedicated to Wild Wadi for years but we thought that going to Atlantis would be a fun new experience this time around. We were right! The beach was beautiful and the kids enjoyed seeing the fish jumping and swimming around them. There were plenty of beach chairs and they had covers so you could easily shield yourself from the heat. Downside, there were no chairs to be found near the pool areas. If you do not arrive as soon as the park opens, you will need to set up on the beach. The rides led into the rapids and lazy river so you could stay in the water forever! Shark Attack and the Leap of Faith are the only rides that do not lead into the river. Shark Attack is a great slide for all ages since it goes through a transparent tube where you can see the fish, mantas and sharks swimming all around you. The lines were reasonable. The longest line was for the Leap of Faith but even then, it was only about 10 minutes. We went in the middle of the week so the crowds were not bad. I would not recommend going on a Friday or Saturday. You might want to bring your own towels as there is a 45 AED charge (about 12 USD) for renting a towel at the park. There is also a 45 AED charge for a locker which we paid and never used. Our things were fine on the beach chairs. Meals were reasonably priced and you can add a meal to your admission fee upon arrival for 45 AED. The park closes at sunset which is around 6pm but I recommend leaving just before that. The line at this time for the taxi is very long and does not move quickly at all. There is a monorail that will take you the the opening of the Palm Island where you can find a taxi easily.
Water Park. Pretty good but really packed, people are rough and confusing to get around sometimes but overall fab!
Great day out..... ...and you can get yourself a few cold beers whilst you're there. A good selection of rides and it makes for a great day with family, friends or your partner.

Awesome, fun-packed day. I would highly recommend a day at Aquaventure! The rides are fun and will suit every thrill seaker's needs. Get there early to avoid the queues. It is well worth going on the big, main attraction slide - you will not regret it! Remember if you are a UAE resident, please ask for the special rate! Enjoy
Great for Everyone. Lots of water, lots of sun and lot's of fun.More attractions than Wild Wadi, however Wild Wadi's big slide is the best slide.

Place was good. Stayed the whole day with friends. Not a big fan of water rides but actually enjoyed a few river rides about 2 or 3 then stayed the rest of the day at the beach. Few of my friends had actually tried other next door water theme park previously. I cannot attest to this but I heard stories that rides in Wild Wadi are more challenging and fun, not sure though.
Just fun, water and speed. Great place to have fun, even for children :)Rides, rapids, and the big slide, just amazing. Enough things to spend several hours, get plenty fun and enjoy a lot
Full of Fun. Fun, Great feeling.. cool water and great people there.. Very Clean and great..!!

Great fun. Loved this for a great day's fun and the chance to visit Atlantis. The water rides were great and had a range of levels from relazing to very scary. Great views. It was a little expensive and would be very expensive for a family but worth it if you can afford.
Excellent fun!. We booked a Dophin experience and a day at the water park. Worth every penny, I just wish we had spent more time there to enjoy every ride.

A nice day out. It was a nice day out at the park. Has got some rides that are good like the Leap of Faith,Rapid rivers etc.You may want to bring your own towels to the park coz they otherwise charge you for that.They give you a locker which actually is very small and you have to kinda struggle to get a locker that's working coz a lot of them do not read the band that they provide you in order to lock it.Also suggest to leave a little early as if you leave in the evening when everyone else is leaving too, you will have trouble to get a cab,get a shower room and also to get a clean toilet.
Great place especially as it was included in the hotel price. Good facilities. Needs a few more thrills. The rides they have are good but a few more would make it perfect.

Fun day out!. We spent the day out at aquaventure and although we couldnt ride all the slides as we had our 2 year in tow, there was enough for us to spend the day there! The kids area was nice and plenty to kerp the 2 year old occupied. The beach area is nice and clean and was faulty quiet so the little one enjoyed it too. The only downside to the place is the cost (without vouchers)it's about 210 dirhams plus 50 dirhams for towel and locker. The list chambers aquarium was a further 100 dirhams plus food and drinks are very expensive. The 2 years was free though which was good! The entertainers vouchers book have but 1 get 1 free vouchers for entrance to the park for towel and Lockers and for the shark bites resteraunt aswell so with the voucher the whole day was a lot more bearable to the pocket! And in the end well worth it! The queues for the taxis is quite long at the end of the day however we had arranged a private taxi to do a drop off and pick whenever we liked this saved us having to wait in the queue and the price wasn't much different to what we would have paid for a normal, the taxi driver just asked us to call him an hour before pickup. (windows tours did the private taxi for 150 AED pick up and drop off from bur dubai Arabian courtyard) All in all with the vouchers was a very good day out!
Expensive but GOOOOODDDDD. great place, must go to while in Dubai..where all the rich & famous come to bathe...

Love it. The question you have to ask, which is better Aquaventue or Wild wadi? Both are nice, However, I like Wild wadi ... maybe because I'd like Jumerah Group and how they are treating their brand name ....back to Aquaventure, it great place and nice to visit with your kids ... I love Dolphins and Sharks tunnel
I detest this place. This Is such a con as an adult with no kids. It is unclear and there Is very little to do. Far more exciting things to do in Dubai
Clean and Safe. Clean, well managed, efficient and safe. Can be enjoyed by whole family

A good day's time well spent. We have only used Aquaventure as part of a stay at Atlantis, so we have become a little blase about it, wandering in and out, at will. The rapids are great fun, and the other water features are worth a good few goes as well. I've never tried the big one yet, but give me time!

Great fun - Take Towels!!!. This is a pretty good water park, it's huge so if like me you get bored easily you can wonder around as much as you like, there's a nice beach area and plenty of slides/attractions.The main thing with this is that it is very new, clean and safe, there are so many life guards you'll wonder how they afford to pay them, but then you'll quickly remember you just paid £45 each to get in!! As it is at at hotel it's also licensed so you can grab a beer in the sun. The lazy river is great and the staff along the way like to mess about and push your ring into the waterfalls etc.Money saving tips..Get an ice-cream on the way in at the Cold Stone then tell the kids to pipe down later on when they are asking for a £11 ice pop later in the parkTake Towels, It's either 30 or 40dhs which is £5-7 and for a family of 4 who've already paid over £150 to get in adding another 20+ just for towels can be a bit frustrating.Lockers are also £7, but then on the grand scheme of things that's a lot cheaper than the (very slim) chance of someone taking your wallet/phone/watch. Food.. There is a Starbucks by Dolphin Bay. They have plenty of cold drink options fruit pots/sandwiches/salads/paninis muffins etc and you'll save about 60-70% on using the Aquaventure establishments.

Disney does it better. The aqua park was great fun, but a bit monotonous with the slides and lazy river, personally Disney's Blizzard Beach and Typhoon Lagoon was a better experience! A great freebie if you're staying in Atlantis! I didnt do Wadi so can't make a comparison
Great waterpark. An amazing water park with a variety of different 'rides' for everyone including the full on Leap of faith for the very brave!
Great fun for kids of all ages.. Well set out and friendly staff made for a great time. If you take the leap of faith ride, you may end up with a medical invasion on your nether parts.

Good fun - go on a week day in the peak season. Water parks are always good fun. This one is well spread out with plenty of slides. Bag yourself a bed and grab a rubber ring to sail around the rapids and lazy rivers for a while. The tube slides are great - especially the one that goes through the shark tank. Beware of the Leap of Faith - it is NOT for the faint hearted! Wear water shoes if you can as the floor gets very hot and you have to hop around from wet patch to shady patch like an idiot!
nice to be. be patient, sometimes you better walk ... i don't like those pipes were you don't see at all.

Absolutly great and best ever with kids. How to explain such week staying here. First be noted that it is for all budgets in term of food. With kids all is under control with life guards every 20 meters! 2 kids 5Y and 9y and they could go around all alone 30 minutes without problems. We would have never though doing that one day but all is so secured! Major central placd with all slides in limited up to 120 cm but so fun ! Do not be afraid to take all sides of slides as even last,we discovered new places! Every lunch cost approx 40€ as special rate for kids and for us one meal at choice : salad, wrap, hamburger... Surprise as not expected as every body was talking about high prices ( in fact only drinks cost ! So go and anticipate by having water in advance always). Winter the water is a bit heated and perfect and summer it is coolish! Anyway, best holidays in family we had and enjoyed so fun! Do not forget to book your double rubber ring. For deckchair if you want to bepeacefull go by dolphin place and they are small beaches with nobody but inconvenient is a long to go around after for fun and come back but worthy. Go and enjoy without fail!

Best park in the region. Really clean, modern and fun. Go in the morning to avoid the packs of people.
Much better than the other waterparks. Doesn't feel dated like the others. Rides are very good and you dont need to stand in queues as the lazy river feeds you into the rides.
Great day out. Quite spenny though!
great place for fun. For single entrance fee you get a whole day of swiming, bathing, sliding and other cool water atractions. Great for kids and also adults who likesto have some fun.
enjoy!. Nice place for kids and also adults! But from my point of view, staying 3 hours is much enough!

Awesome fun. Great fun if you like waterslides. Some are quite tame but relaxing all the same, while there are a couple that are definately for the adventurous. They have a little kids area too. There seems to be about 6-7 rides but some take a good 15 minutes to get around. We spent about 4 hours there with our adult children (17 - 23) and thouroughly enjoyed ourselves. It was quite cold as a strong wind was blowing off the ocean so it was reasonably quiet which was good as we didnt have to queue up at all. You get warm enough once youre in the water. Everything was very clean. Our visit was included in our accommodation.
Guiness record. Huge front glass wall, many types of sea creatures, but after the tunnel becomes very dark.

One of the last things to do: overrated,expensive...mainly for family.. I went in aquadventure water park on February in order to enjoy the attractions but I don't find them so amazing... there are just two nice slides, the other ones are nothing special. there are better and cheaper aquatic park in other places ( for example Aquafan in Riccione, Italy, is amazing!) Than this one... Aquaventure is nothing comparing with any other thing in Dubai.

Average experience. After hearing a lot about this water park I have to say I was underwhelmed - from start to finish. Buying the tickets - the cashier couldn't give me the correct brochure to show me what rides/attractions the water park had. In the end when it got too hard for her, she just said 'we've run out'. The lockers for AED 40 each - no signage or instructions about how to use the locker, so we had to go outside hunting around for someone to help you only to be met by a lady who was too busy talking to a fellow colleague to help us. She then grunted something and went back to talking to her friend, leaving me standing there. For a first timer the whole park experience is rather confusing - you need to know what to do/where to go as there is no 'journey' or easy way to find out what to do/where to go - instead you end up walking backwards and forwards picking up rings and asking park staff who rarely can answer a basic question. Otherwise the park was clean and it was quite a nice way to kill 3 hours.
It is very nice... ... if you go with persons that have a diiferent approach. Beach, watch ppl or just use the funpark? The whole family has something to do.
Fun day. Rides and pools are great. Food in shark bites was ropy, but ot really surprising. Very clean and attractive environment. Pricey tho so spend whole day there.
the best place to take the children. the aquaventure park is a really nice place to take the children there

Great place for fun with the family. Absolutely must do.....great rides...great waterplay for the kids....fun rides for adults. Veg food is actually available...nice salad, corn cob, pizza. Nice beach to relax once we were tired..while the kids played with their sand toys

Average water park!. Nothing great....the slides are OK except for the highest one. Other than that...its a very mediocre experience. It is assumed that who ever visits this place knows what to do in a water park. There are no guidelines on what you should do and how your experience could be better.

Fun for the family. We visited Aquaventure using the entertainer vouchers (only one coupon for adult admission, one for kids and one for locker and towel) Bring your own towel if you want to save on that This is a state of the art aquatic park very well designed to cater for all needs. There are plenty of rides even for adults that are not so thrilled at this sort of activities. You can charge some money on your bracelet and pay for food and cocktails with it. There is also a nice chicha bar on the beach Avoid the sun loungers at the pool as they are packed tighly on five rows and cater mainly to families with small children. The beach is really nice with plenty of available sun loungers each with its own “umbrella”. Food is ordered and delivered at your feet with a golf cart Avoid the ride back with the palm shuttle train as there is no taxi at the exit (only a few private cars). You will find yourself on a highway and only your feet to walk back to wherever you’re going.

An excellent day out!. Having been to Wild Wadi and being unimpressed, I didn't hold high hopes for Aquaventure. However, I was pleasantly surprised. The park is extremely clean, the staff are great and there is something for everyone. I also liked that there was beach access and plenty of sunloungers. A fab day :-)
It was just OK. It was just Ok to spend 2 or 3 hrs & we had to park far from the parked & waied more than 20 min for the shuttle bus

Full day of joy for my boys - and a relaxing beach experience for me. We spent the full day in the park - it's really good and big (and we visited a lot of them).Most important facts - no lines for all attractions and different food optionsClean, great service, nice environment
great day. definitely worth visiting, spare a day for this one, your kids will not soon forget the experience
awsomeeeee. best place to beat the heat in the summer in dubai! enjoyed it with my wife and kids!

Full day adventure, but beware of Jelly Fish!. At first we thought it was a bit small but my family and I stayed entertained until closing time at 6pm! I think it is great that the slides connect and you can go from slide to slide without getting out of the water.The beach was beautiful looking back over the city. They had signs out saying beware of Jelly fish but being the tourist that we are we still wanted to swim.My mother was stung several times while trying to swim back in.The life guards are very friendly and offer to help with vinigar. She was left with marks months after the sting.Other that this, the swim and day was a fantastic experience.

How to fall in love with a dolphin. I did the shallow water encounter and loved it! worth every dirham! the dolphins are truly cared for and it didn;t feel like a commercial environment even though there was the obligatory shop. do not miss the chance if you get it

Amazing!. Kids' paradise with nice slides and rapids + helpful staff. Battle of the floaters (double seaters) was sometimes heavy. Plenty of sun beds in various parts of the park. Handy transportation from the Atlantis hotel. This was our number one attraction during the entire Dubai holiday.

Not as good as Wild Wadi. After reading poor reviews of Aquaventure we were not going to visit and instead we returned, as always, to Wild Wadi but then we decided to have a second water park day so went to Aquaventure after all and wished we had instead had a second at Widl Wadi.Apart form the good lazy river with rapids the rides are poor and crowded. Also because of the hotels location on the end of the palm it is very hot and although the sunbeds all have canopies little has been done to provide any proper shade.The one good thing that came out of the day trip was that it answered our questions as to whether we would want to stay at Atlantis Hotel in the future, the answer to that is no, the whole place seemed very badly planned, not user firendly and not as interestng as all of the media hype suggests, there are many much better hotels in Dubai. The food here is expensive and poor (Disney style fast food on the whole)If you are choosing bewteen a day at Wild Wadi and a day at Aquaventure go for Wild Wadi!!

Lots to do..... This waterpark in my opinion is slightly better then wild wadi,but to my knowledge does not have ladies nights which is the plus point wild wadi has to its advantage, I think this park has more to do, the kids loved the big house filled with water and slides. Worth visiting.
fun for kids. a really good water park, well built for entertaining youngsters. the river rapid is really long and varied, perfect for keeping teenagers entertained.
WOW!. the rides are great especially the LEAP of faith. This ride is not for the faint hearted. A great day to be had for all young and OLDER/
Food detail. Greek salad was good. Fried chicken bad. Pizza okay.
Aquapark. Better to go in the morning, because later will be a lot of people. Have a lot of fun.

Stay away, unless you want to be treated as a silly tourist. If you would be dropped there and then had your blindfold removed, you'd not be able to tell where you are. Same old stuff as anywhere. Even the artificial concrete rocks are the same as in all other amusement parks. This time with tons of overweight, loudmouth, silly looking tourists wearing swimsuits. Good thing is they don’t sell alcohol in Dubai, so no drunks this time. Don't let your tour operator drag you in a bus and drop you there; there are better places to visit nearby.

Thrills for the whole family. The park is a nice place to stay with a lot of activitet.The dolphines in Dolphine Bay can not been seen or touch, only if you buying the "swim with dolphines tour" but it is expensive.

Good day out. We spent a few hours at the water park. The slides were very good. The park is set out ok but easy to get lost in even though it is not that big. The best ride was the Leap of Faith. Keep in mind that most locals are very modestly dressed so if you want to fit in, cover up.

Shame of Dubai. I must say-I didn't like it at all: too many people, to loud music, very poor offer of food. For children is interesting enough, but poor choice for adults.
And then, after a day in park we were waiting for a taxi 45 minutes. Staff was really unpleasant, they didn't care for the chaos in front of the park.

Fun but bad food - Heston; where are you??. Kids like it, but get some decent food and coffee for the parents.. They are able to make it in Copenhagen "tivoli" with little resources - so buy one decent chef and bring him to town and let him go to work! You can afford Heston now that he's finished with BA and truckers paradise in the UK. Great watermark and gourmet fast food???? Great combo!

Confusing layout, and too many injuries!. We love water parks and this was part of the reason we stayed at the hotel. But this one just didn't click with us. Rides are all intertwined, it was so hard to meet up again if people went off on different rides, and even the lifeguards couldn't really tell you where riders would come out on the other side! The other problem we had was injuries - we all got bruised or bashed on the stone walls, and we saw the medic dealing with at least 4 other people. One poor Russian lady sat next to me for 10 mins waiting for the medic with blood all down her leg - I made her elevate it on her rubber ring and got her some paper towels from the ladies loos! So my advice would be take it easy, take some plasters with you, enjoy Shark Attack which was hilarious, and stay together as a group! By the way, if you're staying at the hotel, you need a blue wristband to get in, which you get from the 1st ticket window on your left. And to view photos after you leave, go to the entrance to the Lost Chambers aquarium and scan your other, yellow wristband.

A good family day out. We arrived at Aquaventure at 10:30am. We were able to use our UAE ID cards for a residents discount. We were able to get a good position in front of the torrent. The children had a great time. There are so many lifeguards on duty there is no need to worry about falling into the water. They enjoyed the torrent and also completed all 7/8 rapids though all agreed the darkness with rapid 3-4 were unexpected yet lasted only 15 seconds long. If you get tired of the waves, the there is Beach access thrown in and a visit to dolphin bay are a must as we saw the dolphins and they are beautiful. Fast Food is reasonably priced and the portions a good size.For the very daring the leap of faith is an option though we didn't attempt it but saw many having much fun it is a 9 second slide from a steep drop.

Great time but not cheap even with 2for1 vouchers. Great fun for whole family with 3 and 5 year old with older boy able to go on "Big rides", just scraping the 1.2m height limit. Not cheap though and we had 2for1 vouchers from The Entertainer book belonging to our resident friends.
it is a must. a huge park with attractions for the whole family you'll enjoy it
