Great fun!. We stayed at Atlantis so you get free entry in and out. It was a busy week being kids halfterm, but we used to go for an hour at about 4pm every evening, and there were no queues and it really wasnt busy, The Leap of Faith off the Ziggurat pyramid was apparently scary - I didnt do it!! - but he bloodcurdling screams of people coming down were amusing to listen to! My son said the Shark attack was good.

Expensive. I thought this was quite an expensive day out - food at is very expensive for families and consisted of mainly fast food. Top tip - Use the Entertainer vouchers. We realised this after the event and 2x250D entry and over 100D on burger and drinks!!!!

More is not always better. I visited Aquaventure and was thrilled but the sheer amount of attractions. However the layout is a bit weird and it is more like a labyrinth. Usually I would have more fun in Wild Wadi...

Great day out for the family, very slick organisation.. All good, although food and drink expensive but no more so than going to the cinema or a theme park in th UK! Incredibly well organised and staff excellent.

Fantastic water fun for all!. Something for everyone. Get there early to get a sunbed or you could hire a cabana in advance. I feel it's quite expensive to get in (we have 3 children so I'd expect that I suppose). Or if you are staying at The Atlantis it's free. Really good fun.

Family Fun. This is a fun adventure park. We were staying at Atlantis so had free access to the park. The buggies from the hotel were brilliant.
Riding on a tyre through a tube trough the shark tank was a unique experience. One downside was the 40AED (£8) for access to a locker in the locker room.

Fun Day at the Waterpark. I spent a fun day at Aquaventure last week. I really enjoyed some of the slides on the Ziggurat, but would say that this water park is better suited for kids. The "Leap of Faith" was thrilling and so was "Shark Attack", but found the selection of slides more timid and not full of the thrills I was seeking. That being said, I still had fun, the park is well kept and staff are very attentative and helpful.
fun. fantastic for kids....they will love it,very well done.
Great fun for the kid in you. There were no children in our party and we all loved it. Seems to be a shortage on double rings. Would have liked to do the dolphin experience but next time.

Great park - very loud music made it less pleasant - food not good. This is absolutely one of the best parks we have visited from an activity perspective. Both small and large children can enjoy the very funny water activities.The beach was not ok - you would not jump into the water for a swim!You should prepare yourselves for loud music if you're there with children and just wish to relax. This makes it less pleasant for parents with children that wish to relax.We purchased food in the burger bar - the pizzas was ok - the burger was basically terrible. I found an half inch fat piece in the burger - and lost my appetite.
:) Amazing :). This place is amazing I went there 10 times I love it you should go there
Water and kids,big and small!. Always a winner-a bit expensive but a lot to keeps the kids and dad(!) busy while mom relaxes!
too expensive for such an attraction. too expensive for such an attraction, a couple of slides and floating on water balloons shouldn't cost that much
awesome. If you miss this then you missed Dubai. Just the beach is enough to pay for the entrance fee. The water park is superb especially the Kids section, this place will not disappoint.

Amazing!. Can easily spend a whole day at this water park.. even if just floating around the park in the tube with a book in hand! Barracuda section is lovely and quiet if any one needs a snooze in the sun while waiting for others enjoying rides!

Fantastic rides, could have more though. Lots of breath taking rides and drops, but not enough rides, and not enough easy going rides. Seems they were all white knuckle (tick for hubby, cross for wifey in our case).
Leap of faith though....wow!
Exciting for the young. The Leap of faith is amazing, but only for the young or young at heart. The pools and sunbathing very enjoyable
A lot of fun. We went with our 1 year old daughter. She loved the toddler pool ( although the water was a tad cold) and the rapids were fun.
Awesome waterpark on the Palm Islands. We loved the waterpark. Come early to get a good chair near the water. Many slides for all ages and also a very big lazy river.
Aquaventure. a relaxing day out ... with my family ...you have the leap of faith and other rides .... good family experience
Good fun. We had great fun, however it was very busy especially around the children's area. The food is expensive however you have to take it.

altantis water park. the rides are very good, although sometimes a little disjointed. The let down with this water park is you need to carry around your tubes all day. Pretty annoying. they need to re think this. The rides are very good and the Leap of Faith is a great ride through the shark tank. the food is what you would expect although a little pricey. A great day out and the Dolphin encounter is amazing. Worth every cent.

Great place for a day in the sun. Great rides, great landscape, clean and not crowded. Queues were small and they move fast. Quite expensive to eat and drink inside but is the same everywhere. A good day out
very nice. its just great!!!u can realax if u like, or go on great rides, super service...all the staff are very helpfull and friendly.the food is ok too.kidz love it

Good fun and very relaxing. The watermark is a must and you stay ideally in the Atlantis Palm. Most times you can get a rate where the waterpark is included. I staid there for business and the family and it is great either or. The watermark has numerous stops with restaurants, bars and beaches to just stop by and relax. The slopes are great fun and doable for everyone. The wave area is really exciting. Take at least half a day to enjoy it. It is cooled water in summer which you need and very nice to chill out.
Great day out. Great day out. We did the dolphin encounter whilst at the park which was well worth the money.
Great fun for kids. My 3 boys had the best time ever according to them...expensive AUD222.00 FOR 1 Adult 3 kids entry but the absolute best rides.

Experiance the under water life. I is very nice. I was the second aqua park I have ever been to. I saw some strange fish. I also saw shark for my first time in life they were very amazing. In the park there is a tube where you go inside to enter the under water world. You can feel that you are diving.
not so adventurous. just okay did not compare well with wild wadis and I really dont like the Atlantis hotel building, it belongs in Disney land

Clean and fun. Loved the waterpark, stayed there from opening hours until they closed. Tryed every waterslide, except the one for the little kids. We had a lot of fun. Loved that you have to use the tubes in the slides, have been to other waterparks, where you are not allowed. And got a lot of pain in my back. So a very good experience, we enjoyed our day here :-)
Ok, but not for the faint hearted!. Take out the scary rides and its not worth the money. Wild Wadi would be better, but the drops and the rapids were awesome. Worth it for those alone.

A great day out. This is my favourite water park ever. There are loads of fast and fun rides, a lazy river and loads of different food and drink stands with a variety of things to choose from. There is also a private beach with views of Jumeira, Burj al arab and the Palm with waiter service for food and drinks and calm water for swimming/cooling down. Would definitely recommend.

Fun, Expensive fun:). This was one aqua park kids enjoyed tremendously! everything was amazing, though we found it all to be on the expensive side, but then again so was most of Dubai! Snacks and drinks certainly overpriced! Kids enjoyed it thought it got chilly by around 4 and had to leave earlier than what they wished for. Highly recommend doing it as part of the Dolphin encounter since it was lovely! Don't buy the pictures they sell take of you in the slide, total waste of money.

nice aquarium design. The staff is very informative and friendly. The design of the aquarium is very interesting. There are pillows in front of the aquariums where you can sit comfortably. The divers inside the tanks are also very friendly even when they are in water. They show great care to kids.

nice to try. it is nice to try once, no much rides for Adults. you can finish all rides in 1.5hr if you go early.
try to be there when gates open to enjoy before queues.

Great day out!. Went here with friends and chose the Atlantis Aquaventure as Wild Wadi was closed for 2 weeks for maintenance (check online if you go out of season!) At the time of writing it was 200AED for an adult day pass (£36) and definitely worth it. The leap of faith slide is incredible and definitely worth a try and also find the shalam slide which is on the other side of the wooden pagoda to the other slides and is probably one of the best ones. Its a two person ride though so pick up a double ring before you get down there as its a bit of a walk. Plenty of space and sunbeds for relaxing, waiter service for food and drinks to your sunbed. Great service, staff really friendly, great fun! Only downside is that the lockers were 7AED each which is only £1.50 but its non refundable and considering its supposed to be one of the worlds best and a 5* water park you'd think they gave you a locker for free - my local council swimming baths even give you your pound back! We shared a locker between 3 with smallish beach bags containing suncream, book, ipod etc, you can easily share one between two.
Excellent. Excellent water park. Be careful if you get tipped out of your rubber ring. The depth of the water is not always very deep as I found out as I cracked the back of my head on the ground.

Clean water Fab time!!!. Brilliant place to spend a daythe relaxing river ride around the park on one of those donuts is the best bit the lagoon is beautiful but the water was little cold so I have got a reason now to visit again!!!!

Great Family Day Out. Lots of exciting rides and fun things to do. The kids will love it and so will the parents. If you can get it with an offer to stay at the Atlantis or use one of the Entertainer vouchers (buy one get one free) it makes it a whole lot better as well! You can spend a relaxing day there or an exciting one depending on what you are looking for. It is obviously better during weekdays as its less crowded..but its quite a great day out with the family whichever way you go! It is also a place that serves alcohol (which is not very common for beaches in Dubai). Enjoy.

perfect for kids 8 and up. Fun for the kids, but keep an eye on them, always..also in the kids section called Splashers.. the park is too huge and the lazy river game for instance has unexpected turns.The shark tank is great fot ages 7 and up but in most of the slides kids should be accompanied. It feels safe as you see many staff members and life guards in every corner. Excellent chicken wings.

Cool!. I went to Aquaventure park on Sunday, UAE's Monday. Barely a wait for some rides although there are only seven rides with another Kiddie area.Unfortunately, after all the fun my family was having, one of my family members was on a ride when she was doing the right thing, smashed her foot against an unknown object. First aid looked at it and said it wasn't bad but it severely hurts her. Luckily, they gave us the ticket price for her ticket ( after that tide, she did not go on any other rides). I highly recommend Aquaventure but they should upgrade the safety among the rides

Super wet fun. Guests of Atlantis, The Palm have free access to this amazing water park but day visitors are allowed. The ride up to the top of the numerous water slides is even more fun than the ride down! Guests are blasted up twisting ramps by water jets, and in some cases, by gentle conveyor belts. Food and drinks are not over-priced and there is plenty to choose from too.

Great Day Out. Aquaventure was great, unfortunately i was there in December and since the water isn't warmed it was very very cold but still amazing to be on a waterpark on a man made island. The rides were great since you could just stay on the tube and you wouldn't need to get off and walk up lots of stairs to get to the slides as the water pushes you up (same as at Wadi Wadi).
Excellent safety for small children. Water slides for children under 120 cm had supersvisors at the top of every slide as well as at the bottom of every slide, very safe!

Great fun for kids. Had an excellent time here, although my 5 year old couldnt go on some of the bigger rides , think the height restriction was 110cm. Great rides, some ending in see through tanks with sharks and stingrays etc swimming around you, quite unforgettable experience
Wonderful!!!!!. Children are enjoying to watch for. More on relaxing.

America's less attractive younger sibling. The park in the Atlantis resort is superb for children under 10 but does not have quite enough thrill rides other than the leap of faith to preoccupy older generations. Friendly staff, completely overpriced food/merchandise and an excellent kids play area
Lovely aqua park. Enjoyed the aqua park, took a short while to get used to where to find the towels etc at the park but loved the rides.

brilliant!. one of the best in the world!
great rides
fantastic day out for all ages.

Wet but good. We got a buy one get one free voucher otherwise this would have been an expensive day out. Theres enough to do for a whole day, plenty of water rides and places to relax. Food is ok and showers and toliet facilities are excellent.

Best Waterpark by miles. We have been to waterparks all over the world and some good ones in America, but this is the best we have ever been to and would recommend, also a visit to the aquarium bit inside - extra but done so well it is amazing.

Fantastic, spent 6 days there in total.. Liked everything, nothing to dislike. Food by poolside can be expensive, check the menu carefully before you order or take a packed lunch and plenty of drinks in a cool box.

Thrilling. We did not try the leap of faith: too scary ... but our kids did!
The facilities and the nice beach are fantastic. Spending a full day is not enough ...
To spend the day. Great atractions, specially for kids but a little spensive

Nice but to artificial!. I really wish the rides where a little more thrilling. The ones from the top are a treat but they are to few and it takes so long to get back up. The park does not allow you to bring your own food and drinks (1 liter of water allowef). this is a scam since costs of food in the park are mindbending!
A fun day in the sun!. I loved this park. It has so many fun rides and you can bask in the sun while having fun. Definitely worth a visit and we will return.
Amazing for kids. This place is so much fun! So many rides, hop on a water tube and follow the rapids, loads of sun loungers, snack bars. Amazing section for kids!

Great day out but v expensive. Kids loved the water park - something for everyone to stay busy for whole day but be warned you cannot take your own picnic lunch you have to buy their food - if you do take your own they insist you throw it away in the bin before they let you through the gate, (unless you have a car or are staying at the atlantis hotel to leave it) - and you cannot get away with it - all bags are checked by security before they let you in.
a lot of fun. very nice to enjoy with family or friends , the food and beverage is quite expensive though

Hold your Breath!. That Leap of Faith was craaaazy!! You just need to hold your breath and wait till you see the sharks...that's when you know you're almost done! :) It's not for the weak hearted, but the entire Aquaventure is so much fun. A perfect day in the sun

Great day out. Lovely water park. It's so open you can easily spend a whole day and alternate between running around the slides and chilling out on sun loungers. It's a pain when it's busy though as there are lots of queues. Still though, good way to cool off in the Dubai heat.

Good day out but Wild Wadi is much better!. We visited here on the last day of our Dubai holiday on a whim. I'm glad we went, but having went to Wild Wadi also, I think Wild Wadi had much better rides and was slightly better value for money. Aquaventure was a bit of a nightmare in the sense that to get on the rides quicker, you had to carry the dinghy up a few flights of stairs, and the ground was absolutely roasting under your feet! The Leap Of Faith is the main slide that goes through the water tunnel with the fish and sharks etc, but if you're a contact lens wearer like me, don't try and open your eyes to see the fish, my lens ripped with the force of the water splashing back.The food and drink was relatively basic fast food, chips, burgers, sandwiches etc, and it was quite expensive. It's the same idea as Wild Wadi with the electronic wrist bands so you don't need to carry soggy bank notes about with you.All in all, a good day but if i was to return to Dubai, i'd go back to Wild Wadi. Better rides, friendlier staff, slightly cheaper and great views of the Burj.

Expensive, but worth the money. AquaventureWe decided to go to the Palm Jumeirah, to the Atlantis hotel and water parc Aquaventure. On the way to it with taxi and back with the monorail. Note: the monorail is nice, but at the final stop you need to take a taxi, because there are no other possibilities. The Atlantis hotel looks very nice, got interesting shops and restaurans, but is off course expensive. Aquaventure is also expensive, but we had a great time. We took the gold deal (with towels, safe, entrance fee and diner). There are some interseting rides, which we all took. Most of them are with tubbs. They have one super fast slide and and the tubb ride between the sharks in the aquarium (also possible to dive) was fantastic. For the kids a super water area with a big parc/playground in the water. At the end of the day we spend a couple of hours on the real beach, viewing the city of Dubai. Last thing was a visit to the Dolphin Bay, but we only took a look.
Love this place. wonderful for relaxtion, on the sunbeds that look like prams withrtheir own shades, lovely waters & tranquil beachvery different to such as Typhoon Lagoon, but just as enjoyable

As much fun money can buy. It surely left a hole in the wallet, but the kids enjoyed every minute. So did I!
The service level, the safety measures, the slides and the river = GREAT!

Good fun!. If you happen to be at the Atlantis for your stay or if you live in Dubai or nearby and you are looking for some fun, you should definitely go there and spend a few hours. There are a few attractions that you can enjoy inside the park.My wife and I also visited the dolphinarium and decided to do the dolphin experience in open water (we had the Entertainer voucher, so we had 50% off). It was the very first time for both of us being so close to a dolphin; it was an amazing experience. The dolphins seem to be kept quite well, or at least that is what we thought (and we hope so!)
Lots of fun. Around 6 or 7 water games, all of them are extremely fun, go ride leap of faith, it worths it :)

OK place. OK rides, not too scary. Wasn't too excited about them. Nice beach. Fun for bigger children. Atlantis very nice to see... Go of you have children. Prefer weekdays for shorter lines.".."................
Fantastic. Kids loved it so much. However, it's quite cold on the day we went there. Needed to wear wetsuit in Dec.

probably the best in the region. i loved the huge landscape specially in this part of the wold. Crowded but fun. I f you are into water parks, you will love it . I loved the huge landscape specially in this part of the world. clean park, food OK and bit expensive.

Expensive but a big hit with kids (and kids-at-heart). After dragging my son around to various mosques and other cultural sights, we decided to take a break and relax at Aquadventure. We did the dolphin encounter program, which although very expensive, was a highlight of the trip for both him and for me. The rides were fun, especially the Leap of Faith, and we enjoyed lounging at the beach as well. A couple of things to keep in mind if you go (based on my one-day experience, which may not be reflective of the everyday situation): * Get there early and go on the rides first, doing the dolphin encounter later. When we arrived there was literally no line for Leap of Faith, in the afternoon we waited more than 20 minutes. * Plan your transportation back. The taxi cue at 5pm was unbelievably long. Arrange in advance for a taxi pickup or a hotel car, or plan to stay a bit longer, maybe getting dinner somewhere at the Atlantis (we went to the buffet at Kaleidoscope and enjoyed it). There was no queue at 8pm.

A great couple of days. We came on 2 consecutive days during this holiday and loved it apart from a few minor niggles. The towel and locker rental is a ripoff at 50aed for the two. Signage is poor at best. We managed to get lost at one point. If you are an adult and plan on riding the rapids do not use the single rings with a bottom in the middle. You end up with too high a centre of gravity and WILL get thrown out of the ring. This hurts. Roll onto your back and let the water carry you to a calmer area. Don't try to stand up in the rapids as you will fall over again and look like an idiot. Don't expect the lifeguards to jump in and help unless you are actually drowning. That is what they are there for.

Waterpark True Dubai style. Great waterpark with an amazing beach & view. Perfect for adults and kids of all ages. Free Golf car buggies available to drop you around the waterpark. Big fan of the gorgeous fresh fruit available, the watermelon was Devine.
Feed the rays or join the Dolphin show!. An amazing experience no matter what age you are! There is quite some ways to get in on discounts, ask some people in your hotel!

Sportive or relaxing. lovely place where you can relax, go for adventurous water tours floating in a plastik ring. There are fast an slow waterrides to choose from or just relax at the pool or at the clean beach

Fun for everyone!!!. Aqua venture has something for everyone!!! Excellent water slides and if your brave enough try the leap of faith!! Amazing views from the top- overlooking the whole of Dubai and gives an amazing view of the Atlantis hotel!Water park has lockers and tower rental for customers and there are plenty of beds around for everyone!!! We found that most people headed for the beds by the swimming pool so we headed for a quieter spot!!We enjoyed our time at Aquaventure but we would also recommend the Wild Wadi water park which is located by the Burj Al Arab.
A lot of rides to go on!. Nice waterpark and alot of water rides didn't get on them all, downside is the foodprices in the waterpark, a total rip off!

Great fun for adults and kids. I enjoyed the rides at the Aquaventure park. Also loved that we were floating around the water park in twin floaters with bottoms to hold children even as young as infants. The bobbing up and down the water just makes them want to sleep. There are areas just for children of small ages that they seem like they were having so much fun. The water photographer takes lovely pictures as you are swimming but the photo prices are very expensive. You would rather take your own pictures. It is also cheaper to combine the lost chamber and aquaventure ticket.

So much fun, even for adults. This is a great waterpark for adults, go in the 'winter' seasons, Nov - Feb, there are very few queues and you can get on rides very quickly.The float through the aquarium is over rater, on the net it makes it look absolutely amazing, however it is rather short and not that exciting, but worth doing anyway. I had a lot of fun with a group of mid 30s and would go back again!

Amazing. This place is HUGE and caters to every person's likes with regard to water slides, etc! Just make sure you go in the morning already, otherwise you will not be able to get seating in the park.
FABULOUS. Go go go - it brings out the child in you - where else can you think you would spend all day bobbing about in a plastic bubble.

high level water park. best water park ever tried especially for children, 100% safe, life guards everywhere taking care of everything, well kept slides, hot water in winter season make it comfortable for my daughter even in December,kids play area is great and big enoughwill definitely go back
Fab. Leap of Faith was amazing, my 6 year old was the youngest to do it with no fear !!!
AMAZING. one of the best places to go in the summer total magic really

Great Water park. My favourite water park.You can go round all day without getting out if you want.Conveyor systems take you to different heights.Also has a beach area.Not the cheapest of water parks but their is a lot of water
lovely. Lots of slides, good area for children to play in, comfy loungers
a little dissapointed. very busy, expensive, only a couple of big slides, rapids were fun, think wild wadi better for younger children. no wave pool
fun day out. the ride into the shark pool is so cool...the facilities are good but not as nice as wild wadi atmosphere

Dolphin bay is a must. Go to the dolphin bay and enjoy the experience. Take ur kids, but don't if they are below 4. If you are not staying at the hotel, take u shampoo as even with 900 dhs per person, you need to take ur own shampoo bottle!! The album and USB for 1100 dhs is epensive, yet, this s what. Take with. Home to impress ur friends.
Water Fun. Very nice, but hasn't got the amount of exhibits as the Wild Wadi

A well-maintained, well-run, water adventure. Unlimited access to the park is one of the outstanding perks of staying at the Atlantis. If you are planning a vacation with young children, you cannot go wrong with staying at the Atlantis.The park is well-maintained and well-run. It is clean and the equipment is new. The slides, handrails, beach furniture, towels and floats are all clean and new. The theme-ing, meaning the landscaping and the facades in the park are all clean and well-maintained. You don't get the feeling that you're walking into an ageing theme park that's seen better days and where you have to worry about the safety of your young. That's the other thing, there are lifeguards with ambu-bags, life-floats and first aid fanny packs every which way you turn.Staff are friendly and helpful and professional; no bored teenagers working summers here. We got turned away at the Ziggurat for not meeting the height requirement, 1cm shy, but I appreciated the staff for doing their jobs and keeping the park and rides safe.The center attraction is the Ziggurat which has 4 rides, the biggest and most famous of which is the Leap of Faith. You can always catch season 18 of the Amazing Race for a demo. Awesome! The rides all end up in the "River" which has a course that runs all around the park picking up riders. You can get in or out at many points along the course and all over the park. You can choose to lazily float along and eventually choose to follow a tidal driven course (Torrents), where huge waves come along and rush you along the course or Rapids where you go down a series of rapids which simulates a white-water experience.There are single floats or tubes and Two-bies (what the kids and I called them).There's also a Kid's Island with a huge drenching bucket, slides of all sorts and wildly-colored water spouts, faucets and sprinklers. Also the warmest part of the park if you're visiting in winter.

Best thing we did in Dubai. The most amazing water park I have been to :) it was great for families even with diff age groups, from my 3yr old cousin to my 90 year old grandfather - Everyone had a great time!My grandfather didnt swim though, but he was happy roaming around on his wheelchair.If you don't want to bring your own towel, you can get the locker and towel combination for 50aed. Locker is at 40aed each, just add 10aed more for the towel. Pretty pricey for a locker.We only got a few lockers to put our valuables and the rest that cant fit anymore, we brought it with us and left it on a beach chair and luckily nothing was lost even after leaving it for hours unsupervised.The locker room is pretty small to accomodate the whole park, there was a long line for the showers and changing rooms - at the end of the day. Cold but the water was warm and nice. Its cold when your wet and your walking around to transfer attractions/pools, or waiting for your turn on the slides. They have a beach with a great view, but the sand is not nice. We were allowed to bring water inside the park. The park was open from 10am - 530pm. Wish we had more time :)

Absolutely brilliant slides and rides. Definitely go here - whatever your age. Fantastic slides of all degrees of scarriness and ease. If you want a leisurely time you can just cruise round the river route in your ring! Or take the Plume of Death for a total thrill!

Great water park with views of Dubai. Loved the water park at the Atlantis, great way to laze away the day with the lazy rides sitting in the rubber rings taking you to each ride, walking along the beach with spectacular views of Dubai or just sunbathing. Very relaxing.....
Good to visit. Aquaventure park has something for everyone. Kids area, one of the tallest slides, river ride experience.

Good family fun. We stayed at atlantis so acces the pool 3 times. was fun but lockers are like £8 a person... extortionate! kids slides are so much fun and there are lots of staff and lifeguards so you feel really safe. didnt go on the big slides as was with the little ones and you have to be 1.2m to do all the rides.
Fun place. A fun place and sufficient num,ber of rides to keep you busy for a day. well mantained and safety gaurds all over and very friendly and helpfull.
Best in the World. Great water park nothing beats it, Dare you try the "Leap of Faith"

Arrgggggghhhhh. excellent rides and great facilities - a bit expensive - use the entertainer book to lessen the dent in your wallet/purse, beware you may have to get your swimming costumes surgically removed after the leap of faith

Dolphin experience a must.. Excellent experience with dolphins. Price includes entry to Aqaventure too. Booked early session then spent all day in park followed by Aquarium and dinner in the many Atlantis restaurants.
Kids loved it!!. Excellent waterpark a bit pricey 200 aeds per person but definitely worth every penny free parking and u definitely need to take the leap of faith!!!

Complicated but fun. Booking in was tricky as the offer you deals with food, towels and lockers. But you can only eat in 2 resturants and its NOT cheap. They search your bags with a stick so you could perhaps be a little flexible with what you take in - if you get my drift! I believe you are allowed to take in a bottle of water They could do with better signs for getting around and working out the rides.It was pretty chilly with a bit of a wind on the day we went - I wouuld not reccomment anyone goes on a day like this it was flippin freezing at times and the wind really blows when you are up a tower!! The whole thing works on a big river that you can use a ring to go around the park and all of the rides feed in to this. There is a tower and there are about 5 rides that come from that. One of the rides requires you to have a double ring but we did not know this until we had walked for some distance to the start ! finding the start is an adventure of its own :( We also got the the begining of some of the rides to find that they had no rings.... Take your ring with you and make sure you find a pumped up one! We walked some way to find one of the 2 eateries only to find it closed so again quite a long walk to find the other.. Burgers is the choice.They have changing rooms, lots of small lockers with a nifty locking system. the ladies had cubicles for changing and about 8 showers. 8 toilets and 5 sinks with the mirrors above them. Thats it. I feeel that the facilities were very inadequate, it was full and the park was not busy as it was a cool day, I cant imagine what it would be like on a busy day. The rides were fun and a good work out as you walk quite a bit. We had a good time on them The beach area is lovely and there a several areas to sit and chill and watch the people drift by all with great free sun beds.I did not make it to Wild Wadi so cant compareI would only go again on a hot day!
Fun. Amazing rides, great views and fun all over, this is a must if in Dubai especially when the weather is warm and nice.

Best water park we've been to. Excellent value for money, lazy river was far from lazy. You cruise along for awhile and then come across some small rapids which the kids loved. Very safe lots of lifeguards. The queues for the rides were not too long and plenty to choose from. A definite for families with kids
Fun. The rides are good but I prefer Wild Wadi - but you do get the advantage of being on the beach.

New Water park. It has not only waterpark, but good beach.
Advice: take gold ticket.

So fun!. I looooooved Aquaventure. It's a bit expensive but definitely worth it. I have never seen a waterpark this epic in my life yet! I felt like I was 8 again.There were lineups for the slides and such but they were tolerable. It was running at a good capacity especially since December is the "busy season". Also the staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely come back.
Excellent. Don't forget to use your entertainer voucher for park admission and for sharkbites restaurant. Good beach also. Changing rooms get too crowded at closing time.

Great fun for kids and adults. Great water park, loads of rides to choose from, get there early to avoid the crowds. The beach area is a bit odd, I couldn't shake the feeling that I was in The Truman Show!

Great way to spend the day!. If you too lazy to stand in queues to slide this is the place for you! You can sit in your tube and go around and around the water slides for hours without having to get out of your tube!!! Or for the adrenaline junkies - slide down the Temple of Doom through the shark tank!

Great Park. If you have little children make sure they are over 1.2 Metre's tall otherwise they cannot use the slides in the kiddie park. Travellator up to some of the rides can become a little tiresome and it couldn't definitely use more water in the rides. The Leap of Faith is fantastic for the brave or the lazy river for the less energetic

Water Experience!!. If you are a water baby and take to water like a fish, then this is definitely the place for you!! Attached as part of a plethora of attractions to The Atlantis Hotel in Dubai, this is a must do for even a first timer here. You get individual lockers to stash all your stuff into including your valuables. Just strip down to your swimming trunks and you're ready to go!!!!  The Aquaventure itself is this huuuuge expanse of water, like an oversized swimming pool with a ton of plastic boards and equipment floating all around, just cling onto one and you can swim or splash around. It is interconnected with other towers and steep water slides for the adrenaline junkies!! For the faint at heart, you can just keep floating away with the inbuilt wave pool, carrying you and the 10 second huuuge wave lifting you and literally creating a splash!! I forgot my age and where I was, when I was carried into this huge underwater passageway and let loose my lung power when the wave carried me away!!! It's absolute fun and frolic here and it builds up your appetite for the huge buffet menu at the Kaleidoscope Restaurant in the same vicinity. Coming all the way to the Atlantis which is quite a while away from downtown Dubai, and not doing this, is a waste of time!!

spectacular views. it was an exhillarating experience on the way to the top. the sights and sounds were spectacular..one can imagine the view from the top as far as your eye can see. toilet facilities at the top were excellent. and a reasonably priced souvenior kiosk as well. we enjoyed 360* views...wow

Fun!. The waterpark is a wonderful place, especially for kids. The dolphin experience is one of my lifes highlights. The only problem is its too short for what you pay. The second thing is the photos are quite expensive as well. The slides and lazy river are a lot of fun. They do sometimes carnival nights where the waterpark is open till late and fireworks are displayed with different entertainment acts and the kids enjoyed that a lot. If you can go on weekdays rather than weekends it would be better. Girls going alone together can be an issue as men can be quite rowdy. Not to be missed though!

Fantastic fun. Just got back from Aquaventure a few hours ago. All in all we had a great time, and for us (a young couple late twenties/early thirties) we preferred this to Wild Wadi Park, also an enjoyable park, but one we found to be much more family orientated and busy. The rides at Aquaventure were generally fast and quite exciting and there were plenty of sun loungers to be found, so need to stress out and about getting there early.One of the best attractions is the Lazy River which is vast and includes some nice rapids along the way and of course a ride which plunges you into an aquarium. Facilities at the park were good and well maintained. Cost:* Price of an adult ticket is not cheap - 200 DHS per adult, so a Buy One Get One Free voucher from the Entertainer book is advisable. * Towel rental is 30 DHS  Locker rental 40 DHS  A towel and a locker together is 50 DHS.* Food was quite dear but par for the course for these types of places. We paid 110 DHS for two meals (Fried chicken, chips and a drink). Food at Wild Wadi was cheaper and a lot nicer - there an average meal seems to cost around 35 DHS compared to 55 at AV. * Don't underestimate how long it will take you to get there and how much it will cost. Unless you live or stay around the Palm, you must factor in about 50 DHS for a taxi. The Monorail which leads to the park, also costs 15 DHS one way, per person but has some very nice views. Park Atmosphere:Despite going at the weekend (Friday), the park was really quiet and we barely had to wait any time for the rides at all - normally an average of 5 minutes per ride at most! The one exception was when a group of five people held up the whole queue by asking the flume controller to pump up each of their inflatable rings. They should really have a separate station for this as we waited 15 minutes until he was finished and resumed sending people down the ride!The rides were all very good but I can understand when people say that the park lacks variety. Many were very similar, it is true and it is a shame that they didn't have a few more different rides, such as the ones, one finds at Wild Wadi.Pros:* Fast rides* Nice atmosphere* Very little waiting time* Not too crowded* Good changing facilities and showers* The ride through the aquarium was wonderful and very memorableCons:* Could be more rides* Park expensive without a voucher* Not as well organised as Wild Wadi - no maps were supplied* Food quite expensive and of questionable quality.Summary:Having tried and enjoyed both Aquaventure and Wild Wadi, we prefer the former, simply because the rides are more exciting and better thought out and because the queue time seems to be much better. Families with children, however, are probably better off going to Wild Wadi, as there are more child friendly rides and the food is cheaper.Overall, we would give the park 4.5 out of 5.
Love it!. We loved the water park! We went there twice! The rides were fun. We also loved the lazy style tube ride. The "Shark Attack" slides was very interesting.
Wet and Fun. The river that runs all around the park is great, just sit on the rubber ring and go with the flow. Plenty to see and do
good value. great thing did not have long cues no waiting, not many rides. clean and loads of staff about.But you have to pay extra for lockers and when finished walk stright on to beach

Nice but for bigger kids really. Not really suitable for 2-3 years old. A number of the water rides were restricted and I think they would mainly please bigger kids like 6-7 years old and above. The big very steep water slide was scary to do.
Very Cool for Adults and Kids. Such a great water park. Went with my girlfriend, and we had a total blast. Worth the money.

Not really worth it. Glad we did it, but not really worth the money. There are not many rides and it closes at sunset. So, if you go, make sure you go early when it's warm because I found the water cold in the afternoon.

Very Very Good. Great - if a little on the small side for a waterpark - staff can be a little overbearing at times - some let our smallest child on stuff and the next person on duty wouldn't. Great thing to do is snorkelling in the big pool that the slides go through - snorkel with rays, guitar fish & sharks - you get to keep the snorkel too and the staff on this section were so, so good!
Fantastic!!!!!!. Amazing day trip here!!! We went on all the rides and I had already booked in advance swimming with dolphins, unforgettable experience :)
Great Experience. Clean and very big park, but very busy for some games you should wait around 10 minutes to try.
Atlantis Aquaventure. A bit pricey, but well worth it! Great day out for the family! Lots of fun!

Good extra with Dolphin Encounter. Included in our Dolphin Encounter. Huge lazy river/rapids. Lots of slides. Choice of places to eat was good and not too expensive. Great day out during our stay in Dubai. Dolphin Encounter was very informative and a brilliant chance to get up close with the Dolphin, highly recommend it.

great. very nice reception, great aquarium, helpful staff .
we had great party at the dolphins pay .

Great park, loads of fun!. - went w/ my wife on a Thurs in Nov 2011- bigger and better than Wild Wadi according to research, haven't been to both myself- avoid on Fri and Sat- $55 (AED 200) per person; locker & towel is an additional $13- 2 for 1 coupon in entertainer book, family edition- entertainer book kiddy edition also has coupon, but for kids- plan on spending 4-6 hours here- Rides are fun, however many rides "are all the same." I would divide the rides into 4 categories. Leap of faith, shark attack, grand rapids, and all the rest - single or double person tubes, there were more than ample available- lines were short on this Thurs- given wrist bands which operate the lockers, saw several people having trouble operating this- beach is picturesque with good photo opportunities (nice background skyline)- no idea about food, didn't eat there

Wasnt worth the trip!. To be fair, let me tell you that we first went to Wild Wadi and visited Aquaventure a cpl of days later - and were truly disappointed with it - especially when compared to the facilities...will leave the fun part aside.Firstly, there werent many tubes around as we were looking to enter the rapids. I was with my wife and son (7yrs) and when I asked for assistance, the guy said tersely - I got to find myself. Told him that I could not find any and he acted to look but gave me a look enuff that sorry, I cant help on this. We managed just one double tube and thought best that my wife go with my son and I will follow later when I get one - which I got one after 2 hours!Secondly, the food options are very limited and are very expensive! For AED 70, you get half melon, half pine apple and one coconut water.Third - it was hot when we went there - and the ground was scorching. True, you cant help that - but Wild Wadi had an answer to it - they had sprinklers all around that kept the ground wet and conducive to walk.Fourth - You can rent a towel for AED 70 (again expensive - can buy one in that) - but perhaps Aquaventure dosent believe in giving its guests a refreshing experience after the end of the day! Sample this - the doors in the shower are transparent with a mild opaque film, but yes ppl outside can see thru, there are no latches/ locks inside the shower room and there are no hooks either! Sad indeed.
Expensive but worth it. The rapids go on and on and are great fun. The rides thru the pyramids are fast but we went several times until the very end.

Fun. It is a child's paradise ( and adults). I was quite happy to grab a sunbed and watch the others in the rapids and the shark attack. Also the dolphins were brilliant, we were there from 11 am till 8pm and still didn't want to leave

Tame experience. I have had much more wild experiences in London where I live and in Mexico when I went there for my honeymoon, but if its included in the price of your stay at the Atlantis then go there everyday. We stayed there for a couple days and fould atlantis to be a brilliant hotel, yes the price is steep, but it has to be experienced at least once.
Must Visit!!. Has the most amazing water activities!.Go well-equipped since the shops there are expensive.

BETTER THAN WILD WADI BUT MORE RIDES WOULD BE BETTER AND SLIDES. I visited wild wadi and atlantis and i have to say atlantis is better. It has shorter ques and is cleaner too. The rides here also provide a much better thrill than those at wild wadi.The charges for having a locker are extortionate , oh and you should purchase the entertainer dubai book to get the buy one get one free vouchers.
Great Water park. Really had a good day , good rides and very safe with lot's of life guards .

Fun Day. Visited the water park on 2 occassions and thoruoughly enjoyed it. Found that the ques were not to bad and got on the rides fairly quickly. The only downpoint is that there is not enough family rides for younger children.

Average compared to Wild Wadi. Having come here the day after Wild Wadi we felt a bit let down. Bar the lazy river and the Leap of Faith we found the rest of the rides a bit poor. If you have younger kids this water park may suit you more over Wild Wadi

AWESOME fun!. We went to Atlantis mainly for the swimming with the dolphins experience and to see the spectacular hotel. We were really pleasantly surprised to find out that the water park entrance was included too. We were in the water park within about half-an-hour of it opening and had a brilliant time. Never had to stand in a queue for longer than five minutes or so. Most of the rides, we just managed to get straight on. After about a couple of hours, you could begin to see the park was getting V busy and the queues were getting crazy long. Def get there early to enjoy your 'space'.The loungers are quite a pain to get hold of. We were okay as we got there early (as I have already mentioned hundreds of times...sorry!) and we did what everyone else did...just put our towels, sun lotion...unvaluable items on the loungers and kept them as 'ours' - yes, definitely very cheeky, but that's what majority of the people were doing, so it was the only way to ensure we had somewhere to sit/lye down. The guards are quite cool - we had a little cheap Kodak waterproof disposable camera and they took pics of us - am on the wrong laptop right now...will upload some photos later.The female changing rooms were very crowded by the time we were leaving, so if you prefer a private cubicle, you'll probably have to wait a few moments.

Amazing rides. Amazing water rides and an excellent place to laze around in water. It is an excellent park. You need a full day to enjoy the park. If you plan a half day tour you will feel you have missed out on a lot of things.
Wonderful place to spend time with family. Very safety and clean place with good services. Don't miss it while your Dubai holiday

Interestinfg water slide which is the main attraction. Not for the weak hearted. It is a great water theme park, which lots of activities to keep teenagers occupied for at least a day, while the parents can shop at the nearby shopping malls.

Fab day out for any ages (family or couples) and the Dolphins were fantastic!. We read the reviews and went to the waterpark on a Wednesday and arrived at the Atlantis for when it opened at 10am.First, we checked in (we had pre-paid, as we booked a dolphin adventure so we got free water park entry included in this.) Then we each got a wrist band and we each put 100 on it and bought a locker. We put our stuff in a locker and went straight out to stick our towels & flip flops on a sun lounger and grabbed a double tube! We went on all the rides, there was no queue at this time of day. You can use a floaty-tube on all of them apart from the highest one, which you have to go down alone and tube-less! We had a fantastic time, and went on the rides & the lazy river up until about 1pm, when it started to get busy and there were queues forming on the rides. Thankfully, we wisely booked our dolphin adventure for 2ish so we abandoned the tubes, had a bite to eat & a drink and went to 'Dolphin Bay.' Although the double tubes were popular, we found that we saw a lot of them abandoned at the exits to the lazy river, so we would not have had a problem getting another one if we let go of the one we had. We also arrived back to our sun loungers to find our towels & flipflops still there (we had read reviews about things getting stolen, but this was not the case and we chose sunloungers in one of the central/busy locations.) We just brought a couple of our hotel towels with us, and are glad we did not bother buying/renting any. After walking around, down to view the beach, and having a quick bite to eat, we were both pretty much dry. We visited in November, and did not find it too hot to walk around without shoes on.Dolphin Bay was fantastic, we went all out and booked a Royal Swim and we were not disappointed. We got up close & personal with the dolphins, had some fantastic photos and have some lovely memories. We were on our Honeymoon, and it was a really special thing to do. If we come back in a few years time with our young children, we would definitely take them to Dolphin Bay. In our group were 2 young children (aged approx 7 & 10) who did it alone whilst their parents watched, and they were in safe hands and really enjoyed themselves. The photos you can buy from Dolphin Bay are crazily expensive as with most of these places. A nice touch is that you get a complimentary towel & drink after your swim with the dolphins. We used this towel to dry off properly once we walked back to the changing rooms at the Waterpark (they are near the entrance, and it really is not that far. It is probably only a 5 min walk from most areas of the waterpark, probably about 10 min walk from Dolphin Bay.) We got back to the changing rooms about 4pm and it was quite busy! In the ladies changing room, women were glamming themselves up properly by washing & drying their hair and doing their makeup in the mirrors, which were a bit busy. I just got changed, brushed my hair and tied it up and decided to wash properly when I got back to the hotel to avoid the crowd of ladies around the mirrors and hair dryers (you pay for the hair dryers, by the way.) This was a wise move, as there was a queue for the taxis when we got to the entrance of the hotel! We waited about 15 minutes and we noticed there was a lack of normal taxis but lots of 'posher' hire cars (most of them either black or white.) We enquired, and ended up getting one of the un-marked posher taxis back, but we had to agree with the taxi driver that he would start the meter at the same price as a normal marked taxi, and so our drive back to our hotel in Dubai Creek cost the same in the posher car as it did in the marked taxi! (but make sure you check this before you get in!!!!)We stayed in Dubai Creek and including tip, it cost just 70 each way out to The Atlantis Hotel/waterpark (which is about £12! Bargain!) The Journey takes about half an hour from Dubai Creek and probably about 20 minutes from the Dubai Mall area.

Simple the best for family fun. A hot place like Dubai and the latest waterpark venture is most definitely a recipe for success. Just a word of warning when you go on one the long water rides it throws you in a maze of water canals and you can easily get lost from you family.

Great Day at the waterpark. Great water park with a difference, we really enjoyed it and there really want many lines considering it was a very busy period.Great touch with the slide through the aquarium

Great fun. This water park was lovely. We had coupons for the park so we got buy on get one free, which made it more reasonable. All parts of the park were very clean and well kept and the water was lovely. I would advise when putting money on your wrist band for food/drink etc. put a little more then you would usually, the food and drink are a little pricey. But over all a really good fun day out.
SUPER!!!. Don't think I'll find a better aqua park than this one. Really so beautiful, great slides, enough boats... super amazing!!!
Most amazing aqua park ever. No words to describe, really a super great park. Great slides, beautifully build up. The slides are cool, enough boats for everyone, really amazing!

Fun family day!. We really liked this experience. We were invited by a friend and has a blast. It was not summer time and this make it really nice. Food was ok, crowd was nice and our son has great mamories.
kids paradize. kids will enjoy as well as he parents. Ideally it's better with kids above 5 to 6 years old.
amazing fun for the whole family!. great place, quite expensive, but a dream come true for kids!

fun water ride. especially ideal to go on a hot summer day... the rides and fun and relaxing. the most heart-beating adventurous ride was the "leap of faith" the highest slide in the venue. lasts fo about 10-13 secs and a deep lunge into the pool, freakin awesome!:)
Great place to visit with or without child. Fun place for both grown ups and kids at all age, nice beaches inside aquaventure as well. A must be place when visit Dubai.
Exciting familly leisure. Must take a locker to keep your cloths, bags and shoes so that you can be free to enjoy all the rides

Great day out. This was my second visit and I'll probably go again. Almost on a par with Wild Wadi, although a few things let it down. As a Dubai resident, we got cheaper prices so worth checking out. The rides are very good. The standard slide rides are better and faster than Wild Wadi, but there is only one 'thrill ride' ( the leap of faith) rather than the three at Wild Wadi. This is the one that hurtles you through the middle of a shark tank (although you go so fast you can't see anything). I think Aquaventure is probably the best choice for families and you can also go and see the Dolphins. One negative point it that the lockers are next to the entrance - a long way from the rest of the park so quite frustrating if you want to get anything from them! Overall though it's got to be one of the world's best waterparks.

Pricy but good family fun, not huge selection for those under 3. Its a waterpark filled with enough to do to spend an afternoon. Its not the hugest waterpark so you can cover it in a couple hours however if travelling with young toddlers, the choices of water play areas are a bit limited.

live the excitment in real life. love the excitment and speedy rounds and circles in atlantis water park it was such a beatifull and nice time we spend under the sun playing and enjoying the fresh exotic fruits.
marvllous experience. experience the enjoyment in water it is nice and relaxing

A great day!. This is the place to come with your family or a group of friends. You can stay in your tube all day and float along, or be shuttled (in your tube) up to the waterslides. Basic fair food is available and be sure to pack your sunscreen!

Wow water park in middle of the gulf. This is one of the great places if you have friend or family to go to and spent full day with lots of fun in the water and sun , also if you are keen to swim with dolphins then book for that , it is a bit expensive but it is once in your life , enjoy it
too much fun!!!!. If you love abit of adventure and thrill,this place is great!!! the rides are amazing and its a perfect place to cool off in the heat of Dubai!
Excellent. This is my favourite part of visiting Dubai. Top class.

Competitive amenities!. Its a great park.. beach, wave pool, rapids, lazy river and tunnel rides.. There's all that a water park has to have! Maybe some mor!! You should visit Wild Wadi waterpark also!!

Better 2nd time round. We went here two years ago and weren't convinced it was on a par with Wild Wadi BUT we have changed our minds now. The children loved it and the extra space, newness of the park now makes it our fav...sorry WW!
not just for kids. This took me back to my childhood, the waterslides were great. The man made beach and lazy river were great for relaxing.

Love that place!. Atlantis is one of biggest attraction in Dubai, I was there for 1 day trip and had so much fun at water park,so I would recommend this park to all people who travel or Solo or with company or with kids. Several swimming pools,for adults and children,water activities, food courts and chamber of lost town. Great place to stay whole day!

WHAT FUN. This park is wonderful, I could have sailed round the lazy river all day. The sun beds are wonderful and there are so many rides for all the family. The whole park is beautifully done and an excellent day out.
loved it - who wouldn't. loved the organisation, the safety, the lack of crowds and the value for money (it was free thanks to a voucher from the hotel).

Super Fun. Aquaventure was so much fun. We stayed at Atlantis so admission was free.The slides were amazing specially the shark attack & the vertical drop one. The lazy river was very relaxing. If you pay a little extra you get to book a cabana with a private area that serves complimentary beverages it was great. Don't miss dolphin bay!!

totally amazing place. Husband and I visited this water park and also the Atlantis Hotel whilst in Dubai to see last years Grand Prix. Wonderful place, as is all of Dubai. I really didn't think that I would like all the concrete but its mind blowing. The park was scrupulously clean and all the staff very helpful. Do visit the sea life (Atlantis) whilst there - makes ours in the UK look like paddling pools! Very reminisant of Stargate Atlantis on TV.Overall good value for money.
Beautiful..... We spent an adventure afternoon with dolphins!!! It was simply wonderful....The place is perfect, staff friendly. Everything perfect

Great water park. Aquaventure is similar to the nearby Wald Wadi water park, however travelers staying at the Atlantis get to use the facility for free, otherwise it is a pricey option. Food & Drinks are expensive as with other parks. The highlights are the 61m long Ziggurat and the Shark Attack tunnel, but be prepared for long queues for your turn.

A waterpark for everyone. Wasn't sure if we were too old for a day at the waterpark, but my husband and I had a really good time. There are lots of water attractions for all ages, flumes, lazy river, rapids etc and even though it was quite busy there were plenty of inflatables to use. Get there early to get a sunbed, although most of the time you just use it as a base to leave your towels. Have a stroll to view the dolphin enclosure and see the views of the Dubai skyline from the beach. Only negative for us was the queue at the end of the day to get a taxi.

Great day out. Worth arriving at 10 when it opens to get a good place to sit for the day. We were disappointed not to be able to take our own water in - drinks were expensive. A great fun day. Worth doing the slides in the morning as the queues built up in the afternoon. Expensive but worth it for a special day out. Worth spending a bit of time on the beach.
so colorful. you have to see different fish and swim with them.It was soo colorful

Good day out. Good day out and nice concept no need to carry cash once there as they give a wristband and you put money onto it... Will be back next year , only downside is the price of photos . four photos in a wallet was around £75

Awesome day out. I have been to Dubai many times for work but have never been to the Water Park before.We booked online and had no trouble when we arrived, no queues to speak of....place was lovely and clean and we managed to get a couple of sunbeds on the Lagoon beach.For those that say its a rip off and expensive.....aren't all theme parks (what this basically is but with water rides), you don't expect to go to Thorpe Park or Alton Towers in the UK and eat there cheaply or the entrance to be cheap????To be honest we didn't think any of the prices were that bad....and lets face it you don't come to Dubai on a budget holiday...if you want that got to Crete or some other hateful bucket and spade package tour holiday destinationAll in all we had an awesome time and would highly recommend it to anyone...we will be going back again!

great day out. Used an entertainer voucher so saved 200dhs, loaded that onto the wrist band for the need of the day. Went on a thursday and while busy there were not long lines and it was easy enough to get rings and sunloungers. Plenty of lifeguards. Prices of drinks etc were what you would expect from a tourist area, had to buy sunscreen though and the price was way over the top.Had a great day and would recomend to families with older kids, my daughter is 11.
good family resort.clean. good for a relaxing day, but long queues..................
Release the inner child. A very enjoyable day was had by all, whether the beach or the rides or the lazy river (my fav) there is something for all

Breathtaking Water rides for Pure Fun. The Atlantis Water Park is a must visit when in Dubai.The Water park experience was truly out of the world experience.I must see this particular water park takes care for entertaining all age groups.Best part is their security at all levels to make you feel all the more safe when on rides.There are life guards at every 10 meters happily assisting you.Some breath taking rides such as Leap of Faith and Shark Tank are highly recommended for people looking forward for sheer thrill.Food counters are easily available.Though the price were a bit steep at 200 Dhs per person when we visited but its worth every penny for a life time water park experience.Recommeded specially for Family travelling.A must see!!!!!
new type of activity. new type of activity, you slide inside a tube of water which surounded by water

Great way to spend a day!. Had a fab day riding the slides and the lazy river. It wasn't busy when we visited and there were no queues for any of the rides so we could go on and off as often as we pleased. The near vertical drop slide was amazing - a great adrenelin rush and worth a go at least once!!!!

Great water park - makes for an excellent day out. We really loved this water park. The lazy river is a great way to spend a day in the sunshine and there are some great rides. If I was being critical then I would say that £100 for 2 adults is expensive and they could use a few more rides but having said I'll that I would absolutely go back if in the areas.

Great day!!!. Really great day, so much fun....! You can buy a combined ticket for the aquarium and the waterpark for 250 dhs.... only extra cost is if you want your stuff stored in a locker. There is no need for renting several lockers, you can share.
Too busy. the park was good for a short amount of time the rides are quite repetative and it was too busy and commercialised

Expensive. It is a clean park but very busy at holiday times with queues. The tube rides are good for all ages and the food options aren't bad but expensive. It costs £10 for locker and towel on top of entrance fee so beware.

Excellent day ;but very expensive.. Made the mistake of not getting there early the que for tickets was horrendous.Learnt our lesson No 1; Buy your tickets on the internet before cheaper and quicker. Food and drink is very expensive, thankfully we had brought some stuff with us. but had our lunch in a burger bar and it was over £40 for 2 adults 2 kids burger meals.Get there very early to get a lounger, we arrived before midday and there was absolutely nothing left. we ended up under a tree on the beach area.However this was quite pleasant and a lovely view across the estuary; would recommend.Thankfully the rides were brilliant and the kids loved it. the lazy river has parts which are NOT lazy!.we loved it and was a great change to just bobbing along.The que were not long considering the amount of people in the park.Unfortunately we had to wait over 1 hour for a taxi to get home. HOT TIP..leave a little earlier and get ahead of the que .The mono rail down the palms is an absolute RIP OFF.. don't even bother to price it . Taxis are really cheap.
Great overall. It was a good experience for someone who has never experienced a water park. Limited rides but fun.
Huge fun. Spent hours here - get there early for a sunbed. Huge fun and would have happily returned day after day.
The BEST fun. Spent endless hours shooting down rapids, plunging down terrifyingly high water slides, wafting around on large rubber rings. Huge fun.
better than florida. So much better than wet n wild! Flumes that go through aquariums, just amazing!
just fun. Loved the hydrocoster, its a bit annoying that you have to go through the lazy river again and again to get access to some of the slides

Great for the kids!. We stayed at the Atlantis, which obviously gave us access to the park. Unfortunately, the process in place to ensure that only people who pays get in was not working at all. The second day we did not even get bracelet and no one had asked us at the entrance if we had paid or were guests of the hotel. However, the beach was nice, the kids were on their own (12,11,10,9,8) and we felt very relaxed as staff were all over the place. We even lost one child and within ten minutes the staff found her. Attraction are well maintained and fun for everyone. The leap of faith is something you need to do, you do not have time to feel the speed. Food is ok and drinks are good, the best is you can charge it to your room so no need to take cash ir credit card. Enjoy! And your kids will want to stay more but will sleep right away.

OK - but for not as good as expected. I love waterlands and slides and had really looked forward to Aquaventure at Atlantis the Palm, Dubai. However there where only 6 rides, 5 with a tube that where quite simular and one freefall without a tube. Except the freefall one could keep the glasses and hat on all the time without risk of loosing them - that tells a little about the "wildness" of the rides. There is also a rafting-river all round the compound (where the slides end up), unfortunately it is so slow water that one needs to jump out of the tube and swim / walk.The settings are really nice and it is themed very well, but the rides are not up to its promising. We went there with kids 7-12 years old, the 7 year thought everything was perfect, the other thougt it was OK but not thrilling. Compared to Wet´n Wild in Orlando the rides are really lame.The place is very well staffed with people about every 10th meter, also in the pools. There are a couple of snack-places, coffeshops etc inside, actually I think the prices are reasonalbe (compared to Disneyland etc). Towels & locker could be rented for a total of 50. Over 120 cm are classified as adult - entrance fee AED 200. However if you have opportunity for a Family Enterainer you can get three coupons "buy one get one free" saving lots of money!If you go there tip:1. Buy Entertainer Dubai to save money on entrance2. Be there when they open - then you can get "reserve" sunbed with you towels (free of charge) - after 12 it is often hard to find3. Go on the rides - was no lines before noon for us4. Take your car - they have not organized any transportation FROM the place. When they close (sunset) there is a 50 meter line for taxi. If you instead take the monorail there is note even a taxistand or anyway to get a ride from there. Someone have not been thinking or it is planned that everyone drive their own car?If you are short on time in Dubai, chose something else. I guess you could find a simular or better waterpark in any major vacation-area.

Queue, queue and more queue's.. We arrived at approximately 10.15am. The queue's were small, but it still took approximately 15 minutes for us to gain entry into the park even though we had pre booked tickets. After this time the queue's became significantly bigger.The changing facilities were adequate, although one of our wristbands for the lockers did not work. However we did not have to queue up with the masses to sort this out, one of the staff organised a replacement wristband.Even though we arrived early, we could not find any available sunbeds which was slightly disappointing. We soon found out that to go on most of the rides/slides you were required to have a rubber ring, which at times were difficult to come by. Many people hung onto theirs. Singles and double rubber rings are provided along with life jackets for small children. There were lots of safety staff along the rapids which was nice to see.Queue's for some of the larger water slides were approximately 45 minutes long and over with very quickly. We felt that the waterpark was quite small in comparison to others we had visited.We also had to queue for about 20 minutes to order our food, even though it wasn't busy. The food was similar to McDonalds etc, we then had to wait another 25 minutes for the food to be ready which we felt was totally unacceptable. This is obviously a managerial problem which needs addressing.We went with our 5 and 8 yr old children and decided that we much preferred Dreamland which is located about a 50 minute drive north of Dubai. There is much more to do there, although maybe not as adrenalin filled. The queue's are much smaller, espescially if you go midweek.Waiting for a taxi afterwards to take us home from Atlantis took about 1 hour, which is not the hotels fault, but is worth noting.

A fantastic waterpark. This is a well thought out water park - although we went at a busy time it never seemed over crowded. Food was quite expensive but it was nice. It was very pleasant to wander down to the beach during the day while the children were off on the rides.

great enjoyment. this is great for couples or families. the rides are not too rough but not too slow too. Don't line up for the shark tunnel or something like that.. nothing much to see.. apart from that.. everything was great
absolutely loved it. this is great for lazy people. they have rides "flushing" ppl up to the rides in loops. or you can simply float around and enjoy the sun. definitely go again

Amazing for the whole family. I went last month and I have that feeling before I go that it suits children only. I was there with my family and friends and all of us enjoyed it a lot.Its not cheap but it really worth it. Try to take the combined tickets with the food and towel as food inside is really expensive

fun in the sun. Aquaventure is always nice to go to for some leisure time. Of course you might wanna get a copy of the entertainer before you go, because otherwise it's just ridiculous how much they'll charge you.Unlike wild wadi it doesn't get disgusting when it's packed. I really do not need that wild wadi experience again. Aquaventure might get crowded on the weekends and public holidays as well, but it's only a bit annoying while you're standing in line to get on the slides. If you're just chilling in the water streams it's not to bad. The park is well maintained and very clean. There's such a huge amount of lifeguards, taht it makes me crack up every single time I go there. But anyway you'll enjoy your time. The leap of faith is great fun, but don't go to often. You'll see what I mean when you take a look at your shoulders after the second or third time. Slides in general are nice here. sometimes it takes a lot of patience though.Shark bites, the restaurant, is affordable when using the entertainer as well. Keep in mind to bring the voucher as they search your bags for food and drinks and aren't always letting you get away with bringing your own water.
Great fun. Had a great time here... Great for families... Leave the kids on the water coasters and slides... And lay by the pool!

It hardly makes up for a swim in the sea.... ...but unfortunately they had jellyfish the day I was there, so I had to use some of the rubber tube rides to at least get some value out of the entrance fee.

Not value for moneyque. Paid nearly £200 for a family of four (two adults, two children - rented 2 towels and locker and a snack lunch). Long queues to get in then for rides. Even had to wait for 30 mins in a for a taxi at he end to get back to the hotel. To be frank the whole thing is a rip off and I hardly ever write bad reviews.
Amazing. All Rides Are Brilliant Been On All Of Them Including Leap Of Faith

Super fun. Very clean with numerous life guards.Loads for kids and families to do.no charge for guests at Atlantis.lazy river was fantastic.food was expensive.crowded.Staff was very helpful.Connectivity to hotel was great

Ok but prefer Wild Wadi. Did not have as much to offer as Wild Wadi but my kids enjoyed feeding the stingrays.I found floors not as clean as I would have expected when people are walking round bare footed.

Atlantis Waterpark. Get their early to get a sunbed,sunbeds come with a sunshade which is needed,Their is a beach which makes a change from all the water slides,big queues for taxis at the end,used a coupon from The Entertainer to get BOGOF

Great Fun for the family!. This is a must-do if in Dubai if you haven't been. Great fun for adults and kids alike, although rather expensive to do.(Please see photo for rates as of December 2010).We went in December so the air was a bit chilly but the waters were fabulously warm and we were reluctant to get out into the cool air once in.Friendly and cheerful international staff at every corner and all round the vicinity , ever willing to give a helping hand made the visit all the more an enjoyable and safe experience .The park , like most of Dubai , was spotlessly clean and clear of any litter.Just as well, as once changed into our swimming costumes for the tube rides, we had to go around barefooted.Unless you have a waterproof bag of some sort, it was also impossible to carry any cash or valuables with you as they were bound to get wet. The lockers in the changing rooms were far away from any of the rides so it would have been impractical to go back and get any cash if one wanted to get a drink etc.It is also rather impossible to take any photos here unless armed with an underwater camera and you are advised to leave them in the lockers in the changing rooms if you do not want them to be damaged in any way.Due to the nature of the rides, they are not suitable for children less than 7 years old unless accompanied at all times by an adult. Although it was winter, the queues were quite long, the longest being the Leap of Faith, an almost vertical drop ride sans tube (this is the only ride in the park without a tube)- definitely not for the faint-hearted.We went after lunch and brought tid-bits and water along but the kids were so preoccupied with their rides that they did not stop to have anything to eat.There was also a man-made beach and bay which overlooked Burj Al Arab, supposedly the most luxurious hotel in the world.But the rides were sufficient for us and we did not go into the sea. We found a nice shady and uncrowded spot here on the grass and left our towels, food and water on a mat as we went to do the rides after which we returned to collect them before heading for the showers.It was quite a long wait in the changing rooms though for a shower, (about 20 mins) but the showers were warm and powerful.The bathrooms were generally well maintained and clean as well.Would definitely recommend this as a must-do but I would like to try the Wild Wadi the next time round to see how it compares to the Atlantis WaterPark. If you haven't been, it's worth going, even though it is a bit dear.But generally, it's a great outing for the family in Dubai.Tip- Try to get there early before lunch. We had to queue for about 3/4 hour at lunchtime to get in and the park closes at 5-6 pm (depending on the sunset time) so you would get your money's worth if you get there early.. We managed to squeeze in all the rides plus a few repeats but the kids would have liked to stay longer if given the time

Fantastic!. All rides are great even the leap of faith! As you would expect food is expensive. Get there for opening and stay there til close! Lockers are £8 even for hotel guests!! Wear tee shirt and cap as it is hot!!
Good fun at the water park!. Lots to do here, places to sunbathe and relax, a good variety of food and drink available. But quite expensive for what it is.

Well looked after and thought through. Clean, functional and well supervised. Some nice quieter areas for sunbathing. Great for the kids though I'm told the rides at wild wadi might be a bit more exciting. Love the beach. Like starbucks but could do with a more adult a la carte restaurant

disspointed. Cannot take any food or drink into this park after spending lots to get in, it just goes in bin or you dont get in. Over priced and lack of sun beds unless arrive when it opens. First visit okay wouldnt go again.

okay. Beware you cannot take food or drink in this place after spending lots to get in. Any food etc you take goes in bin they will not let you in with it. Busy and lack of sun beds in park so get here when it opens not later on or forget it.
Just not as good as Wild Whadi!. It was OK, but Wild Whadi is better and a lot cleaner!

Superb way to cool off!. We went to the water park for 3 days out of our 6 day stay at the Atlantis hotel as we enjoyed it so much. (Free as we were staying in the Atlantis hotel.) We rode the free golf buggy from the hotel to the far end of the water park where we always found plenty of comfy sunbeds. (Note great moveable sunshades which helped to keep us a little cooler.) We didn't go on any of the rides but spent hours on the 'lazy river' which isn't that lazy! The beach attached to the park was fun, but we saw a number of people being treated for jelly fish stings.Tip - Buy a refillible drinks bottle for 40 Dirham (£8) then it is only 5 Dirham (£1) to fill up. You can use it any day you visit, not just the day you buy it.

Great fun ESP with older kids, slides too scary for younger kids. Memorable waterpark with awesome rapid rides, slides thru shark tanks (the tank bit is a gimmick as the views are better outside the tunnel and in the separate aquarium (Lost Chambers), play water park for kids. No wave pool (have to go to rival Wild Wadi for that which is equally awesome).

Everything a waterpark should be!. Great day - quite expensive, but if you liek water slides, then this is the place for you! Leap of faith lives up to the hype, and there are plenty of other rides as well.There is a rapid ride that takes you on a tube around the whole park, and you can float off to an "exit" like a freeway to get onto other rides, you stay in your tube and go up an escalator and when you get to the top your already in the queue for a ride, without having to get off another ride! Only in Dubai!!
