water world. its mind bogling , you cannot miss the adventure island , the kids will have a blast and wont miss it once they go there .
Brilliant fun!. Loved this place to escape the August heat. Very well staffed and kept spotlessly clean. A great day out!
unbeliveable !!. amazing leap of faith.great, food is fantastic highly rated, should go. fantastic resturant !!!!!!

Beautiful surroundings, great rides. Fabulous waterpark at the famous Atlantis. Fun rides and good play area for younger kids. Gets busy - arrive early if you want to bag sun beds. Expect to pay higher prices for food etc. Staff helpful.

Awesome. Great rides. Loved the rapids. Heaps of rings available,very close to hotel. Heaps of deck chairs available.kids loved the Shark Attack ride. Couldnt believe the amount of lifeguards,one around every corner. Soooo safe.
great fun for all ages. get there early to get a water side sunlounger especially if you have children and want to watch them play while you sit. slides are fun but I preffered wild wadi

It was good but we prefer wild wadi. We stayed at the Atlantis hotel and visited the water park everyday. It is a very good waterpark but we prefer the wild wadi so for us, if we werent staying at the hotel we would go to the wild wadi. Having said that swimming with the dolphins was an amazing experience but also a pricey one.

Great place. Atlantis water park Must do in dubai, it does not matter if you are in your honney moon, traveling with friends ore with your family this place has activiiee for all ages and you can gave a alot of funPlus you get to know the lobby of the hotel and whatch the amazing acuarium that they haveThe private beaches that they have towards the inner side of the palm are just amazing gratuitous place to hang out and enjoy te seeIf I had to focus this to a certain group of people I with go with families first but you can have a great time no matter who you go with Overall a must do in dubai

Fast, wet, wild good times!. Dubai is such a crazy country I was not at all surprised to see that Atlantis had a water park attached to it - getting to Atlantis was a treat on its own - we got the Metro and then got a cab to the hotel and was met by a friendly doorman who opened the cab door and let us into the amazing complex.We were lucky to have the hindsite to buy the "Entertainer" book so we had 2 for 1 entry into Aquaventure - a relief as 200 dirhams per person is a heft amount to pay for a waterpark. But by saying that, what a water park! We were waiting in line to be served and immediately another desk opened up and we were ushered to it - the level of customer service was 5 star (like the hotel). Plenty of changing facilities and room to wander about if you're tired from racing about the slides as well. You can hire towels too.The "Leap of Faith" was the first slide I did and it was awesome. Very very fast and one hell of the drop. I did it 4 times and I am scared of heights! The other slides were very good and you can do them all with a tube. Once you finish the other slides you're ou're led onto the lazy rivers and this is amazing. You can go down rapids or go down one with constant waves and they go on and on and on! Once you eventually end you can keep on going down the rivers or go to shore and sit back in the sun. It's no fuss and incredibly well run with plenty of lifeguards watching everybody at all times.The only low point which isn't too bad but does need improvement was the concession carts for water, soft drink etc - paying 16 dirhams for water was a little cheeky! But I guess you are at Atlantis which is a completely different world than anything else. I highly recommend this attraction, especially if you have a copy of the Entertainer as then it's a real bargain. But either way this is a must see/do when visiting Dubai.

Fabulous day out at the water park. Was on holiday recently in Dubai with my husband. We spent 2 days at Aquaventure as it was so much fun. Buy the ticket that gets you towel, locker and the meal deal as this is excellent value for money. Spent all day in the water. Park has several rides. Would highly recommend a visit.

A Bit Disapointed. I was so excited to visit atlantis, when i arrived i thought WOW what a place, walking thhrough the Shopping Center to get to the way in. Then when we got in and made it to the pool i was soo gutted. Its just one giant lazy river with a few rapids thrown in every now and then, and 5 water slides (Master Blasters) where u go in you rudder ring, with only one slide you go down on your own the Free Fall where you go through the fish tank (No point as you are going that fast and there is that much spray you cant see a thing) Least when you go through in the ring you can see the fish. The beach was rubbish, yes it had white sand and warm water, but it was so still may be a little stagnent. All in all i must say i was LET DOWN BIG TIME. I'm glad i went to see what the hype was about.

Awesome!. This place is awesome! we was a group of 9 and we enjoyed our time there. we stayed half day there. playing each activity more than twice!every thing was cool there and everything is available there. someone of the group was injured knee with small scratch. a lifeguard immediately called a medic and he fixed the injury.I love the place and definitely I will go again there. The only thing is negative is every thing with money and their stuff is very expensive.

Some fun time for half a day.... Aquaventure in the Atlantis Resort is a great place to enjoy water slides and the joy of water in this warm weather.A lot of fun and in the morning at opening time, the crowd is less than in the hours of early afternoon... so make sure to come as early as possible.

Great Water park but expensive. We were staying at the Atlantis so we got this included in our stay but looking at the prices for those coming for a day it looked really expensive. I think it worked out about £40 a day base price then lockers etc were on top of that and drinks in the park were expensive too.It was on a par with the likes of Wet and Wild but some of the rides were not open. However, the lazy river (whihc wasn't very lazy at all) was much, much better than the American counter part and it was really well managed and staffed. All the staff were really friendly and helpful. I wouldn't necessarily stay at the Atlantis again but I might be tempted (even at those prices) to try this again for a day out.

Good fun not just for children. The facility is well kept since the opening and great fun everytime we return back. Definetely recommended to go there during your trip in Dubai. You will have good fun day as a couple or family with kids, or by yourself, it offers chace to have fun to everyone....Enjoy

best christmas present. i treated my 12 3/4 years old son and myself to a "swim with the dolphins" and visit to the Lost Chambers in Atlantis Hotel and Resort in Dubai: the best! Interacting with the Lucy the 12 years old dolphins was the most beautiful experience we've had in long time: getting a dolphin his and hug, just learning about and touching this amazing creature gives you a sentiment of peace and warmth! The lost Chambers were amazing too, with educational informations presented in a very attractive way: science fiction mixed with real life. My son loved it. Bonus: the rides thru an aquarium were sharks and manta rays float above your head!

Fantastic!. This water park was absolutely exhilarating! The leap of faith took the life out of me - twice, and the 'Shark attack' was really cool. All the other water rides are guaranteed to thrill, not for those with vertigo though! The price included access to the beach which was, unfortunately, filled with very sharp, tiny coral pieces. Not to mention my pal was stung by a jellyfish! The paramedics were quick to respond. The views from the beach of the city are great and even better from the top of the 'Ziggurat'. Would definitely visit again.
Expensive Area. Very Very Ecpensive attractions and food. The Ice cream shop was very good. They were playing with the Ice balls , it was a fun. Shops were too expensive.

A great waterpark but dont forget footwear. This is a great waterpark for both adults and children. There is a good variety of slides and of course a lazy river. The lines for the rides were not too bad and well worth the wait. There are ample areas for relaxing in the sun and plenty of places to eat and drink. The cost of food and drink were high but no worse than the usual Dubai prices. The only potential problem is in the walk from the lockers to the action areas which becomes very hot and people were burning the soles of their feet. You can buy flip flops there but you will pay a premium so it is worthwhile taking something with you. Recommended activity.

Good, not Great, worth a visit. The park itself is one of the larger water parks I've been to, but you would think the size would lend itself to a varied amount of slides\rides. You'd be wrong, all the slides are in the ziggeraut near the back of the park and most of them are similar. Having said that, we really enjoyed the rapids and the leap of faith is one of the best slides I've been on, you can keep your eyes open for the most part, which I find is rare on most steep slides these days :D The other slides are all up\down tube affairs, you can stay in your tube for about 20 mins if you like as they have a conveyor system, but its kind of boring after the first go.The water in the park isn't as cold as it should be imo and as a previous poster said, there are plenty of exposed places to burn your feet.We visited Wild Wadi the day before and in my opinion, thats a better park. Not as big, but more varied rides. Good to do both, but if your only doing one goto wild wadi ;)

Great water slides. We went to aquaventure because we stayed at Atlantis. It was summer while we were there so perfect weather for a water park. The park covers a huge area and has a lot of pools and water slides. The tube ride is great if you don't want to go on the steep water slides or stand in long lines. Definitely take shoes when you go. We went on a hot day and we both burnt our feet walking from the hotel the the water park.

Epic Fun. We went in peak summer to chill out for a day. Aquaventure was awesome and the rides were really fun. The rapids were good and the leap of faith was really scary in the beginning, but after the short 20 second or so ride was over, I wanted to go again. There was extreme hype on the shark ride in which you are in a glass tunnel and surrounded by sharks. The ride may have been hard to build, but ; frankly I could see only 1 small shark! there were more of fishes. Some rides were awesome while otheres were a bit slow. Food is ridiculously overpriced for Dubai with one slice of watermelon at 25 AED! WE ate burgers which were priced at 50 AED or so.. All in all, a good place to getaway with friends on a boring weekend!

Dolphin Bay was brilliant!. We had always wanted to see the dolpins but never did because it was expensive. But we finally did it and I must say that it was all worth it! We were advised to arrive 15 mins early which we were glad we did. As soon as we arrived in Dolpin Bay, everyone greeted us very warmly - so friendly and helpful. Checking in was very easy and soon we were told on what we should and shouldn't do, e.g. take out all jewellery, etc. Then we were given the option of having to change to a wet suit or a jacket. After all that, we had to go through an orientation to learn more about the dolpins which lasted about 10 to 15 mins. I must say that we did learn a thing or two about the dolpins so we didn't mind. The children there seemed to enjoy it. After that, the fun part starts! When we met our dolpin Alice, she was such a wonderful gentle creature! We got to touch her, kiss her, play or dance with her and pose with her. Everyone had their turn and it was such a wonderful experience. There were 10 people per group and the time spent with the dolpins was half an hour. The trainers were really great and they made sure that all of us took part properly and asked us if we had any questions for them, which they happily answered. You could tell that they really love the dolpins, so it's nice to know that they are well taken care of. After it was all over, we could have a shower and change. Water and soft drinks were provided. Then it was time to look at the photos. They are expensive to buy but we could not resist taking back some good memories with us. Besides, it's a good way to help fund the upkeep of the dolpins so we didn't mind so much. All in all, it was a once in a lifetime experience that everyone should do at least once. Highly recommended!!

Best waterpark experience ever. This was definitely one of the highlights of our trip to Dubai. My husband and I ran around the park like kids, and made a point on going on everything at least three times. Even if the queues are a bit long, its definitely worth the wait!

good fun day out. We had a great day out at the waterpark. The weather was very hot (as expected) but the rides kept us cool and were good fun.Compared to Blizzard Beach and Typhoon Lagoon at Disney the Atlantis waterpark is disappointing because there are only about 6 rides. But it is very clean and there were no queues at all for any of the rides.The lazy river ride was nice & long and a lovely way to relax in the sun.I would have liked to visit the beach but was forbidden by a rude member of staff despite having paid for access.

A Must Visit Place. The waterpark is a must place to visit. Great facitiles....great concept of the park. Water rides were good too. Park is not very big....good service...3 different kinds of resturants. The wash rooms were big and nice, great facilites.... Friendly staff. Enterance feewas reasonable.

One of the best rides in the world. Yes it's just a waterslide but the the Leap of Faith is one of the best rides i have ridden in the world! It's a great waterpark but is less "organic" and easy to get around than Wild Wadi.Overall the slides feel "short" and the watar canal that winds around the park is used as an exit point for all of the rides rather than a means of travelling from one ride to the next (like at Wild Wadi where their "Canal" is also a ride in itself).For a family you are much better off staying at the hotel and taking advantage of the free entry.The kids had a great time.Don't forget your beach shoes or sandals - the concrete walkways and paths get TREMENDOUSLY hot (and you can kick them off at the rides to collect later).

Good day out, but plenty of annoyances along the way.. I went to Atlantis waterpark over the Eid holiday, which is the few days holiday at the end of Ramadan. Since it was a holiday time, it was totally PACKED with a combination of Gulf Arabs on vacation and US military personnel on R & R. This was, as you can imagine, a very curious mix of conservative and non-conservative. Despite arriving as soon as the park opened, the queues were long. We opted to pay for a towel rental and a locker and got our required entry wristband. However, no-one, at any time, informed us that we could load money on this wristband to pay for goods on the other side, so this was our first encounter with the poor communication at the park.  Once inside the locker rooms, it was unclear how the lockers worked. There was a diagram on each door, which was incomprehensible. We had to wait and ask the attendant how to work the locker and it turned out the lock was operated by your wristband and the attendant showed us the trick. Easy when you know how, but a challenge on your own. We witnessed many other people having difficulties with the lock and then having to ask the attendant. Black mark number two.Once undressed and clutching our (paper) towel coupon, we wondered should we get the towel at the start of the adventure, or at the end, and if we get it at the end, what should we do with our coupon in the meantime. The towel cabanas were nowhere to be seen, so we decided to leave our precious towel coupons in the locker.We set off to find the start of the park. The first attraction we came too involved climbing a lot of stairs. We noticed that everybody climbing the stairs had an inflatable ring with them to use, so we wondered where to get the rings from. After much searching of the nearby signs, we finally had to ask and were shown to a completely different area where the rings were kept in a back area, all piled up. No sign to say that these rings were a critical part of the water-riding experience and needed to be collected first before you could do anything else. So a lot of time wasted there - black mark number 3.Once we had a ring each, we were able to get going. Despite the park being busy, at that time in the morning the queues moved quickly and it was easy to get on lots of things. As the day progressed, though, the queues lengthened and we chose the rafting experience, which runs in a continual loop and is a lot of fun. There are many, many lifeguards along the way, which was comforting, especially since I fell out of my ring during one set of rapids and quickly started to panic. The lifeguard lifted me up right away and advised me what to do should it happen again. I was very impressed with his speed, so that was a plus.When it came to lunch, since all of our belongings were back at the lockers, one of us had to laboriously go back there and get some money. If anybody had told us about the loading money on the wristband thing (which we only found out at the end of the day), we could've saved a lot of time and energy.Black mark number 4 came at the end of the day when we needed to get our towels. We had to go all the way back to the lockers to get the towel coupons and then head out again to find the towel cabanas, which all seemed to be back in the park. So more confusion and head-scratching and searching for signposts. Why isn't there a towel cabana beside the lockers? If there is, it wasn't obvious. Next time, we will probably bring our own towels.Overall, though, I have to say that it was an excellent day out and although we stayed for about five hours, we still didn't manage to do everything, so a return trip is in order. Next time we will be prepared though!

Pricey, but lots of fun.. Aquaventure is pricey, but there are plenty of exciting attractions and the facilities are wonderful. The staff/lifeguards are friendly and helpful. There is one area for small children and our daughters loved playing on it almost all day.However, the lazy river is too slow at times and too fast and wild at others. I wasn't always sure that our small children would be safe on it even though we were constantly reassured by the lifeguards. Also, they are very strict about the prohibition on outside food and drinks, and it is ridiculous that you have to pay extra for a locker.So don't go to Atlantis because it's cheap. Go for the exotic location and thrilling rides. If you want somewhere gentler for the kids, with more attractions geared toward them, try Dreamland Aqua Park in Omm al-Qawain.

LOTS OF FUN, AMAZING. you go there, park your car, jump in the bus that will take you there in 3 min..head towards the ticket counter, if you have UAE RES ID you get 20% off.. if you have the entertainer coupon you get 2 for the price of one generaly the tickets are for 200 AED, lockers are for 40 AED, towels i dont know.went there 2 times and i love it…go early to enjoy the full day, there are a lot of cues so try to avoid weekends

Dolphine experience. My wife really enjoyed Doplhine Tour there. Staff very friendly and helpfull, like experience with doplhins its really great way. The photos are VERY expensive, but for memories its good way take one ore two. Its expensive (950 DHS), but like a present very comfortable!
Fabulous!. We worth a visit. We had a blast! We stayed at the resort and spent a total of 16 hours in the water during our 3 night visit. We were big kids and loved every minute!

Excellent!. Stayed with my sister at the Atlantis and during our 5 day stay we visited every day. We thoroughly enjoyed it, we were like too big kids! The lounger area was clean and comfortable and the rides were great fun. Arrive early to avoid the long ques that tend to start from about 3pm! Was definately good value for us as was free due to being hotel guests. Food and drink was not cheap but we found it reasonable given the environment.
great fun. great fun but watch your stuff, too hot to walk about without flip flops but when we came back round from the rapids our good flip flops had been stolen. take them with you!

Overpriced, but still amazing. The looks of the water park is stunning! You feel like your in a whole other world. Sure the prices are high but i think its worth it. Younger kids as well as older kids would LOVE Aquaventure. I reccomend to families with kids of all age groups.

Mediocre and over priced. We visited Aquaadventure with another young Australian couple who were also considering this water park or Wild Wadi. We were initially impressed by Aquaadventure it was clean and there was fun to be had on the rapids/torrents/slides. But that was it, the fun was over after 2/3 hours and it was just boring. 13dhms for water was a bit much. We went to Wild Wadi the next day and the next and again on our last day. It is infinitely better than Aquaadventure.

Worth every penny!. We stayed one night in Atlantis Hotel so we could use the aquapark.The aquaventure is beautiful, you can borrow a life jacket for toddlers , so is fantastic for those who can't swim. My daughter loved the kids corner ,all the slides were fantastic.They don't allow adults in most of the kids slides ( even the big slides) but because they thought I was her sister they let me in(!) The adults slides usually have a long queue, so we didn't use because was too hot to stay in the queue. There are photographers taking photos of you everywhere around the park so you can buy the photos after ( cost around £15 each) You can bring you drinks and snacks inside (I forgot to bring and ended up paying £5 for a bottle of 500ml water and £7 for a can of pepsi) Overall the place is excellent, there are staff everywhere so you can feel safe if you have young kids.If you plan just to use the aquapark, is best to book one night in the Atlantis so you can use the aquaventure, the lost chambers, the pool and beach for two days ( the day you check in and the day you check out also )

Atlantis Palm Dubai - Absolute Rip Off!. Well I guess my love affair with Dubai had to come to an end sooner or later, I just didnt expect it to happen at the Atlantis Hotel. Ive visited Dubai many times and this was my families second visit to the Atlantis. I always remembered it being a little expensive but I guess I accepted that given the facilities and the grandure of the hotel. However this time round the costs and relentless approach from the staff for cash was just too much for me to handle. 50DHS for a pint of beer, thats £8.30 GBP, is ridiculous. We have for a few years chosen Dubai as a good alternative to European and US holidays and it always came out on top, however its clear to see now that this destination is suffering from the package holiday influx and Dubai is cashing in on it.We treated our kids to the Dolphin experience whilst at the hotel, which for the five of us worked out to just under £600 GBP. Ok a little heavy but I thought the experience would be a good one. The actual Dolphin swim was so scripted it was sickening. All I can say about this is, its just not worth the money. Oh and I should mention the costs of the photographs....... budget for at least £100 GBP.To sum up the Atlantis offers a very unique Duabi experience, is it value for money, in a word no. I would suggest staying at one of the Jumeriah hotels i.e the Mina A Salam, worth every penny!

Lovely experience.. Had a fantastic day here with family. Got discount voucher from a booklet at hotel and it wasn't too bad price wise. I don't do water slides but my husband and daughter do and they had a great time but so did I chilling with my book by the pool and strolling round. Loads to see and had a stroll through the hotel afterwords looking at the huge aquarian.

Loved, loved, loved the aqua and the adventure!. I had a blast! Maybe even more fun than my young daughter.We were all over the place, trying new things, on the water slides, in the pools, floating around the park... etc. We kept relatively cool during a very hot time in Dubai because we were always in the water. I recommend going when it is not peak season. I heard it can get packed. We didn't have lines at all!I highly recommend Aquaventure Water Park for adults and children of all ages!Note: You do have to be a certain height to go on some of the rides.

Great day out but dont leave any valuables around. Had entrance as part of our swimming with Dolphins experience and had a very enjoyable day.the rides are suitable for all ages and has many rides and long winding routes to enjoy the sun.Great idea to put money on wrist straps so no need to carry cash aroundthe only negative was my flip flops and towells getting stolen and the floor being about 200 degrees so lots of running to areas of shade.would defo go here

Amazing rides. We have visited the waterpark last year and we've repeated our holidays at the same hotel, which operates the waterpark. This year the water was not so cool as last year. Other than this, the park is great. Very clean, with lots of lifeguards at every corner. Great slides. There is one that takes you all the way UP to the high tower. Yes, a slide that takes you from ground level and takes you to the top of the tower from which you can slide down using the other slides.Even if you don't stay at the hotel, visit the Aquaventure waterpark. It's worth it.
Such a great place. Great experience, it has great sights amazing pools and water experience

Fun day. We went to Atlantis a few days after being at Wild Wadi, Jumeriah. I would say Wild Wadi is slightly better however atlantis waterpark was still an excellent day and well worth a visit. Entry price is 200 AED per adult and you are required to pay for the hire of a locker 40 AED and towel 30 AED should you need them or 50 AED for both. Like wild wadi you are provided with a wrist band which you can load with money to buy food and drinks with instead of carrying your money with you. Food and drink prices are a bit higher here than wild wadi though. Plenty of sun loungers scattered about the park....oh and if your goin during Ramadan don't worry, the food and drinks stalls/restaurants are all open and operating as usual.

Fun and relax for all the family. Undoubtely the main attraction of the park is the Ziggurat and its slides, that you must climb with your own tube and then you can choose among different types of rides. The most spectacular is the no-tube slide which is a terrific sliding-fall down which starts from the very top of the Ziggurat and ends at its basis. But there are other rides of different adrenalinic level. One of them passes through an aquarium tunnel so that you seem to ride among the sharks and other fish.If you don't have enough you can try the other rides along the park, but if you don't like adrenalin and you are tired you can let yourself be transported by the lazy current of the river which flows very slowly throughout the park, over and over. For young children there is a dedicated themed area with many slides for all ages. The park is supervised at all times by an incredible number of lifeguards.If you stay at the hotel Atlantis the Palm the entry is free.

the best in DUbai water park. Here you can have lots of fun for every one and big space with chance to touch the dolphins and have lot's of photos , the food and drink is expensive but the entry fee is great value for the full day fun

A great day out!. I spent absolutely ages deciding whether to go to a waterpark whilst in Dubai as the reviews are really mixed. We decided to go to aqua venture in the end and am so glad we did as we had an amazing day. The water park is absolutely gorgeous, so clean and picturesque. The water rides are fab, you dont even have to leave your rubber ring for some rides, you go up your little conveyor belt in your rubber ring, it's great! You can also take a wander o to the beach and go in the sea which I didnt realise you could do, we loved it! Yes I guess it was expensive but when you're on holiday in Dubai you must expect these amazing places not to be dirt cheap?! And yes it got fairly busy in the afternoon, but when do you ever go to a water park and not queue a little bit? I've been to the Disney water parks and think that aqua venture is just as good a day out. Don't be put off by some of the bad reviews, you'll have a great, fun filled day in the most amazing surroundings! Oh and wear LOTS of suncream!!!

Plenty to do, loads of choices. The water park is well laid out and has slides and water courses to fit everyone's sense of adventure. I great way to stay cool on a hot August day. There was not a lot of shade, so sun screen is a must. The many photographers allow you to capture family photos with out having to worry about wet cameras.

Thrilling. I enjoyed this experience alot. We went pretty early in the morning on a working day, so it was fairly quiet. The ques were very short, the longest we qued was roughly 5-10mins. Most of the rides had the rubber rings to go in, either double or single. One ride which we enjoyed, iss when you came out in a glass shoot, going very slowly in a tank full of different fishes. The only thing that ruined it was the wether as it got too hot to walk around. It was very handy having the resturants, we went to "shark bites" which was a lovely resturant.

Well executed park but only average. We loved the setting and landscaping but the park was short on variety. Best feature was 99% of rides were accessed from the lazy river so you never had to get out of the water. Tubes were too small for adults and riding them up escalators was an stamina exercise for your neck. I agree with several other writers that the lifeguards were gruff and unfriendly. Usually a sign of how they are treated as employees or at least managed. In an area know for extreme summer heat, I was surprised they don't have misters for the sidewalks to minimize the burning flesh when you need to walk about. US parks have been doing this for years. and its not like they don't already have drip lines anywhere there is a living plant to keep them alive.Another poorly planned item is lockers. Lockers are located only at the main gate which is a very long way from anything other than the front gate. Anything I was willing to keep in a locker I could have not brought at all, because it wasn't worth going all the way back to it.All in all we did have an enjoyable day, but with a facility as over the top as Atlantis I was expecting more. ***Sidebar*** On your way out be sure to find the Cold Stone creamery Ice cream shop just inside the hotel. Unlike the water park, the staff in there was incredibly entertaining and talented. They literally throw ice cream to one another like snowballs. A show well worth seeing and the ice cream was excellent.
Great fun. We had a great time and really enjoyed this, it was our first day in Dubai and the kids loved it.Dont miss it if you ever go !!

A Fun, Well Maintianed Park with Great Staff. When my son, my sister and her son visited us in Dubai, we took advantage of the Summer special rates and enjoyed the resort. As a hotel guest, up four people can enjoy the waterpark and aquarium for free. The hotel lets you check in as early as you like, and will still give you credentials even if you arrive in the morning, so that means that for the price of ojne night at the fabulous resort, you can enjoy two full days of the waterpark. The park is spotlessly clean and well maintained. The water attractions are good, but waterpartk experts will tell you that the they could have more thrill slides. The Shark Attack is very nice because you get to spend a couple of minutes in a tube that is surrounded by sharks and other swimming creatures.The staff are very friendly and professional. Many of the life guards made it a point to get to know my son and nephew by name so they could say hi every time they went by. At one point, my nephew felt lost and was located by hotel security staff who stayed took him back to our park home base, stayed with him and made sure that he was comfortable by giving him water and some flip-flops. To sum up the staff, if they are not truly happy to have you as a guest, they do a great job of faking it.

Expensive For What You Get. They advertise childs prices but the kids have to be under 1.2m. My son is 9 years old and we had to pay full price for him which we thought was unfair, you have to be 1.2m to go on the rides, plus they charge extra for towels and lockers, it cost us £120 to gain entrance plus a fee for lockers, we took our own towels or it would have cost us £6 each. to hire a towel for the day. If you have been to water parks in USA i would give this one a miss.

Cooling and fun for late 50's couple. We went to the water park and spent the day there. You can sit in a tyre and float around all day. You do not have to get out other than to eat and use the facilities. You will ride around going through torrents and up an escalator, you can choose to go down slides if you wish. No part of the ride was beyond our years, although we are fairly young at heart. There are a few other rides that we did not use that looked to be more like "white knuckle rides" for the more adventurous. There was also a great area for younger children and families.I have not got a good figure and being in a swimming costume only is not good for me, but I love the Arabic fashion for wearing a swimdress in the pool, so much more comfortable and flattering. I bought the overdress from downtown Dubai's BHS - yes, they have most of the stores from the UK's high street.The main downside for me was the state of the changing rooms/showers. They are short of having more cleaners on duty at peak times.

Fun, fun, fun. Aquaventure is great for kids and adults. It is very big with lots of water attractions. We stayed at the Atlantis so entry was included. A golf cart takes you from the hotel to inside the water park without you having to queue for tickets.Although it is big and it was fun, we felt that the lifeguards were not as friendly (interested) as the ones at Wild Wadi (another water park in Dubai). In fact, majority of the life guards were grumpy and dis interested. Saying that, they did the job and it did not affect our time at Aquaaventure.We ate everyday at Shark Bites. A mean deal (e.g. burger, chips and a drink) is approx £10. When we were there, the hotel (Atlantis) gave us vouchers so the kids ate free. Otherwise, it is approx £40 for the 4 of us for lunch. The food was nice and the air condition was great. It is a great place to take a break from the heat outside.Being a big water park, you do have to walk. Although not far, the floor is very hot. At wild wadi, the life guards and the sprinkler kept the paths wet so that it is not that hot on your feet. Althought they have sprinkler system at Aquaventure, it seems to be far fewer. You do need to have something on your foot.Drinks are quite expensive. Just over £5 for a mile shake. Approx £4 for a fizzy drink. £ for pop corn. You should take some water with you, especially if you are visiting in the summer.The water rides are fun.If you stay at the hotel, you can charge everything to your room so you do not have to take any cash around with you.We felt quite safe in the water park. You can leave things in the bag on the chair and have confidence that it will not disappear. Many people had SLRs, so they must have left them somewhere.We did not have to wait long for the rides. We found that 3 hours at a time is plenty sufficient. Then it is time to return to the hotel pool and relax.If you go to Dubai, you must visit Aquaventure.
good day out. Plenty to entertain everyone.Staff helpful and friendly. Definitely get there early, after midday it fills up!

Excellent park! We love it!. Every time we go to Dubai to show the city to some family or friend, we spent at least half day in Aquaventure park. It's a place you can't miss in Dubai because in my opinion is the best water park in the area. I feel they took the lessons learned from the other water parks and use them here to make a very comfortable and improved water park. The walkways are big and clean as well as the restrooms. You can put your things in very nice and clean lockers and enjoy the park with just your swim suit. The only thing I don't like about the park is the food. Still the junk food they have needs to be improved a lot!!.

Very good. Enjoyed a lovely afternoon at Aquaventure water park in July. Its a bit expensive to get in, but no different to Wild Wadi prices. Great fun on the lazy river, and liked the fact that you could stay on your rubber ring from this and go to the slides via a conveyor belt - you never actually need to stand up the whole afternoon! Not that many rides, we'd expected a few more, but still very nice. Water nice and cool for a hot July day.
Wonderful. Really exciting long jump brave jump scare me but was so interesting non forgotable experience

Love it!!!. A clean water park, not very big but good enough to accommodate the needs of every age group.Bring a waterproof bag for your money, key cards & cameras, then u will not need a locker that costs u 50 dirhams. Look for a Sun lounger, place your clothes and towels on it and there u go...be there early to avoid the crowds. Lines formed after midday and u could hardly find a tube for the rides since then.The weather was so hot (we vusited in july) that any chilled drink became lukewarm in minutes...so even u brought with u the water, u still wanted to buy some real icy ones at the kiosks. Costly though at 18 dirhams per bottle or u may choose to buy a refill cup at 40 dirhams so that u may get a refill of soft drinks at 5 dirhams each time.My 8 years old son is a lover for exciting games and he went for the leap of faith 3 times. According to him, it was the best slide in the park. The line for this slide might be goung slow as there were people who hesitated to go down and stuck there. It took time for one trying to overcome the fear and to chicken out, to try again and decide to leave... 5 mins had passed!!!!On thurday summer nights, a carnival will be held and the park will open till midnight with fireworks and lazaer show to conclude. ask the hotel beforehand to get the most of the arrangement. I didn't get chance to experience the fun but got a glimpse of it out from the balcony while the Kids were fast asleep.My 60+ mom who doesnt know how to swim had a great time floating along the river with rapids but certainly not good for small kids who are scared of water, as parents are not allowed to hold them when going through the rapids for safety sake.Highly recommend it if u stay at the hotel... If u need to pay a steep price for entry, think twice ESP if u have been to some brilliant water parks before.
If you have nothing to do visit it. Expensive with no much rides. I really didn't like the rides and i don't think they it is better than wild wady

Thrilling and exciting park. The water park was has a great look and feel, and is somewhat easy to walk around it.If you're a rides junkie then the ziggurat offers you about 7 attractions, there's also a huge river that goes from wild to lazy, expect to spend a whole lot of time in it as most rides sends you to it. Best one i'd say is the leap of faith, make that your 1st jump as the queue draws longer as the day goes along.There's also a beach, kind of a pool and a dolphins areas which you can "swim" and take photos with, for a price.Overall it is a really well maintained place and you'll have a good time.

Fun in the Sun. Well it's a great Waterpark, as a guest it's free to get in and it opens @ 10am until Sunset, the best time to go is as soon as it opens, your allowed only 1 litre of Water to take in, NO Soda i.e Coke is allowed, so be prepared to pay their rates for Drinks, bearing in mind a 500ml Bottle of water in a Drinks machine in Dubai is 1dhm and the Hotel and Waterpark charge 13dhm so it's a Big mark up.Anyway the mornings are quite empty so that's the best time to go if your a guest, it's around midday that it starts to get busy especially around the main pool area.The rides are great and there's plenty of fun to be had.One recommendation is to buy a Kodak Waterproof camera for 50dhm from a shop or Mall outside the Palm to use inside as we did, as as far as I know you can't buy them in there, they only have there own photographer, and um guessing it's expensive.One complaint is that there's not enough shade along the walkways, as getting from one area with your inflatable to another can get a little hot on your feet, there was a few sprinklers that normally water the plants aiming at the walkways but Shade Sails above the walkways would help heaps.Bottom line is, Great Waterpark, Expensive Drinks, Hot feet and Plenty of life Gaurds to keep you safe.ENJOY 

Rip off..... Great place but not worth the 200AED. ok, maybe its because that is quite an investment and the owner(s) must recoup his/their money....Facilities were however top notch but the staff were clearly demoralized, unfriendly and definitely couldn't wait to go home...Are they underpaid? think so...For that price? naaaaaa. will try out other joints next time i visit Dubai.....

Brilliant. Brilliant water park which is fun for the family. There is an almost vertical slide called the leap of faith which is an enormous thriller but if your not one of the people who like those things like that there are great flumes where you sit in tubes. Also if you stay in the atlantis you have free entry which is brilliant because you can just go in for a few hours in the morning then head out or something which is perfect. Finally I recommend this water park and is better than jumeirahs wild wadi.

Waterslideshills bothways - UP-hill and down-hill. Out of the 3 located in Dubai it's hard to pick the best, since haven't visit the others, but this one claimed to have the "speed-monster" of the waterslides - one of the fastest on the planet which takes you down from the pyramid look-like hill top with top speed of 80 km/h!Only for the waterenthusiats, since the activity is solely based on the water theme. But if you're thinking would you dare to go there and you're already interested in water - take the step, since there is something for every level and age.Yet it's hard to get there by the monorail, you should try it, since it's something totally different what you're used to - an exiting choice which is not that popular that you should be wiaiting in long lines.

Superb - best water park I've ever visited!. Great location, great facilities, great rides/slides.They have thought of everything - from lockers, towels, cash on wristbands, sun loungers with canopies, good food outlets, great layout and family friendly! Virtually all the rides can be enjoyed on solo or double inflateable rings, and the rapids and lazy river are the perfect way to keep cool in the Dubai heat.The Palm monorail takes you directly to the park door, or park at the designated car park and get the free shuttle bus to the entrance - much more fun using the monorail though, and great views of the Palm and Atlantis hotel as you arrive.Only negative comment I would make is the beach area is not that nice - typical man made area, but stay in the water park area and enjoy every minute.

Nice and clean water park for the family. We were a big group, gone for a day trip to the aquaventure water park. The water was really clean and hygienic. The rides were nice but not too exciting. The usual rides which any water park has, except for one ride which was a real thrill called "The Leap of Faith". This ride was exciting giving an adrenaline rush.The safety aspect was very well covered. They had lifeguards at very small intervals which brought about a sense of safety, especially for kids. The rapids were nice but because of safety aspect they were not too fast and thrilling. If you have been to some nice water park, you can give this a miss, because it does not have much different to offer. I would not go there again.

fantastic time at aquaventure. if u are a large family 9 4 or more) try to be a hotel guest as u can find great deals at Atlantis.Trust me its worth the money.U get unlimited entry to water park and since its good the family really enjoys it. Do try the leap of faith ( if u are strong hearted, it is a lifetime experience) .Entry after 3pm is comfortable else days in may get very warm.Keep stuff in bags its very safe, lockers are waste of money.U can swim at the private beach next to the water park.Excellent calm water.

We have seen much better water parks!. There was so much expectation before visiting Aquaventure, but then we left disappointed.Firstly it is expensive. There is no point to charge reduced prices to attract more visitors, but then you start charging supplements for additional services, such as locker, parking and very expensive food and drinks. These are services that you need to take and therefore you do not have choice.The weather was nice and for an outdoor experience with the family was fine, however it is not the watermark that will leave you with the desire to be back. Most water slides are concentrated in the same location and the signage is very poor. You waste your time understanding where everything is and what it is.There are much better water parks.

Fantasic day out would definitely recommend this Water Park!. Great day out though quite expensive (cost us approximately £50 each for one adult entry, one towel and one locker (which we shared between three of us) plus about £16.50 for a couple of beers and a portion of nachos) but it was well worth it. We laughed all day and had an absolute ball, I would most definitely recommend this water park and would certainly return if I go back to Dubai. Queues could be quite lengthy at times so go as early as you can to make the most of your day. Leap of Faith was the only one that really took my breath away (and lost me my sunglasses and nearly my contact lenses) so just be careful if you're a bit of a scaredy cat like me and take your spare specs/pair of lenses if you need them!Enjoy.

Good (expensive) day out, but misses "wow factor". We spent a day in the Atlantis "Aquaventure" park on 23 April 2011 with our kids (5 and 7 years old). The long circular "river rides" with rapids in the park were very good and quite long and they kept us amused for a long time. They had also built a pyramid in the centre of the park, the top of which was the starting point for a couple of water rides/slides. However, these rides/slides were a disappointment: the lines for those rides/slides were close to 30/45 minutes (due in part to the fact that it was possible to cut in line at a few places) and these rides/slides lasted a mere 20 seconds. Unlike rollercoasters, water slides have to rely on gravity only and a 15 meter vertical drop simply does not result in a long ride. Overall, we had a good day out, but we considered it rather expensive for what it was (Adult AED 200/USD54; child under 1.2 meter AED 165/USD44) and they charge extra for towels (AED 40/USD 11 each) and a locker (AED 30/USD 8). Once you also include meals, a family day here is rather expensive and we have been to other waterparks that offer similar attractions at a lower price.Michael, London

A defo Must!!!!Great experience for Kids, Teens, adults and Older Adults. – Great experience (Must see)If you are staying at another hotel, try to get a day pass to : Atlantis Hotel – Day pass We were so excited when we saw on expedia that we had to the chance to visit the 7* Atlantis Hotel on a day pass during our tripThis Day pass allows you into the main entrance and building, the beach areas, pool areas and Dolphin enclosure (If you have pre booked it)Atlantis lives up to it’s hype – on the drive into Atlantis you feel like its , its own countryBreathtaking views, it defiantly lures you in to want to see more The entrance is over Elegance, high as the sky ceilings, large chandeliers, marble flooring, top Restaurants (Nobu), High end fashion Boutiques and Jewellers (Harry Winston, Cartier)The Day trip and the activities you may want to do come at a charge, but as we pre booked I think every penny was worth it It came to 2040.00Aed which was about £340 in total (For Dolphin experience , String Feeding & Lost Chambers tour) But note locker s are at a charge and you must remember to wear your wrist band at all times We made sure we pre booked Swim with the Dolphins at Atlantis Hotel – I would say was my best experience so farWe were in a group of 6 and we had two trainer and one dolphin named CathyOur group consisted of four adults and two kids The trainer went through a safety guide and basic mammal facts, questions and information introduction Then we went out to the private pool area where Cathy the Dolphin was already performing tricksWe each got the chance to stroke Cathy and perform two tricks with herStroke, play fetch, hug Cathy, Do a dance or have a kiss)I was totally amazed by this experience and still treasure that experience as a lifetime must!!!!!!Another activity – Based at The Mall of Emirates Ski Dubai – Expedia price at the time £40 pp for an hour instructions and free use of the ski for as long as you want (This includes Equipment clothes, shoes) – You may want to bring your own hat and gloves )if you forget a shop is on site to purchase theses things)Lost Chambers Tour Guide –Stingray feeding – At Atlantis Hotel I was a bit scared to do this one but my friend was really up for itWe got a short, brief instruction guide and we went in the pool with one guide and 2 other peopleWe got to feed the Stingrays – Prawns and fish and they way they eat is unusual (Their mouths are under Near their bellies they snap the food from you quickly so you have to mind your fingers but you are shown how to feed them correctly The do get excited and the bigger stingrays brush themselves on you (So its really fun almost being pushed over by a string ray) But you have to remember to stand up right and try not to fall over Atlantis was amazing they have shuttle Hopper that take you around the whole area The pool is one long not too deep pool area surrounding the AtlantisIts has different sections in the pool at each stop off (Its like a pool maze but you can just get a dingy and let the current push you round and round ) Its safe as well as every turning point has at least two life guards watching As you rest in the dinghy’s being pushed by the current around the water maze, there are turn off points to water activities like fast water rides and water tunnel rides and there is a young children’s section (where the water is low and they have an amazing jungle gym area in the pool The staffs in the pool are happy and friendly and every time we went round and came back to the same pool attendant, he made sure we got the full whirlpool experience (It is a large whirlpool in the water that spins you around, really fast and pushes you through a large tumbling waterfall. Deep breath before hand)Great experience for Kids, Teens, adults and Older Adults A defo Must!!!!

A mess from the minute you need your ticket. Certainly one of the less impressive water parks I have been to, even in Dubai, where I much preferred Wild Wadi. Already at the ticket counter there is so much noise in the hall, that it is close to impossible to understand, what the ticket seller is trying to tell you. The locker rooms are not very clean and there are simply not enough of them. Went there on a friday, big mistake, plenty of rude local youth who cut lines, scream and don't follow the instructions of the supervisors, who are simply overwhelmed. long lines in front of each ride, rides are short and the Leap of Faith main attraction doesn't come close to similar attractions in other water parks. Going through the shark tank is an useless experience as you don't realise that you are going through anything at all. The Shark attack ride, which leads you through the same tank, allows you to see more fish, but hardly any sharks.I wouldn't recommend spending all that money for so little.

Serious staff training concerns!!!!!!!. Overall Aquaventure looks great and has plenty for everyone to do. It is not cheap to enter and even if you only need one locker you still need to get one per person - again not cheap! The food is a typical burger, hot dog place but very pricey!!! Certainly not worth the money.On a more concerning note I seriously question the staff training and health and safety at this venue. In particular whilst on a shoot that goes uphill the rubber ring did not make it up a steep incline thus throwing us back down. Expecting a lifeguard to come to get us as we were being battered by water jets and now stuck in the middle of the shoot but no one appeared until we eventually had to shout and scream until rescued! Over 5 mins stuck! They apparently could not see us - that is the most worrying part. Overall a lovely place to visit to look at however a very frightening experience and not one I will revisit!

Most Amazing Aquarium and Water Park in the Middle East. Well if you have been in Dubai and not been to Atlantis Aquaventure than you have surely missed the most wonderful water park and waterpark in Dubai..there is no entry fee for the people staying in the Atlantis hotel however for others it is approx 75 USD for entry to both water park and the lost chamber which is the aquarium with 160000 water species..the attraction is situation on man made island of the Palm Islands..and it is one of the amazing experience. the lost chamber is themed under water aquarium based on the lost city and ancient theme..it has many water species including a shark..the waterpark has one of the biggest slide amongst all the water parksThere is also a Monorail which starts at the entrance of the waterpark and rides to the Jumeira road. the ride in the monorail is important as it gives you overview of the Palm Island.

excellent way to relax. It was one of the best visit to any water park. The slides are amazin=g, very very safe and innovative. They have made a common pool by which all of you will reach to a common spot even if you go to different slides.Leap of faith is amazing.

Poorly organised, poorly signposted and grumpy staff. We went to Atlantis following swimming with the dolphins at Dolphin Bay. We entered the waterpark then walked around looking for the changing rooms. After finding them we went to the first ride to find no rings. The grumpy member of staff told us to go the bay area to get one. On arriving at the bay area there were no tubes in sight. On asking the grumpy lifeguard he told us to stand and wait for an empty one to come round or to wait for someone to get off. After standing for approx 15mins we decided to give up and went looking around the park. Eventually an hr after reaching the waterpark we found 2 rings and managed to get on some rides. All the staff we came across were grumpy, barely able to raise a smile and uncommunicative. We went to Wild Wadi a few days later and the difference in the attiutde of the staff was amazing - their staff are smiley, friendly and game for a laugh, they want to talk to you and ask if youre having a good time. The park feels better organised and is far cheaper. Overall give Atlantis a miss and go to Wild Wadi instead.

Save your money for something else to do... If you have been to the waterparks in Florida, then please, my friend -- save your money for something else to do in Dubai.The crowd is pretty weird and the rides are mediocre at best. Skip it..

Fabulous for a day out.... We were day trippers to the Atlantis Water Park in the first week of Jan 2011 and had an amazing time. We bought a combo ticket with access to Aquaventure and The lost chambers for 250 AED, which is a saving of 25 AED if you bought the tickets individually.Started our visit by going to the lost chambers, a huge Aquarium which claims to host 65000 types of marine animals. As with the name, Lost Chambers as well as the water park is modelled on in the legendary lost city of Atlantis. The giant aquarium is a big hit and gives an opportunity to observe the marine species closely.Following the visit to lost chambers, we collected our entry tickets (read plastic watches) and entered the Aquaventure water park. There are changing rooms with secure lockers conveniently located just after the entrance. Lockers can be hired for 40 AED and in case you forgot to get your towel, you can hire both the locker and the towel for 50 AED. However, I do recommend that this is a water park and you have to be aptly dressed in swimwear to enjoy the park fully.After changing to the swim wear, we started with the river rides by grabbing the tubes and floating around the 2 km long river which is interspersed with rapids and torrents in many places. 2 km on the tube can be daunting, but it does kick up the excitement and set you up for the bigger rides.The water slides are definitely the bigger attraction and all of it based on the central part of the park called the Ziggurat.The highlight of the Zigurrat is the leap of faith ride, a 70 degree vertical plunge, which takes you through the shark and sting ray enclosure and certainly kicks up enough adrenaline. There are many other adventurous slides, but this one is exciting.I have heard of the WIld Wadi park close to Burj Al Arab, but didn't go there as we had already planned Atlantis, so can't comment on it, But I do feel Atlantis Water Park is a must visit when you are in Dubai.

Great, clean, big. The waterpark is free for Atlantis guests. It is bigger than Wild Wadi and has more rides, the lines even during the weekend weren't long. They could have provided easier access to the tubes needed to go on the rides though. I also wasn't keen on some of the lifeguards, they were making lewd comments about the guests in their native tounges. Wild Wadi has the more professional staff.

Overrated. We read the reviews before we visited. We didn't eat or drink there, so I can say much about the costs.The website boasts about a 42 acre waterpark, well this includes everything!! There really aren't that many slides, as a max I would say there are about 10 different slides, and that includes the slides taking you back up to the top.The queues can be really annoying. Standing on top of a man made pyramid waiting 30 minutes for a slide with a cold breeze freezing you, with little kids pushing in - not great! The slide with the longest queue is the one with the tunnel that goes through the fish tank, where you can apparently see sharks and loads of fantastic fish. Don't get me wrong I'm not saying it's rubbish, but it's completely overrated! You get quickly pushed through the 'fish tank' and that's it, ride over!I remember going to the Wild Wadi as a child, and I'm sure it was much better. But compared to water parks in America, this is nothing.If you have a free day in Dubai, with nothing else to do, and it's extremely hot, then go. Otherwise spend your money on something better! There are so many other things to do in Dubai and this isn't one of the greatest.

Great time at waterpark. We went to the waterpark for a day from our hotel and had a great time.We used the entertainer vouchers for food and admission which helped to save a bit of money as it's not cheap.The changing rooms are great with showers, lockers, hairdryers etc - no shampoo so bring your own!There are about 8 rides and there were very few queues - I think the longest we queued was 10mins for the shark ride. We went on a Thursday - I'm not sure if thats why it was't too busy. It also feels so so safe - there is a lifeguard every 5 yards or so and everyone is very friendly.I would highly recommend it for a day out in Dubai.

Too much money for what you get and horrendous trying to get out!!!!. For a family of two adults and three children, our visit here cost us £300 for entrance, towels and 2 lockers!!! This seems a lot of money for what you get. If you're going make sure you find and use the money off vouchers which we have since heard about. The park and its facilities are extremely clean and the rides are good fun but when its busy, there is quite a bit of waiting around and sun beds are impossible to find. As we went in Dubai's winter everyone was leaving at around 4pm and therefore getting out was horrendous - including the longest queue for taxis I have ever seen. We waited for over 1.5hrs. and according to our taxi driver this was not uncommon. Will definitely not return!

An excellent day out for the whole family!. We arrived early to avoid the crowds but really there weren't any!! We had the place to ourselves for the first 2 hours, possibly because it was December and a Thursday? The men in my family were keen to try the Leap of Faith, the highest and near vertcal slide - all enjoyed it but said they'd only go down once due to the red marks left on their backs! (it's really steep!). The other rides were fabulous and really great fun. We couldn't fault the restaurant, great food and friendly service and well priced. I enjoyed the beach although didn't swim, it was just nice to walk along it for a change. Don't forget to feed the stingrays - which costs extra but is a once in a life-time experience. Oh and also you have to visit the Lost Chambers Aquarium - the best one I've ever been to. Overall, a clean, safe and well managed park with heaps of fun for the whole family!

Great Day Out,. We went to Aquaventure at Atlantis for a day out over our Christmas vacation in Dubai. We arrived at opening time 10:00am and used BOGOF vouchers for entrance for 2 Adults and 2 Kids. We hired lockers but in retrospect, you didnt really need to if you had a sun lounger as you feel perfectly safe leaving your things with the lounger. The lockers were very clean and tidy, plentiful changing areas upon arrival but got very busy as everyone was leaving. We had our pick of sunbeds and chose ones by the lagoon area, adjacent to the Kids play area. The park was spotlessly clean, attendants at every turn, lifeguards all around the rapids, lagoon areas etc, many inflatables for the various rides about too. We thoroughly enjoyed the day there, as it was December, the weather started to cool and shade drew in around 3:45 or so, however we walked round to the beach area and enjoyed some more sun. The whole place was was relaxing and easy, music piped in the back ground and a general laid back feeling enhanced the visit.We had lunch at Shark Bites, its a fast food, but cooked to order place, it was much better quality than I anticipated, the prices were high for fast food, however we were using our BOGOF entertainer voucher again so it worked out very reasonable, the portions were rather large and despite being a fast food outlet the service was impeccable. I needed a fork and returned inside to get one and a member of staff ushered me back to my table and insisted on getting it for me. The service here is fantastic. There are golf buggys transporting guests around the park and up to the Dolphin experience, on to the beach and back around to the hotel.Our kids enjoyed an ice cream sundae and candy floss on the way out, again they Sundae was about £6 but I didnt feel ripped off, the quality was there and having used our entertainer vouchers. The whole day ran to about £100 for the 4 of us, that was our entrance, lunch, ice creams, locker rental x2 and towels x 2 I felt it was money well spent and would go again, next time we visit Dubai.

Good fun but very expensive - definitely get there early. Of course we didn't want to miss out on a trip to Atlantis Waterpark but must say it was very expensive. Definitely get there early so you can go on all the slides before it gets busy. Having been to Disney a number of times we were disappointed in comparison.

Well-run waterpark for early birds. Professional, safe and friendly staff. Arrive at opening because it fills up fast with motley international crowd, hence the friction some report. Plenty to do for a day trip with small children to teens, with attractive combo aquarium, feeding etc (prepare for sticker shock!) and food is pricey too. Bring towel, water but food "not allowed"

Great waterpark experiance. What a great day we had a the waterpark!
A clean, new waterpark which gave us hours of fun and relaxation.
Plenty of sunbeds- also a great view from the beach. Always lots of rings for the slides and no queues.
BRILLIANT.

Water park & bruised bits. We stayed at the palm, so the water park was free. So to get our moneys worth we went every day. Great fun for young and old.The water park itself tries to be very Disney, but doesn’t quite pull it of. Firstly, get there early. There aren’t enough sun beds when the park is busy, so you will then end up walking around trying in vain to find one. You will eventually give up and have to pay £8 for a locker. If you do get a sun lounger, each has an individual shade which can be adjusted to suit your needs and there quite comfy as well. Also if you don’t bring a towel there £6. The best part is the dolphin experience. The experience is great and you know that the dolphins are well looked after and their personalities taken into consideration during their training. Within your entry fee is a locker, soft drinks and a towel. The electronic locker key is a great idea but not transferable to the water park.Most of the rides start from the Ziggurat and in the afternoon the queues become quite large. There is also a lazy river which can take various routes, lazy or rapids. All the rides use these big rubber rings. This is fine in the morning, but once it get busy people start to keep hold of them and you will in up waiting to find one.The main attraction is the LEAP OF FAITH. It’s a sheer drop and to be honest I screamed like a girl the first time. I wouldn’t advise going on to often because I got quite a bruised behind. :o) Safety is in the form of life guides on every corner, who are constantly blowing there whistles at the misbehaving people.The food is very reasonably priced within the water park and the service is quick at each of the service areas.
Excellent. Very nice attraction ! The beach is nice as well. You can rent lockers and towels at your arrival. I had a great moment there.Have fun

Very nice relaxation!. We went there to have some fun with our 3 years old daughter. She really liked it! Leap of faith was a great experience and you almost think you are free falling, good one!! :) It is catered for all ages of kids so you'll have fun for sure.As we went there in November on working days (Tuesday) it was not filled with people so it was OK. Leap of faith wait was maybe 10mins, everything else almost nothing. But I can imagine it could get stressful when crowdy. Food/drinks are a bit expensive and be aware that it is all PRE PAID! You have to load money on your wristband by the entrance! They didn't tell me that, but a nice person did allow us to order anyway and come by later on when I did manage to go all the way back to the entrance.Also be aware, that lockers are REALLY SMALL, one backpack per locker!

Amazing, but very expensive. We did have a great day out here, but it was not as good as all the hype led me to believe. For younger children, there is a very limited set of things to do. If you are less than 1.2m, then all the really good rides are out of bounds and this was very disappointing. The rapids were great and the water play area. We did a dolphin encouter which was fantastic, but the briefing took forever and I was glad I did not put my four year old through this, was fine for the six year old. Limited food choices, but reasonable value.

Great water fun, and dolphins too!. This is a fabulous day out. the water park is suitable for all ages with fun rides and pools suitable for everyone. Don't imagine that half a day will be enough thoufgh, there's lots to do.We also booked a Dolphin adventure, which despite involving dolphins in captivity, which I was a bit sceptical about, was actually an amazing experience. Not a cheap addition to an already fairly pricey day out, but one of those "always to be remembered' experiences.My big tip if you go this park is to try to book a "Cabana" for the day. This gives you a roped off private space with a gazebo style tent for shade with a table and chairs where you can eat lunch, private sun beds, etc. There's also an attendant who keeps an eye on everything and will go get lunch and drinks for you, and there's a locker to keep eveything safe while you're off around the park. Also they give you a lovely bowl of fruit, chilled soft drinks and free towels. No worries about losing your sun bed or personal belongings, plus at busy time it guarantees a quiet area with some personal space (sunbeds elsewheer are really crammed together, and there's little shade). It would be ideal for a family, there are cabanas for four or eight people. You need to pre-book since they get snaped up quickly on the day. They add a bit t your bill for the day, but are probably the best value thing about the whole place.Wonderful day out all round though. Not cheap by any stretch, but worth it as a holiday treat for everyone.Peter H

BRILLIANT. My husband and I spent 6 hour here and it was so much fun....We arrived and found some beds along the banks of the lazy river. I was a bit tentative but after one circuit I was hooked. We went around the rapids and the torrent and I havent laughed so much in a long time.We also got on the water slides and I was like a kid going round and round again and again. I wasnt brave enough to do the Leap of Faith but my husband did and said it was amazing. A tip for you men out there though.... cross your legs :o)There were also lots of choice of food and drink and it was quite reasonable too.The beach is also very beautiful, offering gorgeous views across to the Burj al Arab and Dubai. We didnt swim with the dolphins and I was kinda gutted we didnt as it looked amazing. Next time we go back (and we will be back) the dolphin experience will be on my list.

great fun. spent a full day here in October, paid £50 for two adults as had been given voucher from a friend who stays in Dubai. leap of faith is great fun, get up early as lines get busy. you can spend hours going round on the inflatable rings. found there to be loads of beds both by the waterpark and the private beach.beach water was very warm and not ideal for cooling down in.ate at one of the burger bars and found it to be good.will def visit again if ever back in Dubai

Hotel - Wow! Staff need training -NOW!. This park is wonderful, the rides and attractions are really super and well thought out. It's also set out in such a way that you can set up a base and manage to see everything without dragging all of your things all over the park.Do not bother with the "beach" the water is stagnant and the beach itself is unwelcoming and very boring - not a wave in sight.If you come here and I think you should, prepare to spend a lot of money in addition to your entrance. Towels are $10 and when you soak one through you can't replace it you have to pay another $10! A burger combo is $14 and more if you want your fries curly! A bottle of water is $3 and a beer is $7. Also if you don't keep the receipts to prove that you have spent $30 on food and beverages, you will have to pay $7 for parking your car and where does one put a receipt in a bikini?This place is really banking on the fact that people will not drag their children, who will be having a whale of a time, out of a theme park on a matter of principle and of course they are right. Do not bother asking the staff anything as they are pre programmed robots, the only programming they have received, however is how to be totally unhelpful and adhere to company policies even in circumstances whereby the company is lacking product etc.Go to Aquaventure you will have a good time, your kids will adore it and talk about it for years, we had two 6 year olds, a 10 year old and a 15 month old with us and they all got a huge amount out of it. By the way, as our family is particularly tall, we all were charged as adults as the lower 'Kids" price is based on height not age!!! They clearly know that lots of Danes like to go there!So, go. Go to Aquaventure. Go with a full tummy! Keep your receipts and enjoy a burger that is priced as in a five star golf club, but eaten in a staff canteen.

Fun for everyone... We stayed at Le Royal Meridien hotel but visited Atlantis waterpark for the day. It is quite a palarva to actually get through (vigilant security check of your bag, complicated system from the ticket vendor) but once in, after the very long walk into the park itself, it is a great day out. We lliked the fact that you can just stay on your float and just drift into the next ride without having to leave your ring! There are some amazing views of Dubai (from the top of the area you need to climb for the more thrilling rides) and you can also see the Burj Al Arab form here, so good photo opportunities. The park did not feel very full even though it was, we noticed many of the hotel guests came later in the day about 3pm (as they have free entrance). There is a huge children section and pool which the kids will love, a great day out for all ages.

Enjoyable but can be pricey. This park is situated on Jumeirah Palm, upon arrival you can see the obvious attention to detail and first class staff service, the place was spotless and every staff member was programmed to provide excellent service, the water chutes and rapids are very good but others are not for the faint hearted, there are perhaps four or five ride options and a private beach with sand the same colour as flour, I'm glad I went and wasn't dissapointed.The various food and drink cabins located at regular intervals are very clean but a drink and a snack for four could set you back £30. there are photographers located throughout the complex, they even stand in the rapids and click you as you pass by putting a wrist band on you so you can go and view the photo they've taken, we did this and asked how much it was to buy ONE photo, the answer 85 Dirhams about £17.00!!, take a waterproof camera. Life guards seem to be every ten feet.The ground gets blistering hot so take flip flops and towels are extra so take them too and some quality sun cream it was 40 deg in October and not a cloud in the sky

Brilliant. We stayed at Atlantis for 3 nights and can honestly say it is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. The decor is amasing, staff friendly and there is so much to do there. Club Rush for teenagers is a must and the waterpark s enjoyed by everyone. Yes, food is on the pricey side but you can go out for dinner instead. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and know they will have a wonderful holiday.
Enjoyed Every Bit Of it!. People of any age can enjoy their time in the park. I strongly recommend it.

funfilled day out @ best Water Park. Dubai can be hot, 44 degrees recently on a stopover to East African Safari in Tanzania, Apart from the major tourist attractions, there is one place to escape and have the best fun time going round on all the water ways/rides on a huge tube, that will keep you cool & thrilled all day.It's Aquaventure at the Atlantis Palm Hotel and it's fabulous...the setting, the rides the sun chairs....the aqarium....it has it all and as old waterpark lovers, think it's one of the best .Lockers & towels to hire, food and bev available too.

Good attractions, get there early and bring food and lots of water. We arrived at the park when they opened at 10:00 AM last weekend, and the first couple hours were fun. There aren't too many attractions, but the facilities are new, clean and well-maintained.After mid-day Friday prayers, the locals swarm in by the hundreds and it's a much different experience. The attractions are crowded, lines are long, there is a lot of pushing and shoving, and it's standing room only. We had left the towels we rented for 150 AED on a chair and were lucky to locate 3 of the 4 cast to the side, wet after someone else had used them. No chance of lunch as there was no place to sit, so we cut our day short.I was quite disappointed that there are no drinking fountains and there aren't enough sun beds to accomodate the afternoon crowds. I probably won't do the day pass again but may stay at the hotel and spend the morning at the park, planning to leave when the crowds roll in.

Take a "golf" vehicle taxi and go to.... Take a "golf" vehicle taxi and go to watermark next to Atlantis hotel. The entrance is free for hotel guests. This place is amazing! You will definitely enjoy it. You can take a air-boat at one of the beaches and go! There is a river around the resort with waterfalls. You can jump into air boat and enjoy the fun on the river which will take you around park. The big pyramide in the middle is the biggest fun. Go to the top and enjoy fastest ride ever. You will be falling down and going through the sea aquarium in the tube! You can spend hours here!

Fun Waterpark-Eat beforehand. My brother and I opted to do the Lost Chambers and Aquaventure Park which is 250AED per person (68.00USD). The Lost Chambers was fun and the artificial artifacts were neat. The Leopard Eels were really cool. There are tons of photo-ops along the way and the gift shop at the end isn't too bad as far as prices go. After the Lost Chambers (which is a pretty quick look-around) we went to the waterpark. The lockers cost 40AED (11.00USD) and if you need a towel it is 10dirhams (3.00USD) more; we didn't bring or buy towels. Our first stop was the locker room, it's not co-ed so I was the only one w/access to it. They give you a wrist band that has a magnetic circle in it that will assign you the first locker you put it up to. Once we got settled in and our SPF on we went to find some food first. It wasn't easy because some places weren't open or didn't have what they advertised to have i.e. the popcorn stand without popcorn(?). We just ended up grabbing some snacks from a cart that drives around and parks. It's pretty pricey, wish we'd eaten beforehand. It was pretty quiet I thought, we went on a Thursday and their busy days are Friday's and Saturdays I believe. The lounge chairs were awesome because they are made of a comfortable mesh and have a top that swings over giving even more shade. Water tubes weren't too hard to come by but again it was slower on the day we went. Their version of the Lazy River (I can't remember what it's called) where you float around in a circle, was really neat because there were rides in between so it was surprising. That was my favorite part. We went on some other rides but the big ones (by the time we got the nerve up:)) were closed. I guess the big rides close around 6:00pm. I was a little dissapointed by that. I thought most waterparks stayed open later. It does get dark pretty early in Dubai though so that may be why. I would've spent more time playing than sunning if I'd realized that, I should have informed myself better. Otherwise this was a blast.
