It can take a good part of a day if you spread out your activities as it is a smaller water park and the attractions are few compared to other parks of it's kind but the Lost Chambers is a fun prelude to it all. Definitely recomend it but be aware of the admission price so you aren't surprised.

Hotel overnight gets you free entry. Arrived early afternoon to the hotel and hopped on the free buggy from the Atlantis East Wing exit (by the Zero pool) which gave us a little tour of the hotel grounds. Stopped by security before Aquaventure and given entry wrist bands. Towels provided and several drinks/food huts with reasonable prices (20 dirhams for cocktails and snacks averaged 25 dirhams) no different to many of the UK water parks. Worth visiting if staying at the hotel but not being fans of scary water rides wouldn't personally bother paying the entry fee otherwise!
Brilliant!. Fabulous place, when we went there were very short queues - my family loved every minute and fun for the adults too!!! Love Dubai.

Enjoyable but not worth the hype. We went as a family in July. After having been to wild wadi previous year we were expecting something a bit more. Price was expensive for 3 adults 1locker and 1 towel it came to 130 uk pounds. It was nicely laid out with gardens etc and once you had done the leap of faith everything else was quite tame. There were a few kids who were upset as most of the rapids etc had a height restriction of 1.2m which was strictly enforced so they could not go on them even if they were good swimmers. Lifeguards were very friendly and professional. Dolphin shows and experience were all extra to the price also. On the whole it was expensive for what it was and you could go to wild wadi instead for cheaper and not feel like you had been to Dubai and missed out by not going to aquaventure

Incredible park!. I was surprised to see some of the negative reviews on here. I love this park and have been 3 different times on various trips down to Dubai. The park is beautiful and if surroundings are important to you this is why you might choose Aquaventure over Wild Wadi. Wild Wadi is a bit concrete, crammed and not very pretty. The other major attraction is that Aquaventure has it's own beach! Gorgeous when you want a break from the water.The slides and rapids are great fun. My personal favourite is The Torrent. I haven't done the Leap of Faith because I'm too chicken but the other slides are great and I love the fact that for most of them you don't ever have to leave your ring.Food and drink prices are in line with what you'd expect in a relatively exclusive water park attached to an iconic 5* hotel. Come on people...it's Dubai not Benidorm. If quality is important to you you won't be disappointed.

fabulous place for tourists to visit. friends this place is situated in palm jumeirah row houses with excellent hotel facility water park, etc., especially the dolphin show in the evening is a heart throbing event for children especially. the beautiful construction of different architects shows the unity and friendly nature of dubai people.love this place.sathyakala

Great for people who love tube rides. The.... Great for people who love tube rides. The whole park is full of different slides and their is a long tube ride, that brings you in 40 minutes thtough the park.Great place for families, too. Very safe with lifeguards everywear.On the negative site: Very expensive drinks and food. Tge food us not too good. So, don't forget your cookies.

Fun day out. Having read previous reviews we decided to visit Aquaventure rather than Wild Wadi. The site was as clean as others have commented, but some areas of the facility are starting to appear dated. We purchased the use of a locker, but given the number of sunbeds that were available we're not sure we would do so again. The site is quite confusing but the rides are concentrated in one area which makes things easier. We had no problems with rings, but it was quiet and we could easily see how there could be a real shortage if it had been busier. Staff were incredibly helpful and unfailingly cheerful - even helping with shortcuts between rides on occasions!We arrived at 1:30pm and were told the 25% discount applied from 2:30pm, which seemed like a deal until we realised that simply having a coffee in the nearby restaurants would cost more than we would save! (All the signs and the website suggested 3pm was the start of the discount time)

Very expensive for one rapid ride and the.... Very expensive for one rapid ride and the leap of faith ride! Around £50 each was no where near worth it!The sun loungers went straight away even though we got there early, there wasn't enough rings for everyone to go on rides.It was so cheeky for them to charge £5 for lockers. Not deposit, "rent" as in you don't get your money back!The food was so expensive leading to the whole day costing around £150 for both of us. No where near worth it!As its attached to the Atalantis I expected much more.The ticket we had also allowed us in the lost chambers which was one of the poorest aquariums I've ever seen.I wish I didn't bother and was a waste of money and the day.

A LOT of money for a day out. Kids had a great time. Management need to sort out the ring hoarders!!!. We just got back. Had one night at the 895++ rate (1074) for 2 adults and 2 kids (6&4). Although the rooms are not available until 2pm, you can check in early, access Aquaventure from 10am and leave your luggage with reception. Despite plans to get there as it opened, it was like herding ferrets round the apartment, so we arrived about 12pm. Check-in was quick and efficient. It was boiling when we arrived and we trailed around looking for a sun-lounger (kids moaning), but there were lots around the back near Barracuda restaurant. Our sons are below the 120cm height restriction, so we were limited to the kids Splash area (lots of smallish, but still good fun for them, slides and water sprays), the wave pool (pretty sedate) and the Torrent (lazy river), which included a rapids section you could could choose to go on or not. We stayed 6 hours until the kids' splash bit was evacuated due to some child pooing in it, but we were ready to leave anyway. The sunloungers have individual shades over them , but it is still hot sitting under them. It is cool enough if you sit in the splash pool, but lots of people roasted a lovely shade of red, so do cover up. I would also recommend pool shoes, as I had to get off the lazy river before completing the route and burnt my feet getting back tomy shoes.The kids had a fab time. My husband and I both got very cross with people hoarding the rings that you needed to go round the lazy river - many (all nationalities) had several by their loungers, in the restaurants or on the rocks in the splash area and refused to give them up, so we spent 20 minutes asking people who came off the river for theirs, with most refusing because they were still using them (ie wanted to ride again before they left). There were enough rings for all the people who wanted them at any one time if people didn't hoard them. The staff asked people to give them up, but didn't make them do so and I have to say that it did spoil the day a bit.You can take a litre of water per person in (didn't know this). 600ml bottles are 10dhs each, bottles of coke 12dhs. We had lunch in Barracudas - cool, quiet, good quality food and plenty of it. The kids had burger/ chicken strips, chips and Capri-sun (35dhs each) and I had half a chicken tikka, nan, raita and some grated veg (delicious) and 58dhs.For dinner, we had planned to get room service, but main courses were around 140-180dhs, so we went to Kaleidoscope restaurant and had the buffet (175 per adult, 85 per child aged 3-12). The problem is that we are spoiled with access to great food over here and I was expecting lots from this. It was good (Italian, Chinese, Indian, carvery, Arabic, sushi and lots of desserts )but nothing special, in my opinion, and I thought it was overpriced, particularly when the kids were too tired to eat much at all. There wer lots of high chairs and booster seats, free baby food and it was easy to be there with children. Breakfast was 140/ 70 dhs each and we chose not to eat there.Our deluxe room had a sea view and was very nice.The children would have liked to go back to Aquaventure on the second day and you can, at no extra cost, but we had an appointment elsewhere and my husband had had enough anyway.Altogether, Aquaventure, lunch, dinner the room and valet parking cost 2000 dhs. We had a good time and I'm glad that we tried it, as it is one of Dubai's attractions, but we won't go again.Hope this is helpful.

Another must for kids. Our children (aged 7 and 9) love water parks, especially during the hot Dubai heat.We do find this waterpark quite busy (worse in school holidays) and so involves long queues at the entrance, problems getting the rubber rings (so much so that people hoard) and finding sunbeds seated together. It means that you do have to set off early and reserve your place sadly. Bring your own towels and charge your wrist bands at the entrance so that you don't have to bring money and valuables into the park (or get a locker at extra cost). Food and drink (the usual theme park food, ice cream, half of a pineapple & watermelon) are readily available and the usual cost. There are no water drinking fountains that we could find!There are many rides but a little more suitable to the larger and taller child. Our 9 year old was tall enough to go on the Ziggarat but was a bit 'light' and so once he was in a ring he wasn't heavy enough to get pushed up on the travelator and so the ride had to be stopped. The 7 year old was too short for these rides.It is a good family day out and a must in Dubai but beware the long queues and the cost.

Best Waterpark EVER!!!. I have to say, i've been to waterparks all over, and this one tops them all. Something about Dubai that makes this a little special!They have some cool slides, and the vertical one (leap of faith) is a pretty awesome adrenaline rush!Aquaventure also had this Cool Nights event, where u can use the waterpark until midnight which was brilliantly done, there was a carnival parade, international food, live music, salsa, fireworks, and of course the slides.Would recommend it to anyone :)

Soooooooooo much fun!. Such a great day out, went with a group of friends and spent hours in the river which is amazing! The big slide was insane - you have to let go before you see it beneath you it's so steep. Didn't feel crowded and we were also able to go and chill on the beach for a while - very cool.
Don't expect Blizzard Beach!. I was a bit dissapointed, it was nice but that's about it! No Blizzard Beach! Not a bad way to spend a few hours and second to the Wild Wadi!

Good Day Out, Very Good Service. Enjoyed my day out at Atlantis Waterpark. All the staff were very helpful and I was very impressed with the amount of lifeguards on duty and people overseeing all the time. I particularly like to mention 'Joseph' from Kenya was very helpful and friendly.I can hardly believe I did the Leap of Faith four times, (although number 4 was due to my friend not get the required photograph in number 3 time). It was nice that the staff remembered me each time, especially considering how many people were at the park. I do wonder if it was because I screamed so loud and long each time I did the Leap of Faith.Based on other reviews I have read I chose to go on a 'school day', as a result while there were plenty of people, I do not consider it crowded and the most I had to wait to do the Leap was 3-4 mins.I felt that everything was keep very clean and tidy. I do have a suggestion for the shower area....would be very handy to have a hook to hang towel.I would also definitely suggest taking your own water and plenty of it as its very expensive.Overall I am very pleased I went and enjoyed my day. Also enjoyed the 'Lost Chambers' and would recommend the Aquarim at Dubai Mall too

Brilliant fun. Aquaventure entry is free to hotel guests, which is brilliant because to non residents it costs approximately £40 per person. As a hotel guest you receive a bracelet on the way to the park each day. The only extra we paid for was for a locker, which are approximately £8 a day. All towels are free to hotel guests aswell. The lazy river is brilliant, you can just relax in your rubber ring an float around for hours, and take different short cuts to different rides, such as the rapids and torrent, all were brilliant. The slides were great especially the “Shark Attack” where you go through the tunnel through the tank full of sharks, rays and different fish. My sister did the “leap of faith” she said it was brilliant but looked a bit to scary for me!!!. Food and drink is expensive in the park, but no more expensive than when you go to Chessington etc in this country.A must do when visiting Dubai.. Loads of fun.

Incredibly overpriced spectacle. If you're going to Dubai anyway, Atlantis is certainly a thing to behold, but I wouldn't make the trip there just for Atlantis like we did. When you get there, you'll find that EVERYTHING is very expensive. By accident, we arrived early which turned out to be the ideal time to avoid long lines for the water slides. Because everything is so spread out, you really have to plan your day in order to get to do all of the rides. Staying there at the resort could be fun, but we couldn't justify the 600/night room. I would say that the aquarium there is quite spectacular if you enjoy looking at fish. That's probably the best feature of the place. The water features are fun, but again, just not worth the wait and money. Also, beaches 'close' at dusk, so good luck sitting and watching the sunset!

Don't bother spending the AED 100 (£20 pp) on the Aquarium!!. We recently visited the Atlantis resort in Dubai as part of the Big Bus Tour. The resort is definately worth a visit but unless you are really into fish, don't bother spending AED 100 on the entrance to the aquarium. Although it is spectacular, once we came out and walked around the corner (if entrance is on your right, go straight on and you will see a load of people stood gazing), you can see the main part of the attraction for free!!

As expensive as you want it to be. We had discount vouchers from a book called The Entertainer so saved huge sums on entry prices. You can buy this book online or we found it at Borders Bookshop in the Emirates Mall. You have to pay to rent towels if you do not bring your own (about £6 per towel). However, there is no deposit scheme, so you can walk away with same towels if you choose - and they are huge beach towels. Nobody checks your belongings if you want to take your own food and drinks so you can save money there too if you want. Get there when the place opens and take your belongings with you to stake out your sunloungers. We had absolutely no problems with getting loungers, rubber rings or queues for rides. This is not the place for adrenaline junkies (bar the Leap of Faith) but is more a relaxed fun park involving a very long and complicated Lazy River which has torrent and rapid options - you choose. It is completely surrounded by well maintained gardens and don't forget the lovely white sand beaches. You can also pay to feed the rays (or just watch) or pay to "interact" with the dolphons (or, again, just watch). In Discovery Cove in Florida, you cannot just watch - you have to pay to participate as it all takes place out of sight. Not here! Large numbers of very happy lifeguards at every twist and turn of the river, photo opportunities with no pressure AT ALL to buy - you choose to view the photos AFTER you leave the park in the souvenirs shop. Again, unlike Disney. You can visit the hotel to gawp at the ocean-themed decor and watch the beautiful tropical fish in the enormous tank all for free. Unlike the Burj Al Arab where you have to have a restaurant reservation to get in at all. It is also a stop on the open top bus tour and has its own monorail stop so transport is very easy. Don't forget, this is a business they are running so they make money where they can. You have choices too so make best use of them. We did not visit Wild Wadi (much to our teenage children's disgust) so cannot compare but will go there next time. And use our discount vouchers there too, of course!

Too expensive for what you are getting. Although it is nice to go out on to the Palm and the Atlantis hotel/resort is very impressive the waterpark is only very average, not many rides, rides not really fun and the park is difficult to navigate. At first I though -- hey where are all the rides and wandered around looking for the hidden entrances but then after about 3 hours I realized thats it!! I paid 200 UAE dh for this! what a rip off. But to be fair the park was spotlessly clean and well maintained and the changing roomes etc were top notch. The visit to the Atlantis was worth it and there are many free attractions, huge aquarims in the hotel underground but skip the water park!

Underwhelmed. The newest water park at the most famous hotel in the world has to be amazing, right? Well, actually no - or at least not amazing enough I'm sorry to say.Elsewhere on Tripadvisor you'll find visitors to Dubai sharing mixed views on the two main water parks - Wild Wadi at Jumeirah Beach and this one next to the Atlantis Hotel on the Palm. Of course it's a matter of opinion but I felt that the choice of rides/attractions you get with the basic entrance charge (£36 at Feb exchange rates) felt somewhat limited. Centred around the Ziggurat water slides, the flumes and slides interconnect so that you can do most without leaving the water or giving up your inflatable ring. This latter point shouldn't really be an issue but trying to find, beg, filch a ring isn't the sort of experience I would expect. With the park very quiet I would have expected better.Generally I was underwhelmed by the rides. With no queues it was possible to do them all in a couple of hours. Given that many are similar in nature (some might even say dull) I certainly wouldn't want to queue for ages in high season.The good bits? Nice changing facilities; cleanliness; and plenty of loungers coupled with the continuous nature of the flumes means that parents can stay in one place all day whilst kids roam free.In my opinion Wild Wadi has more variety and was more fun. Both are OK for a half/full day visit - despite my strong reservations you will enjoy yourself here honestly! Obviously they're brilliant when you have free access as a hotel guest. It's all a question of value and expectation. Watch your wallet here at Aquaventure as the extras soon rack up. We didn't go with the swim with dolphin or the Lost Chambers add-ons yet with entrance, locker and towel hire plus a modest snack lunch we were looking at over £50 per adult - for a half-day visit. You pays your money...By the way - take the monorail from the park and take in the amazing Palm Jumeirah development and the Dubai skyline - the best bit of the visit!

Great day out at the Atlantis waterpark. Really enjoyed our day spent at Aquaventure water park. Unlike other waterparks we have visited this one was quite quiet.There were plenty of rubber rings even the double ones which normally you have to wait for at other waterparks. The sunbeds are really comfy and you don't have to pay for them which is great. What i was really impressed with was when you get off a slide you go into a lazy river which has all different paths to take, you can even get back to the top without getting out and walking up all the steps again as there is a slide which pushes you back up amazing!! Also if you stay on the lazy river you can go on the rapids which are great fun. I very much enjoyed Shark Attack which is a slide you use your rubber ring for, you end up in a tunnel with sharks and fishes swimming all around you it was really good. I didn't brave the big tall one but my partner did and said it was good you also go through a tunnel on that one but he said your going so fast you don't see anything but water spray. If you go to the top of the pyrimid where all the slides are you have great views over Dubai so make sure you have your camera ready. We paid for a combined ticket into the Lost Chambers of Atlantis, it was ok but nothing amazing once you have seen one aquarim you have seen them all.

Oh my God!. The main attraction (?) has to be the leap of faith which is a near free-fall of 27m into a tunnel through (small) shark infested pool. For the bold and daring this is a great experience; for those who hate heights this is an 8 second feeling of complete dread which culminates in a massive adrenaline rush - didn't even see the sharks!! The whole park is excellent with a great layout of lazy rivers, rapids and slides which can be ridden on rubber rings for one or two people. For anybody who loves water then this is a perfect place to come. It's not cheap (£100+ for two adults) but its great fun!

atlantis brilliant time. just come back from christmas in dubai ,fantastic time.throughly enjoyed the waterpark at the atlantis .we had a buy one get one free offer so was only120 dirhams each,approx 20 pounds each! got there at 10 left at 5 so many rides to go on and we are in our 50s only stopped for about an hour to grab a hotdog. i think its the best waterpark and also a beach there staff great.

Not worth the money. If you're not staying at the Atlantis and have to pay to get in - don't bother going to Aquaventure, just go to Wild Wadi. The rides are kind of boring and they're all the same! Most of them are located on the Ziggurat (a pyramid structure) they just start from different levels of it, and honestly, there really wasn't much difference between the rides. The rapids were real short and boring. The Torrent River was alright, the waves were nice, but it was kind of boring too.Overall, I was disappointed because compared to other water parks that I've been to, Aquaventure is really boring.

Should have been better than the Wild Wadi. As we had a 4 night stay at the Atlantis hotel, we had free use of the Aquaventure water park included. A big bonus given the rather high entrance fee for non hotel resident visitors.I have previously been to the Wild Wadi and several other water parks to make a comparison.The centrepiece of Aquaventure is the 27.5 metre tall, The Leap of Faith. As you wait for your turn at the top you get to enjoy magnificent views from the Palm Island looking towards the new Dubai skyline. So much so that you will soon return with your camera to take snaps. In theory you will catapult down a transparent tunnel and through a shark filled lagoon. However as with similar rides of this kind, you move down so fast that you can hardly keep your eyes open and even if you did, you will see not see anything. A ride concept defeated by the laws of physics. Again the Wild Wadi has a similar big slide in the Jumeirah Sceirah.Shark attack is another ride where you go through twisting tunnels but again I did not see much of the sharks even though you descend more slowly into the lagoon.The rest of the rides are a series of interconnected tube rides mixed in with a lazy river. This is again similar to a concept the Wild Wadi has with the Master blasters.For younger kids the water playground has thrills with two huge tipping buckets spin the release torrents of water, climbing frames and rope bridges lead to water slides. You can even soak others with water jets.Life guards are everywhere to keep an eye on guest safety. Food and drinks are expensive; we managed to get a sun bed before they all went and kept our stuff there. As there are a lot of tube rides they were sometimes in short supply especially two ringed ones that we wanted for some rides.However, it’s only a half day excursion and if it was not free entrance for Atlantis guests I would baulk at paying full price. I do feel that its in need for some more individual rides such as more pure water slides and a few raft type rides that you could go with a larger group of people.In a sense the limitations of the park has set up the heated question of which waterpark in Dubai is the best. Both parks have something to offer. The fact that this newer park should have demolished the competition by being more bold and diverse with its attractions but it did not means the debate rages on. In a sense this should have been better and is not.

Absolutely Brilliant. Hubby and I went for the day to the waterpark for the day in November whilst staying with friends in Dubai and had a fabulous day.It is pretty expensive at about £30 per adult and a locker for the day about £10 but the facilities are excellent and the level of service from the staff exceptional that it felt worth it.It's fairly newly opened so everything is in good condition The changing rooms are beautiful to the point that I almost felt guilty walking in dripping wet!There are a range of rides from fairly sedate floating round calm rivers to more turbulent rapids, and a number of flumes of different speeds in cluding one that actually takes you upwards! All the rides are all, bar the big drop, done on rubber rings of which their are plenty of both single and double options. If you don't want to walk anywhere and don't want to climb stairs you can pretty much make your way round all the rides on the rubber ring with travellators taking you uphill where required.The place was over-run with staff with lifeguards at every turn but all were ever so friendly and helpful.There is a massive aquarium with sharks that one of the ring rides goes through at a leisurely pace. The big drop from the zigarat also shoots through the shark pool but you don't have chance to see a thing it's so fast!There are plenty of places to sit and sun yourself if you prefer and a kids splash area that looked fun. There are also quite a number of eateries.Over the far side of the park is a dolphin lake and if you are feeling flush you can pay to get in the water with them.

Unless you've got young kids don't bother.. Having been to water parks in Florida, Cyprus, Crete and various other places I have to say this one was a massive disappointment. I went the other week with my 18 year old son and once you've done the 'Leap of faith' that's it as far as 'ringless' chutes are concerned. In fairness the 'Leap of Faith' is a good ride but because it's the only chute you can't use a ring on there was a massive queue each time we used it - the first time we quesed for about 10 minutes, which is OK, the second time nearly half an hour and the third time the queue was so long we estimated over an hour's wait! The rest of the rides you are simply sat in a rubber ring and carried round at varying degrees of speed from slow to almost stationary. One of the main reasons we went to Aquaventure rather than Wild Wadi was the pictures we'd seen of people floating through a perspex chute (on a ring) through a shark tank - it looked stunning - in reality the inside of the plastic tube is so misted with condensation from the differences in water and air temperatures that you can hardly see a thing - again a massive disappointment. We also went here thinking we could go into Atlantis, which is next door to the water park, and have a coffee - you can but only into an area that resembled a bus cafe - you can't actually get into the hotel's lobby for more civilised surroundings - the hotel guards see to that. It's also not easy to get to - we took the Metro to Mall of the Emirates and then taxi but we wanted to use the Monorail coming back and that means trying to get a taxi from the 'Gateway' (where the monorail ends) to the Mall to get the Metro - taxi's are cheap but for some reason getting a taxi from the Gateway is really hard - there aren't any! So in summary if you like floating round in a rubber ring then go for it - otherwise don't bother.

Great day at the Atlantis... much more than just a water park. I was a bit sceptical about Aquaventure as it is pretty far from the rest of the attractions in Dubai but was well worth the journey and the money. It was great to see the Palm resort and the Atlantis hotel is stunning. Get there early and secure a sunbed and go on some of the slides with less people around plus the staff get more involved.. ie pushing me into a whirlpool (v. fun)! You may also want to bring a sarong/cover up for when eating as unlike other waterparks you'll find lots of people are fully clothed which made me feel a bit underdressed in my swimsuit.We spent the whole day on the slides etc and also walked down to the beach and swam in the Sea. My favourite was the Shark slide (not sure of exact name) was brilliant as you go down a tube through a huge fishtank of sharks rays and tropical fish swimming all around. The only issue is the price for entry and food which is overpriced especially for families but I can understand they want to keep the exclusive, high end feel of the resort.

Worth the money. Aquaventure was good value in October 2009 at AED 200 per person, despite the fact that afterwards we found a 25% discount leaflet at our hotel. Well presented and in good condition. Although rides from the Ziggurat often involved queueing, the Rapids ride is fun, quite extensive and because it is continuous and goes past several concrete beaches, you can join in without queueing.Arrive early as there's so much to do. When it gets busier, you can relax on the sandy beach on the landward side of the Palm, or swim in the sea.As the monorail station is right by the waterpark entrance, this would be a good way to arrive if you get the taxi to drop you at the Gateway Station. The monorail is due to be extended to connect with the metro (2011?). At the end of the day, taxis were hard to find at Gateway Station and it's not practicable to walk to the metro.

Disappointing. As we've been to Wild Wadi before (and loved it!) we thought we'd try out the Aquaventure on our last visit to Dubai. Very very disappointing - we thought it was a poor imitation of the Wild Wadi. Not many big rides - but also not many other ride either. The lagoons was very dull - only drama was when my husband and lost each other for about an hour and half - but no-one could help us to locate each other. Expensive and boring. Should have gone to Wild Wadi.

Good fun, go during Ramadan - it's much quieter!. We stayed at Le Meridien Mina Seyahi, and my husband and sons (teenagers) loved the water park. We had read the reviews on Tripadvisor, and all seemed to say that it was busy, nowhere to eat and very expensive. Looked at the Wild Wadi, but after speaking with the Hotel it appeared Wild Wadi (the original water park) is now quite dated, and rides are more suitable for smaller children. They therefore all set off, to try Aquaventure. The setting at the Atlantis Hotel was amazing. Look out for the aquarium which is huge. Lockers and towels could be rented, but pretty expensive - take your own towels if possible. Rides were really good, and no queues anywhere - but we did visit during Ramadan and it was exceptionally quiet everywhere. My husband said on a busy July/August day with hundreds of people, he could understand why other reviewers were not too happy - it was quite chaotic, and not sign posted too well either. He couldn't find anywhere to eat either, unless you went out of the Park and into the Hotel - again, if you take a picnic that would solve that particular problem... plenty of sunbeds available, and overall a fantastic day out. Promotional cost per person (kids classed as adults) was 200AED each (£34). Usually 295 AED, so a good saving. We thought it was very worthwhile, however probably true about previous comments during the normal holiday period.

Don't bring your kids if the're smaller than 130cm and like slides. We booked the Atlantis because entry to Aquaventure would be free. Aquaventure is a fun place for the whole day. Nice kiddy stuf, nice raft (however very slow on most sections) on tube and fun slides. Indeed the leap of faith is great. I needed several rides to understand what happened :-).Go on the slides early (after opening) and there are no queusThe big minus for us was the 120cm length restriction which is being enforced.They are using make shift sticks vary between (estimate) 125-135cm long. Incredible, building a place like that and not being able to make 120 measuring equipment.Result: our son, 121cm long, could not ride any of the fun slides.That really makes you happy, booking the place (knowing your son can ride the slides, because he is 120+) coming there and not being able to do so.I complained at the hotel (in writing) but, 2 weeks later, still got no reaction .Bad ending on a further nice stay.

AMAZING. Leap of Faith is awesome!!!The other rides could be a lot better though.The torrents and lazy river/rapids are a great way to spend a day in the sunshine.Price was OK (220AED) and got BOGOF with the entertainer - Locker fee is outragous!!Also a dolphin interaction area where you can watch (or for 900AED particapate) in a small dolphin show. The fastfood places are OK and theres also a starbucks by the dolphinsWould definately recommend over wild wadi

Take your kids and have a blast!!!. I live in Dubai and go to Aquaventure quite regularly during the hot summer months. Like any other attraction, you must use some common sense when visiting. Don't follow the crowds, there are SO many chairs, you just have to look beyond the first pool where everyone seems to plop down when it's busy. Try to head closer to the dolphin attraction, there is a whole world of chairs over there and it's quiet and peaceful ( there is also a starbucks right around the corner) The staff is always very friendly and helpful when called upon, and always have a minute to flirt with my baby. We spend most of our visits on the river with the baby ring just floating and we can't get enough. Next year we will definitley get the annual pass again.

Too expensive for what you get. The best part of this attraction is that it is new, clean and their are lots of lifeguards to keep you safe. We opted not to take advantage of the 150AED valet parking and parked in the lot. Once there we found out that we had to take a shuttle to the waterpark. Fortunately, we arrived right at opening and there were very few other people around so we got on without a wait. The shuttle bus parks around the corner from the monorail station - quite a walk to even get to the hotel. From there you have to walk through the entrance to the hotel to find the waterpark. It seems like a pretty poor set up - soggy water park patrons mixing with dressed up restaurant and hotel guests.There was only one staff working at the entrance so quite a line up formed before they finally opened up another line. We had 2 for 1 tickets, so the admission fee was reasonable. But add to that the cost of a locker and towels if you need them $$$$$. Most of the walkways are covered and most of the ones that are not have water spraying to cool the paths - very necessary as we burned our feet crossing the bridge. Keep your water shoes with you!My son is about 118 cm and the minimum height for the big rides is 120cm. At least the staff appear to consisently enforce this rule. Because he couldn't go on the big rides, we spent most of the time on the rapids and torrents in the rivers - nice long rides and pretty fun too. The only other thing he could do was the children's area. There was a pretty good variety there.There are only 6 big slides and they all have the same entry point. I imagine there would be major line ups and congestion if it was busy. We didn't try them all, but they looked unique. Many of the slides are covered tunnels.We found the food and beverages to to very expensive. Opted not to buy, so I don't know about the quality or quantity.Apparently there are only 2 shuttle busses to the parking lot and they come at greater than 15 minute intervals. We were glad we left early in the afternoon and the park was not busy. Even so, the bus was completely full. Overall I would have to say that Aqua Adventure is not good value for the money. We had way more fun at Dreamland in Umm Al Quain for less than half the price. Aqua Adventure looks good, but the lay out is poor.

fantastic!. Overall having been to both the aquaventure water park and Wild wadi I would say that Aquaventure seemed a little better (although both parks are fantastic). Aquaventure is newer than wild wadi and the attractions were very good for both adults and children. We bought the entertainer book which is highly advised as it gave us buy one get one free tickets for many attractions including Wild Wadi, Aquaventure, Arabian nights desert safari and many restaurants (the only catch for this book is that we found some restaurants were not existant!).One of the great things about the park is that you float around on a lazy river in a rubber ring which leads you to a range of fantastic rides- most rides you never have to leave the water! Within aquaventure there were many areas to sit with individual parasols, this was very helpful and it didnt seem busy. Eating within the waterpark was reasonably priced and I would advise taking a cool box with water in. Only negative is to watch out for queue jumpers!Overall a great day out for the whole family!

Dont go if your a chicken :P. it is a daring experience :D its a must that you go on the leap of faith but dont que up and get right to the front of the que and let your 11 year old daughter go down first before you decide its too high. Which my step dad did ANDREW MATTHEWS, yes he did. One hour and 15 minutes to walk down the stairs again and get the mick taken out of him. its cool, go down the rapids and through the tunnel through the sharks cause thats fun as well. its cool for kids :D

Amazing. My wife and i stopped in dubai on the way back from the maldives as part of our honeymoon. I prebooked tickets for the aquaventure only to find out when i got there they were not accepted so using the puppydog eyes they let us in half rpice which they did not have to do as it was Keith Prowse fault. When we got in we quickly sorted our stuff into the lockers and hit the slides which were brilliant....... The leap of faith was so fast you didnt even get a chance to the marine life in the tank, still really good though. My favourite part was the "lazy" river with rapids......ive never been on one where there is a travelator that takes you up hill and then down rapids, truly amazing and fun! water was quite cheap in the park too, £1.70 a bottle. The staff were great, plenty of rubber rings. Also the torrent was fantastic, one of the staff pulled you into a part of the lazy river and you were met with a rush of water that was released from a flood gate, you were then surged down the lazy river wih the occasional wave from the flood gate.....even funnier that we both went over the top of 2 small boys!So good, that we have booked to stay in atlantis next year on our way back from OZ!

Fantastic fun for all the familly. During a 2 day stopover staying at the Atlantis hotel, we, that's me mum, Tom aged 13 and Jacko aged10 had a fabulous time here in the park, free entry because we were hotel guests, so we had a seesion in the morning's and went back for another one after lunch.Life guards every 20 metres, On the rapids I kept my eyes shut for the first 4, I was in a double tube with Jacko, Tom leading the way in a single, looking back and lauighing at his mother scared, exhilarated,enthralled, excited, 60 emotions a minute, amazing place.Your so safe all the time, although it dosent look like you are, bobbing along in the warm water, what's that noise? look back and wow where did that come from, a tidal wave behind you, towering above you, then your picked up, up, up on top of the wave you look down and theres the other people in tubes in frnt of you, your gonna swamp them land on top of them, collide with them, but NO! magically they move up as you move down . Smiling lifeguards watching your every move. And it goes on through all levels of excitement the splashers children area, with fantastic tubes, and swings and slides and 2 buckets that fill, and fill and fill abit more, gives a little wobble, then down they come, shrieks of laughter from thechildren, their parents and grand parents, just the best fun.The shark attack teases you as you glide through the clear tank watching them watching you, another level of adrenalin, wonderment and pure enjoyment.Food and drinks sold in the park are good and plentiful, heapos of sun bed's with their own shade shelters so you can have as much or as little as you want.Everywhere you go, look, walk you're greeted by friendly efficient staff,the whole place is immaculately clean, just a wonderful place.Was fantastic to have the hotel to retreat to, to get your breath back and have a rest before going back in for another session.Was 43 degrees when we were there in late June, so not crowded, but every nationality and language all screaming in excitement and laughing in pleasure. do yourselves a favour and go.

Go on Thursday nights in the summer for the fun atmosphere. I give this park 4/5 stars because for the price it could have more attractions. However, we went this past Thursday night because it's 175 AED and on Thursdays it's open from 8-12 at night and features a DJ and a fantastic fireworks finale. However this park would be fun at anytime as it is new, clean and super fun. Just be prepared though to spend an arm and a leg as locker rental is another 40 dirhams and each picture they take of you in the water can be purchased in the gift shop for another 65 dirhams. Bring your own towels, H2O and snacks and that should save some money that could be better spent elsewhere.

Great ride with a Summer Promo. To be worth it, get at least a night stay at Atlantis to get an unlimited entry to Aquaventure and Lost Chambers for 2 days . Great water rides but not on regular or peak season since you have to shell out dhs 295 per entry. My family paid only dhs 800 per nite stay at the Hotel plus 20% which i think was a good deal. Aquaventure was great except that you'll have to bring your own towel if you are not a hotel guest. Sorry also they don't have a shower gel and soap neither shampoo at the shower room so might as well bring your own or bring home the viruses. Can't they provide some for the people just like wildwadi? You also have to pay for your own locker for dhs 40.

Great fun, but not as many rides as you might expect. we went there on a weekday with a couple of friends, so it was quite quiet, don't want to imagine this place on a weekend, esp since all the slides start from the same tower, so I am sure there would be a traffic jam. Go after 3pm, then it's much cheaper. rental of anything is expensive, so try to bring your own towel etc (although you don't really need one, as you will be on the rides all the time, esp if you come after 3 - park closes at 6).the rides are fun, but most of them go through dark tunnels, so keep that in consideration if you're afraid of darkness. All slides are with tubes (apart from the kid's I think) I personally didn't do the leap of fate or whatever it's called, but friends liked it. there's a kid's area too, but didn't go there.the canals didn't have a lot of water in them when we where there, maybe that's why it's cheaper after 3?food is also expensive and not very satisfying, bring your own food & water. no water fountains in the park.overall, a fun place to see, as long as you don't expect tons of slides (haven't been to Wild Wadi, but some waterparks in Italy and Germany, which were much larger, but didn't have such a nice design)

Terrible waterpark!!. Hardly any rides in the park and very expensive not worth what you pay for!! we paid AED285 each entrance fee which is about GBP50 each. You also had to pay GBP6 for a towel and GBP10 for a locker. The rides are not impressive, they have few tube slides you go on with rings and the water was not forceful enough. There seems to be so much open space and not enough rides seems better for kids. The private beach was horrible to swim in and felt dirty and very cold as is man made and nothing compared to the beach on the main land! There is also hardly any direction where to go to and you have to find your way round!! Definately would not recommed it, the wild wadi water park in jumeriah area is much nicer.

Best Water Park. one of the best water parks in Dubai, we were told that it is even better than Wild Wadi.it is on the expensive side but worth your money. try to bring less baggage with you as the locker is expensive too @ 50 AED and the costumes if you buy at the spot are expensive too, towels: 30 AED extra.small kids may not be able to enjoy all rides but kids above 1.1m can enjoy all the rides including LEAP OF FAITH which is fantastic.whole park is connected through a lazy river and 6 rides are concentrated in one area.enjoy it!

Great Fun. Great fun! It's lacking a few water rides to equal Disney's blizzard bleach, but this park holds it's own. The Leap of Faith is very thrilling and much steeper than similar ones in other water parks. The river ride is full of rapids, dips and waves. The shark ride which goes through the shark tank is fun as well. We ate at Barracuda's restaurant two times and it was almost completely empty and the prices are good with a combo meal for 35 -40 dirhams. This park also has it's own beach, with beach sports such as beach volleyball. We got our towels free since we were hotel guests otherwise would have been 30 dhs. Photos were taken and were 65 dirhams for a 5 x 7. The locker in the changing room was 50 dhs and the changing room was very clean. We spent a whole day of great fun here for four days and really enjoyed ourselves.

Aquaventure and dolphins at Atlantis in Dubai. This can be either a family day out, a couples day out or an outing for a small group of friends. At Dhs750, it could not be considered a 'cheap day out', but the overall experience is fun. Your entry fee buys you access to the dolphins and to Aquaventure. Whatever the staff tell you, it doesn't give you entry to the aquarium. This is an additional Dhs75. Our intention was to see the dolphins and then go to the water park. The best part is the dolphin experience. The educational presentation which precedes your interaction is slick and highly informative. The experience is powerful and you know that the dolphins are well looked after and their personalities taken into consideration during their training. Within your entry fee is a locker, soft drinks and a towel. The electronic locker key is a great idea but not transferable to the water park.If you did not have the forethought to bring your own towel, this will cost you a further Dhs30; and unless you have a portable safe, a locker will cost an additional Dhs50 (about £10) which for most travellers is a bit steep because you don't get your Dhs80 back! You would do well to do some planning before you arrive if there are more than two of you.Nearly all of the rides start from the Ziggurat although there can be a queue for some of the rides - and we went during the week. They can be a bit the samey after about 4 rides. Adrenalin junkies might be a bit disappointed. You are not automatically given a map of layout of the park and it's not obvious how to access the rides from outside the ziggurat (or even where the sitting areas are). I suggest to grab a map before you go in so you can decide where to sit.The resort has great sun beds. Each has an individual shade which can be adjusted to suit your needs as the sun passes over you during the course of the day. Also, the food is very reasonably priced within the water park and the service is quick at each of the service areas. There is a great queuing system for ordering food in the main cafe which regrettably falls down because the cashiers don't keep a float.The rubber rings could be problematic if you were overweight (not as substantial as the Wild Wadi ones?). I'm 65kg and ended up with a bruised gluteus maximus which was very uncomfortable. The little launch converyor belts are quite fun though . Those with children need to measure them before going as some of the rides do not allow children under 1.2m. There is however no visible measuring instrument on site so it's up to the conveyor belt 'monitor' to decide whether or not your child can go on the ride. The most irritating thing about our experience was the fact it took us a good 20 minutes to find two rubber rings. This was highly irritating especially as the staff were unhelpful on this matter (I asked four staff in different parts of the resort) and there was no obvious point of collection. I also just had a feeling that the staff in the main restaurant were not properly trained, but the water -based staff dotted around the waterways were a joy. You always felt safe even if you occasionally bumped your head, stumped your foot on the bottom or walked away with bruises. They are armed with whistles to ensure you don't commit any misdemeanours.....If you've never been to a water park before, this is a great start. Some of the 'dark' rides might be a bit frightening for young children, but hey, that's what the adrenalin rush is all about, isn't it?

Still needs to get its act together..... Well it's impressive...I'll give you that! I mean the whole complex: the hotel, the Aquaventure Water Park and the Lost Chambers aquarium. I visited the place with my 9 year old son in the end of October 08 and I believe the place opened sometime in September. It's build on Dubai's newest and most ambitious project "The Palm", which is basically an artificial city in the sea! I got a very strange feeling the moment I passed the bridge and onto the island... it was like "what if something happens and the whole palm shaped island collapses or gets swollen up by a big Tsunami or something? Anyway we arrived there by Taxi and were not allowed to be dropped off in the front of the Hotel Entrance but were directed to go further on and into the parking area of the water park. There we had to wait for the park's bus to take us back to the Hotel's Entrance... (???). We paid AED 220/ about USD 61.00 per person (kids over 1.10 pay the same as adults). But be warned: this was a special price valid the end of October 08. The park is not huge...actually smaller than the Wild Wadi across the main land by the Jumeira Beach Hotel. It has limited rides: there is a lazy river which I admit it was fun as it had parts with mini tsunami waves that my son really enjoyed. Also there is a ride that you end up in an all glass tube inside a shark aquarium and you actually have the fish swim on all sides... The Lost Chambers aquarium was in my opinion the best attraction... It is VERY impressive with a big variety of fish and just the size on the main aquarium is something I was not expecting. Now the bad points: there is a beach (man made of course like the whole island). I was so disappointed... the whole edge of the beach was covered in this white foam and the sea was not clean at all... There is only one Food Outlet and it’s only for Take Away the only problem is, there is no area to sit and enjoy your meal! We had to actually sit on the steps and eat our sandwich as all the sun beds by the pool area were taken and ours were a bit far at the beach area. I also found the food a bit overpriced, which …fine you expect this I guess, it happens in most places BUT if you order a plain sandwich it goes together with a soft drink and a pack of crisps (either you like this or not) and of course you pay for them. I had to pay extra and buy my son a bottle of water as he doesn’t like soft drinks and they wouldn’t make the exchange! But the worst was our departure: we had to wait for 1 hour and 45 minutes in queue for a Taxi (STANDING)! It was a nightmare... Here's a tip: leave BEFORE the park closes... other wise be prepared for a good hour's wait for a Taxi...
